name: Bethanie Hotel
description: The hotel lets you camp by the lake side next to the hotel restaurant.

name: Gisovu Tea Factory
description: Informal campsite arranged with management to allow visit of the Tea production in the morning. No facilities but on top of the hill in the plantation with amazing views.

name: Institute of National Museums
description:
NO CAMPING HERE. 

There are no campsites in Huye/Butare so we thought we would be cheeky and ask to stay overnight in the museum carpark.  We arrived 5 minutes before it closed and explained we wanted to visit the museum when it opened in the morning.  They allowed us to park overnight, there are no facilities but it is guarded.

name: Seeds of Peace
description: Camping for vehicles in the carpark but there is grass for tents, very expensive for the facilities!  There are toilets only for campers but they gave us access to a room to have a hot shower.

name: Inzu Lodge
description: Nice clean well run place. Recommended for the tented rooms, but not for overlander camping.

name: Discover Rwanda Youth Hostel
description: Great urban camping spot right in the middle of town. Price (USD 10 pppn) includes a small breakfast internet.

name: Ibis Hotel
description:
NO CAMPING.
Apparently no 21,000 RWF rooms available so we were offered a larger option at 38,000 for two adults B&B. 
Room simple and clean although not the most comfy bed I’ve slept in, and the mosquito net had holes. 
Breakfast good and nice hot showers.

There are other guesthouses that look nice in Butare, so with hindsight I think we agreed to this room too quickly. It’s expensive for what it is and we probably could have got cheaper elsewhere.

name: Uwinka Campsite
description: In the midst of the rain forest, Nice covered terrace with view to Lake Kivu. Firewood provided, facilities well run.

name: Musaya hotel
description: Garden of hotel directly at lake with view over Congo mountains.  Shower of one of the rooms. Necessary to negotiate price and offered facilities. In 2022 15 dollars per car.

name: Jambo Beach Camp
description: Quiet small field next to restaurant at lake with beautiful sunset. Lake not visible from camping spot. When we were at the place there was no water, so toilets were smelling.

name: Mutumba Hills
description: Very basic campsite in park. Great view over park and lakes with Tanzania in the distance. Firewood provided for chopping yourself.

name: Kinigi Asoferwa Lodge
description: Right next to the NP HQ - where you can camp in the carpark for $5 (2016: FRW 5.000). Also known as Kinigi Guest house.

name: Paradis Malahide Cottages And Campsite
description: Parking lot campsite, excellent beach, you can paddle there boats to their private island. Excellent place to relax

name: Mountain Gorilla View Lodge
description: Nice place but definitely not worth the price!!!

name: La Bella Lodge And Camping
description: Beautiful garden directly at lake, quiet, we had to stand in the parking lot with our truck, very good restaurant with African food, friendly host and stuff, you have to negotiate price; 20 USD / 1 car, 2 persons

name: Hakuna Matata Rubavu Lodge
description: Just opposite of La Bella, where we stood on parking lot. Owner gave us brochure of hotel and offered camping as well. Worth to have a look at!

name: Rushel Kivu Lodge
description: This is a lodge/campsite on the congo-nile trail, usaly visited by bikers and walkers. It is posible to get here by car but the road isn't on the map. There are sings between Kayove and Giginga. The road is rough so 4x4 is needed! The place is really nice and the view over the lake is great! Food was delicious  and staff was kind. There is a big field where you can put up a tent due it is not accessible by car so we had to camp on the parking. It is also possible to rent a tent or a room.

name: Urugo Women's Opportunity Centre
description: Camping and lodge run by the "Urungo Women's Opportunity Center". The site has permanent tents for rent and also gives the opportunity to camp on the perimisss. It's spotless clean and has great food. Behind the lodge there is a valley with farms also owned by the organization. Trucks or cars can enter to the back and camp with a perfect view over the valley. This is definitely a little peace of heaven :)

name: Ubumwe Hotel
description: Very close to the border. Basic hotel but we could leave the car there while we were gorilla trekking and hiking the Nyiragongo vulcano.

name: One Love Club
description:
It's quite run down, but the staff, location and price make up for it. The camping spot is nice too. 
Shower was cold, but could be hot if they fix the heater.

Price was 7,000 FRW. I was put in a dorm for the same price because there were no other guests.

name: Home St. Jean
description:
Hotel on beautifull peninsula behind the memorial church of Kibuye. Amazing view over the lake from the terrace of the hotel. Camping on the paved parking. cold showers but friendly staff. Food is not to expencive (we didn't taste it but it looked good) and for camping 5000rfr for 2 persons per night.
3000fr dorms

name: Home St. Jean
description: Hotel on beautifull peninsula behind the memorial church of Kibuye. Amazing view over the lake from the terrace of the hotel. Camping on the paved parking. cold showers but friendly staff. Food is not to expencive (we didn't taste it but it looked good) and for camping we paid 4000rfr for the two of us per night.

name: Afrika bite
description: very friendly staff. good rwandese food. they serve a buffet for 3000 rwf. a la carte is also possible. nice location, you can eat inside and outside in the garden.

name: Step Town Hotel
description: After searching for a while, we found this nice hotel with a great view over the city! Manager and staff are very friendly and acommodating! We paid for camping on the parking 10000 rwf for the two of us per night. They gave us a room for showering. We also took breakfast for 2500 p.p. wich was very good! for us this was the best option in town!!

name: Mamba Club
description: Ex-pat bar that also offers accomodation. Private and dorms. Swimming pool, billiard and bowling installations. Nice area and surroundings. Bed in dorm is 11.000RWF. A few private rooms are available for 25 000 - 30 000RWF.

name: Red Rocks Campsite
description: Nice quirky campsite that offers lots of activities, the owner Harriet is very friendly and helpful, ablutions are ok with hot showers and basic flush toilets, $6 pppn, dinner is ok at 5000 francs, quite a lot of room on grass which is flatish, OK for our truck. Electric at some spots. Can get noisy if a big group is here, about 7km out of town

name: Hotel Chez Lando
description: Large hotel with parking in rear for truck, no camping allowed so took a room $94 a night inc good breakfast

name: Emarauda Kivu Resort
description: We could camp on the grass carpark of the hotel. Fantastic views over lake Kivu. We made use of the free wifi on the deck of the restaurant. No abolutions but you can make use of the hotel facilities. We negotiated the price down from $20 to $10 per night.

name: Calafia
description: After coming back from the DRC this Cafe felt like from another Planet. Hipster Place full of young People serving very good Hipster Food. Free but very slow Wifi (because all the young Hipsters are constantly posting something to their Social Media Profiles ;)

name: Discover Rwanda
description:
Hostel and Campground- great location, across from beach. Quiet and fairly private. Good wifi, small menu but food is good and staff very friendly. 

Very smart hotel which also allows camping (tents or rooftop) out back. Level ground with shade. $10pppn including breakfast and access to (hot) showers and toilet. Nice food in the restaurant. Only drawback is the camping spot is in view of a road. 2 minute walk to popular beach with clean water

name: Huye Mountain coffee - informal campsite
description:
There is no camping around in Huye, but we found this place. It is at the coffee washing and drying factory of the Huye Mountain Coffee company. Space for one to two cars, basic ablutions, nice view, in a village, but not that much attention, only a few kids. Security and the guide of the company lives there as well. 

No big rigs.

name: Huye Mountain Coffee
description: You can do a 1 or 3 hour coffee tour, including traditional coffee roasting, excellent explanation about the whole coffee process, nice views of the surrounding Huye Mountan range. One if the nicest things we have done in Rwanda. Highly recommend. We did the three hour tour for $30,-pp.

name: KCCEM Guesthouse (head office)
description:
Camping 5000RWF.
Single 12000RWF
Double 20000RWF
Good stop on the way to/from Nyungwe Forest.

name: Murambi genocide memorial
description: Impressive museum. Must visit, bring some Francs for donation. Graphic exposition of exhumed bodies.

name: Tasty Bakery
description: Bakery next to the chinese restaurant, bakery in red under white roof. Try the cake.

name: Eden Garden
description:
Directly at the lake on a small half island, parking on gravel, all around Bungalows and pavilions.
Good, inexpensive food and beer, on weekend maybe noisy.
Entrance gate only 2.30m wide.
2G with MTN-SIM

name: One Love Club
description:
Parking lot of area, directly at the busy road. Smaller cars can park inside.
Toilet and shower in a room.
Restaurant and bar.
9$ p.p.p.n (too much, but at that time there was no other possibility)

name: Touristik Restaurant
description:
Huge parking area in front of a restaurant.
Friends have stayed there for dinner and the night.

name: Republica
description: Great spot for dinner with a nice view of the city. Decent meals around 8000 franc. A soft entry into trying local dishes.

name: Galileo Hotel
description: A somewhat fancy hotel with friendly staff who were surprisingly happy to let us set up the roof tent in their courtyard for one night. They have a quality restaurant. If the hotel is busy (it's next to the stadium) they may not have space.

name: Musasa basecamp
description: One of the basecamps set up on the Congo-Nile trail, this one is run by the staff of a coffee washing station. 5000 frw. I asked about dinner and they said I could have some of what the staff would be having (rice & beans) at no extra charge. Shower and toilet in the staff house. They directed me to set up my tent on the small triangle of grass in front of the offices, but I would not recommend it as it is right beside the generator, and there were lots of curious people around until late at night and again early in the morning. You could probably camp behind the staff house if you prefer to attract less attention.

name: Ishara Beach Motel
description: Camping is possible on the lawns of the hotel for 10 000 frw. They also have plenty of parking space for vehicles. Access to a room for ablutions. Nice View of Lake Kivu and you can walk down the hill to the beach. The Ishara basecamp for the Congo Nile trail is also nearby.

name: Kinunu guest house
description: Guest house for stop over on The Congo Nile Trail. Rooms cheaper than Rushel Kivu Lodge. Clean rooms and well priced food. We cycled in but 4x4 or hiking is an option. View of lake over the coffee plantations. 25 000 Francs for double room. 10000 per tent to camp.

name: Bugarama /Cimerwa hot springs
description: A decent spot for some infomal camping if needed in the area. Not worth the 5 hour round trip from Kamenbe. While hot springs are impressive, used by many locals as a bath and water is too hot to swim comfortably.

name: Engen with service station
description: Monior services, just charged for oil change, did fuel and oil filters, flushed water trap. Car wash very good, ask for full wash, engine and under. Tire services also available.

name: Meze Fresh mexican food
description:
Awesome restaurant! They serve Mexican food, huge portions for very reasonable prices. They also do take away.

Highly recommended

name: La Bella
description: Beautiful spot on the lake (for own tents, not rooftop tents). The owner and staff is very friendly. Bathrooms are a little bit far away, but manageable.

name: Nice spot
description: We found this nice spot on our way from Rusumo border to Kigali, next to a rice storage depot. At the back is a leveld place for the car. There is a toilet which we could use behind the building. Curious people from the village came to have a look and learned us a few words Rwandese. At 7pm a local man came to send everyone home. Felt safe here.

name: Tea House Bis
description:
A nice hotel, in the eastern part of Kigali. We had a room with shared bathroom (ask to turn on the boiler for a hot shower), including breakfast for $15 (2p), but the owner said the normal price should be $25. Look at the booking websites for accurate prices. The car was parked inside the gate and we got electricity for the car as well. Good wifi.
There is no sign outside, the hotel has a blue and white fence. 
Within 2min walking distance is a Simba Supermarket and a huge local market. They sell everything you need! 
Nice local restaurants in the area. 
We took a motortaxi for FRW1000 to the Kigali Genocide Memorial.
Phone number of the hotel:+250782181209. Also good available on Whatsapp.

name: Kimironko New Vision Restaurant
description: Do you like/dare to eat real local? Go to this restaurant, all motortaxi drivers are eating here. Everybody eats the mixed plate (FRW 1000): chips, rice, beef, spaghetti, beans, salad, mayonaise, potatoe and banana. Also try the samosa's!

name: Isa's car repair
description:
We found mechanic Isa with the help of some local people. He is a very experienced man. He and his team speak English, so no problem to communicate. They have experience with Land Rover, but they work on all type of cars. 
We could park our car inside a fence, so the people of the village could not hang around the car and our stuff.
There is a small shop around the corner where the buy basic products.
He charged us 25.000 for 3hrs work with 4people, what we found a reasonable price.
You can reach him on: +250788538146. 
The coördinates on the map can be incorrect. Driving on the main road from south to north, you first pass a mosque on the left. After that, you will find a local gasstation called Delta, also on your left. At that gasstation you turn right into a dirtroad. At the right hand side, after about 200m, you will find Isa's workplace.

name: La Pailotte
description: After hiking the Bisoke volcana we ended here recommended by some locals. Expecting little from the Italian food we still ordered it (we were really looking forward to Italian food). We were amazed. Had to wait for about 30 - 40 minutes, but the pasta was freshly made for us, as was the pizza bottom! Great taste, especcially considering the prices (around 2.500 for a dish). And it was plenty! They also have a bakery (good samosa, chapati's and French baquette).

name: KCB Kayunza Branch ATM
description: Withdraw USD400 out in one go without service fee.

name: Rusumo One Stop Border Post
description: This is a one-stop border crossing from Tanzania to Rwanda. If you are traveling Rwanda to Tanzania then cross the bridge to Tanzania for your border crossing.  Very straight forward.  Enter the main hall and Start with officials on your left to stamp out of Tanzania.  Next office stamp into Rwanda. Cost for British visa US $50 paid in US dollars (crazy!). We don't have a carnet so we import out motorbikes easily and pay 15000 Rwanda Francs per bike. Finally if you have pets the next building up the hill is Dept Agricultural to check pet documents, but beforehand go to www.minagri.gov.rw to register with e-rabis because you need this document at the border. You can get money from atm in Rusumo, Tanzania, then change it to Rwanda Francs and US $. There is no atm on the Rwanda side and they'll send you back to Tanzania to get the money.

name: Bumba Basecamp
description:
Great campsite next to dorms. Mostly used by people that hike up and down the Congo Nile trail.

They make great food at night for 5000 rf that is served around the fire. The next morning you can either have breakfast with the rest or buy some bread from the bakery.

Camping is 10 000 rf per tent for two people.

Ask in the village for the way since the road are not clearly visible on the map.

name: Dian Fossey Hotel
description: Brand new hotel on the top of a hill along the main road. USD 10 pppn for camping in the parking lot. Use of a designated shower and bathroom

name: Canaberra
description: Very modern cafe/restaurant with diverse food and drinks menu (big meals) and wifi. Very comfortable and clean

name: Vita Guesthouse
description: Astonishingly nice rooms. Restaurant and small bar available. 10 000 RWF

name: Toyota Rwanda Ltd
description: Formerly part of Akagera Motors (still continues with Mercedes etc franchises), now owned and operated by Toyota Japan since April ‘17. Chief of Service Department and head mechanic, Yann, was knowledgeable, helpful and made sure repair/maintenance was done properly (reinforced rear bumper mount and re-welded front shock mount. —also found source of intermittent ABS problem that had existed for 10 months!!

name: Rwandan Revenue Authority—Customs (Magerwa - Gikondo)
description: Extend TIP. Caution—only possible to extend AFTER expiry date!!! ATM at facility. Also possible to extend at border—BUT see Joy at this office BEFORE you attempt this!

name: La Galette (German Bakery & Butchery)
description: Very tasty German Bakery (Baguettes, REAL Bread, Pretzels, Cakes ...) and German Butchery (very good fresh Meat, good dried Pork Sausages, Salami, even Weißwurst). Westerns and Locals alike carry out Bags of tasty Stuff from this Shop. Also has a nice Supermarket and Restaurant. We didn't try the Restaurant but it was crowded with People and not to expensive so it should be good. Update: we now also visited the Restaurant and its good and cheap. Owned by friendly German Erich and his Partner. All in all one of the most beautiful Places we have seen in Weeks! ;-)

name: Kigali Genocide Memorial
description: Not a Tourist Attraction but the must visit in Kigali. There are 250 000 bodies buried here. The Memorial also includes a very good museum about the Rwandan Genocide and other Genocides around the World (2nd Floor). Entrance is free but a donation suggested. Audio Tour available in different Languages, costs USD25 pp. Cafe offers free Wifi, snacks, food and drinks. Secured parking available. Impressive and sad place.

name: Hotel des Mille Collines ('Hotel Rwanda')
description: The original Hotel from the Movie 'Hotel Rwanda'. It's a modern Hotel made of Concrete, Metal and Glas and looks nothing like in the Movie. However it's a famous Place and offers some okay Views. The Garden, Bar and Pool are nice. Beers are a bit pricey.

name: Ntarama Genocide Memorial
description: Not a Tourist Attraction but another sad Memorial. There is a Church, School and Kitchen where several Thousand People were butchered. Mass Graves for around 5.000 People. We were guided by a friendly Local. Free but a Donation is suggested.

name: Nyamata Genocide Memorial
description: No Tourist Attraction but another sad Memorial. The Church is full of Clothings and other Remainings from the Victims. There were around 10.000 People butchered here, only 7 survived... Free but a Donation is suggested.

name: La Corniche Border Post (Rwanda-DRC)
description:
It says 'One Stop Border Post' but it's two Stops :) Very modern and efficient Border.

Leaving Rwanda:
1) Passports got stamped.
2) Carnet got stamped.
No Fees, done in 5 Minutes.

Entering DRC:
1) Drive to the next Hall. Showed our Visa Confirmation we got from Virunga Park (we applied online through the Parks Website after booking our Treks with them. Single Entry 14 Days Visa was 105 USD pp). Passports got stamped in.
2) Showed our Yellow Fever Vaccinations at the next Counter.
3) Went on to Customs to stamp the Carnet de Passage.
4) We then drove out but got stopped at the Exit Barrier. Guys had a quick look inside our Car and then made Problems because we should buy a 'Carte d'Entree'. So we Went back and found out that this is a TIP that costs 25 USD and we don't need because of the Carnet. The Chief Lady from Customs went to the Barrier with us and told her Guys so we could drive out Hassle free.
As we already paid for our Visa online there were no Fees. The DRC Side took us 45 Minutes.

Going back from DRC to Rwanda was equally easy.

Leaving DRC:
1) Got Passports stamped.
2) Got Carnet de Passage stamped.
No Fees, done in 10 Minutes.

Entering Rwanda:
1) Police had a quick Look inside our Car. We applied online for the East Africa Tourist Visa and printed out the Approvals. Showed them at the Immigration Counter where they told us to pay at Customs.
2) Went to Customs and paid the 100 USD pp. Also stamped in our Carnet at Customs.
3) Went back to Immigration with Payment Receipts and got the Visa.
No Fees besides the Costs for the Visa. Done in 45 Minutes.

name: Guidos Mechanic
description: Fantastic mechanic! Guido is a Headmaster Mechanic and runs this Garage with about 20 students watching his every move.. He is very well known in Butare as being the best and most reliable mechanic around. We drove in with huge amounts of smoke coming out of the exhaust of our vw kombi, Guido started working on it straight away and found the problem eventually. He worked on it for over 8 hours and charged us a very small price. He speaks mainly french but has a few mechanics who speak english. He was super nice and very professional, you can tell that he knows his trade. Highly recommended! Right next to the Galileo Hotel

name: Anglican Church HQ & Guesthouse
description: Quiet, peaceful, clean compound with rooms around grassy courtyards. Large secure parking. We paid 20,000 RWF for a double room with en suite bathroom with flush toilet and hot shower. Good value lodging. They have a restaurant. No menu, just request what you want. We had ugali, greens, & (very tough) chicken. We made the mistake of not agreeing to the price for dinner beforehand, and in the morning they charged us 15,000 for two. Very overpriced!

name: Sous le soleil / Under the sun
description: Nice fish restaurant by the lake side. This is a place where the locals go. Very affordable prices and very good food.

name: Kigali Expat Bike Repairs
description:
Motorcycle workshop working on BMW and KTM bikes. Walter  is a great guy and has all the tools to do major repairs on the bike. He also have motorcycle oil and other spare parts in the workshop.


+250784000501

name: Macheo ecolodge camping
description:
Beautiful place with a view of the lake. Camping site available (green grass) , bar and restaurant with good food. 
Check the web for prices, http://www.macheoecolodge.com/

name: Planette Motel
description: Clean room with 3 prices, $7/night (bathroom outside), $17/night and $21/night (bathroom inside, different the size only). Cold water for shower but if want hot water they can provide. They hv bar and restaurant. The staff very friendly.

name: Kitabi Ecocenter
description:
A very nice place with an unforgettable view! A lovely campsite on the top of the hill right next to Nyungwe National Park. They have huts for rent for 30$ pppn or 40$ for two people. Camping costs 15$ for tent space/vehicle  (or 12000 franks). They can heat up the water for shower and there are flush toilets as well as long drop ones. Not very clean… There’s also a kitchen guests can use. The dinner was 5000 franks pp with soup, main, tea and fruits for desert. They also sell cold beer. They can switch on the WiFi if you ask nicely :) 
In the evening they made a fire for us. 
You can rent a bicycle for 20$ (3-5 hours) or go on an ecotour for 25$ with them. 
The road to the campsite is a bit steep, but cars do go up. Motorcycles went up fine. Maybe it can get slippery after a heavy rain though... IMPORTANT it’s not really suitable for cars with a rooftoptent. You will have to camp on the parking lot.

name: Wailers lodge
description: As all the places before in ioverlander in Kigali where so expensive we looked on booking.com and found this place. Nice rooms including bathroom (European toilet and cold shower). Free WiFi, super king size bed, private secure parking, including breakfast. We paid through Booking 18.200 RWF. They serve dinner as well but didn't try it. Big Primus beer (720cl) 900 RWF.

name: Market for cheap foods
description: Here is the local market and you find a supermarket around to buy some fresh bakery stuff. Good to get some snacks and other necessary foods before go to Virunga.

name: Umutuzo Hotel
description:
Cheap hotel with basic rooms for 10.000 rwf. They have a small bar with some food as well. We only eat chips 1.000 rwf for a big plate incl. good mayonnaise. Beers Skol 500 ml 800 rwf. They made hot water in the morning for a shower. Secure parking for motorcycles, maybe one 4x4 will fit as well.. 

The vida hotel only had rooms for 30.000 rwf.

name: Border Rwanda - Uganda
description:
Pretty crowded border crossing, they are building new offices on both sides, it looks pretty chaotic at the moment. There are a lot of big busses passing from Kigali. Don’t forget to switch to the other side of the road. 

RWANDA > UGANDA
Exiting Rwanda took us 30 minutes. Uganda side took us 1 hour. Payments for the road tax only in cash. We are traveling with 2 motorcycles incl. CDP.

UGANDA > RWANDA
Checking out was super easy. At the Rwanda side we were checked for Ebola and then allowed to proceed. Immigration and customs was fast. No payment needed. Took us half an hour to cross in total.

name: Amahoro Guest House
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Description provided by owner.

Amahoro Guest House is a little guest house located just two blocks off the main road in downtown Musanze. Suitable for group travellers! The owner also runs Amahoro Tours and can help organize any of your travel needs.

name: Sole Luna
description: Really nice Italian restaurant with beautiful view of Kigali. Homemade pasta, proper Italian pizza, draught beer. Not the cheapest but worth spoiling oneself!

name: Auto Parts Store - Huge sortiment!
description:
This should be your first place to look for any car, truck or motorcycle related parts in Kigali!

All sorts of fluids, seals, filters, o-rings, tools, spark plugs, fuses, hoses, gaskets, bearings, nipples, bolts, nuts. You name it, they'll have it or know where to find it. 

You'll see a sideways parked Mercedes just outside of the entrance. No shop sign. Good service!

name: 4Blooms Burgers & Fries
description:
Best burgers in Kigali! The kitchen is inside a shipping container next to a SP gas station station and outdoor seating with roof.

100% local prime Rawandan beef and excellent service!
Prices from 4000-6000 RWF depending the size of the burgers.

See picture for menu! Plenty of parking spaces.

name: Nyiragongo Expedition (DRC Tours & visas)
description:
This tour company is extremely well run by Moses and his staff of five! We met Moses at our hostel, and his service was reliable and professional from the second we met him, he's also a fun guy with a great personality.

Moses arranged our DRC visas in two days, and we booked the volcano and gorilla trek through him with transportation.

We paid:
Visas - 130 USD pp (2 day handling)
Gorilla trek permits - 200 USD pp
Transport for gorillas - 200 USD total
Volcano hike permits - 300 USD pp
Transport for volcano - 100 USD total

Transport is cheaper than through the Virunga NP, and Moses always met up on time.

The service is great. He picked us up in Rwanda and guided us through the whole immigration process, and stayed with us the entire time. No hassle. He brings you around in Goma, and will take you to any  hotel depending on your price and comfort level, and will make sure the price is right. Any questions or requests, they can make sure it met.

They've got a proper Land Cruiser in Goma to bring you around and to the treks. Brought us back to Rwanda and stayed with us through the immigration process.

Can't speak highly enough of the service. Suberb from A to B. Check out the reviews on TripAdvisor if still in doubt.

Highly recommend!

nyiragongoexpedition.com
Moses - tel & WhatsApp +255715888427

Moses also knows all about Gisenyi and Goma, and qualified motorcycle mechanics. If you need something done on your car, motorcycle or looking for parts. This is your guy.

name: Mount Fuji
description: Guest house near the border! Restaurant and bar connected next door! 20,000 francs for the night for a double bed. Gated yard with a guard out front. The bus driver told us it’s the safest place to stay as there is a police station next door.

name: Anthurium Residential Hotel
description: Very nice newer hotel in quiet location. excellent value in Kigali. very clean, modern. and comfortable. I paid $30 (plus $3 city tax on Booking for a single person). good breakfast. fairly large secure gated parking. friendly family owned.

name: Simba Supermarket
description: Biggest Simba supermarket in town (still not great), good wine selection (expensive), some cereal, soy milk, bread, some meats

name: Café Resto Iby'Iwagu - Great local spot!
description:
Awesome local artsy restaurant with cheap and tasty food. 1000 RWF for vegetarian buffet, 1500 RWF with meat. Great variety and tasty, open from early till late. Very popular among the locals with cool seating options inside and outside.

Try the local drink Tezok (tea is ok) both with and without alcohol. Quite the distinct taste.

Highly recommended!

name: Coge Bank ATM
description: Entering from TZ. Takes VISA. Maximum withdrawal RWF200000.

name: Turning for Akagera National Park
description:
This is where you turn off of the main road to reach the main entrance gate for Akagera National Park. 
Bumpy dirt road from here, but easily doable at around 40km/h (at least in dry season!).

name: E.A.R Gisakura
description: Camping for 10.000 RF. You’ can sleep with a rooftop tent at the parking lot. Nothing is flat. With a ground tent you can stay on grass. Shower and toilet is in a bungalow. Only cold water but you can ask for a bucket of hot water.

name: St Joseph Centre
description: Located in Ngoma district in the Eastern province of Rwanda and offers luxurious and spacious rooms in the new section of the hotel. A bit pricey – 25,000 RWF per person sharing a room – it included breakfast. WIFI was available but very slow. Staff were friendly and helpful with a slogan at reception “Bad service is not on”. The center also has a neat restaurant with reasonable prices.

name: St Joseph Centre
description: Located in Ngoma district in the Eastern province of Rwanda and offers luxurious and spacious rooms in the new section of the hotel. A bit pricey – 25,000 RWF per person sharing a room – it included breakfast. WIFI was available but very slow. Staff were friendly and helpful with a slogan at reception “Bad service is not on”. The center also has a neat restaurant with reasonable prices.

name: Centre Saint Paul
description:
Centre Saint Paul is located uptown in Kigali.The Guest House is surrounded by spacious and scenic green gardens. We each had a double room with 2 beds. Facilities are basic and nothing fancy. A new extension will open in September and might be more modern. We paid 20,000 RWF per person per night which includes breakfast. WIFI with intermittent internet connection is available at the Snack Bar. The Snack Bar serves food of good quality and price. Laundry facilities are also available.

St Paul is walking distance from the Nakumatt Center. Try Bourbon Coffee for something to drink or eat.

name: Jibu water refill
description:
They happily refilled our bottle even though it was a different brand for 600rwf per 5l.
You can also purchase Jibu reusable water containers here.

name: La Paillotte Gorilla Campsite
description:
Forest lodge and campsite with good mountain view. We paid $10/12,000rwf for 2 people and our car. Camping in the gravel carpark but it was nice enough. They gave us access to a room for a hot shower. 
I think you can also rent their tents but I don't know the price.
W
There are no signs to this place. We followed signs to Silverback lodge and then continued pass for about 2km to find it. 
We didn't eat here but friends told us the food comes from Kinigi and takes 30mins to arrive cold! 

There is also the La Paillotte Gorilla place (hotel) in Kinigi. You can ask for prices and pre-order food there..

name: Fratellis Brussels Belgian Fries
description: Excellent fries! Maybe the best in Africa... Also other dishes.

name: Gisakura Reception Center
description: Information about Nyungwe National Park. Also meeting point for Chimpanzee Tracking. (Permit to be booked in advance www.irembo.gov.rw)

name: Mona Campsite
description: 10000 RWF the night. Basic ablutions. They rwnt tent then its 50USD.

name: Cormoran Lodge
description:
Nice houses overlooking Lake Kivu.
Good restaurant with terasse, rather expensive. Stayed there for lunch.

I didn't ask for camping cause parking was already crowded.

name: Centre d'acceuil Sainte Marie
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

Its Christian. Single room 5000RWF or 10000RWF (with bathroom). 
Camping was not possible. 
Regret that i already stayed for Camping at Bethanie B.

name: Kings Hostel
description: Bed and Breakfast with private rooms or dorms for $15 inc breakfast - very quiet - was only guest there - not much atmosphere but very functional and well located

name: Pizzeria Al Lago Kivu
description:
Pizzeria run by an Italian with his Rwandan/Congolesian wife.  Vers friendly. Woos fired iven for Pizza. Pizza was good.
Variety of Italian wines. 

They offer also rooms. I was for dinner didn't ask about the rooms.

don't be scared of the dark road. it's alright and at the very end behind the gate a Pizza will wait for you... ;-)

name: Musanto Hotel
description:
Cozy small hotel. friendly and heloful staff. Restaurant and Bar. Maby other restaurants around. Safe parking. Standard room 25'000 (1 Person) or 30000 (2 people). Hot shower with good water pressure. 

Nice garden to relax.

name: East Africa Amazon Guesthouse & Campsite
description:
Grassy area in the backyard of the guesthouse. 5000RWF pN. suitable for big trucks but entrance is narrow.

Small kitchen. free wifi. note: there is only 1 toilet and shower which you share with 3 dorm rooms... or you have to book a private room that has a private bathroom for 22.000RWF. Restaurant buffet for 1.200 RWF in the corner.

They can organise tours f.e. Gorilla Tracking in Uganda.

name: Cyimbiri Basecamp
description:
Another guesthouse/campgroud on the Congo-Nile trail, beautiful and quiet just on the lakeside.
It's run by a charity and the manager is a friendly and cultivated young man, fluent in french and english.
Self-contained rooms for 10000 francs, camping in tent on a little flat grassy area, just meters from their small private beach for 5000 francs. Camping in vehicle ok in the yard, but no view from there.
Big dinner for 5000 (they were not expecting anybody, but managed to get some supplies and got some fresh fish from a little fishing boat that was around). Breakfast 2000. Very good coffee from their own plantation.
No village around, so bring supplies if needed.
Great place ! Only downside for me is the absence of beer...

name: Remera Modern Guesthouse
description: Large double with en-suite (shower and western toilet), including breakfast (bread and omelet) for 20.000 rwf. No problem to store two bicycles in the room. All rooms are ground floor. Wi-Fi and hot shower, but the latter takes a long time to heat up.

name: Gisakura Family Hostel
description: We paid 30.000 RWF for a double with en-suite bathroom with western toilet and hot water, includes breakfast. Not cheap for Rwanda, but good price for Gisakura. Monica speaks English and is very helpful. We put our two bicycles in our room.

name: NGH Guesthouse
description: Double room with en-suite (western toilet, cold water in shower) without breakfast 10.000 RWF. Ample space for two bicycles in the room. Possible to park motorcycle behind gate, not cars. Very good value for money, and walking distance to La Paillotte (see review there)  where you can have breakfast.

name: Garage Weikl
description: super place for mechanic work, the Austrian owner Armin know, where you can find parts, place for mechanic work, everything!! Amazing place also for parking the overlander truck, we spent 5 night's in this place.

name: Burundi Embassy
description:
As of September 2018 :
One month tourist visa 90$. 
Three days transit visa 40$. 
10 days turnover waiting for Bujumbura approval. 
Fee paid on pick up day.
You keep your passport during waiting time.
Documents : passport copy and one photo.

Edit October 2018 :
For some reason it took about 5 weeks to get approval from Bujumbura ! But they assured it was not always the case...
Also be aware that you need to give them the exact dates of your planned stay in Burundi (at least that's the case for transit visa).

name: German Butchery
description: This is the former partner of La Galette a few meters away. Fantastic quality of meat and saussages! And really cheap prices. Best adress since Windhoek...

name: Gisa Stay 102
description:
Nice and quiet new place in Masaka area. It's a bit far out of town, but easily accessible by public transport.
The very clean rooms range from 10$ to 25$, there's a nice grassy area for tents (no shade) and 3-4 vehicles can fit in the courtyard (no big rigs).
It lacks sitting spaces outside the house, but this is a work in progress.
Meals and drinks including cold beer are available at good prices.
Run by a friendly and welcoming team who is fluent in english and french.
There's no sign at the entrance so far, but the big green and yellow gate is easily recognisable.
It's not your usual overlander camp, but well worth it if you like staying out of the city.
They also run another similar but smaller place closer to town in Kimironko area (no camping there) called Gisa Stay 101. Both places are on maps.me and booking.com.

name: Peponi living spaces
description:
Rather new guesthouse/hotel with nice clean rooms, safe large parking area, swimmingpool, free Wifi and breakfast for 40$ 2 people. The owner is a nice indian guy.
You have a nice roundview of Kigali opposite the plateau.

name: border between Burundi and Rwanda
description:
we crossed from Burundi to rwanda

rwanda side :
stamped to passport and show vehicle's documents - 15 min

name: Borneo cafe-Indonesian resturant
description: best resturant in Kigali! great and special food. there is buffet Tuesday-Friday from 12:00-15:00- 3,500RWF lots of Indonesian  dishes, soup and dessert.

name: Bisoke
description: Bisoke Hike 3-4h up. 75$. Really muddy. You need to be fit.

name: crema cafe
description: Coffee - Community - Creativity. This trendy cafe serves Question Coffee coffee, a social enterprise based in Kigali which supports around 30 000 women in rural Rwanda farming coffee through NGO Sustainable Growers. Suitable for families, this cafe has indoor and outdoor seating, a co-op shop, artwork on the lawn for sale as well as a Rwandan specialty ice cream trailer, Scoops. Conscious of the environment, metal straws are used for the ice drinks and individual care is taken in crafting a great tasting beverage! Wide range of food and pastries. WiFi is available too. Mon-Tue 06:00 - 18:00, Wed 06:00-20:00, Thurs-Sat 06:00-18:00, Sun 12:00-18:00.

name: virunga lodge
description: very expensive lodge (850$ pp!) and expensive restaurant & bar. we didn't stay but enjoyed the amazing view of the lake and the volcanos.

name: Pili pili
description: Good beer, nice people, lounge music, wonderful view... a must on Sunday evening (there is a swimming pool).

name: NYUNGWE NZIZA ECOLODGE
description:
Wonderful place up to a hill with the plantations all around. This is the last lodge before Nyungwe National Park, so the view is simply gorgeous!!! You can heard only birds, and monkeys far in the forest.
About the prices, for a single room from 40$pp, for a double room from 80$pp. 
Of course you have hot water, and American breakfast included in the price.
Wi-Fi is also available almost everywhere in the lodge.
There is a beautiful fire place in the evening/night where you can spend cool moments with a banana beer. 
Anyway there is a good restaurant, with African or European food ( try the pasta made by Eric, the Italian manager!).
There are also bicycle and car for rent, they organize tours in the park.
The place is very safe, with night guards. Parking inside.
Enjoy the view!!!!

name: NYUNGWE NZIZA ECOLODGE
description:
Wonderful place up to a hill with the plantations all around. This is the last lodge before Nyungwe National Park, so the view is simply gorgeous!!! You can heard only birds, and monkeys far in the forest.
About the prices, for a tent from 7$pp. 
Of course you have hot water and  continental breakfast included!
Wi-Fi is also available almost everywhere in the lodge.
There is a beautiful fire place in the evening/night where you can spend cool moments with a banana beer. 
Anyway there is a good restaurant, with African or European food ( try the pasta made by Eric, the Italian manager!).
There are also bicycle and car for rent, they organize tours in the park.
The place is very safe, with night guards. Parking inside.
Enjoy the view!!!!

name: Rwanda border
description: Very quiet and easy border.  Open from 6am to 6pm

name: Premier Class Laundry & Dry Cleaners
description:
one of many Laundry service in the city,
do Laundry, dry cleaning and ironing
very friendly staff, though a bit pricey- approx 2000RWF per item

name: Bureau de change euphrate
description: If you need change money rwanda/Burundi/DRC, this is a good place, better than border spots

name: Le cafè gourmand
description: The most chic cafe/boulangerie of all Butundi, Nice to take a coffe

name: Hotel
description: Decent hotel with private rooms and dorms. I had to insist to take the bicycle into the room. Negotiated price for a single room with buffet dinner 11'000 RWF.

name: Imigongo Art Center
description:
Great coffee house, fast food, and art centre. Large paved parking area (big rig friendly), covered outdoor seating area with plugs to charge gadgets and very clean western style bathrooms. There are paintings and pottery for sale but there were no pushy sales pitches, very relaxed place. The local owner, Charles, is also very interesting and involved with the community using locally sourced bricks, providing employment etc. After spending a few weeks in western Tanzania this place might as well be in East London.

While not a campsite, the owner said he wouldn't mind overlanders staying in the car park, next to the road but security, toilets, and maybe even electricity are all present! I wish we had stayed here instead of at the Anglican HQ 40 min towards the Tanzanian border east of here.

name: Imigongo Art Center
description: Not a official campsite but the owner of this art centre, Charles, told us that he is open to people staying here overnight in the gravel car park. There is security (though not needed), western style toilets, and electricity outside. Talk to Charles to negotiate first. There is also a great cafe and food available as well as an art and pottery workshop. The place is new, community orientated, and has a good atmosphere. If headed to/from Tanzania, the Rusumo border is about 2 hrs drive.

name: River Site
description:
Very local. Price 5k or 7k for single room. Actually no difference in bitween them. Has a little camping. 
Has a bar with very few food options.

name: Good Heart Lodge
description:
Very local place, they asked me for 10k I give them 6k. Bar at the site, Mutzig beer 700 RF. 
In the evening they took me for dinner. Dinner was 1.4k and it was good. They had only beef with chips.
Very nice and friendly staff, broken English.

name: Centre Diocesain de Pastorale Incuti
description: Nice place on the top of the hill. Rooms starts from RF 7 000, single with shared bathroom. Nice view over the lake Kivu. Secure parking, possibly to park under the roof.

name: Keza Lodge
description: rooms are barely bigger than the bed and very dark! 30,000 for a single!

name: Ruhondo Beach Resort
description: Beautiful square overlooking lake Buhondo. The manager is very friendly, he assigned a room for the toilet and we were able to sleep in our van for 25000FRW. if we wanted the breakfast, the price is 30000 FRW. It's better to have a 4x4 to come here.

name: New Impala Hotel
description:
Camping in your car is allowed in front of the hotel. It is located at a quiet street and there is permanent security. You can use (hot) shower and toilet in the hotel which are good. The restaurant is serving good food, but there are also other nice places nearby. There is good Wi-Fi available.
There is also a parking space behind the hotel if you want more privacy which has a great view. But beware that the owner loves Land Rover (has two himself) so if you drive one you should at least park it in front of the hotel for the picture.
The staff is friendly and helpful. The manager Aimabre is really a great guy.

name: Crown Resort Hotel
description: We stayed on the parking of this hotel in RTT. Electricity, Wifi,  key to a bathroom. Beautiful garden with big pool, restaurant and bar. Music till 11 pm. Perfect for just a night stop on the way to Kigali. Paid 15000 RF

name: MTN Service Center
description:
First place to buy a SIM card when coming from Uganda. In Rwanda, you can buy SIM cards from the street vendors, but if you need a nano-SIM (e.g for iPhone) it needs to be cut to fit. At this NTM Shop they can do this for you. 

Shop is one floor up. There are toilets and a small bakery next door. 

A SIM card is 1500 RWF and you’re given a few MB of data and airtime. 10GB/30 days is 10.000 RWF.

name: Westgate bar&lodge
description: Small hotel, very simple. Three rooms. It’s clean and very cheap (between 7000 and 10000). Hot water on request. No camping available.

name: Acces bank
description: ATM only visa card, mastercard doesn't working

name: Gishwati Reserve turn
description: really really worth going this road, it's picturesque! No entrance fee

name: Chez Maman Joy
description: Food is ready, you just choose what you want. Vege is 1000 no matter how much you take. Meat a little more. Cold beer. Fast and ok.

name: hidden bush camp
description: nice place next to the road but hidden in the trees. We stopped for lunch but seems to be good place to stay for the night. No people around, you cam hear road but it's ok. The turn to this place is around 200 m on the north

name: SIM card tigo
description: You can buy a SIM card here and register with your passport. SIM with 1 gb is 500 tz shillings. In case, ATM at opposite site of the street, but it charge you 8000 shilling per transaction.

name: bush camp in the forest
description: Nice spot in the middle of the forest, sometimes some bike or motorcykle crossed us but nobody stopped, at night you can hear some trucks on the road but it's fine. Nobody bothered us. Well it's a game reserve so I'm not sure if it' allowed to sleep there ;) but the road seems to go to some village so seems to be public.

name: Wildcamp by the lake
description:
There is a big grassy flat area leading to the beach where the fishermen have their boats. I asked permission to the fishermen to camp. Apparently someone else camp there already. Some workers they said. I’m assuming people working on the trail?

Great milky way view early at night.

name: Muyumbu Campsite
description:
Nice flat campsite with an amazing view, inside the national park. 

Toilets and a well for water is available. There’s also a fire pit and fire wood is supplied. 

A bit windy as it’s on a peak.

name: Akagera Rhino Lodge
description:
Lodge 20 minutes outside Akagera National Park, with an amazing view! Perfect place to stay before and after Akagera. 

Small place with some 6 bungalows for 60 USD/night. Camping isn’t something they usually offers, but the manager Joseph happily let us stay for 15 000 RWF/night. Call in advance just to make sure. We used the toilets in the restaurant and the shower in one of the rooms. They’ll boil water if you want a hot shower. 

Hard to find a spot where you can be leveled for your roof top tent, but there’s a lot of flat rocks around to level out the car. 

As it’s a lodge, food is on the expensive side, about 7000 for dinner and the same for breakfast.

Staff is super friendly, all of them! They do everything to make you comfortable. 

Last 10 minutes is bad road. A 4x4 is needed, or at the very least a car with high ground clearance. I wouldn’t want to do it without low gears. With low gears it’s not a problem though, slow and steady. 

Phone +250 788 865 016

name: Abel Couture
description: An excellent tailor with some ready made items in kitenge, materials and tailoring services. Bring your kitenge and get anything you want made. 20k for a dress, 10k for top. Very high quality and they make sure it is right for you. See the manager Gaston.

name: Venus villa guest house
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner. 

Is at Musanze district,it is only 6_10 mins, from Musanze park to Venus villa guest house. 
It located to 2nd Berch near Muslim's masjid.
We welcom you all,and thank you gor being with us!

name: Congo Nile Trail
description: you can drive the whole trail with your car! great views! 4×4 necessary

name: Question coffee
description:
Great coffee and fast wifi.
Best we’ve had in a while!

name: Gisa Stay 101
description:
Good option for budget stay in Kigali!  Clean rooms with shared bathroom! 
it is on booking.com but we didn't book in advance! It would be 10 US $ (also on website) but in franc it was 8000 for the double room 2 person! 
Nice staff and they have a kitchen for preparing own food or you can order breakfast, lunch or dinner if you tell in advance! (see pictures)
Hot shower, two shared bathrooms. wifi available 
good value for money
secured parking but not for big cars! we have landrover defender 110
they also have a nice souvenir shop

name: German Embassy
description: For all Germans a good place to fix passport issues or anything else!  A very friendly and helpfull team! We got issued our temporary passport as second one within a day because we were running out of pages. Show up between Mon -Thu 9-11 am.

name: B.Alpha Kibuye
description:
next to Fortebet there is a shop with small restaurant inside for breakfast.
Ginger chai 200
milk 200
chapati 100
omelette 500

name: The Nest - Kigali
description: Boutique guest house with beautiful en-suite rooms in an amazing neighborhood in Kimihurura. Near to the city centre, close to Kigali convention centre and many restaurants in walking distances. Friendly staff who'll love to help you settle into Kigali

name: City Valley Motel
description: Cheap and clean hotel with friendly reception in Kigali downtown next to the main bus station. Double Rooms for 12000 RWF with road view and shared bathroom or 20000 RWF with garden view and bathroom inside. Breakfast included for one person. Big buffet for 3000 RWF.

name: COMESA Insurance
description: the place to extend your comesa yellow card

name: La Palisse Hotel
description: Hotel offering camping facilities for overlanders with own equipment or will hire tent for you. 8000RWF per vehicle per night. Access to pool is charged extra. No breakfast. Use pool showers etc. Close to airport.

name: Dian Fossey Research Centre
description: Excellent exhibition on Dian Fossey, her life and Gorilla conservation. Free entry. Open every day of the week, including Public Holidays!

name: Urugo Roadside Cafe
description: A lovely roadside cafe (sheltered and adjoined to arts centre and campsite) offering pizza, sandwiches, tea, coffee, muffins, and juices. Stopped here for an hour for a breakfast of eggs, coffee, potatoes, and fruit (with my bike parked right next to me!)

name: Haven Of Peace
description:
a reasonable prized guesthouse in a tranquil area away, but still closed to the town centre. 
single room 8.000 RFC, double room 10.000 RFC,including (weak) Wifi, private bathroom, hot shower, cosy outside terrace and even a shared kitchen that you can use for 2.000 / day if desired.

name: Kirehe Guest House
description: Not a good experience. We agreed in paying the price of a ‘middle’ room 10,000 francs, so we could use the bathroom and camp in our vehicle. The room is a 1 person room. The bathroom didn’t have water at first and the toilet seat was covered in pee. The manager was rude and laughed in my face when I adressed these issues. We just left the filth, erratic water and cold shower for what it was and stuck to our own facilities.

name: Pure Africa Cafe
description:
This coffee shop has one room at the back for 4 people.

The staff are amazing they were always available to help. They washed all of our laundry free of charge including all our bedding from the rooftop tents !!

We paid $60 per night for 4 people including breakfast (choice of omelets, pancakes etc. and great coffee!!)

Parking within walled garden (camping not possible).

name: Rwandamotor
description:
This is the old Land Rover centre in Kigali.
They still have links to Land Rover and stock many parts.
Friendly staff.
Not cheap $40 per hour, but they give you a full quote before they start. I used some of my parts as they were so expensive ($120 for a fuel filter!!)

name: Motel la Gazelle
description: 10.000 francs. Basic place with parking. Very good for overlanders. I don't know for sybarites...

name: Eagle Nest Lodge
description:
Very basic place. Clean enough. Cold bucket shower.
5.000 Francs

name: Elegance hotel
description:
Slightly expensive hotel. Good rooms with private bathroom and average WiFi in the hall.
Price was 40k francs for a double room with breakfast. Additional 3k for dinner.

name: Remera Ruhondo
description: This is a spiritual retirement hotel. It's a church-owned place on top of a hill with awesome views to a lake and to the volcanoes. The road to get here is about 15km of dust road but should be ok during the dry season. We paid 20k rwf pp with dinner and breakfast.

name: Kirehe Sun City Motel
description:
A seemingly new, modern motel approx 20km from the Rw/Tz border at Rusumo. Welcome was warm even though staff don’t speak great English.
B&B was RWF 30,000. I was shown two rooms I could choose from - a smaller one at the back, or a larger at the front – I chose the smaller one because the place is right on the road and I wanted the quieter place. There is a restaurant/bar on site and the food was good local fare - don’t know price as I was invited to join a group.
There is no place for a tent, but you might be allowed to “camp” in car park with a vehicle.
Rooms were clean, modern and everything worked - hot water too. WiFi was free and worked excellently.

name: Spa Shallum
description: 2 single rooms available for USD18.- incl. breakfast. Simple, clean & directly at lake Kivu. Place just opened & is run by some young people doing a great job. Stayed 2 days here to recover from riding. Great place to relax. No restaurant / bar, but many places nearby.

name: Dereva Hotel
description: 30k RWF for single room, double bed & en-suite. Clean & comfortable. Good restaurant, bar & pool.

name: Africa Riding Adventures
description:
- SWM motorcycles dealer 
- Any Motorcycles Sales and After Sales Services 
- Motorcycles Parts and Accessories: Spare Parts, Tyres, Inner Tubes, Riders Apparel

name: Polyclinique du Plateau Kigali Rwanda.
description: Wow the fastest and most professional medical service that I have ever experienced. Doctor saw me in 30 minutes, test results back in 1 hour. Cost was 17000 Rfr for doctor and 45000 Rfr for 5 different tests.

name: Coffe shop
description: Good coffee, sandwiches, samosas and more. Fast free internet. Shop is also there. Very good place for a break. Next to an ATM.

name: Heroes Motel
description: Small and nice place with a wonderful garden. Quiet and near to the city. Single room after negotiating for 7000 RWF and double room for 10'000 RWF (you have to be married:-) Cold shower but every day you get a bucket of hot water. Very friendly staff. Restaurant is ok but I recommend to go to the city. There are different restaurant for very good prices. Secure car park. Maybe they would allow to camp with a safari car. There is not enough space for a big rig. Very good option.

name: Haven of Peace Hotel
description: Basic, small hotel with hot water (no door between bathroom and room). Parking space. 10 minutes walk to main street. room for 2 with breakfast was 14.000 RWF. great green garden to relax in a quiet place.

name: Scenic drive
description: The DR1 is a stunning drive through the Nyungwe National Park. We stopped here but you can go to the Burundi border. It's a dirt road but in good condition (2x2ok). We saw monkeys and birds. And it's free!

name: Kimironko Market
description: Great local market. Many stalls with fruits, veggies, housewares, clothes & shoes, gorgeous fabrics and seamstresses ready to make you a new outfit, and great souvenirs. Fun place to explore!

name: Uwinka Visitors Center, Nyungwe National Park
description: Starting point for park hikes (guide mandatory). See picture for list of hikes - $40pp. We didn't hike but the interpretive center has great info about the plants, animals, and history of the park. Worth a stop. And the drive through the park is stunning (And free).

name: The Peak Spot
description: Guesthouse with camping available on beautifully kept lawn with views of the volcanoes.   $30 per tent per night including access to a bathroom for a hot shower. Beautiful views of the volcanoes and lovely staff. Camping with RTT in car park which is on a small slope but if you park across it you can get more or less level, given we parked in the car park we negotiated $20 for 2 of us and the car.  You can also hire tents and they have rooms and also two bedroom bungalows. Lovely place.

name: Aromas hotel
description:
Large, clean double room with bathroom.
10,000RWF for two of us.
 When turning off the sealed road, it’s a pretty bad dirt road but only for a km or so.
Secure parking.
A little noisy from the street.
Cheapest / nicest room we could find.
Didn’t ask about camping due to the language barrier.

name: Pam’s quality Landry and dry cleaning.
description:
We spent forever trying to find a laundry that does it by weight not per piece. 
Finally found this place. 
Was 20,000 for a HUGE basket, (2 weeks worth of clothes for 2 people) plus our bed sheets.

name: SP gas
description:
Before you can fill up you need to come here to pay for the gas; 
Cogebanque building, 
7th floor. 
SP office. 

Once you have done that then go to the following coordinates with your receipt and invoice.
S1.95031
E30.06061

We filled up a South African bottle. 
870RWF per kg.

name: T2000
description:
We broke our power inverter and this place is the only one that sells them. 
500w inverter 57,000RWF
300w inverter 43,000RWF
Also sells cameras and many other electrical items.

name: Kigali art cafe
description:
Best coffee we have had in a while. Really lovely set up, food is also really good. 
Especially the burger and wraps. 
Perfect morning hangout.

name: Supermarket
description: A small supermarket (but largest in Gisenyi) to buy staples and fresh bread. Across the street from local market with fresh fruit, veg, clothes, housewares, etc.

name: Haji Enterprises
description: Standard Rwandan buffet for 2400rwf with a drink. Nothing special, but not bad. There is also plenty of street food kinda stuff, brochettes, corn etc. outside. There are a few small shops nearby as well for the basics.

name: Supermarket
description: Small supermarket that sells everything you need, from cheese, juice, coffee, fresh bread, snacks to decent toiletries.

name: ITUZE Motel
description:
They offer nice rooms for 10000fr
The restaurant offers very good food.
Stuff is amazingly friendly!
Free Wifi

name: Guest House La Cigale Chez Rugina
description:
What a nice place. Private parking. Extremely clean rooms. It looks like they may have just renovated as everything is new.

No wifi, no breakfast but that's ok. Perfect for a hot shower and night's rest.

name: Auto Capeli - BMW bike parts
description:
Edward is the importer due BMW motos for the national police force. he had filters and oil, brake pads, shock absorbers...

±250788528356 

Autogapeli2@gmail.com for parts / info

name: Road - Akagera NP and Kigali
description: Very bad road, too small and unstable bridges. A bridge broke down when we were on it and we got stuck with our Landcruiser. All the people from the village helped (100+ people). Advisable if you want a big adventure and ‘once in a lifetime experience’, but we would NEVER take this road again. Super dangerous.

name: Asimba Guesthouse
description: Beautiful villa with 5 private rooms with ensuite bathrooms to treat yourself. The owner Justine is the best! Around $50 for a double room including breakfast. Swimmingpool, gorgeous rooms and quite place to stay!

name: ViaVia Kigali
description:
ViaVia Kigali is a guesthouse, bar and restaurant. We have 3 gardens to pitch your tent in. You can use the bathroom of the dormitory to shower in. 

We serve a healthy, vitamin-packed breakfast (not included in the price of camping) and our restaurant also has appetizers, mains and desserts.

Our terrace is a nice place to chill from.

name: Mamba Club for Overlander
description: We enjoyed our stay at the Mamba Club very much. It is not the quietest place but you can watch the Volley ball players and enjoy yourself by 8ball and bowling. The staff is friendly and they offer laundry service. We payed 5000 Franc per night, had shower in our car. Sure they open a room for shower, maybe extra costs. Clean Swimmingpool. The place is close to the Garage Armin Weikl, the best Garage in Town.

name: Gisa stay 103
description: Very nice camp site with a view on the beautiful skyline of Kigali. Possibility to parc the rig on a nice flat space. Green area for placing tents. Excellent (!) staff, free laundry, hot water, very good wifi. Very good food. Everything could not be better. Very quiet spot. 5 dollar for camping per night so not per person! You will not get it better in Kigali.

name: My Hill Eco Lodge
description: Lovely eco lodge in the middle of the lake on a hill with stunning view ! 100 dollars the room included breakfast, 3 beers and boat. The view from the room is beautiful. Peaceful place. Nice terrasse and bar. There is a two terrasse with grass which would be perfect to camp but we did not ask if we are allowed.

name: chez Emilienne
description:
This place is not an hotel but a private house which is advertised on the Airbnb website. We want to give more visibility to this place, as Emilienne, the owner, is an amazing and lovely women and her place is great and has a big history.
She survived from the genocide but she lost her entire family. A few years ago, she built a new house above the ruins of her family's one with the idea to welcome people and travellers to share her story and to give a new and fresh spirit to this place where she lost her family. That's really brave and her way to move forward and to honor her family. With the money she got, she is building a second house to help and support other women who survived the genocide.

When we stayed, we used the nice 2 persons bedroom (less than 30 000 RWF), but you can probably use your tent/rooftop tent in the secured garden too. This needs to be discussed and agreed with Emilienne upfront. You can contact her,  a few days before coming as she is not living full time there, with this number: 00250788537123.
You can get diner for 3500 RWF pp and breakfast was for us included in the room.
Really nice garden with grass and beautiful view.

Emilienne was wonderful too. She came from Kigali to share diner with us even if she had to drive back the day after for a meeting at 08:00.

name: ATM Cogebanque
description: ATM with no fees. Language English and France

name: Sailors Restaurant and Cafe
description: Good local food. Buffet style 1000RWF for a plate (rice, beans, potato chips, bananas stew, cassava, spinach, spaghetti, sauce) if you add meat it’s 300RWF for each piece of meat you take. Cold beer available. Nice seating on the terrace.

name: Fantastic fresh fruit and veg market.
description: Fantastic fresh fruit and vegetables market. Open everyday.

name: Ishara Beach Camp
description:
Camping available directly on the beach on the shores of lake Kivu. You can choose to be on the beach, or there is a grassy spot just before the beach that you can use as well. 

Clean flush toilets just off the beach- we didn’t try the showers. The place is under construction (guest houses on the beach to open soon). A small beach bar is available as well, however when we were there it wasn’t bothersome at all- music was turned off around 9PM.

Power available at the bar. 

Turn off is 20 metres before the Ishara Motel (which is affiliated/ same property). 

10,000 per tent.

name: Pitstop auto clinic & Spa
description:
Good garage. Will come to wherever you are and do repairs and services.

These coordinates are for the workshop. 

The owners name is Sachu and can be contacted on  +250732901706 very helpful and prices are very fair.

name: Mr Service Auto Repair Workshop
description:
Turkish run mechanics yard, do all makes of vehicle.  
Changed Universal joint on our Land Rover propshaft in the hour. Own supplied part. 
RWF 20.000 per hour.

KN 12 Ave, Kigali
+250 787 67 34 34
+250 787 01 23 23

name: Eastland Hotel
description:
10,000/15,000/20,000 RWF/night for single room with breakfast (6 rooms available with different sizes). 25,000 RWF/night for twin bed with breakfast (2 rooms available). 25,000 RWF/night for double room ("VIP") with breakfast.

Secure parking behind the hotel. Careful: they washed my motorcycle after I had said no thank you.

Breakfast of fruit, bread, omlette, honey, and coffee. The coffee at the new cafe near the round about (-1.902486, 30.50621) is very, very good. There's also a bar.

Reception: 0788313271
Service: 0781075684
Management: 0787003930
eastlandhotel@yahoo.com

name: Sifa Guest House
description:
8,000 RWF for large room with double bed, hot shower, flushing toilet, sink, chair, and small table. Very friendly and helpful.

Parking space for 3-4 cars/4x4s or about 10 motorcycles. Unsuitable for big rigs.

Bar has a restaurant that serves meat (no meals). Music from the bar finishes about 10 pm.

name: Buffet Place
description: Nice buffet for 1300 including a piece of meat. They have tea and coffee

name: Primo Bar
description:
Cheap place if you stay in the town.
Very basic, bucket shower, but quite clean.
Rooms are behind the bar in another building.
Price is 5.000 per room

name: Umut Restaurant
description:
A really good Turkish restaurant with average prices, very good food. You can have Turkish sandwich at 3500, meal at 5000, pizza or burger at 5500.
WiFi avalaible and the restaurant is well decorated.

name: Kitabi Reception NP
description: You can buy your permits here for chimpanzee tracking and hike and ask for any other information! online it showed booked for the next days but here they found an opening in 2 days. Friendly staff and very helpful

name: Cyamudongo Forest
description: This forest is where the bigger group of chimps reside and where you will go with your guide from the Gisakura reception, who will have to drive with you to get here. Make sure this is where you track them as at the main park the group is much smaller and the forest much bigger and chances are slim to see them. They offered we could go here for free after a 5 hr bush mission on the same permit on the same day with the same guide. It is took about 2hrs with the last part bumpy tracks, so all in all not an easy activity this chimp tracking but well worth the effort to see them in the wild.

name: Jibu Pure Water
description: RWF1500 for refilling own container of 25 litres. Phone +250 785 12 1071; rwanda@jibuco.com

name: Beach bar
description: Local bar right on the beach for a beer and some local tunes. Food took an hour and arrived wrapped in plastic as it comes from the restaurant up the road, it was good though and well flavored.

name: REBEX Bureau de change
description: Got Ugandan Shillings for the CIP for the border here. Phone +250 788 500 054

name: Java House Coffee Shop
description: Kenyan brand coffee shop, offering beverages for sit down or on the go. Also pastries and meals. Rwandan coffee in the hopper!

name: Turkish supermarket
description: Surprisingly enough a small supermarket full of Turkish products, lots of dried lentils, couscous, kebab, cheese, etc and reasonably priced! Owners are the same as MrService the garage.

name: Simba center
description: Simba supermarket upstairs, 24/7 coffee shop and pizza place, cell phone stores, DHL and other general crap. Free wifi at Bourbon Coffee with some pretty nice food and cakes.

name: No fee ATM (KCB)
description: KCB banks do not charge a withdrawal fee. Plenty of branches around the city.

name: Lookout bar
description: Incredible views to be had from this spot! Sheraton Pub will arrange a table for a drink or two overlooking the misty hills and peaks in the distance. Enjoy and well worth the stop!

name: Turn off for Remera Ruhondo
description: Take this dirt road to the Remera Ruhondo accommodation. 7 kilometres to the hotel one way. Great vistas and views to be had!

name: Fromagerie La Lumiere
description: Cheese makery where you can buy fresh cheese, only Rwf2000 for a small wheel of 500gr. You can’t go in due to hygiene but just ask and they will sell you some vacuum packed young cheese.

name: Choma’d
description: Nyama choma (grilled meat) is the dish of Africa and this hip place with a big covered terrace with long tables provides just that, meat dishes and beer! Nice place for a meal or some drinks

name: Modern Bazaar Turkish Supermarket & Restaurant
description:
It's a Turkish Supermarket.
And you can find the best 
Adana Kebab,
Beef Brochette, 
Chicken Brochette,
Chicken Wings (barbecued)

For more information, you can call +250 789 229 227

name: MTN service center
description: MTN service center for sim card with data. Took a while as the network was down but in the end all worked well...

name: Imuhira Ecotourism Rwanda
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner.   

We are a registered, Rwandan based Eco Tourism project and our name "IMUHIRA" means "At Home". We own a campsite in Nyamasheke District on the  shores of Lake Kivu. We organize and sell different community based tourism activities in the communities around the Kivu Belt Destination especially in the area between Lake Kivu and Nyungwe National Parks. Our value comes from passion we have to provide support, comfort, safe environment, affordable products/services and commitment to go beyond client’s expectations.

name: GTBank ATM
description:
This ATM has no fees. 

Extra text for 40 characters.

name: Green Haven Motel
description: A cosy motel with secure parking. Free breakfast with the room and wifi.

name: Bisesero Genocide Memorial
description: National monument commemorating the genocide.

name: Stafford & Family Cafe & Fastfood
description: Nice cafe along the road close to Kigali. Very good coffee. Very nice place and clean toilets. A stop here is highly recommended.

name: Filon d'or
description: Found this campsite through Google, coordinates might not be exact. A bar and restaurant offering rooms 25k and up. On the side they had a great lawn were with language difficulty we managed to camp with RTT. Very nice friendly staff, used restaurant toilet, and they brought a bucket with hot water for shower. Music on till around 11.30pm. Had a meal here chicken and chips and salad 16k for 2. Paid 10k each for camping which is what we offered. Good stop over on the outskirts of Musanze when crossing the border Uganda to Rwanda. Mtn centre in geico plaza in musanze for Internet and sim card

name: Happiness Star Motel
description: Good value for money. 20,000 RWF for a double room incl breakfast (2 people). Big room, hot shower with good pressure, mosquito net and proper WiFi. Secured parking behind a gate, no shelter so we could park our motorcycles inside the building. Friendly staff who speak good English. For dinner we had chicken with rice for 4,000 RWF per dish.

name: Akagera neighbors
description:
We could pitch our tent in the garden of the Akagera Neighbors (this is a hotel, a bar, a restaurant and a shop) for 10 dollars for two people and one night. They stop the music and switch off the lights for us to sleep quiet. Very friendly. We could access the kitchen of the restaurant. The speak french and/or english.
Possible to stay overnight wirh a car on the parking as well. Or let a room.

name: Akagera Ihema Viewpoint Campsite
description:
Beautiful view over the national park of Akagera, it worth it to come here as well only for the view. We stayed here for 10000FrRw per night for one tent and two people. No shower but you can ask for a jerrycan of water. 
Not a lot of place for a camper but easy with a tent. They will make a better place for camper in the future. Very friendly.
You can call Ariane at this number (from Belgium).

name: Kumbya Retreat Centre (Missionary Summer Camp)
description:
Not at all an official camp site but a missionary summer camp. Locked gates opened by caretaker we were allowed to camp just by the lake kivu. Only a toilet and water available. Great views and bird life. Offered 10k rfw for 2 cars 2 pax accepted. Caretaker 24 hrs.
Not far from rwanda to Congo border.

name: New Planet Motel
description: decent place, relatively clean, big rooms. Payed 7000 for a double room. We could take bicycles inside the room. Big parking lot mayebe not for high rigs because of cables. They offer dinner but it takes long.

name: Old Mutual Insurance
description:
COMESA insurance available.
$90 for 3 months
$50 for 1 month
Third party only
Good for Rwanda, Burundi, Congo, Uganda, Kenya.

name: Ruzizi 1 Border Crossing
description:
Congo to Rwanda. 
$5 Rapid COVID test taken at border.
Turn in Vehicle Import Document.
Cross bridge to Rwanda. 
No bribes. Fast checkout. 20 mins max.

name: Ruzizi 1 Border Crossing
description:
Crossing from Congo to Rwanda.

No PCR, No Vaccine Requirements.
Probably because Congo requires exit $5 rapid COVID test. 

$50 1 month tourist visa, available at border. 
Vehicle import permit, one month free. After 1 month, renewed for $30.

No bribery. Very fast. 20 mins. Smoothest border crossing ive ever done in Africa.

name: Umuko Lodge.
description:
An amazing view from the upper grass lawn overlooking Lake Muhazi, only 90 minutes away from kigali.
Umuko Lodge owned and run by a friendly Belgian couple offers a restaurant and bar, swimming pool, WiFi and cabins.
Allowed to park on the upper lawn with our RTT. Price is normally 20k for first person and 10k per person after( negotiable).
Very clean showers and toilet available. Fresh water top up too, and if need be they can charge yr phone or store your food in their fridge. Also offer various activities.

name: Akagera transit lodge/ camping
description: A hotel with really nice rooms approx $80 with breakfast for 2. They also have a lawn for ground camps. With a RTT on the side they have a driveway with flat space to park near the lawn, pit fire and with a long cord allowed us to use electricity for fridge etc. Also a restaurant, and coffee bar on site. Allowed us to use 1 of the rooms for a really hot powerful shower and toilet. Good English speaking receptionist and very friendly staff. Normal price for camping 25k but negotiable. Recommended before Akagera Park just a drive away, but $100 P. P for foreigners and $40 for car or if you are crossing the border from Rwanda to Tanz. WiFi in bar and restaurant.

name: Elisabeth Lodge
description: Nice safe lodge with really nice people. Place for safely parking car behind gates. Allowed to cook at car. Room with hot shower 20k for single 30 or 20 k for 2. Very clean. Ideal if you are on your way to or from Mwanza.

name: lokals Quarry
description: Nice overnight spot, with amazing view. Lokals staying on main road and keep distance in the evening. In the morning a few kids around. Rocky road 100m down the hill for a level spot. peaceful quiet night!

name: La Galette supermarket
description: They don’t really have supermarkets in Rwanda. But this is a supermarket and restaurant in one place. Expensive, but very nice! Butcher, Bakery, wine and fresh products! So for a one stop shop, great!

name: Akagera Motors
description:
Next to the Toyota dealer there is Akagera motors. They sold most of the place to Toyota, but they still have their own shop.
Super friendly and flexible. Our Land Cruiser needed new shock absorbers but the Toyota dealer didn’t have them. Akagera checked it and replaced the rubbers, which was all what was needed.
They’re very professional. They do about 10-12 cars a day. Staff speaks English, is friendly and tries to come up with solutions.
They are specialized in Toyota and Mercedes. But they work on all car brands. Yan is the owner.

name: The Ellen DeGeneres campus Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund
description: This is the new location for the Dian Fossey research centre. A very large complex housing Dian Fossey exhibitiion and Gorilla centre. A wonderful informative and interactive place with short films in a 360degree cinema and learning centre. All indoors and some outdoor walks with views of 6 volcanoes if the weather permits. Its free to view but a donation is expected, they usually ask for $20 and you get a free coffee at the onsite cafe but you can give what you think is ok. All in,all a very good place to visit and learn about Dian Fossey and Gorillas.

name: Airtel and MTN SIM CARDS
description: The shops from Airtel and MTN are close to each other. You can buy sim cards here. We paid 200 Francs for an Airtel sim card + 3000 Francs for 3.5 GB data valid for 30 days of 3g internet. If you want 4g it's not much more expensive but the lady didn't tell me that, so you must specify it.

name: Engen (Visa card accepted)
description: Engen filling station in which they accept Visa card payment. I don't know if it's current here in Rwanda as this is our first time filling up the tank but in TZ it's rare that they accept it. Also diesel is cheaper here than in Tanzania.

name: Fruits and Veggies
description: A small market with lots women selling a large variety of fruits and veggies at the same place. Have the feeling in Rwanda there's not as many women selling stuff by the road as in Tanzania. Maybe they concentrate in places like this. Open daily.

name: Khana Khazana Kiyovu (Indian Restaurant)
