description: Excellent indian restaurant ! Pleasant atmosphere, free wifi, parking inside and out in the street with an askari at the entrance. A bit upper class but nothing fancy. Jeera rice 3300, paneer butter masala 8500, chicken spinach (pahadi kebab) 8500, cheese garlic naan 4500. Simply delicious!

name: Kurry Kingdom Indian Restaurant
description: Wow! Another delicious Indian Restaurant in Kigali. We found it even better than Khana Khazana Kiyovu Restaurant that we've added 2 days ago. It's also slightly cheaper. Great atmosphere, good service but took quite long for dishes to be ready. Safe parking inside and outside. Panner Butter Masala 7000 FRW, Chicken spinach 7800 FRW, jeera rice 2800 FRW.

name: Quality Inn Executive Rooms
description: Left Kigali late so we arrived here around sunset. Found nowhere to wild camp on the way as it was too crowded. Asked to camp with a rooftop tent at the parking lot which has a nice mountain view but she asked for the same price as for the rooms so we took the room. Excellent and clean rooms with hot shower. She wanted 30,000 FRW for 2 people but we negotiated to 20,000 FRW which we found really worth it. Great MTN and Airtel mobile internet.

name: King's Palace Museum, Sacred Cows & Hiking Trails
description: Very interesting guided visit that takes around 1 hour. Last visit departs at 5pm. Lady at reception said they could allow camping at their parking lot. Price for internationals is 6000 for King's Palace and 3000 FRW for Inyambo Cows. There are also 2 hiking trails available starting from here passing through villages and museums +- 8 km to 10 km long.

name: Café Chez Venant
description: I could not find the other bakery but here you can find bread, potatoes samosas / beef samosas and a few pastries.

name: Engen Butare (Visa Accepted)
description: Filling station where they accepted our Visa card without extra fees.

name: Tiny Peninsula in Nyamasheke
description: After not being able to find Imuhira Ecotourism Campsite we arrived here. Talked to the caretaker in kiswahili (no English or French) and he kindly allowed us to stay. Around 5pm many "give me money" children came to visit and stayed around until almost 7pm. But they were doing it more for the fun than for actually begging... Had a pleasant night sleep except from some fishermen passing on the lake and chatting during the night from time to time. In the morning 2 guys came as soon as we left the tent and started asking questions but all very kind. They left 30 minutes later and we had a few hours in total peace during the morning. Saw otters and a beautiful turaco as well as many other birds. Access road is great gravel, no 4x4 required. Great Mobile internet with Airtel and MTN.

name: Burger Planet
description: We stopped for a quick coffee and didn't expected too much - but the cappuccino was very delicious and the fries also 😉. Good for a quick stop 👍🏻

name: Broken Bridge!
description: This bridge is broken as of 27 May 2022! No detour possible by car.

name: Richard Trading Supermarket & Rukara Supermarket
description: Two supermarkets one on each side of the road. Both accepted Visa credit card payment. Good variety of goods: cheese, yogurt, wine, butter... Rukara was cheaper so start there and buy the rest at Richard Trading.

name: Inuma Inn & Campsite
description: New campsite by the main road. Ground tents can camp at the lawn and rooftop tents must camp at a huge parking lot with a nice view. Probably a bit noisy because of the road. They asked for 5,000 rfw ppn.

name: Volcanoes Forest Camp
description: As usual ground tents can use a nice lawn and rooftop tents use the parking lot but the owner said he would change it soon. They asked 10,000 RWF ppn. Really next to the road.

name: Extremely Fast Free Wifi at Volcanoes NP Office
description: At the Volcanoes National Park office and headquarters they offer free wifi and it's extremely fast! (downloaded 1gb in +-3 minutes!) There are some comfy ppaces to site in shelter and even some plugs available.

name: Inuma Inn and Campsite
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by person associated with business.

hello everyone. 
iam happy that iam the first guest in this campsite , the owner his name Andrew he just open this business,  i was happy to put this camping here to help him , he is friendly and  he like bicycle.  just came here you will enjoy with him and u dont find any problems in the prices and services. 
please support him

name: Tourguide Jean-Paul
description:
We wanted to do the Congo-Nile-Trail and met Jean-Paul, he is a tourguide from the area and was very helpful. We first intended to do the trail on our own but after negotiating a good price, Jean-Paul accompanied us and it was great having him with us. He organized a boat to pick us up from Musaya Hotel where we were camping (and where we were also allowed to safely park our car during the 3 days we were on the hike). We were dropped off at Musasa including a visit to monkey island and the swimming cows on the way. We then hiked from Musasa to Gisenyi in 3 days, it was lovely! Jean-Paul knows many short cuts along the way and it was nice to be able to speak with the locals. He also negotiated good prices at the guesthouses we were staying. We can fully recommend him as a tourguide. He also offers boat tours on Lake Kivu.
You can reach him under this number +250 787 141 948

name: Iliza Beach Kibuye
description:
Right at the lake with a private beach, there are 8 bungalows as well as a little campsite (space for ground tents and max. 2 cars with RTT). A beautiful spot to stay in Kibuye and enjoy the lake and spectacular sunsets. 
There are flush toilets and hot showers. $10pppn
Aimable, the owner, also offers tours on his houseboat around the lake. He is very friendly and will help you making plans and arrangements wherever you want to go. He also has his private island and a hotel in Kigali (New Impala Hotel, also on iOverlander)
Call or whatsapp +250788301315 
Mail: info@ilizaexpeditions.com

name: Biryogo car free street food
description: Car free street food with great food and good music. It is open everyday ad they start serving food around lunch time. There is a stage with live music during the evening. As it is the Muslim district, no alcohol is served but the African tea is delicious. The food is really cheap for delicious meat and pilau rice.

name: Cleaned laundry $ dry cleaners
description: Normally priced per clothing, but after some negotiation we got a full laundry for 10 000, dried it ourself.

name: Huye mountain coffee
description: A restaurant and coffee shop opening in August. But you can get coffee now for 1000 RWF. Really nice, local brewed espresso.

name: Beach Garden
description: Stayed for 2 nights. Standard is ok, but not super clean and beds are not very nice to sleep in. They said the water was hot, but didn't try. no mosquito nets on the windows or over the bed. Paid RDF 30 000 per night. Compared to other places around it is very expensive for the quality. Safe parking within compound.

name: Chinese restaurant
description: Very good and affordably Chinese food. The staff are also very professional and helpful. Only place I've eaten where they remembered my allergy!

name: Iliza Malibu
description: Iliza Malibu Beach is hidden gem located on the shores of Lake Muhazi. It's atmosphere along with eye-catching sceneries gives you a feeling of tranquility and happiness. It's large garden can host up to 300+ people at once, which makes it suitable location for various events, parties and a camping site for camp lovers. On the shores of Lake Muhazi lies a beach house with four bedrooms and an outstanding view on the Lake. Iliza Malibu beach is a home far from home.

name: Maddy's kitchen
description: Very nice and clean hotel. Nice beds, and hot shower with a good pressure. It has a indian restaurant, but the chef was out when we where there. The staff are very nice and helpful. Safe parking within compound. Paid RWF 30 000 for a doble room.

name: Fravan Eco Resort
description: Space for large and rooftop tents in the car park, and a nice green garden campsite in the gardens. There is food and a bar-restaurant. Manager Jean +250 788 356 603 gave us a room key to shower warm. They locked the gate at night, so safe. Beautiful bird song in the morning. Recommend at a great price. We were a family of 5 and paid 10usd to stay. Manager might change the price to per person as we were the first overlanding vehicle they hosted. Not sure about paying more in most African car parks, one always walks away feeling 10usd too much per person, but per car, good price.

name: Kivu Paradis
description: Stayed in the car park in our caravan. Really good place to stay for 10k Rwf a night, this is complete no matter the amount people. This is the first time they have guests like this. We used a close by toilet and there is possibly hot showers. The food is really great! Beautiful gardens and birds!! The lake is accessed through a short walk through lush gardens. Recommended as best place along this side of lake, we tried other spots but this took the prize, super neat hotel.

name: Forest of Hope
description: Registered Non Government Camp site which has great toilets and cold showers for campers. Close to forest and will see/visit Gishwati forest. Self service cooking and camping. Big rigs can be here. +250783491512. Cost 20USD per person or tent and 30 for two people!! PCR test if you want to see primates!

name: Best Cleaning Laundry
description: Emma is the owner +250781208105 and allowed us to wash per kilo. They open 07:30-21:30 Mon to Sun. good service.

name: IPRC Katibi College
description: Ask the administrator and head of college Richard Nasasira +250788447739 for access and stay on the college grounds in your vehicle or tent. They offered a toilet and shower in a local room. This is a tourism college and they encourage to speak to students and be part of the learning experience. We stayed over a weekend so the college was quiet and peaceful. Restaurant is student oriented and cheap. Beers are available

name: Hotel Tech
description:
After cruising for hours through Kigali to find a spot for our van, we found this place by luck. Most of the other places are closed down or ridiculous expensive. 
You can sleep in the parking lot, some places are more or less leveled, for free. There are three options. You can take a room for 10.000 with private shower and toilette. Or you go into the steam sauna for 3000 pp, or you just use the saunas shower and toilettes for free. They have a nice little restaurant, a bar and a garden.
Text or call the owner Pascal if you like
+256 788 527771

name: Lake Mihindi camp site
description:
Special Camp site at lake Mihindi.  With barbeques, flush toilets and showers. Firewood is provided. Needs to be booked as camper numbers are limited 15. Cost is USD50 pppn. 
It's main attraction is the cafe/restaurant, which as far as we have samples provides good food. As is the case for the entire park, cash payments are not accepted.

Facilities are shared with day visitors and the cafe can be quite busy around lunch time especially.

name: Kijamii Table
description:
Authentic African food (fairly cheap) with a view over Kigali. Very nice Staff too (Brady & Geoff)
It‘s a long wait for the food but it‘s worth it!

name: Escale bar
description: Nice bar where you can also enjoy local food. Nice music and people come to share a drink

name: MTN Centre Kigali
description: Here you can buy a MTN Simcard and get the registration. In this center, there is a medium sized supermarket as well.

name: View point waterfall
description: From this place you have a nice view over the waterfall

name: Djidjak
description:
Beautiful lodge right at a deserted beach with camping under shady trees, proper ablutions, huge community room and free Wifi, also organizise pirogue trips into the Saloum delta.
Excellent security. Shade. Cold showers and clean toilets. Bar and restaurant. Good bakery nearby. There are two extremely fierce guard dogs here, whose owners are very nervous of being anywhere near another dog, so bear this in mind if you are travelling with your dog like we are. Library with lots of childrens books and a few adult ones. Sporadic wifi. 7000 for two.

name: Chez Stef
description:
Pretty campement run by a German artist living close to nature with a large vegetable garden, nice breakfast with homemade mango jam and very friendly owner, bicycle rental possible
5000CFA/night (7,62€) for two people, breakfast 1800CFA/person (2,74€)
(4G with Orange)
(two Dogs on the Compound)

name: La Ferme de Saly
description: Camping in a fenced area with trees, horses, a vervet monkey and a chained baboon, run down ablutions, nice restaurant and beach at the lodge across the street, 5000CFA (7,60€) for two people

name: High Consulate of Guinea-Bissau (Ziguinchor)
description:
They issue visas while you wait and we were out of there with visas in our hands after about 10 minutes.
Costs are 20.000CFA/person (30€) for a 1 month double entry visa.

name: Zebrabar
description: Favourite overlanding haunt. Rooms, dorms and camping. Beach, bar, restaurant.  Cost: CFA5,000 (includes park fee).

name: Njagabaar
description: Community campsite just outside the park gate, sand only. Have some chalets as well. Restaurant. Great birding.  Cost:CFA2000

name: Oriental Oasis
description: Allowed to park and camp in the car park. Access to shower and toilet on pool side. Can use restaurant, bar and internet as well.  Cost:CFA4000

name: Campement Wassadou
description:
Addition to the previous check-in: it is an established campground with facilities. There were at least 50 cars with tents when we were there. Large area to pitch your tent. There is also a RAMP to check your vehicle.
---
No real camping but allowed to park under trees on river bank (quite popular amongst overlanders). Bar and restaurant. Access to shower and toilet.  Cost:CFA4000

name: Campement du Lion
description: Basic campsite in park. Food and cold drinks available. Also have basic roundavels.  Cost:CFA5000

name: Campement Lew Lewal
description: Clean campement with chalets. Stand pipe. Access to shower and toilet in chalet. Bar and restaurant. Can park and camp for  Cost:CFA3000ppn. very friendly owner and good hospitality. 1000CFA a beer.

name: Lebambouk
description:
Hunting camp with chalets. 

It has a restaurant-bar, swimming pool, barbecue, electricity, shower and toilet in one of the cabins, potable water. Possibility of camping in the shade of a large tree. It does not have room for washing dishes or clothes. Nor has Wifi. It is 5 km. of Koungheul. Rooms ventilated and heated FCFA 12.500 FCFA 16,000. We paid 8,000 FCFA per vehicle and 2 passengers.

name: Campement Popenguine
description: Community camp with chalets. Not really set up for camping, but we found a flat-ish area. Restaurant and access to water. Expensive for what they offer.  Cost:CFA4000

name: SouSoum Hotel
description: Small hotel in up and coming area. Friendly staff. Parking outside with security guard. Bar and breakfast.  Cost:CFA12000

name: Terre d’Afrique
description: 6000CFA p.P.p.N. a Bungalow is opened for us and we can use the Pool. Acces to the Beach.

name: Auberge Kayanior
description: Secure parking.  They won’t allow you to 'camp’ in their car park.  Large, cool double room with luxury ensuite bathroom with soap and loo roll. Fan. Table and chair.  Bar and restaurant. Wifi. CFA10,000 for two

name: Manon des Sources
description:
Excellent security.   Plentiful space and shade under trees.   Cold showers and clean toilets.  Bar and restaurant.  Bread can be delivered in the morning as the nearest shops are a long walk away.  Really welcoming and helpful manager, Jackie. 5000 CFA for two.
Manon des sources (anciennement auberge Ma Petite Camargue

name: Camping Coquillages
description: Good security.  No shade and just enough room to fit a Landy in.  Cold showers and clean toilets.   In middle of village so easy access to shops, market and restaurants. 7000 CFA for two

name: Keur Youssou
description: Good security.  No shade and just enough room to fit a Landy and a tent in. Bucket shower and clean toilet. Shady lounging about area where you can cook. In middle of village as above. 6000 CFA for two

name: Woods by road
description: Woods by road on the beach from Saint Louis to Dakar. Make sure you camp right back from the beach as there is a lot of traffic at low tide.

name: Camping Casamance, Ziguinchor, Senegal
description: 7000 cfa - 10,000 cfa per night Camping, depending on season and negotiation skills. Beautiful place on out skirts of town. Shady bar area, restaurant & free WIFi. Clean amenities. There are also rooms available here.

name: Campement Touristique Le Baol, Mbacke, Senegal
description: Camping 8,000 CFA a night for 2 people & Roof top tent. Shower & Toilet at back of the premises but bring your can of insect killer to kill mosquitos before you drop you pants. Room available from 15,000 up per night. Liza & Jason

name: La Calao du Lac Rose
description:
Beautiful lodge with campground at lac rose. Run by Franceman, Pierre. Showers and toilets clean, swimmingpool, restaurant, wifi. No kitchen for own use. Quiet, truly an oasis. 4,500 cfa pppn (3.500 + toeristfee 1000 for area). 
Very nice camp site with pool and bar. Can rent bungalows. 9000 CFA for camping with national park fees

name: Relais de Kedougou
description: A lodge which allows parking in the car park for 5,000CFA per night. There is a bathroom but no shower. Wifi is good and nice pool, bar and restaurant.

name: Camping eden
description:
campground direct at the beach with shade areas.
restaurant with well prepared food.
shower and basic european toilet.
pool without water😯 but you have the beach with nice sand.
we stay here for 3 days and take dinner for 3000cfa pp
so we had only to pay 2500 cfa/night for our van and 2 person.

name: wild camp on a field at Sine Ngayene
description:
On the way to the stone circles we had this bushcamp in the shade of a big tree.
no people are coming to visit us so a calm place.
not romantic but better than direct at the piste.

name: Esperanto Lodge And Camping
description: Nice clean and quiet place part of the lodge. Campsite with clean shower and toilet. Very good restaurant and beachbar

name: Wildcamp Close To Mali
description: It is a hidden place off the road after Saraya.

name: Grimaldi Office
description: If you shipped with Grimaldi, this is where the agent office is. The process was reasonably smooth and the agents very helpful. We got our motorhome out of the port in 2 days. (Though custom made a mistake in the Carnet so extra day for us to work that out)

name: Hotel Oceanic
description: Perfect location with benefits if you dealing with port admin. Room for 2 was CFA 26000. Very useful place while we needed to deal with getting our motorhome out from the port. It's under 5 mins walk to the port, under 30 second to the artesian market and about 3 minutes to the main plaza with all offices, banks etc. Staff is very helpful they saved parking lot in front of the hotel to park our truck for a night and the restaurant/cafe is great!

name: Centre Assunta
description:
Catholic women's training center. Possibility of camping. Bathroom with shower. Running water. Shaded area. Run by three Franciscan nuns. Sister Matilde, Sister Georgette and Sister Celsia. Philipe takes care of the area. 3 single room 10000 CFA, camping 6000 CFA   

Centro católico de formación femenina. Posibilidad de camping. Cuarto de baño con ducha. Agua corriente. Zona con sombra. Atendido por 3 monjas franciscanas. Sor Matilde, Sor Georgette y Sor Celsia. Philipe se encarga de cuidar él área. Disponen de 3 habitaciones individuales a  single room 10000 CFA, camping 6000 CFA   .  

Le centre catholique de formation des femmes. Possibilité de camping. Salle de bains avec douche. Eau courante. La zone ombrée. Dirigé par trois religieuses franciscaines. Sœur Matilde, Sœur Georgette et Sœur Celsia. Philipe prend soin de l'area. 3 chambres simples ont  single room 10000 CFA, camping 6000 CFA   

New prices (June 2022) - single room 10000 CFA, camping 6000 CFA

name: Chez Maurice
description:
It is not specially designed for vehicles but can support up to 2. It has running water, electricity and wireless prepaid. It offers clients a room to use the shower and toilet. Closed camp wall. Entrance through the back gate. Cordial reception. 5000 FCFA per vehicle and 2 passengers.

luisyermi.blogspot.com.                                                 No está especialmente concebido para vehículos, pero puede admitir hasta 2. Dispone de agua corriente, electricidad y Wifi prepago. Pone a disposición de los clientes una habitación para utilizar la ducha y el aseo. Campamento cerrado con muro. Entrada por el portalón posterior. Recibimiento cordial. 5000 FCFA por vehículo y 2 pax.

name: Campament Diba Nima
description:
Typical camp with basic services, but welcome after the abusive Oriental Oasis, where they wanted 11,500 FCFA  for parking without electricity and access to the pool. Here the welcome is warm. There is some shade at the end of camp. They gave us a room to use toilet. Bucket shower. There is no electricity. The price is 3,500 FCFA per vehicle and 2 passengers .

luisyermi.blogspot.com.                                    Campamento tipico con servicios basicos, pero bien recibidos despues del abusivo Oriental Oasis, donde nos querian cobrar 11.500 FCFA por parking sin electricidad y sin acceso a la piscina. Aqui el recibimiento es cordial. Hay algo de sombra al final del campamento. Pusieron a nuestra disposicion una habitacion para usar wc. La ducha es de cazo. No hay electricidad. El precio es de 3.500 FCFA por vehiculo y 2 pax.

name: Eco Campament Keur Annick
description:
Camp on the edge of the River Gambia. Good reception. It has 11 cabins and space for camping . Shower and toilet in a cabanas . Possibility of fresh well water. Possibility of food being prepared. Ousman is aware of what you need. We paid 3,500 FCFA per day.

Campamento al borde del Rio Gambia a la salida de Mako direccion Kedougou. Buen recibimiento. Dispone de 11 cabanas y espacio para camping. Ducha y aseo en una cabanas. Posibilidad de agua fresca de pozo. Posibilidad de hacer alguna comida. Ousman esta pendiente de lo que necesites. Pagamos 3.500 FCFA diarios.

name: Campamentos Solidarios
description:
Run by the community. It has 9 cabins and space for camping. Shower and toilet in a cabana. Price for 2 pax cottage 10000 FCFA. Camping car and 2 pax 3000 FCFA

Recibimiento cordial. Manteniendo a cargo de la comunidad. Dispone de 9 cabanas y espacio para camping. Ducha y aseo en una cabana. Gerente Makhan. Precio de cabana para 2 pax 10000 FCFA. Camping vehiculo y 2 pax 3000 FCFA

name: Bush Camp Near Border
description: Quiet location. Pushed our way in to the woods. There was a spectacular thunder storm when we were here that made this place even better.

name: Bush Camp Off Highway
description: Just 1km off the highway along a dirt road. Few houses nearby but we didn't meet anyone.

name: ST George's Point
description:
an amazing local home with great view of the ocean/river. spent two nights camping here. locals absolutely friendly and very helpful. you definitely near 4x4 to get here as there are endless sand.
local sea food awesome. had some really massive tiger prawns fresh from the sea.

name: Chez Balingo
description:
Basari camp . It has 13 cabins . 4 Showers outdoor saucepan. Wc . Restaurant bar with fridge . Food 2500FCFA per person. Accommodation 3000FCFA per person. Car camping possible.

Campamento Basari. Dispone de 13 cabanas. 4 Duchas al aire libre con cazo. Wc. Restaurante bar con frigorifico. Comida 2500FCFA por persona. Alojamiento 3000FCFApor persona. Posibilidad de camping Car .

name: Campament Chez Gilbert
description:
Warm welcome by Gilbert. It has 5 double cabins . 3,500 FCFA per person. Possibility of camping inside. Wc with shower. Electricity. 3,000 FCFA vehicle and 2 passengers .

Cordial acogida por Gilbert. Dispone de 5 cabanas dobles. 3.500 FCFA por persona. Posibilidad de acampar en el interior. Wc con ducha de cazo. Electricidad. 3.000 FCFA vehiculo y 2 pax.

name: Campament África Cascade
description:
Warm welcome by its owner Djibril Camara. It has 7 double and triple cabins with shower bucket inside. 3,500 FCFA per person. Possibility of camping inside and have a shower and toilet . It has electricity by solar panel. Parking inside. Camping Car 4,000 FCFA vehicle and 2 passengers .

Cordial acogida por su propietario Djibril Camara. Dispone de 7 cabanas dobles y triples con ducha de cazo en el interior. 3.500 FCFA por persona. Posibilidad de acampar en el interior y disponer de ducha y aseo. Dispone de electricidad por placa solar. Parking en el interior. Camping Car 4.000 FCFA vehiculo y 2 pax.

name: Camping Elinkine
description:
Campground direct at the river with amazing view, shade areas with trees were you can sit. 
A nice brise from the riverside.
Restaurant also prepare fish you catch or buy yourself. 
Menu cost her 3500cfa incl. starter and dessert. Without starter but with dessert only 2000cfa!
Very friendly owners. No amenities for camper but they give you a key to a bungalow so you have nice shower and toilet.
as they switch of electricity on the day free wifi is only available in the morning or evening. Or you have to ask.
3500CFA  per night for 2 person and our van.

name: Hotel Arc En Ciel
description: Bit expensive hotel with two swimmingpools and large restaurant. But could park the car and had access to all amenities for 5000cfa for 2 people. Owner Ibu is cheerful man and working on an actual campingarea.  Good value.

name: Embassy Guinea Conakry
description: Two days for application visa. Approximately €80. Application form handed by them, 2 pics, itenary, copy passport, pasport. Btw: We were told that shorts were not appreciated to wear going to their embassy. Prederably were a pantalon 😁

name: Auberge Thialy
description: Very friendly and relaxed hostel. 9000 cfa pp, parking in front and paid nightguard a little to watch it. Warm showers amd breakfast included. Very clean and noce atmosphere. Beautifull patio.

name: Sindeye
description: Beautifull and tranquille spot. Superfriendly staff and good food. Bicycles for rent. For a stylish and clean bungalow its 30.000 cfa for two people including 3 meals a day in the restaurant. Wifi +. Also possible to sleep in yout car/van but not sure what price would be.

name: Africa Keur
description:
Hotel with 16 rooms with air conditioning and TV . Hot water shower and toilet in the room. Very friendly staff. budget restaurant , bar and pool. 24h guarded parking in front of the hotel. 20,000 FCFA.

Hotel con 16 habitaciones con aire acondicionado y TV. Ducha agua caliente y WC en la habitación. Personal muy amistoso. Restaurante económico, bar y piscina. Parking vigilado 24h. frente al hotel. 20.000 FCFA.

name: Campament Niayes
description:
Camping with bar and restaurant, Wifi, pool. Possibility of shower and toilet. 3000 FCFA.

Campamento con bar-restaurante, Wifi, piscina. Posibilidad de ducha y WC. 3000 FCFA.

name: Campament Turistique Casa Meissa
description:
Parking facilities outside. Use of shower and toilet cabin. Bar. Restaurant. 5000FCFA.

Posibilidad de aparcar en el exterior. Utilizar ducha y WC de una cabaña. Restaurante bar.Agua corriente. 5000FCFA.

name: Bush camp beach Boukot Oulof
description:
we camped unter trees direct at the beach.
Surounded by privat properties we found this open place.
A nice brise frome the sea.
The beach is clean with nice sand.
We stay here for some days. Some people come over here on there way to work. All are very friendly and calm.

name: auberge de la paix
description:
Campment direct above the sea. You have a beautiful view, shade areas with trees were you can sit and park your car. A nice brise from the seaside all the day.
The owner Omar alias Keskes (he is playing this instrument amazing) was living for more than 15 years in europe and learnt the Hotel Buisness as well as to cook. He now started to built up this place seems to become a wonderfull artistic place. In his Restaurant he prepares outstanding  delicious meals, breakfast and best fresh fruit juice. we got a welcome juice and a welcome tea as well. He speaks fluent german, English and French.  He is an amazing friendly guy. Also his stuff is very friendly and helpfull. everything can be organised like laundry seecice etc. No amenities for camper but they give you a key to a bungalow so you have shower and toilet. 
You also can camp at the sandy beach where also a tipi is (to eat or to relax). You than just have to go up the stairs for the amenities.
Price have to be negotiated for camping. The rooms for 2 pers it is from  6500 up.
Menu is 3500 up and breakfast 1500 cfa.

name: Hotel Dior
description:
Update from previous post.

i stayed with a group of fellow overlanders (14 peraons) who i travelled down from Mauritania with. Their lead has been here with groups over 10 times.

They agreed a late check out at no extra cost on arrival (as always do). On leaving the presented a late check out charge. They would not budge on this and so they all eventually paid. There were no other guests, i stayed another night and its just me, so difficult to see why they'd sour relations.

It left a bad taste in my mouth and i personally wouldn't stay again. There are plenty of other places available down the same road

Also, the swimming pool is not included, 4000 cfa to use it

name: Customs Dakar - Carnet Stamp
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

Come here to get your carnet stamped if you couldn't at the border

name: Cote D'Ivoire Embassy
description:
33,000 cfa for visa 
UK Passport 

Make sure have print of booking confirmation. i just did a booking.com and will cancel it

name: Mali Embassy
description:
Mali Embassy, Dakar, Senegal

Duration visa: 1 month
Entries: single entry
Costs: 25.000 CFA per person
Handling time: 1 working day
Valid from: Date set at the time of the application
Documents needed: 2 photos (they can take you a photo if you don’t have), copy of passport. 

Very sufficient, the application took about 30 minutes. 

You can park your car or motorbike in front of the embassy or across the embassy at the beach.

name: Guinea-Bissau Embassy
description:
45k CFA 
Single entry 
Two days

I didn't get it. I'll go to Zig instead. But its possible here if you wanted to

name: On a melon field
description:
Owner of the field allowed us to stay here.
DON'T PARK UNDER A TREE!! Lot of Insects fall down at night!

name: Cow desert
description: Nice place, but only recommended if you are not scared of cows. They pass by sometimes.

name: Senegal Customs - Correct
description: Initial check in was incorrect. Its on the main road. This should be correct

name: Aljowe
description:
Swiss run campenment. Clean, everything works and friendly owner. Seems quite new. Rooms were very cool(despite the heat) although had either air con or fan. Mosquito nets on bed, no holes

Bar with 800 CFA beer. Pastis too if you like!

Room shared bathroom (clean) 7000 for 3 people
Suite with all in 12000 for 3 people

Camping possible right next to thatched gazebo area where you can sit and work and cook

They have wifi available

name: Senegal Immigration
description: Senegal immigration post. On the left side going to Bissau.

name: Guinea Bissau Immigration and Customs
description:
immigration one side of the road. Customs the other side

Customs stamped my carnet. i don't know about a TIP. GB isn't a listed carnet country for me. but they kind of knew it. i had to explain how to use the carnet though. all very friendly

name: Camping Dar Salam
description: The camping is right at the entry to the Niokolo Koba NP. Nice owner. Bungalows for 7500 and some limited place to camp for 5000 cfa. Restaurant and fridge with drinks on site. Bucketshower.

name: Edge of Kaolack near Hotel Adjana
description: On the banks of the river backed up to unfinished construction! Main road 150m away

name: Campement Le Bedik / Chez Leontine
description: Rondavels for 10,000 cfa, incl two meals, and a little place for campers for 2,500 cfa. On site meal is 3,500 cfa (couscous). Bucket shower.

name: Secure Car Parking
description: If you want to park your car in Dakar, eg for staying on Ngor Island, a local Boat Operator, Omar, offers a secure space on his compound (14.747592, -17.518784), most times he is at the boat terminal. His phone number is +221 775672774. Ask for prices, for us it was 10.000 cfa the week.

name: Chez Nicolas
description:
Hostel with very friendly staff with possibility of guarded parking. It has rooms and allows the use of the toilet and shower. Electricity. Drinking water. Restaurant. 3,000 FCFA per night.


Albergue con personal muy amistoso con posibilidad de parking vigilado. Dispone de habitaciones y permite el uso del WC  y la ducha. Electricidad. Agua potable. Restaurante. 3.000 FCFA por noche.

name: motorcycle insurance ecowas west Africa
description: Place in Saint Louis to get your west Africa insurance. We paid 17.375 cfa for 4 months, we got send here from Zebrabar. Much cheaper then other places before

name: Burkina Faso embassy
description: Apply visa on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. 3 months visa 48. 000 cfa single entree, double entree 62.000 cfa. Visa takes 48 hours

name: Cercle de Voile. CDV
description:
Cercle de Voile de Dakar
Pitches for 2 or 3 vehicles with a maximum length of 6m
Contribution of 3000 F cfa per vehicle per day
Shower, WC, Wifi at the bar restaurant du Cercle

Cercle de voile de Dakar
Emplacements  pour 2 ou 3 véhicules de 6m de longueur maximum
Contribution de 3000 F cfa par vehicule et par jour
Douche, WC, Wifi au bar restaurant du Cercle

name: Aéroport de Bakel
description:
After having signified our intention to spend the night towards the airfield at the gendarmerie of BakelWe set up next to the building. .... control tower (what's left of it) Night very very quiet. ...


 Après avoir signifié  notre intention de passer la nuit vers l'aérodrome  à la gendarmerie de Bakel
Nous nous sommes installés à côté du bâtiment. .... tour de contrôle ( ce qui en reste )
Nuit très très  calme. ...

name: La Gondole
description: Well priced cafe/restaurant with vegetarian options. Good wifi and located close to the embassies

name: Poste de garde de Obadji
description:
At the exit of Niokolo Park Koba..in direction of Kedougou, quiet at night.

Nuit tranquille. ....
Réveillé  par le coq...

name: Assurances ATA- For Western Africa
description:
You can have western african traffic insurance here(brown insurance) for motorcycle 3 months 15.000cfa. We paid 17.376 cfa for 4 months to each motorcycles

UPDATE- this insurance is also good for Carte Rose CIMA countries (Cameron, Gabon, both Congo). A pleasant surprise for sure!. There were two papers. we had two small papers. The first was for Carte Rose and the second was cart brune. The insurance is from AXA

So you can get insurance here for almost all of the west side of Africa here!

name: Zahe
description: If you are traveling by motorcycle You can find what you need engine oil, chain oil, chain cleaner...etc Not really cheap but better than nothing... little chain oil we paid 5.000 cfa and 1 lt engine oil was 2.500 cfa

name: Hotel Hermattan
description: Has garage for two motorcycles. 15000 to 20000 CFA for single room.

name: Fast Food
description: Justba basic fast food joint in Senegal. Yassa chicken, burgers, schwarmer etc. 1000-2000 cfa. Cheaper than the hotels basically

name: Kebemer,  Haras national
description:
Very nice place,  off RN 2,  this national stud of Senegal has plenty 
of space.  For those who love horses,  it is really the place to stop for one night,  on the way or coming from/to Dakar.
After asking to a guard if we can stay for a night,  he got approval from the horse's doctor in chief. We even went through a full visit.
Very friendly People.  Guarded and closed at night till 7am.
Fast wifi,  pw :[passwords are not allowed ]

name: Customs.  Passavant renewal
description:
AXA building.  4th floor. Place de l'indépendance 
The place to go to get extra 15 days for the " passavant ".
Closed betweem 1 pm and 2 pm
Got the stamp in 10 min.
Quite difficult to park,  better to come by taxi
Bring with you a copy of the passavant

name: Corrupt police
description:
Just outside the police HQ. Corrupt checkpoint. Claimed I was speeding. For once I wasnt as bike was in all kinds of trouble! No amount of talking was getting away from this. Eventually paid the 'on the spot' infringement fee of 12k CFA.

He was incredibly bold. And was stopping every car that looked like it had cash. 

It was 5pm at night. If I wasn't pushing for time to make the Zebrabar before sunset I'd have waited him out!

name: Plage La Somone. Parking
description:
Day parking,  very close to the beach.  1000 cfa. 
Can be used overnight for an extra 1000 cfa.
Very quiet during the night.  Good location with beautiful view toward the laguna. Not far from the village.

name: Hotel le Firdou
description:
At the edge of an arm of the river CasamanceRestauration possible2 swimming poolsShadowed placesPrice per vehicle 10 000 F cfaA avoid Saturday night (night club by the pool)


Au bord d'un  bras du fleuve Casamance
Restauration possible
2 piscines
Emplacements ombragés 
Prix par vehicule 10 000 F cfa
A éviter  le samedi soir ( boite de nuit au bord de la piscine)

name: Garage
description:
Garage SAE electro
Mr Ousseynou Mbaye
possede une valise OBD pour les nouveaux vehicules aux normes Euro V et Euro VI
elecronique et mecanique ne pas se fier a l allure  du garage 
Il travaille avec un dieseliste " Sow pompes a injection " Mr Alioune Sow.

name: Casino Supermarché
description: European style supermarket, great selection. Also sells wine and spirits. Good parking for all size vehicles.

name: Île de Carabane.  Chez Helenna
description:
Nice campement, on the beach.
Half board 7500 cfa per person
Full board 9000 cfa
Very nice remote location

name: Malahika hôtel
description: The hôtel is not offering parking for motorhomes but it is possible to park between the hôtel outside car park and the football pitch. They have 2 guards during the night and 1 guard during the day. They said the area is safe and quite at night.

name: Parking Hôtel Malahika.Tambacounda
description:
Large parking,  guarded all night by 2 guards.
Safe and quiet. Free.
We have asked the receptionist to stay overnight.
Bar and restaurant. 
A good alternative to the overpriced Oasis which is one block away.

name: Le Yokam
description:
Campsite with cabins located at the edge of the oceanRestauration possiblePar night and by truck 5 000 F cfaWith shower available


Camping avec cases situé  au bord de l' océan
Restauration possible
Par nuit et par camion 5 000 F cfa
Avec douche à  disposition

name: Nianing beach wild camp
description:
Very close to the beach,  off the main road through a 2.5 km laterite track in pretty good condition.
Desert beach

name: Ndayane
description:
Parking by the ocean
Very good to spend the night.
Rocked by the sound of the waves

Parking au bord de l'océan 
Tres bien pour passer la nuit.
Bercé par le bruit des vagues

name: Dakar.Les Almadies, street parking
description:
Very quiet street,  with a large space off the street. A guard is present overnight on the other side.
No facilities around,  except restaurants 200 m away.

name: Free car park
description: Free car park and secured since there are guards outside the hotels and houses around. Ideal location to go and visit Ngor island. Large motorhomes will fit.

name: Sabi border
description: Again had trouble getting a visa on arrival to Senegal. -We said we would call our embassy to sort out and visa was then issued.  TIP was 2500 CFA for X days. No services at this border but had border barriers controlled by the police.

name: Niokolo-Koba NP
description: We weren't allowed to enter without a guide plus fees per car and per person plus camping and they wouldn't say how much.

name: Village des Tortues (Village's Tortoises)
description: The Village des Tortues (The Tortoises' Village), in the heart of the botanical reserve of Noflaye, near the Lac Rose (Pink Lake), has oppenned its doors in March 2001 to welcome many tortoises from Europe and from individuals giving away their pets. The village is the leader in conservation and reacclimatation programs of some local Senegalese tortoises, including the biggest land tortoise in the world, Centrochelys Sulcata. Part of their protection program includes re-introducing tortoises in the wild reserve of Katane in the Ferlo region.

name: Restaurant Téranga Ndar
description:
Local restaurant to try the local cuisine. Was really nice and a good price. The fish and rice (Thiébou dieune) was only 800FCA and Yassa Poisson was 2000FCa. homemade ginger lemonade for 500FCA. 
Dont get scared of the restaurant itself, it is really simple.

name: Baobab sur terre
description: This is a campement for tourists with available bungalows and it is near the ferry. We were allowed to stay here with our 4x4 and could use the toilet and douche in a room for 5000CFA. If you eat here, you will pay only 2000CFA and dinner is only 3000 or 4000CFA. The owner, Famara, is nice and speaks several languages! Nice and clean really worth it!!

name: express automobile
description:
Very good workshop. The manager, Mbissane Ciss, of all confidence. Multibrand. 

muy buen taller. El gerente, Mbissane Ciss, de toda confianza.
Multimarca.

name: Police check
description: Corrupt police who want to give you a fine without any reason. Watch this point

name: Hypermarché Exclusive
description: Big supermarket. A little bit overpriced, but it has almost everything you need.

name: Hôtel Monaco Plage
description:
I would highly recommend not going here! Very unfriendly people and they try to rip off your money. So if you are planning on staying there, make sure you do not pay for the nights you are going to stay up front and check every receipt (even from the restaurant). If it is not correct what they charge you there is a small chance they will agree with you and charge you the correct amount.

We camped inside the gates of the hotel for 10.000 CFA per night for two persons and a 4WD. We were allowed to use the toilet and (warm) shower in one of the hotelrooms. The hotel has a restaurant/bar and is located directly to the beach. The place also has WiFi. 

There is only place for 2-3 vehicles. 

It could have been a really nice place to stay if there would work more honest and friendly people.

name: Wild camp in farm
description: Camped in a deserted farm. No one bothered us.

name: Sobo Bade
description: A very beautiful hotel right on the edge of a cliff overlooking the ocean. Really interesting architecture with ocean facing rooms. Also seems be some sort of artist's commune. Great restaurant. One room for two people for one night cost 23,000, much cheaper than other hotels in the area.

name: Open-air seafood restaurant area
description: Lots of really cool seafood and fresh fish stands. You can get whole grilled fish, gambas, oysters, rice. Anything! And not too expensive. Right on the ocean.

name: Duane Regional Point Nord
description:
Because our Nissan X-trail is older then 8 years we’re not allowed to enter the country with it, unless we pay for a temporary permit which allows us to drive through the country within 3 to 5 days.
Luckily we had very sweet border officials, young guys that just started working at the border and were eager to help us out. They called their chief and anyone they could reach, and within an hour there were regular people trying to help us as long as we paid for the temporary permit; Martin kept on saying we only had 50 euros to spend and so of course, nobody wanted to help us for that price.

With the language barrier, we talked with the sweet border official and asked him what the possibilities were? Was the temporary permit really the only possibility? 
He said that two weeks prior to our arrival, other travelers had the same problem and they left their car at the border and talked to the chief in St. Louis personally; this way they managed to figure something out.
But he did not know which price they paid or anything else about them.

We took a cab to St.Louis (2000 CFA when shared) and got a hotel in St.Louis, got on the public WIFI and called as many offices as possible as well as the Dutch Embassy. Martin found the government website of Senegal and filed a complaint because the website stated that tourists can get a temporary permit easily at the border; which obviously did not happen easily.

On Monday we decided to talk to the chief at the Duane Regional Point Nord, he was extremely friendly and first asked us to explain everything. Because we saw he was Muslim due to the Arabic paintings hanging around we used as much ‘Bismillah’  ‘ Inshaallah’ and ‘Alhamdullilah’ as possible. 
He gave us two options; either a free five days to Dakar and back to the Diama border crossing, or an escort that would guide us, around Gambia, to the Guinee border. 
The escort normally costs 150 euros, but because he ‘wanted to help other Muslims out’, he wouldn’t mind paying half of it. After Martin only put a 50 euro note on the table, he put 100 euros worth of CFA on the table, said that we should take all the money to the border where we’d pay for the escort.
Afterwards, the escort would come with us and we’d have to get an official document at the Duane Regional Point Sud before we could drive south to Guinee.

It was too good to be true, but when we returned at the border, everything was arranged, we paid; the officials got the official document for us and we were able to drive off to Guinee with an escort in our car.
Before we left, the border officials were mad at us and asked us why we filed a complaint on the government website stating they’re corrupt and were asking money, and why we called the embassy.
Martin kept on saying that his dad is an ambassador so that he might have called. 
In the end, we don’t know why everything happened quickly and easily; was it all just because of the complaint that Martin filed or really because we grew up Muslim?
We managed to get our car, older then 2008, through Senegal with an escort for only 50 euros.

name: le bougainvillier
description: super clean hotel/ villas with kitchen , bar restaurant and closed parking for bikes and car .fair price for a very clean place. good restaurant. easy access to the beach. just close to the camp Auberge de la paix. the owners Nicole and Jean Claude are very welcoming

name: Akine lodge
description: Bargained down to 20 euro a night for two persons, for a lodge with shower. All of the lodges are grass hut style, with wooden swing bridge walk ways and flower lined sandy paths connecting them. Restaurant/bar on site. 5 minute walk to the beach and 10 minute walk to the village where there are restaurants and a store. Fantastic paradise to spend some time. The owner Anne is lovely and very accommodating. The place has real character!

name: Unpassable road to Guinee.
description: We have two off road motorbikes and half way through the passing to the Guinée border we realized that we would break our bikes and ourselves getting there. Very steep and absurd road. Haven't been so tired and hot ever in my life...

name: Ndaali hotel
description: Excellent place to stay 50000 cfa for an apartement sleeps 7 people

name: Superette Marche... Supermarket
description: nice Supermarket.... you get nearly everything you need

name: Auberge Gilbert
description: A few rooms and a pleasant back lot for camping. Shower and toilet clean enough. Good option if you need to pass a night here. Wifi worked well in range.

name: Fadidi Campement
description: A nice spot on the river. Set up more for the bungalow crowd but they gave us a big flat spot to park overlooking the river with good toilets/showers next door. Paid 10,000 cfa for 3 people.

name: Senegal - Guinee Conakry border
description:
Easy border crossing, no money asked, just stamped the passports and carnet... done in 5 minutes

Closed from 13h to 15h

name: douane in Kaolack
description: easy place to renew passavant without going to Dakar

name: Auberge viel Azur
description: Nice basic hostel, Good at restaurant available.

name: campement horeepelun
description: Campement with huts at 4000. Possible to camp right outside the gates at 2000. Outside the city centre with basic ablutions.

name: restaurant Le cailcedrat
description: nice bigger restaurant with terras. big menu. nice People english speaking

name: King fisher restaurant and bar
description: nice place with terras walking distance from sukuta camping. big menu. also open for lunch.

name: Plage Ndayane
description: It is just a dead end between two big houses, very quiet and you are directly at the clean and beautiful beach. Very close to the hotel "terre d'afrique".

name: Quiet spot for wildcamping
description:
Quiet spot for wildcamping, probably way better than the campsite in town. And free:) 
No people when we were here.

name: Banda and Claire
description:
Large sandy secure area next to the Fleurve Senegal for camping. Water tap, squat toilet and shower available 3000 cfa for camping per person. 
Banda and Claire are artist and can offer cultural artistic workshops, contact for more information. 
They can provide meals and also have a couple of guest houses with ensuite for 7000 CFA.
There are a couple of shops in the village.
Between Banda and Claire they speak French, Dutch, English, Spanish and Wolof.
Please ring Claire on +221778212237 or Banda +221776517529

name: Lagoon of Somone
description:
We were camping next to the Lagoon of Somone. It was a bit hard to enter the nature reserve because our truck ist 3,80 m high and the trees around the area are very low. But the place is beautiful: giant mango trees and baobabs, close to the mangrooves. In the morning and in the evening you can see monkeys, a lot of birds, jakals and meerkats. 
If you come from Somone, you have to cross the guardian, turn to the left over the small bridge and after 100 m turn to the left again (follow the signs of lodge nature). At the big white sign "guerero...") you can see the big mango trees. Take the way straight on. 
If the guardian will stopp you, say, you want to go to the lodge nature.

name: Maya Plage
description:
Dream place! Direct at the beach, under palmtrees, very quiet, endless beach.
When you come from Cap Skirring, you have to turn to the left behind the village Boukot Oulof and follow the signs of Hotel Maya. 150 metres before the sea take the way to the left (Maya Plage). The way is very sandy, so it is good to have a 4X4.
At the beach there are some hotels where you can eat. Pretty nice!

name: Babacar DIA
description:
Tire shop that has used tires in truck sizes, including 14.00r20 and 16.00r20, mostly Michelin profiles.
Tel 77 783 47 78

name: Campement villageois se Seleki
description: At the edge of a bolong and an impluvium box Rooms and Catering possible price per truck and 2 persons 3500 Fcfa

name: On the countryside
description:
On the road from Bakel to Podor, after a long day of driving on a bad road, 
full of holes and sandy pistes, we turned away from the street.
We stopped under a big acacia for shade. Quiet, lonely, just some goats, and birds.
In the morning people walk by with their goats and on donkey charriots

name: Les Cocotiers Chez Moc Tar
description:
Very nice restaurant with local dishes. English speaking hostess/cook is very welcoming and kind. Lets you try the tasty local dishes and very fair prices. Plates starting at 1000Cfa. 
We had a nice ¼ grilled chicken with lentil stew for 1500Cfa.

name: M-Racing
description: Motorcycle accessories shop with gear, oils etc. Workshop mainly does scooters. One of the more useless mechanics/workshops I've come across in Africa. Basically did everything myself.

name: Espace Scooter No1
description: Good little motorcycle parts store. Bearings, fluids, filters, tyres etc

name: Keur Diame Auberge/Bed+Breakfast
description: Nice Bed+Breakfast, very clean, space for motorcycle inside the patio,  next to the beach, i pay CFA 16000.00 for one night. The oner is  Ruth a swiss Lady . Phone  +221 338209676 / Mobil +221 774502820 mme.ruth52@gmail.com

name: Auberge Thomas Sankara
description: Probably the cheapest option in town. Double room with fan, TV, bathroom: 15000F. With AC: 20000F. Rooms are clean. Breakfast included. Wi-Fi. You have to ask for turn on the water. Private parking.  Close to Gambia river and street food.

name: Hotel Oasis Oriental Club
description: Very nice place with swimming pool, private parking and good restaurant. Bungalows with bathroom, Wi-Fi, AC and TV: from 25000F. A little bit pricy but worth it.

name: ICP Medical Centre guest houses
description: Probably the cheapest place to stay in town. Clean triple room with fan and shared bathroom: 12500F. No restaurant, kitchen available. You can Park the car in the front of the building, on the space separated from main street. Medical clinic on the ground floor.

name: Auberge Keur Ghan
description:
A little run down, but clean. It looks as though they are renovating. Good value for price, single with AC and mosquito net 12000CFA. Safe parking for motorcycle inside gated yard; I don't think big rigs would fit.

As you exit to the street, to the left there is a small shop with cold drinks (300m) and to the right there is a restaurant where locals eat (500CFA menu of the day, hearty meal).

WiFi password is GASS1111.

name: Auberge Le Walo
description: Nice auberge, rooms ok, with fan. Also airco, but not functioning very well. Fast wifi available. Little restaurant opposite the street. Not very cheap, we paid 20.000 CFA incl. breakfast.

name: Near Donaye at the river
description: Quiet spot behind bushes under tree near the river. Look for track going from the main road in the direction on the river. If you follow the track till the end you can stay at the river (no shadow). We turned left a little bit earlier. One downside... in the evening lot’s of mosquito’s...

name: Foret de Ouargo
description: Nice quiet spot for wild camping between very old acacia trees. This time no mosquito’s! Beautiful old trees.

name: Bivak near Aoure
description: Quiet spot just of the mainroad behind some trees. No mosquito’s. Be carefull if you drive in the dark to this spot; there dry river slopes.

name: Hotel Boundou
description:
Ok hotel. Everything is working including airco, which was nice after a few bushcamps in the heat 😅
We paid 18.500 CFA for a room without breakfast. Breakfast is 1.000 pp. Although there is arestaurant we did not check the food.

name: Bush camp
description: Following the example of Dieda-unterwegs.net (thanks! 👍) we went a little bit further into the bushes. Following a path which starts at the main road. Stayed under a lovely tree with many beautiful birds. Although some locals passed by on a path which was 50 meter further, nobody disturbed us.

name: CFAO / MPS GROUPE
description: Brand new workshop with excellent service. The owner is Mr. Cherif M. Mouctar NDIAYE. Did a full maintenance on our LandCruiser 78 incl. all original filters etc. , new ‘sabot de frein’ and all oils changed for €350. Car was cleaned too afterwards 😃 Phone: +221 33 981 57 28 or +221 77 651 15 81 Email: cherifmouctar@yahoo.fr

name: Lake near Kaymor
description: Wild Camp on a Lake near the Piste. Real Quiet, no People, next to the Stone Circles. A excellent place to stay for the Night. If you drive Carefully it is possible in the Dry Season to get here with a normal Car.

name: Stonecircle near Koungheul
description: Nice Place next to a Stonecircle near the Piste. A lot of Cows and Sheep's around and very friendly People. Also possible to go here with a normal Car. You have some Shadow from the Trees. Good for a night on the way to Tambacounda...

name: Kedougou Custom
description: This is the custom close to the Guinea border in Segou. Easy export, stamped carnet de passage. no money asked. Consider the bad track from Senegal (Segou) to Guinea before exporting your car.

name: Segou
description: Police checkpoint to stamp the passport. Before crossing this boarder walk the first part up to the mountain to check the conditions of the bad track.

name: Campement Villageois '' Les Cascades de Dindéfelo''
description:
Campement with solar energy 24h
Fresh drinks (beer 1000 and soft 500) and meals(3000)
Rooms (2000) with fan and bathroom and electricity (3000pp) or camping (2000 per small tent/camping car or 5000 for a group/big tent)

name: Campement '' Chez Doba''
description:
Campement Villageois
Meal 3000
Room per person 2500
Tent ok but not free, have to negotiate
Next to the waterfall, easy access to the attractions around

name: forage
description: Forage from the source of the waterfall of Dindéfelo

name: Campement Le Lamantin
description: Brand new campement with friendly owner: Louis Diatta, 00 221 77 316 4675, asoketendiatta@gmail.com, www.campementlelemantin.wordpress.com. The campement is at a lovely spot right at the beach. Spotting dolphins and manatees at low tide. Rooms with (12.000 CFA) and without (6.000 CFA) private bathroom available; looking really nice and comfortable. For camping he apparently does not charge anything, but probably expects to spend something in the restaurant. We just passed by this spot, but thought it would be worthwhile to share this info on iOverlander!

name: Orange Boutique
description: A cellphone store with copy machine, and a few computers for internet access / printing. Can also buy SIM cards and recharge for all 3 big carriers. Says orange but they do it all. Also a nice western grocery store across the street.

name: Le Kossey
description: It's more a campement with bungalows, but it's possible to put the tent for 2000cfa. Beautiful location at the seaside

name: New Ghana Ambassy
description: New Ghana embassy in Dakar (the one near the airport is closed)

name: Africa Safari
description:
4000 CFA for camping, 1000 CFA for ice cold beer. friendly bunch with great view of the river and pool.

+221 77 6760984 +221 77 4051941

name: Immigration to Senegal
description: Very easy. Very friendly and super fast border on Guinea Bissau and Senegal border. Driving north

name: Cameroon Embassy
description: Today we went to the embassy to apply a visa. They offer two choices as a tourist visa. 1 - 3 month, single entry 51.000 CFA and 6 months multiple entry 101.000 CFA. To get the visa you have to display a hotel booking minimum one day, one passport picture. We ask about the border crossing in the area Ekok and he tells uns there are problems with a group of people who want go separate from Cameroon and they fight with the military. We sould be careful in this area.

name: L' Africaine de L' Automobile
description: This is a service station especially for the brand Ford and Land Rover

name: Fara Moto
description: Mechanic specialized on modern big bikes. They do big 1200 Gs's as well as big scooters and sports bikes or whatever you bring them. Also sells gear and parts. I camped next to the shop for a few days and watched them working. Yes they have worked with modern motorcycles before and yes it might be one of very few shops with experience. BUT it is still an African garage. They don't know how to work with high quality stuff. No respect for the value. They lay brand new bikes on the side on the gravel to change chains, they don't clean the funnel before they use it for oil changes, they use sharp edged rocks to support the bikes for wheel-changes... Better do everything yourself and just ask them for tools and parts.

name: Border crossing
description: Border crossing on Dakar-Banjul road. Senegal immigration and customs come first, then the Gambian. On the Gambian side, we were faced with requests for cash in exchange for letting us go with our prescription medicines.

name: BANKU MUSSO
description: Das BANKU MUSSO (das Haus der Erdenfrau) ist ein Ort für Menschen, die den sanften Tourismus suchen und nachhaltig reisen möchten. Das traditionell gebaute Lehmhaus ist umgeben von einem wunderschönen Garten. Es ist geeignet zum Ausruhen. Wer jedoch gerne kreativ tätig ist, hat in der « auberge des arts » die Möglichkeit Mal-, Lehmbau- und andere Kurse zu besuchen. Das Meer ist nahe, ca. 15 Minuten zu Fuss und lädt zu langen Spaziergängen auf unberührten Sandstränden ein. In unserer "auberge des arts" haben wir 3 Zimmer mit Doppelbetten und ein Familienzimmer zu vermieten.  Die sanitären Anlagen sind gemeinsam nutzbar. Das BANKU MUSSO ist geeignet für Naturliebhaber und Menschen, welche sich gerne vom Alltagsstress erholen möchten. Der Garten mit den vielfältig tropischen Bäumen und Pflanzen inspiriert zum Zeichnen und Malen und zum Gestalten. Im Restaurant des BANKU MUSSO können alle Mahlzeiten eingenommen werden. Ich lebe selber im BANKU MUSSO und bin für meine Gäste da.

name: Mariamacounda B&B
description:
Nice accomodation with some rooms.
Could set up my tent in the garden under some trees in the shadow, use the public toilet and good wifi for 5000.- CFA.
There is place to park the bike (also 4x4) inside the walls.
You could also eat dinner or breakfast but its also possible to cook for yourself. They offer some drinks as well.
Pool was empty because of some works going on.
Very nice place to get some rest.

name: Residence Hilton Kaolack
description:
No Hilton but okey for one night.
Double room with AC for 18000.- CFA.
Good wifi.

name: Village Namari
description:
Stayed here while driving the N7 from north to south.
Asked the chef de village for the stay and they let me sleep direct in front of their houses.
Even gave me some coffee, and invented me for dinner and breakfast.
Real africa experience.

name: N7 (Ouro Sougi-Tambacounda)
description:
The road is not really a nationalroad. Its heading trough the bush.
The first and last 20km are pist the rest are paths.
Sometimes sand, dirt or rock.
Not that easy to find the right way all the time but always some villages between with people to ask and water.
No petrolstation.

name: Hotel ?
description:
Nice small Hotel on the opposit side of Hotel Sogui.
Paye 18000.- CFA for room with AC.
Restaurant is good.

name: Hotel Samassa
description:
Hotel with room with AC or Ventilation.
Restaurant is ok.
Pool cost extra.

name: N2 under construction
description:
200 km of the N2 are under construction.
Always a deviation with a pist in a condition which is drivable.

name: Hotel du Djoudj
description:
Could set up my tent on the guarded Hotelground for 4000.- CFA.
Hotel was still closed after wetseason.
Public toilet was avaiable.

name: Le Sénégalaise du l'automobile
description: Official Mitsubishi dealer. Don't go here, they only do service for cars bought here. Using the diagnostics computer would cost around 30.000CFA.

name: mobil center near oil libya
description: Does oil change and has a diagnostics computer.

name: at the sailing club of Dakar
description: Mola fills all the gas bottles. Came and introduced himself.

name: Cofran Lubricants
description:
Sells Lubricants. Also has special oils for gear boxes and automatic transmissions, so if your car needs some special oil it's a good place to find it.

Owner speaks French, English and German.

name: Hotel Paradise
description:
Not a camping but i could set up my tent in their compound. And park my bike next to it.
Could use the simple toilet and shower.
They have wifi as well.
4x4 could park outside and connect power.
For camping i paid 3000.- CFA, for the Breakfast 1500.-.
They have terasse with view on the ocean and a path which is leading to the beach with some bars.

name: Parking with Guard
description: Good place to leave your vehicle if staying at Espace Thialy. Guarded from 8pm for a 1,500 fee.

name: Police Checkpoint
description:
Checkpoint in the village before the boarder.
They searched our vehicels and where looking for something...
Unfriendly police officers.
In the end they took a pack of cigarettes!

name: Guinea-Bissau immigration post
description:
Entering from Senegal:

You get stopped at the begining of the village.
In a small hut to the left they not youre passport data in a book (no stamp).
Behind there is a house where they take youre vehicle data from youre car licence and you have to pay the roadtax (5000 CFA). Free for motorcycles. You get a official receipt for that.
They search youre car a little and ask what you bring them. Just negotiat it.

Drive a little further to the next stop sign.
To the left is the police counter where they stamp the passport. On the right side is a custom building. We went there and showed our Carnets de Passage they filled it out after we explained what to write where.

Everything for free.

name: Saint Louis Sun Hotel
description: Excellent reasonably priced hotel - walking distance to independence square.

name: Metou hotel
description:
Great Rooms & restaurant!  Not too far from Gambia border. 
Staying here right now & been very impressed with the service, food &  accommodation.  12000for a single room for the night.

name: Mango Village Hotel
description:
Great Small lodges, small pool, shaded sitting / eating area in an enclosed compound. 
Very friendly staff. 
It is sandy tracks for about 1km of the main road, but not too tricky and for cars no problem. 
I did drop the bike due to some soft sand that I wasn’t expecting but it doesn’t take much!! 😃

name: Chez Daggi
description:
Nice place for Cold Beer & Sandwich 
Good music & good vibes. Visit here while camping nearby

name: South of Langue de Barbarie
description: Nice and quiet parking at the southern point of langue de Barbarie Island between laguna and ocean. Really good overnight camping spot to visit historic part of St. Louis island at 6 km from this point

name: Marsassoum ferry
description:
500 CFA for one motorcycle. Drive on board and ticket man finds you. One ferry operating back and forth. Spoke to a local who said it departs from on side of the river at 9:00, waits until 10:00 to depart from the other side, and so on.

Note: they are building a bridge for vehicles, but it's not yet open!

name: Mat-Equip
description:
shop for bearings and sealings in industry quality

specialized on hydraulics and pumps, but can organise everything.

name: corrupt Policemen
description: stops you on the toll gate and claims you for speeding without evidence. just pass by this guy

name: visitor centre, reserve naturelle Dindefelo
description:
This is the place where you get ticket and guide to visit the natural reserve and get all the infos you may need.

1. Dindefelo waterfall : about 100m high (according to locals), 30 min walk one way, 1.000 CFA/pers. Nice pool were you can swim, but water is extremely cold.

2. Reserve loop cave (source of the waterfall), "mushroom" village, Dandé teeth (cliff), Affia waterfall (small pool), Cascade de Segou (200m from Affia, 40m high, can be seen from the top). 1.000 CFA / pers.

3. Chimps tour also availiable with a guide. Seems to have great opportunity to see some specimens, but we didn't try it.

10.000 CFA for the guide per day (for a group)
we left at 7:30 morning, back at 15:00 afternoon. Very nice, worth a visit.

At the moment they have up to 7 different day hikes that you can make in the area.

name: bush camp near Dindefelo
description:
large old quarry just outside of Dindefelo, very good before or after hikking around...
completely hidden from the village. Very quiet
no facilities but hand water pump is a few hundred meter away in the direction of Dindefelo
access is a bit chaotic the last 10m, maybe difficult in the raining season

name: Road to Segou and Dindefell
description:
Here is the beginning of the dirt road to Segou or Dindefelo (approx 1h30). Easy in dry season. No gaz station.
Plenty bushcamps possibilities. Hand waterpomp 6km further. Another hand waterpomp at the entrance of Dindefelo.

name: Bakery - boulangerie
description: looking for bread... this is the place !

name: wild camp behind "Auberge L'etape"
description:
wild camping possible behind l'auberge l'étape.
this place is not beautiful and there is some waste but it's very calm and safe. You can find wild toilet there. Good for stay one free night in Kaolack if you need to renew your passavant.

name: Quicksilver Boardriders Dakar
description: Nice hostel. A bed starts for around 20 euro and includes breakfast. There is ample secure parking for a half dozen motorcycles and / or a normal sized vehicle. There is a pool and good wifi. A real nice treat to relax in a little luxury.

name: Prince
description: We stored our Toyota LandCruiser at this place for 7 months and everything was ok when we returned. Price was €50 per month. Manager Lamin and his colleagues are very helpful in assisting you in anyway they can. Actually it is a car cleaning station, which is closed during the night with a fence. Quiet area. One limitation: only space for one car, not a truck.

name: Orange Telecom
description: Helpful staff. Get your phone set up. 1500 for SIM, 5000 for 2GB. For internet settings, update on settings: Mobile Network >> Access Point Names >> Add >> Name: orange network, APN: internet

name: Dakar International House
description:
Friendly staff that can speak English (most of them), clean and comfortable enough. It was the cheapest price I found in Dakar: 6000cfa/night in a 4-beds dorm with ensuite bathroom and shower. 
Wifi is not the best but it works. There is also a restaurant serving cheap local food, drinks and some groceries if you'd like to cook yourself. I had a vegetarian yassa for 1000cfa and a coke for 300cfa.

name: Ferry to Gorěe Island
description: Great for day trip or overnight. NEED PASSPORT to get into port. 5,200cfa pp return tix, plus 500cfa/pp tourist free on island. Saw 2 overland trucks parked inside wall here - they overnighted on the island.

name: Bandia Animal Reserve
description: See a bunch of herbivores, including Eland, Giraffe, and Rhino. 40,500cfs for 2 people + our car + guide in car (required). Nice taste of African animals.

name: Keur Marrakis
description: Nice hotel overlooking the beach, with pool and plenty of shade. €40 for double room with private bath, A/C, and breakfast. Good wifi. Quiet and secure parking, friendly staff. Nice menu and bar - meals are €5-€7 a plate (grilled fish and chips was €6). www.marrakis.com

name: Entrance to Island
description: Nice excursion to "shell island". Small fee to enter. Cemetary has both Muslims and Catholics. We did boat tour for 6000cfa, plus guide for 5000 - 11000cfa total.

name: Hotel Dior
description:
The sign under the Hotel say camping ocean!
This hotel has some camping places for CAF6000 for 2 persons and 4x4.
It is 50 meters from the beach, but beach is not so clean.
Toilets with and without seats and some have toilet paper. Showers are cold. Sanitair looks clean.
There is free wifi and swimmingpool.

name: Campement Badjikunda
description:
Clean and comfortable guesthouse by the beach. 
Bedroom with ensuite bathroom is 8000cfa.
There are bedrooms with shared bathroom/toilet for 6000cfa/night and 7500cfa/night (per bedroom which takes 2 people).
These prices are only for lodging it doesn't include any meal. 
I didn't stay there but I saw it wasn't on the app and I decided to ask for information.
Binta is one of the workers there and she was extremely helpful and welcoming.

name: near the road
description: Nice quite place near the road. The villages are really close, you can hear the voices, but nobody cross the area.  The camping area is huge empty space. We parked near some trees.

name: Guesthouse of Madelaine
description:
we found this place by surprise. we asked a guy in the village, for a place or campground. we didn't found a other place. so we were lucky to find this.
it's a guesthouse running by Madelaine. 
the courtyard is not huge and it's only enough space for two cars or smaller truck's.
(opposite of the restaurant le cormoran is a shop, the owner Buzz (Mr. Effenberg) is the brother of Madelaine, he speaks a bit english, a very friendly guy)

name: Maison Des Oeuvres
description:
This hotel is a katholic mission.
They have clean rooms with toilet and cold shower starting from CFA 10000.
There is free wifi.
It is a populair place, so somtimes fully booked.
You can park your car in the small safe courtyard, but you absolutely cannot sleep in the car.

name: under the tree
description: Nice place 200m from the road under the trees. Path passing the place realy close and many locals using it. So if you like more quite place, just drive off the path and more deep into the bush.

name: Auberge Le Bloc Gadec/Auburge Sadio
description: Hotel/Hostel, 5000 cfa for bed in 4 bed dorm with breakfast. 12000 for double room I think. Has fans, no AC. Cold Shower and western toilet. Has room for a few motorcycles or probably just 1 or 2 cars behind the gate. Probably the cheapest place in town and in my opinion totally fine for a night or two.

name: Supermarket
description:
Wine, Beer, Alcohol etc., Meat and a little Supermarket...
Good for Traveler !

name: ATM - Societe General
description: ATM that accepts MasterCard, visa and Maestro.

name: Nigeria Embassy
description: Embassy of Nigeria, next to OiLibya petrol station, Point E. A very friendly man advised me to apply in Cotonou. While he didn't deny me the visa, he said tourist visa is only 1-2 weeks valid and that when they will see my itinerary through West Africa and possibly my Cameroon visa, they should the visa there.

name: ATM. Accepts Mastercard. No Fee.
description: Atm machine which accepts MasterCard and visa

name: Baraka Bar
description:
a true drinking den. 600 small flag. 900 big. although most people were buying bottles of cheap gin! as far as the red lights on the wall would let me see!
A+ :)

name: Bandia Reserve Restaurant
description: Just inside the Bandia reserve, a nice restaurant by watering hole to watch crocs, monkeys and warthogs while you eat. You don't need to pay the park entrance to eat at the restaurant.

name: Restaurant Le Reveil
description: Nice Restaurant with great food. Beef curry was amazing. All kind of booze available. Dodgy pool table with dodgier cues, but it‘s for free.

name: Douane passavant renewal
description: Unfortunately he could not help me because agents at border wrote transit on my papers.

name: Le Figuer
description:
Small campement close to Chez Clara and  next to Le Lamatin at Pointe Saint-Georges. 
Run by Jaques Andre Diatta and family. Phone: 00221 77 420 44 86. /  00221 77 563 77 20. Mail to: lefiguier9@gmail.com
Not quite finished yet but the only campement  where we could pass the entrance with our small truck ( 3.70 x 2.30 x 6.20) We parked right next to the river and ate great meals (4000 CFA) cooked by the family. 
Toilet is European style but there is no running water, just buckets.
The dirt track to Pointe Saint Georges is under construction. The bigger part is still deep sand. Starting point is Kagnout, west of Mlomp.
In case you want to stay a while, make sure to bring enough veggies and fruit with you.
Great place, we spent two weeks there.

name: Il pelicano
description:
Very friendly hotel to stay on the road to Dakar
Big room. Nice bed
The staff is very friendly.
Restaurant international and senegalais. Very nice food

name: The stone circles at Kabakoto
description: Just next to the dirt road, football field and village of Kabakoto.

name: Keurandoni
description: nice place ..rooms ..has no parking but if it have a 4x4 you can park in front (has guard)...200m to the beach...jacuzzi&spa

name: Les Pieds dans l'Eau, N'Gor restaurant
description: Large and closed parking area where we are allowed to stay overnight in our camper after diner.

name: Bantab Too
description:
Very scenic location above the Casamance River. Lodge with restaurant, bar and swimming pool. Large area for parking and camping.
Rather expensive but it's worth it. (10 000 XOF for the place) 
Clean and everything is working and in good shape.

name: Casa di Mansa Chez Mbasso
description:
Very welcoming campement in Kafountine. Very helpful and friendly staff, they speak English & French. 
Everything is very clean, although there is some rebuilding done. Showers available, but African style ;-)
Nice Restaurant with very affordable food (national plates at it's best!) beer and all you need. Also bungalows available.
The Ocean is just 2 minutes per foot away, very clean.
This campsite was one of our best experiences during our trip through Senegal. You can learn a lot from the owner Mbasso and his beautiful family!
They also offer  some Dancing courses, Djembe lessons and once a week kind of a discotheque, but its all calm and nice :)
Really worth a visit and don't be afraid of the road to them. We did it with two big rigs :) It's doable up to 7,5-8,5meters length and 3,50m high, I would say.

name: Axa Senegal
description: Here you get all information on carte brun and a very good price. We left the other place at the city center because they didnt want to explain to us how the insurance works. Therefore we went to this place with very friendly people. They speak English and French and helped us also with other information.

name: fresh air under a huge tree
description: found this place by chance. It has fresh air and a great view. asked the villagers if we can stay. they were very helpful and friendly and we had a great exchange on culture, travel, work and life

name: Podor border crossing coming from Mauritania
description: Crossed the border within 15min with a bicycle. No problems at all. There is no bridge only tiny boats. Pedestrians and bicycle can cross not sure if it possible for motorbike riders.

name: quartier des bolongs, chez Rose
description:
very nice camp, on the beach.
For 4x4 and trucks

name: Dieuf dieul lompoul
description: In the middle of Lompoul village, Paco can host you in private hut. His wife will cook for you. Much cheaper than staying in camp in the desert. 10000fcfa for the night and meals

name: Hotel Casa Italia
description:
15000 per night including little breakfast. 
Garage for motorcycle.
fast WiFi in room.

name: Auberge de la cité
description: small cheap hotel without confort. toilet are outside of the room. I paid 12500fcfa for one night with breakfast. bar and restaurant very close

name: Kafountine beach
description: In front of a former hotel. Some locals still „maintain“ the place, like clean the area a bit. They are happy if you give them something little. Lots of trees that provide shadow. Lonely beach with some trash. Very silent spot.

name: Silent cap
description: The silent point of cap skirring. Enter the beach at hotel Restaurant „Bar se la Mer“ (google maps know it). Watch the tides

name: Rex Hotel
