description: Decided to stay here rather than drive into Dakar at night. There is a secure garage where we parked our motorbike, it would fit a couple of 4X4’s. We paid 14,000 CFA for double room, with bathroom and fan, 16,400 CFA for double with air con. Rooms are very clean and comfortable and there is quick WIFI. The water was cold but had just finished a long and very hot drive so not an issue. We ate in the restaurant and the food was good, 1,000 CFA for a Flag beer, 1,500 for Riz au poison, 2,500 steak and chips.

name: Restaurant Afrikabane
description:
A little restaurant and bar on the beach side with moderate prices. very good food, nice people and very good atmosphere.
sunbeds for free.
open all seasons
(4G with Orange)

name: Chez Agnes
description: Decent and cheap hotel with very nice owners and staff. We travel by motorbike and were able to bring it inside courtyard at night. Good WiFi and hot showers. We paid 13000 CFA for double room without bathroom (including breakfast) Double with bathroom 15000 CFA. Best priced beer we have found outside supermarket, big gazelle 1000 CFA.

name: axa assurance broker
description:
The boss was not here so a young boy gave me the correct price without bargaining : 3 months for brown card is 12000 CFA 
My motorcycle is a 400cc

name: Mad Bikes
description: moto mechanic. just went for a little maintenance. seemed very professional and used to big bikes / Enduro bikes. Has oil for KTMs (ipone fully synthetic). and for regular bikes (champion brand semi synthetic).

name: Complexe Keur Mame Astou
description: cheap hotel (15000fcfa) for one person and one night. restaurant. beers are not available at the hotel but it is possible to buy some in town. nice people

name: Restaurant Chez khadija
description: Fantastic restaurant directly on Yoff beach, look for collection of plastic chairs and umbrellas on the sand. Enormous whole bbq fish/ prawn skewers with rice/ chips and salad for 2500 CFA. The best food we’ve had in Senegal so far and a lovely place to pass the time.

name: Toubey moto
description: Great place for big bikes. Oil change etc full of BMW GS and Africa twin new and old. Good oils from France. Got oil change done here and took a friend to get new spark plugs and air filter cleaned

name: Grand Bao Balon
description:
In between of the river and a small forest. 
Huge area among  trees. Very quiet.

name: Campement MINDISS
description: cheap place to stay (12500fcfa with breakfast) very nice people.a bar where you can drink a beer is at 200m away.

name: Bakolong Lodge, Camping, Bar & Resto
description: The place is running by a Senegalese named Adam. Adam is living half of the year in Germany, so he speaks German, English and French. Beautiful place, good food and cheap cold drinks! Adam and his crew is very friendly and funny. Sometimes he make Reggae Party’s at his spot. So it’s very cool to meet nice people there! Clean and beautiful! Place to be! Please check the way before you enter! Cars no problem! Trucks maybe to high, but it works!

name: Senegaleses military and gendarme check point
description:
A bit easy off-roading, only military and gendarme check point take note from driver’s license and registration of vehicle. 
No passport stamp and passavant required. 
You can stay in Senegal as long as you want .

name: Almadies Parking behind a Ruine
description: Perfect place to park in Dakar! Directly behind a Ruine is the sea. A little bit of rubbish but not that much. Not too noisy, a lot of bars and restaurants in the street! We love the place!

name: Auberge Kayokulo
description: nice people, nice hotel. several bars and restaurants around. price for a single room with fan starts at 10000fcfa

name: wild camping at the beach
description: Nice spot directly on the beach. Also possible with no 4X4. Easy dirt road. You can park on the street or drive in the sand! A lot of crabs!

name: Hotel Moya
description: Good hotel. Price start at 12000fcfa for a room with fan, including breakfast. No alcohol in the hotel but bar very close

name: Chez Ouli
description:
I traveled alone and got a single room for around €20. Ouli is super nice - but speaks French only.
This is the cleanest location I’ve ever got in Africa. 
There is an Apartment and double room available. There are no signs because it is in an Apartment complex. Location was hard to find for me as I do not speak French.
The area is good - just some minutes to the center
Found it at Booking.com - but you can call here
+221 776861453

name: Campement Ecotourism
description: A beautiful place with lots of mango and cashew trees (you can pick them yourselves). They make bio-honey which is unbelieveable tasty. There also lots of bungalows around with very simple facilities. I don‘t know if it was meant as a camping place, but there is a lot of space and also a lot of shade. Happy I found this gem! But bring your own food as there seems to be no restaurant, boutique is 1km away.

name: Abandoned building site
description: Next to the main road, easy to come there. accessible for big rigs. quiet place even though the street is close, a bit bizarre/abounded site.

name: Decathalon and Auchen
description: Decathalon is a French outdoor store, some camping equipment and stuff, no gas for stoves! Auchan is a good grocery store, get there around 12pm if you want a rotisserie chicken :) Good selection of fruits, veggies, meats, wine and beer

name: airport cargo/freight
description: come by taxi here to get your motorcycles if you did airfreight.

name: Pelican Hostel
description: Decent place, next to the beach, they have cheap bungalows for rent and rooms (double, 2 people, private bath) is $25usd. parked our motos outside next to guard house.

name: Campement de chasse
description:
Nice hotel with rooms with bathroom, current water, electricity from afternoon to 11pm, swimming pool, covered terrace, meals available.
Room at 15000CFA.

name: Into the bush
description:
Just after crossing douane, guys proposed us to sleep near school’village.
Very good place. 
Little food shop, bar and many guys very friendly who offered many fruits of their gardens!

name: le relais
description: Western standard hotel. double room with airco is 32000fr inc breakfast. good wifi, good airco,good swimmingpool! :-) there is a new gasstation across the road where they sell a lot of western products. also a bakery there.

name: Rosso
description: Just For the boat  across to Mauretani the custum Office For the carnet. Close from 13:30 till 15:00. In order to cross QuickType the let you pas the lorrys. Pay pay... just drive richt down to the carnet Office. 300 mru For the local communitie and 3000 CDA For the policy. Scams al over. We did Diama coming and wanted to try Rosso on our return. Take Diama but with a valid visa For Mauritanië. Only Rosso can do visas 55 euros (we were told). Diama had awful road but can do.

name: Auberge l or du Sahara (Chami)
description:
Campsite camperplace. Tent, 4x4, 6 rooms, water and toilets. Secure parking, lights at night. Small shop at campsite. Dog no problem. Entree front sometimes high and soft sand. 
2e entree at the back even for big rigs. Park and sleep in own car 300-500. Friendly people. Coming from the North: on corner right attachés to sidestreet. Coming from south: end of Chami oppositie boulangerie.

name: Espace Velo Bicycle Repairs
description: Really friendly service and had all the bicycle parts I wanted, though some in good condition second-hand. Very helpful and with limited English was able to communicate well and called a friend when more English needed. Very glad Pabgay was here)I may have spelled his name wrong though)

name: Auchan Mbour
description: Big supermarche. Here you can buy all western food!

name: Souka Be. Hostel in Vélingara.
description: Perfect simple but ultra clean rooms, run by Polish sisters, next to the children malnutrition centre. Single/double/triple room are 12000/19000/22000CFA, equipped with air con, mosquito nets, bathroom. Closed, secured parking. All the profit from the hotel goes to the children they take care of (despite the religion). Sister Chrysologa lives in Senegal more than 20 years and knows everything about local situation, sister Gabi is also a doctor and started a hospital for children in Velingara. Very good option after crossing the border.

name: abandoned beach hotel
description: abandoned hotel right on the beach. amazing place to put up your tent. I arrived on a motorcycle but should be able to get up the ~100m sandy driveway in a 4x4. highly recommended!!

name: Santati Services
description:
You can scan and copy of your documents here.
Color copy available.

name: Entreprise DIOUBO
description:
Air conditioning - Mechanical spare parts for all vehicles. Oils, batteries, accessories. Ismael helped us replace our compressor on our Defender. Very very knowledgeable and very friendly. We highly recommend it for any mechanical information.

Climatisation - Pièces détachées mécaniques pour tous véhicules. Huiles, batteries, accessoires. Ismael nous a aidé a remplacer notre compresseur sur notre Defender. Très très compétent et très sympa. Nous vous le recommandons vivement pour tous renseignements mécaniques.

 Ismael Ndiaye Entreprise 77 657 17 25.

name: Touba Gaz
description: gas factory, selling and refilling bottles. were able to refill a German one. 6kg for 3000cfa. weigh bottle after refilling, ours was overfilled.

name: Museum and Bar
description:
Really good museum of African art. It´s inside the miammiam. Don't miss it, very good tour.
 We didn't eat there.

name: Hotel Bedik
description: Western style hotel. Very good place. Relaxing swimming pool. Great restaurant. Clean and comfortable bedrooms and clean toilets and shower. 40.000 CFA for a triple room (2 adults and 2 children - 3 beds and they brought an extra mattress).

name: Unbusy dam in the mangroves
description:
Kind of dam on which you can drive for 50m to a mooring of pirogues. Flat enough and dry ground for two vehicles. Hotel on the road seems to store its pirogues there, as well as the locals from the village. Still very quiet with few mosquitoes and some monkeys. Loud music coming from direction of town so maybe quietest place here.
Best part: water glows when something moves through it at night. Phytoplankton causes this special effect. Do take a dip at night and be amazed ;-)

name: Beach close to Lac rose
description: Casuarina-forest in the dunes. Compared to other places, less rubbish. Access to the ocean. A few visitors at the beach, and some vultures, but calm. Sandy piste, maybe difficult without 4x4. Lac Rose in walking distance.

name: Casuarina-trees in the dunes
description: Nice quiet spot, you need a 4×4 because it's pretty sandy. But nice beach (rubbish!).

name: Bushsavanna close to St. Luis
description: On the way to Dakar close to the mainroad. Sheltered under trees. Only one person passing by. Quiet.

name: In the shrubs
description: Hidden under dorny shrubs and baobabs, but enough space for your camp. Quiet, nobody passed by.

name: Ngor international hostel
description:
Converted flat, hostel.
Nice owners.
4000/night
Outside parking down a dead end street with security guard.
Space for bikes and/or car.

name: Roadside
description:
Nice small place on the way to Ziguinchor.
A few locals on their motobike on the small road near the spot. 
Very quiet.

name: Road to Gambia
description:
Nice spot away from the road.
There are only friendly locals who work in the field in the morning.

name: Camp in Bush
description:
Away from the main road.
You take a main track then a small track. 
We parked next to the small track, only few friendly villagers came back home before the night. 
No one at night.

name: Goree island
description:
You can take a guide in tourist information but you can also see island by yourself. 
- entrance to house of slaves is 500 cfa pp (12-3 pm is a lunch break) 
- museum of history is 500 cfa pp but all info is only in french :( - open all day till 5 pm
- at the tourist info we were told to pay additional 500 pp for sth like a tourist tax

There is also a castel with a view on island, many craft shops and restaurants. It's really nice island for a walk with beaitiful architecture. Wort the visit if you have time.

name: Craft market
description:
Many many craft shops. Most of them sell the same ;) you can buy iron hand made stuff, they have a small place where they really do it, ask around and you can see them working.
And in this place where I marked is a guy who has a looot of masks from the region.

name: Under the trees with ocean view
description: We hide ourselfs from the sun and people but still with view on the ocean. You'l find many places here. And all the beach drive from Dacar was so fun. It's sandy and sometimes quite small space for the car when you drive between tries so maybe not for a big rig.

name: big big local market
description: you can buy all you need and more. There is a lot of colorful materials to buy, and a big factory where they make cloths. Be prepared for many sellers who will not let you walk slowly and just look around. Remember - always bargain!

name: alone in the bush
description: Great place to stay before/after crossing the border. You turn into a small dirt road and then you turn right, you'll see a big building, then just turn left into the bush and find your place. No people around only some animals.

name: On street parking Yoff beach
description:
We stayed several nights on the road opposite a fancy house, outside a surf school. the house had a security guard who kept an eye on our van the whole time. (Blue uniform, lovely man call Mohamed, we gave him a 1000CFA at the end of our 3 night stay and he was happy enough!)

loads of placed to eat, small shops and beach places to rent shelters or boards.

Most of the beach places have an outside beach shower and basic loos you can use during the day.

name: Camp near Foundiougne
description: Wonderful place under acacias, but beware the dorns! With excess to the lagune, where you can swim. No one bothered us. A few warans around.

name: Parking Lot
description: Parking under the leafy trees next to the tourist bars. We spent 2 nights in the free (we think) parking, but gave the locals that hang out under the trees 100D to watch the van whilst we were out. After a little negotiating with the taxi drivers who sit toward the beach we filled our tank from their tap for a "donation" of 50D. Bit noisy at night but ideal for a few nights in tourist town and proximity to the English breakfast in the morning!

name: Useful Tourist Info
description: Not your usual pushy office, gave us loads of info about where to camp, surf and mountain bike plus a tip about a wrestling match later!

name: Military base in Sine-Saloum Nationalpark
description: Military Basement in Sine Saloum Nationalpark with nice inhabitants, that let you stay for 5000 CFA/person. Wonderful lagune in the mangroves, where you can swim. Calm.

name: Abandoned hotel above beach
description: We parked here for 1 night and walked down through the abandoned hotel to the restaurant below (also on ioverlander) for dinner.

name: Parking off main road opposite big hotel
description: We arrived late and pulled up here, no one was around who seemed in charge of the parking and no one bothered us in our campvan. We stayed inside so we didn't attract attention but felt perfectly safe there are loads of security guards at the gate to the hotel opposite. No one asked for cash the following morning, busy road but you are on a gravel (open) parking lot well away from traffic. Nothing special but free...

name: La belle fourchette
description: a new restaurant with the best hamburgers!! with fresly tomatoes, onions and everything. He just opened his restaurant. It is near to the roundabout in a white small building. He also has fresh self made juices. All for a good price.

name: Fromager Lodge
description: Italian run lodge. Family run, set in very peaceful surroundings with swimming pool. the owner Julio is a great chef, safe parking outside.. costs for double bed bungalow is 25000cfa and a double 4 bed 50000cfa

name: Bass tailor shop
description: If you want to get your real african dress, stop and talk to Bass. He is a wonderful man and does excellent work. Ether you bring your own fabric or you choose one from his shop. He needs one day to get it ready. He speaks perfect English and also German. So please bring him some business, you will love your dress. I paid 7000 cfa, brought my own fabric, did not negotiate, because his work was worth it. He is also a friend of the camp site „The Little Baobab“ nearby.

name: Campement La Casa
description:
Fantastic chilled spot near the beach. Italian owner brings a special mood to the place. Camped with our truck for two nights. Clean toilet and shower (cold water), resto and bar as well as rooms to rent. Cost for truck and two persons cfa3000 per night. Electricity also available. Shady or sunny spots in yard. Stayed two nights but really could spend a month.

Access from local town on deep sandy track so 4x4 required. Local trike motorbikes also make it through.

name: Nianao - Pirada
description:
Very little post border in Nianao.
It's 26 kms of road pist from Kabendou (Sénégal) 
Very friendly, very quick, no other car.

name: Wild camp on dry lake
description: Be careful to check that the surface is dry. Only in dry season.

name: Dara Serigne Saliou
description:
Modou works on motorbikes and is specialised in electronics. I went to MAD Bikes and the guys brought me over here for my special electrical problem. Modou rewired my whole bike and changed it from a 6V to 12V system.

Modou's tel.: 775070676

name: Free parking at Lamin’s shop
description: On my way to Cape Town I stopped here. Lamin and his sister are having a small souvenir shop here. They offered me to sleep beside their shop for free. Lamin is super easy. There is free WiFi 24/7 from the near by hotel, also 230v from Lamin’s shop (if you give him small money) and a public tap for water. The mangroves are 100m walk from Lamin’s shop. Lamin often starts a fire in the night to preparing good fish and tea. You are welcome. It’s little paradise. There are some mosquitos because of the mangroves. Btw he offered me a cheap 2h boad ride through the mangroves. He also runs a facebook page “Discover Senegal and Gambia with Lamin”. Super low fares! Feel free to support him, last shop at the street! At the weekends it can be a little bit louder because of local music. But not too loud!

name: Get your carnet stamped here
description:
At the port nord of dakar, you can get your carnet de passage stamped. The guy that does the stamping is on a break between 13 h and 15 h. 
Take a copy of your papers with you (there is a copy place next door).
Everything took us about 20 minutes. 

Beware of the huge traffic jams if you come here. It took us 45 minutes extra.

name: NSIA Assurance
description:
Friendly staff that helped us out getting a vehicle insurance for our campervan.
25500cfa for one month.

name: Le Relais de Kaolack
description:
Fairly nice hotel, safe parking in a courtyard with a guard all night.
Wifi. 
Cost for a double is 32,000 a night, so notthe cheapest. Room has AC. Haven’t tried breakfast yet (typing this while sat at dinner; there’s a restaurant by the pool).

name: L‘endroit
description: Good local restaurant. Reasonable prices and great fish. Was brought here by locals many times.

name: Inpassable border road
description: The road to guinee is too rocky, narrow and steep to pass in a 4x4 vehicle. Motors can be pushed maybe. Don't try this alone

name: Senegal police border post.
description: after having tried and failed to cross at Segou with a 4×4. We took the advice of a local and came here. Get your carnet de passage stamped out in kedougou. Found a small border post here. Friendly people.

name: Sita
description:
Next to a little village. Near the street. 
There were kids looking at us but when the sun goes down the kids leave the place.
 Friendly people. Quiet at night.

name: Sitokoto campement
description:
Campement which provides rooms right on the beach :
- 3000 CFA for camping (breakfast non included)
- 7500 CFA per person for a room with breakfast (which cost 1500 CFA)
- 11500 CFA per person for a room with breakfast (which cost 1500 CFA) + one meal
- 14000 CFA per person for a room with breakfast (which cost 1500 CFA) + 2 meals

Nice people and relax atmosphere.
Quite far from the centre of city, but right on the beach and 10 minutes from the harbour.
The road to access is quite sandy (400 m) so it could be difficult for overlanders and cars (I pushed my bicycle).

name: Île des Pelicans - chez Ibra
description: Nice parking spot close to restaurant. Safe and beautiful spot. We had twice grilled fish. You can use toilet of restaurant.

name: Appartment en bourde de mer
description: Small quirky/arty apartment over 2 floors, with kitchenette and good shower, part of complex with other homes sharing a courtyard. Small pool overlooking the sea and near to beaches & touristy restaurants. Next to Sobo Bade Art Hotel with a good outdoor restaurant. Convenient for visiting Dakar, Lac Rose, Saly etc. Street parking, though busy with tourist traffic.

name: Wagadougou
description:
Beautifull and quiete place on the Gambia river, you can swim in the river.
We saw alot of birds and baboons and other monkeys, we heard hippo’s, but we didn’t see them.

name: Les Fialos/Kabrousse
description:
A beatiful place .
Only reachable by beach with 4x4. 
Place under the trees in front of a destroyed hotel complex.
Near a local, basic, original bar/restaurant "Les Filalos".
Owned by a friendly Senegal guy.
Enter the beach at Hotel restaurant "Bar se la Mer".
Watch the tide!

name: Salemata
description: Customs stamp CDP when going to or coming from Youknounnoun

name: Pakour
description: Good piste for when you come from Guinea and want to go to Casamace.

name: Blue Lodge
description: Clean, staff friendly, garage for my motorcycle 1500 CFA a room, 8 km from Somone close highway

name: Campement Mussuwam
description:
Lovely, well-designed place with charming small rooms in huts, some with shower & WC. Very nice bar and restaurant, right on the beautiful palmbeach. Relaxed and friendly.

.

name: Abene
description: very private spot behind a beach bar. some deep sand to come here, but no problem for the unimog (3.30m height).

name: Wild Camp
description: Wild camp in a flat spot. Some friendly locals passed near with horses. We slept well, nobody at night.

name: Garage Moto Cap Skirring
description:
Very good mecanics for motorbikes. The location of the Garage is between the drugstore and the restaurant “Le regal”. They change my clutch disks for good price, also the guys are members of the motorcycle club of Cap Skirring. If you need any help you can call Paul +221 774586614 and Lamine +221 776606800
They are super friendly and they can drive you to small villages you will never discover without them !

name: Cap Surf
description: Surf camp with cheap board, you can also have surf class. The price are négociable call Abdoulaye +221 772190754

name: Bank Societe Generale
description: The only bank in the area thar accept Master card, charge me a commission of 0.50£, it didn't show that on the screen ?in Mauritania was free of charge).

name: Auberge Restaurant Le Saint-Louis
description:
Hotel very close to the main road, has good single rooms without A/C 13000, toilet, hot warer and even TV, double room 16000, we tried to bargain because we arrived quiet late but they had fix prices.
 for more prices check the pictures.
Fast wifi
simple breakfast inclusive
very friendly staff

name: Baba Garage
description: Some 500m from the piste under a giant baobab. Beautiful views. Some friendly people passed by.

name: Fall Meissa - sculpture
description: Small sculpture shop/museum made with bicycles parts, very interesting closer to other museum

name: Border crossing coming from Djoudj Park
description:
Djoudj park is spectacular  for its Pelicans and depending  from the months, its huge quantities of European  birds. But it's expensive. We paid total  of 43.000 CFA but I'm not sure if the 15000 for the useless guide cannot be avoided..
Leaving the park you can drive straight to the border on a not so bad road. Before you know it you're at the border gate. we didn't  cross because we needed to finish a bottle  of wine, so we turned back to sleep  at this quiet place. Friends were searched a week before and had to pay 40€ penalty for the 9 beers  and 1 bottle that were confiscated. 
In the morning  a french hunter and his guide passed by (there are 2 hunting camps in the neighborhood').

Update after crossing : i told the customs I had 3 beers and they let go without searching. 
BEWARE : THE INSURANCE  GUY WILL SHOW YOU TARIFFS IN OLD OUGYUA AND WILL HAPPILY RECEIVE THAT AMOUNT IN NEW UM. THE SAME FOR THE CUSTOMS GUY : 400 OLD UM

name: Tailor’s market
description: Tons of tailors/seamstresses working here. The place to get clothes made or adjusted.

name: Local restaurant
description:
Small local restaurant, dishes for 1.000 CFA rice with chicken or fish with diferent  sauces.
Friendly lady who makes the meals.

name: Coeur Ocean Hotel
description:
We stayed 2 nights in the hotel, because it wasn't high season we get the double room for 10.000, 12.000 if you want breakfast. It was right in front of the mangroves, very nice view from the room.
they have restaurant but at that time wasn't work so he let us cook some food in his kitchen. The owner was very friendly and give us some information about the area.
It has wifi but it works better in some areas of the hotel.

name: Hotel Le Palmier
description: Parking possible in the hotel courtyard. Catering possible for a very reasonable price. Excellent reception.

name: Musee Kadiouth
description: A very nice outdoor museum about Diola culture. The caretakers do a really nice job explaining Diola culture in an outdoor setting. Call Valere: +221783517696 to make an appointment. From the main road in Boucotte follow the signs to Musee Kadiouth.

name: Surf spot
description:
Here it is a nice right handed wave! Works on high tide. Not consistent, but worth checking out. During the 3 months of our stay in the area we only saw one man surfing. Start close from the rocks just on the right of the restaurant "La cabane sauvage". If you have a 4x4 you can park at the beach, right in front of it.
We also camped just beside the restaurant for 10 days. Very chilled, under the trees, almost no one in the area. But maybe in a year or soo that won`t be possible as they are building this bar/swimming pool just there.

name: L’eau Mame Diarra
description: Business for drinking water. Also large quantities can be fueled. Own hose is necessary. 18 cfa / liter of water

name: Curaan Center
description:
Opposite the Curaan Center possibility to park on a paved area.  
Parking is free.  Dinner 3500, - cfa, Gazelle 1200, - cfa, breakfast 1000, - cfa, is desired.  Drinking water available.  1000, - cfa / 500 l.  The Bakhoum family is very nice and runs a kiosk / café / restaurant.  Please do not overuse the free parking!

name: Dépôt de Boissons
description:
small supermarket and alcohol shop.
Nice Place in the Base Casamance...

name: Mont Roland
description: Nice place to camp, lot of baobabs around. Base camp to run with my enduro motorcycle to the hills around and to the Atlantic ocean too.

name: Bivouac Potou
description: Nice place for tents or mobile home. Not far from secondary road between Leona and Potou. You’re welcome from the population. Base camp for enduro motorcycling around.

name: Mangroves Fadial
description: Very nice place for tents and motorhome close to the mangrove swamp. You can swim all day long because of the main sea watercourse. Very quiet and safe place. You have to deflate seriously your tires when driving on the sand!

name: Dindefelo
description:
Very nice place where I spent 3 nights.
Close to Segou, Dindefelo and Dande.
The right area for practicing motorcycle trips.

name: Nice spot on the field
description: We were just on our way to Rosso and this is a nice spot just of the road to spend a night. It’s a bit hidden behind a wall, protected for curious eyes from the road. One friendly Senegalese came by, and a few horse carts further very quiet. If you have dogs do take them inside at night as apparently there are hyena’s at night.

name: Campement Diouloulou
description: Campement directly on the Bolong. Nice complex with very clean bungalows.  Clean shower and toilet in the Bungalow. 15000 CFA including breakfast.  Secure parking for two large trucks. Restaurant or meals to order. Fish Yassa 2000, - CFA, Beer 1000, - CFA. Very better local owner...

name: Hopital Divine Providence
description:
Little healthcare center managed by a senegalese nun who is pediatrician. They can treat malaria and other infections. 
Only open at weekdays from 8am to 5pm. 
no appointment needed.

name: Phare des Mamelles
description: Very Nice and welcoming restaurant. Nice view over the whole city.

name: Le Perroquet
description:
Nice hotel just at the river. Their own Restaurant serves delicious food. Little terrace with sand at the river, where you can have a beer or food. 
18000 CFA for a double room with AC. Some rooms have a little balcony facing the river.

name: Scooter rental
description: nice and friendly place to rent your scooter here. exploring the casamance by scooter is an adventure (Pointe-saint-georges is a recommendation, approx. 1:40 h from Cap Skirring). it's 10000 CFA per day, our scooter was very new and we got helmets.

name: Maintenance Pneus
description:
A specialized Tyre Center. They are very friendly and professional. They have all kind of tyres, from old used ones to new all Terrain tyres. 
We bought a second used spare tyre here. Including the rim, we paid 150000 CFA. definitely recommendable!

name: Restaurant Le Terasse
description: Basic Restaurant with nice food and reasonable prices. very close to the Auberge. nothing special, but totally all right.

name: Campement Tako Mayo
description:
Very nice Campement just next to the Gambia River, where you can take a nice swim. The little houses are basic, but totally fine. The rooms have electricity and a Fan and mosquito net, water and a proper shower in the evening and morning, Western toilets. The food is nice. Beers and drinks available. 12000 CFA pppn, including breakfast and Diner and Private bathroom. Rooms with public bathroom cheaper.
Definately recommendable!

name: Restaurant dolima a la paillote
description: Very good and cheap local food. When we were there they had two different dishes to choose from. 1000 CFA for a big Portion. Cold drinks also available.

name: Garage Sept place
description: Good and friendly mechanics. We had a problem with our alternator and battery. We got a used new alternator (50000 CFA) which he had to adjust a little to fit in our Pajero. Besides, we got a brandnew battery (100Ah, 55000 CFA). Now everything works perfectly.

name: Chez Sidy et Roos
description: Sidy et Roos have a room for rent, a tent for rent, and enough space to put your own tent. Their house is situated at the crossroads between Saint Louis, Dakar, Touba and the desert of Lompoul.

name: Restaurant Touba Kheweul
description: Amazing restaurant in North Dakar. There is a menu of 1 meal each day and will cost 1000CFA. Oumy is the lady in charge and she is lovely. Honestly some of the best Senegalese food I have eaten and the atmosphere is lovely. Definitely worth giving this place a look.

name: Baba’s mechanic workshop
description: Baba is really good mechanic, super friendly & exact. Site is just off the pistr devcharmettes, 200m from club kathmandu

name: Lac Rose
description: we spent a quiet night here, a few meters from the lake. busy until 19h00 with quads around but surprisingly quiet afterwards. nobody came to sell us things.

name: Chez youyou
description:
A nice campement at the beach. Pape the owner is very friendly and his stuff too. It has also a very nice bar even with table tennis place and a petagne place.
It's very calm and has nice ocean view. They have nice rooms and it's possible to camp here.
We stayed three nights with our tent. Costs are negotiable, we paid 3000CFA and utilise the shower and toilets.
We don't know if it's possible to camp here with 4x4 but we think it could be possible to park just in front of the place.
Quiet nice familiar atmosphere.

name: Café de la mer
description:
we could spend one night there on the parking of the café. the restaurant was closed when we were there. it was very quiet.
we drive a campervan and are not 4x4 so not so easy to find nice places next to the beach ;)

name: saly main beach parking
description:
flat parking with security a few meters from the ocean. a bit busy as it's Saly main beach, a bit of music until 10pm but very quiet afterwards. no hassle from the beach sellers. we came here 3 times.
we were asked to pay (2000cfa) the first night, but nothing for the next ones. I think it's actually a free parking ;)
no facilities except nearby beach restaurants. we have a self contained campervan.

name: gaz filling station
description:
we could exchange here our french cylinder against a local one (same system). they only have butane here. it's a Total filling station. 
We paid 6250CFA for a 12kg cylinder.
very friendly staff.

name: Quai de podor senegal
description: Place to spend the night in podor near police

name: Auberge De La Vallee
description:
Nice hostel, a bed in dorm cost 6000 CFA per night.
Good location, right in the historical centre. WiFi is ok, electricity and shower too.

name: Cofran
description:
Cofran or also known as Lub & Supply

They provide a good variety of oils and grease for cars. We're looking for a special transmission oil, and they're very helpful. 
The owner speaks French, English and German.

When you found the entrance at the roundabout, the actual Shop is very hidden, just ask the guard or the people at the garage and the will show you where to go.

name: Fara Moto Maristes
description: I’ve been riding in the in mud for the last three days in Mauritania and I had a clutch problem for my BMW750 GS, I come to the guys and they change it with no time also they changed the oil and the filter ,friendly people specially the owner fara

name: Edk oil kaolack
description: Endroit sécurisé avec 3 gardiens (jusqu'à 6h du matin) pour passer la nuit. Fast food et magasin dans la station. Bien pour passer la nuit.

name: La Mboroise
description: Nice hotel with AC rooms for 20k Cfa and with just fan 15k Cfa, it is clean, and staff is nice. Rested here on my last day before Dakar. Secure parking for Motorcycles as well. I highly advise this route from Saint Louis to here, almost no traffic and nice landscapes.

name: Camping Onderhoek
description: A small campsite on a working vineyard. Good bathrooms, friendly owners and grassy camp spots.

name: Springbok Caravan Park
description:
Nice shaded grassy camp spots with power ad running water, Braais and laundry machines. The pool is a great way to cool down on hot days
 Very clean ablution. Do not go here for the scenery. Price was 200 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car.

name: Lungile Lodge
description: We waited for our vehicle to arrive by ship to Port Elizabeth and stayed in Lungile for eight days and tried out some of their rooms. Rooms, bathroom and kitchen were clean and nice. A communal kitchen and fridge so you could cook your own food. Free tea and coffee. Swimming pool that we never tried. Free wifi. Off street parking. And a short walking distance to the beach and several resturants.  dorm bed 120 rand, double room w shared bathroom 310 rand, double en suite 385 rand.

name: Addo Elephant National Park Main Camp
description: Best to book in advance by calling or online ant sanparks website. Nice sites, good ablution, free wifi at the restaurant. Sites are often fully booked. Shop has basic food, firewood and drinks. Cattle baron restaurant as well. Watering holes and bird hide at this camp. Price was 380 Rand per night for 3 persons. PLUS you must pay park entry fees roughly R450 per day for international and R50 for SA residents.

name: Bloukrans River Camp
description: Ok toilet and shower facilities, but the water was brown. Power. Just next to the highway and you could hear traffic at night.  120 rand per site and 40 rand per person. We shared a site with four other people and paid 90 rand.

name: Erlandspoort
description: This place has changed ownership and is now a game lodge. It does NOT offer camping facilities any more.

name: Doringkloof Boskamp
description: Power, water, braai and ok toilet and shower facilities. Camping on grassy area.  180 rand

name: Komdomo Campsite
description: Power, water, braai, a place to do your dishes and nice toilet and shower facilities.  90 rand and that includes the park fee to Bavianskloof

name: Hostal Island Vibe
description: We had the car serviced at Nissan in Knysna that was just 200 meters up the road. Off street parking, communal kitchen with fridge, free tea and coffee, swimming pool and free wifi. In the city center and a nice place to be for a few days.  300 rand for a double room with shared bathroom.

name: The Wild Farm
description: Backpacker place that also have camping. Some kilometers up on a hill outside Wilderness, amazing view over Wilderness and the ocean. Communal kitchen and fridge, free tea and coffee, breakfast is included and they have a small restaurant and a bar. Free WiFi. Nice toilet and shower facilities.  180 rand

name: African Overlanders
description:
A campsite for overlanders, offering places to camp, dormitory and dorm accommodation. Hot showers, free Internet 24 hours access. We also offer shipping services all over the world. Come join us.

ADMIN NOTE: This place has recently moved. The coordinate marking this place is now correct. For reference: -33.8715898°, 018.7348398°

name: Sanddrift
description:
PRICE JANUARY 2022: 380 for up to 4 (or 6?) people. 

Water, power, braai, a place to do dishes, nice toilet and shower facilities. Sanddrift is the closest campsite to Wolfberg Cracks. To hike through the cracks the permit is 50 ZAR pp, to Wolfberg Arch 100 ZAR  pp, to Maltese Cross 60 ZAR pp;

name: Camping Verbe
description: Power, water, a place to do dishes and nice and clean toilet and shower facilities. No wifi.  120 rand

name: Pafuri River Camp
description: We arrived in the dark and left in the dark, but what we saw of it looked like a nice place. Campsites with braai area, water and your own toilet and shower block with hot water. There was also a place to do dishes. They had a bar and restaurant too, and a swimming pool??  200 rand

name: Kruger N.P. - Punda Maria
description: Not the most organized campground, no specific campsites and you just had to find a free area. Water and power points around in the campground, but not enough power points to everyone. Nice toilet and shower block with hot water. A small kitchen to cook and do dishes. Restaurant and a small shop at the reception. There was also a water hole with a shelter where you could sit and watch the animals at the campsite.  136 rand (we were four people sharing a site)

name: Phalaborwa Safari Park
description: Just outside the Phalaborwa gate into Kruger National Park. Nice campground with braai place, water and power. Really nice toilet and shower block with hot water, a place to do dishes and there was a laundry machine and dryer that you could use for free.  195 rand

name: Buffalo Thorn Lodge
description: Beautiful lodge just 10 km from the Botswana border. Inexpensive for how nice it is. Big rooms with small fridge and coffee and tea facilities. Private veranda at each room looking out over a waterhole. Common braai area. Meals upon request. Wifi is intermittent. There is vodacom cell signal. We paid R350 per person per night.

name: merry pebbles caravan park
description: huge  (guarded) campsite located at the sabie river, very nice and clean shower/toilet block, restaurant pub, shop, pool...140 rand pp (low season), no motorcycles, www.merrypebbles.co.za, wifi on campsite

name: magoebaskloof rest camp
description: Beautiful location on top of hill. Some renovations in progress when we stayed. 5 grass campsites with electricity, ablutions, big pool. Access around rondavels for bigger rigs tricky. Restaurant, wifi, nice staff. R175 pppn camping.

name: the pont
description: nice campsite set on the grassy banks of the umatamvuna river, ablution-block ok, water, braai, restaurant, pub, 250 rand/site (max 6 persons, extra car 60r, low season), tel 039 311 221

name: Swellendam caravan park
description: Caravanpark in forest, shower- Nice Campsite at the rim of the town with a view on the mointains! Clean ablution blocks even with bath! We paid R244 for 2 persons and truck with electricity

name: caravan park vanryhndorp
description:
Small campsite with simple hot showers and a small restaurant.

Very friendly owner.
Rand 190,- for up to four people and car.

5/22 "Very weird place - people screaming at night and no reaction from owner this place worst campsite i have been to in my life it feels like you are just in a big parking lot of a bar"

name: Brandkaros resort
description: Simple bud nice situated place, good for an overnight stay on the way to the richtersveld park, very windy during the day, a bit run down the campsite has a pool (no water at time of visite), a playground and some huts to rent. the abllutionblock is ok. there is no kitchen or sink. we payed 60 rand/pp and 40 rand for the car.

name: Richtersveld - De Hoop Campsite
description:
Beautiful site directly at Oranje River with mountain view. Well maintained ablutions. Sandy terrain with some leafy trees.
ZAR 290 (2 adults, one car).

name: Kwa Nokeng Lodge
description: Great place to spend the night, or a few if need be, before crossing the border. WiFi okay at the lapa. Donkeys will visit your camp. Lots of birds and even a rock monitor. Saw a Croc on the sandbar by the river. Oh yes, they have a cat with a face like Groucho Marc’s. Ablutions clean with nice large shower stalls. We didn’t eat at the restaurant, but smelt good. Prices have gone up. We paid 250pula for 2. Included a 35pula tax.

name: Camp Mamgnwele
description: The campsite is being renovated, there are new power cables going to the site, a new fence and gate with low thatched roof - don't worry they have a section of fence that can be opened to let in taller vehicles if you have 4x4.  There is a large grass area and several single camp sites in the trees.  The ablutions are in the process of being done up but there is hot and cold running water.  What makes this location great is the stream coming down through the gorge behind the camp ground.  There are about 10 pools you can swim in and slide down the waterfalls between them, great fun and the Baboons seemed to be amused watching us playing in the water.

name: Camp Africa
description: Nice campsite near the top of the hill with great views.

name: Satvik Campsite
description: Small campsite next to lake. Expensive, run down.

name: Lake View Campsite
description:
Nice camping area next to lake
Expensive campsite. Every camp has it's own braai. Ablution good. Campsite is good, but still we did not like it very much. Price was 240 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car including electricity.

name: Devoetpadkloof Resort
description: Nice campsite with chalets too.  Quite a lot of game from the farm walks through the campsite, Duikers, Kudu, Zebra etc. Conveniently located between JoBurg and the attractions northeast.  Swimming pool too.

name: Moreson Ranch Rest Camp
description: Nice camping sites with great views over the plains of Wildebeest and fenced in Lions (a lot of!).  You can play with the lion cubs too but not really our thing.  Camping R350 per night.

name: Mahai Camp Site @ Royal Natal
description:
Nice spot good starting point for hikes. We did Tiger Falls 3h, and Thugela gorge 7h. ablution clean, sites grassy some with shade. 130Rppn for sites without power. 

082 459 0279 Conservation Manager (all hours),     036 438 6310 Visitor's Centre (office hours)

name: Kwa Rie Caravan Park
description: Nice campsite with small lake and ducks. Green Grass and some Bungalows. Swimming Pool (a bit dirty), very good Ablutions, hot Shower, free Electricity, free Wifi near the Reception. 180ZAR pppn. Closed on Saturday. There is a second gate for high vehicles.

name: Country Park Campsite and Vehicle storage
description: Lovely place and staff. Pool, lot of space, kitchen. We liked this place and the price is absolutely correct. 170R/Motorhome + 25R/Person

name: Sukuza Camp
description: Kruger NP, Skukuza. Largest camp in the park. Not the nicest but has all the facilities. Free wifi in the restaurant as well. Price was 204 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car including electricity. (wildcard discount)

name: Satara Camp
description:
Kruger NP, Satara camp. Big campsite. Try to get a spot near the fence. Braai wood in the camp store. No wifi. Camp is located in the area where you may find big cats. 
Mugg & Beans + Debonairs Pizza restaurants, pool, 278R for two (17,50€)

name: Isinkwe Backpackers
description: Hluhluwe-Umfolozi National Park – we’d heard that accommodation was overpriced in the park, so we stayed outside the park at Isinkwe backpackers, Bushlands. (R850 for private en-suite, including dinner and breakfast)

name: De-Hoop Campsite
description: De-Hoop Nature Reserve – world heritage listed site, wildlife lovers paradise. Not to be missed! Camping by the Vlei, with good facilities, internet available at reception, mobile 3G internet also at campsite. 375Rd for Campsite, and 40Rdpp entryfee (once)

name: Upington - Sakkie se Arkie
description: PRICE JANUARY 2022: R150 ppn. Great spot on the banks of the River Orange. Swimming pool, braai, electricity. The owner Theo, used to run tours through Namibia, so has lots of great tips!

name: Molopo Kalahari Lodge
description: ‘posh camping’ in front of the lodge, with individual private shower and toilet. 50km from the Namibian border at Rietfontein.Pricey though, 300R

name: Sani Pass - Sani Lodge Backpackers
description: Good location to start the drive up to the Sani Pass. Basic camping in the grounds, but has toilets and hot showers (R165)

name: Chapman's Peak Caravan Park
description: Wonderful Campsite with lots of animals. its like a day on a farm. Owner are very friendly. Ablution is fine. You can use washing machine for only 15 Rand. The next Shop is to far to walk. It was very funny to stay there, because of the several animals. I would check in here again.

name: Zandvlei Caravan Park
description:
Large grass terrain, mountain view.
Basic but clean and convenient near the main road to downtown Cape Town. Cheapest place to camp near Cape Town. Attracts many black South African tourists. Safe place. 148 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car including electricity.

name: Ebb & Flow Restcamp
description:
•  All vehicle access
•  2 Rest camps with hot water communal ablution facilities
•  Fresh water in camp
•  Some of the sites are equipped with 220V power points (for caravan plugs only)
•  Three-point plugs can be used with an adapter
•  Coin-operated washing machines and tumble dryers are available
•  Braais at campstie
 Nice spots near the river. Good walking trails and canoeing here. 
 Price was 172 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car without electricity (wildcard discount )

name: Hardekraaltje
description: Noisy camping squeezed between 3 major roads and near railway. Places themselves are OK.

name: De Hollandsche Molen
description:
Grassy terrain, nothing special. Expensive. WiFi to be paid separately. Nearby Paarl River Resort supposed to be less expensive, Bergplaas Resort in Stellenbosch even more expensive. 

A weekend here is a party weekend with family groups from CapeTown. The ablution is perfect, but the toiletpots are of childrensize, so you sit with your knees beside your head. And with the showers it’s HOT or COLD. During the week it’s a good campground.

name: Patensie - Geelkrans
description: Beautiful site at the river facing cliff wall.

name: Orleans Caravan Park
description: Grassy, bit messy terrain.

name: Cederberg Conservation Area
description: Beautiful site in the middle of the park between high mountains. Credit card payments not during the weekend. Fee is per group of max. 6 persons and 2 cars, 270 ZAR plus entrance fee 60 ZAR pp

name: Butterworth Country Club
description: A few camping places next to the local golf court inside a rundown courtyard. Bar open between 8:00 and 18:30. Hot shower in the ladies' section only.

name: Voortrekker Park
description: Large, quiet, sandy terrain with high eucalyptus trees. Too few ablutions.

name: Queensburgh Caravan Resort
description: Lawn between permanent camping houses. Primarily for people from Durban escaping the city. At small river.

name: Futululu Caravan Park
description: Beautiful park-like environment with spacious places and high trees. The place looked abandoned in the evening. Just before we left we got the manager on the phone. .

name: Hluhluwe Backpacker
description: Small, open campsite just outside park. 6 double rooms; putting up your tent is limited but ideal positioned to enter the parc as early as possible as it is just 1,5 km from the memorial gate

name: Lakeside Recreation Resort
description: Large grassy sites at lake.

name: Pamona Caravan Park
description: Grass terrain with a number of poorly maintained caravans. Close to airport and major roads; convenient but noisy.

name: Krugersdorp Game Reserve
description: Well equipped open field on game reserve. Price includes reserve access. Excellent option close to Johannesburg.

name: Fountain Valley
description: Well maintained site between Nature Reserve and highway. A bit noisy.

name: Sha-Henné s
description: Messy terrain behind lodge with building materials and trucks.

name: Manyane Caravan Park
description:
Well maintained sites with trees. Large flat campsites with a range of electrified-tented, non-electrified tented, caravan, etc. Multiple ablution blocks of varying sizes. Swimming pool + kids pool. Small shop with basic amenities. Self-guided walking trails in the EEZ (see photos for map - speak to reception). Guided safari tours into  Pilanesberg 3x daily at extra cost. 

***Midweek special running at 40% off camping fees until March 2022 (50% of park fees from day 2)

name: Pretoriuskop
description: Small sites next to cottages. No visibility of park, only at the spots near the fence. Restaurant, swimming pool, laundromat, ablution blocks and shop present

name: Bontle Camping (Marakele National Park)
description: Wide terrain with shady trees and view over field with wildlife.

name: Maroela
description: Spacious field at entry of park. No park view from campsite.

name: Polokwane Game Reserve, Caravan & Camping Ground
description: Spacious field next to Nature Reserve.. Not just a field but a set up camping and caravan site

name: Waterberg Wilderness
description: Beautiful campsite in quiet spot 17 km from the main road (R101). Stands are under trees and have additional shelter. Braai, fireplace (including wood) and tap for each stand. Good ablutions. Completely self-catering.

name: Red Sands Country Lodge
description: Some stands have private ablutions, but the shared ones are just fine. Bar and restaurant are great staff are great. It’s a great spot.

name: Twee Rivieren
description: Main camp in KTP. All facilities, including restaurant.  Cost:ZAR100

name: Nossob
description: Main camp in KTP. Shop, fuel, pool.  Cost:ZAR 250/ 2people + car

name: Mata-Mata Restcamp (Kgalagadi NP)
description:
Main camp in KTP. Shop, fuel, pool, hide.
Good campsite in South African way (spots close to each other). Some partial shade provided by trees, swimming pool, spotless facilities, loads of birds, squirrels and meerkats in the campsite. Caravan electric plugs at each spot but no regular South African plug. No Vodacom signal at all. You can see the bush from almost every camping spot. The road to get here (+-50km) is quite corrugated (noisy and bumpy!) which totally ruins your safari experience (Same thing around Nossob) ! Paid 380R for 2 people per night through SANParks website.

name: Le Must River Residence
description: Lovely B&B

name: Lamberts Bay Caravan Park
description: Very old buildings, all weather beaten. R190 for a stnd with private ablution, which was in a state of neglect, or R170 for shared ablutions, which didn't look too bad. i don't see the point of having a caravan park right next to the beach but surrounded by six foot tall chicken wire fence and no beach access.

name: Yzerfontein Caravan Park
description: Great shade trees, clean facilities and on beach, electricity and braai stands at sites, just keep in mind that the area is not fenced off, 165R pp

name: Berg River Resort
description:
•  150 Partially grassed stands for caravans and tents
•  Most campsites have 15amp electrical outlets
•  Communal ablution facilities
•  Communal kitchen
•  Every campsite has their own braai
•  Bring own braai grid
•  Camping is first come, first serve - except for Easter Weekend & 
   December holidays
140 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car without electricity

name: Wild Oats Farmer's Market
description: Open Saturdays 8am til 12 noon, slightly longer hours in summer. Lots of food, flowers, fruit and veg. All local. ATM at nearby gas station. Neighboring markets have more souvenirs, art and crafts.

name: Oribi Nature Reserve
description: small campsite in the nature reserve. 100 rand per person, including the entry to the np. ok abolution and nice green campsite, seems well maintained. office hour is 8 till 16.00. if you are late, just go there and pay next day. we were the only one on Easter holiday, no idea why. n2 is close but not too noisy and the farmers on the other side do some noise cannons against the moneys but stop at about 17.00. the hiking trails are worth it and next to the campsite but just outside the np there is a small lake with a pier, where the white locals came to jump in and have a swim, so seems to be save

name: Buccaneers Backpackers And Campground
description: Large area not too far from wild beach. Camping area is separate from the backpackers.  Lots of facilities. Camping 125rand per adult.

name: Makana Resort
description: Camping area in grounds of small hotel close to the centre of Grahamstown.  Each site has its own private shower, toilet, kitchen area and Brai site. We paid 195 rand for 2 adults and 2 children.

name: Mountain Zebra National Park
description:
Nice campground in lovely National Park.  Good facilities including a cheap coin operated washer and dryer. Also has a kitchen area with instant hot water, fridge, deep freeze, hot plates and a microwave. Nice hot showers and even bath tubs if you prefer! Campsites are pretty close together, all have a portable braai, electric (standard SA 3 prong 220 plugs). No picnic tables or chairs. Most sites have at least some shade, but it would pay to get here a bit early during holiday season to get a good spot. 

Shop at reception has basics, ice, snacks, drinks and an espresso machine! There is also a nice looking restaurant and a swimming pool for the warmer months. It does occassionally snow here July-Sept, this park is higher elevation than many others, so bring warm weather gear. 

Best 4g signal from MTN (25 MB/s). Decent 3g signal from vodacom. Big rigs may have to watch for the occassional low branch, but otherwise shouldn't have trouble. No bicycles, no motorcycles allowed, please dont feed the lions. 

As of May 2019 - campsites are R300, plus daily entrance fees. See sanparks website for most up to date prices.

name: Graaff-Reinet - Nqweba Campsite, Camdeboo National Park
description:
Larger gravel campsites with camp tables and braai. There is a small camp kitchen with freezer, two burner electric stove and hot water dishes area. 

Easy site has power and a light. It is not a quiet campsite because of the highway noise. 

Electric fencing around the compound to keep animals out, main gate closes at 10pm at night

Good cell service

name: Karoo NP Campsite
description: Typical SAN parks campsite. Nice area to park and good clean facilities.  Quiet when we were there.  260 rand for 2 adults and 2 children.

name: Milnerton Flea Market
description: Open Saturday and Sunday. Good quality second hand junk. Tools, household stuff, etc. Good deals.

name: Timberlake Village
description: Nice collection of small shops. Good coffee, great wine store, restaurant and other stores. Free WiFi at cafe. Great place for a lunch or coffee break. Watch out for the sneaky monkeys. Open 7 days a week.

name: Lake View Inn
description: R750 per double room sharing including breakfast

name: Colesberg - Onze Rust
description:
Small caravan site on pebbles between chalets close to town.
Electricity, water and braais at each site. Excellent ablutions.
Pet friendly.

name: Doringkloof - Doringkloof
description: Large grassy campground at small lake. Canoes, MTB trails and 4x4 trails offered. Well maintained ablutions.

name: Nieu Bethesda - The Owls House Backpackers
description:
Small campground in the backyard of guesthouse. Access to all facilities of guesthouse. Well maintained. Reception at Karoo Lamb Restaurant. 
Phone=+27 49 8411 642, +27772 742 7113 
Email=accomodation@nieu-bethesda.com 
fee= ZAR 160 (2 adults, camper)

name: Burgersdorp - J.L. de Bruin Dam Recreational Facility
description: Grassy, no trees at lake. Not adequately fenced, not guarded at night. Poorly maintained. Fee ZAR 150 (2 adults, camper)

name: Kamberg - Glengarry
description: Large spots Spots 8-12 have great view over lake to mountains. Ablutions well maintained. Fee= ZAR 200 (2 adults, camper)

name: St. Lucia - Sugarloaf Camp
description: Large campsite with mix of fields and secluded places. Close to but not at beach.

name: Sodwana Bay - Sodwana Bay Camp Site
description:
Very large campsite. Spacious secluded places in sandy environment under trees. Not at the beach, but beach accessible with 5 minute car drive (maybe by walk via the lodge...). Maintenance is ok. no swimming pool, no wifi but a small store at the entrance. 95 ZAR ppn without electricity, 100 with, + you need to pay the park entrance fee to access the campsite.
Website=www.iSimangaliso.com 
Phone=+27 35 590 1633 
Email=info@iSimangaliso.com 
Fee= ZAR 140 (2 adults, camper, no electricity)

name: Piet Retief - Sundowners Caravan Park
description:
Small camping area next to resort. Simple but clean facilities. Close to busy road. Tiny swimming pool. Cages with birds and children's farm next to restaurant. 
Phone=+27 71 612 5094

name: Kruger N.P. - Tsendze Rustic Campsite
description:
Large shady pitches, quiet place.
www.sanparks.org 
+27 13 735 6536 
reservations@sanparks.org

name: Kruger N.P. - Shingwedzi
description:
Large, well maintained camp.
www.sanparks.org 
+27 13 735 6536 
reservations@sanparks.org

name: Panorama Rest Camp
description:
Well maintained site with great view over the gorge, good ablution and good and free wifi in the restaurant. Has a great (infinity) pool with awesome view. 
+27 13 1091767, ruskamp@lantic.net 
ZAR 210 (2 adults, camper).

name: Pretoria - Rietvlei
description: Next to lake, basic facilities, noise of nearby roads, good view, flst, no trees.

name: Kruger N.P. - Crocodile Bridge
description:
Small crowded campground next to the gate of the park. Well maintained ablutions. 
www.sanparks.org
+27 13 735 6012
reservations@sanparks.org
Fee= ZAR 252.50 (2 adults, camper)

name: Pretoria - Nkwe Caravan Site
description:
Campground at river between cottages behind double fences. Well maintained ablutions. You have to call a number to get in. Closing time 5 pm.
Opening hours=8:00-17:00
fee= ZAR 240 (2 adults, camper)

name: Johannesburg - Bobo Campers
description:
ADMIN  NOTE: user wearethree reported on 22 October 2018: on bobo Camper i did park my defender.after 6 weeks window was broken and a Lot Things was stolen. terrible 
---
Campground only for customers of  Bobo Campers (RV rental or vehicle storage). Site for 2 campers.
Fee= ZAR 120 (2 adults, camper)

name: Ashtonvale Guest Farm
description: Multiple sleeper rooms. Very old style rooms. Running hot water but in trickles. Rooms have lights but NO power points.

name: Piet Retief - H.C.H.
description: Fills LPG bottles while you wait.

name: Pretoria -
description: Fills LPG bottles; can't remember the exact name of the store.

name: Mazhou campsite, Mapungubwe NP
description: National Park campsite set in riverine forest with usual facilities.  Cost 300 rand for 2 adults and 2 children.

name: Letaba, Kruger NP
description: Large SAN parks campground with all the facilities in the centre of the park.

name: Berg-en-Dal
description: SAN Parks campsite with all the facilities: shop, restaurant, laundromat, swimming pool, electricity, ablutions.

name: Cape Vidal
description: Camping at an established campground in the National Park close to the beach.  All normal amenities.  The campsite has a minimum charge of 480 rand per site. R1008 in high season per campsite. Call them for potential discount rates.

name: Ezemvelo Nature Reserve
description:
R100 per person per night to camp.
Pensioners discount offered
Lots of shade and power

name: Battlefields Country Lodge
description: Big country resort with small lawned camping area.  Can use all the lodge facilities including swimming pool.  100 rand per person.

name: Glen Reenen Campsite
description: SANP campsite in Golden Gate National Park with all the usual facilities.

name: Midmar Dam
description: Mumford Bay camping in a recreation area on the side of a reservoir.  Not that attractive really but a convenient spot if you need somewhere to stay.  240 rand for 2 adults.

name: Richtersveld - Richtersberg Campsite
description:
Beautiful site directly at Oranje River bend with mountain view. Well maintained ablutions. Sandy terrain with some leafy trees.
ZAR 197 (2 adults, camper).

name: Richtersveld - Potjiespram Campsite
description:
Site is at Oranje River, but individual pitches are not. Lots of leafy trees. Well maintained ablutions. Sandy terrain. This campsite has the advantage of being close to the park entrance, but the other two riverside camps are more beautiful.
ZAR 197 (2 adults, camper)

name: Kalahari Trails Bush Camp, Meerkat Sanctuary
description:
Sandy terrain with some trees between sand dunes. Four fenced pitches with braai and pinnacle. Inside nature reserve, 35 km from park entrance.
NAD 180 (2 adults, camper). Nice guided walk. Drinking water from separate container.
Extremely basic (seen better days/at the beginning of a long revamp phase) campsite adjacent to a Meerkat Sanctuary. The camping site (150m away from the main building/chalets) comprises a sizeable red sand area containing 4 individual reed-walled enclosures big enough for up to 3 4x4 campers at a push, with shade roofed 'car port' and braai. Located 35km from Tweerivieren Camp and the Kalagadi it is an ideal stopping place. Chalets are also available as are game drives. R80 pppn

name: Caledonspoort Border Post
description: Border Lesotho to South Africa. Caledonspoort border post.

name: Cape Agulhas
description: Cape Agulhas, Africa's most southern tip. Giant map/sculpture of Africa on the floor.

name: Bainskloof Drive
description: Start and/or end of the Bainskloof drive

name: Bains Pass
description: Absolutely beautiful scenery with plenty of picnic sites as you drive up the pass.

name: Lamberts Bay Bird Island Nature Reserve
description:
50R p.p. , free for SANParks Wildcard holders.
You can park in the harbour in front of Isabella's

name: Bo-Kaap colourful houses
description: Bo-Kaap colourful houses

name: Bontebok NP Entrance
description: Bontebok NP entrance

name: Boulders Beach Penguin Colony
description: Boulders Beach Pinguin colony. Rand 153,- pp entrance fee. Plenty of penguins to see without entering the park!

name: Bloukrans Bungy Jump Bridge
description: Worlds highest permanent Bungy Bridge, 216 Meters. You should phone before Arrival or book online 1-2 Days in Advance in order to get a Reservation. But you can also jump spontaneously if there are not too much People. Jumping is 950 ZAR per Person. You can also walk to the Jumping Point as a Non-Jumper on a small Bridge under the Main Bridge, it's a little Adventure itself and costs 150 ZAR per Person. They take Videos and Photos of you while jumping, you can buy them for 400 ZAR (Video only 300 ZAR, Pics only 200 ZAR). Equipment was top but they didn't have the Bungy Ropes with built in Sling (Backup) that is Standard nowadays in Europe. However they operate this busy Jump since 1997 without any Accident and we had a good Feeling! They were very professional and it was an awesome Experience. It's also way cheaper then anywhere else outside Africa.

name: Caravanpark Kleinmond
description: Quiet and nice surroundings. Each spot has a braai. 143 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car.

name: Municipal Camp
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 11/20

Basic but good enough. Ablution was clean. Cheapest campsite we had in South Africa. 110 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car.

name: Lake Campsite
description: Bontebok NP, campsite near the lake (no electricity here). These spots are nicer than the ones with electricity. Price was 220 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car. (wildcard discount)

name: Camp Warmwaterberg
description: On route 62, Camp Warmwaterberg spa. Nice views of the Karoo. Swimming pool with warm water from the hot spring. Free wifi. Price was 160 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car without electricity. Don't forget to visit Ronnie's Sex Shop near the turn off to Warmwaterberg Spa. They offer a real mean burger and cold beer.

name: Kleinplaas Campsite
description: Big campsite in the village. Good ablution, swimming pool and free wifi at the reception. Price was 250 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car including electricity.

name: Nature Valley NP Campsite
description: Nature Valley NP, camping. Also rent out small huts. Good place and nice canoeing here. Watch out for the monkeys. Nearby Nature's valley village has basic supplies and shops. Price for campsite as of Feb 2016 is R205 for the site (more than 2 people are extra). Plus park entry which is currently R40 for SA residents, R80 for all others. Prices change by the season and increase each year. See the SanParks website for prices and availability.

name: Brakkeduine 4x4 Camp
description: Campsite on a dirt road to St. Francis Bay. Has it's own lake for fishing and offers a challenging circuit for 4x4 drving (min. 3 cars and booking in advance). Price was 150 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car. Ablution very basic.

name: Jeffreys Bay Caravan Park
description:
Update: fenced all around, checkpoints and guards. 
Place is often very windy. Most famous surf spot in South Africa. Price was R461 for 2 nights for 2 persons and car & caravan incl electricity.

name: B&B of Jon and Yvonne
description: Camped in the garden of a local B&B of Jon and Yvonne. Very nice people. If you ever go here tell them you found them on our website.

name: The Nest B&B and Campground
description: Place also offers a few campsites. Because place is near the road there is a lot of noise from passing trucks. Convenient located on the way to Lesotho. Ablution is clean, free Electricity and Wifi. 100 ZAR pppn.

name: Leokop Campsite
description: Chelmsford NP, Leokop campsite. Camped surrounded by zebra. NP was deserted and not very well maintained. Ablution was old and not very good. Price was 160 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car (no electricity) , 2021 40% covid special discount

name: Lower Sabie Camp
description: Kruger NP, Lower Sabie camp. Small campsite in a wildlife rich part of the park. Camp has the nicest restaurant in the park (great view over the river with hippo's). Most favorite camp in the park and mostly fully booked. You must book in advance. Price was 214 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car (wildcard discount)

name: Potjiespram Campsite
description: Richtersveld NP, Potjiespram campsite. Small campsite in the park at the banks of the Orange River. Place has a remote feel and ablution is basic. Watch out for the monkeys here. Near the Sendelingsdrift ferry. Price was 197 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car (no electricity and wildcard discount)

name: Rondeberg Resort
description: Good spot with a great view over the lake where you can go fishing. Most sites have their own private kitchen, ablution and carport. Free wifi at the bar. Place is mainly visited by local South Africans. Price for the luxury site with private ablution was 200 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car including electricity.

name: Xamarin Camp
description: Campsite is nothing special but a good option when you want to escape the chilly Atlantic for in Lambert Bay. This place lies just outside the misty coastal zone and is mostly sunny. Place is quiet but ablution is poor. Asking price was high, so you must bargain here. Price was 200 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car

name: Tietiesbaai Beach Campsite
description: Quite campsite just outside Paternoster. Great place with clean ablution but no other facilities. Watch the weather because it can be very windy here. When it is calm is it a very nice place to camp right at the sea. Price was 232 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car no electricity.

name: Imhof Caravan Park
description: Nice campsite. Reasonably priced in low season but expensive in high season. Located near the beach in a very nice neighbourhood. Ablution is very clean. Price was 180 Rand per night for 2 persons and a car including electricity.

name: Constantia Guesthouse
description: Cosy reasonably priced questhouse with two bedrooms in the nice Constantia wine area. Space for two cars inside the gate. Can be booked through Airbnb.

name: Chimp Eden Jane Goodall Institute
description: Sanctuary for rescued chimpanzees. The money you spend here is very welcome and the stories behind te rescued chimps touching.

name: Clarens
description: Nice little village with good restaurants and shops

name: Home Affairs Office
description: For information on visa etc.

name: Tele Bridge Border Post
description:
Border between South Africa and Lesotho. Easy and Hassle free.

Leaving South Africa: Stamped Passports. TIP (Temporary Import Paper) was not even touched and can be used entering SA again.

Entering Lesotho: Stamped Passports (no Visa or anything required; EU Citizens). No TIP or Carnet de Passage needed. Payed Road Tax (60 ZAR for Cars heavier then 2,000 KG). That's it. All together it took 10 Minutes.

name: Blue Route Mall
description: Clean busy mall with a good selection of shops. Underground and surface parking.

name: Nanaga Farm Store
description: Great farm shop with fresh baked bread and other delicious stuff

name: Muisbosskerm Restaurant
description: Open air restaurant. For us one of the highlights of the west coast. All food is freshly prepared before your eyes. Only open a few times a week so check before you go. But if you can go here, do not miss it.

name: Mar e Sol
description: Tiny restaurant in a small west coast village. One of the best grilled hakes we ate was here.

name: Container Depot
description: Cape Town, Container depot for vehicles.

name: Kleinbaai
description: Kleinbaai, best place for shark trips.

name: Mahamba Border Post
description:
Border between South Africa and Swaziland.

Daily 07.00 AM to 10.00 PM

name: Swartberg Pass
description: Great drive between Prince Albert and Oudtshoorn

name: Table Mountain Cable Car
description: Table Mountain cable car and parking area.

name: TMNP Office (Wildcard)
description: TMNP Office - Here you can purchase your wildcard.

name: Toyota Dealer
description: Nelspruit, Toyota dealer

name: Toyota Dealer
description: Cape Town, Toyota dealer, Tokai road

name: Meringpoort Waterfall
description: Swimming under the waterfall here is allowed. Very nice but icy cold water.

name: God's Window viewpoint
description:
Located on the edge of the escarpment to the Blyde River Canyon below.  Impressive panoramic lookouts into the valleys.
Adults now ZAR20, children 6 to 12 ZAR15 and RSA Pensioners ZAR15. Besides God's Window, there is a nice 1 km walk to and from the rain forest with associated views. Well worth it! Toilets at end of parking lot. Open daily 07:00 to 17:00.

name: Zvakanaka Exclusive Camping
description: Beautiful idyllic place in the mountains, individual braai, water, gas cooker, fireplace (firewood included) and shelter. Tidy, nice ablutions and good facilities including washing machine, fridge. Small pool. Ranked under the 50 best campsites in SA and definitely under our top 10, very hospitable hosts, signposted walks around camp, R150pppn -  Note: you don't have network coverage at the gate where you have to call for opening, but 10 (!) meters back you have again full coverage. There is also full 3G internet coverage in the camp.

name: Madi A Thavha Mountain Farm Lodge
description:
Camping on grass (unfortunately not a single flat spot) next to ****lodge, braai, firewood provided, but no water at campsites, nice facilities. Pool. Art gallery, art shop and a lot of art works in the garden and lodge. 110 ZAR pppn. 
2 camp spots available and the dutch owners welcome overlanders!

name: Blouberg NR/ Modumele Wilderness Camp
description: Secluded private campsite, waterless pit toilet, bucket shower, water and firewood ( if available!) provided by the office. 300 ZAR for 1-2 persons pn,  entrance fee 20 pp + 30 per car for the stay. Mobile E- network.

name: Blouberg NR/ Molope Camp
description: Nice Campsite, each stand under a big tree, fireplace, braai, 400 ZAR for 2 adults and 2 kids pn,  entrance fee R160 for the stay.

name: Iveco Italian Commercial
description: Big garage and dealer, competent and friendly personnel

name: Sandveld Resort, Bloemhof Dam
description: Nice campsite at Bloemhof Dam. Dedicated stands with braai, shady trees, but you can also choose any spot  the beach.  100 ZAR / car with 2 person.

name: Lake Grappa (rooms & camping)
description: A surprise in the desert. Very pretty and manicured place, looks all very new! There are individual bungalows and campsites all around the lake. We didn't stay here but asked the price for camping: R 200 pp. WiFi R20 for 1 hour.

name: Kambro Accomodation & Farm Stall
description: 6 nice caravan stands with braai between self-catering chalets. They also offer B&B. Traffic noise.

name: Pofadder
description: Quiet spot on the site of the road.

name: Bamboes Bay wildcamp between Doringbaai and Strandfontein
description: Free spot. Bit smelly because of the seaweed. Accompanied by other campers. Enough space!

name: Steenbokfontein Art Studio
description: On the R27, Gerrit Burger is an artist and has a wonderful property close to the beach. Worth a visit!

name: Bottom of Canyon/Botterkloof Pass
description: Big even spot next to gravel road, not a murmur, but baboons' barking, at the bottom of the canyon, beautiful views.

name: Camp Clanwilliam
description: Practical camp at the Clanwilliam Dam, day visitor area, lots of flinders at the beach, 3G mobile internet. 190 ZAR for up to 6 persons with electricity, 150 ZAR w/o electricity.

name: Piekenierskloof
description: Beautiful spot, shade and a great view. Didn't see any person in 48 hours

name: Hardeveld Lodge
description:
R150 pppd. For Camping. Very friendly People. Overlander bicycle people use to stop here. Clean Pool and Ablutions. Indoor lounge with fireplace and tv. 

If you ask Fey she may also provides a WiFi Router for you.

name: Grootkloof Campsite
description: Nice little campsite on gras with great views, partially with big trees (15, stand 14 has also a little cave behind!), small trees are planted , spot to swim in dammed up creek, 50m up the creek it's even nicer, wonderful walk around local mountain (approx. 5h), 150 ZAR for up to 6 people- not overcrowded even during holidays. Obviously preferred by people who like it remote and quiet.

name: Rooiduin Farm
description: Beautiful rustic camp directly at the beach, in a private nature reserve. No facilities except pit toilets. We paid 200 ZAR for 2 persons pn. You have to pick up the key for the gate in Lambert's Bay, contact jan@sanveldsafari.co.za

name: Vensterklip
description: Nice campground next to bird sanctuary, 11 stands with individual facilities, 5 with shared ablutions. Electricity & lights on sites. Pub & restaurant on site.

name: Isabella's
description: Recommended by different locals. Kingklip, prawns and service were excellent. Let space for the Malva pudding!

name: Van Puttens Vlei
description: Beautiful camp between rocks, trees and little ponds, on grass, washing machine,very friendly hosts, open-air restaurant Boisduifklip in walking distance. 125 ZAR pppn.

name: McDougalls Caravan & Campsite
description: R200 a night camping (2 pers + vehicle) + R20 deposit for the ablutions keys.  An utterly dismal place right on the sea front 5km outside Port Nolloth.  Ablutions are dire!  6 stalls, no locks on doors, 2 with no toilet seats (gents - similar condition in ladies).  No toilet paper and no roll holder so clearly no intention of providing any.  Cold water only.  No showers.  Camp plots are sand with a braai, tap and electrical point.  Laundry room (sinks and drying line) open to elements.

name: River Lodge Backpackers
description: backpackers with camping in backyard. very clean ablutions.   kitchen with all you need avilable. 135 rand pp. train station oposite. ticket into town 7,50 rand pp one way. uber taxi about 100 rand

name: Onrus Caravan Park
description: Nice campsites directly at seafront. Lots of trees. 300 ZAR for 1 stand w/o electricity. Mobile 3G internet.

name: Struisbaai Karavan Park
description: Directly at sea, no shade, 200 ZAR for up to 6 persons pn, endless white beach at  warm Indic Ocean for wonderful walks.

name: Strandskloof caravan park
description: very nice place, European standard, heated pool, grassy pitches, ablutions absolutely amazing, laundry 15 rand, pitch per night 270 rand. Small kiosk on site. There are no dogs allowed

name: l' agulhas caravanpark
description:
campsite next to the beach but no sand, public "natural" pool with ocean water, grassy pitches, no shade, facilites ok

Price for up to 4 people : Winter 124 Rand, summer 155, December and Easter holidays 215.

name: The Station
description: Camp site on an old railway station in Calitzdorp.Very quirky with rooms in old ticket office , set up tents, backpackers and camping areas with electric & water. Showers, toilets very clean. Big Rigs can be accomadated . Great railway trolleys to ride on !. The manager/owner is very friendly and welcoming The cost is R95 pp

name: Oaksrest Vineyards Guest Farm
description:
