Oaksrest Vineyards Guest farm campsite is located in the beautiful Dwarsriver Valley at the foot of the majestic Swartberg Mountain, just a stone’s throw away from Ladismith on theR62. Only 3.5hours from Cape Town, 2hours from George and 1hour from Oudtshoorn where the historic towns of Calitzdorp and Barrydale are both about 60km km away and the scenic winelands and orchards of the Klein Karoo are easily accessible from here. 
Our campsites is quite literally between the vineyards and on the banks of our Pinotage Lake area offering you thick lawned stands with shaded areas, next to the dam. Individual stands have electrical hook-ups, fresh water and braai facilities. Ample Braai wood provided at R35.00 per big bag. 
A 5 Star ablution facility provides showers and toilets with Washing machine, Tumble dryer, fridge freezer and Microwave oven and Free Wi Fi as well.
 So if you enjoy waking up to the sounds of the prolific bird life, breathing in fresh country air, enjoying long walks on farm and mountain bike trails, lush gardens, fishing, canoeing and swimming in the dam with a built in wooden deck with inflatable tubes then this is a perfect setting for you. Be amazed at the stars in the clear night sky and remember the majestic call of the Fish Eagle for a long time to come. 
Rates are R150.00 pppn Adults
R100.00 pppn Kids 4-12
Kids 0-4 Stay for Free

name: point caravan park
description: next to the beach, not too windy, facilities good, pitches in first row 210 rand, second row 160 rand. Underneath the light house.

name: Middelcamp Witsand
description: windy, grassy place, facilites are dirty, next to the beach, no sand there, 180 rand for 2 people

name: Storms River Mouth Rest Camp
description: Nice campsite in the Tsitsikamma NP, directly situated at Indian Ocean, spectacular views. Swimming pool, hiking trails, kayaking. All the usual amenities plus a restaurant and shop. No wifi. intermittent Vodacom cell service. Reservations required around school holidays. Availability is shown on the sanparks website. 370 ZAR for a tent site. Park entry feed based on nationality. 45 ZAR pp for SA residents. 180 ZAR for international. Prices change every season. See website for details. Nearby Narture's Valley camp is half the price, but also half as spectacular.

name: Harkerville Forest Lodge
description: R50 p.p.p.n well looked after. Great and clean ablutions. Well maintained

name: WaterShed
description: Funky work area at waterfront above 'craft' market.  Excellent Internet and office facilities.

name: The Willows Resort
description: Nice campsite beautifully situated at the ocean and less than 10 km from PE, 350 ZAR per stand pn. Nice ablutions, laundry. They also offer nice rondavels.

name: Medolino Caravan Park
description: Beautiful park-like city campsite with pond and lots of birds, on grass, stands separated by hedges and trees, newly renovated and tidy ablutions. 280 ZAR for 2 persons pn in low season, 450 ZAR in high season. You pay per site plus per person. Kids under 2 for free. Fast 3G mobile .

name: Gonubie Caravan Park
description: Situated at nice lagoon, narrow stands next to each other, not separated, most stands on gravel, only few on grass, 269 ZAR for a stand pn.

name: White Clay Guesthouse & Camping
description: 4 stands, terraced on grass, on cliffs with spectacular views over the Wild Coast, we even saw dolphins. No shade. Last 200 m very steep, 4x4. Ablutions not really clean. Access to own beach. 220 ZAR per stand pn.

name: Mt. Currie Nature Reserve
description: Beautiful campsite close to nature. Wonderful views of the mountains, terraced on grass, shady trees. Absolutely quiet. Walks to surrounding mountains. Zebras, blesboks, lots of birds around. 80 ZAR pppn, limited highth under the tree branches (limits big rigs).

name: Garden Castle Nature Reserve
description: Beautifully situated campsite in KZN Maluti Drakensberg NR, wonderful views of the mountains, well maintained on grass, big trees, wonderful hiking trails, mobile 3G internet, 75 ZAR pppn

name: Lotheni Camping
description: Beautifully situated campsite in KZN Maluti Drakensberg NR, wonderful views of the mountains, well maintained, terraced on grass, few trees, lots of hiking trails (we stayed 5 days, Emadundwini is our favorite), slow mobile internet, 80 ZAR pppn

name: Cobham Campsite
description: Beautifully situated campsite in KZN Maluti Drakensberg Park, great views of the mountains, on grass, big trees, lots of  hiking trails, 75 ZAR pppn , no telefon signal at all.

name: Tshipise A Forever Resort
description: Large campground with everything you need. Clean ablution,washing facilities,2 swimming pools hot and cold and a reumatic pool. Wifi at the restaurant, shop and butchery. Paid R145,- pp

name: Mariepskop View / Blyde River Canyon Backpackers
description: Campesite next to the roasd near the drakensbergen. They have dorms,lodge,campground. Paid R100 pp for camping. The roas is a bit noisy and there's not much water coming out the shower at this moment.

name: Blyde River Camp
description: Campsite at the river, the acces road is quit rocky. The campsite is a bit dirty and the ablosution block is dirty but works. Price is R129'- for campsite + R20,- pp

name: Sabie River Camp
description: Big campsite with fixed tents, ablutions are very neat, one heated and one cold pool, braai stands, electricity, free wifi at reception, easy walk into town,  R125 pppn

name: Wacky Woods
description: Beautiful campsite & cottages, with amazing 3-level imitation rock pool. Sites are spacious, R150 pp. electricity is extra R50 per day. Ablutions are good and the water is hot, but plenty of spider rags.

name: Porcupine Rest Camp
description: Joy and Francois run this great rest camp. There are three campsites which are all under shady trees and each one has a private shower, toilet and braai site. Basic campgear for hire if necessary. Great bar with pool table and fire place to hang out. R200 rand per person from 1 Sep 2021. Www.porcupinerestcamp.co.za

name: Clan William
description: small bungalows  get setting by river.

name: Kowethu Guesthouse
description: We stayed on the parking lot and payed only 30 rand for the night. You can also rent one of the lovely rooms (2 people) for 360 rand. Totally worth it!

name: Berg Rivier
description: Camping and a few chalets on a private reserve, beautiful views, lots of wild life, peaceful and quiet. Wifi at the main house does not reach most chalets or campground. Vodacom cell signal intermittent. Entry road is rough gravel, passable but rough by two wheel drive or low clearance. Covered cooking areas in campground and has a firepit and loads of wood. We paid R500 for a chalet per night.

name: Ukholo Lodge and camping
description:
Groovy small guest house with clean rooms. Intimate camp site and ablutions. Owner run established. Benjamin is a really cool host and can grill up damn nice steaks. Right on the N7 highway between Namibia and South Africa. Animal friendly. 
0229213988 or 0722099029 Benjamin Thomson. Www.ukholo-lodge.co.za

name: Bagdad Cafe and informal camping.
description: Owen is the owner of this really cool roadside restaurant. It's not always open but basic camping is available.

name: Tarantula self catering accommodation
description: Stunning place in small town Calvinia. The nicest new cabins with Wi-Fi, TV, good quality beds. Place to grill some meat and a beautiful view over the Karoo. Owners Franse and Hendrina knows how to make people feel welcome! 👍0836437277 or 0836437177 www.taranrulaguesthouse.co.za frans@tarantulaguesthouse.co.za

name: Kroon Lodge
description: Great host, very friendly and helpful. Bathrooms- amazing! Clean, spacious and with carpets on the floor! Camping spots quite small but very well organised: braai area, lamps, roof which gives shadow and little sink with running water. Great place!

name: Monks Cowl
description: Nice but hilly campsite and it is difficult to level your  motorhome. Day walks and hikes start from the camping. 220 ZAR for 2 persons and a rig, without electricity, but including KZN Park fee.

name: Thaba Nkwe Bushveld Inn
description: Nice campsite in Thabazimbi. Well located between Botswana border and Rustenburg/Pilanesburg/Sun City. Hot showers and clean ablutions. Bar and restaurant available.

name: Hodge Podge Lodge
description:
Campsite about 10km south of Rustenburg. Friendly owners. Let us use ablutions in cottage as it was freezing cold.
150 Rand for camping pppn

name: Piet Retief, Waterside Lodge
description: Small campsite behind the Lodge. 5 sites at the pool. 150 ZAR for a site with electricity. Nice restaurant with wifi. On walking distance to the shops.

name: Amphitheatre Backpackers Lodge/Campsite
description: Backpackers with private rooms, dorms and campsites. There's a big garden, restaurant, bar, lounge area, swimming pool, sauna. Communal kitchens and braai area's as well. Great views. Nice place to stop on the way to /coming from the coast. Double with en suite bathroom R 480 pn. Camping 115R pppn.

name: Piet Retief
description:
Totallygas can fill propane bottles from 5 kg till 12 kg.
www.totallygas.com.za

name: Die Vishuis
description: opens 10am - serves breakfast as well.  lovely spot on water front.  popular with locals.

name: Ansteys Backpackers, Bluff, Durban
description: Backpackers at the Bluff beach. Camping is possible if you have a small tent, but not for cars. Dorm room R 150 pp. Double R 200 pp, with shared bathrooms. Communal kitchen, dining and tv area. Free (limited) Wi-Fi. Downtown Durban is easy accessible with city bus. Lovely staff. Parking in front of hostel.

name: MARTINZKRAAL LODGE AND CAMP
description: We only have used the lodge. we paid 350 rand pp. Nice bungalow. There is a campsite.

name: Boma In The Bush
description:
Well kept green caravan site about 10km north of Polokwane. Easy drive to the Mall of the North for all your shopping needs. Pitches have large shades and electricity (caravan plugs but they have adapters) and they will bring you a braai to the site, firewood for sale, ablutions very good with toilet paper, soap, towel, large communal area with flat screen TV, bar and restaurant, pool, outside seating. Laundry service for 20R per kg. You can hear the highway but it's not too bad. The three resident Jack Russels will entertain you. 170R (11€) for a site for 2 people 
You can also rent a small but very neat self catering chalet with kitchen. ensuite bathroom and DSTV for 500R (33€).

name: Pietersburg Gas
description: Owner Derrick is very nice guy and able and willing to fill any gas bottle using any fitting.

name: 4x4 Megaworld Polokwane
description: Camping and 4x4 equipment near Polokwane

name: Tredici
description: A Deli of note.  well worth a stop for lunch or to stock up on the very naughty but nice cakes etc.  price range medium.

name: Princes Lodge
description: Lovely b&b with swimming pool & good wifi.

name: Kosi Bay Casitas
description: Basic campsite just outside Kosi Bay Reserve. Lovely hosts, there's a pool, bar and restaurant. Mix of grass and sandy terrain with nice trees. They also have chalets/rooms. Each site has braai, power and light. Water is dotted around the place. Ablutions ok, very clean! R 110 pp/pn. The Kosi Lake is approx. 2 km. away which makes a great afternoon walk. They offer different boat trips and you can rent snorkelling gear. The Kosi Mouth area is about 15 km. away.

name: Limpopo Toyota
description: Large and modern Toyota service center. They could not help us much with our old car but directed us to the right person. Very professional and you can probably expect a quick service on newer Toyota models.

name: Bloemfontein, Levey Street (Easigas)
description: Can full up different types of propane bottles.

name: Salt Rock Caravan Park
description: Not ideal for overlanders, more of a caravan park and that's about it, no atmosphere and expensive, too many residents on site at any given time. The sites facing the waterfront/beach are nice and the pool in the ocean rocks is very nice.

name: Forest Hill
description: Hidden behind a clinic on a grass field... Nothing special but looked safe, it's free and quiet during the night. Internet at the library and 100m from there.

name: Mica Hardware
description: 165 Rand/9kg

name: Harold Johnson NP
description: Quiet with zebras and impalas, wc and cold shower. Normal price is 85/A and 45/kids + 25/A and 10/kids for entrance fees or with KNZ wildlife pass. We actually paid 150 for 2A and 3kids all included.

name: Volksrust
description: Big Gravel place next to the golf club. We asked few people and they said that place is safe. Ok for an overnight. No services

name: Malmesbury Karavaanpark
description: Nice green campsite located just outside of town. Each pitch has grass and is separated by trees. Water and electricity on each site. Hot shower and clean ablution. There is even a swimming pool. 160 Rand for two people (120 for 1 person)

name: Lighthouse Farm Lodge
description:
Camp site in the fenced grassy Garden of a backpacker within the quiet Eco-village. The place hosts a mix of backpackers and long-term guests. There is a shared kitchen and lounge area with TV. Outside electric plug, fast internet. The train station is conveniently located outside of the Eco-village with a direct train line to Cape Town Central Station within 17 minutes (10 rand per journey). Camping is 60 Rand per person.

Tel 021 447 9165 / 082 744 2504
bookings@lighthousefarm.co.za
www.lighthousefarm.co.za

name: Palmiet Caravan Park
description:
Nice green municipal campsite with direct access to Overstrand beach. There are 3 different pitch categories, some with see view, others more secluded, separated by dense bush and tree. Price per pitch up to 4 people in low season 165/180/210 Rand depending the location you choose. (high season 1.12 to 31.01 + Easter is 270/305/380). Electricity is an extra 38 Rand.

Now, in 2021 mainseason, it's 580 Rand al includet at a good view plot.

Tel 0282718400 
gveden@overstrand.gov.za
www.overstrand.gov.za

name: Gansbaai Karavan Park
description: Grassy municipal campsite right by the ocean but also just next to the industrial harbour. It is the closest campsite to Kleinbaai if you are here for shark cage diving. Price is 230 Rand (Beginning of January) per pitch up to 4 people. Electricity and water at pitch.

name: Oom Benna's
description:
Cosy holiday house with a separated living room / bathroom for campers. It also has a pool and a nice fire place for the windy days. It's the perfect spot for a stop over for the way from/to the North. 
100R pp/night 

If you don't speak Africans: the sign says that the reception is on the farm 1.8km further down the track.

name: Moonsong Backpackers
description: This place is located outside of town in the nice country side, a few kilometers away from the entrance to the Robberg peninsula for a beautiful hike. This backpacker has a nice large grassy garden ideal for camping. The place is super quiet. Price per person 110 rand.

name: Cederberg Oasis
description: Grass campsites among orange trees, some shaded. Water, electricity, hot showers, toilets, pub, backpackers, can get busy & noisy at night. R150 pn for 2 people camping. Sites too small for big rigs. Internet, pool.

name: Balule Camp
description: Very small camp for Kruger NP standards, about 15-20 stands only, book at one of the other camps or gates, checkin at Olifantsrus, no electricity but good ablutions with hot showers and paraffin lamps and kitchen area, taps and braai stands, game not as dense in the area but nevertheless our favourite Kruger camp due to being so small and quiet.

name: Wegraakbosch Organic Farm
description: Organic farm which produces handmade cheese from Swiss cattle, very charming and we stocked up a fair bit, access over dirt road but should be fine for most vehicles. honey, jam, baobab oil also. closed on weekends : go to farmstall in haenertsburg on R71.

name: Zwakala Brewery
description: Small craft brewery in chilly mountain location, has been opened since 2016 and you can get a tasting of the lager, weiß and naked ale and stock up (150R for a sixpack), access over dirt road where a bit higher clearance can't harm. Craft beer of the year winner 2021

name: The Red Plate
description:
Very nice little café with a welcome fireplace, you can get well priced mountain trout here which was delicious as well as many other treats including good coffee of course

Now called The Red Plate. Next to the Eatery on Rissik St. There's also the Iron Crown and Caffe Villa further down the same road. Opening times are a bit erratic over holiday periods for all of them.

name: Sabie Brewing Company
description: Established craft brewery with 8 different beers, tasting platter costs 70R and you can buy bottled beer at 19-22R for 440ml (~1,30€), they also serve food, a local cherry cider and a good South African whiskey from the barrel and the service was very attentive

name: Bush Camp Mountain Forest
description: Nice and very quiet spot in the forest, turn into track just right of the geological viewpoint and you will soon come to a clearing, other suitable bush camping spots in the area as well and very little traffic on this beautiful mountain road

name: eMshopi Campsite - Mkhuze Game Reserve
description: Larger campsite at entry to park with electricity, taps, braai areas, good ablutions, pool which was out of order due to drought, park itself is very different with its freshly renovated hides to gameview from instead of driving around all day and we enjoyed this peaceful approach a lot, 240R (15€) for two + 152R (9,50€) conservation fee for two (wildcard not accepted)

name: Bushbaby Lodge and Campsite
description: Very nice Dutch owned and run place close to Hluhluwe Game Reserve with two small camping areas with lights, braai stand, electricity, kitchen, good ablutions, bar, pool, pleasant green garden, small dam with many animals coming to drink, as the name might suggest many bushbabys at night and good opportunities to observe them, vervet monkeys during the day but not such a pest as in other places, wifi at 50R (3€) for 24 hours wheelbarrow of firewood for 30R (2€), 120R pp (7,50€)

name: Leeuwenboschfontein
description: Nice campsite on old Karoo farm with excellent facilities. 4x4 trail to mountain top lookout. Good condition gravel access roads to site.

name: Backpackers Lodge
description: Double en suite room for 200 rand. Rooms basic but clean. Could camp in car park or lawn. Secure parking.

name: Middleton Manor
description: Cozy little campsite, nice grass and trees with peacocks walking around. There are also some vervet monkeys, but kept at a distance by the dog. You can hear the road and the train. Electricity at site, water at the ablutions block. Toilets and showers are tired but serviceable. There is a bar, swimming pool, tennis court and children playground. Part of a rehabilitation program. Price 80 Rand per site + 30 per person. Extra charge for caravans.

name: McDonalds Guest Farm
description:
I can't really recommend this place but if you have to stick around town for the night, you won't have many option s. The place looks more like a scrap yard with old caravans used as rooms. There is also a building where local workers are staying and a bar with pool table. There is electricity at sight and water in the ablution. Price 85 Rand for the site (2 people, one car).

If you have more time to look for a place, we have been told that there might be a camping facility at the Bonkolo dam just outside of town (northwest on the R392) and also the Roydon Lodge a bit further away (20-30 min. drive following Komani street going south).

name: Werner Jacobs
description: Good mechanic for all kind of cars but specialised on LR Defender and Series.

name: Klipwerf
description: Small place at busy main road, bit expensive but with private ablutions, price 150 rand per person

name: Kam Bati River Resort
description:
•  Camping areas offers individual campsties of 90m2 each
•  All vehicle access
•  Braai drums are available, but it's best to bring your own braai in case they're all being used
•  Central ablution blocks with hot-water showers
•  Food prep/sculler area in camp
•  Fresh water at campsites
•  Select plug points
•  Daily servicing of bins and braai area

name: Mountain View
description: Large camping with good ablutions, shade, brai stands, drinking water, free wifi.

name: Landyworx / Overlandworx
description: Very good and reliable Landrover garage, people friendly and helpful - phone number  011 781 0020

name: Back To Kumi Service Station
description: On a gravel pit, nothing amazing but good, safe and quiet for an overnight.

name: Protea Karridene caravan park
description:
Nice big grassy campsite with clean ablution(shower and bathtubs), water and electricity at site, washing machine and tumble drier (10 Rand per load), swimming pool, mini-golf, trampolin, children's playground, direct access to the beach, Wi-Fi at the hotel reception. Price 75 Rand pppn.

This is the cheapest and best value for money in the area.

Tel : 031 916 7228

name: Mozambique Embassy
description:
Single entry (1 month) Visa for Mozambique is 600 Rand for Swiss, Dutch and German passport. Bring your passport, the money, a passportcopy and 1 picture between 8am and noon. One day to process.

They were super efficient and agreed to do it the same day as they would be closed for public holidays the following 2 days.

Tel: +27 31 303 71 30

name: Sodwana Bay national park
description: Entrance fee 40 Rand per person + 50 Rand for the car, valid for your entire stay. If sleeping inside the national park you will have to pay an extra 6 Rand per person per night.

name: DG - GAS Appliances
description:
Filled our german Gasbottle there 5kg 123R
---
Fittings for German gas cylinders available.
---
Tel: 031 303 1069
gasappliances@telkomsa.net

name: Bourke's Luck Potholes
description:
Very nice views of the narrow gorge where the Blyde and Treur rivers converges and forms naturally carved out sculpted rocks. Curio shops, restaurant, information centre, interpretation centre and museum.
Adults now ZAR65, children 6 to 12 ZAR25 and RSA Pensioners ZAR25. Open daily 07:00 to 17:00.

name: Kruger View Backpackers
description:
We camped on the parking of the backpacker. Ablution ok, power plug in the parking area, shared kitchen, free wi-fi. Price 120 Rand pppn. This is a convenient stop between Krüger NP and the Mozambique border.

(There is also a Karavan Park in town, but is more expensive: 200 rand per site + 50 per person)

name: Klaserie karavan park
description:
Beautiful location on a peninsula over the damed lake within a reserve (no extra fee if going to he campsite). Clean ablution, electricity at site, braai facility. Price 120 Rand per person. It is about 50 kilometers from the Kruger NP Open gate.
Tel: 015 793 2833

name: Barn 62
description: Just off the R62

name: Calitzdorp Statie
description: Campsite on the premiss od the former railway station

name: Oppi Dam
description: R220 per night for 2 persons and truck, electricity, personal shower, toilet, braai included

name: Sensayuma Backpackers
description: Highly recommend this place! Very cool backpackers on a hill right above the beach, spectacular views over the ocean and Tugela river mouth. Super friendly owners, excellent meals, comfortable dorm beds, 2 pools and a jacuzzi in the deck overlooking the ocean. Would stay here again.

name: Thistle backpackers
description: Pub with a hotel/hostel above. 180r for a dorm room. Comfortable beds, not much atmosphere. Is a decent place to stay if you're passing  through. Breakfast is around 7 and isn't open for long so be up early if you want to eat here. Gated parking with security out the back

name: Martin's Place
description: Great mechanic working on all kind of vehicles but especially older models. Don't be put off by the scrapyard look. Martin and his wife have been very kind and he reconditioned and replaced our transmission at a fraction of the price Toyota was asking working through the weekend. It's kind of in the middle of nowhere so best to give them a quick ring before showing up. 0152957117

name: Aird Country House
description: Nice place in the beautiful countryside of the Midlands. You can pitch up on the large lawn in front of the country house and their are two powerpoints. Ablutions simple but clean and hot water. Very friendly owners. 50R pp (3,30€) and 25R if you want electricity.

name: Highmoor Nature Reserve Campsite
description: Very small and quiet place in the lower foothills of the Drakensbergs. There are two easy but nice hikes to caves and the pitches have braai stands and a nice view. Some of the access road is gravel and decent clearance recommended to get to the campsite but nothing exceptional. Good first stop and warmup for the Drakensbergs. 170 Rand for two people

name: Injisuthi Campsite
description: Beautiful place at the end of a valley with fantastic views and many great hiking trails. Pitches have braai stands and are located between two rivers. Trout fishing possible in season. Small shop at reception. The access road is gravel and potholed tarmac but very scenic. Our favourite camp in the Drakensbergs. 90R (6€) pp

name: Mdumbi Backpackers
description: Great low key backpackers away from it all working closely with the community. Attracts a different kind of people and you can have great conversations or just relax. Beautiful bay, river and beach, small pitches with electricity, wooden lookout tower for whale and dolphin watching (saw both), communal area, free wifi, great dogs who might accompany you on a beach walk, meals available, no bar but shebeen nearby, several activities on offer and good massages (100R for 45 minutes). Some locals around trying to make a buck by selling everything from ... oysters to crayfish and fire wood. All in all our favourite stop at the Wild Coast. 115R pp

name: Sugarloaf Backpackers
description: Small spot in courtyard of backpackers. There are better options for camping (White Clay looked best) but we had terrible wheather and enjoyed the backpackers facilities including a bar, restaurant, pool table, table tennis, kitchen, wifi (1R/mb), simple ablutions, sofas and hammocks. Very friendly staff and much quieter than other backpackers. We could get electricity for the car but an extension cord was neccessary. 100R pp (6,50€)

name: The Pont
description: Nice green campsite at the river run by friendly elderly lady. Several power points in the area and simple ablutions with hot showers. Short drive into town and to the beach. Cheapest campsite in the area at 80R pp (5,20€). Now 110 pp.

name: Link's Country Inn
description: Great restaurant with a beautiful view over Port Alfred. The apricot honey glazed Eisbein was outstanding and the service more than adequate. They also serve seafood, curries and more.

name: Orange Elephant Backpackers
description:
They do not have camping anymore!!!

Backpackers very close to Addo NP entrance gate run by friendly owner. Small area to set up camp, simple ablutions, bar and restaurant with free wifi separate from backpackers so no noise from there, kitchen with free coffee and tea, they arrange game drives into the park. Good for a stopover before or after entering the park. 60R pp (4€)

name: Profcon Resort
description: Centrally located resort and good base for Graaff-Reinet. Good ablutions, pitches have braai stand, shade and electricity. There is a huge playground for children and a pool as well as wifi. Small kitchen but no stove just a microwave. 150R per site/for two (10€)

name: Woodbourne Caravan Park
description:
Nice little caravan park a bit outside Knysna with braai stands and electricity at pitches and good ablutions. Laundry service available. Prices depend on the season. We paid 100R pp (6,50€) in shoulder season. 

Private site on George Rex Drive 1 km from Knysna Heads. This can be walked easily along the road .grassy sites with shade of trees. Some larger sites for Trucks. A couple of ablution blocks, hot water & wash up area. Each site has electric & braai. Medium sized salt water swimmingpool . 6 km from town. Price R 250 per site. The East Heads cafe is well worth lunch & has a view of the Heads.

name: Augrabies Falls NP
description:
October 2020 restaurant and shop closed due to covid
Great stop in SA as we have always wanted to come here. Hot water. Great views, pool. You also need to pay park entry per day. R40 pppd for South Africans/ 192 Int. travelers. Shop at reception sells wood, meat and most basics, but no vegetables or fruit. You can drive your vehicle to the cabins or campsite. Watch for baboons.  They have a small fuel station on site. WiFi is R20 per hour. Camping is R250/p. site

name: Island Vibe Backpackers and Campground
description:
Chilled place with everything you can expect from an established backpackers. Views over the bay and small separate double rooms and dorms. Open ended bar and a place where all the young surfers stay. Surf school and tours available.
Camping in the Car Park (closed Gate) 100 ZAR pppn.

name: Jagerskraal Guest Farm
description: Farm cottages for rent. Simple cabins fully equipped with kitchen utensils, etc. Each cabin is slightly different, read website for details. There is decent wifi, hot showers and nice hiking and 4x4 trails. Approximately 15 km to matjiesfontein.

name: Elandsberg Rest Camp
description: Located in the Tankwa national park. 5 cottages overlooking the surrounding desert. 5 more being built scheduled for 2017. Roughly r1200 per night for two people excluding park entry fees. You must book in advance on sanparks website. Cottages are well done. Big room, comfortable, well equipped. Hot showers and a solar fridge but NO electric or internet. Enjoy the quiet.

name: Lavumisa - Golela border post
description:
Open from 7am to 10pm.
Brand new border post, friendly and efficient staff, quick and easy procedure.

name: Bluff Eco Park
description:
Nice camping just outside of town in a quiet suburb. The campsite is very green with grass and trees. Electricity and water at site, spotless ablution with hot showers. There is a swimming pool, a travel agency, a coffee shop with wi-fi. It is walking distance to a mall. They also have very nice and affordable cabins. Price for camping in low season is 85 Rand per person. (cabin for two people 315 rand)

They charge a fee for the car between 30 and 100 rand, it's not obvious how much they will charge when. It's not showed as parking fee on the bill, just the fee per person is higher. 

http://bluffecopark.co.za/rates

name: Kiaat Campsite
description:
Beautiful campsite near Hazyview just outside Kruger NP. Nice leafy lawns. Swimmingpool. Immaculate ablutions. Communal kitchen with fridge/freezer and even washing machine and dryer. Free firewood 200/240 ZAR for 2 persons and car.

Follow all the signs to the Sanbonani resort: Kiaat is next to it.

Cell number 0836035664.

name: Middlefontein Guest Farm
description: Small guest farm just outside Sutherland. Reception is at the Kamboo Kind hotel in town. A few cottage options each with different amenities, see website for details. Cost is approx r900 per night for 2 people. Very quiet and clean. Equipped with basics. Our cottage (saffran) did not have electricity but did have hot water and a basic kitchen. Recommended if visiting nearby salt observatory. Also nice hiking trails on the farm to explore flowers and old ruins.

name: Khotso  Horse Trails and Overland campsite
description: Well established horse ranch, backpackers and campsite. Lovely, friendly owners Steve and Lulu will make you feel very welcome. Overlanders themselves, they have just completed a full renovation/ upgrade of the campsite to make it more "overland vehicle" friendly. Newly built ablution blocks with two hot/ cold showers, communal kitchen area with simple gas hob and fridge/ freezer for campers to use. Spacious camping area with nicely positioned level plots spread down a gentle slope, under trees so lots of shade and looking out across the mountains and adjacent to a stream.   Big rigs may struggle to get onto campsite but there are plenty of other spaces to park under the trees, alongside the site itself. Khotso has over a hundred horses and specialises in a variety of horse trails. Lots of nice walks around farm and slightly further afield, some great hiking in the Drakensberg mountains ( e.g. Garden Castle and Cobham KZN reserves). Typical, friendly backpacker style atmosphere with good, hearty breakfast and dinner available if required. Very easy place to stay for more than just a few days. We paid 120ZAR ppn including electricity and wifi. We were visiting Sept 2016.

name: Wayne's 4x4
description:
Good mechanic, expensive but knows his stuff! 
0126530309
0825542075

name: Warmbaths accommodation
description: Fairly touristy campsite/resort. 290 rand for two people. You can only check in at 3pm (check out is 11am). Pools and spa are included in the price. Facilities are great.

name: Diesel & Creme Karoo Moon Motel
description: Diner reataurant on the R62 in Barrydale that occasionslly lets overlanders stay the night. The owner Arthur and the staff are very friendly and offered us to stay when we stopped for a drink.

name: 52 On Main
description: We wanted to stay in center of Knysna and we couldn't enter Moonk's with our big rig. Gordon and Janey offered a spot on their drive way in front of hostel

name: Buffalo Bay Campsite
description:
Right on the shore with a 3 km unspoilt beach next to the Campsite. Paid R200 for 2 persons and a truck

Grassy open site with views of the sea on 2 sides.no shade or trees. Can get extremely windy. Ablutions very good, with wash up area, water taps . Great hot water shower.nice walk along the beach. Popular surfing area.expensive at R380 p night for 2 people.

name: Tube & Axe
description: Backpackers hostel where you can park. R210 to park a 7.5t truck on the drive way and make use of the hostels facilities

name: Homestead B&B
description:
A lush haven! Ablution & kitchen a bit outdated, but the surroundings and the hosts more than overcompensatie that. 

Small campsite in a very nice garden with lodge facilities on the premises so you can use the breakfast and bar facilities if wanted. On a farm close to Addo town so barbed wire and fences make it a bit less appealing. Very close to Addo Elephant Park main gate. R150 for campsite for 2 people.

name: Trennery's
description: Usage of hotel facilities (bar, restaurant, swimming pool), 10 slots available. Direct access to beach & lagoon. R90 pppn. High season: 860 per stand.

name: La Maison Guesthouse
description: R800 for 2p bedroom in decent and amical guesthouse

name: Kamberg valley store B&B & Campsite
description: B&B is already ready; Campsite beginning 2017. Pub& petrol facilities

name: Glensheiling Caravan Park
description: Campsite with shared, clean ablutions. Dam with fishing and canoe options. Pont, games room. Pet friendly.

name: Albert Falls Nature Reserve
description: Fabulous place, very large open and spacious site overlooking large reservoir, grass pitches all with water and power. Lots of well maintained ablutions. When we visited we had place to ourselves but it looks like it could get busy with Durban families at weekends or holidays. Campsite is open to the reserve and you are free to drive, bike, walk anywhere and of course animals free to come onto site.  Animals we saw : Nyasaland, Bonteboks,other antelopes ! Zebras, ostrich, wildebeest, giraffes, and even 3 rhinos. Really good place, we paid 120 pppn.

name: Mablingwe caravan park
description:
Set in the private game park of Mablingwe. Other options of accommodation here also further into the park! See website. You don't need to book but best to for other types. 
Large sites, quite open. 
Two swimming pools and a bar/shop. Facilities nice and clean. 
270 rand for two including self drive game park entrance.

name: KZN Iveco
description: Really knowledgable and quick and affordable service ; even though our Iveco 80.14 was never sold here

name: The Cheese Shop
description: Situated in the farming hamlet of Tonteldoos, 21 kilometers north west of Dullstroom.  The Cheese Shop offers superb cheese platters, cheese, teas and coffee, ice cold beers and wine, and of course Cheesecake.

name: Dolphin Holiday resort
description: Nice and big camping site, 100m from the beach in the middle of apartments and houses. The waypoint was not precise.  Secluded pitches mostly under big trees.  Ablutions are very clean. 220v power at each pitch. We paid R210 for 2 p.  Mozambik restaurant across the main entrance. Wonder why there are no more comments on  iOverlander.  This is a nice place to stay. We planned to stay only one night but we will be here longer.

name: Nelspruit Botanical Gardens
description: Worth a visit if in the area, 30 rand per person. Great walks, next to a river, trough a 'rain forest' and medical gardens. Nice restaurant.

name: Westlands engineering & projects
description: Quick and knowledgable workshop to get repairs or modifications done on your car. We had new steel brackets made to hold diesel tank

name: Richards Bay Caravan and campsite
description: Stayed oct 2016, paid 240 for a site. Big site but nicely laid out with quite private and spacious pitches. On the beach clifftop but no direct views. Remember to get a key at the reception to allow yourself exit and entry for the beach gate! Deposit for the key is 200,-

name: Shemula Lodge
description: Nice Lodge with campsite, 19 km before the entrance gate to the Tembe Elephants NP. Campsite 70 Rand p. P.

name: Thembe Nature Reserve
description: Big 5 NR where only 10 4wd per day are allowed in. So arrive early! Entry is R90 per car.

name: Kosi Bay NR Campsite
description: 15 plots on shore of lake. Plot 1-5 with lake view. Ablution block cleaned everyday.

name: Jessica the Hippo Accommodation
description:
House on the site where Jessica the Hippo lives. 250 rand per person per night and the house can take up to 8 people. Book in advance. 
House is large and spacious, basic facilities. Beside the Blyde River. 
Joubert@jessicahippo.com

name: Jessica the Hippo
description: Meet Jessica the tame Hippo. You can feed and touch her. It's pretty incredible. 75 per person.

name: Gariep Dam Nature Reserve
description: Very nice campingspot (150 zar without and 250 zar with electricity). The campsite has a beautiful view over the Gariep Lake. Very good facilities.

name: Die Mas
description: Nice spot with a lot of shadow on the riverside. 100/site plus 60/p.p. And they have really good own wine. Wine testing 40/p. But we went just for the bottles. Couple of them, so please excuse the English.

name: Travel vaccination clinic
description:
Level 11 Picbel arcade. Netcare travel clinic.
Can get Malaria medication and travel vaccinations here.

name: Ndumo KZN Reserve
description: Very nice open campsite with all usual facilities including very good kitchen. Nice pool. Limited cellular coverage. Price includes the park entry. Park offers game drives and walks. Lots of birds and game, no elephant, lion, cheetah. Very nice and relaxing spot, well worth a few nights visit. Game drives / walks cost 150 per person. Self drives around park but lots of low trees so maybe tricky for big trucks. We visited Nov 2016

name: Shemula Lodge
description: Small campground, shady and ok facilities. 17km to TEMBE elephant park and 25km to NDUMO Reserve. Simple but convenient site. 80 per person. Nov. 2016

name: Tembe Elephant Park
description: Very quiet park. Only 4x4 vehicles allowed in (unless staying at Lodge), only 10 vehicles per day. We visited twice, first day 2 other vehicles, second day just us entered in whole day. Great Sandy but narrow and forested trails to drive around. Not a huge amount of game but if you find the elephants they are amazing. We really liked the place, very 'exclusive' feel and just 95 for 2 people and a vehicle.

name: Copacopa Lodge and Camping
description: Camping sites in the garden of lodge and conference center, well maintained, friendly staff. Good option before entering Krueger NP. Big trucks take the small gate right next to the main gate! Still 150 R per place and night

name: Coffee bay camping
description: Camping allows roof tents - some don't - large site. Not very well kept and facilities are basic - bring toilet roll! For the price 120 per person + 30 per vehicle for electricity I don't think it is great value. Very near the beach! Lots of mossies!

name: Kgalagadi Lodge
description: Good alternative if you don`t want to stay in the park, it is just 5km from the entrance. Each campsite has an own ablution block and a sun shade. Not all of the sites are perfect for a ground tent. Everything nice and clean, reception well organised and friendly. Well stocked shop with a own bakery. WiFi only at the reception and pool area and not that good.

name: R&D OFFROAD
description: R&D Offroad services both the local and international market with 4x4 accessory fitment. Our focus remains on selling top quality products and services.

name: The pine lodge
description:
behind the dunes but close to the beach. stands with grass, braai and electricity. Close to each other, some with little shade. Clean ablutions. Good condition. wifi free but not working
348Rd per stand. near PE.
252 off season
clean, nice.... BUT, monkeys all over..... they come in motorhome with people inside and take food......resort management is even protecting they as it is monkey area.........best of all, what ever monkeys damage, no refund policy by management if you leave early.

name: Reptile Africa/the Health Cafe
description: Didn't go to the reptile centre, but the Health Cafe is a great stop off! Nice food and cake! Some shops around also!

name: Sable Dam sleepover hide
description:
There are two hides in the Kruger park which overlook different waterholes/lagoons  ('dams') and it is possible to exclusively reserve these for a single nights stay.
Check in at the Phalaborwa gate where you collect the key and your bedding and mozzy net bag. Beds fold down out of the wall.
Very atmospheric place to sleep and worth the extra cost for a night.
We saw lots of birds and some elephants the night we stayed, we also experienced an incredible thunderstorm with a real 360' view from the viewing portals of the hide - amazing.
Costs almost double of the normal campgrounds in Kruger, we paid 675 for the night (two people).
No facilities on site except long drop toilet.

name: Kruger NP - Malelane
description:
Rustic bushcamp, lots of grassy pitches, quiet place and away from the crowds at Berg-en-Dal (where we had to checkin)
nice camp though it is on the very edge of kruger and so looks out across the river to farms and some distant industry.
we liked the place though.

name: Karma Backpackers
description:
This is a small and cozy backpackers run by a lovely and very helpful host, Vera Ann.
Her main business is homemade jam which can be sampled, as much as you like, for free.

There's a kitchen with all the pots and pans you need. You get one 100 MB WiFi voucher, next ones are 10 Rand.
Breakfast is 50 Rand.

Located in a township. 

90 Rand camping, 180 Rand dorm.

name: 4 wheel drive overland
description: accessories, service and repairs to all overlanding vehicles

name: Hippo Waterfront
description: nice shady campground with private abolution, very quiet area 295 per site for max 6 people

name: Seebries Caravan Park Langebaan
description:
Basic campsite with clean absolutions. Not too much shadow and just a few wind protected stands. Each stand has a braai place and electricity.
159,- per stand  (up to 4 persons)

name: Boston T Party
description:
This place is amazing! It's beautiful, near a small dam pond.
Next to the pond is the cosy pub with a fridge that always has something to offer.

The owners Rory and Sue are incredibly good hosts. They've traveled quite bit themselves and have many stories to tell! 

There's also a kitchen and Sue will cook if you request dinner.

Camping is 75 ZAR. And there are some rooms.

name: SAN Parks Corporate Office (for Wildcard)
description: South African National Parks Corporate Office. Internationals can apply here for the Wildcard pass and receive the card immediately. A card for a couple costs R 3455 and gives access to over 80 parks and reserves.

name: Produkta Trucks
description:
Well knowledgeable mechanics; specialized in Iveco, UD, Unimog. They work fast and precise! They even fixed things even mechanics could not get fixed in the Netherlands

Addres is: 25c rapid street, Riverside industrial park, Nelspruit, 1200

name: Outdoor Warehouse
description: Extensively stocked store for equipment, from little stuff to watertanks, refrigerators, etc

name: Mopani -tindlovu
description: Restaurant at Mopani Rest camp with 180 degrees view of river with frequent wild life viewings.

name: Handigas
description: Gas bottle filling station, also has the adapters for European bottles

name: Tent & Tarpaulin
description: Workshop manufactures and repairs tents, camping chairs etc!

name: Giriyondo border post
description:
We travelled from South Africa into Mozambique via Kruger and then Limpopo N Ps.
It is possible to obtain permit to transit Kruger without paying entry fee, need confirmed booking for accommodation on transit day in Mozambique.
Comfortable and easy border, easy to exit SA and entry guys for Moz are all in one office, some English spoken.
Pleasant and efficient service and no unusual checks or 'taxes'.
They processed CDP no problems knowing exactly what's required for that.
We bought our visas here at border, took some time as camera and fingerprint hardware was being awkward.
Visa cost 784 rand per pers (British), paid in Rand.
Could buy vehicle insurance here if needed (we had already got ours online for 280 rand from drivemoz ).
No 'fuel tax', 'food tax' , or even 'road tax'. 
No insurance asked for and no vehicle search.
We did have to pay Limpopo park entry of 450rand (150 each and 150 for truck), this is a steep cost and not worth paying for what park offers.
'Road' from here to park exit is very bad corrugated dirt, 90 odd kms - ouch !

name: Bali Will Will Farm Lodge
description: Lovely Francis runs a pine tree farm and welcomes people to camp on her farm or use self-catering cottage. Nice ablution, hot water and electricity. Price R200 for 2people and camper.

name: Magoesbaskloof Canopy Tour
description: Secure and impressive Canopy tour

name: Forever Resort Blyde Canyon
description: Huge campsite as part of a resort where there's  also chalets and rooms. There's a pool, a shop, a fuel station, restaurant etc. For us too big, too crowded and quite expensive, so we didn't stay. Price is R 115 pppn + R230 per site (peak season). Other seasons slightly cheaper and probably less crowded.

name: Valley View Backpackers
description: Owner Joseph let us camp on the grass next to the backpackers. Usage of backpackers facilities (kitchen, ablution, living area. R130 pppn

name: Away with the Fairies backpackers
description: Campsite more for backpackers with tents. Ablutions are a little run down. We could park the campervan underneath some trees and had a cozy spot although it was the parking lot. Fun bath with a view. Great hiking in the area.

name: Woonwapark Campsite
description: Good place for overnight near Volkrust, decent ablutions, good value 120rand for two adults and out truck, right at the Dam, quiet and secure. No sign on the main road. Follow the “Mahawane Country Resort” sign and further on is a small “Woonwa Park” sign.

name: Steenbokkie Private Nature Reserve
description:
Nice campsite with pitches on grass. 
It is a shelter for all animals they find, brought an picked up. And they ( geese, ducks, sheep, donkeys, springbok, dogs, cats, goats, turkey, peacock, horses and big belly pig and........flies!) all walk around your tent/ car. So, be careful not to stap on some s..t. The springbok is so wild, that you can tap it on his one horn ;-) before it eats your table empty. So they will sing you at sleep in the evening, call on you at night and wake you up before sunrise. 
Ablution space and ok. There is a dish washing area and a big fridge to put in your things. 
Price R200 for 2 people and car. 
There is wifi, elec. and water taps at the sites. 
Even a swimming pool, but we did not try that one. Do not make a mistake and jump in the water basin at the other side ;-) 
We liked it here. It is a quit place, friendly owner and not busy (with people).

name: Riverside Country Club & Caravan Park
description: Nice campground, clean facilities. Pool. grassy pitches. hot and clean shower. 6 dogs for the security!

name: Camp & Gas
description: Camping stuff but here we were able to get a replacement of a brass gas fitting (european)

name: Ymansdam
description: Very beautyfull, basic but scenic one spot campsite. Outdoor toilet and shower.

name: Josephsdal
description: Border Swaziland

name: Steve Tshwete Municipality Campsite / Middelburgdam
description: Between the R104 and large dam a large grassy area for both day visitors as campers (max 7 nights). Some electricity points, trees and toilet blocks scattered; only 1 block has showers. R80 for truck and 2 people per night

name: Rocky Bay Campsite
description: Large campground with stunning sea views, ablutions very clean, not cheap at 190rand pppn, but great location, shop on site for basics and restaurant next door. Power and water at all sites. Beach is quiet and good place to chill

name: Xpert Welding
description: Welding expert that can do a variety of metal work. We got a new fixture for our exhaust.

name: Sterkfontein Dam Resort
description: Campsite on peninsula. Great views on lake and escarpment. On the road to amphitheatre. R100 pppn

name: The Big Fig
description: Beautiful gardens to camp in. Ablutions ok. Nice stop before Botswana,  only about 5kms from the Groblersbrug border post. 150 pppn

name: Reyneke Caravan Park
description: Good camping for stopover. Clean ablution, power points but lack of ambiance. R400 per spot (max 4 P)

name: Vehicle storage Country Park
description:
Long term storage near JHB. Different options, very cheap!
ZAR 260/month for open air, locked in parking. Also carport parking, but often full. Contact them for details and availability.
info@country park.co.za
+27 (0)79 159 0594  or  
+27 (0)83 256 7000

name: Goxhill Trout Lodge
description: Grassy campsite. Nice view on Drakensbergen. Private clean ablutions. 100 Rd pp

name: Cremorne Campsite
description: Camp pitches along river a few KM's from Port St Johns, most have water and electric, grassed areas, braiis on each, 210 rand pppn, bar and restaurant on site. A nice place with friendly staff, quite a walk to the good and clean ablutions

name: The old Mill coffee shop
description: Lovely coffeeshop for breakfast or lunch. A little gem. R42 for pie and salad for lunch

name: Kardoesie
description: An ideal stop along the N7 between Cape Town and Namibia with a Family Restaurant as well as a shop where you could stock up on water, softdrinks as well as local produce such as Rooibos or fresh produce.

name: Springbok Hotel
description:
a Two Star graded Hotel situated in the Central part of town, with a variety of accommodation options to suit you requirements. 
The Hotel seem a bit "old" but the facility's are clean and comfortable. If you want a shower, do enquire at reception as rooms with showers are limited. 
Meals are also available from their restaurant albeit breakfast or dinner, be warned! Portions are not skimpy😉.
A great plus for me was the 220v powerpoint in the parking area for running our freezers etc.

name: Pumbas Backpackers with Camping
description: Great backpackers in Hatfield, Pretoria. Camping possible in garden in own (ZAR 100 pp) or provided tent (ZAR 250 per tent). Car with rooftop tent also possible in secure parking area in front. Double rooms are 400 per night, dorms 170 pp. Very clean ablutions, communal kitchen, DSTV, free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, pool and nice garden. Walking distance to shops, banks and restaurants. Secure off street parking. Not suitable for big rigs though.

name: Lobotes campsite
description:
Nice camping on thé beach and good price for the coast in january. 180 r for 2.
We are very happy to meet Naas the owner of the bar restaurant, à good Man.

name: black pearl winery
description: Nice and quiet place on a wine farm with beautiful views. Table mountain in the distance and amazing sunsets. Each Campsite has water, electricity and lights. There is a big Lapa next to the clean ablutions where you can Braai or make a big fire. The owner Lance is very friendly. A wine tasting is highly recommended. We loved the Mourvedre.

name: Vaalwater Lodge
description:
Camping and cottages.
Beautifully kept, best shower and toilet block we've seen!

name: Rendezvous Caravan Park
description: Nice sheltered grassed areas to camp in. With electric hook up. Shade from trees & wind. Each site has its own ablution in a block. Swimming pool. Short walk cintsa west small shop. Access to a fantastic beach and nature reserve. Beach fishing , swimming , walking & relaxing . Someone recommended this to us and it didn't disappoint . Ralf the 96 year old caretaker is lovely .

name: The Baths Natural Hot Springs
description:
25 Camping sites
3 Communal ablution blocks spaced around the campsite
Braai facilities
Power points
Heated and cold swimming pools

name: Malkoppan Guest Farm
description: Open grassy terrain amidst dunes. Right oppositie open air restaurant (off season only open saturdays). Clean spacious ablution. Electricity at spots. R290 2 people per night. Cell phone reception very bad.

name: Kleinplasie
description:
Just outside Calvinia on little sheep farm camping and B&B. Clean ablution, few trees to provide shade. Wifi. 180 degrees unobstructed view on the Karoo. 
Big Rigs can get in and the Campsite is big enough if you're alone..
price is R160 for 2 ppn

name: Dorperland Farmstall
description: The only place open for lunch in town. Great friendly owner and She does everything to make you feel at home!

name: Tkabies Camping
description:
On a working sultana grape farm, several campspots on grass. Also 2 chalets. Clean ablutions. Next to the road but still nice place to relax.

R135 pppn (Jan 2019).

name: Zone Off-road (Jeep Wrangler specialists)
description:
These guys are Jeep Wrangler aficionados and true professionals. We are thrilled that we found them! They are distributors for AEV aftermarket conversions, Cooper & BF Goodrich tires, and are expert mechanics. They can truly solve any problem on a Wrangler. (They solved a fuel problem that had been plaguing us since Bolivia!) They all own Wranglers and have taken them into Namibia, Botswana, and further north - so they are full of information. If you have a Wrangler and are starting your Overland journey in SA, they can ship replacement parts to you anywhere in Africa. 
Shane and Corné are the owners and are both really great guys. 
Address: 151 Lechwe Street, Corporate Park South, Midrand.
Website: www.zoneoffroad.co.za

name: Mqeku picnic camping site
description: Phone number to contact and book in advance 0848231083 Sibusiso Shangase

name: Keurbooms Lagoon Caravan Park
description:
Large campsite on a stunning lagoon just outside town, gets busy at weekends, 180pppn, lots of trees about for shade, ablutions nice and clean, though some ablutions are only open at peak times, though a big place it is very relaxed

R130pppn, children half price (Aug 2018)

name: Monks Holiday park
description: Campsite & other accomadation. Camping access ok for large vehicles. Site on edge of Knysna town . Can walk along edge of lagoon to waterfront in about 30 mins. Hot showers, water & braai. Traffic noise can be heard from the road . An ok stop for visiting town . R 250 per site

name: Kudu Kaya
description:
Lovely, wooded area, large spots each with braai facilities, enough space for car and rent and sitting.
80 ZAR per person
Simple showers and toilets with very hot water. On a working farm (orange orchards) close to the east entrance of baviaanskloof, where you can see antelopes, monkeys and buffalo. 4x4 only).
There's a walk through the thick woods, along a stream, up to 8 natural pools for swimming. At least 2 need to be swim across, no further access on foot.

name: Wilderness
description: On a parking lot next to the beach, in a residential area. Seems to be really safe and not too noisy even with the main road 200m away.

name: Klerksdorpdam resort
description:
Large campsite with all facilities like indoor and outdoor swimming pool. R200pppn. All is outdated but functional. Campsite has also a chapel
User reports The sanitary facilities are a disaster. All showers defective, dirty, disgusting! My parking space without electricity and light.

name: AirPort en route Travel Lodge & Guesthouse
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Owner report users having hard time locating them. Please contact Marion or David if you need assistance locating them, Phone number and address located below. GPS coordinate in iOverlander is correct. 

Campsite, Cabins , rooms and long-term vehicle storage( Up to 2,5 meter under carport above open air.)

Camping: R200 per night for 2 people. R150 for 1 person. 

Nice fully stocked kitchen and a very nice and clean ablution. Also a tv/ library room is available for guests.

Very well kept place. David and Marion have build this place over the last 15 years.

Call or email in advance, that someone can open the gate. 

email: mariondt@telkomsa.net
phone: +27845629713 or +27837735777
Address:97 Boden road , it is a bit difficult to find so it's better use the coordinates! There is no sign just drive to the gate and honk or call the nr.

No possibility to dump chemical toilets because of septic tank.

name: vleissbay campsite trail
description:
Nice campsite top of the Hill with sea view.
on the grass ,there is terrasse ,kitchen, brai.....

name: Jonkersdam Camp
description:
Beautiful campsite which provides even chalets. The lawn is nicely green and next to the small lake with plenty of ducks and gooses waking you up in the morning.
Swimmingpool and playground for the kids and a bar for their parents.

name: Bontebok Reception & Camping Is About 8 Km From Here
description: 2 camping areas . One beside river only accessible for cars & roof tents. No access for large trucks or caravans. But other area is ok for all vehicles & these sites have electricity points, water, braai & nearer to ablutions. Fairly large sites. Ablutions very good. Swimming in river Brede. Tranquil if no big families around. Hiking , mountain biking, canoes only if your own. Not far from Swellendam. R 245 with wild card .

name: Farm stall Coffee Shop
description: Nice basic farmstall with a basic restaurant, nice cappuccino, stunning views over to the mountains, you can buy local wine from Bonnievale winery

name: Jeeper reef dam
description: Nice and quiet spot not far from Kruger NP. Lot of places to bivouac

name: Cango cave parking
description: In the parking lot of cango's caves. Calm and ok for park's employees. No facilities once the caves are closed.

name: Beach parking
description: Big parking on dirt and grass. Playground, braai, toilets. Calm and looks safe. Beach just next to it.

name: Kleinmond nature reserve
description: Braai place into the nature reserve. Can hear the road but not really noisy. There is a gate but was open so we decided to go for the afternoon and overnight. Beautiful landscape around.

name: Iveco
description: In that area, many workshops for mechanic, tyres, etc... specially Iveco needed for us.

name: Waterfront parking
description:
Excellent place to stay for visiting the city... clean, safe and quiet at night. Can use the waterfront's toilet.
Rand 110 per 24h

name: Windmill Beach
description: Parking close to boulders beach... neighborhood watching were on duty so the place is safe. Quiet but windy the night we had there.

name: Vygeboom Dam
description: Nice spot beside the water. Quiet with access to the water just in front of holiday village

name: Moreson River cottages and campsites
description: A fairly new campsite, no grass, individual ablutions but in blocks, some of the sites are tough to get into with truck because of trees, electric on all sites, when we were here there was no water at all in the river and a lot of machinery had turned it into a quarry like area, not a nice outlook really, it is a working farm and can be very noisy in the morning (5.30am!), owner is very friendly and helpful, 300zar per night for 2 and vehicle

name: yellowwood forest
description:
Very nice and quiet camp site in the forest. Located 1,5 km from sea side. A lot of birds to look at.
Price out if Season: R115 per site, R15 per person
Price on season (easter + dec): R250 per site + 25 per person

name: Hlalanathi Resort
description: Very nice Place with view to the Amphitheater Camping p.P. 120 Rand

name: kidds beach
description: On the see side, looks safe and very quiet. No prohibition sign, nice view.

name: The Blue Moon - Restaurant & Hotel
description: Lovely restaurant in a hotel . Rooms look great & pancakes are Fab

name: Sterland Caravanpark
description: Great campsite , can arrange evening star gazing talks by Jurg Wagener ( owner) R100 p person. Camping also R100 pp night. Nice ablutions , very clean , electric hook up . Large sites on gravel. Easy access to SALT - those tours are R60 p person at observatory

name: Table mountain cable parking lot
description: On the parking lot of the table mountain cable... nice view for sunset.

name: Vrede parking
description: Just outside of town, behind a big factory, a large parking where you can stay overnight for free

name: Kandirri Game Farm
description: Very nice place with many animals and lions behind the fence directly next to the campground we are happy we are alone. Ablutions nice and clean with lovely hot water. Staff very friendly.

name: Casablanca Campsite
description: A bit of a strange one this, it's really the side yard to their house and you park on the rough hard standing but it is flatish, you have to use the shower and WC in the house, both of which are fine and water it hot. There is an outside wash up area. The owner is very pleasant, but at 230 rand for two people it's a bit expensive but ok for an overnight stopover

name: Kalahari Monate Lodge
description: PRICE JANUARY 2022: R180 PPN. Shade trees, swimming pool with slide, playground, picnic tables, braai, tap, communal ablutions with hot showers and flush toilets, and fast free wifi.

name: Riverdeck Backpackers
description: Nice little campsite at the river. Restaurant, Farmstal, Kanurental, all you need for a pleasant stay. 80 Rand per person. Our small Kids were for free.

name: DC-6 truck parts
description: (Second hand) Spare parts for 4x4 trucks. Especially Magirus, Unimog, Iveco, Samag, Samil. We bought Hutchinson wheels

name: Diamond T Coffee & Gift Shop
description: Great coffee , milkshakes look great too . Meals & cakes available

name: Palm Park Hotel
description:
Great hotel. 
Plenty of parking.
Has good swimming pool, gym, and also a Spa.
Rooms are very nice with nice veranda.
Two restaurants.
Fantastic.
Secure parking

name: Dinokeng Game Reserve
description: There seems to need some clarification, this campsite is one of a number within the Dinokeng Game Reserve. This review is for this specific camp ground. It is a lovely campsites with some grass and some under tree spaces. All seem to have electric points at the site. Everything thing is well run and looked after. The facilities are very clean and tended to regularly. Due to the location I suspect it can get very busy on weekends and holidays.

name: Badensfontein Campground
description: Nice campground at 200R for 2 people and a vehicule. Only 7 campsites, some cottages if you want. Really quiet with shade. Very clean ablutions and hot water. Braai with grill space covered and nice little clean pool. Beautiful scenery 5 km from Montagu. You must call the owner who lives 1km down the road to open the gate 023 614 2187.

name: Garamtata Safaris
description:
Garamtata Safaris is situated in the far north of South Africa. The lodge is approximately 150 kilometres north of Polokwane in the rain shadow of the Soutpansberg mountain range between Louis Trichardt and Musina.

Experience the breathtaking scenery, endless vistas and majestic baobab trees, with nothing but the sounds of the Mopane bushveld. Whether you are travelling for business, looking for a quiet break away with family, visiting the northern region of the Kruger National Park, interested in a hunting safari of simply passing by, Garamtata Safaris is the ideal place to satisfy your every need.

Besides the spectacular views there is a wide variety of game, birds and tree species. Amongst the numerous game species are Sable antelope, golden Oryx, black Impala and Giraffe. Bird lovers can lookout for Martial Eagle, Pale Chanting Goshawk, White Crowned Shrike and many other beautiful species. Iconic bushveld trees like the Red Bush Willow, giant Leadwood, Wild Syringa, Marula, along with the overwhelming Mopane and mysterious Baobab trees provide the essential nutrients and much needed shade during the day. Taking all of this into consideration it is a paradise for any wildlife enthusiast.

The Overlander campsite is adjacent to our safari tented camp which is nestled on the banks of a small episodic river. Access for higher vehicles is not a problem at this campsite. While staying over at this campsite you can look forward to the comforts of hot and cold running water, electricity and a swimming pool to cool down in on those hot summer days. The Overlander campsite ideal for hunters as well as outdoor enthusiasts looking for a getaway to the heart of the Mopane bushveld.

name: Ursula & Gerald Carstorage
description:
A very good place to store a car for a long time. A little bit outside the city in a quiet, green area. There are possibilities to store the car outside, under a roof or eventually even in a garage.
We store our landrover under a big roof and pay 500 Rand per month.
Phone: +27 72 255 9721

name: Utshwayelo Lodge & Camp
description: Lodge and campground located right next to the Kosi Bay Mouth KZN park entrance gate, 5 km from the Mozambique border. Utshwayelo is the name for the reed fishing kralls used by the Tsonga people, and all the camp sites here are surrounded by reed fencing. Sites are private, very big, and under the shade of large, beautiful trees. Each has a braai, water tap and electricity for 4 hours from 18:00 - 22:00 (Update: worked all day long in October 2020). Facilities include clean ablutions with hot water, a pool, an honest bar. There's a kitchen, which we used in low season in February. It may be reserved for people staying in chalets and luxury tents in high season. Permits to drive into the park are issued at reception. (4x4 required). Ken, who runs the place, is very helpful. The property is a partnership with the local Tsonga community. Cost is R190 per person.

name: Waterfront Guest House
description: An extremely nice guest house in Carolina. Very private and clean. We stayed in a suite with living room and two bedrooms. The fastest most consistent wifi since we arrived in SA. Price is R760 for 2 people w/o breakfast. R900 with. Secured enclosed parking in a garage for vehicles up to the size of a Hilux.

name: Elands Bay Hotel
description: Shady trees and lawn on a terrace overlooking the beach. Has a braai and electricity. Ablutions are spotless.

name: Woodstock banks
description:
Nice place to take a rest for few days right beside the lake. Nice fishing spot with shade and pit toilet. 
To access you need to ask permission at the farm just before the gate at the of the track

name: Wasteland
description: Down the track you will find a large area where to stay overnight. Not really nice but we've stayed there just to spend a quiet night before Port St Johns. 4wd or bike only

name: Open space
description: Nice and quiet spot where to stay overnight

name: Mabibi Beach Camp
description:
This campground is incredibly peaceful and idyllic! It's located inside the iSimangaliso Wetland Park, just 137 steps down the dunes to a gorgeous beach. There are 8 huge, private sites, surrounded by subtropical forest. Each one has a water tap, trash can, and braai/fireplace. No electricity, except in the ablutions, which are clean with hot water. Water is non-potable so you need to bring your own. Ladies at the gate sell firewood and handmade grass baskets & mats. 
To get here, you will drive 45 km on gravel and sandy roads. For more adventure, you can drive from Kosi Bay on sandy tracks through the park. The rate through Nov 2017 is R124 per adult, 50% off for kids under 12. Plus a one-time park fee of R25 per adult, R25 per vehicle and R15 per child. On weekends and holidays, minimum charge per campsite is 4 adults. 
Leatherback and loggerhead turtles nest here, and turtle viewing tours are available. The only other accommodation is the Thonga Beach Lodge next door, so there are few people on the beach in low season. 
You can go to their website for directions and/or email Natalie@isibindi.co.za to confirm availability.

name: Forever Resort - Badplaas
description:
Large family resort. Chalets, cabins, hotel, restaurant, shops, golf, 2 huge pools, ATM, etc. Not really what we look for but not much else in the area. 
330 Rand for 2 people per night (I guess you're paying for all the facilities?). Pitches are reasonable size, power, plenty of ablutions. Lovely views if you chose the ones furthest from Reception, overlooking the escarpment - otherwise, it's just a holiday park with shady camping. Fuel nearby, very basic )but helpful / friendly) mechanic in the village.

name: Caravan Park Kleinsee
description:
Some nice places with bushes and trees around. Every place has its own shower toilet and braii station. Electricity 220V.  2017: 150 Rand pps night.
Restaurant nearby. Restaurant is closed on Tuesday. 
Tiny Museum in town.

name: Nakop border
description: Easy crossing from Namibia to SA. Fruit are not allowed

name: Kalahari entrance
description: 1km before the entrance, a flat spot 50m next to the road. Free

name: UMS workshop
description:
Phone 0543322641 ask for Nicole or Daniel 

Email sales1@umspares.co.za

name: Curries Camp
description:
We were invited by Herman, a friendly man that is actually finishing his guiding studies. 
When you come here, you will have a true experience with local community. Herman will bring you around to discover this lovely place. He organized a visit to the local school. We have been to the Orange river for a wonderful swim, something you need with this heat. Then, we have been to the cafe to share a drink à talk with local people. It was, for us, a real experience in contact with real people, no fakes here, just the real life of a friendly community.

To sleep, Herman will show you free spots to put your tent, 4wd with rooftent or motorhome. If you don't have your house with you, then he will be able to provide an accommodation for 80R per night per room with double bed, or 120R with breakfast.

Herman will guide you a whole day for 350R per day per family.

Phone number : 0630593523
Email adress : hermanfloris1@gmail.com
Herman@jomecason.co.za

name: Back kowie river
description: Quiet place for overnight camping near Port Alfred

name: Lenmore Chalets & Restaurant
description:
Very nice. maybe ***, chalets not far  from Addo main gate. Nice Restaurant and Daily. View to a small dam with fishes and more.
2017. ZAR 475ppn.

name: Tree line
description: Not far from Port Elizabeth for those who want something free just for overnight. Quiet place but visible from the road

name: Lakeview Resort
description:
Large campsite, power & shade. Many pitches in waterfront amongst shady trees. Large, good ablutions. Can get busy at weekends with fishermen. 100Rand per pitch (with power) and 50Rand per person. 
Note: other location for this resort on I-Overlander is wrong.

name: Maselspoort Resort
description: Huge setup - typical Resort with 160 camping pitches, chalets, water slides, restaurant etc. Not really our sort of place but great for kids and ok for an overnight stop. Not much else in this area. 20% of pitches overlook the river and have private ablutions for each pitch (200Rand per pitch plus 50Rand per person). Other pitches have communal ablutions and are cheaper. Mobbed for 4 weeks over Xmas. We had the place to ourselves early March!

name: Super second hand Tyre
description:
Really nice team and owner in family business . Lot of choice of tyres in good condition 
Possible to balance and alignment

name: Waterhole Camping
description:
A large campground surrounded by water with a romantic weet belt. Plenty of birds. Basic ablutions. Rather steep entry but no problem for any 4x4. 
80 ZAR ppn.

name: Joalani Guesthouse & Camp
description: Farm-style facility with small camping facility on lawns of the house. Chalets also also available. Separate kitchen / ablutions / honesty bar for campers. Comfortable chairs! All very clean and well maintained. Friendly family-run facility. 250Rand per pitch. Shade & shelter. No electric hookups. Small 'dam' style pool. Some road noise, but not obtrusive.

name: Pin forest
description:
Quiet with nice pin tree parfume but small place. Not far from road but hide enough to be not disturbed. 
Good for overnight stay to go next day in Storm River Mouth.

name: Close to the main gate - Addo
description: This place is a nursery for plants of the national parc... we haven't seen anybody during our three nights there to tell us that was forbidden. And the workers in the morning are friendly. It is next to the park's fences and we saw a lion walking along, almost scary ! Quiet and free, good option for these looking for a free place to stay or if there is no availability in the camping.

name: GM Motors
description: Really good, well organised workshop. We limped in on the off-chance with a rear axle that snapped in the centre of town and they fixed it over the course of the day. Run by Johan. Highly recommended. Tel: 072 225 9812

name: Nice rocky beach place
description: Pretty windy but very calm and beautiful. We were alone

name: Tsitsikamma backpackers
description: Warm friendly staff. Dinner and breakfast available but must be ordered in advance. Hostel is set in an attractive garden. Accommodation is in dorms, a few rooms and tents. We stayed in the "Hard Pear" room. This room was very noisy at night as next to the communal toilets. They have a bar with a pool table. Expensive for a hostel but a good place in a great location. The tents could be the quietest option.

name: Marilyn's 60's Diner
description: A fun place to eat with great music (60's!) and atmosphere. Food is good ('American Diner') and reasonably priced. Plenty of Elvis and Marilyn memorabilia on display with some old cars and motorbikes  They also have a craft brewery on site.

name: Landrover Defender specialist
description:
Edward "Boetie" Theron did a great service on my Defender. 
Found him on couple of Landrover forum and he is well known to be very good and passionate with Defenders. 

Boeties phone number: 082 577 02 35

name: Bush Camp Swartberg View
description: Behind trees and bushes just of the gravel road leading over the Swartberg Pass. 4x4 size vehicle not visible from road at the time. Very quiet and had no traffic after sunset.

name: Bush camp near De Hoop NR
description: A track leads east of the access road to the Reserve and we found a nice opening to bush camp next to it. Track is a bit sandy.

name: Otter's Bend Lodge
description: Small and green place with a few spots to park and camp, great for exploring Franschhoek and the surrounding vineyards on foot, community room and kitchen available and they light the fireplace during the cold months, one power point at pitch, rooms also available, friendly owners, two dogs on site, free wifi, plunge pool, laundry service available, 100R pp

name: Fynbos Guest Farm
description: Lovely guest farm with friendly owners, good stopover, clean ablutions, electricity and braai stands at sites. More than 150 different animals on the farm which you can explore freely; firewood and olive oil for sale, swimming pool, friendly dogs, beautiful gardens, stunning views of the valley and mountains, easy walking trails through natural fynbos vegetation. Perfect place. A pizza restaurant is opening soon a short walk down the hill from the farm  110R pp

name: Jamaka Organic Farm
description:
120 Allocated camping spots over two shaded campgrounds next to the river
9 Communal ablution facilities
Electricity and hot water
Freezers & fridges placed around each campsite, as well as cold rooms and freezer rooms at the office
Braai facilities (some with pits, some with barrels)
Office sells wood, ice and limited foodstuff & household items
Campsite shop open during peak times

name: Beaufort wes
description: @ grandma's hotel. I asked if I could stay on the parking lot behind a fence. That was no problem. I didn't need to pay anything. Instead I bought something at her shop...

name: Forever resort
description: Campsite direct on the lake. Beautiful view. 305 rand per spot

name: Kroonpark holiday resort
description: Place is a little bit run down but clean, good for a night if you go from South to north or north to South.

name: Dwesa Nature Reserve
description:
Dwesa is a small, secluded nature reserve on the Wild Coast  - owned by the local Xhosa people and operated by Eastern Cape Parks. The campsite is cut into the coastal forest, and it's a quick walk to the beach. On a weekend in April, we were the only ones camping. The campsite has over 50 large sites on a grassy lawn, each with a brick braai stand. No electricity. The only trash cans are by the ablutions. The unusual thing is that there is just one ablutions block, which is located across a stream from most of the sites. We had a lot of fun marching over the swinging suspension bridge to use the ablutions each evening. Ablutions are clean & reasonably well maintained. 
The best way to get here is to take the N2 to Idutywa -- Willowvale -- gravel road to Dwesa. It's very well signposted. The road was in good condition but apparently it can be bad when wet. Cost to camp is R233 per site per night. Conservation fee included

name: Roydon Nature Reserve
description: Great place to overnight about 10 km south of Queenstown. Campers are given a key to a small cottage, so you have your own bathroom and electricity. You're welcome to sleep in the bunk beds inside but we found it much cooler in our rooftop tent. Very quiet. R300 per site.

name: Cradock Spa
description: The campground at Mt Zebra NP was fully booked when we arrived without a reservation (April school holidays) and the Cradock Spa campground is the closest alternative. It's good for a night. Flat grassy sites. Quiet. Ablutions are relatively well maintained and are clean. No hot water when we were here. Cost to camp was R164 for two adults for a site without electricity.

name: Kogelbaai Caravan Park
description:
