First you have to go to Gordon's Bay and make a booking at Hanson Park Resort and pay at Pick 'n Pay there. We talked, talked and talk at the gate with the guard, but we had to go first to make the booking. So when you come from Cape Town, do not forget the booking. If you com from Rooiels then you have to go 10 km to Gordon's Bay for the booking and back again. Very odd system! 
But this camping is nice because of the beach. No elec. 
We payed R168 for 2 persons.
 Phone: +27 21 850 4262 (found on Google)

name: Agrimark
description: Can fill German gas cylinders. Agrimark in general is a good adress for supplies and tools you need on your overland trip. And they sell cheap diesel.

name: Camelroc Farm
description:
Chalets and Campsite near the border post. The scenery around is absolutely gorgeous and they have a couple of Mountainbike single and hiking trails. 
Paid 300R for four people

name: The Outspan / The Coffee Patch
description:
A beautiful cafe which offers an amazing home made Burger (huge!) 

Burgers and coffee are great...nice place for a stop over, also with kids, encaustic there is a little playground there. Free wifi.

name: Shady area
description:
Nice for overnight before or after crossing Namibia - SA border. Not far from road with lot of shade. 
Pity there is too much rabbish around

name: Underberg Auto Center
description:
Good mechanic who fixed my Defenders engine after the timing slipped. 
Tyrone is definitely one of the best mechanic I met so far.

name: Braai Area
description: Large BBQ area, has water, bush and few trees for shelter. very quiet at night. families and anglers in afternoon. restaurant nearby.

name: Meiringskloof
description:
Nice campground close to or from Lesotho. 255 zar 2 people and a car.
Nice short walk into the gorge and nice caves.

name: Little Rock holiday resort
description: Lovely small caravan park. Neat and well kept and we were given keys for the brand new family bathroom. R220 for 2 people for the night. Unfortunately on site restaurant closed on Sundays, and we were the only people here.

name: Tugela Mouth Resort
description: very nice and peaceful place, very friendly owners and staff,every site has electricity,braai and a water tab,Ablutions nice and clean, with (very) Hot water, we had site nr. 12 which is close to the reception and the Wifi was very good there, it is possible to get diner, served at your site, it was very good and the price was more than fair, the beach is beautyful and only a 4 Minutes walk to get there, 2 Pools , a little Shop where you can buy nearly everything you need, there is a little "restaurant" (3 minutes to walk)where you can buy beer - the food there was not so good. the road to get here is a gravel road at the moment, but there are roadworks, so I think it will be a tarred road soon. Lovely place- anytime again!

name: Flatcat Camping & Chalets
description: Willie and Rina are very friendly hosts who love to camp themselves. Beautiful campsite with private ablutions and communal ablutions. Lots of shade and a swimming pool. Electricity points always available even during outages as they have a very big generator. Very neat and clean. About 5km from beach entrance. You need to drive about 600m on a good gravel road to get to the camp.

name: Eureka Farm
description:
Eco- Camps in the middle of the farm area, very nice owner Albert Vorster and his wife Erna. Two camp spots at a dam, game around, working cattle farm. 3 km from the entrance gate of Mokala NP. 

Rates 2022: R200 per person 16 years and older - minimum of R400 per site. (Max 3 children included per site free of charge - additional children R100 pppn)
Rates 2022: Easter/Christmas/SA Pub Holidays : R250 pp 16 years and older -minimum R500 per site.
(Max 3 children included per site free of charge - additional children R100 pppn)

Call Albert to open the gate: 083 644 1234
Preferably call in advance to book.

name: Maideira Police Station
description: We arrived after a little accident on the N2 in the evening time in Mthatha. Many homeless people in a rough atmosphere. So we decided to ask in the police station if it is possible to stay. We stayed in the safe backyard (maybe 25 cars from the policeman) for three nights. From the beginning we had an officer as our friend, he helped us with repairing the car. The radiatior was leaking also, so our friend organized a mechanic to change the core. Also a friend of him came to show us the Mandela museums. We could use the private car of the police officer... We could also use the toilets in the police station. crazy experience. manz shops around.

name: Attakwas B&B+Camping
description:
B&B, Self-catering cottages, Camping. Stayed on the campsite for 1 night, 75R p.p. Nice owners. Contact: Ilse & Katot Meyer, 192 Jan van Riebeeck Rd. +27721991919, Tel. +27442725114, www.attakwas.co.za
Basic shower with paraffin, toilet, water. Some noise from town.

name: Bonamanzi Lodge
description:
Beautiful private game lodge. 
Campsite with private abolition is 220R ppn  or 190R ppn with a communal one. 
Campsite 17 or 18 are nicely secluded and because nothing is fenced animals will wander through your camp. They have four of the big five except for lions. 
Ask for a discount if you are over 60!
It's pricie but absolutely worth it.

name: Beach parking
description:
Parking area above beach. Few anglers around, police did round at 8pm and 8am but didn't seem to be a problem that we camped there. No shelter.
110319
Test 4.24.

name: The Ranch--overnight chalets
description: Ok for overnight if first choice unavailable. 4 spaces w/private ablution--small sandy flat spaces (med. size trees around each space) next to each other and also next to N14 and swimming pool and chalets. Staff friendly and ablution clean w/hot water in sink and shower. Site power 220@10A. R100 vehicle and R50pppn.

name: Mountain View Resort
description: Nice campsite with good facilities and free wifi in the restaurant nearby.

name: Potluck Boskombuis
description: Beautiful outdoor restaurant at the treurriver. If you stop only for a drink or lunch, you won't regret your decision.

name: Orange-Ville Lodge & Campsites
description:
Small grassy Camp-area with a nice view on the compound of a beautyful Guesthouse. Simple but nice and clean ablution with hot water.  The Guesthouse is run by a german Couple. Hardy and Steffi are great hosts. There are many trees for shade, good WiFi, Swimmingpool and a Braai.
2 People with Car 300ZAR incl. electricity

name: Magalies Sleepy River Campground
description:
Large grassy area and also area with plenty of shade. But Camping on sandy Area. OK facilities, bit dated.
convenient for visiting "cradle of humankind". Countryside spot so quiet at night.
120 rand per person (visited April 2017).

name: Kameelboom Lodge
description:
Not special. Good place for overnight 
Bit noisy from the road. Good grassy site. 210 R for 2 people and a campervan. Free wifi at the bar.?

name: Platjan Border
description:
Very easy border. No customs at ZA side but police stamped the CdP.
The "bridge" very narrow (see image), therefore not suitable for big rigs.

Correction: old bridge is wide and strong enough for big rigs. The new bridge will be a two lane bridge.

ONLY Monday till Thursday!

name: River place
description: Nice spot next to the river, surrounded by cows, not to far from N2. Some cars on property across the river, no one on this side. Need 4x4. Stayed one night.

name: Jungle Monkey Backpacker
description: Grass area for camping available for 90R pppn. Free slow Wi-Fi around bar, hot showers, power available in kitchen and near bar. Gate closes at 10pm, security guard present but sleeps and we witnessed people come after 10pm, loud music until midnight. No own alcohol allowed. Unfortunately food disappeared when we stayed here. Probably better options available

name: Green Fountain Farm Resort
description: Great reception with friendly staff. Excellent security. Grasses stands. Private bathrooms. Braai and wood available from reception. Laundry facilities.  Free wifi around the swimming pool. Bathrooms are cleaned daily.

name: My Way Lodge
description: Camping on grassy ground between the lodges, it was a Sawmill in former times. Big playground, horses and rabbits running around.  Hot showers, electricity available.  Very nice pensionered owner, pub with snacks. Much cheaper than other campsites in Sabie - we paid 200 per place and night with 2 adults and four children. Near to the street, but quite during night.

name: Marine Dinamics. shark, penguins and conservation
description: very good place to reserve your activity to dive with shark, go to african penguins island etc. they are very honest and friendly people and they have a conservation project with different  animals. the Price is very good in comparation with others.  They ofered a Coffee with muffing for free while you are waiting.

name: Mashovela Bush Camp
description: Beautiful campsite ~3km off the N1, making a great overnight before/after the Beitbridge crossing. Camp space cost ZAR 110, plus ZAR 55 conservation fee per person. The lodge also offers rooms and a restaurant.

name: Star radiators
description: We got our radiator fixed (leak). Taking out would cost around 350ZAR, we did it ourselves, fixing the radiator costs around 650ZAR.

name: Borakalo National Park
description:
Nice place for watching birds and animals , on a big Dam. Campsite Plljano at the Lake is nice, but ablution are poor, hot water is 
working!!!! Campsite Moretele is down! Entrancefee 80 Rand/pers. Campsite 100 Rand/place (Max.4pers) car 10 Rand .No electricity.

name: Picklepot Café
description:
Cute café with restaurant. Small shop with homemade relish, local chocolate, and lots more. 
Good stop-over from/to sani pass. Recommend.

name: Froggy Pond Resort
description:
Terraced campsite with +30 places. For tents, motorcycle, bicycle, 4x4, campers etc.
Very friendly staff. 24/7 security. Swimmingpool, hot showers. Also cabins. Windy.
Not on the beachside but with sea views and there’s a beach across the street.
A 5 minute walk to piquins and 12 minute drive to NP Cape Of Good Hope.

Price: R120 pppn low season R135 pppn high season

name: Caledon tunnel - ash river
description: Next to the exit of the river's tunnel, quiet and clean. A bit noisy because of the rapids... no prohibition sign for overnight stay.

name: Golden Gate Highland Fence
description: Next to the fence, outside the NP. Plenty on space for wild camping...

name: Theewater Sports Club
description: Public and members only camping, electricity, restaurant, pub, water, hot showers, boat launching, wifi, fishing. Duty Manager tel: 060 884 6497.

name: Bulungula
description:
Its a community run Backpackers place with a stunning view!
They offer bungalows and camping (not for rooftop-tent, since the lodge is in a nature conservation area). You park your car ca. 500m from the Lodge away.
You can go for horseride, fishing, village hike etc.
Bungalow with 3beds cost 190Rdpppn

name: Between trees
description: Wild camping just off N11. Stayed one night, few houses in the area but no one bothered us. Surrounded by trees, dirt road leading there.

name: Cape of Good Hope
description: Not much to see directly at the Cape of Good Hope apart from the Sign. But we were lucky and saw some Whales. And we really liked the Cape Point some Kilometers away. The Hike up to the Lighthouse and then further to the steep Cliffs was worth the expensive Entrance Fee (308 ZAR pppd). Beautiful Views. You probably have to Visit the Cape when you are in Cape Town.

name: LE GITE
description:
LE GITE
The friendly owners, Kevin and Cecile have a lovely, spacious, established Airbnb and are hoping to attract more Overlanders by developing the plot.
Space for bigger rigs is limited by the 2.3 height access at present.
Kevin has a very well equipped workshop, heaps of technical knowledge and can point you in the right direction of local specialist repairs/ mechanics, if you need a spot of help with your vehicle.
We stayed for nearly two weeks and were made to feel very welcome. We had use of good facilities and WiFi and there is a spacious lapa if you feel like stretching out with some yoga. If you ask Cecile, she may even come and join you.
This is not a campsite but it is in a useful residential area for access to all things.
. “ Camping” would be in a quiet spot at the bottom of their lovely garden, with tropical flowerbeds, veggies and a pool. Realistically there is only space for two or three vehicles at a time, at the moment.
Additionally, the location is convenient for the airport and transfers can be arranged to/ from.
Please do not just turn up. Contact Cecile directly to enquire.
+27 82342 6317
cecile.legite@gmail.com

name: JB Meyers (Land Cruiser)
description: JB's garage for 4x4 repairs on Toyota Landcruisers. Small family garage. Does a good job and in time. Realistic quotation for the job.

name: Ou Skip
description:
Big campsite with a lot of spots for 4x4, tents, trucks, caravans.
Every spot have space secluded from other spots by bushes. With braai!
Camping has big swimmingpool and very close to the beach. (walking 5 minutes).
Walking to centre via beach is 30 minutes.

name: Gayland Martins, Mechanic in Nompumelelo
description: Local builder and mechanic with tools and welding machine can help you fix things quickly. Does a proper job, had a crank built for my rooftop tent. Recommend.

name: Millers Point
description: Bay view/about 14 sites in 2 tiers on cliff (10m)--stairs to beach and children's play area--nice grass w/smooth boulder beach for picnics and white sand small cove w/ablutions and outside shower at end. Situated between road and bay, there's some traffic noise. ZAR202/site up to 2 vehicles & 6 p. Most sites are just big enough for 2 vehicles--lots of trees for shade--some just tall enough for vehicles w/pop-up tents. Non-cliff edge sites have nice grassy areas for tents. Friendly staff and highly secure--gate manned 24/7. Even in winter, busy on wkends. Managed by city of Cape Town--can't pay onsite. Essential to get an invoice from the caravan park in Fish Hoek during business hours and then pay invoice at the local Pick and Pay. And then ...  give the receipt to guard at Millers Point for entry. We did not know this and wasted an hour driving back to Fish Hoek ... but eventually worth it. Grounds and ablutions (bathtub, too) and scullery kept very tidy and cleaned daily. Famous fish restaurant (Black Marlin) next to camp--moderate prices, decent food. Phone: 021 7825503, 021 7861142

name: Malalane Toyota
description: Ordered radiator parts for old Land Cruiser, took 2 days for delivery, friendly staff. Phone: +27 13 791 5132, Address: 1 Air Street.

name: Lakeview Hostel
description:
Hostel very close to the airpoirt. the hostel offers a shuttelservice, just call them.
very friendly people and a good place to prepare the vehicle and start the travel.

name: Robberg Island Nature Reserve
description: Peninsula with great hiking tracks and amazing views. Sanpark, entrance fee 60R or wildcard.

name: Chapmans Peak Drive
description: Very beautiful and scenic drive along the coast. Vehicle height restriction 3 metres, width restriction 2.1 metres.

name: Kalahari Camelthorn Caravan Park and Guesthouse
description: 5 camping sites with lovely shared ablutions. Running water and electricity and lights. . Guesthouse with 1 x double and 1 x 3/4 size beds. Fully equipped.  One stationary caravan with side tents. 1 x queen size and 2 x stretchers . Sharing ablutions with camping sites. Safe. Fenced in. Pet friendly. bird lover's paradise. shady trees. Green grass. centre of town.

name: Stonechat Private Resort
description: 12 camping and caravan sites with electricity, nice view over the main dam, new modern ablutions with under-floor heating, communal kitchen and wash up area with freezer and fridge. Camping was R150 per site. Just off R36, some noise. Also 2 self catering, fully furnished cottages available. Phone: +27 (0)83 645 8488 or 011 462 1037, http://www.stonechat.co.za/

name: Guadom camping
description:
At the Orange river.
It was a camping site? The office is a ruin. Nowbody there, but a warm welcome by 3 donkeys and flies.
So it is a wild campingspot now.
All sandy and rocky. For a tent a little tricky.
Quiet place all by your self shared with millions of stars at night.

name: Augrabies Backpackers
description:
Simpel campsite with sandy spots and a vew grassie spots.
Plase looks a bit rundown.
Friendly owner and friendly dogs.
Ablusion is OK. Hot shower.
Quiet place and 10 km from the SAN-park.
For 2 persons + a 4x4 = Sar 200.

name: Khalahari Water
description:
There are 2 campsites. The first 2,5 km from the mainroad. This place has electricity and more..... We did not checked it. Price 2 people 200.
You have to check-in at this office for the basic campsite 2,5 km further down a track. Price 2 people and 4x4 is 160.
It is a huge campsite, also for day visitors, so it can be busy at the weekends.
On the Orange river on a open grass field. Ablusion very simple. Toilet and shower. There are gasbottles for hot shower but it did not work when we we there.
There are braai facilities. We where the only campers with al the space and silence you want.
There is a swimmingpool. But before you put on your swimsuit...... think twice. You can swim in the river.
We felt save here.

name: nelspruit backpacker
description:
It's actually a backpacker (dorm R150 pp) but Paul allowed us to stay in our truck. The parking lot is not 100%flat.
Hostel is very well equipped, close to malls, located in a silent area of Nelspruit. 
9 Andries Pretorius Street, Nelspruit 
R110 pppn

name: Pioneer Border Post
description:
Easy Border, friendly People.

Leaving South Africa: 
Passports got stamped. We kept our Temporary Import Paper (TIP). Took only a few Minutes.

Entering Botswana:
Fill out Arrival Form, Passports got stamped. No Visa required (EU Citizens). Allowed to stay 30 Days. Payed 295 P (25 Euro) Road Tax (German Number Plate). It's only cheaper for local Number Plates (South Africa for Example). Our South African TIP was also valid for Botswana, they just stamped it (no Carnet needed). Took 15 Minutes in total.
You are not allowed to cross the border with fruits and vegetables.

name: Windstone Backpackers
description: A bit of an odd location for a backpackers (i guess the people staying here are mostly laborers) but a decent place for a stopover. It's not a proper campsite but there is a courtyard and some lawns where you can pitch a tent, and use the shared ablutions and kitchen of the backpackers. I imagine you could also park a camper if necessary. I paid 70R.

name: Melkbosstrand Parking
description: Huge und quiet parking space right at the beach in a residential area. No facilities.

name: Transkaroo Country Lodge
description: Lovely hotel with hostel rooms available for lower budget travellers. 270R per person and they have double rooms. Internet available and not too bad in the courtyard but unreliable in the room (we were the furthest from the courtyard). Shared toilet and shower but sink in room, heating also in rooms. Very clean and friendly staff, just very lovely. They allowed our dogs in the hostel part. Secure parking with a guard. Restaurant and gift shop with reasonable prices.

name: Rus n Bietjie
description: It is a nice place with very clean ablutions and electricity on every site. It is in the middle of Pofadder. The owner, you can find him on number 1 of the apartments is a very friendly 'oubaas'. I really recommend this place for a night overstay.

name: DeVreede
description: Little campsite off the road to the Kgalagadi NP, also has several bungalows. Sanitation blocks redone in 2016. Nice and very friendly owner. 150pp

name: Zulu/Mooi Falls
description: Awesome waterfall on the Mooi River and a game ranch which sleeps 24 people as self catering. Now community owned. R250 per night per adult and R100 per night child. Contact Doug on +27824139801

name: Engen Fuel/ATM
description: Engen fuel station. Has ATM, useful if you have just crossed the border and need currency. Also has food.

name: Wild Camping at Old Ship Wreck
description:
Wild camping at picnic spots at the Aristea shipwreck. A few kilometres from the "town" of Hondeklip". Sites are all on the sea. There are braai places, no ablutions or water. 
Don't leave any litter!

name: Pearson Park Resort
description:
If you're looking for an alternative to staying in Addo, we thoroughly enjoyed camping by the river at Pearson Park resort. They have 2 options of campsites: the powered sites by the ablutions, or, a few kms down the road, the rustic but amazing riverside setting where you are pretty much bush camping. Where we stayed there were long drop toilets, taps and braai stands. The view across the river to the rolling sand dunes was epic.
We had to drive back to the main campsite  for good hot showers, but it was well worth it for the setting.

name: Leentjiesklip Caravan Park
description:
Good campsite. Lots of space but no shade and directly at the sea (can be windy). Grassy pitches which have their own braai, shared and clean abolutions.The showers are nice and hot! At least the first day when we were there, the second day they were ice-cold! When we asked about it at the reception the lady was not very helpful and did not seem to care.

No WiFi available. 

We paid 139,- ZAR per night, two persons and a 4WD. 

Although we enjoyed our stay the first day, the second day was a complete different experience. Very unfriendly and unhelpful staff. 

I guess when you arrive in the weekend and there are more people staying this is a nice place to stay. Otherwise you are just a moneybox.

name: The Shark Shack Backpackers
description: Backpackers hostel. Car parking on road outside under cameras. Very friendly staff. In centre of Mossel Bay.

name: Jesa
description:
Very friendly, clean and affordable campsite. Finally found a cheap campsite with proper facilities in South Africa! 75 pppn. Update: price now R250 per site (2 persons and a car). Private ablutions, though in shared building. Pitches are right next to each other, but shaded and each with electricity and a braaistand. Big rigs can park on the grass, while smaller vehicles can park under the shades. 
Ablutions are clean and well maintained. Hot water. Wifi available at the campsite. Next to busy road but shielded by big wall and fenced, so a bit noisy but safe.

name: Lancaster Lodge
description: Simple setup with power, washing facilities, table and chairs. Good shower block. R350 per night for a site but we were in the off season and said it was too much and got it for R200. Also has a pool and I think they would do breakfast on request. A few nice dogs running around but clean and healthy.

name: Kokoriba Nature Reserve
description: Big established campsite. Well run and safe environment. Good ablutions and braai drums can be obtained from reception. Taps and electricity points at sites. Shop. Bar and restaurant. Three swimming pools. One heated indoor pool.

name: River of Joy
description: Established campsite. 30km north of Bloemfontein on the N1. Powerpoint and water tap at each stand. Braai drums and grids available. Big rig friendly. Short distance off N1

name: Woodstock Moto co.
description: Awesome place to meet local riders, place is for motorcycles. You can work on your bike here, especially crowded on Saturday mornings. Place is also open during the week to hang around, get in touch with Devin he can help you with everything.

name: etiennes workshop
description: best mechanic we've encountered in Africa. We did overland tour with 32 year old toyota landcruiser so unfortunately we met a lot of mechanics (10 to be precise). This was the only one I would describe as great. He mostly works on the go but has a small workshop on a farm. Our motorblok was worn out because of a bearing on the crank that was gone. He found us a new engine, completely revised it, and solved some other smaller issues for a fraction of the price others charged us for smaller jobs. so if you have a mechanical issue around nelspruit I would strongly recommend him. He works on trucks and 4x4. contact Etienne 0714793230

name: Giriyondo 4x4 site
description: Lovely! 3 marked pitches with fire pits. No water or electricity. Bring everything with you. No shower. Long drop toilet. Pretty surrounds and very quiet. Good for birds. Very rocky, bumpy drive to get there. Sturdy 4x4 with high clearance essential. 210MTpppn (pay and arrange at gate or Fish Eagle campsite).

name: De Bakke Santos Campsite
description: Campsite in Mosselbay, price starts from Rand 110,- and Rand 140,- in the weekends(no seaview) for 2 people and a car. Pricelist attached as photo.

name: Oasis Caravan Park
description:
Very nice Dutch owned campground. 
Braai and electricity. We payed 305 for a camper with 3 persons

Close to the diveshops

name: Witsieshoek Mountain Lodge
description:
Witsieshoek Mountain Lodge is placed in the Sentinal NP.

You can stay here in a private hikers room for around R400,-(hot showers).
You can also hike the mountain and camp on top for R75,- pp(bring your own tent).
Or 'camp' at the parkinglot at the start of the trail for R110,- pp(there are dorms with cold water).

Entrance fee for the Sentinal NP itself is R45,- pp.
And the hiking trail costs R75,- pp.

It is all quite expensive for a hike,
but the hike up is nice and takes 5 to 8 hours(we did 2hrs up, 1hr wandering on top and 2hrs down).

name: Alexander Bay Immigration
description: South African side of border with Namibia. Entering SA by bike didn't even have to fill in a form. Immigration was done in 2 minutes but then had to visit the police too for some kind of double registration which confused me.

name: Kuiervreugde
description: Peet & Elsa are the owners. Lovely people who make a wonderful all day breakfast and spectacular cakes to go with their coffee. Have a small guesthouse too and lovely handmade local gifts - jams and Peet is a carpenter so lovely woodwork.

name: Malelane Golf Court Camping
description:
Enter at 'Malelane Golf Court' and drive all the way to the back passing the golf court, bowlingclub and fitnessclub. There's a small and basic camping. 
Secured(!) WIFI at the golfclub but other campers were able to type in the password for us.

Bathrooms of the golfclub upstairs can be used and are spacious and clean(women have a bathtub).

We paid R150,- for two people and a car. The owner has his house alongside the camping where you're able to pay.

It is the only camping we could fine in the area.

name: Jeppes Reef Border South Africa to Swaziland
description:
Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

Easy stamp out at the South African side, no need to pass customs.

Easy stamp in, they need your vehicle registration number, you have to pay R50,- road toll. No need to pass customs.

When exiting the border post they take one of your receipts of the paid R50,- and you're good to go.

name: Draaihoek Lodge
description:
Gorgeous lodge with beautiful rooms to stay in. There's an on site restaurant which while not fast makes delicious food - the springbok carpaccio was amazing. 

There's also a private beach from where I saw a few whales and a swimming pool as the Atlantic isn't that warm.

Super-friendly staff who went above and beyond to help when I asked.

name: Enrico
description: Good fresh fish

name: bushcamp Rooisand NR
description: small car park for the small coastal nature reserve here. Nice views over enclosed bay. approx 3kms from highway so very quiet.

name: Port Elizabeth - Sardinia bay
description: small car park (no views) at base of sand dunes by beach on edge of nature reserve (sardinia bay), though high parked on grass verge in reserve on road to car park (better views). great bushcamp and just 15kms from Port Elizabeth.

name: District Six Museum
description: Nice little Museum covering the History of the forced Removal of the Black Inhabitants of Central Cape Town in the 1960s. 40 ZAR per Person, 55 ZAR per Person including Guide. Impressive and sad Place, recommended.

name: Castle of Good Hope
description: More than 350 Years old Castle built by the Dutch to defend Cape Town. Also Home to a Military Museum and a Colonial Art Gallery. 30 ZAR per Person. Go with one of the guided Groups or walk around on your own.

name: Betty's Bay Penguin Colony
description: 20 ZAR per Person. Secured Parking. Penguins are also visible from the Parking Lot and the Beach so you don't necessarily have to enter and pay. Please do go in though as it helps secure the home for this endangered species.

name: C&D Unimog Specialists
description:
a  Unimog Garage, a real little nice Garage with Unimog- Specialists Danie and Carel Roux  , perfect.
Homepage: www.unimogsa.co.za

name: The Wild Fig Tree
description:
Very nice Restaurant with really excellent food and good prices . service is very friendly. take the specialities,you will be happy
open from 8.30 am to 9 pm

name: Econotrans
description:
Shipped two bikes + gear and luggage in one half open crate to Montevideo for 2450 €. We took the bikes apart to make them as small as possible. 2 Husky 701 enduros + stuff in 1.9m3, 435 kg.
We were allowed to strap the bikes to the crate but they finished the cover as it has to be certified fumigated wood with stamps. 

www.motomorgana.com

name: Sani Pass Border Post
description:
Going down:
Leaving Lesotho:
The Lesotho Post is on the Top of the Sani Pass. Stamped Passports, that's it (as we didn't need a TIP or Carnet as we entered). Took 30 Seconds. The Pass consists of about 20 km Gravel Road, everything else is paved. 4WD is compulsory according to signs. When wet definitely 4WD only or not possible at all.

Entering South Africa:
Also only stamped Passports. Our TIP was not even looked at. Took 3 Minutes.

Going up:
Stamp passports at SA building. No TIP, carnet or anything else required. 

Drive up Sani pass to Lesotho post. Park before the gate or get yelled at. Stamp passports and pay road toll. Drive through gate. No carnet or TIP required here either.

name: Kidd's beach picnic site
description:
Found this great place to camp. Really quiet and in front of the sea. Wild beach to walk close by.
Police came to visit us in the afternoon and it was not a problem at all to camp here for them.

name: Botshabelo
description: Open air museum, everything seems down-dated and no longer cultivated - but what has its own charm. The nebdele village with beautiful wall paintings lies next to an abandoned campsite at the small stream.

name: Kenton beach
description: On the parking right on the beach with benches, toilets and external showers. Very quiet. No prohibition signs.

name: Emahlatini Border Post
description:
Easy Border, friendly Staff, no Costs.

Leaving South Africa:
Passports stamped. TIP was not looked at. 2 Minutes in total.
Road until the Border completely paved but some Potholes as you get closer to the Border.

Entering Swaziland:
Passports stamped (no Visa or anything required; EU Citizens). No TIP issued, no Carnet required. Payed 50 ZAR Road Tax (Toyota Land Cruiser). Took 5 Minutes in total. The Road after the Border is completely and nicely paved.

name: Kea B&B
description:
Several twin rooms with private bathroom behind and in private house. Very friendly owner. Rooms are basic but clean and not broken.

Room is R650 pp per room and R85 for breakfast.

name: Maropeng Museum (Cradle of Humankind)
description: Excellent and modern Museum covering the archeological Excavations around Johannesburg. Part of the 'Cradle of Humankind' Area that contains several Excavation Sites and Caves (one of the most important paleontology Sites in Africa). Here they found Remainings of one of the oldest Human Ancestors. Museum covers not only Human History but also the History of the Earth and Universe. Top End interactive Installations, Videos, an underground Boat Ride ... Definitely worth a Visit! 120 ZAR pp. Discounts for Students. Secured Parking.

name: Top of the hill
description: In the bush off the dirt road but quiet for a night and not too far from Paul Kruger gate

name: Hluhluwe Park Gate
description: Memorial entrance gate to the  Hluhluwe/Imfolozi Park

name: Along the fence
description: On a Gravel road along the fence of NP and before the automatic door. Nothing very good but good place if you looking for something free close of Mountain Zebra NP. Quiet and hidden of the main road. This small park worth a visit. We didn't see a lot of animals but the landscape is stunning !

name: GRNP
description: Quiet place 10 Km from Nature's Valley. Completely hidden from the main road but you can hear the traffic. To reach this place we took the small road R102 from Coldstream. From this village there is a sign indicating "road closed" but you can go thru. Of course you can reach this place from nature's valley too.

name: Loch Athlone Dam
description: Wild camping! (boondocking) Really nice spot right next to the lake. Peaceful and possibilities to fish. Lot of place around and plenty of spot for any type of vehicle. Very close to town and neighbourhood. Don't go if the occasional pedestrian will bother you.

name: KARDOESIE - Piekenierskloof Pas, Citrusdal
description: Beautiful camping. sites on the grass, have electricity. Clean and good ablution with hot water. Good restaurant.

name: Rhodes Camping Ground
description: Nice municipal campground with lots of shade next to river in the old part of this town. We couldn't find anyone to take payment so possibly free - just open the gate. Toilets, braai, showers etc all clean and well maintained. Hard to find - municipal ground is behind white metal sign for Woonwa Park Caravan Park (not used). Quiet and no hassle from friendly locals. Nice views of surrounding mountains. Roads in are gravel and rough in places. Camp area flat. Couldn't get hot water from shower although these appear to be gas fired. Vodacom 3G available

name: Photo copys and passport photos
description:
Inside of the Grand Central there's lots of small boots on the floor below the Cape Town Post Office.

Photocopies and ID photos are easily obtained here.

name: Traffic Department - Civic Center
description:
If you come to Cape Town as a foreigner to buy a vehicle/motorcycle, you will need to obtain a traffic registration ID. This document allows you to register vehicles in your full name.

The process is simple:
- Bring passport with Visa or tourist stamps.
- Bring two black and white passport photos.
- Bring a proof of long term accommodation rental agreement.
- Bring a utility bill (water, electricity or similar).
- Fill out the white form "Application and notice in respect of traffic register number."

Come in the morning, fill out all the paperwork and hand it in.

Open weekdays from 08.00-15.30
Saturdays from 08.00-11.30

Come back three days later and it should be done.
Good luck on your travels! Drive safe.

name: Bushmen Safaris
description:
This is a hunting lodge. So if you have a problem with that, find an other place.
You can stay here at the entrance on a grass pitch. So you can hear the main road. But for R50 pp we will snore loud and do not hear any traffic ;-)
There is a toilet, even a hot shower and place to do dishes.
Very friendly guard at the gate.
An excelent place for a stopover.

name: Martin's Drift
description:
Strait forward border crossing.
We crossed from Botswana to South-Africa and it took us 20 minutes in total.
But.....it was not busy :-)
Open from 06.00 - 22.00.

name: Premier Truck & Trailers Spares
description: Little Shop for truck spares, with good parking place at the road.

name: Magoebaskloof Getaway
description:
Nice campsite with braai place, electrics and water. Clean showers and toilets.
On the terrain there are two nice dams and several lodges. Nice atmosphere. Wifi at reception. 
R300 per campsite per night.

Hikes possible in the area

name: Klok Inn
description: There are lodges and there will be a proper campground. The campground is still work in progress, but you are more than welcome to stay here. There are not yet ablutions but we were allowed to use a cabin. Final prices for camping are not there, but to use a small nice cabin is 300 rand pppn. The ablutions for the campground will be ready within the next month. You will need to call the phone number which is on the sign near the main road, the sign is a bit small, so look closely (forgot to look it up). There is no doorbell near the gate. Braai is available.

name: Paradise Camp
description: Simple camp ground on the lawn behind the house. Good and new ablation block with decent showers. A bit of noise from the road. Cheap 80pppn

name: Sepapus Gate
description:
Exited from SA to Lesotho here on my bicycle. 20km gravel road to get here is fine. 

Border open 8am to 4pm.

name: Craig's Motorcycle Spares (for all bikes)
description:
A store filled with goodies for any types of bikers. Craig is a great guy who spends time on finding you the right parts for any types of bikes. He's an expert, and found 90% of the parts I asked for.

You'll find almost anything related to a motorcycle, and if he doesn't have it he'll scramble it within days, but mainly service plus wear and tear parts.

An extremely big range of parts for Japanese bikes, but also for BMWs, KTMs and similar.

Chains, filters, engine parts, gaskets, tires, sprockets, battery's, lubricants, brakes, bulbs, tubes, carburator parts, rectifiers, after market parts. They also do fitments of tires, sprockets and the items they sell.

Hours:
Mon-Fri 0830-1730
Saturdays 09-1300

Phone: 0215111916
Email: craigspares [at] absamail.co.za

name: Allandale Farm
description:
Nice campsite amongst orange & lemon trees on citrus farm above Citrusdal.
Mostly grassy sites, some with full shade, small dam for swimming, clean ablutions with solar and donkey boiler heated hot water which was slow to heat the water in the mornings. Sites have braais and lighting and unusual 12Vdc electricity boxes (connectors available) but no 220V. Campsite is located in a valley so sun rises late and sets early. R80 pppn camping.

name: Klipkraal
description: Handy, basic overnight camping spot just off main N7 road. Laid out as a kraal (animal pen) in the valley with stone chippings underfoot and 1m high rock walls. Each site has a water tap and place to braai. The simple timber ablutions have hot showers heated by a donkey boiler (wood supplied). To have the ablutions unlocked and water turned on phone Coenrad or Dwalita on 083 653 8554 or 081 271 3227. R100 pppn camping.

name: Speekhout plaas
description: Mark & Pauline Will accommodate you in a self catering formula. Very friendly owners! They do breakfast and provide for self braai! Call ahead! 0877004494 landline or 0722025752

name: Kruger Adventure Lodge
description:
If you want a space to camp because you cannot find something els and it is getting dark, than for emergency you can use this one.
It is at a lodge.
Tiny spot, behind the reception. Two pitches for tent or car. Not big rigs. Pitches has one tap.
Ablusion not so clean, but hot showers.
There is a restaurant and bar. Wifi available.
Price:R100 pp
It is about 1 hour drive from Kruger Gate.

name: Twana Lodge
description:
Thise place has dorms, rooms, houses, wooden chalets and campsite.
The campsite has shaded and sunny places on grass. There are some water taps but no electricity. You find a plug in the ablusion.
The ablusion is a bit out dated but it is clean and the water is hot.
The place accommodate Overlander trucks, so it can be busy and noisy.
There is a swimming pool but not so clean :-(  and a bar where you find also wifi. The wifi has a funny password. They have a book exchange!
The owners Chris and Arne are very friendly and will help you in any way they can.. They also have huge, very huge dogs, but they are friendly too.
Price:R180 for 2 people and car.
You can long park your car here. Price is R400/month. Car under roof but open at front and back.
We parked here 3 years ago and everything worked out fine. So we decided to do it again.
There is airport transfer R550 by taxi. They will organize it.

name: Rooiduin Guest Farm camping and day trails
description:
Camp Site
4x4 Day Trails
Dune Boarding in the red Kalahari dunes!
+27825896659

name: Nuwerust
description: Campsite at a river between mountains, opposite to a rock with equipped climbing routes. Very nice location. Different walking trails start from the site. Open pitches or shaded with trees available. Nice pool. Internet available for 30R/100MB. We paid 250R for 2adults, 3 children and a car.

name: Jongensfontein Caravan Park
description: Nice camp ground in sleepy coastal town. Direct access to beach which has plenty of picnic and shady areas. Camp ground is unfenced but feels safe. Grassy camp sites some with plenty of protection from wind by low trees. Some sites no shade. Clean ablutions but take your own paper and soap. Good 3G from Vodacom. Beach has children's play area. A few local shops within short walk and cafeteria too. Water taps and electric points around sites

name: Lone creek waterfalls
description: Nice long waterfall where you can swim as the parking is at the bottom. entrance fee at 30 rand pp. For us this was the best waterfall in the area that we visited.

name: British 4x4
description: Workshop and parts. Helpful people and good shop with all parts you need for your LandRover/ 4x4vehicle.

name: Riggton River Farm - Campground
description:
Cozy river campsite along the river. Very secure and lots of space for big rigs and overland trucks. Secure area with two gates. Electricity, showers, braai-pits, toilets with running water. 

 R130 per adult, no matter if you camp in a tent or sleep in your truck.

Recommended.

name: Travelers Rest - Restaurant & cottages
description:
A great place to eat breakfast or lunch (or early diner). Decent prices and good service!

They are also renovating a couple of cottages that they'll eventually rent out, probably later in the 2017-season.

name: Groenrivier Guesthouse
description: Nice Campsites with own absolutions, brai and all you need. 100 ZAR /ppn.

name: Farm Campground
description:
Located along a very fun and beautiful dirt road is a farm which also has a designated camping area on top of a hill. It has a toilet with flushing water, a bonfire pit and large areas to park your camper, car, motorcycle or pitch tents.

Price per person is R120.

The ever so kind couple that runs it also has a warm shower for you to use the following day.

Knock on their door, and they will give you information on where to camp. They also sell jars of jam/kwepers for R30-70. I did not have cell coverage here.

name: Fish on the Rocks
description: Possibly the best informal fish restaurant in Africa! Take away or sit and eat at their tables and benches. From traditional fish (hake) and chips to calamari, prawns, yellowtail, snoek (when available) and other things fishy and in many combinations this British owned place is a long established institution. Don't miss it!

name: Bush camp in forest
description:
a free place in the forest a bit away from the street so  no one see u
it is a firelane here and on a hill. but it's enough wood around to level the car.

name: Inkosana Lodge
description: Lovely place with a huge garden and nice sitting areas created everywhere. It’s like a backpackers with dorms, rondavels and camping, although with a rooftop tent you’ll be limited to the front area of the lodge. On a nice grassy patch though. Great views. Friendly owner and all facilities available like kitchen, fridge, lounge area, free WiFi, fresh water pool. Camping is ZAR 150 pp

name: Namaqua 4WD Trail - Advanced offroading
description:
Be warned, the Namaqua 4WD trail is very technical with lots of sand, steep rocky climbs, sharp rocks and wet riverbeds. Often there are tracks to follow, but they'll disappear after rain. Look for areas with less vegetations while crossing the river bed/green area. There are also black tires marked with 4x4 along the trail.

This track is NOT suited if you have a heavy truck with low clearence, or big bikes with lots of luggage - unless you are a confident rider and have prior experience in these environments. 

However, if you go here it'll be an awesome ride with lots of cool photo ops and amazing nature.

Crossed from east to west November 2017 on loaded motorcycles.

Enjoy!

name: Joos Becker Caravan Park
description:
Big campsite between the mainroad, traintrack and Apies river.
Big places, some with tap and electricity.
Ablusion is a bit outdated but has hot water. Nice swimming pool.
There are a view caravans/tents with local working people who stay there for longer periods.
Price 2 persons + car R165.
There is a shopping mall opposit the campsite for shopping. Even McDonalds and Wimpy..

name: Tubby's Auto Development
description:
A family bussiness for car maintenance and repairments. Specialist in LandCruisers, but also do other brands.
Good job for a good price.
If you want, he can do without tax ;-)
You can call Kenny on 0824955950
In the same street (Breedstreet) there is a 4x4 LaRo specialist and there is next to this place a Toyota second hand spares shop.

name: TigerWheel & Tyre
description:
Big shop for tyres and alignment.
Sell BFGoodrich for good prices.
For example:4 BFGoodrich KO2 tyres 265x75x16 for R150.500 incl discount and all included.

name: Ganzekraal Camping
description: Place is directly on the beach with stunning views. On weekends often fully booked, but out of season camp sites are available. Ablutions are very basic but clean. Camp sites are not private and separated by a small fence. Braai spot without grids, tap nearby, small area with basins to wash up cutlery by the ablutions. Basic setup but 10/10 for location.

name: Chane Cheese Farm
description:
Huge Gras parking space outside the farm at the forest. They run a small shop and good restaurant.
We had a snack, bought lovely cheese and were welcome to stay. They close at 5pm. Then it's absolutely quiet.
No facilities.

name: Berg River Bush
description: Nice spot along Berg River, with lot of emplacement and shade.

name: Lunch spot on the Swartberg Pass
description: Small side road where a house or hut used to be. Great spot to park for a while and enjoy the pretty view over the valley.

name: Zwakala
description:
Great campsite at the river, really beautiful place. Close to the brewery that goes by the same name. They also have very nice cabins. 
No restaurant. No WiFi.

name: Kom Kyk Caravan Park
description: Small caravan Park at the BP gas station. Also a restaurant, small store, and wine shop. They wanted 300SAR for a site for one night. So we didn't stay. Across the highway there is a hotel/Lodge and bar where Samuel let us camp in our van for 100 SAR, behind locking gate. Good.

name: Motswedi Camp Mokala NP
description: 6 camp sites around waterhole. Each camp has good quality individual ablutions, kitchen including gas hob and fridge/freezer. Own shower/wet room and toilet. No wifi or 3G. Very peaceful spot in middle of national park to watch private waterhole just meters away. Braai facilities and picnic table/chairs. No mains hookup.

name: Store it SA
description:
Secure parking facility for big rig (7 x 4 x 4 meter) in your own closed storage unit. Also storage unites for smaller overland vehicles.

Facilities to clean your car and do some repairs as well. Tell the owner Steve Tucker (+27 82 463 35 72) you found his place through Vera and he wil get you a place!

name: Umshanti
description: Small grassy campsite next to attractive Buffeljags Dam. Space for about 3 camping vehicles, some shade, rustic ablutions with hot showers, electricity and shelters on sites. Boat trips and fishing on dam. Small shop on site. Self catering cabins available on same site.

name: Cannon Valley Estate
description: Several camp sites, either grassy or sandy, in coastal bush near beach each one with own ablutions and hot showers, electricity and shelter. Water on sites not potable. Nice sandy beach within walking distance. Some small buck and other wildlife may be encountered in the bush. Friendly owner.

name: Cannon Valley Estate
description: Several camp sites, either grassy or sandy, in coastal bush near beach each one with own ablutions and hot showers, electricity and shelter. Water on sites not potable. Nice sandy beach within walking distance. Some small buck and other wildlife may be encountered in the bush. Friendly owner. Tel: 082 493 9750.

name: Gouritz River Eco Camp
description: Camp site on farm next to upper reaches of Gouritz River. Grassy site on different levels but little shade. Braais (BBQs) on most sites. Simple ablutions with hot showers. Electricity only in ablution block. When river is dry a 4x4 trail along river bed and river island is possible. Friendly farmer owner tel: 076 398 0892. Approach road to farm is along farm tracks from main N2 highway. Look for gate and camp site name board on highway at S34° 11.327' E21° 43.949'.

name: Motosurgery, All Mechanical Repairs, Port Elizabeth
description:
Very helpful people! They changed the toothed belt and the pulley at our MB Sprinter413 cdi. The spare parts we had in stock and they did the work immediatly and well. For changing the bearings inside the alternator they brought the alternator to a specialist. Very friendly and responsible.
phone Quintin 0839253303

name: Ala Turka
description: Great turkish restaurant in fortress like building just off the R21 near Irene off ramp, opposite George Hotel. Food is Great, decor is sublime. 3 course meal around ZAR 250

name: Berg River Banks
description: Nice spot with a lot of place and some shade on top of cliff along Berg River. Quiet most of time but can be busy during weekends. Nobody bored us in 48h

name: Tshikwalo lodge
description: Grassy camp spot under trees with electricity. Small swimming pool, restaurant overlooking waterhole. Clean ablution with hot water. R160 pppn. Very friendly staff and all Well maintained.

name: Baobab inn
description:
Best food in this area and very cheap for what you get.
Extremly yummy

name: Willows Caravan Park
description: Camping in the middle of the town on the riverside. The best time is over but absolutions are clean and all things works. 165 ZAR for 2 people.Electricity and braai on each site.

name: Inni Kloof / Heuningkloof
description: Rustic campsite on a nice grass covered area surrounded by shady indigenous trees. All basics are there; running water, braai, 2 big fire pits, games, a lapa, washing facilities. Few power-points and lights around. You’re right in nature surrounded by green bush and hills with just the sound of the birds. And there’s an amazing natural pool for a swim or you can take a tube from the campsite! Owners are lovely people and as they have an orange farm we got some tasty oranges as well. Paid only R150 for 2 plus car. There’s also a bush campsite, but only accessible with a ground tent. Amazing place!

name: Doodsklip Campsite (Baviaanskloof NR)
description: One of the two official campsites within the Baviaanskloof NR. Spacious spots on grass with braai, table and benches. No electricity, no running water, only long drop toilet. Close to the river in a stunning location surrounded by cliffs and hills. Enjoy the silence and starry nights. Bookings at Komdomo, shortly before the park gate in the east.

name: Uitspan Guest Farm and Campsite
description: Amazing sites surrounded by rock formations and nice views. All campsite have their own ablutions, water, braai, small covered area to sit in the shade and washing up area. Very well maintained and lovely setting with dams and a swing rope over one the dams. Nice hikes to do in the area and there’s a bar with pool table, tv etc. R250 p site Highly recommended. Electricity and running water on spot!

name: Rondekop campsite
description: In the Pietersrivier Nature Reserve is this stunning campsite next to a dam. It’s a rustic (bush) camp with amazingly built shower (warm water!), flush toilets and fire pits with tools to braai. The dam is a nature pool you can swim in and in the area are lots of different hikes to do with beautiful scenery and lookout points. For us this was the best official bush campsite we’ve ever seen!! R100 ppn Book via Internet or (as we did) stop in “de Vlugt” at Outeniqua Trout Lodge and ask for gate key and directions there.

name: Augrabies Falls National Park
description:
very nice place for 1 or 2 days, you can hike (gorge trail 1h or dassie trail 2h30), go to the view points to see the falls (6 platforms) or drive with the car and make 67 km (hartmann's loop), 82 km (lekkerwater loop) or 91 km (quiver loop) to the game area. we saw giraffes, antilops and dassies.you can make these loops by 2WD, we made it with a normal car without problem;-)
 in the day area, you have picnic area and swimming pool. 
opening hours in November: from 7 to 18.
you can sleep inside in chalets or campsite.
if you sleep inside or you reserve the restaurant, you can see the falls by night with lights!!!
fuel station, restaurant and small shop inside.
 price: FREE for Wild Card or 192 for international adult,96 for SADC and 43 for south african people.

name: The big hole
description: to visit only the big hole alone:50 pp. to visit with a guide the big hole, the museum and the mine every hour from 9 to 5 : 120 pp (1 hour). very interesting with a museum, a reconstituate city and the big hole!

name: The water tower
description: very nice rooms in a tower. first floor, twin beds or last floor,round double bed. toilets and shower outside sharing. kitchen available. 390 for 2 only the room or 520 bed & breakfast. in the city center. restaurant available.

name: The brewery
description:
coffee shop, home made biers at 45 rands, fresh cheese, restaurant, jam... perfect for one stop!
open daily from 8 to 5.
phone:+27 49 841 1602.

name: Guest House Metro
description:
cheap rooms near the airport. 400 the room for 2 people with bathroom but we bargain for 350 and if you stay 2 nights, you can have the room for 300!
quiet, safe, clean.

name: Sondzela Backpackers
description:
inside Mlilwane Wildlife Sanctuary.
(Update 27/12/2018: No longer accommodate vehicles with rooftop tents, caravans, or big rigs. Only ground tents.)
 the campsite of the park was crowded so we decided to stay here! all facilities: fully equipped kitchen, fire place, hot showers, coffee for free, swimming pool, grass to camp.
camping, dorm,rooms and rondavels.
nice view, clean, friendly staff.
nice park to hiking.
wild card accepted or entrance feee.voucher for wifi.
camping :100 pppn.good value !

name: Willem Rus
description: Well maintained campsite in bushveld surroundings with view on 2 waterholes. Large pool. All spots have electricity, Clean and Well maintained ablution blocks.

name: Yellow sands caravan park
description: Nice spaces on the shore side, shadow sides behind.Pensioners pay the half, 50 Zar pp in high seson.

name: The Growcery - Umkulu
description:
Nice campsite next to the orange river on the RSA river bank.

Servers shady spots with electricity and sink at each spot. Braai place.

Hot shower, flushing toilets.

Bar and lounge area and a big fire and Braai place. Nice herb and veggie garden.

They are offering trips on the river. White water rafting.

They also have small huts which they rent out. 

MTC signal (namibia) + a tiny bit of Vodacom SA at the bar.  Slow data signal. 

internet vouchers r60 for 120mb.

Camping 120 ZAR pppn.

name: Ma tala tala lodge
description: More a lodge for function with Some rooms and army tents (with only beds in). Staff is very helpfull though and you are allowed to do walking safari’s on your own. R400 for 2 People in a tents. Open shower but with hot water

name: Highlanders
description:
Really nice campsite on a small winery. Every site has large grassy area, perfectly cut plus a hard standing to park on, each has shady trees plus a covered area with sink and bin, electric and light. Hedging between site is tastefully done in grape growing vines. Each site also has a large braii pit. 
Great bar at back of site. 
Price was ZAR250 for two people plus vehicle. Very friendly owner and staff, it's about 3km from turning on N7, the gravel road is good but can get busy with farm vehicles, this was not a problem. This is the best option for camping along this area of the N7, don't miss it. Good wines too

name: Willem's Land Rover
description:
LOCATION IS UPDATED AND CORRECT. 

We broke down out of town and the nearest lodge couldn't recommend Willem more highly for Land Rovers. He quickly and enthusiastically came and towed us and arranged a tow for a good price (with his daughter) to Jo'burg to a recommended LR mechanic (we already had accom paid for in Jo'burg, otherwise we would have been happy to have Willem work on our vehicle). Though we didn't have any work done, we would be happy to recommend Willem if you need LR work done. Very knowledgeable. (072 218 4231)

name: Boulderbaai
description:
Camp No. 10 of the Namaqualand Coast National Park

Braai place, Little Rock windbreaker 
Dry toilet 

No running water, no electricity. 

But a lot of nature :-)

Camping for 2 incl car 171,30 ZAR 
Plus NP Park fee - didn’t pay the park fee because of wild card

name: Platbos forest reserve
description:
Perfect place! A very nice place to camp or take a lodge. 

We met the owner, Francoi (who runs a business in Cape Town), in Nairobi as he was doing his own overlanding trip! This site is in the middle of a forest reserve which is run by his wife, Melissa. 

They have a couple of lodges of which the prices vary at an average of 950 rand per night for 2 persons. 

There is also an option to do camping under a forest canopy.
Parking space for canopy tent or 4x4 camper van
Open-air shower
Sink and waterless toilet
Firepit and braai grid provided
Communal freezer
Firewood provided for donkey boiler, additional firewood can be purchase
NO OUTSIDE WOOD ALLOWED
Off-grid (no power points)

The campsite is quite small and our landcruiser only just fitted (floor is not level) but we managed to put our car in a position to open our two rooftop tents and there is space for a ground tent next to it. But you don’t come here for the large space, you come here to camp in the most southern forest of Africa! 

There is also the opportunity to do a hike. If you combine all 4 routes this will take you about 1,5/2 hours to finish and it requires no stamina or skill, just a nice walk. 

All the money gained with the accommodations goes straight back into the reserve. The owner, Melissa, is more than happy to tell you all about it. 

0027824110448
It is advisable to call ahead of your stay if there is room in the lodges. They tend to be fully booked in the weekends. As there is only one place to camp it might be wise to inquire for a spot there as well.

name: Gifberg Holiday Farm
description: PRICE JANUARY 2022: 100R PPPN. Open grass lawn with only one small shaded tree (many other were planted but still tiny). Braai, flush toilets, showers. No electricity. No signal with vodacom. Free wifi at reception. Swimming pool. Many hiking trails, bushmen paintings, rock pools and waterfalls included in the price. Cottages also available.

name: Itala game park
description:
150/180 R pppn including day fee for the park (day visit is 60Rpp)
very nice maintained park and the nicest landscape of all parks till now for us.
beautiful 4x4 tracks so you have the feeling NOT to be in a park. Only a few visiters where here (even it was start of the high season) so we had it 2 day not see any other car on the tracks.
They have many leopards, black and white rino,  elefants, buffalo, tmany turtles (we saw one with about 1m diameter) and and .......
The campground is basic but clean. Has hot water open shower remembers a bit to Botswana. just more luxury. No fences around. We loved it and stayed for some days. We where the only one on the huge campground most of the time. It is near a river and you are alowed to swim in.

name: De Bos Guest farm
description:
Right at the edge of town is this campsite on a pecan nut farm. Different areas to camp, all on grass with lots of trees for shade. Some places only accessible with ground tent but enough places to choose from. No electricity on site but the communal kitchen has a big fridge. There’s a pool and free WiFi. 
Nice hiking and climbing options nearby. Easy walk into town. Very cheap even in high season only R100 ppn.

name: Kawasaki shop and mechanic
description: Just had a simple service of my Honda XR 250. Really happy with the experience. No nonsense.

name: River of Joy campsite and B & B
description:
Established campsite. Near a river. Loads of shade. Some grass. Power points and neat clean ablutions.
Good stop off, near the N1 at Bloemfontein.

name: Holgat River Bank
description: Beautiful and quiet spots along the 4x4 trail through the Holgat River Bank. Sheltered from wind but not from sun. Close to the R382 and great stay before or after crossing the Namibian Border. Track is very sandy and requires 4x4, but fun for off-roading. Might be inaccessible after rain or flooded river.

name: Citrus Creek
description: Campground. Tidy. Lots of sites. Swimming pool. Next to golf court.

name: Klipspruit River Resort
description: Way out off the road. Coming from Bothaville the road is gravel and corrugated. Nice enough campground. Sand and some grass. Some shade. Right on the Vaal River. Ablutions nice. Water slide. Miniature golf. Stayed here overnight during holidays... bad choice! Loud music and karaoke. Staff friendly.

name: Southernmost pub
description: Charismatic coastal pub. Chunky pork knuckles. Try the MoerKoffie of you enjoy consuming your pint with a knife and fork (or even if not, just drink one)

name: Indabushe eco camp
description:
Well maintained, friendly place in beautiful landscape with steep hills surrounding the site. Grassy field with trees. Hiking trail and mountain biking options. Also a pool and small playground for kids. 
There are small safari chalets available. Close to the road so you can hear the traffic a bit. 
Camping was R320 for 2 adults.

name: Kings beach backpackers
description: Nice hostel with parking 400 a twin room

name: Sips Quick - tyre experts
description: Tyre fitters & they sell batteries for vehicles. Industrial area also has other mechanical businesses

name: Malojeni Guest Farm
description: Large campground in a private game reserve. Grassie and lots of sites however sites with shade are limited. We were able to get one but this was in high season. Lots of deer-like animals around. Game tours are being organised. We did not use the toilets and showers but used our own. That is why we are not sure about the condition. The only negative thing we could think about is the presence of numerous flies. Beautiful birds spotted.

name: Café Molinari
description: Nice little coffee shop that also serves small meals and has free, good WiFi

name: Aardwolf Backpackers
description:
Very nice hostel owned by a incredibly nice family.

Dorms 150pp individual room 250pp.

name: Khomeesdrif
description:
Wonderful, quiet and very large place on green grass, a river to swim nearby and petfriendly. 
Fresh water, ice and firewood are provided, if needed.

name: Honda Motorcycle Dealer
description: Good garage and stock of sare parts. I told them I was on my way and I couldnt stay more than 2 nights, and they made space to my motorbike for next morning.

name: Clarens Inn Backpackers
description: Cheap individual rooms. 200 without private bath and 280 with it.

name: Goegap Park Camp
description: About 5 very nice arranged places with roofs for shadow in a small valley. Good ablutions, nice trekking possible. Bring everything with you. Mobile connection around the hill. Price including entrance fee for the park for 2 people 90R!!!!

name: Bahati Caravan Park
description:
Two caqmping areas with 6-8 places, in the bush with antelopes in the camp. Roofs for shade with electricity. Alutions ok. 
Owners live somewhere else, but can open the door for you.
The road and train are very near, but quiet at night.
3G with MTN
240.-R two persons

name: Sondela Game Reserve
description:
Huge caravan park with about 200 sites in a game reserve. Public or private bathrooms (4 places grouped around the ablution hut) available. 
Trees for shadow, huge lawn, pools. Tame nyalas, horses, sheep around the camp.
Mountainbiking in the reserve is very recommended(100.-R for 4 hours bike), riding, visit of the WLC (hurt or orphaned animals) is possible. Fastfood restaurant, not well stocked shop. Very busy on weekends and holidays an much more expensive.
480.-R for 4 people and 2 cars on one site.

name: giants castle
description:
70,- Rand pp entrance or wildcard
beautiful landscape. you also can have a walk to caves. We did not do it as it cost extra and we ran out of time.
It would be a lovely spot to sleep at the day visitors car park (300m before reception but we were not able to convince them to let us stay there. No other possibilities to sleep here except taking a chalet.

name: White mountain in
description:
A lovely place close to a lake. They have pool,bar and gameroom.
Unfortunately all is run down a bit and the ablutions were very dirty.
270 R for 2 person per night

name: Valley bakery
description:
They have nice European bread and cakes. 
Also a nice restaurant here
(Sunday closed!)
Enjoy

name: Ciglers Butchery
description:
Amazingly nice butcher. Best I have ever been.
A must to go for good meat

name: CUMMINS parts and garage
description: location has been updated and is accurate. CUMMINS dealer. All you will need for a Cummins engine or some other diesel engines you can get here

name: Drive in   KOM -MA-WEER
description:
The very friendly owner let us sleep here. 
Nice clean toiletrooms.
Food/breakfast has reasonably prices also the homemade jam and pies.
They told us that they open the place not long ago and the future plan is to built a "wild campside" and showers.
Some nice shady picknickspots are already here.
Guardians around in the night so a save place to stay for free.

name: Kheis riverside lodge
description:
Campground and chalets  right to the beautiful oranje river.
120 pp pn

name: Desert Camp
description: Because of a bad sandstorm we stranded here. Just followed a small track to get away from the road. At least a quiet peaceful place to stay.

name: Inthaba lodge
description: Beautiful large camp grounds, nice ablutions.... some shade.

name: Forever resort Plettenberg
description:
Clean, well run in the river with clean warm showers, expensive at R800 per night for 4 people only.

In high season its very busy with lots of kids on bicycles, boats on the river (tidal) and a rather overcrowded atmosphere but clean and well run campsite

name: Moriti Bush Camp
description: Located on the banks of the Limpopo river, border between South Africa and Botswana, it is the ultimate private campsite, no sharing with strangers.

name: Van Rooyen's Gate - South Africa / Lesotho Border
description:
good tarmac road until here.

friendly officers.

name: Meijer's Rust Guest Farm
description: Beautiful spot right next to an old cottage situated in the hills of a cattle farm. Very friendly owner. We could use all the facilities of the cottage (giant braai, gas cooker, fridge, 2 nice sinks, shower and a bath tube (all outside!!). Also possible to sleep in the cottage, but we love the bed in our Camper. Very rough and steep 3km farm pad to get there, really needs 4x4. We love this place! 150 rand pp.

name: Bloedrivier Battlefield Camping
description:
Large open Campsite with less schade from some trees directly at the Voortrekker Monument (3 minutes by walk). Ablutions need some mentainance, but okay. Very nice Owners, friendly and helpful.
Electricity at every Spot, no braai but we could use the mobile braai from the owners. okay for one stopover, if you don't want to drive no longer. we paid 200 Rand for 2 people and a car.

name: Udderlicious Milkshake Bar
description: Crazy milkshake bar. They have more than 40 flavours and they taste delicous! The staff are very friendly! They also sell light meals, slices of cakes, cold drinks, but the shakes are the best! Prices are between ZAR30 and ZAR50 for a milkshake. Don't miss it!

name: Gemsbokkie Camping & Chalet
description:
nice new small campground on farm
with animals an small butcher shop

name: Valschfontein
description: Very friendly owner, Open sites next to Pond, R200 for two of us. lots of birds, part of 100 year old farm. Clean ablution, nice kitted kitchen.

name: Tugela river
description: near Tugela river. easy access. very quiet. we arrived by night and stopped by this place. many possibilties for wild camping.

name: Isimangaliso wetland park
description:
Nice wild park for a one-day safari. Éléphant, rhino, hippo, Buffalos and many antelops ...
Worth it,  and in addition, beach access with free showers and bathrooms.
entry: 48R/adult, 36R/ child,  58R/ vehicle.  +5R/ pers community tax.
No map,  no information available at the gate, no map inside the park neither. You need to buy it: 20R.
All roads or loops clearly indicated on maps.me

name: motorbike equipment store
description: An accessory motorcycle store, aimed primarily, but not solely, at the Adventure/Dual Sport and Overlanding market, which sells all types of accessories, bike protection parts, soft-and-hard luggage/panniers, long range fuel solutions, fuel bladders, clothing, crash bars, extensive range of MAPS for sale, all with an AFRICAN focus, etc.

name: Ilanga Resort and Caravan Park
description:
Large campground. Sites with grass. Well maintained. Situated directly next to the beach. Has several entrances to the beach. More than enough ablution blocks. Quality ok. The environment however is not very attractive. For some action you need to go to Port Shepstone 7 kms away.
The campground does not give you that warm welcome you would expect. A paper full of regulations complete with fines if you do not stick to them is handed over when entering. The laundry room has 9 seperate papers with instructions hanging with do’s and dont’s.

name: riverbed on way  to Eksteenfontein
description: from Sendelingsdrift to Eksteenfontein about 15km before  E. after Modderfontein River take a small pist to South. Before ascending you cross the little riverbed of Klipneus R. Turn right into it and follow to a rock and a tree. shady and not seen from the road.

name: South of Elandsbaai
description:
Parking area South of Elandsbaai next to the beach. Fantastic view at the beach and the rocks behind. 
Take the road to Elandsbaai south and pass the fish fabrik left along the Railway. Use the designed parking area. We had a wonderful evening and night.

name: public Parking area at the beach
description: small Parking area next to holiday houses above the public beach with public toilets and cold shower. For inside car overnight only.

name: Kenton on Sea
description: Parking Place at the beach. Fantastic dunes at the sea and a rivermouth. A Picnic area is nearby but with no view at the sea. In Front of the ParkingPlace you are just at the beach.

name: Morgan Bay Caravan Park
description:
Nice quiet campsite which belongs to the hotel nearby. If you are lucky (in low season) you may get one of the places at the lagoon and enjoy the view on the Beach, which is rather close. Friendly staff, which did not mind that we brought our dog with us. Not a problem in low season: Please look after the poo ... 
If you do not want to cook / braai, you can eat in the restaurant of the hotel, which provides a nice view at the sea from the terrace. 290 ZAR per site in low season, 660 ZAR in high season.

name: Tortoni Guest Farm & Campsite
description: Very nice rustical campsite on a farm. Beautiful and peaceful, next to a small lake/dam. Very friendly owner, warm welcome. Small clean ablutions, if you need a hot shower, you must fire the donkey. Braai places and power points on all 6 sites and a big fire pit. We love this spot! 100 ZAR ppn

name: African Array Backpackers
description: Beautiful backpackers on a Hill 5 min car drive from the beach. Campground is nice but hard to find even land, sometimes it’s very windy and then it can be hard to find a place without wind. Owners are very nice and always around. Nice kitchen with everything you need and a VERY nice living area with a fireplace and amazing view. Free WiFi. Typical backpackers with a nice calm vibe, a hundred times better than the soulless South African caravan parks. R100 pppn for camping and it’s totally recommended!

name: Bosch Diesel Electric
description: Do service and repairs on all diesel cars. Had a small service on our Landrover (change of oil, oil filter and air filter). 3400 Rand. Had a good impression.

name: Ncome muséum, blood river battlefield.
description:
Site of a dramatic moment of the South African History: Voortrekkers fleeding british colony of the Cap to create a new country. Defeated many times by Zulu Warriors, a retaliation commando leaded by Pretorius arrived there and succeeded to defeat a huge zulu army.
2 museums propose interpretative and historical monuments: one about the zulu nation and history, the other about the Vootrekkers struggles to establish their new country.

name: flat pullout beside hill
description: flat pullout on the very very quiet dirt road D742. The small hill protects you from the West wind.

name: Kokerboomkloof
description: It was our favourite Camp in the park in the middle of lots of Trees and rocks. estonishing views own the valley towards Namibia. Luckely no wind. 4 sites with own ablution block. A pity that there was (is?)no water there but they told us at the gate. 250R per site.

name: Elandsheim
description: Campground, chalets, cabins and villas close to Dundee and Rorke's drift near the battlefields. Open grassy campsites with some shade. Sites has electricity with potable water at the ablutions. Ablutions clean and neat with hot water. Very friendly staff. Beautiful view of the mountains. R120pppn. Will definitely recommend staying here.

name: Grave of Piet Retief and Dingaanstat
description: Museum of Zulu Kings. Gravesite of Piet Retief and also site of Dingaanstat. R35pp adult

name: Richards Auto Services
description: Great Mechanic. Have had vehicles serviced and repaired here for years. I would recommend them to any Travelers needing mechanical assistance.

name: Cristy Sports
description: Tent repairs, tent manufacturing and camping equipment. Tel: +27 78 722 2652.

name: Battle of Spioenkop
description: Very informative and educational self guided walking trail about the battle of spioenkop between the British and the boers.  If you are a fan history this is a must. Very steep road to the summit but incredible views.

name: Spioenkop Dam Game Reserve
description: Campsites on the dam. 30 sites with electricity and water. Some areas with grass and some shade. Ablutions clean but run down. Hot water available. R90pppn

name: Sasol
description:
Next to tankstation you can buy third party insurance and you can change money.
Just see the lady's lined up for you. No hassling.

name: T.O. Strand Port Edward
description:
huge campsite (170 pitches) north of Port Edward. big places, some at the rivermouth. very nice beach at the sea. clean pool, Shop, Restaurant, washing machines etc
RND 230,- p plot+ RND 70.- registration fee (only once).
MONKEYS!!!

name: Kouga Dam Picnic Area
description: Stayed one night at this picnic area, very spacious and clean with trees, benches, BBQs and rubbish bins provided. Toilets available which were not locked. There is a gate to drive through with a sign stating the opening times for the dam visit from 7 am to 5 pm. It may be locked at times. There is no sign prohibiting camping.

name: Kliphuis Kamp
description:
CapeNature Campground between Clanwilliam and Pakhuis Pass. WildCard accepted. Very clean ablutions and nice staff. Quiet at night even though the camp is right next to the road. Long and short hiking trails, lots of shade through big trees. Cell phone signal only on the road.
We paid R120 for 2 people and car.

name: Mbashe Riverbend
description: Just east of the bridge turn north and follow the riverbanks to find a perfect place to camp. Probably not all year around depending on water level. Sandy tracks.

name: The Gates
description:
Community fee 5 RND/person
Very nice and rough tracks through wild nature.

name: Palm Springs Resort
description:
nice very clean campsites at the lagoon and close to the beach with good facilities
rate for retired off season 200 R per site

name: Mbotyi Campsite
description: Nice campsite with clean bathrooms and washing areas, plenty of shade and close to the beach. Next to the school so a bit noisy during the day. Security and fenced.

name: Fishriver mouth camp
description:
When we have been here it was more like wildcamping. Nobody around which is responsible for this campsite. Nearby living people told us about busy times around christmas but not for the rest of the year.
There are many large, grassy spots in walking distance to the nice beach. Otherwise no facilities available.

name: at the gorge
description: fantastic small place at the Mohocare gorge. Fron A1 follow the sign to Mohohase B&B. when road Turns right up the hill keep straight. then a flat place left at the gorge. Fantastic view.

name: Kotisephola Pass
description: from SaniPass about 10km East to the highest point 3.240m. before top take the gravelroad left behind the rocks. We had a wonderful night there (7°)😀

name: Redhouse Coffee Shop
description: Little coffee shop in the sailing club building. Great place for a coffee or light lunch, with lovely breakfasts that are really good value - egg on toast with beans just R10! Also licensed if you enjoy a cold beer with lunch! Owner very friendly and welcoming. Peaceful and pleasant spot on the river.

name: Stompdrift Dam
description:
Lovely spot by the dam, shame about the campsite! 
Swarming with ants, the worst I’ve seen anywhere - but that’s fine, it’s part of the wildlife. Very noisy campers, but that could be a one off bad neighbour.
Ablutions were kept locked and  there was only one key, which we were expected to share with the other campers - except the person in possession refused to hand it over, and once they’d give to bed there was no way of getting it anyway!
Power points didn’t work, ablutions were in an awful state (I almost threw up from the smell). In the evening the tap water ran brown, by morning there was no running water at all. Consequently the build up of waste in the toilets was horrendous. 
As I sat by the braai in the evening, a piece of rubbish blew past. I looked down to see a sanitary towel on the ground next to me. Would not come here again if you paid me.
Complained and therefore only paid R50 per person.

name: Pumlas Place
description: On a hill overlooking the waves and ocean Pumlas Place has a small spot to park my campervan and camp. There is a big kitchen and dining room/lounge to chill and use as needed. Fresh oysters and cold beer! The price is not really clear as it seems to change all the time but R120 per night should be acceptable.
