I enjoyed chatting with Pumla and catching up on all the Transkei gossip, she is a classic!

name: Sentinel carpark
description:
at official Sentinel Carpark ( with guardians) where the walk starts to Sentinel. had a Quiet Night here before the walk. 
road to Carpark is partially rough!

name: Next to R712 near Golden Gate NP
description: South of R712 next fence to Golden Gate National Park pad toward the Mountains. Beautiful view at the wall and over the land.

name: Cannon Rocks
description:
Cannon Rocks Holiday Resort. Very large(74) camp sites and very friendly staff. 
Well equipped.

name: in front of church
description: Nice remote place in front of church just after crossing the river with the ferry. Good shelter against the wind.

name: The Kraal
description: Plenty of rooms and dorms available as well. Food can be provided, honesty bar and relaxing sitting area and lounge. Difficult road to get the last km’s done with steep rocky uphills, mud and corrugated road but well worth it! Don’t drive in or just after rain I suggest.

name: T.O. Strand leisure resort and caravan
description: We arrived here on a Sunday afternoon. The reception was closed but the security man helped us to find a place near the river.  Big campsite but well organised.  Clean ablutions. R240 and R60 admission fee. Shop closed on Sunday.Nice place to stay a couple of days.

name: River Destiny Lodge
description: Nice and family run Lodge and camp ground. 220 for camping. Not accessible directly from N1.  Either via Gariep or Colesburg

name: Oberammergau Caravan Park
description:
Small and nice caravan Park and campsite in senekal. Near on the Road N5. Lovely and clean showers and Toilets. Small Swimmingpool. No shadow. No Problems with big vehicels
ppn 150 ZAR

name: Katse Dam
description: little Plateau near the Dam next to the road nur hoffen with view over lake and Dam.

name: Malibamatso river
description: at Malibamatsu river below Katse Dam.  Gravel road along the river with nice places. Fishing young men sell Fresh cought trouts😀

name: flat side of Mpofana Road
description:
flat grassy side of this super quiet dirt road.
very beautifull landscape

name: Tiffendell Alpine Retreat
description: Ski resort with camping on the bunny slope in summer only. Grassy area with no shade. No electricity at site but you can run an extension. No water at site. Beautiful views of the mountains with the Ben Mcdhur pass behind you. It is the highest pass in SA. Ablutions needs updating and semi clean. Host Lee very friendly and helpful. Has MTN internet. R100pppn.

name: Karnmelkspruit River Camping
description: Nice grassy campsites with some shade. Camping on the river with trout fishing and pheasant hunting.  No electricity at site but water near site. Ablution nice and clean with 1 shower and 1 bathtub. Electricity in ablution is solar power and gas heater for hot water. R110pppn.

name: Steepside Campground
description:
10 Grassy, shady campsites with 2 ablutions on the river with willow trees and nestled against sandstone cliffs.  Braai areas and picnic tables. Hiking trail to bushman paintings and also available trout fishing, horse riding and tennis. Might be inaccessible after heavy rain. Although we didn't stay here we met the owners who were very nice. R90pppn. 
0826293655

name: Senquane river
description:
nice Place at the Senquane river. At the bridge near the lodge follows the dirt path along the river. Several places to Stay.
As there are roadworks further on  (maybe the build a new road across the river) thus Place might be impossible in future.
we spent a quiet night there.

name: Black & white spare parts
description: Massive workshop for mainly 4x4 heavy duty trucks. We had our Iveco 80.14 serviced there. Don’t be in a hurry because they apply african time, but are very knowledgable, friendly and not pricey

name: Arniston Beach Parking
description: Public parking area at the beach in front of the Entrance to the Waenhuiskrans Grotto area. Might be busy in high season. Good cell phone signal (MTN). Busy during daytime, quiet at night.

name: Witput Country Lodge
description: Just a little gras space next to the lodge. It is noisy during the day but night is ok. Doesnt look clean but abolution is ok. Good for a one night  stop over. owner is very friendly.

name: Quthing river
description: there are some places to stay along the scenic route along the Quthing river from A4 to Ha Makoae.

name: Rubicon Accommodation
description: This place does no longer offer camping...they lead you to the Hotel or to another place. It is just a guesthouse.

name: vanderkloof dam Bush camp
description: big gras area next to the dam. turn to the left in a small service road just after the village sign. in the areal are two old little houses. not in use anymore. its quiet and you have a Great view over the lake.

name: Creative canvas works
description: Canvas and zip repairs and replacement. High quality zip replacement and canvas work on anything custom. They let us pull the 4x4 into their gated compound to remove the tent and even lent us tools and gave us coffee. Next day service for big job, decent prices. They make custom safari tents and all kinds of off-road trailers so they get it. Owners Gustof and Sandy are great, highly recommend

name: Thompson Dam
description: Nice site directly at the dam. The gate was not locked. Later a security guard arrived. However he spoke very English and did not open the toilets. In the morning we were locked in and no sign of our security guard he went home. We had to call the assistance number on the gate and someone from the city had to come and open the gate. We did not pay anything but it could be that the people were to embarrassed for locking us in and did not charge us.

name: R388 between Richmond an Graaff-Reinet
description: Right next to the gravel road. Little place next to a fence with a stunning view to the mountains. No traffic so it is quiet.

name: Thompson Dam
description:
official campsite at Thompson Dam near Elliot. FOR FREE !
Just phone the number given at the gate.
Lovely grassy area at the lake with toilets (showers out if order), braais and electricity. Fantastic view at the mountains behind.
we were the only one here!

name: Fish Eagle Camp
description:
Campsite belongs to a grape and olive oil farm and the B&B.

Camping on green Gras next to Berg River and the grape/wineyards.Small swimming Pool.

Electricity and water on the site. Braai facilities. 
Clean ablutions Block with hot shower and flushing toilet.

Good signal with vodacom and 3G data.

Small self service shop where one can get ice and cool drinks. Wood. Buy and swap books. They call it „Honesty Shack“ ... Very
Nice !

Nice owner from the UK. Rhodesien Ridge puppy takes care :-)

100 Rand pppn. Electricity 30 Rand extra.

name: Sanctuary
description:
Great beautiful place.
Good toilets and showers, kitchen, fridge. 
Electricity points.

300 per site, 14 kms from Zebra mountain park

Call for directions  ‭(082) 821-3254‬.

name: Twee Rivieren/Two Rivers Border post
description:
On the main reception building from the Kgalagadi Park there is a desk for Botswana Immigration and one for South Africa Immigration. 
We arrived from Mata-Mata and after a couple of days we proceeded to Botswana. The proceed was very simple:
- the Botswana immigration stamp in our passports 
- no stamp on the carnet 
- no fees to be paid 
- a quick vehicle inspection was done (they didn't ask about food)

name: Montagu
description: Nice grassy camping lots of shade. We payed 170 rand per pitch

name: Featherbed
description:
Rustic farm near Dortrecht. selfcatering rooms up to 8. meals  can be ordered in advance. Very friendly farmers invited us to stay with our Camper. Interesting Rockart was shown to us. 
highly recommended!
Just phone before so the farmgate is opend.
+27 (0) 824156818

name: Urquhart Camping
description: Big campsite with some big trees for shadow. There are also little chalets available. The abolution is old but fairly Clean. 150 per sites per night. Quite close to the village and the gates of the NP.

name: Old Anenous Pass
description:
nice quiet place on side of old pass road out of sight of main road R 382
with beautiful view over the valley!

name: Pearson Park Resort Camp B
description: Campsite at the river with nice view on the dunes. No electricity, ablutionblock with toilet, scullery and shower (hot water).

name: Pearson Park Resort Camp A
description: Without ablution. You have to walk to nearby camp B. Otherwise also very nice place at the River. Reception at Pearson Park Resort.

name: Redefin
description: Nice little campground right in Steynsburg. Gras no Shadow. Just one space for big rigs right at the entrance. Very charming owner.  Abolution is small but clean. 100 ZAR pPpn.

name: Barkly East campsite
description: Campsite is open and in good shape. Big lawn. a few trees to give shade. Good wifi, nice shower and toilet with small kitchen.

name: Matatiele Caravan Park
description: Nice grassy campground with little chalets near town. Sites between trees with electricity and water, quiet except for a few cars. 80R pp. The main entrance is low but a side gate can be opened for higher vehicles.

name: Commando Drift Nature Reserve Camping
description: Beautiful location overlooking the dam lake. Sites with power 170psite without power (no shade) 150psite. Quiet and peaceful even on weekend, only some fishing visitors at the damlake. Stayed st the powered sites (shade, nice view) alone,  toilet near the site showerblock near the cabins can be used (5min walk). Vodacom signal is available.

name: Groot Rivier Poort
description: Stony little plateau South of Grölt R. interesting canyon and challangig 4x4 trail

name: North of Patensie
description: 21km before Patensie (Comming via Steytlerville- Antoniesberg) beside the 4x4-trail with wonderful view.

name: Bayview 4x4 Service Centre
description:
Paul is an excellent and completely honest mechanic specializing in 4x4s. Hands down the best service I've received from any mechanic anywhere. Highly recommended. Speaks English, German, and Afrikaans. 

083 685 6989 or 021 557 6462

Email 4x4bayview@gmail.com

4 Estoril Road
Killarney Gardens
Cape Town 7441

name: camping in front Police station
description:
quiet Spot in front of police station

After talking with the cops i was allowed to stand in front  the SAPD with my truck

name: Lake Eland Game Reserve
description: A huge area with game such as Zebra, Giraffe, Impala, Gin etc. 2 camp areas with big gras sites incl braai and electricity at each spot. Clean abolution. Activities such as zip line riding, oribi gorge views, hiking Trails etc are available. Sites cost 400 ZAR per night for up to 4 people during the week. Nice place for viewing the gorge and enjoying some activities.

name: Marcia's Studio
description:
We stayed at Marcia's Studio (art & sculpture) near Calitzdorp. Flat grassy area to stay - Outdoor Cinema at weekend! 
bring your own facilities (Food etc) - you can expect wonderful nature at a small river and an extraordinary place😀

name: Shell fuel station gateway motors
description: Stayed one night at the Shell station behind the truck fueling pumps. It seems this place is also used by truck drivers. Few pedestrians pass by security by the 24/7 fuel station as well as a secured area of the N4 toll station operator. Free overnight stay. There are also a chicken fast food place, Sophies Bistro and a huge farm stall next to the Shell station.

name: The Jetty River Lodge
description: A nice Lodge and campsite right next to the river. Bit noisy as it is close to the street. Nice care taker. Sites are in gras some big trees for Shadow. Abolution is clean. 100 ZAR pPpn.

name: Crosspoint above beach near Heroldsbay
description: at the end of a gravel road at a big cross looking over the bay of Heroldsbay. nice view at Sea. Some walkers and fishermen parking here in the evening.

name: Rooihoek Campsite (Baviaanskloof NR)
description:
Rooihoek is also an official campsite (next to Doodsklip) in the Baviaanskloof. 6 places, but you don't see each other. Bush camp feeling with only some shared long drop toilets and a braai stand on every site. 
Beneath the red cliff, where the campsite name is coming from, we saw some people swimming. No phone coverage.

name: Donkieskraal
description:
Nice campsite in a private game park at the top of a Hill with nice views over the valley. Clean ablutions with hot water. Five pitches with power.

Camping now 140pppn, with nice pool and bar - friendly staff and extra pitches. Chalets and glamping tents available.

name: Wagendrift Camping (KZN Wildlife)
description:
Nice Camping/Caravanpark  at the dam. Grassy sites with braai and nearby plugpoints.
For one night ok, its rather noisy, you hear the N3 road and trains are passing at the other side of the lake and on weekends..... like everywhere on caravansites in Southafrica! 85Rppn.

name: Moutain splendour camping/caravanpark
description:
Typical southafrican caravanpark with all facilities. Many shady gravelsites spacious under big trees some sites with  view to the mountains. If the weather is cloudy and rainy it's a little bit dark...
168Rppn in low season (pensioners 50%). We stayed 1 night because we needed a washing maschine.

name: Rosemead Artisan bakery
description: Great little bakery run by a lovely young couple, make amazing croissant and pain au chocolat. Very close to caravan park

name: Qacha's Nek
description: We stopped here for lunch and thought it would be a great place to wild camp, in the middle of a nest of boulders.  Close to the border with Lesotho.

name: Double Mouth Campsite
description: Very nice campsite situated in a little nature reserve next to Morgans Bay.  Big trees allow for shadow and every site has its own braai. This Spot is also the starting point of a long trail to East London. 225 pN per site. That includes the fee for the reserve. Abolution is good and clean. The view over the ocean and the surounding hills is fantastic.

name: Kleinod beach
description:
Parking area in Kleinod. Fantastic seaview. friendly people.
Had a lot of nice talks and a Quiet night.

name: sunset caravan park
description: Campground with grassy campsites, water and electricity.  In town next to N12 so bit noisy at night. Ablutions clean and nice. Good for overnight stay. R180 per site.

name: Nature Rest Campsite
description: Nice little campsite down in a valley.  Gras and shadow places. Abolution is clean and there is a laundry. 220 ZAR pN per site.

name: Doornkraal Campsite
description: Nice and peaceful basic campsite in the valley at a river about 12 km from the reception (reception 5km from park entrancegate). Communal dining lapa and washing area. 2 toilethuts and a really nice double open shower with hot water. The sites are not numbered just choose your own spot some have a braai. Low season 150Rppn (high 180Rppn) As we where there there was a discount of 40%  (KNZ special until 27th march).

name: in the fields
description:
flat place between the fields, along a very quiet dirt road.
nothing special but quiet

name: lake view south
description:
large open flat grass fields around the lake
local fisherrmen during the day

name: False Bay
description: Beautiful KNZ Campsite by the lake. We arrived after 4pm when the reception was closed. No problem you pay the next day. We told them that KNZ has 40% discount until march 27. The regular price was 80Rppn (with no electricity, we had to tell them that the power didn't work). So we paid 96R for 2 per night (plus the Isimangaliso park fee). Ablution not nice but ok. When we arrived no hot water, in the morning somebody turns one the hot water. Next day the same. Very quit place and beautiful views! In the morning we did a 6km trail.

name: False Bay Park (Isimangaliso park)
description: Beautiful small park at the shore of the St. Lucia lake. 3 hiking trails (12, 8, 6 km). Nice picnic points between Sandy point, Rocky point and lister point. Many birds, pelicans and flamingos aswell. There is a KNZ camping inside, you have to drive about 4km to the reception. At the entrance gate you have to pay the Isimangaliso entry fees. If you stay overnight there is a additional overnight fee of 7Rpp. The entry is 42pp+5Rpp conservation fee + 7Rpp overnight fee. If you stay more nights you have to tell before otherwise they charge you again the entry fee (the computersystem!)

name: Le Roux B+B
description: Small campsite at the back of the house in town. About 4 sites. Not much shade or grass. Electricity at site but no water.  Ablutions clean and nice. At R100 per nite it is a bargain!!.

name: Swallowtail Country Estate
description:
A nice little campsite. All grass and manicured like a private garden. Good and clean ablution. In walking distance to the village and the hikes.
ZAR180 pppn.

name: Van Stadens River Mouth Resort
description: Big shaded and grassy spots as well as more closely packed sites with permanent caravans, many day visitors on weekend but some spots (like 50 and 51) give lots of privacy and the beach and river closeby. R240 per site for 2 px and R50 pp extra.

name: Buffelo Bay Caravan Park
description: Right at the ocean, beautiful location and well established and clearly for pensioners. Didn’t feel welcome in my old campervan next to all the long term pensioners and the lady at reception didn’t have places because next week school holidays start, clearly a time not to come here, although we were allocated a spot for the night. R400 per night is expensive as well.

name: Summerstrand Hotel
description: A big old Hotel. No charme but good for preparing  the car before shipping.  Parking is big enough for big rigs. 1050 ZAR  pN for 2 p incl breakfast.

name: Die Mond
description: This is a very nice campsite on a river! Beautiful view! Cash only

name: Piet se Staning
description: Bush campsite in the valley amongst trees. Also known as Die Hel.

name: capetown backpackers
description: big and nice hostel with mixed dorms. prices start from 200. good beds, nice hot showers, big kitchen, terras inside. bar, restaurant only for breakfast. friendly personal. in the middle of capetown centre.

name: view site
description: Possible place for overnight near A3 on the montain top. we did not stay there but it seems goog with nice view.

name: Sterkfontein Dam Nature Reserve
description: You can camp by the damlake next to the caravan/camping site (200R) for 100R (2 people and car). Very beautiful scenery on to the lake and the Drakensberg. Zebras grasing nearby. 2 small ablution blocks have water but it is run down. We went to the ablutionblock of the camping. Very good hot shower (not to hot).

name: Die Poort Campground
description: Quiet and peaceful campground in the rocky valley. some shade no grass or electricity. 6 sites some nestled in the rocks. Ablutions clean and build into a rock outcropping. Potable water at sites. Owner very friendly. Beautiful stargazing at night. This is a must do on your trip.

name: Swim with Stingrays!
description:
Swim with Stingrays!
Here you can swim with stingrays for free! 
Optional:There is a 5r parking fee, and you can purchase fish food to feed them at the shop next to the beach
This information was provided by Cape Agulhas Backpackers Hostel.

name: Camel Rock
description: Very chilled outdoor setup in beautiful Scarborough with interesting characters, good locally made beer and a fishbraai on Sunday eve for only R75. Great place to relax and listen to some live music

name: karooboom
description: big restaurant. everythings home made and fresh. really nice woodtstock feeling with also all the furniture is made from resicled stuff. some sweet animals walk around. runned by nice family. also good wifi. have also small shop

name: cango wildlife ranch
description: small but very nice "special" zoo. you can pay entrance 340r and visit all the animals while walking around. but also pay 240r extra per encounter. they do 5 different ones. you can go in the cage with big cheetah and pet it. also you can go in a cage in the water with the crocodiles. ore pet a big snake, several ore baby cheetah. they have a restaurant and also free places were you walk true the cages with kangaroos, birds, big bats. i liked it and the personnel is very friendly

name: Uilenkraalsmond
description:
Big resort with campsites, semi permanent houses and self catering chalets. Direct access to the beach with posibility to swim.
Simple but nice and green carvan park directly by the sea. The toilets and showers are old but clean. In the toilets theres no toilet papers.
Off season we paied for camper and 2 adults 170 rand per night (electricity incl.). In high season it would be 360 zar.
There are no dogs allowed
This place does not give pensioners discount if you does not produce a pensioners card, even if you are 70 years old according to your I'd

name: Voortrekker Park
description: Vortrekker is a municipal resort. Caravan Park is simple and not very clean but for one night ok. The toilets and showers are good and clean. But in the toilets there is no toiletpaper. Price in mid season is 176 zar for one site with 2 adults.

name: Kromrivier Cederberg Park
description:
PRICE JANUARY 2022: 320 ZAR FOR 2 PEOPLE.
•  18 Campsites
•  All vehicle access
•  Each site has its own private ablution facilities with hot water
•  Each site has its own braai facility and electricity
•  Sink
•  Power point
•  Free wifi
•  Braai facilities
 Slightly more private than Sanddrift Campsite but you can't really swim in the river in front of the campsite. (Actually you don't even see the river because it's very bushy). Nice view over the mountains valley. Fast free wifi throughout the campsite. Excellent craft beer sold at their shop. Disa Pool hike is very nice but water is really cold. It's around 18km roundtrip from the campsite but you can also start the trail at the parking lot 4km away. No Vodacom signal.

name: Padlangs Country Restaurant
description: Very nice restaurant with excellent choice of food. Huge garden area and a nice playground for the kids. Only thing negative: They close at 16:00 hours.

name: Nice Shady Spot Under Tree
description: Nice camping spot just a minute off the road. Under a tree with a leveled concrete slab (we think its put there just for camping)

name: Vallei Motors Mechanic and Workshop
description:
Amazing Mechanic in Patensie, prob the best in Town.
If you have any Problems after driving the Baviaans or before, stop here and let it fix.

Good Price and amazing Work, you can watch and they explain what they do. No basic mechanic, way better than that!

Across the Road is a Spar so you can go and Buy some drinks while you wait

name: Nama Bike Camp
description:
Awesome motorcycle orientated camp site, cars allowed too!

Luxury tents with bedding too!
Breakfast, lunch, dinner and cold drinks

Great place to stop :D

*February 2022: now 110 per person to camp and completely worth it! Great place, delicious food, kind owner and highly recommended!

name: River Lodge
description: Beautiful Campground on the Vaalriver. 2 campsites with shade, electricity  but no grass. Each campsite has its own ablution and kitchen. Ablutions neat and clean. Lodge has swimming pool. R200 per night.

name: Riverside Holiday Resort
description: Nice grasy place right at the Brandwag river. Price is 100ppn.

name: Bains Kloof Pass
description: A patch close to the road but good for a night with fabulous views.

name: Kyleu Bushcamp
description: Very quiet campsite with friendly owners. You have your own clean ablutionblock with hot water and flushing toilet. No fences. Zebra's were passing by. Good place to do some drives through the Dinokeng Park.

name: Witsand poshpackers / Barry’s
description: After checking out the campsites we decided to rather stay at this hostel. Nice facilities and good atmosphere. The lovely new owners have renovated it completely and have a story to tell! (They were running a farm in Zimbabwe)

name: Cango Campsite
description: Big grassy field with trees for shade. Clean ablutions good hot showers. Swimming pool. 219 Rand for two people and a car.

name: Olienhof Restcamp
description: Small grassy campground with shade and good showers. 200 Rand for 2 p and a car when we were there.

name: Dennes Engineering
description: Very well equipped place for welding, drilling, milling and other sorts of metal works. Had my roofrack repaired. Friendly people.

name: Falcon Rock
description: Below the Ladys Slipper, low range of hills is this very comfortable and safe campsite. Gary will welcome you and the restaurant is good.

name: Kliphuis Akkommodasie
description:
B&B, which also has a small nice campsite. Payed 250 ZAR pp for one night.
Tel.083 2272 407 or 023 4711 870

name: the beehive
description: its a beautiful campsite with all you need

name: Riverside Country Club & Caravan Park
description: Nice grassy level campsites next to a river. About 3km from N12 so a perfect overnight stop. Small amount of road noise from N12 at night. Didn’t see any other camping around Kimberley

name: Path to Diaz Cross
description: Here it's the start of the path through the dunes which takes to Diaz Cross. Length km 1.3, 25 minutes.

name: Diaz Cross
description: You can rich these place with a km 3.7 walk on the beach from Boknes or km 1.3 through the dunes.

name: GPS4AFRICA
description:
The best stocked motorcycle adventure shop in Africa. They stock all sorts of adventure stuff and overlanding goodies for motorcycles. 
Also sell and service gps for cars and bikes

name: Pyper se Boom
description: Very basic bush camp, some trees may  give shade. Beautiful scenery, very quiet and lonenely. Payed 128 ZAR for 2, excl. park fees

name: builders
description: they do not refill campingaz bottle.  only cadac

name: Onseepkans
description: Easy friendly border crossing with nice staff on both sides

name: Seal point
description:
Nice little parking lot overlooking the popular surf spot. Stayed here a few nights and no one bothered me.
Busy during the day with surfers and fishermen (week ends and holidays).
Small shop in town and a full supermarket in St francis Bay.
Washrooms were not super clean but the toilet flushed. Showers when there isnt a water crisis..

name: Wildcamp between Wuppertal and Eselbank
description: open space next to the track,  very quiet and view over the mountains. Can be cold at night

name: Miss Chrissie Country House
description: Very basic camping in the yard of a working farm

name: Twin Rivers
description: The Greyton Eco Camp is now Twin Rivers. Lots of space, mostly grassy with some shade from big pine trees. No electricity but water taps everywhere. Clean solar showers. Nice riverside setting but river water levels may be lower in summer months. Friendly owners. Now R80 pppn - excellent value. Whatsapp 060 901 9708.

name: Auto Repair Services
description: Mechanical workshop doing repairs to all vehicles and 4x4,s

name: Dawn Ridge Guest House
description: Nice and inexpensive guesthouse. 140 rand pp for en-suite double room, 120 pp for shared backpackers. John prepares a VERY filling breakfast for 60 additional rand (we had pancakes, cheese omelet, toast, sausages, yoghurt, a banana, fruit juice, coffee/tea, cereals and milk). A nice three course meal is 100 rand.We are cycling and parking the bicycles in our room (we had a double room) was no problem.

name: Stoneybrooke
description: They rent cabins and welcome campers. Very quiet spot, among the meadows. Even place at the river. Friendly people. They do meals and laundry too. Ablutions in one of the cabins or near the swimming pool soon to be finished. 120 pppn, wifi at an additional charge.

name: Matamba bush campsite
description: 5mn driving from the main road.A very nice bush campsite in a game  reserve. beautiful site fully equipped . you can walk by yourself to see the animals. we paid 800 rand for 2 adults and 2 children per night.

name: Klein Pella Guest Farm
description: The camping belongs to a big date and grape farm. The campsites are nice, there are some trees and you have view on the mountains. Some campsites have private ablutions, anyway there are quite some clean ablution blocks with hot water. You can drive around the farm area and to the Orange river. It is a quiet peaceful place. The fee is 150 Rand pp.

name: LR Sales & Service
description: Landrover parts & service dedicated to everything Landrover

name: Pretoria Backpackers
description: Good clean accommodation. Free WiFi and friendly staff.

name: Entrance to Waterberg Wilderness Camp
description: This is the actual entrance to the Wilderness reserve. The camping is another 10+ km further into the reserve. Another two gates.

name: sir henrys barkly guest house
description: nice big and clean proper guesthouse. private rooms with all facilitys. Electric blanket. tv. föhn. douche. towles. soap Coffee thee fridge and microwave.  single 500  double 700 rand. wifi and secure parking

name: Amber  Lagoon
description: Very beautiful  place with campsites, dorms and huts, B&B. swimming pool for hot days. they do not sell alcohol so bring your own

name: Wildcamp on top of a hill at cellphone tower
description: Nice spot next to a cellphone tower/antenna on top of a hill with nice views over the valley and surrounding mountains. Great stars and sky at night! Can be windy. The road to the spot is partly quite steep, but doable without problems. No one came by or disturbed us during our stay. Good mobile reception;)

name: Dizzys Pub and Restaurant
description:
Great place for pizza, burger, lasagne and good craft beer! It looks like a pub, but has a really good range of food! Pizzas were the best we had in all through Africa, crispy thin and delicious! Original wood oven for the pizza. Also good wine selection. Prices for pizza range from 80 to 120 ZAR, burger starts also from 80 ZAR. 
Safe parking right in front of restaurant. Highly recommended!

name: Craft Burger Bar
description: Great little burger restaurant with nice craft beer selection and also good vines. Here you can enjoy good burgers for reasonable prices. You can either easily create your own burger as you prefer or choose one from the menu. Basic burger starts at 49 ZAR. Also great and tasty fries!

name: Tweede Tol
description:
Cape Nature  World heritage campsite part of the Limietberg  Nature Reserve located on the beautiful Bainskloof Pass. Twenty campsites with Braai  area.  Clean amenities with hot showers & bath tub. Walking tracks. Running creek through some campsites. No wifi. 
Can use Wild card at this site. 
R160 per site . Off season 40% off. We paid R 96 for 2 people with wild card including permit . 

Gate times 8am - 6pm  Friday’s closes at 8pm 
Reservations Tel: 021 483 0190

name: Gateway off-road Centre
description: Mechanical workshop and Off Road centre mostly Land Rover but good for other 4x4

name: Brake Super Service
description:
If you need work done on your brakes or clutch, welding or general repairs then this is an excellent garage.  It's run by Anthony and Spider who offer excellent service at reasonable prices.
On my Toyota Prado I had new front discs and pads fitted, the rear discs skimmed, rear pads fitted, a handbrake drum skimmed, handbrake shoes re-lined, a rear axle oil seal replaced and some welding done and was extremely pleased with the workmanship and service given.
They will work on any vehicle and go above and beyond to either locate or even make parts - they made a special clip to hold the handbrake shoes in for me as it was missing and one couldn't be easily obtained in South Africa.
They even rang me a couple of hours after completing the work to ensure I was happy with the way the brakes were performing.  I would highly recommend this garage.

name: Wildcamp between South Africa and Lesotho
description: quiet place at the river,  good for one night on the way to the border of Lesotho. next to the road but no traffic at night. beautifull road from Elliot to here,  but acces only with 4x4 and if it's dry. road very bad

name: mini market
description: small shop. but they also have warm food an coffee to go. and a public toilet. close to the fuel station

name: tarentilos country venue &accommodation
description: chalets under big trees. each with big verandas and braii facilities.  around a pond impala, bushbuck and bles bock are running over the compound. cell. 0835313063

name: Modjadji cycad reserve
description: Nice place on a hill with plenty of cycads some of them 5m and higher. Pick nick spot on site.  Entrance 25 zar

name: Umzumbe Surf Camp
description:
Lovely little grassy campground on the waterfront. Safe behind a gate that gives you direct access to the beach. All geared to surfing, which is apparently excellent here. Cosy little house with all facilities. Terrace, garden, braai. Place for 4 to 5 trucks. The rest is tents for surfers. There are two private rooms and two 4-6 p dorms. Bungalows for up to 6 p available. 
Camping 100 rand pppn. Dorm 200 pppn. Private rooms 400 per room pn. Bungalow over 1000 pn. Surflessons available. Fully equiped kitchen, hot shower, clean toilet. A gem on the coast.

name: wildcamp at river
description: very nice and quiet spot at the river, not really free but nobody came to us

name: EJ-Auto Electrical
description:
If you have an electrical problem with your car, they can fix it. The owner and his staff are very skilled and helpfull. Also rewireing etc. Specially Toyota.
They do all the elec. work for Toyota Malalane.
Paying by card or cash possible.

name: Chill Inn Guesthouse
description:
Very friendly place. Double rooms from R500.
You can use kitchen and fridge.
Car parking secured.

name: CanvasWorld
description:
Small workshop with nice owner Martin.
All your handmade tents, covers, sags, bags etc. In pvc and ribstop materials in every color.
Very competitive prices and good work.

name: The Rectory
description: Great guesthouse in ClanWilliam within walking distance of restaurants and shops.

name: Timbila Game Reserve
description:
4 campsites in game reserve bush environment with good ablutions. Deep freezer and sink with hot water. Each campsite has a nice fire ring, table, seating area and a light (that can be switched off!) R150 pppn plus R100 per vehicle. Very peaceful, wild thorn trees, lots of different hoofed animal and bird species as well as vervet monkeys (beware, they will steal unattended food!), mountains all round and great star gazing at night. Hiking and 4x4 trails, firewood for sale. Best to book in advance (email: info@timbila.co.za). They also have tented and cabin type self catering accommodation next to a river in the reserve but currently the area is suffering from the widespread drought in this part of RSA so the river was dry during our stay. Highly recommended if you like the solitude and peace of the bush. Entry to campsite is along short distance on narrow gravel track so big rigs might get scratched, and turn arounds could be challenging. 

Spotty vodacom signal, 3G but very intermittent.

name: Lake Pleasant Resort
description: Well maintained & attractive park like setting with established trees and grassed sites with 220V electricity. Excellent ablutions & security. R240 pn for 2 persons. They also have self catering accommodation on site. Beach, lagoon, shops & restaurants nearby. Could be very busy in summer and school holidays.

name: Wild spirit Lodge and campsite
description: Backpackers campsite with dinner and breakfast, ideally located for the otter trail. Cars can be left and transport to start/end of trail can be provided.

name: Aan-die-Oewer
description: About 4 - 5 campsites some with shade. Very well kept facilities, ablutions old but clean. Now R200 per night per site pensioners rate, R300 normal rate. Max 6 per site.

name: Ellensrust Municipal Caravan Park
description: Very large campsite,grassed but no shade. Direct access to the beach. Ablutions old but clean, however we arrived after hours and out of season, were given keys to the ablutions only to find no hot water. Lady on duty then gave us keys to a chalet so we could use the showers there. Ok as a stopover but nothing special, think it gets really busy in season.

name: Grass Roof
description: Great restaurant and farmstall with ready made meals, cakes and farm produce. Breakfast and lunches only

name: Gravel flat spot right next to the road
description:
If you travelling by bike and running out of power for the day, in the immediate vicinity you’re out of luck. Everything is fenced. There is a little gravel flat spot here where there is no vegetation (at the moment). The place is next to the road ie highly visible. There is space for about three tents. It’s just for emergency situations.

Actually about 1km up the road there is a little farm, not much life but failing that facing the farm there is a big dig out where you can easily camp and should be sheltered from north wind too. May light get flooded in rainy season. If you have some more km in your legs there are some more farms about 10/20km up the road.

name: Papkuilsfontein camp site
description:
Papkuilsfontein is a large farm with guesthouse and lodges. However they have this camp site where I was given permission to camp. Is about 2km from the guesthouse (sandy double track). 
There was no one when I camped as it was winter and rainy.
There is no electricity but there is running water from bore hole.  The water is a bit salty but I drunk it for the last two days I’m still alive.
There are pit fire places. A dishwashing station with dish soap. 
There is separate building with one room with toilet. And one room with basin and shower. You can turn on a gas operated heating system for hot water. There is no electricity but there are plenty of oil lamps around the facilities. 
I was able to pitch my tent in the shower room as it was really windy and raining for two days. There is no much space and the Hubba Hubba barely fit. Had to place two bags with sand outside the boot to avoid the water flooding the room.
All in all is a great spot to camp.

name: Gogo’s Guest House
description:
Most welcoming and friendly place you’ll find in Coffee Bay. They offer fully equipped  tent or an studio accommodating up to 4 people. We paid 250rand per person including breakfast. Karen (one of the owners) even invited us for diner and a drink while they showed the rugby and had a potluck with all their friend. They make you feel right at home and can show you around. 

Close to all the local hotspots and backpackers if you want to go for a drink or whatever.

Great beds, good shower. Just a really nice and relaxed place to spend night or two and explore the area.

name: Midas Walker's
description: They have a lot of car parts (oil, electro things) camping, outdoor, fishing. The stuff is very friendly and helpfull. They know where they have the things and if they dont have it, they know where you can bay it.

name: Frontier Agencies
description:
Resin & Fibreglass, Polyurethane Suppliers
East London

name: Mpila Camp
description: Please note : this is not a campsite! No camping allowed! Self catering accommodation. Tented accommodation or self catering huts available. Beautiful and comfortable accommodation but shouldn't be on this list as a campsite.

name: Woodlands Cottages and backpackers
description: Secure, Hot showers, common kitchen,big open sight under trees, 4G MTN

name: Cuckoo Ridge
description: Cuckoo Ridge is a lovely B&B just outside Hazyview on the R536 Sabie road. Ideal place to stay for a night or longer before heading into the famous Kruger National park, or before heading home from your Kruger or Mozambique holiday.

name: Great wildcamp hidden from the road
description: I didn’t see the other other spot down the road as I didn’t check the map however the place where I am now is perfect if you are going to pitch your tent. It’s away from the road and there are little canyons so you are really hidden 360 degrees. It’s quiet and wonderful sunset.

name: Klipdraai Karavaan Park
description:
CAMPING:
The caravan park has 350 caravan sites with beautiful green grass and many trees. Stays have not been marked out and allocated, so you have the freedom of choice where to camp. Each stand has a 220 volt / 30 amps electric power point and water points are located nearby. The modern and clean ablution facilities, and laundry areas make the visit a comfortable experience. There are 10 ablution facilities with showers, baths, toilets, paraplegic toilets, sinks and power points for razors and hair dryers and 4 washing areas available

name: Albergo Backpackers
description: Very nice backpackers with an affordable camping option (vehicle camping is just in the car park but there is a secure gate). Dorms 160pp, camping 80pp. Kitchen, strong hot showers, free WiFi, very nice lounge and dining area with fire in the winter evenings, cute garden with seats and braai/fire, and a bar to buy drinks. Very welcoming staff.

name: Bushwillows
description:
Bush camp in Private Nature Reserve, part of Greater Kruger Park. Rustic Bush kitchen,  outside showers and toilets ...all with the charm of the bush. Unique opportunity to spend a night or two in the company of hopefully some of the Big-5.
Only one vehicle at a time and by reservation only. 078 0210 966

name: Zeestock Lodge
description:
One of the nicest places to stay just out of Cape Town. 

Ben (Australian) and Anouk (Dutch) are two of the most welcoming people we’ve met. They have a great house where they rent out 2 and 3 person rooms and have several cabins on the property. Great farm to stay, bushpub around the corner and Melkbosstrand close by. Ben can take you out hiking in the area, sandboarding and (kite)surfing. There is even a paintball area on the farm. 

Selfcatering kitchen, a bar, pool, braai-area and pooltable. 

Really a place you want to spend time and feel right at home!

name: Old Vic Bagbacker
description: Dorm 190R, double rooms 500-700R the size and the facilities make the price different. We had a double bed room for 600R our one toilet and shower. they were clean. they have free wifi in the reception.

name: Wild cost KTM
description: Super good ktm dealer. Can get all sorts of stuff and services on most brands. Simon the owner is a really great guy.

name: Kei Bridge Private Camping
description:
Secure camp site run by Leon and Dixie. Powered sites with great bathrooms with loads of hot water. Phone 063 208 9054 or 08 37353349. 
Nice and quiet.

name: Friends Backpackers
description:
nice backpacker and restaurant.
you can sleep here in dorms, private room and in a camp site.
hot water wifi and electricity.
the crew is really nice and 4:20 friendly. the place is onthe beach

name: butterfly's bistro
description: nice restaurant with good food and vibe. there are tasty options for vegan and vegetarian

name: red cafe
description: good restaurant with lots of special and tasty meals. vegan and vegetarian friendly.

name: Cat and Moose
description:
Hostel in center of Cape Town
With parking space for up too 3 motor bikes 
Free wifi
Large self catering kitchen available 
Hot showers 
Daily housekeeping
Close to nightlife but in a quiet part of the city
Nice staff ask for John
Price range seasonal R135-R190 dormitory 
Private rooms R400-R490

name: Kapensis Guesthouse
description:
A very nice guesthouse. Very friendly owners, good food and a delicious breakfast. 
Good price!

name: Kalkies
description: Great local & cheap place for fish. Very busy on weekends.

name: Marketplace
description: Huge indoor marketplace with food stalls, souvenirs, clothing, drinks, ...

name: Rooi Deur Huisie
description: Excellent value for money. Paid 540 for a huge room with terrace, barbecue, WiFi, TV with Netflix, living room, parking etc. Really good value for money, great location. Reservation on booking.com mandatory since there is nobody on the premises. You’ll have to call a number and you’ll get a code in order to obtain the key from a lockbox.

name: Natucon Logistics
description: Offices of Natucon Logistics for the shipping of cars in Africa

name: Heads
description: Beautiful viewpoints (check maps.me). Easy access and parking. Nobody here in July but might get really busy in December / January

name: Perlman house self catering accommodation
description: Great self catering place. Sleeps 6 in one room around a fireplace. Good facilities and service. Great kitchen. 1 toilet and 1 shower.

name: DVK
description: Diesel at a cheaper than at other fuel stations. As you enter Graaf Reinet from South, you will see DVK on your right. 50 ppm Diesel is quite a bit cheaper here. No other services. Also known and displayed on business signage as OVK. Fuel pumps accessible from the side road perpendicular to the main road.

name: The Ferry Hotel and Caravan Park at Gamtoos River.
description: On site is a Hotel with rooms to rent as well as a Caravan Park. Also on site they have a bar, restaurant and small shop. The camping and van site has lovely green grassy sites with water and electricity. Good ablution blocks and a bit of a camp kitchen. It is on the banks of the Gamtoos River with great views and good security. Cost for a powered van site was R205 for two people.

name: Biltong Factory Shop
description: These guys are the real deal, biltong of all kinds are produced on the premises, they can vacuum pack your biltong for extended shelf life, their factory shop sells direct to the public. They also sell the freshest nuts and other yummy snacks, also there's a great coffee shop across the road, an excellent combination stop when passing on the scenic route to Cape Point.

name: Kaga Mountain Backpackers
description: Lovely backpackers with group and family rooms. R480 for the family room, R160 if you want to share. Just across the road from a farm stall with curios. Perfect spot to stop over or spend a few days. Will have a camp area in future.

name: @home guest house Zeerust
description: If you want a clean no hassle place to sleep then this is it. Great double rooms for R600. All needed amenities and friendly staff.

name: Kalahari Guesthouse and farmstall
description: Apart from the farm stall next to the road, a lovely campsite with bathroom facilities on the other side of the road next to a big dam. There are also campsites with bungalows available. 50 km from Upington. Plenty of birdlife.

name: Ou Skool Guesthouse
description: Apart from Guesthouse and restaurant facilities, the place also offers established campsites on grass with bathroom facilities, braai places and electricity. Cosy, near the highway, and convenient. Sometimes the nearby road noise can be a problem, as it is with other campsites in this region as well.

name: Stand Fitment & 4x4 Centre
description:
Auto electical, aircon and 4x4 repairs.
Also do alarm repairs.

name: Table Mountain Sunset Parking
description: Nice parking area directly at the beach with a good view on the city centre and Table Mountain! Perfect for sunset!

name: Caffe Mario - Pizza & Pasta
description: If you like real Italian food, then you are at the right place. Excellent pizzas and pastas, fresh ingredients, great service and a fair price, even for the touristic waterfront area. Reservations are recommended, we visited 3 times and it was always full!

name: 4x4Outlaws
description: Land Rover and other 4x4 , fitment , performance enhancement, general maintenance workshop

name: Incredible amount of flowers
description:
ADMIN NOTE:  The flower season peaks between early August and late August and it is dependent on the winter rains. As a general rule the wild flowers begin flowering first in the Northern Cape in Namaqualand in late July/early August. 

Amazing! A lot of different colors of flowers around this area. At least at the time of the year when we were here. Like a blooming dessert :) if you are around at this time,you must see it.

name: Savoy Motors
description: Land Rover specialist; parts, service and repairs.

name: Enjo Nature Farm
description:
Small campsite next to river on a secluded farm in the Biedouw Valley famous for its amazing wild flower displays in the late winter/early spring. The campsite has only 3 sites which are part shaded and have electricity, water points and a fireplace. Booking is therefore essential. There is only one hot shower and a single toilet for the camp which may be a problem as camping is also allowed next to and on the disused airstrip not far from the main camp but there are no facilities there. The cost to camp is R120 per person per night on either the main campsite or the air strip. Great location but quite a way from any public amenities such as fuel stations. Activities: relaxing, hiking, mountain biking, star gazing. Access is on gravel roads which vary in condition from good to not so good. NB! There is no through route north east from Enjo as the river crossing 17 kms  along the gravel road is normally too deep in the rainfall winter months.
All vehicle access.  Firewood available for purchase.  Main farmhouse has an honesty bar selling drinks and snacks.

name: Green meadow
description: Beautiful place close to PE and the coast. Lots of birds and frogs but apart from that noone around.. Way up is a bit narrow and bumpy, maybe muddy after rain, we had no problems.

name: Putsonderwater Ghost Town
description: Ghost Town along the train, interesting houses to explore. We camped in the middle of the village with no problems, no one around...

name: Grysduin (Grey dune)
description: wildcamp site with beautifull sea view backed by a low dune. Accessible by 4x4 only. No facilities or drinkable water.  Windy.

name: Pearston hotel B&B
description: Locate in the city of Pearston, Nice hotel, lovely owner, room start at R400, safe parking, back yard with tree, nice food, self-catering unit, tent is maybe possible you have to ask

name: Bamboo guesthouse
description:
Various rooms with common area, dining room and lounge.
Room includes breakfast.
Secure parking.
Fireplace in rooms.

name: Angie G-Spot
description: Don't choose this place. Totally rude and unfriendly lady-owner. We stopped here because we really needed internet this evening. It was our first question. "Internet is available" is written on the sign and she assured us that she has good internet. It was 280 rands for 2. Expensive but we stayed because of internet. We were sitting outside together for a while, it was nice and friendly with her partner and their friends. We went to repark the car. When we came back after 5 minutes all lights were turned off, there was nobody and no internet. Is was 7 pm and she switched off everything. We kindly asked her for switching in on because we really needed it. She told us that it's mountains and she has no energy (ok but she should have told us this, she new we are here for the internet) and if we don't like it she will open the gate and we have to leave. Her tone was very rude. It was totally dark, it's mountain curved road to go and we already drink a beer that she gave us. When we started to discuss and negotiate the price she told us she is going to call POLICE. So we payed for 2 small beers (90 rands!!!!!), left her possetion angry and stayed for a night next to the road. 100% UNRECOMMENDED place. So if you have to stay somewhere here choose different place (there are few) or stay wild because we were told it's safe area.

name: Dwarsrivier country getaway
description: Lovely couple own this camping, cottage, pub , clean ablution and nice view.

name: Nare Tent and Tarp
description:
083 460 7321, 15, 6th Ave, Industria, Polokwane. 
Marius does custom tent, chairs. cushions, curtains etc and repairs too. Excellent workmanship and materials. Easy to work with. 
Located in back.

name: Sabie Gypsie Backpacker Hostel
description: Clean and nice place to spent the night!! Perfect for backpacker style and budget! Private dorms 180 for 2 pp. Or private en suite 250!! And also are dorms for 4 ppl. Owners, Sandra and William, are really friendly! We stayed here after driving the whole way from Johannesburg! So just in time after the sunset! Also we went to have dinner to The Wild Fig Tree! Sabie is beautiful and a touristic city, so more pricy than Graskop (so do shopping and fuel in Graskop before Kruger).

name: Parking Beach Ballito
description: Beautiful spot in front of the beach!! This is a perfect place to spent the night inside the car/caravan/motorhome. Specially after check the prices of accommodation. Locals chill here at the evening and then go away. Boards say don't drink not pets not parking etc but everybody is doing everything hahah. Fishers and pet walkers at morning too. Nobody bothered us. No guards. Amaizing sunrise, we saw whales and dolphins!!

name: The nautilus guest house
description:
Well equipped rooms with microwave and small fridge. There is a well equipped small flat/ apartment as well good for extended stays, especially while waiting for a vehicle to arrive or be shipped. 

The breakfast is freshly made and does not disappoint. There is a few parking spots around the back where you can fit a larger vehicle. This is not a camp site. 

Be sure to contact before hand to see if Accomodation is available. +27 (81) 300-7557

name: Bergheim Resort
description: Campground with many sites, electricity and braai pits, swimming pool, mountain bike trails. 65pp plus 25 per vehicle.

name: Lesoto feet
description: Incredible viewpoint to check the beginning of the border Lesoto, after the Sleeping Beuty Cave!! Entrance to the Ukhahlamba Drakensberg Park 40R pp. 2hs walk till here!! Nice streams with clean fresh water and stunning landscapes!!

name: School Parking
description: Quiet place to spent the night inside the car. Really inside! Was freezing!!! My god!! Just couple of meters up from the main road you will find this buildings which we assumed is a school according to with traffic boards! There are also some trees on the back if you feel encouraged to set a tent!! F r e z z i n g!! And windy of course!! A blue big tank of water can be used too,  probably potable! Nobody living here, no visitors, no problems, just cars passing by and stopping due speed bumps.

name: Gariep Country Lodge
description:
Camp site is part of a lodge. There are 2 camp sites for 6 people per site. 
Tel: +27 53 353 2552
Email: garieplodgeprieska@gmail.com

name: Gungho Bikes
description:
A very helpful and understanding motorbike spares, repairs and maintenance workshop.

The owner has vast overlanding experience and helped me out tremendously with his knowledge and time.

Highly recommended.

name: Broadwater River Estate Campsite
description:
Self-catering Houseboat, Apartment, Chalets or Camping.
Each campsite has it's own private bathroom, scullery and power point.
Most sites have a river view with shad.
Restaurant on site.
Tel: +27 87 310 3280
Tel: +27 82 332 2266

name: Rustenburg Kloof Resort
description:
Large caravan park with chalets.
play ground, tennis court and swimming pool. 
Hiking Trails. Each camp site has a braai, water tap and electrical outlet.
Tel: +27 14 594 1037

name: Molalatau Lodge Campsite
description:
Campsite is on the banks of the Mogolriver. Camping area and ablution very clean.
Restaurant, swiming pool, and cottages available.
Tel: +27 66 201 8792
Tel: +27 82 820 2080

name: Shepherds Tree Camp
description:
Great place to overnight. Sandy camp sites with hot water ablutions. 
Swimming pool and lapa.
Tel: +27 14 763 4522
Cell: +27 72 727 3377
R60.00 p/p/n

name: Munala Game Lodge Campsite
description:
CALL AHEAD... Users report no one at location 

30 Campsites with electricity, shade and clean ablutions.
Tel: +27 15 575 1091
Cell:+27 81 342 1418
R100.00 p/p/n

name: Dongola Ranch Camping
description:
Campsite in the nature reserve on a farm. Each site has it's own ablution with a kitchen and elextrical point.
ZAR150 p/stand/n & ZAR35 p/p/n
Tel: +27 15 533 1948
Cell: +27 82 653 9730

name: Klein Bolayi Game lodge & camping
description:
This is a 4 star lodge with chalets, game drives, restaurant and more.
ZAR150 p/p/n
Breakfast ZAR 60 each. 
Tel: +27 15 534 0975
Cell: +27 72 444 7958

name: Tshipise Holiday Resort
description:
Offers rondavels, guesteooms and camping. Laundromat, shop, pool, warm water mineral pool, putt putt ect available. 
ZAR 150/site & ZAR50 p/p/n
Tel: +27 15 539 0634

name: Laske Nakke Caravan park
description:
Near the town of Lydenburg. The park has chalets, rooms and camping with hot water ablutions, power points, restaurant, pool and putt putt.
ZAR100.00 p/p/n
Tel: +27 13 235 2885

name: Witbank Dam Leisure Resort
description:
This resort is on the banks of the Witbank dam and Olifants river. They offer chalets and camping with power points and a pool.  You can also do fishing here.
ZAR150 for the first 2 and then ZAR30.00 p/p there after.
Tel: +27 13 697 0151

name: Utrecht Balele Caravan park
description:
Shaded campsites with power points next to a dam.
Each site has a braai (BBQ)

name: goldwagen
description:
good priced parts for many cars. for VW, Opel, Audi also.
even in stock!

name: Wildcamp between dunes
description: Area between 2 dunes with fire pit made from stones. Nice view of the ocean. No facilities.

name: St Helena Beach Cottage (cash only)
description:
Great cottage 50 meters from the beach. Beautiful view of the ocean. Owners are very welcoming. Cottage sleeps 6 people and has it's own deck with an ocean view. Cottage has a fully equipped kitchen. There is a bath and shower with hot water.
Price changes according to season.   You need to book ahead of time

name: Barberspan Resort & Campsite
description:
9 Camp sites at water front and 16 other. There is a restaurant,pub and pool.
R120 per site and R50 per person.
tel: +27 73 318 6366
cel: +27 74 154 8862

name: Litchenburg 4wd Club
description: Located at the local 4x4 club near lichtenburg.

name: Somabula Nature Reserve
description:
Campground with either private ablutions or sires with communicable ablutions. Situated on a game farm I the Cullinan area.
Small shop at reception selling ice and wood.
No electric power the campsites.
Ablutions have gas geysers and a light powered with solar.
Plains game at the reserve and you can derive around in your own vehicle. Some roads are for 4x4 only.
Situated close to Cullinan diamond mine and historic village. Tours are possible.

name: Hi-Q Tyre Service
description: Very good service!!!! To recommend very much!!

name: Oewerus River Camp
description: Campground and chalets on the SA side on the Orange river. Shady campsites with some grass and own ablutions. Place needs some update but overall nice. Clean ablutions but hotwater temperamental. Restaurant and pub with excellent pizza. Price for camping R120pppn. They also have 21 chalets.

name: Kgaswane Mountain Resort
description:
Many campsites and ablutions.
R50 per person. R60 per vehicle. R350 per camp site.
Tel: 014 - 533 2050

name: Intibane Lodge
description: It is a farm with many animals. Very nice owners. Have a pool, free Wifi. Food is very good and inexpensive. Man can observe the animals in the water hole on the patio.

name: Krom Klip
description:
well establiced park with stand next to a dam.
Clean unisex ablutions.

name: Xaxaza Camp
description: Quiet situation. 85 Rand p. P. /4 kilometres to the beach. Pool, WiFi, washing machine,

name: Leeupoort Vakansie Dorp
description: A nice campsite set up inside the perimeter of the town

name: Tugela Mouth
description:
The parking bay is so nice, we did not want any more away. Overnight here one may stand. The space is 24 stood guarded. He is sure. He is direct by the sea, marvellous beach with seat group, grill state, toilet. The space costs nothing, he is without free. We have given the watchman a beer, there he has been glad. Showering ares outdoors.
Jan. 22. The beach was full of wood, the water brown, we didn't stay.

name: Ace Propshaft Repair of engines and gears
description: Specialists for universal joints and cardan shafts. Very good service.

name: Ann van Dyk Cheetah and wild dog center
description: you can have a feeting tour to cheetahs and wild dogs. the about 2 hours tour cost 340R pp. very informative and you get very close to all animals. (also others). we loved it!

name: Caravan park Dullstroom at the lake
description: very nice campground direct at the lake. Angling and hiking possible here. some horses and goose are locaded at this Plas as well. 125R pppn

name: Underberg Meat SupplLes Allan
description: Really good butcher!!Very good offer and really service

name: Panorama Place
description: The place is big with spectacular view. 300 m of the high street. The place is 3250 m high! We had snow and - 2 ° at night. Entrance of the high street in the brown footpath sign.

name: Canyon riverbed
description: Nice place between 2 koppies. Big tree but beware of thorns. Also saw lots of elephant but they didn't disturb us. Heard baboons. Very windy until 9pm.

name: View over valley and crashing wave rock
description: Very nice spot at a huge rock that looks like a crashing wave. Beautiful view over valley and Brandberg. Already has a fire pit.

name: riverbed camping
description: Camping in Ugab river bed. We took Divorce pass to get here which was hair raising. Very nice site under tree. Saw elephant dung and lion footprints.

name: Riverbank camping
description: Camp on the riverbank close to cave. No animals around except flies. Great sunset

name: The Fat butchers
description: Great homemade pies and biltong (Jerky / dried meat). Also sell loads of BBQ meats.

name: Oude post bistro
description: The best "roosrerkoek" sandwiches! Also a fuel stop and place to take a break on the road

name: Fat Pony Backpackers
description:
Pleasantly accomodated in a homely environment.

Food is also good when pre booked.

name: Small Sand Dunes
description: Lovely hidden area to camp behind small dunes about 150 to 200 m from gravel road close to a seasonal river (track turns off after bridge traveling westbound), many beautiful spots, sand, trees, plenty of firewood, very peaceful.

name: Valley bush camp
description: Lovely Bushcamp at the start of an apparently seldom used hiking trail, easy 4x4 track to go there is on T4A. Seasonal river, 4 big trees, valley is framed by the typical rugged Cederberg mountains, beautiful scenery, network-free.

name: Tankwa Tented Camp
description:
Incredible place! A campsite (R110/pp), tents, chalets (with ensuite bathroom), bar and restaurant in a middle of nowhere. Frequented by friendly and fun locals, especially over the weekend. Sometimes a band would play here. 

This place has an apocalyptic feel to it and is a home to the yearly AfrikaBurn festival (like the Burning Man in the US). The structures from the festival still stand all around the territory. Never saw anything like this before, probably the coolest venue we have visited coming from Europe to Cape Town... Very rustic, cozy and basic. Though, in the middle of a desert, so don’t expect much luxury :)

Run by incredibly helpful and friendly people. 
You have to ask for a “snuff” at the bar!

No cellphone reception, but there is a reasonable wifi for a fee. 

There is a tyre shop and they also always have some fuel for the bikes. 

In my opinion, this is a must see place while in South Africa.

name: Tankwa Pastal
description: A good place to eat and have a drink at a nice bar with locals

name: Bodemloos Kombuis
description:
It is a reliable and safe place where you can store your vehicle near Cape Town. Run by a friendly family, long time in overlanding business. There are also chalets where you can stay and a mechanic for basic repairs. 

The cars are stored in a dry hangar with electricity to keep the battery on. Price: 500R/mth

They would transfer you to the airport if needed. 
Contacts: Du Toit / +27 79 854 7502 / dutoit@zuluoverland.co.za

name: Bodemloos Kombuis
description:
3 cabins with ensuite bathrooms, electricity, hot showers, wifi. Family run, informal place... but very nice and authentic. You can also store your vehicle there - see a separate entry. 

270 R/pp

Tel: +27 79 854 7502 Du Toit

name: Beau Valley Backpackers
description:
Beau Valley backpackers offers a variety of comfortably accommodation.
a variety of dorms with shared bathrooms as well as private rooms with en-suite bathrooms.
Communal facilities include kitchen and dinning area, bar, lounge, sunset deck with stunning views of Lake Heritage. 
Enjoy the peace and serenity of wild animals roaming around freely.

name: Lumana Resort
description: Very large campground situated directly on to a wide river. We payed 190 Rand for two people plus car plus electricity. We were the only campers at the time. In weekends might be fully booked due to local church activities. Friendly owner. 5 ablution blocks. The one we used was basic and needed an upgrade.

name: Nice view wild camp
description:
Nice place on a grasy plateau. Amazing view! Expect a cold night.
Only horses around.

name: Border Ramatlabama
description: Easy border crossing, quick and officers are very friendly. Roadtax payable with credit card.  If you're double vaccinated, you don't need a PCR test.

name: BOBO CAMPER - MOBILE HOME FACTORY
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

we did Park our big Rig here and they did try to come in the vehicle
They break the passenger window  -
break 3  lockers- big damage - and big shock.
Better look for an other place to Park Your vehicle.

name: Sionbergh
description: Beautiful campsite. Green grass, clean ablution next to a dam.  Rooms also available.

name: Buffalo Gorge
description:
Two campsites, one in the kloof (currently undergoing renovations) and another remote campsite with spring fed rock pool.  The wild campsite is however the nicest as it is up near the escarpment and a few km from anybody else. The wild campsite has a natural spring fed rock pool which is dependent on the water table levels. Shower is heated via donkey boiler. A flush toilet and running water is available at the wild camp site. Wood for the donkey and braai is provided. A 4x4 of hi ground clearance vehicle is required to reach the WILD CAMP. The facilities are basic but clean and usable. Not a white tiled ablution type facility but ideal fro wild camping and self sufficient campers. Abseiling, basic rock climbing, hiking and horse riding can be arranged with notice.
Cell phone coverage with data connection is available on high ground only.

name: Kliphoek River Resort
description:
Nice and quiet private campsites with private  (clean and mordern) ablutions with hot water and  a sink. One fix shade on every Campsite and there is electricity.
There is also a braai on every site.
Campsite is next to the berg river, you can go for a walk and see the birds and flamigos... 
During office time you could slso rent a kanu.

name: DeMist Camp Site &Cottages near Patensie
description:
Nice campsite on a citrus farm! Very friendly owners, quite place off the road, open air toilets and shower, swimming in nearby river. 
We payed 100 rand for two pax, water not in site, no elec. Braai in every site.
Cottages for rent, don’t know the price.

name: Serengeti Caravan park
description: Beautiful campsites/resort, swimming pools, waterslides, restaurants...

name: Drakensberg Gardens Caravan Park
description: Campground affiliated with the Drakensberg Garden Resort. Nestled in a valley with fabulous views into the mountains. Camp right next to Resort so restaurant, superette, etc within easy walking distance. Ok for vehicles of most sizes. Grassy sites along river. Site AE right on the river with beautiful view of mountains. Ablutions ok with hot showers. Several (short and half day) hikes into the foothills right from resort. Stunning views. ZAR 170pppn? Price various - power point or no. Pensioners pay ZAR 120pppn for site with power point. WiFi at reception. Good MTN signal in the camp.

name: DIAZ Hotel&Resort Parking
description:
we got this recommendation from a security guard in another village area.

24h/7d guard arround the hotel complex.
Safe parking in day and night.

30mtr down to the beach.

Look from yr vehicle to the beach.

Amazing view

My advice 》 Park very close to the Hotel complex...
My highly recommendation!

name: GAS.CO
description:
here you can fill Gas cylinders also  German Gas cylinders.
Kilogramm price 26Rand/Nov.2018

name: Breno Auto Electrical
description:
Comprehensive auto electrical supplier.  Everywhere else in town told us our part wasn’t available and that it would have to come from overseas. Breno asked us to send them the photo of our part, along with other details and they found this part in their stock for our Cummins motor fuel shut off from America.  Very helpful.  They also have an extensive selection of waterproof auto electrical plugs.

Parking limited.

They have a very good website also: 
www.brenoparts-autoelectrical.co.za

name: JEFFREYS BAY Parking close to the beach
description:
nice place close to the beach.

There is a night Guard and its safe

name: Shelly Caravan Park
description: Caravan park and campsite. Lots of grass and trees with a pond in the middle. Very close to Shelly Beach. Electricity points and water available. Very nice pool. Ablutions are bit average (lots of cockroaches) but otherwise a very nice campsite.

name: The Kraal
description:
Very Nice Hotel with Lots of Rooms
Also Dorms are available.
Restaurant, Bar, Pool, free WiFi....
Extremly nice and friendly owners.

name: Wolf sanctuary Tsitsikama
description:
Huge wolf sanctuary with about 25 wolf's.  Very informativ and interesting to see this animal as close. 
Huts also available for overnight. 
This is a nice experience to hear them crying in the night!😄

They expect a donation!
0829564175
www.wolfsa.org.za

name: Fijnbosch cottage and camp
description:
Very friendly owner let you sleep in the beautiful Garten. You have your own shower and toilet.
Very quiet there even on the weekend
110 R pp
Cottages available.

name: Overnight place in the N 7
description: Really more freely of unfenced in surface, no farm area. Very quiet, 2.5 km of the N7. No village nearby. Nice view.

name: Palm Tree Lodge
description: Absolutely beautiful campsites and chalets. Lush green grass. Restaurant, swimming pools, games room. R150 PPN

name: Riverside Manor
description:
Absolutely beautiful camping sites with green grass on the banks of a river. Electric points, tap, and braai place on every site. 
R90 pp + R90 for the stand. 
Also have overnight rooms and backpacker dorm rooms. Everything very neat and clean.

name: Bergville Caravan and Camping
description:
Very basic with clean ablutions. Hot shower. 
Swimming pool. Camping ground very basic but have electric power points. Also a few chalets and rooms for those who don’t camp. 
Camping R80 pp out of season. R100 pp in season. Good enough to stay over for one night.

name: Close to Police station
description:
close to police station 
We did ask the commissioner at the police station for permission to sleep there for one night.
We did park between the fences,(right Hand from building/when you face the station)
VODACOM SIGNAL is strong

name: Blue Sky Mining Backpackers
description: Really beautiful backpackers. Very clean, big rooms and in great location. Has campsites and sites with tented camps too. Self catering cabins available. Very good restaurant with cheap food. Super friendly and helpful staff. No braai facilities.

name: Tshahitsi Lodge
description: A four star resort with chalets which are also designed for camping. This means that you have a private chalet of which you only use the bathroom. You also may sit inside during the day with the television and airco switched on. The chalets are quit new and luxurious. For camping you park your vehicle on the parking lot of the chalet itself. Even tents are allowed to set up over there. Each chalet has an electrical powerpoint and water connection on the outside. The lodge has all the for star services you can imagine. High quality breakfast is included in the price with a cook making your egg exactly the way you want it. Springboks and Emoes walk around freely. The only disadvantage we can think off is the noise of the nearby road. We payed R400 for two people and a car with roof top tent. Worth every Rand. Unfortunately big rigs won't fit.

name: Olifants Camp
description: For us the most beautiful camp in KNP. The camp overlooks the Olifants river and vicinity. We didn't camp for they dont have camping but stayed in a chalet with 2 single beds, bathroom, kitchen and a beautiful view of the river. Chalets 1-24 have views of the river. There are also 111 rondawels available.  please see attached photo. Price R1640 pn

name: Police station
description:
we did Park just for one night in front the police station

VODACOM SIGNAL extrem strong

name: Swadini Forever Resort
description:
Big resort with youthhostel, chalets, tents and many campingsites.

The campsite is grassy and with lots of shade (Trees).
Nice,  clean ablutionblocks and kitchen
There is a laundry possibility aswell.
We paid 240 Zar for one night.

There is a shop, a restaurant and a pool.
You can go for short hikes on the resort.

name: The Golden Quilt B&B - Kempton Park -6 Du Plessis Avenue
description: Small but perfect B&B for international incoming our outgoing over O.R. Tambo Airport Johannesburg. 6 Km distance. Inexpensive and Transfer included. Very friendly owners. Sarah can organize what you like. Phone: (0027) 11 3945999 Also available with bookings.com

name: Fraaigelegen Farm Tulbagh
description: Farm stay in Tulbagh, Cape Winelands with grassy campsite & excellent ablutions. Also cottages for rental in this olive farm

name: McGregor Backpackers
description:
Very nice place on the private parking slot in the garden of the McGregor Backpackers house. 
Dorothy & Geoff, the owners are very friendly and very helpful. 
Two slots for small campers. 
Kitchen and Bathroom with hot shower available. 
Laundry service by Dorothy. 
All super clean. 
We paid 150 Rand per night for two people and the camper.

name: Africamps at Mackers
description: Glamping as they call it is basically a big canvas 2 bedroom apartment with lounge, table, kitchen, wood stove and bathroom. R1050 for 2 people per night. Very nice beds and bedding and comfortable setup along the Sabie river. It rained a lot and this was perfect to read, cook and relax.

name: The Three Bridges
description: Spacious rooms with, aircon, fan, tv, comfy bedding, small kitchen and shower/toilet including breakfast for R425 single. Pretty good deal actually

name: Padstal and Restaurant the Three Bridges
description: Very nice padstal with many items and a lovely lady called Lynn to chat to. The restaurant is very good actually and decently priced so perfect for a stopover and a meal and I decided to stay for the night! Recommended

name: Tracey’s Guesthouse and Family restaurent
description: A lovely quiet guesthouse, rooms are nicely decorated, quiet, have AC, great hot showers. Restaurent food delicious- really nice home cooked food. Couldn’t recommend this place more if you need to stop over to/from Botswana border. R400 for a double room, ample safe parking.

name: Spar
description: Good place to stock up on food and drinks before entering the park!

name: Senor Pizza
description:
A lovely little pizza place (also serve salads and pastas).   And a small bar with sports on the television.  Owned by a local older couple.  They enjoy meeting travelers.  Very reasonable prices.  We paid R90 for a medium pizza and two Cokes for the two of us.  Well worth it!

Some of the best pizza we have had in Africa.

name: Koedoeskloof Country Lodge
description:
ADMIN NOTE: description and photos provided by the owners
---
Koedoeskloof is a guesthouse set in a beautiful unspoilt area close to the Klein Swartberg mountain range in the Klein Karoo just off Route 62.  We have a small fenced off lawned camping area as well as 4 double rooms, a licensed restaurant that serves gourmet burgers and breakfast. It is manned by the two owners, Debi & Eugene. We offer safe camping in a garden setting with good views. 

*PLEASE NOTE* Our campsite is ONLY suitable for tents, no vehicles and no 4 x 4 vehicles with rooftop tents, RVs, caravans or any other vehicle that requires level ground. 

There are 4 lawned terraces 4m wide and 30m long and offer some shade with a few  trees. There is no vehicle access so you cannot park next to your tent, you would need to carry your tent to the terraces from the parking area.  There is an electrical power point on each terrace. You have the use of a very basic outside kitchen with kettle and washing up facilities. The ablutions are in the same building with two showers, two wash basins and two loos. The facilities are shared between men and ladies. Corrugated sheeting separates the kitchen area, loos and showers. There are 2 braai /BBQ areas but they are separate from the campsite, one opposite the ablutions and the other close to the restaurant. We sell wood at R30 per bag. We do not allow own alcohol as we are fully licensed, we also have our own pets so cannot allow yours.

REGULAR rates 
R810 per double room (R405 per person per night sharing) (Excluding meals)
R505 single rate per person (Excluding meals) 
Lower WINTER rates (1 June 2018 - 31 Aug 2018)
Camping R85 per person per night
No caravans and/or 4 x 4 vehicles with rooftop tents can be accommodated due to the slope of the property.

name: Low’s Creek Lodge
description: Up in the lush hills with a bit of a slippery road going up after all the rain, but quiet and peaceful with just the birds to listen to and hike in the forest, such a difference after Kruger but a very welcome one. You can use the kitchen or pre order dinner for R150 or breakfast R80, no wifi but decent cellphone reception, nice communal bar and lounge area. There is a little pool and tons of birdlife (some happy tweeter staying here counted 40 species). Campsite is under trees, electricity points are there with an extension cord and you most probably will be the only one here! R100 pppn. Three chalets from R550 a night sleeping 3 people. Quinn the manager is a really nice guy!

name: Kaapsche Hoop
description: What a surprise to find this quirky little village with several guesthouses, bed and breakfast, wonderful walks, wild horses running around and restaurants and 3 pubs. Very arty feel to it and super friendly people. I loved my unplanned stay here and stayed another night. Nice walks to a waterfall and viewing point in between beautiful rock formations!

name: Mount Ceder
description: Three campsites 1,5 km from the reception. Nice braaipacks and scenery.

name: custom
description: We crossed the border at the Kgalagadi Nationalpark and there is no custom, so we got our TIP here.

name: Destiny‘s Inn Lodge
description: Nice little lodge also with small cabins, pool, clean abolutions, WiFi at charge, also lawn for tent campers. Really nice! only on appointment.

name: Dwaalfontain Lodge guest farm
description:
lovely guest farm and overnight accommodation
very beautiful and clean lodges.
