The owners are super friendly!
van zyl and Jolene Venter
call 082 583 0036

name: Sun City
description: This is the site of the fun park Sun City. Pure entry fee is ZAR 75 pP. Once paid one can stay "forever". The park is open 24 hrs. Most of the other attraction you have to pay separately. Eg. the "Maze" ZAR 140pp; the "Valley of the Waves" costs ZAR 160pp. Camping on the parking place is not possible.

name: Burnco
description: Specialist 4x4 custom engineering shop for off road bumpers, storage boxes, roof racks etc. They do excellent work on all makes of 4x4 used for overlanding and serious offroading. Ask for Hein Burnett.

name: Eddles Gas
description: Can supply new gas cylinders and fill some  cylinders (propane/butane) as well as gas appliances including camping stoves, lights etc and parts & fittings such as new jets for same. Also can do repairs to range of gas stoves for RVs and camping, heaters, geysers etc. They also stock a big range of fishing equipment. Ask for Quinton Smith. Tel: +27 21 701 1904.

name: Deltec
description:
Suppliers & testers of deep cycle batteries suitable for 4x4 offroad vehicles, overlanders, campers and RVs. Contact Jacques Prezens.
Tel: +27 21 511 1001.

name: Solardome
description: Suppliers of photo-voltaic solar panels and associated equipment such as regulators/controllers suitable for 4x4s, RVs, overland vehicles. Tel: +27 21 886 6321.

name: Sangiro Game Lodge
description: Fenced in BnB with secure parking, child friendly.

name: Backpackers Connection @ JNB Airport
description: This youth hostel is very close to Johannesburg airport (8km) and they offer a cheap shuttle service from airport and train station. It is on a big secure country style property with plenty parking for overland trucks and camper vans. They have electricity points available, hot showers and free wifi. They have a swimming pool, bar area and a lot of space to chill and prepare your travel plans. They have clean dorm rooms and lovely double and twin rooms. What a great place to stay over in Johannesburg between flights and safari's. Very well run for all travelers.

name: Ficksburg Municipal campsite
description: This is a very basic municipal campsite in the middle of town. Nothing more than a stopover for one night. There was nobody in sight when we arrived on a Sunday afternoon and the gate is permanently open. So we simply drove in and found a nice spot under huge trees and camped. The ablutions was surprisingly clean for a municipal site in the middle of town.

name: Babalala Picnic Site
description: Really nice picnic site at a waterhole. The special thing about it is, that you can rent scottle braais. We didn’t take one, so don’t know the price. 😉

name: Very basic "campsite"
description:
Very basic "campsite" and pretty run down. Even not sure weather it is officially open. In former times it was propably a nice place with some chalets, a small pool, ....even an area for paintball ! At the moment the whole complex has a new owner and they want to rebuild it in the future.... 2050?!? .... anyway... since there is no real alternative to the expensive lodges and the nearby nationalpark it might be a cheaper place to spend a night here. The "Sun City" complex is only 10 km from here. The prices for the "chalets" we don't know, but they opened one for us to use the toilet and shower (don't expect Hilton standard!!). The price for camping is obviously not fixed, rather a question of bargain. Guess between ZAR 100-200 p2Pn with a vehicle is eveyrthing possible with the guy who hangs around here. 
Since the place is not well marked on the main road (only a rather hand written sign) turn into the small road leading to the airport and then the first dirt track left. There is no sign anymore but after 200 m you are there.

name: Leopard Rocks Coffee Shop & Lookout
description: Very nice restaurant and coffee. Very good food and the location overlooking the Umzimkulu river / gorge is great. The famous Leopard Rock belongs to it.

name: TAU Auto Electronics & Thread Check
description:
Electronic & Welding Jobs
The eletronic garage was a recomendation of some farmers. The best option for several hundreds kilometers! We can confirm this. Mike is an excellent mecanic and repaired within a very short time our alternator and brake light problem. 
In the same building Tyler helped us with some welding, etc. jobs. 
👍👍

name: Lenong Viewpoint.The Towers at Marekele National Park
description: The Towers at Marekele National Park has a tarred road up to the 2043m radio masts.

name: Wolfkloof Boerdery Accommodation and Camping
description: Really nice place that has dorms (180pppn), cottages and camping. Beautiful scenery and very peaceful around. Very clean toilets and showers available. Flat areas for camping. Fire pit and grill areas. Communal kitchen and dining in a huge barn! The place is not fancy but there is the atmosphere and surroundings - highly recommend it. And the owner is very friendly!

name: Ronnies sex shop
description: Iconic pub on route 62. must stop for any traveller. serves drinks and simple foods

name: Weenen Nature Reserve (KZN Parks)
description: Beautiful National Park (no cats) and nice campsite

name: Nels camp
description: A little know camp Site on the banks of the mooi river about 3 km below Zulu Falls. There is a camp site an a couple of chalet available, the whole site is off grid so the hot showers are created by donkey boiler. It's a very peaceful site with no noise other than the river and wild life.

name: Safari Lodge
description: Very nice lodge in town. R570 for a room for 2. Rooms have TV, microwave aircon stocked mini fridge and free WiFi

name: Dunlop Zone Vryburg
description: Great service and prices on most makes of tyres

name: Rugged Glen Campsite
description: Rugged Glen Campsite is a campsite from KZN. We stayed here during high season and while the Mahai Campsite was really crowded, we were the only campers with one other family. Really nice and quite place, good abolutions and power point at site.

name: Arniston Resort Oord
description: Basic municipal camping. 205 R the site. 153 for pansioners. You have to pay for wifi

name: Bush camp near De Hoop NR
description: Near the trail there is a place for 2 campers. It is 1,5 km from the gravel road. Entrance of the trail on the gravel road GPS  : S34 24.557 E020 24.591

name: Near entrance Storms River Mouth
description: In the pine forest, well hidden from the road. For internet, our Vodacom data works

name: Mundees B&B
description: Great little spot in town. Stay here when weather too misty, cold and rainy to camp. Glynis keeps the cottages well maintained. Can do self-catering or B&B. We pay ZAR500 per night cash (for the former) A discount as she likes to support wildlife conservation. Decent WiFi. Easy access to village shops. Quiet and secure.

name: Northern Offroad
description: Fitment and repair of auxiliary fuel tanks. General 4x4 repairs.

name: Bospoort Dam
description: This is a nice site at a lake surrounded by small mountains. Unfortunately there is some waste and there are a lot of mosquitos. But you have a beautyfull view.

name: Gassentrum
description:
Refill gas cylinders here. We filled our almost empty 3kg Cadac cylinder for R80.20.
Also sells lots of other camping and fishing supplies.

name: Mapochs Cave
description:
This site is a kind of meeting point with a central traditional house and an ablution block. But it seems to bee out of use and order. The toilets were closed. Also there were no stuff and no chance to find the cave. But it is a nice place to stay for a night. You have a beautyful open view. In the afternoon there came a local guy. "I am security and you have to register." 😇
It was 30 R (2 €). The night was quiet and nobody hassled us.

name: Tyre choice
description: We change our Cooper tyres. Good price for tyres and good work. Serious staff.

name: SARS Customs
description: Place to go when you change of CDP. They put the exit stamp on the old carnet and the entrance stamp on the new carnet. Come at 8h or 15h

name: Muizenberg colorful beach cabins
description: Be carreful when going to photograph the colorful beach cabins near this place, i got my camera snatched by 2 men

name: Oranjeville on the lake
description: Nice grass and shade on the lake side. People fishing. Good ablutions. 300 RAND each site (electricity available on the site) Beautiful sunset.

name: Oryx Gas
description: Friendly owner and wife. 62 RAND to refill small gas bottles

name: airport customs
description: here you get carnet stamped, right around the corner is the cargo/freight area (or pets), everyone is super nice and helpful. really easy, cleared our motos in 20min ($30usd) and uncoated them in parking lot. :)

name: Zebra Crossing Hostel
description: Nice place, clean, good kitchen, secure parking for motos or cars/van (height clearance might be 3m). parking is $25rand per day for a car, motos are cheaper, access to parking is easy & you get a gate remote. Close to the shops, restaurants and bars. Good wifi, super nice staff, small bar on site.

name: Pool Paradise
description: Great place with waterfall and pool, grassy meadow in the jungle, Picnic place and braii, what a paradise!

name: Bushcamp near Echo Caves
description: Almost hidden from the road with less traffic. A small meadow in the bush on the way to the Echo Caves. We had a perfect quiet night.

name: Echo Caves
description: Big Cave system, choose between short or long guided tour, both 60 Rand p.P.. possible to camp, has also bungalows and restaurant

name: Three Rondawels
description: Viewpoint of the Blyde Canyon and Three Rondawels. ZAR35 pp

name: Rod’s Engineering
description: Very experienced Hydraulics workshop. They helped us fixing a leaking hydraulic connection on our Unimog winch. Rod was very helpful and nice. They did a good job for a good price. Can only recommend.

name: Fish and more
description: Very nice fish take away. Has one of the best fish, calamari and chips we ever had. Sells also fresh and frozen fish.

name: Kontrei Coffee Shop
description:
Coffee shop with good coffee, deli, gift shop, small art gallery and clean toilets. Didn't try the food so can't comment on that. Great place to stop for a break on your journey.
(Amendment- apparently the men's toilets were sadly NOT clean!)

name: Rhodes Backpackers
description:
A converted small School dorm with 4 sperate rooms and 2 sets of bathrooms. Call Rhodes information for details. 
 Cost of ZAR 180 pppn

name: Grobersdal mall
description: Nice new mall with all the important shops to stock up on, clean, modern and spacious but as with any mall in South Africa do not leave valuables in vehicle, alternatively carry with you or someone stays with the vehicle/s only trust security guards

name: Suikerbos Nature Reserve
description:
Campground in nature reserve. Beautiful surroundings. Grassy sites with a lot of (small) trees. 

Each site has a tap, braai stand and power point. 
There is a rustic swimming pool in a round basin and a very tiny play ground. Extensive marked hiking trails around starting from the camp site. There are chalets in the premises and a lodge, but separate from the camp ground.

Recommendable place, especially compared to the polished resorts along the Vaal river. We had the place to ourselves outside season.

name: Bushwacked
description:
Very quiet and tranquil hillside spot on the edge of Barberton with wonderful views and lots of chickens running around!  There are nice rooms available for 520 Rand per night. I had wanted to camp at Barberton caravan park but it is closed and is being made into a huge shopping Mall. Owners Pete and Catherine said I could camp on the grass and use facilities in a very nice rondaval for 200 Rand per night. The road is a bit narrow, my landrover was fine but anything bigger will struggle.
Phone , +27 (0)73 6915646

name: Nthakeni River and Bush Camp
description:
Situated on the Mutale River in the Pafuri area close to the Pafuri Kruger Park Gate. Well-appointed self-catering tented Chalets (3) and numerous camping sites that can take 1 - 3 off road caravans in each site.  Well-equipped kitchen and bathroom facilities with hot water and outdoor shower in each site. Restaurant and pool available.
A good base to explore the area for a few days or as a one night stop to and from the northern Kruger park.

name: Bonnievale River Lodge
description: 25 Campsites right beside the Breede River. R150pp. On the riverbank itself most of the sites are for ground tents only but site number 8 is OK for a vehicle with roof top tent. Plenty of place for RTT further back from river. All other vehicles are parked on the top level away from river bank which makes it very pleasant. Campsites have electricity and braais (bring your own grid).  Ablution facilities with hot-water showers.  Kitchen and washing-up facilities with a shared fridge/freezer.  Small shops sells wood, ice, drinks and various other items.

name: Gecko Creek
description:
3 sandy stands under big Eucalyptus trees. Nice quiet remote location with mountain views. Pool, lapa, kitchen, bar. No Electricity at the stand, but in the bar cell phones etc can be charged and water connections from bar area, nice showers & toilets. They also have cabins & safari tents. Very friendly staff. Good WiFi. 
Email: info@geckocreek.com

name: Melton Wold
description: Huge grassy site with electricity, taps and BBQs on each stand. Big farm style pool, camp bar, excellent ablutions but limited shade at stands. Melton Wold is a game farm and the beautiful Victorian farm house is the oldest guesthouse in South Africa. B&B accommodation is available in the guesthouse. WiFi is available but only by the guesthouse.

name: BP Gas station
description: We stay for the night at this gas station for free. Staff very friendly. Night very noisy. Parking secured with camera and security staff.

name: Maanlig Resort
description:
Campsite on edge of like with toilets, shower, BBQ and shade

Quiet, reception closes at 5 but owner lives on site. 

R300 2 adults and 2 children. 

Accessed on rough road best for 4x4.

Beautiful clean site and toilet block

name: Amohela Guesthouse
description:
Fabulous little guesthouse for when you need to be in the city. Brigitte and her team went above and beyond to take care of us while we were preparing to begin our trip, and a year later preparing to go home.
Spotlessly clean, spacious ensuite rooms, free fast WiFi, satellite TV, secure parking, fridge in the room, tea& coffee making facilities and a wonderful feast for breakfast! Some rooms also have microwave/kitchenette. All set in stunning landscaped gardens with a lovely pool for cooling off and communal braai facilities. Excellent value for money. Cannot recommend highly enough.

From ZAR850 per double room B&B.
http://www.amohela.com
+27827609235

name: Fischhoek Caravan Park
description: Simple campground on sandy surface, just behind the beach, without a view of the sea, but with some cover from the wind because of little dunes. Very quiet during weekdays. Around 200R for 1 vehicle with 2 persons.

name: African Dawn Bird and Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Many, many gorgeous birds, a cheetah, a few servals, caracals and a variety of buck call this sanctuary home.  The residents are all non-releasable. The center also rescues injured, abandoned, surrendered and confiscated animals and when possible they are released in a save wild place. Many paying volunteers enjoy assisting. There is no animal petting or interaction for the public... which is good. It takes about 2 hours to walk around the place. Toasted sandwiches and cool drinks are available. It is well worth a visit as you’ll see birds you’ve probably never seen before!

name: Safari Centre Cape Town
description: A store and workshop, specialized in 4x4 vehicles and accessories. We had our old man emu leaf springs serviced here. Very pleasant way of handling things and a neat job. We were advised to go here by Gary, the mechanic at African Overlanders. Good advice and good experience.

name: Hoeka Toeka
description: Very friendly place with good sandwiches and coffee between small antique shops. Very friendly staff.

name: Sani Pass Road
description: This site is at half way up to the Sani Pass between the two border posts. You will have a nice view to the "Twelve Apostles". I did the road with a 11 t/7 m truck. The buisines times of the border posts are from 8-16 h.

name: Addo’s Fine Dining
description: Maybe not the cheapest, but for sure the best food in Clarens by chef Addo from Ghana.

name: Valley View
description: Great place above Barberton, various possibilities to camp, depends on youŕ vehicle ;-) from here 4wd recommended.

name: Sophie’s Choice
description: Delightful little restaurant set in an antique shop! Sophie personally greets her guests. The food is delicious. Not much else in this little town although it appears to be the entry/exit point for traveling through Baviaanskloof.

name: Mozambique Consulate
description:
You can apply for your visas here. 
$50 (Spanish passports)
It’s better to get your visas here if you are planning more than one month in Mozambique, cause you can extend them at any Immigration Office (main capitals). 
(For “border visas” you must go the border for the extension).

name: Veros Restaurant and Take-Aways
description: A real surprise! A not-much-to-look-at house doubles as the restaurant. It is right across from a craft store. Both in the middle of nowhere. They offer toasted sandwiches on a unique tasty quasi-flatbread. This was pretty much the only place open on this road on a Saturday afternoon.

name: Tsitsikamma Sunrise Caravan Park
description: Campground right off the road. Large grassy area with many sites. Gina the manager very helpful and friendly. Ablutions ok. Power available. Water iffy. A bit of road noise otherwise quiet. A farmstall right across the road. MTN signal not very strong. ZAR100pppn. Great place to stay if visiting Birds of Eden, Jukani etc.

name: Vanrhynsdorp Herstelwerke
description: Mechanic shop in the area with very kind either managers or owners, not sure which they were. We needed to buy electic wiring for a wiring issue another defender we were traveling with had, and rhey kindly sold it to us by the meter. They were very helpful and seemed to be all round mechanics and one of the old options if you get stuck in the area. I can't speak for this mechanic skills or quality but helpful either way.

name: Gouritz municapal campsite
description: Neat well maintained. Clean ablutions. Grass and shade. R210 per night for the campsite

name: Car glass shop "Glass4U"
description: If you have any problem with glasses for your car or RV this friendly guys will help you

name: Shower
description: Parking place next to the beach where it should no problem to sleep. We sleeped at an other place. But here you can have a outdoor shower and also , under the restaurant, there are puplic toilets and showers. cold but clean.

name: A A welding & turning works
description:
Repairs and welds all type of casting.
It is a small workshop and the owner has a huge knowledge about welding, constructions and repairs.
Aluminium, Stainless steel, Magnesium what ever you have. He is the right man to do the job!
Also has a lot of Material for constructions so whatever your problem is. He will help.
Ashley Alberts
19 Nicole St. Franskraal
0283880556 & 0727324187

name: Victoria Bay Campsite
description: Beautiful medium sized grassed campsites in a small bay nestled right above the water. There’s actually 3 different areas you can camp, two of them overlook the ocean and beach and a 3rd sits further back. One area offers private restrooms for R370 per site, the other which we chose is R290 with very clean shared restrooms. We stayed in site 40A and highly recommend it! No access to any vehicle over 4m high. Restuarant right below campsites. Shopping Mall 10mins drive away.

name: The Chubby Pig
description: Very nice little charming eatery at the river. Nice setting, good food and very friendly host.

name: Vaalriver campsite Christiana
description:
Very neat camping next to the vaal river with clean ablution and green grass.

Good for fishing and water activities.

Pity about the camping area gradually being swamped by poor permanent structures for permanent residents.

name: Drakensberg  - Witsieshoek Mountain Resort (Sentinel Trail)
description: Parking in the Witsieshoek Mountain Resort with an amazing view on the Drakensberg. good restaurant. People are very friendly. The track (7 km) from resort to the Sentinel Trail parking is very bad so if you do not want to go by car you can take a shuttle bus or go by walk. We did it + Sentinel Trail by walk  (29 km go and back).

name: Fouriesburg - Shumba Valley Guest Farm
description: campsite in the farm. Owners not friendly and we paid 120 Rands for laundry which is overpriced for only 1 machine (no dryer)

name: 25 km au Nord de Barkly East
description: picnic area along the R396 with tree shadow. quiet.

name: Cape Town - Table Mountain NP
description: along the road near the Table Mountain cabin. Nice view.

name: Boulders
description: picnic area along the Road, nice sea view. Closed to Boulders and the entrance of Cape Of Good Hope

name: Scarborough Beach
description: beach parking, shower, toilets and drinking water

name: Hermanus - Langbaai Beach
description: picnic area along the littoral trail, nice sea view and nice beaches. We saw 2 wales.

name: Mossel Bay - Santos Beach
description: Municipal parking near the Santos Express Train Lodge at 100 m to the beach. Toilets, showers on the beach. We stayed 2 days.

name: Knysna - Thesen's Island
description: San park parking. toilets. restaurants on the waterfront

name: Plettenberg Bay - Beacon Beach
description: beach parking, nice beach and good restaurant. shower, toilets and drinking water

name: Coldstream
description: Ruglos picnic area along the R102 (this road is normally closed, we went there). This place is the start of Bloukrans (Tsitsikamma Indigenous Forest)

name: Cradock
description: church parking in the residential area. Quiet.

name: Nieu Bethesda
description: in front of the church in the centre of the town. quiet

name: Marchand
description: church parking in the residential area. Quiet. 26 km to  Augrabies Falls NP

name: Restaurant Die Strandloper ++
description: Restaurant on the beach with rudimentary tables and benches sheltered by canvas awnings. It does not pay off (we eat in paper plates and cutlery are mold shells) but the place is absolutely sublime. Facing the sunset, a team is working around braai to cook a gargantuan menu of 10 dishes of grilled fish, curry, meat, lobster. Even homemade bread and dessert are cooked over a wood fire. For once, this restaurant is frequented by all the people. it is both popular but also very popular and well known. We have a great evening. Food, atmosphere, decor, everything is perfect. Since we are in South Africa, we go to the restaurant frequently. The reason is that you eat well and that prices are affordable. Hard to find a place in the world where you can make a meal as rich and tasty as tonight for 20 €. The drinks are at cost because the restaurant operates on the principle of BYO (Bring You Own) which means that you can come with your own drinks without any extra charge

name: 17 km avant Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park
description: along the road near  with tree shadow. Quiet.

name: Never@home
description: Very fancy backpackers, really well organised and everything is almost brand new. Kitchen, two computers (no usb plugs), fast Wifi, bar next door. Lots of friendly stuff. Extremely clean. Price: 199/pppn in 16 person dorm.

name: Phumelelo Lodge
description:
Beautiful 4 bedrooms lodge in a private game reserve. Amazing place to relax.
Amazing views of the savanna while drinking a coctail in their infinity pool.
Meals included in the price.
They also have self catering, bungalows and glamping in a near future.
Great value for money..

name: Lab Electrical
description:
Repaired our Snomaster fridge within a few days. Very knowledgeable and kind guy named Peter who does the repairs and lovely lady named Suzzette who helps with coordination.

It looks like a house so don't think you are in the wrong spot. We recommend calling ahead of time +27215575269.

Out Snomaster was still under warranty so when we contacted Snomaster they told us to contact Suzette and Peter as they are one of their certified repair shops.

name: Bloemfontein - Hawies Springs
description:
Roelf and his team are very professional and very friendly ; they listen to us and give you solutions. They installed 2 new springs on our Isuzu. We highly recommend them.

Roelf : 082 902 8657 – 051 448 1348 – admin@hawies.co.za

News Leaf Springs
News Coil Springs
Repairs of Leaf Springs and Coil Springs
For all types of trucks and vehicle.
Manufacturing of all ...

name: The Travelling Tortoise Eco Resort
description:
Beautiful private spots, with an incredible communal pool! Lovely and friendly host Jeff! Well worth the visit! One of the best off the beaten path camping I’ve found! 
Take exit middelplaas or Die gat to get there

name: Rooidam. Andre and Bonquet. Tel 0844910142
description: Very nice campsite 500 meter from N 12. 10 km south from Britstown. 3 places with privat ablution. Also self-catering cottages available.

name: Green Elephant Backpackers
description: This is a hostel that has a small space for some tents. R110 or € 7 - breakfast included.

name: Borderpost Ongeluksnek (only SA!)
description: Very rough road from Lesotho down the Ongeluksnek Pass (hìgh clearance and 4x4, dont try if its wet!). There is NO Lesotho Borderpost, but the SA give you the entry stamp anyway, don't know how it works the other way round

name: Mvubu Campsite
description: Very basic campsite in the Kabouga part of Addo Elefant NP. Shower and toilet did not work when we were here. So bring everything with you. Nice setting near the river but swimming is not allowed. Good for everybody who needs a quiet spot after visiting Addo. Braai places are available. Mainly grassy area.

name: Caritas Werfbederf
description:
A Nice camping site on a farm wedding venue.
Very relaxed place close to the road.
Werfbederf means: " to be spoiled on the farm yard"
The main is close by but there are limited traffic
R120 for 2 persons

name: Ladygrey View
description: Nice grassy place on a plateau above Ladygrey on the way to Jouberts Pass. Seems like an old picknick place with braais. Panoramic view and nice sunset, had a quiet night.

name: Hidden in Farmland
description:
Not a bad place on grass and hidden from the road we saw nobody. Ok for a night. 
Drive the way between the fences to the train tracks

name: Marine Drive
description: Wild camp next to the sea. A bit exposed to passerbies and not overly safe for overnight, but a great picnic and fishing spot.

name: The Big Pineapple
description: Listed as one of South Africa’s 5 Unusually Interesting Spots to visit in SA, the Big Pineapple is Bathurst’s biggest attraction.

name: camping edelweiss
description: clean campsite with very friendly owners. 3 places for overland vehicles with water and elec connections.. also campsites and a tree house which is really cool to sleep in on the hot nights.. braai with free braai wood available.. good shower and toilet. no Wi-Fi, good mtn connection. 80R per person for camping.

name: Loskop Dam Nature Reserve
description: Small but very nice game Reserve. We saw Kudu, Nyala, Zebra, Warthog, Oribi but there is also Buffel and Rhino. Entrance fee R48,-

name: Beestekraal stasie
description:
Very Afrikaans lunch/restaurant in an authentic railway station.
Nice food with fair prices and a good stop over!

name: Riverside Lodge
description: A beautiful place right next to the river with great AC in the rooms. They have a bar and seating area overlooking the river with a restaurant. Really friendly and helpful owner Gert. A large selection of beer too ! Secure parking and a pool.

name: victory motors
description:
Donavon did a solid and quick welding job on our suspension. 
small garage with a great mechanic working there.

name: Selati River Lodge
description: Very pleasant lodge with campsite. Very friendly staff. Basic campsite with power alongside river. We paid zar 120. (2 persons with car) We were offered one of the lodge houses for same price. About 35km from Phalaborwa gate (Kruger). Lodge has a bar and restaurant. Recommended

name: Stanley’s Camping Grounds
description:
Nice campsite between trees. Grassy area. Basic but very clean ablutions with hot water. They have a Restaurant with WiFi but it’s closed on sundays. 
Haven’t seen a braai place. No electricity. Street is close so you can hear the traffic noise, but it was absolutely quiet at night.

name: Landy Bay
description: Perfect place for fixing up your Land Rover Defender. Andy (the owner) has a very good team and knowledge about Defenders.

name: Tierkloovdam
description: Well hidden perfect Wildcamp for a night. Big gravel place in front of the open gate to the small george. You can walk or drive to the Dam and climb up very easily. Nobody around.

name: The Neuk guest house
description: The Neuk guest house is home away from home! Haley, the owner and manager, is such an amazing, welcoming, funny and engaging person! We laughed a lot together, the rooms are beautifully designed with antique furniture, spotless bathrooms, great breakfast and whenever you had a question, Haley was there for us! Our car didn’t fit in her parking so she found a place where we could park it safely. She dropped and fetched us at the parking, so grateful for that! If you have the chance or opportunity to stay there, we recommend it without any reservation. The Neuk is located next to Florida road, many restaurants, bars, shops and grocery stores. 115oZAR double room incl breakfast.

name: Ikaia River Lodge
description:
Lodge with Campsite in Keimos at the bridge over the Oranje River. 
www.Ikaia.co.za
amanda@ikaia.co.za
082 331 1353
2 campsites, one down by the river with a nice view of the Oranje with 4 shade shelters in a little tree/palm grove. Electricity plugs on central points, watertaps and braaistands. Water is treated river water to be boiled before drinking. Private ablutions for each site.
150 ZAR per person
Second campsite on the top. View over the Oranje Valley, but no river view. Shared ablution. No shelter, only trees. Central electric plugs
130 ZAR per person 
Rooikoip island can be reached via a wooden bridge.
Very fast reception with MTN.
A small group of springbok is roaming the place and a fenced in kudu female.
Only downside is the heavy traffic from the road, but it was quite at night.

name: Eselbank Waterfall
description: Very nice pool for swimming. Seems lika a good place to stay a night, no shade.

name: Beachcamp
description: Very good place to stay. A few meter from the beach. To this point you can drive by a normal Car further requires a 4x4 and the sand is very soft. Nobody around.

name: Langbaai Beach
description: Big parking lot with nice outdoor shower and toilets in a nice quiet housing area!

name: Marivale
description:
Wetland 
No Camping
Self Catering Accommodation 
2 houses each accommodate 4 people

name: Stroom Af
description:
Sleeps 6
Great accommodation
Has all the essentials

name: Brittania Hotel
description: Best Indian food in Durban, especially Bunny Chow!

name: Weesgerus
description:
Nice formal Caravan Park / Holiday Resort in the bushfield with Indoor Hot pool. Various hot and cold outdoor pools. Short hiking trail. Tennis courts, mini golf, paddle cars  for kids. Restaurant and Pub. 
R225 per camp site (up to 4 persons) low season, R505 high season. Pensioners discount 20%
Chalets available.
Impalas in camp.
Plenty of birds.

name: Camp Sallie @ de Pakhuys
description: PRICE JANUARY 2022: 100ZAR PPN. Many camping spots spread under eucalyptus, near dam, by the boulders, etc... Not all camping spots have power. Bouldering and hiking trails available. Rock pools about 500 mts from campsite. Waterfall 1.2km hike. Fast free wifi.

name: Chris' Bikes & Car
description:
Local white mechanic, took care of my motorbike. He can repair anything: from boats to trucks (all parked in his yard).
Just be careful because he is quite tricky and can rip you off if you don't know about mechanic, which was my case.

name: Pizza Vesuvio
description: Great pizza. Close to Italien style. Nice atmosphere. Lovely stuff. Some craft shops around.

name: Serendipity Eco Trails
description: 4x4 and motorbike trails and campsites. Also day and overnight hiking trails

name: Port O’Call
description: This is a hidden gem right on the Blue Flag beach at Trafalgar. Spacious campsites and at many of them plants devide you from neigbours. Super sea views if you get a stand on the top part but bottom stand also very good. Clean bathrooms and a little shop for basics. Big swimming pool and games room. Very quite campsite and we stayed here in peak school holiday season. A must when you plan to vist KZN south coast! Low season 150ZAR per adult, 75ZAR for children (also small ones pay). High season 960ZAR per stand.

name: Cannon Rocks Holiday Resort
description: Walking distance from Cannon Rocks beach. Nice campsite with newly renovated ablusion. Swimming pool and games room with braai area. Shop with more than basics on-site. Stands are a little bit small but good enough. Each stand have its own braai place that are cleaned daily. If you have a big caravan plus extra’s I would suggest you book 2 stands in peak season otherwise the camp allow you to use 2 stands in out of season times. Recommend this place!

name: Riverside Camp
description: Beautiful place at the Orange River, not much shade but nice for swimming. Sandy place for a few cars, not much firewood. The last few meters down to the place are a bit steep with loose sand, 4x4 recommended also for the drive along the river. Beautiful drive over the Helskloof Pass, high clearance recommended.

name: Truck Stop Musina (Messina)
description:
You can use this guarded Truck Parking for overnighting with car or truck. There is food, toilett and Billard. It is rather busy during the night. I had some fun with truck drivers playing billard. It is 1 km to the border at Beitbridge.
35 ZAR/12 h.

name: Dusk to Dawn
description: Very nice place, luxury Farmhouse. Self catering cottages on a working farm up to 500 pp. No campsites.

name: Tim's Motorcycles
description:
Motorcycle mechanic with a decent shop and fair prices. He got me in and out in 20 minutes for a chain swap. Next door to a bike showroom as well if you're shopping.

021-425-5560
082-930-9183

name: Meadows by the sea
description:
Enough level grass to accommodate the whole African overlanding community. Either at these coordinates or, if you go down towards the right, closer to the beach. Sheltered from the views of the village and somewhat from winds. 5min walk down to a beautiful, secluded beach that seems to be used mainly by cows.
No 4wd necessary only maybe after rains, as it's a somewhat steep track on grass. We stayed two nights with a herd of cows and two locals visiting. None of them seemed to bother.
Full MTN 4G signal.

name: park transit
description: You are allowed to cross the park from the town of Addo here. No need to pay entrance fee. officially you get 20 minutes to transit but it took us 45 minutes because of the corrugated road. No problem at all! A free minisafari. A lot of animals to see.

name: Coney Glen Wildcamp
description: Secluded but secure carpark and beach with eight BBQ spots. Fishing off the rocks. Perfect for a sneaky 1 or 2 night stop.

name: Hollywood Lodge
description:
Very cheap single room with fridge, cutlery, kettle, private toilette and kitchen access.
They are really friendly and good people. 
The place doesn't have any sign and official name, i called Hollywood Lodge because is the owners name.

The single room is 100 ZAR.
Her telephone is +27 78 126 0808

name: Trichardtsfontein Dam Secunda
description: Quiet campsite along small lake. Good place to stopover before entering Joburg from East. Many SA dayvisitors fishing. Very basic. approx ZAR 135  2 pers plus car.

name: 4 Stroke Auto Clinic / Rust to Riches Auto Spa
description: 4 Stroke Auto Clinic. Very good place to have your car cleaned before storage and does service as well. Very professional staff. Close by Store It SA. Recomended. Owner Errol.

name: Eastern Food Bazaar
description: Great Foodhall cheap prices and huge portions.

name: Beach Wildcamping
description: Beautiful place right at the beach. clean beach toilets (bring toilet paper) water, 9 braai spots, wonderful beach to have a rest and a dip in the cold water. no shade though, bring a sunshade if you want to have a beach day. there are light spots at night but it was not too bright for us to sleep. police checks once in a while but never said something. wonderful sunsets. also almost no wind compared to other places we have been before on the west coast.

name: Swartberg Pass View Point
description: We saw the photo someone posted and took this as our overnight stay. Wonderful views down to the valley. Quiet and Peaceful.

name: Braai Place next to beach
description: Parking with braai stations right between two beaches. Clean public toilets a few meters away towards buffalo bay (about 3 min. walk), no other amenities. Quiet night, no one disturbed us, security checked at around 9pm but didn't say anything.

name: Paradise Beach Main Parking
description: Parking lot with toilets (closed at night) and outdoor showers. No direct beach view. Playground next to it, where families come play sometimes. Also some fishing people during the day/evening. Security guard in car checking once in a while. No one cared we stayed here. Local people (mostly old white people) were very friendly. Had two quiet nights.

name: Kini Bay Parking
description: Parking lot at the beach with security guard in the car checking once in a while. Had a quiet night. Unfortunately no toilets or anything.

name: Hole in the Wall
description:
It is worth a visit but go there by your OWN. If there are guys who want to show you around, watch your car or whatever make them clear you don't need help or ask them how much they want.
We had two young guys who walked with us to the hole (didn't ask them to) they were nice though and one of them told some stuff about the place etc. and there was another young guy who watched our car. at the end they wanted ZAR300 (100 for each) for this!! we gave them 20 each and told them we are campers. They were unfriendly after that, so make sure you ask them AHEAD or tell them you don't need help.

name: Scottburgh Main Beach Parking
description: had two quiet nights at the main beach parking. one night down at the braai area and one night up by the restaurant. lots of people come here early (5/6am) for surfing, fishing etc. we had a safe feeling because there are lots of big lights around (need good curtains though 😉). underneath the restaurant there are toilets (were always open) and changing rooms with cold showers (closed at night). also nice seaviews on the top parking. basically everything you need :)

name: Land Rover Parts
description: Graham has this amazing place with tons of Land Rover parts and he can help you out if you need anything. He also knows lots of people in Mozambique, Simbabwe etc. it's def. worth to check it out and have a nice talk with him.

name: Beach Parking
description: There are a few beach parking lots which are great for staying overnight in the car. mostly white people live here, lots of surfers. Car park guard here, nobody bothered us, only friendly people. There are outside showers and toilets open 24/7, toilet paper there.

name: Beach Parking w/ toilets
description: We took this parking lot over the other because here you have public toilets. The other one might be a bit more flat. We had a quiet night here and before that a family invited us to have a hot shower at their place, so we had a nice evening with beer and pizza at their wonderful house just up the street with amazing views. It's always a good idea to talk to locals ;)

name: Ingwe Beach Parking
description: Stayed here for 4 nights and parked a bit behind a small tree (still visible though) but nobody bothered us. There are a few cars during the night (I think fishermen) but other than that it was quiet. Didn't see or hear hippos but always be careful! there are public toilets and changing rooms, unfortunately no showers as the beach is not for swimming, but there are outdoor beach showers at the other beach. Beautiful beach for walks etc.

name: Sodwana Bay Beach Parking
description: turn left before the national park gate and you will find a beach parking for free. stayed there 2 nights and had no problems but be aware of the monkey, don't leave anything outside the car. there are toilets and outside showers at the national park parking next to it (accessable by foot). we paid 88rand for 2 pax and one car incl. beach parking (see photo) which we really enjoyed as you can stay directly at the beach with your car during gate times.

name: Mountain Mist
description:
Nice beautiful log cabins in the mountain close to Aurora.
You will need a 4x2 to get up there.

name: Torro Refrigeration
description: cooking gas refill station. all bottle sizes.

name: Kgalagadi Lodge
description: Friendly clean campsite. Very nice owners. We payed R150pp. Pool is available. It is in the very small town of van Zylsrus

name: columbine Co.
description: Without a doubt, the best coffee in the west cost. A small authentic coffee shop with a lot of history and breathtaking view to the river. Rudolph the owner is the sweetest guy. He will tell you all you need to know about the area. Defenitly worth a visit, even if you come from afar!

name: South Africa
description:
An incredibly friendly place to stay over for the night. After stopping by the other caravan site listed here and finding it a bit dodgy and unsafe, Jukskeipark was recommended to me. 

Space for campers, rooftop tents, or ground tents.  Campsite R150 per site + R50 per person. Room with shared bathroom R150.

name: Beaverlac
description:
•  Must pre-book (see website link)
•  High ground clearance vehicles advised
•  Non-demarcated campsites (some flat, some shady, some with views)
•  Communal ablution facilities (most have hot-water showers - ablutions facilities are scattered around the campsite) 
•  Take your rubbish with you (no disposal at the camp)
•  Power point and freezer available for use at the camp shop
•  Bring your own braai grid for allocated braai pits
•  Camp shop sells wood, beer, wine, ice, snacks, meat and cold drinks

Price: R75pppn + R30/vehicle

name: Lebo's Soweto Backpacker's
description:
Nicely laid out and well laid back backpacker's in a friendly community in the heart of Soweto. Responsible tourism provider with spotless facilities, good WiFi. Offers camping for R100pppn on a piece of land (that also functions as a community garden) a 1 minute walk from the main backpacker's.
Also offers bicycle and tuktuk tours around Soweto.
Highly recommended!

name: Embassy of Angola
description: working only on monday, tuesday and wednesday

name: Under The Stars
description:
Great recently setup campsite that is part of Bushwhacked Barberton, but with a separate entrance. 
The campground is nice and basic in a very quiet place with beautiful views. Good for ground tents and a few camper vehicles (no big rigs).
Small but spotless ablutions and a little sheltered sitting area to share with other campers, with electricity, sink, stove and braai.
The owners are extremely nice and welcoming and will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. 
I loved the place and warmly recommend it to all travelers who prefer a simple and homey vibe over well established campgrounds with private and/or luxurious facilities...
100 rd pppn.

name: Turn out
description: Small turn-out road next to road. Flat. Nice views.

name: Cederberg Wilderness Area
description: The Cederberg Wilderness Area is an amazing place to visit but its unique arrangements can absorb time and money.  There is only one place to camp in the park and that is at Algeria but you can camp just south of the park at Sanddrif (check in at Dwarsrivier Winery) or Cederberg Park at Kromrivier (where we camped).  They are all crazy expensive, for instance at Kromrivier they asked for R520 for 2 people but agreed to 350. You also have to pay for individual walks and get permits which give you the combination to the locked gates.  The Maltese Cross walk, for instance,  costs R70 pp, the rock art is 50 pp (the price list says its R70pp to picnic!).  You can enter the park from the south via Ceres or the north from Clanwilliam.  There are no entry fees if you are just passing through. The third way in is off the N7 about 20 km south of Clanwilliam, follow signs for Algeria.   This third way is the fastest in/out of the park from Cape Town. But it's all worth it - the park is stunningly beautiful!

name: Gecko Rock Nature Reserve
description:
Gecko Rock Nature Reserve has got 2 campsites. The coordinates are from the entrance. You'll have to phone or write an email to get the number code for the gate lock. De Wet's Rus which is bigger and Echo Valley, a smaller one. Basic ablution with gas heated hot shower and flush toilet. Basic covered kitchen with sink, small pool, movable braai drums and set fireplaces. Water is slightly salty, so bring own drinking water. It's quite a way in to reach reception (there is also a small shop for firewood, water etc) and they will direct you to the campsites in midst of fabulous mountain ranges in the Karoo. If you love solitude, you are at the right place. They offer various activities from hiking, mountain biking and a serious grade 4 4x4 trail. No electricity and no mobile reception. At the farmhouse you'll get free WiFi access which is quite fast.
140 ZAR per person

name: Edenvalley
description: Wonderful private camping ground on the Bergriver, just south of the Misverstand dam. One has to contact the owner, Jan Nel, for permission. His details are on the campsa website.

name: Berlyn Waterfall
description: Viewpoint for waterfall. Pay ZAR 10.00 to access viewpoint

name: Mac Mac Pools
description: Beautiful picnic site next to Mac Mac pools. Swimming in the pools is allowed. ZAR 20.00 pp entrance fee.

name: Island Vibe - Harbour Master's House
description: Nice, new hostel on top of the hill in Port Elizabeth.  160 Rand for a dorm bed in a 4 or 6 bed.  Good WiFi, clean and new facilities, kitchen, outdoor area, etc.

name: ZYHO Ltd Truck garage
description:
ZYHO: located in the industrial zone of North Springbok. Maybe not the cheapest garage for trucks in South Africa but they are really good with a big building (not the typical African style "lottery" garage). They are able to do everything. Welding, brakes, elektronic problems, etc. Also they repair normal cars. Probably your best beg in this region for the next hundreds of km. 
An additional remark (this comment we put in some days later): The seal replacement did hold only two days and was leaking than again and unfortunately they forgot to reassembly a spring of the brakeshoes....not so "funny"... So have a close look what they are doing.

name: Bush camp away from main road
description: Since the access to the other bushcamp nearby was a bit tricky because of the deep sand we drove a bit further up into the other valley on a small track. Here you have a good even place and a nice view to the broad valley. The only disadvantage is that cars coming from the north can see you. But you are at least 500 m from the main road away and there is almost no traffic at all. So it didn't matter to us. Info: the road from Eksteenfontain to the north is small, stony and bumpy.

name: Henk van Rooyen campsite
description: Campsite within Marloth Private Reserve. There are 9 campsites on the bank of the Crocodile River overlooking the Kruger Park. Restaurant and swimming pool is some distance away so the campsite is peaceful and quiet. Nice place to relax, sit under a tree, read a book while listening to the birds. R250 per night for 2 people and 1 vehicle.

name: Verneukpan Camp
description:
Camp in the middle of the Verneukpan. 
Fetch the key for the gate to enter the pan at the reception from the farm house. If you come from the south, the reception is on your way anyway. The gate to enter the pan is about 5 KM from the reception. The camp itself is about 5 KM from the gate. There are signboards so it’s easy to find.

This place is obviously used as playground for the guys :-) 

As the guys like to come here for racing cars and bikes, the set up is also made for partying in the middle of nowhere. Very special. 

Modern ablution block. 
Besides running water and flushing toilets (4) (even a male and female section) (clean and fairly new)- hot water from a donkey for the 4 showers- you will find a big communal area with a big fire place and bar set up (inkl. Fridge and kitchen sink) and shade. Sandy surface. The whole set up is also protecting nicely from wind and sun. Fridge and Light are running on solar. 

It’s like a small open air rockers club in the desert :-)

Camping is 120 pppn.
A bag of wood 10 ZAR. 

No signal. Digital detox.

name: The Hantam House
description:
Restaurant and Shop/Museum - antique style. Very interesting and cosy.

Yummy food and a fantastic atmosphere.

Have a look at the pictures. You will find the Menu.

name: Waenhuiscrans Cave
description:
Probably one of the most beautiful cave structures to be found anywhere. Like people say, go there during low tide for the best experience. And watch your footing :) bring some shoes that can get wet.

Bring your bikini for a swim at Roman beach or Otter beach. Otter beach is a 4x4 required.

No entry fee.

name: Great White Mall Superette Vulstasie Kleinbaai
description: Fill up for gas bottles. See the picture for prices

name: Sterkfontein Caves
description:
Sterkfontein is a set of limestone caves of special interest to paleo-anthropologists located in Gauteng province, about 40 kilometres northwest of Johannesburg, South Africa in the Muldersdrift area close to the town of Krugersdorp. 

The Sterkfontein Caves are one of the richest and most productive palaeo-anthropological sites in the world and form part of the Cradle of Humankind World Heritage Site.

name: Toll point
description: Toll point. Only RSA cards are accepted and cash. So we had to turn around and get cash and then we could pay.

name: African Aloe Cafe
description: Charming cafe in Uniondale. Delicious coffee and breakfast.

name: Bush camp close to Lighthouse / Namaqua NP
description:
If you go to / or coming out of the Namaqua NP than this area might be a good opportunity for a quiet bush camp. Drive approx 5 km southward along the beach to the lighthouse. After having passed the gate you are out of the NP and you can stay wherever you want for the next 70 km (info from the employees of the NP). 
If you like to be very close to the beach follow the track - 1 km after having passed the lighthouse. 
If the wind from the ocean is too hefty, wet, salty and cold you can go up the track into the countyside. We followed the track for another 500 m and stayed on a "small junction". Not so beautiful like on the beach, but warmer, nice view to the ocean and also very quiet. Nobody passed us on this small "bush track". 
If you want to hide even more than you can follow the small track on this "junction" into the inland. In - 1 km there is a kind of old quarrel.

name: Bagdad Café
description: Road side restaurant with very good food for a very acceptable price. Huge portions. No menu but a buffet. Very informal place where lots of locals go. It's open all week (except for Monday) but only on Sundays as of 1:00 pm this buffet is open. The other days sandwiches and pancakes are being served. Also possible to camp informal.

name: Luphohlo view
description:
Nice spot with a beautiful view on a mountains and valley with Luphohlo lake.
We stayed between rocks on flat place close to grassy road.
Road goes to top of a mountains and there probably is the end.
Two 4x4 cars pass and one nice guy. 
But he told us that this is area with local robbers with knifes. And they like stealing phones and money.
Nothing happened. But be careful! The road is on maps me.

name: Frischgewaagd B&B
description:
There is no camping but we stayed here with our friend who hasn't camping equipment. 
Nice couple live here and they have 5 rooms.
He payed 300R for nice room with bathroom inside. 370 with a breakfast. Big area with domestic animals and sheep.
Good internet WiFi.

name: Kruger Inn Backpackers
description:
Great backpackers close to the Crocodile River entrance to Kruger NP.  The nicest owners, who will help with all your planning for Kruger.  It wasn't busy when we went and they upgraded us to a private room.  Good WiFi, nice kitchen, parking.  Nice rooms and beds.  Mosquito nets.  Cash only.
Dorm was 170 pppn on Hostelworld.

name: Natalia Meatmasters Vreyheid
description: Amazing Butchery with good quality meat from the area. Good place to stock up before heading east

name: uniondale guest lodge
description:
clean rooms, good breakfast, small bike museum, adventure bike friendly.

beautiful old house that has been renovated.
owner run.. great people.

name: Forklift Specialist
description: Michele and Alan are very friendly and willing  to help big rug  owners.  You can consult with them.  0317691010

name: Blyde River Canyon viewpoint
description: There is another viewpoint of the Blyde River Canyon here.  We didn't go to see it, but from the photos it looks nicer than the Three Rondavells viewpoint.  It's 50 rand per person to get into the property.  You can also eat at the restaurant and the fee is waived.

name: Biggy Best
description: B&B near centre of Howick. Needed a place to stay cause our car broke down. Price 950 rand per night. Staff was overwhelming friendly and helpfull. For 100 rand there is an excellent breakfast.

name: Just Tools
description: Dave the owner and his son  Guy are vilining to help.  They build us an adaptor  for our European gas cylinder

name: iSimangaliso wetlands - Western shores
description:
Entrance to the western shores part of the iSimangaliso. There is also an entrance 25 km south of Hluhluwe. Entrance for 2 people and a car was R173.

It's a small park, with Rhinos, giraffe, hippos, Buffalo and several antilope species. The views over the wetlands are very nice!

name: Boat House restaurant
description:
Good seafood!
At the ocean shore. We ate plater for 2 full of calmari, fish, shrimps, mussels for 310 zar. Difficult to eat it all! Delicious.

name: Mopane Bush Lodge
description: Forms part of the Mapesu Private Game Reserve. Soon to be a big 5 reserve with planned introduction of lions in Aug 2022. No more private driving in the reserve. They offer activities in Mapesu GR and Mapungubwe National Park. An unfenced campsite close to Mapungubwe National Park gate (8km). Campsite about 7 km away from lodge. You can use the swimming pool at the lodge or Wilderness camp and they offer breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The price for the campsite is R190 pppn (children 6-12yr R95) per night. Ablutions new and clean.

name: Oude Stasie
description:
Small campground at a old trainstation.
Simple ablution block with running water.
There is a pub where you could eat and have drinks as well.

name: Palm Resort Mozambique
description:
Super friendly and helpful owners that will make you feel at home and ease. Fully booked during main South African school holidays, but an awesome place to relax otherwise as it's open year round. Does offer en-suite camping but gave us a good off-season discount on one of his self-cwtering sea view casas in combination with diving.
Manta Reef is an awesome spot for a dive, and Jay (the owner of the resort and dive center) is a superb instructor. We did 6 dives in 4 days. Surfing also possible in the bay and local fishermen selling fresh catch.
If there's nobody at the reception go down to the dive center/restaurant on the beach.
Restaurant has WiFi and reasonable prices. 5 bars Vodacom 3g.
Highly recommended!

name: Monkey Bay Backpackers & Campsite
description: Very nice place, 150 metres from the beach, the supermarket/ATM and the Mozambique restaurant. Rooms are very nice and artistic, 500 rand with shared toilet and shower, 550 with private bathroom. 200 pp in the dormitory and 130 pp for the camping. They also rent tents with 2 beds inside for 400 R. The camping is very nice and all the spots are in the shade. There is a bar, a braai area and a spacious common kitchen. WiFi in the bar/kitchen zone. Staff very kind and helpful. no vehicles for camping can enter

name: Sodwana Hengelklub
description: This campsite is at the entrance to Phongola NR gate.  Since the Phongola campsite is closed it is a possibility if you want to stay around.  160 p2 ppn.

name: Wonder View Parking
description: Stayed at the parking lot of Wonder View overnight and had a quiet night. No one bothered us, Police drove by once but didn't even check.

name: Urban Backpackers
description:
Cheapest hostel in the city center of Johannesburg, with a rooftop terrace and a large choice of rooms. Dorms for 165 rands.
Very friendly staff. The area is not 100% safe but the hostel and other artistic shops and trendy restaurants bring some hope for the neighborhood

name: Die Kraaltjie Guesthouse and Caravan Park
description: Campsite near Joubertina. ZAR150 for the site and ZAR25 pppn. They opened a small Cottage near the reception/restaurant for me as it was raining, so I could stay inside and use toilet and shower there. Haven't seen the Caravanpark, as it's on the other side of the plot.

name: Legend Resort, wildside camp
description:
Wildside camp is a tented camp in the Waterberg Nature Reserve. It is a private game reserve with over 20000 km2 and houses all the big cats and rhino’s. No camping is allowed.They have around 10 tents with own abolution and fridge and you are surrounded by wildlife. Elephants, kudu, baboons, wildebeest, giraffe, etc all come into the camp. Besides that you have a stunning view of the mountain range which houses more lodges to stay.

The camp has a bar and restaurant and offers free wifi. The camp should normally be pre-booked, but we where able to get through security without problem. 

It is not cheap (2200 Rand pp in high season - until end of April), but a package includes 2 game drives, full board and coffee or tea. A good place if you want to spoil yourself.

name: Buffels Drift
description:
Good food, friendly staff, uncredible view while you have dinner/ lunch.
Waterhole with elephants, hippos, buffelos and birds.

They also have lions, cheethas but we didnt saw them.

They also facilitate accomodation, swimmingpool, gamedrive.

name: Tokai
description:
A well managed land rover specialist. Good mechanics and team. 
Nice vibe. It helps a huge amount to have some knowledge as it seems I was pushed towards unnecessarily buying a second hand engine by the owner.. when all that was needed was a bit of a rebuild. (I did the rebuild at a fraction of the cost) 
I visited and kept an eye on the job over two weeks rebuild. The job seems ok so far.. a few loose connectors needing tightening but not too serious mistakes. 
I would suggest this place if you have a Land Rover, basic ideas of spaces and mechanics. All my spares had to come from joburg.. availability problems. 
Thanks to the team on site. You guys helped me so much.

name: Dynamic Drive Vehicle Service Center
description: A full service auto shop. The mechanic/owner Ryand was very nice, explained the problem and found a solution. And he fit us into his already full schedule. Highly recommend.

name: Canvas & PVC Products
description:
Manufacture of custom canvas products and repair. They made a new rooftop tent cover of heavy canvas with sturdy zippers to replace the Hannible tent cover. They completed the job in a few hours and charged $55. They also helped us to repair a broken part of the tent structure, supplying us with the necessary hand tools piece of wood, screws, and work space. Maureen and her staff were very nice and super helpful. 

Railway St, Parow East, 7500
078 364 9170

name: French Lodge International
description:
biker friendly, wifi, R850 and R990 per room inc breakfast, rooms with bathrooms, good and clean.
safe parking, walking distance from steak house.
friendly staff.

name: grumpy griller
description: A real South African stake house, with very good steak and cold beer. Plenty of parking for big rigs as well.

name: Motorcycle repairs
description: motorcycle workshop good service, wheels. tyres fitted as well.

name: Capitec Bank
description: This bank is free of charge for foreign cards.

name: Atlantic Point Backpackers
description:
Nice, clean hostel with a bar. Free healthy breakfast in the morning. Secured, gated parking.
Rooms range in price but I paid $14USD / 200R for the cheapest 8 bed dorm

name: Hoedspruit Endangerd Species Centre
description: Very educational, great tour. Loved the cheetahs and the rehabilitation program.

name: Baobab road toll
description:
Need rands to pay for this road toll.
Car/Bike is 45 ZAR
Truck is 122 ZAR

Do not accept any other currencies and card machine doesn't work. If you don't have Rand they will send you back.

name: Windpump PADSTAL
description:
Small shop and coffee bar also selling gifts, farm products  (chutney etc) and cold drinks. We were able to change some USD here for the toll heading south.

Owner is really friendly, great place for a rest after the border if heading south.

name: Aloha Lodge
description:
Lovely guesthouse with secure parking behind an automatic gate (for annything bigger than a regular 4x4 or van, better to contact beforehand). Nice rooms. Very clean. The friendly owner used to overland herself in Africa. Located a bit out of the city, but the nearby MyCity bus takes you there fast and cheap. Supermarkets and restaurants nearby. Safe neighbourhood and nearby beach is great to spend a day. 

We paid around R350 per night for a room with private bathroom and kitchen for 2, but price is dependent on season I guess. Check prices and availability on booking.com.

name: quick fix - phone repairings
description: good specialist to repair your cell phone. you can buy here new one if is needed

name: Celtis country lodge & restaurant
description: R650 for room with bathroom. Nice and modern. Safe parking, pool and wifi.

name: Wildcamp Potluck
description:
Instead of turning to Potlock Boskombuis take the gravel track on the opposite for a few hundred metres. On the right site you will find a small bay where you can easily park and camp for the night. It is flat as well, if you manage to park your vehicle properly. ;-)
There is enough space to pitch a tent next to your car too.
Absolutely quiet, safe and not a single person passing by.

name: 7 Mill guesthouse
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

7 Mill is a large three-bedroom house that is comfortably furnished. Two of the bedrooms have queen-size beds and the third room has two single beds. The bathroom has a shower and a bath and is shared by guests, while the kitchen is fully equipped and has all the necessary for guests to prepared cooked meals. The lounge is open-plan and features a TV with local channels and there is also a patio outside with a built-in braai and table and chairs. Albertinia is a peaceful country village situated between the Indian Ocean and the Langeberg mountain range. The area offers beautiful views of the coastal area along the Gouritz River and is well-known for its abundance of aloe that grows in the district.It is also about 5 Kilometers away from the Big Five. Please note: rates subject to change depending on the amount of guest staying. Two guests at R800.00 per day, three-four guests at R850.00 per day and five-eight guests at R170.00 per person per day.

name: Gearbox Specialist
description: Gearbox and differential specialists and full auto services. Owner Richard went out of his way to help us. Had to replace the diff housing.

name: Agents Building - Customs SARS
description: We entered SA through Eswatani. At Oshoek Border they wouldn’t stamp in our Carnet (not sure we should have stamped in eswatani) because they aren’t an international one. They sent us to the Airport. At the terminal we were sent then to that building. You can walk or take a taxi/minibus 8R. You can get the stamp here 1st floor

name: Lisbon Falls
description:
Really nice waterfalls, 10 ppn but they will rise the price from 1 August in all places.
it will be 15 ppn

name: Dentist Dr. Botha
description:
If you have on your long journey problems with your teeth (even root canal treatment, etc ) and you need a real good dentist on European level than we can highly recommend Dr. Botha. 
Dr. Louis Botha
Phone: 021 851 3772
Email: info@drlouisbotha.co.za
Tre Mondi Office Park, 2B Niblick Way, Somerset West

name: Regional road through big 5 game reserve
description:
The regional road (P466 on mapsme) is going trough the Phinda Game Reserve.
Connecting N2 and R22.

You are allowed to drive trough for free. Even with the BIKE!

I saw cheetahs laying on the side of the road. Lot of giraffs, buffalos, gnus and other antilops.
Worth it!

name: Monzi Safari Lodge
description:
"Lodge" with diffrent sleeping possibilities.
They have dorm and diffrent fix tents in the area.
Huge clean kitchen, pool with lounge area, braai area.
Stayed in the dorm for 165R.
You can also organize a lot of stuff over the reception.
There is no camping possible.

name: Aweh Africa Backpacker
description:
Nice alternative backpacker. A lot of locals and friends of workers are hanging around at the weekend. Had a lot of fun together and went out at saturday night.
Warm showers, kitchen a safe parking for the bike. They have wifi as well.
Payed 145R for a dorm. (20% discount because i was in contact with the ownee over couchsurfing)

name: Huuuuuge buddist temple
description:
Impressive buddist temple, we were told second biggest in the world. Worth visiting. 
9-16 exept Monday
Free entrance
Restaurant available for 30 zar pp.

name: Mac mac falls
description: 10 zar pp, nice view on the high waterfall

name: Lisbon falls
description: 10 zar pp, nice view on the Lisbon falls

name: Embassy of Poland
description:
The most unpleasant embassy in which we were. The arrogant attitude of all employees and Vice Consul K. Dąbrowska. We wanted to make temporary passports to get back to Poland on the western coast. Like many Polish travelers, we wanted to keep the "old" passport in case there was no temporary passport in one country. We did not get permission for that. The old passport had to be canceled immediately. We therefore applied for a biometric passport - 1700 rand per person and 6 weeks of waiting. The passport can then be picked up by courier, sending the old one to be canceled.
The consul also refused to give us a consular note that could help in obtaining a visa to the DRC, Cameroon or Nigeria.
Unfortunately, they are under it: Namibia, Lesotho, Swazi, Botswana and Zambia.
If you can settle consular matters in Angola or Tanzania, do it. The consuls there are much more forgiving for travelers.
----
Najbardziej nieprzyjemna ambasada w jakiej byliśmy. Aroganckie podejście wszystkich pracowników oraz Vice Konsul K. Dąbrowskiej. Chcieliśmy wyrobić paszporty tymczasowe, aby wrócić do Polski zachodnim wybrzeżem. Tak jak wielu podróżników także polskich chcieliśmy zatrzymać "stary" paszport na wypadek gdyby w którymś kraju nie był uznawany paszport tymczasowy. Nie uzyskaliśmy na to zgody. Stary paszport musiał być natychmiast anulowany. Złożyliśmy zatem wniosek o paszport biometryczny - 1700 randów od osoby i 6 tygodni oczekiwania. Paszport można potem odebrać kurierem przesyłając stary do anulowania.  
Konsul nie zgodziła się także wydać nam noty konsularnej, która mogłaby pomóc w otrzymaniu wizy do DRK, Kamerunu czy Nigerii.
Niestety podlegają pod nią: Namibia, Lesotho, Swazi, Botswana i Zambia. 
Jeśli możecie załatwić sprawy konsularne w Angoli czy Tanzanii zróbcie to. Tamtejsi konsulowie są dużo dużo bardziej wyrozumiali dla podróżników.

name: Embassy of Namibia
description:
You can get your visa here. 
Many papers needed:
- passport copy
- one photo
- printed and filled form from their website (they don't have forms in embassy)
- copy of certificate of marriage if you are woman (...)
- copy of car registration
- prove of accommodation (booking reservation for 2 places is enough, you can cancell it later)
- printed bank statement for last 3 months
- copy of your international credit card
- prove of transfer of 80 rands to FNB account of Embassy (you go to FNB Bank and you do this transfer by yourself in ATM, you'll get printed receipt, no stamp on it needed
- itinerary - if you want 3 month visa make itienarary for 3 months

Cost: 
80 rands for applying 
500 rands for tourist visa (paid AFTER VISA APPROVAL) (2-3 days of issueing)
500 rand if you want expres visa (24 hours)

good luck!

name: Hlane NP entrance gate
description:
Entrance fee is just 60 zar pp but if you enter your own car you can't drive into lion section. To see lions you have to go on safari game drive (not your car) which is 375 zar pp. With your own car you can see standards: giraffe, zebra, etc. and white rhino.
We saw giraffes and blue wildbeest from the main transit road.

name: DEV PANEL BEATERS
description:
Good garage with very friendly owner. 
We fixed here our liquing axis seals and bearings. They have also welding equipment and other staff.

name: Bulembu
description:
Nice border in the mountains. No people at all. Beautiful landscapes both sides. Road at Swazi is gravel but easy and SA tarmac. Worth driving.
No carnet needed, just a stamp in the passport.
Open 8 am - 4 pm

name: Off the main road
description: We stayed here after few hundreds km of fence next to the road. You turn from the main road and cross railway. We asked friendly family if we can stay next to their house. They keep there tracks. Told us it's very safe area. We had quiet night.

name: Olivuer's rust
description: Beautiful place to stay. A lot of grass, trees etc. They also have a swimming pool and nice places in the garden to spend evening outside. Around in the city you have everything: shops, restaurants, petrol station etc. Good place to stay before/after meringspoort. Better to stay here in a room but probably camping in the garden also possible but without facilities. Special price for the room for bikers is 300 rands (I would say apartment because it has kitchen inside and bathroom of course and a lot of things you need). Recommended!

name: Toll for Chapman's Peak Drive
description: Toll for Chapman's Peak Drive is ZAR52. Pay cash or RSA bank card. Gate is only on north side.

name: Muriel's
description:
Cheap bar with sea food. Calmari woth chips is 70 zar
Next to it is seals collony in the water so you have to wait to see it. One of it is on the coast and if you pay some donation to one guy you can touch it and take some photos.

name: Nice near border crossing
description: Nice hidden place. You have to turn right from the main road and drive gravel up the hill (even though road seems to be over), then you are on the top and then drive down. You are surrounded by small hills so absolutely nobody can see you. We spend nice peaceful night here with beautiful stars.

name: The Amble Eagle View Campsite
description:
Large beautiful private campground on the edge of a gorge with 3 waterfalls. Trees for shade or places without shade. Electric plugs on some sites. Clean and spacious ablution with showers and toilets. Nice gas heated hot water with super pressure. Small kitchen and laundry in between the ladies and gents ablution. Beautiful possibilities for hiking. As it is a private campsite, pls contact the owner Dieter on 0828064034 or Rosi on 0711 248944 first, as gate is locked with a combination padlock. From the road follow the white arrows, it’s not far along a good dirt road. Good vodacom signal, no MTN!
140 Rand per person

name: Mandini Maintenance Services
description:
Small little workshop with a very experienced old mechanic who can do any kind of mechanical and electrical work. 
Contact is Chookie 0824916448
19 Mimosa Place, Mandini

name: Willemsrivier Trekpad 4x4 Guest Houses
description:
I checked into this place just as the sun was setting and I'm glad I did. Basic and simple lodging set on an old farmstead that's been in the family for 7 generations. 

The room that I stayed in was an old jewelry shop over 100 years ago. Plenty safe, I left all my luggage on my bike. plenty of room for big trucks or trailers too. No wifi but good cell signal should you need it. 

200R for the night.

name: Trysome Auto Electrical Specialist
description:
A international business that is specialist on auto electricals. 
They did all my wiring of the car and it looks awesome.

A company that delivers excellent quality, their time management (8 o’ clock is 8 o’clock and they exactly know how long the project will take) is good comparing other companies. 

——> price is value for money <———

Go here it is more better (and cheaper) then R&D for example.

name: Morewag Farm house
description:
Isolated private apartment still rooms. Self catering. Heat / AC, Television, good beds. Plenty of room to park whatever you'd like with no need to unload the bike for security. 

And it's cheap! 150R / night

name: Witsand NR
description: This campsite is in the nice Witsand NR. The costs for the campsite is ZAR 125pP. Entry fee is ZAR 120pP (international). The San wildcard will not be accepted. The ablution block is very clean and has hot water. Each campsite has its own BBQ and electricity (but only the South African blue camping adapter fits). In theory they have also a restaurant and a pool - however in this season nobody is here, so it's closed. Apart from the famous dune you can climb and see, there are also some animals like oryx, springbok, dyker, baboon, klipschiefer, mangooses, etc.around. Some are even in or in the bushes behind the campsite.

name: Pumba guest house
description: Pumba guest house. 380R for a single. very clean. secured parking and fast wifi. not much to do in the town so make sure you eat first or bring food.

name: ATKV Klein-Kariba Holiday Resort
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please be aware that this place has likely been submitted by a stakeholder of the place.
---
Surrounded by bushland, this casual, riverside resort is 6 km from Bela-Bela's town centre and 22 km from Sondela Nature Reserve.

Good shaded paved camping some with shade netting, very neat and tidy abblutions. Cabins and 1- to 2-bedroom suites add kitchens, living areas and sofabeds; some have air-conditioning. There are also safari tents with kitchenettes.

Amenities include a restaurant, a cafe and a convenience store, as well as a mini-golf course, and indoor and outdoor pools. Boats are available to hire, and horseback riding is offered. Parking is complimentary.

name: Platjan Lodge
description:
Platjan Lodge now also has 4x campsites, each with their own ablution. Not on the Limpopo river though, with power and running warm water. Overlanding vehicles (trucks) could have access issues to the camp.

Platjan Lodge offers a wide selection of accommodation, only a short drive from the Platjan border post to Botswana. Here guests can stay in lovely private chalets, all fully equipped for self-catering.

The accommodation is available in the Three Bedroom Chalets, Pool facing Rooms and Garden Cottage. The units are all comfortably furnished with modern facilities and fully equipped kitchens. Each unit has a private braai area and views of the gardens, river or pool.

On-site facilities include a restaurant, bar and swimming pool.

name: Kook Fontein Rondavels
description:
Rooms for 300 ZAR. Large shared room for 100 ZAR where you lay sleeping bag on floor. Kitchen and toilets attached to sleeping area. Warm shower in building next door. Parking is inside camping and it's possible to position vehicles out of sight from main road. Lots of electricity power points. Friendly owner.

kookfontein64@gmail.com
027 712 3701
072 569 7096
071 918 4670

name: Rust Oord
description:
Nice campground in the Bushveld not far from Brits. Very friendly and helpful staff who made us feel very welcome. 16 campsites with braai, electricity and water. Ablutions very clean and neat with dishwashing area. Communal boma next to ablutions. Bar at reception where you can order take away sandwiches etc. They also have a swimming pool and play area for kids. Walking routes with small animals. 
Tel: 0824945570

name: Die PlaasKombuis
description: holy smokes... If I wasn't in a rush, I'd sit here all day and just drink coffee. This is a great little coffee shop with amazing sandwiches. great breakfast or lunch. I'm definitely going to come back.

name: Ifafa Caravan Park
description:
38 grassed and level campsites 
Top campsites with seaview 
No braai's Ablution block very nice & clean with 6 bathroom cubicles (shower bath toilet & basin) 
On site butchery liquor store basic supermarket restaurant & laundry facility
Reasonably priced @ R125 p/p

name: Hollywood Bunny Chow!
description: Delicious bunny chow, it is also a place for sport bets but not creepy. secured parking available, even for higher cars.

name: Relax&Unwind
description: Very nice place to stay. . 350R for two per night. The cheapest option in town. Very nice private room (indépendant from the rest of the house) with a confortable bed, and private bathroom. Safe for our bicycles. Hester was a amazing guest. She can provide dinner (65pp) and breakfast (35pp). They invited us for dinner and we talked about South Africa for hours. Very interesting.

name: Wild Dogs Safari Lodge
description:
Wild Dogs Safari Lodge is a small-scale bush lodge with 10 chalets situated in the heart of the Greater Kruger Area. We are in the process of adding overland camp sites to our site. 
Our open and inviting main building and entertainment area offer you a dining room (where breakfast and dinner is being served), a comfortable lounge, outside terrace with open fire pit, fully stocked bar and refreshing pool with sunbeds.
All surrounded by a luscious garden for your relaxation during the day. In the evenings you can enjoy a pre- or after dinner drink at our open log fire while being embraced by the starlit African sky.

name: Tekweni Backpackers
description: Standard hostel environment with gated / secure motorcycle parking. Has a bar and a pool. 200R / night for shared dorm

name: Mercurius Commercial Polokwane
description:
A garage for Mercedes Benze trucks. You have to make an appointment. 0152984700
5 Marmer St.  Polokwane  Google Maps have wrong position

name: Mercurius Commercial Polokwane
