description: Mercedes-Benz  garage for trucks.  0152984700 you have to make an appointment ahead. Very nice  and helpful

name: Pak Steel Machine shop
description: dodgy neighborhood but good supply. came in with a buddy because he broke his foot peg off. they fixed him up something quickly. just another option for you

name: Green Fountain Farm Resort
description: Location updated. 48 Spacious Stands, each with own private bathroom facilities (shower, bath, toulet, basin), electricity & addition basin & shelve for dishes etc. Spacious stands. Some stands are paved if you wish to stay longer than a month....others grassed stands, where you can camp up to a month. Some stands also offer a DSTV connection port. WiFi hotspot available. For longer stays you also get a Tourism Pass which offers discount at local establishments offering recreational activities. The resort is situated 7km outside (East) Port Alfred, Eastern Cape. Pets (on condition) & Child friendly. Safe & Secure. A beautiful & tranquil resort....a real piece of paradise.

name: Bakgatla Caravan & Tent Resort
description: A huge campsite next to Bakgatla gate. 228R p2ppn. Pensioner's discount.

name: Skooltjie Farm Store
description: Very nice farm shop we a LOT of very nice thing to eat and drink. Everything is home made. Cake, cookies, jam, juices, tea, coffee, ice cream, mustard,...

name: country club caravan park
description:
nice campsite with braai spots, water, electricity and lots of shade.
call Soon for the site 0820563531. 
70 ZAR pppn.

name: Hluleka Nature Reserve
description:
Really nice chalets with ocean view. Prices and information on website. 496 off season, 650 high seasons for 1-2 people. self catering!
hiking trails unguided, nice stretch of beach. Camping not possible

name: Fort Baufort
description: Filling station with convenience store and rest rooms

name: Gubu dam campsite
description: Camp in a pine forest next to Gubu dam. Very senic. Flyfishing for brown or rainbow trout. License for fishing needed.  Ablution block and water. No electricity. R30 per person per night

name: Santos Express Train Lodge
description:
You can sleep in an old train car! need I say more?
Secured parking for motos. Private suites available. Restaurant and bar in separate train car. Definitely worth checking out if you're into trains.

name: Houdenbek Campsite
description:
•  Working fruit and vegetable farm in the Koue Bokkeveld 
•  All vehicle access
•  1 Private campsite accommodating 15 people
•  Fresh water in camp
•  Non-powered campsites
•  Braai facilities and fire pit
•  Swimming pool
•  Private ablution facilities with hot-water showers

name: Anysberg Nature Reserve Campsite
description:
From R160 per night
Anysberg is a beautiful campsite in the Karoo. There are 5 Campsites (Duiker, Springbok, Gemsbok, Steenbok & Eland) with very clean and modern ablution. Wheelchair friendly. All vehicle access (high ground clearance vehicles advised). Communal kitchen area with gas stove, fridge and freezer. Communal ablutions with hot water (gas and solar-powered geyser). Fresh water in camp.  No electricity. Braai facilities with picnic tables. Horses sometimes roam through the campsite. Horse riding, hiking, and mountain biking are some options to consider. Pensioner discounts (conditional)

name: save Build Mica Hardware Hazywiew
description: You can buy or refill LPG GAS at Save Build Mica Hardware Hazyview . 30 ZAR per kg.

name: Nelson Mandela capture site (museum and monument)
description: Site of Nelson Mandela's capture. There is a free museum and monument, new exhibition opening August 2019. Interesting historical stop off on Midlands Meander route.

name: Rufpatch, Smithfield, Hamilton street
description:
Ideal overnight with hot water shower & clean ablusions. (Camp or rooms)
On outskirts of Smithfield, next to owner's house

name: Nkomazi Municipality (Nature Conservation)
description:
Office to get the permit for visiting Lionspruit Game Reserve.

97.20 Rand for Adults.

name: Bryanston Organic market
description: Great place for some nice goodies, natural products, cakes, homemade products, breads and a meal in the yard with live music. All organic and handmade items and foods!

name: Victoria Hotel
description: Beautiful old hotel. Victorian style. Clean, high ceilings, bathtub and shower. 400 zar

name: Didima Camp
description:
Really nice chalets in this place but looks very expensive. But you can come as a day visitor for hiking. 50pp or free with wild card.
There used to be a campsite but it is closed. 
The receptionist said they are working on it...
We did Rainbow Gorge hike ( 3 hours)

name: African Bush Backpackers
description:
Backpacker place that allows camping.
Car with roof top tent pitched somewhere in the parking lot - there is an electric plug for campers.

Use the facilities from the backpackers.

Super well equipped kitchen, big fire place, huge outdoor sitting area.

Nice & helpful Owner

Camping is 200 Rand incl WiFi and electricity

name: Lutzville hotel
description:
Really lovely owner !!!!
Room are clean with WiFi and tv.

Single room 600 rand 
Double room 900 rand

Food in the restaurant is good !

name: The Padloper Coffee Shop
description: Nice family owned country store... Far better than stopping at a chain restaurant. Lovely owners. Great food!

name: Simonskloof Mountain Retreat
description:
•  8 Private off-grid campsites around a 300-year old oak tree (some on grass, shaded or in the sun)
•  Water points at select campsites
•  Ecofriendly compost toilets
•  Hot water showers with traditional "donkey boilers"
•  Pit braais (wood for sale)

name: LPG Tank Fuel Station (Autogas)
description:
Here you can have a gas tank or a gas tank-bottle filled.
BP / Stockill Road is the meeting place with Niel.
You need to call him (+27 84 408 3643) before going as it is a private facility.
Good service, good price.
The only place on the whole coast of South Africa for gas tank filling.
E-Mail: neil@autogassa.co.za

name: Fish & Chips
description: Nice Fish and Chips. Fresh and tasty. Parking at GPS coordinates.

name: Ossewa Padstal
description: (Ox Wagon Farmstall in English) Lovely farmstall that sells fantastic pies and other traditional farmstall goods as well as succulent plants. Lovely owners that manage it. Highly recommended, you won’t regret stopping here.

name: Teen-die-meer (Next-to-the-lake)
description:
Turn-off 3 km before Chrissiesmere, from Ermelo, in Mpumalanga.
3.3 km Dirt road.
Nect to largest lake, on an operating soya & maize farm.
Ideal for summer camping, fishing, rowing (few cano's for hire - R100 p/d) - no power boats allowed..
Patches of shade.
We camped in dry mid winter - only 2 campers - complete silence.
Care-taker (Andre) on site.
Hot water from solar heating - high season would limit supply.
Few ablusions - very neat & tidy.
4 House & few hoyse-tent accomodation.
Main feature for us: complete silence.

Fee was ZAR 200. I paid R80 for car and just me

name: Darryl se Dienssentrum
description:
Good reliable mechanic. We did a service check and renewed our break pads  (Landrover Defender) 
Darryl the owner worked a long time for Mercedes Benz.
They are busy, may be call ahead 

058 303 1572
083 414 2937
083 309 3226

name: Komatipoort Municipal Caravan park
description:
Like all other platteland towns, this municipal campsite is equally run-down, but still operative.
Normal rate R250 per stand.
We preferred to negotiate it to R200, over the nearby luxury one at R440 but 3 days minimum.
For stop-over it supplied all we needed - even a warm bath!
It was a Saturday evening, we were alone with only a party at the lapa - with the promise from the on-site care taker, that he closes the gate at 20.00 - end of party.
We walked out the gate down to the bridge over the Komati river - spectacular- the bonus was the yawning hippo opstream close to the railway bridge. The suset contributed to spectacular scenes.
We washed laundry & had the ablutions to ourselves.
Good value for our money.

name: Mariepskop Gas
description: Refill of LPG GAS and exchange, can be done here.  You can also get some spare for gas bottles, pipes, regulator etc.

name: Backpackers Connection
description:
Great place to stay in Joburg. Not only as a hostal but also for camping! We stayed here with our truck on a large grassy area. 
The price was ZAR 150 in total (a breakfast is included). 
Staff very friendly. They have a pool, kitchen, saloon and free fast WiFi. Watertap is on the ground but no electricity plots (but we could connect with our long cable drum with the house).

name: EPR 4x4 Centre /Panelbeaters & plastic repairs
description:
Run by Marius these guys whipped up a bunch of useful stuff for me in aluminium: iPad sun shade, fridge holder, foldable table frame etc for good prices and with a helpful smile. Recommended if you’d like something custom made. They also have a small 4x4 bits and bobs shop and can do full panel beating and plastic repairs, painting etc 
0827758733
marius@epr4x4.com
(This whole street has lots of useful places and a good community spirit amongst them all)

name: Pro Clean Window smash protection
description:
JayJay and team can fit window protection to your windows so that they shatter and stay in place (rather than smash and allow access) in the event of a attempted robbery (very common occurrence in South Africa and Namibia currently).
0218874060
0710500118
info@procleancarvalet.co.za

name: Cockpit Tyres
description:
A good place to get new tyres and get them repaired. We got here new tyres for our truck. Contact is the super friendly and helpful Gio Zanchetta. 
He will give you infos and prices per e-mail in a very short time. 
Tel: 011/4540606
Fax: 011/4540651
info@cockpit.co.za
www.cockpit.co.za
They are located at the corner Fleming Street/Koomhof Road in a very calm area.

name: Schwaben - Traditional German Food
description: If you looking for real delicious traditional German food....."Schwaben" is the place to be!! In this combi Restaurant/Shop you   will get thinks like Leberkäs with sweet mustard, (real) Brezel, Maultaschen, Spätzle, German Brötchen/Semmel, German sausages, German Wurst, Sauerkraut, Schweinshaxe... and we are sure many thinks more... äh .. forgot Rittersport Schokolade!

name: Diesel Line
description: Specilised parts shop  for diesel vehicle.

name: 4 stroke auto clinic
description:
Recommended by Country Park Campsite. We went to make the oil change : it was Ok. We came back to change the timing belt, to change gasoil filters and to change the oil of the gear  and the transfert boxes. After that, the vehicule started badly and stalled at the fire-lights.
They did not purge the filters. They made only le level of the gear box and they did not do anything at the transfer box they did not find it without saying anything !
We had to come back. We don't recommend at all !

name: MRZ Gearbox & Differential
description: Mechanic specialized in differentials and gearboxes. Rashaad and crew are very professional and diligent.

name: Techno Dent Pty Ltd
description: Really friendly and helpful advanced collision mechanics!  We didn’t get work done here as they specialise in panel beating and spray painting but they recommended somebody who could install parts we already had (will put that on ioverlander too).

name: Musical Cars - electrics and aircon
description: Great place, friendly owners and mechanics, great service. Asked us to come back after a few days to check again whether the aircon was leaking.

name: Cousins Mechanic
description: Excellent garage in PE. Very professional, fast and cheap! Accepted parts I had to do work, some other garages in PE wouldn't. (084) 377-6602

name: The Pantry
description: Nice cafe/restaurant with parking directly outside our round back. wood burning stove in the winter and great food!

name: Anysberg Nature Reserve
description: Nice nature reserve with a good track. On the top of nice mountain

name: Camping, Canvas & Bags
description:
Kobus runs a small workshop (unit 6, number 9 Link Road, Gordon’s Bay) where he can make or repair anything out of canvas and pvc etc.
He replaced my ripped 3m awning with ristop canvas that had a sun reflecting side and made an awesome small canopy for my back door (1200 rand). Super nice guy, calm area, great service and products.
0786076079
www.ccbagman.co.za

name: Gounden’s Restaurant & Take Away
description: Excellent curry house - the Bunny Chow here were voted best bunny’s in Durban 2018.

name: Dennebos Camp Ground
description:
Camp site and Self Catering Units.
I stayed in one of the units for a very reasonable price of SAR120.00 for the night. Fully contained self catering unit with a kitchen and 2 beds. No shower but a nice deep bath.
Telephone Number:	+27 (0)23 316-1882 / 1878
email:  denontvangs1@witzenberg.gov.za

name: Mette’s Auto Electrical
description:
Great place, established in the 1970’s by a German family and run by the enthusiastic son Claus-Peter they offer top class auto electrical and mechanical services.
I replaced all of my Defender wiring looms with them and installed from scratch a ctek system with Smartpass, sound system, solar system and all accessory wiring. Impressive wiring and over 150 years of combined knowledge.
Also did quite a lot of mechanics, the guys are good, lots of Toyotas and Landies come through for servicing.
Workshop space to rent out the back for overlanders, large enough entrance for trucks, electricity, sheltered and shaded, but if the offer is abused it will be withdrawn, so please work respectfully. Can use auto electricians and mechanics on a chargeable basis if they can fit it around their booked work.
Super lovely people, easy commute from Africa  Overlanders with little traffic, good safe area with lots of useful trades people for overlanders.

name: Stellenbosch Speed Body Shop
description:
Great panelbeaters, painted all of my wheel arches and dashboard plastic, removed rust from bonnet underside and painted it beautifully.
0835004110

name: Afrigas
description: Small gas filling shop, can fill any sized bottles etc etc

name: Hi Tech
description: Professional auto electrician, big workshop, fixed my problem in 2 minutes, though the guy was surly and spent most of his time checking text messages.

name: ATKV Eiland Spa (African Culture Org. Island Spa)
description:
I was surprised to note that this top class camping site was not yet listed.
It is situated 80 kms NNE of Tzaneen, Limpopo Prov.
It is one of a few sites in this organisation, spread around the country, mostly with hot water swimming facilities.
We decided to pop in & experience a site where EVERYTHING works, because you pay for it. At R340 a night it was more than we could afford every night on our 30day tour from Cape to Kruger, but this 2-day visit was worth it.
The enormous outdoor hot water swimming pool was a treat around sunset last night & at sunrise this morning and the hydro pool is filled & will be tested tonight.
Winter camping is pleasant here with mild night tempratures.
Facilities are top of the range and monthly tarrifs for "swaeltjies" (swollows) are very atractive.

name: Fennells Gas Appliances
description: Very helpful, filled my fixed gas tanks with ACME fitting. Lots of spares etc for sale

name: Parkrun Doornhoek Farm
description: Part of the Parkrun series of runs just outside Thabazimbi

name: Leavy Green Cafe
description: Fantastic vegan buffet for R175 for a large plate. Nice orchard and farm feeling, next door there is a coffee shop and another restaurant next door but vegan buffet was fantastic!

name: Tsitsikama Wolf Sanctuary
description:
This pin is located at the big rig entrance/exit for Tsitsikama Wolf Sanctuary which also allows camping. If you arrive at this entrance call Robin on +27 82 956 4175 to open the gate. 

Camping with the wolves is offered for 100R pppn (or voluntary donation, just talk to Robin) and there are ablutions, power, and water. Not sure about showers. 

You actually camp between wolf enclosures and you can listen to them howl at night. Beautiful. Hiking huts (byo linen) and a fully furnished cabin are available too.

Wolf tours are 100% worth it and you can pet/scratch some of them, lovely animals. 

Robin, Raven, and Andrew are really knowledgeable and passionate about this Sanctuary and it's a great cause to support.

name: The Falls Guesthouse
description:
very nice B+B w different room options and spacious grounds. we paid zar 600 for a double room w bathroom and small kitchenette (fridge, microwave, kettle - no stove tho). spotlessly clean, decorated to a high standard. tv. 

theres a common area / honour bar, childrens play area and parking. couple of restaurants nearby.

name: Calvinia Guesthouse
description: 300 ZAR ppn in winter. Lovely, rustic cottage with a kind owner. Has secure garage with two parking bays. Room equipped with TV, microwave, kettle, fridge, small heater (takes bite out of cold winter night), and comfy beds.

name: Link Gas (Plumstead)
description: Place to refill Euro/UK/Namibian gas bottles. 200 ZAR for 9kg, quick and hassle free. Eddles gas wouldn't refill ours but this place was no problem. Recommended.

name: Nomad’s Land
description: Really nice, relaxed, rustic backpackers’ hostel; dorm, rooms and camping available. Can’t take roof tents but we parked up and had a great stay overnight in a room.  Beautiful views over the ocean; great place to re-charge your batteries!

name: Eagle Creek Resorts
description: A very friendly and nice place to stay. Especially the owners Sandra and Oliver are great. They let us stay, because we need nothing. They have no abolutions etc. for typical campers yet, but they plan to set it up. So for travelers like us it is perfect, others have to wait a bit. We stayed for free, because we just asked and we were the first ones ever, but I can imagine that they set up a pricelist as well. Big place, grassy and clean. A lot of big trees, so there is shade, too. The road is not a problem at all.

name: Thabaphaswa Mountain Sanctuary
description: Thabaphaswa Mountain Sanctuary is not a normal camping site, but rather a bundu bash. With a "donkey" for a hot shower (outdoor geyser heated by wood fire) & a flush toilet with a mountain view, it must be experienced to appretiate the uniqueness. The 10 km dirt road is also a challenge for a soft under-belly motorhome. The entire lack of electricity, made our heater useless.. extra blankets helped us through a chilly night. The bushveld is dry & dusty in winter. However, we find everything peacefull & very safe. Deon was friendly & Johannes "managed the donkey".

name: Op-I-Plaas Bush Camp
description: Basic campground with all most needed facilities. Flat grassy ground. Big. With trees for a bit shade. Nice owners (farmer). 100 Rand pp.

name: Above the Ebenezer Dam / Lake
description: Amazing place above the lake with a stunning view with surrounding mountains. Absolutely quiet, nearly hidden from the small street. We just parked on the forrest track.

name: Die Bosvarkie
description: Space to pitch tents on grass/sand for 50 ZAR pppn. Pay 20 ZAR pppn for electricity. The pub runs the campsite and serves food too.

name: Hole in the Wall
description:
180 ZAR per room when booked online for twin 'backpacker' room. Communal kitchen available (room 6).

They have a bar at reasonable price. 750ml bottles of lager are much better value than smaller.

Friendly and helpful staff.

name: Motorhome-World / Bobo Campers
description:
Motorhome factory with fully stocked motorhome part inventory.
Bobo Campers is a camper rental company with workshop.
Specializes in the motorhome part.
www.motorhome-world.com
www.bobocampers.com

name: The Kaross cafe
description: Beautiful restaurant on orange farm. The restaurant has outside tables under big shady trees. Some inside tables also. Wood art work throughout. Small shop that sells beautiful needlework produced on site. Varied menu with vegetarian options. Food was delicious.

name: Askham Agrimark
description: Fuel station and well stocked shop with meat as well. GAS refill done here and they also have an ABSA ATM

name: Franschhoek pass
description:
Perfect parking lot / picnic area.
you should arrive there for enjoying the sunset 
pretty quiet, even if u can hear the road  ( about 100 m away )

name: Bobo Campers Mini Campsite
description:
A patch of grass and/or parking and a well maintained and clean ablution block.
It is part of the big Bobo Caravan rental area.
Space is not for many campers, so best call or write before if it is ok to come.

IMPORTANT:  you must arrive before 16.15h Mo-Fr if you have not pre-arranged for getting the keys! You cannot enter the place if you don‘t have the key.

Price is R275 per vehicle with up to 4 people included. Credit card accepted.

Tel +27 11 395 1020
info@bobocampers.com

Traffic noise from the street. No airplane noise, despite being next to JNB international airport.
No wifi
Very useful is the shopping area Brentwood Park just 500m away with supermarket, restaurants and a professional laundry company.

name: Corporate Auto Electric Car Mechanics
description: Excellent mechanics who immediately sorted out a broken calliper for us (brake fluid was leaking on our right tyre). Their labour costs are 550 rand (circa £30) an hour. We were recommended this mechanic by a local. Highly recommended! Email: corporateauto@netralink.net. They work on all sorts of cars of different makes and models. Ours is a Toyota Landcruiser Prado 120.

name: Wild camping next to the beach
description:
Very nice and quiet place,(at least in winter) next to the beach.
It's a small parking with only 6 places.

name: Copperleigh Trout Cottages
description:
Moderator note: This place added by an owner, and has not been overlander verified. 

Copperleigh Trout Cottages offers guests two lovely units built overlooking the 10ha trout stocked Mavela Dam. It is located on our fully functioning sheep and cattle farm in the beautiful upper Dargle area, close to the popular Midlands Meander in KZN, South Africa.

Copperleigh Trout Cottage sleeps up to 8 guests and features 3 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, open plan lounge and fully equipped self catering kitchen. Complimentary DSTV, WiFi and bundle of firewood provided daily. Kayaks and easy access to the dam to go fly fishing.

Copperleigh Trout Cabin sleeps up to 4 people and features 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom and open plan lounge (with double sleeper couch) and self catering kitchen. Stunning sunsets can be viewed from the verandah!

name: Stormy Hill horse trails and accomodation
description:
Stormy Hill horse trails is the place to be for quality horse trails and comfortable self catering accommodation.
From a one hour horse ride to a complete horsey holiday you are in the right place.
If horse riding is not your thing then relax and enjoy the views from the cottage or go for a walk on the hill.

name: Koningskop
description: Campsite 15 km from N7. Very well kept places at an orange farm. 50 spots. They have 4x4 routes. Gets busy during summer with Cape Towners.

name: Clarens Auto Clinic
description:
Cobus Von Wielligh
Great mechanic in Clarens (the only one!) who can do call outs and has a workshop. Fixed our landrover. very nice guy. 

Phone number - 076 873 4875

name: Railway service road (cyclists and bikers)
description: A lot of nice hidden spots along the railway service road. It's a good gravel road. You can push your bike through one of the little tunnels to get on the other side of the railway.

name: Thula Thula Game Reserve
description: Here is the famos place of Nana, the Elephant from the book „The Elephant Whisperer“. You should read it, if you are traveling through South Africa and you should visit the place. Nana and the other elephants are amazing. We never saw elephants so near and so authentic. Best animal experiance ever.

name: Motolek Upington
description: Specialist  in any electrical problem, like starters and battery

name: FIT IT Upington
description: A tyre, exhausts, shocks etc. center for fixing or replacement

name: swartberg pass
description: nice overnight spot, with beautiful mountains surroundings, with river. some tourist trafic. So nice, we dont want to leave.

name: Anne's Inn B&B
description: This B&B with 4 campsites are clean and an unexpected oasis in the Karoo knersvlakte. Note that there is only 1 x bathroom with the shower and toilet for all the sites.

name: Solarzone
description:
German owner,  great service, very knowledgeable, excellent pricing
Solar panel supply, fit, service.

name: Andante Game Farm
description: What a lovely place. camping on lawn in the bushveld. Every camp site has enough shade.  Clean refreshing pool & good facilities with hot shower. Every spot has a power point. There is no shop but at the reception you get firewood, icecream, soft drinks and sometimes game meat. But there is a shop nearby and the famous vleis fabriek . One of the best butcheries in Limpopo. Management and staff are very friendly people.  It is allowed to do bushwalks by yourself. Zebras, Wildebeast, Ostrich and much more animals are walking around. A lot of different kind of birds. At night you can see Bushbabies. It is worthwhile to come to Adante and spend some days here. We definitely love this place. 250 Rand for a place / night (2 people).

name: Kareespruit Farm and Camp
description:
Awesome Lodge and camping. Great food at the lodge. Really well maintained and modern 
300 Rand per site

name: Mpayathutlwa Pan Waterhole
description: Water is pumped in , so you should always see something worthwhile here

name: Skilpad Padstal Farm Camp
description: Basic but beautiful. Stunning view. You park right on the Gras. Absolutions clean. Signal only at the park reception. It’s in the park. Not sure how much it costs since we got invited but I heard it’s 275R per site.

name: Farmstall  Skilpad Namaqua NP
description: A nice privet campsites next to Namaqua NP  reception. 275 pnp2p.  very  nice at the flowers time. The pass under the N7 when you  come from Kamieskroon is high about 4m. Good MTN connection next to the park reception.

name: Doornkraal Uitspan Guesthouse
description: Campsite 22 km east from Garies,  used to be an old school, belong to a very nice farmer which is not always here you can contact by these numbers: 0276528705/0836267997/0845499999. Write Doornkraal on the GPS,  it located about 500 m after the houses on the south side of the road a sign written  "Uitspan Welkom"  when we came nobody was here but his neighbor passed and we have asked him to call the owner. It coast us only 100R p2ppn since we didn't use any facilities. Since we didn't use any facility I am not sure about the amenities. Very nice  in the flowers time.

name: Seal colony
description: A lot of seals at the south of Boulder bay. Sandy track for 4x4 only.

name: Mercedes Benz Commercial
description: A Mercedes-Benz garage for trucks go  there if you have MB truck, they are the experts. New Vaal  Motors  0544950436

name: Pitlane Motorcycle Accessories
description: Well stocked selection of tyres, oils, helmets, boots, gloves, spare levers etc. Could be a good place to change tyres if you're about to enter Mozambique to head up the East coast.

name: Gas City
description: They fill Gas cylinders  we had an adaptor for European  cylinders

name: Green Place in Village
description: Nice, quiet place direct in the village. By the way an absolutely nice village with cute shops. Grassy and flat under trees near a tennis court. We spent one night there and we were also at Clarence Restaurant 5 Min. away. That was very delicious. We don't know if it was allowed, but no-one came.

name: E&D Engine  Center
description: We fixed here our Mirror they have craved us the broken part. Elias strauss 0543323718/0827760043

name: Bei den Lisbon Falls, mit Badegumpen!
description: A wonderful parking lot for the night, next to the water, with mountains view. The street is a dead  end. In the evening very quiet.

name: Buffalo Grill & Bistro
description:
If you want a perfect steak, this is the place.
Grilled to perfection and VERY tender!
A medium rare order will come medium rare!
Very friendly owners and service. Pleasant garden. 
Safe parking inside the yard.

name: Nieuwoudsville Municiple campsite
description:
Nice safe campsite just outside town.  Clean ablutions.  Power.  Running water. 
Ideal for stop over to visit the flowers.

name: Gas Connexion
description: Good place to fill your gas bottles! We bring an adapter and it was no problem to fill our german bottles.

name: Port Elizabeth
description: Exclusive Car Care and Valet. Thorough truck clean inside and out. 2500 Rand. Worked non stop 7am to 6:30pm, tough day but great and hard working team.

name: German Farm Butchery
description:
The german  butcher  Arno sales very good venison products directly out of the farm. To recommend very much, everything tastes really fantastic!! Sales of high-quality meat products from game meat. cheap and well.
Please, contact for trading hours
germanfarmbutchery@gmail.com

name: X-TREME AUDIO
description: Very friendly and good prices. I bought a rear view/dashcam. They also do window tinting. Excellent service.

name: Villa Lin-Zane
description: Lovely guesthouse, friendly owner. Perfect for a stopover. R700 for a clean, pleasant double room.

name: Masisi Fuel
description: General Store and fuel station. Has Petrol and Diesel. Last fuel before Kruger and Mozambique if you are going through Parfuri gate.

name: Blits Hardware
description: General hardware store with gas filling station on the back.

name: Midwest caravan park
description: Nice camping spot 18 sites with electricity and water and pet friendly. Under new management.  We pay R100 pp (check latest price)

name: Skurwe bay camping
description: Nice spot at the beach.  Wild camping.  We stay 2 nights.  Beautiful view of the ocean.  Free.

name: Addo Elephant Safari & Lodge
description: You can walk with three elephants, feed them and take a lot of pictures. The program lasts 1,5 h. We tried it, although I don't like domesticated wild animals. But these three elephants would be killed in Kruger, if they weren't there. So ... nevertheless we enjoyed the contact with these big and fantastic animals. And I hope they have a good time with their guides.

name: Die Koperketel Restaurant
description: Tastes differ. Some do and some didn't enjoy the food at all. Good wifi. $65 for double cheeseburger and chips.

name: Desolation Valley
description: Here is the entrance of the Camdeboo National Park Valley of Desolation section. Unfortunately it was cloudy, so we saw nothing, but I saw a lot of nice pictures, so try it.

name: Swart Berg Pass
description: Wild camping on a flat area. No facilities. nice view from here.

name: Die Pienk Padstall
description:
Best well known Padstall in the Northern Cape.
Local dried food and all sorts of everything.

Coffee to go and small dishes.

Don’t miss. Cute place <3

name: Smith's Cottage
description: Very nice backpackers hostel with wery nice host. No camping

name: Sendelingsdrif Rest Camp
description: The Sendelingsdrift Rest Camp is situated in the Ai-Ais/Richtersveld Transfrontier Park and is run by SANParks. This campsite is mainly used by tourists arriving late at the park, and cannot reach one of the more popular campsites in time.  Campsites have a power point and there are clean ablutions with hot showers. There is running water at this campsite. No motorbikes will be allowed inside the park.

name: Manyeleti Main Campsite
description: Camping for the Manyeleti Game Reserve. R125 pppn. Many campsites, but most are unusable, the usable ones have water, a sink, power and a Braai. Ablutions are OK. Entrance to the Game Reserve was R55 per person. The reserve adjoins Kruger, and there is no fence between. We saw lots of animals on just a couple of short self game drives .

name: Elangeni Holiday Resort
description: Just off the N4, so you do get some road noise. R135 for the stand then R60 per person. Nice grassy sites. Ablutions OK. Power, water at sites. Shady areas. Friendly owners.

name: Herold Wines
description: We parked here on the parking lot for one night after a wine tasting. The owner was very friendly and open to that. The wines are nice and the cheese platter is great. Yummy!

name: Kleine Paradys
description: Very nice campsite on grass next to river with shade and ablutions per campsite and warm water pool.

name: Rebellie Game Farm
description: Camping outside a self-catering lodge. Great views and wildebeest, eland and zebra. For 250 pppn to use the well equipped kitchen, nice bathroom and braii area. 350 pppn if you want to use a room. We had the place to ourselves. Good hikes from the lodge and 4wd trail. Good mobile phone reception

name: Langebaan Laundrette
description: Laundry and ironing services. 100 Rands per big lot for laundry

name: Hermanuns and bay
description: Stunning view from the mountain above the town and the coast. Could be windy at night. Quiet.

name: Benmari Resort
description: Well established campsite with accommodation available.

name: Lesoba
description:
Guestfarm with Cottages and a little campsite. Fantastic view to the Mountains. 100 ZAR pp and per site. Nice and really clean abulution.
Very friendly Owners!

name: Umlalazi Campsite
description: Very nice campsite inside the nature reserve. A short walk to unspoilt beach . Well marked level spots. Own braai facilities.  Grass site amongst an established forest.  Well protected from the winds.

name: Modderfontein Farm Campsite
description:
Campsite next to a farm. Communal showers and toilets. Braai places. Very quiet, nice surroundings. 
No kitchen, in some parts of the camping there is MTN LTE. Telefone: +27 82 602 4607 

We paid 120 per person.

name: Look to the Indian ocean
description: A really big parking bay with look to the Indian ocean. Beach access. Overnight stay of the meant permits. On the day the place is guarded. Toilets exist. In the place there are shopping possibilities.

name: Forest place
description: Lonely, very quietly, meadow, in the wood situated parking lot. Entrance on forest way with GPS data p. 28°24'11.4" O 31°7'13.9"

name: Fairhills Caravan and Camping site
description: Very nice small campsite with lots of facilities including washing machines, small swimming pool, yable tennis etc. Out of school holidays 80 Rand per person.

name: Riders Rest
description: Great place for motorbike riders (but also camper vans or trucks) in the Tankwa Karoo. Just a couple kilometers east of the padstal with wifi, cold beer, shower and toilets. All you need and nice people too! 100zar pp for camping. There are also set tents if you prefere.

name: Pofadder overnight apartments
description: Great place, clean rooms. Friendly people all over. Best stop over onroute to Namibia. Onseepkans border post close by.

name: INDUNA ADVENTURES
description:
Nice place to stay for adventure attractions : river rafting, zipline, geckoing/tubing, quad biking, horse trails, paint ball, mountain biking and archery also Teambuilding groups.
Very professional guides/coachs and nice, friendly staff. 
Enjoy a journey or couples of days in the park. Possibility for camping. 
Running from monday to saturday
www.indunaadventures.com
We stay here 2 days and we was very lucky and enjoyed our journeys after 5 days in Kruger park.

name: Pestano Lodge
description: Hotel type conference centre with large deck above crocodile river on south west of bridge into Kruger Malelane Gate

name: Camdeboo National Park
description:
Very neat affordable campsite in a fenced camp. Surrounded by the cambdebo National Park. 

There is a beautiful large lookout deck which make the perfect sunset spot. This looks over many animal trails and over a large water body perfect for animal and bird spotting. 
The most beautiful sunset happens here. 
The campsite also grants you access into the park for more animal spotting. 

It is close to the town of graaf-Reinet as well as nieu-Bethesda. 

The campsite has bathrooms and warm showers. As well as kitchen areas. Each camp spot has access to power. Perfect for camping as well as larger overland vehicles.

name: Amber Lagoon
description:
Beautifully crafted campsites in the heart of the Karoo that boast creativity and soul. Run by a lovely german lady the campsite is truly in the middle of nowhere close to the Gamkaberg Nature reserve between Oudshoorn and Calitzdorp. 
Make sure you take a walk to the top of the property where there is a beautiful sunset bed .
As well as into the adjacent land.

Keep your eyes down to the ground to find some incredibly specialized succulents and fynbos. 

It is also placed between ostrich farms so if you here some odd noises during the night don’t be alarmed.

name: GAME services
description:
Superb garage for motorcycles. They fixed my leaking rear shock.

https://gameservices.co.za/

name: Alternative for Sentinel Car Park
description: Free place, 50 metres beside the entrance to the Sentinel coach park on meadow. Several parking spots. Wonderful views to the rock massif, amphitheatre. Very quiet.

name: Umfula Resort
description:
Umfula Resort next to Vaal river. This resort is located about 7 km away from Parys in the countryside directly on the Vaal river. They have about 38 campsites all near (some directly on) the river. Some have shade, some less. But all have a nice grassy underground, electricity, braai .... and a nice view to the river. There is a bar and a nice pool.
The "midweek price" (Sunday to Thursday) was ZAR 200 for a vehicle up to 4 persons. If you stay at least 3 days the price will be reduced to ZAR 150/day.
At weekends the price is a bit higher (Not sure how much). 
But this is a good option if you stay in this region since there is no proper campsite in Parys

name: Balie’s Gat
description: Wonderful chilled camp site with basic amenities. Men’s and ladies shower. Running stream and green grass

name: Marshall Services
description: Repairs and Servicing of most vehicle makes and models.... diagnostics etc.

name: Good Hope Farm
description:
nice farm with lovely owners at the end of the valley.
just follow the dirt road till the end.
9 cottages available.
great hiking and views at valley
goodhopefarm.co.za

name: Heriot Manor
description: 4 Star Guesthouse including self catering studios

name: Blinkwater camp
description:
Cool spot with small river, natural pool, fireplace, big an clean shower/toilet complex.
Electricity and fridge available.
R80 pppn
You can get keys and pay at Citrusdal Country Lodge at the main road at town.
(022)9212221/2

name: Trekoskraal
description: camping prohibited and can be fined. day visitor are allowed

name: Badenfontein
description: Lovely well established campground under shady trees and lawns. Good facilities and suitable for overlsnder trucks snd rooftop tents etc

name: COD Maintenace
description:
Little allround garage for all kind of vehicles. Very knowledgeable, quick, honest and reliable. Not expensive as well. Gave me the wholesale price for the parts.
Been here with my Toyota Landcruiser HJ60 with a leaking Clutch Slave Cylinder.
Contact Melinda 0157932369

name: Happy Wanderers
description:
Campsites with braaï, electricity and pletts and chalets (4 p). Near the beach, at 20m. Clean and big ablutions. Space for washing dishes. Near a train rail. But quiet in the night.
160 rands/ ppn for camping. Grass and sand. Swimming pool. Restaurant. Shop inside also. Little dogs in low season. Very nice place to relax on the beach.

name: Cottage Restaurant
description:
This nice restaurant offer Breakfast, salads, gourmet toasties, pizzas, burgers, snack baskets, grill, chicken, seafood, mexican, wraps, pasta, combo’s and curries. Special menus for pensioners and children. We eated a fish & chips (80 R/pp)very good!!! All is very clean. Staff Douglas & Tracey, the mangers, are very friendly and helpful. Definitively we recommande it! Also take away.
Adress : 3 Ironwood Road, Pennington. Tel : 0399751938.

name: Solihull 4WD
description: Excellent, helpful Land Rover workshop. Speak with Ryan.

name: Kimberley Caravan Park
description: Safe campground, clean toiletts, friendly staff, perfect after visiting the Big Hole. 70 for car, 50 pp.

name: Municipal Caravan Park
description: Just in front of the Elands Bay Hotel and better value camping then at the hotel. Right on the beach. Each site has a braai pit and electricity. Abolution block clean. Simple but everything you need. High season 217 Rand for a site up to 6 people and low season 187 rand.

name: See Kaia
description:
Really friendly place, perfect for a hungry cyclist battling the wind (:
Sells fish and chips, pizza, burgers and also a small food shop. owners are really nice. WiFi available.

name: The Great Outdoors
description: The Great Outdoors - Supply Company, Tours & Safaris. Your go to store for all your outdoor needs and accessories

name: Parr's Halt
description: Easy border crossing. Gravel roads on Botswana side.

name: The love rock
description:
Big campsite with Lovely green grass. Toilets bit run down and noise from the road. 
There is a big pool, playground, sweet rabbits and a bar and restaurant. We quite liked it for a stop over. Despite the traffic sounds.

name: Rivierzicht
description: Beautifull grass campsites next to the river

name: FD Motorcycles
description: Motorcycle mechanic. Marius does the work right in his driveway and he loves meeting adventure riders.

name: Newton sands guesthouse
description:
Very nice place, friendly owner and staff. Fully equipped kitchen and safe parking. 
We highly recommend this guesthouse. 
It’s in the business district near many garages.

name: Ardenza Farm
description:
This is a very nice farm to stay. Quiet, clean, with domestic animals. The owners, Joan & Jan are very friendly and helpfull. 2 rooms available in an independant house. En-Suite bathrooms. One with double bed for 350 R/n/room, the other with Queensize and single bed for 400 R/night/room. 
One big campsite is possible on green grass, with block ablution, hot shower, electricity and braai facilities. 100 R/ppn.
You can use also the kitchen for cooking (good equiped). 
You can order a breakfast for 50 R/p. We stay here for one week : Mountain Zebra is at 45 km, Bedford at 60 km. The next town Cradock, is at 30 km. You can relax also ! Our favorite place in South Africa! We definitively recommande it. 
Informations/Reservation : Jan : +27823537744 or janheerden@gmail.com

name: Wonderlik
description:
Coffee shop with basic food (Sandwiches & Cakes).
Open Monday to Friday from 8:00 til 17:00

name: Swartrug campsite, Kagga Kamma
description:
5 campsites with nice view.
#1 ok for 2 cars
#2 ok for 1 car
#3 very little privacy
#4 ok for 3 cars
#5 Best privacy, ok for larger group
Nice swimming pool
Ablutions to small

name: Ararat Viewpoint
description: In our opinion the best lookout. come here 1-1,5 hours before sunset as the gorge turns into red & golden colours. Also better to climb up the hill on the right as you can have a better view on the gorge and you are also able to see the sun. Much more beautiful than in day time. Road to the viewpoints are easy driving. Perfect spot for a sundowner :-)

name: Collywobbles Gorge
description: There is a gravel road that doesn't see much use to this location. Views from the east side of Collywobbles Gorge.

name: West Gate of the Baviaans
description:
The west gate of the Baviaans. Fee is R68 for foreigners for a day permit.

Great mountain pass with many baboons. 4x4 required. Be aware of rains, as there are a couple river crossings.

name: Bushfoot Base Camp
description:
Small and simple campsite 1 km before Bakhatla Gate into Pilanesberg Nationalpark.
Very friendly owner Craig Hunter built up an overlander and backpacker Bushcamp.
Craig‘s been overlanding himself and has much knowledge about the environment and the park. He also offers hiking and other tours.
There is a communal brai area, a main building with a communal fridge and a sitting area to relax. Solar lighting, but there is 230V electricity in the main building and Craig‘s got a long extension cord. Next to the main building is a small communal kitchen with a gas stove and pots, pans and cutlery.
The warm showers are bucket showers.

Camping is 75 Rand per person,
4sleeper rondavel 600 R, twin room 500 R and small 2 sleeper tents with bedding 400 R.
Mobile signal despite a nearby tower not stable. Best reception with Vodacom, cCell and MTN weaker.

name: Jembjo's Knysna Lodge & Backpackers
description: Nice backpackers within walking distance of the harbor. Clean ablutions, wifi, some space for parking, and a breakfast of hard boiled eggs and toast is included. Dorms are R180 per night.

name: Pistols Salon
description:
Pistols drawing room and game west museum is a very nice special restaurant. Peter, the German owner is very nice and friendly. Food tastes very well!!! Every Friday there is live music of the finest one!!! In the season every evening live music. In Visit of the restaurant on may spend the night on own car here also certainly.
Pistols Salon und Wild West Museum ist eine sehr schöne spezielle Gaststätte. Peter, der deutsche Eigentümer ist sehr nett und freundlich. Das Essen schmeckt sehr gut!!! Jeden Freitag gibt es Live Musik vom feinsten!!! In der Saison jeden Abend Live Musik. Bei Besuch des Restaurants darf man hier in seinem Auto auch übernachten. Der Platz ist bewacht.

name: Pistols Salon Place
description: In visit of the restaurant, one may spend the night in own car here also certainly. The place is guarded 24 hours.

name: Laledi guest house
description: In troubleshooting for a vehicle Night 200 zar Electricity Toilet Shower Very kind.

name: Checkers and more
description:
Brand new shoppingplace with great checkers, woolworths, mugg&bean, etc

Parking place big

name: The Clivia Farm House
description:
5 grassed Stands , beautiful clean ablutions , splash pool, set in a 1ha garden on a working Sugercane farm with abundant bird life.
Have a look at our face book page "Ekukhanyeni farm house"

name: Adams Apple Hotel
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this is an entry by the property owners.

This is a family run hotel. We have a bar with a wise variety of beverages and all sports channels 
You use our restaurant which serves Portuguese cuisine or you can use the braai facilities 
We have twelve hotel rooms and seventeen rondavals

name: Kevin- 248 Kenyon Howden Road
description: Kevin was recommended through the Durban 4x4 club and is a keen Toyota 4x4 owner. Offers full mechanical work including specials and upgrades. Fitted new rear suspension and changed cam belt on our Landcruiser camper. Very friendly and helpful. Recommended for overlanders whose vehicles need some work. contact ikevingovender@gmail.com

name: Route N8 Luca
description:
Very nice furnished restaurant with overnight possibilities. Food is very tasty everything and inexpensive. Opening times from 7 to 17 o'clock and Friday till Saturday till 22 o'clock.

Sehr schöne eingerichtete Gaststätte mit Übernachtungsmöglichkeiten. Das Essen ist alles sehr schmackhaft und preiswert.

name: Buildit Gas refill
description: They refill the gasbottle. German gasbottle needs the Southafrican adapter.

name: The Cabin Farm Stall
description:
Very lovingly designed farm stall with restaurant and sales to regional products and antiques. 

Sehr liebevoll gestalteter Farm Stall mit Restaurant und Verkauf regionalen Produkten und Antiquitäten.

name: The place at a dam
description:
Free space on the water, surrounded by mountains. Man can stand on meadow and under trees. 300 m further is a dilapidated caravan park, no longer in operation.

Freier Platz am Wasser, umgeben von Bergen. Mann kann auf Wiese und unter Bâumen stehen. 300 m weiter ist ein verwahrloster Caravan Park, nicht mehr in Betrieb.

name: Cango Caves
description:
A beautiful cave system. A 1 hour heritage tour and a 1.5 hour adventure tour are available. 

The adventure tour is a lot of fun and costs R220 and you go through small holes and chimneys.

name: The Roadside Diner
description:
Original restaurant with small farm stable.
Originelle Gaststätte mit kleinem Farm Stall.

name: WFN Fred Nathras
description:
Fred Nathras is a senior now and working from his home office.
He is specialized in roro plus container shipping plus customs.
We are overlander and have met him 2 years ago in Durban when we needed some help. 
Now we have ordered tyres from China and he arranged the Durban handling for us. We did not have to pay customs duty and all was very professional and quick.
Fred worked throughout his life for shipping companies. He has lots of experience and is well connected to the port of Durban.
If you are looking for a shipment of your overlander vehicle from or to Durban - Fred is highly recommended. The GPS Coordinates ist just close to the roro terminal and not the real address. 
phone: +27 (0)726 395 534
email: wn0825425@gmail.com

name: Die Berghuis
description:
Alone standing house on a hill.
No power except for 12v lights running off a battery. (solar) 1 charging port for cellphone. 

Private swimming pool and boma.

Can sleep 6 people.

Self catering and very affordable.

name: Parking Wilderness Beach
description:
Public parking place next to the beach between two hotels. We asked at the Beach Hotel, if we can stay there for one night and they agree
d. Don't ask at the Spa Boutique Hotel, maybe they will say no. We parked next to the Beach Hotel. Quiet night. Very close to the entrance of the Wilderness NP.

name: The Anchorage beach bar and restaurant
description: Lovely place to eat right on the sea, good food, super friendly staff🤘

name: Kameeldoring Guesthouse and Canping
description:
Relaxed place set around a nice garden and tree nursery with 20+ rooms. The very friendly owners, passionate travellers and photographers themselves are busy also establishing a campsite from simple sites up to set safari tents.
Many dogs and chickens around. It was very quiet at night, rooster wake up call in the morning.
A room was 350 Rand, but as I slept in my car and only used toilet and shower from a room I got a very fair special price.
Will be definitely cheaper than the nearby farm place and much nicer than the backyard camping on the other side of the N4.
They are present on Facebook and answered my messages very promptly, I was impressed.

name: Huisie Ommie Hoek
description: Nice little Guesthouse run by a lovely couple in peacful Uniondale. Had a great rest before continueing to Baviaanskloof.

name: The Hungry Ghost
description: Nice little Pub / Restaurant run by a group of retirees. Good food & drinks at a resonable price.

name: Untentweni Caravan Resort
description: Small grassed and shady caravan park next to the river. Clean ablutions. Very close to a main road so really noisy. Fine as a stopover. Small dogs allowed in low season @ R30pd. Camping costs R140 pppn

name: Forest next to N2
description: We parked next to the fence on a grassy ground but you can also drive down into the forest. There are quite a lot of places, where you can park. Nothing special but good for a stop over night. Well hidden from the street, quiet, between the trees sheltered from the wind.

name: Limpopo River Lodge
description: Clean, simple rooms with restaurant on premises. R350 for a single. It's on the main road through Musina and the reception is a little difficult to see from the road because it's hidden behind palm trees. Parking is off-street and secure.

name: Eastco Parys
description:
Very nice place by the river. Well maintained and clean ablution. Not a big caravan park but still has 2 pools, a playground, washing machine and a fridge. 
Each site has a tap, power and a concrete pad and sun cover. 

Friendly manager and the near by town Parys is very cozy and safe to walk around in. 

Pice for weekends are 125 ppp and weekdays cheaper. 

For reservations call/WhatsApp Susan: 083 379 2872

(There are lots of campsites in this area that isn’t on IOverlander)

name: VFS GLOBAL Application for visa
description: This is the office where you can apply for a visa extension. You will need an appointment unless your visa is running out.

name: GC TRUCK REPAIR CENTRE
description:
Very good Truck repair center only for bigger vehicles > 4tons.

They will be able to Help you.
but take a look when they are working on yr vehicle.
(hour Workshop 550Rand plus 15% (November 2019)

Ask for Tobi or Conel

name: Hermanus Backpackers
description: Hostel with dorms costing R210 per night (3.5% charge on credit cards). Toast and jam included for breakfast.

name: Ashanti Backpackers
description: Backpackers with a pool and bar. A 5 minute walk from Kloof St bars. Dorms are 200 per night and include yogurt, toast, jam, and fruits for breakfast. They have a tiny gated space where they let me park my motorcycle.

name: rnc mechanic - motorbikes
description: locals claim he's the best mechanic in Kimberley

name: Di Bus Stop
description: Accommodation and Camping, 15km from Clarens on the R712. 2km from Golden Gate National Park. Camping with sufficient space for caravans, on grass, under shady trees, close to a beautiful small dam. Basic (clean) ablutions with moderately hot water. Electricity at sites. Individual fireplace at each camp site. R240 for 2 adults to camp, per night. Restaurant across the road with lovely play area for kids

name: Laundry Til Late
description: Very clean modern laundromat in a shopping center. Either self service or "drop and go". Machines are quite large. Self service is coin operated (no change machine on premises). Washing is 38 R per load, drying is 35 R. Drop and Go is 24.5 R per kg for wash, dry, and fold. Wash only is 22 R per kg, dry only is 20 R per kg. It's open 7 days a week. Hours are 07-23 for self service. Drop off laundry 07-1800 M-F, 07-1600 S &S.

name: Makopong Border Crossing
description:
Very straightforward border crossing, with friendly officers. Despite what the Botswana customs website says, there is an outbreak of hoof and mouth disease and they are not letting uncooked meat of any kind into the country. The ban also extends to uncooked eggs, and to fruit. They allowed our cheese, butter, potatoes and onions. 

We paid a total of 256 BWP for insurance, National Road Safety Fund, and the Road Transport Permit (which varies with size of vehicle and ours is large). If you leave the country and then return, you must pay this fee again.

name: Nature's Way Farm
description: Single campsite with ablutions on a working dairy farm.

name: Bel Punto
description: Excellent Italian restaurant! Very good service and really delicious food. Highly recommended!

name: At the beach
description: Parking next to the beach with outdoor showers. 200m further down the street you will find toilets and showers in a container open 24/7. Stayed 4 nights, nobody disturbed us. Security guy in the night and a lot of friendly people, who were happy to meet some German overlander.

name: Bush track near N3
description: You can follow the track to find a place on the side. There are not so many flat options but you will find a good place for the night for sure. Well hidden from the street, nobody came.

name: Cattle Loading
description: Cattle loading spot next to the really bad gravel road (corrugated and deep sand ditches). No traffic at night. Perfect mobile signal.

name: Dwarswegstrandoord
description:
Dwarswegstrandoord is situated near Great Brak River, between Mossel Bay and George.

The resort is next to the beach with amazing ocean view accommodation.

The pleasant climate, peaceful atmosphere and beautifully clean beach make this the perfect retreat for you and your family.

An access-controlled security boom, with 24/7 security guards  also improve safety at the resort.

name: Silwerstroomstrand ("Silver Stream Beach")
description:
This is a formal City of Cape Town minicipal resort. Booking must be done in advance at email Silwerstroom.Resort@capetown.gov.za or 021 444 3605. An formal application form must be completed & returned with copy of ID & proof of residential address. Then an invoice is sent & must be paid in advance (Paying at any Pick.n.Pay is easy, or eft to City of CT). Then an entrance pass is mailed to you. Bit of an excersise, but a good practice to manage their facilities.
Camping during the week is VERY quiet - if not alone - I will not try it over weekends or in school holidays.
Tight security with roaming guards 24hrs.
Very long beaches for walking, limited swimming with lifeguard protection.
Biggest benefit..only 55 k's from Parow.
Summer season R145...very cheap.

name: police station
description: parking in front police station just for big Rigs

name: The Laundry Spot
description: Very friendly and quick service. R26/kg wash, dry and fold. Next to a Spar and 5mins  to Noth Gate mall.

name: Cluster of cafes & Reataurants
description: Nice setting with a number of cafes and restaurants, and a couple of boutiques. We ate at Food Purveyors - the coffee and cakes were amazing!!

name: Forest
description:
Here are a lot of places, where you can park for the night. A lot of trees, so well hidden and nobody around. Nothing special but good for a night stop. 
Can be muddy, when it's wet. But should be possible without 4x4. 
Really enough space for big rigs. We travel with a Mercedes 1017.

name: Route N8 Luca coffee cafe
description: Great place to stop for coffee, breakfast, lunch or dinner!

name: Storm Guesthouse
description:
Super nice Guesthouse! The owner Ryan is also the Land Rover mechanic. Price for a family room is 850 Rand and a normal room is 450 inkl. Breakfast. We actually camped in their little garden. It is not a campsite but it worked well for one night and we could use the toilet and shower in a room. 

They are super friendly and helpful!

name: Dual Sport Motorcycle Clinic
description: Repair to all makes of Dual Sport and touring motorcycles.  Emergency breakdown recovery, service and tyre/puncture repair.  Onsite accommodation available. Available after hours.  Contact Guy on 082 823 8980.

name: MJM Metal Arc welding
description: Located this welder in Clarens when the panier bracket broke.

name: Papiesfontein Beach Horse Trails
description:
R450 pp for a 2.5 hours ride.
We had an excellent time. You start going through the bush, then go over the dunes and finish with lots of galloping on the beach.. you do about 15km all together. 
Have beginner, intermediate and advanced horses, dependent on your experience.
They have over 50 horses and they are all looked after really well.
Highly recommend this place. Rides are at 10am and 3pm.
Need to book a day in advance.
+27 820072381

name: The Golden Grape
description: Nice and comfortable B&B in Lutzville. Everything clean, safe parking. Price 950 Rand for a double room. This place is much better than the Lutzville Hotel. Because there is no restaurant, you can get some takeaway at the tank stop.

name: Dijembe Backpackers
description:
R130 pppn which includes breakfast. 
We asked for a discount as we didnt want food so paid R100pp
Nice hippie style backpackers, has a lovely, large garden which is relatively flat to park on.  
We enjoyed the stay here chatting with other travellers. It was very quiet at night to sleep. 
Showers need a little more pressure.

name: Oaks on Main
description:
Cluster of restaurants and shops.
Snobs coffee does great coffee and cakes. Also a juice bar, art studio and other shops here. Nice seating area in the middle to enjoy the atmosphere.

name: Hot Springs Riemvasmaak
description: Basic campsite with clean toilets, no electricity, no water. 2 pools of hot water, upper pool has 38 degrees, lower pool 28 degrees. Payed 135 Rand for 2 persons per night. Day visitor is 70 Rand per person. Campsite is in a gorge, accesseble with 2x4 and high clearence.

name: powerflo Exhausts
description: Exhaust pipes, air filters, shock absorbers in Johannesburg. Ask for Ash on Republic Road in Randburg.

name: Emzini Apartments
description:
An amazing venue with apartments set in incredible grounds with indigenous plants and animals.

This is truly a special venue which has to be seen to appreciate.
It is set within a short distance from everything an traveller may require including shops, embassies etc.

Close enough to the main motorways to make entry and exit a breeze.

Although all travellers are welcome and ample secure parking, this venue does NOT provide facilities for large overland vehicles such as  motor homes and over-landing trucks. 

There is no real camping area as this is an apartment type setup, but there may be room to request this.. I wouldnt though as the apartments are amazing.

The owners are very friendly and helpful and have a passion for travelling, so you will fit right in.

Accommodation is high quality, rates are very reasonable and a fantastic place to rest after a long journey, especially a motorcycle..

To add to all this, there is a BBQ area, gym and a workshop... which if you ask nicely you would be able to possibly make use of some of  the facilities. 

Highly recommended!

name: The Old Mine House
description: R2,500 for three rooms with air con, kitchenette with fridge, microwave, small two plate hob, basin. TV, air con. Shower.

name: Cosmos Wire Eroding
description: Engineering Workshop Specializing in milling turning wire and spark erosion 0827701217

name: 14th Green Guest Lodge
description: Very nice guesthouse directly at the golf course. Quiet and safe area. In the morning all kinds of wild animals graze on the golf course. We wait here until our ship arrives with our camper. There's no restaurant, but you can order food.

name: Shipping Agent Ena Horak
description: Very nice shipping agent, very helpful. Mrs ENA shows us for refill our Gasbottles and show us an supermarket. Shipping from Southafrica to Europe

name: Harbour of East London
description: Place were you can pick up or give up your car.

name: Sasol Zebetiela
description: Duell stop with shop and Steers take away. Cleaner and quieter than most on the N1.

name: Kudu garage
description:
Just behind the Quest petrol station. Knows pretty much all about Land Rovers. Very friendly guy. Let us stay over in front of the garage as they did not finish the job in one day. 
R615 an hour.

Highly recommended.

name: Tierhoek
description:
It is an undeveloped site, you have to bring everything you need and take all your rubbish with. It is managed by Namqua Tourism Offices in Springbok and Alexander Bay. Here you can book the Namaqua 4x4 Eco Trail and the campsite. In case you start from Upington it is possible to pay the fees cash on the account of Namaqua Tourist Office and they send you the permit per e-Mail. 
Website: www.namakwa4x4.co.za
Email: info@namakwa4by4.co.za
Cell: 081 8739043

There are two parts of the trail and you pay per part and car 450 Rand and 
200 Rand per campsite and vehicle. 

It is a really remote place and more a wild camping spot then managed campsite. But it is really beautiful location.

name: Heins Farm Resort
description:
Working farm with cows, sheep and horses. Chalets and campsite. Clean ablutions with warm water, nice level grassy campsites with water, brais and electricity at the sites. Free wifi. Right next to N11 so a little bit of road noise but didn’t bother us at all. Great place for an overnight stop.
We paid 200R for two people and the car inc electricity and wifi.

Heinsresort.caravanparks.co.za

name: Tulip Cafe
description: Amazing coffee. Nice vibe and very quick service.

name: Ukhahlamba / Drakensberg Park Hiker's Parking
description: Secure trailhead parking next to guard stand for entry to hotel. There's a large map showing the various hikes in the area, including to Cathedral Peak. The guards also have some hiking info. Day visitors pay 50pp or free with Wild Card. Beautiful area.

name: Garden Corner Guest House
description: Nice clean rooms in a quiet part of town.

name: Neil's Auto Gas
description: Neil can refill fixed auto gas LPG containers. The only one we have found in Southern Africa. Contact Neil beforehand on 0844083643. This duplicates the info on the fuel station opposite, but I have repeated the info under the LPG icon.

name: Camel Thorn Camping
description: Great and green place. Just outside the National Park. Private and clean ablutions. Kitchen also in the private area. There’s a few spots for camping and about the same number of permanent tents. Many trees. No WiFi. Hot water. R385 per campsite. You must call at the front gate.

name: Roadside
description: We passed a quiet night in our RoofTopTent at this small pullout on the side of the gravel road. Two cars passed in the night and one in the morning but none stopped. No people or houses in sight, just beautiful rocky desert scrub lands. Good stopover for a night.

name: Schoongezicht Farm
description: Recommended to us by a very sweet couple up in Strandfontein. A real hide-away on a the farm, snug up against the mountains, wonderful rock-pool, lots of shade and very clean ablutions! You won't be disappointed! Contact: 0828554573

name: Gatsrivier
description:
Magic Karoo campsite on a perennial river, spotless solar powered ablutions, honesty pub with wood and ice, 4x4 drives, mountain bike and hiking trails, splash pool. Some campsites have their own private ablutions, no electrical connection points at the campsites.

Self catering cottages also available

Contact: Wessel or Caron 
mail: info@gatsrivier.co.za. 
cell: +27878028440

name: Moto75
description: Motorcycle workshop. Full workshop to repair or service motorcycles. Very friendly. As I was an Overlander they gave me access to their workshop to service my own motorcycle.

name: RIVER REEDS LAPA
description:
Beautiful quiet, scenic, informal place, with 4 chalets, next to the river. Neat maintenance, safe, communal kitchen and neat ablution blocks. It is very close to Kirkwood, and ideal, if one wants to spend the night on the way to the coast or even for a weekend. Lots of ice in the freezer and a cute jetty to fish from.

AFRIKAANS
Pragtige stil ,natuurskoon, informele plek, met 4 chalets, langs die rivier. Netjiese onderhoud, veilig, gemeenskaplike kombuis en netjiese ablusieblokke. Dit is baie naby aan Kirkwood, en ideaal, as mens wil oornag oppad na die kus toe is of selfs vir 'n naweek. Baie ys in die vrieskas en 'n oulike jetty om van te hengel.

name: Prince of Tarts
description: Amazing tarts, cheese cakes, muffins, coffee. Best in SA.

name: Morningside Medi-Clinic
description: Large private hospital just off Rivonia in Sandton. Has a small restaurant.

name: AGFAB Workshop
description: Workshop also for big rigs. Did a very good service.

name: 7 Landies
description:
family run Land Rover mechanics, fair prices, fast and honest work.  

better rates than LR service center and often times they have good second hand accessories.  (Bought a hi-lift Jack with rooftop bracket, mounted, R650)

name: 200 Rivonia Medical Centre
description: Oncology, physical rehab hospital with chemist, optician & restaurant

name: Secret Falls
description:
2 self catering cottages on a private farm near Tulbagh in the Western Cape. There is a campsite higher up the trail accessible by 4x4 only.

Stunning scenery!

name: Afrox
description: Here you can fill up gas bottles. Fast service

name: Medi-Clinic Sandton
description: Large hospital. Despite the name, it's closer to the Randburg CBD than Sandton. In Peter Place. Entrance is partially hidden.

name: Ray's Coffee Shop
description:
Great spot for a coffee, breakfast 
or lunchbreak. Reasonable prices, biker friendly, smoker friendly.

name: Die Skeerhok Padstal
description: Nice farmstall roadside cafe. Delicious homemade pies & excellent coffee & cake

name: Die Dam
description: Die Dam is a big camping (93 spots) and many semi-resident houses. Prices see attached, overpriced in high season as most campings along the coast. You normally have to pay at the camping at Franskraalstrand. You can choose between being at the Rock pools & sea (without protection of wind, but with an amazing view) & cold showers. OR on a grass field or under shady trees & hot showers. Ablutions look like an army block. Not very clean, but functional. Nice beach 2 minutes walk from the camping.

name: Matjirsvlei
description: The exact location is about 4km from this point (just follow the road and then left by the sign). Absolute peace and quiet campsite, 2.5 kilometer from the reception, you will find a place just for yourself. River is closeby (although not clean when we were there). You light the donkey shower yourself, and can use the clean ablutions. Every site has a braai and fire wood is provided. 100 Rand per person per night.

name: Bydidam
description: Near Citrusdal, restaurant and bBar, 220V, grassy sites, no shadow, dam & pool for swimming, 250R in December.

name: SAPS Vehicle Clearance unit
description:
Come here to get police clearance for your vehicle. This certifies the car is not stolen and will make crossing borders much easier.

Opens 8h00
Closes 15h00

Bring passport and original registration.

name: Hillcrest Berry Orchard Stellenbosch
description: A beautiful tea garden with a shop. Greatest selection of jams, fresh berries, home made ice cream, pies, cakes, delicious cappuccino, smoothies. Selection for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Closes at 5pm. Fresh berries are seasonal from Nov to Feb/Mar. Outdoor and indoor seating. Caters for vegetarians and vegans, the chef can adjust all the menus to any dietary requirements.

name: Tea Junxion
description: Lovely cafe & gardens on the Seven Passes Route.

name: Truck Stop - Truck Wash
description: Great place to get Land Rover and Caravan washed, or big rig. Depending on how busy they are you may get your rig dried. Good place to clean up chassis etc after the desert. 120R for LR

name: Danjin Engineering
description: Great machine workshop. I’ve used them a couple of times to do little jobs with excellent results. Tomorrow usually possible.

name: Gharagab Wilderness Camp
description: 4 ‘luxury’ cabins set on a sand dune overlooking a waterhole. One of our favourite places in South Africa. Well equipped cabin with towels etc provided and large 240V fridge/freezer. No 240V outlets or 12V sockets. Solar powered. Must bring own water. Lots of animals visiting the waterhole including lion and brown hyena. Easy drive in, drive out can be difficult, especially if heavily laden, as a number of dunes to climb on the lee side.

name: Bitter Pan Wilderness Camp
description: 4 ‘luxury’ cabins by a pan and overlooking a waterhole. Each cabin has a small bedroom and private bathroom across the walkway with towels etc provided. Communal kitchen with separate large 240V fridge/freezer for each unit. Each unit has own braai area and there is also communal braai area outside kitchen. No 240V outlets (could use fridge outlet to charge laptop) or 12V sockets. Solar powered. Must bring own drinking water. Lots of animals visiting the waterhole including lion and brown hyena. Drive in and out can be difficult, especially if heavily laden, over a large number or dunes. 2 vehicles didn’t make it the day we arrived.

name: Kalahari Tented Camp
description: 15 ‘luxury’ cabins set on a sand dune overlooking the Auob River and a waterhole (I think the waterhole is in front of cabin 5). Well equipped cabin with towels etc provided and large gas fridge/freezer (struggled to freeze at 40C). No 240V outlets or 12V sockets. Solar powered. Must bring own water. Not exactly the wilderness experience but a nice alternative to Mata Mata. 2WD easy access. MTC signal.

name: Grootkolk Wilderness Camp
description: 4 ‘luxury’ cabins set on a sand dune overlooking a waterhole. Well equipped small cabin with towels etc provided and large 240V fridge/freezer. Outside kitchen which is a challenge in the wind and rain. Good braai area. No 240V outlets or 12V sockets. Solar powered. Must bring own water. A few animals visited animals the waterhole. We never seem to see much here. 2WD access.

name: Gas Express
description: Refill various Gasbottles with southafrican Adapter.

name: Acara Guest Cottages
description: fully serviced, fully equipped cottages, beautiful gardens,  heated swimming pool, very friendly service, easy access to shops, free fast wifi.

name: Cadeau
description:
Camp ground in the middle of Tsitsikamma. 4 permanent tents under roof, with plenty of space for camping or caravanning. 
Big communal area with fire places, bar, pool table, big screen TV and pizza oven.

Mail: cadeau.za@gmail.com

name: Die Koffiekan
description: Restaurant about half way between Joburg and Polokwane if you avoid the freeway route. Closed Sunday afternoons.

name: Avoca Vale Country Hotel
description: 24 rooms en suite. Allows camping. Google maps and Garmin say it's on the left of the Machado (Louis Trichardt) highway. That's wrong, it's on the right. Used to be called Inn on Louis Trichardt. Rooms comfortable, with baths, TV and air con. Indifferent restaurant, but if you're heading for the border, the mountain air is your last respite from the heat.

name: Poortjies Gate - East Gate Baviaanskloof
description: 68 Rand per person. Check out time 18h or sunset

name: Lifestyle Center
description: Just rooms, but nice, large rooms with air con, hot showers, fridge, microwave and two-plate stove. There's a swimming pool, too. Potable water is supplied free in the rooms. About ZAR 700 a night

name: Mthatha Backpackers
description: Situated in Mthatha formerly known as Umtata, the home town of legend Mr Nelson Mandela. This Backpackers lodge or hostel have 24 beds. diffrent options available. Private en-suite, private single and dormatry styles with self catering available. Of street parking. There is free wi-fi and it is situated in a quiet suburb. Lots of bird life.You can visit the nelson Mandela museum in town. This is the traveling hub for the Wild coast area with bus terminals and a airport. Car rentals also available.

name: Camp and Climb
description:
camping specialist store, much cheaper than outdoor warehouse and safari center.
example; 3 kg LP gas R450, Jerry cans R440 (single roof rack bracket R550)
ZA and all stickers + reflective tapes R20

they have everything you'll ever need for camping at the best prices around

name: Waterberries
description: 800 Rand for the night. Crazy price. Rather go to Backpackers, where you get a big room with private ablutions for 600 Rand.

name: 4x4 Megaworld
description: ARB, Alucab, Tmax, everything you need for your overland vehicle.

name: Burgher’s Walk
description:
Turn right from the Boulder Rock Penguins parking for the path. There are at least two hundred penguins on the rocks, beaches and between the bushes. 

Look for the paths and tunnels between the bushes for their nests. No tourists and no entrance fee :).

name: Sanctuary Guest Farm
description: Correct location of the entrance of Sanctuary.

name: BP gas station
description:
if you're in a bind and looking for a place to camp you can pull into this 24 hr petrol station.  

asked attendant for permission and said we can park on the north side of the building away from big trucks where it's more quiet.

safe, toilets available

name: KTM Dealer
description: KTM dealer. If you‘re not planning on buying a bike & just need support to stay on the road, you won‘t find any help here.

name: Roadside bush camp
description: We passed a quiet night in our RTT. Follow the small dirt track heading north off the main road to come to a large rock formation. There's a huge pile of old pipes & barrels but its hidden from the road. No one came.

name: Welbedacht Trailhead parking
description: Cederberg Wilderness trailhead parking for several day hikes, including to Welbedacht Cave and Tafelberg Peak (trails are on Maps.me). Gorgeous hiking area.

name: Zonnenstrahl Campsite
description: lawn, big trees for shadow, electricity and water. small site with around 10 sites but only two other campers. we had a nice private corner overlooking open field. Happy wil visit again. R260 night for two people and car. nice walk to a beautiful Karoo village with good restaurants, worth visiting.

name: Casa Cara Resort
description: Beautiful property situated just outside the town of Parys near the Parys Aerodrome. 3 categories of sites: Riverside, Poolside and Bush. Sites have electricity and caravan sites have shade netting awnings. Ablutions private and spotless. Lots to do for the family and lots of wildlife, white lions, Jackals etc.

name: Tlokweng Border Post
description: Tlokweng is situated near Botswana's capital, Gaborone. It forms the border post between Botswana and South Africa. A valid passport book and vehicle papers for your car, must be on hand. Any goods acquired outside the country must be declared by border gate. Payments can be made by card transaction but always carry cash as the card machine may sometimes be not working.

name: Karoo Soul backpackers and Hostel
description: Beautiful place. It’s more a hostel than a backpackers, since there is just one dorm, with 4 private rooms, although with shared bathrooms. Braai area and wood available. Great place to sleep in a comfortable bed after camping forever. Booking.com.

name: Stellar Overberg Travellers Lodge
description:
Secure and covered long term storage for vehicles of all sizes with overnight accommodation at the lodge and an airport shuttle to and from Cape Town international airport. 
Vehicle servicing and repairs can be organized locally. www.stellar-sa.vacations, +270720485673

name: Blue Moonlight Backpackers
description: Green lawns, camp wherever you like, little shade, ablutions/showers very okay, place very quiet! It's a game farm with all sorts of antelopes(!), unfortunately no restaurant within, only nearby (Hartebeesport). Vehicle repair connections/storage available!  Chalets/bungalows available too, price rather cheap for the quality offered. Recommendable ****

name: Vlakvark
description: Deep in the farmland one would never expect to find a restaurant and pub like Vlakvark. Warm welcome, good variety, freshly prepared, reasonably fast. In and outside tables, good variety of drinks. All prices are moderate considering the big portions. Absolutely recommendable *****

name: Karoo Wildlife Centre
description:
Choose your own site on 260 ha of spectacular Klein Karoo scenery

-33.555744, 21.168468

name: Blesfontein Guest Farm Sutherland
description: Fantastic place to do stargazing - sky observation. At the farm there is self catering accommodation and it’s possible to order dinner and breakfast. Stargazing is done by one of the owners, at 20:30, 4 nights a week. Very cold at night. Since the farm is 27 km from the paved road, in a slow gravel road, you must spend the night here. Contact Marina for booking: +27 83 633 4913 (WhatsApp also). Cash only.

name: Black Forest Lodge
description: Lodge with three double bedrooms 4 km from Haenertsburg. It's comfortable and there are plans to re-open the campsite.

name: Shaws wood
description:
