MODERATOR NOTE: This place might have been added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.
---
Shaws wood self catering and accommodation is set in the beautiful Karkloof  valley, below the indigenous forest. Accommodation is simple clean and affordable

name: Enkeldoorndam
description: Very neat campsite with ablusion on the edge of a dam. Also 8 person chalet available. Phone 0794852139 Gerbus

name: Waterval Padstal
description: Great little stop in Senekal with quirky shop, cafe, and great kids play area, with rabbits running around. Great coffee as well!!! Toilets are very clean. Would definitely recommend to stop for breakfast or lunch.

name: Vegkop Campsite
description: Well maintained camping site with grass on the terrain of a battlefield Memorial. Museum and historic artefacts on site. Phone Corne 0833060357

name: tiffindell ski resort
description:
Small campsite next to ski resort. Open during summer. Not marked spots only open field behind restaurant.
 R100 pppn plus R150 if you want electricity. We went for a chalet since it was windy/cold and cost only R390 for two people. restaurant on site and bar plus coffee. Hiking trails available. Be carefull if you take the Wartrail to the site. 1.5 hours to do 19 km and can be a bit scary with drops on one side. Used low range a lot. Your wife might prefer to walk certain areas. Absolute spectacular views.

name: Klipkrans
description:
•  36 Large, beautiful, campsites on the banks of the Breede River
•  1 Bush Camp accommodating 16 people (accessible via 4x4 only)
•  Braai facilities and power points at each campsite
•  Communal ablutions (very clean) with hot water showers
•  Honesty kiosk with extra firewood, ice and other basic necessities
•  Camping lapa with braai facilities, tables and benches
•  Wifi

name: Mobile coffee trailer and mini van
description: Mobile coffee bars with great views! Open 07:00 to 16:00 weekdays and from 09:00 Saturday's.

name: Coffeetalks Cafe
description: Gem of a place to stop for breakfast or lunch. Farm setting on outskirts of Bloemfontein, great for kids with farm animals, zipline, trampoline. Food menu is devine and a nice change from the norm. Israeli style food. Great outdoor settings.

name: Zingela Safari and River Company
description:
A beautiful place on remote location. It is in a valley just along the Tugela river. 
They also offer lodges / tents etc. 
Things to do: Kayaking, rafting, game walk/drive, hiking, swim in the river and last but not least, relax! 
About self-catering, it is possible but don't bring to much, they offer full board, also with camping.
We had dinner, food was very good!

We camped here for 3 nights and were the only one on the campground, R350 for 2 persons and a car.
We really recommend this place and although is more than we usually pay for a campsite it's definitely worth it.

name: Tempelhof guest and game farm
description:
Moderator Note: The description for this place is apparently provided by the owner/manager and has not been verified by an overlander.

Tempelhof is situated in the heart of the Eastern FreebState, 12km from Ficksburg. Tempelhof offers you a unique wildlife and an excellent view of the majestic Maluti Mountains. 
Accommodation is offered in tastefully decorated self catering bed and breakfasts chalets. Caravan and tent stands.

name: Lazy Lizard
description:
Very good place to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner
with locals products.

you can also buy jam, olive oil, olives.

name: Tempelhof
description:
Beautiful campsite with incredible view. Campsites with electricity, nice and clean ablutions and braai stands right next to the lion, hyena and wild dog enclosures. 
We paid 205 ZAR for 3 people and a camper van. There are also nice-looking Chalets available. Many other animals all around the farm, big and small cats, ostriches, bucks, monkeys and livestock.
All enclosures seem secure, some maybe a bit small. 
Food and bar available, game drives and other activities offered.
All around a lovely campsite.

name: Occi Lodge
description:
Very nice lodge with smalls rooms (shared bathroom) and also a bigger one with a private bathroom. Very clean, Wonderfull garden, incredible kitchen (every room has its own fridge). Just a perfect place. 

235 R per person for the simple room.

name: Willems 4x4
description: Good Place for Landrover moved to this place last year

name: Husqvarna & KTM Eddy2Race
description: Great Husky dealer, that also does KTM. Get in touch in advance for spares; might have to be ordered. My preferred option over KTM Cape Town.

name: Paternoster Hotel
description:
Following a recommendation we had a very good dinner there.
Restaurant and bar, friendly stuff
large portions

name: Worchester Yacht Club
description: The camp site lies directy at the lake. It is a fabulous family camp site on the banks of the Brandvlei dam. You can take a swim, sail, jet-ski, wake board, fish, etc. The sites are on grass. There is little shade. The crew is very helpful, the camp site and the ablutions are clean and well kept. During season a reservation is necessary. (wyc@telcomsa.net  tel. 023 343 2877)

name: Pro Sports and Cycling
description: Peat is one of the most trustable and best mechanic for bicycles in SA. If you contact in advance by WhatsApp he can get the parts in advance for a very very good reasonable price and reliable service. Peat +27794454517

name: Di Rooi Spinnekop
description: Very good restaurant in this small town. Extensive offerings, the fish tasted very well. Friendly service.

name: Beach
description: Nice. A little bit raised place on a sandy beach. nice view to the water.

name: Beach
description: Very nice. Sheltered from the wind. Sandy beach. nice view to the water, very quiet. Fireplace.

name: Lee's Laundromat
description: R100 per basket, wash and dry same day drop off and collection. Cash only.

name: Songinvelo boundry
description: Nice flat site next to the road. Almost no traffic after dark.

name: Lamberts Bay
description: Very big parking lot, with marvellous look at Lamberts Bay. With grill places and natural pool. Very quiet.

name: Bosvelder Pub & Restaurant
description: Great Afrikaans pub & restaurant, best traditional Afrikaans food. Child friendly, has a great outdoor play area. Awesome atmosphere whether for a meal or just a drink. Often has live music. Great secure parking.

name: Waterval Campground
description:
We found this camp spot on Airbnb as Jaco and his wife also rent out fully equipped cabins. On their farm ground there are undefined spots where you can camp; even wild camping in the bush! Jaco is more than happy to direct to a spot of your liking, near a river or all alone on the top of a hill. 

We paid R300 for 2 pax and a truck (off season) and using the bathroom of one of the cabins. Price depends on season, camp spot of your liking. Best to sent a message to Jaco prior to your arrival to check availability at +27 78 823 5196

name: Die See Ster Kombuis with overnight
description: Very nice restaurant, decorates very much 7 days open from 8 o'clock to 16 o'clock. Home-baked cake!!!!

name: Numbi Hotel and Caravan Park
description: Next to Numbi hotel, the caravan Park offers around 10 plots. They have electricity, light, water tap (out of service when we were there). Ablutions have great showers and there is a room where you can cook. Wifi. 300 Rand.

name: Highlands Nook
description:
Campsites and cottages on beautiful lawned area on a working farm. Neat ablutions with an outdoor undercover shower. All hot water from a woodfired donkey.
lovely scullery area and great big communal lapa area.
Electric points at some sites.
spectacular views of the surrounding berg and lots of walks on the farm.
Alison was friendly and welcoming. Camping cost R150 per person. Cell phone reception intermittent.

name: Public Parking
description: Nice big place, directly by the sea. Toilets and tap. Summer cottages nearby.

name: Dragon's Peak
description: Well equipped camping with swimming pools (although green water), big playground, very well-maintained ablutions (with baths). Pricey at 170pp [Feb 2022: 180R pp] per night. Washing machines and dryers (the ones in the back are 10R).Drakensberg boys choir (very good show!), shop, restaurant, horse riding, helicopter flights on premises. Open Wifi on and off [at reception and restaurant only], but good connection with Vodacom. Loud ibis and cheeky vervet Monkey's.

name: Shonalanga lodge
description: 375 ZAR ppn for a self catering room (see photo). they ensuite rooms also. not very clean and swimming pool was not cleaned when we stayed there. still a value choice compared to what is around in this very touristy and pricy place.

name: This is Eat
description: The best place to eat fish and seafood with reasonable prices. Enjoy!

name: Gi Gi's Accommodation
description:
3 self catering Rondawels, each sleeping 4. Own little deck with views over the valley.
A little tired but good value for money. We paid R350 out of season for 2 people.
Communal braai area and restaurant.
Jenny and Paul will organise you a guide to walk to Hole In The Wall.

name: Scottburgh Campsite
description:
Big and beautiful campsite right at the beach. Surprised that no one has entered it into iOverlander.
Nice, spacious and clean ablution blocks. I think the only downside is the price in mid an high season (up to 1140 rand for 4 p.) 
We paid 350 rand for one car and 2 people in low season (end of january) which really worth the money.
 Had stand no. 132 with beautiful sea view.

name: Westbrook beach
description: Stayed here one night, lots of street lights, feels safe. Some fishermen around till late. Toilets and outside cold showers.

name: Bhanga Nek Tented Camp
description: Camping at R210 pppn, feel it was overpriced for what you get. Last 13km took 1 hour and the branches scraped the jerry cans, so tall vehicles will have a issue. Beach 30 meters away but don't think safe for swimming. Camping also available at the lake side at R150 pppn but between local houses and no view. So we decided on the more expensive one on the beach side. For R210 I expected more then a duct tape fixed toilet seat.

name: Cathedral Peak Parking Lot
description: We stayed here one night for free before the hike at the parking lot for non-guests. We arrived in the evening and told the guard that we want to check-in in the hotel. So he didn’t charge the entrance fee and let us pass. Very quite night - some baboons woke us up.

name: Ruins close to Giants Castle
description: Really quite spot. You reach it via a narrow bridge from the main road. The ruins give a good hide. Next morning a group of NP rangers passed by and invited us to their place to camp there for free.

name: Ramsgate
description: Great quite spot with a beautiful view over the bay. No problems

name: Suikerbossie
description: Nice grassy mostly riverside sites on citrus and Rooisbos farm. 100 Rand pppn in winter for pensioners.Some sites are more than 20m from electricity connection boxes so a long lead is needed. Some have lapas for shade and a nearby water tap. The showers are not fully enclosed so can be chilly in winter months. Turn off from the R303 is at S32 39.704 E19 12.927.

name: Cederberg Guest Farm
description:
Very nice, quiet little place, very friendly owner, grass places, lapa and kitchen. R 100 pppn.
TEL. 083 262 5464.  info@cedarbergguestfarm.co.za
The place is off the main road and therefore very quiet. Clean ablutions.

name: Dam viewpoint
description: Spent a quiet night here, beautiful view of the dam with some tables, no toilets or anything else. In the morning some guys arrived early to set up their little stalls selling souvenirs, but they were nice and friendly

name: The Last Resort
description: Small campsite catering for cycle travelers, motorcycles and small to medium campers and vans. Communal kitchen, wash up and relaxation area with free WiFi. Level grassed sites, clean basic ablutions. Owner on site. Set in large gardens with trees and shade, just off the Southern Cape Whale route between Hermanus and Stanford on route to Gaansbaai. Please call +27820512447 for reservations

name: port shepstone
description: back packer with campsite for tent, near by the beach

name: Brauhaus Afrika
description:
A good restaurant with German food. As the name says, it is a brewery witch brews different beers after German "Reinheitgebot". They also roast coffee. Well worth a visit.
We asked if we are allowed to stay here for the night and could park in front of the restaurant with a superb view on the dam and the mountains. And after a lovely dinner we had only a few steps to go.
Only suitable for self-sufficient vehicles, incl. toilet (when the restaurant is closed).

name: Jonny's workshop and Gearbox Mecca
description:
Very friendly garage. Had problem with my Land Rover rear diff and they did diagnosis at short notice. Got great advice and service. Very reasonable costs would use them again for sure.
Jonny 0825677781.
Andries 0836317439.

name: By the river
description: Nice spot by the river with a cement table, beside the road, but it’s pretty quiet

name: Summit Self Storage
description: Long term vehicle storage. With added services like battery and vehicle upkeep while the vehicle is in storage.

name: Surfer Hot Spot
description:
Small parking between houses overlooking the sea, it is safe, we stood 2 nights there. A lot of surfers. Great view over the bay to Hout Bay and Tabelberg.
Kleiner Parkplatz zwischen Häusern mit Blick zum Meer, nachts beleuchtet, sicher, wir standen 2 Nächte dort. Am Tag viele Surfer, deshalb sehr früh oder am späten Nachmittag einparken. Toller Blick über die Bucht nach Hout Bay und Tafelberg.

name: Jumper‘s Place
description:
Wonderful place! I felt like I would visit family. Ronny and Lisa who run their family business are bikers and very knowledgeable about the the area around Baviaanskloof, South Africa and Namibia. I looked for a stay for one night and I stayed for four. We had even a ride together to the Baviaanskloof! 
If you are a biker - this is a place you have to stay at. If not - no problem of course, you will enjoy it anyway: it’s calm, safe and has a good restaurant/bar. I stayed in a cottage with own toilet and shower. All very clean. Paid 250R p.P/N.

name: Jenlee‘s Country Shop & Kitchen
description:
We were hungry and discovered a local restaurant next to the road. During the lunch a thunderstorm came and brought heavy rain which didn’t stop for hours. The friendly staff offered us to park the bike and to pitch out tent in their garden (a beautiful one: with a lot of animals!). Because the rain flooded the garden we were offered to spend the night... in the ladies restroom ;). What an experience! 
By the way: They want to establish a campsite here, suppose to be ready by February 2020.

name: Nice road N to S to the cave
description: Relatively easy and interesting track north/south along the mountains. Little sandy in the south. Can camp everywhere next to this public track. Also used also by Namaqua4x4 Eco Trail. No people. Bakkrans Cave on the southern end is worth a stop, or go for a camp there.

name: Bukkaros Cave
description: Large shady cave, nice to visit but you can also park your car in and stay sheltered from the wind. Nice Botterboom hill across! Public road, but better accessed by 4x4.

name: Kaijaiki Guesthouse and Restaurant
description: Very nice cafe and restaurant. Dutch owner. Rene is very friendly. Dutch pancakes.

name: Before Paul Kruger gate
description: Spent a quiet night here very close to the gate, feels safe as the guard is there all night. We asked if it would be ok first and they told us it would be fine. Only recommend it here if you plan on going into the park very early, because you won’t get much sleep or privacy once all the cars start coming past

name: Kilimanjaro Cafe
description: Lovely European style cafe with shady veranda with tables and parking in front of it. Nice and clean. A lot of dishes on the menu, speciality coffee, loads to choose from for breakfast. French toast was outstanding. Staff is very friendly. Plenty of books available.

name: Mdumbi Beach
description: We had a great quite afternoon, night and morning here. As last year already. Some local people chill there until 5pm. Afterwards we were alone. Great sea view and braai area

name: Mimosa disused train station
description: Good camp at disused Mimosa train station. Good spot if you want to be at the Addo main gate early for a game drive about 12 km from Addo gate. You will wake up if a freight train comes through on the tracks which are right next to it. Hidden from the road.

name: Gecko Lodge & Backpackers
description:
nice small Camping area next to the Backpacker hostal with  hot showers and fully equipped kitchen 
90 R p.P. camping

name: canvasmaker
description: replacing heavy duty zipper and canvas repairs

name: Sodwana Hengelklub
description:
big campground mainly for angler events at the dam with kiosk and a small pool
R 80 p.P.

name: Lakeview
description: quiet place to camp overnight far away from villages directly at the lake - just turn off the D 1848, 4x4 required, nobody bothered us and no traffic

name: Cliffs Auto
description: very good mechanics - changed oil gear box and new brake fluid...

name: Hi-Q
description: professional garage for welding, exhaust service, wheel alignment...

name: Meerensee Boat Club
description:
nice campsides in the boat club with restaurant and excellent abolutions  - nice staff and very remote area next to the river side
150R p.P.

name: Doornrivier Accommodation
description:
verry remote and beautiful Gamefarm with perfect facilities for camping .
Big shady trees on grassy area, very sweet owners and one of the best clean showers we had after a long time!

name: Ascot Place
description: Privately owned Guesthouse with neat, spotless rooms and ensuite bathrooms as well as secure parking behind the gate. Price for two people in one room is 800 ZAR per night, includes a very nice, freshly made breakfast and fast free WiFi. Small pool and terrace outside.  Greenacres Shopping centre is in walking distance. Very nice and helpful owners. The address is 12 Ascot Road, call at 083 651 0457. There is no sign outside the building but it is a grey painted gate which they will open when you call or ring the bell! Would always go again!

name: Jenny's Bar & Restaurant
description: Lovely local place, clean, serving delicious local dishes. Staff speaks English. Chef came out and translated menu for us in English. Jenny also came to say hello and wish us a nice meal. We would recommend the place for a good local experience.

name: Mike’s mechanics
description: Garage specialised in Landrover. Friendly people

name: Silwerstrand Caravan Park
description:
•  60 Campsites and caravan sites
•  Electricity and power points
•  Ablution facilities with hot water showers
•  Laundry facilities
•  Kitchen facilities
•  Wheelchair-friendly
•  Braai areas
•  Firewood available for purchase
•  Shops available on site
•  Ablutions and wash rooms nice and modern, and kept spotlessly clean. •  Kayaks available for hire. Also has swimming pool, slide etc.

name: Mboyti
description: A quiet night a bit hidden from the village with a great view over the sea

name: Luputhana
description:
Very quiet and lots of spaces with seaview.
Some local people talked to us, really friendly. 4WD with high clearance required. Toilet with seaview. River crossing to the waterfall bluff only at low tide.

name: Peperboom Campsite and Wild camping
description: We parked our truck at the Peperboom campsite. It's a bushcamp next to a stream/river on a working farm but you are far away from the farming activities. They have 3 sites all with water and power plug-in. Very neat ablutions with a basin to wash dishes at the back of the ablutions. R250 per campsite max 4 people. It includes one bag of wood and a portable braai. Phone signal weak but you can manage. Koot and Jannie are very friendly. This seems to be the best camp in the area. The campsite also have a cabin called Peperboom loghouse with it's own toilet and basin. Very neat. R450pn for 2. There's also a permanent tent with a double bed R350pn. Mattresses for children. Tierklip is a self catering farmhouse 20km from the camp site and is available for bigger groups. Max 16 people. R800 for the first 4 people and R200 for every extra person. Linduli lodge 45km away consist of 2 Luxury A-frame wooden houses. 2 Adults and 2 children. R2300pn full board. Linduli lodge, Peperboom camping and Tierklip self catering all belong to the same owners. Contact Koot on 060 521 4178 call or whatsapp. Mail: stay@linduli.co.za

name: Swinburne Fields
description: Pitched our tent after dark next to the road and the car. Almost no traffic here at night. Left before sunrise, no problems.

name: Kloofeind
description:
Campground with old perminent visitors. Not much around. Ablutions are fine. Perfect for a one night. R150 for two persons and a car, cheapest around Bloemfontein. 

A lot of dogs on the campground, not sure if you can bring your dog.

name: Pearly Beach
description:
Very nice place by the sea, with beach access. Houses within sight. Very quietly.
Sehr schöner Platz am Meer, mit Strandzugang. Häuser in Sichtweite. Sehr ruhig.

name: Kleinbaai
description:
Very nice place by the sea. Houses within sight. Very quietly.
Sehr schöner Platz am Meer.  Häuser in Sichtweite. Sehr ruhig.

name: Arniston Beach Parking
description:
in the local edge on the beach nice parking lot with toilets, shower, water. Very quietly and certainly. Very nice small fishing village.
am Ortsrand am Strand schöner Parkplatz mit Toiletten, Dusche, Wasser. Sehr ruhig und sicher. Sehr schönes kleines Fischerdorf.

name: No name Guest House
description: Small guest house with 3-4 rooms, kitchen and bathroom. Asked 500Rands for a double room but we prefered camp (100 pppn) in the backyard. Better if you call the owner Awie +27 (84) 488-3566 because he doesn’t live here. If you camp he let you use the ablutions (no hot water when we stayed)

name: Smart Guest House
description: Nice place with nice owner (François) and good grill. Small swimming pool. He let us camp in the backyard. Rooms available but we didn’t ask prices. Hot shower.

name: Ifafa Beach
description:
Very cozy and clean campsite with big sites and great ablutions (Several lockable rooms with Shower, bathtub and toilet in them) perfect privacy.
Seaview
125 ZAR pppn

name: Steers
description: Burgers and breakfasts. Toilettes, petrol station with shop. Caravan parking to sleep and place to pinch your tent in the grass

name: The Shed Farmstal and Lodge
description: You can have a breakfast, lunch or a coffee. There is a small shop where they sell many stuff. It is a lodge as well but I don’t know the prices. Very confortable place

name: Jakalsgat
description: Traditional Afrikaans Pub close to Bella Bella

name: Crawdaddys Restaurant
description:
Portuguese type Restaurant 
Anything available to suite your taste

name: Reservoir
description: Nice quiet place above Swellendam, at a reservoir with a view of the mountains.  You can swim in the lake.

name: Stille Waters
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

This is a fabulous and scenic spot with large private campsites, each with their own fabulous ablutions and even a small private outdoor soaking tub. The campsites are all completely covered in wonderful grass. We paid 300 ZAR for one night, and it was worth every cent.

The campsite is not staffed, so it is necessary to call 082 926 3943. It is the same owner (Adrian) as the Wolvenberg Campsite, but much nicer.

name: Low Africa
description: Closest thing to a bush camp in these parts. Space for one vehicle in riverside clearing with about 50% shade. No electricity, braai (firepit), grass, swimming in the river, bush style ablutions with "donkey" fired hot water (which wasn't lit when we were there), flushing toilets. Beware biting mosquitoes and flies if no precautions taken. The site is across the river from the more formal and much bigger Klipkrans caravan and camping facility which can be full and noisy over weekends. Low Africa campsite is part of a bigger riverside facility named High Africa offering chalets and canoes to hire, an artificial climbing wall and other outdoor activities. Nice owners and Zim caretakers. Tel: +27 83 301 8533. Entrance from main road at S33 44.602 E019 28.996. R100 pppn.

name: Duiwekloof Lodge
description: 5 campsites on grass with seats and shade and braai. Ablutions are extra clean. Hot water. Small natural pool. Electricity just during the day. Very friendly staff. Also rent chalets.3 little hiking tracks start here. Very nice, but also very expensive. 350R for 1 Person + car. Wifi 100R per day.

name: Lodge
description: Lodge like a Motel. You can park your car next to your little chalet. 250R pppn. Not really good and very noisy, because of directely beside the N11, but safe, when you are late and need a place to stay. There are not so many possibilities around.

name: Driehoek Farm
description: Lovely streamside campsite in the mountains on the oldest farm in the Cederberg region owned and run by the same family for 5 generations. They also produce some award-winning wines, particularly their Shiraz rated one of the top 12 in SA. Good ablutions with hot showers, electricity and BBQs at all sites.Apart from the mostly shaded campsites they also have various cottages and chalets for self catering rental also near the stream which has been dammed to create a small swimming pool. Hiking trails, another great natural swimming hole, climbing and mountain biking all possible. Dawie & Lizette are very nice owners. Good idea to phone them ahead for site availability during holiday periods. Tel: 027 482 2828

name: Waterval Farm
description: Campsites mainly on packed earth strung along small perennial stream that flows over many waterfalls as it drops down the steep sides of the Groetwinterhoek Mountains. Some sites suitable for a vehicle have part shade, other smaller ones for tents only have full shade. Electricity and braai places (BBQs) by each site. Good ablutions. Good idea to phone ahead for availability of sites especially at weekends and in school holiday periods. Tel: +27 82 878 1358.

name: Herbs Infusion Farm
description:
A beautiful, peaceful herbal farm. You can camp (R50pp) or stay in their little lodge (R150pp). There's electricity and always water (borehole). The lodge can comfortably sleep 4. There's a fridge and en-suite bathroom.
You can use the kitchen in the mainhouse if needed.
Shower/toilet available for campers too.
Optional meals at R50pp.
We had a great relaxing getaway in the bush.

To get there: On N4, take koedoesfontein turn off (the one halfway between Zeerust & Groot Marico), follow it for 2.2km, turn right by bluegum trees, follow track to the end (3.3kms).

name: Swartvlei beach parking
description: Beach parking, with cold out and indoor showers and toilets. Busy place with locals for boating, fishing beach walking. Quiet at night. Beautiful beach.

name: Silver Karoo
description: What a place!!! the most amazing self contained guest house on a farm for 700r. stunning quirky interior and super friendly  hosts. definitely worth a stop here for the night.

name: Montagu guano caves
description: Very nice campsite. Burned down two years ago, so everything is brandnew. Big sites, great pool. Has a trip up to the caves in the maontains around which has bats, stone age paintings and so on. Beautifull trip, steep climb though. We paid R80 pppn in the off season during the week

name: Supa Quick exhaust repair
description: German speaking staff. They did a great welding job at our exhaust and we got it for free :)

name: Bundu
description:
Bundu Camp is an hidden gem situated between Ventersburg and Winburg next to the Sand River.

With only 15km away from Ventersburg and 1.3 km from the N1, Bundu is the perfect hide away for nature lovers, 4x4 adventure fanatics or overnight stays between traveling.

Bundu offers electric and non-electric campsites including clean ablution, washing up facilities, a few rondavels and a range of different self-catering units.
 
Guests can enjoy a variety of daily activities such as hiking, swimming, bird watching, fishing and 4x4 trails.

name: Grootvadersbosch
description: Situated in the Grootvadersbosch Nature Reserve, there are 12 campsites, 2 of which are private

name: Near Wupperthal
description: Nice wild camping next to a huge boulder which even gives some shade. There is a fireplace. Some farmers harvesting Roibos use this road but quiet night.

name: Van Zyls Rus Caravan park
description: Very nice and paved caravan sites in secure property

name: Betty's Boutique Hotel
description: Small hotel with a few rooms in an old villa style house, family-run business. Swimming pool, tabletennis, nice deck terrace. Every room has an individual style, each with ensuite bathrooms. Everything is spotless, very good wifi. Communal room with fireplace and poolbilliard, old-english/colonial style. We enjoyed this as a luxurious treat as the campsites were all fully booked. Paid 1000 ZAR per night for a double room including fantastic breakfast. Yes, pricey but we found it worth the money!

name: The Fat Mulberry
description:
Nice place near the mountains, we slept here when we drove all day from Thaba-Tseka and it was late and dark. We managed to enter the compound calling the owner and they let us stay on the parking lot for R250 (using our own RTT, but they let us use the facilities of the rental holiday houses they normally rent out). Holiday house is R375 per person. 

And the view over the Lesotho mountains is amazing!

name: Rietspruit Dam Resort
description: Great location directly at the dam. About 40 campsites with electricity and water. Well-maintented ablution block.

name: Kuilfontein cottages colesberg
description: We hired a little cottage here. It was so beautiful. Dog friendly. We didn’t stay in our van - the owners are lovely so I’m sure you could arrange something with them but their cottages are great!

name: Morgan bay beach parking
description: This whole town is absolutely beautiful and so safe. There is parking everywhere if you’re in a van and don’t want to pay to stay in the camp grounds, although those are also beautiful! There are restaurants and shops near by. The whole town is dog friendly. It’s an amazing place!

name: Tranquillitas adventure farm
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Advertisement: Tranquilitas Adventure Farm is situated on the on hilltops of Waterval Boven, overlooking the Elands Valley and Waterval Onder in Mpumalanga, South Africa. Accommodation consists of four rustic chalets, six Perma-tents, a farm house and spacious camping grounds. The farm offers excellent rock climbing, miles of single track mountain biking and fantastic opportunities for hikers, birdwatchers and astronomers.

Tranquilitas Adventure Farm is a rock climbing and mountain biking mecca, with over 600 bolted climbing routes and 80 km of single track mountain bike trails. Unique campsite with bouldering wall over the pool and accommodation to suit all budgets

name: Oostewal Caravan Park
description: Camping with space for Caravans. Small braai at every site. Okay abolutions. Very close to the kite beach

name: Panorama Indlu
description: Very reasonable priced Lodge close to the airport. And very safe area to park your vehicle when exploring Capetown. Some rooms have got a kitchen. There's a  beautiful garden you can use with a braai and a swimming pool. Can be booked on air bnb. Very friendly owners. They can tell you a lot about nice things to do around Cape Town area.

name: Towerkraaltjie Campground
description: Beautiful grassy campground with clean ablutions over looked by the surrounding mountains. Lots of shady spots. Lovely owner who kindly stored our meat in his fridge. Each pitch has a Braai and the owner brought us some wood. Small swimming pool to cool off in. 220r for 2 of us.

name: Blue Cow Cottages
description: Fantastic self contained spotless cottages on a working farm. Each cottage has a terrace with a braai (wood provided by owner). 600r for a cottage. Very friendly owner.

name: Quiet hidden Quarry
description: Really quite place in a quarry. Hard to find a place to camp in this area due to the fences, but this hidden spot in the quarry is great. Only disadvantage is the poor view as it is in the middle of the quarry. Sometimes Vodacom signal

name: Manna Restaurant
description: Such a lovely place to stop for lunch, has a lovely private outdoor seating area at back of cafe with childrens play area. A huge selection of food to choose from! Beautiful bathrooms! Probably the only decent stop to eat on the R63. Very unexpected in this small town. definitely worth the stop!! Service great also!

name: Oppie Oewer Chalets & Camping
description: Chalets and camping on the Letaba riverbank. Chalets very nice equipped.

name: ThulaThula near by
description: Grassy campground with sanitary building. Friendly owner. We stayed here one night only because we couldn’t visit ThulaThula without booking and so we needed a place for the night. We were glad to find this place round about 17 kilometers away from ThulaThula.

name: Bayside Guesthouse
description: Nice guesthouse with large rooms, kitchenettes, a swimming pool, and a safe parking place. Very friendly owner Alida. Maximum car size for parking: height 320cm, breadth 220cm. A good place to prepare the vehicle for shipping.

name: Springbokpan Guest Farm
description: Large campground with ‘bomas’ for each site. Sites have electricity and some have a water tap. Ablutions very clean but only one set which could be busy at peak times. Also they are 100m trek from furthest camp site. Very friendly lady host who only speaks Africans, and has great knowledge of Botswana. Ice and firewood available.

name: Swartvlei Caravan Park
description:
Camp and caravan along side the Swartvlei river,

I stayed 2 nights there very cool with local monkeys and good fishing and amazing stars. 5min walk from the beach. We just had our camping table , cooking pot and braai ( BBQ ) tongs stolen . Not a cool way to start our adventure . Not sure if this is an ongoing thing or a start to an unsafe camp site. so just be careful and do not leave anything at the camp site.

name: Kalahari Lion’s Rest
description: Lovely, small guesthouse with cozy rooms which have thatched roofs and cool views to Orange River. Peaceful and secure area. Secure parking. Owners are very friendly and helpful. Great place to rest for a few days. About 10min drive to center of town.

name: Malgas Pont ferry
description: Man powered ferry across Breede River. Cool experience. Takes about 5 minutes. Cost 60R.

name: Kalahari Lion’s Rest
description:
Quaint little hotel in upscale neigborhood with secure parking in the inner yard. Affordably priced, super clean and cozy, free wifi & DSTV, good kingsize beds, balconies overlooking the river. We paid 40€ per night for king room. 

The entrance is from Hoephoep Str (unlike Maps.me shows): look for a cute wooden building resembling Alp huts but with thatched roof :)

name: LRP — Land Rover Workshop
description: Good workshop that helped us fix our windshield wipers. Works exlusively on Land Rovers. The place to go in Bloomfontein i (or nearby) if you have a Land Rover! Friendly and helpful service. Can recommend these guys.

name: Imani Guesthouse
description: Nice, little place. Room was spotlessly clean and spacious. It is the house number 10 on this street, there was no signs outside. Private parking behind gate. Neighborhood ok, but just try to pick a different route to drive here than past bus station, that was not nice neighborhood, as you can probably guess.

name: Morgan’s Bay River KM side
description: On the Kei Mouth side of the river there is a parking lot with an awesome view. Protected from most winds .

name: Millers Woodcabin
description: Very nice place and very friendly owner. We where there with our truck. There are some woodcabins and a large garden. We could have electricity, shower and toilet at a cabin.

name: Spitskop Dam
description:
Located at the lake, many beautiful places. There were some anglers there. The entrance gate is not locked. We had no problems at night.


Direkt am See viele schöne Plätze. Es waren einige Angler da. Das Eingangstor ist nicht verschlossen. Wir hatten keine Probleme bei der Übernachtung.

name: TBH Fiberglass specialists
description:
Very nice guy. Fixed our roof with fiberglass. 
061 760 0141 or email at sales.njhafrica@gmail.com

name: CURIOCITY, Cape Town
description: Newly opened, very nice and clean Hotel. Private Rooms from R750 and Dorms from R200. Staff is very friendly. We stayed 5 nights. Centrally located and safe parking. We can definitely recommend this place.

name: Coral Tree Campsite
description: One campsite up a mountain track with magnificent views. It has a covered kitchen area, plunge pool and deck and private ablutions. It is only accessible via 4x4. We towed a small caravan to the site. There is no electricity but the kitchen area does have solar panels with 12v lights. It can be described as a luxury campsite.

name: The Hut
description:
It was a very windy day and I was riding from Port Elizabeth with my motorbike. After 7 hours battling with the wind, I decided to stop at Burgersdorp and found this heaven to shelter from the wind. The cheapest room is R450 (its peak season) but well worth the price. Air-conditioned, attached toilet & shower, microwave, electric kettle, fridge & TV in the room with beautiful view of the mountain 

from the window. Its very quiet and serene.

name: Calitzdorp Spa and campsite
description:
Lovely campsite. A bit neglected and needing work
Bathrooms are clean and in working order. Springbok roam free here! Big naturally  heated pools plus two big cold pools. Grassed and treed sites as well as sandy treed sites. Has small shop. Has chalets and day camping areas. Was a beautiful campsite in its heyday! Still nice and worth a stop over.

name: Container share requests
description:
I have seen a few posts on the shipping company POI’s requesting container share partners. 

So here is a location dedicated for that. 
Please try to give the following details when looking for a share partner;

- Date of departure
- Destination port
- Space available 
- Expected total cost 
- Email address or Whatsapp number

Date of departure; 24/04/2020 Destination port; Livorno, Italy Space available; 5m Expected total cost; €3500 Email address; jannis.drew@gmail.com

name: Long Street Backpackers
description: Nice, clean place, good location.Dormitory 150R

name: Baris monger
description: Goat farm with accommodation and restaurant. Weekday 1,000 Rand per night. Very beautiful garden and surroundings.

name: Kwass se Baai
description: Campsite No. 4 in Namaqua Nationalpark. No showers, no water tap. Environmental loo available only. Very nice sea view with wind protected Braai area.

name: Varswater
description: Campsite No. 5 in Namaqua Nationalpark. No showers, no water tap. Environmental loo available only. Very nice sea view with wind protected Braai area.

name: Bamboeskamp
description:
Campsite No. 6 in Namaqua Nationalpark. No showers, no water tap. Environmental loo available only. Very nice sea view with wind protected Braai area.
The coast is rocky at this section.

name: Skuinsklip
description: Campsite No. 7 in Namaqua Nationalpark. No showers, no water tap. Environmental loo available only. Very nice sea view with wind protected Braai area.

name: Koringkorrelbaai
description:
Campsite No. 8 in Namaqua Nationalpark. No showers, no water tap. Environmental loo available only. Very nice sea view with wind protected Braai area.
Situated close to a huge and long bay with white sand and dunes. Very recommend.

name: Skuinsbaai Noord
description: Campsite No. 9 in Namaqua Nationalpark. No showers, no water tap. Environmental loo available only. Very nice sea view with wind protected Braai area.

name: Franschoek camping (Heuwelsig Farm)
description: What a fabulous spot, established campsites, beautiful ablutions, two swimming pools, great view across the Franschoek mountains. It was R450 per night for two adults.  We had a 4-year old with us, no charge for him.

name: Willard Batteries XPress
description: If you need any help with batteries or need new batteries, go to this place. They are cheaper than others and the staff is more than friendly and helpful.

name: The Alpaca Loom - Coffee Shop and Weaving Studio
description: The largest Alpaca farm in South Africa (400 animals). Daily tours at 11:00, 13:00 & 15:00 (80 Rands per person). They also offer Alpaca Walks.  They produce scarves, shawls and blankets. You can also drink coffee, tea and other drinks. The staff was very helpful and nice.

name: Finchley Farm Bush Camp
description:
Camping in a field with sheep and thorn trees. Half dozen sites with electricity. 

Facilities are primitive but functional. One toilet shower and sink plus kitchen sink.

name: Abel Erasmus Pass (R36)
description:
The spectacular Abel Erasmus Pass, named after a very prominent citizen of the area, was officially opened on the 8th of May 1959, and navigates the Manoutsa section of the Limpopo Drakensberg. It is regarded as an engineering triumph, with a sequence of bends and twists that can only give rise to admiration for the gold rush pioneers of the late 19th century that carved this route through the mountains with their wagons. The pass has 62 bends, corners and curves of which 12 exceed an arc of 90 degrees.

The pass also includes a 133 metre-long tunnel, named after J.G. (Hans) Strydom, who served as the prime minister of South Africa from 1954 to 1958. This huge pass is over 24 km long and has an altitude variance of 737 metres; the road surface is in a good condition, but the pass is sometimes plagued by heavy traffic. It can be very difficult to pass slow-moving trucks – please exercise a degree of tolerance and patience, and give yourself plenty of time to traverse this route.

name: McCarthy’s Rest Border Control
description: Very easy crossing and friendly staff on both the South African and Botswana sides. Paid insurance and road tax for 3 months on Botswana side. We were the only people at the crossing. Black top road with a few potholes on Botswana side, well graded gravel on South African side.

name: Askham Chalets
description: Rooms with bathroom, small kitchen and Barbeque facilities

name: Molenrivier Farm
description:
A very neat camping site in beautiful nature. Situated in a forested kloof next to a dam. Tranquil with stunning bird life, hiking and swimming.
Only 9 sites, each with an electricity point and on green grass with semi shade. Stunning ablution with ample hot water.
All types of caravans, camper vans and tents welcome.
By owner.

name: nata
description: Fuel station close to Nata lodge with a shop to buy supplies

name: WeDoStorage
description:
This is a good place to store a vehicle for short and long term INDOOR. 
We left our big mobile truck here for some months. 
The location is only few km east of the International airport (5km ?/ 10 min ?) in a quiet suburb. 

They do also repairing of vehicles or can certainly support.

The names of the very nice and helpful owner are Sinie & Gerhard Venter.
Adress: 435 Killarney Rd.
                Bredell AH, Kempton Park , 1619

To contact them the best maybe is to give them a call / or whatsapp message
Gerhard 027/649854239
Sinie: 027/661799088

www.wedostorage.co.za

name: Buffys Surf Bungalows
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Buffys Surf bungalows consists of a rondavel, kitchen and another room attached.Hot gas shower. Flush toilet and fully equipped kitchen

name: Somerso Klein
description: Guesthouse with Self catering. We got a very well equipped cottage within a fruit garden. Big living room and kitchen, sleeping room for three to four persons and bathroom. Good hot showers, everything clean. Kitchen with hobs, fridge, dishes. Save car parking. Price was 750 for the apartment per day.

name: Mount Sheba
description: This lodge and resort has a grassy campground area with shared ablutions. Friendly staff. Near local hiking trails.

name: Honey Nest resort
description:
Bush campsite. Two lovely owners who have made a small campsite. Lovely quiet and overlanders friendly. Place looks tip top! Hot shower with a donkey, clean bathroom and beautifull walks. Very much recommended! 
Price is good if you stay longer. 
We stayed here durring the lockdown (COVID-19) and they where the only people who would take us in the area. Brought us fruit, tomatos and beskuit(rusks). So we are very gratefull towards them and it almost became our second home...

name: Ruah Park
description:
Very neat and quiet camp ground, newly established, each site has its own bathroom with wash up area
There is a swinging pool and dams with fishing on a catch and release base allowed

name: Boegoeberg Dam Holiday Resort
description:
Boegoeberg Dam is situated 35 km from Groblershoop on a gravel road. The campsites are on the waterfront, are well maintained with lots of trees that offer campers plenty of shade. The main camp has water and electricity whilst the other camps situated along the waterfront Langgrass, Swartstomp and Koegelenberg se Gat are bush camps with no electricity. 
There is a small shop at reception that offers treats drinks and firewood. Camping rates are R130.00 pppn. There are also 5 chalets availability at R850 per chalets which sleeps 4.
Boegoeberg Dam is an oasis in the area and is well worth visiting. +27832574730 email boegoebergdam@gmail.com for more information.

name: MBS MOTOR SPARES
description:
George and his team was super helpful! 
He managed to source an exhausted gaskets for our Toyota Land Cruiser (1992 / 70s series / 2.4l 22RE) nobody else in town could find. Besides he helped us out with new belts and plugs which they directly installed in their own workshop behind the store. 

We definitely recommend this place if you are in need of any spear parts!

name: Kleine Bela
description:
Kleine Bela is a family owned campsite plus accomodation in a huge compound.
We arrived here with the Lockdown.
The owners are super friendly and helpfull. Every stand is huge, green grass and shadow if you want. Two pools, playground, putt putt. Also a coin laundromat.
Some pensioner caravans with monthly rate (2200 rand) at an extra area. Daily rate is 300 rand for holidayers. Maybe ask for a discount for overlanders.
We are happy to be here during the lockdown, because the place is so big, part is nice garden, part is still bushland. All is clean and well maintained. 
Once when we have to leave the country we will miss Kleine Bela.
There is a second gate for big rigs.
It is convenient to or from Pretoria or Joburg or airport.

name: Fraaiuitsig
description: A guest farm. Close to Vrede. Stayed here last night. Owners are extremely friendly hand helpful.  R200pn plus R50pppn. Sleep in a chalet.

name: Once is Cape Town
description:
Lively hostel behind the Yours Truly bar (they use the same entrance). Price varies per room and day. One of my favorites in SA thanks to the staff while I was there.

Pros:
-rooms were clean and neat
-daily activities planned for travelers to meet
-small breakfast is included
-kitchen available
-limited parking

Cons:
-music until 10:00 pm and some noisy crowd potentially until later
-some rooms are a little small

name: Uitvlugt
description: Located next a dam with beautiful view on the mountains

name: Riekertsdam Camping Site (Marico Bosveld Dam)
description: Beautifully situated along the shore of the Marico Bosveld Dam, campsites under shady trees with everything a nature lover would need. Good fishing and motor boating.

name: The Old Post Office Inn
description: Beautiful self catering accomodation, well equipped and designed. A home away from home. Knowledgeable and accomodating host Greg. Indoor fireplace and outdoor braai facility and veranda. Secure onsite parking.

name: Middelpos Hotel
description: Very basic camping in a tiny village in the Karoo near Sutherland and Calvinia. The owner is very welcoming and their hospitality is lovely. No electricity and no water supply but permission will be granted to use indoor ablutions. Meals could be arranged for in the hotel’s doning room, wholesome Karoo cuisine.

name: Overlander Storage
description:
Moderator's Note:  Place information provided by owners, Bashewa Motors
Long term storage for SUV and 4x4 vehicles.  www.overlanderstorage.com

name: Bashewa Motors
description: Listing provided by owner.  All mechanical repairs and maintenance on SUV and 4x4 vehicles

name: CD Shipping international
description:
We shipped our Landcruiser back home from here. There were another car and two bikes in the container, which gave us a small discount. 
Mr Wolfgang Vogel is the owner, very helpful.

name: The Old Post Office Inn
description: Beautiful self catering accomodation, well equipped and designed. A home away from home. Knowledgeable and accomdating host Greg.Fully equipped self catering kitchen. Indoor fireplace and outdoor braai facility with a nice veranda. Secure on site parking.

name: Safari 4x4
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: post appears to be submitted by owner. Next user please confirm independent comments on this business. 

It is a family business trading since 1996 in 4×4, pickup truck (bakkie), adventure motorcycle and camping accessories.

Their service is not only professional, but developed from years of experience and personal passion. Their goal is to fulfill in customer needs rather than pushing specific brands. Being in the 4×4 business for such a long time gives them the advantage into buying at competitive prices from leading suppliers, which therefore benefits the customer both in terms of cost and quality products.

name: Matroosberg Reserve
description: Large very basic campground under pine trees. R70 pppn.

name: Kraalskloof
description:
A beautiful well appointed 
campsite on lawn adjacent to a dam. Suitable for single group. Excellent ablution single shower single flush toilet. Gas geyser for shower and kitchen. Braai wood. R300 per night for first 2 persons R100 per person per night thereafter and once off R50 per vehicle. Maximum 10 persons 3 vehicles. Call owner to book on 082 373 3001

name: Ossewakop Viewpoint
description: Plaque commerating the Anglo Boer War that took place in the area

name: Hennops Pride
description: Campsite on the Hennops River. Has campsites and chalets available. Also lots of lapas and kid's entertainment areas

name: Thorn Tree Bushcamp
description: Tented camps, campsites and bushcamps within Dinokeng Game Reserve

name: Boelamien Rivier Camp
description:
Beautiful Campsite and Chalets on the banks of Limpopo river just off Platjan Border Post. Chalets could be occupied in hunting season so check in advance. Contact Mariana +27762162285 (signal is weak so try WhatsApp).
Visit them on Facebook.

name: Lebombo Fuel Depot
description: Fuel depot selling 50ppm diesel at substantially lower prices than other places in town. Accept cash or card.

name: D'Oude Molen Guesthouse
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Guest Home has been offering both the leisure and business traveler the luxuries of a guest house combined with the warmth of a home.

It is the ideal accommodation for families, Unisa students, post graduates, researchers and culture vultures attending the Aardklop Arts Festival every year.
         
Being owner run, you could expect hospitality and friendliness.

We are in the (CID) Cachet Park City Improvement District (camera monitering services & refuse removal/cleaning and maintenance) on the Bult area.

+27 832976244
doudemolen15@gmail.com

name: Salty Waters BnB
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Accommodation rooms and restaurant are at the same premises, very nice and secure place in town. You would not regret a stop over for a night rest and a breakfast for the next morning.

0609313208 Tamboekie Koffiehoekie
0834285305  Salty Waters BnB

name: Moss & Maple Farm stall and restaurant
description: Delicious food! Country-style place. Lovely setting with ponds, gardens and playground for the kids. Craft store, didn’t see vegetables. But homemade preserves. Good service and price.

name: Nature’s Valley Restaurant
description: Relaxed pub and restaurant at far end of town. Hamburgers, pizza and such. Good vegetarian selections. Great place to grab a meal after hiking the beach. Don’t miss the hike up to the Point on the other side of the Groot River mouth. Fab views.

name: Jukani Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Rescued and confiscated Big Cats find a forever home in this place. From lions to caracals. The enclosures are large and the animals well cared for. There is no animal interaction, just viewing and learning. The guided tour takes an hour and a half. Well worth a visit.

name: Birds of Eden
description: Touted as the world’s largest free flight aviary. Here you walk through a number of environs amongst a spectacular variety of birds. From the large Blue crane to tiny White-Eyes. Supposedly all are rescued, surrendered or confiscated. All touching is discouraged, however, some parrots and turacos are very tame. It is a must experience.

name: African Bird of Prey Sanctuary
description: Unreleasable raptors of all kinds call this Sanctuary ‘home’. A large Verreaux’s owl to tiny Pigmy falcons. A few birds are trained and flown in daily flight shows to entertain and educate. The flight arena overlooks the hills towards the ocean and creates a stunning backdrop for the show. A nice little curio shop. Toasted sandwiches and drinks. Playground for the kids. Nature walk to see the resident zebras. A great place to spend a few hours with nature.

name: Radical Raptors
description: Very informative fun show with owls, Harris Hawk, and others. Birds fly close and handler teaches while he flys the birds. Set in a fun center with shops and good restaurant.

name: Elma’s B&B and camping
description: In the heart of this small town Elma offers camping to one or two travelers. Literally only space for about two vehicles with RTT and one ground tent. There is one toilet and shower room. Power went out and water too during our stay. However, Elma provided water buckets and lamps. She only asks for a donation and has no set price. We paid what we usually do ZAR200 for the two of us and our Landy with rooftop. No info on B&B.

name: Supa Quick Tire
description: Great place to get tires fast. They had to bring in what we needed ... BF Goodridge KO2s ... after we shredded one driving the Swartberg.

name: Potholes
description: Road between border and Piet Retief atrocious. Tar and full of deep potholes. Eswatini side good road and  beautiful drive.

name: Vernon Crookes
description:
Small nature reserve set within the hills between sugarcane farms. Not much game, other than zebra/wildebeest/hartebeest however lovely for a day trip & a picnic. Wonderful bird life and a few walking trails. Picnic sites with braai facilities (bring own wood/grid). 

30R pp
Accommodation available but no camping.

name: Graskop Gorge Lift Co.
description: Enjoy a 51m lift down into the gorge and a 600m educational trail in the forest with suspension bridges over the river. ZAR210. Nice cafe with a wide variety of foods and great coffee! Also a 68m bridge swing at ZAR450 and zip line at ZAR180 or combo special at ZAR570. Swing includes the ascent of the lift. Entrance fee ZAR30 if not doing any of above, otherwise is included in above prices. Touristy with curio shops and although a pricey stop, is a unique, proudly South African enterprise worth the visit.

name: Free Three Rondawels Viewpoint
description: Although one cannot see down into the canyon, this road siding provides a safe, accessible and free location to snap some photographs of the Three Rondawels. Safe enough to park with all 4 wheels off the road and visible to traffic.

name: Oliphant Campsite
description:
Spacious and clean campsite with plenty of shade. A great stopover if you don’t want to stay at the lodges down the road (none of them answered our calls!). 
Has a bar, restaurant, shop and petrol station just next door. Karl, the manager, was absolutely lovely and brought us firewood as the shop was closed when we arrived. 
PS there are baths!!!!!!!!

name: Wattle Chop
description:
Beautifully maintained small holding where the owners have dedicated the pond and large grassy area to host campers. Large communal sheltered area with sink and ping pong and open fire pace to settle on against the cold winter. Summer must be amazing! 

An excellent stop over!

name: Albasini Ruins
description: Forming part of the the early trading routes that traversed the eastern area of Southern Africa, this is the ruins of a trading post set up by Joao Albasini. Interesting information boards provide some historical perspectives.

name: Nkumbe Lookout
description: Impressive views to the west! Nice shelter with stone seating. No facilities.

name: Lookout
description: Impressive views of the plains below looking east and to Mozambique. No facilities.

name: Kruger Station
description: Third wave coffee shop, pizzeria and soft-serve ice cream bar and bar situated within and around an old steam train, it's carriage and station. Prices are are the high side. Nice for a treat or if passing by Skukuza! Children's play area too. Open daily 08:00 - 16:00. www.krugerstation.com

name: Stevenson-Hamilton Memorial Lookout
description: Nice views on a koppie of granite extrusions of some of the surrounding plains, named after one of the builders of the Kruger National Park and where his remains were scattered. No facilities.

name: Jock of the Bushveld's Birthplace
description: Plaque marking the place where Sir Percy Fitzpatrick's famous dog, Jock of the Bushveld, was born in May 1885. No facilities.

name: Gardenia Bird Hide
description: Bird hide with views over a water hole. No facilities except to park and disembark and visit the hide. Nice spot!

name: Steilberg Lookout
description: Nice spot with 180 degree view of the Steilberg and associated hills. No facilities.

name: Shiloh Coffee Shop
description: Locally grown and produced coffee can be enjoyed here on the farm in an exquisite setting alongside a dam, set amongst coffee trees and views of the surrounding hills. Breakfasts, light lunches and tasty treats at reasonable prices. Hiking and biking trails coming soon! Children's play area. Open Tuesday to Sunday 09:00 to 16:30. www.shilohcoffee.co.za. +27 79 290 9567.

name: Long Tom Canon
description: Cannon marking the spot where two Creusot cannons (Long Toms) were put up by the Boers where a shoot-out took place between them and the English cannons of General Buller. Great views of the surrounding valleys below! No facilities.

name: M&R Oil & Diesel Depot
description: Diesel can be purchased here at substantially lower prices than elsewhere in town. Engine oils and some vehicle accessories too.

name: Lookout
description: Almost 360 degree panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and hills.

name: Magangeni Lookout
description: 360 degree panoramic views of the surrounding hills and valleys. Great spot!

name: Zincakeni Lookout
description: Nice 180 degree panoramic view looking south over the hills and valleys.

name: Nkwankwa Lookout
description: 270 degree panoramic view northwards over the hills and valleys.

name: Hlaza Lookout
description: Stunning 360 degree panoramic views on a saddle overlooking the surrounding valleys and hills.

name: Hilltop
description: Restaurant, bar, toilets, fuel, curio shop, high end resort accommodation, picnic site, children's play area. Brilliant views of the surrounding hills and valleys below.

name: Nqabatheki Lookout
description: 270 degree panoramic views of the hills and valleys below.

name: Centenary Centre
description: Interpretation centre and capture bomas commemorating 100 years of uninterrupted protection of black and white rhinoceros in the Park. Vulamehlo craft market, take away kiosk, toilets and picnic site. Card payments accepted for curios.

name: Nyalazi Gate Hluhluwe iMfolozi Park
description: Park entrance to or from Saint Lucia side. Go into Hluhluwe or iMfolozi sides of the Park from here. There is also another entrance on the western side of the Park called Cengeni Gate.

name: Flambojant No. 7
description: Modern, self catering apartment.  Provide own towels. ZAR440 for 2 persons, 3 year old free per night. Includes fridge, large freezer, microwave, stove, oven, kettle, air conditioner, fan, full DSTV, sleeper couch, outside braai place and wash line, lock up garage for vehicle not exceeding 5.2 metres long and safe lock up box. Good value for a night or two.

name: Mtunzini Toll Plaza
description: ZAR48.50 for a normal car. Accept cash and South African visa cards

name: Mvoti Toll Plaza
description: ZAR14 toll fee for vehicles. Cash and South African visa cards accepted.

name: Wonderbag
description: Proudly South African and internationally renoun Wonderbag factory producing and selling energy efficient slow cooking bags. Supporting and empowering women. For greener living and saving on non renewables, this is a recommended and fun way to cook especially at camp! Can even be used as a cooler box! Tongaat Industrial Park, cash only, but can view range and bundles and order online too. Open Monday to Thursday 08:00 to 16:00, Friday 08:00 to 13:00, closed weekends.

name: Outdoor Warehouse
description: For all things camping and outdoor gear.

name: savior cafe
description: Brilliant coffee, cakes and more. Inside and outside seating, brewing locally grown Beaver Creek coffee. Open Monday to Friday 07:00 to 17:00, Saturday to Sunday 08:00 to 15:00, public holidays 08:00 to 15:00.

name: LM Prawn/Pizza
description: Family restaurant offering a variety of seafood, pizza, ribs, curries, burgers or combos. Reasonable prices and friendly service. Also offer take outs! +27 79 191 0901

name: Khamkirri Lodge
description: Beautiful 3 star Lodge  with 10 chalets, 5 tented rooms and Camp facilities on the banks of the Orange river. Fishing, riverrafting,kayaks,game drives, 4x4 trail and mountainbiking. A must visit near Augrabies and Riemvasmaak. Phone 0842444408 Phillipa.

name: Beaver Creek Coffee Estate & Cafe
description: The worlds most southern coffee farm. Cafe (with bottomless coffee!), restaurant (light meals and cakes), coffee tours (ZAR60 pp), children's play area and hiking, running and mountain bike trails (for all ages!) at ZAR20 pp. Small shop selling coffee beans and other locally produced artisan food goodies. A good, recommended coffee experience. Open daily 08:00 to 16:00.

name: Lala @ C
description: Nice quiet location on a secure property 100 metres walk from the beach. ZAR350 for two persons with rooftop/big rig or own tents on green grass. Pool, braai spot, tan deck, undercover seating area, kitchen and more. ZAR400 for two and minor up to 12 with the above facilities sleeping in the semi permanent caravan set up under cover for a cozy stay. Call or message Tom ahead of time: +27 82 448 7548 (he also repairs all types of vehicles).

name: Springbok Lodge &Restaurant
description:
Traditional South African Food
Bobotie
Malaysian Mutton Curry
Biltong and feta quish

name: Coffee Bay Lookout
description: Exceptional views over the bay and coast line! Can drive to this point.

name: Johnny’s Pub
description:
A cool quirky pub with great food, great booze and a great attitude!

Come get drunk in Pilgrims Rest!

name: Kallabaskop Lodge
description:
Campsite near Soebadsfontein
5 chalets
4 under roof camp stands
Communal ablution 
Shop on site
Braai Facilitates 
Hot shower (donkie)

name: Bergview Caravan park
description: The caravan park behind fuel station, number of restaurants. Grass, Under pine trees, ablutions. ZAR270

name: Baby Hole in the Wall
description: Directly south from here, walk down the small footpath a few metres to view the Baby Hole in the Wall. See photo of what to look for. To get here take the turn off at the top of the hill which is about 20 metres from the sign.

name: Four Cousins Restaurant
description: Beer, Wine & Food available with tastings. Plenty of parking

name: Mavuradonha
description:
Great site for trailers and tents. Access to the site restricts regular caravans.
Fabulous site for quiet out of the way camping to relax.
The town is very nearby which has a restaurant and all the day to day things you will need.

name: Fleckvieh Guesthouse
description: Two locations one open space on the dam, the other along the river. All lovely grassed areas with electric on site and individual braai space, ablutions shared between 2 camp spots have hot shower. This information is regarding the camping facilities, there are also rooms available.

name: Nona Rosa Bush Camp
description:
A remote location of tents or off road caravans.
A lovely quiet place with no disturbances. Is a way from any shops or  facilities so you need to make sure you have what you need as nearest town is about 15km away.

name: next to a sheep's food store
description: Unable to drive in the dark the farmer allowed me to wild camp here. Sheltered from the wind by the sheep food storage building. No light pollution. Just a bird and his nest for company

name: Grootvlei Mpumalanga
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

Private property, overlanders welcome. Water for drinking, no electricity. Safe.

name: Die Sandveldhuisie
description: Tourist office  curio shop in Citrusdal. Meet the nutter owner Juandre.

name: Bushman Valley
description: beautiful camp site  and chalets set in the majestic mountain vistas ,only a few KM from the town of Prince Albert...hot water showers and fire wood available for campers.

name: Pear Tree Campsite
description:
This appears to be a very new site. Currently only 2 sites completed but more are being added. Both sites have there own facilities, shower, toilet and scullery.
It is in the middle of the small town but seems very quiet and safe. The owner lives across the road. Access is therefore no problem.
It's a level gravel stand with some shade.
It cost R250 per night for a caravan and 2 adults.

name: Viedgesville Wholesalers Fuel Depot
description: Fuel station at substantially lower prices (??) than other mainstream filling stations around. Card payments accepted.

name: SaveMor Spar and Fuel
description: Hogsback grocery shop, quite well stocked. Same building has fuel station with some vehicle accessories and air for tyre pressure adjustments.

name: Riva Resort
description: Wild Camping spots next to Orange river, with beautiful self catering Bungalows

name: Silver Mist Resort
description:
A beautiful campsite on an equestrian farm, with fishing in the dams. Due to COVID we camped on the deck that the fixed tents are usually on, so were facing over the dam and it was AMAZING! Really cool spot, but unsure what camping would be like post COVID. 
Cost was R300 for two people

name: Peak Formosa turn off
description: Turn off from R62 to take to the start of the Peak Formosa hiking trail. The coordinates of the parking and start of the trail that that leads to this beautiful high point is S33 50.909 E23.40.356. ZAR100 per vehicle access fee for the gate on weekends, free access weekdays.

name: OnsKarooPlaas
description:
On the Rouxpos route off the R323 between Laingsburg and  Seweweeks-
poort.  Camping for tents, rooftop tents, caravans and motorhomes.
Grass and shade for most sites.Electric power for each site.

name: Champagne on the river
description: nice camp site with clean ablutions green lawns and a river for swimming

name: Matjiesfontein
description: National Heritage Site, this historic one street town was founded in 1884. Home to the first international cricket match in South Africa, it now boasts old cars, museums, buildings, old post office, train, station and more retaining its original character. Well worth a visit and coffee and more in The Coffee House. www.matjiesfontein.com

name: AgriMark Ceres
description: Purchase diesel here at lower prices than mainstream fuel stations.

name: Sentry Hll Campsite Botsalano NP
description: Bush camp with facilities inside Botsalano

name: Near... Rooinek
description:
Dry river bed, only to be used in the dry months. This nook in the mountain is sheltered from the wind and has tall hills on both side to avoid the all day sun that is common in this plateau area.

Plenty of place to park a big rig, to make fire and to set up a loo / shower cubicle.

name: West Coast National Park
description: Langebaan Gate. Opening hours September - March 07h00 - 19h00, April - August 07h00 - 18h00. Beautiful flowers in the Postberg section during August and September. No access fee for SANParks Wildcard holders, otherwise refer to SANParks website for latest pricing.

name: Atlantic Viewpoint
description: Brilliant 180 degree panoramic views up and down the West Coast National Park coastline from Yzerfontein to Tsaarsbank. One can walk down to 16 Mile Beach, the longest uninterrupted beach on the South African coastline. Table Mountain National Park is visible on a clear day. Picnic tables make for a nice stop too!

name: West Coast National Park
description: West Coast Gate. Opening hours September - March 07:00 - 19:00, April - August 07:00 - 18:00. Beautiful flowers in the Postberg section during August and September. No access fee for SANParks Wildcard holders, otherwise refer to SANParks website for latest pricing.

name: Karee Vleis Mark
description:
Large selection of excellent biltong and other meat. Recommendable.

59 Monument Road, Kempton Park
Mail: kareemeatmarket@gmail.com

name: Camp near Aristea Shipwreck
description:
This is actually a picnic spot near Aristea Shipwreck. We decided to camp a little further down south from the shipwreck because we have noticed warning signs that camping is not allowed between the shipwreck and Hondeklipbaai.
The site is slightly elevated from the water and we did experience a little bit of wind in our trailer top tent but had a good nights rest.

name: Bushwillow caravan park
description: Beautiful level grass stands with electricity and water. Forest in the background with Samango monkeys. Hike available to a very high waterfall. R125 pp out of season and R150 pp in season. Washing machine and dryer on premises, R15 per wash.

name: Near....Graaff-Reinet Golf Course
description:
Lovely tucked away spot between a large water reservoir and bushes.

With vehicle facing the road, created a triangle of wind protection (not a lot of wind but a bit nippy due to coming out of winter time).

Great for large rigs as well. Stunning views of the surrounding mountains, and just below a hill horizon to ensure minimal person observance.

name: Montagu Tolhouse / Tolhuis
description:
Old toll house on the Montagu Pass between George and Herold. 

The toll house burnt badly in October 2018 and has been lovingly restored to almost its original masterpiece. This has been done 100% through volunteer work, donations as well as selling pancakes.

Met Joulian Roelfse, local historian / guide who kindly allowed me to camp on the grounds for the evening.

If you decide to camp here, Please donate towards the continued restoration of this amazing Old Lady.

name: Port Nolloth Museum
description:
it is not any more at the beach front, as indicated in travel guides.
it is in Rowland Rd next to Tyremart @ 1244 Kamp St, Port Nolloth, 8280, South Africa

private museum
Curator George Moyses is a legend
Super interesting stories about diamont diving.
if in the area dont miss it

name: Smillin Thru
description:
Such a shame. Lovely location and big. Lots of space for all sorts, just a pity it is let down by the facilities. The ablutions are in a very run down state.
It was cheap at R90 per person but we didn't choose it for the price we just turned up.

name: Buffelspoort
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this post appears to have been placed by the owner/operator of this resort/conference centre site. No independent comments from overlanding travellers as yet.

Whether you are looking for action and adventure or peace and quiet, you will find the perfect family holiday right here! The area’s peace and tranquility also provide the perfect atmosphere for positive and creative business planning.

name: Eagle Falls
description: Beautiful site with campsites and timber chalets near the falls after which the place is named. Flat level grassy sites with sparse shade, all with electricity, braai places (BBQ) and water taps, simple but clean ablutions with hot showers, big lapa and kitchen (closed when we were there). Michael the owner is very welcoming and interesting to talk to. Hiking and extreme Grade 5 4x4 trail. Good gravel access road from main N9 road. Highly recommended. Turn off the N9 at S33° 46.134' E22° 47.328'.

name: Gamkaberg Nature REserve
description: Reserve is run by Cape Nature. A SA Wild Card will get you in for free and then only campsite fees apply. The campsite has just two stands with cement  slabs on which to pitch a tent but alongside which one can park a vehicle. The ground is hard earth and not completely level. There are good ablutions with hot showers 100m away from the campsite with new long drop composting toilets at the campsite. Nice hiking trails in the nearby kloof with bushmen paintings and signs describing the fauna and flora. 4x4 trail to the mountain top self catering cottage. The turn off to the reserve is at S33° 37.183' E21° 54.245'.

name: Vrederus Wild Trout
description:
Vrederus is a working sheep and cattle farm. They offer fly fishing in the dam infront of the two self catering cottages.

The cottages sleep 6 and 4 people comfortably and have everything you need. Pre-booking is essential. There's no signal in this area and it is advised to check the conditions of the mountain passes used to get to Vrederus.

Juan-Marie and Donie Naude are great hosts and there is superb fishing in rivers and dams.

name: Trentyre
description: Tires and batteries for sale and fitted for big rigs. In 2020 only stocking Good Year but from 2021 onwards all brands. Speciality is big rigs

name: Rhodes Hotel
description:
Local farmers bought the Hotel recently and will open officially end 2020 but they still accommodate visitors. 

Sandra is very friendly and kindly offered us a room to shower in. We supported her by having a few drinks at her bar.
Sandra 084 867 8174

name: Noukrans Boskamp
description:
By owner: In the shade of our oak trees, come and kick off your shoes and take a deep breath.  Enjoy the silence and freedom only a farm can offer. 
Pour a glass of wine and enjoy your view of the mountain.  A short walk will take you to Noukrans, where a weir in the river makes a nice swimming spot.  The brave can take the walk into the river for 4-5 hours and explore the big waterfall.
With no electricity, but hot showers and flush toilets, we offer you the best of both worlds.  In the bush, without living like the Flintstones.
We have proper farm milk, straight from the dairy, available to buy.  And per order, I  deliver freshly baked bread to you.

name: Elandskloof Trout Farm Campsite
description: A short 5km gravel road to get to the office, then another 3km further and you are at the camp. A beautiful location, with hills all around you, dams for the trout and big well established trees. You can fish apparently, and there are many other activities available.

name: Riverside Paradise
description: Camping sites with and without power next to river. Hiking trail. Shared ablution. Swimming.

name: Reedsdell farm
description:
This is a working farm that hosts big adventure events. Their ablutions are designed to cater for big groups so only cold showers are available for individual campers. The owner did say that he plans to install a gas water heater at some stage. 
The facilities are neat and tidy and you have a beautiful view. The owners are Chris and Cath. R100pp including wifi.

name: Koekepan
description: Basic meals and snacks available, safe parking for trucks and water. Big rig friendly

name: Red Rock River Camp
description: Set directly on the Orange River with swimming, fishing and rafting on your doorstep. Beautiful location and we would have stayed for 2 nights, but if you want time alone you might not get it. The owners invited themselves to our camp we ended up having to unwillingly host them. It’s a lovely place and very remote which has great appeal, it was a shame in the end.

name: Boegoeberg
description:
Nice shaded camp sites ...50 sites.
Pool and shop on site.
R250 per site per night.
Shop and braai wood on site.

name: Ragelsrivier Bokmakierie camp
description:
In the corner of a craggy kloof and shaded by leafy white stink woods, wild olives and other indigenous trees; this beautiful campsite lies peacefully on the grassy bank of a rocky riverbed. The amenities are beautifully built out of natural stone and wood and include a basic kitchen equipped with a gas geyser and cooker; 2 toilets and a separate shower and loo, warmed by a rustic but effective ‘donkey’ geyser. The bird life is amazing!

email:  Ragelsrivier@gmail.com

name: De Berg Guesthouse
description: Very nice Guesthouse with Dinner and Breakfast served

name: Ganora
description: Great stay ! Awesome food ! Great showers

name: Truksvygrivier
description:
It is not really a camp but they have space for you to park and they have a nice little ablution facility with hot water. We paid R200 for 2 people. They also provide wood for a braai and have a communal kitchen. 

We were lucky to find the family here over a weekend but there is a foreman here called Kerneels (I think it's his name 🤔) and he will assist you. If you can't find him just call the number on the gate. Very friendly people. 

They also have a little cement dam with clean water to swim in. 

082 894 3351 Arrie and Stephanie Stopforth. www.turksvygrivier.co.za

Ps. Other self catering accommodation is aslo available.

name: Driekwartblou Guest Hose
description: Very nice guesthouse near Gariep Dam on a farm.

name: Kuifkopvisvanger
description:
Nice estabilshed camp site next to the Berg rivier.
R175 per night.
Tel no. 022 7830818

name: Zelpy Fishing & Game Resort
description:
Beautiful fishing & Game Resort in the Magaliesburg area. (Used to be called Eastco).
Hard standing, shade cloth, water, power point & braai area at every pitch.

name: Marlu Farm stays
description:
