Bushcamp near the river. Very neat ablutions. Washing up area and gas geyser for showering and /or donkey system. Lucia and Martin makes you feel very welcome and go out of their way to make you stay a pleasant one.
Whatsapp 084 513 0232 or 
email info@marlu.co.za
www.marlu.co.za

name: Hopewell Conservation Estate by Mantis
description:
Nestled in the heart of pristine nature, in the foothills of the Groot Winterhoek Mountain Range. 2500 hectares of tranquil, unspoilt fynbos in one of SA's biodiverse regions.
Glamping Tents with en-suite bathroom,shower,basin, toilet,patio with kitchenette,cutlery, crockery, towels and linen supplied.
weber braai, communal boma, swimming pool, mountain biking track, self drive route on small reserve.

name: Near Addo Elephant Park
description:
Within 10kms of Addo Elephant Park and a perfect overnight place if you don’t want to pay the high Park overnight fees.

Spot is on an unused service gravel road next to the train line. Train track seems not to have been used in ages and no sign of other vehicle tracks or activity in the area.

Spotted a couple of scouter-baboons who didn’t come closer than 200 meters. 

Excellent views of the open fields.

name: Cornutis restaurant
description: Italian restaurant with pizza's, Grill, Salads and Seafood in city center Plettenberg bay With free parking

name: Smokey Moon Backpackers
description:
Very rudimentary camp site with an additional 5  rooms.

Campground is a basic open mowed green field. 

Property used to be an old brick making facility which now oozes history and character. 

Lovely large dam to walk around for kids or the evening stroll. Tucked away from traffic and noise. Super secure and the sound of the various birds in the morning gently wakes you up. 

I paid R100 for one person (camping).

name: Willowmore Caravan Park
description:
Surprisingly ok, private owned caravan park. Neat private ablutions and security is good. R140pp. 
They also have a few self catering units. R350pp.

name: Wolfberg Arch
description: Nice hiking to the Wolfberg Arch on  1.557m altitude. You pass the famous Wolfberg cracks and you have the possibility to go back a different track. All of them you'll find on OSM maps, Osmand or maps.me. Permits must be bought at Sanddrift Campsite reception (free with wildcard).

name: hiker's parking
description: Parking spot for hiking towards the Maltese Cross. Quiet and surrounded by nature. Clean pit toilet is also available.

name: Tzaneen Country Lodge
description: What a bombastic and funky lodge! We stayed here for one night and it’s a fantastic place - great food, great drinks and even a gym and pool! Lovely staff too!

name: Mountain Fly Fishing
description:
Camping and chalets available spread across 5 trout dams. Very well maintain and family run on an avocado farm. 

The campsite is lovely - we were the only ones staying here and had a view over a dam, with our own private ablution block. Small touches (like soap and small flowers in the bathroom) make this place quite special!

It was very windy when we stayed, but unsure if this is normal or if it was an exception for us. 

Would still highly recommend, it was a lovely stay.

name: Zanchieta Wild Cat Rescue
description:
A very unique experience camping on a big cat rescue farm. The whole place is full of animals, with squirrels, rabbits, porcupines, chickens and genet cats all popping in and out of reception when you check in. 

The experience is what makes this place amazing! We listened to the lions and jackals roaring from our tent at night, and the ladies in charge took us around to see them up close at feeding time (gulp!). The three-legged springbok kept us company for cuddles at camp during the day, so be sure to give her a stroke from us!

The campsite is on a big field with a braai stand and running water with a simple shared ablution block. Come here for the experience of camping (safely!!!!) next to lions - we don’t think you’ll be disappointed!

name: Ngulube Game Lodge
description:
A one night stopover with a big open sandy area people can camp in. You get your own ablution which is nice, but the whole place seems a little run down. There is a pool, chalets and dam with crocs and hippos in. 

We won’t stay here again, but were happy to stay here to pass through as we were only one of two campers. 

BEWARE OF THE MONKEYS! They’ll steal your fruit, girlfriend and livelihood if you’re not careful!!

name: Wings Coffee Roasters
description: Exceptional third wave coffee roastery and cafe with South American and African coffees on offer as blends or single origins. Inspired by and through the excellence and precision in the adventure of flying! Open Monday to Friday 08:00 - 17:00, Saturday 08:00 - 13:00, closed Sunday.

name: Elgro River Lodge
description: 5 STARS Beautifully situated on the banks of the vaal river.Fully equipped lodge with restaurant and bar, offering camping facilities. Fly fishing paradise. superb and attentive service!

name: Alpine Swift Trails
description:
Alpine Swift Trails Campsite is situated next to the R396 Naudes Neck Pass road to Maclear. There is a wooden deck gazebo, private yard, power points, basin and barbeque. Ablutions and kitchen is shared and about 50m from the camping area. Access to the pool, tennis court and gym. Various hiking trails are available and mountain bikes to rent. Fly fishing on property is allowed.

Other basic camping is available next to the Bell river without power points.

name: Tucked away oasis
description:
Awesome area that is just off the gravel road.
Small stream at the bottom of the flat open area (no risk of flooding). 
Small amount of traffic before 7pm, then nothing at all.
Beautiful view of the kloof and woken to the sound of a myriad of birds on the cliff face.

name: Nylsvley Nature Reserve Camping
description:
Inside of the Nylsvley Nature Reserve.

About 10 spots under trees with cement table & benches and fireplace/braai.

Watertaps inbetween the camps. 

1 flushing toilet and cold shower.

No electricity.

Camping is 50 Rand per person. 
Conservation Fee also 50 for Adults

NYLSVLEY is an Eldorado for waterbirds, esp when the floodplains are flooded. Bring your binocs and hiking shoes. Half of the area one can only explore on foot or by bike (bike rental is 120 per day)

Four bird Hides and a spectacular Tower for your sunset drink.

Also plenty antelopes, warthogs oder smaller animals

name: Melkboomsdrift Guest House
description:
Melkboomsdrift Guest House & Conference Centre is situated in the heart of the Olifants River valley, between Vredendal and Lutzville. This working farm with a restored farmhouse is an ideal stop-over between Cape Town and Namibia along the N7, with the West Coast 20 minutes away for whale spotting.

The historic building, which houses beautifully restored suites, achieved monument status in 1992 when the owner lovingly began the laborious task of restoring the then dilapidated building. The accommodation comprises 13 en-suite garden suites of which 4 offer self-catering facilities. The units can accommodate from 1 to 5 people.

Melkboomsdrift serves a farm breakfast, with dinner and picnic baskets available upon request. Guests can relax at the pool overlooking the Olifants river and vineyards. 

There are conference facilities available and can accommodate up to 20 delegates in an air-conditioned room with the necessary equipment available on request.

name: Oranjerus Resort
description:
A perfect little spot along the Orange river! Grassy field with clean ablutions, trees for shade and lots of spots that you can make a private little camp for yourself. 
Bar and restaurant that sells wood and ice.  
We were meant to stay only 1 night but stayed 4!

name: Igloo Inn
description:
Budget accommodation and campspots under palms in town.
It’s at one of the mainroads, so you hear traffic.
The igloos are the ablutions with flushing toilets and showers. 
Electricity plugs all over.
Camping is 90 per stand plus 40 per person.
Washing machine 40 per load.
Also dorm beds for 150 per person.
If you wanna pay with card, it’s an extra 3 % fee. So cash is king.

Phone numbers 082 3763355. 0152988445. 0784519098

name: Laniakea_Mjejane 34
description: A self catering 8 sleeper bush lodge on the crocodile river at Mjejane Game Reserve inside the greater Kruger Park. Privately owned by an overlander who has done most of west, southern and east Africa offroad.  Lodge is inside Kruger with the big five, antelope, hippo, birds and crocs from the deck. This is a rest and recovery spot in style and comfort with all the modern facilities and rates to match.

name: Oryx Game Farm
description:
Small camp site that caters for private campers and not commercial.

Clean and friendly.

name: Table mountain road parking
description: Nice and leveled parking beside the road. Very quiet at night and view to "Capetown at night" 4G C cell reception.

name: Andover Nature Reserve Campsite
description:
Campsite inside of Andover Nature Reserve, which is managed by Mpumalanga Tourism.

Facilities are definitely run down and need a Face lift.

The campsite is next to the reception on an open gras area. 

Most of the plugs are broken, otherwise there is electricity.
No Braai stands or dustbins - all gone and broken and not replaced 

Showerheads spread all over the Show - but warm water :-))

Ablutions clean.

Camping is 250 per site (up to six people) plus 60 pp conservation fee for the nature reserve.

Didn’t see any game, but there is supposed to be. 

Close to Orpen Gate for those who didn’t get a booking inside of kruger.

name: Blyde River Wild Camp
description: Wild camp on the banks of the Blyde not far from the Bourke’s Luck Potholes. Access through a disused cattle field. Beautiful view and background noise of the running stream. Crystal clear water good for morning wash.

name: Ebb & Flow Rest Camp (North)
description:
•  2 Rest camps with communal ablution facilities
•  Some of the sites are equipped with 220V power points (caravan plugs)
 •  Three point plugs can be used with an adapter
•  Coin-operated washing machines and tumble dryers are available
•  Braai facilities

name: Ebb & Flow Rest Camp (North)
description:
•  2 Rest camps with communal ablution facilities
•  Some of the sites are equipped with 220V power points (caravan plugs)
•  Three point plugs can be used with an adapter
•  Coin-operated washing machines and tumble dryers are available
•  Braai facilities

name: Ebb & Flow Rest Camp (North)
description:
•  2 Rest camps with communal ablution facilities
•  Some of the sites are equipped with 220V power points (caravan plugs)
•  Three point plugs can be used with an adapter
•  Coin-operated washing machines and tumble dryers are available
•  Braai facilities

name: Ebb & Flow Rest Camp (North)
description:
•  2 Rest camps with communal ablution facilities
•  Some sites are quipped with 220V power points (caravan plugs only)
•  Three-point plugs can be used with an adapter
•  Coin operated washing machines and bumble dryers are available
•  Braai facilities
•  Well maintained

name: Fish Eagle Eco Camp 082 745 8931
description: Rustic site next to the dam that supplies water to the nearby town of Calitzdorp. Friendly owner is Lourens. Camp sites are not laid out - you just find a level spot near the shore of the dam. Showers are hot and heated by a donkey which Lourens will light up early in the morning for you. Peaceful spot and the site is a work in progress. The gravel access road to the site connects to the lower end of the Swartberg Pass north of Oudtshoorn.We paid R150 pppn which is a little high for what you get.

name: Sacramento trail
description: A beautiful hike along the rocky shore of the ocean, whales waving from afar and lots of quiet spots to have a private beach for the day.

name: Hluhluwe Bushcamp
description:
A relatively new camp, has 4 sites for overland camping and a number of glamping options. 
A swimming pool and farm stall/ cafe with food options is a short walk away from the camping area.  The vibe of the place and from the staff is very good.

name: Gamkaberg Nature Reserve
description:
Ou Kraal Campsite :
•  4 Herder's huts that each sleep two people (in single beds, with mattresses)
•  Basic ablution facilities (an Enviro-loo waterless toilet and basin)
•  Water tank with rain water
•  No electricity
•  Outside braai with grid provided (wood provided on request)

Gamkaberg Campsite :
•  2 Campsites, each able to sleep four people
•  Electricity available
•  Ablution facilities with a solar-heated shower
•  Braai facilities

name: Gecko Rock Private Nature Reserve
description:
•  De Wet's Rus :
•  Campsite accommodating up to 20 vehicles (60 people)
•  Kitchen with cold running water
•  Communal ablution facilities
•  Central braai area
•  Movable braais for private camping
•  Swimming pool (filled mid-September to mid-April)
•  1 x 8-seater table and benches

•  Echo Valley :
•  Campsite accommodating up to five vehicles (10 people)
•  Kitchen with cold running water
•  One toilet and shower
•  Central braai area

name: Kagga Kamma Nature Reserve
description:
•  Swartrug Camp :
•  5 Camping sites (no power)
•  Communal ablution facilities with heated water
•  Swimming pool
•  Access to a braai but bring own grid

•  Bobbejaanskrans Camp :
•  Can only be accessed by 4x4
•  No camping stands
•  No electricity
•  No ablution facilities
•  No water
•  Bring own braai and grid

•  Tierskloof Camp :
•  Stunning panoramic views of the Cederberg
•  Can only be accessed by 4x4
•  No camping stands
•  No electricity
•  No ablution facilities
•  No water
•  Bring own braai and grid

•  Joubert's Werf Camp :
•  Can only be accessed by 4x4
•  No camping stands
•  No electricity
•  No ablution facilities
•  No water
•  Bring own braai and grid

•  Wood and ice can be puchase at reception

name: Noordhoek
description: Beach parking at Noordhoek, nice spot for Campers. Walking track to Chapman's peak is starting nearby. Nelson, the park guard, is very helpful with informations. C Cell 4G reception

name: Wagon Wheel Country Lodge
description: Great place for a stopover. Diligent staff and the option to stay at the backpackers or lodge

name: Kroonland 4x4
description:
Campsite situated on the bank of a perennial water stream
Site has grass but offers limited shade
Roofed lapa in close proximity to the camp, offering top quality braai facilities and ample seating
Hot showers available

name: Matjiesvlei Guest Farm
description:
6 Campsites on the dam (Die Damrivierkamp)
All vehicle access but high ground clearance vehicles advised
Fresh water in camp
Rustic ablution blocks with flush toilets and heated water
Non-powered campsites
Braai facilities

http://www.matjiesvlei.co.za/accom.php

name: Oewerzicht Farm Cottages and Camping
description:
25 Grass campsites with shade from surrounding reeds
All vehicle access
Power points
Modern Ablutions with hot water
Food prep/Sculler area in camp
Fresh water in camp
Braai facilities (bring your own grid)
Dog friendly

name: Mtentu Wild Camp
description:
Great spot right by a small cove and beach. Fireplace built by fisheries but not maintained. Nicely secluded. A few locals around offering help and to sell fresh fish. All friendly. 

Great spot. Can be quite muddy and a bit sketchy to get out if there have been rains.

name: Kamp Uitsig Vanderkloof
description:
Privately owned camp site for 3 camp sites next to owners home. Offering views of the lake, men and female showers and toilet, wash up area in commin area. 
Braai, water, electricity per camp site. Use of swimming pool. Safe, behind gate, quiet little traffuc area above town. Succulent nursery and garden and for sale. Owners tel nos. 0662165276 Ronell. Fishing and boating on the damn

name: The Maker’s Brew
description: Stunning craft brewery that also does out of this world pizza and coffee. Run by the brewer Ryno and his wife Helen. Helen makes beautiful ceramics and this place is well worth a visit

name: Club Amigos
description: Grassed camping sites and chalets on bank of Rietspruit dam

name: Bruintjieskraal campsites
description: Along the Gamtoos river there are campsites with great facilities. Some are private, most have warm water showers and private toilets and a covered kitchen area with sink and counters. Perfect quality camping with wind breaks and fire places. Sites are R400 per night for up to 4 people. Fire wood is available for R40 a bag so cheaper to bring. Contact Jacqui for bookings and enquiries. (084) 515-0993

name: River Goose Campsite
description:
•  20 Campsites on the grass
•  Most have shade and wheelchair access
•  Shared ablution blocks with flush toilets, showers and hot water
•  Wood and braai facilities
•  No electricity
•  Small playpark for kids
•  One wooden cabin with a double bed and sleeper couch, small stoep and shared ablution

name: Rivierplaas Camping
description:
•  37 Campsites on the lawn
•  All vehicle access
•  Communal ablutions with hot-water showers
•  No electricity
•  Fresh water in camp
•  Dog friendly
•  Braai facilities
•  Small shop stocking select basics (ice, wood, cold drinks and mosquito repellent)

name: Slanghoek Mountain Resort
description:
•  15 Grassed campsites with a stream running through them, situated between the vineyards
•  Tents are pitched beside a peaceful stream and surrounded by green grass with plenty of space for children to play
•  Each site has its own private washing facilities and hot-water showers
•  Power points are available, and electricity is included in the rates
•  Braai facilities

name: Suikerbossie Guest Farm
description:
16 Riverside campsites
All vehicle access
Shaded gazebo or small portch
3 Glamping sites
Power outlets at select camps
Solar panels at Waterfall, electricity at Ghoeboontjie and Alison's Cabin)
Food pre/sculler area in camp
Fresh water at campsites
Communal ablutions with hot water showers; private ablutions at Waterfall at Ottercamp
Communal fridge and freezer facilities
Braai facilities

name: Trout Haven Campsite
description:
11 Campsites each accommodating 15 or 20 people
Private ablution facilities with hot water at each site
Portable braai at each site with two bags of free wood on weekends 
Wood can be purchased from the kiosk during the week
Selected sites have electricity
Kiosk sells various supplies such as firewood, ice, coffee, snacks and fresh farm bread
Bistro (open Monday-Saturday, 10:00-23:59)

name: Tweede Tol
description:
Situated in the Du Toitskloof Mountains, close to Bainskloof Pass, at the spot where the original tollgate was built in 1851
All vehicle access
Food prep/sculler area in camp
Communal washing and hot-water showers
Fresh water at campsites
Powered campsites
Shaded campsites
Each campsite has its own braai (bring own grid)
Firewood can be purchased at the gate
No power points
Campers have exclusive use of the Wolwekloor River swimming holes

name: Vensterklip Holiday Resort
description:
6 Private sites with private ablutions, kitchen and a grass area
11 Overland sites with sharing ablutions (perfect for those with caravans or trailer tents)
5 Vleiland sites for campervans with sharing ablutions
Each site has a braai area, lighting, electrical plug points and washing facilities

name: 97km outside Bloemfontein
description:
On a farmers land. Stopped and asked the farmer (whose house in 300m from where I camped). 
Farmer was happy to allow me to wild camp next to the fence. 

Incredibly quiet and the sounds of the birds woke me gently. In the next camp was a horse that came to visit me and the landscape is arid and beautiful.

Wild camp site is nestled against a hill so protection from any wind.

Excellent place for the evening.

I gave a few slabs of chocolate as thanks for the spot. BE SURE TO ASK PERMISSION.

name: Kakhulu Karoo Nature Reserve
description:
Off-the-grid tented camping sites
Bare-naked dirt for a Bear Grylls Experience
Campsites have access to running water
Lavatory facilities
No showers or bathrooms

name: Nature's Valley Rest Camp
description:
SanPark-operated campsite
Communal ablution facilities
Laundry facilities
No electricity in the campsite but the two-bed forest huts have electricity and ablutions with heated water
A shop, restaurant and pub are located in the nearby village
Braai facilities

name: Mbumbulu Bush Camp
description:
4-12 Sleeper camping sites available
Bushcamp
Campsites vary in sizes and gets allocated according to your requirements
Grass
There is a braai - bring own wood
Generator at camp that runs from 07:00-11:00 and then again 19:00-23:00
Bring own extention
Charcoal and ice for sale

name: Franschhoek cycles
description: Perfect help from these guys, very recommendable!! They did a great job!

name: 22km from Oudtshoorn
description:
Epic views of the local countryside and farms. 

Situated on a hill next to the abandoned ‘Zebra’ Train Station. I actually parked on the train station platform.

Nice and sheltered from the wind, only one local house on the road and they were super friendly.

Local farmer came to check on me at around 5ish, he has actually purchased the abandoned train station and has no problem with wild camping as long as people are respectful and clean up anything left behind.

Quiet, sound of lambs in the background early morning and the occasional bird call to wake you up in the morning.

name: Kogelberg Nature Reserve
description: Get your permit here for hiking various tracks. The Palmier River Walk leads you along the river to a sandy beach for nice bath to cool down. They offer also beautiful cottages for overnight!! You need to book in advance.

name: Horseshoe Game Reserve
description: Game reserve on 575 ha land that actually let us self drive and stop and walk where ever we wanted. Tented camps with tents on decks  or on ground level could also be booked . Tented camps had communal hot water geysers and communal kitchens. There were 2 rustic stand alone campsites  . Some shaded some not. Camp sites were quiet and in nature, far from everything. The one camp site had a donkey . All camp sites did have a tap and a long drop. So you need to be self sufficient or make use of the kitchen at the main camp . Campers could go and shower at communal ablutions at the main camp at the entrance gate. Swimming pool at main house was open for everyone. Light meals could be pre-ordered on some days.

name: Kameel Rust en Vrede
description: Beautiful camp spot and bnb. Hosts are incredibly kind. R250 for 2 people camping. Breakfast and dinner can be provided. Also a range of accommodation, campervans and wooden lodges. Highly recommended.

name: Sandgat camp site
description:
Sandgat is near Van der  Kloof dam on the banks of the Orange river outside Petrusville. It has very nice grass sites with large trees lots of shade, braai and clean ablutions. Very nice well maintained level grass sites. 
Pet friendly.

Camping is R200 per night R300 for family

name: Kleinmond
description: Kleinmond beach parking, parked here for two nights. Very friendly neighborhood. Shower, toilets available. 4G C Cell reception.

name: Nguni
description: This is our friend’s small holding. He graciously offered us a spot for our big rig. We have an Iveco daily 4x4. Please call Andre on: + 27 828513728 for enquiries. Please call or text beforehand. Best accessible with 4x4. There are many small tracks leading to the coordinates, it is better if he gives you directions over the phone. Please note that really big rigs might not be able to access it. He has a mechanical workshop for repairs. The ground is level. Cellphone reception is good. Solar electricity available and running water (cold)

name: MacFee
description: super Nice restaurant from breakfast to dinner on awesome location at market square. Perfect place to take kids. good prices and European style entourage.

name: Doonside beach
description: Between Amanzitoti and Winkelspruit is Doonside beach. And open field to wildcamp or hide away in the bush to be protected from the wind. No facilities.

name: Skurweberg camping
description: Beautiful location - warm pulley system shower.

name: Vasco da Gama Memorial
description: A 5th centenary marble memorial of the birth of explorer Vasco da Gama presented to South Africa by Portugal and erected on the same day he arrived here after sailing from Cape Verde opening up the west to the east in 1497.

name: Stellenbosch Auto
description: Very reliable mechanic for 4x4s. Not for very big trucks   Nick also has good contacts for finding oils etc.

name: Minwater
description: Good clean private campsite. Individual ablutions, hot water donkey / kettle. Very friendly owner, very knowledgeable about nature, insects, plants, animals. 240 R for 2 persons and vehicle. Very good firewood included.

name: Blue Horizon
description:
Newly established, small camping area. Can take about 6 large tents/caravans. Good for overnight stop. Nice ablutions, grass, pool, power, water. 
Owners extremely nice, still in the process of setting up all facilities, but already quite good.

name: Wild Camp - (Abandoned) Pomene View “lodge”
description: This place comes up in google maps as Pomene View Lodge. We did not double check the information and drove here. It is now an abandoned lodge with beautiful views of the estuary and the ocean. We decided to wild camp here. There seems to still be water here which the local people would come and collect. We saw maybe 2 or 3 people. No one bothered us. A friendly gentleman came to greet us and showed us where the water was (near the old generator) and we think he explained that other people will also be arriving the next day. We had enough water in our tanks and did not need to use the water so I can’t comment on the quality. We had a great night here, great views, some shade, not sure if really big overlanders will be able to make the drive to the spot. We have an Iveco daily 4x4 and we were ok in terms of width but parts of the path was narrow.

name: Tsitsikamma Gardens
description:
Very nice and cozy restaurant/cafe. They serve breakfast for reasonable prices the whole day, lunch and burgers, also sell homemade pies, jam, honey. Really friendly owner. Real breakfast recommendation! Opens up at 07.30h in the morning. 
They have accomodation as well. 

https://tsitsikammaselfcatering.com/menu.html

name: Lah di dah - Coffeeshop
description: Little, cozy and stylish coffee shop. Serving lunch, breakfast and dinner. Also some crafts from the region. Relaxing backyard with a little pond. Pet friendly. Really good free wifi.

name: The little unknown
description:
We found this hidden gem in the middle of the garden route and the good thing is there are no other tourist! It's tucked away in a beautiful corner of the forrest, in between Plettenbergbay and Knysna. You have your own cottage, that's build in the old stables, with two double bedrooms and ensuite bathrooms. There is a big kitchen with all the equipment you need. You can chill on the terrace with a long table and a lounge area overlooking the dam and the mountains in the background. There is a fire place and a braai area. Very friendly owners Richard and Claire, who are happy to tell you about nice hikes in the forrest. We loved this place and can really recommend it if you like to treat yourself after a long time of camping!

You can contact: +27 (0)66 250 3418(WhatsApp) or enquiries@dav1es.co.za

name: Mouton's Motors
description: Erik and his team repair and service any vehicle type. Reliable and efficient. Highly recommend.

name: Kuzilonde Bush Camp
description:
This place has around 10 sites all are spaced out and under big shady trees. It is right next to the reserve and you can walk into the reserve to the lake from the camp site.  There is electricity on the sites as well as lighting. The ablutions are flush toilets and showers with hot water from a “donkey” which is lit morning and night. The place is very peaceful. Access to the beach is by car and going through Utshwayelo Kosi bay resort which provides the permit to the beach and manages the bush camp bookings. All excursions eg turtle viewing and lake boat trip and fish trap tour can be booked from here too. 
Large rigs will have a problem to park here. Access is with a 4x4 due to sand and high clearance needed.  Not difficult. 
Shopping is done at Manguzi, the closest town. 
We stayed a week and there is still work to be done on the camp to get the value for the price paid. ( currently overpriced).

name: Nelspruit R40 Spares
description: The workshop is a warehouse type building located at 1 Loco Road Nelspruit with a sign board out front ‘Land Cruiser Spares’ Parking is off the road in front of the building.

name: sewejaarskop
description: nice view of beach and braai area with no facilities

name: Die plaaskind padstal
description: Nice place for a break. You can sit outside under the big tree or in the sun and they have coffee and some nice cakes! Hippie place!

name: Skurweberg Bush Camp
description: Rustic Campsites with character and friendly host. WiFi and electricity available at one site. Can supply wood. A perfectly safe, quiet stopover away from crowds.

name: Medi Cross Westering
description: Dr. Erasmus Morne, is a great dentist! We highly recommend him, he did a brilliant job, fitted a Crown within 26 hours.

name: The Bushbabies Elite Lodge
description: Beautiful Comfortable Lodge situated in private game estate (Hoedspruit). Great upmarket self cater facilities. Luxury Queen Suites with lovely on suite bathrooms. Sparkling pool with sundeck overlooking small drinking pond frequented by game. Recommended to call owners prior to arrival. Call +27 828825647  or +27 835912403

name: Kouga Wilderness
description:
Remote campsite along a beautiful loop you can drive in the area of Joubertina. The main campsite is in a valley with spots under big oak trees. There is also a private bush camp in a gorge, spot looks really nice but since it was occupied we couldn't stay there, better to make a reservation in advance. 
There are several things to do like hiking, 4x4 tracks, abseiling.
There is a natural swimmingpool and power at the main campsite. Ablutions are a bit rustic but clean.
At the main campsite there is a more private campsite, called Side Wing.
Paid R120pppn.

name: Fairy Knowe Backpackers
description: Backpackers and lodge with chilled vibes, surfer dudes (who can’t surf at the moment due to the lockdown rules), camping on open grass or hidden in the forest for small tents. Only one nice shaded spot for a car with electricity point but that's close to the bar/restaurant. R140 pppn.

name: Hackelwood Hill Country House
description:
Very nice hotel, it's an old colonial house with beautiful rooms. Stayed here for R1.089 with the two of us including breakfast, price is from Booking.com.
Just arrived very last minute after our car was not finished yet.

name: Tsitsikamma
description: Close to the gate from the Tsitsikamma National park. Space around the car and hidden enough. 4G C Cell reception.

name: Andrews Auto Mechanical
description: quick and cheap repair of my ledder. Friendly guy

name: View Point
description: I had a super quiet evening and night here. Well hidden from the road and a spectacular view.

name: Pinnacle Rock
description: Nice viewpoints. Spectacular view and 2 Waterfalls. 20R pp

name: Green View
description: Really quiet spot next to a forest with a stunning view

name: Lapa on Bakkes Farm
description: Awesome place up a hill on Bakkes Farm. Please ask at the farm for camping. There’s a small Lapa with braai. Beautiful views over the valley and the dunes, really epic. Bring your own wood and water, no ablutions, no electricity.

name: Museum of Man
description: 30 Rand, interesting history about the bushmen and their life in this cave

name: Maruleng Motor Spares
description: They have almost everything for Landrover and other cars

name: Near road
description: Hidden off the road camp site, great for lunch or a wild camp, no facilities at all, no braai place

name: Blyde River Dam
description: Beautiful nature park for 35 Rand pp. They offer interesting boat trips at the dam for 250 Rand pp and several scenic hikes. We saw some hippos in the water on the boat trip and got a lot of interesting information on the wildlife and canyon by the guide

name: Wildcamp close to Phabeni Gate
description: I had a quite night here. No people. It‘s close to the river, so be aware of the hippos and crocs. I just stayed here overnight. Perfect if you want to visit the Kruger Park

name: Karatara waterfall
description: Park here and walk down the trail to the waterfall and big swimming hole, beautiful rocks to climb over and explore the river a bit!

name: Near forest
description: Well hidden from the road surrounded by forests with a great view over a field and of the mountains. Hard to reach, so absolutely no people around. 4x4 required. I even needed gear reduction and diff lock due to heavy rainfall in the last days

name: Bridal Veil Falls
description: 15R pp. Better wear proper shoes, really slippery after rainfall.

name: Arch Rock
description:
Beautiful semi shaded sites with electricity and running water. Clean ablution facilities serviced daily.  
- Very close to the sea. The beach is wonderful there. 
- Friendly staff.
- We paid 420R/night for one car and rooftop tent, 2 adults and 2 kids.

name: The Green Shed
description: Great coffee Roastery with a really good artisan sandwich place in the garden. Good for a quick bite that's not your standard pub grub.

name: Seeberg View Point
description: Nice spot for some panoramic views of the West Coast National Park and Langebaan lagoon. Information Centre on the rock and bench by the beacon for views south.

name: Hilltop Camp
description:
Perfectly situated in the Hluhluwe-Imfolozi-Park. Unfortunately they do not offer camping in the park, but you should go there. The park is beautiful! The cheapest way to stay is at one of the selfcatering rondavells (price incl. breakfast). Every rondavel has its own braai and sitting place outside. Inside it is fully equipped with fridge, plates, cutlery etc.
We highly recommend doing the guided game drives (R360 pp) and the morning walk (R300 pp). The staff is very motivated and we had good sightings. For overlanders like ourselves it was a great alternative for camping once in a while.
http://www.kznwildlife.com/Hilltop.html

name: Bella da Karoo
description: A really quaint spot to stop for a meal they produce great home made South African meals... their ginger beer is great.

name: Cullinan Guest House & Camping Site
description: Nice campsite with clean ablution with donkey shower, not far from botswana border. 120R pppn for camping. Bring your own wood for braai.

name: Hondeklip Bay beach
description: Beautiful spot south of the braai areas near the ship wreck. Very sandy so deflate your tyres!! Sunset over the sea was magnificent. No facilities whatsoever. If you come here do not leave a mess!!

name: Aloes Meat
description:
Great Shop, which sells a lot of different meats, e.g Kudu, Bushpig, Ostrich, Vernison... They also have honey, selfmade sauces, biscuits, sausage pies and more. 
Nice place to sit outside in the shade with an ice and wifi.

name: Total Truck Stop
description: Same diesel as the mainstream Total on the N7 road side, but at a discounted price. Behind the buildings. Card payments accepted.

name: Woody Cape Nature Lodge and Backpackers
description: Beautiful camp in a wonderful valley close to an amazing beach. Electricity, water, WiFi, ablutions, braai ... everything is there. Lovely! Camp is ZAR 150 per campsite. Very friendly management, showed me around. There are chalets and a backpacker dorms as well. Can really recommend this place!!!

name: Lubanzi Beach
description: Very nice spot directly at the beach close to Lubanzi Backpackers. Camping on grass, no facilities. I suggest to take the dirtroad to the backpackers, than go down over the river to the beach.

name: Coffee Shack Backpackers Lodge
description:
Very nice place directly at the beach. Offers private rondevels (ZAR 480), dorms (ZAR 190) and a small campsite for ground tents. There’s a bar, communal kitchen, hot/cold showers, toilets. They offer breakfast, lunch and dinner as well. To get from the rondevels to the main lodge you have to cross a little river by feet 😁. Very friendly people, for me a perfect place to stay and discover they area. 

 Note: coming from Mthata, be aware of scam's! let nobody help you with the traffic of a toll bridge!

name: Lismore waterhole
description: Mman made waterhole close to the road. Lots of elephants, warthogs and buffalo

name: Marion Baree waterhole
description: Man made waterhole beside the road. We saw the elephants very close.

name: Addo elephant park maingate
description: Park is open from 7am to 6pm. Elephants, elephants and more elephants 😍

name: Addo elephant park South gate
description: At the South gate you maybe have issues with a bigger campervan or truck. According to the gate manager it's not allowed to enter at this gate by park rules. At the end we managed to enter, but be aware.

name: Die Ou Lady
description: Two campsites under large shade tree, ablution and wash up area. Die Ou Lady is a guesthouse B&B and self catering and also has a coffee shop, barber and beauty salon. Play area and farmyard to keep the children entertained. Well run friendly owners and manager. Camping costs R200 per site per night.

name: Nels camp site
description: Bush campsite on the side of the river, has 3 small chalets and plenty of bush camp sites next to the mooi river.

name: Carol's rest
description: Man made waterhole. Elephants, red hartebeest, zebras

name: Hapoor Dam
description: hundreds of elephants having fun in the water of this dam, great to watch!

name: The Wild Butcher
description: Seriously high quality meat by serious meat mongers who source directly. Range includes beef and venison in a variety of cuts. Highly recommend. Opening times Mon - Fri 8am - 5pm, Sat 8am - 2pm.

name: Goudmyn
description: Well established and well maintained campsite next to the Breederivier with dedicated ablution facilities per site.

name: Alice Falls
description: Nice waterfall and easy to reach by car. Swimming on the top possible

name: Pine Creek
description: Pet friendly camp site on the Groot Brak River at Groot Brak near Mossel Bay in the Western Cape.

name: Fraser Falls Viewpoint
description: Excellent place for wild camping with a stunning view at the Fraser Falls and the canyon. Some Dassies on the rocks, no people. No Vodacom Signal. Just turn off at the main road at the signpost „Fraser Falls“.

name: Waterfall
description: not far away from Mnceba. A lovely walk along the beach to this waterfall. Some shade to rest for a while. Waterfall is not accessible

name: Cathedral Rock
description: Beautiful rock formation that looks like a cathedral. Worth the hike

name: Mfihelo Falls
description: Scenic waterfall into the sea. Can be seen great from the rock at this GPS location

name: Ouma se Huis
description: Ouma se Huis is a formal B&B with a large lawn suitable for camping. The use of the B&B's facilities are allowed. These include, power connection, toilets, kitchen & water.

name: Ruach Ridge Farm
description:
Self catering chalets nestled amongst the mountains of Schoemanskloof. Lots of chalet options, mens & womens ablutions, communal lapa entertainment area with kitchen, dining, lounge, bar, pool table, table tennis, darts, braai area, pizza oven.
Also 4x4 driving tracks, dam fishing, walking or mountain biking tracks.
Very remote, safe area, tucked away in a piece of paradise!

name: Oasis Refill
description:
Oasis Refill Water station. 
They offer to fill up your own containers with potable water. Additionally, they helped us out with an additional new container, as our old one was leaking. Very friendly service.

name: The Battery Solution
description: Battery Solution offers any kind of support with batteries and spare parts. Furthermore, they can additionally recommend further contacts for other electrical problems. They helped us out with our secondary battery, even though replacement has been a challenge due to our batteries specification. Very helpful staff.

name: Magwa Walls
description: Beautiful waterfalls and very easy to reach. Just park at this location at the picnic spot, cross the river and walk to the viewpoint

name: Chintsa West
description: Braai area and beach parking. Toilets and restaurant 200m further. 4G Cell C reception

name: Hole in the wall - parking
description:
Parking area right above the hole in the wall. Quiet during night and awesome view over the coastline. 
4G Cell C reception.

name: The Fisherman's Cottage
description: Lovely small restaurant situated in an old fisherman's cottage. Fresh fish of course but also small plates (tapas style) with fish, meat and veggie options. My ice tea was also made fresh on order. Busy with locals even on a Tuesday night. Really recommend!

name: Kambro Accomodation and Padstal
description: A few camping spots with water and electricity. Excellent ablutions. Pet friendly with rules.

name: GasSun Komatipoort
description:
Shop to fill up local South African bottles. 
Paid 67 rand for 1.8 KG top up

name: Mazeppa Bay
description: Wild camping on the wild coast Transkei. The perfect spot for off the grid camping. No facilities just a brick barbecue. Endless beaches, on one mile beach. Near Mazeppa Hotel. Fishing, surfing chillaxing spot.

name: Vaalwater Riviercamp
description:
Campsite and tented Camp. 
Nice place near the river. Electrical points and ablution

name: Petervale cottages & campsite
description:
Price January 2022: 150Zar ppn. 
Lovely guest farm with animal interaction and super walks to waterfall. Swimming in dams and waterfall. Wood fired hot tubs are a winner.  WiFi at reception but also good Cell signal. Big rigs should phone ahead as difficult to get to campsite but we parked outside a cottage.

name: La Trattoria
description: Family-owned Italian restaurant with authentic Italian dishes of excellent quality and decent pricing. A must for lovers of pizza, pasta, some meat dishes and ice cream! Feels like being in Italy for a few hours.

name: Pink Lady Restaurant
description: Great food at very reasonable prices. Located on the main road in Ceres.

name: BreedeSmal
description:
Established campsite on the confluence of the Breede and the Smalblaar rivers. Lovely grassy sites on 2 levels. Not a lot of shade but trees have been planted for the future. There is a braai boma if the wind gets too much. The bathrooms are immaculate but might be a bit busy if the site is full. We paid R130 pppn. 
Contact Lana +27726033625 for booking or info.

name: Amanzimlotzi
description:
Budget Tented Camp / Bush Camp run by Andre - a bubbly character. Some tented camps, two rondavels and some basic rooms. 

Don’t expect high standard or a fancy place - it’s backpackers Budget style. You can check out the pics also on booking.com

After having some bad experiences with campers, he actually closed down the camping section. But if you ask nicely he will most likely allow you to pitch your tent.

No signal, but working WiFi. Power points at the Braai area and the old camping kitchen. Open air shower with hot water.

0795446982 or 0725961917

The pin is taken at the turn off from the gravel road. The camp itself is about 1 km down the Road towards the river.

name: Lekke Rus
description: Small campsite in town centre with clean toilets and showers. Nothing special but for R100 pppn it's just what we needed. There's a restaurant to one side and a pub to the other. Luckily campsite is set back so you can't hear either. They weren't expecting us but the bathrooms were still spotless! Very nice owners. There's a sign on the road opposite of the number you need to call as they don't live on-site.

name: Tsitrus cafe
description: Cute cafe, open until 8pm even on Sundays. Friendly staff, delicious food with good quality ingredients. They sell alcohol but also offer corkage for 40 rand. They offer breakfast, lunch and dinner with vegetarian options. WiFi available.

name: Ethio African Restaurant & Coffee Shop
description: Ethiopian restaurant that serves freshly prepared food at super affordable prices. Vegetarian friendly. Super tasty and a welcome break from the norm.

name: Afri Camps / Klaserie Dam Caravan Park
description:
This is the „other“ Klaserie Caravan Park - not at the big Dam, privately run - but same name. It’s a bit confusing.

If you come from the Hoedspruit Road, it’s the first turn off from the gravel road. The second turn off goes to the big dam with the „other“ Klaserie Dam Caravan park (run by the municipality) 

This Klaserie Caravan park is at a small dam and is now also part of Afri Camps.

There are some Plattforms to park on with power plugs. 

Ablutions nearby. Restaurant, swimming pool and WiFi.

Camping is 150 pp

name: farmstall
description: Nice farmstall next to the road. Farmers lady sells good variety of vegetables and fruits as well as jam. And firewood. Very reasonable price

name: Bushmans river trout
description:
100 meter in front of the entrance to Giants Castle park, you find on your right hand side the signboard.
Cherice and Dean are running the trout farm and selling delicious fresh, frozen, cold smoked or hot smoked TROUT.

name: Giants castle park
description:
Right beside the road, right hand side, you'll find a nice leveled spot. Almost no traffic during the night and nobody cares about us parking here for two nights, spending the day inside the park. Still no camping possible at giants castle according to the manager...
No telephone reception at all

name: Caltex station
description: Refill gas bottle at the Agri Supermarket R85.00 for 3kg.

name: St Helena JPS grill and bar
description: Restaurant near the caravan park, (they are three close to each other) this one delighted me.

name: Springbok Lodge
description: Campground in town at the Lodge. There are 2 campgrounds. One with 12 sites and an ablution. No shade gravel sites. We didn't stay at this one. Other has 3 gravel sites with some shade overlooking a scrap yard. It has sinks for washing dishes and a braai area.  The ablution is part of the "Boomlapa" a braai area with bar etc, I assume for big groups. Only 1 shower with 2 toilets. The mosquitoes were eating us alive even in a drought. Also has rooms and cottages available.

name: Friday Island
description: Great restaurant ... (and rooms) on the beach, the mussels ... depending on availability .... are excellent.

name: Ouberg pass
description: At the summit of oubergpass next to the road. Nice flat area. Fantastic view over the Tankwa Karoo.

name: Nina's Real Food
description: An excellent restaurant, looking like a diner but serving an exceptionally wide variety of very tasty food. They focus on fresh products and offer a special menu for vegetarians and vegans. Portions are big and prices more than fair. Also, they work together with a sushi place in the same building, which can also be recommended.

name: Frikkies se gat
description: Farm stall selling small variety of vegetables and farm fresh eggs. Cool drinks and homemade jams etc also available. Coffee shop on site

name: Atlantic Auto Electrical
description:
Auto electricity specialist.For checking the rear differential lock on Land Cruiser 
Pour contrôle  du blocage de différentiel arrière  sur Land Cruiser

name: Mitsubishi-Nissan dealer Pinetown.
description:
They haven’t got a clue about Mitsubishi. 
Their core business is Nissan. Their diagnostic is very unreliable and they don’t carry any spare parts. Paid 1000 rand for useless diagnosis.

name: Magwa Tea Factory
description: A tea factory in the middle of tea plantations. You can visit and taste the tea. The tour through the factory is informal but informative! They sell Roibos tea and black tea, either in normal tea bags or in bigger packs so that you can portion it yourself. However the tea is always sold as powder, not as leafs.

name: Fountain Baths
description:
They have 7 unites that can accommodate 20 persons pricerage from R375 P/P shearing.
On the beginning of the heritage route not far from the Barberton museum. It is a heritage building and has loads of history. With free WiFi and swimming pool and well kept gardens and a fully stocked pub.

name: ACDC electric
description: Solar lights, panels and everything solar for good pricing.

name: Tuneserve  - Landrover, Toyota Specialist
description: www.tuneserve.co.za Landrover specialist with excellent service and workmanship

name: Umtamvuna Nature reserve
description:
Office with the start of several hiking trails see on the photos. Very well maintained and clearly signposted. Nice views and forest walk. We can definitely recommend.
Wildcard accepted, or 50,- pp

name: Lehr's waterfall
description: Nice waterfall. Stunning view. 25rand Pp entry.

name: Doringlaagter Resort
description:
A beautiful well-appointed campsite with water and electrical points. A number of swimming pools and a great “ beach pub “  created around a dam. There are 4x4 routes and a spot to drive a golf ball off a hilltop 200m down to a green. A great spot for family’s.an awesome addition to their offerings. portable wood-fired hot tubs that will be delivered to your camp site prior to arrival. Ronel ( the owner ) is contactable on +27823195130. 
But noisy and crowded over the weekend as camp spaces are touching each other with no privacy. Avoid weekends. Must be really nice the rest of the time.

name: Ruach Ridge Farm
description:
Camping options available on this self catering farm. Also chalet options. It is a bumpy dirt road in so not ideal for caravans or low cars, but 4x4 trailers and tents will be able to access.
Mens & womens ablutions available as well as as a communal entertainment lapa with kitchen, dining, lounge, bar, fire place, pool table, table tennis, darts, braai area, pizza oven, small outdoor splash pool.
4x4 driving tracks and fishing dam on the property, as well as many walking or mountain biking tracks.
Very remote, safe area, tucked away in the beautiful mountains of Schoemanskloof.
Can wild camp anywhere on the property if you wish to also.

name: Midway Tenahead to Tiffendell
description: Panoramic views, a little exposed in the saddle,  early April 7degrees after night fall.

name: Suki Sushi & Asian Cuisine
description: They are offering amazing sushi and also the Asian main dishes are very delicious. We will come back soon.

name: Sitrusoewer River Camp
description: Lovely riverside camp / caravan park. Accessible for all vehicles including big rigs. Neat ablutions and kitchen area. Lapa available for campers. Firewood available for sale at R30/bag. Pet friendly. Many sites on the river, some set back from the river. Canoes available to use and can swim in the river.

name: Wit Mossel Pot
description:
Restaurant and Deli Surf Shop in Elands Baai

Great seafood and amazing service. Thai seafood curry that was delicious. The seafood platters  excellent

name: Victoria Oaks guest house
description: self catering bed and breakfast located in the heart of Victoria West with secure parking

name: Charlie’s Fish and Chips Shop
description: Great fish and chips as well as fresh fish for sale

name: YellowStone Cottages
description:
While waiting for our camping truck to arrive in Durban, we are travelling with a rental car and hence depend on ‚normal‘ accommodation.
McGregor is a nice little ‚frontier‘ village with lots of things to do in the area. We decided on www.yellowstonecottages.co.za because we liked the pictures and the moderate price ... and we were not disappointed, to the contrary! We initially thought one ... maybe two nights, but stayed for three nights ... and would have loved to stay one more, if our schedule would not have demanded us to move on. Allie and Peter are ever so nice and helpful and interested to meet travelers. If we ever are in the area again, we certainly come back to McGregor and YellowStone Cottages
This place is recommended for overlanders who once in a while wish to stay in ‚normal‘ accommodation – not meant for overnighting in the camping van. There are a couple of nice restaurants in this small village

name: Pafuri border post
description: Pafuri border post Mozambique /South Africa. Easy border crossing Moz side took 10 minutes and SA 5 minutes. No bank or Money changers around.

name: Langkloof campsite
description: Two sites in the Tankwa Karoo National park. Both sites have private kitchens and bathrooms. Situated in a dry river bed, this renovated old farmhouse is managed by Sanparks.

name: shark board
description: Don't go there. What a disappointing experience. We went there with high expectations, but unfortunately they have a nice museum and everything but it is run awfully. Same story with so many places in rsa. Very bad management obviously destroyed the place

name: Nandi falls
description: Worth it, as pictures prove. Take the shorter way

name: Rea se Boskamp
description:
Remote Campsite between the red Kalahari dunes on a working farm. 
No light pollution. No traffic or other noise pollution. Brilliant night sky. 
Flushing toilet. Donkey shower. Water not drinkable. 
Contact cell no 0833131044

name: Cheeky Karoo Corner
description:
Quiet side road off the N12, Beaufort West - D Drust (aprox 20mins out of B West) 

About 1-2kms off the N12 on a super quiet and corrugated dirt road. Camped 20m off the road on a quiet corner. 

No cars passed for the entire night, just beautiful stars, clear skies but an endless wind!

name: Roadside
description:
On the verge of a very quiet dirt road between some cattle fields. Just pulled off in the side of the road and layed our mats down for the night. 

Beautiful stars and open spaces.

name: 4x4 Mega World
description:
Off-road equipment manufacturer, for the car, camping, everyday life. You'll find everything you need to travel. Very nice staff.
.....
Équipementier off-road, pour la voiture, le camping, le quotidien. Vous trouverez tout le nécessaire pour voyager. Personnel très sympa.

name: Zinkwazi Lagoon lodge
description:
Quiet camping ground with about 100 stands all separated by vegetation. Our spot was 8m x 12m and enough space for our tent car and relaxation area. There are larger sites available. Sites have electricity, but some require an extension lead to reach plug points. Ample shade and place is secure. Ablutions are good with hot and cold water. Laundry can be done with coin operated machines. There is a restaurant and bar if one doesn't want to cook. We shared the place with about 10 other campers so place was quite empty.
I could not do a star rating but would give it a 3.5 to 4 stars.

name: Lionsrock
description:
You'll find rescued lions from European Zoos and Circuses, which are spending their retirement here.
Organisation Vier Pfoten, Organisation four paws.
Tigers and leopards are also at this place. You can book different tours, have a look at www.lionsrock.org for more information.

name: Namasta Lodge Springbok
description: Camping and Chalets on the outskirts of Springbok. The actual campsite is ok. The kitchen and bathrooms are a bit tired. It is R250 a site. The big benefit is that we got to use the pool, Wifi and sit on the grass at the Springbok Hotel next door.

name: Firefly Falls
description: The same place as Rocky Road backpackers but under new management. Many of the facilities as described for Rocky. Lovely ablutions, including outdoor shower and an outdoor forest bathtub. Camping was R150pppn

name: Ngome Pine Lodge
description:
The very friendly and welcoming owners have built some cabins on their premises and are building a campsite down by the dam at the moment. They are planning to open the campsite in the (southern) summer. However, we were in need of a campsite for the night and they welcomed us with open arms and let us stay on the lawn and use one of the cabin's bathrooms.
Please call the owners on +27 72 593 6964 for any enquiries.

name: Glentana campsite
description: This is a wonderfully neat and tidy campsite close to the seafront in Glentana.The campsite is grassed throughout with 2 very tidy ablutions, the best I have ever seen. Electricity, hot water, overhead lights, as well as bins,  taps and braai areas provided. The entrance is secured, book in advance with Errol. One stand for 2 is under R300 for longer periods or pensioners. The Visgraat restaurant is walking distance and it has a shop for basic supplies.

name: The Duma Lodge
description: Lovely hotel with variety of affordable accomodation run by sweet polish couple Mariola and Mirek. They are most helpful and they go the extra mile to show you around, give you local tips and help you in every way possible. Place is pristine three star lodge with highend and budget rooms as well. Their restaurant offers local food and not processed stuff. Its about 40km to nearest Kruger park gate. Got there as two people with two bikes and stayed entire week!

name: Sleepy Hollow
description:
A very strange set up but was ok for what we needed for the night, a safe place to sleep.
People’s wooden holiday chalets, and then campsites in front of the river (from where we were the river is just bush and bamboo). Half the campsites are in front of people’s houses and the others in a row with trees blocking the houses, those are very close together, so not much privacy all in all. I saw a sign leading you to a hiking trail, so maybe that’s what people come here for. There are monkeys around so be aware.

name: Marcuskraal
description: Located on a working citrus farm, this site is attractively located and has some of the best ablutions you will find anywhere. Most but not all the sites are grass under trees (watch out for the birds bombing your tent/awning/truck roof!) and have 220V and taps, some have portable BBQs, there's a nice pool tight next to the orchards. Everything is neat and tidy although there was some building work in progress on new accommodation when we were there. Cristiaan, the son of the owner, was very friendly and although the site was heavily booked when we stayed, he managed to find a spot for us to camp. Unfortunately, due to the stands being close together, if your neighbours stay up to well after 11pm talking and laughing, you won't get to sleep till they do. They also accommodate overland truck groups from time to time so again noise may be an issue. That said, the facilities and location are great. Very nice looking modern chalet accommodation too.

name: Highway rest stop
description: We don't know for sure that the water from this tap is drinkable but it tasted and smelt fine and the tap appears to have been installed by perhaps a local farmer. It could be a life saver or overheated engine saver, so we thought that in this arid region on this long lonely road it was worth entering.

name: Old Thomas River Camp (and Historical Village)
description:
The camp site consists of a large open grass field (suspected to once have been a soccer field). Ablutions are on the side of a nearby building - clean with hot water.

It is quite a historical place with a train station, fuel station, hotel, car museum, historical information center with history of area.

name: Gwaing River Resort
description:
Neat and tidy, level grassed sites, electricity, 180 degrees sea view, drinking water taps, washing basins and washing lines. Cellphone signal available. 

You have access to the Gwaing river mouth going down a steep road. Beautiful scenery.

Was previously called Aqua Eden Camp but now managed by George Manucipality. We were pleasantly surprised.

R178 pd per site. Card facilities available. The Supervisor lives on site.

name: Noah's Cheese
description: Little cheesery 5 km off the main road. A big yellow signboard shows the way. You can do a cheese tasting for 40 rand pp or eat small meals and have drinks. The owner explains about the cheeses they make.

name: bocca di lupo
description: Good Italian restaurant for pizza and pasta. Italian owner that somehow managed to lay his hand on real mozzarella and  Parma ham. Recommended if you crave for good Italian neopoletanian pizza

name: Covid Testing airport
description: Flying out of SA requires a Covid test and at DisChem in the arrivals area you can do a quick test with 15min wait for R850.

name: Angela's Guest House
description: A cosy guesthouse with a very nice garden. The main house has 4 double bedrooms all with shower en-suite, 2 bedrooms have a single bed which can be used as family rooms. There is a cottage that sleeps 4. They also serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.

name: Kakhulukaroo
description:
Kakhulukaroo is approximately 28000 hectares that hosts a verity of wild animals which includes lions, elephant, white and black rhino and buffalo. Kakhulukaroo has lodge accommodation and also offers wild camping in the true sense which is unique as you can camp literally anywhere at Kakhulukaroo which is divided up into two areas with lions kept in a separate location enabling campers to camp safely should you not wish to camp amongst the lions. No facilities are offer should you wild camp. There are however, 4 hides that has water and hot shower facilities that you may camp next to should this be a requirement. Hosts Jake and Charmaine go out of their way to ensure you have a pleasant stay. Pets are allowed by prior arrangement.
Contact Charmaine +27 831252981

name: Big Fish Caravan and Camping
description:
Beautiful grassy camp spots, each one with electricity, water and a braai. Situated on the Gamtoos River between Port Elizabeth and Jeffrey's Bay in the Eastern Cape.
Clean and well maintained ablutions and sculleries.
Swimming pool and playgrounds.
Pet Friendly with no size restrictions.

name: Bush Automotive Repair
description: Did my 4x4 service here, oil change, filter change etc. Highly recommended. Owner is Claud

name: Jai yen yen - custom bush camping
description: Lovely simple farm with camping possibilities, bar, hammocks. Part of the facilities are still in construction. Just on the river, nice and beautiful place. The owner, Kyle, is a motorcycle racer and a lot of motorbikers coming here at weekends. Great atmosphere. We camped next to the river. Contact in the attached picture

name: Tierkloovdam
description:
Big dam, just 500m from the wild camping site.
Climb to the top to see the beautiful pool

name: Quaggaskloof Camp
description: he grassy campsites are on the bank of the dam, with sand beaches in the summer ocasionaly. Booking is essential.. The wind at times comes up during the afternoon.  Clean place and friendly people. can contact on the website or by phone, phoning first is always good.

name: Rocky outcrop
description:
Flat rocky area next to rock outcrop. 20m From gravel Road very little traffic. Great view of Tankwa karoo. Patchy Vodacom reception. 
Right at end of pass on right if coming from Die Dorp Op Die Berg. Pass starts going downwards after the outcrop.

name: Wind sheltered wildcamp in small cove
description: Small horseshoe shaped campsite. Several options depending on the wind. Small beach. Just drive down and look carefully. Fireplaces and close to the beach there is a black bucket open toilet. A lot of trash around so please pick up so and take it with you or burn it. The places would be nicer if it's even cleaner.

name: Klein Oqis Restaurant in Koingnaas
description: Great restaurant and Takeaways. Burgers and Pizza. Tel. 0733268671. Open 10 Am to 8 Pm. Monday to Saturday. Sundays 12 Pm to 14 Pm only by booking. No alcohol served bring your own.

name: Peace Corner
description:
A charming and cosy little place to stay in Dullstroom if camping is too cold for you!

In walking (stumbling) distance from the pubs and just down the road from the dam to go fishing during the day make this an ideal location to explore the town in the peace and quiet! 

We’ve stayed here twice now (Poppy cottage in the photos) and the wood burners in the house and the thoughtful touches (such as board games and full DSTV) make this the perfect getaway!

Highly recommend! We thoroughly enjoyed every moment here.

name: Vossie-Nes
description:
Small camping area adjacent to a historic self-catering cottage.
Situated in a very quiet and clean town, friendly and welcoming.
The rustic hot shower and ablution facility was perfect. Very comfortable for our overnight stay. R150 for the night for 2.

name: Mantuma Camp, Mkhuze Game Reserve
description:
As the eMshopi Campground closed in 2020 and you cannot camp at Mantuma, there are various out of vehicle options available:- 
- rest huts 2-sleeper) R650/couple
- safari tents (2 or 4-sleeper)
- chalets 
- cottages (6-sleeper)

There are guided walks and drives, as well as many recently renovated hides and picnic sites around the game reserve to visit. 

If you enjoy birding, you might see some special birds here to tick off on your lifer list. 

iSimangalaliso Wetlands are extremely special and worth the visit. The camp gives you a good vantage point to travel around the rest of the park from.

name: Nyalazi Campground
description:
Rustic campground with new ablutions just outside Nyalazi Gate between Hluhluwe and Imfolozi National Park. Access is about 1 km on a rugged dirt road. There are 2 sites suitable for big rigs but the track to the upper sites is very narrow. 180 ZAR p.P. is too expensive especially compared with the nice campsites near Hluhluwe, e.g. Bushbaby Lodge (120 ZAR p.P.).
We stayed with our big rig on the upper sites, narrow but no real problem!
Nice view, good cellphone vodacom and mtn

name: Great Fish River Nature Reserve
description: This is the visitor center of Great Fish River Nature Reserve, a remote and seldom visited park. You can drive from the south to the north on a rocky and steep road (ok for cars but not for normal campers) by crossing the Great Fish River. No problem at low water level. Don´t miss Adams Kantz Viewpoint. You have a good chance to see white rhino in the park. The game drives are very narrow and not for big rigs.

name: Cordner Dairy Ocean View Campsites
description: 3 very nice farm camping 400 m from the ocean with a beautiful beach with paraffin-heated shower and flush toilets. Absolutely quiet and a very natural setting. You can walk down to the beach from the campsite. But  shrubs and trees are blocking your ocean view.

name: Struisbaai Flaat Dunes
description: Overnight parking at the end of the bumpy track to Struisbaai Flat. There are nice Sand Dunes and an endless white beach without any people. Very quiet and safe.

name: Shu Shu Hot Spring
description: This is a hot spring on an Island of the Tugela River. You have to cross the Tugela River when it is safe -  low water flow. Many people live in the area and are using the hot spring a lot and throw their rubbish everywhere. There is a lot of space for camping but we didn't stay because there were too many people.

name: Isinuka Mud Caves and Sulfur Pools
description: Strange colored spring. Locals are selling the water along the street. Nice to see the spring but we are not sure about water quality.

name: Brocklee Lakeside Camping and Chalet
description:
In our humble opinion, one of the most beautiful places one can think of: some 10 km West of Eshowe, 2.5 km from the D493 (turn left here -28.870536, 31.406942 and follow the signs) on a good dirt road thru sugar cane fields (although the road is narrow, no problem for a big rig) and then you are at this beautiful, most tranquil and large grassy spot on the shore of the pond (which is part of this working farm), in which you even can swim! Showers, toilet, kitchen, security, braai place, hiking, biking, fishing, birding, waterfall, chilling
If you feel like getting up early you may even see how they fire the sugar cane!
Cost: R 100 pp/n
While the owners live on this working farm, their house is some way away – hence do call in advance to arrange your arrival.
Name: Renée
Cell phone nr. 065 597 6380
Email lakesidekzn@gmail.com
You will not regret it!

name: Robbery
description:
Avoid the town of Stanger/KwaDukuza!. We parked our big rig around midday on the busy market square to visit the nearby Shaka museum.
Upon our return about 1h later, we found that somebody had climbed up to the roof of our driver‘s cabin (3.5m), cut the lashing straps with which we fastened a package with camping equipment and nicked it.
A teenager passing by casually said "you may find your things for sale up in the street market“. We learned later from various locals that this town is widely considered "not safe‘

name: Next to Pinnacle rock
description: Quiet parking next to the road. No traffic at night and 4G Cell C reception.

name: Mapungubwe NP main gate
description: Main gate and reception, here you need to book the Mazhou campsite (70km round trip back to park). The museum is open at R75pp

name: Padstal - Farmstall
description: Oranges, Pomelos, Mandarin, Grapefruit and many more. Different Pies and lekker cakes! There is a small restaurant where you can eat  or outside under Marula trees.

name: Rossouwpoort Camping
description:
Great mountain camp, just outside Thabazimbi. huts and camping sites.

Well manitained grounds, roofed lapa, deck with specracular views and a pool

name: Nigramoep Slowlivings guest farm
description:
This is a campsite and Guesthouse. They have cotages and campsites. Very well organised. You can camp with all the facilities or camp in the Karoo veld away from everyone. Great setup. Maruis the owner can share his wealth of knowledge about the area, plant life and nature in general. Fast Wifi if you want to do some work. There is a communal area where you can Braai or swim pool. Kitchen area also available
You can do walks and hikes, arrange prior to arrival as they are very busy during the flower season.
We paid R250 for 2 people for camping.
Check their website or Facebook page for more information

name: Soetfontein Guest Farm
description: Soetfontein Guest Farm is approximately 12km outside the town of Postmasburg on a compacted gravel road. They offer guest house accomodation as well as camping, they have 2 sites with a private ablutions and 7 level caravan platforms as well as a large communal ablution facility with hot and cold water and washup area. electricity is available on some sites but you can use an extension to get power to your site. Contact Albertus +27828084168

name: Boereplaas Holiday Resort
description: Holiday Resort offering Chalets, Tented Camp and Camping also suitable for day visitors. peaceful and in nature with wildlife surrounding the place. Bar and Restaurant on the property as well as a swimming pool

name: Ncwancuba shopping complex
description: The closest shopping to Coffee Bay and Mdumbi areas. Very well stocked and reasonably priced. Also has a bakery, bottle store and place to get gas refilled

name: Ngwancuba / eazi has
description: Gas filling behind fuel station and between wholesale shop

name: JC Marine
description: Boatbuilder but very good with fibreglass and steelwork.

name: Bierfassl
description: Typical Austrian restaurant with a nice beer garden and austrian music.

name: Zama
description:
we could not enter Cathedral Peak for a campsite and nothing nearby.
Zama offers us to stay in his garden in the village.300R for the night.
safe and quiet. Zama : 082 229 6118

name: NAGRIMOEP ( OLD COPPER MINE )
description: BEAUTIFUL OLD COPPER MINE ON GUEST FARM. Contact Marius at Nagrimoep slow living guest farm

name: Karoo Brew
description: Great place for lunch! They also sell really good coffee !

name: Near Road
description:
Very (too) close to the road. But quiet and you're ready for your next day hike. It's an old road work quarry. Flat and shielded from wind.
But your roof top tent can be seen from the pass road.
Nice view to the West. We spent one night there on our way to the coast.
during covid period and winter... thus traffic was low.
I assume it's not a good plan for summer time
3G reception

name: Kruistementvlei Farm
description: established caravan site. accommodation with cottages too. very neat and very affordable. off rhe grid so no electricity. wifi at the house if needs be. Definitely worth a visit. camping 85 pppn. cottages on their website.

name: Long Acres Cottages
description: Lovely farm just in the start of town with self catering units. Owned by overlanders Jeroen and Michéle who are very friendly and have good knowledge of the southern african countries. Nice pool to cool off when it's hot and fast internet. There is talk of vehicle storage in the future

name: Bike Tyre Warehouse West Rand
description: Bike Tyre Warehouse West Rand specialises in Motorcycle and ATV tyres, brake pads and chains and accessories

name: Uithoek private nature reserve
description: This is a beautiful camp site with stunning views, it is very well maintained and ablutions are spotless. There are lots of trees for shade and there are power points, dustbins, water, wood and braai stands on every camp site.

name: Evergreen River Guest Farm
description:
Two campsites close to the river on a grassy field. Private ablutions with own lapa/kitchen. Kitchen equiped with gasstove, dubbel sink, pots, pans etc.  Outside braai area.  WiFi (very slow) on request. No electricity (solar for lights and charging devices). Please book in advance.
Also 3 self-catering cottages that sleep 16 in total. 
The farm is located in a peacefull, tranquil and beautiful nature setting.
The owners Lynnie and Rob are very welcoming. Contact: 0145031057 or 0827841782
 (Whatsapp)

name: Pappa G’s
description: Great little kitchen run from home. Serves pizza and a verity of local favorites straight onto the sidewalk. While waiting to get your tyers replaced at TWT  you can take a stroll up the street to grab a bite!! I enjoyed the sloppy G - great value for money. 0027 74 105 5507

name: Sandrivier Guest Farm
description: Overnight parking / camping and cottages, hot shower and toilet available at camping spot, neat and clean, no electricity. Small pool. Braai facilities. R100pp. Cottages, fully equipped en suite bathroom and kitchen with hot water and solar electricity. 083 343 7271

name: El Haddai Coffee Shop and Take aways and Accommodation
description: Owner Sonja and Dries says you can hoot at the gate at anytime during the night. They will make you some food. They also have accommodation and a braai area. They also have overnight parking for overlanders. Very friendly. She doesn't always answer her phone but says you must just hoot. 082 811 6225

name: The Anchorage
description: Delicious seafood. Fresh fish and well cooked. Worth a visit. It beats all the surrounding restaurants!  TEL. 044 382-2230    11 Grey street  Knysna. South Africa

name: Ampath
description:
Covid test station.
850 rand pp. You get the result next morning at eight. Easy and fast. Not busy when we were there.

name: Dinokeng Camp and Leisure
description: Excellent facilities with hot water and outstanding bathroom facilities. Swimming pool and close to Dinokeng big five reserve. Water and electricity at every stand.

name: Vodacom shop
description: Buy your sim card here. Good parking at mall and friendly shop

name: GasSa
description: Local gas cylinder refills, gas stoves, geysers and spares/parts

name: Wild camp in Skaap River Gorge on the way to Nigramoep
description: Great Wildcamping spot next to dry river bed. It's elevated so save even when rainy season. Take turn of and drive along the river bed. Nice and flat. No cellular reception. Road is quiet.

name: Fiddlers Creek
description: Great, well run campsite with a kitchen at every site. Grass and a Braai. On the river. Marc was welcoming and accommodating. No WiFi but Vodacom and Namibian cellular network reception. We paid R120 per person per night.

name: Poffader car clinic
description: Andre is very helpful with car and tyre problems. He can do metal work and welding

name: Oryx Gas at KLK Landbou
description: Here they refill or exchange LPG gas. Gas city was out of gas so we came here.

name: FNB Bank with Forex counter
description: At this FNB you can buy USD. The only bank in Upington that we could find.

name: Gooderson Natal Spa
description: Very comfortable and well cared Hotel and Spa with 32 leveled campsites on a grassy lawn some of them shaded by trees. All sites with potable water and electricity. You can use 4 big pools with warm water from the natural hot spring. 2 pools are around 37°C, 2 are around 32°C. There is a waterpark too, also with warm water. The setting is nice and natural along Bivane River. big rocks and an otter in the pond. We paid 398 ZAR for 2 people and a truck. There are also a lot of entertainment opportunities which we did not use: Zipline, Tennis, Bike rental, Mini-Golf, Waterslides.

name: Ebenezer Dam Viewpoint
description: Great bushcamp with lots of space overlooking Ebenezer Dam. Wealthy Houses and yacht club around, quiet and save.

name: Tivane tailor
description:
Nice guy with a singer sewing machine. If you have a small thing to repair, it's a good address to go to. Added a zipper (we provided it) to a jacket for 200 mt. Very neat job!
Also sells bags and skirts and stuff for very reasonable price.
Again very impressed by the accuracy of his stitches, far above the standard we have seen on our trip.

name: just tools
description: very friendly arrange an adaptor for our europian gas cylinder

name: Frosty Peaks (Glen Lyon Farm)
description: Beautiful secluded campsite set against the mountain with amazing ablutions in an epic setting.

name: Urikaruus Wilderness Camp
description:
Luxury camp on the South African side of the Kgalagadi NP.
Has beautiful views over a water hole in the river bed.
Has braai on the deck, kitchen with gas plate and fridge freezer - powered by solar.
Lovely hot showers in the ensuite bathroom.
Bookings made easily on the Sanparks website.

name: Abrahamskraal campsite
description:
Lovely rustic campsite on sheep farm. Basic facilities and hot water.  Braaiwood supplied by Owner Johan.
Very friendly and hospitable. Highly recommended, will stay again when in the area.

name: CRS Mokopane
description: Helpfull staff for electronic problem with our fan.

name: KG Sand and Stone
description: Super Mechanic Place for all cars. The owner speaks German. You also get Diesel.

name: 5 km’s outside Beaufort West
description:
Stunning sun set. Just 300 meters off the main road. 
Perfect dip behind a large bush to wild camp for the night.
Unused gravel road between the electricity pillons, and up the hill. 
Very quiet and you can walk another 200 meters up the hill for breathtaking views of the valley and the Beaufort West dam.

name: Frontier River Resort
description:
Awesome place. Just on the SA side of the border.

Although not a campground the owners allowed me to stay in a designated camping area. Access to hot showers and toilet and friendly dogs. 

Ended up chatting and braaing with the owners for hours in the evening. Super hospitable.
