Cost for camping, R120 pppn. I have R150 as this seems fair value. 

The accommodation looks out onto the Orange River / Namib SA border river and has lots of shade for those hot days.

8 lovely chalets with own braai area. 

Contact 0277618774

www.frr.co.za

name: Cell phone reception (Vodacom)
description: After no cell phone reception, this spot has. I’m with Vodacom so not sure for other Providers...

name: Eksteenfontein Tourism Office
description:
If you haven’t prebooked / paid to stay at Tierhoek campsite, you do it here. 

R55 pppn. No conservation fees for South Africans. 
R105pppd for non South Africans.

name: Engen fuel and carwash
description: Fuel station, with carwash up to 3.5m, taller trucks outside washing possible, 250ZAR for IVECO outside only.

name: Jakkalskloof camping
description: 9 big grassed sites overlooking a river dam, solar powered ablution, swimming pool to cool off in the summer. Close to the small town of Van Wyksdorp, which has a few shops and restaurants. Very friendly owner, Mark. If your rig is too big for the campsite, but is self sufficient, he will allow you to park in another place..

name: Brakkdakkie
description: There are four self-catering cottages on either side of the owners house. All are open plan with kitchenette, shower or bath and outside BBQ area on a private patio with small splash pool. Rates are R850 for a single night and R750/night for 2 nights.

name: Opi Oewer Camping & Accommodation
description: Campsites at the river with rooms available as well. Self catering facilities at the campsite.Food & drinks available with prior arrangements.

name: Veldskoen Farmstall
description: Great place to stop for coffee, breakfast or lunch. Always selling seasonal fruit at great prices.

name: Bushwillow Creek Ranch
description:
Impeccably maintained camp site overlooking a small dam, with private plunge pool to cool off, and private ablution.
Booking is essential as there is only one camp site. Ideal for a small group. Totally private.
www.bushwillowcreek.com

name: Voetplaat Park
description: Campsite with communal washing rooms as well as private washing rooms and chalets.

name: Kwagga Foods and Take Away
description: Great little restuarant with inside and outside seating. Good for breakfast and lunches. Makes great omelettes. Good for takeaways too.

name: Roodekrans Hiking and Mountain Trails
description: Roodekrans is a off-the-grid camping site 15km North of Orichstad. It is situated halfway up the mountain and provides a beautiful setting and view. There are basic facilities available but is done in a rustic way. 10 vehicles can easily be accommodated here.

name: Satellite Groot Melkboom
description:
The groot Melkboom is part of the Namaqualand 4x4 Eco trail. This little campsite is few km upstream and nicely secluded.

For the trail you need a permit. Part 1 is from Klein Pella to Vioolsdrift- permit 500 per car.

Camping 250 per car per night.

name: Tankwa Karoo - Bloukrans Pass
description: Flat areas along the pass where you call safely pull off and camp. Stunning views of Tankwa. Very exposed.

name: Tankwa Karoo - Quarry
description: Large quarry to the side of the road - easy access and good spot for shelter from the wind

name: Raptors Ridge Lodge
description: Very nice and friendly low cost accommodation, next to Gariep dam

name: Altydwater
description:
Nice and convenient camp right on a beautiful clean river. The camp area is covered with grass, shade from trees, powerpoints and braai pits, communal lapa area with a fridge and tap.

150pppn

name: Die Blou Huis @245
description: A campsite including a Restaurant in full operation during Flower season, August/September. Camping can be arranged outside flower season by contacting the owners.  A lovely vibrant place with lots of hospitality and good vibes in the main street of Nieuwoudtville. Bed and breakfast also available.

name: Star Wors
description:
A brand new themed camping facility with professional input to make this a must see destination. The name sounds a bit wacky, but that is part of the fun. Beautiful Star Wars themed bathroom facilities, braai and heated swimming pool, private lapas, 12V and USB power.  - high quality and lovely vistas over Nieuwoudtville from between the rocks of the koppie (hill) where it is situated.
 What a unique place! But unfortunately it was fully booked. The owner offered us a "wild" campsite near his place. We could use a clean and modern shower + toilet. We paid 150 ppn, normal rate is 200 R. The friendly owner showed us his farm, very exciting. Place your booking in advance during the flower season, via Facebook or homepage. Ore: Call 079 538 6822 bookings@starwors.net

name: Mdobi Camp
description:
Small and cozy campsite on the kuNhlange lake. It has some chalets, camping spots,  a kitchen and dining area and ablutions. Hot water with donkey geyser. Self catering, wood available. 
Trevor is very helpful, and he organizes trails to the area and guided fishing, snorkeling and turtle tracking when season. I recommend the raffia palm trail, half by traditional dugout canoe and half walking to the raffia palm forest.
Bhanga Nek beach is abt 30 min by foot.
4x4 necessary.

name: Noup
description: Sea facing camping, with stone cottages also available. Clean ablution with warm showers. Hiking and 4x4 available

name: Mac Nicols Caravan Park
description:
An upmarket, yet relaxed camping and caravanning spot. 
Spacious sites, with lots of trees and shrubs to give it a sense of space and privacy.  A short walk onto Bazley's beach. 
Park has well stocked shop, heated and normal swimming pools, lots of other features. 
Special rates for pensioners. (currently R120pppn in low season) but rates, photos etc can be found on their website.

name: Battlefields Caravan Camp
description:
A wonderful campsite on a cattle farm, approximately 400 metres off the R33. Very quiet but there was only one other camper staying. 

The facilities are first class: clean, plenty of hot water with pressure, and everything works…drains, taps, lights, etc. 

Cost is reasonable at 240 for the site.

name: Bush camp
description:
Beautiful place in the bush with view on Damaraland mountains.
Very quiet

name: Namcor
description:
New station in Khorixas.
For fuel, gazoil and water.
You can pay by credit card.

name: Pauwkop Cattle & Game Ranch
description: Wild camping, overnigh accommodation available for campers (caravan/motorhome/motorcycle/rooftop/tents/4x4) travellers. The game camp are fenced 2.4m high. Farmers house are close by. Tariffs @ R200/night/stand one vehicle, wifi available at house.

name: A1Tommies service and repairs
description: Great workshop for repairs, very helpfully, specialized in Toyota but can do any make.

name: Goede Hoop Garage
description: Excellent all round in service, workmanship and quality. Impecable workshop - highly recommend! Don't work on motorbikes but are able to obtain parts (besides the vast arrary of parts for vehicles). Speak to Phillip.

name: Skov Camp
description:
Nice place, with no one to bother you.
There is a toilet, but no water.
It is in a national park, and there are biking trails in the woods.

name: Mertonhof Guest House and Camping
description: Beautiful setting in the Biedou valley. We were here during flower time. There are 10 campsites. Electricity available but need a long lead. Ablutions functional lots of hot water. Sink available for washing dishes. Firewood R30 and assorted homemade jams for sale. The price R120 pppn. Pet friendly. Barry and Marriette Lubbe very welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. 0274822845.

name: Mojo Hotel
description: huge hotel close to a big market with a lot of food stalls.

name: Van Zylsvlei B&B
description:
B&B in very cute huts. Every hut has its own bathroom. 
We stayed with our campervan here. The owner gave us the key for one of the huts and we parked in front of it. So we could use the bathroom of the hut but slept in our van. 
The owner is sooo friendly just ask him if you need something. If you want they make dinner (maybe also breakfast) for you. 
We payed 250R for one night and two people (in the constellation as described above). 
There are also two places for barbecue.

name: Manteka - Pondo Beach Camps
description: Tented Chalets (12x2 sleepers) and a great communal lounge, dining room and kitchen. The tents have beds, mattresses and chairs as well as a full en suite bathroom. Bring your own bedding, food etc. Kitchen is fully equipped with everything you could need. It is a beautiful setting between the beach and the river. Canoes are available. There are lovely walks along the beach from here. Bookings through Pondo Beach Camps. Only accessable by 4x4. No reception at the campsite, but possible at the top of the hill behind the campsite. We paid 950 pn for 2 adults and 2 kids on a family special. We got two tents for this.

name: Witzenberg guest farm
description:
Great spot to set up. Allowed to use overlanding vehicle next to a lodge to use the toilet, kitchen etc. 
lots of space and child friends with little closed farm area. Fantastic views.

name: Whipstock guest farm
description: Wild camping by the river. New camp site with several spots to stay

name: Behind a stone heap
description:
Very quiet place behind a stone heap. It‘s not visible from the road if you park behind the big heap. 
It‘s getting very dark so the stars can be seen great. 
The track to the place is a little bit trickie to see from the road. 
Only 4x4, NO big rigs.

name: Birdlife SA Wakkerstroom
description: Small campsite next to the wetland area. 4 Campsites available. Clean ablutions with hot water. A few km’s from the quaint village. This is an international birding area with peak season being Sept - March. Great spot to spend a few days.

name: OPEN-PLAN
description: Nice characteristic house. It’s basic, but everything you need is there. You can rent a private room with your own bathroom on Airbnb or contact the owner Rhonette directly (0027829234590). The living room, terrace and kitchen are shared. There is a garage to safely park our motorcycles. The waterfront and Bo-Kaap are within walking distance.

name: Groen River Accommodation and Campsite
description:
Basic camping area with rustic but clean and well equipped ablutions.
Owner friendly and helpful.
Paid R90 each per night
Good place to overnight before going into Namaqua coastal reserve. The converted tunnel serves as a communal braai/kitchen area out of the coastal wind and mist.. Very useful.

name: Klipkolk Guesthouse
description:
It‘s an B&B absolutely basic. 
You can rent a small Lodge. 
We just parked our campervan beside one of the lodges and only used the ablutions of it. Cost 140Rpppn. 
The complete areal is a little disintegrated but for one night it’s ok.

name: Brandkop Camping
description:
Quiet lovely sites among the Acasia trees. Not much shade at noon. Near the main road, but never bothered us.
Lovely bathrooms and showers powered by gas.
Good suggestion to book. Pieter is the owner and an awesome gentleman. His number is 083 633 0669.

name: Biedouw wegbreek. Biedouw area.
description: Large camping grounds in the Cederberg along the luscious green river banks where the Biedouw river, with its stunning waterfalls, flows right through the year. Well known for its unique and gigantic rock formations, ideal for bouldering, gorge jumping (up to 17m). Swimming in one of the secluded mountain pools is a must do in summer. Hiking, cycling, bird watching, mountaineering. Pure drinking water from a fountain in the mountain. 6 Self catering chalets. Rooms to rent, as well as a dormitory.

name: Rhodes Brewing Co.
description: A charming micro-micro brewery, producing three quite likable beer with such intriguing names like Blizzard, Avelanche and Blackout - truly worth a visit and a try.

name: Dwarskersbos Caravan Park
description: Caravan Park on the beach with lots of campsites. Semi grassy sites with t power, water, braai and shade. Ablutions clean with hot showers. Laundry facilities available. R277 per day for 2people.

name: Laaiplek Meganies
description: Very nice mechanic and spare parts store. Did oill change on LC. Topped up power steering fluid for free.

name: The stables
description:
Very nice place secured at night, owners are very nice ! big grassy parking in front of a big Stables which now is a market place.
Stay for free in the parking if you use the shops ...
This place is the starting point for the Sanipass tours !

name: Kole & Deeg
description: Restaurant and Coffee shop with very tasty food. Vegan and vegetarian options also. Sells roosterbrood, rusks, coffee and some pastries.

name: Mankele Campsite
description:
A well established campsite along the r539. 
Very good facilities. 
Grand for families with young children as there is a small river that is accessible to children.

name: Laaste Kamp
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Overnight camp basic R100 per night per person. Clean, Green Grass, Quite. 1 km from Western Entrance Gate to Baviaanskloof Nature Reserve. 

Lots of parking space, great large showers hot water only if sun shines mid day. Great braai pits. 

Call Clive Statoe or whatapp him to book (+27 (83) 890 7109). Cell reception only MTN. No Vodacom. 

Fire wood for sale - good dry.

name: Ruby River Resort
description: Beautifully situated on the banks of the Olifants River, 18km from Groblersdal and 14km from Loskop dam petrol station, supermarket and butchery. Chalets available and a restaurant on site, small shop with amenities, firewood and ice. Hot communal showers, camping sites have electricity points. Management and owners are hospitable and friendly, we enjoyed our stay fully.

name: River Lake camp
description: well established, on the banks of the Vaal river, excellent ablusion. More known to anglers, but enough camp sites for non anglers. Pet friendly. R 300.00 per night per stand for up to 4 persons, enough space for big rigs. Electricity at all the stands and with a braai.

name: Moon River Bush Camp
description:
Wonderful camping spots (2 for now) in the southern end of Cederberg. Unmarked turn off (they send you instructions when booking) up a winding hill leads you to a secluded and wonderfully basic camping spot. Check camp details, some have toilets and wash up basin with running water. Lovely small stream runs next to camp, and walking trail up streams leads to great swimming spots on hot days. Veronica & Adrian runs the camp and super friendly and welcoming! Give this spot a try.

Moonriverbushcamp@gmail.com

name: Lilypond
description: Nice campsite / Farm to stay. Owners warmly welcomed us. Campsite is on green grass right next to a pond view a nice view over the farmland

name: Loskop am Forever Resort
description:
A huge resort on the Loskop dam offering cottages and campsites. There are five large well maintained ablution blocks to serve the campsite. 
Lots of trees and level platforms for caravans. 
Stayed three days to catch up on laundry and other necessities. 
Highly recommend.

name: Das Grűn
description: Small little cafe with low prices. Food delicious and homemade. You can buy home baked bread on order and they also sell vegetables grown in their garden. No wifi.

name: Cafe Schatzi
description: Nice cafe beside a garden center, serving delicious coffee and smal meals.

name: Crimson Bush Lodge
description: Affordable self-catering lodge in Dinokeng with immediate access to game drive loops, sparkling pool and views into the reserve. 10 double/twin rooms (1000R/room): ask for the view, so that the room faces the fence. ”Private suites” have a covered and open patio without the view. Braai facilities, stove, fridge, pots & pans. Huge king beds. Lovely owners.

name: Outdoor Warehouse
description: The best spot in Pretoria to find camping gear: tents, mattresses, headlights, gps, cooking utensils, clothes, some recovery gear etc

name: Just Aircons Cc
description: The best aircon specialist in Pretoria. Just go there at 8AM when they open, because they’re always super busy. Excellent service.

name: Jacmar Thecnical services
description:
Owner is Jannie van Deventer works on all types of car do welding also exelent guy to do business with  0764648827 done the head gasket of my jeep cherokee with great sucses
Wonderful person

name: Warmwaterberg Spa
description: Situated above Hot Springs, with the hot water flowing from one pool to a second pool. A third cold water is adjacent to the two hot pools. The camp sites are well spaced out, with clean ablutions dotted around the property. Well worth a visit!

name: Nikive Farm Adventure Park
description: Basic campground near the adventure park. Nice place from bushveld surrounded absolution basic but ok.

name: Fuel station
description:
Old style fuel pump, open until 1pm Sunday and 5pm the rest of the week.  We arrived after closing hours but the man still sold us unleaded. They have diesel too.  
Prices are a little high.

Not sure of opening hours.... 8 or 9am...

name: The Hill Hotel and Conference Centre
description: 3 star rated accommodation available on the main road with easy access. Drive approximately 3 minutes from Thohoyandou Town. Fast WiFi and Meals provided on site

name: Outeniqua Transport Museum
description: A brilliant array and display of steam locomotives and rolling stock overlanders of antiquity on display. Enjoy a highly recommened 2.5 hour ride up and down to view the 4 Passes of the mountains overlooking George on the Power Van. ZAR180 pp adult, ZAR160 pp child, under 3 free. Booking head recommened with Nico at +27 82 490 5627

name: FJ Bande /tyres
description: tyre repairs and Gas sales in Kleinsee owner Johan Dreyer 0610642068

name: Swan Craft Panelbeaters
description:
We had a serious problem with the fitting/mounting of our outside waste water tank box (due to a badly done previous repair). The friendly and welcoming gents at Swan Craft took us on immediately and put in a lot of dedication and effort to fix our problem properly and thoroughly… and at what we considered a fair and reasonable price.
We are highly satisfied and recommend Swan Craft for probably all kinds of body work.

name: Griekwastad, Rest.
description: Very nice, cosy and friendly, restaurant with a garden in this small and pleasant town. Ideal for lunch with good local food. They also serve as a i-Info-point and seem also to offer accommodation

name: Mafikeng Nature Reserve
description:
The coordinates provided mark today‘s entrance gate; the entrance from the R49 is closed.
North West Parks Board is now operating the area as Mafikeng Nature Reserve (formerly Manyane Game Lodge).
We did not check out if the camp sites are in any way operational (ie power, water, toilets, etc). We arrived late, but were free to find a spot as we pleased. We elected to stay near Kolobe Dam (which is just a tiny water hole), out in the open… nobody to be seen.
We paid R25 pp (pensioner) + R20 for the vehicle... at this price I forgot to ask about the Wild Card…

name: Vaal Vrede Campsite
description: Nice small campsite with grass right next to the Vaal River. Lots of shade from big trees. Good clean ablutions and washing area. Only 6 stands. Place is frequented by fisherman. It's only 3km outside the town of Douglas. If you are in the area and need a campsite then this is a great option. We paid R350 per night for 2 people.

name: Car time
description:
new workshop.
we changed our wheel bearings here.
super nice and efficient, and very reasonable prices. there's a nice waiting room upstairs with coffee, snacks, free wifi and toys for the kids. 

after 2 years overlanding africa we definitely recommend this place

name: K.N.K Curries
description: Nice curries and drinks, plus sitting outside watching the quiet harbour

name: Neuberg laboratory
description: PCR testing is done here. 700,- Rand per person

name: Water Paradise resort
description:
Smallish campsite which has many day visitors for the fishing and boating. Cost 150 for site and 50 pp. 
Facilities are very average but they are for the campers only. There are other facilities for the day visitors. As we were the only campers we had it to ourselves. Campers issued a key.

name: Kleinberg Cabin
description:
Off grid, isolated wooden cabin on a pristine mountain stream.
The cabin sleeps 4
The rate is R1500 per night.

name: Map Of Africa
description: Unique land form created by the Kaaimansrivier depicting the African continent. Nice lookout and place to recollect the many African overlanding memories. No cost.

name: RDs Service Centre
description:
It’s a combined workshop of mechanic (Dewil & Duan) and electrician (Izaac Meyer) 

The mechanics are father and son and used to work for Mercedes.

They replaced my bearing and joints of the propshaft and the other guy checked some wiring. 

Reasonable priced.

0735846497 is Dewils number

name: The Whitehouse Inn
description: Pleasant camping in the heart of Sutherland. Green grass, 4 spacious sites, scullery, portable braai stands, clean modern facilities with nice resturant and bar. ZAR140 pppn, children under 10 half price.

name: Bakenskloof Campsite
description: Basic riverfront campsite with bathrooms and wood fired geyser for hot water. No electricity or drinking water. Large sites and free firewood.

name: Lephalale One Stop
description: Gasoline/Petrol & Diesel with shop, take-away restaurant, and liquor store. Lephalale the last reliable source of fuel before the Botswana border at Groblersbrug-Martin's Drift. (or Stockpoort-Parr's Halt when it reopens.)

name: Lancet Coronavirus PCR Testing Clinic
description: There's an Ampath clinic right next door, too. Lephalale is the last town where testing is available before crossing into Botswana at Groblersbrug. Next day results, but Botswana allows 72 hours from the date of testing.

name: Die PlaashUYS
description:
Nice people with a house for 8 people and if necessary more. Overlanders can camp too.
R350 pppn for a room includes a farm breakfast.

name: The Motorcycle Room
description: Nice cozy motorcycle museum with 150 different types of motorcycles. Worth a visit when you’re in Knysna.

name: Mopani Restcamp
description:
Mopani overlooks the Pioneer dam, only different bungalows, no campsite. Restaurant, bar, cafeteria, wooden deck with amazing views. The camp is particularly accessible to the disabled. 
There is a walking trail within the camp, a really nice swimming pool and a day visitors centre. 
The bungalows are old, but well maintained, shower was hot. 
The overnight Shipandani hide is nearby, you can book it at reception,  better you do it in advance. 
Nice huge Baobab tree near reception. 
Bungalow BD4  with kitchen,  1540 Rand a night, high season

name: Forest Cove
description: Great place to stay. Motorbikes can be parked behind the gate (covered). Clean rooms with private bathroom, outside area, WiFi and comfy bed. Tina is a lovely host and very easy going (+27 82 5504512). Location can also be found on Airbnb.

name: Kromdraai Camp Nature Reserve
description:
Some bungalows for self catering in the Park Songimvelo. And a place for camping, slightly uneven terrain, nearby the river, some trees. Only very basic toilets, no showers. We have been alone there, paid 250 Rand park fee and 50 for camping. But at first they asked for 150 ppn.
Unfortunately 10 km of road to the park is in a very bad condition

name: Roadside
description: a flat pull out along the side of the road.  no facilities of course.  we passed the night without any trouble.

name: Forest
description: nice place in the trees, far from the road, nice flat spot that even big rigs can turn around in.  smaller vehicles or bikes can hide behind the giant piles of logs (until they move them).

name: Mweni Community Center
description:
90 rand per person per night to camp, free secured parking while you hike to the Mweni Pass, nice clean abulutions. gas showers, very hot. 250 per person per night to stay in the rondavels.  Has a well-stocked kitchen.  It's maybe not up to the standards of the 'silver-spooners' but we enjoyed our stay.

you'll make it either way, but the road is a bit smoother to the south of the lake (meaning don't cross the banana bridge if coming from Bergville).

hiking permit is 60 rand per person per night.

we managed the loop (mweni/rockeries passes) in one very long day.  they reckon you should hike with arms or in larger groups.  we were two unarmed people.  we didn't have any troubles but we didn't feel safe to sleep in the caves. there is 5km of road on either side of the loop hike.  you can shorten your day by arranging a ride.  we didn't and felt pretty insecure walking the last 5km after sunset... maybe we were just paranoid.

name: Unleaded and Diesel
description:
Unleaded and diesel.
We didn't see it in any mapping apps

name: Roc N Rope
description: climbing gear rentals, fair and good prices, you only need to pay for the days you climb, without trekking back and forth to town from the crag (in low season).  lovely family business.  they also have gear to purchase and run some accommodation in town which is 125 rad per person... the same price as camping at tranquillitos.

name: Roc n Rope Lodge
description: 125 rand per person, 250 for double rooms.  lovely place.

name: Gaz filling station
description: Here we could fill our french cylinder (with adaptaters). took 5 minutes for a very good price : 23ZAR/kg.

name: Kleyn Workshop
description:
Kleyn Workshop is the best and most efficient 4x4 and car workshop in the district.  They are a one stop workshop, with minimum overheads.  If he cannot fix the problem, he will at least give you the best consultation.

It might not be the best looking showroom, but the service brings it into balance.  They shine in all the right places.

Another plus side is that Parries will share details about your car that is worth knowing for the future.  This is the selling point.

name: Crocodile Centre St Lucia
description:
You can see different species of Crocodiles (Nile,  Long-snouted, Mississippi etc.)
Displays, Crocodile ponds, Cycad Garden, Feeding, Curio Shop 
Rand 60 pp

name: public toilets and showers
description:
next to the beach a building with free public toilets and showers, only open during daytime.
Outside also showers, open 24/7.

name: Bhejane Campsite
description: Two bush campsites, great location in the bush, hot and cold showers, washing up place, social fire pit braai, electricity available. Friendly staff with ice, wood and bread on request. Also arranged drives to view Buffalo . Highly recommend for a break from city life or just a stop over.

name: Backpackers hostel
description:
Hostel with some space in the backyard for 3 cars/small trucks for camping. 
Rooms : R450 
camping : asked first R150 pppn, but they dropped the price to 100 pppn. You can use the kitchen, toilet, shower, patio, etc. There is a tap for water in the yard, no electricity.
They washed our clothes for R100.
A lot of dogs around, so if you are afraid of the dogs, this is not your place to be. 
The hostel is next to river, with nice views and a lot of birds.

name: Monte Rosa Guesthouse
description: Monte Rosa Guesthouse is a luxury guesthouse with 6 rooms/sleeps 2 per room with en-suite bathrooms, and two self catering units sleeping 3 to 4 guests. This Guesthouse is situated in a prime spot in the Breede River valley and very popular due to the social calendar of the Western Cape

name: Honne-Pokkies
description:
New or newly renovated, Ablutions and everything very clean & fine, 10
 campspots, not far away from harbour & lighthouse. Water, powerplugs.

name: EPR 4x4 Off Road Centre
description:
Marius is running this workshop and he is doing brilliant work. Customizing anything you want to convert at your bakkie or trailer. Fix and repair. Great work! 
082 7758733

It’s in a small business compound with a gate in the front.

name: Little Addis Cafe
description: At 44 Stanley street are some nice shops, restaurants and other backpacker like things. One of them is this Ethiopian restaurant. Only a few dishes between R80 and R140.

name: Verneukpan Camping
description: Remote and solitary wild camp on Verneukpan ideal for stargazers and photographers. Access to Cambell’s Koppie situated on the farm Kareeboomdam. Note this is a wild camping site with no facilities. Please leave no trace of your visit behind. Water only available from a borehole at the farm house. Braaihout for sale on request

name: Oyster Bay Resort
description:
200 meters from beach, 44 camp sites (4 of which with private bathroom), also 4 chalets i  think.
power and water at all sites, communal kitchen, ablutions, swimming pool, no wifi but good 4G coverage, laundry service.
good security, friendly and helpful owners.
THE BEACH IS INCREDIBLE.... dunes, white sand, no one there... paradise !!!

name: old carry with nice view
description:
we stayed there 3 nights before and after going to the Kgalagadi, and saw nobody around. Looks like an old quarry with a large flat gravel area and some rocks. we asked at the nearest home and they say no problem.
you can be hidden from the road (faint noise from the road).

name: Silver streams camp site
description:
Camp site with electricity points and chalets available too. 
One ablution block.

name: Velskoendraai Farmers Market & Restaurant
description:
Family run restaurant with a nice play area for children, seating outside and some inside for the restaurant (pet friendly). They have a fairly broad menu (catering for vegetarians/vegans, too) making food for breakfast and lunch (as of Nov 2021, closing around 17:00).  The Rooibos milkshakes are definitely worth a try! 

The farmstall has loads of local wine and beer, a wide range of Rooibos products, as well as a broad array of homemade products; jams, marmalade’s, sauces, rubs, soaps, etc. We also saw some fresh produce, cheese and meat.

If you also looking for some gifts/trinkets, there are two containers outside (part of the shop) which sell some gift items (leather bags, frames, pot plant stands, etc.), and some pre-loved items (clothing and books).

name: Oasis Camp Site
description: Oasis Camp Site is part of a property with 3 guest houses. This camp site has a backdrop view of the Merweville church and koppie. The camp site is right on the dry river bed and has a braai area, fire pit, toilet, shower, washing up station and WiFi access. The camp site is also on the same street as Die Boekklub restaurant, the Merweville Mall shop and Douvoordag butchery.

name: Oranjekom viewpoint
description:
nice viewpoint to have a break, with toilets available.
benches and tables under a canopy with great views over the canyon.

name: Klippspringerlodge
description: Very nice Place. Amazing view over the valley. You can go hiking, mountainbiking, obstacle run, archery hunting and a lot of things more. Super Restaurant with Pool. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The have a well prepared archery shop with bows for rent.

name: Henbase Lodge
description: This is a very nice camping and wedding venue. excellent ablutions. well- equipped shop selling from ice to tentpegs. All camping sites paved with electricity and water. a must for a camper

name: Farm to Fork Restaurant
description: If you want to enjoy the hospitality of Tracey and the excellent cooking of her husband James (who was a chef in the White House to Barack and Michelle Obama) in a peaceful setting: this is the place!

name: Hoopoe Haven Guest House
description:
A great place to unwind in a tranquil, safe and very welcoming atmosphere!

Tracey and her team will attend to your every need and go out of their way to enjoy yourself!

Her husband James runs the Farm to Fork restaurant on the premises

name: Rocky Ridge River View
description: Very nice place at the River banks. It's an established Lodge with beautiful cabins and space for camping. Reservation prefered: Natasha +27 8182 169 10. 5 bars 4G  cellphone connection.  No wifi at sites.

name: Waschbank River Lodge
description:
We found the Waschbank River Lodge accidently. By visiting their website it was said that they will start with a camping facility close to the lodge. So we became the first visitors for camping. 
The place is awesome, with a great view over the river. Breathtaking at  sunset.
We payed 200 Rand for our Sprinter Van and 2 persons. May be that was a special price because the restrooms where not ready yet. 
Great breakfast at the lodge for 60 Rand. We didn't try the dinner in their restaurant but the place looks promising. 
This place is the best choice for camping in this area. Absolutely quiet. 5 bars 4G Cellphone connection, WiFi at the reception and in the restaurant. 
The access road starts a few meters north of the bridge, watch for the signs.

name: Lanseria Airport-Customs
description: Had Carnet stamped in and out by Customs - International Departures in under 30 minutes!

name: Seweweekspoort Akkommodasie
description:
Camping, selfcatering, venue.
It's a sheep farm with a nice campsite at a small dam with some trees, lawn, braai facilities, communual ablutions. 
Hot water from gas geyser and 2 showers with donkey.
Friendly owners. Very remote.
We paid 125 ppn
Walking trails, mountain bike and 4x4 tours.
Tel 076 276 2864

name: Roratau bush camp
description: What a gem. The campsite is tucked into a secluded piece of bushveld. Sites are level, far apart from each other and in pristine condition. The hosts, Rob and Elsie, are superb. Each campsite has a braai, waterpoint and electricity. The ablutions are great and super clean. In the evening you hear lions, hyenas and jackals. No cars or other noises. Limited cellphone reception, only messages go through. A splash pool for the heat. Game roam free on several farms and you can walk or cycle anywhere. Excellent rates apply. We will certainly come back again and again. It should be a perfect winter destination, it does get quite hot in summer. The last 6km is not tarred and a bit corrugated. If driven slowly ordinary caravans can also go there.

name: watertaps
description:
This is a public parking lot in the center of franschhoek. there are several water taps where you can take water for free. 
Also nice picnic spot with lot of shade.

name: HIPPO Boutique Hotel
description:
This is a very nice little hotel in Gardens.
Plenty Bars and Restaurant are around the corner in Kloof and Longstreet and you could walk to the most of attractions.
The rooms are very big and few have a nice balcony. The rooms to the street are a little bit noisy because of a busy restaurant below, but it was OK. No breakfast in the hotel, but you have a kettle and dishes in the room and Cafés around. There is a Park Garage for normal cars. We where lucky and could use with our roof top tent the visitor parking in front of the Garage and within the fences. Price booking.com Start by 580 per room plus 50 parking.

name: nice safe spot next to a sports club
description: its a nice flat area of green gras on the driveway of the sports club. between the gate and the road but not visible from the road. we had a quiet 2 nights here. The owner of the sportsground ( Adrian)invited us to even camp behind the gate on the sportsground terrain. we got offered a shower and a toilet and water if we wanted. checkers is around the corner with public toilets in the underground garage. lots off restaurants nearby to.

name: Elephant Waterhole
description:
Wollie and Nelmare run a small campsite (only 5 plots) and few cabins in the heart of the Dinokeng Game Reserve. The selfdrive from the main road is excellent: we even managed with our  truck. From the campsite you have excellent view on the waterhole. 

We stayed at campsite 3 with private ablution and kitchenette for R150 pppn. Small kiosk, snooker table and ping pong table on site.

Saw lots of game visiting the waterhole when we were there

name: Kleinzee Wildcamp
description: On the beach, in sand dunes. No facilities at all, stunning beach.

name: Frontier discount diesel
description: Diesel sold here at discounted price. No other services offered.

name: Klondyke Cherry Farm
description:
They offer cottages and camping. 
The campsites are between huge trees, near to the cherries.
Upper ablutions - cold water only and toilets. 
There is hot water available in the lower ablution block. But only 2 very small shower rooms.
Cellphone reception is poor around the farm. You can find good signal in the driveway in front of the office,  Wi-Fi also available there.
Cherry season starts end of November.
75 ZAR ppn
Alan 082 7385790
Janene 079 8763656
087 550 0232
For directions go to www.cherryfarm.co.za

name: Amapondo Backpackers
description:
Nice spot! Away from the people and craziness in Port St John. 

It's very basic, showers have hot water, bathrooms are kept clean. The serve a basic food menu. Bonfire area, communal areas, bar / pool table. Fantastic view!

Dorms
175pppn In Season
150pppn Off Season

Also have tent sites, glamping, individual rooms.

name: Diesel Drive discount diesel and LPG
description: Here you can buy diesel at 10% less than normal fuel stations. Also sell oils and LPG

name: Safari mall gas station/ gas cilinder refill
description: Next to gas station, at supermarket, you can have your gas bottle refilled

name: COVID test centre
description: Inside International Continental Hotel you can take PCR test and antigen test. By appointment only

name: Copperlake Breweries
description:
An actual brewery with restaurant. Nice seating outside and friendly laidback staff!

https://copperlakebreweries.co.za/

name: Langebaan Lagoon
description:
An option if you're looking for a free place with great views on the lagoon.
but note that it's just a small place next to a paved road leading to a few houses 200m further up. so not the place where you'll spend several nights, and only suitable for people who can live inside their van. not possible to cook outside or make fire. We had a quiet night, didn't see any security patrol. just friendly people running/walking in the afternoon and morning.

name: Michelle's Pass
description: Flat ground near the old railway line. Quiet and peaceful. Can just hear the cars below but very quietly. No access unless on a bicycle or foot. Beautiful setting on the mountain.

name: Vespetti
description:
Had a good meal, maybe a little overpriced. Very nice view of the ocean.
They don't have a alcohol license but you may drink your own alcohol.

name: Humpback Backpackers
description:
Lovely backpackers in Sodwana Bay, close to the village. Humpback is a great place to relax and hang out, with a beautiful garden.

Nolte, the owner is fabulous host who will help arrange dive trips.
Prices:
R250 per double room
R300 for A/C double room

name: Kudu Rest Camp
description:
Airconditioned units with ensuit bathroom and toilets available.
Self catering, or.
Restaurant with on site shef.
Rustic campsite for caravans and tents, self catering.
Contact: Henri 082 428 3175 (Whatsapp)

name: Casa Calida Guesthouse
description: Guesthouse in Upington Northern Cape South Africa

name: Signal Hill
description:
Small gravel parking lot 1,2km before the end of the Signal Hill Road. we spent 1 night there in our campervan.
a police patrol came every 1 or 2 hours, even during the night to check the surroundings. they were ok for us to stay there. don't know for people living "outside" though... (rooftent, trailer...). amazing views !

name: The Berry Guest Farm
description: A lovley place to be with a tent,  a caravan or in a cottage. Perfect for familys with Kids between 3 and 12 years. We have been here with a Motorhome. It's 150 Rand per person. Eat Berrys as much as you can, relax in the pool, use the tractor-attraction or drink a smoothie at the waterfront Restaurant. It is amazing! Have a look on their site.

name: Leisure View Caravan Park
description: Nice place on the hill with ocean view on one side. They have many lots for caravans and some walk ins for tents. Many old trees. Toilets are old but clean. 4G MTN and Vodacom available at most sites. The owners, Kathy and George are very friendly. They asked 580 ZAR and when they saw our old Sprinter Van we agreed on 400.

name: Kakhulu Karoo Nature Resere Entry Gate
description: Very nice place with wild animals. Few km after the gate on the left side there is a lodge, but at the moment no real reception. We where lucky to meet the owner and they allowed us to camp.

name: Ramsgate beach - parking
description: Quiet secluded parking area, near beach - nobody after dark - early morning surfers & fisherman pass

name: Jakkelswater
description:
This is a great place - mostly for big rigs. Small bungalows also available. Small pool, donkey boiler shower and clean ablutions. In flower season (Aug/Sept) you are in the middle of the flowers. 

Mail to: Jakkelswater@gmail.com

name: Old World Charm B&B
description:
This old house is owned by Somayya. She rents out the rooms in her previously student residence for tourists now.
The breakfast is included and very good. it's not possible to cook dinner, but ordering food is fine.
We booked through booking.com and paid ZAR767 for two adults and two children (per night).
Free coffee and tea. Small kitchen with microwave. Big social area. Good internet/WiFi. Secure parking. Cash, ETF and card payments accepted. Close to city center and other parts of Johannesburg.

+27832969801

name: Pathcare at Mediclinic (PCR-test)
description:
You can get your PCR-test here. Enter this hospital and you will see the office of Pathcare. The results will be send by email and can be printed to cross the border. They also can provide an hard copy.

ZAR750 per person

name: Kay's Caravan Park Strand
description:
For all People who forgot booking at  the other campsites near Somerset West. Take a look the photographs. Ablution are old but ok.10 min. walk to the bay.
It's a Site in front of a community for underprivileged. Ask for Kathy. We payed 290 Rand with a Motorhome, 2 adults and two children.

name: Dam
description: Beautiful view and directly at a small dam. No people, just some farm trucks after 6 in the morning passing by

name: Millers Point
description:
big flat parking with brai facilities and toilets. we spent a very quiet night there.
nice views and nice walks around
no Cell-C signal.

name: Kaleo Guest Farm
description:
campsite with private ablutions.
On a working farm.
Just outside Ceres

name: Aloe Falls
description: Beautiful lonely waterfall on Rob‘s property. Call him and he will open the fence for you (082) 577-2740

name: Ngodini Bunduz
description: This is a Newly Developed Entertainment & Tourist playground, located at Ngodini Area, Eshowe under uMhlathuze. There are various sites within Mhlathuze Bunduz, i.e. Camp Site, Picnic Site, Wedding Venue, Tree Bar, 4x4 Track, Quard Bike Track etc.

name: Ngodini Bunduz Adventure Park
description: This is a Newly Developed Entertainment & Tourist playground, located at Ngodini Area, Eshowe under uMhlathuze. There are various sites within Mhlathuze Bunduz, i.e. Camp Site, Picnic Site, Wedding Venue, Tree Bar, 4x4 Track, Quard Bike Track etc.

name: The Barn on 62
description:
Beautiful place on the route 62, with delicious food and coffee. 

Definitely worth to stop.

name: Ngodini Bunduz Camp
description: This is a wonderful but very basic place on the river Umhlathuze. You can swim and paddel in it, they offer quads biking, historical walks to caves, they have a bar, toilets and showers (only cold water). There are some things missing as a tap on site, but they are working on it. The best on this place is the nature and the owners. Father and son are very friendly, helpful, bring you warm water, firewood, do everything possible for you to make you feel comfortable.

name: Forest Falls
description: Remote Falls in the forest. Worth the jungle hike along the MacMac river from the Picknick spot opposite of Maria Shires Falls (30 R pp)

name: Maria Shires Falls
description: Opposite of the picnic spot. Comparable small but worth a refreshing

name: Sabie Falls
description: Easy accessible Waterfall in Sabie. Not super spectacular but worth a visit if you are passing by. 15 R pp

name: Daggarboer
description: Padstal. Drinks, Food, Sheepskin Slippers, various..

name: Disakloof
description: Well run, beautiful campsite with brand new ablutions. Views of the Kloof and gorgeous trees. R400 per site for two people in a camper.

name: Noup
description: Wild camping site. Ablutions available +-3km north.

name: Westcoast Tyres
description: Tires, new, all popular brands, shocks and wheel alignment

name: Karoo Daisy
description: The food at Karoo Daisy is exceptionally good ! Wide range of food including excellent pizza! The service is fast and friendly ! Great lawn for kids and a small shop with local jams, honey, coffee etc. Do not miss stopping here !

name: Ride in bikes, hire and cafe
description:
Cool mountain bike hire, with good quality choice of bike and trails for all. (possible to do a guided bike ride between vineyards or 'proper' mountain biking at the nearby trailcentre).

Excellent cafe and really friendly owner (Kevin) who couldn't have been more helpful when we realised we'd forgotten our helmet.

Showers and clean toilets in the car park, where we were allowed to spend the night in our campervan.

name: Marlow Rugby School
description: They welcomed us to stay here. We looked for a place, because the Camp in the Mount Zebra NP was fully booked and the the Cradock Spa was closed because of a water problem. The director Filippi of the school is very friendly and opend a bathroom for us. It was not really clean because of schoolholidays but its a nice and save area.

name: Gulfstream discount diesel
description:
here we found diesel 2R cheaper than other petrol station.
17,85R in december 2021.
haven't seen less than 18 since 3 months at least !
500 and 50ppm available
only diesel, no petrol.

name: The Ripple Hill
description: We stopped here for lunch - good burgers and a nice salad - everything was fresh

name: The Suurvelder
description: This is both a pub and nursery. We stopped here for New Year’s Eve. They had a spit bbq. We asked the owners if we could park our Iveco for the evening and they happily welcomed us ! We had a great time here !

name: Mooihoek Berry Barn
description: The Berry Barn is a great restaurant on Mooihoek Strawberry farm. Good food! You can also pick your own berries or buy some from the shop. It is worth a visit if you are in the area. https://www.mooihoek.com/

name: MAC Auto Mechanic
description: Friendly and competent mechanics that helped me out the second time again with my Landy. He also has one and knows the problems. Helped very spontaneously for a good price. There is a part shop 500m away (Makizi trade center on the left to Kosi Bay) that are experts in Landy stuff

name: The Historic Hogsback Inn
description: We had lunch here and the food was great ! They also have rooms and self catering units but we did not stay over. The Inn is lovely and still has all of its historic character.

name: Jay’s Laundry Service
description: You can call Jay at +27 (83) 242-9157 he will collect your laundry, wash, dry and fold it. 0-5kg for R70, thereafter R10 per kg. See photo for price list

name: SA Covid Test site
description: Here Covid Test for Southwards Travelers. Coming from Namibia, a health form is handed out at the gate of the South African customs, along with a tie. Fill out the form and go to the health office (in the brick building right next to the police). Here, another form will be issued, where a few data must be completed. With this form go to the tent where the tests are taken. After the test was evaluated, the Tie must be stamped by the health office. Now you are free for the immigration (office 1). For the test incl. waiting time, we needed a maximum of 45 minutes. No prior application necessary. We paid ZAR 150 per person.

name: St. Lucia parking lot
description: We had 3 quiet nights here. River view, a small park in front and Hippos walking along next to the car after sunset, but no people bothered us. Toilet in the Hotel next door

name: Landy Scrapyard
description: Just saw this Landy scrapyard from the main road

name: Fitpro Fitment
description: We got here a new exhaust pipe and a few little welding jobs. Christian is very friendly. The price was okay, espacilly compared to Germany.

name: VSF Global
description:
For Visa Extension: 

For information: A calendar year in South Africa starts from the date of VISA issue. From the date of issue, the tourist receives 3 months visa within the calendar year. To extend the VISA, one must either apply through VFS Global or leave the country and hope to get 3 months again on your next entry. Anything from a transit VISA for 7 days to 3 months is possible. It is determined by the person at the border crossing.
Here is the VFS OFFICE.

name: Botterkloof
description: Top of the Botterkloof pass between Clan William, Calvinia and Nieuwoudville.  Beautiful in spring time.

name: LandyMan Rick Emphangeni
description: Rick helped me crafting a new brake pipe. Very professional. +27 (82) 372-2392

name: Crystal clear stream
description: Easy access to a crystal clear stream. Great tast, we filled up our tank and drink it without filtering

name: Outeniqua Trout Lodge
description:
Very nice campground on grass. Good ablutions. Large swimming pool with fresh mountain water.
You can park under big shade trees.
150R/pp.
German owner very friendly and helpful.
Look on the signpost on the main road.

name: Poor Men‘s Game Drive
description:
Safari for free at the connection road between R72 (-33.6540089, 26.5360155) and (-33.6035004, 26.6750431).
Saw lots of Giraffes, Rhinos, Antelopes, Warthogs, Birds, Zebras

name: Gritschontour falls
description: nice waterfalls with small pools for a short dive. Don't miss the junctions, watch the track.

name: Gritschontour pools
description: Pools for cooling down during trekking to cathedral rock. Enjoy!

name: Caltex
description: Last fuel station before Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park. There's a Small supermarket and a coffee shop opposite to it.

name: MAN Truck & Bus Cape Town
description:
Clean, well-organized, helpful and efficient official MAN workshop.  
Address: 
Falcon Close, Okavango Park, 
BRACKENFELL 7560
South Africa.  
+27 21 980 2738. 
Service Manager: 
Morne Victor
Mobile +27 83 969 6577 morne.victor@za.man-mn.com.  www.mantruckandbus.co.za

name: Mud Manna
description: We had the chance to visit this house. Reminded us to the Hundertwasser buildings in europe. Must stay there if you have the chance.

name: De Krans
description:
we loved that place! 
you can test wines/Porto and have lunch at the same time. tasty food.
the tables are IN the vineyard.

name: Sunbury Bed and Breakfast
description:
Very nice place to stay in Johannesburg in a very safe neighbourhood. Christina is a very nice host and she will advise you with everything.
The place is beautiful! Its a house with rooms, and you can park very safe the car inside the property. They have also swimming pool, breakfast, braai and very good WiFi. 
A very good place to stay with very good relation-price during your days in Johannesburg!

name: Perly Beach main
description:
Parking lot for the public beach. Next houses are far away  but in sight and nobody around.  Quiet at night a bit of shade from the wind due to some bushes.
Perfect 4G with MTN, toilets are clean, shower cold.

name: UTE
description: Experienced and helpful mechanics. Repaired my land cruiser issues. Lots of 4x4 cars in the workshop

name: Jerry's Sportsbar
description: Nice Sportsbar with very good food. Try the ribs and waffles ;)

name: Topfast
description: You will find good quality tools and material here!

name: Phakamisa George Auto & Truck
description:
Brilliant service! Got the garage already recommend from other travellers and we are very happy with these guys!! Changed all our oils and got a new sealing for the power steering. They also offer 24/7 towing service!

Vernon: +27680369720
Office: +27414841721

name: Muse Fusion Food
description: Great place to spend a whole evening: fireplace, pool table, games, drinks, excellent food and veggie options, great service, music, cozy atmosphere , tables in the garden. Highly recommended

name: Rally Service Centre
description: Bruce is a very professional mechanic to repair all kind of cars! Even filled our gas bottle! Nice workshop!

name: Truck Stop
description:
huge area for Truck parking with shower and ablution (new ones almost finished) with facilities ( laundry & restaurant under construction)
small shop and fuel station!
Not far from N3 but quiet and security at night, big concrete wall around - safe place and nice manager. 50 R parking fee for 1 night

name: Sevilla Rock Art Trail
description:
PRICE JANUARY 2022: R40 PP.
Easy hiking trail with 9 caves where you can admire some impressive bushmen paintings. It's about 5km roundtrip. Permits must be bought at Travellers Rest, which is the starting point of the hike. If enjoy rock art you can also go to Gifberg Farm further north of Clamwilliam. They have several impressive paintings there which can be explored for free if you are a guest at their campsite or cottages.

name: MURATIE Wine Estate
description: Muratie is one of the oldest wine farms around Stellenbosch.  If you love the old and romantic, this is the place for you. Very personal and familiar service and excellent food with top wines in the Restaurant. The owner family is on site and you can look around freely. Nice view to the Table Mountain and beautiful sunsets.

name: BOSCHENDAL Wine Estate
description: Very nice MANOR House in Cape Dutch style. Very good food in the "Werf" restaurant with vegetables from the garden. Nice shops, beautiful garden area. Driveway also suitable for BigRig.

name: Warthog Land Rover / Toyota
description:
Very good Land Rover garage with the most friendly mechanics. Helped us out right away with replacing the turbo and starter motor. 
They moved from another place to here. 
Contact Lance or James at 083-5046301 or 074-9035584

The sign is not yet at the turn, but there is also a wood workshop.

name: B & J Motors
description: Goodnl garage for Land Rover, Toyota, Jeep. Quick and reliable service. Lots of knowledge. Also for tuning ;)

name: Eezi Awn factory
description: We visited the factory of Eezi Awn and they did some minor fixing at our rooftop tents. Very friendly people

name: ACDC Express
description: All you need of electronic /electrical parts. Even victron is here to find.

name: VERGELEGEN Wine Estate
description: Vergelegen is perhaps one of the noblest winery in the Stellenbosch area.  The extensive gardens and parks are beautiful. In addition to lots of flowers and the rose garden, there are also 300-year-old mighty camphor trees. In the two restaurants, you can eat excellently and enjoy good and cheerful service. The manor house and the other buildings have been beautifully restored and the view across the flowers to the surrounding mountains is enchanting. The estate is also easily accessible for BigRigs.

name: Battery & Tyre World
description:
They have Mitas E0-7s, Michelins, Metzelers, Dunlops motorbike tyres.
only 400 rand to change a tyre set.

name: Aankoms Farm Shop
description: Cute small farm shop with cookies, olive oil, cold drinks, sweets, biltongs, Rooibos, etc... The sympathetic owner can also make coffee and sell hot and cold drinks.

name: Panorama kamp
description: Nice private campsite near small lake under shaded pine trees with beautiful mountain views in a private valley dedicated to fruit plantation. BUT : prebooking essential. We couldn't stay because a group had booked over the weekend. Great mobile internet with Vodacom. Phone Adri in advance for bookings: 082 857 7713.

name: ATKV Drakensville
description:
Very well established campsite with very nice ablutions. First night we paid R260, following week days R180 for the 5 of us. Weekdays are cheaper than weekends.
Braai, power and water at every campsite.
They also have an cold and warm swimming pool with slide, and indoor swimming pool.
Washing machine with token 15 rand. 
Free mini golf :)
Mini market with meat, some veggies and canned food, and cold beer.
It's a big camp with also a lot of chalets, and a lot of older people. Weekend can be quite busy

name: Basson’s Auto Centre
description: Any maintenance or service to Offroad or expedition vehicles. Wiring, servicing, mechanical repairs, custom built frames and hoists.

name: Rose Garden
description: nice Cafè with delicious food and sweets

name: Wild Fox Hill
description: In a passionate pursuit of creating a feeling of home in nature, I have created eco-campsites that are designed for nature lovers to feel connected with the earth, while enjoying the comfort of raised flat grassy terraces, picnic spaces, a roofed shelter, nearby bonfire pits, rain water on hand, outside hot showers, compost loos and herb gardens to sample for evening meals. Large 3m canvas tents, mattresses and bedding can be provided at a small additional fee that is negotiable.

name: Wild Fox Hill
description: In a passionate pursuit of creating a feeling of home in nature, I have created eco-campsites that are designed for nature lovers to feel connected with the earth, while enjoying the comfort of raised flat grassy terraces, picnic spaces, a roofed shelter, nearby bonfire pits, rain water on hand, outside hot showers, compost loos and herb gardens to sample for evening meals. Large 3m canvas tents, mattresses and bedding can be provided at a small additional fee that is negotiable.

name: Natural pool
description: Beautiful natural pool for a refreshing swim in between some waterfalls.

name: Afri Eco Resorts - Wilderness
description:
Moderator Note: The description for this Place was provided by the Owner/Manager. It has not been verified by an Overlander.
.....
Afri-Eco Resorts is an eco-friendly resort in the heart of the Garden Route.
We offer 6 exclusive camping sites, each with its own private bathroom and small kitchenette. Each camping site consists of 3 levels. One level is for camping, the second level is a deck with your own wood fired hot tub, sun loungers, table and chairs, and the third level is a deck with a big firepit and BBQ/braai.
We have a big swimmingpool with slides for the whole family.
We rely on solar power, so electricity is limited. We make use of borehole water.

name: Powerflow Exhaust and mechanic
description:
They fixed a hole in my exhaust, welded a new piece in. Very quick service!
they also do turbo and intercooler conversions etc

name: Goegap nature reserve
description: Beautiful campsite fairly close to Springbok but extremely peaceful. No power at campsites but ablutions have lights are extremely good. Camped against rocky outcrops with Dassies. Own braaispot some shade by boma. Inexpensive camping only drawback, gate to reserve closes at 7

name: Melkbosstrand Rest Stop
description: Service station with farm shop / bakery, Total gas station, restaurant and Bonjour shop.  You can stay overnight here for free (ask at the gas station).

name: AVOID Mthata (BP petrol station!)
description: Extremely dangerous and crowded city. We were scammed for a lot of money at the BP petrol station. They say you have to pay tol for a bridge. That's the scam! It suppose it happens a lot...

name: Steve's Place
description: An established site with beautiful grassed stands that are level. The stands are spacious with a braai and powerpoint. The ablutions are in a terrible state of repair. There is no control over loud music. On weekends several campers make loud music, swear and misbehave. Not recommended during weekends.

name: Charlesford Farm
description:
Very nice campground just 15 km away from Knysna. The campground is out in the bush directly at a river. It belongs to the farm with a fantastic butchery. 
Big open area with around 4 camping spots, 2 very nice ablution (each with clean toilet and shower). You have to book in the butchery or better contact them in advance.
www.charlesford.co.za / phone 081 478 31 42

name: Kempton Caravans & LeisureWorld
description:
https://www.kemptoncaravans.co.za/

Kempton Caravans & Leisure World, previously known as Kempton Caravans and Campworld, in Edenvale Gauteng is an authorised caravan and trailer dealer for Stealth Caravans, Quantum Leisure Luxury Caravans, Invader and Vagabond trailers. We are centrally located on the East Rand, and a short driving distance from Midrand & Sandton. We also specialise in all major Jurgens caravans including Gypsey caravans, Sprite caravans, Sprite Tourer dirt road caravans, Jurgens Safari off road 4x4 caravans, WJ Motorhomes, Jurgens luggage trailers and Jurgens Safari off road 4x4 trailers.

name: Platform 62
description: Wine tasting and bottle selling from different wine cellars, nice choice. Also includes a Café and smal shop.

name: Millbury Guest House
description: Real nice 4 Star Guesthouse with nice garden and pool. It has 7 Guestsuites from 2-5 people. It's 1300 R for 2 people incl. Breakfast.

name: Pringle Bay SeaView
description: Another wildcamping spot in pringle bay, but with better view. You can see the sea and sunset from this spot. No problems in the evening, at night and in the morning. Vodacom 3G 2bars

name: Van’s Auto
description: Airconditioning, mechanical repairs, batteries, service. Big truck friendly. The One Stop Fix It All. 0498924261

name: knysna radiators
description: Great place that replaced our coolant tube as there was a small leak. Got it fixed within the hour for a very reasonable price. They also do radiators.

name: Aliwal North
description:
WARNING!!! DO NOT STAY HERE. 
Landy's Bed & Breakfast. 
BAD EXPERIENCE at this place. After a long motorbike ride in a really hot day, I was looking for a place to stay with Air Conditioning. Yes AC and WiFi and Hot shower. at 9pm they shut off the AC and WiFi and theirs no hot shower. Sleepless night. Voiced out my concern to the reception in the morning but she said the owner always do this. She can shut out the AC and WiFi remotely to save power. and hot shower is broken but she forgot to tell me. 
I recommend all travelers NOT to stay at this place.

name: Anna's Bed and Breakfast
description:
350 rand  for a room with 2 beds and shared bathroom. I think it's 450 rand for the room with private bathroom. Breakfast included. Toast, beacon, sausage, eggs, juice, coffee.
its basic here but clean and secure parking with secure guard.
my room was facing the mountains.
WiFi is available only near the reception.

name: Matabeng
description:
Malimd Guess House. Tato is the owner. She is very accommodating. I arrived at this place late at night after the Matabeng mountain pass ver challenging ride. It pouring rain so there's no way to pitch my tent. 250 rand for hut. Tatu will bring you a bucket of warm water. No running water here and no toilet inside the room. Pit toilet outside only. Tatu will cooked supper for 50 rand ( beef, veggies, coke and pep ) tell here to get easy on the salt.  breakfast of my choice 50 rand for 2 eggs, slice beef, pep ( mashed corn) and fanta. She will knock at your door in the morning for another bucket of warm water. The room is clean and the bed is comfy. Thick blankets are provided as it get cold here at night.
electricity only at the bar or kitchen.

name: Vroljikheit Nature Reserve
description: Nature reserve with bird hides and a couple of hiking trails, we did the 18km Rooikat trail. Braai stands and toilets are near to the entrance.  Wa also enjoyed a quiet night parking here. Almost 4G Cell C reception.

name: Klein maricopoort dam
description:
beautiful spot at beautiful place, right on the lake, grassy graund.
arrived here around 17 after crossing the border, nobody disturb me during my time here.
little bit of flies as the sun came down.
space for maybe 2 camper's

name: Du Toitskloof pass
description: Brilliant view over Paarl towards the Table mountain. We spent a windy but quiet night here. 4G Cell C reception.

name: Anglers Paradise
description:
6 caravan sites, all grassed, with electricity, water, free wifi, ablutions.
sites are suitable to 4x4 campers or offroad caravans.
Nice tidal pool
very quite, one can walk along the coast in both directions.

there is one 4x4 bush camp with donkey and toilet/water - no electricity
bush camp is R120ppn and big bag of wood at R50

one can buy wood from a farm just after turning off the tar road  from Oudebosch farm store (good big breakfast).

name: Crodinie
description:
Grassed, shady camp sites on the river. no electricity. ablution blocks with hot water. Wood R 50 per bag and Ice available. Non-potable water.
accommodation approx R 80ppn. one can fish. hire of canoes, 
no cell reception on river- cell reception on top of hill.
very steep access road to site - suitable to 4x4 campers and off-road caravans.S34.15817 E20.48228

name: Zandrivier Farm
description:
There are self-catering cottages as well as camping. You have to bring everything. Water…..
Ben will say what places you may use. Very friendly farmers. Places with stunning view.

name: Mozart Cafe
description: Great place for breakfast or lunch, fresh bread, wide variety of South African classic meals and good wifi, perfect stopover!

name: Lowveld Landy Services
description:
Landrover Specialist!
www.lowveldlandyservices.co.za
 
They fixed some small problems for us like alarm rele, breaks, change oil and filters. Labor hour was around $35 dollars. They were really helpfull and fast

name: Shipwreck museum
description: Very interesting and well laid out museum on the numerous shipwrecks of this part of the coast and history of Bredasdorp. R25 pp well worth the stopover

name: Elron motors
description: Excellent service. Also tourism information centre.

name: The Gearbox Company
description:
Landrover Specialist
Repairs, parts, gearbox
www.landyspec.co.za

name: Almega Caravan Park
description: A caravan park in a game reserve at Rust de Winter, North of Pretoria.

name: Riverrun Resort
description: A family campsite on the banks of the Vaal river near Vredefort in the the Freestate province.

name: Freedom farmers market
description: Stylish market with coffee and food. No breakfast, so come later and enjoy the nice atmosphere

name: Baobab Padstal
description: What a great find after a torturous border crossing into South Africa. We stopped for biltong and late lunch and stayed overnight under beautiful trees with access to a room for hot showers and the B&B living room for a catch up on DSTV of the news. There’s even a small a swimming pool. A really warm and friendly family business and overlanders are very welcome to stay here. There are also 11 well appointed rooms. There is a small shop for supplies and the food we had at the small restaurant was home made and delicious. All reasonably priced too. We recommend before or after the border crossing.

name: Landy World
description:
Very professional Land Rover garage. Helped us very quick 

620 R per hour

landyworldinfo@gmail.com

name: Gavin’s Trattoria
description: Great Italian with good Pizza and other food at reasonable cost. Friendly and helpful staff. Well recommend.

name: Skye Beach House
description:
Beach-front, self-catering, well priced guest house, perfect for travellers to treat yourself for some days chilling at the beach and comfy bed. Supermarkets close by

Call for the booking at +27736662845

Most friendly owners on earth. Safe parking 

it's also on airbnb

name: Elnatan Calitzdorp Fruit
description: Nice shop with local season fruits, dried fruits and snacks, local jams, nuts, nugats, etc.. the kg of prunes here was 10 rands whereas at Spar in city center it costed 16 rands.

name: Carmel Villa
description:
Lovely little B&B for a spot of luxury. Large double room with en-suite, plus delicious big breakfast. Victorian claw-footed bath and toilet in the room we had - but unusual open plan layout so no privacy from your partner! Owners very helpful and friendly. 950 rand for room and breakfast.
Space to securely park 1 bakkie, nothing larger. I believe they also have self catered chalets and there’s a pool, although we didn’t use it.
Restaurant in walking distance called Blou Nartjie - best lamb I’ve ever tasted!

name: Tankwa Karoo National Park
description:
Entrance to Tankwa Karoo National Park. Drive over cattle grid here into the park. 
Main road is loose gravel and stones, mostly good condition but some sudden holes, bumps and gullies. Road was dry when we visited.
Arid flat landscape surrounded by mountains. We saw plenty of springbok and ostrich, plus some eland.

name: TyreMart
description: Very quick and efficient, professional service. For tyre repairs and replacements. Also sell batteries.

name: Oorlogskloof NP
description:
nice place allowed to camping. inside the Oorlogskloof NP. free of charge. you just need to buy the permit in Nieuwoudtville (Goedehoop) before enter in the park. R30 pp.
nice hike trails into the park.
no phone signal

name: moot gas and kamp
description:
here I refill my LPG cylinder with my own record.
31 Rand for one kg

name: parking near church
description: nice and quiet parking in the city. a lot of Shadow with beautiful and big trees. not disturb all the night

name: The New Aukwatowa Museum (formerly Port Nolloth Museum)
description:
The museum is now at this location — A phantastic place! … and George, a former SA Navy and diamond diver, has incredible stories to tell … what a live he had!
Entry R25pp – definitely worth it!

name: Rietpan camp and hostel site
description: On a beautiful farm about 50 Km from lady grey , there is a lot of space to put up camping gear or park an Overlander , there is also a great hostel with good clean  rooms and bathrooms , the farm has a beauty river that runs through it that , the owner has happy to show me , nice place and WiFi is available R350 per person when using the hostel

name: Waterfalls With Hike
description:
Is there something to do in Ladysmith? If so I couldnt find it, but we found these beauty waterfalls.
"Sharon's Waterfall", it's on Google Maps to see photos. The road here is at the turn for Stanley's Light. The road in will require some clearance, buy 2x4 is ok. At the fork in the road go right, left takes you to a farm. Then at the big sign go right and down the hill. Park here, the hike to the falls isnt easy, but the reward is nice. Takes 20-30mins to hike over rocks and under trees. Just follow the "path" and garbage and eventually you find the falls and a little pool. Worth it! Note: potential camping spot,  but the gate might be closed when you want to leave.

name: Arbeidsloon Campsite
description: Peaceful camping in nature setting. Lots of grass, not much shade (trees are planted & growing), water, electricity, 2 small blocks of toilets & showers. If you are looking for someplace quiet this is your spot. There is also a walking trail, but was too overgrown to complete, did see 2 Bushbucks though. R300 cash or EFT, seemed a bit high for mid-season camping. Wood for purchase onsite. Check google if you want to call & reserve, 20-30sites, rezo likely not required only 2 other campers when we arrived. 3G signal, no wifi.

name: Sundowner
description: Basic hotel with self catering close to Addo. We booked on AirBnB in February mid-week with one day notice and the room for 2 was the same price as camping! Room details on their booking site, but if the rooms are empty they seem to do some last minute discounts. The first night it looked like all 8 rooms were full, 2nd night just us here. Simple, but decent place close to Addo.

name: La Rochelle
description:
On this place is a guesthouse with some charlets and a restaurant. The new owner Irene & Johan want to open also in approx 2 month officially a campsite. 
We were happy to find this place after having not found any place in this farming region (coming from the south).
We could camp in the very nice, huge, grassy foregarden of the buildings. Plenty of space!
For shower, etc they offered us one of the spotless clean charlets. 
WiFi was very good. 
We paid R 200 for 2 person in a truck.

They also offer charlets incl a breakfast for R 500 (?).

name: gewel guest house
description: nice old house, clean rooms, super friendly owner, R475/night. sentral located with safe parking

name: Clanwilliam Hotel
description: very comfortable self catering cottages. good wifi. green and quiet area. spotless bathroom with powerful shower. a/c cottage for 350ppn

name: Camp Skeurklip
description: Ablutions, water, boma. No electricity. No cellphone signal. Pet friendly.

name: salome's grapevine
description: really nice restaurant. great quiche and butternut salad. great desserts too. terrace overlooking the little lake

name: Weavers Nest Campsite
description:
Campsite belongs to Barberspan NR.  Inside the reserve, but not at the shore.
Quite run down. No water in the shower and toilet. But water taps working.
10 campsites in the veld. First two with power points (power was working)
Broken down braai pits. Some tables scattered around. 

Fortunately they just cut the grass. Otherwise it would have been totally overgrown - campsites 3 to 10 are still overgrown.

50 rand entrance fee for the reserve and 100 for camping.
Barberspan is still an Important place for waterfowls, unfortunately the facilities need an upgrade. 
Belongs to North West Parkboard. It’s not privately run.

name: Nare Bush Camp
description:
Bush Camp inside of Mafikeng NR. Unfenced Bush Camp with a big Braai place, fire place, table, bench, roof, sink inside Mafikeng Game Reserve. 
1 shower (donkey for warm water), 1 toilet . No electricity. 
You get the permit at the main gate from the reserve.
40 rand entrance per person, 10 for a car. Camping at the bush camp is 250. The normal campsite which was 150 with electricity is totally trashed and run down - officially it’s closed for renovations. No idea when or if it will be reopened …  Anyway, the bush camp is lovely.
Nata means Buffalo. There is a small watering point around 400 meter from the camp. Saw a group of buffalos there at sunset. So the name of the camp makes sense :-)) Lots of game in the park. Game drive was very rewarding. Would definitely come back.

name: Ox Wagon Lodge
description: Unique ox wagon ring setting with chalet accommodation and excellent food and friendly staff. well worth the stop

name: The Mud
description: Very nice restaurant with nice deli shop. Coffee is also really good!

name: The Hub and Spoke
description: Very nice restaurant and great coffee and sweets. Nice shop too.

name: Duiker island off grid camping
description: this is a newly established off grid camping there are designated sites to ensure people don't camp haphazardly. no rates as yet as Bernardo is still setting up and deciding where what is. however he assess' he will charge about R50 ppn. +27720855653

name: AliCellpbone repair
description: Ali is the owner and very helpful. He charges 150 rand for a sim card with 1.5 GB of internet data. Get spot with street parking.

name: Motorcycle Workshop
description:
4X4 mega world Honda and Suzuki. They repair/diagnos all motorcycle brand. The manager Peter was very helpful and hospitable.He can help find resources to get someone to pick you up if your motorcycle breakdown. He did not even charge me for diagnostic. 
They also sell 4x4 camping equipment and motorcycle accessories. They can also store your motorcycle if needed.
peter: +276543322245
Highly recommend this place if you are in Upington

name: Gateway Land Rover
description: garage and selling parts. ask for christiaan

name: Moholoholo ya Mati
description:
A campsite set in the foothills of the northern Drankensberg on the banks of the Blyde River, beneath Mariepskop. The campsite has 11 individual pitches and is part of a larger complex that includes chalets and a teagarden. Each pitch has both power and running water.
Management and staff are extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating.
Reasonable long-stay rates available.

name: Westoe Dam
description: It is situated next to a dam with no facilities. 100% wild camping. It is allowed as you will see when you enter the premises by the signage next to the road. Great fishing spot. Very cold in winter. Used by locals for fishing and fishing competitions.

name: Pathcare Covid test
description:
Antigen or PCR test, quick service.

Antigen takes 2 to 4 hours for result. They email and Whatsapp/text the result. 

Antigen 150 Rand
PCR 500 Rand

It's hard to find. It's behind the church and the end (you see radiology, it's at the right).

name: Drive Line propshaft
description: Anything with your drive train or prop shafts can be fixed and done here, same day service and reasonable prices 076-7927933

name: Mountain wild camp
description: The end of an open road that goes up into the mountains you can setup camp without being seen. You need a 4x4 to get up here if you are in a vehicle.

name: Kamp en Braai 4x4
description:
Caravan sales and 4x4 shop 
workshop offers repairs and maintenance work to overlanding vehicles.

name: Annie's BnB
description:
Very charming Retro-accommodation with BIG Rooms.
AC, kettle, fridge, microwave, TV, nice bathroom.
Outside is a beautiful pool located.
Price for single Person 850 R without and 950 R with breakfast.

name: Apachè Resort
description: Nice open area on the banks of Koster dam for fishing or shaded areas for camping. Option of chalets. Swimming pool at chalets. Single ablution facility. Camping @  ZAR 80 per site and ZAR 60 per person

name: Bivane Dam
description: 15 beautiful stands at Bivane dam. 8 of the stands are waterfront. Electricity points, braai and taps at each stand. Mostly grass except at 2 very shaded stands. There is a little shop that sells the basics. Canoes for hire @R150 for half a day. A must do if you are able. R350 for 2 on weekends and R250 during the week.

name: Fort Fordyce Nature Reserve
description:
Basic camping in a very nice nature reserve ran by Eastern Cape Parks.
The reserve direct number is 087 286 6500 or phone Eastern Cape Parks central reservations on 043 492 0881.

name: Bayside Auto Truck Clinic
description: A good place to repair your truck, we have an old Mercedes 1017 4x4 and they knew what to do.

name: Mountain View
description:
Luxury Rooms for 800 ZAR without breakfast. Kettle, fridge and bathtube. 
An outside pool with an amazing view on the surrounding mountains.  You can do beautiful hikes on them and enjoy the view down in the desert and the town. 
The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful. Loved it here.

name: Die Koperketel
description: Lovely restaurant. They serve the best burgers in town. Big portions for hungry people. Stop here and enjoy the yummy food and the ambiance of this place.

name: Car Aircon Specialist
description:
Merlin did a great job on our aircon. The pressor switch was not working.
He had a new in stock, replaced it, checked everthing in a short time and a fair price.
We can highly recommend Merlins Workshop for all aircon problems, he is really a very good specialist.
