name: Mica Hardware
description: This Mica Store refilled our 3kg Cadac Canister. Helpful staff, easy experience.

name: Namaqua Lodge
description:
Neat Guesthouse. Big and clean rooms with a fridge, kettle, filtered water and AC. 
The kind Lady from the reception asked me if I wanted a room with bathtub or shower. (As a girl on a bicycle I'm always happy with a bathtub ;) Nice In- an Outside Lounge. Fast WiFi in rooms. 
Room is 450 Rand a night. Meals are not included but there is a restaurant.
Grocery stores are near by.
Vanrhynsdorp is a very nice little town.
Love it here.

name: Rosenhof Guethouse
description:
Lovely private guesthouse. Rooms with kettle, fridge, microwave and small kitchen area. TV, AC and fan. Wifi available. 
Karen, her husband and their staff are very warm and welcoming. 
Town is in walkable distance but you can enjoy the quietness from a little bit outside here. 
Nice pool and bar area. In future they will build also abolutions for camping. 
I paid 400 Rand pppn. for a private cabine in the garden. 
This is the place to hang around in Clanwilliam. Good vibes here... 
Karens Number: +27823236037

name: Triple Lodge
description:
Nice rooms with AC and kettle. Swimming pool.
The lady made me a good price. Normal price is 450 Rand.

name: Deli Chintsa
description: Great little breakfast and lunch spot in a courtyard, its behind the other coffee shop btw. Fresh bread, nice goodies so treat yourself here!

name: Terra-Khaya Lodge and Backpackers
description: This eco lodge lives up to its name; cabins and huts built with clay and natural materials, compost toilets and extensive recycling, beautiful views of the hogs, horse riding and lounging in the communal lounge. Very cool to see what you can do with upcycling and natural materials. I came here for a 10 day Natural Building course and think its a pretty epic spot! Only one spot for a campervan or RTT which requires a 5km detour to end up at the back of the property, some level campspots so better for normal tents or get a cabin!

name: FATS (Forwarding African Transport Services) Shipping
description: Shipping agent for RORO on Eukor and Wallenius Wilhelmsen.

name: Koedoesrus Bush Camp
description: Campsites with power points. Open air ablusions with hot showers. Ice and firewood available for sale.

name: Chulamoya Chimes
description: Wind Chime Manufacturers and sales. Sensory garden and picnic spot

name: Juffroushoogte
description:
Guestfarm just a little off the R27. 
There is nothing wrong with the rooms but comparing with others accomandations its orpriced with 570 Rand a night. Breakfast is included. 
Staff is very friendly and the rooms are clean. Wifi is available. Kettle is there and you get a "coffee box" with coffee and tea. There is an outside pool and a very good restaurant and bar. 
Others than the room prices the prices for the delicious meals are quite low. And the portions are big. Definitely worth a stop here.

name: Disused quarry along R26 near Van Stadensrus
description:
Coming from Rouxville, all is fenced along the R26, no chance to go into the ‚bush‘.
This disused quarry served us well as a nightspot (the gate was open), although the Police came at 7pm to check on us, but they were very friendly and understanding that we were tiered after a long day of driving and confirmed it was ok and safe to stay here for the night.
The quarry is somewhat elevated from the R26, big rigs can be seen, smaller vehicles may go unnoticed.
The R26 was surprisingly very quiet during the night.
We had a very quiet and undisturbed night.

name: Brandkop Guest Farm.
description:
Wide, flat campground amongst Acacia trees. Clean ablutions with hot water. Braai packs & wood for sale. Friendly owner Pieter Louw, looking after our well being.

Kokerboom Forest 6km walk, MTB or drive away. Many MTB trails.

WiFi at ablutions. Fire place at each site.

Wild camping site also available.

name: Ramansdrif West
description: Permanent grass patch. No facilities. Take out what you bring in and leave only footprints. Fabulous sunsets.

name: Route 48
description:
Road house dinner & LPG gas refills, gas appliances / gas spares. Hardware. Short term parking. 
Diner 0538800113

name: Quest Bed and Breakfast
description:
Nice Guesthouse in quiet neighborhood.
Rooms 800 Rand. Nice swimming pool. 
Sharon, the owner gave me an entire apartment for this price because she was fully booked.
Very friendly and helpful.
Call 021 553 2702 for infos or bookings.

name: Vrede Diesel Electric
description:
We had a problem with 94 Toyota Hilux Surf. After calling a mechanic in Warden who came out and couldn't fix it he then towed us to these guys and we could t be happier that they did. The owners Boet and Diane were so friendly and accommodating. Boet worked on our car all day, and Diane even fed us at lunch time. as the day drew late they allowed us to stay at their beautiful home where we had a huge room, and bathroom to ourself. The next morning they served us a huge breakfast and back to the garage where the issue was fixed. For a day and a half of work they charged us R2150. And refused to take money for the food and bed for the night. 
100% recommended! 
unsure whether they would be able to help with motorcycles but worth a call to find out

name: Mozambique High Commision
description:
Mozambique high commission for visa entry.  Open 8am-12pm. 
details on their website for entry requirements. At time of posting you needed passport valid for 6months, 2x colour passport photos, hotel booking for arrival date.

name: Shintsha - the place of change
description:
Rustic bush camp at Palm Beach Port Edward - eco friendly rustic off grid experience.
Stay with Wesley and stay away from the average caravan park.

You can stay in your tent or the Shintsha Caravan.
Hot shower, compost toilet, power possible with extension cable. 
Wifi available.
Give him a buzz maybe before hand to make sure someone can open the gate. 
+27682097937

Camping is 100 pp

name: ATKV Hartenbos
description: The ATKV campsite is large with different sectors. The pitches are close to each other, but it's a nice atmosphere here. You can walk for hours by the sea, swim and best of all: super great toilets and showers and spotlessly clean. The reception is in the village, look out for ATKV Hartenbos. It's not a lonely place, not the worst either.

name: Half collar and giant kingfisher trail to waterfall
description: Really nice fully shaded hike to waterfall on boardwalk, 2 hours return. Wildcard can be used

name: Avatar views and pine tree forest camp
description:
We came here to climb and realised there’s a nice pine tree forest to camp in. Somewhat near the road but not too noisy. No one came when we were here. You can venture deeper into pine forest if you wish. 4g reception 2 bars vodacom. Nice view is at climbing spot, a bit of bush bashing until you can see the bridge and huge canyon below

Big rigs should use open area in photo. Smaller rigs can enter forest

name: Deep forest
description: Pine forest is burnt down, here’s one of the deep forest lane you can take to camp. Absolutely no one, just dense pine. High clearance needed, not for big rigs. 4g 2 bars

name: Broken bridge river camp
description: We were scouting for a campsite and found this great spot. Good for small rigs. High clearance needed. The road bridge is broken so no one will ever use this road again. The road is a bit overgrown as well. Next to river.

name: Die Kliphuis
description:
Small cottage on the river. Can sleep up to 12 people. 
Camping is available with a bathroom. 56km from closest town. No cellphone reception, WiFi is available.

name: Marloth Park Shopping Center
description: They refilled our 3kg local South African cadac gas bottle for 105 rand at the supermarket. Paid with credit card.

name: Happy Hogs
description: Pub style restaurant with burgers and lamb shank etc from R80 upwards, great food although service is slow, took 30 min to order a drink and another 30 min for food to arrive, Hogsback has a different pace...so bring a book and enjoy!

name: Mr. Winch
description: The number one winch professional in Southern Africa and specialises in Warn winches. Give the owner a call and he’ll give you good advice on what you need. Very good value for money and managed to fit into  our tight schedule for the installation. Winch has already got us out of trouble a few times.

name: KZN Customs Clearing & Forwarding Agents
description: Used these guys when we shipped our 4x4 from UK to South Africa to use in our travels around southern Africa. Came in with a carnet. Vassie was great, kept us in the loop and managed to get the car cleared with no fuss in a couple of days from landing. She had good advice on dos and don’ts of shipping into South Africa.

name: Vluytjieskraal - Noord Riverpark Caravan Park
description:
Rivercamp with about 15 Stands - lots of long(we)term parker, mostly people that are building property in Orania that set up a camp during the building process.

Power plugs (bring a blue plug), water at site. 

Small and clean ablution block. 
Portable Braai stands.

Camping fee is 280 per stand, up to 4 people.

As I am travelling on my own they gave me the pensioner rate of 200 Zar.

The entrance by car is through the big gate with the two white pillars outside of town. Walking it’s just next to the other campsite.

One needs to phone the owner Peter to open the gate. +27 (82) 897-0778

name: Destination River resort
description:
Campsite is a green gras area being part of a venue with for fubctions with swimmingpool, tons of Braai places under trees, benches etc made for day visitors 

Camper can camp next to the wedding area and use the totally run down day visitor ablutions with no toilet seats, missing shower curtains and being dirty. Half of the tiles are missing. 

Asking for a camping fee of 150 rand plus 50 rand day visitor fee.

Thank you but no - didn’t stay :-) 
Maybe some others want to use it as an overnight stop.

name: Baden Klub
description: Nice place with swimming pools. Very quiet. It is a members only area but the welcome other guests as well. We paid 380 Rand for 2 people per night. Campsites are big. The price is for max people per site.

name: Thorny bush camp
description: On the way to mountain zebra national park. Good quiet stop, very faint road noise, no disturbance. Big rigs might also fit. Some thorny bushes around but we found a spot without many. No one disturbed us and no one passed. with 4g cell reception

name: Vaal Truck Inn - discount diesel
description:
23März2022: Diesel 50ppm price R19.95 … while at every other pump the price was above R21.00
Open for every diesel vehicle … but diesel only

name: Springwell Suspension
description: The place to get your springs or springblades fixed or retention, professional large place for trucks, trailers and cars. Make sure to be early as you will wait for hours otherwise but there is free coffee and a waiting room!

name: Big trees outcrop
description: We spent a few hours looking for a good spot and found this outcrop of big trees near the town. Big rigs can fit. It’s past a cattle gate with no lock. High clearance might be nice. Lone farmer passed on the road far away but no one bothered us. Limited cell reception. Keep it clean and peaceful so maybe future overlanders can come and stay also :)

name: Maletsunyane waterfall camp
description:
If you have a 4x4, you can camp right at the viewpoint. The access is a turnoff maybe a 100 m before the visitor centre. If you don’t turn off there, they have built a small barrier so you can’t drive across.

Visitor centre is not open, but the tourism guy who charged us 100 rand pp for entry said in the future parking overnight will incur fees.

When you get down to the viewpoint area, there are 3 flattish spots, left at the dustbin or two slightly higher on the right (facing waterfall). Access to lower right is muddy, we were skidding even in our cruiser so be careful. But the plot is on a decently flat rock and more level. 

No one bothered us from 7 pm to 830 AM. Sadly, in the day, from 830 am and when we arrived in the late afternoon, a bunch persistent horse people came up trying to sell us their horse riding…and then sat around our cruiser when we politely declined. They did leave after an hour or two

3g reception

name: Plaatbos Nature Reserve
description: The start of some nice walks through the Tsitsikamma indigenous forest, you write yourself a free permit at the gate where you can park safely and enjoy some forest time! Different walks and routes clearly marked, this is where the segway tours go as well. Swimming and picnic spot along the easy 8km yellow route

name: Sand pit with trees
description:
The river place doesn’t exist anymore so we took the road up which ends at this sand pit. Nothing much to look at, but you can walk 10 steps to a view of the river. Need 4x4 and high clearance to get up the rocky road. No one disturbed us. Limited cell signal - you can walk up the hill for better signal. Some shepherds around but they leave you alone.

Not visible from road but can slightly hear it. There is a stagnant pool nearby from sand pit so there are mozzies at dusk and dawn

name: Thaba bosiu cultural centre and shoeshoe restaurant
description:
Good guided tour at 100 rand per person. Without guide is 50 rand pp. 45 minutes. Shoe shoe restaurant has great lesotho local food buffet style on wednesday.

Museum also has good english explanations if you want to read more after guided tour

name: Seven Fountains Farm
description:
Beautifully situated farm offering actual overnight accommodation for B&B guests with additional three RV sites. Located not far from the N2 and easily accessible via a well-maintained gravel road after 1.8 km. The site has: showers and toilets as well as a swimming pool. Electricity can be provided on request. Dogs are welcome. Good Wifi at the main building (restaurant). On the site there is the possibility to take a beautiful short walk. A very good breakfast and dinner is served in the restaurant on request. Especially the 3-course menu in the evening is delicious, prepared by Nandipha, an excellent cook who has also worked in luxury lodges. In addition, there is the possibility of going on day safaris in the surrounding exclusive game lodges without having to pay the expensive overnight rates there. Definitely worth a stop!!
Attention for large vehicles: the gate has a maximum width of 2.8 m. Price: 2 people incl. vehicle R 200. Please contact the very friendly and welcoming farm manager Daan before arrival: +27761751589 or info@sevenfountainfarm.co.za.

name: Super Airbrake Systems
description:
They installed my air suspension and leveling system. Specializing in trucks and expedition campers. Also do airlines and brakes. Very helpful and professional. 
Tel: 0414534113

name: Rushing creek by the road
description: Decent spot after thaba bosiu. Not as much privacy as the sand quarry place but right next to a clear creek. You are visible from the road, but as it’s a rough road, only 1 bakkie passed as night and 3 in the morning. No one disturbed us. 4 friendly locals walk by waving hi. You can’t hear the cars even in the RTT as the rushing water is loud enough. No reception. High clearance needed. You can also just drive across the creek to another flattish grass spot.

name: Afgri Petrol Station - discounted diesel
description:
Agricultural cooperations often also run petrol stations, which provide Diesel at a substantially lower price than commercial petrol stations. They sell to everyone.
At the time of our visit (March 2022) we paid R19.17\L (50ppm) … while the going rate at commercially run petrol station was above R21.00

name: Tsehlanyane national park
description: 50 per person 20 p car. Tbh the waterfall hike from river lodge was not spectacular and some of the path is a bit overgrown. For toilets it is better to go to the malibu lodge toilets as the toilets at the gates are not maintained and have no toilet paper

name: Peets Auto repair
description:
+27787604258

 Peet is a great mechanic and helpful as well. Very much recommendable!

name: Porcupine Peak
description: camp site and cottages. amazing place with beautiful walks and surroundings. a must do if in the area.

name: MALAS
description: A big shop and workshop for tyres. You can find all models at a good price. They remove the old one, keep them if you want and make balancing, alignment .

name: Big liberty mall with no height limit entrance
description: Go around the back and tell them you can’t fit in the 2.2 m entrance. That’s where the big delivery trucks goes. You can then drive around to the front. Parking is also free via the back. There is pick and pay and checkers and everything you need

name: Sani Pass Private Tours - enjoy without stress!
description:
We highly recommend Sani Pass & Lesotho Private Tours to those who do not wish to put their own vehicle to the test driving up Sani Pass for a day visit to the highest pub in Africa (and it is a very serious test indeed!)
We’d have the vehicle to drive up Sani Pass … but we decided to do it with a guided tour … and we have NO regrets.
We selected Sani Pass & Lesotho Private Tours because first they were very fast and friendly responding, very accommodative and secondly they offered a „private tour“ at a very competitive rate. „Private“ meant just the two of us as passengers in a very comfortable vehicle, stopping whenever we wanted and a few other nice goodies. 
Greg was an excellent, gentle driver and a very pleasant guide and companion for the day, giving us lots of information and handling all the administrative issues at the border controls.
As passengers, we could fully enjoy the drive and the breathtaking scenery and we have absolutely NO regrets we did this trip in this ‚softy’ version as passengers and not self-drive.

Sani Pass & Lesotho Private Tours
contact Angie on +27 82 306 0000
www.sanipassprivatetours.com
info@sanipassprivatetours.com

The location given is the standard pick-up point in Himeville (other pick-up points can be arranged)

name: Service Zone Auto Tyre Center
description: very knowledgeable workshop. does 4x4 fitment and repairs

name: Moholoholo Lodge
description: This is really a lodge with chalets and a large area of grass. Without ablutions or services. We paid 100 Rands by night for 2 people and a van.

name: Drive train service center (GM)
description:
General mechanic and gearbox repairs

Got a gearbox problem sorted here ( Land Rover) Very helpful and very knowledgeable. 
They do all brands. 
0829240192 Kevin

name: Darkest Africa
description:
Alongside the Bushmans river. Rustic campsite, out of the beaten Track, quiet, peaceful. 
Hot showers, nice ablutions.
No electricity, great views.

R. 250 per night
Call Kyle 0833882906

name: MTN Store (Cellphone Shop)
description: Wifi available for tourists and people from abroad. You are more than welcome, if needed we can resolve your cell phone inquiries. We can activate your simcard, load airtime and if sell you accessories or a phone. For travelers we are willing to assist when needed. You are welcome.

name: Tube & Axe Camping
description: Few campsites available with electricity and ablutions. Suitable for tents and motorhomes. Pool, restaurant, kolkol and pub on site.

name: Tamboekie Koffiehoekie
description: Restaurant and overnight accommodation are on the same premisses. Save parking next to restaurant.

name: Camdeboo National Park game viewing entrance
description: Wild Card free entry. Reasonable gravel road throughout. Small, compact park for the whole family - quite a wide variety of game can be seen in a relatively short space of time. Recommend!

name: BayFibre - Fibre Glass Manufacturing & Repairs
description:
Bay Fibre is a relatively small operation but they are indeed expert specialists in all kinds of fibre glass works and repairs.
For us, Des Goosen and his team worked dedicated and tireless on a rather delicate problem till they found the solution. We are most grateful!
Highly recommended, very friendly!

Cell 083 234 4668
www. Bayfibre.biz
bayfibre@lantic.net

If necessary, one can overnight on the compound if necessary.

name: C-tronics Camping Fridge Repair
description: Gavin is a fridge repairmen who can repair your National or Engel camping fridge (or any brand really)! We stayed with them as they run a bnb, and his fridge repair business is a home business. Whatsapp 0829272715

name: De Zeekoe Guest Farm
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.

Affordable accommodation only 7 km from Oudtshoorn
We have various room rates as we have 23 different category rooms available

Rates from R 680 pp – R 1950 pp

name: OVK Diesel
description: Discounted diesel available here. Navigate using Google.

name: Loch Maree Guest Farm
description: Field campsite amongs the red dunes. Rustic lapa,flush toilet and two showers heated by a donkey. Visit a working salt pan mine in the vicinity. Test your 4x4 skills in the dunes. Other more formal accomodation also available. Real bush experience. Google contact info.

name: Grootfontein Private Game Reserve
description: What an amazing place and people. You can camp or stay in self catering units - Serengeti Bush Camp, Marula Camp, Aloe Lodge and Kudu Lodge.

name: 2 B Happy Backpackers
description:
Very nice backpackers in a beautiful and safe environment. Don't offer camping but clean rooms from 180 pp (private, shared bathroom).
Well stocked communal kitchen and a beautiful lush garden with a braai pit.

Was a quick stay over for me but I wished I could have stayed a bit longer. Nice place to have a rest after driving.

name: 8 on Weitz
description:
Cottage with 2 beds. safe parking. camping at the rear. 
Whattsapp the owner @ 0836611730
Cool vibe here. definitely worth a night. the owner is very friendly and accommodating.

name: Between fields
description:
A good spot with mountain view. All around are Mango trees. We met the farmer and he was totally ok with staying here. There is even a waterless toilet we could use (normally for the workers). Really quiet place. We decided to stay two days enjoying walks through the landscape.

MTN mobile had no connection but Vodacom has really good internet speed up here.

name: Nigramoep
description:
We camped all alone about 5km away from the main lodge, up on a hill besides a heap of huge rocks. Beautiful 360° scenery. Peaceful and very quiet. Very safe. 

You contact the owner, Marius. Very nice man, very friendly. Tel no: 0766103739. He is also on WhatsApp. Prices on website, simply google "Nigramoep".

What you receive:
* NO electricity 
* NO drinking water
* Relative okay cell phone signal 

REMEMBER:
1. Leave nothing but your foot prints.
2. Never litter! 
3. Take your rubbish with you. 
4. Always leave a camping spot in the same way you would like to get it.

name: Doreen falls grassy lot
description:
We asked the security if we could sleep in our car and they said yes! She also kindly offered to call the hotel if we wanted to sleep in their lot, supposedly parking there is 50 rand. We chose to stay here. Peaceful night, wind sheltered by trees. Flattish spot for small rigs, big rigs will have trouble levelling out. Full 4g reception.

As this is next to (but not visible from road) the gantry, cars passing sometimes give a small honk in the day.

Otherwise it’s a good free spot to hike early the next day. Enjoy!

name: Swift Fuel
description: Got diesel here, petrol and diesel were about R2 cheaper per liter then anyplace we'd driven by in 2 days.

name: South of Kaudum South gate
description: Wildcamp on the road next to shade trees. South of Kaudum South gate. No facilities.

name: Mountain view point
description: Beautiful spot on top a mountain close to Citrusdal. Spent a night camping with my dogs . A vehicle with decent ground clearance is needed. Perhaps 4x4 too but could be possible without I think .

name: Wildcamp North of Khaudum Noth gate
description:
Wild camp just of main rd. Camping fees at Khaudum camp @ R440 pppn is ridiculous. Very very deep sand with high "middelmannetjie" and   moguls all the way.

11km/hr is average speed due to current road conditions.

name: Valley of 1000 hills
description:
Nice spot close to the road with an amazing view. Not too easy to reach with a big truck but possible (we did it).

We came from the west side but the road was under construction with deep mud an really steep parts. I would recommend to reach this place from the east. That road is a small sand road but in good condition (even after the heavy rains we had).

Vodacom has good connection, no MTN.
There is no water around here but you can do nice walks around the spot.

The whole day only a handful people were passing by.

name: Grill Grove
description: Restaurant inside Spar. Delicious food, lot of options, Meat, salads, vegetables, costed around 50 Rand one good size dish. There are tables to eat there or you can choose take away.

name: Gastehuis 17
description:
Lovely selfcatering Guesthouse. Super confy bed, shower, place for 4 cars in open area inside the gate, small but fully equiped kitchen, free wifi. Is a very quiet and secure neighborwood, 1,5km from Fleural Mall with Woolworths, HyperCheekers, Dis-Chem. 
We payed 400 R the room because this was Booking price with discount and she kept it. You can call or WhatsApp Erina the owner in advance +27828986397. You can check the pictures on Booking.

name: Dachshund coffee co.
description: Nice trendy kind of specialty cafe offering good coffee and tasty treats with secure parking behind the building. Nice stop on this route/area. Enquire about the daily special.

name: Ten road blocks. Armed with sticks and rocks
description:
10 road blocks with gangs demanding money. They burned tires, shattered glass, ripped parts of the highway out to use as road blocks. We ran out of money after the 5th 6th road block and gave them Biltong. Then on the 7th or 8th roadblock we offered the remaining sweets to the guy but he held up a brick and asked us to pay or else he will smash our cruiser. In that 2 minutes, a mob had gathered and climbed onto our cruiser. I found a old lesotho note in the glove box and he let us pass.

The reason they gave for smashing glass and blocking the main highway in and out of tugela falls was that they had no electricity. Please find out road situation before driving to the falls. We are super shaken after having rocks hurled at our cruiser and multiple people jumping onto our car.

name: Peatties Campsite at the Resort
description:
Nice Camp between lakes. Clean with a small shop, table tennis, Billard, small swimming pool. 
Vodacom has no connection but MTN has a little bit. 100R per person

name: De Kleine Akker
description: Very neat site, good and neat ablution facilities. Playground for children. R200 for two in small tent.

name: Soap Suds
description: Coin-operated laundry. wash and dry in 1hr30ish.

name: Green Zone energy
description: Fabulous service for vehicle electrical issues. my solar 12 v system had failed but the problem was resolved here. Arthur is the owner and was extremely helpful. 0833107343. recommended.

name: Near Airport
description: nice private campsite near the airport. the owners Sini and Gerhard are marvelous hosts and provide you with anything you need for a stop in Johannesburg to get you set for the trip. they have good quality WiFi, a washing machine, a workshop if you need one and lots of advice. you can also sleep inside. they rent out rooms as well.  Of course they do car storage as well.

name: Boplaas Padstal
description: Great little farmhouse for coffee or lunch. A beautifully set garden, where you can enjoy homemade pies, cookies, biltong salads or buy some of the locally produced jams in their little shop.

name: Agoris Cabin
description:
Great little cabin in the woods. Pool, patio, braai, 3 bedrooms and 6 beds. Hot shower. The BEST wifi we've had in S.A. They also have a backup battery and inverter for when the power goes out. Can run a light and a few other things plugged in (not the whole place).
Paid R600 on AirBnB. It looks much nicer in person then it does on AirBnB :)

name: Country Laundry
description: Opening hours and prices see photos. Laundry ready the next day. +27 33 330 8094.

name: Bluebird Coffee Roastery
description: One of South Africa's best specialty coffee roasters with authentic direct trade relationships with producers worldwide. Selling a wide variery of home/travel brewing equipment as well as coffee beans and coffee to drink, this cafe bar is set in a beautiful location that is fun for the whole family. A must visit stop for those who appreciate coffee made, presented and enjoyed properly. Voted roastery of the year 2021.

name: Dovehouse Organic
description: High quality organic foods sourced directly from origin. Eggs, venison, wheat,  vegetables and more. Monday to Friday 08:00 to 16:00; Saturday 08:00 to 13:00; Sunday closed.

name: Quiet spot in the woods
description: Very quiet place in the forest plantations which cover the whole area. Not visible from main road. There are many similar places just off the tarmac road in this area. We did not see a single soul. Good 4G cover with vodacom / mediocre with MTN

name: Howick Falls
description: Impressive 100 or so metre drop falls of the Umgeni River that flows from Midmar Dam. No charge. Park and walk from Harvard Street. Gorge Walk down to the river trail head near here. Few traders selling their wares.

name: Total GAS Solutions
description: Gas place just off the corner of Thabo Mbeki Drive. Fills gas bottles

name: The Barn Owl
description: Voted Best Cafe Design 2021, this cafe brews Bluebird Roastery coffee and serves some tasty treats and whole foods for any time of the day. Brilliant views over the valley below, this cafe and its location is a highly recommened place to stop in the Midlands. Closed Tuesday and Wednesdays, otherwsie open from 09:00 to 16:00. Childrens play area and indoor and outdoor seating.

name: Kareelaagte Guest Farm
description: two newly renovated 5 sleeper accommodation on working farm. if you are looking for prices or to book please whattsapp Ina Botha on 0828225311. they are self catering and have everything and more that you need.

name: Protea Corner
description: Brilliant 180 degree lookout spot of the surroundings in the Golden Gate Highlands National Park. Be aware of the drop offs!

name: Jolie's lodge
description: There is a small campsite forming part of a lodge right next to Ariamsvlei border post. camp and ablutions are very basic but clean. Hot water and electricity. A small shop and restaurant. The owners are extremely helpful and friendly.

name: Stumble Inn Backpackers
description:
Dorm:250 SAR
Double Room: 600 SAR

Staff not very friendly, abolution clean, rest of standard ok, hangoutarea is outside - therfore cold in the morning and evening

name: Hazygas propane
description: The other place mica is marked closed on google, so we found this propane top up place instead. Filled our SA 3kg propane bottles. Parking is in front of hazyview tombstones blue building

name: Salt River Trail
description: Pretty easy walking trail to amazing secluded beach at Salt River. We didnt do the Loop as you Return on the Beach and you need to do it on low tide. There are 2 Viewpoints on the way and the end where the ocean meets the river is just so beautiful. Around 1,5 hour return. Cannot recomend this trail more! Park your car near Tranquility Lodge and start to walk at the beach to the right, you will see the sign.

name: Shady pine spot
description: The other spot may have been pinned wrongly so we just found a dead end quiet spot in this pine forest. No one bothered us. Check google satellite for this dead end spot. 4x4 not needed but high clearance is nice. Slow 4g vodacom. Very faint road noise. There are many places around this big pine forest and you can go further in away from the road if you wish! Slightly hard to fully level

name: Highland Coffee Specialty Roasters
description: Well established with reputable significance in the RSA specialty coffee industry, this espresso bar boasts some great single origin roasts, home brew coffee equipment and coffee to go in passing through Clarens. Nice place to stock up on whole coffee beans or ground for the road!

name: Ruah campsite
description:
6 camping sites on a wine farm , grassed
 with electricity just outside De Doorns neat ablutions . Cell phone reception . R500. / site max 4 people- great hiking - mountain pool

name: Emmanuel Park Campsite
description: A large open campsite with some shade on grass.  Wash basins, good, clean ablutions, well tended, recycling bins.  Electricity available and taps at sites.  Very friendly and helpful owners.  Not far from a road but there isn't much traffic and hardly any at night.

name: Luputhana Coastal Forest
description:
Beautiful spot under the trees, adjacent and overlooking the flat rock coastline shelf. Space for ~5 camp sites, though low trees mean only 1 or 2 of these can accommodate rooftop tents.

You may be asked to hire a "security guard".
The regular campers here recommend NOT employing anyone (though possibly mentioning that one has already hired secretive guard).

The road in is intimidating after rains, and has braided sections when trying to avoid mud and rocks.

name: closed bridge
description: The bridge is closed, so there is no way of getting to the National Park from here.

name: Magoebaskloof farmstall and cafe
description: Amazing flat white 30 rand pp and good beef burger. Fantastic pit stop with outdoor dining in a lush forest!! Plenty of space for big rig parking. One of our fav places in SA and we’ve been here 3 months

name: Strydom Stop & Stay
description: Separate rooms, communal kitchen and free, fast WiFi, this spot is ideal for a stop over and place to regroup and restock with a PnP Hyper accross the road, after some heavy camping and overlanding. Paid ZAR650 pn for two adults, 5 year old and infant. Nice, easy going and hospitable hosts!

name: Sandstone Manor
description: Very good value Guesthouse. Is in a historic building, really beautiful and refurbished. The rooms are good size, comfy bed, fridge and even in downtown was very peaceful. There's a well equipped kitchen and a Parking just next to the building (no big rig friendly), but you can Park on the street though. Johan the owner is very helpful and polite. We payed 450 rands the room without breakfast. You can book on Booking (550 room) or direct with owner. +27 798063879.

name: Langham Farm
description: a great mix if facilities, from honeymoon suite chalet to fixed tents. a beautiful piece of the Koo Valley, where the farming is all low impact. we were there when the first Pluerry fruits were ripe (March) and we were able to pick our own ... no pesticides so it's from the tree to the tummy! don't pass through the Koo valley without throwing a line at the biggest bass you've encountered ...

name: Tropic of Capricorn
description: Tropic of Capricorn runs across the R510 just outside of Ellisrus

name: Lazy lizard
description: Nice Local shop and cafe. They serve breakfast, lunch and have delicious bakes.

name: In the woods
description:
A place directly at a rarely used Sandroad in the woods. Feels like nobody will ever come here. There were a lot of other places before we got here but someone told us not to stay at a visible spot because there are many people with guns around ... no idea if it's the truth ... but we decided to search for a spot like this one, where we aren't seen.
It's just a spot to stay one night and then go on. Interestingly the internet (both MTN and Vodacom) is excellent. MTN is better than anywhere else so far in SA.

name: Vanderkloof Wild Camp 1
description:
An ideal little spot to throw down your bivy and stay the night. Great for bicycle tourists and just 5km from Vanderkloof.
Coming up from the bridge, look out for a dirt road going left. Follow it up to the circle, and then go left into the bush. There is a small path up a bit, and then left again. There is enough flat area to sleep comfortably.
Beautiful starry skies here too, and if the dam is overflowing, you can hear it roaring in the background.
Beware of baboons in the area, likely not a threat but still. 
Respect the place, leave no trace!

name: Brandberg valley
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Flash floods reported in this location. Please use caution 

Wild camp site in river bed secluded in valley against mountain

name: Hazy Park Lodge Caravan and Camping
description:
We offer 12 shaded, grassed camp sites with electricity at all sites.  Sites are all very big, average size 8m x 16m per site.

Ablution and washing up facilities for campers. We also offer affordable self catering accommodation. Ni wifi.

We are located just of the R40 White river - Hazyview road on a farm, 3 km from Hazyview CBD

name: Peet se Padstal
description: Brilliant food. Fair prices, excellent service and calm atmosphere.

name: Halfway Toyota Scottburgh
description: Excellent workshop experience! Extremley  competent, motivated and customer-oriented workshop staff got several jobs on my LandCruiser done where other Toyota & 3rd party workshops failed or didn‘t even try! Especially if you come with a left hand drive many places will show you the door but these guys loved the challenge and dove right in!

name: Mad Dogz
description: Nice little cafe stop, gallery and shop. Good prices, and good. Nice atmosphere, small fish ponds. Recommended.

name: Dreghorn Safari Lodge
description: This is a 12000ha game farm on the Molopo Eco Trail close to Bokspits. A beautiful setting between the Kalahari dunes. There are chalets and four camp sites with private ablutions. It's stil new, but will become popular very soon. Camp sites are set far apart from each other. R450 per vehicle. The host is as pleasant as you will expect from the Kalahari's people and a excellent chef too. There's also a challenging 4x4 dune route as well.

name: Campfridge Repair
description:
Extremely professional 12V fridge repair workshop. Great service from the company owner and his son including staff. They really go the extra mile to solve all your problems.
Contact Johann Prinsloo

name: Roof of Namaqua Picnic Site and Lookout
description: Lovely spot to enjoy the view. Climb up onto the adjacent rocks for 360 degree panorama.

name: skulpiesbaai
description: Sand & rocks Carpark in front of the beach. Such a quiet place ! Nobody all night long, some walkers in the morning. Toilets (clean !). Impossible to go further than here to the skulpiesbaai natural reserve park.

name: Quiet dirt road
description: Just a place for one night off the main tarmac road close to a lake filled with flamingos. We had a quiet night. Nobody even passed by as far as we could tell. Average mobile network cover (video calls possible with little lags).

name: Active Sushi
description: The best value for sushi we had in months. You can find more fancy sushis in Cape Town but All you can eat for 200 rands pp is unbeatable. You only cannot order sashimi, but all their Signature Menu is available and they are really good. Fresh tuna, salmon and prawns. But dont get too excited because the pieces are big and they come in 8 pc portions (and they charge the leftovers). Open every day for lunch and dinner. Have to park on street.

name: zambia
description: wonderful community camp next to the horrible road for a sleep over. 85 kilometres before and south of Mpika. could not go further.  save and pleasant. Close to road but wonderful after a hard day of driving on a bad road.

name: Erasmus Bush camp
description: 7 level stands with private ablutions and a heated pool. Campsite is fenced. Friendly staff. 4km from local shopping centre, butchery and fuel station. Excellent rates.

name: Truck stop behind Shell petrol station
description: We spent a night here, there is security and lots of lorries parked for the night. We are in a big rig, possibly not suitable for anything smaller.

name: MTO trails camp
description:
This Mountainbiking community has a wonderful camp and often many truly nice people around. Good ablutions near the entrance of the grounds and camping is possible if you ask for permission. there are plans to make a more official camping at some point.

some few monkeys around and lots of nice plants

name: huge meadow by the river
description: Beautiful place right by Orange River. Huge meadow, big rig friendly, locals showed no interest in us. Good Vodacom reception, okay MTN reception. A bit loud because of the artificial water wall, but okay when behind the trees.

name: Ladismith CBL hardware
description: A place where you can refill gaz in the CBL hardware store. Just after the Spar super Market, in Town.

name: AFROX SALES CENTEr
description: You can refill Bottle gaz here. Little Cadac 8bottle is 84 $

name: On a hill outside Beaufort West
description:
Better view than the wild camping spot checked in close by. Great to see sunset and sunrise! Quite, far from the roads.
4x4 only, the road up the hill is steep, not sure if it fits big rigs. Also at the end of the climb there’s a sharp turn.
After quick climb up hill turn left and the spot is after 100m from your left on the side of the dirt road.
Theres a bit of an angle but you can manage, not a lot of other spots on the side of this road because there are lots of big rocks.
In the evening, before sunset, a few cyclists went by, asked them if its safe, they said yes and just be careful.
There were fire leftovers so I guess I’m not the first to stay here for the night.
Great LTE signal.

name: Roadside
description: In this area, it seems particularly difficult to find a good wild camping spot due to the fences. This place is not pretty, but very safe. Side of the road in front of the Caltex gas station. Many truck drivers park there for the night. A bit noisy in the morning, but quiet at night. Good cell phone receptions. Might be able to use the toilets at the gas station, but we didn't ask.

name: Openmine caravan park Kimberley
description:
Municipal Campsite with corresponding quality.
big grassy camp with trees and shade. A bit rundown ablution but hot shower, power points and toilets are working. Acceptable cleanliness.
The big advantage is the proximity to the Big Hole touristic complex at 200 or 300 meters walking distance.
Payed 238 rands for 2 pensioners and one motorhome.

name: Lions Rock Rapids - Lodge & Luxury Tented Camp
description: Come enjoy the luxury of modern amenities while being "Under Canvas", right on the iconic Sabie River. Safe parking, free bike wash, hot showers, sumptuous meals included in the rate, huge Boma Fire area, Lounge and bar area next to the river. Plenty of secure parking for bigger vehicles.

name: Lions Rock Rapids
description: Enjoy the luxury of modern amenities while being "Under Canvas", right on the iconic Sabie River. Safe parking, free bike wash, hot showers, sumptuous meals included in the rate, huge Boma Fire area, Lounge and bar area next to the river. Plenty of secure parking for bigger vehicles.

name: Tjol Se Gat
description:
10 sites with drinking water taps 
Nice place with very friendly owner Tjol. 
On the others side of the road he owns a bar called Tolhuis. It's a house build in 1832 as a rolhouse and is now a very nice bar, beer and other drinks. No food U can buy "boerewors" Braai pack

name: Riverside camp next to warm water
description: A really nice spot next to the bend of a small river. possible to drive almost all the way to it, and the car would then be fairly well hidden from the road. The river feels unusually warm. Not sure if it's coming from a hot spring or if its just lukewarm groundwater. Taking a bath at the pool bellow a tiny rapids feels really nice in the morning as the water is moderately warmer than the air.

name: Height restrictions
description:
Going North, you are only allowed to pass here if you are less than 3m high and less than 2,1m wide. 

Very very tight turns and very low overhangs. Frequent rockslides as well.

name: The Hidden Valley
description:
Hidden in amongst the mango and citrus farms close to the Blyde River it is a true hidden gem, our two wooden cabins offer accommodation for a stop over on your trip, a family holiday, a romantic getaway or a base to explore the area. The Blyde River is considered by many as one of the most beautiful rivers in South Africa.

Surrounded by nature and a wide variety of birds and small wildlife, it is any birder and bird photographers dream location with four different biomes within easy reach, Impalas, Blue Wildebeest, Zebra, Giraffes and other game may also surprise you as we are located in a wilderness estate.

The Hidden Valley is perfect if you are looking for a break in the heart of the Lowveld and everything it has to offer.

We are a self catering outfit.

With the Kruger National Park just around the corner, the area has a lot of tourist attractions.

name: Kanniedood 4x4 Wildcamp
description: Situated on a working sheep farm in the Karoo near Lainsburg. Perfect getaway. 2hrs from Worcester on the N1. Lovely couple Pieter and Micaela  allow guests to camp on the farm, usually near a borehole in a sheep kraal. Go for walks, cycle or chill out.

name: Grotto beach parking
description: Beautiful, quiet, safe and spacious parking right by the beach. Spent one night here. Nobody came and asked questions. Signs say that tents are not allowed, but overnight parking seems to be fine. Might be a different story in high season. There is also a little facility with toilets a bit further down the road. 4G on MTN and Vodacom. Restaurant close by.

name: Diggers Inn
description: A resturant and pub with large parking space.  Nice trees, no facilities.  But they let us park overnight.

name: Stilbaai Private Caravanpark
description: Each stand is privately owned with own ablutions. Public not allowed.

name: Morgan Bay Hotel and Restaurant
description: Excellent food in an otherwise uneventful hotel restaurant setup but the meals are reasonably priced from R85 upwards, great service and very tasty fish, pizzas, meat dishes

name: Balloch Cottages and Campsite
description: This place could just as well be called "The Jewel of Barkly East" or "The Jewel of the Eastern Cape". An old trout farm with cottages and two campsites - one at the river and one under a giant sandstone overhang. The surrounding mountains and cliffs provide the perfect setting for an off grid experience second to none. Electricity is available at the sites when water is abundant as it is hydro generated. Ablutions are neat and clean with hot water (gas heated). Wood is available from the owners. Current price is R490 per site and privacy is guaranteed. The road leading to the farm can be driven with a 2x4, yet caution is advised. This is a true gem!

name: Dam Kaya
description: Very nice campsite with three cabins with basic facilities next to a dam. Fishing and hunting can also be done here

name: Bulshoekdam campsite
description: A small grassy campsite next to the Bulshoekdam, very quiet and peaceful. The ablutions are a bit old, but clean and tidy.

name: Scotia Inn
description: Paid 500 for room only. 600 for a (v good) view. Room was clean, had kettle. Seemed the cheapest in town by a long way. Bicycle storage around back. However it was a Friday night and the music from the bar outside was noisy until 1am so might recommend ear plugs. WiFi was free but slow.

name: Pro Sports bike mechanic
description: Decent mechanic. Paid 65R for him to fix issues with my bike. Peat +27(0)711567850

name: Maru Djembe
description:
In the bush we like to stress less, and we therefore do things a little bit different than the rest. There are no fences here for instance -and the famous Maru Djembe Leopard roams around.

We also have Snakes, Scorpions and Spiders - which is part of the small five. The big five can be spotted in the surrounding areas. In camp the Zebra’s, Sables, Giraffes, Impala, Kudus, Buffalos, Hyenas and warthogs will pay you a visit.

If you are a nature lover, adventurer and a bit of a risk taker, then this is for you. If your preference is soft sheets and you worry about your WIFI connection, then maybe this is not for you.

Bushveld tranquillity and breaking free from the rat race is what it is all about. If you love the sounds of the bush, you will love the Maru Djembe camping experience. This is bush camping at its purest

We have a 5km Rockfig trail on site, a beautifull arena to braai and have conferences. 
Hot water showers , heated by parafin heater for your convenience. Flushing toilets and water points in camp.

Contact 079 513 6914 or 082 801 3350 for bookings or send an email to bookings@marudjembe.co.za

name: Pro-Fit Exhausts
description: My overland campers exhaust started leaking (rusted out) and I needed a new exhaust system. Profix fabricated a new stainless steel exhaust in a couple of hours (when there was none of the power load shedding!) and I was on my way. Price was great (4,500 Rand) and very reasonable. Brandon was great and I can highly recommend this shop for both price and quality of work.

name: Croydon Cottage and Campsite
description: A beautiful campsite set on a private farm, owned by Glen & Roz Burmeister. This is a gem of a place to stay, level ground, a donkey and hot shower, flush toilet and wash basin, electricity, natural wooden table and seating on logs, fireplace and wood provided, big tall trees and spectacular scenery. Glen was so so helpful and talkative, salt of the earth folk! It was cold as in -0.5 deg when we were there 03 June 2022. We paid R150pp for the night.

name: Footloose and fancy free
description: Saint Helena Bay on the West Coast.  Comfortable accommodation with beautiful seaview and very friendly hosts. Highly recommended. There was safe parking in the yard or in the garage for my motorcycle. Price was Rand 350.00 per Night and there will be Rand 500.00 for two person. Ask for Ursula Mobil 0721973354 .

name: Pit Stop Cafe farm shop
description: Good place selling tea, coffee, pancakes , toasties, burgers, chips and has farm shop with cold drinks, preserves, chocolate etc. perfect for a break after cycling over that mountain! Owners- Blackie and Annalise are really friendly.

name: Delicious coffee, pies and sandwiches
description: Wonderful place with great owners. Good coffee, good sandwiches, good pies. Perfect for stopping.

name: Louis @ Magwafalls
description:
Basic, rustic off the beaten track accomodation on the wildest Wild Coast.  Strategically positioned on the tip of the plateau ridge, overlooking hundreds of hills.
Generous and welcoming hosts Louis and family, introduce visitors to permaculture gardening, leather workshop etc.  They can also take you on guided day hikes to abundant and spectacular waterfalls (magwa, angel, fraser, the bluff etc) caves and along an awe inspiring coastline.

name: Uitvlugt Guesthouse
description: Wild camping on a beautiful farm on the outskirts of Worcester on the N1 to Cape Town or Johannesburg. Ideally suited gor an overnight stop

name: Graskop Holiday Resort Campside
description:
Campside on Green below trees. Abolitions ok. Electricity we have not used, installations look a little risky
We laid for two adults with Motorhome 159 ZAR

name: Khora lion park
description:
Great quiet spot on a working farm and lion sanctuary.
For a great price you can have a private chalet or camp with the sound of the lions roaring throughout the day and night.
The owners are friendly and helpful and the accommodation is clean, comfortable and has everything you need

name: Khula Dharma Eco Village
description: This eco village community is a pretty cool place and different to most campsites. Camping is R150pp including a vegan dinner or R100 if you prefer to self cater but the dinners are nice as you interact with some people living interesting lives here. Permaculture gardens (free greens if in season), natural buildings from mud and thatch, long drop toilets, nice hot shower with donkey system, a yoga hall to meditate or do yoga, free wifi and lots to see and experience. The 7 or so people staying here are mostly busy in the gardens and building so you can go see and help out if you like. Other visitors like volunteers and guests come stay in the retreat rooms (R300 single or R400 double incl dinner) and there are basic cooking facilities for breakfast and lunch. If you interested in offgrid natural living this is an amazing place! 083-5999337 for whatsapp only or info@khuladharma.com you need to give them some notice as they don’t want people just dropping in!

name: Die Oog Caravan Park
description: Well established campground. all sites with 230v power and braai. Old but clean ablutions with hot water and flush toilets. Resort has hot mineral springs, swimming pools and supertubes for kids. Excellent security and a game camp with wildlife.

name: BSC Brakecore Suply CO.
description:
We get some Parts for our Truck here. (Clutch Zylinders) They are specialists for Brakes, Clutches and Engine cooling.
Really nice guys!

name: Ikaia River Lodge
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.

Ikaia River Lodge is a fisherman and nature lover’s paradise, where you can relax near Keimoes – the jewel of the Northern Cape. The establishment is situated a comfortable 40 km from Upington, on the main road between Keimoes and Cape Town. It is conveniently located close to the national route to Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park, Augrabies Falls National Park, Riemvasmaak, Namaqualand, Upington, Namibia, Kenhardt, Johannesburg, and Bloemfontein.
Accommodation comprises of en-suite units, self catering chalets and camping sites. Ikaia offers a cosy and intimate setting for weddings of up to 100 guests. The island on the Orange river makes for beautifully unique ceremonies, or other types of events and functions. For an intimate reception, Ikaias restaurant at the entrance of the lodge can be used. The deck makes for amazing sunset views.

name: Gemsbok Station
description: Disused station a few kilometers off the N1 just before/after Laignsburg. Ideal as an overnight stop to or from Cape Town. Safe.  There’s no wifi but very good connectivity on own devices.

name: bush and buck
description: 68 campsites and chalets. cold and warm swimming pools with children's entertainment area. some camping stands with private ablutions. duatbins and braais on all stands. game farm

name: May's Auto Centre
description: A good place for small auto repairs, but what these guys are really good at is fixing motorbikes. Technically very good, fast and honest. A perfect place to get your bike fixed or maintained before you start the Sani pass.

name: Thomson's Hardware
description:
A lovely hardware shop, with a lot of stuff, from electrical to tools, and a bunch of other stuff.
They refill propane there at a good value. We paid $12US for 4.5l.
Staff is friendly and helpful.
The entrance to place is like an antique museum: lovely!

name: Klein Tafelberg
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by someone associated with the owner.

Very nice and clean campsite. We camped on the mountain at there wild campsite. There are 3 small sites, with a wonderful view. There are a number of animals to be found. If you lucky you might see a leopard.

name: MAN Hatfield Truck & Bus
description: Hatfield MAN Truck & Bus in our opinien is a top MAN workshop. The workshop is checked every 6 months by TÜV Rheinland.  Reliable, efficient and courteous. Overlanders are allowed to stand on site overnight and are made available a toilet/shower and can also be provided with electricity if required.

name: Golden Springs
description:
They replace all kind of springs for cars and trucks: coils, leaf and parabolic springs. They can also harden the springs again.
The repair of my parabolic springs was done very well & professionally and for a fair price.

name: IDL SERVICES, Upington Cell no. 0636509147
description: Says on the sign out the front that its a welding shop, however, they also refilled our 3kg gas bottle for R120.

name: Van Zyl's Spring Works
description:
It's a mechanic garage specialized in suspension and shock absorbers. They have such and expertise in that, valuable advice  and they also make custom Spring coils and leaf/blade suspension.
It's definitely the place to go.
Very reasonable prices.
Ask for Jannie if you need any opinion.

www.springcentre.co.za

name: Die Ark
description:
Small camp site on a farm. Showers, small kitchen available to use. 100 zar pp. Wifi was not very reliable. They offer other activities too, most geared towards youth. 

I'm traveling by bicycle and they offered me to put up my tent in the covered communal area which was comfortable during cold weather

name: GOWRIE FARM
description:
Plenty wild camping sites.

4x4 only
Wood 
Camping 
Trout Fishing
Hiking
Hunting 
Indigenous plant 

There is also an old stone ruin to camp and braai at. 

No toilets ( soon to be built). 
No shower ( soon to be built). 


See pictures 
R100 per night. 
R50  braai wood. 

0839964137 
Josh 

Limited signal within the area. Wifi at main house if needed.

name: Motherland Coffee St Georges Mall
description: Nice coffee shop with expresso and light meals. Very good avocado sandwich. Good atmosphere and superfriendky staff. At basament of Mandela Rhodes building.

name: Summerhill
description:
Old farm turned into a spacious guest house in the middle of nowhere with a wide choice of private accommodation or camp sites. Also a wedding venue.  Staff nice and green surroundings. Internet reception in some areas. 
Current prices:
Double room w shared bathroom: ZAR 350pn
All other private rooms w ensuite: ZAR 500pn
Camping: 80pppn

name: Neil Woolridge Motors
description: 4x4 Accessories wholesaler and repair center. Service center.

name: Ferry to ROBBEN ISLAND
description: Here you can book a trip and board a boat to Robben Island. Trip takes 4 hours. Daily at 9, 11 and 13 h. 600 rand pp. ( 36€). . Expensive but must in Cape Town.

name: Mboloba Caravan Guest house
description:
Private basic countryside accommodation near the Eswatini border. Surrounded by farms and hills, very tranquil and affordable. Choice of small rondavels or setup caravans, with shared toilet and kitchen. R250pn for two. 
Owners not always on site so best to call ahead: 0695068731 or 0661187722

name: River Valley Resort Pennington
description:
Campsite under green lush trees with some permanent campers and Wendy houses. Everyone very welcoming. 
Each campsite has a power point, tap.
Ablutions super clean. 
Laundry room with a couple of washing machines and tumble dryers (30 rand and 45 rand for a load)

There is a small Swimmingpool and playground. Few minutes walk to the beach.

Paid 150 for 1 pax 1 night.

name: ESPRESSO.kOM
description: Nice coffee shop with good coffee and a sort of light meals and breaksfats. Beautiful terrace and friendly staff.

name: The SALTY SEA DOG
description: Nice fish restaurant at the harbour. Hake, calamari, other fish. Reasonable priced. Park in front.

name: Moosa & Sons Hardware store
description:
Moose and Sons is a hardware store that also refills tanks. After trying everywhere near town to fill the bottle with my US fitting, here they sold me parts and helped me together with my spare parts to construct a make-shift adapter. After that they filled my bottle, 7.3kg for 280R. Going forward I now should be able to fill anywhere where they can fill South Africa bottles. Of course, like anywhere in Africa it'll be LPG (Butan?) only, no propane.

Note: I had a connector for my bottle, they had the line, clamps and an African plug.

name: Danger Point Lighthouse
description: Beautiful spot. Lighthouse was established in 1895. Now fully automatic. Amazing surrounding for a walk if you are lucky with weather.

name: Shopping Center
description: Small shopping center with many shops, pharmacy and SPAR Supermarket

name: ELLIE'S on main
description: Nice restaurant with good fish and Burger. Very reasonable priced. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Ellis the owner came from Johannesburg to manage her restaurant. Highly recommended. Good music also

name: Whale watching/ Fishing place
description: Good place to watch wales between june and september. We spend a couple of hours and vould see several whales. Good fishing area with some locals at duty

name: SPASIE
description: Nice restaurant with good croissant for breakfast. Also Burger, fish and pizza cook at wooden oven. Martin, the owner, will be more than happy to offer you his home made rum and spirits.

name: De Rust Caravan Park
description: Camping. Dinokeng Resort. Unfenced. Stunning bird and wild animals resort.  Rustic. Beautiful river and dam.  cold swimming pool.

name: GOZONE WATER
description: Place is located in a shopping centre about 30 metres from the Sefalana shopping centre. They can refill bottles and so far do not have a hose to reach your tank. Price is P1.40 for 10 litres or more.

name: Raptor’s Ridge BnB
description: 5 double rooms each with en-suite bathrooms. Group lounge with in-door fireplace, kitchen facilities, boma area and swimming pool. All overlooking the Gariep Dam ( the largest dam in South Africa). Spotless!

name: Leopard Tree Retreat
description: Rooms and cottages on a running farm. Scenic pool and braai area. Great host, highly recommended

name: Red Rocks Lookout
description: Red Rocks Lookout - saw a hippo, croc and white backed eagles. Supposed to be resident leopard but we did not see it.

name: Skeiding Guest Farm and Campsite
description:
Amazing campsite on a former Ostriche farm, runned by the Uys family. They have a Guest Farm for a long time now and started running a small campsite as well. 

The Guest Farm is amazing with a nice view over the hills and a swimmingpool as well. Breakfast and diner are luxury but affordable. 

The campsite is a private one, they have some big spots so it can be used by one tent, one car or one big rig only so you have a wildcamp feeling. They do one group at a time only to let you experience the private feeling. 

Hot running water (nice shower with a stunning view!) solar power and a fully kitted kitchen with gas stove and braai area.

name: MacMac Forest Retreat
description: Basic camping side in the forest close to the road. Very rustic

name: Oppilam Camping
description: Camping, house boat rental, caravan hire. Field with brais by water, hot showers. 150 Rand vehicle plus 75 Rand per person.

name: 23 Ambleside Holiday Retreat
description: Nice little family run guesthouse with private rooms in the main house or self-catering cottages. With spacious backyard and walking distance to beach. We paid R400 for two on booking.com.

name: Kliprand Guest House
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overlander stayed overnight so far

Kliprand Guest House is situated in the lovely town of Springbok, which is world renowned as the Namaqualand Flower Capital. It is the perfect stopover on the main N7 highway between Cape Town and Namibia.
We offer eight comfortable rooms equipped with selected DSTv channels, Air-conditioning for summer and electric blankets for winter, Tea- and Coffee-facilities and a small fridge in all the rooms.

Breakfast is also available. Enjoy the charming swimming pool on a hot summers day, or even a great barbecue with some friends.

name: Emdoneni Lodge and Cheetah Rehab Centre
description: Cheetah, Serval, Caracal and Wild CST rehab centre. Tours daily (winter 10:30 am and 4:00 pm) You May need to prebook as tour size limited.

name: Downstream Accommodation
description: Situated in Groot Marico North West Province 90Km from Botswana Border Post. We have 2 x 4 and 1 x 3 self catering cottages and tent camping sites for overnight, midweek and weekend stays available.100m River frontage on the Groot Marico River ideal for fishing, camping and picnics.

name: Pezulu Tree House Lodge
description:
Pezulu Tree House Lodge in the
Guernsey Private Nature Reserve.
Kind of luxury lodge, I stayed there for one week. It's a gem.
Nice and very friendly staff. Guess I was the first camper to stay there. Get a special low rate because of a recommendation of the owner of a neighbor lodge. Always call in advance to ask for the price of the campsite. 
Telephone: +27 (0)82 896 0049
I could use the bathroom and the power outlet of one of the tree houses (Teak 1). 

You have to pass the entrance gate of the Nature Reserve first and they ask at the lodge, if you have a reservation. 

Entrance Gate Guernsey Private Nature Reserve:
-24.51564,31.11455 

Pezulu Tree House Lodge:
-24.52391,31.12052

name: Rise and Shine cafe
description: Great cafe in Salmon. Very friendly, great coffee and cakes and good internet

name: N2 Bakery Cafe
description: If you are coming along meandering midlands R103 you will see a number of road signs that will tempt you to stop at this bakery cafe. Well worth stoping for some great bakery treats or light lunch. Real cappuccino! And also a pretty B&B on a horse farm. Nova and Wayne are gracious hosts.

name: Kabbo Burger Factory
description: Best gourmet burgers (and milkshakes)ever in the world. All made from scratch so takes some time. Excellent service too by Mondli! Highly recommend! Just opposite the Drakensberg Choir. Hours:  Su, M, T 12-5pm, Th, F, Sa 12-8pm.

name: Cumberland Nature Reserve- Uzavolo campsite
description: Rustic Campsite with water (not for drinking) toilet and open air shower. Only booked out to one group at a time.

name: Nelmed Medicross Medical Centre
description: Very well organized medical center with many doctors in different disciplines.  Appointments can be booked online.  https://nelmed.co.za/

name: Marula Oase
description: Another huge resort style campground, however not a lot of choices around Bela Bela. 400r one night one person. Good ablutions, but everyone is crammed together.

name: Stockpoort Border Lodge
description:
Basic but nice place, small individual chalets (about 700zar?), nice pool, friendly manageress. 
Camping area across the road is used by hunters during the hunting season, else it’s free and nice to use.
Otherwise they will let you camp next to a chalet and use the toilet/shower if one is free. They may build an animation block soon. Seems quite flexible and willing to accommodate. Quoted 300 for the camp site, as I’m one person I politely talked them around to 150 for just me.
The border has no trucks, so is quick and easy, open to everybody both sides. A great option, road up here is much nicer than following highway with the trucks and police harassment.

name: Khartoum Youth Hostel - YHA
description: Camping and dorms in the secure grounds of the  YHA –  basic facilities and close to a number of nice restaurants.

name: Meroe Pyramids bush camp
description: A highlight of our trip to Sudan, there is a great spot to bushcamp here

name: Bush camp
description: In open field.

name: Bush camp
description: Naast Taka Mountains bij meertje met watervogels en grazende beesten.  Af en toe komt een herder of een ezeltje voorbij. Next to Taka Mountains near lake with water birds and grazing animals. From time to time a shepherd or donkey passes by. In the morning there were over 100 drinking camels.

name: Bush camp
description: In open field under trees. Very quiet.

name: Bush camp
description: In the middle of the desert.

name: Public parking
description: Behind homes in hamlet. Much interest of villagers.

name: Bush camp
description: In the middle of the desert.

name: among palm trees
description: Between palmeries at the outskirts of Karima. This was the only place in Sudan where we had discussion about our camping location with locals.

name: Public parking
description: Beach next to boulevard. A bit busy because of picnicers.

name: Wild Camp Nile
description:
Bush camp at the Nile in the past?
I couldn’t find a spot there

name: Wild camp 3rd Cataract
description: In a palm grove. (The difficulty we found in camping along the Nile is getting down to the palm groves over generally 2m high irrigation ditches)? But not a bad spot despite the continued 45°C heat day and night – and some local farmers who came to chat were very welcoming.

name: Bush Camp
description: On the banks of the Nile & secluded

name: Bush Camp
description: Secluded and view over pyramids & river

name: Acropole Hotel
description: Nice hotel where they can help you with visa registration, travel permit and everything

name: Refill Gas Station
description: If you need to refill your gas bottle you can do it here in this refilling gas station

name: Refill Gas Station
description: You can refill your cooking gas bottle (propane/gpl). Located on the left hand side on the road from gedaref to Khartoum

name: Filling Gas Station
description: Possibility to refill your propane bottle (cooking gas)

name: Small road through farm land
description: off main road, light ppl traffic, those that did pass were friendly, lots of herding in surrounding area, quiet

name: Palm Trees Camp
description: Just beside Nile river. It's a quiet bush camp at the end of small village. Perfect to take a rest for couple of day

name: Nile Wild camp
description: Wild camp with access to the water and wide shadow provide by dates palm trees

name: Naga Tempel dessert wild camp
description: near the Naga tempels a wild camp in the dessert. Very quiet!

name: Dessert wildcamp
description: in the middle of the dessert, wildcamp on our way to Kassala

name: Nile Bank
description: Wonderful place for birdwatching with access to Nile not far from Barge

name: Dry River Bank
description: Nice and quiet place to stay overnight. River empty during dry season, probably full during wet season, which will create a nicer spot to bivouac

name: Dinder National Park Border
description: Wild camp near Dinder National Park . Very quiet place- we had a lot of wind at night

name: Petroleum Company
description: We could camp between the first and second security gate. Police everywhere so very safe. We had to camp here because Moroe was flooded! Don't camp at Moroe during rainy season :)

name: Nubian Guesthouse
description: Nice guesthouse in Abri right on the Nile river. You can camp on the street in front.  Quiet and safe.  Owner Magzoub is very helpful and friendly. You can either book a room for 250 SDG single room-300 SDG double room or just use shower and toilet for a donation. You can even swim in the Nile.

name: Soleb Guest House
description: Guest house run by a friendly old man. Rooms are available but camping in front of the house is also possible  (for free), though he might insist on you taking a room anyway, out of sheer hospitality. In walking distance from the beautiful Soleb temple.

name: Park ranger
description: The GPS location to this is wrong. It is further back away from the border about 10 km or so. There are two huts where the park rangers stay. If you are really stuck they will let you stay but only really if you won't make it across the border in time or tell them you feel uncomfortable camping at the border  (we only had a tent). We stayed here as the other two spots listed here are too exposed.

name: Quiet spot off dirt road
description:
Nice quiet spot on dirt road about 200m from highway
Passed by a couple of locals who said hello but didn't stop for more
Only problem- loads of flies and not much shade, ground was very hot!

name: Foreigner permit
description: Get your Foreigner Permit right of the departure terminal. Bring a passport photo, copy of your passport photo page and a photocopy of your visa plus a letter written from your accommodation (they will know what to do). Cost 530£. After you have this don't forget to get your "photo and travel permit", see the POI on iOverlander just east of the airport. I had a two week transit visa with an extra stamp saying I had to do this on the border or here in Khartoum.

name: Foreigners Permit (Option 2)
description: The main office to get your foreigners permit. If you can go to the airport office go and get it there, here you wait a long time and have to go from nondescript office to nondescript office struggling to keep sane. Photocopy of your passport photo page, your visa and one passport photo. Cost was 370€. Good luck...

name: Amir hotel
description: Basic hotel, with fan, bathroom inside the room and squat toilet. 250S£/night for 2 people. Friendly owner.

name: Palace hotel
description:
So so Hotel in Port Sudan                                                   Good location
AC works

name: Suakin
description: Parking near fish and rice restaurant. When we were there it was not used. Plenty of space and a nice view on the old city and the harbor. Quiet place, though at 21:00 there was some modern music played somewhere. You can get ok cellular data here.

name: Wild Camping
description: Quiet place hidden away.

name: Nubian Lodge/Guesthouse
description: This is a very luxurious hotel with 150 usd rooms. BUT: you can shower here for free! They have a separate shower/toilet block near the side gate. Ask at the reception for the caretaker and explain that you are an overlander who would like to use the shower. Enjoy :)

name: AlMotwakil Hotel
description: Hotel quite clean. Restaurant. Secure parking at the back for motorbikes. Expensive at US$90/S£600 a night for twin room with no towels. If you've exchanged your US$$ on black market then it makes it a lot cheaper.

name: Imperial Hotel
description: It has lost its grandeur and it's a bit grubby in places but is ok for Sudan. Twin room S£400. A bit pricey unless you're using black market exchange rate. Restaurant. Safe parking for motorbikes.

name: Amazing wild camp site
description:
Amazing wild campsite along railway desert track, about 125km out of Wadi Halfa.

Easy to drive track passing deserted stations. 

Stunning campsite amongst mountains, in a sandy gully so protected and hidden from the winds.

name: Fish restaurant
description: Don't know what the name is in Arabic, but a helpful local lead us to this restaurant with little air conditioned huts set around a courtyard. We had fried Perch accompanied by fresh herbs, onion, bread and a hot sauce. One of the most satisfying meals I've had in a long time.

name: Parking near Cleopatra Hotel
description: Overnight parking and use of showers and toilet for a courtesy gift (10-20 SDP)

name: Alien registration office
description:
In this office you can register (within three days of entry) as an "alien".
You need a copy of your passport, of your entry visa and a passfoto. Copyshops are around the corner. Cost here: 521 SDP

name: Fixer for KSA visa
description:
Location of office of Waleed in Khartoum. Very reliable! Phone +249 91 235 3377. 
 
Only sign in Arabic. Next to Sky tours Travel. 

This us what you need to apply:
passport and copy, two photos with white background, original carnet de passage, copy marriage certificate(for women) copy of car registration and copy driver license.

name: Quiet spot on dirt road
description: Watch out for thorns on the ground and mud if it rains. Really sticky mud! But it was quite and no one showed up!

name: Police Station for Registration
description: You have to register(copies are done here), 780 SDG for 2

name: Willy Amad A. Mahid fixer Sawakin
description:
We recommend you use this fixer and NOT Mohamed (driving a Mercedes). 

Responds fast to emails, offers fair price. We choose differently because he would be in Egypt on the day of our departure and could not lead us through the harbor (immigration and customs). 

We were extremely disappointed in Mohamed as he lied a lot to us (see other review)!!!!

Contact details: 
Willy. Ahmad A Magid
donyamanga@yahoo.com
+249 91 231 0548

name: Motor Mart Co
description: The whole area does Toyota. These guys speak good english and sell parts. They found us a good mechanic.

name: New Ministry of Tourism and Wildlife office
description: The office you need for the photo permit is on the 2nd floor.

name: Nubian Hotel
description: Lovely new hotel. Clean shared ablutions. Friendly staff. And aircon in all rooms!! We slept inside for 350 sudanese pounds for a double room.

name: The Blue Nile Sailing Club
description:
Blue Nile Sailing Club

The place is a bit run down but it's still a great campingspot.

With a rooftop tent you can sleep on the big and secured parkinglot. 
If you have a seperate tent you can camp in the grassy kindergarten alongside the Nile.
The place is very quiet at night and around 1 AM all the lights go off.

What makes this place worthwhile are the clean bathrooms(ask them to open the new ones, not the one of the mosque) and great cold showerpressure as well as the friendly and helpful staff.

There is a fruit juice stand(SP. 25,-for a deliciously fresh banana with milk and sugar shake), a small shop with cold drinks (SP.5,- per small bottle) on the parkinglot as well and a small "restaurant"/kitchen(owner is Willem) that opens in the evening and sells foul(mashed beans).

Price is USD5,- pppn and USD10,- per car per night. Although if you sleep in a rooftop tent it might be less.

Phone: 0912569563 of Muhammed the receptionist.

With in the club. There's camping for tourists. The club is located on the nile coast. Price per person. 5$. And also per the car is 5$ And per bus our trucks. Is 10$ And motorcycle is 3$. And Children under fifteen years free. It's very close to national museum and The Forum of the Nile. And downtown. You can go to all those places. Where you don't need a taxi you can woken. The light closes at 12pm. distinguished by quite and safely. You will find everything you looking for. If you want to Inquires before. Inquiry number +249912569563. 0912569563.

name: Metemma border Ethiopia/Sudan
description:
correct location is on the right if coming into Ethiopia. 
Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

The only country in Africa where we ordered a Carnet for USD250,-(only payable in USD) beforehand with Midhat Mahir(+249 9122 53484, available on Whatssap, we highly recommend him) in Khartoum.

It is impossible to cross the border without, so we've been told by customs at the border.

A colleague of Midhat Mahir awaited us a few km in front of the border to hand us the Carnet de Passage and we were good to go.

Ethiopian exit:
Ethiopian customs are at the right side in a few small containers. They will check your TIP and car and will keep the TIP. After that there's immigration in a small container across the road, after passing the fence.  You'll get an easy stamp out.

Sudanese enter:
Before being able to pass the security guard you have to show your Carnet.
Then you can pass and go to immigration on the left hand side where you already see benches and people sitting. Go inside, they'll need a passportcopy and a copy of your Sudanese visa. Then you have to fill out a small form and they stamp you in.
