After immigration you drive further to where you can see 'customs' painted on a white wall. Park your car and enter the big building in the back.Y ou have to walk to the building in the back and then walk all the way to the back of the building and just call around until somebody answers. 
They'll check the Carnet and your car, will take a while to copy and put a signature etc. they'll ask the end destination(never say 'Israel'!). 

After that you'll get a paper that you'll have to hand over to customs when exiting the country.

The Carnet you also have to hand back to Midhat Mahir('s colleagues) when exiting, otherwise he has to pay a fine!(which already happened to him so he was a bit reluctant with helping us)
And that is that!

For any questions about the Carnet you can email us: shakuramj@gmail.com or mij.name.is.nobody@gmail.com

name: Sawakin port immigration, ferry to Saudi Arabia
description:
Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

The same Midhat Mahir(+249 9122 53484, available on Whatssap, we highly recommend him) in Khartoum that helped us getting a Carnet de Passage for Sudan, helped us with arranging a fixer(Oemar) in Sawakin to border the ferry.

Midhat forwarded our passport copies and carnet copy to our fixer Oemar and gave us his number. In the 2 days we drove up from Khartoum to Sawakin, Oemar already arranged our ferry tickets.

Exiting Sudan:
When arriving in Sawakins port we called Oemar and he arrived within 10 minutes to help us. He needed our passports and carnet, explained a little bit and was on his way very quick and fast. After 3 hours we could drive up to the ferry and handed over the Sudanese carnet to Oemar so he would send it back to Midhat.

You have to leave the car key in the car for the drivers to drive the car in and out of the ferry(nothing was stolen).

The ferrytickets for 2 people incl. the car and Oemar's services costed us SP.4600,- 

We were happy with the service of both Midhat and Oemar. We advice to book a fixer via Midhat, as you'll know for sure you will not be disappointed and arrange a fixed price.

Entering Saudi:
We arrived around 10AM and left the ferry 11AM to go through immigration very easily. No need to fill out a form.

After that the waiting for customs began; after 2 hours there were 2 men that handed over port clearance papers(SR. 270,- but you can pay in USD and can also exchange USD with them if no other option) with which you'd be able to arrange a TIP(free) and insurance(min. a week for SR.140,-). After arranging all the paperwork we had to wait another 3.5 hours for the cars to finally be cleared. From that moment on it goes very fast; they drive up your car and you can check real quick before you get in and drive off.

name: Something in Arabic
description: Nice local restaurant with picture menu and prices in English numbers. We got egg rolls and coffee for breakfast. Tree to park under shade and quiet for people not traffic. Petrol station about 400 m away.

name: Far Best Automotive Service +249912304675
description: Abdu salaam is a very helpful guy who will go out of his way to help you with anything. We found a series of great reviews about him on Horizon blog and they weren't wrong. We also slept in his yard where there's is a toilet and shower although very basic (room with bucket) for free. He found a doctor for my girlfriend to see at his house and we even stayed one night with his family and ate his wife's delicious food. Highly recommended for basic mechanics. We got our brakes done, an oil change, air con regased and a new ignition.

name: Awlad Mubarak
description: Great mechanic knows his land cruiser engines very well if you need any serious work he's your man. +249912366978

name: Olla hotel
description: The real Olla hotel is located in a quiet part of town. Parking for cars is on the street under the tree but the bikes were allowed to stand behind the gate in the tiny courtyard. Paid SP250 for a double bed room. Basic hotel, hard bed and no WiFi. We were here during the riots on December and this part of town was quiet. The big hotel had had it’s windows smashed the day before so we didn’t feel safe there. According to a local 2 people died here on Friday on the bridge after clashes between the rioters and the police. There was a curfew imposed on the city starting at 19:30. We didn’t notice much of this until our friend told us. Stay safe!

name: Merowe Land Tourist Village
description: Great place with hot showers at a very reasonable 800 to 1000 Sudanese Pounds a night. Good place for a break from camping!

name: Syrian Castle Restaurant
description: Good food and value in downtown, with lots of menu choices. Dinner options for 40-90sp.

name: Several LR / Toyota Parts Shops
description: There are several parts shops and mechanics on this street. For LR, call 0912-340-898

name: Blanco's Defender Workshop
description: Installed master brake cylinder. shop full of defenders. no sign in front.

name: Private Bush Camping
description:
Away from the pyramids, away from the road noise, away from the people selling stuff, all alone and very safe. Just to the east of the hotel and north of the pyramids, out of sight and very private. Beautiful stargazing. FREE

They wanted $20 pp for pyramids, or 300 pp.  We got 300sp for both, but it took some effort. Amazing at sunset. 

4 hour drive from Khartoum

name: Chicken & Juice  Place
description: Good BBQ chicken and fresh juice. We split 1 order of chicken which was plenty for 2, 100sp + drinks. Very friendly people.

name: A big hotel with grand entrance
description:
ADMIN NOTE (21-3-2018): now with correct coordinates

Feels like you're entering the grounds of a palace. Multi story beige hotel at south end of town with big rooms, elevator, ceiling fan, and secure parking. 200sp double, very basic

name: Land Rover spare parts
description:
A rare workshop/spare parts shop selling Land Rover spare parts.
Contact: Ali Gomaa Balal 
Mobile: 0912733477
Landline: +249/23006552

name: Blue building cafeteria
description: Lunch/foodstop, chicken, eggs, falafel and baklava. Owner speaks a little English. Basic but good and cheap.

name: Border Egypt Sudan
description:
Fixer - you can do without, but worth the cost.  First time in 20 years (and over 200 crossings, 20 in Africa) we used fixers.   On Sudanese side, customs didn't want to talk to us and it was hard to find English speaking people. 

Sudan - Mazar +249-122-380-740

Egypt- Jamel +201010899250, 200EP
new number from Kamal
+201100504841

name: Border Sudan to Ethiopia step 1 Security check
description: Small office 50 meters off main road just check passport

name: Basic guesthouse
description: Basic guesthouse, nothing special but the owner has a boat to go to the soleb temple. Paid 200 for a double and 200 for the boat to soleb for 2 persons.(could probably been cheaper if we negotiated)

name: Bush camp
description: Camped behind a little hill close to the road, nobody noticed.

name: Ahmed Mousa hostel
description: Quiet clean hostel for 300sdp ($3 blackmarket) for two people. Call Ahmed Mousa at 0912 585 462 (he was at the museum when we called). We had the whole place for ourselves. Parking only on the quiet street in front of the house.

name: Camel race track
description: You can get to camel race tracks if you turn off the tarmac here and keep heading to the east on dirt tracks, until you will see the gates and tracks, about 10-20 km away from here. The race is on Friday or Saturday (maybe only once in a month?), very early morning - ask in advance when is a race. Abdulsalam of Farbest auto service center might find out for you.

name: Nub Kush Tourist registration and permits
description:
Sudan tour information and Archaeological trips in to the sudan desert. 

Moez Mahir.
+249 912972571
Suq Al Arabi
Said Abd Al Rhman St
West of Oilibya Gas station
Sati Building

name: power station guard house
description:
Small building with solar panals fenced off next to a house
The two guards set up beds for us outside under the stars. They chilled with us and made us some tea in the morning. Great place to stop if you are running out of daylight and need a safe place to sleep.

name: wild camp
description: Rocky outcrop just off the road. Good spot to camp.

name: Ertiah Hotel
description: Nice establishment on the nile river. Rooms are clean and well kept and avalable for 600sp. We spoke to the manager and organised to camp in the parking lot for 250sp (4 people).

name: Rocky Desert
description: Flat patch of rocky desert. Great spot for stargazing and close to a nice restaurant.

name: Koka Ferry
description: Ferry crossing the nile. It has a capacity to transport 4 cars, 3 motorcycles and 6 donkeys. They charge 40sp for a car and 15sp for a motorcycle.

name: Castle
description: Remenence of a stone castle on top of the hill overlooking the nile. Not much left of the castle but the view on top is great.

name: Kerma ruins
description: Old mud hut inhabited by swallows. Not much left of the building.

name: fantastic modern restaurant
description: great restaurant, ac, modern, full menu, super nice and clean.  just opened.  reasonable priced

name: Ethiopia Embassy (correct location)
description:
correct location. google was on other side of cemetery. Great at bunchofbackpackers.com


Get there before opening as they only have limited slots or you will have to come back tomorrow 
come as early as possible but at least before 8 am

name: Old fuel station and truck parking
description:
We found this place safe. A few broken trucks parked here but also transport companies use it as a sleep over. Someone knocked at the door just after dark, we said hello and shook hands ,all good. Tyre repair shop near by.
.

name: Karima market
description: Several eateries and shops on the market, about the only eating option in Karima.

name: Abri petrol station
description: No petrol on the main road but this station had petrol.

name: Kassala Hotel
description: 120 for fan room - shared bathrooms - can bring motorbike into lobby for night

name: Marafy Hotel
description: 150 SDP for fan twin ensuite. 24hr guard and good parking for motorbikes etc. Next to petrol station and very near bus station

name: Rocky hill wild camp
description: Dried river bed in between two rocky hills. Semi out of sight from the road and the hill provides some shelter from the wind.

name: Dried up pond
description: Small dried up pond hidden from the road. nice flat ground for camping. peaceful and quite.

name: Quiet desert camp near Wadi Halfa
description: A good place to stay for one night in the desert. It’s hidden behind some rocks. Just 4 km from Wadi Halfa. Just follow the tracks into the desert, 4x4 necessary.

name: Friday Wrestling Arena
description: Sudanese wrestling Fridays only from 4pm until Sunset - S£ 10 per person, good show !

name: Shisha place and Sports on Tv
description: Shisha is still running besides the ban if you’re looking to watch tv and sports too this is the place !

name: Market - Food & Shisha
description: Best options to eat and kill some time around a Shisha - bus stop to Egypt

name: Sahara Desert wildcamp
description: There are no villages along the road between Karima and Dongola, so you can really camp anywhere. We found some rocky dunes to camp behind. Very windy during the day but the wind died down at nightfall. Totally quiet and gorgeous night sky.

name: Argin
description:
Border Crossing EGYPT - SUDAN
Very good alternative to Wadi Halfa Crossing. 
24 hours open.

name: Ozone
description: Very nice modern western style  place where you can enjoy a selection of pastries, fresh juices, salads, Quiche, ice cream and more. There’s an outdoor seating area as well as an AC regulated inside restaurant. No longer WiFi. Enjoy!

name: Wild Camp in the mountains
description: Beautiful secluded place in a dry river bed in the mountains. Nice view and very quiet. Coming from the north is no problem, but we came from the south and ended up driving the wrong way when the (unmarked) road becomes one way for 6.5km, then we turned onto the dirt track. You could potentially do the same as it’s a pretty big road and it seems like many people go the wrong way. But be warned.

name: Excellent fixer for ferry to Saudi
description:
Hamido is an excellent fixer for the ferry to Jeddah. He speaks good English, was very responsive and professional and everything went smoothly as promised. He even helped us find diesel during the massive shortage. He also does tours and can help with whatever else you might need. Highly recommended. 
‭+249 (0) 91 234 1234‬
hamido_basil@yahoo.com

name: Maks cargo service (Turkish airlines)
description: We airfreight our motorcycles with Turkish Airlines from Khartoum to Istanbul. This is the location office (13). We paid in total 662 usd for 2 motorcycles (excl. costs in İstanbul). For all details we write an article on our website www.oneroadoneworld.com (very detailed).

name: MTN Store
description: There is a good MTN store, you can buy local SIM Card and Data Volume for Internet

name: Tuttifrutti
description: Italian Café with the best ice cream in Khartoum

name: Shopping mall
description: A decent shopping mall with all the goodies you might need. Also in the area is a bunch of other shops that are in the area surrounding the mall

name: Dunlop Zone (workshop and sale)
description: Quit new workshop and sales of Dunlop. The also speak english very well. Did wheel balancing here. They also do oil change, alignment and sell Dunlop tires. Balancing 4 tires was 320S£ so with black market exchange this time 8$.

name: Immigration for ferry to Saudi
description:
For beeing up to date:

Got my ticket for the ferry at one of the many offices in Suakin. The price was 6500Sudan£. That‘s for a Jeep and one person. With the actual black market rate it is about 150$. People in Khartoum and Port Sudan asked for 350$ so better pay in Sudan£. I arrived on saturday and took the ferry on sunday evening. On Sudnay morning I went back to the office for registering my ticket for this day. 

At 2pm I drove up to the port, show your ticket at the gate. After that ride to the customs building just 100m left. They take you carnet and give you some letter in arabic. After that continue straight on the termac road. You will come to another gate, turn left on the dirt road until you come to the next gate. Here you park your car and go for immigration. Three different steps for the exit stamp. At first in the big building straight and after that the small building on the other side of the outdoor hall. Pay 45Sudan£ for some „exit ticket“. After collecting two stamps on the form and the „ticket“ you are ready for the passport stamp inside the big building again. 

After being a stamp collector you can drive your car in the area for boarding ;).

No fixer needed. Police is also speaking english sometimes and friendly.

Be aware that in august and end of july it can be very busy because of Hajj season.

name: Crimson Lights
description: Middle class hotel complex with several buildings, garden, restaurant, secure parking. We paid 80 US dollar for a small but clean double room with bathroom, buffet breakfast included (price in SDG would have been 1300).

name: Aldaman Hotel Nyala
description: Modern, clean business hotel with restaurant. Parking in front of the hotel. We paid 960 SDG for a clean double room with bathroom and breakfast.

name: Almuallem Hotel
description: 300 Pounds the night. Neither clean nor working working toilet.

name: Civil and Passport Registration
description:
Alien registration possible, but takes ages. It took us about 2h and even had to take the police officer for a spin to another station for some more stamps. But in the end everything worked. Was 580 p. P.
Actually copy of passport possible on site (first office after entrance)

name: unknown name petrol station
description: Has Benzine. Finally! There's another one about 6km out in direction to Karima, which has only Diesel

name: Adel Hotel
description: Good, clean hotel but comes at a price. Has WiFi, toilet and shower en-suite. Rate 900-1100. Lots of parking space in front. Bicycles can go in room.

name: Al Abara Hotel
description:
Actually it's probably the nicest place around. Checked the other two places prior to this. Price is ridiculously high (1500 for one night). The parking space is gated. Check rooms before you check-in. Some have no toilet seats, other have no running water. It's ridiculous. It would be so easy to brush this place up.
On the fun side: it was probably the best check in that took me the longest time ever.

name: Al Marfa Hotel
description: Nice double rooms with shower, kettle, AC and fan in the room. Restaurant also on site. Paid 400 sudanese pounds per night. Enormous rooms with two bedrooms 550 Sudanese pounds per night. parking in front on the street but there is a guard and cameras

name: Wildcamp in borrowpit
description: Quite place located in an abandoned borrow pit approx. 200 m from the road. Access road and site on firm ground. Can be accessed during rains.

name: Desert wildcamp
description:
Beautiful place in the middle of nowhere. No people, no water, no facilities. Nothing but hills, sand and rocks. And bugs.
Reachable probably only with a 4x4 vehicle as the track towards it is sometimes deep sand.
We spend a wonderful, quiet night here.

name: Restaurant at the Blue Nile (name unknown)
description: Very good food in a fantastic setting looking over the Blue Nile. Prices are not bad at all and service is very good. We had to point to other table to choose our food where the menu was completely in Arabic, but there's always very nice Sudanese people around who want to help you with the translation :) There's no parking for cars though. We had the chance of parking our motorbikes inside at the entrance.

name: BBQ Chicken (Sign is in Arabic)
description:
This is a great BBQ chicken shop that is on the left-hand side as you’re driving into Dongola’s main road. It has a red sign with yellow writing in Arabic (see photo).

It cost us SDG120 (USD7) for a whole chicken stuffed with garlic rice that comes with bread and a spicy, hot pepper sauce. It can easily be shared between two. There’s a place to the left of the restaurant where you can wash your hands. If you need the toilet there’s one to the left of the hand-washing station, but you have to go through some gates into what looks like a school courtyard with benches. Head to the right and there’s a very simple toilet in the corner.

name: (Scam) checkpoint
description: Guard wanted SDG 2,500 for some form of ticket. On asking for a receipt with his name on it, he went to the hut, spoke very briefly to someone, and then waved us through. DON'T PAY ANYTHING!

name: Electricity mast, hidden place
description:
Nice place 50 kilometers before the border. 
There is a dirt road on your right hand, go in, under the electricity mast there is a road to the left follow and you find a nice sheltered place.

name: APSCO
description: We got diesel here. One of the few places between Wadi Halfa and Khartoum. Very long queue. Went directly to the office and had a little help of a friend

name: Speed limited
description: Warming, they controle your speed here (60???). Even if you don’t drive to fast they will say you drive too fast. You have to pay $170 sdp.

name: Desert camp
description: Just of the road behind a dune. No people, no bugs, just you and the stars.

name: Diesel station
description: Diesel station near Delgo, coming from Wadi Halfa it’s after a police checkpoint to the right. It looks deserted but there was somebody there! And no line!

name: Diesel station
description: This place had diesel, they only wanted to tank jerrycans.

name: Diesel station
description: SANAPIL fuel station. Only Diesel available

name: Police Station
description: Not the best place for camp but that's ok for rest the night in a safety place. Policemen are nice but don't speak english

name: Nubian Desert behind an adobe wall
description: Wild camping in the Nubian Desert behind an adobe wall. Nice spot in the Desert not far from the main road. Save from wind

name: Nubian's Desert
description: Camping behind dunes, near the road but not at the main view

name: Bush camp
description: Half way Naqa temple, between the trees. Beautiful setting. BUT our cover of the rooftop tent got stolen at night. It was the only thing we left outside the car. We saw a couple of farmers during the day and some lights at night so some must have come back to roam around while we slept.

name: Diesel station
description: This place has diesel. Huge line, ask for help.

name: Beneath the road
description: The road passes over a dry river bed. Easy to get down to, out of sight. Good place if travelling with bicycle.

name: Hotel al-Nasr
description: Clean room with private western toilet, 300 SDG. Two bicycles easily fit inside after removing one of the four beds. The beds are cafeteria style, but with mattress. Quiet. Very friendly people. You have to visit the security police (مركز الامن) yourself for registration at 18.542034, 31.843348

name: lookout over wohle pyramids
description: here you have the best view of all pyramids, perfect for sunset and sunrise! you can camp at the bottom of the hill and climb it for superb views

name: Lord Hotel
description:
Moderator note: User reports "The correct location is around the corner on the 'main' street. Yellow entrance. The orange building is not the hotel"
Basic guesthouse. 150 SDG per night for room with private bathroom (no western toilet, cold water only), cleaning.

name: Diesel
description: diesel gas station, a local brought us here because no other petrol station had diesel . long queue because at this moment the only place with diesel

name: tombs of el kuru
description:
you can see two tombs, one with we'll preserved painting, in the other you see an altar but no colorful paintings, 

10 dollar or 300 pounds for 2 person

name: nuri pyramids
description:
a couple of pyramids, some well maintained others not,
you are the only person on this world heritage site 
we paid 200 pounds for 2 
you can bargain about the price 
nice here to do funny pictures with the pyramids 😀

name: Embassy of Djibuti
description:
visa for djibouti!
next possibility is Addis far away from border crossing etiopia to djibouti! so if you want to go get your visa here

name: steel worker
description:
can do metal welding! very nice people that can not speak english! 

tarek was again our translater who also helped us with the mechanics BLANCO , 
if you have trouble come here, honest and friendly people 

tarek telephone number:
0912158333
(see also mechanic landrover, tarek knows a lot of people who are able to help you with any problem of your vehicle, when he is not picking up just tell that they should call tarek, he lives in an outskirt in omdourmani and may be it takes a little bit of time, but waiting is worth because he speaks english well and can translate and will definitely be able to help you!!! 
even when he is not answering the phone try to go to the mechanic blanco or this place and they will call him!)

name: Wild camp between the trees
description: A nice wild camp between thorn trees, not far from security checkpoint. Asked there if we could camp in this bush, they said no problem. Nobody disturbed us.

name: Delgo Hospital
description:
Ask for the Delgo Hospital. I was trying to find a place to sleep in Delgo, when I came across the hospital. I asked to a doctor if I could pitch my tent, and I was offered to sleep in the unused (?) mosque of the hospital, instead. 
The room has electricity. 
The toilet I could go to was far from being clean, and had no door.

name: The Nile Hotel
description:
Small hotel with three rooms. The hotel opened in July 2018. The rooms and the bedding are clean. Asked price is 100 pp/night. You end up paying 200 if you take a room for yourself. The rooms aren't big, but you can store your bicycle in the room if you want to. 

The shower only has cold water. 

Finding the hotel isn't easy as you have to first enter a gate  between two buildings, before  accessing to the entrance of the hotel. 

The hotel is next to the bank and opposite the ferry and a small fruit market.

name: Diesel and Petrol
description:
Gas station with green banner, sign is in arabic. This gas station has diesel and petrol, we are travelling on two bikes and the locals where really friendly letting us skip the line. 

A few km before we got offered petrol from the black market by a rate of 100sdg per litre, which we refused. At this gasstation you can get 1l = 6,45sdg.

name: Besides Wadi Halfa
description: Beautiful wildcamp spot behind a hill off the main highway. Take the track off leading into the desert and turn left after the first rocky hill tracking around until you are in the sandy part. Hidden from the road, but you can still hear it.

name: Diesel, no benzine
description: Long lines for the diesel and even though we were told there was supposed to be benzine here we were unlucky.

name: Petrol
description: Long queue. It means that there is a petrol like yesterday. Sometimes gasoline is long queue and diesel is without. Just ask around and try.

name: Camp under the trees
description: Wild camp in a dry river next to a couple of trees. You can see the road but probably nobody see you. High mountains around. And what is important it's not so hot in here. Very nice for camp.

name: bush camp
description: very nice place for camping next to the lake. Go further in the lake direction and you will find nice places fir camping. Close to the village but very friendly people. In the morning they come to the lake with their cows so early wake up :)

name: Border Sudan-Ethiopia customs step 2
description: after checking passport you need to come here to do the customs exit with your CDP (triptik). quick check of number of the car, form no 25 which you got in the entrance to Sudan and you get your stamp. Then go to immigration which is around 60 m further in Ethiopiam direction, last building.

name: Border Sudan to Ethiopia step 3
description: coming from Ethiopia it is a small blue building on the left side. Customs is about 50m further a building with 3 flags in front. You can make alien registration at immigration office direct. No need to do it in karthoum it is 740 sp pp now. for immigration you need 1 copy of visa and of your passport, Plus one Passport-Photo for the alien registration.

name: check point
description: just passport control, asking about gun, easy

name: Nile petroleum
description: We were able to find petrol at this station, long lines off course but there is a separate line for motorcycles so we were able to skip most of it and be finished in 10 minutes. No diesel.

name: Local Sudanese Ful Restaurant
description: Really good local resraurant with excellent ful and good prices. It is located on the other side of the street from the Blue Nile Sailing Club, oposite of the chicken fast food place. Priceys are pretty cheap. ~50sdg per person.

name: Official Toyota Service & Sales
description:
The official Toyota service and sales center in Khartoum. Opening hours: 07:30-15:30. No reservation is needed, just roll in as early as possible. Starting to be more people at 9:00. 

Park in the parking spots outside, go into the office and state your business, the representative will then tell the guards to open the gate for you to drive in.

name: Camp behind dunes
description:
Hidden behind the dunes. As it’s close to Khartoum there are more people around than further out in the desert. However, we hid behind dunes and no one came anywhere close or could even been seen. 

Nice solid surface to camp on and a quite easy path from the main road. 

Can get a bit windy as the desert is really flat.

name: Camp behind dunes
description:
One of few places with some dunes to hide behind on a long stretch of very flat landscape. 

Even if looks like desert, this is actually farmland and there are irrigation systems to water the crops. You may hear noise from pumps/generators from a far. If you’re elevated (e.g have a roof top tent) you may be seen from a distance. 

When breaking up camp and going out to the main road again, we met the owner of the land, a super friendly guy and if we’d met him before setting up camp we probably would have end up in his house for the night. 

There’s a sand access road leading almost all the way up to the campsite. The road has a few patches of soft sand, so make sure you’ve sufficient speed and air down if you’re heavily loaded.

name: Alneel hôtel
description: Very Cheap place, dormitory for 30 Sudanese pounds. Cold shower.

name: Ruins camp
description: If it s windy, the place it’s good with ruins

name: Hôtel in Atbara
description:
Clean room with A/C for 300 Sdp
Nice staff

name: Diesel station
description: Had diesel at Jan 4th 2019. No line early in the morning

name: Pension Khartoum 2
description:
Cheap place to stay. 


Bike in room. I payed 200 Sdp for 1 room with 2 beds ( I m alone, maybe price little bit different if you r 2)

It s not easy to find because nothing write. It s small door in front of Kak restaurant .

name: Sudanese Customs Office
description:
If you are late or they need time to stamp the carnet and it's dark now, they allow you to camp in the yard of the customs
office. All officials are very friendly. There are restaurants around.

name: Riverbank of the Blue Nile
description: Leave the main road at the checkpoint north of Wad Madani and follow  the track to the Nile. You will find nice places without dust, directly at the steep slope, with an amazing view over the Nile. Some  people passed, just friendly greeting, nobody disturbs us. Sunrise above the water...

name: Gas Filling Station
description: The first Filling Station with gas available since Ethiopian Border! 100 SP for 5kg

name: MAN Workshop
description: Very friendly stuff, helped us immediately. Workshop will change 2020 to a new place.

name: Rafa Travel & Tourism Agency
description: Here we booked the ferry from Suakin to Jiddah. Price was 14.500 SP for our truck and 4.000 SP per person.

name: Border post
description: After crossing from Ethiopia to Sudan it was late afternoon we camped at the border in a big parking lot very quite & peaceful & obviously very safe with the guards .

name: MTN shop
description:
MTN shop for SIM card & data 
Helpful & efficient 
Spoke a little English

name: Afra Mall
description:
Afra Shopping Mall  Khartoum good supermarket with lots of essentials, good butcher & deli reasonably priced. Also a few coffee shops, MTN shop & cinema.
Good parking available

name: Sanabil Diesel
description:
Diesel available  long queues here in Karima 
The security guard let us get to the front of the  long queue , all smooth & orderly 
5.12 pounds per litre !

name: Musawwarat Es Sufra Site
description: Big site, fenced and guy that showed up said $20 USD per person, then came down to 500sp for three people. He's just making it up.

name: Rocky Desert Wild
description:
Could not find anything on the river that was not farmed or densely populated.
Followed good tire tracks to this small canyon to shelter from relentless wind, which did stop overnight but started again at 8 am.
Locals are back here getting gravel, but I didn't see anyone or any vehicles.
Great view of big mountain.

name: Petrol
description: Station behind. Lots of Petrol, no line, easy. No diesel at time.

name: Continental hotel
description:
An old colonial hotel close to the Nile.
500 for a double with working AC, fridge, plugs, cold shower and OK European style toilet

Selling point is the whole vibe of this hotel. It has a nice beautiful garden and a restaurant in the front which sells Shwoarma, fish sandwiches, chicken..
Also fresh juice available and within reach of the hotels Wifi

name: Greek Club
description: Nice place to rest. Many (only) expats. Quite western style. There is a swimming pool, soccer and basket. Quite cheap. Nice on Friday.

name: Karima's pyramids
description: A must to see if you are around. Nice pyramids next to the road. Free. 10minutes it's enough. Good spot to take some pics with your vehicle too and pyramids.

name: Dismissed small house
description:
Good for cyclist to spend the night. 

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Wild camp in dry pond
description: Dry pond, out of sight of the road. Just 100 from the main road.

name: Tyre Repair
description:
MAN Khartoum recommend this place.
Repaired serious puncture to Michelin XLX. Excellent job, 1600 Sudan Pounds.

name: Petrified Forest
description: Worth to see and you can camp in the desert.

name: Hotel Red Sea Resort
description: Very peaceful place, they offer a campground for USD 10 per person, using toilet and shower. Diving Center, electricity availabel

name: Luxor Laundry
description: Wash all clothes, no underwear. Very quicklebendig cost doubble Price.

name: park
description: free camping. there are shadows, many trees, goats and monkeys

name: Cold drinks
description: Cold drinks. Enough said. Have a rest.  Cheers!

name: Bush camp
description: Following the only path/road you see on your right on the main road and you will arrive here. Relatively out of sight. Watch of for thorns. Probably only for people travelling by bicycle for other vehicles the path might be too narrow or you will be visible but you could go deeper. MTN E signal.

name: Bush camp
description:
Quiet bush camp. A little close to the road but at night no traffic. 
There is a double track that leads to a field I used that to enter and then pick a spot. The land is very dry and with lots of cracks but there are a few even places.

name: Off by 1km
description: It’s one km down the road. Plenty of food choices (fast food) and cold drinks.

name: Wad Morah Cafeteria
description: Big cafeteria with little store. Only a couple of beds available. Lots of tables and seats.

name: Several shops and cafeterias
description: Lots of cafeterias with seats and beds. Food and cold drinks.

name: Small cafeteria with small shop
description:
Usual cafeteria. Got here in the dark not sure there is something better around. They had no cold drinks. 
Usual food. Lots of beds.

name: Roadside Refreshments
description: Few cafeteria and shops. Cold drinks and food available.

name: Adobe walls
description: Here you can pitch your tent sheltered from the desert’s winds. Also while being close to the road you won’t be seen.

name: food and cots
description:
Food and drinks available although not cold. 
Few beds.

name: food and cots
description: Usual Cafeterias and cots. Very cold (iced) drinks in the shop towards the end (towards Khartoum). If you wanna spend the night on one of usual bed the best a quite place is past all the cafeterias another 50/100 on the left there is a cafeteria very quiet. No cold drinks here tho.

name: Big Cafeteria
description:
Big cafeteria. Lots of food and plenty of cold drinks. Lots of bed available if you wanna spend the night.
It’s one of the bus stops.

name: Big cafeteria
description:
Big cafeteria where bus stops for a break. Exposed to wind and dust. 
Possibly there are better options on the other side of the road. 
Lots of beds available. 
Lesser known local soft drinks available. IE Sudan Cola

name: Cafeteria
description:
Nice place. Unfortunately no cold drinks.
You could arrive here in the dark and spend the night. A few beds available. Large courtyard to camp too.

name: Cafetería
description: Cafeteria. Cold drinks. Bed available. If you arrive lTe and it looks all closed go to the far end there is a little garden and that’s where the keepers put his bed.

name: Road side cafeteria
description:
Road side cafeteria with little mosque next to it and petrol station. 
Food and cold drinks available. I’m sure there are beds around but I was here in the afternoon and only saw a couple of ones. I’d be surprised they don’t have more available stored somewhere.

name: Cafeteria
description: Roadside cafeteria. Beds available. They have a generator so sometimes cold drinks depending how lucky you are.

name: Cafeteria
description:
Road side cafeteria.
Cold drinks (maybe because of the generator on during the evening. 
Food available plenty of space to spend the night. Beds should be available but can’t confirm as I stopped to rest and have some food.

name: Cafeteria
description: Roadside cafeteria with food and cold drinks. Beds available. Convenient store.  There is another place a little further if you’re heading north or a little before if you’re heading south.

name: Cafeteria
description:
Roadside cafeteria with shop. 
Food available and beds. The shop has frozen like drinks!

name: Cafeteria
description:
There are two cafeteria. This one is the first on if you’re heading north or the second one if you’re heading south. 
Run by a sweet gentleman who can’t speak properly for some conditions and his wife and daughters. It’s the first time I see a cafeteria run by women. 
Food available, beds but sadly limited choice of cold drinks when I got here in the middles of a sand storm.

name: Cafetería
description:
Roads side cafeteria. 
Food and cold drinks available. 
Lots of beds.

name: Cafeterias
description: Lot of Cafeterias. Food, cold drinks and beds. Several convenient stores too.

name: Cafeteria
description:
Roadside cafeteria. 
Food and cold drinks available. 
Convenient store. 
Beds and matted floor space available.

name: Meroe Pyramids Wild Camp
description: Behind a dune next to a small tree behind the pyramids and out of sight.  No one to bother you and perfect spot for the night.  In bye morning a very polite camel rider allowed us a ride and pics for 200 sp and a vendor arrived on a donkey selling various souvenirs but not pushy at all.

name: Behind dunes
description: 200 km before Argeen Border to Egypt.  Off the main road a few hundred metres. Hidden from sight and perfect stopover

name: Nubian Guesthouse Camping
description:
Good place to stay next to the Nile. (You can go for a swim there) The owner is a very friendly and helpful guy. He can help you with mechanics and people in town. 
Toilet and shower clean but basic. We were aloud to camp in front of the guest house.

name: Mecca
description: Clean rooms with western toilet, shower, fan and air conditioning, and WIFI

name: New turn off for Naqa Temple.
description: This is a new road into the temple. Good tar road for most of the way makes it a quick trip in.

name: Rocky outcrop
description: About 200 metres off the road behind a rocky outcrop. It was very quiet and no one around for miles.

name: Kangan Hotel
description: A big hotel which was quite busy. 300SP per night for two people in a room with two beds and a shower and toilet. Fairly clean and reasonably comfortable. There is no food served here so you have to go up into the town.

name: Half moon hotel
description:
Now called DMD Hotel. Friendly manager and staff who speak English. New and clean hotel. 7,000 SDP per night but might be able to negotiate. With good AC and fridge, TV, slow Wifi. Nice location. Laundry for 100 SDP per clothing item. Kitchen upstairs you can use.
We are traveling by bike. They keep our bikes in the safe place near the reception.

name: kerma museum and main Dufofa
description:
main Dufofa (old temple)
surprisingly nice museum with great statues of the black pharaohs. a 20mn movie explains many things about the place.
they asked 15$ for entrance fee for our family (we have 3 children), we paid 400SP to encourage preservation of their heritage.

name: Best Foul
description: Really good food, fresh bread and falafels

name: Atbara-Karima crossing
description: Many food places, cold drinks and groceries.

name: Dodi
description: The shwarma I ordered at this restaurant is the single best meal I’ve had in 6 months of traveling from Cape Town to Sudan

name: Ruins
description: Stoned ruins in case of windy weather. 50 meters from road

name: Chai stop
description: Little family, they make chai and I guess some food.

name: Quiet bush camp close to Migre village
description:
Wide flat area with bushes and rocks to hide from the road. Easy access.

Convenient stop for cyclists coming from Al Qadarif and going to Al Fao. There’s a small village about 4 km East where you can stop to have dinner and stock up with water and biscuits.

I met a young shepherd while trying to find a place to pitch my tent. He was very polite and helpful (big thing coming from Ethiopia) and recommended me to go behind the rocks to get away from the wind and the traffic noise. I had a very calm and pleasant night under the stars, the first one since Kenya.

name: Camping in a Gas Station
description:
It was night and a couple of truck drivers were sleeping on their cots next to their vehicles. I pulled over with my bicycle and asked the security guy if I could pitch my tent. He said yes, but insisted on giving me one of those cots Sudanese people love and I ended up sleeping on it under the big roof. 

A little noisy because of the road but not too bad. Nice breeze coming from the river.

name: Bicycle Mechanics and Spare Parts
description: Many bicycle mechanics and little shops. Ask for Adam, he’s very good and don’t cheat.

name: Falafels
description: Good English speaking falafel guy, from Egypt.

name: Many food places
description: Lots of food places and trucks stopping.

name: Foreigner Permit Step 2
description: This is the location for the second step of the foreigner registration process. After you fill out the form at the window on the right side of the departure terminal, the person will tell you to go pay and get the stamp at the immigration office nearby. This is the place.

name: El Kawther Hotel
description:
Basic hotel. You get a room only for US$30 - non negotiable! 
I had no choice as my motorbike had broken down and I needed somewhere quiet and “safe” to fix it. Was dropped here by guys who gave me a lift. 
No drink and no food. 
A/c in twin bed room with shower which dribbled water. Acceptably clean, just. 
If you’re stuck, your stuck; otherwise go elsewhere.

name: Zain
description: Get your data SIM card here. Cheap and fast.

name: Currency Exchange
description: Black market rates. Ask Ahamed at western Union or speak to the guy selling cigarettes.

name: Bicycle repair
description: 2 shops with bicycle spares, repair and new.

name: After/before Gadarif
description: Checkpoint friendly. Did not stop me and I continued to Doka.

name: Cafeterias and petrol
description: Cafeterias, eating and drinking. Petrol station with cold drinks. It is in the entrance of Doka Town.

name: Meroë Pyramids Turn-off
description:
Turn off to pyramids N of Kabushiya. Look out for bird’s wings sign! Follow road round hill to the tourist Centre which, for some reason, is completely hidden from view. 

Entry fees S£225.

name: Last Resort Hotel
description:
Definitely a place to use only in dire need. 

Asked S£700 for a filthy room with a disgusting toilet/shower and no water. Fan worked, air in didn’t. I negotiated down to £500 which was still about 5 times too much. 

There is a reasonable kitchen as some international contract workers live here and have installed it; they will let you share if you ask.

name: Ferry offices for ticket to Jeddah
description:
At these offices, are located on right and left about 150m after you turn off the Port Sudan road towards the port. It is just before first block of pink shops. 

Here I got a first class ticket (I didn’t ask, they just gave it to me), which included a cabin,  for me and bike for S£14,000 (US$187). 

My passport was checked, I got 2 white forms to complete and my carnet was photographed and sent somewhere. 

All very efficiently done in about 30 mins

Open at 7am but some cannot sell ticket until 9 am

name: Suakin  Nr Port
description:
A fish restaurant right on sea front, serving fish with rice or bread. 

Fish was delicious - S£120 per fish. 

Good place to wait for ferry. Easy access for bikes and lots of space for bigger things. You could probably overnight here too, but no facilities

name: Ferry to Al Qadarif
description: If you are coming from Ethiopia into Sudan through the small Humera border crossing, your only option to cross the river to Al Qadarif is this ferry.  Not sure what their exact schedule is. I was told it would leave at 5pm. Got there late around 5:30pm, there were a couple trucks waiting, and we ended up leaving at 7:30pm. I think I paid around 2USD. This place is in the middle of nowhere, at the end of a 4x4 track that looks like it will take you nowhere. If you get lost ask someone for “benton”, this is what the locals call this. Nobody speaks English but they will point to where you have to go if you say that. When you get there, you will see a small shack selling drinks and snacks. Lost a full day looking for this place so hopefully this helps!

name: Border Post
description: A good alternative to the main crossing at Metema. If you’re coming from Ethiopia, your passport and carnet have to be stamped for exit at the immigration and customs office in Humera (two different locations in Humera), they can’t do it at the border. Very nice and honest people. No fees to get into Sudan. Maybe a very small fee to get out of Ethiopia with receipt, can’t remember exactly.

name: Al Sharif pharmaceutical factory
description: You can see the ruins of the so called chemical weapon factory that the USA bombed to pieces. Interesting to read about it, not too much to see but worth the visit for the site to remember. Very friendly watchman speaks good English and is happy to show you the site and explain. No money asked

name: 6. Cataract, local restaurants
description: Beautiful peaceful place right at the Nile, 6. Cataract. Some local small restaurants offer very good grilled fish and other food. Camping posible right at the river without fee. Boat trip one hour for 1000 SP, maybe negotiable. Toilets available, showers not. Mobile reception good.

name: Registration of the passport, Immigration
description: Friendly officers, take 3 h, cost 535 SDP plus 250 SDP (Government Tax), both with official receipt and Computer registration.

name: Orbis, Mercedes
description: Very helpful. We could park here our car for 4 weeks

name: Roadside Cafeteria
description: Very good roadside cafeteria with food, incl mutton, coffee, tea and above all freshly pressed orange juice. Just went for a quick stop, but there are typical beds too and plenty of space to pitch a tent.

name: Roadside Cafeteria
description: Stayed here for the night. Another great Cafeteria. Drinks, tea, coffee, variety of food, Shisha. There’s a tank-based shower that’s potentially warm too! Was empty when I was here though. The staff said it was just bad timing. Toilets. Camped behind the place, secure from sun and wind.

name: Cafeterias and Shops
description: Arrived here on a 38°C day and was euphoric to find a tray full of ice, bottled water and Coca Cola. Small shops, usual food and tea. The first roadside place after Wad Madani!

name: Camp Spot by a Lake
description: Spent the night here. Really nice area by lake next to mountains. There’s a spot where you can enter the water to take a swim. I wouldn’t drink it though, not even filtered. Close to the road but not very load. Look out for thorns!

name: Roadside Cafeterias
description: Very good spot to stock up with water and have a snack. Plenty of food options. Excellent egg and falafel rolls. There’s beds here and there too. I just stopped for lunch but it seems like a place calm enough for the night too.

name: Roadside Refreshments
description: A few shops and the regular cafeterias. Some cool-ish drinks towards the end coming from north-west.

name: Desert camping south of Wadi Halfa
description:
Desert Camp Spot 20min south of Wadi Halfa. Just follow the tracks on the left side of the road going south. 
Camping area is flat and can not be seen from the road. Probably also doable without 4x4

name: Abandoned mud brick ruins
description: Just off road mud brick ruin great place to shelter from sandstorm or a night stay

name: Diesel
description: Here they have diesel and there is no Line!

name: Desert Camp Spot
description:
Desert Camp Spot close to a few rocks about 200m from the road to Atbara.
A bit windy.

name: Roadside shop
description:
Cold drinks and chai 
Also a shop to buy some supplies

name: Roadside shop
description: Cyclists - Some drinks and a little shop for cake biscuits if needed

name: Hotel Cleopatra
description: Basic place, relatively clean. Took a room with three single beds and en-suite (western toilet) for 350 Sudanese pounds. Close to the bus station. Fine for a stopover in Wadi Halfa.

name: Mamas
description:
Cheap hostel in the center of Wadi Halfa. If you look for a clean and quite place, that's not the hostel. But the owners are nice and wonderfull! 
One night 100 SP, room of five beds.

name: Football Playground Police
description: Friendly police man next to the roand. Possible to sleep in their tend, use their kitchen, bathroom and lots of water. Possible to pitch the tend outside. They need socks, always cold!

name: trucker parking with camping
description: at this location big trucks park along the road. but you can drive in and park near some trees. good cover at night but viewable during day. there are already tracks from locals camping here. easier access than the camp a little further up the hill

name: Bush camp spot
description:
Bush camp between Gedaref and the border to Ethiopia. 
There are tracks in three directions. Depending on how deep you want to hide in the bush choose yours.

name: Step 4: Border Sudan-Ethiopia
description: Here is the actual border. It’s just a rope but they add something on your Carnet and check your Passport once again.

name: Step5: Sudan-Ethiopia
description:
Passport check. Immigration.
Walk by the seating area and enter the building. There is two desks with monitors in the room.

name: Step6: Sudan-Ethiopia
description:
Customs:
Blue Building on opposite site of Step5. 
Go to backside, Office No6.

name: shiekan insurance new office yellow card
description: the new shiekan insurance office for yellow card. ask for mohammed saleh (0909960290) he does yellow card. We took 7 months and 7 countries for 2 drivers in a nissan pick up paid 5500 SP (+/-€55)

name: Toll Gate
description: here you have to pay road fee. we didn't have any money. so he let us go without paying

name: Cafeteria
description:
tea and food and drinks
good place for a rest

name: Turkish Restaurant
description: Very nice restaurant with sort of English menu, and staff can help with the rest. Good food and comfortable.

name: tea place
description:
quiet place you can have a rest
tea and fresh water

name: Eating Options
description:
Big stop for bus, truck ...
Many restaurants and Cafeterias

name: food fare
description: Outside food stalls, we had 1 kg of grilled goat meat with rice & yogurt. simply delicious,

name: local food place where they let you sleep
description: local place just off the road. stopped here when we were going to Port Sudan. Very kind people left us sleep here they provide beds under the stars. Tea & Bread for breakfast,

name: Roadside Truck stop
description: You can get Food and sleep here under the stars. You can get a bed and sleep outside or inside if you like. It's a good option as not many other places.

name: Arab Plaza
description: The more expensive hotel in town (1000 Sudanese pounds which was 10usd at the time). Probably not the best night you'll have but it'll be decidedly be pretty good. Parking was right out front and there was a goat standing guard sometimes. There is also parking behind the hotel but no fence, no guard, nor goat. Three nights waiting for the ferry and the motorbike was fine. The room had two beds and was the same price for one or two people. Quiet nights sleep in a bed that in no way resembles a hammock. The attached bathroom was clean. There is a small shop out front with all the Cokes, water, and candy you might need. The restaurant has freshly made bread and the food will be served hot and tasty. There's even a shisha cafe right behind. It's a modern take on a caravansary full of the people stoping, staying, or just passing through this tiny port town.

name: Okier Hotel
description: Pretty nice and very clean hotel. Unfortunately don't know the prices of other rooms but twin room was 1500 pounds (15usd at the time). Proper beds with sheets and blankets. AC and fan, and private bathroom with hot water. Balcony. Parked motos on the street in front of reception and felt secure. Walking distance to many restaurants.

name: workers palace
description:
500sdg single room
clean modern tiled
motorcycle secure parking

name: Cafeteria
description: A basic cafeteria where they serve Cola, Water and Tea.

name: Local Water
description: Next to the police checkpoint are four clay pots with water.

name: Al Asfia
description:
We arrived thursday evening and many of the cheaper hotels were already full. Here we found a room with a good price/performance ratio. Its a nice place to stay. The rooms have en en-suite bathroom with western toilet. I absolutely liked the shower with warm water and nice preasure. Our room was clean compared to the places where we stayed before and had a fan, AC (didnt check if it was working though) and a fridge. The beds are a bit saggy.

We were three people in a three bed room and paid 1000 pounds per night.

Our bicycle we could store in a locked room next to the entrance.

They say the hotel has Wifi, but it didnt work when we were there.

name: Lisamine Safari Hotel
description:
Rooms are so much nicer than at the Acropole Hotel but only slightly more expensive (110 USD per night, w. breakfast). Good Lebanese restaurant in the hotel.
Unfortunately, Khartoum is expensive!

name: Cafeteria
description: Basic Cafeteria with cold drinks and Tea.

name: Camp spot near tombs
description: Nice camp spot in the desert. Hidden away from the road and near beautiful tombs. Most of the road to this spot is hard sand.

name: Cafeteria with space for camping
description: This is a basic but friendly little cafeteria. The guys were very welcoming and happy to have me pitch my tent. They had a few beds too. Hot meals available.

name: alhabika Akoud
description: water, mosque, place for camp, toilettes, food

name: Mafasa Hotel
description: There are several hotels in this area but this one deserves special mention. It's a multi-story blue building. Cleanroom, fan, AC, TV, cold water, no wifi. Currently 600 pounds, prices are up at the moment due to exchange rate fluctuation. Owner Khalid speaks some English and went out of his way to help me get settled after cycling the long hot desert from Karima.

name: lokanda hotel (no name)
description: okay lokanda, paid 700 pounds for a room which has 4 beds in it. dingy bathroom but okay for 1 night.

name: Muhammed
description:
he is the honest man to go if you have a problem wit your suspension
he made me a new leaf spring (mein leaf) for 60 USD!
it is a small business on the road but he knows all and he knows where to go.
AND he is honest
Ask for him if you don't find him
picture of him I also add

name: BaAboud Travel
description:
Here is the way to go for booking the ferry from souakin to Jeddha if you don't want to wait till you are in Souakin. 
We got a good price 
300USD for our Van (2 seats) plus 2 Person in a first Class cabin
They speak well English,  are friendly and work quick.
At the other travel agent they let us wait for more than an hour and rises the price 2 times in that time. we did not liked that and found this more professionel travel agent.
it is located in a mall (waha mall) but you see the office from the street

name: custom office
description: here are the correct coordinate of the custom office to stamp out carnet

name: Hotel Alhwad
description: 400 SDG for room with shared bathroom, or more (~700 SDG?) for room with private bathroom. A good location as it's next to the market, but only street parking available. Friendly staff who spoke a small amount of English.

name: Delicious juices
description: Delicious juices and fresh juice dishes, for example dates for 150 SDP (0,50 €), guava juice for only 100 SDP (0,33 €).Cold refreshments especially for thirsty cyclists that want something different than water.

name: Borrs station
description: A new petrol station in Borrs for both, benzin and diesel.

name: green oasis
description: Lovely family with two donkeys and two cats. Water available! Please use a filter.

name: Hotel Wadi Halfa
description: clean, 2500 per night, hot shower, AC, No Window inside

name: Maziya Residence
description:
Rooms and appartements. Very friendly people. Clean and safe. shopping and eating nearby possible. Most embassy in 4-5 km
Costs 40 USD

name: Red Crescend Center
description:
We asked at the Red Crescend Headquarter for the blue nile state if we can Pitch the tent behind the building. No Problem. People are amazingly friendly. They Take you to some aid Projects If they have time. Hassan, the Koordinator of all the Projects Help us with Our Special permit to visit Kurmuk. He knows every Office, Police and Military Chief in Damazin. Next building is a good upper class Restaurant. 
Open all day. Quiet at night, maybe bit louder in weekends. 
They offered a toilet and bucket shower with private Key for us.

name: Police Checkpoint Sennar
description: Before you enter Sennar, coming from Kartoum, you will be Stopped by friendly officers. We asked them to Camp behind the bushes on the West side of the Checkpoint. No Problem. Bit noisy until 11:00pm and after 6:00pm according to the Trucks.

name: Little tea store
description: 3rd building with blue door has cold cool drinks, tea, water and some very basic food on the shelf. I didn't see if any cooked food is available. Check cool drinks as one was filled with water haha

name: Bicycle mechanic
description:
Small bicycle shop with a friendly owner Ahmed. Was  able to true wheel, replace spoke and some maintenance.  There are also card board bicycle boxes available for transporting by plane. 
Was the best place I could find in Khartuom 

Ahmed +249902553416

name: Aliyaa 2 Hospital Covid PCR test
description: Easy process no waiting, 10000S£ or could pay $30. results are given at Aliyaa 1 hospital across the road in 24h.

name: Khartoum Hotel
description: S£500 a night for a bed in a shared room.  Cheap and nasty. Bicycle can go in room, motorcycle can go in entrance hall.

name: Rayan Lab Covid 19 Laboratory
description:
Covid Test Lab left (east) of the Syrian restaurant. 
Open also on Fridays until 8pm. 
There are 2 options available:
Result in 24h: 10000 sdp
Result in 10h: 15000 sdp

name: Badr Airline Ticket Office
description:
Cheap flights available to Addis, Dubai, Istanbul, Cairo etc. Not found with normal search engine, because it's not an internationall recognized airline.
Check https://badrairlines.com/en/ for more info..

name: water filling station (from clay pots)
description: Lots of clay pots sheltered from the sun by trees. You can fill up your water here it's fresh!

name: local water filling (clay pots)
description: Little shelter with a few claypots. You can fill your water here!

name: cafetaria Al Dabbah
description:
Small cafetaria with tea, coffee and the usual cold drinks. They also serve food (ful and some kind of meat stew).
Water available (although a little bit yellowish haha).
Also a small shop available.

name: big restaurant and shops
description: Big restaurant with a decent shop and cold drinks. You can also eat here or drink tea, coffee

name: Cafeteria
description: Cafeteria and shops. Tea and hot food. They had beds too.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police checkpoint. They allowed me to camp here (solo female cyclist) and were very hospitable. They have water, toilets and a shower.

name: Small cafeteria
description: Small cafeteria with a few types of cake, tea and water jugs. Had a few beds.

name: Water at ticket office
description: There is a tap around the back of the ticket hall. I camped and used it in the morning. (Filtered it) ask permission to be polite.

name: Tea place/truck stop with beds
description: Stopped here, has many beds. Tea and coffee. Was offered a free bed but opted to put tent up. Near busy road so not quiet but good for solo traveller with bike

name: Local Family Offering A Place to Sleep
description: What an experience! We randomly stopped here at this family's store on the road and ended up camping over night. They fed us and really gave us a true local experience. This was culture immersion at its finest. When you stop by ask for Al Hag Ood, he owns all the land and buildings near this GPS point. No charge for the stay, they just enjoy sharing culture.

name: Cafeteria
description: Basic cafeteria. Beans, meat and bread available in this restaurant. Also possible to overnight, they provided beds and shelter for sleeping. The bikes were secured in a locked room.

name: Nile Valley Guesthouse Hotel
description:
University loging open for tourist. Compared to Adel is it much cheaper (10 euro per night single bed  for two persons including AC and Fan and fridge), quit ( in the middle of the old english neighbourhood.) and has a relaxing garden with some shade.
we spotted a washingmachine when we left in the left back corner of the ground floor. (maybe?). Opposite the railway museum. A bit out of city center.

name: Travel permit step 1
description:
Ministry of culture: Get your travel permit here. Very friendly staff. It will take a while but it’s for free. Go inside on the right hand side is a building go there an tell him what you want. He will give you directions.
When you have your paperwork done here you have to go to Wildlife and Tourism police to rewrite the papers.

name: Travel permit step 2
description:
Tourism and Wildlife Police: 
Bring your paperwork from the ministry of culture here, they’ll rewrite it on they paper’s and check it with the ministry of information. When you finish here it’s done. It was also free of charge here.

name: Lake Nasser
description:
Very nice spot, coming or going from Sudan. 
Follow the road on maps me till the end and you can camp everywhere you like. Sudan is just great for wild camping and hospitality. Lokal fishermen around gave us some big fish for free. We played football together. Nice last night bevor the “adventure” at the border.

name: ZEESUDAN Hostel & Guesthouse
description: Room in a nice family house for 25usd/night. You can use the kitchen and Mohamed and Maya are really nice people and so helpful. You have your own area of the house separate bathroom and living room. We had a good time with them and ended up staying 4 nights. The best time in sudan so far.

name: check point
description: check point will ask for money,  we didn't have so they let us pass ;)

name: Check-point (problematic)
description: In the direction Atbara -> Khartoum we were stopped and forced to return back to Shendi to some police / military camp for a check of our stamps / passports by their boss. We are still waiting here, nothing is happening and it is already dark, so we will be forced to find a place to sleep in Shendi.

name: Mwanza Yacht Club
description: Nice location next to the lake and close to town, toilets and showers poor but hot water.  For power you can run a power cable into the restaurant.

name: Orion Tabora Hotel + Camping
description:
Allows camping in enclosed car park with access to ablutions, breakfast included in camping fee.

Camping or room: 50000 2 people/night

name: Jakobsen Beach Camping
description: Nice camping site with secluded private beach. Breathtaking views from Sundowner deck near  reception. Absolutely quiet. No disturbing lights. 1 standpipe and braai stand on whole campsite. Thatched seating area with table and benches. Small ablution with cold shower and flushing toilets. Far from town so make sure you have what you need.o

name: Quarry
description: A quarry off the side of the road, flat site out of sight from the road.

name: River Side Camp
description:
Nice place for a stop over. Juma is a nice guy and speaks good English. They will heat the donkey boiler for you and give you access to a toilet in one the rooms. Actually nice view over the river with a few hippos and some birds roosting in the trees. Firewood also supplied... We paid 20k tsh pppn..
Very basic camp with poor facilities, but had over 100 Hippos in the river at the side of the camp ground (end of the dry season). Normally 10 USD pppn. Hot water showers and toilet available (July 2021). Looks a bit run down, but camp site is fine with the decent view.

name: Lakeshore Lodge and Campground
description:
Amazing!  Beautiful, well managed, well trained staff with good facilities.  Campsite at the back under big shady trees. Good clean ablutions. Stand pipe, braai, table. Restaurant and bar. 
Worth the detour- their motto is "come as a guest, leave as a friend", and it's true. 4 large shaded sites and great abolitions. Lots of water and boat activities, great beach. Chris and Louis are fantastic owners and hosts. No power at sites. WiFi is... it's Africa. Great food. Plan to stay a couple of days.

name: Forest Way Country Club
description: Shady camping in car park, allowed access to a room for shower.

name: Behind Rocks
description: To the west of the road at these co-ordinates there is a gap in the rocks.  Drive through here and there is a large open area for camping.  Level ground and hidden from the road.

name: Utengele Coffee Lodge
description:
Camping area next to squash courts and gym.  You can get power from the toilet block.Really nice Country Hotel with good restaurant, swimming pool, tennis and squash court. Toilet and shower block are fine. Internet in hotel and mobile coverage available.  It is a working coffee plantation and it was possible to walk over to the plantation to have a look at the production (they have Sundays off).

2019: They offer old basic huge bungalows for Overlanders. Terrace, kitchen, living fully furnished, multiple bedrooms! Cleaning lady will come now and then!

Don't miss! Only 20 mins south of Mbeya. 

 $11.5 pp to camp. Can make use of all amenities such as tennis court, squash court, swimming pool. Has a stunning restaurant if you are camp food weary. Amazing coffee. Hot water as well! Organises tours of the coffee plantation,

name: Ngosi Crater
description: Wild camp in a jungle clearing at the start of the climb to the Ngosi Crater lake.  4x4 track!

name: Blue Canoe Safari Lodge
description: eco-friendly camp lies at Matema Beach on the most northern end of Lake Nyasa and offers breathtaking views, crystal clear and safe water and sandy beaches. We only have 8 bungalows all of them built out of renewable and regional materials and from all of them you have spectacular views of the lake and the mountains.. Our campsites are nestled amongst green vegetation and are just a few meter from the beach.

name: The Old Kisolanza Farm House
description:
Fantastic place to stay inbetween Mbeya and Dar. Good camping facilities, but make sure you go for breakfast at the restaurant – amazing home grown food! Farm produce including fantastic beef available to buy. $10 pppn (covid pricing), normal is $12 pppn.
Campsites under some trees with a braai pit. Toilet and shower block was nice and clean. Has a place to do dishes. It is a campsite and lodge on a working farm and it is possible to buy some fresh farm products. They have walking trail on the property. Cozy restaurant and bar that we did not try out. Great place to stop.

name: Tan Swiss Lodge
description: nice place, clean ablutions with hot water, a nice pool, friendly and organized staffs, a good restaurant.  Free, good WiFi.

name: Peponi Holiday Resort
description:
Cottages and campsite set in a jungly environment right at the beach, with a shelter to most sites. Charging points and electricity per camp spot. Some of the sites are at the beach front and have a good view over the sea. 

Toilet and shower block is ok and with hot water in the afternoon. Average restaurant but nice beach bar, great little swimming pool and plenty of relaxing spots.

name: Irente Farm
description:
A couple of campsites with shower and toilet block next to them. Hot water, but no power at sites. They have a small shop where they sell their products like good cheese, homemade bread, jam, juice, yoghurt etc.  15 000 TZS per person. you can get lunch there for 12000 our dinner for 25000 (3 course). Good hiking from the farm, with or without a guide.
150000 for double room (Incl. Breakfast and Dinner for two). For further information contact the Owner: Ute +255 783 685 888

name: Irente View Point Lodge
description: 5$pp large grassy terrasse below the hotel for rooftop tent. smaller terrasse with view over the cliff for groundtents. small ablution block with hot shower. shelter and water tap. no power.

name: Mambo View Point
description: Incredible location for a lodge with amazing views over the landscape below. One nice campsite for overlanders with good view. Toilet and shower block is nice. Water but no power. Restaurant and they sell local produced cheese, yoghurt and bread. Good information about local trips and things to do in the area.  16 000 TZS

name: Keys Hotel
description: They let us camp in their parking lot in the back of the hotel and opened up on of their huts/rooms so we could use a really nice and clean bathroom. Breakfast buffet was included in the price. Internet in the reception, swimming pool and a restaurant. Walking distant into town. We had planned to stay in Honeybadger Campsite while in Moshi, but as their price was in usd and they would charge us a stupid rate to pay in shillings we left after a 30 min argument. So we were happier paying more per night in the end at Keys Hotel.  40 300 TZS

name: Lake Chala Safari Camp
description: Nice and quiet location with good views to Kilimanjaro. Campsites with braais and water. Nice toilet and shower block with hot water in the afternoon. Bar and restaurant. There is a small water hole where we saw elephants one day and baboons every day.  32 000 TZS

name: Masai Camp
description: Campsite for overlander trucks close to town.

name: The Beach Crab Resort
description:
Nice well run and organised resort, good restaurant and stunning beach.  There is a Dive Centre, windsurfing and canoes available.  The camping is on the edge of the beach.  The only down side is the salty water in the showers (which is normal along this coast).

NOTE see recent checkin re high vehicles -- "They didn't cut their trees so we can't reach the entrance gate and the campsite. Our vehicle is 3,50m high. We looked to the campsite. The place and the toilet get run down, not well kept. The staff was not interessted in helping us. So we had to turn and drove back the way to Peponi. It was a very annoying experience after driving the long way to this site. Not recommended for high vehicles! "

name: Traveler's Lodge
description:
Very beautiful place with access to the beach and a very impressive amount of different trees on the property. You can easily walk to Bagamoyo. The days are nice and quiet. At night the bar on the opposite site of the road is a challenge. You can not sleep without earplugs. The beach and the landscape are incredible. The noise as well. 

Nice grass camping area under plenty of trees. Beautiful lawn of hotel with high palms. Hotel has own beach, but camping is not directly at beach. $10 pppn.

name: Mikadi Campsite
description: Great campsite on the beach, nice bar and swimming pool. $10 pppn. Location is under Dutch management now (since end 2019), the place is worth a visit.

name: Kipepeo Beach Village
description:
Camping and huts available.  On the beach, good security around camping area.  Bar and restaurant. 

10 dollar per person per night.

name: River Valley Campsite (Mfumbi)
description: A community camping site on the banks of the river.  Flat grass site, only a long drop toilet for facilities.  There is firewood and the village send down a security guard for the night.  There is no GSM phone coverage.

name: Landmark Holtel
description: Basic hotel that allows you to camp in their garden or car park.  They give you access to a room to use the shower.

name: Kola Hill Hotel & Camping
description: If you need another place to stop on the way to Dar, this place is fine for one night. A fairly run down hotel, but with big grassy area for camping and access to a room for toilet/shower. $10 per night.

name: Honey Badger
description:
Great community establishment with pool,bar, restaurant etc.

Camping option no longer offered

name: Camping Sunbright
description: Now under new management and a number of new chalets being built and swimming pool. Still working progress when we were there, but it is a great spot to stay before heading into the Serengeti. ($20 night)

name: Tunza Lodge
description: Amazing place to recuperate after the Serengeti – beach camping right on Victoria Lake. The owner Jan, looked after us very well and arranged for a mechanic to visit us and repair our radiator! You’ll be in safe hands with a full security team of Maasai!

name: Kilimanjaro Hotel
description: Here aren’t many places to stop on the way up to the Rwanda (Resumo) border, so we camped in the carpark of this hotel . It’s still being developed, so was a building site when we stayed, but looks promising. There is 24hr security and access to a room for toilet/shower, but beware they love to watch terrible Nigerian films on full blast! Bit steep at $20 night!

name: Karibuni Center
description: Small court of lodge and church, run by mission. both beds and camping available.

name: Tungamalenga Lodge & Campsite
description: Small yard between cottages. Some rubish around. Electricity in the evening only.

name: Crocodile Camp
description: Place at the river opposite the NP between cottages. Background noise from trucks on T1 main road. Electricity in the evening when generator runs.

name: Aqua Vitae Resort
description:
NOT an official/established campsite (anymore)! NO shower. NO toilet.
Staff try hard to sell a room, wanted let campers stay on parking lot for 30000TSH pppn! After long discussion they let camp on grassy party site fir 10000TSH. NOT RECOMMENED.

name: Lawns Hotel
description: Garden of hotel outside village. Small lawn, quite noisy.

name: Mullers Mountain Lodge
description: Large grassy place with mountain view next to forest.

name: Amarula Camp
description: Great place.  Wide, grassy field with trees and view over mountains and valley.  Very quiet. Price negotiation needed. Toilets and shower poor. Only spring/rainwater available.

name: Sinda Garden Lodge
description: Parking of hotel.  We got a room key for toilet and (cold) shower. Quite noisy environment.

name: Zion Campsite
description: Walled, quiet camping just outside NP. A few safari groups camping as well. Price needs to be negotiated. .

name: Village Camping
description: Quiet site under trees just outside village.

name: Ngorongoro Camp
description: Grassy,  garden like. Equipped for safari groups. Loud during day, quiet during night. No dedicated sites, no shade, facilities run down. 10 USD p p

name: Teacher's College
description: Large compound of college / mission post.  Quiet, safe place, but no facilities.

name: Liembe Beach Lodge
description:
Nice place on the lake. Campsite in sand but easy to get a car in.  cold shower. Flushing loos. Bar and restaurant in old fishing boat.
Cost:15$ pppn, negotiable.

name: Morovian Church Conference Centre
description: Big building on the outskirts of town. Clean. Selection of rooms s/d/t w/wo en suite bathroom. Restaurant. Secure parking.  We chose twin room with communal bathrooms (warm shower, western toilet, African toilet).  Cost:TZS15,000 for the room

name: Baraka Guest House
description: Double rooms with en suite bathrooms.  Hot shower and flushing toilet. All tiled so a ecchos when other guests move around.  Restaurant adjacent (service slow)  Cost:TZS20,000 for the room

name: Sankere Hotel
description: Clean and reasonable hotel. Double room with flushing toilet and hot shower. No restaurant, but small café up back alley for food. Parking in court yard.  Cost:TZS30,000 for room incl. breakfast

name: Sayari Guest House
description: Clean and reasonable motel run by policeman. Access to water, but no water in pipes. Electricity unstable when we were there. Bar. Lady offered to cook for us. Also used by overlander bus.  Cost:TZS15,000 for the room

name: Kiroyera Camp
description: Campsite on the beach. Basic but clean. Lake Victoria is 5m away. Shower and toilets reserved for tourists. Bar and restaurant on premises. Walking distance to town.  Cost:TZS8,000

name: Spice Beach Motel
description: Clean and reasonable motel on the beach. Very friendly and helpful staff. All concrete so noice carries. TV outside that comes off when requested. Parking possible in court yard.   Cost:TZS20,000 for room incl. breakfast

name: Segera Hotal
description: Camping in the rear of the hotel, no shower available

name: Kibo Hotel
description: The Kibo is a rambling old hotel built at the turn of the last century by the Germans as a summer holiday retreat and in recent times is a base in the climbing season (July – Jan) for mountaineering groups going up Kilimanjaro. The hotel is now looked after by a great old guy called Isak who keeps the gardens absolutely magnificently and was most concerned about our comfort and welfare. We liked chilling out as the only guests in the huge old hotel! Interestingly, President Jimmy Carter and his wife stayed at the Kibo Hotel in 1988 when doing a climb of Mt Kilimanjaro.

name: Serengeti Stop Over
description: Expensive but only option close to west gate. 10 usd pppn.

name: NP Serenera public campsite
description: Only public option in the park. 30 usd pppn. Facilities are OK.

name: Public Campsite
description:
Basic facilities, stay in old section.
Sandy campground and a fenced dining area

They asked for 20,000tzs for some firewood and when I laughed and said 5000 they agreed on 10,000tzs.

name: Kudu Campsite
description: Good facilities, few overland trucks

name: Saadani Safari Lodge
description: Worthwhile splurge, enjoy the beach, poor game viewing but the sea life is amazing

name: Sunrise Beach Resort
description: Very nice but can be noisy on some weekends, nice trees to camp under - electricity and water. unfortunately no dish and laundry washing

name: Lake Tagalala Official Camp
description: nice location in the middle of the park. the campsite overlooks the lake but no direct view because of the vegetation. various large bandaroofs with only a table as furniture. ablution block not clean but ok. no other amenities. no ranger and no staff. we saw a lionness nearby at dusk and you can hear hippos at night.

name: River Valley Campsite
description: 10 USD ppn. Three large camping areas on green lawn by the river with many trees for shade. Tables, benches, barbecue and fireplaces, shelters for rainy days, bar and restaurant.
