Electricity and water taps all around. Great hiking trails around with Polly, the friendliest dog of all. Cottages and cabins also available. Very nice place.

name: Ruaha Public Campsite #1
description:
Good facilities & unbelievable location. Clean ablutions. 

best with roof tent, but also fine with ground tent, will have to collect fire wood as not much near by, be sure not the post near the foothills coming up from the river, the kitchen is in really bad condition but is dry and has a few small working LED lights, park HQ is not far away

name: Utengule Hotel
description: Good facilities & restaurant! Very friendly staff and a swimming pool!

name: Ikuu Campsite TANAPA control
description:
No advanced facilities, campsite under random tree. Good location, animals through camp

right next to a hippo pool (at least in the dry season). also right next to ranger post. build a fire and prepare for some wildlife at night. Clean western tiolets, shower and running water.

name: Ngosi Crater Forest Reserve
description: Park car at turnoff from gravel road into jungle, walk 30 min to a clearing, end of 2-spoor track, then start jungle path up  to the crater rim (3 hours return)

name: Lake Oil
description: Gas Refill station behind petrol station

name: Magara Waterfall
description: Former Magara Community Campsite, no facilities, spot to stand under trees near waterfall. "Security guys" came to ask for money, but we did not see them afterwards!

name: Public Campsite Simba A
description: On crater rim of Ngorongoro, spectacular view, basic toilets and showers, 30 USD PP

name: Tembo Beach
description: Directly at Lake Victoria, on sand, no shade, 10 USD PP, nice terrace under trees

name: Matvilla Beach Lodge & Campsite
description:
PRICE UPDATE JULY 2022: 15 USD PPN
Nice cozy spot at tip of peninsula, well maintained setting, friendly stuff, they cut the trees for our big car!

name: Snake Park Meserani
description: 10 USD pPpN including entrance to snake park.

name: Panorama Safari Camp
description: Great camping. Bar with free Wifi that works well. OK Showers and Toilets(men bathroom is more modern than women). Unfortunately not much view from the place where you can camp with a rooftoptent. But from the cliff campingspots the view over Lake Manyara is great. Well worth the USD10,- pppn, especially in that touristic area.

name: Rhuhinda's Lodge
description: Self containing motel, looks newly renovated, we only asked for parking without facilities, but building and yard left  a good impression.

name: Meatu Hotel and Guesthouse
description:
Hotel with off street parking. Rooms starts from 14USD included breakfast.
For cheaper option, ask for the guesthouse, just across the street, about 5USD included breakfast too.
Your car / motorcycle can stay safe on the hotel's parking.

name: Backpackers Paradise
description:
The cheapest backpacker's in Moshi ! Small place to park a small motorbike inside (big bikes won't fit in).
Dorms, double room, only few travelers but lots of volunteers.
from 12000 for large dorm.
well situated, walking distance from city center

name: ICC Hotel and Guesthouse Mbalizi
description:
Camping possible in ICC compound for 20,000 tsh pppn.
Staff will give you access to a room to use the bathroom and shower. Restaurant with bar on site.
Good price/quality ratio here on a double room 50.000 Tsh/night, breakfast included. Clean, nice room. Hot shower (electrical). Friendly and helpful staff. Camping would’ve been 20.000 Tsh/pppn. So it’s better value to take a room. Big compound, lots of safe parking space. Breakfast was nothing special and really light: toast and an omelet. The restaurant’s food was bad, though cheap, but don’t bother. Same Swiss owners as for the workshop, hospital, zoo (this does not sound good) under the ICC (Ifisi) brand.

name: Kalambo Falls Lodge
description: Very nice hotel, room starting at 70.000. we could camp on the parking, 20usd in total. They would opened a room for toilet and shower

name: Keza Mission
description: A mission where we could stay. We could set up our tent but we decided to stay in a house. House is clean, no running water, no power. We think we have to pay 6000 but we hear the price tomorrow morning (becouse arrived sunday late afternoon). *update: decided to sleep in our rooftent after finding bugs in the beds!

name: Second Chance Education Centre
description: Nice campsite within the premisses of a school. Clean showers and toilets available. Swimming next door at honey badgers lodge.

name: Secluded Near Kopjes
description: Former stone quarry. Big flat place just few meters from the main road to Dodoma overlooking the valey. Quiet and nice place to stay without curious people.

name: Mambo Cliff Inn
description: Campsite and rooms build on a cliff. View over valley is amazing! Local run. Camping is 10,000 tsh pppn. dinner is 7,000.

name: Rafiki Backpackers
description:
Nice hostel with different dorms, free laundry and a good staff. Possibility to pitch a tent on concrete.

They are expanding for next season. There you'll have a nice view over the Kilimanjaro.

Free pickup from town when you arrive. 

They also host the Viva Africa Tours tour operator which organizes, amongst others, trips to the Kilimanjaro.

name: Dreamland Motel
description: We could camp in the court of this motel and use their facilities (toilet and cold shower, also used by truckers). Due to the bar/restaurant on the premises it was a bit noisy, although quiet during the night. We negotiated a price of TZS 10,000 (as rooms were 20,000) - however the 'manager' first asked for a mere 30,000. Was ok for a night as it was close to the border and our visa was not yet confirmed, but otherwise not recommended.

name: River Campsite
description:
Very basic Masai Campsite. 10$ pp/night. 
We did not stay here as it was not the money worth and run down. 

Be aware: To get to lake Natron you will have to cross three "toll" barriers. The first two will charge 10$pp and the third 15$pp and 20$ per car!

name: Lake Natron Tented camp
description:
Nice Campsite at the lodge for 10$ pp/night (we paid 5$ pp/night as it was off season). The Lodge has a pool which you can use free of charge.
Not everything is well maintained but working and it's a very comfy place.

Annoyance: To go to the lake counts as an "activity" which would cost 20$ pp. We decided that we already paid way too much and just drove to the lake. One of the camp staff called then the local council, who turned up the next morning to collect the "activity" fee. 
We refused to pay - it's ridiculous to pay 130 USD for two people to see lake... 

Be aware: To get to lake Natron you will have to cross three "toll" barriers. The first two will charge 10$pp and the third 15$pp and 20$ per car!

name: toll/fee gate lake Natron
description:
You need to pay a fee for entering the Ngorongoro district. 
Per person 35$
Per vehicle 30$
village fee pp 30
There is no specific time limitation

name: Meserani Oasis Lodge & Campground
description: Large grassy area for camping, some pads for tent camping in an area with lots of trees. Also has nice clean rooms with shared bath (I paid $11 per night) and rooms with private baths. Restaurant and bar on property. Owner speaks fluent english. Gated and guarded.  No wifi. Owner arranged tour to Ngorongoro Crater for me at a reasonable price.

name: U-Turn grocery store
description:
Quite large supermarket, perfect for stocking up. 
Only frozen meat.
Possible to pay with credit card.

Monday - Saturday: 8am - 8pm
Sunday: 10am - 2pm

name: fruit & vegetable market
description:
Best vegetable and fruit market in town.
There are as well some butchers.

name: Kilwa Dreams Lodge
description:
Great place with friendly staff, camping beachfront in a very quiet place. Views over the harbour and path down to beach. Campsite is a decent sized area with shower, western toilet and a Banda with electricity. Loved it! 10usd pppn
Good restaurant serving ao superfresh fish and veggies

name: Boma Cafe
description: Nice cafe run by German woman, next to museum and near market, parking out front, nice range of coffee and cakes, in fantastic restored building, opened July 16

name: Buffalo Hotel
description: We stayed here after not finding parking at the hotel nearby. The have a small parking area behind a locked gate that will fit at least 10 bikes, but only 2 cars. The small but clean hotel room costs $15 for a double and includes breakfast. Wifi must be bought next door. There are some rooms with a view that includes the mountain, currently fully booked. Staff are very nice and there looks to be a good Indian place across the road! Sold. I still need to try if the showers are hot. Flush toilets on suite

name: Maasai Giraffe Camp
description: We stayed here 3 nights and went out of our way to get here. The landscape is Savannah and  different to that around Moshi and Arusha. It is in Maasai Tribal lands, peaceful site under an active volcano. Friendly and helpful staff. Fire pit. $10 pppn camping under acacia trees on grass. European toilets, can buy a little water here. 140km of bad dirt road to get here, it took us over 6 hours. Great scenery and awesome locals. If you can ride motorcycle off-road then you will enjoy this. Gravel roads, sand patches and patches of rock. There are trucks and buses driving the roads so fine for  4x4. Wild animals next to the roads. Lake Natron has flamingoes. Come to spend a few days. You need to brig water, cash and enough fuel to get out again. Wifi avalaible at $2.50 per hour. No cell reception. There are three gates to pass on route at costs of $10pp, $10pp and $15pp with a vehicle fee for cars. To visit the lake costs $20pp with your own vehicle for the guide. They can provide food for $28 for full board or you can cook yourself. Three dogs on site and a kitten. The costs add up, but it is a great spot away from the tourist hoards and you can really relax here. Owner is Belgium and was not here during our visit.

name: Warere House
description: If you are coming to Zanzibar without your vehicle, this hotel is a great stop. We stayed here two nights and got more than we expected. The staff are very friendly and will help you with anything. There is a big included breakfast and the showers are amazing. Air conditioned rooms with clean beds and mosquito nets. Roof terrace with an honesty bar and it is close to town. We paid $45 for a double room. There is wifi included too. No secure parking at most places in stone town.

name: Zebra Campsite
description:
Beautiful scenery between river and mountains. very close to the main road. traffic heard.  ablutions not very clean, all in all a bit run down but we liked it here. 
10.000 tzs ppn, kids are free. No restaurant or bar. Banda roof on the river.

BEWARE acacia trees on drive in are very overgrown and will scrape vehicle!

name: Elephant Hotel
description: Hotel on main road through Same, small camp area for tents only (no vehicle access) they let us camp in our Daf in front car park and use their ablutions, nice and clean with hot water, we managed to get breakfast included at $10 pppn, quite noisy but had a lot worse, very friendly staff and manager

name: Golden Valley Hotel Free Camping
description: On our way from Rwanda border to Arusha we found this hotel. Alex the owner welcomed us with open arms. we could camp on the parkinglot and could shower in one of the rooms. We didn't have to pay for all this. He suggested to have dinner at his restaurant, so we had some good food, a couple of beers and breakfast and paid 52000tsh

name: Bushcamp Usambara
description: Exploring the east and western Usambara we had to stop before the night and rain would come. We found this nice place in the bush. No locals came to visit us we were well hide in the bush :)

name: white guesthouse
description: Could stay at this parkinglot after long exhausting drive from Lushoto. Paid 15000tsh got room for toilet and shower.

name: The New Planet Motel
description: Spotlessly clean ensuites with mossie nets, secure parking, free breakfast. 35000Tsh for double.

name: Marangu Hotel
description: They have a small campsite behind the hotel, ablutions are okay, you can use bar and restaurant. Maybe also the pool. Price 10 usd pppn. There is internet but you need to buy vouchers. From here 50 km tot Kenyan border, all tarmac

name: Weru Weru River Lodge
description: This is 6 km from Moshi on the road to Arusha. Head down road to WeruWeru and turn right a t junction go another 200 m and it is on your left. Camping is on a grass area beside a very nice hotel with swimming pool bar restaurant etc. there are hot showers and excellent facilities. Cost $12 per person and 8000 shillings for use of pool. This is best value and a great base to explore Moshi and surrounds.

name: Simbamwanni Lodge Camping
description:
We have reopened. Safe travelling. price is now 30,000/- 

Located 5 minutes outside the city centre in a quiet secure compound. Recently opened with accommodation including Chalets, standing tents and large grassy area leading onto the river for camping. Good ablutions. Pizza oven and a nice lounge area, swimming pool, and plans in place for a bush hide by the river. Owners very friendly.
Follow Simbamwenni signs to reach the campsite. Turn north towards Mazimbu at the main Iringa road traffic lights, then take first left tarmac road, opposite ATN petrol station. After about 1km turn left just before the Open University signboard. beep at the timber gate or call +255 753884496

Meals are only available by booking ahead. Bar runs on an honesty system

name: Fish Eagle Point
description: If you are near here or passing then this is a must. Steve and Cathy have a well run beautiful lodge fronting on a sandy beach. The camp ground is near the lodge and has toilet shower and solar lights. The cost is $10 us per person. There are many activities like fishing diving kayaking to name a few. In short a must visit oasis.

name: Isimila African Garden Campsite
description:
Campsite & Lodge, still under construction whilst here.  Nice seating area and we had a meal which was very nice. Run by same couple that run Boma Cafe in Iringa. Camping area for tents & small vehicles . As we are quite large we stayed in parking area, but there is also a nice campground, with close toilets. Nice views & friendly staff. 30,000 Tsh pp p night 
You can make great pictures from a viewpoint and have a walk in the Stoneagesite. Fantastic stop for long drives between north and south.

name: Lake Batati
description: Nice place to stay overnight

name: Nzega Pond
description: Small lake or big pond with huge place to stay few days.

name: Victoria Shore
description: Right next to the lake on tiny beach. Lovely place to rest and enjoy the lake and its prolific nature. Plenty of birds there. No many people around

name: Sandy Bay
description: Nice and huge area beside Lake Victoria, few kilometres from Bukoba.

name: Neema Crafts Cafe
description: Great cafe and great food. Staff are deaf and has a shop downstairs. Definitely worth a stop.

name: Malaika Beach Club
description: You like adventure right? You would rather be found in the woods than lost in the city. You are the real Camel man and you like them best without filter. The only reason you are in Dar is for Zanzibar and/or to sort some things out.This is your way out: Close to the city but feels like being in the bush. You can pick your own camp spot right on the beach. Shady spots are created by wooden structures with palm leaf roofs. Amazing swimming with high tide. Just started and run by three young inspirational minds: Ali, Fani and Naima. The vibes the place is giving of are: a little Rastafarian, Woodstockish, with a dash of Ibiza beach club with a backpackers mindset.It's basic but they make you feel home. If your lucky and interested you might get invited for tea, a free morning workout session, or a outdoor cinema where they are projecting old and new movies on the beach.The restaurant offers basic meals. Simple but fresh and tasty. (10.000 - 15.000)Price for camping (2.000)Price for safari tent (10 USD)

name: Forest Village Africa
description: Absolutely no village there but a small forest from the road to the lake with few wild animals like zebras an monkeys; where you can stay overnight. This place will become a camping in near future. Owner of this land is really welcome.

name: Driving Permit- Department Of Transport
description: Get your "Foreigner Driving Permit" here. 15000Tsh, bring two passport photos and drivers license, bring passport also just in case. Take bit of the old driving licenses from 1963-1980 till today :)

name: Jambo Beach Bungalows
description: Nice place on the beach. Rooms 30$ per night share bathroom. Plenty of space to camp.

name: In Forest
description: Not far from road, there is a long track with plenty of place to bivouac under shade

name: Mbyea hotel
description: Basic but clean hotel. Best of the bunch I looked at in the area. 60,000/80,000 tsh single / double

name: Lukmaan Restaurant
description: Cheap quality food with a large selection. Cheap seafood and meat dishes.

name: Forodhani Park Night Food Market
description: Cool ambiance and many food stalls serving allot of different dishes from small pizzas to seafood. The sea as a backdrop, a must in Zanzibar.

name: Forest Near Town
description: Quiet and nice place without people around not far from town

name: The Rhotia Valley's Coffee Corner
description:
Great coffee and lunch!
Proper coffee machine and beans from the Arusha area. 
They also serve cold drinks, beer&wine, smoothies&healthy drinks, soup, sandwiches and salads. Most of the herbs and vegetables are home grown. 

Very friendly staff, free wifi and amazing views. 

The Coffee Corner is connected to the Rhotia Valley Tented Camp & Children's home which is run by a Dutch couple. Proceeds all go back into the community and the projects they run.

name: YMCA Tanzania
description: Edit: price is 30000 tsh for a double room. Lost in translation.

name: Shellu Lodge
description: 40'000 tsh with breakfast for a clean double room with ensuite. 30'000 single. Beer on site, food available if you ask.

name: Mahaba Beach
description:
Nice beach resort with huts and possibility to camp. Beach camping only possible with 4x4.
Good food, bar, clean toilets and shower.
Camping is USD 10 or 22000 Tsh.

name: Mbuta Guest House
description: 10'000 tsh room with double bed, fan and mosquito net, squat toilet and bucket shower. Bar next door.

name: Catholic Seminary Rest Camp in Peramiho, Songea
description: This camp was shown in Tracks4Africa. No facilities. TSZ50000. We did not stay here as the asking price was far too much.

name: Mec Mbalizi
description:
mission run vocational school that works mainly on Toyota and Land Rover.  

going west (coming from mbaya) take the first left after the river, go in 100 meters and turn right.

name: Simba Farm Lodge
description:
nice camping. 30000TZSpp

All meals are excellent and they have a nice wine selection as well.

Located 1 hours drive from Moshi and on a clear day you can see almost a 150km view from the lodge towards Mount Meru, the crater and to the other side Kilimanjaro.

You can also buy fruits, vegetables, meat and dairy products on the farm.

Would recommend to stay here!

name: Arusha, Tanzania Farmers Service Center
description:
Tractor workshop and car workshop for Landrover and Toyota LC. Can also do repairs on bigger trucks. German owners.
There is also a possibility to store your camper car on their compound in open area or sheltered with a good security.
Contact Mr. Manfred Lieke by Email; tfsc@habari.co.tz.
The Tanzania Farmers Service Center is at Dodoma Road and oppositie of the Cultural Heritage in Arusha

.

name: Firefly
description: Grassy & shady campsite near beach but not on beach. A bit rough around the edges and unkept, but I think they are aiming for the hippie vibe. A restaurant which was only serving nachos and pasta (whomp whomp). Big overland truck was there with about 20 people, making for a cramped but not terrible pool area. $10pppn, too expensive for what it is so we left looking for something better.

name: Livingstonia
description: Camping space behind lodge. Fat from beach, although restaurant and pool are by the beach. Gives you keys to a room to use hot showers and toilets. Price is $15 pppn, negotiable but we didn't bother. Stayed down the road instead.

name: Nyatwali Beach Lodge Campsite
description: Directly at the lake with huge trees, no sign. Friendly cartaker woman opened a bungalow and we use the toilet and cold shower in the bungalow. Price negotiable we paid 10 000Tsh but she asked for 17000Tsh

name: Kiliman Coffee Tours
description: Amazing community cooperative run programme offering coffee and cultural tours. Get a tour of a real coffee farm by coffee farmers. They take you through each stage of coffee growing, from the tree to your cup. You pick your own coffee, shell it, dry it and roast it and finally enjoy :-) One of the coolest experiences we've had in TZ! We paid Tsh40000 pp for a half day tour including homemade lunch. Book via: info@kilimanculturaltourism.com or call +255 765 143737 or +255 782 324121. We booked one day in advance. There is also a campsite and homestay offering reasonable accommodation.

name: Kiliman Cultural Tours
description:
Cooperative running coffee tours and other cultural tours, also offer basic camping ground. No room fit vehicles at the moment, but they plan to expand. Ground tents can be rented. Fee is 10,000 pppn. Homemade food and homestay also available. Amazing views in the foot hills of Kili!!

2 Sept 2017; Unfortunately we weren't able to find this place by the main road that passes it on the left. And the other road is a small dusty road which we weren't sure where it led to.

UPDATE: Leave the main road at -3.244419, 37.356306

name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area Gate
description: The gate for Ngorongoro Crater. Can pay with credit card at gate. No longer need a permit. No real reason to visit this area.

name: Endabash Public Campsite
description: One of two public campsites in Lake Manyara NP. Ablutions with running water here, unlike the site closer to the gate. Very small space for camping but we were the only ones here. Probably because it costs $34 pppn. Not will laid out - on a river bank but ablutions block any hope of a view. Way overpriced for what it is.

name: Keys Lodge & Camping
description:
Campground belongs to Key Lodge, is opposite the street. No view of Kilimanjaro due to high trees. Has also three big tents with bunk beds in it, usually for classes.
Communal lounge under roof, a sink but no kitchen, washrooms are okay.
7US$ (14'000TSH)/p/n

name: Mike John Roussos Grave
description: Next to the road to Ruaha NP we found this beautyful place next to a grave. We came late and departed early. So nobody showed up.

name: Chogela Safari Camp
description: Huge camp situated in a light forest. Friendly staff made a campfire only for us. Clean washroom. We payed 20 Dollars for two adults and three children.

name: Bush camp on road to Mbeya
description: Nice spot to bush camp on dirt road to Mbeya. Minimal tsetse flies. Small road leading to open space and dirt walls to shield from the road. From Tabora, the road is rough but is graded from turn off south of village called Sikonge.

name: Kitulo wild Camp
description:
Wild camping just few meters below the road with a beautiful view to the lake Malawi 60 km in the south. Only off-road accessible over steep rocks. Place for max. two cars.
Probably there is an entrance fee to pay for the national park. In our case there was nobody around.

name: Peace of mind
description:
Medium sized hotel with restaurant, swimming pool, free WiFi and secure parking.

Very nice and clean double room with en-suite including hot shower for 55,000 shillings. The price includes a delicious large buffet style breakfast for two (you can order Spanish omelettes and there’s fresh home made bread, coffee, tea, milo, fresh fruits such as watermelon, pineapple and bananas). Free WiFi. Secure parking within a gate (which can fit circa 5 vehicles). Friendly staff.

name: Emau Hill Amani Forest Camp
description: Very nice and secluded grassy camp site. Some attractive walks through the semi-rain forrest. A little paradise of peace and quiet.

name: 10 degrees South
description: Lodge and hostel across the road from the sea. Right next to Eco2 Dive Centre. Nice bar and restaurant area. Some rooms are private with aircon ($70 per room). Other rooms share bathrooms and only have a fan ($25-30 per room).

name: Matembe beach resort
description: correction. seemed we were at lutherian.  nice place but not the money worth. 15000 pp. moved to neighbour matema beach resort. 15000 including breakfast and more shade.

name: Matema Lake Shore Resort
description: Best option with rooftent. Nice shade. TSH15000 pppn including breakfast.

name: Isimila Rock Pillars and Stone Age Site
description:
Cost: 10'000tsh pp + 18% vat
Guide not included, works for a tip. Museum and excavations not special, walking through the gorge very nice.

name: Superdoll Tyres
description: Very smart legitimate garage for all things wheels. Alignment on a Defender cost 60,000 TSh and fitting of tyre 5,000 TSh. Also sells new off road tyres (including KO2's). Very professional with waiting room where you can watch the work go on.

name: Maina Holdings Ltd
description: TBL distribution centre for reasonably priced beer.

name: Virgin dry cleaners
description: next to the toilets and alpha choice coffe shop in the nakumatt car park - 5000 TSh per kilo. Quick service same day or 24 hours

name: Top One Inn
description: Cheap Hotel with safe parking. 25000 double

name: Pelamio Guest House
description: Could put up roof tent between fences in this Guest House. 15000 for 2 pp. Also got room

name: Alpha Camp Site Inn Lodge
description:
MOD NOTE perhaps in wrong location
Camp site in middle of Mtwara. could put up roof tent. Owner want to stop camping facilities. could use shower in room. Salt water. 10.000 for us two people. Not to bad. we found nowhere else to camp near the beach

name: Kilwa Seaview Resort
description: Decent campground. close to village. we checkes this one and the Kilwa Dreams. Decided to camp here because of uninterested owner of Kilwa Dreams and because we could bargain here to 5 dolar. Also swimming pool here. Beach of Kilwa dreams was full of seaweed.Anyway see fir yourself.

name: Selous River Camp
description: Lovely place just outside East Gate with nice bar on river. Many anymals. 5 dollar pppn. Excursions can me arranges.

name: Enau Hill Forest Camp
description: A great spot in a wonderful nature area. Facilities: hot shower, long drop, fireplace, jungle bar, restaurant and a lot of shallow places. It's also possible to stay in rooms. Very friendly people and a lot of possibilities to enjoy nature!

name: Ambassador Cafeteria
description: Small Restaurant with rooms. Good stop on the way to or from Rwanda. Car (Landrover Defender) just fits in gate. Intented to camp here, but same price as room; 10000TSH/pax (negotiated). Simple but clean.

name: Manyara NP main gate
description:
Main gate of Manyra NP
Price ppp24h 45$ (single entry only!)
Price per car 40$
Public camp site 30$pppn (check if water available!)
For extending the permit for another 24h you have to go to the main gate. No refunds.

name: Jubilee Tyres Karatu Branch
description:
Helpful and skilled people, have some 16inch tyres, no 18inch available. 
Very friendly place.

name: Napuru waterfall office
description: Wonderful waterfalls, very idyllic. Around 1.5-2h walk from arusha town, very scenic. Try it! Get a guide in town, he will know. Entrance cost 10$ at the office, worth the money.

name: Kilimanjaro bush camp
description: Large space at the foot of Kilimandjaro. Great view of the Kilimandjaro if not cloudy. Good place for few days. Nobody around. Very quiet place. 4WD recommended.

name: Amboni caves
description:
Rates: 
20'000tsh pp foreign visitors. Guides at the office right nect to the cave. Accessible by car.

name: Mziray Oil
description: Last/first fuel stop around Horohoro border on Tanzanian side

name: Bushcamp
description: Bush camp on the road close of Mikumi NP. Nothing spacial and you can hear the traffic from the road but good place for overnight if you are on the road.

name: Doffa Safari Camp
description: Closest camp to the Ngorongoro Crater gate. Lots of spacious campsites on grass. Shade. Room for large trucks. Toilet and shower old, but functional. Owner, Charles, friendly. Price $10 pppn

name: Kwa Mtoro Village
description:
We got stuck traveling the back road between Singida and Dodoma. Failed shock which smashed a fuel connector. Seif, an amazing bush mechanic, repaired both. We camped in front of his home/shop in the village for several days. Problem was not his repair, but getting the air out of our TD5's fuel line. (Not sure GOS coordinate entered correctly... this is in the village of Kwa Mtoro

35°25'29.7"E

name: Calman Lodge
description: Decent place to stay while waiting for parts for our Land Rover. TSH35,000 pn for 2 for a small room, includes African breakfast (mainly carbs) Shower hot some of the time 😜Be sure to spray mattress before sleeping, bed bugs. Few places to eat. Finally found Free Point Pub which has a variety of African food. Secure parking, okay for larger rigs.

name: Free Point Pub and Restaurant
description: Best place we found to eat in town while we wait for a part to arrive for our Land Rover. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We've eaten lunch here everyday. Off the road so more quiet. Menu primarily African. Good food. Good price. Even has vegetarian options.

name: CMC Automobiles Land rover
description: Land Rover mechanics, also work on other vehicles. They sent a mechanic out to us about three hours away when we got stuck. Good mechanics. Limited parts.

name: Bush Baby
description: Very great place for tents, space for vehicles. Friendly and kind owners, they are starting his business and are very open to opinions to improve. We were biking and the invited us to stay for few days.

name: Beer and soda wholesale
description: To the left of the four story building is a small shop with all you need for drinking. Open 08:00 to 17:00 daily.

name: BMC lodge
description: Nice lodge, 30'000tsh for 2 persons in one room including breakfast. Warm shower en-suite.

name: near Usambara Mountains
description:
In the sparse bush, near the track.
View to the lake and the mountains, no people.

3G with TIGO Network

name: Customs and Immigration Tansania
description:
Friendly people, open when ferry is operating.
Maybe you can stay overnight at the parking lot.

name: Ferry
description:
Small parking place at the ferry landing at the river, because Ferry left early in the morning, some garbage. 
Quiet at night, hippos could be heard.

name: Capricorn Cottages
description: 5 gorgeous self contained cottages on the beach. Incredible restaurant with traditionally Indian cuisine as well as all other foods types. Excellent place to eat!

name: Peku-Peku
description: Only camping in the whole Zanzibar Island. Owner is really friendly and showed me the surroundings. Camping on sand but many trees to have shade. Gated. I cooked with staff and owner. Has also some bandas and a house to rent. About 2 minutes from beach, which is not touristy. Wonderful sunset from beach. Very nice place and very cheap.

name: Mwaji Group Workshop Ltd.
description:
Brought our car for service here, not very trustworthy. The were filling cheap oil into quality bottles and tried to hide it when i saw them. Highland Motors was recommended by me by another tourist, ask for Benny: 0754274381. 
cant recommend Mwaji Group.

name: Manjis Gas
description: Manjis Gas Store, refill for non-Tanzanian LPG gas bottles (Cadac etc.)

name: Zanzibar Ferry
description:
Ferry terminal to go to Zanzibar. You may reserve online but don’t have to.

Do not trust the ticket agents on the street. Go straight to official counter in the terminal (with your confirmation number from online registration if you did that). You still need to pay in person with cash. Bring US dollars ($35 ppn for economy, $40 for business) if you can as they will charge slightly more for shillings with an office exchange rate

The online form will tell you to arrive 3 hrs advance. Not at all necessary. We arrived an hour and half before sailing. 

Bring passport and yellow fever card. Both are needed at the Zanzibar immigration.

name: Mount Longido Guesthouse
description: Very nice clean Guesthouse with quiet rooms. We have parked our truck just outside the door and slept inside but it was safe because a Masai Askari was watching at night. Before we tried to sleep in the bush but had an uncomfortable encounter with some armed people so we decided to move. We can recommend this place. Breakfast with omelettes included for Tsh 30000

name: Sikonge
description: hotel / Lodge, just outside the village. Rooms en suite, clean. sh. 30000.

name: Oloip Campsite and Guesthouse
description:
Grassy camping area in the garden. 
Needs maintenance 
$10pppn

name: Maua Cafe, restaurant and Information
description: Maua Cafe serves breakfast, lunch and on Friday's, dinner. We serve Lunji Coffee grown on the slopes of Mbeya Peak. While chilling and eating a meal, you could visit our gift shop too, which has crafts from women groups in Mbeya Region. We are about 800m from Mbeya Town Center. Business hours are from 8:00am-17:30pm and till 9:00pm on Fridays.

name: JP Safari Hotel
description: Looks like relatively new place. Everything was super clean. Only 40 000 TZS for Double Room. Quiet neighborhood. Good for when you have to get your vehicle serviced in Mbeya and don't want to camp somewhere.

name: Highland Motors
description: Benny Perraira, runs this well equipped garage. They worked a full day on our 4x4 having to take out side axle and replacing a wheel bearing, also fixed a front shock and did a minor service (oil and filters) all for only 85 000 TZS. Highly recommended.

name: Njema Hotel
description: Simple clean and cheap. 20000 for a double room with hot shower and satellite tv. No breakfast. Didn't enquire about camping - would be surprised if there was any space for it

name: Mbeya Golden City Hotel
description: Nice hotel with spacious double room. Hot showers, secure parking and breakfast included. 50,000tsh

name: Hondo Hondo Udzungwa Forest Camp
description: Beautiful place on perimeter of the Udzungwa Forest National Park. Several primates and birds are visible from the campsite. Camping is $10,00 per person. There is also Bandas and Safari Tents. Meals are available from the restaurant.

name: Saadani National Park
description: Through the park is the shortcut from Pangani to Dar Es Salaam. It is no longer permitted for foreigners to pass through the park on motorcycles or bicycles without paying parkaccess, due to increasing animal numbers.

name: Mala Green (MG) Campsite Park
description: A pleasant place to stop over on the way to/from Malawi. Camping 5000tsh, rooms from 15000tsh. There was no food available when I was there, but the owner is friendly and speaks good English.

name: Free ATM at KCB Bank
description:
As much of the ATMs in Stone Town charge up to 17.000 tzs and have a limit of 400.000tzs, here the limit for foreign cards is 900.000tzs WITHOUT fees :-)

Be sure that you have many before leaving the town because there is no other atm in the island out of Stone Town.

name: Ridge Cafe
description: Modern coffee shop with cakes and smoothies also available. Next to official Airtel and Vodacom service shops. On first floor (upstairs) of business centre.

name: Britam Insurance + COMESA
description:
They sell us local insurance and COMESA without problems and even cheaper as National Travel Corporation who had problems to sell insurance over the road tax deadline.
3 months local inaurance + 3 months COMESA = 160.000 tzs

name: FPCT - vehicle storage / hotel
description:
This is the Service Centre of the Free Pentecostal Church in Tanzania. 
Safe parking (under roof) for 2.500/day (USD 5,- for foreign vehicle). When I was here there was some overlander vehicles for long term storage. Very friendly staff.

They offer comfortable rooms from 30.000ppn included breakfast.

Uber to Ferry terminal or to Airport aprox. 8.000-10.000. Shuttle service is more expensive.

Heriel Gabriel 
fpctcentre@gmail.com
+255 712658038

Manager is Robin Bulungu

name: Aquarium tours - Kombo
description:
Ask at the Aquarium for Kombo. Best place for booking tour to Mnemba after we was aproached by several touts at the beach and hotels double the prices...
Kombo was just fair without negociation for low season at 25.000tzs

They organize also other tours as deep sea fishing or in the island...

name: Feel happy guest house & bar
description:
7000TSH for double bed room. Next to main road. Very clean. They will get your motorcycle inside the bar dor the night for security. Very limited English  speaking staff. 

There​ was no power until 9pm but they started generator from 6pm. The generator was next to my room so very noisy and the bar was showing very loud TV. Luckily, the power came back at 9pm and they stopped the TV so the rest of the night was quieter. 

Had a visit from little mice during the night :)

name: Stanley Motel Annex  in Singida
description: It's a motel but they let you to camp. Friendly staff, clean. You can stay on the grass or in the car park. We were two car and four people. We payed scelling 25.000 for a clean room to use toilette. This is a second time we stop here. Very good place to stop

name: Wild Camping
description: flat area not far fro. the road. a bit noisy. flat ground and no people around. nothing to stay for teo night, but because of missing alternatives ok.

name: Behind the bush
description: wild camping, somewhere behind the bush. just follow the track from the main road. bike only!!!!

name: Pikilili motorcycle mechanics
description:
Great place to fix or maintain your motorbike. Its run by an English girl, Claire, whom is an overlander herself. She trains locals to become mechanics as well as doing a project to fix up 400 abandoned  motorbike ambulances. These motorbike amulances will be ridden by women and mostly used in remote rural areas. 

Even if you don't want your motorbike to be fixed it's wonderful to step by at the store and have a chat with her. Very inspiring! In case you're in need of a comfortable room, she also offers accomodation on airbnb. 

Highly recommended😊

name: Mara Paradise Hotel
description: needs some renovation but nice place to stay. Has good wifi en breakfast included. 30.000 double room(we didn't negotiate). cold water, rooms were clean. food in restaurant ok to fill your stomach.

name: Kasumulu Border Post
description:
Entering Tanzania from Malawi.
Paid 50$ pp for 3 month single entry visa.
Plus 25$ road tax for the car (Toyota landcruiser)
Nice and friendly, just had to wait half an hour for an agent for paying road tax)
The road tax is per month of stay, up to 3 months.

We got a TIP rather than use the carnet.
Have photocopies of your passport, car registration papers and drivers' licence ready to save the hassle of going to the shops outside.

We crossed on a Sunday and it's nice and quiet and relaxed. Apparently on weekdays it's a different story.

There's an ATM here, just behind the insurance office (at the gate going towards malawi on the left hand side).

Update: 12-2021 blackmarket exchange TAN to  MAL are quite good! Monday morning no problem on the business.

name: Dodoma
description: A hotel run by the Catholic Church.  They allowed us to camp in their extensive grounds but in the end we paid for a room at a discount. Charmless but at least a place to stay.

name: Kalambo Falls Official Campsite
description: Government run campsite right at the top of the falls. Plenty of shade, new ablutions. Concrete tent pads, space for roof tents and big rigs. Entry fee to see the falls is 15$ p.p + 5 usd per car and you can actually camp here without paying extra for that.

name: Itwelele Mount View Resort
description:
Rundown spot with chalets you wouldn't want to sleep in. 
Looks like it might do parties at the weekend, but can't say.
It was void of guests when we stayed.
Paid 10,000 TSc for 2 people camping. Some trees for shade.
Used a chalet for the African toilet with bucket water.
A little noise from the road, but little traffic overnight: good sleep.
Perfectly do-able as a 1nighter.

name: Oryx Mbeya Depot
description: At the depot they can refill gas bottles. Even Cadac. Very friendly and helpful staff. Could take same time as it is a big depot.

name: Singea Heritage Cottage Hotel
description: Hotel Mgr will allow camping in there large back garden. Also use of bathroom and power. Paid Ts 30,000 for 2 of us. Cold beer at bar

name: KBH Hotel
description: A hotel next to the Lake. Very friendly staff. Very clean, free wifi. We took a chance as we couldn't find camping in the area. We got an en-suite room (double bed) for 45000 TZS, including breakfast, which works out cheaper than most camping places in the rest of Tanzania!

name: hot springs
description: Awesome hot springs entry 10000, moto there 15000 from Boma including the way back

name: Big hole... shimo la mungu
description: Volcano crater in the middle of nowhere some 10 kms south of this spot, need to ask local masai people, need 4by4, please respect the place, don't litter, physically by waste, nor mentally by giving money or sweets to kids... Ask for pictures, thanks

name: stoney viewpoint
description: Stone village with nice view of the surrounding... The only pity if u r white they ask u for some fake entrance fee of 10000pp

name: Bush camp
description: quiet bush camp close ta the main road. Few people came to say "Hello".

name: New Holland Hotel
description: Very neat hotel with friendly staff and good affordable restaurant. Double room cost 45 000 TZS. Rooms are spacious with a desk and bathrooms have proper hot showers and western flush toilets. Bed sheets are super clean.Safe parking available. They even wash your vehicle.

name: Sombrero Restaurant
description: We had difficulty finding a restaurant that's open at night in Mbeya. We walked around and stumbled upon this intimate restaurant with seating space for about 20 people. The manager was super friendly and could speak English fluently. Their menu is extensive and very affordable. We shared a chicken curry with fried rice which was delicious.

name: Azra Provisions
description: Decent sized supermarket (for Tanzanian standards) with reasonable prices. Good place to stock up on dry foods and sauces.

name: KCB Bank free ATM
description:
KCB ATM is the only bank we know without fees. There is also one at Zanzibar and a couple in Dar es Salaam.
The information says the limit is TSH900.000 but we could take TSH400.000  per transaction.

name: Okaoni Hotel
description: A very decent hotel. Not in the centre but an ideal location on our way to Rwanda. The staff speaks a bit English but is  friendly. Spotless bedsheets, hot hot shower! The property is fenced and a security guard was next to our car whole night long. TS40.000 for the room including breakfast. They also have TS30.000 rooms but they were already full. There are a lot of hotels in Dodoma, no campsites.

name: Safari Lodge Room
description: Clean rooms with bathroom (hot shower). We paid 40.000 Shilling per night for a single (2 persons). Simple breakfast for 1 person included. The bar next door can be a bit noisy but it's very good value for money. Private parking, laundry service for 1.000 Shilling per item. It's hard to find, go right after the green palm bar (if you're coming from Dar). The gate of the hotel is in the left corner of the parking.

name: Amazing Grace Lodge
description: Basic but clean room for 15,000 shillings. No running water, just a bucket that you use to flush the toilet. Rats/mice running around in ceiling but they were unable to enter the room! Not great but okay if you're stuck!

name: COMESA insurance FAKE
description:
Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

1) Exiting Malawi:
Fill out an exit form and stamped out easily. They take in your T.I.P when exiting.

2) Entering Tanzania:
Write your name in an administrative book.
3) Fill out an entrance form  and get stamped in. 
A single entry 90 days visa costs USD50,- pp only payable in USD.

4) Whilst waiting you can arrange your T.I.P for FREE. Have a copy of your driving license, car registration papers and passport ready to hand over. They'll check your car and you pay the USD25.-for the "Road Tax" at the bank across the street(it has an ATM next to it where you can take out TZS400 000,- max. excl. TZS8 000,- ATM fee). After the payment you collect your T.I.P

5) COMESA insurance after exiting. Enter the 'M-Pesa G8 Pub' and take the alley at the left side of the building until you hit 'Samosa Barber Shop' painted on the wall. Take the door at the left and you will see a man behind his desk in the corner. 
He asked USD80,- for the COMESA.
We showed him a message of the COMESA for TZS160 000,- (USD70.-) in Dar. 

After 2 min we could manage to get it for USD60,- TZS 130.000.- Because how more you ask how less you get. 3 months covering Burundi, Ethiopia, Kenya, Malawi, Rwanda, Sudan, Swaziland, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia and Zimbabwe(probably still a rip off).

Point 1 to 5 took us 2 hours.

name: Simba Hotel and Lion Hotel
description: 2 hotels run and operated by the same staff but across a road from each other. Comfortable bed, very clean, mosquito net, good breakfast included, electricity all nigh, nice fully functioning bathroom with working drain, hot shower, restaurant and bar at Simba Hotel. Rooms from 20,000Tsh per night for a room as per their price list, same price for 2 occupants.

name: Leon Adventures
description: Quality safaris for an affordable price, in the northern circuit of Tanzania

name: Flamingo safari lodge and campsite
description: Nice campsite in a green environment for only 10$ per person. Swimming pool, electricity, hot shower, WiFi included. Bar and restaurant available. Next to main road and big trucks are allowed.

name: Barry's Beach Resort
description:
The resort is a luxury hotel on a quiet, pristine, white sand beach near Sange Village, 26km North of Saadani National Park and 43km south of Pangani Town on the East Coast of Tanzania.

Just a few steps away from the beach, Barry's Beach Resort offers accomodation on a secluded private beach near Sange Village. The resort has an outdoor pool a restaurant and bar.

The bungalow stayle rooms are made out of rich local materials. Each room is equipped with a desk, a fan,safe box, a mosquito net. All beds,lines are in high quality materials for your perfect comfort. The ensuite bathrooms are fitted with a shower and all have hot water; The resort's restaurant and bar over looks the beach.

We also have campsite on our tropical paradise!


Phone: +255 (0)688 290 587; +255 (0)652 813107, Whats-app +255 (0)755 759 336 

Email :  book@barrysbeachresort.com

name: Gibbs farm lodge
description:
Fantastic place to eat. Stunning views over the garden and coffee plantation. Nice buffet.
Prices: 15$ for Lunch, 10$ for coffee plus tour.

name: Commission of Kenya: East African
description:
Update reference The EAC combination visa it is no longer available at the Commission of Kenya  in Dar Es Salam only available at the border .

Because we were not sure we could get this visa at the border: this is the High Commission of Kenya where you're able to apply for an East African Combination Visa(Uganda, Rwanda and Kenya) for USD100,-

They need the usual passportcopy and photos, hotel reservation etc.

Only available to apply Tuesday and Fridaymorning: pick up in the afternoon.

Make sure you stand your ground 'though, as we called ahead and on the phone they stated it was possible to get an EAC visa but once there the girl told us we couldn't. After we told her we called ahead she asked her colleague which we had on the phone and we could finally apply.

name: Pick N Pay Supermarket
description: Medium size supermarket but not the same Pick n Pay as in Southern Africa. Well stocked with cat and dog food available,  both wet and dry. Parking outside.

name: Shoppers Plaza
description: a very good mall with supermarket, relaxed shopping

name: Tanzanian Rwandese Immigration Rusumo Falls
description:
Update note Feb 2020 about this check-in description: this mainly applies to the Rwandan one stop border hall, not the Tanzanian one where this check-in co-ordinates apply. From TZ to RW, go straight to the RW one stop border post and NOT this one.

----

Dutch citizens without Carnet de Passage

We arranged our East African Visa via the Rwandese governments website, where there is an option to 'pay later' at the chosen borderpost.

After three days we received two PDF files which we had to show at the border.  We weren't able to print the files but luckily we were helped without a problem.

Both countries' immigration, customs and bank is in one big hall:
We had to show the PDF files on our phone to get an exit stamp from Tanzania and had to visit customs and the bank first.
At customs we immediately asked for a TIP as well and received a slip for both the VISAS and the TIP to pay at the bank.

90 days, multiple entries, East African Visa USD100,- pp
TIP for 15 days is RWF 15 000,-(around USD19,- according to the banks exchange rate), TIP is extendable in bigger cities.

After the bank we had to go to immigration to receive our VISAS and to customs to receive our TIP.

Everything was very easy and efficient and done in less than an hour.

name: Diamond Palace Self Contained Rooms
description: Very nice, new hotel. 20,000Tsh for a room with 2 people.  Very good breakfast included. Cold shower but not an issue, sit down toilet. Comfort bed and pillows. Bar and Restaurant on site and nearby. Friendly staff.

name: Rweba Guest House
description: Very basic hotel with squat toilet in ensuit. 10,000Tsh for 2 in a very small room. No food but the motel across the road and next door have restaurants, these may have nicer and include breakfast but we didn't investigate.

name: Mbozi Meteorit
description: Mbozi Meteorit, found in 1930. There is an entry fee of 10000Tsh pp. A new visitor center is in construction.

name: utupoa
description: double room under open grassroof. affordable prices for tasty meals. direct beach access.

name: German cemetery
description: old German cemetery from the colonial time

name: german school
description: old German school built 1896. first multiracial school.

name: Patamu Lodge
description:
Very nice and relaxed place. A hotel/restaurant where they allow you to camp inside the gate and use a room for bathing and toilet at a reduced rate. Very clean beds and bathrooms. Very friendly staff. They organise safaris into the crater too. Price for camping USD 15 pppn incl use of bathroom. Price for hotelrooms Single 30, double 40, triple 45 USD pppn including breakfast. 
Bush hot lunch (tour) USD 40 pp. They make an excellent pizza

name: Ma Claree
description: Local restaurant with great food and friendly service. For two people we had a full dinner for around 15.000 tsh

name: Ocean Breeze Lodge
description: Good place to stay overnight. Rooms are available—we could camp and use room ablutions or sleep in room, same price. Decent room with moz net and overhead fan. Camped outside as there is plenty of space. 1 4x4, 1 motorcycle, 1 ground tent and 2 roof top tents and 3 persons for 20.000 tzsh. No wifi but simple shower and toilet free of use. The lady in charge had to call the owner for permission but this wasn't a problem. Good place to stay if all you need is a place to sleep!

name: Bush Camp on the road to Kipili
description: Very quiet spot just off the dirt road to Kipili. Camp in a old excavation site, so barely visible from the road. No-one passing through and no villages for 10km either direction. Very peaceful!

name: Kondoa Climax Hotel
description: Simple hotel with fenced parking lot. 10.000TSH for a double with en-suite bathroom and breakfast. Noisy during the night, though.

name: Chumbe Island Office
description:
Office of the Chumbe Island daytrip, you can book and pay here in person.
A daytrip is $90 pp. The island is idyllic, the lunch excellent, but we enjoyed the snorkeling more at Nakopane and Prison Island.

name: Lobo public campsite
description: $30 pp +18%Vat. You can buy the permit and camping fee at Lobo, at the ranger post. Beautiful view from the campsite. The cooks of the tour operators start cooking around 4am, so it is better to find a place farther from the kitchen.

name: World View Campsite
description: Nice campsite with great view, $10 pp. Lots of tourists. The guided tour to the waterfall and to the lake is $20 pp. The waterfall is a must, just be prepared for a number of river crossings, also in waist deep water. It was very windy during the night. Yaro will introduce you to the village people and invite you into the huts. He can arrange a hike up on the volcano or Lake Natron.

name: Taveta one-stop border
description: For Kenya you need to apply online for the eVisa. If one spends more than 7 days in Kenya, then has to pay foreign vehicle fee, $40 for one month, $100 for three months for a Toyota Land Cruiser. Fee has to be paid in bank which is closed Saturday afternoons and Sundays. But they manage to find a person who pays online and whom you can pay in cash (KES). Just takes more time. Very helpful staff and calm atmosphere. You might get a personal clearing agent assigned who organises all paperwork.

name: Hippo Garden Lodge & Campsite
description:
No signage on the main road but there is a sign at the road where the place is, next to river side camp. But a bit nicer. Right at the hippo pool. These animals and their elephant friends sometimes come play in the garden at night. Special!

Self contained with nice bed and mozzie net for 30k tsh a night. Camping is 15.000 Tsh/pppn. 

Ran by a sweet lady who cooks nice meals and makes sure everything is fine. 

Excellent Vodacom coverage.

name: central fruit and vegetable market
description: rich choice of all kinds of fresh food. fruit and vegetables. bread oil and so on.

name: Kilimanjaro star supermarket
description: bier, wine, mince, frozen chicken, and other 1st world articles

name: Heritage Hotel
description:
Clean hotel with free onsite guarded parking. Friendly staff. Is on booking.com.
(currently under renovation as of March 8th 2019)

name: TRA/Customs
description: For extending Foreign Vehicle Tax and permission to store the vehicle if you leave the country temporarily. The tax is 20$ per month in 2010

name: adcam
description:
tented camp with camping opportunity.  you get a tent with shower and toilet to use. the camp finances a boarding school for the massai and a project to empower the women.  price is 15 us $ per tent 

00254 77507 03 69

name: Kigoma Motors
description: Toyota Trooper, Mitsubishi Delica repaired: general welding, bumper reattached, severed electrical cable repaired, new battery box made. Msouth speaks English and is a capable electrical mechanic. Concrete floor and covered work bays.  Large open central concreted area can probably handle bigger rigs.

name: Domia Estates
description: This is a winery, no camping, but beautiful rooms, delicious dinner, lunch, breakfast and packed lunch for the next day at a super reasonable rate. ($120 for all that for 2 of us including a bottle of their wine at dinner). You just can't beat it for a break from camping in Dodoma. Everything is home made/grown from the wine to the cheese and the oyster mushrooms. Energetic friendly family run place with a cool pool. Their website will be up in a few days so check availability and pricing there. It's small, so do check.

name: Namangara TZ/KE
description:
Easy and quick one stop border post. Cost us 4200 KSH for the vehicle. No longer possible to get Kenyan eVisa at the border. Need to apply online in advance. 
See more details in the Check-In section

name: African Jungles
description:
Nice B&B in a quiet neighbourhood in Moshi, a treat after a few nights of camping! Single room with attached bathroom is 30 USD incl breakfast. Good WiFi. Secure parking on premises.
Only downside is that it’s a bit of a walk to town if you don’t have your own transport.

name: Old Moshi Railway Station
description: Abandoned colonial buildings and railway. Good view of Kilimanjaro around sunset time, and there’s a pub on the platform so great spot for a sundowner!

name: Camp behind Bush
description: Bush Camp behind a big ... Bush. Not really good but okay for one Night. Around 100 m from the Main Road on a slightly narrow Moto Track (but no Problem with 4x4). Partially visible from the Street but the Bush covers you. As we arrived at Dusk and it got dark soon nobody saw us or bothered us. Very quite. In the Morning some People crossed the Fields near us, all friendly.

name: The Secret Garden Hotel Moshi
description:
Added by Owner - The Secret Garden is a fully serviced property to meet all your needs. More than just a place to  rest your head, it is a heaven of tranquility, fresh food, hot showers and perfectly mixed cocktails. A home away from home with staff who care .

=================================

An amazing place with stunning views of kili from their bar/restaurant area and some of the rooms
. staff is very friendly and helpful. 
the rooms are reasonable ($20 - $50). prices are negotiable and includes breakfast. 
free wifi and secure parking.
nice and quiet area out of the town centre. 
================================
A hidden gem! lovely little hotel in quiet surrounds with amazing views of mount kilimanjaro and conveniently located close to the airport (no noise) The owner and his staff are super friendly and will bend over backwards to make you feel comfortable. The rooms are nice and range from king double with views of kilimanjaro to triple, quadruple and twin rooms with bathroom. Prices are between 20 to 45 usd per room, great value for the money. We absolutely loved our stay, having sundowners on their sundeck with views over kilimanjaro while the sun was going down.. the food was superb as well, big portions and super tasty! we can highly recommend this place to any overlanders, tourists and budget travellers..

name: MV Liemba Boat Tour
description:
You can visit the oldest passenger ferry in the world when the old lady lies in the harbour. We did a 30 Minute Tour with the Captain. Most of the Rooms (Cabins, Machine Rooms) were locked and he was not very motivated. Not allowed to take pictures from the outside/whole ship as the harbour is a military area. TSH10 000 pp.

The boat sails to Zambia twice a month departing from Kigoma on Wednesdays. 1st Class ferry tickets are USD105 pp one way.

name: D. R. Congo Consulate
description: We tried to get a DR Congo Visa here in order to visit the Virunga National Park (we read that it might me cheaper here then organizing it through the Park). However, it's not possible. Tanzania Residents only. We will now apply through the Park Website (105 USD pp).

name: First/Last Fuel Station
description: This is the first/last Fuel Station if you are coming from/going to Rwanda. Diesel is cheaper than Rwanda.

name: Golden Eagle Hotel
description: Double room with ensuite bathroom for 30.000 TSH. Secure parking. Great restaurant with Indian food. Hot shower, french toilet. Very helpful and knowledgeable manager, helped to get our car fixed on the spot. Great place for a Stop-Over from Serengeti to Tanganijka Lake. There is a power Point in the parking lot to plug in your fridge if needed.

name: Mama Iringa
description: Restaurant and bed and breakfast in an old convent. Quiet and peaceful place with nice, comfortable rooms, and great Italian food.

name: Hasty tasty too
description: Nice local restaurant where they serve Tanzanian and Indian food at reasonable prices.

name: Tanzania Customs & Immigration (Unity Bridge)
description:
Immigration and customs in the same building. Officials are nice. Very little traffic here. No money changers. Closest ATM in Masasi. Entering Tanzania, we are American citizens and so our only option was $100 for multiple entry visa.  Most other nationalities pay $50.  Customs stamped our carnet and also provided a TIP since he said the police like to see the TIP. Customs charged us $25 road tax. Final step was to show our Yellow Fever immunization certificates to the health official. 
The closest town is Masasi, accessible on an excellent tar road.

name: BR Hotel
description: In Masasi, a good overnight stop before or after the Unity Bridge border with Mozambique. En suite room with fan and TV is 30,000 shillings. Secure car park in the back of the hotel. Bar / restaurant in front (facing the main road) with good bar food. Little English spoken so you get to practice your KiSwahili.

name: Nduvini Motors
description: Reasonably well organized workshop. They maintain some of the government cars. Eddy is the workshop boss. They do have diesel mechanics. Work was done well and quickly.

name: Ruvula Sea Safari Lodge & Camping.
description: Camping & lodges on the beach. Much shade under high palmtrees. Total silence but the waves. Camping 25.000 Tsh, Cabins from 60.000 Tsh, Dinner/Lunch 25.000 pp. Bucket showers and european toilets. In order to get here you need to pay access to the Mnazi Bay Marine Park: 53.100 Tsh per 24 hours. The road to it is all graded dirt except for the last 5KM which is sand. The place is run more or less by a Belgian, Jean-Marie, who makes an excellent bouillabaise.

name: Quinta Timba Hotel
description: Motel type hotel. Cabins with AC, shower, flush toilet. 1.500 for a basic room. 500 extra for AC, 500 extra for TV. They don’t do camping yet but I’m sure if you insist...

name: Lilac Cafe
description: Excellent locally-owned modern, comfortable cafe for breakfast, lunch, or coffee.

name: Sero 6 Special (private) Campsite
description: One of several “special” (private) campsites in the Seronera area, usually used by mobile safari groups. No facilities.  No other campers. Sero 6 is a large flat grassy area with trees by the river and has a beautiful view of the hills. Very peaceful. Previous name was Kubu Kubu. (That’s how it’s marked on the Veronica Roodt map of the park).  $50 pppn. Can be booked at TANAPA HQ in Arusha.

name: TANAPA (Tanzanian Parks) HQ
description:
Here one can book private “special campsites” in the Serengeti. Sites have no facilities and no other campers. $50 pppn. Payable with credit card. You should have an idea in advance which sites you want to book since there isn’t a map here. It’s also helpful to know the site location before you arrive in the Park since some are poorly marked, Park employees aren’t informed, and apparently the locations of the special sites changes quite often. 
The TANAPA HQ building is marked African Court on Human and Peoples Rights

name: Ngorongoro Information Center
description: Here you can book a special campsite in the NCA for $50pppn. These are private campsites with no facilities, no other campers. It’s possible to pay entrance fees here with credit card, but you can also opt to pay these fees at the gate.

name: Nyati Special Campsite
description: Private “special campsite” with no facilities and no other campers. Close to the crater ascent road. Beautiful field surrounded by trees & vegetation. Clean. Quiet. Waterbuck were on the site when we arrived and 10 African buffalo visited. $50pppn. Can be booked at Ngorongoro Info Center in Arusha. It may also be possible to book in Karatu (?)

name: Sero 4 Special Campsite
description:
One of several “special” (private) campsites in the Seronera area. No facilities.  Sero 4 is in open savanna with a shade tree full of weaver nests and a beautiful expansive view. Many zebras around. Hyenas and lions nearby. $50pppn. 
Now it's $60pppn(March 2022)

name: Giraffe Garden Hotel
description: Very good value in Mugumu. 40,000 TSH for a clean, comfortable, well maintained double room with en suite bathroom. Breakfast included. Pretty gardens. Very good set menu dinner for 10,000 TSH per person.

name: Gombe Stream National Park (chimps)
description:
Gombe Stream is famous as the place where Jane Goodall did her research on wild chimps. This is an expensive park to visit since it’s not accessible by road, and the entry fee is $118 per adult per 24 hours, including VAT. But it’s wonderful to see the chimps! We spent nearly 5 hours in the rainforest and saw 20 different individuals. 
You can make a day trip here from Kigoma. Jakobsen’s Beach will organize a boat. You leave from Jakobsen’s early morning for the 2 hour journey on beautiful Lake Tanganyika. Pay park fees on arrival with credit card. (Bring cash as well since the credit card machine didn’t work in the rain). Food is available in the rest camp or bring your own. 
Total cost for two adults is $470.  $210 round trip for the boat (payable in shillings directly to the boat captain.  Cost is per boat & there’s room for at least 8 people), $118 per adult conservation fee, and $24 per group for the ranger to take you on a chimp trek.

name: Kasaine Guesthouse
description:
15000THS.
friendly staff, clearn room.There is a bar with guest hoouse.

name: Quarry between Itigi and Tabora
description: Old quarry situated 100 m from the road. Not visible from the road. Had a quite night. People around in the in the vicinity. They did not know about us and we were not disturbed  by them.

name: Karatu quality auto spares & garage ltd
description: Work shop very performing. Parts in less than 3 hours (from Arusha). They changed the water pomp of my car in less than five hours, including picking parts in Arusha. Price really correct. They charged 40 euros for fitting.

name: Regency hotel
description: Nice, new and modern hotel. Big clean rooms with ensuite bathroom (toilet and hot shower). Also a swimmingpool, bar and restaurant. Not cheap 100000 tsh for a two person room. Nice view over the lake.

name: Camp Bastian
description:
Attractive, well designed lodge with bandas and camping. Beautiful gardens and secure parking. Vans can drive inside to campsite. Tents and Camp gear avaliable for hire. Camping costs $10 and breakfast is avaliable at extra cost. 
Full board $25!

name: Peponi Beach Resort
description:
Very nice place well organised.
Camping 8$pppn
Restaurant and bar
Food not great but ok 
Several camping spot for tent and for trucks on the beach.
Can be busy (around 30 guest total when we arrived)
Shower hot between 6pm and 8pm but a bit salty clean enough.
Wifi free at reception but too far from camping spot.
Several activities available 
Really worth a visit

name: Miami Lodge
description: Room 15,000Tsh/night. Bathroom inside, with mosquito net and fan. squat toilet. Room very clean. You can order food also.

name: Kilwa Beach Lodge
description: Lodge with quiet campsite at seaside. directly next to Kilwa dreams, but slightly more luxurious. is now being maintained and a new area for cooking will be built. we stayed here when they were actually closed for tsh15.000 per tent, normal price is 30.000 per tent.

name: Nastory work shop
description: Little work shop for every mechanical problem advised by Chris from lakeshore campsite (kipili). Located just after airstrip on the left side coming from north. Behind moodys shop.

name: Olympia lodge
description: Hotel about 5 km from T jonction when coming from Sumbawanga. Possibility for roof tent but more expensive than room. Room is 25000 TZS for two including breakfast with private ablutions. Hot shower. Restaurant on place. Noisy.

name: The Garage Moshi
description: This is the new place for The Garage, the owner Sam is very much passionate about motorcycles and Land Rovers. We really enjoyed staying with him, we had some problems with 1 of the motorcycles and Sam was a great help. There is a nice grassy ground yo pitch up your tent. There is a small bar/restaurant to order food and cold drinks, there is also a place to work on the motorcycle if you need to including the missing tools you don't have your self (probably). Camping price 8 usd, there are also dorm rooms and cheap twin rooms available. Free WiFi available. Secure parking. City Centre is about 500 metres away.

name: Starmax Motel
description: A small clean motel with a restaurant. We got a room with double bed, table and shower with squat toilet for two of us for 13000tsh (originally they wanted 15000tsh). Water is cold, but the reception lady can get you a bucket of hot water on request. Filling breakfast for two was 7000tsh. They have a nice gated parking lot too. A bit nicer place than the guest house across the road.

name: Ferry crossing
description: Kigongo-Busisi vehicle and passengers ferry. A short ferry crossing with live queue. Transit time is about 40 minutes. Ticket for a motorcycle is 1400 tsh. For a 4x4 it’s 6500 tsh. Food and drink available on board.

name: Ferry to mafia
description: 16.000 for boat to MAFIA FROM HERE. Leaves 4am. We left our car at the Swedish mission down the road and stayed there the night we gave 25,000 and said we'd give another 25,000 when we'd return in a weeks time.

name: Vasbyt
description: Perfect place to store your car for long term.

name: KK PLAZA MSATA one stop center
description: Nice roadside spot with local food. Goat, beef and chicken with vegetables, rice and ugali...try the masala tea!

name: TRA - Tanzania Revenue Authority
description: TRA for extension of the TIP. Customs is in Room 210. Friendly staff. You have to wear long trousers for entering the building.

name: Olotu trading co. Ltd/ Hardware Store
description: Good hardware store. We’ve been looking all over the place and this shop was able to provide the part we needed.

name: Villa Poa
description:
This is a nice place to spend a couple of nights and leave the car while going on safari. You can either sleep in your car, parked in front of the house or get a room. You can use the bathrooms inside, which are nice and clean and have always hot water.
If you have a long cable you plug your car in.
Camping is $15 pppn incl. breakfast
2 Dorms (shared bathroom)is $15 pppn incl. breakfast
Room (shared bathroom) $20 pppn incl. breakfast
1 Room with bathroom $37 pppn incl. breakfast
Very friendly and helpful staff!

From here you can book a budget safari with “Greg Adventures”. He’s a very nice guy and the Safari was fun. It’s not at all a luxurious experience, and overall quite basic, keep that in mind but you still get all the animals to see. We did a 2 days Safari to Tarangire NP and Ngoragora crater. They’re quite flexible. We insisted on doing the crater on the second day and leaving at 5am from the camp we stayed, so we’ve been at the gate around 6am and then it takes an other 1,5h to get into the crater. We payed $380 pp.

name: Ango Tree Lodge
description:
Charming little roadside lodge that let us camp in front of a room which they opened so we could use the bathroom. Nice reception area, bar and restaurant. A bit noisy from the road but safe with 24hr security. 

$20usd

name: O.M. Insurance Agency
description: Little insurance office where you can make official vehicle insurance. Contact: Mohamed +255712206158 inside a little Restaurant.

name: Horohoro Borderpost Tanzania
description:
Entering into Tanzania. Customs and Immigration for Tanzania. Branch of NMB Bank with ATM.

All the relevant stations for the border crossing are located in one building. At the entry your bags must go through a scanner. Before you enter the main section there is a reception desk with the health check (in my case Yellow Fever certificate entering from Kenya).

Next comes the immigration with fingerprint scanner and camera. If you haven't got a visa you will be escorted to a back office where your passport gets checked and the application forms have to be filled in. You will receive a deposit form for the nearby NBC bank with an ATM at the backside. At their teller you pay the visa fee and hand back the receipt to the immigration. Afterwards your visa gets printed at the main immigration cubicles.

Next in the round building comes the customs section where you hand in your TIP, TEP or Carnet. 

That should be it. If you need an insurance ask at the NBC bank for a person to guide you ( this is a free service!). They want to get rid of all the "fixers" which have been hanging around in the old days.
Otherwise I marked one official insurance office separate.
Before you leave the premises there is a check point where you fill your details in a book. They open the gate for you.

Good luck... service is quick and efficient.

name: Della Monte Hotel
description:
New hotel on main road just out of town on the Singida side. It's owner is a local magistrate so security is possibly not too much of an issue.
There is room to get a high vehicle into the side gate (most other places in town seem to have top bars on their gates limiting access). There is space for one vehicle up to approx 9m long. Smaller vehicles could enter the compound by the main gate.
Rooms are 25000TSh single, 30000 double. They are clean and modern but with squat toilets. There was a water issue on the day we visited, but are told it is not normal....
A fair amount of noise from the road but not too bad as vehicles are maintaining a constant speed at this point.
No-one except the owner and Askari speak English so a good phrase book may be needed if your Swahili isn't up to scratch!

name: Kelli Experts Limited
description: A spacious, clean and well laid out garage run by Emmanuel who is a veteran Mechanic with long-standing knowledge of 4x4s. Has a ramp, a pit and a shaded garage area with administrative office. My ball joints developed a problem at Mbeya and he replaced them. He even came to collect me from the hotel to take me to the workshop.

name: African Dreams Hotel
description:
We've used this place twice as no camping in Dodoma. First time 6 years ago we took a room, from memory it was about 30USD, this time the place has been fully booked (along with everything else in town) due to a political conference. The sales manager agreed to let us camp in the carpark for 30000Tsh.
The hotel is good by African standards, Aircon in the rooms, hot and cold water if you're lucky/insist. Rooms were clean last time, but he restaurant wasn't impressive, however this evening the fried fish was very good😋.
The carpark at the rear is large enough for any big rigs (they even have an old aircraft parked there), but not suitable for tents or rooftops.

name: KTM Tanzania - Workshop
description: Very unprofesional. Just a house. Don't waste your time here.

name: Jubilee 3rd Party Insurance + COMESA
description:
On the 6th floor of Amani Place they issue liability insurance and COMESA for motorcycles. They only sell 12 months minimum which is 118.000 TSH.

COMESA is 40.000 for 60 days, or 30.000 for 30 days. You can buy for up to 12 months. You get a nice information folder, proof of insurance sticker and photocopies of the COMESA.

Friendly and fast service.

name: Rohobot - Ethiopian Restaurant
description:
This restaurant is well hidden by bumpy dirt roads, but it's a unique gem you shouldn't miss while in town!

Excellent Ethiopian food and coffee at a great price. Very tasteful with lots of different flavors and spices.

30.000 for a shared meal for 3-4 persons. They also do proper Ethiopian coffee ceremonies for 35.000 pp.

name: Mama Sele Local Food
description:
Here you'll get a big plate of food for 3000TSH! Cheapest meal close to the beach! We came back here at least six times, and food is always kept ready and served within a few minutes. 

Choose between fish, meat and sometimes chicken. Always served with lots of rice, spinach, beans, tomatoes and some sauce.

It's a bargain!

name: Summer Dream Lodge
description:
The best and most well run hostel we've been to in Africa so far!

Huge cozy chill out area with hammocks, floating beds, seating groups and good WiFi. Enormous shower heads and hot water. Restaurant makes the most tasty dishes in all of Paje, great variety of food and big portions! The beach is just one minute walk away.

The bar makes lots of different cocktails, and happy hour from 14:00 to midnight.

Dorm beds are 17 USD pppn, but they also have plenty of bungalows for 2 to 4 persons. No AC but plenty of fans in the rooms. Breakfast is included in the price, and is comparable to a proper hotel breakfast. Choose how you like your eggs, and enjoy it with fresh bread and fruits, coffee and ice cold juice.

The vibe is great, and suits any person regardless of age. It's not a party hostel, but they'll inform you about where the parties are at.

Very clean and well kept premises, staff is very service minded and fun! They do the little extras like putting flowers on your bed after making it.

Pay by using PayPal, USD or TSH. There's only one ATM in Paje that charges 15.000 in fees you should bring cash, and also consider booking ahead if you want private room!

Enjoy your stay!!

name: Bunyobi Supermarket
description:
Everytime we've visited this place we've found almost everything we were looking for. Stock cereals, tinned food, frozen meat, drinks, toiletries etc etc.
It's on a one way street, we tend to pass the police station then park near all the mobile phone shops at the the bottom of the hill, parking costs 2500 for all day.
For fruit and vegetables go to the friendly market opposite the police station.

name: Iringa Fresh Produce Market
description: Easy and relaxed fruit and veg market. No hassles from anyone.

name: Victoria Service Station (Lubricants)
description: Big variety of different oils and lubricants, they also carry different filters.

name: Kilimanjaro Backpackers Hotel
description:
Located in the city center, this a nice little hostel. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. It's pretty cheap, starting at 6 USD pppn for dorm rooms. 

Single private room - 8 USD
Double room - 18 USD
Triple room - 27 USD

All prices include Continental breakfast at the rooftop terrace. WiFi works good, it's clean, towels provided and the showers are hot. Nice and helpful staff, can arrange same day laundry service.

Secure indoor parking for motorcycles, great place to work on the bike and do some maintenance if needed. If you come by truck/car, the owner of this hostel owns another 5 hotels in walking distance with secure parking.

If going to Arusha, they also have a hostel there with same prices and things included.

Recommended!

name: Technical climb/decent
description:
Advisable for motorcycles only! This road is partly washed away, and some sections can be extremely narrow and tough to pass with a car. Use extreme caution if passing.

For motorcycles it's rocky and steep, but perfectly fine if you have some off road experience. Enjoy!

name: No bridge! Only motorcycles
description:
