There's no bridge to pass the dam if you're in a car/truck. Not sure if it's only now during rainy season that it's impassable, but for motorcycles it's an adventure perfect for the daredevils.

The dam is just wide enough to bring a motorcycle across. Depending on the type of motorcycle, you need to remove all the luggage, fold in the mirrors and carefully walk the bike over. The local piki pikis could ride them across (no luggage). It's extremely narrow and a drop with water on both sides. Ask the locals for assistance so you don't end up in the dam.

There are alternative ways to avoid going here.

name: ZamZam Bakery
description: Fresh bread and cake. Ask for Isaac. Near the Moravian Centre.

name: Cut Line
description: Small tracks leading from the tarmac to a cut line. Many spots to camp. Locals passed by but did not disturb us. The road was quite noisy but good spot for a night.

name: Fruit & Veg Market
description: Lovely local fruit and Veg market, local prices and very friendly people. Great selection, all fresh!

name: Raju Shop
description: Small supermarket with general provisions and spices, no meat or tinned meat.

name: Don Investment
description:
Vehicle Spares, including Land Rover service kits, oil, fuses etc. 
had a breakdown in Ruaha- Don was great, we called him and he arranged spare parts from Dar es Salaam which he sent to us on the bus to the closest village (next day delivery!!) and said we could pay when we get back to Iringa- fantastic service and super helpful.

name: Kipepe Wholesale Bottlestore
description: Good place to buy beers, spirits & box wine. Most places don’t let you take bottles away but here you can. Just past the bus station.

name: Pizzeria Leone L'Africano
description: Excellent pizza at reasonable price (16k shillings medium pizza).  Really good. Pasta was good, but no match for pizza.  Welcome break from ugali et al.

name: Neema Crafts Guesthouse
description: Nice guesthouse with great cafe and coffee. A favourite amongst local expats, came highly recommended. All rooms en suite, Hot showers, breakfast included and WiFi in the cafe. Single rooms Tsh25,000 and Double Rooms Tsh45,000.

name: Fuel Station
description: First fuel station since leaving Shinyanga.

name: Lake Oil Fuel Station
description: Lake Oil Fuel Station along dirt road. Big diversion in the area where they are building a bridge.

name: immigration visa extension - opening hours 8 a.m. to 2 p.m., Mo-Fr
description: If you need a visa extension of 4 weeks here is th e place to come bring passport copy

name: Endallah Cultural Tours
description: Endallah Cultural Tours creates tailor-made safaris   - all over Tanzania. They can assist you in finding the right accommodation for your wishes, whether it is a luxury lodge or staying within a local village. They have talented drivers who know a lot about the wildlife at the parks.

name: Gabriel's Workshop
description:
This is a small but very reliable workshop in Moshi near Aleems Supermarket. Mr. Gabriel the owner is a very good mechanic and can fix all sorts of cars. I am coming to him since years and was always happy with his work. At the moment I have done a major engine repair on my Toyota Landcruiser HJ60 by him. He has a very good reputation with a lot of expats in town. During the repairs I could stay in his secure yard and camp there in the midst of Moshi.
Contact: 
Mt. Gabriel +255 754 650 536 or +255 714 229 079

name: Kilimani Pharmacy
description: Best pharmacy in town, biggest selection of drugs.

name: Mariwa Hardware
description: Biggest Hardware Store in town. Good selection of tools etc

name: Mount Hanang nature forest reserve
description:
If you want to climb Mt. Hanang you need to register and pay here (room 8): 10USD Entrance fee pp and 10USD pp camping fee if you want to sleep at the summit with your own tent. 
They have no hiking map and a guide is recommended.

name: Sereti Wilderness Camp
description:
Right at the shore of Lake Manyara. No facilities up to now, pure bush camping in the wilderness. No water, no toilet. The owner Mellek Kivuyo wants to build up a camp there, it's not ready yet. Wonderful views onto the Rift Valley Escarpment, the Ngorongoro Krater and the Lake. Fishermen selling their fish (Tilapia) in the morning and evening. Hyaenas around in the night. The access road should be alright in the dry season but I reached it together with Mellek also when it was very wet. Pls contact Mellek at +255 763 929 298 or +255 784 266 064. He us also on Facebook via Messenger or WhatsApp. He will meet you at Tarangire Junction and show you the way about 10 km to the shore. There is a village office next to the track where all visitors have to register.
I spent 2 nights there and had absolute privacy. At night a watchman came in and slept right next to my car as I was travelling as a woman alone.

name: Summit Hotel
description:
This small hotel is the best place to sleep when you want to hike Mt. Hanang. We were allowed to camp here in the parking lot with our rooftop tent and got the keys to a room to use the bathroom. We negotiated the price to 15.000 TSh (2persons/one car) The owner speaks very limited English, so it was hard to communicate, but they are really friendly. 
We could park our car here during the hike to the Mountain without additional payment. Recommended.

name: Mt. Hanang Camp - just for hikers
description: Camp for hikers on the way up to Mt. Hanang. Just a small, grassy spot where you can pitch your own tent - nothing else. Great view.

name: Old dirt road T5
description: This is the old track next to the new T5 tar road between Mtera and Iringa. Quiet, flat and if you round the slight curve not seen from the main road. There is a family living not far away, but the people are friendly and come only out of curiosity to say hello.

name: Manjis Gas Depot
description: Here is the depot where they refill your bottle. There is no sign, it is just a red gate right from HANSPAUL. Just horn or knock on the door and they will open. You first have to pay in town. They filled our German bottle without an adapter.

name: Side road of T5
description: Nice and quiet bush camp around a hill off the main T5 road from Arusha to Dodoma a few km north of the road link to the Kolo Rock Paintings. It's on the old dirt track next to the tarred main road behind a hill and not visible from the main road. I had no disturbances. Travelling alone as a woman.

name: Quarry with a view
description: Nice bushcamp in a quarry on the Mafinga-Madibira Road. Quiet on a unpopulated stretch through the hills bordering the south end of Ruaha Nationalpark

name: The Funky Squid
description: A beach bar and restaurant attached to a B&B. We were recommended here for the burgers, and they did not disappoint. The chicken burger was superb, the beef burger was great too. And the chips are the best we’ve had since leaving home. They also offer seafood, beef, and chicken dishes. If they’re as good as the burgers, you won’t be sad. Tsh9000-18000.  Add Tsh3000 for chips.

name: Food Lover’s Market
description: South African upscale grocery store.  They also have an outside cafe and toilets!

name: Stone Town Cafe
description:
A delicious coffee shop!  Open everyday 8a-10p.
Lots of seating, all covered.  They serve breakfast all day.  Good service and prices.  Also have clean toilets for customers.  Complimentary WiFi.

name: Bush camp on old dirt road
description: Nice and quiet bush camp on the old dirt road in a bend next to the tar road amongst unpopulated hills. Bit noisy during the day because of the many trucks braking down the steep hills, but quiet at night. Had no disturbance, a family came past with their cattle, greeted and went without further conversation. The tar road is in viewing distance, small cars can hide behind trees, big rigs might be seen. But I think it's no problem as the cars on the road are busy managing a difficult part through the hills. I was quiet happy as a solo woman, even had a nice fire going in the evening. Vodacom connection quiet slow, but existing.

name: Tembea Mara
description:
Lovely grounds with main structure containing registration, restaurant and bar.  Large camping area a bit uneven and mostly suitable for tents, but a few spots suitable for vehicles.  We tow a camp trailer and did just fine.  Toilets very clean and soap provided at sinks.  Shower cold water only.  Can hear traffic on the main road. $15US pppn. Food in restaurant was very good and staff very nice.

They also offer hiking and can be found on Facebook.

name: Ferry Temesa - Tanga
description: Ferry in Pangani- no other road. Just 10 minutes. 5000 TZS for a vehicle up to 1,5t and the driver + 200 TZS for every additional adult.

name: Harrieth View Hotel
description: Clean, basic hotel, with hot water & restaurant. Includes breakfast. Air conditioning & fridge in the room.

name: Lost and Found
description:
Very nice and clean budget accommodation in Stonetown - looks really new. Twin and single beds in dorm room available. We paid 18USD for the twinbed, single beds 15USD. Rooms with air condition and really nice bathrooms with hot showers. 
Only negative thing: no breakfast available and no kitchen. Close to all touristic activities, restaurants, ferry port and the beach. Recommended.

name: CRDB BANK
description: First place after Unity Bridge to buy 3rd party vehicle insurance. Cost 118000 shillings or $52. Contact Nshishi 0754008894

name: GHOMACOS Fruit and Vegetable Market
description: High quality fruit, veg & egg market funded by the Singita Grumeti Fund. Great place to stock up on fresh supplies before Serengeti. Open Mon & Wed 9am-1pm.

name: Junction to Mbosi Meteorite
description:
Here leaves the road to Mbosi Meteorite from road T1.
Hard to see, view picture.
Follow the dirt road 12,5 km to SE.

name: World's end Viewpoint wild camp
description: Nice area to wildcamp with a beautiful view between 2 rocky areas.

name: Customs checkpoint Tanzania and Sambia
description:
Typically a very busy border and extremely confusing. Best to read through all comments before crossing. 
Avoid the fixers if you can -- they create more hassle and cause you to pay extra fees.

name: CBA Hotel & Camping
description:
Campground on lawn with a lot of space — but beware that you will be camping in the middle of a party area!! Facilities are clean. Cold shower.  Restaurant serves below mediocre food. 5$/PPN. Good place to stay — if you’d like to stay in a club with VERY LOUD music ’till very late.
Camping toilette not very clean, showers in toilette. At restaurant good toilette. Internet Down/not functioning.

name: Immigration Tanzania / Zambia & Carnet & Taxes Zambia
description: One stop border post, 50 usd for the Sambia Visa for 30 days

name: Money Exchange (New Dodoma Hotel)
description: Here you can exchange some money most of the time. It‘s open during public holidays and weekends. Ask at the reception, it‘s a small office upstairs. A 100$ Note is 223000TS and no fees!

name: Katavi National Park HQ
description:
Pay park fees here. All of the following do not include VAT, which will be added on top.

Foreign adult, 24hrs - US$30
Foreign registered vehicle (Tate up to 2000kg) - US$40
Camping in public site - US$30pppn
Camping in special site (wild in the park) - US$50pppn
Bandas- US$30pppn

Can also book walking safaris, night drives etc.

Office opens at 8am.

name: Migombani Campsite
description:
Migombani reservations +255 752 811 018

Absolutely fantastic campsite. Tell them you are an Overlander, the price is then reduced to $14pppn

Price for non Overlander’s is now $16pppn

Hot clean showers, clean toilets, huge clean kitchen area. 

Big flat areas to park your overland vehicle on perfectly cut green grass. 

Infinity pool with view of the Lake and Mountains. Bar with cold reasonably priced beer. 

Fire pit that is put on each evening as it gets dark. 

This campsite is quite luxury, even at $16pppn it’s reasonably priced. (Im not sure what people are expecting when they say this is overpriced) 

There are permanent safari tents that look rather nice, not sure of the price. 

We highly recommend a visit. 

Road up is steep...

Figtree tours can arrange crater visits $200pp including pickup, breakfast and packed lunch. Can also pay on credit card for no extra fee. 
+255 763 444 500

name: Medy One Hotel
description: New hotel and great value for money. Double room for 15000 Tsh. Modern, spotlessly clean, hot shower, flush toilets, TV, fan. Parking is on the Terrasse of the restaurant. Security is up for you to decide. Not all toilets with running water and sit down toilet.

name: MRC Mikocheni Resort Centre
description:
A nice Hostel with very lovely staff and management. Small clean double rooms with private bathroom and really good hot shower with perfect pressure. Rooms with aircondition!
There are also doorms, but we didn't see them.
Price for double room is 15 USD incl. small breakfast and secured parking.
Not BigRigfriendly, but okay for normal 4x4.
They have a restaurant with the best Burgers and especially Pizza we ever had! Don't miss it!!!
Free WiFi in restaurant

name: maranatha pharmacy
description: can buy some needed medication and basic first aid stuff. To fill your first aid box. Good service, cheap prices.

name: Local bar/restaurant
description: Local bar, friendly people, fresh beers & drinks , nice view and basic local food (chips, beef brochettes) ~ 3-5000Tsh.   Good place to chill when your are at the public campsite

name: Kibadamo Hotel Restaurant
description:
Modern Building. Clean Toilets. A restaurant thats suitable for tourists. Food average but available also if you dont stay in hotel.

Rooms 40000 Tsh.

name: CBA Guest House
description: Nice, clean, hot shower, running water. 20000 Tsh for a double room incl. breakfast.

name: The New Acropole Hotel & Restaurant
description:
we came for a breakfast. they serve breakfast all day. you can choose of a variety. place is very run down. prices high for what you get. portions were small. you pay for every side dish seperately (toast, bacon, egg, etc.)
we didn't stay in the hotel.

name: Victory Sleep Inn
description: Very nice place to stay. Exceptionally friendly and helpful hostess and staff. Beautiful clean rooms with en suite bathrooms. Restaurant and non alcoholic bar. Laundry service.  Secure parking. Price 40000 shillings per room per night

name: Council fees
description:
warning: the town wants you to pay 10000 shillings for using their village to go to the border.

*seems to be less of an issue at the moment (2019)

name: Ndituye Highway Hotel
description: A basic, but neat hotel in the main street of Kasulu. Was very skeptical in the beginning but were surprised with friendliness and clean facility. Persons in charge cannot really communicate in English and was a bit difficult at times. Shared a room and paid 60,000 TZS for the room. Hot water available. No WIFI. Nice local restaurant on ground floor with cheap meals. Paid the night guard 10,000 TZS as there was no secured parking. As it was a Sunday night it was a bit noisy with local music and motorbikes going up and down the street.

name: Pattaya Inn
description:
40,000tsh for a double room with ensuite and breakfast included.
Basic rooms but clean and hot showers.
Onsite secure parking.

name: Swedish mission
description:
We paid 80,000ksh for 2 cars/ 4 people to camp 1 night before and after the ferry, and 2 nights while we were away in Mafia.  40,000 when we left and 40,000 when we returned. 
Thousands of mosquitoes!

name: martin luther garden
description: Restaurant but camping is possible with bucket shower. We paid 14000 TSH pppn including breakfast. Couldn't get a place for less.

name: Waves restaurant
description: Nice local bar, most meals are around 15,000tsh and we had fresh white snapper which was great. Staff are very friendly and the beers are cold and cheaper than the resorts. Definitely recommend.

name: Richard - tour guide
description:
Richard - +255 (0) 683114013

Richard took us on a snorkeling trip and beach lunch. Snorkelling was great, then we got fresh fish from a fisherman out at sea and went to Fisherman's island for lunch (fresh fish, chips, chapati and salad). 
The boat was a small fiber glass boat not a dhow. 

Price was $15 USD for snorkelling only, $25 for snorkelling and lunch. We negotiated to 50,000tsh pp for 4 people (approx $22pp). Snorkelling gear cost 5,000tsh to rent. We had a great day and thought the price was reasonable.

name: Ibizza Inn
description:
$35 a night for a double room with ensuite bathroom. Nice clean rooms and hot showers although no pressure. Nice restaurant/bar area. 
Good option if you don't want to pay the Marine park fees or if you are taking the early ferry back to Nyamisati. About 700m walk to ferry, leaves at 5am and costs 16,000tsh pp (buy tickets the day before).

name: Mafia ferry port
description:
Mafia to Nyamisati - 16,000pp, buy tickets the day before. Check in is 5am and left around 5.30am
Don't get confused by the time on the tickets and some locals, the tickets say 11.30am which is Swahili time which starts at sunrise. 
We stayed at Ibizza Inn the night before which is 700m walk to the port.

name: Malindi Guest house
description: Good budget option, $25 (no added city tax etc.) for a double room with fan and shared bathroom. Bathrooms are decent with hot showers. Breakfast included and it's served on the rooftop terrace. Quirky hotel with interesting decor! About 10/15 mins walk to town, 5 mins from the ferry.

name: Field opposite river
description: We drove the motorbikes up the footpath 500m away from the road into a field of sparse trees & tall grass that had been burned some time back. It was flat for the tents, not visible from the road (no one approached us during the night) & we could walk to the river to get water for washing or drinking (if purified). May be difficult with a car.

name: Kihori Bungalows
description:
$55 for a double room with ensuite and breakfast included. Rooms are clean and comfortable. About 100m from the beach but no sea view. A small souvenir market next to it and a local cheap restaurant around the corner. 
Beach is nice but quite small and crowded. We preferred the main Nungwi beach. 

Don't be fooled by booking.com, it has no private beach, no bar and rooms don't have A/C!

name: Mama Africa restaurant
description:
Local restaurant with set meals of rice, beans, spinach and meat stew. 
4,000 meat meal / 3,000 vegetarian meal
4,000 cold beers

name: Union Beach bungalows
description:
$50 double room with ensuite, breakfast included and a balcony/terrace. Right on the beach with restaurant/bar area. 

Accept credit card but there's a 5% charge.

name: kinite castle
description:
Dont come here.

Very rude staff and when they bring me the Bill they increase the price that they say me at the begining.
After a discussion and deny myself to pay the extra cost, i told them to call the police but they didnt want. 

i deny myself to pay the overprice and i try to go out. They hold me between Two people breaking my skirt.

After paying the price that they wanted they close the restaurant keeping me inside and they "call to the police".
I get out climbing to the first floor and jumping to the street from there. I wait to the police over a hour but they didnt come.

The worst experience that i have thought un Africa.

name: Fisherman's restaurant
description: Local beach front restaurant with fresh seafood. We had whole white snapper (15,000tsh) and king prawns (17,000tsh), it was great and cheaper than the resorts. Maybe better for lunch as we had no electricity at dinner! No beers but you can BYOB.

name: Kite lodge
description: Beach front bar (rooms don't have beach view). Negotiated to $30 and $35 USD for 2 double rooms, shared bathroom, breakfast included. Not the nicest place but a good budget option. Reasonably priced bar and restaurant, plus lots of options close by.

name: Banana Farm Hostel
description: Very nice Hostel in the middle of a Banana Farm. New established. Safe big parking for Motorcycle and Cars. Very relaxing spot. 9 Kilometer out of down center. Very friendly staff. I fix may Bike here with no problem. Good WIFI. Very nice for hiking on the river next to it with view to mountain.

name: Kilimanjaro Green homes and camps
description:
Very friendly local family running a small B&B. Double room $13 including breakfast, shared  bathrooms. Tiny double bed but they seemed happy to bring in an extra bed if requested. 
They also offered dinner for $3 (rice, beans, beef stew, spinach), and they have a lounge/TV room with movies etc.

name: Club Marina
description: Neat rooms, nice local food, good service. Fine if you're in a pinch from a long day at the border crossing. 10,500 for single room and 12,000 for double.

name: Tabora B Ranger Post / Gate
description: Alternative Gate for Northern Serengeti. Especially when heading to / coming from Mwanza or Kenya.

name: Lemai Ranger Post / Gate
description: Alternative Entry to / Exit from Northern Serengeti.

name: Jamii Food Point
description: Good local restaurant if you're on your way to the Rwandan border. Cleaner and way less flies than other places around! Rice, veg, meat, plantain, beans etc. Staff have good English and are very welcoming.

name: Drive in Lodge
description:
Despite the name there is actually no accommodation here, it is just a restaurant where busses stop in between Dar and Arusha.

However the friendly English speaking manager Daniel let me pitch my roof tent in the parking lot for 20,000 shillings. There is obviously the restaurant where you can get dinner and breakfast and there are toilet facilities (didn't see a shower). There is also good security.

A decent option if you're on the road and need somewhere to stay before it gets dark.

name: Villa Matalai
description: Wonderful place to stay right on the Indian Ocean. There are several rooms overlooking the ocean and the homemade food (freshest seafood you'll get) is amazing. Mama Sarah and the rest of the staff will welcome you. It's also possible to take a trip on their own boat or kayak to the nearby mangroves. A must when you're in the area!

name: Sunrise Lodge
description: Nice hotel, 15,000 tsh for a double room with hot water and sit-down toilet, breakfast not included. Friendly, helpful people, our bicycles easily fitted in the room.

name: Tanzania Wildlife Authority
description: Office to get a permit for Burigi Game Reserve.

name: Roberts Hotel & Restaurant
description:
Reasonable restaurant with local dishes. Chicken, Beef, Fish, Chips, Rice, Ugali.

Also Hotel for 10000TSH /room/night. Rooms very basic. We stayed for restaurant only.

name: White Lodge
description:
Clean rooms with shower for 25000 TSH. Small breakfast included.

Unfortunately they turn off running water regularly so its often available on request only. They have buckets if there is no running water.

Parking in compound for 1-2 cars.
Limited English

name: Vizano Hotel
description:
Centrally located hotel in Mwanza, double room has hot showers, western toilet, fan, airco, fridge and Wi-Fi and, including very good breakfast, costs 30.000 ksh for two. Our room is on the ground floor and of decent size with double bed with mosquito net, fridge, desk and cupboard, and still two bicycles fit inside. No problem keeping them in the room. 


Called Vivano Hotel on Maps.me

name: Gate Burigi Game Reserve
description: Permit has to be bought at Biharamulo. Guide with Weapon is mandatory at the time.

name: Annex Lodge
description: Clean rooms with hot shower and small breakfast. 20000TSH.

name: Swidish Modern Hotel
description:
Large hotel with rooms or chalets and large secure parking area.  Room very clean with large bed & mosquito net, desk, lounge chair and bathroom with European style flushing toilet, sink and shower with hot water.  Towels provided.  Free WiFi, works better in the room than in the restaurant.

Room with breakfast: 40,000 to 70,000 Tsh 

Restaurant and bar on premises with large screen television.

name: atm
description: the first bank I found from the border of Malawi

name: mini villa park lodge
description: We found this hotel along the main road when entering town. Looks brand-new and I think we were also first customers as register is completely empty still and the ownster was extremely excited to have us there. Secure gated parking. Good price 30000 TSH. Room is small but clean. Big bed. Bathroom is clean but toiletseat not attached to toilet. No toiletpaper available (even after we asked). There is a bar but don't order food. Big language barrier with ownster, speaks no English but laughs a lot ;-). Eventually we went to the restaurant in town, hotel Kibadamo which has very nice food. We didn't take hotel Kibadamo as was more expensive (45.000 TSH) and there was no secure parking.

name: Ruaha entrance park
description:
entrance Ruaha park. 30 dollars pp entrance. 40 dollars for a foreign vehicle up to 2000 kg. Exc. VAT. 
150 dollars if more dan 2000 kg.
Can pay with visa at the entrance.

name: Kondoa Rock Paintings
description: Location of the office. The paintings are up in the mountains where you will go with the guide. According to the guide there (Amon) prices did change recently and normally guide was included but now not anymore? Not sure if this is true as you still need to have a guide to accompany you there and you get two different receipts? Anyway, it is totally worth the money to go there! UNESCO Heritage site and 2nd most important rock painting site of whole Africa! Costs were 30000 TSH for guide, 27.000 TSH per person entrance. We needed to hire a bike for the guide (15.000 TSH) as we were there with only 1 bmw GS 1200. Path is about 9 km and quite heavy off-road. You need 4x4 and off-road experience (stones, rocks, sand). If you don't have 4x4 you can sit in back on the motorcycle of the guide, bumpy ride and painful ass but it will work ;-). View from up there is magnificent! Three sites of rockpaintings, you will access by foot (1.5 hour tour).

name: Sit'n'Spin Laundromat
description: Self service and drop off laundromat. Tsh20  000 for cold wash, dry and fold. Tsh25 000 for hot water wash. Detergent included. 12kg load. Good service and fantastic value. A life saver for those sick of hand washing. 2~3 hour drop off service if machines available. Open 7 days a week. Good location with safe parking and bar next door if you want to wait

name: Sit'N'Spin
description: Self service and drop off laundromat. Tsh20 000 for cold wash, dry and fold. Tsh25 000 for hot water wash. Detergent included.  12kg load.  Good service and fantastic value.  A life saver for those sick of hand washing. 2-3 hr service if machines available.  Open 7 days a week. Good location with safe parking and bar restaurant next door if you want to wait.

name: Rasta's pub&grill
description: you can camp in front of the pub. the owner Lomelazy makes great Pizzas. I was never disturb by locals here.

name: Liga Hotel
description: Good basic hotel with restaurant and decent parking

name: Mgambo Cottage Campsite
description:
This friendly place on an organic permaculture farm has two lovely cottages that are advertised on AirBnB ($60 for both) but also places to camp ($5 per person) that have access to communal kitchen, running water and a toilet
Friendly farm staff prepared to show you around the variety  of plants ... even give you veggies to cook and organise food to buy 
Access is from Muheza , turn right 2 km after the end of the tar road to Magila Mission, then follow the signs 13 km to Magorotto up steep but passable dirt road. At first houses at top of hill (before sign for magorotto estate) take sharp right turn to Mgambo ... farm is just past the school

name: Star Light Hotel
description: Nice place to stay we paid 20.000 TZH for tree persons (Inc. Breakfast) for camp in the parking. One room 25.000 TZH (Inc. Breakfast). Nice Restaurant, safe parking and friendly staff.

name: Starlight
description: They had no rooms available so they let us camp in the parking lot. No shade available. Would not recommend this place but the Boma was under construction.

name: Immigration Office
description: Tanga’s immigration office. In case you need to extend your Visa, etc.

name: Africa Batteries and more
description:
friendly owner Rizwan has a large selection of batteries, oils, tires and can get mostly anything, Inc brand names like optima batteries. tanzania taxes mean it's not cheap! 
area South of here is car part central, tons of places selling land rover, Toyota parts, I'm sure you can find anything within a couple of blocks

name: Guesthouse Udiakonia Tandala
description: Nice and clean guesthouse with restaurant on the compound. Double rooms with abolutions are availible for 25000 up to 50000TZS inkl. breakfast. Good food availible for 5000TZS pp. There is WFI but it did not work when we were there. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Lengai Safari Lodge
description: Nice lodge ,busy with tourists. A lot of activies, you can do. 20US$/ppn. View to the Lake and the Vulcan Gelai

name: Drive-In Garden & Cliff bar
description: Stunning campsite in a lush forest right across from the ocean. 5000 Tsh pppn. Ran by a charming polish lady and her family. Also offers B&B in private rooms. It has a little bar & restaurant with very reasonable prices. Highly recommended

name: Shoppers Supermarket
description: Huge supermarket, well stocked with everything you need. Lots of great small shops in this complex too.

name: Safari Inn
description:
$23 for double room, ensuite and basic breakfast included. Also hot showers. Very average but clean enough.

Location is good as it's central, close to the ferry and TAZARA railway.

name: Side of gravel road
description:
Anywhere North would be ideal, hundreds of spots to choose. We had many curious and friendly locals come to camp.
Road down this East side of lake very good, must be stunning with rain. Beautiful landscape, very wild

name: YWCA Hostel
description:
Hostel 1 km off the ferry to Zanzibar. Room for 2 is 28,000 ZSH. Clean and simple rooms. Clean and simple toilets. Amazing option when you arrived at 1am to Dar Es Salaam Bus Station. If tuk tuk doesn't know is next to Ramada and one block from Holiday Inn. 

@pikachudefe instagram for more info

name: Victoria Hotel
description:
Between 20K and 30K for a Double room depending on your bargaining skill. Nice clean room with hot shower and air-conditioning. Breakfast included.
I hitchhiked with a group of locals and arrived around mid night. The locals took the rooms and the young guy works at the reception let me put my tent for the night in the premise. There's toilet outside and a sink to wash your face.

name: Kigoma Hilltop Hotel
description:
Kigoma hilltop hotel. Very fancy place
BUT, I went for a drink (no alcohol served) and the view from their restaurant/bar is stunning. Worth stopping just for a drink, I imagine the restaurant and rooms are extremely pricey, didn’t check.

name: Kamanga ferry
description: cost 6500tsh for 4x4 and 400 per person. Schedule seems hard to guess but pretty regular. saves lots of driving down and around

name: Bomani Bungalows
description:
We came a cross this place while exploring the coast region and looking for cheaper options to sleep than Dar or Bagamayo. It is a hotel, but they have quite some flat space to park your car or pitch your tent. The hotel is situated close to the sea (50 mtrs) and has a restaurant and bar. This place is secured with a fence and guards patrolling the area. Staff is very friendly and if you want to see the village you are more than welcome to come along.

For camping don’t expect anything to fancy as this was there first time having overlanders over. No braai, but you can make a fire on the sandy surface. There is a toilet, but outdated. No hot shower, but only a cold one close to the beach. No wifi, but this is work in progress. 

But for $5,- pppn this is the cheapest option in this area and good for a night.

name: Bars
description: I was unsuccessfully looking for a place to have a beer in the center of this mainly Muslim town ... well, here’s a street with a dozen local bars and street food.

name: Mihan gas filling station
description:
Refills also cadac cylinders, 5kg 20000tsh
tel 0769 695049, you must make a lot of noise at the gate to get attention!

name: katonga fish market
description: you get there fresh fish in the morning.  get there between 8 and 9am for big fish

name: Bad road
description:
Coming from border of Rwanda going to Nykanazi.

Very bad road. Account enough time if you're going to/from border. So far no end in sight.

name: Lakeview Hotel
description:
65000 Tsh double room
80000 Tsh entire apartment for you. 

Restaurant, Bar and parking.

name: Isongole at the river Kiwira
description: Really nice place directly beside a small bridge crossing the very clear river Kiwira.    A lot of trees around, parking on a green lawn. Locals passing the bridge are very friendly, just waving, no disturbing.

name: Nyororo/Lake Nzivi
description: Lake Nzivi is located in a nice forest area.  The place to camp is directly at the lakeshore. Some little kids around with cattle, but very shy. Peacefull atmosphere, frogs are croaking in the evening. Leaving the Main road in Nyororo to South, after about six km gravel turning left down to the lake.

name: Bushcamp with Kili-View
description: On the way from Kifaru to Lake Jipe, about 5 km after the junction from the Main road. Plenty of space, chose your place anywhere you like. Right side of the gravel road. Some cattle and goats around, locals very friendly waving, no disturbing. And if you are lucky without clouds, nice view to the Kili...

name: Acacia forest
description: Huge  place in a big acacia forest about 5 km north of Mbulu. Owner of the area welcomes us to camp and feel at home. Few kids with cattle around, very shy, no disturbing. Great place to stay.

name: Little quarry beside the road to/from Rwanda
description: It's not easy to find a place to stay overnight beside this really bad road. Many villages, most people are begging, not typical for Tanzania. This abandoned little quarry is a bit hidden behing some bushes, near the road. Of course you can hear the traffic, but during the night it's quiet. We arrived just before darkness, so nobody was around.

name: New Millenium Inn
description: Good hotel opposite taxi park. Classic statues of animals adorn the garden, including a crocodile mauling an antelope. Double room 20000tsh self contained. Shower was extremely hot. Our room had one of those semi holographic shifting pictures of a tiger, almost nightmare inducing. Good restaurant serving cheap local food (menu in Swahili). The place is pretty popular with locals. They have a courtyard with gates for parking. Good times

name: Africa Safari Glamping
description:
Campground and Hotel. Has pre-built Safari Tents and Bell Tents (with beds inside) pool, bar, wifi,restaurant.
Camping is currently on grassy land. Additional space is being built right now a bit further out (150m).
Camping 10$ ppn. Safari Camping ranges from 39$ to 300$ per night.
+255 753 399 603

name: Embassy of Burundi
description:
$90 USD for a one month tourist visa. They have a form to fill in, need two passport photos, copy of passport and copy of Tanzania entrance stamp. Form asks for invite letter, I didn't have one and it was no problem. Bring your original passport when you drop off the application, but you don't have to leave it there so you can go to Zanzibar while you wait for the visa.
Standard waiting time is 10-14 days.
Ambassador very friendly and extremely happy to have tourists visit his country.
They asked to see Yellow Fever certificate at the border before letting me in.

name: 0-60 Subaru
description: Proper Subaru Mechanic with genuine parts (also parts dealership around the corner).

name: Malawi High Commission
description:
Embassy for Malawi 

Will be done in the spot. 

Beware of the low door. You know when you get there 😉

Visa Mo to Fr 9 to 1.

name: Haule hotel
description:
Clean simple hotel with secure parking, friendly staff, very good restaurant and bar. Rooms 15 000 - 25 000 (with or without airco). Ended up here because didn’t want to drive in the dark. Very good value for money. Music from the bar can be a little disturbing. Enjoyed my stay and would totally recommend. 

update: price increased by 5000 TZS.

name: Next to River
description:
Spot directly next to the river. Water is clear, perfect for a shallow swim. A side road leads to some unused mud bricks and the space beneath the end of the road is big enough for a tent and bicycles. It's just before the steep climb towards Matamba.

The side road is smooth and all vehicles can access this, but cars will have to park at the end of the 50m road.. which might be visible from the main road.

name: Super Eden Motel
description:
Nice big room with two double beds, an armchair and very clean. Hot showers (in the morning) or otherwise it's warm. Restaurant attached at the back. Helpful staff. 

Tsh 30,000 for one night but we negotiated down to Tsh 40,000 for two nights per room incl. breakfast.

name: Mdonya public campsite
description: official public campsite near dry river bed under big trees. toilets. dining room. bushy area around.

name: Kiboko Public Campsite (Ruaha Public Campsite #2)
description: On the river. Official public campsite #2. Has great ablution blocks and beautiful view.

name: Katavi public campsite
description: Large area under high tree. we met elephants nearby. near the gate and headquarters.

name: Superdoll Service Centre
description:
Garage workshop supplies BF Goodrich tyres, Michelin etc 

www.superdoll.co.tz 
Ph: +255 - 22- 2860930 
email: stm@ superdoll - tz.com

name: Ngwasi Forest Reserve
description:
Nice place next to a small lake in the middle of the forest. Nowbody there. Many tracks in the forest, many possibilities to stay for the night. 
We saw many birds. Quiet.

name: Rovvenpec Resort
description: Amazing value for money. 40 000 for an enormous room with an enormous bed. Super clean, friendly staff. Secure parking. Bar, restaurant and small swimming pool. Very weird to find this place in the middle of nowhere. Sometimes WiFi but wasn’t really working this time. Totally recommended for the price!

name: Nashe's Cafe
description: Beautiful cafe/restaurant/bar with extensive food and drinks menu. Housed in a lovely old building with a large roof terrace.  Great coffee and espresso!

name: Longido District Toll Fee
description:
Checkpoint 3 for the road toll fee you pass 2 other gates which are left open to drive straight through to speed up the process the third gate is a barrier with a payment office the fee is paid at this office.Apparently you drive through 3 separate districts therefore the fees are:-

District 1: 10US pp + 18% tax
District 2 : 10US pp +  18% tax
District 3:  15 US pp + 18% tax

Total 35US pp + 18% tax  

Can be paid in Tanzania Shilling total approx 193,000

name: Pizza Fresh
description: If you're in the mood for pizza this is the place for you. Lovely pizzas cooked in a proper wood burning oven.

name: Kite Lodge camping
description: It's not the core business, but if you ask you can camping for 5$. You can use the toilet of the lodge, very clean, but not hot shower (not necessary). For me it was possible camping because low season, I don't know in high season when lodges are full.

name: Mbavu
description: Nice local restaurant, you have to try "biliani" and "pilau" and "urojo", very tasting food... about 1,5$ each.

name: ATM
description: This is the only ATM outside Stone city you can find on Zanzibar, by Barclays Bank. 6$ for commission

name: Makofi
description: Very Nice place with about 20 rooms and dormitory. Good vibes! And you can pitch your tent! (Very unusual here in Zanzibar!!)

name: green house
description: local resturant,we ate rice bean and cabbage for in 1100 sh. there is place to eat inside and the place is clean

name: Makkah
description: place to fix tyres. we just wanted to reduce to air pressure from the tyres. wanted 4000sh but it could be much cheaper, we paid 1000 sh

name: road t8 to Chunya
description:
north to Chunya it becomes a gavel road.
don't need 4WD but lots of sharp stones. we drive around  40 kmh in avrege in the first 100km. after it is still a gravel and dirt road, we drove 60-80. it could be dificult in the rainy season because of the mud. north from Pangale is a paved road.

name: Dolphins - boat
description: Boat to see dolphins about 50000 tzn for two people. For 4 people it will be 80000 tzn. Nice trip, start as early as possible. About 5:30-5:45. Contact whatsapp Suleiman tel. 0777494704. This place is a shop. Contact the owner directly. Possible to areange transport.

name: Usambara Coffee Corner
description: Cute little place where you can try freshly ground, delicious local coffee.

name: Emmy's Hostel
description:
Simple, quite cheap hostel in a quiet place. Clean beddings, nice living room and good wifi. They have kitchen with dishes, the fridge is not so clean and toilets are „old”, but for 30000 for 2 people (double bed), it’s ok for one night. Private parking for a bike is available. 
They have dorm beds as well.

name: Joshi's vegetarian food fort
description: Very good restaurant, high quality food, and reasonable cheap prices. The owner, Joshi, is very nice person.

name: Swedzan house
description: Swedish-Zanzibari owned guesthouse. One of the budget options in central stone town. Walking distance to all highlights, restaurants and markets. Especially good for solo travelers since they have « single occupancy » rates. I paid 24$ per night for an ensuite double room (single occupancy). Hot water, fan and WiFi. Breakfast +3$. This is the manager’s number (Bobby): +255682769696. Prices can slightly be negotiated for longer stays.

name: Rock Beach Garden
description: A great local spot for swimming, fishing and boat tours. 1,000TSh entrance.

name: Border of Tanzania and Burundi
description:
We crossed the border from Tanzania to Burundi. 

In the Tanzanian side we stopped first at the right hand side of the road, for processing the car documents. Then we headed to the another building on the other side of the road to get the passport stamped.

We drove about 3 minutes to Burundi side. The process was very fast and simple. The officer just wrote our details from the passport and welcomed us to the country.
We asked about the car and they said we are good. According to them nothing has to be made with the car. Neither payment, Nor documents. 

The whole process was easy and the workers in both of the sides were nice and friendly. 

* The little information about the visa and its process on the internet is generaly misleading.

↓↓↓

**We did the visa to Burundi on the same day, in Kigoma (look for the sign we put on the map), an hour drive away from the border. The visa cost 90$ for 30 days.
You only need the money and passport. It's a short 10 minutes process. 

Good Luck 😃

name: Food Palace
description: Great Indian food. Owner speaks English.

name: Together lounge
description:
Local hotel with clean rooms, double beds, en suite bathroom, hot shower, aircon.
We paid 45000Tsh per room, this includes basic breakfast of tea, egg and bread.

name: Matambwe Gate
description: Please note that you must have the entry permit for the Selous Game Reserve before you get to the entry gate. They do not accept cash or credit cards at the gates.

name: No petrol stations after Dodoma
description: No fuel station for the next 250km from Dodoma to Iringa

name: bujucafe
description: feels and looks like a western cafe, good coffee and jucies. free and good wifi and nice place to sit.

name: Ligunga Executive Hotel
description: Close to the bus station, newly renovated, very clean and sweet staff. 20,000/= for double room including breakfast. Great find!

name: PILIPILI HOUSE and RESTAURANT
description:
The best food in the area. Delicious tapas, fish, main courses, drinks and great smoothies for reasonable prices. 
Many people around choose that place to spend nice time. English, Polish, Spanish and German language. They have a lodge here as well. Realy nice nice place:)))

name: Triple D
description: Nice clean hotel. could park car save. 20.000 double. with bar so bit noisy

name: NMB ATM
description: ATM in the town - most places in the area accept cash only.

name: Kasulu Motel
description: Large well secured grounds in a quiet-ish area. They have en suite rooms which looked quite nice, but we camped in their grounds for TZS25,000 (1 Vehicle, 2 people). The toilets & shower are behind the restaurent- very basic but sufficient. Extremely friendly staff and great service- they would drinks to our camping spot! Restaurent on site too as well as free WIFI. A well located spot just before Kigoma, especially if you are wanting to bypass Kigoma and continue south.

name: CRDB Bank ATM
description: CRDB Bank ATM. Parking available. Long queues.

name: Jambo Guesthouse
description: They have basic but clean rooms with Aircon, Fans and Mokitionets. Paid 30 U$ for big double bed and 20U$ for single bed. We recommend this place.

name: Griama Community Ecocamp
description:
Lokal Guy, Wastar wants to establish a camp site soon. They already cleared the area. Here you will find a mobile toilet and shower. Water will be supplied in Jerry cans.With a long lead you could have power from a nearby house.
Shade and fieldkitchen is also under construction. 
The place has the most stunning view . You can view sunrise and sunset. Price is 400 Ksh p.p.p.n. Please support them, as they are very nice and they are busy to reinvent themselves.
wastarchengo@gmail.com

name: Ndiyo Market
description: Well assorted supermarket, local fare. Good liquorshop aside. Import products.

name: Patrick Premium Hotel
description:
Only place in the area with gated and secure parking for overnight stays. We originally went to the Ambassador Cafeteria however the lady didn't speak English and she made it seem as they didn't have parking nor a place to camp. We ended up asking someone who directed us to this new hotel. 

As it was already dark when we arrived we were lucky to have found this location. The manager was kind and welcomed us. There is a resturant/bar and apparently live music so will not be the quietest however it is safe and secure which is most important for our defender.

The manager asked for 30,000 for the two of us to park and camp using our rooftop tent, which is a bit pricey however as we didn't have much of an option we were just happy he welcomed us to camp for the night.

We are unsure about the shower situation and if campers can use the ones inside the hotel, however there is a bathroom for the resturant which can be used.

name: Cresta Country Logde
description:
Nice spot slightly outside the town. They had never taken campers before but the staff was super friendly and allowed us to camp in their secure parking area for 20,000 which also included breakfast for the both of us, which was basic but good. They also have lovely and clean rooms with AC which ranged from 50,000 to 80,000. 


We originally went to Aqua Vita however the staff was not friendly and wanted to charge us for a room.even though we were going to camp in our roof top tent.

name: T&B barbecue
description: Best grilled chicken in stone town. I went back 6 times and it was always good. Friendly staff and owner. Half periperi chicken with fries 8000.

name: Twiga Cafe
description: Amazing local food at very cheap prices - worth the stop!!

name: Hippo Selous Camp
description: camp in front of the river. small spots,  one with electricity. 15usd pppn. diner 15000 TSH. frendly staf. you should hace the permit before entering to the park. the manager could do it for you but it takes some hours.

name: Royal Beach Restaurant (&Campground)
description: Spot is beautiful. But they still haven’t transformed it into a campsite, doubting they will ever finish. It’s currently a big and loud restaurant. Hence we had to stay on the parking lot with a lot of locals. If they ever finish it could be beautiful, but now it was horrible and uncomfortable. Dirty bathrooms (in the restaurants) and really bad food. Utter disappointment. The lake itself is beautiful so maybe drive around it to see if you can do some wild camping. Beautuful spot on peninsula. The hotel closed, but now the restaurant is transforming into a campground. No showers yet, dirty toilets. 40.000 2 pp. Hippos in Lake and organised tours.

name: Flat Green Area
description:
We struggled to find a place to wild camp until we came across this area. It’s a large area of grass and we couldn’t see anyone which wasn’t easy to come by - as the area in general outside of this green patch is either farmed or inhabited (here are so many people). 

Our phones have a decent signal here, albeit Edge for internet.

name: Mama Pierina Annex and restaurant
description:
Nice place to stay en route to Dar es Salam owned by Mama Pierina, Greek lady. Range of rooms available. Nice room with AC 45000, nice double with fan 35000, basic room 25000 (room 3 - thats what we chose and it had double and single bed), en suite and including breakfast. Guarded and gated parking available.
did not ask about camping if is still functioning but there are facilities available, outside bathrooms and kitchen area. Big rigs can pass also through the back gate.

name: Coast View Resort
description: Amazing view over the lake. Good selection of food. Veg curry was amazing (7000tsh), meat dishes are 12000+. Beers are 3000tsh. Everything is worth it for the view. Only 2 tables on the viewing deck though

name: Wakawaka Hostel
description:
Great clean hostel with gated and secure parking right outside the main town center. Room rates are $38 a night for 2 including breakfast. We ended up leaving our defender here for 5 days while we went to Zanzibar and they did not even charge us for keeping the car there as we stayed there the night before leaving and the night after coming back. They also provide airport shuttles.

David the manager is very kind and helpful. Also Mina one of his staff is amazing. She is always there and great company.

name: Zanaki gas / Filling station (Small shop)  for European bottles
description:
the only place in Tanzania that we found was able to fill our european standard gas bottle. 1kg 15000tsh. nice guy. 

Cadac bottles refilled here. We refilled two 3kg bottles for 50,000 shillings. Only place we could find in Dar es Salaam. Took an hour, but you can park on the street and there are lots of fruit and veg sellers down the road. Lots of other automotive shops down this road too and batteries etc. Everyone very helpful.

name: Big Body with Tatata Spice Farm
description:
Community run spice farm in Kizimbani. We chose this one over the larger farm run by the government in the same area.
The tour was very informative and the guide spoke English very vell.

Entrance fee including tour with guide and fruit tasting in the end is tip based. The tour itself took about 1.5 hours.

We organized our own transport from Stone Town to the Spice Farm, where the driver waited for us and then from here to Nungwi. We asked around in Stone Town: $40 for the whole trip including entrance fee for two persons with tour operator in the Old German Fort. 70.000 TSh for 2 persons including entrance fee with official taxi and 50.000 TSh with unofficial taxi (no taxi sign in top).

name: Nice and quiet
description:
There is a turn off on the main road. Just find a nice place around to camp. I think most suitable for people travelling by bike and motorbike but people with a vehicle should be able to a find a spot just not as hidden. 
Watch out with bushes with thorns.

name: PCM Hotel
description:
Clean Hotel with comfortable bed and apparently warm shower (I didn‘t have electricity so I showered cold). Rooms are good and enough space to take the bicycle inside. Price is fixed at 20,000. I checked other places close around, there are some for 10,000 and 15,000 as well, but I didn‘t feel like a bucket shower
Has a security guard and a gate, so I guess for cars also safe:)

name: Mount Ketumbeine Motel
description:
Nice and clean quite luxury place with good prices. For two 25000 tzs, double beds 30000 or 35000 tzs. Very reasonable for that standard. Nice stuff, private parking, ablutions, breakfast included. 
Nice stop. Good food possible 5000-8000 tzs

name: Pasha Nungwi Hotel
description: stayed here for 5 nights instead of the 2 we have initially planned. Gem, the turkish owner and his wife are the most welcoming hosts we have encountered so far! From here to the beach takes 45 seconds walking

name: New Maboko Classic
description:
Centrally located Hotel, newely opened, clean and nice bathroom! it is within walking distance to many stores and the neighbourhood is quiet, no bars around! Paid 20‘000 for room number 2. She tried to charge me 30,000 first but as always check in the checkinbook what others paid (works well here in TZ)
Safe for cars to park inside the gates and enough space to take the bicycle inside the room

name: Guesthouse
description: Good day ride with the bicycle away from Singada, little guesthouse, very basic, single (5000tsch) double (6000tsch). Really, don‘t expect a lot, I just used it to spend the night. little town with a couple of restaurants and stores. Shared Bathrooms and donkeyshower. There is enough space in the rooms to take the bicycle inside. No Parking for cars inside.

name: Genesis Motel and Campsite
description:
Fair prices and negotiable. 
Campsite 12,000 not the best but...
Rooms without breakfast 25,000 they are clean. 
You can negotiate a few thousands less.

name: Kiteshe Lodge
description:
Rooms starting at 25,000. A great one 50,000.
I just needed to escape the rain didint make it to Dar in time so went for the cheaper option. My rooms had cold shower but better room has hot. 

You better pass from the restaurant/bar as there are people that speak English there. 
Food was 5,000 for six eggs and chips.

name: Suluti Lodge
description: Clean and neat rooms, 20000tsh per double room. Secure parking, squat wc, hot shower.

name: Tanzanite2
description:
Hotel with secure parking inside and Rooms with private bathroom and hot water after 18:00.
current rates start at 15,000 or a bit more luxurious for 25,000 tzs
Clean, good mosquito net and enough space to take the bicycle inside the room.

name: Grancina Guest House
description:
New guest house run by a  retired couple from Ngombe province.  Clean, quiet, hot showers, just a bit out of the main town. Our breakfast was included for  20,000.  speaking English.  They told us they would be happy to welcome Overlanders. Small parking area at the back,  or could accommodate people on the grass at the front.

See the other making on the map for the entrance road.

name: Benzo Breams
description:
Lovely green lawns over looking the Kafue river, beautiful ablutions, kitchen facilties available,with lounge area and wifi, they have tented chalets with a pool, fee fishing and an option to cage swim in the river, we paid 10 U$ pppn.for camping.
Entry is located at -16.029048, 28.791155

name: Myombo Lodge
description: Nice rooms and breakfast included for 20'000. Would definitely recommend. We had both bicycles in our room.

name: Local Restaurant/fast food
description:
Great local restaurant/fast food. 
White rice or whole rice with beans and spices. Bean and vegetables, roasted beef and chicken. 
Balls of potatoes. 
Fair prices, tasty food.

name: Wonderful camp by the beach
description:
Clean grassy spot with pines that shade you. You can access down the beach from the little cliffs. 

Very quiet except on weekends when sound from near by lodge will entertain you till almost 1am. A place to relax a day or two. Not to far from provisions. 

You access on a double track from the main road at these coordinates: -6.0743, 39.42598

However note that you will scratch your car since it looks like nobody accessed by car here in a long time and some vegetation’s has grown.

name: Bicycle Doctors
description:
Bicycle Doctors is the only place you trust with your bike in Dar. 
Sameer can source parts you might need. 
Tel / WhatsApp: +255 787 212 256

name: Mountainbikes House
description: Lovely new place. Laid back athmosphere. You can either take room or bungalow or park on the property with your rig and use the showers/bathroom. They offer breakfast at 2 US-Dollar and Dinner for 3 US. You eat together at a long table in a friendly athmosphere and get to meet people. Also a variety of expeditions are offered for example on mountainbike or 4x4 Safaris. The staff is super friendly and keen to help.

name: Public Campsite 1, NP
description: Camp site inside national park. Limited facilities. Secure kitchen otherwise the camp is open. There are toilets and showers. We paid $35 which includes the 18% vat to camp pp. We entered the park at 3pm in the afternoon and our entrance fee covers us for 24 hours. In all we paid $330 for four people, including the car (fee based on weight), entrance fee ($35 pp inc. vat) and camping. We heard lions the whole evening

name: puma fuel station
description:
the only fuel station we found that accept credit card.
there also a Stanbic bank next to it where you can withdraw 600,000.

name: Tourist Information Center
description: get information on the activitys at Victoria Falls here.

name: Pascal mecanic
description:
We have had a major breakdown with our 4x4 Ford Ranger pickup and there seem to be not a lot of choice of good mecanics in Singida. We have been recommended Pascal and his team who repaired the car for a reasonable price. We had to go to Arusha for spare parts though. Pascal rented us an old Rav car for 60.000 per day which is very reasonable. The garage is on the street and there is not really a name for it, but they took out the whole engine and seemed to know what they were doing. Pascal speaks very well English and knows everybody here. (His wife is a lawyer in case you need one  ; ))
kichambati@yahoo.com
+255784840971

name: Bush camp
description:
You would probably get here only with a bike. Although not a single track the road is avvisi le on with a 4x4 but someone wanting some adventure. 
There is no people around, pick you spot bush on the right hand side is more wild but lots of thorns the left hand side seems more grassy. I like to camp hidden in the bush. Somewhat Vodacom E signal.

name: Camping with a view on Kilimanjaro
description:
Bushcamp with a view on Kilimanjaro and next to one of the many baobabs, find a clear patch and enjoy it.
The bush is a bit dense so you can only get a bit deep and hide from the road of you travel by bike or motorbike. Watch out for thorns.

name: serengati game reserve- self drive
description:
DO NOT ENTER WITH YOUR OWN CAR!

the prices for the a car are ridiculous.
there is a price list for every weight class and if you are over 2000 kg it just doesn't worth it.
the prices are for one day only and don't include the entrance fees and camp permits.
0-2000 kg pays 47$.
2001- and above (don't remember the exact weight) kg pays 177$.
there were some more levels of weight which I can't remember but were above 300$.

it's about the same prices at the Ngorongoro crater and if you just want to get a transit pass through you still have to pay a full day permit for your self and for the car even if it just to cross the reserve with out getting into the crater..


the best option if you want to do a safari, park your car in Arusha or nearby and get a game drive.
game drive is about 180$ pppd and that's incl. everything.

name: Lake Tanganyika Kipili
description: If you come to this small quiet village of Kipili on the Shores of Lake Tanganyika, these coordinates will bring you to the small shop of Baptista Kasokota (M: 0745 353 467) who can be your lovely English speaking guide for this stunning area. He has a wooden row boat to take you to the beautiful surrounding islands for snorkelling, swimming and village life.

name: Cool Breeze Lodge
description: Google shows it as the Bimlo Lodge. Decent little hotel within walking distance of the centre of the village! 15 thousand shillings per night with en suite bathroom and hot showers . I stayed in rome R-22 which is a big corner room with two big windows that let in the outside. There is only room to park two vehicles inside the gate so beware. my toyota hilux fit in one of the spots just fine and they let me plug in my refrigerator so I didn't wear down my battery

name: Coffee Tree camp site & chalets
description: Wonderful place on the slopes of Mt Kilimanjaro just before the National Park. Solar hot showers, water and a shelter where you can light a fire for BBQ and sit and have dinner. The shelter has power and lights. Camping is $10pppn & chalet is $12 pppn.  Nice lawns and garden. You will probably have the place to yourself. The man who looks after the place is great. We recommend this place.

name: Ananda Hotel
description:
Nice and calm hostel. Owner is a Romanian and he’s super nice, he’ll tell you about all the places to go around Paje and also where to go out at night. Prices are some of the best you can find along the beach in Paje. 

Got a double room for 40$ including breakfast but he told me you can have a dorm for around $15. 

I would say it’s defiantly possible to camp here but there are not set prices for it. 

WiFi is okay.

name: Bottoms Up Hostel
description:
Super nice hostel in the middle of stone town. A little bit hard to find in a back ally but ask around and you’ll find it. The hostel is 6 floors and the top one is a deck where you can see all of stone town and the ocean. The view from the deck is so amazing it’s worth to stay there just because of it. WiFi is fast and you can connect both in rooms and in all living spaces. 

Dorm is $15 and private room is $30. Showers are some of the best I’ve ever seen in Africa, good pressure and hot water.

name: Ibrahim’s Motors
description:
This place is very good. Repaired my land cruiser here several times and also my friends Land Rover. They do a lot of work for the government vehicle so they are very good. Also they love overlanders so sometimes you only have to pay for parts if the job is small. 

Definitely recommended!

name: Puma (caution advised)
description: Caution: Puma fuel station with petrol and diesel. They also sell Castrol oil. They tried to charge us an extra 20L by distracting us when they started filling up and presenting 2 separate receipts at the end (apparently he had restarted in the middle of the fill up). Make sure it starts at zero and watch the entire fill up. We caught it because the mileage didn’t add up.

name: Weighbridge
description: Compulsory weighbridge for all vehicles above 3.5T. Signs advise fine of $2000 for anyone over 3.5T caught not going through the weighbridge. They just waved us through, we didn’t even need to get out.

name: St Bernard Mission
description: On the beautiful calm shores of Lake Tanganyika at the far end of the small village of Kipili, run by the lovely St Benedictine monks, there are clean basic adequate rooms with cold shower, flushing sit down loo, mosquito nets and electricity. Rooms are 15,000tzs single and 30,000tzs double. You can eat with the monks. There is green grass camping for a  negotiated less fee with toilets and access to showers.

name: Rutala limited
description: Fuel station on the T9. First one we saw on the way from Tunduma to Sumbawanga.

name: NMB ATM (Laela)
description: NMB bank with ATM that accepts Visa and MasterCard.

name: First Inn
description: Basic rooms for 12‘000, 15‘000 and 20‘000tsch. I got the 15‘000 one and it was all I needed. running water, shower, clean, fan, mosquito net and enough space to put the bicycle in!

name: Lake Eyasi Hadzabe Camp site
description: Situated in a grove of indigenous trees and palm trees a short distance from Lake Eyasi. Wonderful shade for camping under a huge old Tamarind Tree. We paid U.S.$10 pppn. Sadi is a wonderful host. He invited us to a bbq with his friends for New Year the day we arrived. Great fun! We loved our two nights here.

name: Vegetable and fruit market
description: Here you will find the usual veggies and fruits available in the area. You can also find spices, oils, salt and some canned goods.

name: Woods
description: Next to the road (no trafic). If you want to take another route to Ruaha NP other than via Iringa. Long but nice small road. 4x4 better to have.

name: Nyati Village Inn
description:
Hotel with restaurant. They allowed us to park outside and camp overnight for free, we had lunch and dinner at the restaurant. staff were really nice and security looked after our big-rig (with us inside it). We weren't bothered by anyone and it was relatively quiet midnight until 7am.

They didn't charge us but I gave them 10,000 shillings for the security staff. Friendly staff who were really accommodating and had good English. Food was nice but the service slow.

name: Executive Lodge
description: Clean hotel with basic facilities in the room, running shower (cold) and western toilet. Room is very big and had a fan as well. costs 15000 tsch

name: bushcamp quarry next to road
description: quiet spot, nobody around. big quarry next to road,  just before/after town

name: Roots
description:
Very nice backpackers and restaurant. they have only 2 dorm rooms, with A/C and average shared bathrooms. outside there's a lovely garden with bar and great food. staff is super friendly and allowed us to park the car inside the garden after they closed the restaurant. 
15$ pppn.

name: McDees Auto Works
description:
Very professional car workshop. It not seems like one, but they deal with the most complicated modern cars such as Range Rover, VW, BMW and of course Toyota and others. they have diagnostics computers and all of the equipment. Alex the owner is super helpful and friendly. 

Alex: ‏‪+255 754 280 975‬‏

name: Camp near border
description: Grassy spot. It’s nothing special. It’s close to the road. It’s nice to sleep before you Cross the border

name: Livingstone Memorial Museum
description:
A museum built around the exact location that Henry Stanley found David Livingstone on the shore of Lake Tanganyika allegedly uttering the famous quote "Dr Livingstone I presume".

There is a memorial and a talk by a local guide and historian who can answer your questions. Not busy at all and quite enjoyable.  10USD pp.

name: Hope of the Nations Training Centre (curios)
description: The workshop and shop where you can buy wax fabric purses, bags, bracelets etc for very reasonable prices. Profits go to charity. you can even have things custom made here. Other places (like Livingstone Museum) have same goods at inflated prices. Opens 8:00am.

name: Paris 2 Guest house
description: Basic Hotel with secure parking, hot showers, sit-down toilet and it is clean. Good value for money, rooms are 15‘000 Tsch. Enough space to take the bicycle inside the room. Hotel next door towards Malawi has rooms for 30‘000 that look nicer but I think this does it as well!

name: Three in one Guesthouse
description: For 10‘000 tsch you get a really big and clean room, shower is cold but the whole bathroom is huge in my room (H14). Havent had such a good room for 10k here in Tanzania yet. There is also a secure parking area for trucks, motorcycles, and the room is totally big enough to take one or two bicycles inside

name: Igubike Guesthouse
description: Nice Guesthouse with hot shower and rooms from 8‘000 tsch onwards, I got the 02 room for 15‘000. all clean and the lady who owns it is lovely! also secure parking for cars inside the compound!

name: Shopping complex
description: A small shopping complex outside of Arusha. Plenty of good parking, including larger trucks. There is one supermarket, an FNB ATM, coffee shop and toilets - very nice and also very quiet. There is also a petrol station next door.

name: Ndabaka Gate (West Serengeti)
description:
The western gate to Serengeti. We left the park here but you can of course enter as well. 

From what it looked like they have a campsite just outside the gate that’s managed by the park. 

Closest public campsite inside park is in Seronera and that’s about a 3-4h ride. Therefor you’re not allowed to enter the park later than 16:00.

name: Jevas Hotel
description: A very nice hotel with clean en-suite and AC rooms and secure parking (left for three days whilst on safari). We paid $25 per room which includes breakfast we stayed here the night before and after our three day safari. Staff are very friendly and helpful, nothing was a problem. Good free WiFi too.

name: Suricata Safari
description:
Safari business who work from this hotel. We paid $570 pp for a three day camping safari in the Serengeti and Ngorongoro crater it was the cheapest tour we could find, but we had a great safari the guide was excellent and the cook made amazing dinners and breakfasts. Tents, sleeping equipment was all included and the car was very new and made for a comfortable journey. We would highly recommend them. We decided it was cheaper to go with a tour company than do it ourselves in our own car. 

Contact number +255 763 222 293

name: Ajabu Adventures
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this place was added by the owner

AJABU ADVENTURES

Ajabu Adventures is a Dutch safari company specialized in tailor-made private safaris in Tanzania and excist more then 10 years. We customize each holiday or trip to suit your wishes. Whether you want to experience the ultimate safari, a relax beach holiday or trek to the roof of Africa by climbing the Kilimanjaro, it is all possible. The only limit is your imagination. Looking for permits for national park, we can also assist you in this.

OVERLANDERS
Would you like to have tips and tricks about overlanding in Tanzania? 
We have more then 3 years overland experience in whole Africa. 

 Feel free to contact us, we would love to help you out.

Contact:
Inge
+ 255 788 971 730
Info@ajabu-adventures.com

name: Juke Fast Food
description:
Local restaurant with traditional food and soft drinks. No sign but opposite Tanesco (energy company) office which you can't miss.

Ugali with beans, okra, and leaves with a soft drink was 2500 tzs, great value and good food.

name: Relax
description: Petrol and diesel available. They also had Oryx gas bottles (big and small). Cash only.

name: NMB Nkasi ATM
description: 24hr ATM outside the bank. Accepts Visa and MasterCard.

name: Energy oil
description: Petrol and diesel available. Small shops nearby selling food, stationery and motor parts.

name: Market
description: Among all the wax fabric stalls you can find a fruit and veg market and a very nice covered area with many dried goods (beans, rice, coffee, oil, onion, garlic, etc).

name: Petrol stations
description: Two fuel stations. One on either side of the road. There are more stations around town too.

name: BF Goodrich Tyres (at the Orxy Gas Station)
description: Next to Superdoll tyres pull in at gas station. We had our wheels rotated and realigned for 36,000 shilling. Very quick service.

name: Tumaini hostel and restaurant lushoto
description:
Church run hostel  with doublebedrooms in two floor building.
All rooms seem to have own shower/WC (warm water> new electric boiler in each bath) balcony, mosquitonets provided.
Clean.
Restaurant with lots and good food ( spagetti and pizza was great).
Quiet ( except muezzin at 5:00).
Right in middle of Lushoto downtown.
Carpark with fence/wall.
Price 30.000TSH/(~13$) room/night. 
Friendly staff there is clothwashing service. 
They can put you in contact with guides.
No alcohol/smoking allowed.
We think it is a great value for money.
No space for camping .

name: Mabatini Lodge
description:
Good value for the price! Decently sized rooms with hot shower. Rooms are simple but clean with some cheezy 3D pictures on the walls and mosquito nets, professional English speaking staff is a huge plus. 
It's the same owner as New Millennium Inn higher up the hill.
The restaurant serves local Tanzanian staples, also reasonably priced.
The rooms are 20,000 TSH.
There's no Wi-Fi however.

name: don't listen Google, not possible to cross
description:
Google maps shows a way true the mountains. It doesn't exist! Don't even try, I had very hard time turning around and going back with a light motorbike.
Cheers

name: Oilcom Petrol Station
description: petrol and diesel available on TZ side of border

name: Playground
description:
We stood next to the school on a football ground. You drive to the school and go left. After the buildings there is a big football ground, with a lot of space. No one disturbed us. Only in the morning two kids came by. And when we were leaving a couple kids were playing, but they didn’t came to us. 
You hear a little bit noise from to road, but it's very quiet. You can’t be seen from the road. 
Nice place to stay! 
We stood there on saturday during holidays. Maybe it’s busier during the week.

name: Manazini Swahili House
description: Booked via AirBnB for €28 per night. Nice little basic cottage with en-suite and porch attached where you can sit in the shade. There is also another apartment on the premises. Good breakfast included (fruit, eggs, toast/bread, juice, coffee, spice tea), although it was less every day...You can walk (2min) to the quiet beach. Off and on WiFi. No dinner/lunch options at this place. There are restaurants from other accommodations nearby (mains 15-20k, beer 5k) and some small shops for water, soda, fruit and cookies. Snorkeling trip (starfish, blue lagoon, 3-4h) can be arranged for 40k pp. Yussuph the host is a laid back quiet guy. Not welcoming if you ask something and not around a lot, which can be annoying (in our case we had no water for almost a day, he needs to turn on the pump for that...). Parking should be possible but very low (2,20m) entrance. The accommodation is nice for the price, but don’t expect anything more than that from the host/premises.

name: Sundown restaurant
description: Great food, friendly staff, good vibe, sunset. Mains 15-20k, lot of choice for 15k. Our favorite in this area!

name: Tandoor village
description: Amazing Indian food! Really enjoyed eating here! Mains around 15k + side of rice/naan 2-5k. Beer 4k. You can park off the street next to the restaurant (car in sight).

name: Mbega Lodge
description:
Mbega Lodge, cottages for 30 Guests
Camping 10$pppn( kids half)
very friendly, internet at bar, water/warmwater
Drinks Food bit pricy..barbecuearea with roof 
Grassy shady place right at the gate to mount meru national park
Stayed here three nights 
lots of ants ..cool at nights ( february)

name: Silver park hotel
description: Good clean rooms with en-suite with hot shower, mozzie net, fan, tv. Secure parking and restaurant and bar on site. No menu, so ordering is difficult with the language barrier. The wanted 20k for chicken and fries, which we did not take. The room price incl (decent) breakfast: Jasmin at the reception asked for 50k for the room, we replied with 30k which was easily accepted. Later she realized the owner would not be very happy with 30k and she wanted 40k. But we already paid and said, a deal is a deal. Another guy tried to convince us to pay the extra 10k, which we didn’t. The discussion remained friendly though but I think they will not make this mistake again. Rooms normally cost 40-50k (according to the guestbook). Even for 40k it’s a good room. WiFi available but nobody knew the password.

name: Rhotian Glades Restaurant
description:
Upper Class African Restaurant.
Local Dishes for very moderate Prices.
You sit in little bungalows or outside tabels
We had lunch and dinner and it was just perfect. Friendly waiters.

name: Terrace next to the main road
description: If you’re with a tent you should be able to hide somewhere. You’re next to the road tho.

name: Raha Leo Inn Hotel
description:
Cheap small clean friendly singel story hotel
Double ensuite 20$/night secure parking for up to three cars free. Wifi, kitchen, pleasant public sitting area..

name: Kindoroko Hotel
description:
One of the many Hotels in this Area.
55.000TSH doubleroom ensuite..small rooms moskitoblinds and nets..ceilingvan, hot runnig water..roofterrace..4 story building, restaurant bar, safe car parking. Friendly staff, clean 
We stayed here for two nights with family

name: Sikonge Road Lodge
description: Cosy Lodge located just on the corner of the market of Sikonge town on the way to Mbeya or Tabora. Red brick fence around the building so it's easy to recognise. Rooms of great value, 15.000 sh (6$) for 2 with breakfast, bathroom, TV inside plus wooden floor and classy furnishing. Best value we found in Tanzania. Besides, the owner and his family speak very well English and are knowledgeable about the region of Tabora.

name: Natural Spring
description: It's a natural spring on the climb to Mbeya. We passed it with the bikes in february and there was plenty of water.

name: Pitu Mechanic - Arusha
description:
Pitu Mechanic, exist from 1972 (family business). They only work with real parts and they can fix everything! 

Pitu, the owner,  speaks English very well and the responce time is fast on Whatsapp.

Beside that they show the proof of real parts. That give you a good feeling. Because in Africa the people are not trustfull at all.

TOYOTA & DEFENDER SPECIALIST.

#fast #trustfull #valueformoney #40yearexperience

name: Aquiline Hotel
description: Comfortable hotel close to the bus station. good for overnight from/to Moshi 40.000 tzs for a double room. Breakfast included. Free wifi.

name: Jeco Hotel Mtwara
description: New hotel and restaurant, about 1 year old. Rooms cost 35000 or 55000 tsh per night. We opted for the cheaper room which was a decent size for a couple with aircon, fan, TV, bathroom with cold water shower and european toilet. The room was clean and big enough for two people. The restaurant served cold beers etc, there was not a menu but we had fried chicken & chips, and fish & chips.

name: Atm at NMB Bank in Kilwa
description: There is a atm in town. Max withdrawal Tsh400 000 per transaction

name: Mamma Mia pizza - Lushoto
description:
Nice little restaurant with good pizza (base thin-ish) breakfast, salads and pasta dishes and light meals. Several coffee and tea options, as well  as dessert. Good friendly service and option to sit ouside.
For further questions call te chef: Peter +255 717 787 888

name: Meat king butchery. cheese and wine
description: Fresh chicken, beef, lamb, cold meats, pork, biltong and boerewors. All types of cheeses you' ve dreamed of, vegetables, fresh bread and South African wine (small, but good collection) Be prepared to leave with an empty wallet, but happy tummy.

name: Guest House
description: Only Guesthouse I found in Matumbo, rooms for K50 or K80. no shower, only buckets

name: Mogan Guesthouse
description:
