Guesthouse with basic rooms, also space to pitch tents, we were 5 cyclists for that night and got a double room for K140 and they let us pitch the tents for free. Charlie is the manager, really nice guy, good for a stop over and not far from a fairly big supermarket where you can stock up stuff.

UPDATE: (dirty) double room 180 - Aug 2022

name: Manchester Complex Lodge
description:
very small rooms
toilet but no shower in the room K 15.000 pn
Bar & Restaurant. Safe parking very nice people

name: Tembo Guesthouse
description: Nice quiet hotel. You can park inside and there is security. Single room with bathroom and breakfast could be bargained à 25'000 TZS. (initially 35'000 TZS).

name: down at the stone beach
description:
a nice quite spot down at a secluded beach of Tanganyika lake close to Kigoma
there is some grass where you can pitch your tent
only reachable by foot from the street, we parked our car somewhere a bit hidden and went down there
nice view over the lake, you can see some fisherman passing by in their small boats
keep your belongings inside, in the morning some monkeys might come to visit

name: Panone Hotel & Restaurant
description: Nice buffet restaurant. 10'000 TZS, a bit expensive but tasty. there is also a hotel with a big parking and a supermarket.

name: camp at the lake
description: very nice spot at the lake, at the evening only few locals were taking water from the lake but friendly and not disturbing. Night calm and at morning nobody came. Recommended

name: polish cementary
description: 20 000 Poles where send to Africa after Siberia prison. They lived in Uganda, Tanzania and other african countries. Here is one of polish cementaries.

name: Kwik-fit
description: First petrol station since border of Rwanda with possibility of using credit card.

name: AJMS INVESTMENT GARAGE
description: Large garage workshop with pits and hoists. efficient service, identified clutch fault, team of mechanics sourced and replaced clutch fork in 4 hrs. $200 including recovery to garage.  We thought thus was not bad for Arusha.

name: BushCamp Kilimanjaro view
description:
Camp close to gravel road. At first, next to road is some place but go behind trees line. 
There is grass place next to the water.
Small birds and ducks.
No people. Only one man sometimes with cows and sheeps which didn't disturb us.
Nice view on Kilimanjaro at the morning.
We stayed here 2 nights.
Internet signal data: H+

name: Nyaishozi Guesthouse
description:
Local guesthouse with a secured backyard where I could park my motorbike.
Room prices range from 7000 (no bathroom) to10000 (with bathroom) and 15000 for the newer ones.

name: In the bush
description:
Place on our way for one night.
You can turn here from main road. Path for motorcycle but enought space for small car.
No mosquito. No people. Only few motorcycles at night not disturb.
Here is a lot of shadow and space for table outside.

name: Azam Booking office
description: Ferry to Mkoani (South Pemba) every Monday evening 23:30. 35$/person, bicycle free. Cars not possible, but it seams that there is another company (Booking office near the big supermarket) that can take cars and leaves on Monday morning 8am, to be verified...

name: Miramont Hotel
description:
Very nice place in not bad prices as for Zanzibar... We payed 24$ via booking.com. Directly at the beach, swimming pool with clean water (but warm), very good food (but expensive), nice places to chill out, good wi-fi. Beach is almost empty, not many tourist. 
I'm not sure about parking but there is some space secure for car, but probably not to sleep in the car, just to park.

name: police camera/radar
description: Lots of police with cameras and radar around here, $30000 per offence, found out the hard way that the speed limit is 50km on the main highway in the middle of nowhere...

name: Mbalu paradise hotel
description:
Updated reviews below (things have changed) - Very nice hotel, calm, clean, with a nice garden where you can take a drink. Someone told us that it is the hippest place in town. There is plenty of other hotels in this town. 
We paid 45000TS for a room.

name: Msolwa filling station
description:
super nice gas station ,little bakery, bbq place, the store has amazing selection of beer and liquor (even Gentelman Jack), even has some fruits and veggies, better that half the stores we've seen so far, lol. And a live DJ (not sure why).  Should also add if you are in a truck/camper, I dont see why they wouldn't let you park on the side overnight as the place is huge and nothing around. Didnt ask but I would think it's possible for a few $

No cards payments at the gas station.

name: Deserted Lodge with private beach
description:
Nice wild camping spot on the west coast of Pemba island. Access difficult because the road is not on google maps or Openstreetmap. Dirt road ok for bicycle, no sand. It might be hard to access by car because of the branches coming over the road. Be aware that local fishermen also come there for catching octopus in the morning. But I experienced this part of the island as the most hospitable with no kids asking money. Probably a place out of the main tourist circuit, where rarely a foreigner goes.

Directions:
Follow your navigator until Lat. -5.16310 Lon. 39.83967 where you turn right. The continuation is pretty straight to the target passing by those waypoints:
Lat. -5.16010 Lon. 39.84571
Lat. -5.15839 Lon. 39.84853
Lat. -5.15545 Lon. 39.85111
Lat. -5.15255 Lon. 39.85527
Lat. -5.14885 Lon. 39.85863

bring water from the last village before my indicated waypoints.

name: Makufuli Motors
description:
Excellent garage! The yard is full with safari cars all being seviced. It’s a full service shop which does everything from paint jobs and body work to laser assisted wheel adjustments.

They service all kinds of cars. Obviously Toyotas are the most common ones, but there are Land Rovers, BMWs and even two Porches here right now. They’ve the biggest warehouse of spare parts I’ve seen in Africa, which even stocks some ARB parts. 

Manager, Husein is a friendly guy and speaks perfect English. Prices are good. Spent a good hour or two trying to locate a squeaking sound and only payed 4 USD for two spare plastic parts. I tried to pay more but they didn’t let me. 

Opening hours:
Monday - Friday: 08-17. Lunch 13-14
Saturday: 08-13
Sunday: Closed

Phone number: 0784520221

name: Papa’s
description:
Really nice Hotel / campsite next to the lake. 
A little paradise in the middle of the community. 
Campsite is 10K ppn 
Bungalows B&B 100K<200K

name: Bush camp
description: Nice spot in the bush, a lot of space to choose, not a single person disturb us. You can hear the road but it's fine. Turn from the road at begining there is a little concrete, than grass road, that you have to go a little between trees but it's easy, than under electric line high voltage, and then you have a lot of space. Enjoy!

name: Total fuel station
description:
Accept Visa or or MasterCard payments.
Diesel is expensive, other station next to this is cheaper.
On the way to Dar es Salaam was even less.

name: Spears Classic Lodge
description:
Located in Magu on the main road, this hotel is very new, clean and confortable (AC in the rooms, hot shower). Bathrooms are spacious. The double room is 20 000 TSH. Breakfast included but very basic (bread, egg boiled, coffee). You can put bicycles in the yard (or at the reception) but there is no place to park cars inside. There is a bar and a basic restaurant adjoined to the hotel. 
This may be a good stop for cyclists between Mwanza and Serengeti.

name: Ilham Batteries ltd.
description: They sell car and motorcycle tires and batteries; the young owner Irfan is knowledgeable, reliable (!),  nice, and an avid rider.

name: Panone mini supermarket
description:
good place for supplies. slightly expensive, but convenient. no fresh food when we were there, but plenty of biscuits ;)
also very clean western style toilets.

name: Pemba Moonlight
description:
Situated just behind the fancy Manta Resort, this little place let you camp for 10$ including breakfast. There is no real fence around it but I felt very safe on that island.

I didn't stay there because I already had negotiated a good deal at the Pemba Paradise lodge.. If you want to Dive center at the Manta Resort is a good choice. It has new equipment and is more professional and much cheaper than the Swahili divers. David is an excellent Dive master from Kenya.

name: Ruksana restaurant
description: Small Indian restaurant with excellent food, good priced. We went here just we wanted Indian and were really pleasantly surprised with the quality and taste!

name: Pemba Sea View
description:
Nice hotel, but not budget. 50'000 TZS for signs room with breakfast. Only for married couples. No space for camping.

Excellent restaurant.

name: Amani Hostel
description:
Really nice place, secure parking for cars/trucks, parked our motos next to the room. Room was $35,000 shillings ($15usd) and really nice/big. Double bed, ac, cable TV (15 channels, 7 in english), super nice bathroom, table/chairs inside and outside on terrace, small area to hang clothing/luggage.
30,000tsh for room with fan. 

There is a kitchen, we put some food in the fridge, I think you can use the facilities. Wifi works outside, not great but good enough to watch some videos on Facebook or whatnot. Other rooms available (cheaper) and can be found on booking.com but more expensive that just showing up. Food is pretty good and cheap! This place is much better than the $20 to camp at elephant hotel down the road. Gas station at roundabout has beer(cold), wine and liquor + snacks.

name: Khan’s barbeque
description: Good food in not bad price: 16.000 TZS/pp for meat- mutton, chicken and beef from barbecue, salads, different sauces etc.

name: Panorama Hostel
description: Simple but relaxed place with private rooms and dorms. I could bargain a bed in the 4 bed dorm for 25'000 TZS. The room was clean and comfortable but the washrooms were dirty. If you have a vehicle you can park inside.

name: Zetaki Hotel
description: Really nice place. $30,000 for a double bed (ground floor), bug net, AC, proper toilet, safe gated parking, they have a bar & food. Rooms have a desk/chair and lounge chair. Staff is really nice, speak English well. You will see sign on the main road, just follow the dirt road 200m to the hotel (it's the only big building around). Much better than the place marked east of town (same price). No wifi

name: Liberty Rest House
description: 25,000 Shillings a night.  Clean bed and room.  TV.  Nice staff.  Fan.  Decent bathroom.  Next door to Simba Hotel, which was full.

name: The Old Boma Mikindani
description: Former German British colonial administrative building from 1895 turned into a charming hotel managed and run by local people from the village supported by the UK based charity Trade Aid. All proceeds go to the village and surrounding communities. Rooms are nicely decorated with local art, have clean and nice washrooms with hot water, some with sea view, starting from 80,000ppn rather on the higher side but totally worth the money for a good cause. They have a swimming pool, bar and restaurant which is open also for day visitors in case you run on a small budget but still would like to explore the conservation efforts  made in the town of Mikindani. They do offer as well tours to the Marine Park and islands nearby. A house where Livingstone stayed before his journey to the interior of Southern Africa can also be visited. Highly recommended if even only for a cold drink or some delicious samosas!

name: Grass land
description:
Nice place. You can stay on the big flat grass with great view on a valley and mountains or you can hide between a trees in this point.
Quiet. In some places you can find gsm with data signal.

name: Campsite Below Telecom Tower Hill
description:
Campsite ~70km outside of Tunduma.  Aimed to reach the border but rain and darkness set in, so I found a spot to camp.

From Sumbawanga, pass a large hill with telecom towers just next to the road. Turn left on a small dirt road to "Chitete" before the next little town begins.  Roughly 300m back, a tiny track on left leads to a quarry. If you cross the culvert that drains from the quarry, you've gone too far.  

Follow the quarry path back until it splits, the right side winds around to the top of the quarry where there is flat grass behind some dense bushes to camp.

Hidden from both the main road and the side road. Noise from the adjacent town until about 8:30pm, then silence. Just occasional vehicle on main road.

name: Basic Hotel
description: This is a cheap accommodation, good if you are budget or can't make it to Morogoro. There is a parking inside and the rooms have fan and Miskito net. When I was there, there was no running water. So bucket shower. I paid 15'000 KES for a single room. But I'm pretty sure that the police officer who brought me there had a commission.

name: Great view bush camp
description:
Turn here left to the big transmitter. Drive through and then around 200-300 m, find your perfect spot with beaitiful view. In the morning we were just upon clouds. Magic! And not a single person. And the road here from Chimala village is also picturesque. We stayed night and all next day.
H+ Tigo service.

name: Miwaleni Spring Farms
description:
A little oasis in the Maasai-bush. Went here with some local friends over the day and discovered that it’s a super nice campsite. They have a pool and a beautiful little garden. 

I don’t know about prices but shouldn’t be too expensive as it’s primarily locals that camp here.

name: Kimbiji Beach Lagoon
description: Nice beach with crystal clear water since the lagoon is covered by a reef. You have nice corals and a lot a fish, good fun to snorkel. Also a good place to fish. No people, no tourists! Only some local fisherman that provide all kind fish for dinner (octopus, snapper, squid, lobster...). They have a nice bar down at the beach. We had a nice grassy spot overlooking the lagoon and we used toilet and showers of the „mud hut“. Since they - Ken and Colin - are just building up the place, in the following weeks they plan to put up a proper campsite with showers, shade, WiFi, electricity (Solar) and a kitchen. Ken and Colin are amazing hosts and will arrange whatever you need. They have not officially opened and haven’t set prices yet. But prices will be fair. This place is highly recommended!

name: DTB ATM
description: This bank does not charge a foreign card fee using a visa card. we used visa but they say Mastercard is also possible

name: Kahama Super Lodge
description:
Clean rooms with mosquito net and hot shower! 
Room with fan 25.000
Room with ac 30.000
Some rooms are smaller than others for the same price and closer to the road. The 30.000 seem to be one the quiet side of the hotel. Avoid the room which face the restaurant downstairs bcos the noise starts from 5am till 12 midnite. Check before you agree. 
Secured parking. The allowed us to park fenced and they have parking outside with a guard.
They say food is available 24 hours?!

name: Local guest house
description:
Local guest house in a small village. Staff are friendly but they don’t speak English. 
Room are clean and cheap. 
I like this local place. 
Previous food before coming because it s not easy to find here. 

Room with shower/toilet outside room it’s 5 000 tzs
Room with shower/toilet inside room it’s  10 000 tzs

name: FM Lodge
description: Hotel with inner parking (only smaller vehicles). Private room for 25'000TZS, clean. Restaurant has not much choice. OK for one night.

name: Safina Guest House
description:
It s cheap guest house in a small village. 
Simple room with bed. 
I think for the price I don’t wait more luxury. 
5 000 tzs with shower outside room 
15 000 tzs with shower inside room

name: Hot Plate
description:
place is a little bit in wrong location: 
drive inn the small street between DTB bank and Puma Petrol Station! Than look on right side where bamboo is.
Food from southern India which is very delicious. Mains 9.000-14.000
Recommended!!!!

name: karibuni
description: Room for 5.000 toilet outsite, basic place, is in the back of a bar so a bit noise but good enough to stop on the way.

name: Atm - NMB
description: few banks in this area, one of them is NBA

name: Tanga Fresh
description: Good local Restaurant. 3000 TSH for a vegetarian meal.

name: Igawa Hotel
description: Nice new hotel, with secured parking. They didn't want to let me take my bicycle into the room, but they have a good storage room instead. I could negotiate to 25'000 TZS for a single room with breakfast (initially 30'000 TZH).

name: Kasai GH
description:
Owner don’t speak English , simple room. 
But cheap ! 
4 000 TZS room. 
He try to don’t give balance back when u gave 5 000 but you cry and he give back

name: Kitanewa Guest House
description:
Clean, simple and cheap. 
5 000 with shower outside room 
12 000 shower inside room

Small shop around. I think the main problem it s no electricity for
Charging phone...

name: Lodge on the main road
description:
Simple and cheap. 
Not cleanest place and bed are not very confortable. 
Good place if it s just for sleep.

5 000 tzs room

name: Wild camp hill 10km outside Sumbawanga
description:
Nice camp on the hill with view. 
Maybe not easy to find exactly small flat place I found. But gps position can help you. 
I saw nobody in evening and morning. 
If it s windy don’t come here . Nothing for protect. 

It s possible to come with car you have dirty track near. The track begin on T20 road in front of this location.

name: DM Executive Lodge
description:
Nice small rooms, hot and cold shower with low pressure. European toilet. Everything very clean. Moskitonet.
 Nice people. To know a bit of Suaheli could be very good. Small breakfast which I did not use. TZ S 15.000 per room.

name: Kinyanyamba Lodge
description:
clean rooms, decent size. double beds with mosquito net. ensuite bathroom with running, hot water, good water pressure. some have western some squat toilets
rooms are 15.000TZS and big enough to take your bike inside
they have a bar and chipsi place in the same complex (beer 2000TZS, chipsi mayai 2000TZS) may be a bit noisy in the evening but we had no problem
the place is not shown correctly in Google maps, use the coordinates here

name: Barry's Beach Resort
description: See the hotel post too. It was a paradise for us. Barry and his team are very lovely. Just enjoy the time there. Camping is $10 pppn

name: DTB ATM no charge
description: We could get money without fees. We had Visa. 300.000 max per transaction possible, directly behind the fort.

name: Tesha Home
description:
Stay here if in Mbeya!

It’s not your normal hotel but rather an AirBnB (also on Booking.com). We just drive up, and the owner was a bit surprised but quickly welcomed us. Probably better to book or call in advance. 

House built just a few years ago with a really big gated courtyard. 

Payed 80 000 for the largest room as it had a bathtub with water jets! Slightly cheaper rooms are available. Spotless, awesome bed, even complimentary toothbrushes. Great breakfast. Fully comparable to a 200 USD hotel!

Owner is a super nice guy. Really recommend this place.

name: Snack Corner - cheap
description: its not a restaurant but a food Stall where you can have Chips ans beef sticks for local prices. the food elsewhere is more expensive. good for a lunch snack

name: Magofu Hill Eco-campside.
description:
10$ with breakfast. Beautiful green garden to camp or stay in one of the 3 huts. Full of trees and grass. A paradise in the desert. The place is managed by the Masai women community, they are very helpful and this is a place to have an unforgettable Masai experience.
Powerfull shower and very clean toilet.
For any additional information contact via WhatsApp or call +255 752036059

name: El Hazina Executive Inn
description:
Very nice clean hotel with hot water, and bar. We paid 25,000tzs for a double room. 
We were allowed to take bicycles into the room.
Their is space outside for car parking would have to check if available for guests. 
Also a small shop below for basic supplies.

3G signal on VodaCom

name: Massai Village Wild Camping
description:
We camped here for one night between Monduli and Mount Kitumbeine. 
Very small village who didn’t speak English but they let us camp just outside of the perimeter. 
Floor was thick dusty dirt with acia thorn trees around. Had to clear the ground of thorns and place ground sheet down. 
They were very friendly and helped us clear space for the tent.

name: Highland Park Hotel
description: nice hotel, 40.000 TSH one big double room. Bed very comfortable, good mosquito net, warm and running water. Secure parking and very nice breakfast included.

name: new rungemba restaurant  (local)
description:
good, quick food for cheap prices.
directly on the highway if you on the way to or from malawi. cheap and cold beer aswell.

name: Travelers inn
description:
Cheap hotel quite big rooms with fan ,inside bathroom and toilet.
We stayed in room with double bed for Tsh15000. Shower is cold, but you don’t want a hot shower here anyway. Nice people who also do your laundry if you wish.

name: Railway Crossing Checkpoint
description: police check!  you have to STOP at Railway Crossing and not  just slow down

name: Enduimet Lodge West Kilimanjaro
description:
Hotel with double rooms for 20,000tzs, 15,000 for a single.

Small but nice room with western toilet and running water. Mosquito net is included. Could fit 2 bicycle in with a bit of a squeeze. 

Soap, towel and toilet roll are supplied. 

Had a court yard area where we cooked dinner and breakfast.

name: Local restaurant
description:
Had rice, beans and greens for 2,000tzs per plate. 
Cold soda available from the shop next door.

name: Libori Hotel
description: Big Catholic guest house, with simple rooms. Hot shower (huge boiler on the corridor!) and western toilets. 20.000 for one, with basic breakfast. No WiFi! Restaurant is inexpensive, but very slow. Huge secure parking! Big rigs can enter, if they manage to open the second half of the gate! Holland hotel has goods rooms, but now 50.000 for one, and fully booked! The lodges along the main road coming into town from Mbeya look better from the outside than from the inside!

name: Dr. Atiman kristumfalme hospital
description: General Hospital with optometrist surgery, eye surgery and ambulance.

name: Rombo Executive Hotel, Tarakea
description:
Lovely new high end hotel with restaurant below. 

Double room with balcony for 30,000tzs.

Restaurant was very reasonable. Rice and beans for 2,000tzs, chipsi mayai for 2,500tzs and cold soda for 500tzs.

Showers are hot, double bed is comfy, room has fridge.

We’re allowed to take bicycle to the room and lock them on the balcony.

Possible van parking outside the hotel.

Vodacom 3G

name: New Tarakea Guest House
description: The guest house has large and small gas bottles outside

name: Mangalili Toplife Bar & Guest House
description:
Basic guest house surrounded by banana plantations. 10,000tzs for double room.

Room has double bed, hot water and squat toilet. Food available on site.

We have stored bicycle inside the room.

Parking outside for all vehicles.

name: Juddi’s Cottages
description:
Lovely brand new guest house for 15,000tzs for a double bedroom room with 2 people.

Hot shower, double bed, mosquito net, a fan and western toilet. 

We’re allowed to take bicycles into the room. Possible parking for a smaller van down the side of the hotel.

name: Mic hotel
description:
Great hotel to stay in at Dar es Salaam. Nice and clean room for two including a nice breakfast,  A/C, private bathroom for 40,000 TZS.
 Secured parking lot. 24 H restaurant.

name: Modern Rest House
description:
Nice modern guest house with double rooms for 15,000tzs. 

Room is nice with a real double bed, decent mosquito net also included. 

They claim hot showers but have only had cold. Western toilet also included.

Beer and food available with a few minutes walk from guest house (towards bus stand)

2x bicycles could possibly fit in but it’d be a little cramped.

Off-road parking for some camper vans that aren’t too big (no big-rigs)

3G VodaCom is full signal.

name: Korogwe White House Inn
description:
Very nice hotel, double room for 40,000tzs with breakfast. Rooms are massive with hot water, larger bed and mosquito net.  The best thing about the place is the food, veg curry, rice and chapati for 6,500. It was delicious!  Bikes can be kept in the room.  Parking for vehicles outside, not gated.  
3G VodaCom is full bars

name: Acko Guest House
description:
Basic guest house with electricity and squat toilets. Double room with shared toilet is 7,000tzs. Room was quiet after 9pm, has mosquito net and plenty of space to store bikes inside room. Staff were friendly with basic English. 
E VodaCom signal, 3G just outside of town.

name: Pacific Inn
description:
Nice clean guest house. Double room for 15,000 with cold shower and ceiling fan, 25,000 for a double with electric shower and ceiling fan.
(Showers in neither of the rooms were working when we stayed as they’d run out of water)

Large double bed, good mosquito net, squat toilet in room and a (working) tap to wash hands.

No place for parking but possible street parking available.

VodaCom 3G full signal.

name: Hills View restaurant (inside of Hills View Hotel)
description: Very reasonably priced restaurant (15000 tzs for a main course, 3000 tzs for a juice) inside of Hills View Hotel. Large choice of food, terrace, service quite fast. The best food I had in Mbeya.

name: Bungumo & House
description:
Basic guest house with double bed, mosquito net and squat toilet.

No running water, but bucket of water is supplied.

10,000tzs for double room. 

It was raining so didn’t fancy camping at Peponi for $15.

name: Irente view point
description: Amazing views for sunset, entrance fee  25.000 Tsh

name: Wild Camping
description: Wild camping spot between the thorn trees and bushes. Most suitable for motorcycles and 4x4’s due to sandy gravel road. Did not hear any people or see them. Kept light and noise to a minimum. No views just camping spot due to no alternatives.

name: Savannah House
description:
great place 5 min away from town. Anthony the owner is super nice and makes sure you have a good stay.
two double rooms and one big family room for six people, rooms are clean and decorated nicely, nice places to relax outside, great breakfast, free and safe parking,  free WiFi, kitchen, coffee stand.
prices between 10$-30$
Anthony whatsup number +255757757928

name: Mboni Lodge
description:
Warning : we had an electrical fire in this guest house. Our travel plug started to smoke and then a lightbulb set on fire and we had to put it out.

Guest house that’s showing it’s age. 15,000tzs for double room. Shower taps have been removed so only bucket tap in bathroom. 

Space for parking for camper vans within the walls of guest house.

Beer can be purchased in bars near bus station (100m away)

3G VodaCom is full signal.

name: Weighbridge 3.5 t
description: All vehicles 3.5 t and above have to pass.

name: Open Heart Lodge
description:
Nice little hotel, double room for 20,000tzs.
Cold shower, double bed and mosquito net. 

Has a bar / restaurant on site.

Bicycles were allowed in the room. Space for big rig / camper vans within walls of hotel.

3G VodaCom is full signal.

name: Kissiky Guest House
description:
Lovely guest house in centre of town. 20,000tzs for double room. 

Cold shower, massive double bed and mosquito net was decent.

Food market on at night when we arrived. Restaurants/ bars very close to hotel.

Bicycles locked outside guest house.

name: Safaris Partner
description:
Probably the cheapest place to do an organized Safari. Very open for options.
I contacted with them WhatsApp +255768141516 but they have website

name: Bus Station Parking
description: Semi secured parking next to Police office at a regional bus depot. Ran out of daylight on my way to Dar es Salam. This was a welcome stop. New the end of 2018, all is clean. Restrooms and clean cold shower. Buses stop around 7:00ish PM. Quiet until  6:00ish AM when they start arriving again. There is unsecured parking outside the fence - I assume free and possibly limited access to shower and restroom..  I parked inside the gate for an overnight fee 5000 TSH.

name: Comfort Lodge Msata
description:
Nice guest house 15,000 for double room. Western toilet, running cold water and a mosquito net.

Restaurants with beer just down the road near fruit and veg market. 

Bicycles could be taken in room. Space to park any type of vehicle inside the gates. 

VodaCom 3G has full signal.

name: guest house in Doma
description: the cleanest and cheapest place 8000-10000

name: One Night Stop Over T2
description: This is an old quarry beside the road, space for several vehicles, may be muddy with rain. There are a few houses around, but no hassle.

name: Merin Hotel
description: Nice big clean rooms for 30 000 tsh. Big double bed, safe parking and small bar available inside. Safe parking.

name: Garden Hall Guest House
description: Basic guest house, friendly owner. Double room is 10,000tzs. Bucket shower, fan, electricity, no mosquito net. One bicycle fits in the room, we left ours in a spare room though. Porch area for cooking.

name: Bush Baby Lodge
description:
Double room with a sea view and breakfast for 31,000tzs. Hot shower available in room too.

It’s one row back off the beach so a very short walk.

Food available from 15,000-30,000tzs. Beer available when it’s not Ramadan, though wine and spirits served all year round. Was just not possible to stock beer.

No obvious parking available, bicycles allowed to be stored on balcony in room.

Note: water not available during power outage which is a little frustrating.

name: African safari cottages and campsite
description: The nearest campsite to Mikumi National park, within the "buffer zone". 6 km from village and far enough from the highway to not hear it too much. Bush experience with wild animals roaming and sounds of lions. Quite basic for 10$pp. They also propose nice little en-suite cabin facing the riverine bush for 20$ (what we opted for) or 40$ full board.

name: onyona guest house
description: Guest house with a pub attached. Double room with bucket shower, toilet, fan and good mosquito net for 10,000tzs. Other rooms for 15,000tzs and 20,000tzs but we couldn't see much of a difference. Bikes fit in the room. The guy working there was kind and spoke good English. Pub wasn't too noisy.

name: Sameer parts limited
description: This place sells parts. On the front window it says "Landrover specialist", but they have non Landrover parts as well. I needed a big fuse (60A) to connect 2 car batteries, visited 20 different shots, but this was the only place in town where they have it.

name: CMT
description: Gas station- Petrol and Diesel normal prices

name: Asmorein Hotel
description: Very accommodating place, staff are friendly and place is secure

name: Old Bridge near Kikelelwa
description: This place is nice for a stopover north of the Kili. It"s an old bridge beside the new one. There is space for five cars. Quiet in the night. Some friendly locals around with daylight. No network reception. 10 km to the Tarakea border post.

name: Butterfly Camp
description: A nice and private spot near the main road, only two locals said Jambo from a distance.

name: E&S Lodge
description:
This place is hotel/motel type of thing! No camping at all, my big double bed no A/C cost me 20 000! 
New building or recently refurbished, enclosed and save to squeeze one or two motorcycles around terrace where are tables, but after working hours of kitchen and the bar where locals do come and enjoy good new ambience, you will be able to put bikes behind locked gates, safe! Rooms are spacious and clean, African toilet, hot shower, worn actually but meet! No WiFi and restaurant food available ! Very hospitable manager who run to the market to buy peanuts and roasted them in the kitchen just as I liked that way, my friend! Great place to stop and even local village market which is few steps away offer charm of Tanzanian way how to shuffle goods! 
i would recommend highly and only little longer ride from very busy Mbeya, which is. Easy busy and noisy!

name: The Double Eight Restaurant
description: Smart, civilised cafe restaurant with  bar.  Part of a conference centre, open to public. Low prices.

name: Waresa Tours
description:
JAMBO? HOW ARE YOU. You are mostly welcome  to Wakwanza Rehabilitation and Safari (WARESA)Tours. We are happy to welcome you all at  WARESA TOURS. We are a local Tanzania organization that offer a CLIMBING MOUNT KILIMANJARO | WILDLIFE ADVENTURE SAFARIS | BEACH HOLIDAY | CULTURAL TOURISM |BIKE TOURS and also we are life changer for children and youth with disability via the income earn when you travel with us
We provide highest quality service and products that are within your budget. We have strong experience and a great team of people that guarantee the highest quality of service and co-ordination.

Contact Us
Email: waresatours@gmail.com | info@waresatour.com | david@waresatour.com
Call / WhatsApp +255759204912
Website: www.waresatour.com

name: MK Guesthouse
description: A cheap and cheerful place on the road to Tabora. I came across it by chance as I was too tired to cycle all the way to Tabora. 5000 a night, mosquito nets, quiet (yes, quiet! no crazy loudspeakers nearby), towel and flip flops provided, one socket per room, no running water - bucket showers ( but there is communal hot water available which was nice). Food available directly across the road at the corner: rice, beans, meat, green veg, hot milk for 2,500. Had a really pleasant stay here.

name: Fadhil Restaurant
description:
Lovely local style restaurant. We coconut vegetable curry and calamari. Free desert too of fried banana with chocolate sauce. 

16,000tsz calamari 
13,000tsz vegetable curry

name: The Hut of Wine & Cheese
description: Really nice place that offers a studio for campers 50 000 Tsh a night. Place also offers a restaurant with Wine and cheese tasting. The place is secure and clean and the staff speak english very well.

name: John Paul II Hostel
description: Double room for 20,000 TSH including breakfast at the restaurant next door (Nazareth Canteen). Secure parking, clean, hot showers and WiFi available. Good value for money.

name: Saidi Manzana Bakery
description: Nice bakery where you can also get breakfast/lunch. Very reasonably priced.

name: Safari Inn Hostel
description: A nice place with an area out back to lock your bike. I paid 35,000 tzs for a Budget Single Room which has an en-suite with a western flush toilet and a (cold) shower. Room is also pretty spacious and has a good roof fan. Light breakfast included in price.

name: Mechanic
description: small side of the road mechanic with basic tools and ability to patch up our landrover. just down the road from the fuel station (if fuel station on left continue 300m and mechanic is on the right)

name: Aslam Tandoori Chicken
description: small, informal restaurant which serves amazing grilled chicken - choose between (or have a mix of) zanzibar spice, tandoori spice or lemon. chicken comes with shredded salad, chips or naan. home made pili pili and tamarind sauce. you need to eat w your fingers! next door is a shop where you can get a beer or drink. seems to popular in town w local expat types.

name: Wild camp
description: Just behind 2 small hills you are sort of out of sight, several locals passing with their cattle but a smile and a wave and everything is okay.

name: Mabata Makali Lodge and Campsite
description: Seasonal lodge with camping. Still a bit under construction at this time but cold showers and flush loos plus pool onsite. Fire pit with seats, shade at campsite from Banda. Camping $15pppn without breakfast and $20pppn with breakfast. Kids were free. Close to Ruaha gate (40min) on the ‘never ending road’ which is the right hand fork road. Road condition good. Heard lions and hyenas in night. Reasonable value given location.

name: Bush camp
description: Many places to choose on this crazy long dirt road in between villages, it took 4.5 hrs from Mbeya to get here. No villagers around, you can hear some people in the distance but otherwise peace and quiet

name: Chipsi and eggs
description: The usual roadside stuff in a village after long drives.

name: Filling station
description: With the fancy name of the ‘society of the precious blood’ filling station petrol and diesel are available.

name: Local honey
description: Along this stretch you will find lots of honey for sale.

name: Wild Camping
description: Lots of space in between the boulders with views for days! Just watch the gullies and maneuver yourself out of the wind. I said hello and asked if it was okay to sleep here at the closest house which you pass and they say ‘hakuna matata’.

name: Sammi Hotel
description:
New hotel.  Clean and well finished (by local standards).  Secure yard took our camper, but we took a room.  Doubles offered at 35 - 45 k TZS.  A bit noisy in the morning with cleaning etc. 

Small restaurant and bar adjacent.  Restaurant service not great.  The food they gave us was fine - just not what we ordered !2 from 4 choices correct.

Users report Anti LGBTQ policy here. No Same sex sharing of rooms.

name: Supermarket
description: Dry goods, alcohol, cookies and toiletries etc, for fresh things the street has enough options although they overcharge mzungus so negotiate.

name: Tyre repairs and mechanic
description: Small shop for tyre mending and small repairs, one of my spring blades broke and they clamped it so I could keep going

name: Tarangire National Park Main Gate
description: The place to pay and enter the park and your 24hrs start counting... 135 USD for a solo man with his car...its busy, very busy with all the safari companies but thats to be expected.

name: Forestry clearing off road to Benedictine Mission
description: huge flat area. no close houses. had a pre subset visit from a local on a motorcycle filling sandbags, else all good! *nothing* else in the area.

name: old gravel pit
description: very well hidden from the road - huge area. 4x4 needed as gravel dumped on access road, quite deep and loose.

name: Samwange Beach campsite
description: Lovely spot by the beach, found it on Tracks4Africa. Big baobob trees, right on the beach. Owner speaks little English, but enough to deal with us. lots of local kids, typical "muzungu show" but he shooed them off once we were ready to eat. Best to avoid the toilet (western, just not very well plumbed in...). 20,000 for a family of 4, good value we think. Hard to buy beers in this part of Tanzania, convenient shabeen just up the road (2000 per Kilimanjaro/Safari).

name: African Galleria
description:
Large selection of African artwork and souvenirs for sale, including a good selection of Tanzanite jewelry. They will negotiate on price. Also has a cafe, which serves excellent pizza (the best we've had in Tanzania!).
They were extremely helpful when we broke down in their carpark, finding a mechanic and helping us source parts.

name: Allyen - bad fuel!
description: Don’t fill up here! The dirty petrol completely clogged up our filter, got stuck 100km after a full tank. Had to clean the filter to get the car back alive.

name: Sokoku market
description: This semi covered and street market has big varieties of fabric, fruit, toys and any things you can wish for. Great for Maasai blankets and kitenge fabrics at wholesale prices.

name: Warsame Guesthouse
description: Really nice place in the quiet part of town. Paid 12,000 TZS for a room with double bed and ensuite, stayed 3 nights. Clean and comfortable, with a very nice relaxed atmosphere. Western toilet, cold shower available, or a hot bucket shower on request. The owner is lovely, speaks perfect English and went out of his way to help. The restaurant also does good food. This is a new place, only opened a few weeks ago. WiFi should be up and running in a few days.

name: Good morning lodge
description: Really lovely guesthouse. 30000 for private air conditioned room and good breakfast. Good WiFi. Friendly staff

name: Mount Kilimanjaro Lodge
description: Basic hotel: double bed, mosquito net, bucket shower (but running water available), clean. Like a lot of places in Africa, this hotel has seen better days and like everywhere it lacks maintenance. However, it is clean, the rooms are a good size with room for your bike (or in the courtyard) and the lady is nice. 10,000tsh.

name: Cliff over Lake Victoria
description: Large, grassy hills between an abandoned hotel and the bishop's house. Absolut calm. View over the lake from cliffs. Plenty of flat place. 15 min from town center of Bukoba. Access road needs a 4x4 on 300 m. A few children passing by and a motorized couple enjoying sunset.

name: Quarry with a veiw on B8 150km south of Kigoma
description: Big Quarry with lots of even space. Great veiw over valley.  Nobody around and very little traffic noise.

name: Khalfan mini market Kigoma
description: Best of the small grocery shops. Stocks muesli, tinned cream and some European sauces as well as South African products.

name: Traveller's cafe
description: A bit hide but a nice cafe with beach views cheaper than the places around (coffee 3000, beers 5000) they offer food too.

name: Fuku Fuku Camp site
description: Lovely clean, well organised camp site very close to Ndabaka gate - Serengeti.  Good, clean ablutions.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Richard, the owner, is fantastic and also helped us repair our landrover.  Also an experienced guide who offers day trips into the Serengeti.  Highly recommend.

name: Kibo Coffee Roasters
description:
Fantastic place run by Stanley, roast locally produced Kilimanjaro coffee in front of you, and will prepare some coffee to share. Good, fair pricing and good packaging for travel. Amazing coffee!!

Stanley: +255 746 403 316 WhatsApp

name: Neel auto works- iringa
description: A good workshop with an inspection pit.. spares are available around. Maybe a bit more expensive than other side of the road places but secure and worth it. Owner is Rajesh.

name: Bahari Pori Beach Resort
description: Amazing little eco-lodge right on the beach. We camped between the cottages and were treated like all the other guests. The lodge is run by Francesco, a really nice Italian guy. Staff is local and very friendly. Food is very good, they serve seafood aswell as pizza. They offer free tours through the mangroves and onto the reef. Camping is 8 usd pppn. Food is between 5 and 8 usd for a main course. They have a swimming pool. We stayed for a very relaxing 4 nights. One of the best places we visited so far!

name: Rainbow Hotel
description: Basic hotel near ferry. Private double for $65 USD a night (cheaper online). Clean, fast wifi, 24hr reception which is great if you’re arriving late by bus or train.

name: Furaha Lodge
description: Quiet, super tidy & clean, really frienfly hosts. A bit outside of town, but worth the trip for a good nights sleep. Delicious food! Don‘t know the standard price, but got an offer for EUR23.- on Booking.com.

name: Chato Beach Resort
description: Nice Hotel at very reasonable price opened 2017

name: Hotel Tilapia Restaurant Mwanza.
description: Great Restaurant right next to Yacht club. Great Indian dishes. Main 22000 Tsh.  Service was good. Great veiw on the lake.

name: Sukuma Open air museum and Camp site
description: Open air museum that also offers camping and bandas for hire. Clean crouch toilet and cold showers. Small canteen and  you can order traditional meals. 15000 Tsh pppn. There was church services going on a Sunday morning so it was noisy from early on. At night it was nice with the sound of the village nearby.

name: Rubya forest campsite on Ukerewe island
description:
Brand new and still developing picnic area and campsite. Beautiful beach facing west into the setting sun. Basic but clean crouch toilet no showers.
5 bandas with benches on the beach. One big banda away from beach. Very quite and peaceful. One security guard that will call someone that can speak English. This was the only campsite on the island. They charged us 10$ per person. You have to pay at the office that is a few kilometers away. You need to be self sufficient if you come here.

name: Copenhagen Burger House, Mwanza
description: Clean and basic burger joint. Serves burgers, pizza and pasta. 13000Tsh for a burger chips and soda. No booze sold. Service was fast and friendly. Burger was decent fresh bun and  salads.

name: White Parrot Hotel
description: Safe camping area next to the Hotel. Basic but sufficient for overnight. Safe. Basin with running water available outside the ablutions. Ts12 000 pp or 6USD pp. A hotel room was made available for us for a hot shower. The Hotel, petrol station, restaurant and mini supermarket are all on the same premises. The Hotel rooms are Tz 50 000 for a double room and Tz 40 000 for a single.

name: Seashells Millennium Hotel
description: Nice 4 star hotel with pool, bar, restuarant and close to the CBD. 80 USD for a room per night on our stay. Nice and friendly staff and the hotel arranged a city tour of Dar Es Salaam for us.  The hotel has no camping facility but secure guarded parking for normal 4x4 vehicles. Bigger than 3500kg will not be able to park.

name: Hardware / Household Goods (Game Store)
description: Game store for equipment / hardware + food.

name: TS Lodge
description: Informal Lodge with secure parking and bar area. The behind the fence, locked gate parking, on paved floor, is just big enough for our 7meter overlander to fit. 15000 tsh to camp for two and use their ablutions (squad toilet and bucket wash) Very clean and tidy. We didn't use the rooms but they have 7 rooms, clean and tidy with a tv screen and en-suite bathroom with squat toilet. Mosquito net and fan. Some visitors at the bar but everyone was gone by 9pm. This was on a Monday. Had a drink with some locals. All very welcoming.

name: Tanzanice Farm
description: Farm-Hotel with great accommodation. Lovely common area with fireplace and very clean rooms. The staff is super friendly. Around five minutes drive from to Karatu town.

name: IDC Hotel
description: Really small place, very tidy, a bit outside of town. Basic breakfast, pool, cold showers (not ensuite). Hospitable hosts. Quite enjoyed my stay. 17EUR pppn in 4 person dorm. Not cheap but ok.

name: Perugina Hotel
description:
Hotel close to Arusha road. Clean rooms with hot and cold water. Electricity all night. 25 000 Tzs for a double room with a slightly narrow but comfortable bed, 35k for a broader. Breakfast included but no other meals available. Bar serving, among others, Bulimi beer. Strong and tasty but do not drive after one of those!
A fairly good place for a one night stop.

name: FAME Hospital
description:
Very nicely run hospital, founded by two Americans.
Some European doctors on site. CT Scanner and a very good Laboratory.
24h service

name: J. Banobi Mini Supermarket
description: Small but good sortiment & tidy shop. Found Everything I needed.

name: Cheyo Hotel
description: Nice Hotel with good restaurant. Rooms for two start with 30.000. good services and safe parking. wifi is excellent. No place for Camping.

name: Mwanga Campsite and Lodge
description:
A place that doesn't appear in booking but you can find in Google Maps. Campsite and rooms available. We are traveling by bike and we couldnt find any place to stay, fortunately we found this place.
Campsite is big and the are space with roof for cooking. For campsite there's no hot water for shower but we asked to if it is possible a hot water shower in the rooms and the say yes. 
The owner (woman) wants 20$ for one tent but we got it for 10$. If you try for less price, probably you could. 
A hole family woks here, they are very friendly, we share the same table for dinner.

name: Devon Guest House
description: cheap very clean place behind daladala station from 8.000 to 10.000

name: Lake Hotel
description:
They allowed us to camp for 20 000Tsh for 2 people. Large grass area with a few plug-in points. Fenced and have security. Squat toilet and cold shower. Surprisingly quiet at night. Don't know about weekends. 

March 2021: Very unfriendly reception. Price new 30,000. Is more than one room!
Really not to be recommended.

name: Morena Hotel
description:
Very clean and secure place. For Tanzanian Standard an upperclass Hotel.
Good for a stopover.
Double room with aircon and clean bathroom 85 Dollars.

name: Kimwaga Motorworks
description:
Very good and large workshop for all sorts of vehicles. General Dealer of Nissan and Mercedes but does Toyota and Landrover to. In my opinion the place to go if you have some problems.
Fixed our Landys Ignition in around two hours.

name: Nzega Forest Inn Motel
description:
Nice place, great atmosphere. Room with aircon/shower/tv-room 30.000 Tsh. Lively and nice bar/restaurant (which you don’t hear in rooms). Good food, very friendly people. Car parked securely, guards on duty at night.

Probably best place to stay in Nzega (after checking other locations on iOverlander).

name: Sanga Sanga Retreat Centre - Mountain View Campsite
description: Good one-night-stop for 10 000pp. Nothing spectacular, but good enough if you need a decent place to sleep over. Clean ablution block with warm water if they turn geaser on. Electricity available and tables. Ask for Johanna who is very helpful and speaks good English. You can also sleep in guesthouse for 25 000pp.

name: Puma gas station & ATM
description: Puma gas station with a CRDB ATM and clean toilets.

name: Hippo bridge
description: Lots of hippos around the T9 bridge over the Katuma River (just before village of Sitalike). Also saw storks and kingfisher. Great wildlife viewing spot (and free).

name: Forest Bush camp
description: A clearing in the forest. Visible from road but light traffic and no one stopped.

name: Rungwa national park HQ
description: We crossed Rungwa coming from ruaha. They let us camp at their HQ for free. Water and toilets available. Very welcoming and friendly atmosphere !

name: Paji’s Bar and restaurant (at Sikh Union Club)
description:
A really good Indian restaurant. It overlooks the local Sikh club’s hockey pitch and serves excellent food quickly. I’m a huge curry fan being from Birmingham, UK and this is the only place on Africa that I’ve found comparable to westernised Indian food I find at home. 

Try the crispy potato bahji with a papadum for starter for something new and delicious. Mutton Masala and Chicken Tandoori both excellent. We got to watch some hockey too.

name: Roadside bush camp
description: We passed a quiet night in our RTT on this small dirt track along the main road behind some trees. In view of the road a bit but light traffic and no one stopped. Good for a night.

name: Kakonko gas station
description: Fuel station, petrol & diesel,  just south of Kakonko. Cash only.

name: Kibondo fuel station
description: Fuel station, petrol & diesel, just north of Kibondo. Cash only.

name: Tongoni Ruines
description:
Seldom visited - according to the guestbook - Swahili ruins. Not as scenic as Gedi in Kenya but interesting to see. The keeper gave a good informative tour of the place and its surroundings.

Entrance fee is 10.000 Tzs.

Take the turn off at the rusty sign and take a left, this will lead you to the ruins.

name: Southern Corridor
description: Just 10km from Kenyan border. Basic large rooms with on suite bathroom. There is a bath, but only the shower works, cold water. Our car broke down and Leonard, the owner, were extremely helpful and friendly. They made us a basic supper very late and assisted with the our car. We paid 1500 KS for the room.

name: Quarry next to road on B6
description: Working quarry next to B6 towards Mbeya. They are busy tarring the road and quarry is next to it on hill. They did not store their yellow goods here. Nice and quiet - we drove to the back of the quarry. Still a working quarry. So sit it out for 30min to see if someone approaches. We arrived late in the afternoon at 6 and no one approached us.

name: Aqua Lodge
description: Great place at a very nice beach. Rooms all at the beachfront are modern, clean and perfect for relaxing after some hard driving days. Staff is really friendly and give you a warm welcome at the Lake Tanganjika. Double Room is 50 000 TZS / Room breakfast included. Restaurant is good but a little bit pricy. There are different small local places around the corner. City centre is 10 Min. by foot. Safe Car parking. Place is a hotspot.

name: Wonder / Chuma Art workshop
description: Wonder workshop - where people with disabilities recycle stuff into art - went out of business. They moved into a new building with a new name, but the same people and concept. Only open on weekdays.

name: Barcelona Lodge
description:
Clean and comfortable hotel. 40000 tzn per night (more if you book via booking.com). Private rooms with ensuite, wifi, hot water, mosquito net, TV, AC, breakfast included. Amazing staff, secure gated parking with guard. 

We left our motorcycle there for a week to go to Zanzibar with no issues. Stayed here twice!

name: Soni Tuesday market
description:
Great local market! Only here on Tuesday and it’s mentioned in the Lonely Planet. We saw no tourists and the locals were not used to visiting mzungu’s. Nice experience allround :)

Fruit and veggies, fabrics, some wooden items, slingshots, and some chinese stuff for sale.

No entrance fees, and its best to park you car at the main road.

name: Pottery place
description:
This is the rough location for the community pottery business. 

Every item is 4000 tsh. 2000 goes to a general fund for all women, the other 2000 goes to the maker of the item you buy. 

They have animal figures, cups, plates, bowls, etc. Some smaller items are also for sale at mambo view point lodge. 

We walked here as part of a guided hike but you can probably visit by yourself. Not too early in the morning though - they hadn’t really opened yet when we got there around 11. 

Not sure if you can drive all the way up by car.

name: Lake Duluti Sports Club
description: This place is kind of a bar / restaurant with some rooms and a campground to stay with cars or tents. It’s 10 USD pp. It’s situated directly at Lake Duluti at a nice place under trees. The nights are silent. Maybe at weekend there is a little partytime. Hot showers working well and are clean. If you want they cook for you. Food was good. A little bit basic, but clean and friendly staff. You can go for a walk round the lake. Beside them is the Duluti Forest Club. We didn’t visit the forest club but it seems you can even  stay there with your car.

name: Mambo Magumba Lodge
description: Lodge and campsite with incredible view of the surrounding valley and hills of Usambara. On a clear day a view of Kili. Lodge rooms are spacious and clean. Warm blankets, hot shower and western toilet. Campsites on terraced land along the hill with beautiful view.  Short laneway to main road. Good food. Tv in lounge. Fireplace at night. New deck with seating at prime viewpoint and lots of other benches around the property.

name: Mudy Mechanic
description:
Mudy is the local mechanic in Sikonge and he helped us when we broke down in this very remote area. No proper workshop or great facilities but he can do a bush fix to keep you going. The road from here to Mpanda is very bad and there are no other people out there who can help.
0684234111
0757349806

name: Maji Moto spring campsite
description:
The spring is fenced and within the fence there’s a small campsite under the trees and next to the spring. There’s room for a couple of tents and one 4x4/van. Very quiet at night, but lots of people around during the day.

Camping fee is 15.000pp and the guard will cost 20.000 per party. For entrance you pay 10.000pp, if you’re camping you can swim both days. They were willing to negotiate and lower the total price.

There’s a building with showers and longdrop toilets. Cleaned daily. Some food and drinks available.

name: Enduimet Wildlife Area - entrance gate
description:
This park in the Amboseli ecosystem is locally run by the Maasai people and borders Amboseli park in Kenya. 

It’s a nice and very dusty park to drive around. We saw quite a lot of wildlife - elephants, and the usual animals - no big cats. Most of the sightings are found right on the Kenyan border, be careful and don’t cross the border! Roads are decent. No other tourists. You’ll pass several Masai villages, boma’s and watertaps. And there are great views on Kili, Meru and Longido.

This gpspoint is the entrance gate Elerai and you pay the fees here:
10 usd pp entrance fee
10 usd for a foreign car up to 2000kg (every 1000 kg is another 10 usd)
20 usd pp for camping
+ 18% vat!

Usually people visit with a pre-arranged permit, but the rangers said it was no problem we didn’t have one.

name: Chui campsite
description: Chui campsite, located in NP. 20 usd per person including the guard and firewood. Decent toilets and showers. Good Kili and Meru views. The guard did an informal walking safari with us in the morning because there were elephants around the camp, we gave him a tip for it.

name: Lookout hill
description: Amazing views into the Amboseli plains, Mt Meru, Kilimanjaro and more. Great place for breakfast and spotting elephants!

name: @TheWheel
description: Wheel alignment, balancing, batteries, shocks etc. Very professional team. Great service. All machinery is new and workshop is very clean.

name: Mac/Ali's garage
description:
Ali is the owner of the garage. A generous man, perfectly fluent in English. 
They fixed our Land Rover for a reasonable price. Very professional, they know Land Rover and Land Cruiser by heart.

name: Zanzibar guest house
description:
Room was basic but clean, secure parking, hot shower, squatter toilet, friendly enough staff.  Rather noisy though, could hear the neighbour blaring their tv till very late at night. 20,000 for double en-suite room
12,000 for double with shared bathroom.

name: Gupkha Autoparts
description:
Massive warehouse that sells autoparts for Land Rover, Toyota and more. If you need a part, try this place first.

Bought an exhaust and door hinge here for my Defender. Prices - for Britpart stuff - were cheaper than Netherlands and just 10-15% more than Paddock Spares in UK.

name: Emerald
description: Hotel or guesthouse near Kunduchi in Dar es Salaam. Nearby some other, not so cheap hotels. We used it for some days. Everything clean, friendly manager, good rooms and showers. Yo can use the kitchen for free. Price was 40000TSH for the double bedroom. Maybe it is a little bit more if you stay just one day. The have protected parking in the garden. The next restaurant you find seconds nearby.

name: Dear Mama hotel
description: Good budget hotel $ 13 per room and breakfast. Sometimes water does not flow. Good cheap food. Parking in the area. The hotel is 100m from the main road. Not all rooms have air conditioning. There is only a ventilator somewhere. Wifi only in the restaurant. But in Tanzania is cheap mobile internet :-)

name: B6-direction Manyoni
description: Bad road, 4x4,400 km .20-30 km / h, wavy surface, broken rear shock absorbers.

name: Kicheko Bungalow
description:
Affordable bungalows off the main stretch in Nungwi. The property is a lovely garden, in a quiet area, 5 minutes walking to main beach/resorts/restaurants. 

The reception was helpful; we negotiated the price to $45 /night (for 2 people) with breakfast included (tea/coffee, selection of fruit, local pastry & choice of pancakes or eggs).

name: Rufiji River Delta
description: Off the dirt road used by motorbikes. Hidden from the road. didn’t see a single person.

name: Community fee
description:
You have to pay 20 USD per car to the community, even if you only sleep at a campsite. There’s no gate, just a building next to the road where you‘re supposed to register and pay.

If you want to visit the tribes, this is where you can arrange guides.

name: Mara river guided walk
description: Go on a short walking Safari with ranger for a small fee. Learn about hippos, crocs and the wildebeest crossing. Lots of parking. Basic hole toilets.

name: Burundi consulate
description:
(the Burundese embassy to Tanzania is located in Dar es Salaam)

Burundi visa. 
When we arrived the lady told us two weeks waiting time, however when we told her our friend did it in one day, she went to see the ‘boss’ and he then said it’s was possible. 
We waited about 1.5 hours because there were a number of people in front of us. But the actual process took only 15 mins. 
We paid $90 each for the visa. 
You need to take with you a passport photo and then fill out a form, then you get the stamp and are good to go.

name: Baba Lishe
description:
Very local place! Don’t expect anything fancy in terms of seating etc but the food is fresh and tasty with reasonable prices. Chef Dao and his team do a fantastic job.

Beef (large portion), bean pilau with mchicha & salad plus 3 beers cost 25000tzs

name: KCB ATM
description: KCB No chargers ATM - withdrew 400,000TSH

name: the top of Mbeya!
description: 8,900 feet elevation. the last ascent is pretty rutted and gnarly for heavy bikes if you're not experienced. if you make it up, the views are awesome! 360 degree view of the city and surrounding plateau!

name: The Coffee Shop
description:
Nice little coffee shop in the same plaza as the gas station. Decent menu of coffees, juices, smoothies and icecream.

They claim to have WiFi but it's down today. Outlets at most sitting areas and plenty of room to do some work

name: Mt Rungwe Forest Park
description:
Parking area for hikes on Mt Rungwe. A park office is under construction but not open yet so must get hiking permit at office in Tukuyu. Guide (required for all hikes) can arrange permit and lead you through the maze of small roads to the parking area. Local hotels/ campgrounds can arrange local guides. We had a great day with Donald, very knowledgeable and friendly. We paid about $20 for 2 people +$10pp park entry fee for an all-day hike to the peak. Nice hike through the native forest (saw two species of monkeys) and nice view from the peak. 

Highly recommend Donald:  
+25507283361
ipyanadon@gmail.com

name: Ngosi Crater Lake
description: Parking area for 7km return hike to crater lake. Nice hike (steep at times) through beautiful thick forest (we saw monkeys) to viewpoint over the stunning, large craker lake. Likely supposed to pay an entry fee but no one around.

name: Peace Mountain Lodge
description:
I try to refrain from these type of reviews... but... place is a dump. showers are cold.  owner will not reimburse any cost. bathroom floods.. spills into room.
I could go on. just go somewhere else...

name: House of West Kili
description: $80 us, very nice free WiFi nice garden friendly

name: Ngosi crater lake - official trek start point
description:
This is the official starting point for trekking to the Ngosi crater lake view point. There’s an official board with entry prices - US$10 for foreigners, 2,000 shillings for East African citizens. It’s a 2.5km walk to the viewpoint and another 2.5km walk back to your car. It is really spectacular! The crater lake is surrounded by forest and completely untouched. At the lake viewpoint there are several picnic benches.

There’s an official at the starting point wearing a full length green uniform who you pay the money to. He wasn’t able to give a receipt but it was clear he was legitimate. He can also guide you to the viewpoint if you like and give you the history of the lake. He accompanied us and we tipped him 10,000 shillings. Really nice guy called diamond.

It is also possible to camp at the trek starting point but there isn’t a view of the lake.

To get here - the turning point is just south of Mbeya (think it’s called Uyole - will mark it on ioverlander too). Basically you approach the lake from the North East.

name: Ngosi Crater Lake
description: This is the turning to the 4x4 dirt road to the Ngosi Crater Lake. You pass a little village with shops then keep left and you’ll see a board with Ngosi Crater Lake on it and an arrow pointing left. Take that left and follow the path up the mountains. Had to use 4x4 at times.

name: That Park Place West Kili
description: 30000 single/50000 dbl, nice garden, great value

name: The Ridge Cafe
description: Nice clean coffee joint with wifi. no parking for vehicle but I parked my Moto on the sidewalk out front.

name: Kuleana pizzeria
description: Vegetarian pizzeria. Very delicious highly recommended around town. It’s so nice to get some good vego food after so much meat.

name: colobus monkey visitor centre
description: visitor centre for the jozani national park

name: butterfly centre
description: butterfly centre USD6pp, children usd3pp

name: AIM mall
description: supermarket with imports. lots of shops and atms

name: Sleep Way Hotel
description: Looks like relatively new construction, everything is clean and fresh. Ensuite double room with comfortable bed, squat toilet, cold shower and sexy blue/green lighting for 20,000 Tsh.  Good local food in the restaurant for good prices. Plenty of secure parking, though big rigs probably won't fit through the gate. The staff doesn't speak much English, but everyone is very friendly, and we were easily able to sort things out. Overall, a nice place and good value, especially considering it is in the middle of nowhere.

name: Warsame Coffee Lounge & Restaurant
description: A lovely little coffee lounge and restaurant. Mains are around 7,000 - 9,000 shillings. Coffee and avocado smoothie (delicious) are 3,500 shillings each.

name: Flip Burger
description:
The best burgers in town for only 6000 tsh !! Great people and service.
Small place with tables outside covered on a parking lot in front of Ngorongoro investment house, at the elephant roundabout. A must do in Arusha :)

name: Slow Leopard
description: Nice hostel located in a nice part of town. Dorms start at US$18pppn and private rooms from US$50pn per room. Really nice outdoor garden area and cafe/bar which will be showing all games of the Rugby World Cup. They serve really great coffee! A few parking spots available out the front but these aren’t behind a fence. Great vibe and cool owners!

name: Mcelly's hotel
description: Great place to stay in town with a secure parking to leave your car just next to the reception. A double bed room is 35$ including breakfast. Comfortable bed, hot shower, friendly staff and the manager will do everything he can to make sure your are enjoying your stay. 10 minutes walk to the Masaï market and 10 minutes walk to the best burger in town at Flip's burger (Elephant's roundabout)

name: Green Farm Friends
description: clean, safe. gated parking. Jerome the owner is super nice and a local guide in the area. 55,000tsh a night for an apartment.

name: Leaders Lodge
description:
Not too far from the beach, this beautiful lodge has more than 20 rooms differing in size and price starting from 20.000tzs-50.000tzs.  All very spacious, with bathroom ensuite. Breakfast is included plus free coffee in the morning and in the evenings.
The owner is super nice, he will show you around town, give you the best tips and make your stay one remember. He can also organize trips to Gombe NP.
The restaurant serves cheap and tasty pizza and other local dishes.
"A home away from home" is their motto and it's a real Tanzanian Karibu.
You can message/WhatsApp for any info at +255687331343.

name: Kungwe bay, (Mgondozi) beach wild camping
description: We overnight 100m from this coordinates on the beach. We were visible from the street but nobody bothered us. Some truck traffic during the night.

name: Materuni waterfall 96m high.
description:
Lovely walk though the village and small holding coffee/banana plantations. 

10,000tsh pp / guides available

name: Old road to Mpanda
description: Do not take this road. It is apparently the old road to Mpanda. It is a track, rocky, steep and have small bridges. We only got 15km before we had to turn around.

name: Moona’s Pharmacy
description: Decent pharmacy that sells bilharzia medication and other medicines. Cost us 6,000 shillings to buy bilharzia medication for two of us (dosage depends on your weight so will vary). They accept airtel mobile payment or cash. Very professional staff. They also sell malaria test kits - 2 for 22,500 shillings and more than 12 months expiry date.

name: Indoitaliano Restaurant
description: Fantastic Indian and Italian food. More expensive than local food but worth it for a change of flavors.

name: Rock City Hotel
description: New hotel in Masasi. Room for 40.000. Suite 60.000.  Clean. Friendly staff. Some English spoken. Nearby the rocks. Bar and Restaurant area with music. Try to get a room to the other side.

name: Kayla
description: Diesel, petrol with receipt. Looks new. Toilet is there as well.

name: Grassy Area
description:
Alter a short access (maybe 200 m, driveable for every kind of car), you come to a big grassy area with flat ground.
in the afternoon one or two massai passed ,but did not disturb.
you hear the traffic of the main road, but not too loud.

name: Motel Silver
description:
I found this place by accident and I'm glad I did. Cheaper than the other options in town at 20,000TSH. 
Clean facilities, comfortable mattresses, safe parking.
The in-room bathrooms are... to be expected of a $10 a night hotel but really not bad.
No frills place but safe and clean spot to rest.

name: Local guesthouse
description:
Guesthouse about to be finished, the manager told me they should offically open in the coming months. Only small works outside of the building remain. Still 
I could stay there as the rooms and ablutions are finished. 25,000 TZS for a self-contained fairly big room, clean,  with hot water and flushing toilets. TV set, fan, and mosquito net. Bar restaurant on site. What more would you ask for!?

name: Msembe Ruaha Park bandas
description: The Bandas have been recently renovated and now have attached flush western toilet and cold shower. Good beds (single) and nets. Metal huts but thatch roof and insulated walls (vinyl cushions?) so don't get too hot if you get one under a tree. Nice river views with plenty of animal visitors. Central kitchen a bit grim but reasonable meals at cottage restaurant (4km away) or park HQ (500m) $30+ tax p.p. Same price as camping. We were expecting them to be grotty but were so pleasantly surprised we extended our stay

name: wifi
description:
the hotel is already tagged so I created a new post for the hotel owned bar next door.

this is the fastest wifi I've had since the USA. 

(the beer is cold too)

not a bad place to get some work done

name: Faraja Inn Hotel
description: Basic rooms with secure parking. 10 000 Tsh, 15 000 Tsh and 20 000 Tsh for rooms for 2 people. All the same facilities except some rooms are bigger. All cold water and squad toilet, basic with mosquito nets and tv, but looks clean. The man welcoming us could not understand English but asked us to wait while he called the Manager Deo who was very friendly. The concept of "sleeping in your car" is a foreign concept and after negotiations we parked for 10 000 Tsh and washed in their outside facilities which is the same as in the room. We met the owner later, a doctor and explained there are a need for overlanders to park somewhere safe and I will promote his place on IOverlander. He was very grateful and friendly. I must mention it was hard to find a place without arched gates where our truck could fit through, and we just made it through this gate.

name: Mountain’s Hug
description:
This is a newly opened campsite, so it is still under construction. There is a large grassy area to camp on; nestled between Mount Kilimanjaro and Mt. Meru and very near to Momela Gate of Arusha National Park. Stunning!

At the moment there are limited facilities: there is a western toilet/sink for the bathroom, power points to charge phone/laptop, a water tap, a sheltered boma area and a kitchen that can be used on request. Firewood is provided.

Godfrey is the owner and is working on building the place up; he can be reached at +255 769 537 945.

Feel free to contact him, he is lovely! Price per night is negotiable at the time of writing.

name: Elegante Supermarket
description: We found it better then Ndyo Supermarket. More variety. This shop also display prices. Only cash. Situated on the same premises as the fuel station. Big parking space.

name: Tukuyu Hill View
description: Quiet hotel just outside of town with nice surroundings. Large parking lot, clean rooms, sitting toilet and restaurant with local food. There was no running water but the lady provided us some nice buckets with warm water. We paid 30.000 tsh for a large room, ex breakfast. Small room is 15.000 tsh.

name: Malamba Falls
description: Beautiful waterfall, barely visited. About 20km from the main road. You have to pay $10 pp for park fee. The best is to go here with a guide because it is not easy to find.

name: Browmar Hotel
description: On the main road near the turn off to Malawi. Newish, very clean hotel with gated/guarded parking. Rooms start at 35000 Tsh breakfast included, prices seem to be negotiable. There is a restaurant but plenty of street food nearby. No wifi.

name: Lyamba Village Hotel
description:
Nice and quiet hotel.
 30.000 TSH  room incl. breakfast and 40.000 TSH room with A/C incl. breakfast. 
Clean rooms with fan and net. Good shower with hot water.
The restaurant serves good food.

name: Bariadi petrol station
description: a few brand new petrol stations on this new good tarred road. Tarred road from Musoma stop here at this date (oct 2019), rest under construction.

name: maji moto hazda encampment
description: It seems to be the place were guides bring tourists to visit the Hazda hunter-gatherers. The place, a boulders moutain surrounded by hot springs, facing the Eyasi escarpment is wonderful. The group of Hazda living there is not supposed to welcome tourists who have not checked in with the tourism office ahead. They only speak kiswahili. After negotiation they allowed us to stay here for the night for 100 000 tzs. We finally paid 60 000 for the night (considering it included the "cultural encounter" we would have paid for from the village) and gave them some food, clothes and utensils (they really have nothing). During dinner the 2 men came to our car and we had a chat and we shared some food again. For breakfast they were 6. They were nice and friendly but kept asking for food and money. We can't recommend this place to non-swahili speakers or people not ready to share their food. I am also not sure of long term consequences of this kind of arrangement if the tourism office knows about it.The Hazda people living here in their hut "behind the scene" are just extremely poor and I don't know what they get from the tourism activity managed from the nearby village.

name: Mystic India
description: Fabulous Indian food!! In a very nice area, the restaurant is very nice and clean. We met Anup the owner who is a funny and generous person. The sfaff is attentive and always smiling. A very welcoming place. We stayed 3 days in Dar Es Salam and ate at this place every day. It is open every day from 11am to 11pm. I recommend this place 100% ! You can contact one of the manager : +255787647077. You can also order and get food deliver with Jumia Food app.

name: Dagnec Lodge  B&B
description: small hotel with breakfast. payed 30.000TSH for room for two per night. Clean. Save parking place for  motorbikes / two cars. near by Shopprite, local market and laundry. Only minus: there is all day and night a pips/alarm/noise from the security camera... all 3 minutes it rings... there should be wifi, but it didn't work.

name: Bush camp
description: Bush camp in a wide dry wash on the dirt road between Ketumbeine and the road to Lake Natron. Hard ground so can drive further away from the road. We saw a large group of giraffes here. No people or domestic animals around.

name: Bush camp
description: We passed a quiet night here in our RTT. It's a large, flat area with plenty of options to camp between the trees and bushes. We were a bit in sight of the road but there's very little traffic and no one stopped. Lots of mosquitos.

name: Selena Pub
description: Nice local place for a lunch break. They have rice, chips, chicken, pork, vegatables and cold drinks.

name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area Authority
description: Office for Ngorongoro Conservation Area. Went here to get a list of all updated prices; should also be able to purchase permits here.

name: Zanzibar pizza
description: Great place for cheap local food. Amazing Zanzibar pizza for only KES1000

name: Stan home Hostel
description:
Cool place to stay, really clean and friendly staff. Space to park one car in front of the hostel (secure parking). We slept in our car and payed 5000 TZS pp.pn. 

6$ for a dorm
9$ for a private room 
with breakfest.

name: Take it Easy
description: Perfect place to stay in Paje ! We had an 30m2 appartment with HUGE and comfy bed, kitchen and nice bathroom. Eveything was very clean and well decorated. Perfect location, less than 10 min walk to the beach and 5 min walk to the village. Very quiet. Nice roof top to take breakfast or a drink. The wifi is very good even in the room. We paid 25 dollars per night for two people. We booked on booking.com. Marco the owner was very helpful.

name: Kapenja Guesthouse
description: Guesthouse 2km far from the border with Malawi. Self contained rooms for 15k, 20k or 25k. No hot shower, mosquito net. Fresh drinks at the bar. No restaurant but food stands in the surroundings.

name: Autotech Car Care
description: Well set up car wash, work shop, wheel alignment and service center. They service a variety of cars and helped me within 2 hours after discussing the best way to replace my shocks. Tzs500.000 for 2 new rear Robs Magic shocks (Australia brand).

name: Quarry
description: Sheltered old quarry. Perfect wildcamp, close to the road but out of sight and out of most of the strong winds... quiet and no people around.

name: Leyagi Guesthouse
description:
Nice place to stay. Rooms for 7000 TZS available, there is a net over the bed and toilets / showers are outside.

Secure parking.

name: Lighthouse Guesthouse
description: Nice place in Paje ! Very clean and quiet. 1 min by walk to the beach. The breakfast is huge with plenty of fruits, eggs, pancakes, bread, jam, peanut butter, coffee. There is a kitchen to cook ourselves. 44 dollars two nights for two people for a double room with shower. wifi is up and down but its ok !

name: Moonlight lodge resort
description: Really good place to stay in means of stay and costs. We stayed in one of the double rooms for $40,-/night. The Guys over at the place are awesome.

name: Pizzeria amore
