description: Place to have really Nice meal not only pizza but lots more

name: Pamoja Cafe
description: Delicious food for cheap price ! Burger with chips 8000 tsh. Portions are big. Beers are cheaper during Happy Hours 2000 tsh. The terrace is nice, Bob Marley music, good atmosphere. We ate here two times while staying in Moshi. They have got very good reviews on TripAdvisor

name: Exuberant Kilimanjaro Safaris
description:
Being of Chagga ancestry, we are often asked by friends how best to travel in Kilimanjaro and where to visit. It came to our attention that there is a lack of online resources for the independent traveler and that many choose instead to join part of an organised tour or package holiday arranged by an international agent at unreasonable prices.
So this is our guide and travel planner for the independent traveler. It’s based on years of experience organizing adventure tours in the region, and of course putting together our own personal itineraries, which tourists rarely come across due to lack of local knowledge.

name: Darajani Daladala Bus Terminus
description: Place where you can get a daladala (minibus) to various places on the island. All the buses have route numbers. We went to Paje via the 504 to Mwanakwerekwe where we changed a another daladala directly to Paje (forgot the bus #). The trip took ~2 hours and cost 2500pp (400 1st bus , 2000 2nd bus). People were very helpful to ensure we took the correct buses. Great deal at ~$1pp!

name: KCB bank
description: ATM with no withdrawal fees. In a large shopping centre with fast food chains and other clothing shops.

name: Mwenga Craft Market
description:
Lots of little market stalls selling locals crafts, jewellery and wood work.
You can also go out the back to meet some of the local wood workers and see how they make the pieces. Can buy directly from the artists here.

name: Taj Mahal Restaurant and take away
description: Zanzibar pizza 1000 tsh and half chicken 7000 tsh. Big portions. Also rice beans. Everything s delicious ! We ate there many times

name: tire repair Mr Mleche
description: you might not believe but this guy  repairs (vulcanised) the huge cut in the sidewall of our tire very good.

name: Gangilonga Supermarket
description: Good place for staples, wine, liquor, cold beer (no empty bottles necessary). Pretty good selection. Nice owner who speaks English well.

name: Cinnamon
description: Best food we had in Zanzibar... everything was super delicious....

name: Songea Market
description: Huge market with stalls of fruit, veg, fish, nest, cooked foods, housewares, clothes, shoes, etc... Great place to explore.

name: OK Hotel 92
description: A basic, cheap hotel. We paid 20,000 for a large room with large double bed, mosquito net, strong ceiling fan, TV, and ensuite bathroom with shower and flush toilet. Dont know why but there was no running water so they brought us buckets for shower and flushing the toilet. Staff spoke very little English but were very nice and accommidating. Secure parking for 2-3 vehicles.

name: Kunta's place
description: Very relaxed small shop for drinks at the newly cleaned beachsite in Bukoba. After sunset most locals go home, no disco or music so very quiet. Kunta and his staff stay at the beach, play accoustic guitar sometimes, campfire... I ended up staying several nights. 10.000 tanzanian shillings to pitch your tent at the beach (per tent not per person). Local restaurant next door by Mama Samiraj (she used to be the cook for Kiroyera); chipsie mayai, rice, chicken, fish... Or use your own cooking gear at the beach. You can use the toilets at Kiroyera beach. When bridge is completed in jan 2020, rooftoptentcars can camp here as well. For now no problem passing by bicycle via beach. Ask for Kunta's place or see pics.

name: DTB Bank
description: Atm for visa or MasterCard and has no atm fees.

name: Apple Lodge
description:
20,000tsh for an en-suite double room.
Hot shower, really comfy bed, secured parking, fan and mozzie net. Squatter toilet but one of the cleanest I think we’ve seen. Great room for the price.

name: Shop #8
description: A small shop with a bit more variety than the others. Milk, juice, sodas, pasta, coffee, some canned items. I don't know the name of the shop but the address is 8.

name: Hekima House
description: Very nice and quiet place outside the noise of town ! We paid 15 dollars for two people for a double room. The rooms are big and very clean. The bed are so comfy. They have got also a dorm for 7 dollars. Dinner is 3 dollars and delicious ! Breakfast is included you have got omelette, bread, beignet, coffee, tea, peanut butter. You can use the kitchen. There is small shops near where you can buy veggies. Motorbike to town is 3000tsh. The staff is lovely. They have got their own Safari agency which is called Hekima Safari. We did not go with them but we heard very good reviews about them ! And when you book safari with them, meals are free. Wifi is quite good !!

name: Karatu Safari Camp
description:
Very nice and clean rooms with comfortable bed, net and toilet / shower for 40$ incl. a good breakfast.
10$ for dinner.
Agnes is a very warm person and the owner as well. 
Really good place to stay!

name: Kaprikon hotel
description: We were in the bus from Arusha to Mwanza but I was horribly sick. The bus made a stop here and we decided to drop off. A guy took us to this small hotel at walking distance to the bus station and it was a very good surprise. The name is not written but the walls are orange. We paid 10000 tsh for a big room with double bed and bathroom. Everything was clean. The bed was comfy. It's very quiet. We had hot water. I mean the price is very low for what we get ! You can eat for 3000 tsh at the restaurant next door rice, beans, chicken. Otherwise there is another restaurant on the place of the bus station. Bus station is one minute by walk which is a bit better. You can book ticket at the bus station for Mwanza, Arusha, Moshi and others.

name: Guest House
description: [Cycling around Africa] I was exhausted of all the Uphill since Rwanda. Had the pleasure of finding this very clean guest house. Payed 10.000 TZS for a very big room (where I could put my bicycle) with king size bed and washroom with cold buckets of water and pit hole. The manager is extremely nice and we had some great laughs while trying to understand each other. Very good street food restaurant just outside the place.

name: Corrupt Police speed trap
description: They sit with a camera in this area and catch you as you just before the end of zone but only stop you 10minutes further down the road with a picture on the officers phone. Attempt to obtain under table payments

name: New Savoy Hostel
description: okay place for night stop, nothing special. we payed 17k sh for a room, include breakfast for one. toliet and shower inside, but there wasn't runing water in the shower. there is resturant and lots of place to park.

name: AR Lodge
description: Clean and basic lodge 230km from Songea on the T6. We got a room for 20000 Tsh and slept in the secure parking bay in our Rooftop tent. Cold shower and crouch toilet but very clean. Place looks brand new. Not sure if a big rig can fit in the entrance.

name: Vodacom Shop (internet sim cards)
description: Vodacom Shop where you can buy Vodacom Sim Cards.      Got one from the guys selling outside for 1000 tsh.

name: Fuel station
description: Petrol and Diesel. Not many stations on this road but this one 'hidden' in the town.

name: Kigamboni ferry
description:
Pedestrian and car ferry between down town and Kigamboni. 

operates 24 hrs

prices as of Feb 2020;
pedestrian 200 tzs
cars 1500 tzs
overland cars 2000

name: St Josephs Cathedral
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Placed by owner, need confirmation by overlander

You can safely store your car here for Tzs10.000 a day at the church grounds with 24/7 security. Just call Mr Noel a day before to make sure there is space 0689424580.You can also ask him to make arrangements for your trip to Zanzibar or at places around Dar es salaam

name: Didimiza Hotel / Mangrove Guest House
description: Decent place just outside the NP (no fee). Nice bungalows owned by locals, wifi 'on demand', staff speaks English. Double bungalow with own bathroom 25 usd per night, breakfast included. Lunch 10,- and Dinner 15,-. It's behind a mangrove beach, so you have to walk 5 min to reach a bathing beach. Be careful with the name! 'Didimiza' is far better known than 'Mangrove Beach'

name: GP88 Lodge
description:
This station has a HUGE level fenced parking area through the gate to the east side of the building. We warmly welcomed to camp overnight there. Far enough from the highway to be fairly be quiet. Cost 3000 for the security guard. 
Price still negotiable, but definitely not 3000 TSh.

name: Practical Permaculture Institute Zanzibar
description: An amazing center with a well established permaculture garden and food forest. You can come visit to learn more about permaculture and growing food! Call Laura +255 777 304 890 for more info!

name: Barclays ATM
description:
A new 24 hour ATM.

Apparently the only ATM outside of Stone Town.

name: Power Line
description:
A beautiful spot to wild camp, large bushy area amongst the power lines.

There is a work shed nearby, but had no issues. Had one person walk past in the morning who was friendly.

Mobile data connectivity is there, however not very strong for voice call. Streaming worked with little interruptions.

name: SD Vasant supermarket
description: Nondescript front entrance but well stocked inside.  Opposite a fruit and veg market. Parking in front of store.

name: Mahanji Lodge
description: 10 000 Tz shillings. Double bed. No running water but bucket of cold water to rinse in on suit bathroom. No ones speaks english but thank god for google translate. Little shops around for bottled water and some basic food supplies. Rice, onions, Soya mince. Very noisy, trucks & motorcycles on road. Window frames banging in wind. Its cool for a stop over. Rooms big enough for bicycle. Provided with clean towel, soap & tiny vasoline cream tub, very cute (in non sarcastic way) otherwise clean. Mosquito net over bed.

name: RUCU Hostel - Ruaha Catholic University
description:
30 000 Tsh. (It was the cheapest place I could find after cycling up and down asking a few places over a period of 2 hours)

Clean room, bed & bedding. Cold water. Bucket and low placed tap against wall for shower. Reception lady seemed a bit annoyed with me for trying to hustle discount & blatantly refused. Staff members seemed surprised as they all said "discount!" Elec points to charge devices. Got key to lock door. Plenty of ATMs & food around. Maasai market just down the road, 200m.

name: Ritungu Camp
description: New, beautiful camp & Lodge on the highway but camping options far from road. I stayed close to the dining area as it was not busy & the toilets where there. Western toilet options, clean. VERY FRIENDLY English speaking staff. Discount for cyclists camping with own tent. (I asked for discount) The owner was here & I convinced him to make this a rule. Cyclist/bikers pay half price. Food is good. I used showers in the lodge room (lodge roof & proper ablution block for campers still being built) lots of Maasai live across the road & fetch water here by the borehole pump. They love photos & you can buy them a cold drink in return. Super friendly. I ended up staying for 2 nights because the staff where so nice & the owner baught me a beer & offered me a bed when I got to Morogoro 62 km toward Dar at his house (this can be arranged for other cyclists too, just ask "Sadick the tour guide/photographer") I really love this place. FREE WIFI. TV, Fully stocked bar. They even played Country music when a tour group stopped here hahaha) drinking water can be baught or filled from borehole. 1km after (or before) Doma. Tented camps/rooms available. Security guard patrolling area (with his dogs that only come out at night) Sometimes elephants also in camp roaming from Mikumi National Park. Very cool. It's very beautifully situated between thick, lush nature. They make mandasie on request. Im addicted to these little local sweet bread thingies.

name: church with open space to pitch tent
description: I met the paster of the church in the road when finding shelter as it rained very heavily. He said I could camp anywhere around the church. Really sweet old man & everyone in the is village/town knows him. Just ask around. Everyone is very helpful & kind. They have little classrooms aswell & because there is no church for children on Saturday mornings & was allowed to pitch my tent in one of the classrooms. No windows. Village is abit loud because its PARTAY TIME FRIDAY! but there are toilets around. Food & drinks on side of the road. You can walk there. It's beautiful here and I feel very safe & welcomed.

name: Local guide: John Baruti
description:
Knowledgeable local guide of trails, plants and birds for Amani Nature reserve. 
Email: Johnbaruti79@gmail.com
Tel +255786468789
+255768720275
Phone or whatsup
He is also developing a campsite near this location with lovely outlook on forest

name: salt
description: Delicious brownies! toast with smoked salmon with scrambled eggs ... if you are in desperate need for some good muzungu (white man) food after months of travelling .... this is the place to be!

name: crdb atm
description: atm that accepts both visa and mastercard.

name: Selewa classic lodge
description: Secure parking for bicycles, motorcycle and car. Rooms have great mattresses, basic shower. Samual is very helpfull. Drinks are available, he will bring you food from outside when ordered. nice place, friendly staff

name: Makuti bar and lodge
description: Great food, normal prices.Had a delicious chicken soup with irish potatoes, chicken and chapati. They serve other food aswell. Well stocked bar. Big rigs can park here too.

name: Kitulo National Park Campsite
description: Basic campsite near the park entrance inside Kitulo Park. Entrance fee must be paid.

name: Great place don't know the name
description:
This is really the place you want to stop before or after the border. The staff was really nice and it's the best service I ever had for the price (10,000 TZS).
I was alone with my bicycle and I had a big room with king size bed, fan, mosquito net and private and super clean shower and toilets in the room!
They gave me soap, slippers, towel and even washing powder to make my laundry. I had a really comfortable night there!

name: mnana lodge kizimkazi
description: Small lodge good for family and backpackers. There is a restaurant inside and a pool. Just 5 minute walk from the beach. Free bikes for guests

name: The Lutheran Centre
description: Accommodation and restaurant. They have several nice and clean rooms, ranging from singles to even a suit/executive room. The latter had a huge double bed. Bit expensive though, as they have different prices for residents and non residents: Double room 60,000 tzs vs $45. The breakfast was good and they even made a meal the evening before although we arrived late.

name: Shoppers Plaza
description: Great supermarket with “all” western products. Not cheap, but you will find what you need on one spot. Service is excellent.

name: Next to a baboa tree
description: Nice open clearing by a baboa tree. A little off the road. No people around.

name: Gerald's Eco Homestay
description:
Truly a hidden gem and a home away from home! We stayed with Gerald and his family for 2 weeks and had an amazing time. They are welcoming and have the most fantastic food! Hot water in the room and breakfast included. Price around $15 per person depending on type of room. 

WhatsApp Gerald +255755885419

name: sophia lodge
description: quiet and clean hotel, away from mainroad. lady doesnt speak much english but is very friendly. self contained ( squat toilet and cold shower), breakfast is included ( 2 chapati s and tea), fan. unlike reviews on other hotels in this town, I didn t experience lack of water or electricity during my 3 days here. theres a restaurant/ bar. food needs to be ordered well in advance. several drinks. no music, no noise in room. theres a bow over the entry gate so dont think big cars can pass. got a safe place to put my bicycle.

name: Monduli Juu Bush Campsite
description:
This hilltop campsite is run by a Maasaï community. There are extremely friendly staff and we spent a very good stay. We have visited their Boma and they accompanied us to track giraffes. In the evening, they did a fire and we sang together around the fire . 
There was a faboulus view on the Rift Valley and we could see the mount Meru and the Kilimanjaro ! 
We paid 15000 Tsh/pppn. 
Accommodations are basics but clean, little kitchen, a shelter and a lot of shade (black acacias)
It’s necessary to contact Samwel before coming, he prefers be warned a few days before (by whatsapp +255 767 573 982).

name: new africa lodge
description: rooms are 10.000, selfcontained with pit toilet and cold water comming from small tap in bathroom only ( showerhead doesnt give water). fan. clean, very quiet. lodge has a bar with cheap drinks and food. owner is very nice but doesnt speak much english.

name: local market
description: local market with veggies, rice, potatoes and so on

name: Near Quarry
description: Climbing up the escarpment it started pouring down with rain and getting dark so we found this Spot off the road between 2 quarries. Pull off onto gravel road and turn left. Into the bush. Lush trees and grass. Found a flat area for camping. Can hear traffic from road but its safe & covered. Not visible.

name: Kassandra's Beach House
description: Nice location at the beach 5 walking minutes away from the touristy part of Nungwi Beach, very local atmosphere. House is still under construction (December 2019), ground floor with 4 rooms, 3 of them with own bathroom are already completed. breakfast is included (fresh, warm items from local bakery, fruits, tea). Heart of the place is the owner Zaina, who showed us around and made us feeling to be at home. Security can look after car. 40$ per double room per night for 2 people, negotiable depending on high/low season.

name: Ngosha Complex Lodge
description: Having my friend join me we could split the bill for a room. 20 000tsh for room with on suite shower and toilet hole. Clean, affordable, basic food, bar, big room can put bicycles in but we locked the bikes out side to a pole. Its safe & colourful. We liked it. Sheets clean & comfortable atmosphere. Friendly staff. Price includes Chai tea & bread with margarine. Very spacious.

name: NMB bank/ATM
description: Good place to withdraw cash especially if just come over the border. Open Sunday afternoon! International bank fees apply.

name: Police check point
description: Police check point. Asked us where we are from and where we are going. Speed limit 50km/hr.

name: Bassotu lake
description: There ´ re many places to camp in front of the lake. Beautiful view, some hippos during the night. Some people around but they are friendly and it’s so quiet during the night (6pm to 6am)

name: Road to Matema
description: DO NOT follow Google's directions to Matema. Continue along this tar/ black top road to the next point of interest check in and then continue on to Matema.

name: Mbalizi to/from Rungwe
description: Gravel road in fair but drivable and passable condition even in rainy season. 4x4 recommended as some parts are steep. North section of this road to/from the waypoint is very rocky. Highly recommend taking this route as the scenes are beautiful and well worth the drive.

name: teddy lodge
description: big rooms, very clean. good working fan, always electricity ( generator when powercuts). staff is nice and speaks english. breakfast included ( sweet potato, banana, boiled egg and bread with jam) no hot water for shower, only disadvantage for me. room is 30.000 tsh. bicycle can go in room. fenced and secured parking. little shop next door with some basic stuff like drinks. nice if you want to stay longer for a break.

name: karatu tented lodge
description: tented camp, on approach to Ngorongoro southern gate. price per banda/tent around $135/night inc dinner/breakfast

name: Corrupt police speed checkpoint
description:
Police stopped us. Said we were speeding 7km before this point which was not the case. We were keeping to the speed limit exactly as we were aware of this corruption. Were told to come see the picture on a cellphone by their vehicle. The picture is of us leaving the previous town with the 50km/hr sign for going into that town pictured next to us. Complete and obvious corruption case. TSH30,000 fine with a receipt, but as we didn't have this amount on us, it was reduced to Tsh20,000 no receipt.

In this area, make sure to go 50km/hr for a bit after the "no 50km/hr" sign upon exiting each village. ie only speed up once you have seen the 50 km/hr sign in the opposite direction into the town you have just left appear or be in line with the "no 50 km/hr" sign you pass in leaving the town whichever comes last.

name: CRDB Bank ATM
description: Bank and ATM to withdrawal cash for fuel when the Total fuel station could not accept card payment due to network being down.

name: Iringa Sunset Hotel & Restaurant
description: Good hotel with rooms in different price ranges. We got a nice welcome drink and the staff is very friendly! We had dinner and drinks at the restaurant with a nice view over Iringa, indeed a good sunset! The breakfast is great, big buffet with lots of things to choose from. We think the best place to stay in Iringa! We got the residents price and payed 70.000tsh for a nice comfortable room with very good hot shower.

name: Kisasa Home
description:
Nice option for something in between the upper end expensive places and the cheaper places in Dodoma. Private rooms available with mosquito nets, aircon, DSTV, desk and own bathroom, shared lounge/dining area with DSTV. Breakfast of omelettes and toast included. Dinner meals can be ordered on arrival and made onsite. Prices for meals range from TSH10,000 to 30,000. Security guard at night, quiet neighbourhood and very clean, smart and quality spot.

Accommodation ranges from TSH30,000 to TSH50,000 payable in cash. This listing is on Airbnb, but you can just show up or WhatsApp Victor before you arrive to check availability at +255 765 429922

Take the turn off after Admire Oil direction leaving the city.

name: Roman Catholic Mission
description: Safe place in the court of the church. Rev. Fr. Christian is glad if you enjoy his church. Tel: +255 759 874447

name: Mtemere Gate
description:
The prices are very high: (in US Dollar per person): entrance 59 + fee conservation 17.50 (if you don‘t sleep in the camp) or 29.50 (if you camp in the Reserve), Camping 30, car 59.
VAC not included!
Attention: A lot of trucks because of working at the hydroplane project.

name: Kibudya Hotel
description: Spacious self contained double room, basic but clean, with fan and mosquito-net. According to the board at the reception the price for this room is 35.000 for residents but 20 dollars for foreigners. We managed to negotiate down to 40.000 shillings. Very central location, close to ferry and train station.

name: Weightbridge
description: Big rigs should stop here. You don't have to pay anything but if you don't stop, you will get a fine.

name: Mechanic bycicle
description: Nice mechanic they can help you with many things.

name: Mbeya
description: Flat spot directly near the street, but well hidden by trees. Nothing special but maybe the only option for big rigs. We tried the wild camp at the river, but it's not possible for trucks.

name: Libya Street
description: There are many shops on Libya Street that stock parts for different types of vehicles. They have tyres, batteries, spark plugs, fuses, oils, water, carb cleaners etc. Shop around because prices can vary. Whilst hunting for a part, many people directed me to Libya Street.

name: fifi's restaurant and cafe
description:
coffee and snack bar.
coffee good and reasonably priced, Tsh3000.
of all the food offered on the menu only 30% available TIA.

name: Bamba Beach
description: Spot on the beach under trees on a long white-sand private beach. A few locals passing by. No amenities only toilets, cold showers and water. 10000 tzs pp for camping +3000 tzs pp access fees. feel like wild camping on a deserted beach. transparent waters. nice and helpful staff. soda drinks available. they also have bungalows for 10000tzs but without electricity.

name: Milan's
description:
Indian vegetarian restaurant. 
superb vegetarian restaurant at really good prices.
also gluten free available.

name: Zange Public Campsite - Mkomazi National Park
description:
public camp site at the Zange gate of Mkomazi national park.
gate offices very clean/tidy. staff very warm, welcoming and helpful.
clean campsite with a kichen/canteen block, no water. clean toilet/shower block, no water.
there was a problem with the non potable water, but the national park staff brought us Jerry cans of water to wash and shower with. thanks guys!

name: Brother Anton
description: We wanted to stay at the Lake Shore Lodge, but it was closed. One guy told us, that we can camp at the brother's place. It's at the end of the village, direct at the lake. Very basic, but a lovely quiet place. They have also rooms (20000 shilling pppn). Camping is 15000 Shilling pppn. If you reach Kipili, ask for brother Anton, a very friendly Benedictine monk.

name: Kipili Mission church ruins
description: A very beautiful and big ruin of a church. There is also a lot of space to wildcamp here. Nice lake view and there is a path down to the lake (10min). Follow the signs to the Lake Shore Lodge and turn to the right at the star (see map).

name: Junction to the Kipili Mission church ruin
description: Here you have to turn to the right to go to the ruin of the church or turn left if coming up from Lake Shore Lodge.

name: German dental clinic
description:
Very good and well-equipped dental clinic.
German dentist, really good and highly recommended.

name: Shanga workshop & Kahawa coffee shop
description:
The Shanga Workshop is an uplifting social enterprise supporting people with disabilities and recycling. Open for free tours and activities every day from 9am - 4:30pm. There is also a gift shop with all the handmade products for sale from glass beads to Tanzanian cotton blankets and everything in between. Great place to stop for souvenirs for a difference. Also a DHL delivery/collection point. 

The Kahawa coffee shop is next door with indoor to outdoor seating, relaxed setting, good coffee and some tasty treats with free Wi-Fi.

Both of these establishments are accessible via the entrance to the Arusha Coffee Lodge on the left of the parking lot as one drives through the entrance.

name: Mobile Mechanic (Kenneth Autoworks)
description:
Recommended by a local expat of being in the region for more than 12 years, Kenneth is an excellent mechanic, and the only one he would use. No need to come to this location, Kenneth will come to where you are and work on your vehicle at your location. Works on Toyota, Landrover, Nissan and Mitsubishi anywhere in the Arusha and Moshi regions.

Kenneth did an excellent job of a major service on our vehicle and was able to obtain genuine parts with ease. He goes the extra mile!

Call, whatsapp or email Kenneth on
+255 766 496826;  kennethmbunda42@gmail.com

name: Excavation
description:
Next to the road, but not visible. A bit bumpy to go down. A lot of space. Nobody around except one police officer, who visited us in the evening to ask, if everything is fine. He works at the police stop a few hundred meters away. 
The ground should be ok also when it is rainy.

name: no name restaurant
description: good food for local prices. i had really well prepared rice. rice and meat is 4000 tsh. drinks, tv but not loud.

name: guest house without a name
description: Basic tanzanian guesthouse. manager is very nice. Speaks very little english. rooms are basic but clean and big. cold water, and a fan.  10.000tsh. you can take the bicycle into the room. Can easily fit two. Cars can be parked inside gate but not sure there is  a security guard.

name: YMCA Hostel
description:
Single and double rooms available for 25,000 and 28,000 TZS, respectively. Each room has bed(s) with small table and chair, fan, cupboard, and balcony. Shared toilets and showers, which are OK.

Restaurant has a bar and decent local food. Chicken and rice is 5,000 TZS, and large fish and rice is 9,000 TZS.

The Holiday Inn opposite has a rooftop bar with a nice view.

Security guards watch the entrance and car park. They're nice guys.

name: Paradise ECO-Farm
description:
New, very nice campsite with fantastic view over the Masai plains. The southafrican owner, nic and his daughter offer also farm villa homestay, 2 apartments. 
They have family made restaurant with very delicious homemade food. Also a living room with fireplace and a big terrace for looking sunrises and sunset. Wonderful surroundings, awesome viewpoints, nature hikes and tours. They have a playground and are very child friendly. Washing machine. 

Languages: English, German, Afrikaans French

Accessibility: steep uphill drive, 3km from Irente Farm, 4wd cars and Motobikes only. Pick up option from Irente Farm or Lushoto town. 

Contact owner beforehand: Nic +255737151396

name: Viewpoint
description: This viewpoint is for free so no need to pay at Irente for exactly the same view. Several points to sit on the rocks and watch the land unfold below you into the hazy distance...

name: Smiley's Sports Bar & Grill
description: Nice restaurant with a garden and children's play area. Nice bar to watch sports. Good food from ribs to burgers and everything in between at reasonable prices. Weekday specials available and children eat free on Wednesday's! Good, reliable service with relaxed atmosphere. Highly recommend. On the left as one enters the parking area for Sable shopping complex.

name: Brother Sam Guest House
description: Basic Guest House, with double beds and decent mosquito nets, cold Shower and a fan. Lovely owners. 10,000tz

name: Popcorn Hotel
description: Basic comfortable, clean ensuit room with shower (luke warm) for 20,000tsh.

name: Kays Lodge
description: A small hotel well located, quiet and very pleasant.  Ten rooms, small garden and terrace for breakfast.  à la carte order meals.  Very friendly and efficient staff.

name: Lukas
description: Very pleasant bar restaurant with local specialties and barbecue.  2 terraces, bar with African music hits.  Good atmosphere, welcoming staff.  Parking in the street guarded by Masai watchmen. Address known to local customers

name: TRA/customs/NMB bank
description: Get your TIP extended here. Pay TSH46000 only at the TRA OR pay USD20 per one month at the NMB bank adjacent to the TRA after getting your receipt at the TRA. Customs is on ground floor, room 8 on the left as you walk into the building. Easy, no hassles, good, helpful service. Took less than 30 minutes.

name: Union Cafe
description: Support Kilimanjaro small holder coffee farmers by having a coffee and more here. Onsite roasting, good service, coffee and food.

name: Mambo Guest House
description: 10,000 TZS for a room. The lady asked for 20,000 TZS and the sign-in book showed everyone else paid 10,000 TZS. Mosquitto net, bucket shower, and long drop toilet. Electricity works. Basic and dirty, but cheap. There is parking to the side of the building (behind double gate) for many motorcycles or 3 to 4 cars/4x4s, which can be seen from the road. Don't think there is a security guard. Fairly quiet part of town.

name: ONE BIKe Tanzania
description: Authentically Tanzanian small business! Cycling tours offered. Day trips to multiple days. Bicycle rental and repairs. Hillary and Good Luck are special individuals who will ensure your experience is truly authentic and local yet applicable, relevant and in keeping with evolving adventure sports in cycling and mountain biking.

name: Kolping hotel
description: Expensive big hotel (75.000 Shilling per room) situated on a hill with a view over the city of Bukoma and over Lake Victoria. We used it as a last stay before entering Uganda. We had to spend our left over cash and therefore excepted the price. Hotel is somewhat run down and could use an upgrade. However, fast internet available. Rooms are ok. Restaurant and bar present. Restaurant serves surprisingly good food for a fair price.

name: Kilimanjaro airport
description: Dropping off a friend late at night so I slept in the car in the airport parking, very quiet and for Tsh10.000 (1000 an hour) it was a good solution

name: Goodyear tyre depot
description:
Goodyear tyres

Good service and good price

We paid 330000tsz for size 255/70R15C

name: Mukuru Eco Tented Camp
description: This eco camp is Maasai community owned and offers a tented camp, dormitories and campsite. Amazing views and friendly staff. Jacobo the manager will do anything to help you be comfortable. Camping is 5USD pp on flat ground with good shade, you can use the camp's toilets (one with a view of Kilimanjaro!) and bucket showers. Safari tents with beds sleep 2 and full board is 31USD pp (double, incl 3 meals a day cooked for you. More pricing on the website). Activities are plentiful, Maasai boma visit, storytelling, hiking up the mountain, bush experience with medicinal plants, camel riding, Maasai beading or leather making workshop (they sell beautiful bags, wallets, slippers etc). Contact Jacobo, WhatsApp number +255 672 318 347 or +255 752 306 927 highly recommended. jacobo.olenatii@gmail.com or info@mukurucamps.co.tz

name: Oldoniosambu Maasai Market
description: Saturday morning there is a great covered Maasai market with all sorts of products and souvenirs! Great experience, ask before taking pictures!

name: Utamaduni House
description:
Such a lovely place to stay. Simone and Chris - the owner are so kind, helpful and so attentive!!! The rooms are really nice furnished - cozy bed, great mosquito net. The breakfast is amazing : cereals, fruits, joghurt, eggs, toast... and very good Coffee.
They also serve dinner if you want. It is very, very good. You have to try.
You feel quickly like a friend .
Really nice and very quiet place.

name: Fridge and Aircon repairs
description: Fundi to fix your fridge or air conditioning, call Msofe 054037988

name: The Comfy Stay Hotel
description:
Such a great place! 20$ for 3 people room.
Super clean, comfortable beds, hot water. The best breakfast ever with too much food! Very nice staff, they knew that we haven’t seen Kilimanjaro because of the clouds so in the morning at 7 they woke us up with the news “the mountain is visible!”. Otherwise we wouldn’t see it. Comfortable sitting on the terrace, there is nothing negative I’d say about this place. It’s also quiet and has secure parking. 

Timothys whatsapp: +255 762 408 803

name: Mezulla Farmers Market
description: First Saturday of the month only but this outdoor market is full of homemade goodies, cakes, mexican snacks, Indian foods, fresh vegetables, yoghurt, cheeses and very worth to visit and have lunch and stock up!! Not cheap but all very nice.

name: Total filling station
description: Visa cards accepted here. Good prices and clean fuel. New garage.

name: Koffee Shop
description: Great little coffee shop, run by the Asas Milk Company. Excellent food, pizza, coffee.

name: Pizza Hut
description: For some fast food Pizza this well known chain offer a little treat away from the chipsi mayai and kuku...

name: The Prince
description: Bar & restaurant next to Paris Lodge, popular with locals during the weekend. Good food and reasonable prices. We had their chicken (stewed with tomato and spinach) and rice, as well as beef shish kebab and chips for TZS13500.

name: Mkwawa Water
description: Bottling plant. We were able to refill our drinking water containers and car water tank.

name: Open grassland camping
description: Instead of hiding we decided to camp out in the open but away from the road and soon we had some visitors who were friendly and welcoming, karibu, hamna shida... a quiet beautiful place with cattle being herded and the occasional person waving and kids coming to look. Magical place and a quick dip in Lake Eyasi completed it!

name: River crossing
description: The bad stretch of road starts here with mud and a shallow river crossing, we had to go through the field a bit to avoid the deep mud. Coming from the north-east going south-west, turn left after you crossed the river, the road showing straight will take you nowhere and we got badly stuck and needed help to get out from some kind locals, don’t trust the navigation and ask more otherwise a beautiful road to drive until this point, from here on there seems to be no more real road and only smaller tracks to follow and crossing many dry or slow running shallow rivers, difficult at times with 4x4 needed quite often but it is after heavy rains last week.

name: Wild camp
description: Plenty of open space, some villagers around working the field or herding cattle but this is out of sight and quiet. Beautiful sun set and abundant bird life and maybe 100m further is a shallow river to cool off. No people came but you can hear life in the distance.

name: Vodacom shop
description: Official Vodacom shop to get your Tanzania simcard

name: Kitamu Cafe
description:
Really delicious cakes (best carrot cake I had in a while), tea/coffee and fresh fruit juice. 

Also serve traditional and Western breakfast/lunch/dinner food though didn't try them.

name: Royal Oven
description:
Bakery in town that sells very good bread (oat, multigrain, etc) along with a variety of scones, muffins, chocolate cake, etc. Loaf of bread is 3,000 TSH. 
There is a restaurant in the front selling chicken plates with rice and salad. Did not eat lunch here but did grab a cup of Masala Chai (highly recommend - 1,000tsh) but the food looked really good and you can place an order at the tent for eggs, chicken, salad, chips.

name: Grassland
description: Past a sand quarry its open grassland with some trees, no people, lots of spots to choose from and beautiful views to Rwanda, one last night in Tanzania!! Quiet with a view!

name: FM Hotel
description:
Perfectly adequate hotel in town with secure parking and adjacent restaurant. Rooms start at 30,000tsh for double bed. Room is spacious with small seating area and desk. Hot water available for showers. 
Parking in front is guarded by security overnight but a gated lot is available in the back.
Restaurant serves cappuccino, Expresso and chai along with cakes as well as dinner in the evenings.

name: Myovela Motor Service
description:
Needed to have new center bolt placed after last mechanic installed it incorrectly. This shop identified the issue (bolt in wrong hole) and was able to fix very quickly in the evening, just before dark. Shop is hard to find as it is located behind some stores (walk down alley or ask). Accurate GPS of shop is -10.672386, 35.645499 but I'm not sure maps would route there as you have to drive a dirt road so might be best to ask at parts store in front. 
Myovela and his team were very helpful and proficient. Myovela can speak decent English you can contact him via call/text at +255 075 256 7617 or on WhatsApp at +255 065 373 4140. Manzese Industrial Area.
Myovela did not know how much to charge us and asked us to give him what we thought was fair. He was happy to receive 30,000tsh for the labor. No new parts were installed. We were grateful that he and his staff stayed after dark to have this issue fixed.

name: Almanna restaurant
description: Zanzibar pizza only TSH3000 and they cook it fresh on the spot. Locals eat here too. They just cook a lot and put it outside (under plastic cover). Sodas 1000. Unique experience and by far the cheapest option in Nungwi.

name: Oltumure Safari Tour
description:
Best value for money we could find in Arusha. 
Oltumure Safari Tour is a safari company we went in the Serengeti with. Robert, the owner of the company is a really trustfull and helpfull guy who can arrange for you the safari which fits you needs. It was possible with him to do a budget safari, so we didn't take a cooker and took our own tent to have a better price. We travelled with a guide named Wumi, but there are many guides and cookers in the company you can go with. Afterword Robert gave us adresses to fix our car, our rooftent etc.. Highly recommended!

Contacts :
Robert : +255 789 477 066
info@oltumuretoursandsafaris.com

name: CRDB Bank
description: ATM and foreign exchange. Only USD, Euro and GBP available, nothing else (being Burundian, Rwandan or Ugandan currencies). No Ugandan Shillings available anywhere else in Kigoma.

name: Kilimanjaro highway fastfood
description: buffet with rice, pasta, vegetables, etc.  fresh juices, bbq.  basic but cheap and generous portions.

name: horohoro Grand Villa
description:
okay lodge near the border. 
double bed 30,000 tzs with air con, private pit toilet and breakfast (egg omelette, toast and tea). 
you have to ask for breakfast and air con, else they won't provide or offer it.  
secure gated parking.
there's a "restaurant", but all they will sell is chicken and chips for 10,000. 

good place to spend before / after the border.

name: David Livingstone Tembe, home
description: After being found by Henry M Stanley at Ujiji, Dr David Livingstone returned to his home here near Tabora where he lived for a year before setting off on his final adventure. A small amount of artifacts are kept here in this renovated dwelling. it's not easy to find and the track is flat but bumpy, high clearance is required. Luckily we met a guy on a bike who had a key 1km from the house so we followed him. its Tzs 10,000 per person and there is even a lock of his hair.

name: choo cha
description: restaurant selling rice, beans, vegetables and meat.

name: The Wings
description: Great and super clean (newly built) hotel with super service and very friendly staff. I got a nice room with private shower and toilet. Paid 35T TZS (14€), there are rooms up from 30T. Restaurant available... Just vodacom is weak here.

name: Skewerz
description: If you're hungry this is the place to go! Extensive menu with delicious drinks. We ate here twice and both times it was very good. The "Buffett" is served churrascaria style with all items being grilled and then brought out. The fire-grilled meats are seasoned perfectly and each brought out on a skewer, hence the name. It's all you can eat for 20,000tsh.

name: Bahari Cafe
description: Nice and good local restaurant on the port, espresso for 3000, grilled whole fish + fries for 13000. Tasty food and Nice staff !

name: Mud/local detour
description: Really muddy piece. The locals have made a detour along the side of the road. We had to pay 20,000. Probably worth not getting stuck though

name: TTCL SIM
description: Small TTCL office with small parking area at front. Took ~ 1 hour to set up. Need passport.  10GB data only SIM cost 25,000 Tzs.

name: Britam
description: For my German-registered car I got insurance including third party liability with validity of one month for 29,500.00 TZS here. You pay cash and the final sum depends on the amount of weeks you choose to be covered. The insurance company in my case is Britam.

name: Visit Masai Village
description: Excellent opportunity to visit a real Masai Village and learn how they live. The people are very nice and happy to meet foreigners! Just please consider: they live in very poor conditions so a gift (sugar, water, sweets for the kids would be nice to bring. Some money does the job, too. For an appointment please contact: Bertha (+255-768699281)... she is very nice and can be your interpreter for the Masai language, too.

name: Local Food Court
description:
Quick, cheap, and local. We got beef sticks for 1,000tsh, grilled chicken for 6,000tsh, chipati for 500tsh, and potato wedges for 3000tsh. 
There were several vendors with different options, one had rice and fish, another with fried eggs, vegetables, etc. Several options for beverages and a small bar to the side. People were friendly and food was delicious.

name: Never ending road
description: During rainy season this "never ending road" may be partially flooded. In such a case both entrances, the easterly and westerly, should be marked or "closed" by trunks/timber at each junction.

name: Speed checkpoint
description: PoIice speed checkpoint. Keep 50 kph when coming from the southerly weight bridge!

name: Old sawmill (Magamba Forest Reserve)
description: Abandoned saw mill great for camping. We were able to pull our truck underneath an old barn and there was plenty of room to set up our rooftop tent underneath the rafters (eezi-awn jazz tent on a Toyota Hilux). It's 10USD pp to enter and 10USD per tent for one / 15 from 2 persons. According to the lady at the front "the facilities are in the nature." Very private, only noise is from a nearby stream. Excellent birding inside the reserve. Need to be self sufficient but otherwise an excellent place to spend a night or two.

name: Mkomazi Stopover Garden
description: Restaurant available here but also appears to have multiple establishments. Small shops for shopping. Swings/playground for kids. We had chicken and chips for lunch for 6,000tsh. Fast WiFi available.

name: Kuringe
description: They have diesel, petrol, gas and a small shop. If you ask, you can also withdraw cash with their card terminal!

name: DTB atm no charge
description: this atm doesn't charge foreign cards for withdrawal

name: Immigration Office
description: Tried to prolong my visa here but officer was absent.

name: RM Station
description: They have diesel and petrol only, no kerosene

name: Immigration Office
description: Tried to extend my visa here during Corona situation but they sent me to the regional office in Tanga.

name: Elevated camp
description:
Very peaceful, elevated wild camping spot on top of a small hill next to thorny bushes. A lot of even space for plenty of overlanders if necessary. Well-hidden during the emerald season even though you might be spotted while getting there. I did not meet any person within 15 hours but there were traces of cattle around. Stable 3G with Vodacom!

There are additional camping possibilities along the path between the main road and this spot, even with a little of running water from the hill.

You find the access path on OSM (check Maps.ME). Access from the main road is at:
S6.296176°, E35.740920°

name: Lion King BnB
description:
A great, friendly place to stay in a quiet part of town! The owner Shungu is a great, helpful guy with incredible knowledge of the area. There are 5 basic, but nice rooms (3 with shared bathroom, 2 self-contained), and a comfortable living area and kitchen for common use. Beautiful courtyard and garden, camping possible. Not easy to find, so call or Whatsapp: 
+255713143625

name: Kilimanjaro Safari Experience
description:
Shungu Shitindi is a professional, experienced tour operator for all kinds of activities, e.g. climbing Kilimanjaro, Safaris, Day Trips in the region and all over Tanzania. If you want to get the real tanzanian experience, he will take you to places off the beaten track. Do not miss Street Food Moshi or local Craftsman Tour! Also highly recommended: Enduimet Wildlife Trip, Lake Jipe, Pare Mountains, helicopter tour Kilimanjaro.
He is also a real cool and helpful guy who  owns the Lion King BnB.  Contact: +255713143625 www.kilimanjarosafariexperience.com

name: Igeleke Rock Painting
description: Igeleke Rock Art is similar in style to the Kondoa rock paintings, located at a spectacular site on the edge of town just west of the Dodoma road. The ochre drawings depict human figures, an elephant, jumping eland and giraffe hiding in long grass. nothing special, but nice views for 10 000 Shilling

name: Immigration Office
description: Extended my visa here. Very friendly staff.

name: Tanzanian Revenue Authority (TRA)
description: It is possible to pay or extend your vehicle road tax here.

name: River Crossing
description:
The river here fluctuates a lot based on rain in the mountains. We crossed on motorbikes when it was maybe 100 meters wide, with a depth up to midway up our thighs (average height guys). Muddy bottom, so be careful not to get stuck. Not sure how much deeper it can get.

You have to ride through a wildlife management area to get here. Respect the animals and stay on the road. So much fun if you're into river crossings, but wouldn't recommend doing it alone. At least wait for a local to help if you're alone.

name: Texas Cafe
description:
Local place, but the location and food was nicer than usual and staff spoke some English.

This place is next door to a new and clean looking lodge that I did not stay at, but was told rooms are 10,000.

name: Magamba Forest Reserve Office
description: the office where to pay for entrance fees (10$) and camping fees (15$for 2) for the Magamba forest reserve. 3 camping options.

name: Kigulu peak campsite
description: Official campsite in the Magamba forest reserve. Entrance fee 10$pp; 15 per tent (for 2 to 5); 5000 tzs for car. Some banks, drop toilets with water, kitchen shed. In the middle of the woods. Access by stairs to the top of the hill and viewpoint (banda, banks and tables). At the crossing of various walking trails. Accessible by car. payable at the reserve office or at the viewpoint when the ranger is there with his paying device. Cash or mpesa/tigo.

name: Skyline campsite (Magamba reserve)
description: Beautiful and scenic campsite on a large terrasse on a cliff. Same fees as the other Magamba reserve campsites  (10$pp for entry 15 for a 2 persons tent) to pay at the office or call the friendly and motivated supervisor Martin +255 652430520. Hot shower with donkey. Prohibited to do fire but a shed with banks, table and a fireplace. We left 5000tzs to the caretaker who warmed shower and shed. Windy. Possible hikes (waterfall Semakonge). Campsite is 11.5 km from Sawmill campsite (55min), turn left before Gologolo.

name: Puma (Credit Card Accepted!)
description: The only gas station that accepts credit card payment in Dar. Or probably even in the whole Tanzania...

name: Epid'or French Pastries & Restaurant
description: Delicious french pastries, breads and meals in a pleasant place. Option to stay in the garden or in the more modern interior with air-conditioning.

name: Africraft Slipway
description: Great shop with upcycled crafts made 100% in Tanzania. You can find dow wood crafts, beautiful objects made with recycled glass and other reused materials. They also sell baobab and moringa oils and powder amongst many other things.

name: Shoppers Mlimani Mall
description: The largest supermarket in Dar. Prices are better than at Food Lovers (Simply Fresh) in peninsula area. Large parking lot free for 1 hour.

name: Shoppers Mikocheni
description: One of the best supermarkets in Dar. Large variety of goods. Free parking for 1 hour.

name: Mediterraneo Hotel
description: Very nice and comfortable hotel with a magnificent location on the ocean.  Restaurant on the terrace, swimming pool reserved for hotel guests. Nice installation in the traditional Swahili style.

name: Africa Safari Lake Natron
description: Campground on the lodge premises in a wonderful setting with view to the Ol Donyo vulcano and the Lake. Nice swimming pool. 15$pp but you also have to pay the various TAWA fees for Natron wildlife area and the district gates like at any other place around. No shade on the campground.

name: Machochwe Entrance Gate
description: You can enter Serengeti NP here. Payment of the fees with visa. A main track leads to Kogatende rangerpost and a 4x4 track to the Mara river (Mara post).

name: Africa Safari Serengeti Ikoma
description: Tented camp with beautiful view of the savanna, hot showers and toilets in the rooms. Close to Serengeti Ikoma gate. Restaurant and bar at the place. Beer 4usd.

name: river il mugumu petrol station
description: petrol and diesel. mechanics and cleaning

name: Africa Safari Serengeti Ikoma
description: We were supposed to stay at the tented camp but because we got here last minute and there's no business (corona situation) their full board special wasn't available. They let us camp in our tent for 30usd for 2 people which is the price for 1 person inside Serengeti. Opened a chalet for hot showers and toilets and we camped in front of the restaurant (They have the intention of building an official camping area). Really beautiful view of the savanna and Seronera hills. Very close to Serengeti Ikoma gate. Heard hyenas and lions during the night. No conservation fees apply for now but still under discussion with Ikorongo Wildlife Management Area. Good internet connection with Voda and Airtel.

name: God's Bridge - Daraja la Mungu
description: Naturally formed bridge. Admission fee: $10pp

name: Embakaai Special Campsite (NCAA)
description: Special campsite (60$pp +VAT and + NCAA conservation fees) on the rim of Empakai's crater. No amenities. Bad 4x4 road to get there but beautiful landscape and massai villages. there are various space for camping on grassy areas, surrounded by indigenous trees and views on the crater lake or the steppe (the 2 places further down the road). We saw 3 lions cubs 10km before the camp and heard an elephant breaking trees during the night. 2,5 hour from Simba Public campsite. Availability to be checked at NCAA gate.

name: Mechanic Karatu
description: Stopped here to replace some bolts after the crazy roads from Serengeti to Ngorongoro.

name: Engaresero Waterfall
description: A nice waterfall perfect for the hot days. A short 2km walk - with many river crossings and some small rock climbing - took us here from Lengai Safari Lodge. I ended up doing the hike barefoot. Guide is needed. We payed 20usd pp including guide and fees.

name: Salei plains
description: On the Malambo trail (4x4), just outside the NCAA, so no permit required. At the foot of the mountain near acacia bushes. Masai boma nearby, so curious visitors to be expected. Various wonderful places to stop on this very scenic trail. A permit is required to drive within NCAA (we checked in and out entering at the Ngorongoro gate since there is no gate on this trail and they need to take you out of their system). Trail (on maps.me) was dusty but easy (august). Giraffes, ostriches, jackals and antelopes roaming.

name: Twiga Lodge Campsite
description: New camping area by Twiga Lodge. Price 15$/pppn. Great clean ablution block with hot showers. Bordering Arusha NP very close to entrance gate. Elephants passing through at night. Many bushbabies on trees in the evening. Car checks/repair possible (Landrover mostly, but not only).

name: Aleem's Grocery
description: Excellent choice for groceries. Can find everything including local and imported cheese.

name: Shores of Nyumba Ya Mungu Lake Reservoir
description: Located in a small peninsula afar from main gravel road but visible from small track that got us here (no cars or motocycles passed while we were here though). We didn't swim (don't know if safe or not). Had a nice time watching herons and Kingfishers fishing, among other birds. Nice sunset too!

name: Dindira Observation Point & Picnic Site
description: Beautiful view over a large waterhole and mountains. Saw elephants, zebras and antelopes coming to drink while we prepared our picnic. Good tables and benches and clean toilets. Accessible by car until the top of the hill. No need to park at the parking down there if there's no other people.

name: Mkomazi National Park Kamakota Gate
description: Another exit point for Mkomazi National Park. It wasn't clear if it's possible to enter through this gate or not when I asked the staff. But a sign on the main gravel road says it's an entry and exit point.

name: Turn off to the left for Magofu hill campsite
description: This is a turn off to the Magofu hill campsite, call Frank in advance (or let somebody call him or Israel) and he will come to show you the way.

name: Mama Iringa
description:
Mama Iringa is planning a campsite. There will be showers and toilets, the parking will be in the garden. You can already stay on parking lot of the Restaurant and spend the night in the roof top tent or motorhome. She gives access to a hot shower. it's a very peaceful place in an old monastery and the food is excellent. Concetta with staff are very friendly and helpful.
Number: +255 753757007

name: The Comfy Stay Hotel - Moshi, Tanzania
description:
Moderator Note: Submitted by property owner.
Located in Moshi, 29 km from Mount Kilimanjaro, The Comfy Stay Hotel has accommodations with a restaurant, free private parking, a bar and a shared lounge. Offering a garden, the property is located within 3.9 km of Aleems Grocery. The property provides a 24-hour front desk, airport transportation, room service and free WiFi. At the hotel, the rooms have a closet. Rooms come complete with a private bathroom equipped with a shower and a hairdryer, while some accommodations at The Comfy Stay Hotel also feature a seating area.

Continental and buffet breakfast options are available each morning at the accommodation.

Moshi Highway Supermarket is 6.9 km from the hotel, while Mosque Moshi is 2.4 km from the property.

name: Pugu Hill Payment Office
description: Small yellowish building. No signs from outside. Entrance fees for non EA citizen is 10 usd pp. Guides costs also 10 usd.

name: Bamboo Campsite (Pugu Hill Forest Reserve)
description: Price is 10 usd pp for the Forest Reserve + 10 usd for a ranger for the night. No especial fees for camping on top of that. If you want to hike a guide is mandatory and also costs 10 usd. The official campsite is located under a bamboo forest close to this beautiful lake and about 100mts from where you park the car. Because of our rooftop tent we camped at the parking by the lake which I preferred because of the view. Many birds, fish eagle, monkeys on the trees. Feels wild! Nice escape from Dar. Pit toilets available. No showers. Water can be arranged but no tap water.

name: New Pugu Hills Payment Office
description: Apparently this will be the new location for paying Pugu Hills Forest Reserve fees starting from October 2020.

name: Kinyanyiko Campsite (Pugu Hills Forest Reserve)
description: Large campsite hundred meters from the road, easy access, forest fees to pay at the reserve office farther on the main road 10$ pp foreigners. Here starts the hiking trail to bats cave. Water available from a tank. Partly shady.

name: Bat Cave (Pugu Hills Forest Reserve)
description: A cave with thousands of bats. Possible to hike from campsites to here. Fees for guides and Pugu Hills Forest Reserve apply.

name: Magoroto forest estate
description:
Beautiful place at a small lake surrounded by rainforest and palm trees. They rent basic tents around the lake where you can also find the restaurant and bar area. There is a place more up hill (without a view over the lake) for people who bring their own tent or rooftoptent. Ablutions aren't working properly, no running water in the shower, it's not well maintained. 
There are some powerpoints but there is only electricity when they run the generator. 
They offer different hikes, mountain biking and a spice tour. Can be busy with groups. 
$20,- p.p.p.n. is in our opinion to much for the facilities they offer.

name: Mlingotini Seaside
description: Bar, paintball and campsite with view on the mangrove and the sea. Good vibe to meet local youth. Music starts early in the morning around 9am during weekends. I'm not sure  that's a good option for rooftop tents as the area with the nice view doesn't seem to be reachable by car.

name: Ngwazi sailing club
description: Very nice campsite on the shore of lake Ngwazi with clean toilets and hot shower. 15‘000 Schilling per Person. 4G on Vodacom.

name: Traditional Zanzibar cooking class
description:
Lutfia is a very friendly and enthusiastic woman who speaks good English. She will take you to the market to go shopping for the cooking class at her house. After shopping you go to a spice farm outside town, where they show you how spices grow. In the meantime Lutfia is settled for the cooking class and she will make several delicious dishes with you! And of course you have a very nice lunch or dinner afterwards! The whole experience takes definitely half a day. We really liked her class and can recommend it!  

+255 773 701 880

name: Zanzistar lodge
description:
We stayed in this lovely hotel for 5 nights. Because of Corona we got an upgrade to the lagoon room right on the beach! The other rooms are not directly on the beach but in the nice banana garden where they also serve breakfast and dinner(very good food!). They have a nice beach bar where you can have drinks and they are open for lunch. Peter the manager is a star, very helpful and good company! There is a kiteschool next to the beachbar, we really enjoyed kitesurfing here.
The staff can organise trips on the island for you.

name: Veggie market
description: Vegetable and fruit market, fair prices and no hassle.

name: Afroil fuel station
description: 24 hr station with diesel and petrol. You can sleep over in their parking lot. Noise is not a problem after 23:00 hrs. Toilets are clean and non potable water from tap available.

name: Short dirt track off main hwy.
description:
Track leaves main hwy and goes back approx 100-150m. Hidden from hwy although there is a bit of hwy noise. Secluded, some flat areas. In 16 hrs, only one boy with donkey came by. He smiled, waved and kept going. 
Suitable for all vehicles. No amenities.

name: Mbuyuni Farm Retreat
description:
Very nice and luxury cottages for a very reasonable price. Also kitchen is fantastic! You can selfcater or order all inclusive.
Every cottage has a parking lot, kitchen, living room, spacy terrasse, bedroom and wonderful bathroom with hit shower. A big and clean pool is shared. The very fruendly and helpful owners run a farm here and you can buy their supreme organic products. Highly recommended, if you want to enjoy a little break from travelling in paradise!

name: Msosa Campsite
description: Large camping area by the river under the trees just outside the Udzungwa National Park (no TANAPA fees apply!). Located about 10km from the highway. At least 6km of rocky tracks in which 4x4 would be very advised. Hiking to a waterfall possible outside the National Park. Baboons around, and apparently buffalos and elephants might be around too. You can bath in the stream, no crocodiles. No mobile network at all (internet and telephone). The caretaker can prepare food if informed in advance. Bucket shower and very clean longdrop toilets. 10,000 tzs ppn. Very neat and pleasant spot!

name: Msosa Waterfall
description: A small waterfall located 4,5km hiking from Msosa Campsite. Great for a bath in the hot days. Victor, the caretaker from Msosa Campsite asked for 20,000tzs to guide us here. Price is per group. Many elephant tracks and dung on the way so if you feel like you need more security a ranger can be arranged from Udzungwa National Park gate nearby for 50,000 tzs. Very pleasant hike up the river.

name: Udzungwa Mountains NP Gate
description: Here you can buy your permits and find a guide for hiking trails in the national park. You'll have to make space in your car for taking the guide with you to the start point of your chosen hiking trail.

name: Zionzuri Eco Village
description:
A great place to stay in the village of Kigamboni. There's space for big rigs ( limited) , rooftents, ground tents under trees. There are also rooms available. The owners Jacinto and King Mambo are great cooks and serve organic meals with produce from their own garden.
This is also an arts, crafts, music and dance centre so you can join in on the village activities and meet the local dancers, musicians, drummers, craftsmen, etc.
When we were there, they were just starting so prices have not been set but it is a guaranteed worthwhile place to stay or even just visit as there are a lot of activities at the eco village as well as in Kigamboni which has the best beaches in Dar Es Salaam. 
The vibe here is very family friendly, with Rastafarian cultural influences and communal. 
We highly recommend this place.

name: Kigoma
description: Immigration office. Easy process. To get to the office from Kigoma, take any bus heading for Ujiji and get out at the hospital. Five minutes walk from there.

name: Mbozi Meteorit
description: In the evening we visited the Meteorite an paid the entrance. They were really very friendly. They allowed us to stay overnight on the parking for free. The offered us free WIFI. But next Morning came another who wanted to charge 30 USDppn! He was of the Ngorogoro-District. Be aware.

name: car insurance
description:
Small car insurance shop.
Not possible to have less than 6 months. Valid only in Tanzania.
We paid 59 000 TZS for 6months for a 4x4 minibus

name: Nelly's Hotel
description: Nice local Hotel, very nice staff. They allowed us to camp in the parking. They didn't charge anything we just gave tips, they opened a room for the shower and toilets.

name: Near the village on the beach
description:
We camped here on the beach, some fisherman's around. We had the visit of the chief of the village on the morning, it was OK to stay here.
nice view and shadows

name: Ndovo Lodge
description:
Nice Lodge with amazing view.
We negotiate because of Corona time. we were 4, we payed 100 000TSH for a room and to camp with the car.
the manager is so nice.

name: Beach
description:
wild camp on the beach under the coconuts tree.
Very few nice locals.

name: njombe milk factory (Italian cheese shop)
description: Shop open Monday to Saturday 8 to 9. closed on Sunday. They produce very good and cheap Italian cheese. Caciotta for 8.000, Scamorza for 10.000 and Mozzarella. They also sell milk and yougurt.

name: Nygo Lodge
description: New guest house on the main road, double room 15.000 shellings. Nice bed with mosquito net and view on the village. Very hot shower really needed here. There is a small parking, not fenced but looks very safe.

name: Garden Beach Bungalows (Zanzibar)
description:
A great place on the beach. Comfotable, spacious and Clean bungalows for a reasonable price!
Very friendly staff always happy to help. Breakfast (included in price) could be improved.
Great sitting area by the bar with wifi.

name: Moclaud Supermarket
description: Very nice Supermarket. You will get cheese, yoghurt, milk, cream, beer, wine and lots more there.

name: Smart dry cleaners & laundry
description:
Got a medium sized bag of mixed clothes incl. underwear for about a week cleaned here. Their first offer was 40'000 TS and then she offered us 20'000 TS. Probably we could have bargained down even more but the price was okay to us as we didn't have any references anyways.
Laundry came back clean, not nicely folded and we missed one leggings, which we unfortunately only realized when repacking in the evening. 
They got the laundry done within half a day.

name: Theft
description: Even we were really happy these three days, we had a theft. Nothing dangerous, but a guy went in the cabine, while we were outside in the rain with other people and stole our wallet and the cash. Badly: Our door was closed, but not locked.

name: At a small lake
description: The surrounding is beautiful in the North Pare Mountains. Direct in front of a small lake/dam with a lot of water lilies. It is a small way down from the street. For one night it is great. Many children around, but friendly.

name: Impassible Road
description: This is a very bad gravel road! If You come from the east and you want to go to Bagamoyo, it is better to go over Dar Es Salaam.

name: Rock city Mall
description: it's a big place for shopping it has everthing inside and it's a beautiful place to bé i loved it

name: In the Masai bush
description:
Nice place in the bush. A lot of trees and bushes, quiet, not a lot of people. Sometimes a motorbike at the small road which is coming from the bigger one. Near the street, but not visible.

300 meters from the main road following a track. Nice place, no facilites. we heard masai cattle and motobikes.

Some other possible camps nearby.

name: New Raskazone Hotel
description:
Great little hotel in Tanga. Very clean, good sized rooms with AC and fan. Secure parking. 
Very reasonably priced (around 40-45,000 per room including breakfast, and there are also cheaper ones). 
Yummy home cooked dinners (restaurant was closed due to covid, but they cooked for us). 
Lovely helpful management and staff! 
Highly recommended.

name: bushcamp
description:
wild camp posible along the small track. nothing special but hidden from the road, quiet and nice view on the mountains. you can hear a bit the road from there but really not strong. 
A smaller car than ours might be able to go further deep in the bush but the tracks started to get too narrow for us. 
we just saw 3 friendly people in the morning, leaving after saying hello.

name: Museum Bukoba
description: Small museum in Bukoba live the haya, Many pictures of animals, and old traditional items that were used in Many years ago.its a small museum but beautifull

name: Covid test
description:
You can do the Covid test here in Mount Meru Hospital. Now 100USD
Normally you can have the results in 4 days.

name: old quarry
description:
not the best wild spot but not many option on that area and we didn't want to sleep in town or in a campsite.
the place is hidden from the main road and from the dirt track also if you stay close to the "cliff". we saw only few friendly people.
noise from frogs at night ;)

name: local food court
description:
local food court with many possibilities.
A bit dark inside, but tasty and cheap food (chapati 300tsh).

name: DTB ATM no charge
description: Dtb bank ATM, no charge on international cards

name: Lake Duluti
description: Not a real campsite for roof tents but new and clean shower etc. Boats for water fun on the lake. Boda guy got us chips and cold beer ;) 23000 for an adult, half for kids

name: Green Parrot
description: Restaurant with small shop and friendly staff hidden behind a wall of bushes. You get local breakfast, lunch and dinner here. The owner speaks some english and is keen to help you.

name: Yefuka Farm & Waterfall
description: Lovely shaded farm with some hidden campsites run by a local family. The owner is very friendly and will tell you a lot about the surroundings. He is a natural/traditional doctor. Every plant has its purpose here. Camping is around 10.000 TZS but I just visited the small waterfall which is accessible in approx. 15 minutes walking, carries water the whole year and ends in a pond for bathing/swimming. They also prepare local food on request and you can buy seasonal veggies and fruits. The trees are very low but he wants to establish a new site suitable for bigger rigs soon. Mobile network reception only for Helotel currently. Three types of monkeys are around but they are not molesting. They harvest honey during the dry season.

name: Earth Road
description: Earth road for about 160km. Some very steep slopes and will require 4x4. In rainy season can be a challenge and become impassable. We had to wait for a bus to be extracted from the mud. For the adventurous.

name: Kimba Beach Hotel
description: We asked if we could camp in the carpark and we agreed a price of TSH20K/night.  Big rig friendly. Partial view of lake from carpark. Access to beach. Might not be normal practice, place was empty (weekday + covid).

name: the baker's table
description:
nice bakery with a pretty good range of bread, pastries and some samosas as well. everything cooked on site.
don't expect a french baguette though ;)

name: Mas
description: Best place for good food, beer and if you sit at left side of the bar, you’ll have for sundown a sneak view at the Kili. Quick stuff, cheap price, and good quality. Only locals, no tourist so far.

name: Truck Park
description: There are a number of very 'rough' truck parks in this town. Only good for totally self sufficient rigs. But if you have a big rig and its rainy season and you are up to your ankles in mud everywhere, this is a safe (as not getting stuck) place to park.

name: Bukoba CoOp
description: Nice indoor restaurant on the beach. Clean. We had a nice meal, although the local dish of fish with banana and ground nut sauce is an acquired taste. Serves beer.

name: Aivlys Lodge and Camp resort
description:
Very nice and quiet place to stay. Friendly staff, delicious food. 
The rooms are clean and big. 
Price between $10-50
Camping is $10
Safe parking, WiFi available and vodacom is working with 4G

name: George's Car Wash
description: Nice open-air garage with friendly and professional mechanics. There's a bar in the premises which is good to kill time.

name: osion camp and lodges
description: beautiful safari tents, very nice and friendly staff, 375 us dollar all inclusive for 2 persons

name: Tony's Cafe
description: Little restaurant with a fantastic menu with good priced food, very friendly staff, good music with a relaxing area. After asking they let us sleep on their secure big nice yard. (Free wifi)

name: Born To Dream Tours
description: If you need a very good tour guide which is not expensive, call or whatsapp Jackson (+255766172525). He will drive you with his Cruiser through any of the parks. The Office is inside a nice supermarket, next to the Jambo Cafe (where there offer good food and coffee!)

name: Near Mt. Hanang
description: next to the road, no shade but very quiet. Beautiful view on the mount Hanang and a lake.

name: Karibu Redbricks House
description:
We stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed it. A brand new rbnb (12US$pp). It is fully equipped and has 2 double bed rooms. There is also a washing machine. there is also a nice outside shower and toilet, as well inside. Behind the house you can even make a fire. Next to it is a small store selling basic stuff and alcohol for local prices. Deus (the owner) went the extra mile for us!
You can book over rbnb or contact Deus: 
+255762877533

name: Old quarry
description: Just next to the road but nobody can see you (almost no traffic). We had a very quiet night.

name: Posta Sumbawanga
description: Internet on dedicated computers right next to the post office. allows photocopies.  Wifi on request.

name: MKULU Hotel
description: The hotel at the entrance of Myeba in a recent building, clean and functional, price of 40,000Tsh per double room, very good restaurant.

name: Vodacom Shop
description: Get your Vodacom SIM card here. Straight-forward and fast process if your fingerprints are registered through immigration.

name: NMB Bank
description: Get an insurance for your vehicle here. Fast and professional service. NMB offers simple 3rd party liability and comprehensive tariffs.

name: Police Canteen
description: Big, open, cheap restaurant and bar with good local food, fresh juices and friendly staff.

name: Jipe Farm and Campsite
description: we just saw the sign passing on the excellent gravel road between lake Jipe and Pare mountains. campsite is 2km farther towards the mountain. view on Kilimanjaro. Next visitor will please correct exact location and amenities.

name: Sandy plain
description: Shielded from the nice dirt road at the foot of a stony hill you find an open, sandy plain surrounded by trees, bushes and scattered baobabs. Plenty of space, also to hide completely. But there are villages nearby and friendly people could come for a visit. Traces of cattle. Bush baby cries at night. In rainy season the access to this place through a small depression could be difficult due to nearby flood plains.

name: Bahari Bakery and Smootie Bar
description: Bread, colourful cakes, a wide variety of sweet and salty pastries, chapati and a smoothie bar with non-alcoholic cocktails, coffee and chai. You can sit outside. Open 1100-2300. I had a pineapple pie and an tasty smoothie while waiting for my car to be washed nearby. Unfortunately they were not able to spontaneously prepare all the listed smoothies but I had to choose from previously made ones. Still good and friendly!

name: The Blue Heron Restaurant
description: Stunning view of Mount Meru! We came here to eat and after discussing with the very sympathetic owner Beate she told us she intends to open a campsite so we ended up being her first guests. Price yet to be discussed. There's a big green lawn, toilets, cold bucket shower and the food is really delicious and a great firewood pizza! They sell Twiga draught beer which is the first Tanzanian craft brewerie 5,000tzs 330ml. The place is very cozy and with easy access being only a few hundred meters from the tarred road. Really close to city center but it already has a more rural atmosphere and the night was very silent. There's also a craft shop in the premises.

name: Arusha NP road
description: Be aware that to cross through this road you must pay Arusha National Park fees which is 45 usd pp + car fees + 18% VAT.

name: Public Campsite 3 (Arusha NP)
description: picnic tables, kitchen shelter, bathroom (get the key from the nearby gate), clearing in the woods with no special view. 30$pp +vat, a ranger stays at night

name: Public Campsite 2 (Arusha NP)
description: Located inside Arusha NP, park fees apply + 30 usd ppn + 18% vat. You'll be given a key for toilets and kitchen shelter at the gate when checking in. Don't hope to have views of the Meru or Kilimanjaro from any of the 3 public campsites! A good mountain atmosphere though. Very calm and quiet in a clearing amongst the forest.

name: Public Campsite 1 (Arusha NP)
description: Similar to PC 2 and 3 but with more shade. Grassy area amongst the woods with all sort of wildlife but no view on Mounts Meru or Kili. 30$pp + vat. Keys to ablution and kitchen at Momela gate.

name: Snowcap Cottages & Campsite
description: Just at the entrance of Kilimanjaro NP, no park fees. Tidy area with a few chalets (70$ and 45000 tzs for residents) and grassy areas where it is possible to pitch a tent (10$pp). But roof top tent and vehicles can't go further than the parking area. No open view to the nearby summits which can be seen from some plqces between the trees.

name: Cross for Karombo Fall
description: The panel existe more to take the track waterfalls of Karombo folow for 15 km then take on rugby (Big panel)

name: Ferry crossing
description: Cost 500TS to cross with a motorcycle. Did  not have to wait long

name: Immigration
description: Place where you can give your fingerprints again, in case they have been transmitted in the system from the border. You need the fingerprints to buy a local simcard

name: Mafia Beach Bungalows
description:
Beautiful, clean and quiet place with 5 bungalows with own bathrooms.
Very friendly staff, delicious daily dinners. They offers a big variety of activities. Snorkeling at best spots around. It’s about half an hour from Kilindoni and the area is much nicer. But be aware: Utende is inside the Marine Park. You have to pay 20$ pp/ 24h (+ tax) in addition at the gate.

name: Bamboo Viewpoint
