description: Rad spot at the viewpoint overlooking a bamboo forest and mountains. Flat ground out of sight of the road and some water to wash dishes.

name: Mantis Lodge and Campsite
description: African Safari is closed due to covid, but this campsite opened in 2020 and camping is possible for 10 USD ppn as well. Absolution Was very clean even if we arrived late and are the only guest. The staff are very friendly and prepare an fire for us. Impala are around.

name: Elephant place
description: A nice spot aprox. 150 m far away from the road. There are a beautiful view and you will not seen from the road. Only for small vehicles. We saw sign from Elephant and other animals, but nothing visit us.

name: Pharmacy
description: Well stocked pharmacy for the basic medication.

name: Monarch Beach Resort
description: This hotel used to be really nice but when we went there we had a really bad experience! The beach was nice, restaurant very slow, no water, no breakfast, no mosquito note, nobody could speak English, the staff was partying in the hall of the hotel until 4am, the hotel was dirty, we were supposed to stay two nights, we left after one... Price : 20000.

name: Puma station
description: Petrol station where you can use VISA. But if they put the wrong amount they’ll catch you quickly on the road to go back and pay the right money :)

name: Hippo Viewing
description: Area overlooking a large pool of water full of hippos and crocodiles. Can get out of car and walk here. Parking area, restrooms, and picnic tables available.

name: Truck Stop Overnight Place
description: Simple Truck stop at Mogas gas station.  Toilets available, including water, but we didn't use them.  Good for one night and only suitable for closed and self-sufficient vehicles.  Traffic noise , motorbikes and maneuvering trucks.

name: Vodacom Office
description: Buying a SIM card in Tanzania is impossible - almost.  You place your index finger on the device that is connected to the computer and the computer is connected to the Internet.  Now the fingerprint is scanned - and "blupp", your data appear on the screen.  Not so with tourists.  No data, no SIM card.  So you need someone in whose name you can buy the SIM card.  Then you will also get a SIM card.

name: NBC Bank with multiple ATMs
description: Very well-kept ATMs with a security guard at the NBC Bank, who also helps if something goes wrong.

name: Bus and Truck parking lot.
description: Restaurant with a huge, graveled parking lot, also for buses and trucks. Suitable also during rainy season. Well suited for overnight stays, on the edge also for roof tents.  Currently not visible on Google Maps.

name: Emayani Beach Lodge
description: Great place to spend a few days. Newly renovated with nice restaurant and pool!

name: Secure Parking
description: Gated dirt lot on outskirts of boat launch to park while on way to Lamu or Manda. We parked here for 300ksh for one night. The family that lives in the small house watches the vehicles. There were two other cars parked here during our stay.

name: TPC Club - Plantation House
description:
It a bit out of the way, 20km south of Moshi, but it's all tarmac and a quite scenic drive through the plantation.

Its the clubhouse serving the plantation employees, very up market and facing onto a nine hole golf course.

We stayed for a coffee only, but the menu looked excellent and with a good selection of pizzas (from the pizza oven).

name: Roadside mechanic
description: Check after any work from any mechanic as the bolt of the diff was not tightened by the previous guy so a new bolt and oil. Also emergency tyre repair by adding a tube to the torn tubeless tyre. It would be wise to bring tubes for such occasions as this size 245/75 is hard to come by in Eastern Africa it seems....

name: Truck Parking
description: A truck stop behind the garage for overnight parking. There is an ablutions block (not great). TSH5,000 pn.

name: Tanzania - Zambia
description: You must stamp out the  Carnet de Passage from Tanzania in this Building.

name: Peacematunda Campsite and backpackers
description: Peacematunda campsite is located on Moshi-Arusha road on the slopes of Mount meru,  located on malala river bend  in lushly green and quiet environments  offer a lovely camping ground with hot shower and enough parking space for your vehicles.

name: RM Oil Service Station
description: A little used service station with a convenient parking bay for self sufficient overlanders. We paid 5000TSH.

name: Supa Clean
description: 6,000 tsh per kilo, in our case it was ready in 3 hours.

name: Nkondwe waterfalls
description: Beautiful spectacular waterfalls so very nice for a visit, there are 2 huts to stay for 30.000 ugx and a sloping car park to camp for 10.000 pppn  if you like. The normal price for visiting the falls is 10USD but 10.000 was fine as well. Great stop!

name: Nkondwe Falls
description: 2 chalets with 2 beds, toilet and shower with warm water if you like for 30.000tsh for the room, they make food on request (chipsi na nyama etc) but have patience. Camping with a car can be done on the parking for 10.000 pppn plus the entrance fee for the falls, its not very level but a beautiful place to have a shower under the falls or swim in the river. Friendly guys!

name: Free game drive
description: Following this free public road through the park and you might be as lucky as me; wild dogs, a serval, elephants, there is quite some road work going on so trucks driving way too fast. Keep the windows closed as there are lots of tsetse flies...

name: Roadside food stalls
description: Various food stalls to sit down with miskakhi, grilled banana, rice, meat, chipsi mayai, cheap and easy.

name: Old Kilipi Monastery ruins
description: Next to the ruins with lots of space and level ground and an amazing view over the lake you can camp for the night perfectly safe. People will pass and their fields are around you but only when the sun is up you will have friendly bypassers, the nights are quiet and magical at this monument of colonial christianity.

name: Roadside T2 Wild Camp
description: Flat open area off the T2 highway for overnight stop. Not visible from the road, can hear trucks passing but it gets quiet after 9pm.

name: MAN Truck Garage
description:
For those people running MAN trucks, here you can have basic service and repairs done. Be aware it has European prices ++.
Parts are very expensive.
We left our truck here while visiting Zanzibar - plenty of space.

name: Integral Medicine Clinic
description:
Independent Hospital with laboratory, pharmacy, surgery led by the owner Dr. Carlos Manuel Proenza Sabugo. Experienced doctor, born and studied in Cuba, worked in Cuba, Seychelles, Spain and Tanzania. Speaks spanish, english, french and suaheli.

Specialized in pediatrics, diabetes, dermatology, laboratory work, surgery, and tropical disease. We went there for blood values, a removal of a melanoma and diabetes medicine. Our host family's son (6 years) also goes there for regularly check ups. We were very satisfied by the professional treatment and the fast results.

name: Bagamoyo Camping/Restaurant
description: Camping/Restaurant/Bar. Recently opened, young local owner. It is a beautiful  place on the lakeshore with fresh coffee, tasty fish, sandwiches and drinks of any kind. Clean toilet/shower, cosy camping protected by bamboo fence with direct access to the beach. Camping 5.000 TZS per person, breakfast 5.000 TZS, dinner/lunch around 10.000. Relatively cheap boat- and snorkeling trips can be organized. For any questions about camping, food or trips contact Jay: +255 622 081 330

name: Dar es Salaam
description:
Day visit through Dar es Salaam with Kizito. 
We started with a guide and finished with a friend who showed us the deep heart of the DAR markets where tourists normally never go. 
We did the markets tour beginning with the Fish market, then Kariakoo market, Second hand market, Mwenge carvers market, Tingatinga Art Center. 
Kizito who speaks fluently English is born here and knows this city by heart. He also knows everyone in these places and we never felt obliged to buy anything, All the transportations and drinks where included in the 60 $US pp we paid for the day. Kizito adapted the tour all along to what we wanted to see.

Email: kizito@kizito-tours.com

Website: http://www.kizito-tours.com

Phone:  +255 65 581 9844

name: CMC
description: Dealership workshop for a few brands, Land Rover, Ford, Iveco etc. They do good work. Very professional, but expensive of course

name: Crafty Dee’s
description: Surprisingly good craft beer, also the food is great. Looks quite new

name: Paradise eco farm
description: Spectacular view!! 4WD access only, a bit slippery in the wet, so take care. They have 4 rooms, own kitchen for cooking and pizza oven. Double room B&B $60 , but that’s negotiable in the low season

name: Amazing viewpoint
description: This viewpoint is further up and is even better than the other one I think. You do have to pay 10,000 though, but try and negotiate, it’s so worth it

name: The Wash House
description: Nice large DIY or service laundry with seated waiting area. 8000 TSH for 6kg load. Hot wash and dry.

name: The Grand Garage
description:
Run by Evan and his team, this is an excellent workshop. Specialising in Land Rover he will take on any work. Used by all the local expats.

No sign. Green gate with palm trees on the inside.

Evan +255 754 756 675

name: Engaruka Chini Guesthouse
description: Simple guesthouse, 15000tzs for a double with bathroom. Friendly owner, we could take our bicycles into the room. There is limited parking for smaller vehicles too.

name: Watermelon hotel
description: Came here looking for food and ended up staying as the rooms were nice and 20,000 for me on my own. Basic food, not a bad bar area. Proper toilet, fan, mozzy net. For 30,000 you can get A/C

name: Mashanga Guest House
description: Excellent basic guest house, 10000tzs for self-contained (hot water, fan, mosquito net), 7000tzs for double with shared bathroom. Clean, and our room even had a couch and table. We could take our bikes inside, and there is space for a few smaller vehicles in the inner court. Many more similarly priced local guest houses along the same road, as well as a large selection of local restaurants and pubs. Why do people systematically pay 10$+ pppn for a place to camp?

name: Hilltop hotel
description: Rooms for a single person starting from 20,000, 35,000 for ensuite, they do allow camping here, just not sure on the price. Really nice location overlooking town and the lake, beautiful buildings, looks kind of fancy and thought it’d be out of my budget. The staff were nice and friendly with a little bit of English. Ate a big tasty meal of chicken stew with rice for 10,000. Price includes a simple breakfast

name: wild camping, probably an old carrier
description:
Just along the "road", hidden by the bush.
Very very little traffic

name: Uluguru Nature Forest Reserve Office
description: Permits for Uluguru Nature Forest Reserve are made here. Bunduki Campsite permits also must be issued here beforehand.

name: Bunduki Campsite Uluguru NFR
description:
Very peaceful campsite in the edge of the Forest Reserve. No internet no mobile network. It's located about 50km from Morogoro city center. Expect a 2 hour drive since most of the road is within the mountains. River Mgeta passes by the campsite and provides a nice "pool" for warm days. The campsite caretaker speaks good English. We've been for a hike to Hululu Waterfall and it was very nice (2,5 hours roundtrip). A hike to Magruwe village was also quite scenic.

Permit required to be paid beforehand in Uluguru Nature Forest Reserve office in Morogoro city center (Between Tanesco and Simba Oil, I also added it on iOverlander as a "Tourist Attraction"). Paid 12,5 USD ppn including park fees and camping fees.

name: Hululu Waterfall
description: Took us about 1 hour (3.8km) hiking to reach these beautiful waterfall coming from Bunduki Campsite.

name: Mtanga hotel
description: Good local food, 16,000 for a big dish with lots of meat and a coke

name: Speed camera
description: Speed check in this town. 30,000 fine with receipt

name: wild camp
description: On the road between Tunduma to Sumbawanga, north side, about 100 m close to the road but you are almost not seen.

name: ATM
description: Worked for me. People will tell you there is no ATM so that you have to exchange money

name: Near Road
description: It is on the North side, looks like old water mill, very quiet. only cows passing. From Kisi north the excellent tar road ends and begins a good gravel road.

name: Wild camp
description: East side of the road enterance to old quarry, only few cows and people passed. No Vodacom signal.

name: Wild capm
description: On the south side of the T18 tar road. entrance to an old quarry, you are not seen from the main road. Good Vodacom signal.

name: Police Checkpoint
description:
Police checkpoint. We were passing through in early evening and asked if we could stay here. They had no problem with it. Armed guard along with a single policemen were the only two guys here. Very friendly. Very quiet and safe spot to spend a night.
We offered the two guys beer, but they declined as they were Islamic. Decided to tip them 10,000tsh even though they didn't ask for anything. They also let us have access to their water point.

Black-shouldered Nightjar and African Scops Owl heard calling. Ring-necked Francolin (!!!!) only a short drive away. (IYKYK)

name: Equator Hotel
description: A very nice Hotel at two minutes from Clock Tower. Nice building, in a good atmosphere. Very good indian food, nice garden with flame trees, and very confortable rooms, all of this for a very reasonable price. It’s our favorite place to stay in Arusha, Tanzania's safari hub

name: Zahior Kigoma
description: We found everything you need to fix your car. Zahior is very helpful. +255755662111

name: Ajabu Adventures LTD Garage
description:
The very friendly and helpful dutch guys from Ajabu (Gertjan & Anja) started a garage on their premises.

If you need a hand or need maintenance you are at the right place. Very experienced staff!

Phone: +255 784 722 497

name: Immigration Zansibar
description:
This is the place to extend your visa.
Best to come early, they open at 8:00 am.
You need to wear a mask, no hats allowed!
You need to have or write a letter, where you need to explain WHY you want to extend your visa.
If you fly out, bring a copy of your flight ticket.
I had a flight ticket with a flight date a few days after my visa expired, so it was easy. But I just got a few days beyond the flight date.
Only one extension possible.
All process completed in one hour.

name: Selous Jimbiza Camp
description:
Lodge with a nice view at the river, 6 km from entrance gate.
They have an unattractive campground in the back. The toilet and shower block is in ruins. 20 USD pp for camping!
They convinced me to stay in one of their bandas before I came, in hindsight a good decision!
No WiFi, but 3G network.

name: Kilimaheva Lodge/Host
description:
Small, cheap hotel 2 km outside town. Nice host, but very basic.
10 USD/night, incl. basic breakfast.
The location on Google is wrong, on maps.me it is right!

name: NMB Bank & ATM
description: This bank doesn't show up in Google or Maps.me, but we passed a sign for it while driving and decided to stop to pull out money from the ATM. A simple atm with VISA/MasterCard capabilities. We didn't go inside but looks to be new and very nice.

name: Bex Restaurant
description:
Great stop to eat. Mainly local food (can order things like chipati, tea, bread, sweet chipati, chips mayai, etc). The soup is excellent and the owner speaks perfect English. Samosas are some of the best we've had in all of Tanzania. 
Can eat inside or outside. Local prices (one samosa = 500tsh)

name: MAKmar Hotel
description:
Hotel just off the road close to Msata. 

Good place to stay outside of Dar, especially after long day at the border. 

We paid 50 000tsh for a single room ensuite, including breakfast. Western toilet with hot water. Very very clean, proper hotel standard. 

Food was cheap, delicious and massive portions. 12 000tsh for a half chicken and chips. Breakfast was also massive and we couldn't even finish all the food served. 

Beers were also cheap 2000tsh for 375ml.

name: The New Aspen
description: The Hotel is about 100 m from the main road. It has a large space that allows good and secure parking for big rigs. Good Vodacom signal. They also did loundry for us. Only parking 30,000TS, we also took a room for toilet and shower for 10$ including breakfast. There is no water tap near the parking lot to fill your tanks. Also power is not stable. If you have just finished the dirt road from Kibondo, opposite the entrance to the hotel there is a gas station where you can wash your car with a steam jet.

name: Ndungu lake
description: Near Ndungu lake, very calm, no one came by, large field with grass, monkeys.

name: Don Bosco Garage (Trade School)
description:
Fantastic trade school/youth center. They have a well-equipped garage and excellent service. Can't speak to how they would be with major repairs (although I would suspect just fine) but we got an oil change done, fuel filter replaced, rooftop tent bracket welded, and tire rotation very efficiently and for 20,000tsh labor. 
For parts they took a motorcycle out to town to get them and I just paid at cost. Great guys and highly recommend! 
School on site and from what I gather this is a learning institution to teach youth skills in trades. Definitely worth supporting! 
(Also within walking distance to Mama Iringa's Italian Restaurant so go eat pizza!)

name: Bunda puncture
description: A place were they can fix your puncture, next to petrol station River Oil Bunda.

name: Tahmeed Bus Place
description: Here is where the bus from Dar to Mombasa stops in Tanga.

name: Fuel Sation
description: Small fuel station at the staffs place, but easy to find. Just a little bit more pricey than outside the park, paid 2.440 TZS  / liter Diesel (July 2021).

name: green mile
description: hunting Lodge with possibilité of camping

name: Dik-dik Public Campsite
description: Public campsite in a large area, beautiful view, showers and toilets, wood for fire.

name: Briston Serengeti Hotel
description:
A new hotel with big parking lot. 30,000 TS per room including breakfast. We entered the park through the Tabora B gate for a daily safari. We were assisted for the safari organizations with Jacobo +255679624076
They let us connect to power in one of the office, and filling water in our truck. Reasonable restaurant.

name: Glenfarm Shop
description:
Very nice and sweet farmshop. Fresh and organic vegetables/fruits. They also have bread (from Tanz Hands), nuts, frozen meat, prepared food like currys or lasagne etc. All handmade.
On the ground of the puma gasstation.

name: Lake Manyara National Park
description:
Nice park with tropical vegetation. the landscape is very beautiful with the lake. A lots of elephants, baboons, blue monkeys, giraffas, impalas.
The Price of the entrance increased a lot this year : 59 $ pp and 50 $ for the car with foreign number plate.

name: Hotel Guesthouse Kwa Justin
description:
Small hotel close to the south exit of Lake Manyara NP. Very basic, hot shower, nice staff, clean.
you can park your car inside of the hotel.
By night It s noisy, music until 12pm.
10 000 Schelling per room.
good for a stop.

name: Nalie
description: good for eat,simple,fast, clean, great for lunch break

name: Courage Cafe
description:
Very sweet little cafe. Stylish, modern and for a good cause. All profits directly support the Courage Organisation. A organisation against human trafficking. 
Beside breakfast they offer cake, bread, lunch and dinner. You can also buy selfmade jewelry, coffee and clothes.

www.courageworldwide.org

name: Sunset Vista Hotel
description: Wonderful roof terrace with view on the harbour and the MV Liemba.

name: Wild camp in a grass place
description: Large place near the off road but quiet. We saw some Masai people, there were curious and after they left.

name: Naramatisho campsite Kisaki
description: It is in construction. They will built toilets and shower. We pay only 5$ at the moment for the place. The owners are Masai people. Nice place. Elephants crossed the campsite at night.

name: Nifasha Lodge
description: Very nice hotel. New build rooms. We have a room with bedroom, living room and bathroom. Very friendly staff and only 35000 Tsh for the two of us. It is close to the road so we use earplugs at night and sleep perfectly fine.

name: Old road behind bushes
description: The old road is very well kept behind a wall with bushes. It is a bit tricky to cross into the old road but then it is nice and quiet. everyone is using the new road

name: The Cask Bar&Grill
description: Nice restaurant next to Rock Mal. A guy from South Africa is running the place. It is far from basic and the atmosphere is of a chill out place with good food and drinks. You can get Burger Pizza and traditional food.

name: Emati hotel
description: Nice hotel in a kind of quiet place as it is away from the main road. We paid 25000 TSH for the best room in the place and it was really ok. Very nice staff. You can get to places walking.

name: Stair Case Hotel
description: Good Hotel in town if you need a place to stay before crossing the border. The rooms are small but in a good condition. we paid 30.000 Tsh for the night. The food in the restaurant we recommend. Safe Parking.

name: Bukoba Taifa Gas
description:
They filled up my CADAC Gas bottle. TS 3,500 per kg. The Taifa gas bottles have the similar cap, so it fits under the rubber of the machine.
+255758903663

name: TRS Health Club Restaurant, Bukoba
description: Great food, freshly squeezed juice, good Espresso, fair prices, super friendly service and clean

name: ELCT Hotel
description: We booked a single room incl Breakfast for TSH 35,000/ 15 US$ per night in July21 or DR TSH 45,000 per night incl Breakfast and were allowed to sleep in our Camper. Quit place and friendly staff.

name: Katumba guest house
description:
basic local accommodation. clean and quiet place with friendly (English speaking) staff. single room for 8000tsh, self contained for 15000 tsh.
hot water in the morning & evening. some rooms offer a nice view.
enough space to put bicycle inside. many restaurants and shops nearby.

name: Kalungale Lodge
description:
great and affordable place in bagamoyo. super quiet and super clean!
15000tsh for very spacious self contained room with warm water shower 24/7.
easy to fit your bicycle - even two or three very nice & helpful (English speaking) staff. safe parking inside. not many shops or restaurants nearby, but walkable distance to the main road. borabora to center only 2000tsh.

name: Maruku Paradies beach
description: nice place on a small beach, due to high water level. A lot of fantasy took place in the buildings. Camping is free, but I think a tip will be appreciated. Unfortunately uneven ground. but rooftop tents will be fine. Last 2 km of road are steep and washed out.

name: Themi Living Garden
description:
Little vegetarian restaurant in a garden area. Each day the menu is different. Price 6.000 shillings.
Open from 12.30 to 14:30.

name: Princess Salme In
description: Nice little hotel in one if that old building's. reasonable prices. And a roof terrace wit a look over the harbour. payed 33$ for a double room including the city tax

name: Lakairo
description: Delicious Indian food. Best one in the last months. Dishes from 10,000 to 14,000, but you can share because is really well served. Local is clean and cozy. Passion Juice also is a must.

name: CRDB ATM
description:
Atm for Mastercard and Visa. 
24 hours.   
Easy access

name: Barefoot Sansibar
description: Very nice place close to the beach. Rooms from 20$ to 65$. Jiji the host is a wonderful person. He is very helpful and makes your stay comfortable. Helped us with finding a cheaper option of services, like snorkeling. Don't hesitate to ask him. Muchamvi Kae is very remote and you will have a peaceful and quiet experience of Sansibar. +255777462383 This is Jijis WhatsApp so you can get in touch with him directly. There is space for Camping but we did not ask as we left the car in Daressalam. You canalso  get home cooked very tasty meals.

name: Camping Gas
description: You can refill your Camping Gas here, also European bottles, outside the shop „Build it“

name: Nyinda Classic Hotel
description: Clean place with good breakfast included. Not the cheapest we could find in town but it was the best value we think. 65000 for double room. Showers had hot water which was a nice surprise.

name: Chikachika B&B
description: Great spot right on the beach at the north end of Nungwi beach. Main beach can be busy but this spot is awesome. Less crowded. Good food at the restaurant and friendly staff. Highly recommended. WhatsApp them on +33628022541 (owner is French but lives here) or call them on 0773175757. Well priced in the mid range and very clean and comfortable.

name: Quary
description: Big rigs might be seen, but the road is very quiet. Lots of space but no shade.

name: Bukoba COOP
description:
We camped next to the restaurant after someone mentioned the place on another iOverlander spot. At first they tried to charge us more than a room for our own tent, but got it down to 15,000tsh for both of us. Food was cheap but took 1.5hours and came cold with bugs on. Menu was covered in mud too, weirdly (see photo). The camp spot they had given us turned out to be the walkway between a local bar and the toilets, so lots of people walking past our tent and bike. Having taken our money and directed us to camp there, I feel the staff could have directed people around the gate, which is the same distance to the toilet. But no, they deliberately made the area next to our tent the walkway. Didn’t really feel very safe. Even in the morning when all the guests from the bar had gone, staff stood around our tent chatting in the early hours. Once they had our money they were generally very inconsiderate. Toilets were squat and hadn’t seen a mop for some time, no offer of showers. There’s a car park which would probably be fine if in a van. 
Would only stay here as a last resort… Maybe not even then.

name: St Eugene Hostel
description: Nice place and quiet, very clean. You can buy cheese, wine and jam, very cheap. 3000 Tsz the jam, 10000 Tsz cheese

name: Mo & Pragz Kitchen
description: Very good restaurant overlooking Lake Victoria. Staff all very friendly and speak very good English. Coldest beers we’ve had in Africa…and we’ve had a lot of beer! Serve good Indian, Chinese, African or mains along with coffees, smoothies and milkshakes. Prices very reasonable. Toilets here are excellent too. Restaurant is just next to the yacht club where we are camping, can share the same toilets. Highly recommend. Wi-fi available and plenty of plugs for charging.

name: Lake Burungi
description: Very quiet place. 3 locals came along just greeting us. We stopped here but you can go further and closer to the water. A lot of spots to stay.

name: Local Supermarket
description: Some variety of food and groceries in general.

name: Kizolanza Coffee Shop
description: A new open shop from the farm next door. You can drink coffee, eat, buy meat, vegetables and fruits. Very nice.

name: Karena Hotel
description:
Nice hotel in Shinyaga, one of the only cities for a long way between Mwanza and Arusha. Clean and nice rooms with good toilets and hot shower with good water pressure. 55,000 for a aircon room, there are probably cheaper places around but we had broken down and needed to get to somewhere quiet and away from people asking for money. They offer room service with good food and laundry services. Safe, gated hotel with parking available. Staff are very polite and speak English. Wi-fi available although haven’t been able to get signal from our room yet.

*Update*
After having to stay here a week due to delays with fixing our bike, we had food poisoning from the breakfast buffet here. Would eat with caution as it wiped my partner out for 3 days.

name: Carrefour
description: Very nice shop. Great assortment and fresh produce. Unexpected in this area.

name: CYDC Farm Produce
description: Many fresh veggies, some fruits, eggs, meat, honey, rice, beans etc...

name: Nextel to a field
description: Plenty of space and nobody can see you. We asked a guy who was making bricks on the other side of the field if we could stay and he welcomed us.

name: Covid testing Tanzania/Zambia
description:
Crossing from Zambia to Tanzania at Tunduma Border. RAPID test at border, must fill in online form in advance of arrival: http://afyamsafiri.moh.go.tz
Rapid test was free. 
As of this date no PCR test or advance testing required. 
Note. Currently Zombe border closed to foreigners.
Ignore above GPS coords, incorrect for that location.

name: Travellers Home
description:
Nice simple hotel with good rooms. Very friendly staff. Good value for money. We, family of 5, paid 70.000 including breakfast.
There are no mozzy nets. They spray. And it was a bit noisy...

name: Corrupt police
description: The police stop every vehicle and inform them they have been speeding with no proof. We stayed in our car, spoke some basic swahili with them and the officer wanted us to buy water for the police from the shop next door for 5000tsh. We feigned ignorance, showed them our bottle of water stating we don't need any and they waved us along.

name: Betta Yogo Dairy
description:
Local dairy shop. Fresh milk, yogurt and ghee. Vanilla and strawberry flavour. Lovely shopkeepers who can speak basic English. They gave us a taster too while we waited.
A few doors down is a wild honey place that also sells propolis products.

name: Antique Oven Bakery
description:
Antique Oven is a bakery and has a cafe. They have Tanzanian baked goods but also cakes, muffins, bread rolls and coffee. There is a fridge outside with fresh local milk and yogurt.
Parking directly outside.

name: The Kitchen Cafe
description:
Very good, Indian restaurant. Opened a few months ago. They are open for lunch and dinner, even until 11pm on a Sunday. They have baked treats, cakes and milkshakes. Idli, dosas etc. Reasonably priced.
Very friendly staff. Number uses WhatsApp too +255757230020

name: Nyinda Classic Hotel
description: Good hotel to have as a base if you are taking the ferry to Pemba. Rooms (double) start from 55000 with aircon, fan, shower, western toilet, TV + substantial breakfast included. Restaurant on site for local dishes. 1000 for a chapati with sauces! Beer 2000. Laundry 1000 per item to be hand washed. Stored the car here for a week at no extra charge but we did tip. Car is in the sun but in a secure compound with 24hr security. Friendly staff, they can order a tuktuk when you need it. We gave our food that wouldn't last the week to the chef and put our food in their fridge- it was still there on our return!

name: Tanz-Hands Bakery
description: Bakery at the rehabilitation and training centre. Sweet baked goods, bread, pretzels, stroopwaffles, jams, local cheese and butter. There's a table and some chairs to sit and enjoy a coffee too.

name: Auto Electrical Service Ltd
description: These guys are suspension specialists and use Rob's Magic. I was recommended these guys after my Ironman springs snapped. They let me try various springs and shock sizes until I was happy FOC and then fitted them. Would really recommend.

name: Maembe Garden Restaurant
description: Very good western restaurant and bar. Great food, good prices. Pizzas, pasta, burgers, sandwiches and some local food too. Very clean western toilets. We have come back here 3 times after having some very questionable meals in other restaurants and hotels in Moshi. Also has a gated car park so your vehicle will be safe. Highly recommend.

name: Visitors Inn
description:
Nice hotel with simple rooms with toilet and shower (2 double beds $40 pn) and more luxury rooms (2 double beds $70). Breakfast included, is very huge! 
Swimming pool is good.

name: Longonot National Park
description: Camping just inside and close to the gate. Very basic. Good starting point for a hike to the mountain and vulcano rim. We paid $20 pppn.

name: Mechanic local
description:
Did my oilchange there 
also have a lot of spare parts

name: Rockhill Wayside Restaurant
description: busy rest stop restaurant with buffet 8,000 tsh pp, choice from rice, noodle, beaf, chicken and veggies. clean and ok to stop, also various fruits etc sold out front

name: Twiga Safari Lodge
description:
If you want to store you car at a safe place I can highly recommend it. No big rigs only up to 3.5t
additionally the have a garage where you can service your car or get things done properly.

name: Rotterdam Supermarket
description: great small supermarket, has everything (really!) fresh veggies/fruits, milk, meat, and anything else to stuck up (pasta etc).

name: Sango Petrol Station/mini super market
description: gas station with petrol/diesel to fuel up before Tarangire national park - card payment possible. Small shop with basic groceries.

name: Peku Peku Saadani Retreat
description: Best location to visit Saadani National Park without paying the camping fee inside the Park. They have tents with beds and private toilettes (60$) and organize boat safaris along the meanders of Wami river. No better place to spot hippos and crocodiles in all Tanzania. They prepare meals and have showers and toilette for overlanders. The place is still completely virgin and in the middle of a beautiful forest. Full of shade and monkeys. Main gate of Saadani at 3 kms. Allan, the Tanzanian owner, is an authentic bush man, always concerned about the comfort of his guests.

name: Priya's Place
description:
Rooftop restaurant on top of her home, or in her dining room if it's raining! Fantastic home cooked Indian food. You must order at least 5 hours in advance so that she can cook it fresh. Best gulab jamun I have ever had! +255688707070
She will give you the exact location as its not the same as on Google.

name: Buzwagi View Hotel
description: Clean rooms for varying budgets. 30k for a standard room with squat toilet. 40k for a room with hot shower and western toilet, TV and aircon. 60k for a larger room. All have a big double bed. Located outside of the town so much quieter than the other options. I think there is WiFi but we didn't use it. Not big rig friendly. Secure parking in the compound with security guard. We made our own dinner and breakfast and used the tables and chairs outside, there is a dishwashing sink outside. Breakfast can be ordered for 5000pp

name: Baobab Tented Camp
description: Nice Tented camp with wifi, bar and offers lunch board during check out

name: Mawe Camp
description: Located on the East Central Serengeti. Plenty of cats in this area because of river infront of the camp

name: Riverside Hotel
description:
A lovely hotel after the border, basic room 15 000 TSH. 

Lovely staff and a safe spot to park the motorbike

name: Mechanic Toyota
description: My friend had a problem with his clutch on his Landcruiser. They helped him right away, S150.000.  There is also a small spare parts shop. We stayed at the church for the night with a night guard. Very friendly people

name: Mwanza Lake View Farm
description: A working organic farm right at the shores of Lake Victoria. They have stone bungalows and permanent tents both with own facilities, but also an area dedicated as a campsite but that is still under construction and will be ready approx. early next year. Electricity comes mainly from solar panels. Clean and nice rooms. Good breakfast is included to room prices. Quiet place, surrounded by a small rural village. Owner Baraka speaks good English and is a very friendly guy. Prices are 70000 Tsh for a banda/cabin, 60000 Tsh for a permanent tent and 20 000 Tsh for your own tent.

name: Uncle Sam Fuel station
description: Very good place to fill up your fridge with beer, wine and all kind of beverages. Very modern and clean. They have a lot of international beer as well.

name: Shaw Safari
description: the owner of the lodge is a Land Rover mechanic from the UK. He's got 10 300TDI's ;)

name: Boat trip to falls
description: Nice trip, but don’t use UWA. Use the private company. UWA delayed more than half an hour.

name: Zava Nungwi
description: Small lodge at the beach with 7 rooms. It’s clean, the staff is very kind and we were able to get some discount (compared to booking.com prices) and paid 70 US dollars for the room per night. They provide breakfast and (beach)towels for free. They offer snorkeling tours etc. as well. We thought it was a fair option, with what you receive and if you compare it to other lodges in the area (we went to Zenobia and Greens Nungwi too to check).

name: Border Tansania Sambia
description: Custom Immigration Health in building on Tanzania side. Very easy

name: Tour guide Stone Town Tour
description:
We had a wonderful and informative morning by walking through Stone Town with Ramadan. He took us to the old slave market, house of wonders, palace museum, old fort, Freddy Mercury’s house, the market and many more interesting places. He speaks very good English and knows a lot about Zanzibar and it’s history. 
As finding a good tour guide can be difficult in a touristic place like this, we thought we add him :) 
We paid 20 $ per person including entry to the Slave Monument (5$ per person) and the tour lasted 4 hours (incl coffee break). 

You can reach him by the following phone numbers:

+255774179599- WhatsApp 
+255782033774

name: Bus Station
description: Bus to the ferry to Mafia Island leaves from here. Costs TSH 5.500.

name: Afro Whale Shark Beach Bungalows
description: Pretty cool spot directly at the beach. five minutes by car from Kilindoni. The place is basic, showers are cold, but so what. Everything is well maintained, there is a little bar and they serve breakfast and dinner. You can book all kinds of tours here like snorkeling, whaleshark and whale watching or sunset cruise. A room is 25 USD pppn or bring your tent for camping which is 5 USD. Staff is very friendly and welcoming. I stayed four nights and had a great time. Very chilled atmosphere.

name: New Ibengwe Lodge
description: 20.000 with 'breakfast' for a double room. Friendly staff. Good place for a night. Quiet, no bars around with '' 300000 '' watt sound systems. Decent beds, fan, clean rooms, and warm water. Rooms with western toilet or squat.

name: Kasakalawe Rocks Lodge
description: Good place for a rest before taking on the climb to Mbeya. 10.000 for a room without attached bathroom, 15.000 for a room with attached bathroom. Bucket showers. Pit toilets. Clean rooms, fans, mozzy nets. Quiet area. Place to put your  bicycle (and I guess there's also a parking lot for cars)

name: Gravel road
description:
Lovely little spot to overnight with a big rig, bike or bicycle. 
Turning off from the road leads you into a main gravel road with off shoots. 

Pick a spot and enjoy. 

Traffic from the main roads is barely audible in the background. 

No fire wood, small trees so not much shade and you’ll need to pick a spot carefully to avoid the thorn bushes. 

Not a single person or animal in sight.

name: Climbers Home
description: Nice and clean hostel in town. Shower is hot, room quiet spacious. No sitcom, but a fan. WiFi is fast - if it works ;-). Single room TSH 30.000,-, cheaper when sharing. Breakfast is included. Street parking available, Massai security outside.

name: Kishada kite school
description:
Had an amazing experience here. It was low-season and Ally gave me 3 hours private lessons for 120$. He was amazing, attentive and very good at motivating. Highly recommended!

You can whatsapp him on: +971 55 830 8768

name: Bombo Hospital, Hospital Road, Tanga
description: I understand that you can obtain PCR tests here for travel over into Kenya. Unfortunately, non of the phone numbers are working. Some even say that the subscriber has not paid the bill. But we take a chance.

name: Vodacom Service Desk Laela
description: Vodacom Shop. Got a SIM Card here with Data Bundle. Friendly and helpful.

name: Magic 101
description:
Bar, Restaurant, Event Location 

exceptional setting, open kitchen

name: Kikagati border
description: Easy border to cross Uganda/Tanzania. Rapid covid test (free) done at the border (Uganda-Tanzania direction). Visa done at the border

name: Wild camp, hidden stone quarry
description:
Awesome little space. Even large rig will be hidden from any passer by’s. 
Not the most luxurious or awe inspiring place but an epic spot for an one night and it’s protected from any wind. 

UPDATE: 29/11/2021
You can wild camp just outside the hot springs. Huuggeee open space, But you won’t get the security guards benefits from being inside the hot springs area And you won’t get the benefit of being the first ones to swim in the hot springs early in the morning.

Having it allll to yourself is just the most amazing thing. Bring a set of swimming goggles / snorkelling gear to really appreciate the crystal clear water, the small fish and the natural water holes inside the hot spring. 

Again, water isn’t hot, just nice and warm.

name: Construction site
description:
The road is under construction for a long stretch. So the only Place we found to stay overnight was a place where they get earth for the building of the road. 
We camped here for three nights (because one of us had a cold). No one came through. You can hear the road a little bit but you‘re not visible if you park behind the pile of earth. 
Good Vodacom signal!

name: Silver Park Motel
description:
Good place for the night. They have a grassy spot behind a fence to camp. We decided to stay a room with double bed for TS15000. Don't expect to muxh, water not running. Normal toilet but flushing with a basket... 

The owner is very friendly and made it for us as comfortable as possible. They had some drinks for sale, no food but she can organise something to bring to the motel.

name: Mazzola Safari House & Backpacking
description: Amazing guesthouse just outside of the busy part of Arusha. Clean rooms in a quiet area and an incredible spacious garden out back to relax in. Kitchen available for use. Hot water for shower. Laundry and a huge/delicious breakfast available for extra cost. Guesthouse is around a 30 minute walk to the main square, part of it is on a dirt road but it’s easy to navigate if you contact the owner beforehand. Owner and staff are very friendly and accommodating. We arrived by bicycle and they were very helpful. This place is paradise if you are wanting a quiet house that feels like home to relax while still being close enough to main part of town.

name: Regional Hospital Sumbawanga
description:
Regional hospital, very basic circumstances

We did PCR test for TZS 20.000 pp. Takes long, 24 to 48 hours because they send it to Mbeya

name: Ferry Booking Office
description: Alternate ferry booking office that’s not crowded

name: Slow Leopard Kilwa
description:
Basic hostel / backpackers, right behind the beach in Kilwa. The road is quite hidden, and not too great from the main road. 

Not as established as the Slow Leopard in Dar es Salaam, but still very nice. Small bar with a few beers, and dinner must be pre-booked (no menu). 

We paid Tsh64,000 for a double room, which included a basic breakfast the next morning. Nice views from the rooftop terrace.

name: SIM Mission Guest House
description:
Friendly, English-speaking management, and very helpful. 

The accommodation is basic, but clean, and has multiple rooms, a shared kitchen and lounge area, and safe parking inside. 

USD20 pp/pn for non-missionaries; cheaper for missionaries. Wifi is available, but very slow. 

Camping is not available, but this is possibly your best bet for an overnight stay in Lichinga.

name: Immigration checkpoint
description: Tanzanian Immigration and police checkpoint. They stop all foreign vehicles on this road. Make sure your visas are in order.

name: Tbp bank ATM
description: Basic ATM to withdraw cash. In Mto wa Mbu

name: Makuti Bay
description: Great bar and restaurant right on the beach owned by Raymond, an extremely friendly and helpful guy. One safari tent (with bathroom) and more bungalows under construction. We stayed in the tent and Raymond allowed us to park just in front. This required driving onto the beach and over a sandy berm but doable with our LandCruiser. It’s a really great and welcoming place. I highly recommend it.

name: Iringa eco cultural tourism
description:
Iringa cultural tourism is born for the purpose of providing tourists with a touch of local life, It gave the opportunity for client to the village and other places of interest, the way people can be part of a local activity and 
even stay overnight in community.

name: Beer & Liquor
description: Beer and liquor store. Will sell or exchange bottles.

name: Red Chilli
description: Indian run restaurant with very good indian and chinese food for affordable prices (7000-15000tsh). Also offer pizzas, but didnt try them.

name: Off the main road
description: Approximately 1km off the main highway between Nyororo and Edetelo. Very quite place. Amazing place to watch stars at night.

name: National Insurance Cooperation of Tanzania (NIC)
description:
Insurance office for the COMESA yellow card. 
The offices are situated on the first floor of the Bandari Building, accessible by stairs on the right side of the building.

name: Ndlima Mote
description:
Clean and relatively modern motel, good bed with clean linen, hot shower, bicycles could be brought inside. 15,000 per room including breakfast (coffee, omlette, chapati, bread). Staff were happy for us to cook our own dinner with our stove.
No space for ground tents.

name: I. N. Password Guest House
description:
Simple guest house with bar, locked car parking and warm shower.

I payed 5,000 TZS for one person in a clean room with double bed with stiff but good mattress and mosquito net. The room is basically empty apart from the bed. You can ask for a chair and a big towel. My car was locked behind a gate. The bar was quite noisy until 23:30 on a Saturday. On 07:30 some humming generator or mill started around the next door.

name: Green Park
description: Quiet and shady restaurant with plenty of space under trees for good-quality Tanzanian food. The personnel is friendly and attentive.

name: Hasfu Food Empire
description: A clean, airy restaurant where local food is served. The servings are good and the prices reasonable.  There were many locals eating when I was there.

name: wild camp in a forest
description: I cycling across Africa. 100m from the road towards Bukoba on the right side, there is a small hiking trai. You can push your bike in a forest there is some places to pitch a tent. Forest very alive at night, so you need airplugs, not much traffic at night :)

name: Itulu Hill Nature Forest Reserve
description:
Moderators Note: We could not confirm if camping is allowed here.

I tried to find some gate or ranger post to this advertised Itulu Hill Nature Forest Reserve but without success. Still, you can follow the narrow and unmaintained path for 3 km until you reach the reserve's border stones and a signboard. There you find plenty of space for camping between trees. There are people with cattle around though, but they seem to be pretty unimpressed by my presence.

name: Zainabu's Cafeteria
description: Server traditional Tanzanian breakfasts and lunches at a very reasonable price. The meals are good value.

name: Mapelele Lodge
description: Very clean accommodation, bicycles fit in the room, owner and staff very friendly Nd hospitable (family business). Looks pretty new. Bottle of water in the room and soap in the bathroom. Basic breakfast included (bread eggs, tea/coffee).Parking. 20000Tsch one room.

name: Eddah's
description: Nice place for breakfast or if you want something sweet as dessert (chapati, mandazis, vitumbuas, cakes, samosas, tea, fresh juice) Friendly staff that speaks English. Looks much cleaner than most of the places.

name: Lunji Coffee Farm
description:
Lunji Coffee Farm is a really nice farm just at the bottom of Mt Mbeya. It is owned by Clemens, a German, and his wife. They have no real campsite but offer camping in their wonderful garden with lots of flowers and an amazing few of Mt Mbeya. They opened a room for us so we could use the bathroom, good shower with hot water. Paul and Diana, the owners son and his wife, run the coffee farm now. They gave us an interesting insight in the coffee production and we could buy freshly roasted coffee directly from the farm.
They also plan to establish a real campsite on the property in the forest. But for now it is the beautiful garden. We paid 10 US $ for the two of us.
We could also arrange a hike to Mt Mbeya with one of the farm workers as a guide. We paid him 30 000 TSH for the tour.
Really worth a visit.

name: Kilimandjaro Lodge
description: Nice lodge with mostly local people / quiet neighbourhood / 20-25000 Tsch per night for one room / bicycles fit in the room / clean / hot water / no breakfast / friendly staff / places to eat nearby

name: Igagala - No name for the accommodation
description: Super basic room with mosquito net and toilet / no electricity / no shower / possibility of eating and drinking something at the restaurant / looks a bit like a squat but it's fine if you don't know where to sleep around as there are not many spots in this area and also many wild animals / we negotiated 5000 for one night because the owner was asking 10000 / bicycles fit in the room / beware that mice came to say "hello" at night

name: Bush wild camping spot
description: Another place to camp in the bush. Could not find the first spot indicated on the map because of lots of new buildings around. Take small walking trails and pass the first high voltage line then hide between the trees. Masai around with cattles.

name: George’s Tavern
description: Great Greek restaurant. Cold beer, wood fired pizza, authentic Greek food in a beautiful garden setting. Highly recommend!

name: Raffik Juice & Coffee Wakala
description: Great place to have a fresh juice (mango-passion / avocado / tamarind). 1000 Tsch - Girl speaks English. Right next to it (left side) you can enjoy very tasty and cheap food (plate with rice, veggies and beef/beans in sauce + mini fishes for 1500Tsch )

name: Kagera River Resort
description: Hotel at the end of the small border town. Very basic but good. 10‘000 TZS for a double room. Staff was super friendly and they cooked us a delicious dinner for 5000.

name: Wild camping on the way to Singida
description: Nice place for wildcamping, 4x4 and ground clearance is required, view to the lake and to the mountains, some people came along to visit, no English speaking, everybody was friendly

name: Babu Kubwa
description: Mini market for daily supplies, milk, juices, sauces, chocolate and simple wine.

name: Kisiba Campsite
description:
Nice little campsite with bar at crater lake Masoko, owned by somebody from Mbeya. Access via the western track at the dispensary passing the secondary school. Overlanders can stay at the flat grassy soccer pitch which serves as car parking. 25,000 TZS per person per night with your own camping equipment. Otherwise 35,000 if you want to rent a tent. The lake features crystal-clear and lukewarm water which the locals also drink.

If you just want to go for a swim, you pay 10,000 TZS per person (negotiable). But there is also another free access to the water from the northern main road.

name: Mhalo Beach Lodge
description: Simple small double rooms with western toilet and shower for 25,000 TZS in the main reception block. Bigger new rooms closer to the beach and restaurant for 50,000 TZS. In the morning water did not work. Secure parking behind a gate. Friendly staff. The beach area with shady bandas is pretty nice and the beach endless.

name: Bio Camp
description:
Beautiful campsite for 10 € per person under big trees near to the beach. Clean western toilets, calm endless beach. Lovely cottages are available for 60 € per night, a family bungalow also.

The owner is Tanzanian-German and some of the friendly staff also speak German. They focus on sustainable and eco-friendly farming business, grow their own veggies and fruits and produce bio gas from their cattle dung. You can hike up the nearby hill for a great sunset view over the bay and organize snorkeling tours.

name: DAE Coffee Shop
description: Small café, serving snacks and light meals with local Arabica coffee from Mbinga region. You can also buy beans and ground coffee.

name: Good deal Hong Kong Hotel
description: As we were desperately looking for a cheap place to stay in Dar Es Salaam, we found this place close to Kariakoo district. We travel on bike, it was a bit of a hell to reach the place with the dangerous traffic and the crowd but it was finally worth it. Good points : price was 35000Tsch for a double room with aircon and balcony / big breakfast was included (partly buffet)/ we could leave our bicycles locked on the first floor / many places to eat around / walking distance from the Market / helpful staff - Bad points: might be a bit noisy

name: Good deal mango soup Forodhani
description: Forodhani evening food market is clearly a tourist attraction. We manage to find a nice stall though selling cheap and tasty mango soup filled with falafel, boiled egg, cassava, spice potato and meat brochette for 3000Tsch.

name: Boat transport Pangani-Zanzibar
description:
We found a small boat (10 people capacity) that took us to Nungwi in Zanzibar for 80000 tsh incl bicycle per person. 

Ask at the office near the ferry port, the sign says "Karibu Safari cultural centre" 

The boat took 1.5 hours and was trustworthy. 

price probably negotiable but we didn't try as it seemed fair.

name: PagaDeco Hotel
description:
25000 tsh for a double room. no wifi no hot shower. mosquito net broken, no air ventilation, so very hot during summer season

nice atmosphere during the day as it's located right next to the beach, but very noisy at night until 3 am as it is also a bar where people party at night, so little sleep

only recommendable for a short stay

name: Climbing Mt longido
description:
Climbing the mountain only possible with a guide (40000 tsh per Guide divided per person) plus 40 $ entrance for the reserve.

it was worth it as the pathway is impossible to find without a guide as it is only buffalo trail.
going through rainforest and rocky parts on the top the view is amazing. Mt Meru and Mt Kilimanjaro can be seen as well as the volcanos in the west.

worth the money

name: Kidia Vision Hotel
description:
Good budget hotel in Dodoma.
We were not able to find any campsites in and around Dodoma, so we opted for a hotel.
Kidia Vision is a good option for a stopover. We paid TSH30,000 for a basic, small room with a double-bed, TV, Wifi, en-suite bathroom and clean facilities. Safe, locked parking on-site. 
There is also a small restaurant, but it was already closed since we arrived late.

name: Mikaratusini Lodge
description: Basic Guesthouse with double rooms for 15‘000 TZS. The rooms are clean and nice and even have flush toilet and a !warm! shower. Good value for the price.

name: Matundasi
description: Between Chunya and Makakoloza, you will find several gas stations.

name: The JM Ngogo's resort
description: Newly built hotel in Matamba close to the  Kitulo NP. We stopped at Super Eden and were not impressed by the state and atmosphere there. The JM has clean and spacious rooms with a simple bathroom. Prices vary between 10.000Tsh and 30.000Tsh including a (simple Chipata) breakfast. Car can be parked inside the gate. Friendly owner. In our opinion the most 'Western style' place in Matamba.

name: Upendo Lodge
description: Guesthouse kind of place with double rooms at 10‘000 TZS. Very good for one night. Room and bathroom clean and with everything you need. Tasty restaurants are right next to it or chips mayai stalls on the other side of the road.

name: Puma gasstation
description:
we slept at the puma gasstation where more truckdrivers spend the night. 
they have clean toilets and a watertap at the back of the store. we asked if we could fill up our watertank and this was ok. you can not reach it with a hose, so you have to use buckets or something lake that. 
securityguard all night, somebody who worked here suggested that we would give the nightguard a little amount, so we did give him 5000ts. all friendly people. 
truckdrivers leave early in the morning, so or you wake up with them or use earpluggs 😁

name: Karara Guesthouse
description:
Great peaceful accommodation in Paje. Close enough to the beach and local shops/ stalls to get food. Quiet neighbourhood. Very clean. Loveness, the owner is phantastic.We paid around 20€ for the room for two persons. You have rooms with fans, mosquito nets and great showers.  Bathroom is in the room or outside, depending on the room. You can use the kitchen and there are some shared spaces (inside and outside). If travelling on bicycle, you can park your bicycles under the porch. We stayed there finally for 4 night (Airbnb booking) Please note there is no wifi though.
Phone number of Loveness (also Whatsapp): +255 773899022

name: ferry to pemba and zanzibar
description:
ferry tanga-pemba 25$/pp for non resident, 60000ts/pp for resident. leaves only on saterday 23h and comes back only on friday. 
you can take a car but she didn't know the price.

name: Pira's
description: Well stocked grocery store and bakery. Small shop with (brown) bread, wide selection of yoghurts, fruits, canned food and alcoholic drinks. A bit pricey but one of the better grocery stores in town.

name: TANAPA workshop
description:
Well equipped workshop of TANAPA at the Katavi HQ.
Everybody was very friendly.

name: Poa Poa
description: Relaxed restaurant with a reggae/beach vibe. Nice rooftop terrace and plenty of shaded space. The espresso is very good and the food is tasty. We tried the local dishes (beef+rice and chicken+rice) and the portions were sufficient and the prices fair (9.000tsh per dish). They also have a wide selection of Western dishes (burgers, pasta and pizza) but didn't try them. Free wifi.

name: Magharibi House
description: Great place for reasonable price. Around 25€. Close enough to the beach and places to eat. Room with fan, mosquito net and private bathroom (salty water though). Super nice breakfast included. Kitchen available. Possibility to store bicycles in front of the room under the porch.Good communication. Owner very helpful. Wifi available in the dining area or under the porch if close enough.

name: Old tar road
description: This is an overnight stopp well hidden from the main road! A bit noisy till the traffic stops at night. no one came past. A peaceful night on the way to Dar. VodaCom E

name: Toyota Supreme Garage
description:
Good Toyota Garage, also sells  tyres.
Best to contact them per phone/WhatsApp +255 754 382 726 in advance.

name: Dream Liquor store
description: The only place in town which had some nice wines .

name: Msami Lodge
description: Clean lodge, nice staff - 20000 tsch - no breakfast- fan but no mosquito net - big courtyard - can get some food alongside the main road.

name: Ben Lodge
description: The best deal we found in town. 20000 Tsch with breakfast and fan. Clean place and friendly staff. Other places for 10 or 15000 tsch were very dirty and have usually a bar next to them. We left our bicycles locked in the courtyard and took the bags in the room.

name: Ndabkha campsite
description:
Do not stay here.
Campsite is not in the Serengeti park but actually outside the gate. They charge 30$p.p, no hot water and toilets filthy.
I don't think anybody stays here except fools like us that prebooked it at Nabi hill gate.
Absolutely do not stay here

name: Mapito Lodge
description: Nice Lodge a little outside of Uvinza. It seems very new and thus it is clean and nice. Rooms are small with a big bed but no bathroom inside room. Paid 10‘000. No restaurant at the moment but a small shop and a bar in the same building.

name: Quarry with a great view
description: 500 m from the road, drive up a hill on a rocky track. some options for parking you have to look for something straight or build something level. Not visible from the road, lonely quiet night.

name: Hashtag cafe
description: Very nice little coffee bar. Exceptionally good Italian style espresso's and cappuccinos. Also serve some pastries and lunch (e.g. salads and sandwiches) . Airco inside and plenty of parking space in front of the cafe.

name: foresight eco lodge and camping
description:
Newly build lodge with camping. Camping on grassy flat area, has yet to be established. Hot shower and toilets available. Price 10$ pPpN. Good WiFi. Stunning views on Ngorongoro and Karatu. They have a nice restaurant. Ernest is the manager, he is a local and very helpful, speaks good english. Can arrange local dinner and safaris in the lodge safari car. Ernest: +255 757 870 979
Ask him for directions.

name: 7 day lemosho route
description: The Lemosho route is considered the most scenic trail on Kilimanjaro, granting panoramic vistas on various sides of the mountain. As one of the newer routes, Lemosho is a superb choice for your climb. It is our preferred route due to its ideal balance of low crowds, beautiful scenery and a high summit success rate.

name: Manyovu
description:
Immigration office Tanzania.
Make sure to bring enough USD with you because there is no way of withdrawing money here!

name: Ndutu
description:
Official campsite, Gnu Ndutu camp

In the safari it’s called Gnu migration camp

name: Cheapest Package For Kilimanjaro
description:
This was by far the best deal I found, I checked 6 different tour companies. 

What an amazing experience!! Angel (the owner) put everything together for me. I would definitely recommend her.

I paid $1,450 for one person, 5 Days on Marangu Route, but I think there is a discount for more people and more discount if you are going to stay at a hostel.

Fee Included: 
All park fees include 18% VAT
All payments for guides, porters and chefs
Airport transport on the day you arrive and the departure day if you needed it
All transportation during pickoff and drop-off on the mountain gates
Food budget for the all crew
Two nights’ accommodation at the hotel

Contact Info: 
Angel Tarimo; Tour Operator
WhatsApp: +255 676 378 637
Cell: +255 683 615 766
angelinafrica2022@gmail.com

name: Nyasho Medical Center (PCR)
description:
PCR Test available here, cost 115000 TSH pP., book online via https://pimacovid.moh.go.tz/

Test take a bit more than 24h

name: NMB money Exchange
description: Good exchange rates to KSH and USD. Open from 8:30 to 16:30

name: Zebra hotel
description:
Dbl bed with mosquito net,fan,tv and stand up toilet.
Clean sheets,towel and shower.
20,000sh

name: Rukwa Minimarket
description: Small supermarket with almost everything you need

name: DTB bank
description: DTB bank without charges for international cards.

name: Care Plus Health Center
description: Place to see a doctor and get blood tested. Good and fast service.You can even get the medication on site.

name: Lake Burungi
description: Just an empty spot with a nice view on the lake, the interesting thing is the moment we arrived which was at night we found 5-6 hyenas roaming around! No amenities and for free.

name: Kilimanjaro White House Hotel
description: Nice, little hotel with clean rooms and hot showers. Some have views to the Kilimanjaro. Breakfast is good. Double rooms from $30. Parking lot is a bit small but fits several vehicles. Quiet and tranquil place. Staff is friendly. In some rooms wifi is great (like in 101). Restaurant does not serve very good food, but there are good restaurants only a short drive away.

name: Rama restaurant
description:
Rice beans and meat and also chips Mayai
Good chai tea
Breakfast chapati eggs 
Rama the owner is pleased to help

name: Mbizi Forest Hotel
description: Great Hotel, staff is very friendly and the food is delicious. It‘s located in a quiet area. Small rooms are 15‘000 and more spacious ones with couch and table 20‘000. Included is a big and tasty breakfast.

name: Birds of Paradise Lodge
description: Nice, little lodge with super clean and spacey rooms. We got a double room from booking.com for $25/night. In Njiro which is generally a pretty good area. Village Supermarket is only a short drive away. Very good quality for your money. You can use fridge, toaster etc. in the common area. Parking lot is a bit small. Breakfast was not included but you can make your own. Wifi was as slow as practically non-existent and didn’t work.

name: NIC Insurance
description:
We took NIC insurance, a third party insurance for 118.0000 TSh for a year (smallest period for private car). You can contact Andrew +255 68 765 6579 on WhatsApp.
We verified that this office was not fake by contacting the office in Mbeya.

name: Nzoroko Hotel
description: Hotel with secure parking on the main road just north of Mkomazi National Park. Restaurant, wifi, secure parking. 40,000 TSH double breakfast included. Nice options on menu for lunch and dinner.

name: NIC Car insurance (National Insurance Corporation)
description: Here is an official office for the NIC insurance for your car (National Insurance Corporation). If you are coming from Malawi there are no insurance counters at the border (or fake ones be careful), we drove to Mbeya and we were able to take a local third party insurance. They cannot issue COMESA but their office at Dar es Salam can. Price for one year of third party insurance is fixed to 118.000 Tanzanian shillings. It is close to the CRDB bank

name: Malindi takeaway
description: Nice place to eat. Clean. Medium prices for Zanzibar $$.

name: Amani Forest Hostel
description: Absolutely GORGEOUS HERE. Located inside the Amani Forest Reserve. Bandas with good beds, hot showers, restaurant. Camping available. 35,000 TSH for a double. Camping $10 USD. Breakfast 5000 TSH, lunch and dinner 10,000 TSH. Located next  to spice and tea plantations. Decent road to this elevation. May be tricky if heavy rains.

name: Mashaa Allah Cafe
description: Great local restaurant with great espresso and cappuccino.  Near the sights in Stonetown.  A must stop for overlanders.

name: The City Lodge
description: New Lodge with rooms for 20‘000. Everything seems brand new and is therefore very clean. Shower with a lot of pressure and hot water. No restaurant on-site though

name: View on Meru
description: Quiet place amongst the eucalyptus trees (or what's left of them). Only place we found around as there are crops everywhere. You will find a dirt road on your left hand side (coming from Ngarenairobi). Take it and choose the spot you prefer. Amazing sunset!

name: ATM on TZ side
description:
2 trucks with ATM
Here you can get the cash needed to pay for the TZ road permit

name: Best choice guesthouse
description:
Nice place with dbl bed,fan,tv some rooms upstairs have western toilet in bathroom and good shower pressure.
Was at travellers in but was loud,dirty and had to carry bike up to second floor.
Great value for 20000tsh.
Security at gate so bike locked up at side of gated premises.
Sheets changed everyday and room cleaned also.

name: Castaway Inn
description: Nice hotel close to the center. The guy who welcomed us was very kind and helpful. The single room is 25'000 TSH, which is cheap compare to other places. The rooms are nice, clean and shower has hot water. Breakfast is included. We would have went there directly if we knew this place. Bicycles can fit in the room if needed.

name: Swahili House & Art
description:
Nice little house with 3 rooms. Two are for two people, with shared bathroom and one has her private bathroom and can accommodate 3 people. 
Our simple room was 12$ / night, wich is one of the cheapest we found. You can have dinner for 15'000 TSH, it is excellent. Brenda is currently working there, she is lovely and a great cook. A really good breakfast is included in the 12$ (for 2). 
It is not in the center, but you can take a Moto-Taxi at Ilkiranyi church (3'000 TSH to Clock Tower). 
Access is ok with a vehicle, good if you have 4WD. Very easy with bicycle :)

name: Burundi Consulate
description: $90 for 30 day visa. Quick and easy. Did not need to pay anything extra. Apparently masks are required in Burundi. COVID Testing done at the border apparently.

name: ilogi Safari Garden
description: Nice restaurant on the side of the dust track. We were looking for a room and asked for a place to put the tent (we are cycling through Tanzania) . Owners are very friendly and welcoming and speak a very good English. Standard food menu but good quality (see in the pictures). Fresh juice is excellent ! Very clean washroom and beautiful garden.

name: Double N Shelui
description: Less bad hotel of Shelui. Self contained rooms with squat toilets and cold water. Not very clean and a lot a holes in the mosquito net, but we managed. We had the best room for 10'000 TSH. Quiet at night and plenty of possibilities to eat around. Ok stop for overnight but don't expect more of this small village.

name: Nelis Hotel
description:
Clean hotel with WC and shower in the room. Quite cheap for the town as the price for 1 night is 20'000 Tsh. Breakfast (tea + banana + chapati) is included and you can ask for something more if you want (we got one omelet for 2'000 Tsh after negocation, as they first wanted to charge it 5'000!)
Big problem of management in the hotel, with a staff doing weird things, like knocking at the door at 2200 to ask for money for the night, or giving 1 egg for two at breakfast because they don't have more, but offerring nothing else instead. Not very welcoming at the end: we had the feeling we had to negotiate for everything. 
You could also have classic dinner and drinks there. The place is quiet during the night.

name: Pacha Lodge Bwanga
description:
Very nice lodge with friendly and helpful owner. There is a bar with a cosy garden to chill and have a drink. Small but clean self-contained rooms with squat toilet and bucket shower. 
10'000 TSH for the night.

name: Fig Tree Lodge
description: Nice place in the middle of the town. It has warm water and wifi.  The owners are very friendly. 50USD per room

name: Boki Lodge
description:
Standard Lodge in a calm area. We paid 15'000 for a room for 2 people. It was written 10'000 in the book but didn't wanted to bargain after a long day on the bicycle. Room are self-contained but some of them only have a bucket shower. Good mosquito net. 

We first tried Promise Lodge but there was no mosquito net, also for 15'000. 

No breakfast but space outside to cook. Parking for a couple of vehicles inside the walls, no security.

name: Shani Restaurant
description:
Variety of juices cakes and food in a nice little cafe environment.
Popular with the locals.

name: Beva ice cream
description:
Good burgers also does pizza but only had the burgers.
And ice cream

name: G7 Motel
description: Safe and clean Motel in bukoba. Paid 30k tzs for a single room with breakfast. Hot shower. WiFi not working. Parking behind gates and security. Great for 1 night stop. Allowed me to plug in fridge and did my cooking by the car.

name: Naabi Gate Serengeti
description: Gate check-in for Serengeti National Park. Washrooms, information centre and small shop. Picnic area.

name: Futian Executive Hotel
description: Decent Hotel with nice double rooms for 20‘000. They have a restaurant with good food as well. Serving breakfast but it‘s not included.

name: Kilimsuli lodge
description:
Very clean rooms with squat toilet bucket shower fan and mosquito net
10000tsh 
Bicycle in back area locked gate

name: Rubondo Island National Park
description:
A small but well equipped site on the beach on Lake Victoria. 

Do not swim  - Hippo crop the lawn in the early hours and so no going out of your tent to answer nature's call. Meals can be arranged and dinner only costs 7500Tsh., breakfast 3000Tsh and lunch 4000Tsh. Cold water showers for campers in neat & clean block. There are also 6 en-suite bungalows with warm water - simple, clean and a bit 'rustic' ($30pppn - campers too). jungle on one side and beach on other and animals roam around (if lucky, elephant may pass through). 

Rangers and guards very friendly and engaging - ranger site is not far from ranger camp. Rubondo Is is the jewel of the lake (chimpanzee walks, etc) but expect to pay. Ferry from Kasenda on main land entrance gate - you can camp here too and is staffed by rangers and leave cars here or take the new car/passenger ferry to Is.

name: Kasenda (Mainland Gate for Rubondo Island)
description: Simple space for all camping and also parking for visitors to the Island. A ranger station and office. Safe and ever-friendly ranger staff. 15000Tsh, but to be confirmed by the Rubondo Island National Park. I stayed free because there is no official tariff. Park currently upgrading with showers, kitchen and was area. Site of 6-car/50pax ferry to Island.

name: Nkonje Point, Lake Burigi
description: An existing ranger station in the national park. Currently having 6 new bungalows being constructed (12 en-suite roms). A lot of effort going into making the campsite operational and plans to rebuild entirely - plans for solar power installation. Great view but be careful of Hippo and a pair of Malibu storks who have no shame in raiding your table! As with any Parks rangers and guides extremely friendly and helpful. Burigi-Chato is under visited (only one other visiting vehicle in 4707sqm of wilderness) and is crazy beautiful.

name: Ndoto Sana
description:
Camping available on the property owned by Kaasa African Adventure Safari Company. Flat grassy area, water on site, drop toilet, bucket showers. Food and fire wood available by request. Water can be heated for showers. Fully enclosed with secure parking. A good stop over point/base  for the Serengeti, Lake Manyara, Lake Natron and Tarangire National Parks. Located in Mto Wa Mbu just off the main road. Safaris and cultural tours can be arranged. Overland/rooftop vehicles welcome. $10USD/night per person, food costs 5000 TSH and up. 
@kaasa_kigaza Instagram 
Call in advance if possible but not necessary. 
+255 745 238 144

name: Jadora Hotel
description:
This new hotel (built one year ago) is very affordable for a very good quality (32'000 TSH for a small room with double bed and 37'000 for a bigger room). This is for sure the best hotel we've staid during our 3 month trip in East Africa. The staff is also really friendly and helpful. They have a large choice of food at they restaurant and a full breakfast (included).
There isn't any mosquito net, but it is well managed and we haven't seen/heard any mosquito in the room.

name: Puma gas station
description: You can pay by creditcard. Mastercard and visa accepted.

name: Poa Poa
description: Fair priced menu. Fish (snapper) and chips for 12.000.

name: KCB and DTB ATM
description:
ATM from the KCB bank. No fee and you can withdraw TZS900.000 if the ATM has enough cash.
ATM from Diamond Trust Bank (DTB) does not charge a fee.

Also a CRDB, ABSA, Exim and Stanbic bank

name: Entrance Grancina
description:
This is the entrance road to the hostel.

Most navigating apps will direct you to the back of the hostel.

name: exchange office
description:
Many exchange offices in Arusha. shop around for the best rate because it can make a big difference. 
At this we place, aziana bank, we found a good rate. We could change euro to US dollar.
It is behind pizza hut in a small container.

name: Naomi place
description: Best Chipsi and Egg on this stretch of road. We paid 2000TSh per portion which was generous as usual. We told Naomi, that there will be more people due to this amazing app. Please keep to the amount for next users unless it’s been a while since this post. Chips usually 1000TSh and 500TSh per egg, 2 is usually required.

name: Wild Palm Campsite
description: Nice local Masaai owned campsite just 5 minutes from Tarangire park main gate. Perfect place to camp after a day in the park. Price is negotiable and affordable. Basic but clean ablutions, including hot shower. Friendly and helpful caretaker.

name: Mamba Lodge
description: Paid 15000 as did others in guestbook. Very clean but shabby. Has a heated shower head. No WiFi. Tv and fan. Includes a towel! Gates to main road and brought bike in to a semi-indoor space.

name: Bike mechanic
description: Paid 3000ts for him to adjust my gears and true my wheels. He has spare wheels, frames and parts. The parts are cheap but he knows what he’s doing.

name: Hill view resort
description:
Situated outside of Mlalo. A bit difficult to access with a very steep gravel road. No problem with bicycles. The view is stunning.
25’000 TZS for a double room with squat toilet, 30’000 TZS with European toilets.
No mosquito net on the bed but on windows.
It opened in February 2022 so everything is new. Breakfast is included. We could have dinner at the place. They asked for 10’000 TZS pp but as we don’t eat meat, we managed to negotiate for 4’000 TZS pp (chapatis, a salad, avocados and bananas).

name: Zengemka hotel
description: 25000 for large room with bathroom, sofa. Including breakfast. Water heated by the sun. Has a bar and restaurant. Very clean. Kept my bike by the door  inside gate.

name: Lindi Quarry
description: Tried to get to the beach on this road and couldn’t drive through with Landcruiser and Trailer, Bush too dense. Very good quarry away from view. No one passes here. It seems difficult to find camping along this coast, so this will hopefully help. Lindi does have a spot on the beach, we stayed there but 40USD for the night and we couldn’t get through sand with trailer so had to use the driveway!

name: Stone Town Wild Camping
description: This area along the sea is a nice spot for wild camping for the ones who do not want to sleep at the heart of Stone Town city center. It is 10min walking from the city center. We spent few nights there without any issue. A bit of noise on the morning due to fisherman and locals but is manageable and the view is really nice when you wake up !

name: Kendwa Wild Camping
description: One of the best wild camping spot we found on the beach (but no need of 4 wheelers). Take the gravel road until the beach where you can park anywhere. It is a big space. You will have fisherman, curious kids and locals as neighbours. We spent few nights there without any issues and the nights were really quiet.

name: next to the river
description: Nice stop over, not visible from the main road behind a small  hill with trees. Coming from the east go over the bridge. Turn not directly right! after the small forest (100m) turn right and follow the piki piki trail over the hill to the river. As usual few lokals and kids around, the night was quiet.

name: A&S Guesthouse
description:
35’000 TZS, double room with fan, shower (cold) and European toilets, very basic breakfast included (30’000 TZS for single)
