A bit expensive for what it is compared to other places in Tanzania mainland but seems like one of the few budget options in Pemba.

name: Wild Flowers Artisan Bakery
description: Top rated coffee, fresh baked cake and breads. Try the glass conservatory on the roof terrace, it’s really nice being lifted off the city ground floor. Parking outside.

name: Roxy Resort
description:
Delicious food place and bar. Beautiful big garden area with lounges and tables under wonderful trees.
Had amazing roasted goat for two with chips, rice, beans and tomato salad for 15000 tsh

name: Le Parlour Apartments/Lodge
description: Wonderful place to stay, close to JRO. Hot showers, food available on request.

name: Wild Camping next to Kizimkazi
description: Wild camping spot (only place for 1 car) next to the Karamba Lodge. Not on the Kizimkazi famous bay but only 3min away from it by car. Little space hidden from the street, with a small view over the beach ! We felt really good there and spent few days. You can arrange some snorkelling and dolphin tour from this beach. Few curious kids and fisherman around, they did not disturb us but don’t leave anything outside while you are away (one of our pair of shoes was stolen by the kids).

name: Pingwe Wild Camping
description: This is a really nice spot of wild camping (space for only 1 car) just a bit steep but manageable, right in front of the beach ! It is next to the Hekaya hotel we asked permission before to settle there. You will have Tanzanian mamas for massage and massai women doing jewellery as neighbours. We loved this place and stayed there few days. Really calm and with an amazing view !

name: NBC ATM
description: ATM located just off the main road, has a doorway into the x2 machines. It accepted Revolut Mastercard. Charged 15,400tsh for a withdrawal on 200,000tsh. Nowhere really accepts card.

name: Corrupt Police Stop
description: 1 official police man and a guy in normal clothes. Gates that stop you from driving through without stopping. They had machine guns and ask for something cold. We gave them 1 can of cold drink and drove on without any confrontation

name: Wakawaka House
description:
Double room with big private bathroom for 45,000tsh (€17). Booked via booking.com. Hot showers, clean room, large size, mosquito net, kitchen available for use, sitting room available for use, secure parking.
Fellow Overlander runs this place and he welcomes travellers. He is very friendly and genuine. 
Situated in a nice area of Arusha, not far from the main road and there is a mall nearby. 
I 100% recommend staying here, we ended up booking for 2 nights.

name: Safari Bistro
description:
Cafe/restaurant. Safe parking, good vibe, reasonable prices. Located in a mini mall.
Good place to chill with a coffee and a bite

name: Panone Hotel and Restaurant
description:
Little supermarket attached to the panone hotel. Offers plenty of bottled water ranging up to a 20L bottle.
We paid 5,500tsh for 12L  bottle of drinking water

name: Dan's Place
description:
Stay in a local guys house. Beautiful area, beautiful house, safe area, well looked after and clean. The host is a local who has lived in different countries in Africa due to work. 
The room had a double bed and TV with local channels, mosquito net, shared bathroom and shower but it well maintained and clean.
Booked via booking.com for €12 paid 30,000sh.
Shared kitchen facilities also. Gardens are beautiful and on a clear day you can see the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro

name: Stonetown View Inn
description:
Double room with breakfast for 76,000tsh  for 2 people, 1 night. Booked via booking.com (€28). Literally only about 2 minutes walk from the ferry port. Lovely hotel, rooms are big and clean. Has private bathroom with western toilet and shower, air con, mosquito net, safe, stained glass windows. Breakfast is on the rooftop, we got fruit plate and eggs on toast and coffee.
The entrance is down the side lane, 10m from the main road.
They also offer tours at a lower rate than other places if interested.

name: High Tide
description: Absolutely delicious food at very reasonable prices. We got cheeseburger with chips (12,000 tsh) and grilled fish with chips and veg (15,000 tsh). Banana shakes at 4,000 tsh each. Best food I've had on Zanzibar and mainland Tanzania. Place is located right on the beach. It's a locally ran restaurant

name: Babu Garage
description:
This was recommended by our local host (Mama Pierina) who we stayed with in Morogoro. The owner knows his stuff and is upfront about prices. Very professional and clean garage space, no rubbish, dirt or tools just lying around. Big space for parking and working. He has ramps available for viewing underneath the car.
We done an oil filter and oil change for a Toyota Fortuner 4.0L petrol for 200,000tsh all in. We did bargain the cost of labour as it is a quick change for our vehicle which we could do ourselves no problem, but for the ease of it we agreed on a reduced price. Originally he charges 120,000tsh per hour, he offered 80,000tsh and we decided on 52,000tsh as it's a very quick job on our vehicle (20 mins)
Cost breakdown:
110,000 for the oil
38,000 for the filter 
52,000 for labour.

name: Corrupt Police
description:
Police check right at the top of the hill (just at the Crest so you cannot see him) They tried to say we overtook in a no overtaking zone. We told him we did not, we used the climbing lane to pass a truck but kept to the 50km/hr limit. He said the climbing lane is for the other cars and we crossed over the double white line. Again we Insisted we did not and we have camera footage proving it. 
We made our point but kept the mood good and not too serious. The cop knew he couldn't get money from us so told us we could go. 

1 km after this is another police checkpoint with a bug lay-by. They waved us on.

Note: There is a very long stretch of 50km/hr and no overtaking. Its several km's long and is main highway

name: NMB Branch
description:
Branch with ATM service. you can pay for the PCR test here for the Zonal referral hospital. As you walk in the doors theres desks to the right where you complete your online bills payments slip. Reference number from your PCR email goes in the Payment Reference Number box. Then go to the tellers.
Only accept cash or cheque. 
Good exchange rate for dollars if headed to the Malawian border.

name: Mbeya Zonal Referral Hospital
description:
Test here for covid pcr. Book in advance via https://pimacovid.moh.go.tz/#/booking
Pay in advance via NMB branch in cash and completing an online payments form. See the NMB branch nearby for my comments there on how.
Testing is in the first yellow building as you come in the gate. Go up the stairs on the right. Then follow the hall to the left and it's the last room on the left

name: Maua Cafe
description:
Beautiful cafe ran by a Namibian woman (afrikaans). Good food, good coffee, good prices.
Small dirt road on just off the main road (right next to the petrol station). It is sign posted just keep an eye out. Small parking g inside but space outside. Area is safe enough.
Alot of muzungus.

name: Arc Hotel
description: Pretty ok hotel, though overpriced (45€ in booking.com). Big hotel, clean room with a mountain view. Breakfast ok. Secure parking with guards.

name: Vodacom shop
description:
You can get your sim card for 2000 tsh.
For exemple 25 GB for one month was 35000 tsh.
Close at 5pm, Saturday 4pm. Not open on Sunday.

name: NIC Investment House
description: You can buy comesa here. We paid 83000 for comesa for 3 months. we already bought local insurance at NIC Mbeya (they don't do comesa in Mbeya, or you have to wait one day because it comes from a border office). They could easily find us in the system to arrange the comesa.

name: Pauraque Soho Hotel
description: Nice hotel for 48 USD per night, including swimming pool, gym and breakfast. AC and Netflix in the room. We could park our car for free while we were on Zanzibar 5/6 days. Parking is fenced and secured (only few spots for overland vehicles, because the rest of parking lot is not high enough for cars with rooftop tent).

name: Bike 2 Kili
description:
Bicycle repair and rent workshop. Bicycles are shipped from Swiss, so technical quality is still there;)
Extreemely frendly crew! They all so arranging bike tours and trips to The mount Kilimanjaro and arround. Highly recomended !

name: Mhawa Special Campsite
description: Official ‘special’ campsite. Which means wild camping. Beautiful spot, next to the river but then up a little hill. 50 dollars per person… not cheap but beautiful.

name: Catholic Diocese of Musoma - Serengeti Parish
description: Had a great time. Padre Julius and staff were amazing. Fantastic animal sightings. Great Vodacom 4g.

name: Burger Master Point
description: Food truck type of set up selling burgers. Absolutely delicious! Owned and run by locals… very affordable.

name: Nguchiro Public Camp
description: A public camp site that costs $30 plus vat p.p. The 4 boys that run the camp are very helpful, brought us loads if wood for a fire. 25k tzn for 2 nights. Hyena abundant here, 1 hippo and some buffalo. Ablutions ok, cold shower but boys heated up water for us. Nice grassy area for RTT.

name: Sunset Safari Camp
description: Nice and quiet place with trees and shade, clean toilets and hot shower. Very friendly owner and staff (if necessary they will get you a beer - or food if you ran out of something - from the village nearby). 100% recommended!

name: Crown Lodge
description: Not as royal as the name, but good for a stopover on the way to Katavi NP. Small rooms with queensize bed, bath en suite with african flush toilet and hot shower. Everything clean and maintained. cannot complain. Parking for two cars on the premises. They hardly speak English. Paid 15.000,- TSH, diner (chicken and chips) 7.000,-

name: ABC Arusha Bike Center
description: Very friendly staff. Clean place. Plenty of grass. Clean toilets. We could use all the tools of the bike shop to repair our bicycles. Security guard day and night. We stayed there for free. The place is closed on sundays.

name: Climbing Kilimanjaro with Altezza
description:
Their base is at the Aishi Machame Hotel.
Altezza was a an amazing professional company to go climbing with. Not cheap! But proper equipment, professional medical help and a very friendly crew!
A recommendation for if you want to climb kili. They also do shorter tracks, where you don’t reach the summit but still have an amazing experience.

Sleeping at Aishi Machame is ok. (Also these GPS coordinates). Free WiFi, lovely pool. Food isn’t great and the rooms are a little old.
But very convenient if you are going up the mountain.

name: small query next to the road
description:
We spend the night here while on our way to Rungwa. Its just next to the road but not visible from the road. not much traffic after dark and no signal. 
The road from Mbeya to Makongolosi is brand new, not a scratch on it. After that it becomes a typical African road with a very bad rocky section halfway. all the rest is perfectly enjoyable.

name: Arusha Wasim Limited
description: Greatest service and place for any type vehicle. We were told here that our LC76 was good to go and no charge due to the fact that there was nothing wrong. Very knowledgeable and super kind Wasim. Highly recommend for repairs and service

name: mresheni lodge
description: Unable to find a campsite, we stopped at this lodge. Room with breakfast 50k for 2 double beds plus breakfast. Airconditioning, hot shower etc. Very friendly. Secure behind gate parking and allowed to hook up electricity.

name: Famsa Engineering
description: Really well recomended Garage for a Tanzanian friend who owns many hotels and Safari cars. Gabriel is extremely competent and professional. We left our Defender here for 4 days and he fixed dozens of things, alternator, start motor, drop arm, engine oil, pipes and many things from the "house" like lockers, cabinets, water sistem. Was tottaly fair price (the total labor for all days was 120 dollars). Gabriel number +255767998557

name: Mohammed Coffee
description: Coffee shop in a corner with only one table. One of the best Coffee we had in Tanzania, and the peanut biscuit is so good. Mohammed and his son are the nicest people. Dont miss it.

name: 501 Soul Food
description:
Excelent local food restaurant! Buffet at lunch for 8000, chicken, beef, fish, vegetables, Rice and beans. Can pay with card. Its on the second floor, in front of DHL. They have even a small lounge to chill out for a bit. 
.

name: River Lumin Resort
description: Great place to stay for a night. Secure compound with high walls, good beer, and a restaurant (we did not eat but looks neat) paid 1000ksh for our caravan and 5 people total full price. They wanted 2000 to start, but we only needed a toilet and nothin else, so settled on 1000ksh - this is double Tanzania rates we paid. Still nice gardens. We noted a shower. Perhaps pay more and use everything.

name: Kasiha Rest House (Mango Tree Bandas)
description:
This is the only accomodation inside Mahale NP which is affordable. The other two are luxury camps (Greystoke, Mbali Mbali) and are more than 1000USD per night.
They have to be booked in advance through the National Park: mahale.tourism@tanzaniaparks.go.tz
There is a basic kitchen and the rooms are quite nice.
40$ per day for the accomodation plus 80$ per day entry fee. 20$ per day (per group) Ranger fee.
Not cheap but simply amazing to see the Chimps like this.

name: Mahale NP Headquarters
description:
This is the Headquartes of the Mahale NP. It is now possible to get there all the way in your 4x4 vehicle. To get inside the park and to the Kasiha Rest House (where the Chimp tracking starts) you have to get a boat transfer (200'000 TSh) organized by the park officials (mahale.tourism@tanzaniaparks.go.tz, very responsive). It is also possible to hire a car/driver from Kigoma and back for 700'000 TSh.
There is a room for tourists available and also a small kitchen.

name: Mojito Place
description: Coming from Mbeya, turn left. Just before the barrier you turn left again. It's a dirt road which crosses a small river after a few meters. We stayed just before the river on the left. Nobody showed up. We were alone all afternoon, evening, night and the next morning. It's nothing special but seems to be safe and quiet.

name: Kilhill Coffee Tour
description: Nice little place where you can experience local coffee production from the plant to the cup. You see how it grows, pick it, peal it, roast it, grind it and drink it. Very good coffee. Nice experience! WhatsApp Christian for more information: +255621581330

name: Roadside
description: Place next to the road from Mbeya to Dar es Salaam - good for one night stop - still noise from all trucks racing by - but safer here than on the road at night. Pine forest.

name: Old quarry
description: Big clearing of old quarry. We were able to park out of sight of the road. We didn’t see anybody all night. Nice quiet spot.

name: In between Occra field next to river
description: We stayed here for 2 night, had permission from the owner of the fields Jhon, who works there everyday !  Just outside Bagamoyo - next to river …very relaxing …still a bit of sound from road but ok ! People are all very friendly - Airtel LTE

name: Chowpatty
description:
Vegetarian restaurant - Best Indian food we have ever had !!!  Recommend by Kaps Batteries (around the corner) 
A definite must visit in Dar

name: Kaps Batteries Ltd
description: The can refill SA Cadac bottles without any issue !! 30 min wait, very helpfull and friendly family

name: Kilimanjaro beer depot
description: Beer in cans and bottles from the Kilimanjaro beer depot.  The Serengeti depot is on the opposite side of the market.

name: Urithi Tanga Museum
description:
Former German administrative building, now a museum in charge of friendly guides. One of them, Imani, pointed put that they allow camping in the garden with beautiful sea view for a small fee (5 - 10$/pp.). Public toilets are provided and security should be given as government buildings are closeby. Probably ideal for one or two nights!
Imani: +255 745 374 331

name: Tanzania Immigration
description: One stop shop. Checking out of Rwanda, into Tanzania. No mask. No vaccine papers. Quick and clean. No harassment. Rwandans don’t do corruption. Tanzania usually loves to steal money. But today just paid the fees and entered. Cool waterfall under the border bridge.

name: pangani coast tourist info centre
description: We met Emanuel because he manages a hotel nearby. He is one of the most amazing people we met on the whole journey through Tanzania. He showed us where to eat and buy stuff and even helped us get a bus to Dar without wanting anything in exchange. Through his travel agency, he organises boat and other tours even passages to Zanzibar.

name: pangani Bus station
description:
We caught a bus to Dar from here because the boat to Zanzibar was not running.
It costed 21000 pp +20000 for one bicycle and luggage. The journey takes 7 hours with a stop in Tanga. there is only one ride a day at 7 a.m.

name: maisha Khalisi
description: MaishaKhalisi is the most unique and eco friendly place in Moshi. The restaurant was built in 2021 by natural materials which gives the place a very laid back and relaxing atmosphere. We now start to also offer camping for Trucks and Jeeps with roof tents. As the place is at the edge of the city, it is very quiet and surrounded by nature. Banana trees just  beside the house and passion fruit cover the restaurant. We offer a big range of food and a lot of different drinks. You have a stunning view at Kilimanjaro and if you are lucky you can see beautiful sunrises and sunsets. There are always two security guards on the facility. Free WiFi is available!

name: Sunset & Mountain Views
description: After a 9h30m of boring drive from Kigoma we came to check the other wild camping spot on iOverlander and ended up in a large track that follows the power lines (They are still under construction as there are no lines yet.) We could actually camp anywhere on that track but here it had a nice sunset view over Rwanda mountains and good internet connection with Vodacom. Not easy to find a flat spot for our rooftop tent though. Could slightly hear the road from very far but we had a very peaceful night. No one ever came around.

name: Triple P Hotel
description:
Clean rooms with ensuite bathroom (hot water!) and western toilet. It is possible to park inside the gate for a few vehicles, but it is not big rig friendly. The gate is quite narrow and you park more or less at the terrace, but it is fine.
They also have a restaurant, which is ok. 
We paid TSH60.000 including breakfast.

This is the right location: -1.592235,31.142708

name: golden rose g house
description:
very nice place, 15000 tzs for night. breakfast for free. 
quiet. cold water but it's ok. electricity. the cheaper place in dodoma find with talking people, try to keep this price.  don't pay more for next customers please !

name: Vodacom SIM card
description: Get your SIM card from vodacom under umbrella next to the road. Rica and airtime . Ask to change language to English on SIM card

name: Weigh bridge
description: Weigh bridge . We did not get pulled over in Land Cruiser . All trucks had to stop

name: Great Migration Camps
description: We share our "Special Campsite" with self-drive visitors especially because there are no "public" campsites at the Mara river on the Serengeti side at all.  You are also welcome to come camp with us at Ndutu during the calving season!

name: Mwitongo Garden Hotel
description: Clean, large room and good bed. Restaurant/bar on premises. Double room 100k shillings, option to negotiate.

name: Bukoba Ferry
description: This is the booking office for the ferry that runs to Bukoba 3 times a week (Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday). There are 3 classes. First class gives you a 2-person bedroom (45.000 pp), second class a 4-person bedroom (30.000 pp), third class you stay on the deck or in the bar (16.000). Reporting time is 19:30pm, departing time 21pm. Normally arrives in Bukoba around 6-6:30am. There is a restaurant and bar on board, quite lively with Tanzanian music and alcohol flowing freely. I stayed in first class, which was on the first floor. Bunk bed, neat, clean sheets and a functioning plug and small desk. Recommended to buy first and second class tickets a view days in advance since they tend to sell out. We entered with 2 bicycles which they weighed before boarding, total costs for the bikes was 16.000. Possible to enter with a car as well, they told me for a land cruiser it is around 150.000 but depends on the weight.  All in all good experience!

name: Mage Guest House & Bar
description: Simple hotel on the side of the road. There was nothing else on Overlander in this area. Friendly, helpful staff. We could place our bikes inside which was locked during the night. Simple room, bit run down, but clean sheets. Squatter toilet, no sink, two buckets of water provided. We paid 15.000 for 1 room. There is a parking lot in the front that could allow space for a landcruiser. Quite a noisy bar up until 10:30pm (Friday), after that it was quiet.

name: Chelaburo guest house
description: Nice clean hotel in a side street. There is gated parking that should fit 2 cars. Lovely clean tiled spacious room with a comfy bed and a mosquito net. There is a shower but only with cold water, clean squatting toilet. Soap and big clean towels provided. The room went for 15.000tzs, no breakfast. Very good deal!

name: Equalia boutique hotel
description:
This Hostel is the best option for backpackers ,I was amazed at the beauty of the place here,it is completely on the sea with a beautiful view during sunrise, especially during the tides.
 It is also close to the main road and to almost all the activities that you can do in zanzibar. 
The staff are very friendly and nice, the food is delicious and the place is clean, 8€ per night with free wifi and breakfast, the price is very cheap compared to the services.
Contact of the owner :
+255772458783

name: Total Filling station
description: Total Filling Station. You can also pay with card.

name: wide open space
description: We wanted to search for a place after the end of the nationalpark and found this spot next to the road. It is a big area, with a lot of flat spots well hidden from the road. You can hear the vehicles passing but after 6:30pm it was very quiet. Nice sunset view. Nobody around during our stay (arrived by 3pm and left by 9am the next morning).

name: garage zap trap
description:
adress. rehmanji str. celle. +255 (754) 283 667
+255 (784) 293 667
 E.mail zamtrap01@hotmail.com
A very serious and profesional garage for 4x4, Toyota, Land rover (many Defenders...) with a lot of spar parts and a team very friendly and compétent...the Price was very honest for all the Time they give me. It's a very good adress and i warmely recommend it.

name: Schuman garage
description:
Garage for différents campers, Ford and Land rover, also Isuzu, ..
they have repaired a leak on air conditioned on m'y Defender...good contact

name: Ikwiriri Catholic Mission
description:
A Catholic mission closed to St. Francis of Assisi Ikwiriri Parish. But not the same location. We were in contact with FR. Roland Kashaga from the catholic mission in Kibiti who organized the option to park here.
0757660515
In the complex there is a  kindergarden, clinic and a residence for the sisters.
We paid a small donation to the sisters.
They allowed us to connect to electricity.
There are rainwater tanks in place.

name: Theo’s village
description: Rooms that are so neat and spacious with lovely showers and hot water. Tv, secure parking, aircon, restaurant. Beautiful gardens and even playpark for kids. Very secure and a beautiful view of Kilimanjaro. Right at the mountain on the road to Dar Es Salaam from the Kenya border in the town of Marangu. Paid TS4000 which included a lovely breakfast. Will recommend this place anyday

name: Cleopatra Backpackers Hostel
description:
Relax with the whole family, friends or alone at this peaceful and unique place to stay.
Our Home stay is located in the hill area (CAPRI POINT), Where you can view the beauty of Mwanza while enjoying the beautiful sunset at Lake Victoria. We also have a kitchen for our guests with strong WiFi internet.
We always say - Once you find us, you will never want to leave.

name: Ngiri public campsite
description: Public TANAPA campsite. Green open space. Wood for 10$. Property and buildings have lights during the night.

name: Sea View Beach Resort
description:
This hotel has a secure parking lot opposite the hotel.  We parked next to its northern wall. This area does not belong to the hotel, but they said that the security people will guard us also.
Contact Gilbert for all the facilities. 0656379893
Ok for one night when you are on  your road.

name: Peter Pan Beach
description:
The best real Italian restaurant on Zanzibar with great stuff.
3 rooms are also available.

name: NFC
description:
This NFS station accepts visa cards.
Price as in all other ones. They also let us fill water in our water tanks.

name: Ottawas petrol Station
description:
A gas station with a huge area full of  out of order trucks. They allowed us to park in the compound.  You have to be self sufficient.
There is security in the compound. Ask 10,000 TS for the parking.

name: On the Road
description: It is not easy to find a stop for a break or sleep on B6 road. This spot is a good hiden open small space 50 meters from the main road, next to a high voltage pole. No Vodacom signal.

name: Wild camping - flat spot, just off the main road with a beautiful view
description:
Exit the main road, take the gravel parallel road and continue driving until you find an open spot on your left hand side, overlooking the valley.

Beautiful!

name: Baraka mechanic, all cars
description: African mechanic that certainly knows about Land Cruisers and Land Rovers. Works clean and can organize parts.

name: Dangerous area
description: We stopped here to stay for one night. Though it's safe, but in the middle of the night a few police officers came to pick us up and brought us to the police station. They explained that this area is not safe because there is a very bad criminal person around. So it's probably better to avoid staying over night around this place.

name: Safari Blue Tours
description:
This is where all the Safari Blue trips start from . The dhows sails  out to the island from here. Speak to the man on the beach at the little wooden house. And organise your trip from here . Cost much less than the normal tour places in town. 
All the boats move together the whole day . 
Sandbank stop with fruit 
Snorkel next to island in a semi lagoon( no fish)
Island fish lunch and few stalls. 
Price range from 30 us to 70 us depending on where you book. 
But all companies move together the whole day. We booked through Sinbad tours but you can get it cheaper .

name: Butcher shop
description: Really fresh European meat. Lamb chops for South Africans . Drywors and biltong. Also frozen seafood. Only place selling it in Dar es Salaam- and probably Tanzania

name: Community levy charge official
description: On the route to Africa Safari Glamping there was a boom gate. Not sure if it is legit. He had a uniform on and was driving a cruiser. They wanted 20 US pp . Maybe use a road more west or east   that joins this road as near as possible to African Glamping to avoid this gate.  We went to sleep at Nyasa for 10 US $ pp .

name: Nyasa lodge and camping
description:
We arrived late afternoon and staff was very friendly. You camp under huge fever trees on a green lawn. Bar and you can order food from the chef. 

There is a very clean and neat tiled hot water showers and flush toilets.  There is a swimming pool, although we did not swim. Water looked fine. 

They brought a dustbin for us and said we could make use the stoep lounge area to relax. 

They arranged for a Masai to stand guard the whole evening and we had no problems. 

All in all we would sleep here again. 

No card facilities, only cash. 
Few concrete braai rings and a tap nearby. 

Jabir +225 762731776
info @nsyalodge.com

name: Wild camp below old dam
description: We had lunch here about 150m from the road. It looks like a dam wall that broke. But the road splits of 45 degrees so you not really visible from the main road.

name: Texas Lodge
description:
Clean rooms. Lokal toilets and cold shower, but nice for the price. 10 000 tsh for a double room. Cafe next door serves ok dinner and breakfast. Parking space with a security guard during the night.

They play some loud music in the evening.

name: Masahani inn hotel
description: the hotel is near the border.  To get there you must take an unpaved street.  Room with two beds and breakfast 40,000 TZ. Parking inside.

name: Bicycle Shop
description:
Small bicycle repair shop. Stationed in the first green garage door, of the three.
They don't have much, but tools and some basics they do have :)

name: Camping on the hill top
description: Wild camping option just off the main road. We had a quiet night st the spot and could not hear any traffic. There are 2 possible spots to stand. Turn off the main road at these coordinates (-10.91517, 38.02992) and continue straight on the road for a few meters and you could camp right there... If you want a bit more privacy you can drive in on the main road and when the road opens out a bit you turn right and go up the slope (there is a very vague path) untill you get to the hill in the photos.

name: Spot on hill in forest
description: Great little spot we found on a small hill next to a small forest. We spent a quiet night here. 2 motorcycle drove past but did not stop..The spot is close to the main road but we heard no traffic. Will need 4x4 as a bit of rocks to get over. At these coordinates (-9.65393, 34.65025) turn off the main road and follow the tracks to the top. There a few open spaces where you can choose to camp.

name: Agave coffee shop
description: A proper coffee shop! Not often found in Tanzania. On the main Dar to Morogoro highway at Ubena Zomozi sisal estates. quiet and peaceful. Attractive light menu and attentive staff.

name: wild camp few km from rwanda border
description:
The wp nearby is now not easy to get to due to wildfires
We stayed closer the the road by the base of a unfinished pylon, still ok view, no locals, can hear the road a little but nothing too bad,
Easy to get too, good for early/late border crossing, view is ok, ground uneven but possible to find level. Tight uphill bend maybe difficult for big rigs.

name: Shanti Café Zanzibar
description: perfect restaurant for vegans or vegetarians! takes a while to get the food, but it's totally worth it!

name: Zanzest Vegan Hotel
description:
This hotel was heaven on earth!
We payed 25 pppn for a lovely bungalow with huge shower. Breakfast was lovely, with a variety of vegan options, nothing was missing. Staff was very welcoming and friendly as well as the cute cats. The owner, an Irish woman called Anna, is so helpful and happy to have You!
The place itself is located in an almost private secluded little bay, where You can go swimming and having fun in the turquoise waves at high tide.
Every evening they offer a new local, creative and totally vegan menu which is surprisingly good!
All in all, the hotel is very cozy yet fancy and stylish with heavenly food and view.

name: Meat king, butchers
description:
New location, only frozen meat but high quality, also fish.
The nice supermarkets on town sell Meat king packed ham slixes and other meats, it is better price here from the suppliers

name: Menai Beach Bungalows
description:
Welcome to paradise!
Situated at Menai bay, a beautiful, protected area with islands and mangroves, which You can explore in a guided snorkeling or kayak tour, respectively, the bungalows perfectly fit into the landscape.
Camping is available for 25 bucks per tent upon request, but the rooms are also very lovely, every single one like a honeymoon suite. They start from about 50 bucks pn and include a bathroom with hot shower and breakfast.
The restaurant is located directly at the beach, which is completely deserted, apart from a few fishermen.
So, if You want to skip the touristy part of Zanzibar, come directly to Menai Beach Bungalows!

name: Kowere Guest House
description: Cheap rooms available, prices changed a little (first 8,000 a room, then 9,000, then 15 but it's ok you can have it for 10). All rooms ensuite, but without water running the whole time (needs to be turned on I think). Managed by a sweet older lady and her son who speaks some English

name: Bike Mechanic
description: Small bike shop and a few mechanics hanging out. Nothing too elegant but they get the job done in a pinch. You need to walk back between a few shops to get there. They aren’t on the street

name: Auto Rover
description:
Excellent land rover parts supplier,
29 years in business, very helpful and knowedgable

name: kisegese forest reserve
description: 7miles off the road to campsite in the forest. stone table and benches. licked toilet water from a stream nearby. very quiet

name: Bicycle mechanic
description: Small bike mechanic, sorted out some spokes for me after breaking mine. Easy to spot with the telltale rack of bikes outside

name: Kahawa Dodoma
description: Nice coffee shop with baked goods. Good free wifi. Inside the shoppers plaza

name: Ndisiga Joint
description: Fantastic roadside restaurant next to gas station. Issa is a great host, and an overlander himself.

name: Raha Lodge
description:
15,000 shillings for running water, shower, western toilet. Bike fit in room. Speak no English at all.

It looks like it’s still a bit under construction so things still feel nice and new. It’s a ways back from the main road and the door to reception is furthest back. It’s on just past the police checkpoint on the right if you’re coming from Dodoma. Good for one night after seeing the Amazing Grace reviews

name: Klein‘s Gate to Serengeti
description:
This is the entry to Serengeti National Park.

Here you pay the outrages fees:
Foreign car net weight (empty) 2‘000 - 3‘000kg (so most Land Cruiser or Land Rover) is per day (12hours) US$150, Tanzania license plate only about US$10. Foreign adult US$70, child up to 15yrs US$20.

We arrived 17h and asked if it is ok to stay outside the park, but at the gate. They agreed and were friendly and allowed us to choose any place. We chose where there are 3 tables with benches and umbrellas on a grassy spot some 60m from the office, which was great. Wash room nearby.
At sunset the ranger came to tell us to stay in the car at night as regularly lions walk around.

name: House of Ice Cream
description: Ice cream parlor with a variety of flavor. Both traditional scoop and soft serve. I love ice cream after a long day of riding.

name: Musoma Business Care
description: Small local supermarket that sells local gouda cheese 22,000 tzs 1kg, Nutella, good cashew nuts and more.

name: Grumeti and Ikona Wildlife Management Area
description: Public access only on main road T17. No entry in Ikona WMA (North) or Grumeti Game Reserve (South) without permit. We saw lions next to the main road so we took a smaller road to be closer to them. At some point a ranger truck came and told us we might have to pay a fine for trespassing! In the end all worked out to the best, but be aware that you may have trouble if you decide to drive around the very tempting safari tracks.

name: Vikonge forest wildcamp
description: Not so far from the road but well hidden in the forest we enjoyed a very quiet night here. From the gravel road (that starts/ends) in Vikonge village, there is a little track to the east that goes inside the forest. Just follow this track for a few hundred meters until you are not seen anymore from the main road. There is light traffic only on this road so lo worries about the traffic. We could hear a few cars and motorcycles that passed by in the evening but after 9PM it was totally quiet. Enjoy!

name: Amory Supermarket
description: Little but best supermarket in town we could find. Quite a lot of rather unconventional things (for Tanzanian standards) like Nutella, European shampoo and even ice cream! Frozen meat available, but no fresh vegetables or fruits.

name: Serengeti NP Ikoma Gate
description: Another entry gate to Serengeti. Payment by credit cards only. Avoid at lunch time. Many people including students in buses come to have a picnic before entering the park. 3g with Vodacom.

name: Dodoma Siesta Inn
description:
Clean hotel double room TSH 46.000 incld breakfast. Very clean bathroom. Toilet paper, soap, towel. 
Parked the car and caravan next to room NR 1 to get electricity. Very hard mattress! Slept I our own bed.
staff speaks very good English.

name: Abandoned field
description: Turn off road, turn after ten metres turn left and follow the track as it turns right. I went about 100m down the track and camped on the left but you could camp anywhere. Hard to see from road. No people during the night.

name: amphoro hotel
description: lodge with bar and restaurant. very clean and a bit better than you would expect.

name: Green Nungwi
description:
Hotel/Hostel
There is one dorm available. I paid $23 USD. Certainly more expensive than overland options across Africa but it’s Zanzibar so Zanzibar prices.
Delicious breakfast included in the morning. 
Good security all night, felt safe leaving the bike in the courtyard

name: Etanejo Laundry and Drycleaning
description: We negotiated a bulk price for laundry of 5 people and some bedding and blankets. Extremely professional setup and service. Collection and drop can be arranged from town. Also have a drop point in Rock Cory Shopping Mall and CCM Building along Magongoro Road. +255759682898 Vincent

name: Nyange Farm
description:
❗Must WhatsApp in advance❗
Finally a campsite with an amazing Kilimanjaro view! You camp on a flat lawn with no shade. Flush toilets and hot showers available (the latter is to be finished in a few days). Farm atmosphere with crops, bananas, fish ponds, chickens, geese and a dog around. Don't just show up as sometimes they do events at the camping area. They like to spend time with their guests. Living (owner's name): +255 712 046 283. Unstable Vodacom internet. Paid 10 USD ppn.

name: Victoria Lodge
description: Newish lodge in town. Decent facilities and parking available. Right next to the bust station where it’s very noisy and loud speaker announcements start at 6am sharp. Tsh. 20,000 per room

name: Lemara eco camp
description: A wonderful surprise, between Kisaki and the entrance gate of Selous NP. Friendly staff, delicious dinner and clean ablution blocks. 20 dollar for a tent. Worth a visit!

name: Hillary, car mechanic
description:
We had problems with our car. Hillary is a very reliable and good mechanic. Everything was fixed, he knows what he is doing. 
Driving into Ifunda in the direction of Iringa, you pass the police station at the left, go after 50 meters to the right. There you find him next to the road.

name: Afroil Petrol Station
description: New gas station with well stocked convenient store. VISA payment accepted

name: MBC Pork & Grill Lounge
description: Delicious food with a view of Kilimanjaro (when it isn't covered in clouds). Very good value for money, we had a very healthy serving of fried beef with rice, beans, spinach and salad for 8000tsh. There is also a bar and looks like it would be a vibe in the evenings.

name: Spot near Tarangire NP
description: Just a overnight spot 600 m away from Same - Kisiwani Road. A place, where clay was extrated in former times. Nothing special. Bit difficult to find a level spot around. Nearly no shadow. Not visible from the road. Calm night. No one disturbed us. No people seen. No Vodacom signal.

name: Monty's Carwash
description:
Monty's Carwash in Mwanza 

Good professional carwash near the Yacht Club Campsite. Cleaning with high pressure available. For my Toyota Hilux I paid 10,000 TSH, including underbody cleaning, but I didn't order the cleaning of the camper on it. 

The roof for shadow is approx. 3,07 m high.

The intensive cleaning took 50 minutes.

name: Pine Forest Camp
description: The wild camp at the lookout is no longer usable, so I turned back and found a forest road. You drive down the forest road about 200m and you reach an intersection of 3 tracks. If you camp the downhill part of the intersection you cannot be seen from the road. No sign cars have been down the track for a long time. No one passed. You can still hear the road noise from the main road.

name: Unused Road
description: Drove down the track about 200m, and camped at the side and was not visible from the main road. It doesn't look like anyone has used the track for a long time. No one visited, its not near villages.

name: Milo Oil
description: Petrol station that accepts visa payments. Hard to find in Tanzania

name: rock shungu camp
description:
Lovely location, basic but great with an amazing sea view. Very nice beach with no people and no tourists. You can make beautiful beach walk. Only local fisherman that provide fish.
You can use a nice terrace over the beach and the ocean. Water and kitchen.
We were parked on a nice and very quiet spot overlooking the beach, there is also electricity, so you can plug you.
You can use toilet and shower of the camp.
3G available.
Yuma is a very nice and helpful person but speak only Swahili.
We haven't seen the prices yet but we think they will be fair.
This place is highly recommanded because it's a very good place to enjoy beach life and easily spend a few days here.
Contact Aref before coming to be informed of the conditions and itinerary

name: Tawaqal Petrol Station
description: Big petrol station that accepts VISA payment. Has a convenience store on site and a wheel alignment and service bay under construction. Large washrooms with showers inside.

name: Speed check
description: Corrupt police with a speed gun. Reduce to 50

name: Bunyoni Overland Camp
description: Large overlanding camp next to the lake, clean and tidy. Secondary site for overland trucks where roof top tents must also go. Not that many flat spots though. Bar and restaurant. Small craft and curio shop. Free wifi. Lots of Overlander Trucks with big and noisy Groups.

name: Agip Hotel Campsite
description: 35000 for 2 people, 10000 for a very good cappuccino, meals around 10$. Camping on grass on both sides of driveway into carpark. Electricity available with extension cord near barbecue. Noisy as in town between main roads.

name: Masaka Backpackers
description: Simple backpackers out of town, which also offers camping. Basic facilities, but very friendly. (10,000 Ugandan shillings per night for camping or 18,000 for a dorm or 40,000 for double room).

name: Lake Nabugabo Holiday Camp
description: Very beautiful camping area on the shore of the lake, very tidy, absolutely quiet. There are also chalets available.

name: Mpanga Forest Eco Campsite
description: Basic site on the edge of the forest.

name: Kontiki
description: Large hotel complex that allows camping on lawn.

name: Red Chilli Rest Camp
description: Busy campsite near ferry, mostly people staying in preset up tents, very noisy at 5.00am! Can be long queues for toilets and showers as tents are not ensuite. Cold showers and flush toilets, didn't use bar or restaurant. $8 pppn and you park in the car park, not great

name: Ziwa Rhino Lodge
description:
Nice campsite in the Rhino conservation area. Clean ablutions. Rhino tracking $30/pp + reserve entrance fee $20/pp.
Camping costs $20/pp/pn in Dec 2021. Could perhaps be a bit negotiable if you ask Salim (the boss).

name: Nile River Explorers
description: Nice camping area, great view down to the Nile.  Also a centre for water based activities and quad bikes.

name: Virunga Camp
description: Adequate for a night – grassy area for ground tents and gravel lot for RTT and access to basic toilet/shower facilities.  Security around all night. Shilling 70,000 for 2 people for bed and breakfast

name: Kalebask camping
description: Stunning, stunning,stunning! A beautiful lakeside campsite set in manicured gardens, great restaurant, bar. You can hire the canoes, do a boot tour, go swimming in the lake. $5 pppn

name: Nile Rest Camp
description: Possibly the best view of the nile! Beautiful spot, with great food, bar, swimming pool and you can get Rolex delivered!! If you’re camping with your car, ask the manager for the back route into the camp. Follow signs for Black Lantern/Nile Porch and the camp is just next door in the same compound. (30,000 shllings per night).

name: Craters Campsite
description: Just opened campsite (we were the fifth guest). No view over QENP, but beautiful park-type terrain with high trees. Ten minutes walk to boundary of park (for view over plain, not for entry). Very friendly management. Ablutions were still under construction, but very clean.

name: Red Chilli
description: Note: moved in December 2013. Many sites and guides still refer to the old location. Mainly guesthouse with many tour groups. Reasonably quiet in suburb of Kampala (can be noisy over weekends). Beautiful swimming pool. Good Wi-Fi.

name: Griffin Falls Camp
description: Beautiful forest, rich with birdlife and primates. 10 000 UGX for camping. Friendly staff, hardly facilities.

name: CVK Resort Camping
description: Beautiful, quiet spot with lake view. Prices are dependent on place on camping and negotiable. Management is very upselling oriented.

name: Hotel Nakayima
description: Cramped courtyard of hotel. Ablutions in one of the rooms.

name: Whispering Palms Campsite
description: Superb property with camping only. Basic ablutions with cold shower. Outside tap and sink. Access to firewood and braai. Small forest at end of property with good bird life. Electricity if you have long extention cable.  Quiet, park environment at walking distance of Fort Portal. Friendly management.

name: Moses Campsite Sipi Falls
description: Great view over waterfall, minimal facilities.Electricity not reliable. Fast mobile internet. Friendly staff.

name: Murchison River Lodge
description: Really nice lodge and good campsite. Good clean ablution facilities. Shared standpipe and fire pit. When we were there we had an issue with a flycamp and overflow staff quarters. Good service recovery by owner though. Also offer to put food/bricks in freezer.  Cost:US$10

name: Nkuruba Community
description: Lovely basic campsite with lake access for swimming. Nice lawn and tree shade (not a lot of privacy though.) Donkey-heated showers, old (a bit dirty). Flushing toilets. Two kinds of taps: pumped water from the lake and drinkable, tasty village water. Restaurant on site. Curious, friendly, professional staff. Walks, coffee and tree plantation tours. Monkeys. Cost: UGX 20,000 for camping, 15000 for bandas.

name: Chimpanzee Forest Guesthouse
description:
Nice campsite at a tea plantation. Space for ground tents and they also have two tents. One space for roof top tent or truck. Also shelters with chairs, tables and benches. Standpipes and two fire pits. Nice bar and restaurant. Good views. Good clean ablutions with donkey burner.  Ask about overland trucks coming in as they tend to take over. 

Cost:UGX35.000 pppn / UGX40.000 dinner / UGX7.000 Beer

name: Rwenzori Mountaneering Services
description: Small lodge that offers five chalets and camping. The lodge has hydro power so there is access to electricity. There is also a bar and restaurant. The community offers walks.  Cost:UGX10,000

name: Simba Safari Camp
description: Dorms and rooms, and a big space for overland trucks and a decent campground. Bar and restaurant. Free wifi.  Cost:US$9

name: Amajyambere Community Camp
description: Some bandas and a dorm with four beds. Camping in between bandas. Very basic ablutions. Bar and restaurant. Activities. 30m from the park gate.  Cost:US$5pppn

name: Ishasha NP Campsite Two
description: Camp with no facilities, but plenty of peace and quiet (except for the wildlife!).

name: Nile River Camp
description: Very nice with a pool, bar and excellent restaurant on the Nile some 8kms North of Jinja. Run by South Africans – and even has hot showers that work and a swimming pool!

name: Rock Classic Hotel
description: Camping in the Parking Lot in front of the Hotel. There we also had free Wifi (average). Toilets behind Reception (okay) and cold Showers at the Pool 'Health Club' (bad and smelly). There is a Bumper in Front of the Entrance Gate that produces a lot of Noise when Trucks shred above it (luckily not too much Traffic at Night). Okay for one Night. Still 50.000 UGX (11,60 Euro) for the Car and two People.

name: The Haven
description:
Very nice, quite and green Campsite directly at the Nile. Water Taps, free Wifi  and free Electricity (they even got a long extension for us) on Sites! Ablutions were great, hot Shower. Martin the manager is very unfriendly (so don’t expect a warm welcome). 
You can watch the Rafting Boats pass from your Chair. Nice Pool. Overlander Price (foreign Number plate) 10 USD pppn (also payable in UGX).

name: Nagusokopire Campsite (Kidepo Valley UWA)
description: Excellent location, flush toilets, cold shower. Two shelters for the rain and an observation point with binoculars. Unstable MTN network and internet connection. We had lions in the camp at night.

name: Acholi Inn (and camping)
description:
Camping on hotel lawn, poor facilities. Free excellent internet

We used the hotel. Nice rooms, extremely helpful and friendly staff. Nice pool and good food that can be eaten anywhere (restaurant, garden, pool), bar facilities. Building work going on.

name: Lake Albert Lodge And Campsite
description: Awesome location & facilities, make this a stop on the way to Fort Portal. Have a drink with Bruce Martin the owner!!!!

name: Nyinabulitwa Resort
description: Spacious but loads of locals harassing you, limited flat ground

name: The Backpackers Place
description: Backerpacker crash pad, not bad place if you waiting for the ferry. Ferry was overbooked so we couldn’t get on

name: Sesse Island Beach Resort
description: Great beach, avg facilities but big trees and nice grass to camp on

name: Igongo Cultural Centre
description: Nice setting, gift shops, restaurant, excellent cappuccino, unobtrusive staff, very informative guided tour through museum

name: Queen Elizabeth Safari Camp
description:
This place is absolutely beautiful. Stunning view and very quiet. 

The owner is very kind and helpful. 

Hot shower and good clean toilets. 

Secure place to park. 

Good for 4x4/RTT/Ground tent 

The owner wasn’t there when we arrived but someone went and found him. He can be contacted before your stay by calling +256703011104 

$15pppn

name: Bullbush river camp
description:
Nowadays called Bullbush River Camp and the owner is Ugandan. You can get here without paying park fees but you still drive the (quite good) gravel road through qenp ... And the have a guide/driver that can drive you into the park and give you a walking tour for free.

Grassy place next to the river. Lots of shade and a free campfire every night. 10 dollars per person per night.

name: Diamond Complex
description:
Guarded parking lot of the Hotel. Used by local trucks. Ok for one night.

6$ per truck

name: Ruhija Community Rest Camp
description: Nice campsite with view over Bwindy NP. Space for camp and also cottages available. We camped and could use the balcony of a cottage for the view over the forrest. The road to this site is trough the NP but if you are on transit you don't need to pay the park fee. Aldo there are leaving 26 people from this village paying hundreds of dollars to see the gorillas, the Uganda government lack to give power to this village. There is a generator if you want power. We paid 30.000 pp.

name: Crater Safari Lodge
description: We where driving around the crater lakes and found this perfect place. This is a 5 star lodge and we where lucky, they allowed us to camp in the garden! We could use the toilet and showers of the guides rooms and of course we could use the other facilities like bar and restaurant. The view over the lake is very nice and the food is absolute delicious! We paid 25.000 usx pp for camping. Food and drinks is seperare. They probably only allow camping when there are not so many guests so you have to be lucky we think :-)

name: Ruboni Community Camp
description: Camping is possible with a car on the parking lot. There is also a bar and restaurant with a Nice view. There is nightwatch and we got a key of a room to use the toilet. We paid 5 USD pp. Hot shower is possible but it takes a lot of time.

name: Rwenzori View Guesthouse
description: Very nice place created by Dutch/UK couple. Camping is on the parking lot (away from the road), access to close by toilet and hot shower. Free WiFi, good restaurant and the buffet was superb! We checked a lot of places in this area but if you want to stay in Fort Portal, this is the place you want to stay.

name: Crows Nest
description: We stayed here one night and treated ourselves to a small cabin for $12 (40 000s). The cabins look out over Sipi falls and has an amazing location. You do not have to put up with the bathrooms at Moses' place when you have this right next door. Bathrooms are clean, pit toilets and warm water as the town had no electricity during our stay. Beds are clean with mosquito nets. You can camp here. Monkeys in the camp. There is a restaurant and bar here. Tour guides are also around so they will take you if you ask. 20000s to camp pp. Friendly staff too.

name: Edirisa
description:
A local run place next to the lake. It's very quiet and has a beautiful spot at the lakeside. 

The food is good, but a little bit pricey. 

Camping is $4 or 13600 Ush 
There are also rooms (dorm, double)

name: Buhoma Community Campsite
description: We stayed here two nights after a recommendation from friends. The site is in the bwindi reserve and you do not have to pay to enter here. $12 pp for camping here, nice grassy areas and bikes have to stay in parking lot. Place has a restaurant, but we haven't eaten here as it is $10 per meal. More expensive than the US. If you are lucky you may see gorillas in the campsite, as our friends did. There is fast wifi- when the staff are not using it- which is most of the day. Staff are friendly but pushy on the gorilla tracking. We have decided not to do it due to the exceptional costs, and none of it goes back to conservation or the community. Stunning forest scenery, but a massive tourist spot.

name: Murchison Falls NP Gate
description:
The fees are exorbitant:
USD40,- per person per day
USD30,- per motorcycle per day
working out to USD70,- pp per day
excl. any lodging at all.

A foreign car costs USD50,-(ten times more than a local car) per day.

name: Queen Elizabeth Bush Camp
description: Great place for a bit of a treat- 50$ for a private tent for 2 people with big breakfast included, beautifully clean with good beds and spotless amenities, electricity in the tents. Loads of hippos walk though the camp at night, with babies in tow, right between the tents- hippos and hyenas are heard constantly. Staff are very friendly and welcoming, a good stop on the way to Ishasha. Good restaurant and bar. They let us park in the turning circle and plug into electricity.

name: fish eagle camp
description: great View over the crater lake! very friendly owner, Mr. Viktor.

name: Bisina banks
description: If you looking for a peaceful place to rest for few days, that the spot. If you expect to see wildlife, do not come there. Except few birds and grazing cattle nothing more. But really great area.

name: Enfuzi Community Campsite
description: Lovely camp with nice shade under huge trees where you can camp under. Really nice team and owners. Local shower and nice restaurant. On this place you can enjoy nature. Swim in crater lake, observe at least 4 different species of monkeys in one day, and plenty of birds. Privce for camping 10000ugx pp and Bandas 15000ugx pp. if you want book in advance tel: +256 782972756.

name: Above Tea Plantation
description: Flat and quiet place in area where is difficult to find wild camping place for night. Large grass are with nice view on tea plantation

name: Lake Bisina
description: One of the most quiet place we have camp in Uganda, much better than other side and ferry is free to cross. No many thing to do except rest.

name: Ramco Gas (Office)
description:
Filled our german bottle within 5 min.
11.800 UGS per Kilo
Soon they have camping cartridges
office number 00256393261369
New Adress: RamcoGas, Head Office, 60 Ntinda Road, Kampala Phone. 0393261369 email. ramcocare@ramcogas.com website. www.ramcogas.net

name: Kabalega Diner
description: Nice stop for fresh coffee, breakfast, lunch and dinner. Open everyday 7AM - 11PM (8 December 2019).

name: Kanyiyo Pabidi
description: Not an actual campsite but they let us stay in our truck, note that it is about 8km inside the park so fees apply. Chimp trekking was amazing here, hot showers and long drop toilets, they did us a deal as we went trekking the next day

name: Amasiko Homestay and campsite
description: Beautiful located on a peninsula at lake bunyonyi, camping at lake and banda's available, price camping with own tent 5 dollar, banda full board 35 dollar pp. Dug-out canoe and swimming possible. Good food together with family

name: Stitch And Sew Garage Services (Toyota Authorized)
description: Good general large garage, they do most things including making us a new exhaust bracket. Was recommended by a local business woman

name: YES Young Encouragement Services Hostel
description: A really nice friendly hostel that allows camping either in parking area or on grass lawn at rear, all profits go to the owners various projects inc orphanage and a centre for HIV children. Hot showers and decent toilets, you can order dinner and beers available. A bargain at 10,000 shillings pppn. We ended up here as we could get our Daf truck in, unlike others near by. A great place to support.

name: Brownstone Country Home
description: Its not a campsite but as there is not much in the Lira area I mention it. Its a wonderful place out of town and you can camp on nice grassy field. I could use shower of one of the cabins, wifi but I could not connect to the server, good food and drinks. I was the first to do camping ever and there was no price. First they asked 20 dollar and when I told them it is too much they told me to pay what i can afford. I gave them 25.000 shilling including breakfast

name: Toore Royal Cottages
description: A perfect stop-over. We couldn't find a campsite and decided to stay at this place. It turned out to be the cleanest hotel we've stayed in in Africa, with modern & new rooms. Very good, pro-active service as well. We paid 100.000 shilling for a room including full English Breakfast.

name: Tripple M Resort
description:
Simple, basic, local hotel. Small rooms with private toilet and (cold) shower. There is a parking lot where you can camp, but they have a very loud sound system there to attract customers or something. We had a room in the back. 

Rooms are UGX 20.000 (we thought it was per person, but when we got the bill that was for the room). Nice fried chicken and chips for 12.000 and large beer 3400. 
Camping would have been 15.000.

name: Kafu River Lodge
description: Next to the main road. Grassy field were you can park your car between the cottages. Noise from the road. Good for an overnight. 20.000 UGX pppn. Cold shower in public ablution. Hot shower in one of the cottages if you are allowed.

name: Katunguru, Tembo Safari Lodge
description:
Basic campsite with good view over the Kazinga channel and the Queen Elisabeth   NP. Bar and restaurant which we didnot use. Cold shower and long drop toilets.
We paid 15000 ugs pppn including the car

name: Lake Kasenda, Afritastic Planet Ruigo
description:
Big recreation area with small campground at the Lake Kasenda. Some shade of trees and you can use the shelters. Possibiity to swim in the Lake.
Restaurant and bar. Simple ablution with cold shower, although the staff will heat it up when you ask for it.  Beautiful environment.

name: Kalinzu Forest Visitors Center
description: Great grass spot for camping, with Chimpanzee trekking from the campground. Excellent staff . Flush toilet with cold shower. Camping 2 dollars (10,000 UGX) with trekking at (140,000 UGX) 40 dollars. Highly recommend the trek!

name: Ishasha NP Campsite One
description: Great campsite , showers and long drop. Awesome view and in the park.  5 us to camp + 24h park fees

name: Gorilla Nest Campsite at Bwindi View Lodge
description: Nice campsite for rooftop... Green, secluded, flat. Wanted $10 pp negotiated $45 for 2 for 3 nights. Noisy open bar late into night. Noisy early morning people leaving for gorilla treks. Friendly staff. But owner rude and unable to receive any negative feedback. Good food. No power at campsite. Entire camp solar powered by day. Quiet generator from 6:45 to 10:45. Showers lukewarm at its best.

name: Villa Katwe B&B and Camping
description: Cozy, basic, clean and great vibe. 10 $ for camping including breakfast. Private rooms for 35 $ B&B.

name: Ewaka Hostel Sh.30 000,- pppn camping
description: Small setup; almost like camping in the nice garden of a private home. Too small for big rigs and even my landcruiser barely fitted in the garden, but if you have separate tent you'll be fine. Watch out for dog poo though. Clean ablutions. Quiet neighborhood. I had a pizza delivered but there is a market nearby so you can buy groceries as well.

name: Rushaga Gorilla Camp
description: Lovely, flat camp ground with incredible views of Bwindi. Clean facilities, warm showers, and lovely staff.  can try to negotiate (in Nov 2021). Nice lodge on a great setting. Great views to Bwindi forest on its side. We camped the first night, negotiated $15/pppn, normal price nowdays is $20/pppn. Pricey, for what you get. Shower and toilet in restaurant’s facilities. Or they can open one room for you as your ablution. For the other night we took a room: ”luxury” room was nice with good view. Way too expensive (~$300/night!) from front desk, but you may get it for third the price via booking.com (with full board). So check booking.com! Lunch nice, dinner ok. Friendly staff. Rushaga gate is less than km away, if you want to go tracking from there.

name: Nyero rock paintings
description: Camping right next to the rock paintings! Very nice spot next to the guards office. Very friendly guy who says people camp here all the time so no problem. They do ask 10.000 ush per night and there are no facilities. Some people living nearby and some traffic as well, but everybody left us alone, except for an occasional hello.

name: Mount Moroto Hotel
description:
Hotel with big garden in which you can easily camp. Nice view on the mountain. Ablutions are available by a room which they open for you. Expensive, at 40.000 pn per vehicle but they allowed us to sleep in the room as well. Normally a room costs at least 70.000 ush pn. Bathroom is pretty basic but with hot shower and toilet has a seat. Restaurant is very populair amongst locals and expats so order in time. The food is okay. Quite cheap. They have some fresh juices and of course beer. Breakfast is 15.000 and is an excellent buffet with eggs, fruit, bread, pancakes, scones, you name it!
Night can be very noisy in the rooms, but camping is quiet.

name: Buffalo Base
description: Small guesthouse with basic facilities. Restaurant with set menu each day. Camping area can handle up to maybe 4 cars. Secure parking. Room costs 40.000 ush and camping 17.000 ush. Ablutions simple but clean.

name: Apoka hostel and campsite
description: Nice place with decent bandas for 70.000 and camping for 30.000. Ablutions are quite new and in reasonable state. They build a big campfire every night. Waterhole on site so there is ample wild live walking along the premises. Very small restaurant with which you have to order at least some hours in advance. There is a generator but it is not so noisy. Friendly people.

name: Kluges Guest Farm
description:
Guest farm with campsite (also used by some overlander trucks). Nice grounds and facilities, including restaurant, bar and swimming pool. 
They charge camping UGX35.000 pppn or $40,-pppn for a tent including breakfast for non residents.

name: Busingiro ecotourism camp
description: This camp is as basic as it gets. A small stretch of grass in the forest with (at a small walking distance) an old and poorly maintained ablution block (no water) and on site a kitchen (also no water). Friendly people though. They will bring you some water if you want. Situated at the end of a very small path so big rigs will probably not be able to fit through.

name: Pakuba Safari Lodge
description:
We stopped at this lodge for lunch during our game drive. Lodge is open, but also still underconstruction. Excellent views over Lake Albert. Very nice staff, good choices of mains. A perfect lunch stop! 

For lunch (main and dessert) including coffee or tea we paid UGX35.000pp.

name: Masindi Hotel
description: Lovely campground behind old colonial hotel. Katherine Hepburn stayed here during the making of the African Queen. Good facilities.

name: Top Of The World
description: Brandnew Lodge with Camping. Cost 10$/pppn. Hot shower in new ablution block. No Electricity, no Wifi. Restaurant cooks on Demand. Big parklot suitable for trucks. The view is magnificent over 3 crater lakes and to Rwenzori mountains.

name: Arra Fishing Lodge
description:
Nice settled by the river Nile, but run-down. Cold open-air shower. Food available on request. Bar with drinks. Visited by locals from Adjumani (especially weekends). Nice staff.
Costs: camping 20'000UGX
rooms; 100'000UGX(single)/120'000UGX (double)

name: Son Risa Mexican
description: Best Mexican food you'll find in Uganda. 18000 for the enchiladas delux. You will not be disappointed.

name: Living Water Resort
description:
Campsite/cottages/restaurant/bar just at "source of the nile" with splendid view where the River Nile leaves Lake Victoria. Either camp under shady trees or on open spot with view of river and lake. Facilities very basic and cold shower only. Friendly and helpful staff.
Camping costs 30'000UGX/p/n

name: Via Via
description: Very nice place. You can camp in the parking lot can no longer camp in the garden with view on small pond and swamp. Good bar and restaurant. Friendly owners and staff.

name: Katente Resort
description: A surprisingly modern and spotlessly clean hotel, conveniently located a day's cycle from Fort Portal. Offering rooms from 30,000 - 40,000 and camping on their nice flat lawn for 10,000 (with access to a room for ablutions). The restaurant was serving "bar snacks", i.e. chips + meat.

name: Forest Exploration Camp
description:
Safe parking for the car at the rangerstation while we were on the trekking tour to Mt. Elgon and for the night before the tour. Nice place in the jungle, absolutely quiet. They have huts too.
The rangers arranged the 5 days Mt. Elgon tour with porters and transport back quite perfect. 
5$ p.p.p.n.
No coverage

name: Kaabong Police Station
description:
Parking lot or lawn in front of the new police station, where we could stay after asking. The head of the station was not too pleased (may be because of the responsibility), but it was late, so we could stay. 
Some of the policemen were very kind and the village is friendly
We ate good and inexpensive in the Dubai Restaurant.
2G with MTN-SIM

name: Nataba Gate - Kidepo NP
description: one of the gates where you have to pay the entrance fee

name: Karurum Gate
description: one of the gates where you have to pay the entrance fee

name: Headquarter of Kidepo NP
description:
Mowed lawn at the headquarter of the park.
After asking we could stay for free, because it was too late to go to Gulu.
(there is a possibility to camp in the next village)
3G with MTN-SIM

name: Wanseko Police Station
description:
Beside the policestation (not to identify), we had to register in a book, very friendly. Village very basic, some small local restaurants.
2G with MTN-SIM

name: Gate of Murchison NP
description: Here you have to fetch your entrance for the boat tours too (but nobody checked them).

name: Mirembe Beach Hotel
description:
A little bit outside of the village at the lake with some jungle around. 2 cars can park in the garden directly at the lake. Quiet even on weekend.
Restaurant ok. 6$ p.p.p.n. after negotiation (for 4 days).
No moskitos, no beach because of high water level.
2G with MTN-SIM

name: Kibale NP Ranger Station
description: Here the chimptracking begins, but the fee is too be payed at the main ranger station (direction Fort Portal). NOTE: 2022 - You can pay here.

name: Kibale NP Head Quarter
description:
Here you have to pay for the chimptracking

200$ p.p.

name: Gardens of Eden
description:
Nice, flat garden in residential area, 10 min. to town on foot.
Sanitary facilities a little bit neglected.
The boys can organize almost everything, mechanics nearby (also come to the place). 
Recommendable Gardens Restaurant  10min away at the market
5$ p.p.p.n.
3G with MTN-SIM

name: QENP Game viewing for free
description: Open space at the lake with hippos, elephants and a lot of other animals.

name: Dave's Cave
description:
At the rim of a crater lake with some shadow and lake-view.
10$ p.p.p.n.

name: Ruhija Gorilla Friends Resort and Campsite
description: Very similar to Ruhija community camp, but this one has a much nicer ablutions and nicer grounds (lots of flowers). The tent camping area is not very private however, as it is right in the middle. This place is also closer to the village so maybe not as quiet. Camping $10, rooms also available with great views. Meals are available from 15000, but I didn't try them. There's a local restaurant just in front, and a rolex stall just down the road. The road from Buhoma to Ruhija is quite decent (at the moment anyway).

name: Byoona Amagara
description: On an island in the lake, this is an amazing place to chill for a few days! They have a secure parking lot at Rutinda dock (-1.269, 29.937) and transfer to the island is free in a dugout canoe (~1 hr, you are expected to paddle) or 25000 for a motorboat. Camping is 12000 per night on a large flat grass field, fairly secluded at the far end of the island. There are also dorms, cabins, and geodomes. The restaurant has a great variety of local and western dishes. There is also a well stocked library, a cinema, pool table, cards, games, swing set, canoes for rent, souvenir shop etc. This place is basically summer camp but with beer. It is deservedly popular so call ahead if you want a room, it can fill up. 0752652788

name: Backpacker's Hostel and Campsite
description: A hostel with pleasant lawn space for overlanders. Quiet enough and secure. 20,000 Ush including​ a decent breakfast. Friendly staff. Good location for visiting the city (but take a boda-boda, the traffic is horrible!). Big rigs might fit in the parking lot.

name: Rwenzori Trekking Service Hostel
description: The base camp of a trekking company in some old miner's buildings converted to rooms and dorms and grassy areas for camping cars. Price was 30,000 Ush incl. breakfast. There's a water spring across the street and hidden behind a school. There's no reason to come here unless you're planning a trek.

name: Karamoja Arts Guesthouse & Camping
description:
Small secure guesthouse with bungalows & camping ground for tents and overlanders just outside the centre of Kotido. Very clean long drop abolutions with cold shower. Very relaxed with hospitable and friendly staff and although there's a primary school at the bottom of the premises it's very quiet. Camping costs 10'000 UGX pppn. 
Call Sharon for inquiries, see number in a review

name: Bushara Camp
description: We just stopped for lunch but they have many  nice tents in a beautiful spot. Good food at resonable price, took some time but this is standard in the area. Well worth the visit.

name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
description: This road can be driven without paying park fees. Lots of game to be seen. Good option for travelling between Bwindi and Fort Portal.

name: City Tyres
description: Good stop for tyres, shocks, brakes, batteries. Free checking done before hand. Had Toyota Landcruiser parts both generic and original. General services done just next door. Amazing chocolate  treats sold in cafe (Cafe Javas).

name: Toyota dealership and service
description: Toyota dealership and service.

name: Bachu's Garage
description:
Great local garage, we had the clutch replaced on our Land Rover by the owner Nico for a very reasonable price. He had his guys working on it within a minute of us agreeing a price (no exaggeration on timing).

We had a spare clutch with us but were told a replacement could have been obtained overnight from Kampala if necessary.

name: Lakeside Campground & Restaurant
description: Slightly shabby looking campground but only affordable option in Lake Mburo National Park at 15,000Ux per person with own tent. Beautiful setting though with lakeside restaurant with views over a large group of hippos who bathe near the lake shore. Apparently they wander through at night occasionally so be careful on any night time excursions to the toilets!

name: Camping at Primary School
description: Camping at Primary School, this is an excellent starting point to hike Mount Napak. Guides can be arranged with the school's headmaster and there is a small tourist office. Price: donation

name: Lim Welo Guesthouse
description: Clean rooms (bed only 15.000 or self contained 25.000), parking on the street but it felt secure. Check the state of the self contained rooms before you pay!

name: Parish Tapach
description: Camping at the Parish in Tapach, great starting point for hiking Mount Moroto, they can arrange a guide (= 25.000). Price for staying overnight: donation

name: Obama and Sons Guesthouse
description: Clean self contained rooms (25.000)

name: Las Vegas Guesthouse
description: Nice rooms with basic facilities, very helpful and funny staff.

name: Kidopo Lodge
description: Very basic guesthouse with minimal facilities but does the job. Staff is helpful, they arranged for secure parking in a place ca. 300 m up the road.

name: Hospital Lodge
description: A relatively new place and definitely the best option in town. Clean self contained rooms, nice facilities.

name: Noah's Ark Campsite
description: Very nice spot for camping! Whereas Craw's Nest and Moses camp have a view into the valley with the waterfall, Noah's Ark faces out of the valley, brilliant views over the plains below. Very friendly and helpful staff. Price 15.000 neg.

name: Missionary Nakapiripirit
description: Camping in the yard of the missionary, good spot to start hiking up Mount Kadam. They've arranged guides for us (which we turned down because they asked for too much USH). We gave the Father a donation for letting us camp on "his" grounds.

name: Engiri Lodge & Campsite
description: A newish lodge with options for camping in your own tent or a preerected tent. The cost including dinner (v.good three course meal) and breakfast is $20 pppn for camping with your tent and $30 for pre erected. Nice spot with friendly staff and clean ablutions

name: Sandton Hotel
description: Wide selection of food, reasonably priced for the location except for the coffee which is very expensive. Hotel also looked nice.

name: Gorilla Mist Camp
description: The campsite is further from the center of town, so a bit quieter. They opened one of the Tented rooms for us to use the hot shower and toilet. Nice views. $10 for camping and 35 000 UGX for buffet dinner that tasted really good.

name: Hoima Cultural Lodge
description:
Lovely, large green plot with thatched chalets, restaurant and large gardens.
Might get busy at weekends as they do wedding celebrations etc, but when we were here there was no one.
80,000 UGS for a large double chalet with enormous bathroom (bargained down from 150,000)
Camping 25,000 (2 people plus car). They open one of the chalets to use the bathroom.
Pretty quiet.
Very friendly staff. Highly recommend as a stopover.

name: Sharp's Island Lodge
description: Beautiful lodge on private island in the middle of Lake Bunyoni. Lovely staff, beautiful garden and lots of birds.

name: Ramco Gas (Filling Station)
description:
They filled 2x 3kg South African CADAC bottles for us here for 66,000 UGX, regardless that one was partially full. They do filling in the mornings until 0800. We showed up late, 0830, and they still filled our tanks in less than 10 minutes. Responsive on WhatsApp +256 0787270702

This is the place for getting your gas bottle filled (the one further west is only the office). We had our German gas bottle filled.

Coming from Kampala you arrive in Seeta and see Jomayi Stones on your left. Turn in there, then second right and follow the road.
They might only be open in the mornings. So maybe best to call or WhatsApp first: +256 787 270 702
Very friendly, very helpful!

name: Ramco Gas
description: You can get your gas bottle refilled, even German ones.

name: Hotel Acacia
description:
Clean hotel at the junction of the road from Bukwa to Sipi Falls (see advice). One room one double bed, toilet and cold shower. 20.000 Uganda shilling pppn (about USD 6,-). 
Advice: There are two roads to Sipi Falls from here. The road past Kiriki (Giriki) is the better one. The shorter road to Kapchorwa is extremely muddy when it rains.

name: Borderstation
description: This is the correct location of the border crossing at Suam. All previous posts are correct, the crossing was quick and easy on both sides with friendly and efficient officers. However, the road on either side is nearly impassable in the rainy season. I had to spend the night at the border post to wait for the road to dry, and even then I dropped the bike twice. Avoid if it has been raining at all. On the positive, the guys on the Kenyan side were very welcoming and friendly and even invited me to eat with them.

name: Panelbeater and paintworkshop
description: Mechanical area with several craftsmen. Welding, panelwork, spraypainting. People aren't used to tourists so use your tourguide as a middleman. Joel Mugabi Isabirye did a good job for us (+256753828288; joelisee@gmail.com)

name: Rwandan Ugandan Cyanika Border
description:
Dutch citizens without Carnet de Passage and with an East African Visa.

Exiting Rwanda was easy, no stamp out only police doing administration.

Entering Uganda we had to pay around USD20,-  payable only in Ugandan Shillings roadtax for one month and received the TIP for free in the Cyanika office.

Then we had to get our Rwandan exit stamp and Ugandan entrance stamp and a gate pass at the police where they checked all the papers.

name: Equator sign
description: Great sign of Uganda Equator for pics. There is a guy who does the water test show for you for 10 000 Ugandan shillings (2,50 USD) and another 10 000 if you want a certificate.
