name: Embassy of the F.D.R.Ethiopia: VISA for non-residents not possible here
description:
Embassy of the F.D.R.Ethiopia: 
27 Prince Charles Dr
Kampala
Uganda

VISA for non-residents not possible here.
We tried today but we needed to be a resident or have a work permit from Uganda, a letter from our embassy wouldn't help, we could not speak to the Ambassador either: nothing was possible and they were pretty firm in that.

Maybe in the future.

name: Bunyonyi View Gorilla Packers
description: Among all the campsites here this hotel is really worth the detour because of the astonishing view from the terrace. You can find it on booking.com.

name: Retreat Guesthouse
description: Small private Guesthouse on top of Kitende Hill halfway between Kampala and Entebbe. Rooms selfcontained with toilet and shower. Clean, quiet in a good environment, garden, view of Lake Victoria from the veranda. Hellen the owner is very friendly and looks after her guests. 50000 USh per room, rooms are for 2 people. Breakfast included. Other meals on request. 25 km to Entebbe Airport. During daylight hours Hellen also can pick up her guests at Airport, 50000 for the Pickup. +256772429397

name: Great Lakes Museum
description: Nice restaurant and hotel, we just stopped for lunch and for 33,000Ush we ate and drank. Lovely view and great clean toilets. Little art and craft shop. Good wifi.

name: UWA Public site Northern Bank
description: Nice campsite overlooking the river. We understood it was the only affordable one (for our budget) on this side of the river. It was 15,000Ugx and apparently the Delta campsite was 40USD per person per night. Basic toilets and small shelter. Wood provided.

name: One stop border post - Uganda/Kenya
description: Go to the one stop shop border post office for the country you are entering (there is one building each for Uganda/Kenya, both with employees of borh countries inside).  Complete a form and get your passport stamped out of one country and in to the next in the same office. We travelled Uganda to Kenya but the one customs stop shop wasn't completed yet so we had to go back and clear our bikes out of Uganda, this should change soon. No charge for the TIP in Kenya just a short wait to enter details.

name: Kasenyi Lake Retreat
description: Community campsite on the shore of Lake George. Isolated and calm. Wildlife around. 10 $pp.

name: Mutanda Eco Community Centre (MECC)
description:
Nice place at lakeshore of Mutanda. Signpost from mainroad about 4km 
bandas 50 US$, safari tent 40US$, campsite 6US$ pp/n, few flat space for cars/rooftent.
Birdwatching in canoo 5US$/motorboat 10US$ pp, bar/restaurant drinks and meals available.
very friendly and helpful staff

name: Peace Guest House
description: Nice view at the Lake Kivu.Offers Rooms an Bandas. Everything clean. We are allowed to stay in our Car at the parking area, they opened a room with hot shower and toilet for us. We paid 20 000 RWF breakfast included.Offers breakfast and meals at reasonable prices between 5 am and 11 pm.

name: Assy Guesthouse
description: My visa for Rwanda wasn't ready when I arrived at the border so I had to stay overnight somewhere. It's a basic hotel but clean. I liked the bars around, there's something about border towns, had a joel! 10.000 USH

name: Central Gas Supply LTD
description: They filled my Tanzanian Oryx gas bottle, 3 l for 45000 USh. The location is in Kampala Rd. Plot 64 not far from the parking I located. Phone Mr Bigogo 0774377034.

name: Ruhondeza campsite and lodge.
description: The road to the camp is not suitable for big rigs. nice and silent camp still in walking distance to the gate. clean facilities and water tap on site.  As at community camp the campsite is away from parking. also a roof protects against rain.  10US pp

name: Eagles nest lodge and  campsite
description: high on a hill uneven and stoney campsite. 50m from the parking. nice ablution warm shower far from the campsite. only small trees no shade but great view.  very steep access road with a sharp turn.

name: Nkima Forest Camp
description: 1 km from Mabamba Bay Wetlands up on a hill (Nasubuga Hill). Owner Elaine Roberts 0753347727, 30,000USh for camping, firewood provided. Real hot shower (solar), very nice view over the Wetlands, Lake Victoria and Entebbe. Elaine is also building some cottages, should be ready December 2017. Coming from Mabamba boat landing its the first turnoff to the left. Many birds and butterflies, nice walks up the hill and into the forest.

name: Mabamba Bay Wetlands
description: Mabamba Swamp about 15 km west of Entebbe. Home to about 300 different bird species and the legendary shoebill stork. Easy reachable from Entebbe via the ferry. Description of location: see picture of brochure. Contact Irene: 0777818057 from the local community eco tourism site office.

name: Kyebando Auto Workshop
description:
Typical African Workshop Cooperative where different mechanics share the place. I had small repairs on my Toyota Landcruiser HJ60 done her. Mechanical, panel beating work, electrical works. Contact Abdu 0776117039. He is very friendly and helpful and can organise everything. Fair prices, no muzungu prices! He even came with different specialists to the place where I stayed.
It is located up Gayaza Rd, after the Northern Bypass Roundabout it's the first road right, first compound on the left.

name: Bwindi Community Hospital Guest House
description:
Two properties. Six homes. Camping available at either site. Restaurant. Hot showers. Camping:$10 USD pp/pn meals included. Homes: $45 USD pp/pn meals included. www.bwindiguesthouse.com 
email: managerguesthouse2@gmail.com
+256-780-314-560

name: Kalitusi Backpackers
description:
Campsite in a nice big garden with flat green lawn. Shade under Eucalyptus trees. Nice wooden construction for Abulutions and Bar/Restaurant. Food would be available. Official prices:
Camping: 8$ (20k pppn Dec 2021)
Dormitory:10$
Single Room: 15$
Cottage: 30$
They let me use their kitchen.
Big trucks would fit in. Showers are heated with firewood and the water was nice and hot. Bit low water pressure!
kalitusibp.fortportal@gmail.com

name: Amabere Waterfall Campsite
description: Nice Campsite on spacious lawns, flat sites available, nice hot showers, very friendly people. Many waking trails to various caves and waterfalls, but extra entry charges for that. Camping 8$ or 26000 USh per Person.

name: Elite Backpackers
description: Nice hostel with single room ($20), double ($30), dorm shared ($10), bring your own tent camping 10,000ush ($4usd), all can use hot shower and wifi, breakfast included

name: Top of Falls (Murchison Falls)
description: Location at end of maintained 12km Park road — turn off from Masindi Road. Whole area requires NP entry fees!! Views of rapids from parking lot viewpoints not great. Not sure where good viewpoint is located. No staff at gate or anywhere in sight. Ok for side trip if passing by anyway. We encountered lots of tsetse flies!!!

name: Uganda Lodge Ruhanga
description: The place is mainly for volunteers in local school project but overnight campers are also very welcome. They opened a room for us to use the hot shower. Camping is now 20.000 KES pp (negotiable), simple dinner is 15,000. It is interesting checking out the school and the volunteer project.

name: Kakine Campsite
description: Another public Campsite in Kidepo Nationalpark. Right on top of a hill, 360degree view onto Narus Valley. Running water in shower (cold) and toilet. No shade, but 1 shelter (the other one burned down) and 2 fireplaces. Attendant ranger is compulsory but will be brought and fetched by UWA vehicle.

name: Shoprite and Game Supermarkets
description: A big Shoprite and a big Game Supermarket. Located in a Mall so there are ATMs and secured Parking.

name: Malaba Border Post (Uganda-Kenya)
description:
Busy Border, hundreds of trucks, road works. 

Leaving Uganda:
1) Register at the gate (vehicle logbook and passport)
2) Went to Customs, Carnet got stamped and Road Tax Receipt got stamped.
No Fees, done in 15 Minutes.

Entering Kenya:
1) Drove over to Kenyan Side. The Road was bad and full of Trucks, it took some Time and the One Stop Building is a bit of a Hassle to get to. Went to Immigration first, filled out Ugandan Exit Form. Passports got stamped out at Ugandan Counter.
2) Health Department checked our Vaccinations and Temperature (not always done)
3) Stamped in Passports at Kenyan Counter and took Fingerprints (we are traveling on the East African Tourist Visa).
4) Went to Customs. They asked for our Carnet but we said we have none (ours is almost finished). So after some Talking they just stamped our old TIP from Tanzania... :) We paid no Road Tax because we said we want to leave Kenya within the 14 Days (14 Days are free).
5) Registered at Police while driving out.
So the Kenyan Side also was completely free but took us more than one Hour.

name: Moondance Camping Site former Landmark Hotel
description: Very basic Campsite on parking lot of Delicious Restaurant. Owners Indians. Shade under old trees. Toilet and shower basic and dirty. They let me use shower and toilet from one of the rooms, but not very much better. Ok for 1 night when you are stuck in Mbale. 20000 USh per Person. Suppose it's quite noisy on Weekends, I was there on a Friday, but the disco music came from one of the neighbouring plots.

name: Dutchess
description: Restaurant serving excellent food including pizza and steaks. Small bar, inside and outside seating and there is even accommodation options. Can buy bread and yoghurt. Wifi is chargeable, and the restaurant pricing is reasonable for the quality.

name: KSP hotel
description: cheap, but ok place. We found the room better and cheaper then the free zone hotel. 45k ugx for big double room. The usual quality, so check the lights and taps. The car can be put on a parking across the street. It has gates, do not know if it is actually closed. Better then on the street. Gulu has a good supermarket crossing a104 and bank ln, restaurants are in Labwor road, we ate at the Ethiopian.

name: Rwenzori Turaco Community Camp
description: This is a small campground, right in front of the mountains, nice landscape. The staff is really nice, the ablutions are basic but clean. They offer food and walks too. At the beginning they asked for 5Usd PP (18.000 Ush) but at the end we paid 10.000 ush pp.

name: Crater Bay Cottages
description: One more option in Rutinda... $5pp to camp in the parking lot. It’s flat and has plants around so you are hidden from the village, but people staying at the lodge still walk through. Ensuite double rooms are $30 with breakfast and hot shower. Laundry is 1000 UGX per large item and 500 UGX for small items. The grounds are beautiful with a nice dock on the lake. Food in their restaurant is good and reasonably priced - about 20,000 UGX per main.

name: EcoBurrito
description: Delicious burritos for a good cause! Vegetarian burritos are 10.000 UGX and guacamole & chips are 5000. Benefits the Bigodi community. Ingredients are purchased from local villagers. Open Mon - Fri from 8am - 5pm. Excellent stop for a meal before or after a walk in Bigodi Swamp. “Eat burritos not bush meat”

name: Ibrah Motorcycle Repairs
description: Small motorcycle workshop. Guy working there is fixing BMW, but other bikes can be repaired as well. He can help you to get spares for your bike. If needed you can stay in a campsite next door.

name: NTOROKO GAME LODGE
description:
direct on the lake albert front.
very clean and comfortable tent cottages and campsite availlable.
we choosed one of the cottages and we stood one night.
the jung guys tried everything to make us feel comfortable.
it the morning they prepared the table outside directly at the lake side.

the food incl. the fish we got at the dinner was simple but very good!

during the day people from the village beside it, are visiting and relaxing at the beach, all very friendly and so kind.

this place belongs definitely to my first secret tipps for uganda.

name: ABC Motors Garage
description:
Recommended to us by a local. Allen Sebanakitta is the owner. He’s been a mechanic for over 25 years and worked for a Mercedes / Jeep dealership before opening his own shop. He can do all kinds of mechanical work at an excellent price. He helped us with a blown brake line. We called him the night before and he took care of it the next morning. We were very happy with the work - and the price. (You don’t want to drive around Kampala with spongy brakes!)
Allan’s mobile is +256 (0) 772 403 802. Open Monday - Saturday. 8:30am - 5pm

name: KIJOTO COMMUNITY VOCATIONAL TRAINING SCHOOL
description: This is a non profit organization dedicated to providing technical skills to students. Its aim is to promote girls’ education and reduce poverty, making a sustainable impact in the community. It’s located in Kengoma village, Bubaare sub-county, Rubanda district. The school was founded in 2016 as a private initiative from the Bakiga community of Lake Bunyonyi. Asiimwe Lucky, the director and founder of the Kitojo Vocational School works as a guide and has great knowledge of the area around the lake. Lucky felt a specific burden for the young girls working at the quarries because, in addition to the work hazards and low income, they were frequent victims of sexual assault. Kijoto training school is now offering its grounds and welcomes overlanders.The facilities are very basic and therefore you are only expected to make a small donation to the school at the end of your stay.Lake  Bunyonyi can be the perfect place to unwind after your trek to the nearby gorillas. Spending some time in the school is defiantly recommended. Your support here is very much needed and Lucky and his team will make sure that you have a memorable stay.

name: Mutukula Border OSBP
description:
TZ to UG: read comments below
UG to TZ: 1) Sign in security book at first gate. 2) Drive to the OSBP on the TZ side. Everything done in one building, clearly signposted. 3) Check temperature and filled in book. 4) Immigration desks and do whats necessary: UG exit then TZ entrance. 5) UG customs: completed and signed CDP and cleared vehicle from Uganda Revenue Authority system. Received proof of the fact. 6) TZ customs: completed and signed CDP. Received TIP form for payment. 7) Proceed to NMB bank desk to pay TIP (USD 20 equivalent for one month). Only accept TZ Shillings so changed USD for TZ Shillings and while there changed the UG Shillings for TZ Shillings. The bank does the exchange for you like any normal forex. 8) Took form back to TZ Customs and stamped the vehicle in. 9) Drive to gate where security personnel check TIP and let you proceed. Quite efficient. Allow for 90 to 120 minutes. [NOTE: crossing this border as at 5 June 2020 was only permitted through prior arranged Ugandan governmental authorization].

name: 10 kwacha
description: take away and general shop serving cheap food. hamburger with chips and salad K16, pies K8, really cold sodas K4.

name: Bagira royal hotel
description: We arrived in Kanungu looking for a place to stay and put our motorcycles safe. We couldn't find anything then the police stopped us and took them with us to the station to put the motorcycles there and brought us to this hotel. It has very nice and big rooms. Cold shower, European toilet and comfortable beds. 50.000 ush per room, no wifi available

name: TT Gardens Hotel & Restaurant
description: Nice hotel next to the road, clean and big rooms starting at 50.000 ush. Warm shower, bar and restaurant available. Beers 4000 ush, we had liver with chips for dinner 15.000 ush. Really tasty. Bar has loud music but closed at 10 pm. Beds are really comfortable.

name: Lake Bunyonyi Rocks Resort
description: After listening to the managers pitch for rooms, he was happy to let us camp in the grass by the lake. 5 USD pppn, $10 for  very meal if you don’t choose to go a la carte. The budget rooms are 15 USD pppn. This is a great place to relax and view the lake. You can walk around or do a number of boating activities on the lake. The facilities are clean (hot water!) and the WiFi exists even if it is sometimes apathetic. The food is really good but they don’t have a way to keep things warm so expect one part of the meal to be cold if the place is busy. When it’s cold they bring out clay ovens and you can serve yourself hot drinks.

name: Nyore Hillside Retreat
description: Accomodation, Camping, Bar and Restaurant (excellent). Clean, very friendly staff, hot shower (or warm if not enough sun) - a perfect place between Kampala and Rwanda. Campsite is small, on grass, no shade, not even.  Very nice place with beautiful views. Many places to hang out. Great staff and good service. 35000 UGX/pppn. Restaurant pretty good and reasonably priced. Campsite is small, though. Fits about 3 RTT cars, max. Not suitable for big rigs. Wifi works, too. We stayed 3 nights.

name: Roots Retreat and camping resort
description: nice place to be, little, quiet paradies between Entebbe and Kampala. 10 USD for camping. They offer a lot of activities.

name: Jireh Guest House
description:
Hotel close to the border. We asked if we could camp in their backyard, and they didn't mind. Nice flat grassy area perfect for pitching tents. Paid 10.000 pppn.

Single rooms are 58.000pppn.

Squat toilets next to campsite. The compound is secure and guarded, lots of parking space for campers also.
WiFi included.

name: Kasozi Village Primary School
description: On the main well maintained tarred road 67 kms north of Jinja. 24 hr gate security. Large grass area with level parts under  large evergreen trees . Pls contact .... to be advised

name: City Park Motel - Nuel Residence
description:
Very nice, inexpensive and clean hotel direct at the main road from Kampala to Entebbe Airport. Look out for a green gate in a white wall in the left hand when you drive towards airport.
69 USD for two nights and three beds in one room incl. breakfast. 
500 m away from lake shore with nice restaurants.

name: KIJOTO COMMUNITY VOCATIONAL TRAINING SCHOOL
description: Basic camping ground based out of the non profit organisation of Kijoto community.  Asiimwe Lucky, the director and founder of the Kitojo Vocational School works as a guide and has great knowledge of the area around the lake. The facilities are very basic and therefore you are only expected to make a small donation to the school at the end of your stay.Lake Bunyonyi can be the perfect place to unwind after your trek to the nearby gorillas. Spending some time in the school is defiantly recommended. Your support here is very much needed and Lucky and his team will make sure that you have a memorable stay.

name: Kihihi Town
description: Small town with ATM, fuel and plenty of small shops and a little supermarket selling whatever you need for a few days of supplies. Useful if travelling between Bwindi and QE National Parks.

name: Kyambura River Gorge / Fig Tree Camp (chimp tracking)
description:
This is the location where the chimp tracking in Kyambura Gorge begins. 

There is currently no signpost at the main road to mark the turning, so you turn onto a dirt track through grassland that appears to be leading to nowhere! It’s just over 2km down there.

name: Entebbe ferry crossing
description: Get the ferry from here (both foot passengers and car ferry), for free, to or from Entebbe. Alternatively, if you don’t want to wait for the next ferry and you are on foot, get a private boat across for a small fee. There are bodas waiting here to help with your onward journey.

name: Eden Rock Resort
description: Nice and quite campground with lawn and a lot of trees and fruits (you can eat as much as you can!). Clear Swimming pool and a small bar with campfire place. Toilets and showers are ok. We got a key for a room with warm shower. 5 min. walk for swimming in the Nile. Run by Locals - Very friendly staff. Perfect for travellers with Motorcycles and Safaricars (even rooftents) 1 place for a Big Rig. They also have some nice Bandas. Camping 5$ ppn. Access Swimming pool 2$ ppd. We enjoyed the place very well!

name: Enjojo Lodge & Campsite
description: Pretty campsite on a separate grassy field away from the main lodge. Ablutions are modern and clean. Showers are cold but you can watch the stars while showering ;-)! At the main lodge you have a restaurant overlooking a water hole where animals come to drink (we saw Elephants when we were here). Right next to QENP so no park fees apply. You can hear lions and hyeanas at night if you're 'lucky'. Rate is $10pppn. You can also stay at one of their tents, bandas or bungalows.

name: Paula guesthouse
description: Nice small & cosy guesthouse with 5 rooms (85000 for a double, breakfast included). Very clean, secured parking, quiet location , WiFi

name: Stanbic Bank
description:
ATM at Stanbic bank.  Other bank in town is a Post bank and our Cards don’t work in those ATMs.  
Across the street from Stanbic bank is Petroleum Fuels.

name: The Elephant Hab Lodge & Camping
description: Amazing view over the QENP. New lodge and camping. Enough space on lawn. Nice terrasse for viewing animals. Good food & very friendly staff. They have bungalows and also campers are very welcome. For motobikers and safaricars. No big rigs. Camping ablution is under construction. But we got the key for a room to take a hot shower & Toilets. Everything very clean. After negotiating we paid 10$pppn which was ok. Breakfast 15000 UGSH pp. Food & Beverage is a little bit pricy.

name: Bwindi Backpackers Lodge
description:
Campsite right near Bwindi NP so good stop before/after Gorilla trekking from Knuringo or Rushaga.
Rooftop camping in car park (not very flat), tents on grass area. Also have dorms and rooms. 
Camping only - $10pppn. Prices vary based on bed only, B&B, half board, full board etc (see photos).
Restaurant/bar area, hot showers, WiFi wasn't working because the data package had run out. 
Other hikes and tours available from $20pp upwards. Also a Pygmies women's group danced  for guests in the evening.

Most people booked through Seith (the owner), and David is the onsite manager. 
Seith: +256 772 661854 / byarseith2012@gmail.com

Permits - in August 18 the Government changed the way permits are issued, I believe in an attempt to stop tours overselling permits and sending too many tourists in, as a result, August was fully booked and we had no permits. Seith was able to get us in last minute which we are very grateful for although I don't know how, or how legal it was. This isn't a reliable method, before us he was unsuccessful at getting 3 girls permits. Best book in advance!!!

name: Bwindi Gorilla Trekking Check In
description:
As of 20 August 2018 you will no longer be permitted to “walk in” without a reservation, booking and payment must be made through the office in Kampala, we were told by the woman at the front desk here in Bwindi.

Cost will remain $600 per person.  There is a surcharge if using your credit card.

I know other travelers book in advance in their home country, so there must also be a way to do this online.  Please be advised that the service in Bwindi for Airtel made it impossible to even check email let alone access a website.

name: Buranga Pass
description: The buranga pass is a scenic 4x4 track with a stunning view over the border river between Uganda and DRC. You can do the pass and drive back to fort portal on the new tarmac road. We did it with an Unimog but anything bigger you‘ll get problems. Close to the ending of the pass is a military check. But it was no problem.

name: Byoona Amagara storage and boat link
description:
Free carpark and boat link to Byoona Amagara lodge.

Dugout boat 5,000pp each way, approx 1hr journey and you are expected to paddle (Free one way if you stay on the island for a night.)
Motor boat 25,000 per boat each way.

name: Erungu Community Boat Trip
description: Boat trip on the Kazinga Channel for 30 USD per Person. No NP Entrance Fee necessary. We saw Hippos, Crocodiles, Buffalos, Lizzards and various Birds. You can call Tony at 0774392047 or 0703128677 to inquire about departure times. The trip took about 2 hours.

name: Kacheera Camp
description: Basic but beautiful campground off the beaten track. Established by Ugandan/English couple who live there with their young family. Large area of land to wander around, 25 minutes from Park gate. Basic camping facilities (cold water showers, compost loos), covered area to chill in (and escape the rain!) with washing up facilities, meals possible if informed in advance. Seems main focus of envrionmental education but with camping facilities. Welcoming owners, just give them a heads up and you're happily received.

name: Heritage
description: Campsite and Bandas outside the Murchison National Park.

name: Victoria Forest Resort
description:
Very nice  location, good restaurant with swimming pool, Wi-Fi. Also camping 40'000 USH per car.
 Fishing spot, we stayed  5 nights.

name: Lake View Resort Hotel
description:
Best place in town. Initially they asked 50 USD for camp,same price as a room. We negotiated  to 15 USD/pn/family 3 persons . Toilets next by the car park. 
We didn't  eat here, very expensive.

name: Bugombe Gateway Hotel & Camp
description:
Right after the Overland Camp.
10$ pppn for Camping incl. good Breakfast. 7$ without breakfast. hot shower and toilets in one of the rooms. Area is not very flat and not large so difficult to find a place. Entry is steep and narrow.

Rooms for 30$. Good restaurant. Organizing several tours.

name: Kihihi Modern Supermarket
description: Here you get almost everything. Good place to stock up. Electronic system at the till so prices are set the same for everyone.

name: Nalubale Rafting
description:
White water rafting, grade 3-5. Would highly recommend Nalubale, they put a lot of effort into making it a great day.

Full day (8 rapids) - $140
Half day (4 rapids) - $125
(prices are negotiable...)
Includes 2 free nights at Nile River Camp, breakfast, lunch, all the photos and beers at the end! 

Not sure how long the rafting will be running as the new damn will flood most of the rapids.

name: Suba Motel
description:
Id you have to stay in the town of Kihihi and can't spend a fortune for the Savannah Resort then the Suba Motel is a good choice.
Its simple but clean. Hot showers and a reasonable restaurant. Parking is not gated but i didn't have a problem. Wifi is quite strong.

Single room incl. breakfast: 60000UGX
Double room: 90000UGX

name: VEQ Hoima Limited Workshop
description:
Good workshop. specialized in Mitsubishi but also knowledge in Toyota and probabely any other machine. ask for Patrick or Godfrey.

+256772460414 / +256704460414

name: Wankwar Gate Murchison Falls NP
description: Gate when coming from the North. About 50km from/to Paraa(1.5h)

name: New Abessynia
description:
Delicious Ethiopian cuisine. Maim dishes from 8000UGX. Also some Italian cuisine available but didn't taste that.
Friendly staff.

name: Bethel Guest House
description: Nice hotel, friendly staff. We paid 75.000 UGS for a very clean room with ample space for 2 bicycles. En-suite with western toilet and on-demand hot shower. Fan. Breakfast included.

name: Serenity
description: Nice restaurant. Outside and inside tables. African dishes as well as Pizza and breakfast. Good athmosphere.

name: Michelle's Wine Garage
description: There are only two wines available. but beer and a nice atmosphere... good for a drink...

name: O'Cafe
description: Modern Cafe/Restaurant. Most Europeen Food. Good variety of Coffee and breakfast. Good service.

name: Cynibel Supermarket
description: Very well assorted. incl. swiss chocolate... ;-)

name: Jospa hotel
description:
Brilliant value for money. From 25,000 to 50,000, very clean double rooms, including breakfast. Nice owner, close to some local shops and a bicycle repair.
Secure parking.

name: Silver Back Community
description: The Silver Back Community is a Social Project run by Emily. Within the community they have a mushroom growing project to support the community and Emily teaches around 60 kids for dancing and sports to give them something to do. It was a lovely experience visiting the mushroom farm and watching the kids dancing and making sports. They are really happy about people showing their interest in what they do and spending time with the kids. They also do lovely crafts like gorilla masks, woven baskets etc. Phone number: +256781988368

name: Hotel Continental
description:
There are several cheaper options in town. But this hotel has a save parking with security guards. Rooms are clean, large enough. Good shower and bathroom. wifi is free but not strong enough for every room. Average Breakfast included.
Double room: 100000UGX pN
Single room: 80000UGX pN

name: Source of Nile Gate
description:
Entrance Gate to what they call 'Source of river Nile'. Its 30000UGX for Foreigner and 5000UGX for car. 

There is absolutely nothing to see despite some shops and restaurants and the water. If you want see more:

100000UGX for a boat (max. 5people) to the Speke Monument (15minutes) or
200000UGX to go to the real source of the river or
300000UGX for a longer boat trip.

name: Itanda Falls
description:
Big waterfalls. 

Entry Fee: 15USD (negotiable)

There is more 'action' offered:
ZIP-Lining over the falls: 15$
Traditional Dance: donation
Guide: donation
A swimmer who jumps into the falls for you: donation
River Cruise: ??$

name: Buffalo Camp
description:
Lodge with large restaurant and bar close to the river. It has a parking place where you are allowed to camp. The surface is flat to a certain degree and the campsite has one toilet and cold shower which are okay. 

You can have a 3 course diner for 35.000 shilling and the food taste okay. 

The terrace of the restaurant has a nice view over a small open space where buffalo, elephants and other animals will pass by.

name: Ugandan wildlife agency UWA
description:
Here you buy permits for tracking golden Monkeys or Gorillas.

Golden Monkey 90$
Gorilla 600$

name: Ankole Hotel
description:
Very good hotel and restaurant for 45$ the night. Has fast internet in the restaurant and lobby. Hot water. Was built around 2016.
Lots of guarded parking space although the road to the hotel is crappy.

name: Rutendere Primary School and Church
description: Flat place beside the Primary School and Church of Rutendere, near the junction to Buhoma. Locals around, but very friendly, no begging, even the kids are ok. You can use the toilets from the school.

name: soccerfield behind a small Coffee factory
description: At the road from Mbarara to Fort Portal. A big soccerfield behind a small Coffee factory. You can camp in the corner of the soccerfield away from the road. There are simple toilets beside the Coffee factory, also a watertap you can use. Very friendly people at the factory. No village, so nobody is disturbing. Of course you can hear the traffic, but during the night it's quiet.

name: Mansy motorbike parts
description:
Motorbike parts shop under Hotel Mansy. on entebbe road on the left heading towards entebbe just after fuel station.
I got parts for honda xlr250 , tires, throttle cables, speedo cable, choke cable, oil filter, chain and sprockets. Pretty much the only shop in town to reliably find parts for the honda xr250. Not sure about other bikes. If you need a mechanic go to Ibra Motorbike Repairs

name: Landmark Hotel
description:
Spacious en-suite double (western toilet, hot water) including large breakfast. Default is breakfast for one: 65.000 UGS. We paid including one additional breakfast 75.000 UGS. The restaurant has a good menu including some western and Indian dishes plus pizza. The food we had tasted great and was not expensive at all (40.000 UGS for 3 club beer, 1 aloo matar with rice and 1 beef burger with french fries) .
The hotel had a large parking space at the back where they told us we should park our bicycles, but we took them in our room anyway, which we always do.

name: Panaora Hotel
description:
Extremely hospitable place. Looks new. Large room with hot water and western toilet including breakfast 60.000 USH.
 Bicycles in the room was no problem.

name: Little Elephant Camp
description:
A self-proclaimed “glamping” option for self-catering. You cannot set up your own tents but must use theirs. Very luxurious set up - each site has one very large main kitchen-and-lounge tent plus a separate safari sleeping tent with two beds plus excellent flushing toilet and hot shower. Main tent has a very well equipped kitchen - large two burner gas stove plus large fridge, sink, all utensils, lighting and usb charging points, etc. Fireplace with wood supplied, braai/bbq also.  Canadian owned - their website has all the details. http://littleelephantcamp.com/ 
Excellent hosts and helpful staff. Pricing $125 pn for two people. Added dome tent with beds and bedding for the kids for extra charge.

name: Top of the world
description:
Very nice place with an awesome view over the crater lakes.
For a very interesting Natur walk to this place through the neighbourhood and the communities contact "Steven". +256 779 78 19 27
mugumestevenadyeeri@gmail.com
He can also help you out organising good on the market or what ever you need.

Note: entrance fee 25k

name: New Curt View Hotel
description:
Nice hotel owned by an old British lady. Self contained bungalows with hot shower and toilet with double bed for 105'000 2ppn including breakfast.
Depending wich hut you get it can be a bit noisy in the evening. Behind the restaurant they run a generator every now and then.
Camping near the parking is negotiable even with big rigs.
The place is perfect to take a day of to gain some energy for ether the MFNP or the long drive south to QENP. The Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary is 1h drive away and a good option for a day trip. The restaurant is very good and offers western and local dishes.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Only gas station in the parc. Pay at the Paraa lodge first than proceed to the gas station.

name: bank that works with mastercard
description: UBA bank charge 3000for withdrawal. good

name: Toyota Maintenance
description:
Toyota parts and repair.
Authorised Toyota dealer.

name: Maturums Lodge
description:
On the old ruins of the Katurum Lodge witch was left by it's owner before finishing in 1972 because of security issues. The lodge is built into rocks on a hill inside the parc.
A Karamojong startet renovation as new owner in 2014. They expect to open the first few rooms in 2019.
Price is estimated around 120$ pn.
The view over the parc is just breathtaking.
When it's finished there will be a waterhole in front of the lodge, a swimmingpool and a campsite.
It's definitely worth to check out this place.

name: Gas Station
description:
Last / first Gas Station going to / coming from Kidepo National Park.
Make sure you refill here cause there is no Gas Station in the park or on the way. Bring some extra fuel if you plan to do game dries in the park.

name: Shell Gas Station, Service  & Tyre Repair
description:
Very professional mecahnics who helped us repair our punctured tire as well as replace our diff oil. 

Also has a 24 hr ATM at the site.

name: Green Tree Hotel
description: Good option for budget travelers. Rooms are very simple. Free gated parking in front of the rooms. 15,000 without  bathroom, 20,000 with bathroom. There is a bar at the premises and we were allowed to use one function room for cooking. Recommend this place.

name: waga waga guesthouse
description: nice and clean place with mosquitos red. hot water. no wifi. 20000 shillings

name: Ishasha NP main entrance gate
description:
prices now $40 per person for 24 hours. foreign vehicle $50 for unlimited time. camping $5 per night.
Can pay in shillings with good exchange rate. stunning scenery, listening to eles at gate

name: Kitagata hot spring
description:
Hot, dirty and packed with people! supposed to have healing powers so I got in.
Caretaker wanted 20,000 I gave him 10,000. Lots of naked people, photos not cool.

name: Kibiro Hot Spring
description:
Park here. local association asks 10,000, local who lives here asks 5,000.
Not a great spring, no real chance to bathe, but interesting to a hot springs nut like me. Stunning little village on lakeshore

name: Lake Albert view
description: note: coordinates not exact, find a place near here. Tons of friendly and respectful locals on road and nearby. Make sure you can see lake, at night the 1000 lights of the little fishing boats is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen.

name: Nob Petrol Station
description: Cash only, and much more expensive than fort portal... but you do get a windscreen wash!

name: Nshongi lodge and campsite
description: Rustic little lodge in the most incredible location, by far the best location of any lodge in Rushaga. You feel like you are right in the forest and there is amazing birding. No good for roof tents but worth taking a room for the beautiful location.

name: Country Oven
description: Nice roadside restaurant serving a selection of grilled meats (4000UGX a piece), pilau rice dish with chicken (7000UGX) and vegetable and bean casserole (3000UGX). Cheap beers and sodas too. Friendly staff. Also sell samoosas and spring rolls if you fancy a snack for the road

name: Kijungu Hill Hotel
description: Hoima was a convenient place to stay en route from MFNP to QENP for us, since we left MFNP around 1PM. We went to the Cultural Lodge and it looked really nice. However, they charged $40 just for tent camping and that is way too much in our opinion. We found this place, a nice and quiet hotel with rooms situated around a green courtyard. A double room + breakfast for 2 goes for 90.000 ush (its also on booking.com, same room goes for $35 there). Slow wifi but it works, hot water and a bath tub, flushing toilet and rooms have tv. All have a little veranda with a table and chairs on which you are allowed to cook your own food. Well stocked bar (beer @4000) and a very reasonably priced menu (havent tried anything). Secured parking in front of the hotel.

name: Happy Home Guesthouse
description: As I was looking for a place to stay for the night and I didnt wanna go too far out of town I found this nice place for 20‘000 shilling with nice clean rooms, hot shower, mosquito net, enough space to take your bicycle inside the room! I don’t think there is a secured parking, but didn‘t ask! Food and Supermarket just around the corner. Def. one of the nicest places I had so far for this amount of money! good deal!!

name: Blue Monkey Guesthouse
description: New guesthouse opened in 2018. Lovely place with perfectly manicured gardens and outdoor sofas to chill and watch the sun set over the lake. Very friendly German owners. Good wifi included. Delicious, large breakfast included as well (full cooked or pancakes with fruit salad plus proper coffees or tea and fresh juice). $30 for a double room is great value considering the above! No camping.

name: Yared's Island Cafe
description: Tiny village restaurant run by Yared benefiting the local community. If you fancy a change from food at the lodges he makes a delicious crayfish or veg curry with chapatis and homegrown roasted sweet potato for 15,000 per person which you'll eat with him and probably his kids around! You'll need to arrange it the day before you want to eat. Really cute little spot.

name: Excellent Rolex & Chapatti
description: Road side stall with small adjoining bar and seating area serving amazing rolex (omelette rolled in a huge chapatti) - some of the best we've had in Uganda. For 2,000 UGX it's an absolute bargain. Perfect half way stop to/from Queen Elizabeth Park with cash machines and petrol in town too.

name: The Rolex joint
description: Incredibly delicious, cute little Rolex restaurant. About 6 different fillings 2-6000UGX. Easily the best we've eaten in Uganda. Always busy with trendy looking young Ugandans.

name: Visitors inn
description: Very good value hotel, 65000UGX for a twin room that is actually two double beds with a tiny balcony, wifi, en suite and hot water. Nice staff too. Free bottled water on arrival.

name: Westend Motel
description: Nice motel with fast wifi, hot water, secure parking and restaurant. Breakfast included. They have everything what you need in very good prices. 18 -20 USD (65000 ugx) for double room. Really nice to stay here! We washed the bike as well:)

name: Jershem Hotel
description: Nice place with good prices in that area. We paid (the small one) for a room 80000 UGX with breakfast. Nice stuff, parking for bike in front of the room’s window. Quite new and very clean.

name: Kaanos complex inn guesthouse
description: Good for stopover coming from the border. Clean rooms with en-suite, huge bed. Secure parking. Wifi when power works. 50.000 shilling incl breakfast. Breakfast is simple chapati roll with egg, a banana and tea.

name: Karatunga Guesthouse
description: Some spots for campers on the sandy area next to the tented camp. Camping 25k pp incl breakfast. Ablutions (also used by staff) basic: one flush pit toilet, one urinal, one cold shower. Really nice area for relaxing. Great local and foreign food available for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Fresh juices, coffee and beer. We had pizza and Christmas lunch, which we really enjoyed. Staff all very friendly, especially Ivan the accommodation manager / cook and Theo the owner. Because there was very loud music at the neighbors one night Theo offered us to stay at their bush camp on Mt Moroto for the same price, which was really nice and quiet. You can also sleep in a safari tent or in a room in the guesthouse and they offer lots of tours. They are planning to make a new grassy campsite with ablutions and kitchen opposite to the guesthouse.

name: Lake Kyoga
description: We knocked at the door at somebodies house and asked if we could sleep here, because we like to have contact with local people. But you can camp eveywhere in this area, at somebodies house or just a few meters away from the road.

name: Lake Edward
description:
Very nice wild camping site near the lake.  Has been showed to us by a local guide named Godwill. He said it is necessary to register to the local police station and did it on our behalf. You camp near the hippos (not dangerous but make sure you are not too close to the water so you are not on their trail when they come out to graze at around 7pm)
Godwill said it is allowed to make campfire but we did not want to disturb the wildlife too much.
You can also book boat trips to the channel at 15usd pp.

name: Road Safety Driving School and Garage
description: We had to fix a mechanical problem with our 4x4 and after seeing a lot of garages, this seemed to be one of the most relieble ones. Many 4x4 and trucks were getting repaired, dozen of people working here, is quite big. Speak very well English and are in contact with garages in Kampala when they can't resolve the problem.

name: TAKS - through art keep smiling
description: The other places around here were closed, so we walked in here. Pretty nice actually! Spacey garden where you can eat, meals between 4.000 - 12.000 ush. Local stews were good. Very nice juice. If you are lucky you will get a free fresh mango from the tree!

name: Sezibwa Farm
description: Very nice spot under construction, in 2019 it should be ready, but I've already slept in a beautiful hut with great view on the valley. 4kms far the main road, and the road to come is well maintained. If you stay here the kind owners can organize a tour between vanilla/paprica/coffee/etc plantations. Very beautiful is the waterfall 1kms far from here. I think it's possible pitch the tent. Phone: +256772502177 Hanington

name: Leopard camp
description: Beautiful campsite with some lazy camping tent and a few self contained tents. Just near the entry of lake mburo national park. 10 usd ppers 5 usd kids for camping in own tents. Restaurant is very good.

name: Bwana Tembo Safari Camp
description: You can camp here for 10$ (2p, 1 car). It’s a lodge owned by Italians. There is not a real campground but you can choose a spot anywhere (although not many level). You can use the very nice European guest toilets and the shower of the drivers accommodation (good cold functional shower). Food is expensive. We did enjoy our 4 course dinner on New Year’s Eve for 80000ush pp. Other meals we cooked ourselves.

name: Lodge & camping (no sign)
description: It’s not really suited for overlanders with rtt. Ground tent will work! We managed to pull into a spot behind the toilet building with our car, so we were not on the parking lot. If you have a big car this will not work. The site is still under construction (therefore no sign I guess) but it looks promising. We paid 50.000ush for the spot with use of cold shower (hot shower available on request) in a very nice cottage tent. Food available (we cooked ourselves so don’t know quality and price). Really friendly and helpful staff. It might be worth to take a look.

name: Karamoja museum
description: Nice small museum where you can organize hiking to visit tepeth tribes. We talked with miss Teddy. 0786036083

name: Kufan Oranic Farm / Marula Eco Camp
description:
It is a beautiful campsite on the top of the mountain from a very nice and kind Dutch woman and Kenian men. You are in the middle of real Uganda! 
They are still constructing it, but in a few months it will be ready. In the future there will be also bandas. 
Now you can camp at there own property and use a cold shower and toilet there. 
After Tabagonyi (coming from Mbale) you have a bridge, after a few meters you will see riceplantage at your right and a treefarm at your left. You go to the right after the signpost ‘Kufan Ngoyo Organic Farm’. (See the photo). And then stay right at every road. You will see a red fence and you’re arrived. 
10000 ugx per person for camping, campfire 5000 ugx, breakfast 5000, lunch 10000 vegetarian 15000 for meat.
You can call Anke Simiyu in advance +256 788 335442

name: Hello garden
description: It is a small hotel with a large grassy area. The boss agreed that we stay here for the night and he opened the toilet and shower for us.He's very friendly. Paid 50000USH for 2people and the RV.

name: Park House Hotel
description: Nice hotel with inner court (bicycles only). 31'000 UGS for private room with bathroom. 21'000 UGS w/o bathroom.

name: Precious Guesthouse
description: A lovely guesthouse, just across the Botanical Gardens and close to the city center (walking distance to Shoprite, Java House and two malls). They have a secured parking lot. Very good service and even better food. Especially breakfast! A little hut can be booked for about $40 per person.

name: Mbuya Parish Chatolic church
description: Nice economic place, clean and friendly inside the church complex. Single for 20.000 (6$), double for 15.000. Toilets and electronic plugs outside the room. For booking: ms Linda 0795320034

name: Executive Hotel
description: Hotel with inner yard and decent rooms for 50'000UGS including breakfast. There is also a little grass field inside. Maybe it's possible to camp.

name: Makwanzi Falls Farm
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Appears to be submitted by the owner. Not Overlander verified.
-----
Makwanzi is a campsite on the banks of the River Nile. We also have accommodation in cotages and in the farm house.
Activities include riverine forest walk, across to the islands where one can view  the falls and if possible frolick in the white waters. Swimming is also possible when the waters are at normal and low levels.
wild life includes birds, monkeys, mongoose, monitor lizards, pangolins, amongst others. Makwanzi gets it's name from the African fish eagle. The rare crown flower can also be sighted in the forest.

name: Home of Friends Guesthouse
description:
Very nice and green camp ground. Located in the cradle of Uganda's running talent. Sometimes it's nice to stay with European people, especially when you overland and you get tired from locals. The guest house Home of Friends is managed by a Dutch guy Daan. The food is nice and people are so friendly. I love the vibe of the place. Enjoy!

Camping with your own tent:
25k without breakfast; with breakfast 30k ugx.
Dorms start at 50k ugx; 
Double room budget 90k ugx
Self contained luxurious rooms from 140k ugx (40 usd)

Wide range of activities:
- massage
- Sunday games with Community kids
- mountain biking
- cultural dance & storytelling
- Sipi Falls hike
- Coffee tour
- village walks
- explore untouched caves & waterfalls

Feel free to contact manager Daan on +256780548202

name: Mid Town hotel/lodge
description:
Very basic local hotel. Cheap place 7 000 ugx for a single room. Safe motorbike parking.
The road to get here is horrible. Otherwise here is only ferry to cross the lake. The ferry is free it goes 3 times per day: 5.30 9.30 15.30.

name: Signature Hotel Apartments
description:
It's a boutique hotel

Nice and quiet place in the middle of Jinja. 10 mins walk to the source of the great river Nile. 
Mainly two and three bed apartments. All rooms are ensuite. You can book whole apartment or a room within an apartment. 

Single occupancy - 70 usd, 
Double occupancy - 100 usd, 
2 bed apartment up to 4 ppl 160 usd
3 bed apartment up to 6 ppl - 200 usd
Brakfast included. 

Swimming pool, 
Fast wifi, 
Digital TV, 
24hours security, 
Serene gardens

name: Excel Insurance - COMESA Yellow Card
description: not the national company, but valid comesa can be purchased here, as well as at NIC (official national company) next door. price list in photo

name: Upland Restaurant
description: Nice, delicious and cheap local restaurant. We had beans, spinach with sesame sauce, avocado, chipati and metoke. 4000pp

name: Kazinga channel beach
description: Boat trip starting from this point. 25$ pp. You don't need to buy entrance ticket for the park. Great guide, good information about the wildlife. You can also camp here (20.000 for 2 persons and one tent or car). Toilet and cold shower available. we didnt camp here but there is a guard at night so should be safe. restaurant available. 20.000 for delicious Tilapia.

name: Rwenzori founders sculpture gallery
description: Great place to stop and to have a cold drink or local coffee. Beautiful bronze sculpture gallery in an open botanical garden with native trees which offers foundry tours and also sells postcards. Big rig friendly with parking area.

name: BAM Shopping Centre
description: Very big, 2 floor shop, well equipped with food, meat, chemicals, and gas bottles. Accept VISA/MasterCard card payments.

name: New bridge - no motorcycles allowed
description:
The main road will take you over the new bridge, yet signs indicate that motorcycles are not allowed. We got flagged down by the military and made to turn around. Then we got really confused where to find the old bridge. 

If you are heading to Kampala, instead of going straight on the last round about, take a right towards the falls. Then first left onto a gravel road. Again first left which will lead to the petrol station. Go right and then you’ll ride straight onto the bridge. After, take the first left again and you’ll get back to the main road. 

Heading to Kenya: last roundabout take a left. First right, over the bridges and then go straight (through the spiked barricades) and you’ll merge back onto the main road.

name: rock art
description: Not worth spending 10 000 ugx pp. On one rock there is a painting but doesn't really look old, and not much story about it were told.

name: Nice place with friendly people
description: If you don't mind having company of friendly locals it's a very nice place to stay. We just let the police know we plan to stay for the night (it's at the end of the road, next to the ferry). No mosquito, some crocodiles in lake but we didn't see and locals says it's not dangerous in dry season.

name: near the lake
description: This is ok spot for a night. Nobody at all disturb us, some distance from the road so no dust, a lot of places for natural toilet. But no tress at all so no shadow. At night you have a view on the lights on the lake. At the shore there are milions of flies and insects at night, impossible to get out of the car at night but here it's ok. We were sitting outside all night without any mosquito bite. Good to spend a night and go in the morning. I had more nicer wild campings but this is fine.

name: Karungi Camp
description:
Small affordable camp with a eco mindset. There’re three cabins, two who sleeps two (60 USD  for 2, including breakfast) and one who sleeps one (40 USD incl breakfast). Also available is a dormitory for volunteers. As for camping, you can either pitch a tent or sleep in your roof top tent for 10 USD per person. Parking spot is a bit uneven and will fit 2 vehicles.

Three course meal is 30.000 (~8 USD). Well stocked bar with open fire to complement that whiskey. 

There’s a pig, chicken and rabbit farm which they’re using to support the local community. The veggies comes from their own garden.

All day electricity thanks to hydro and generator power. Showers are hot, toilets are clean and the people are nice!

About a 45 minute drive to the Nkuringo trail head for those who’re visiting the gorillas there. The road to Muko is quite bad and most definitely require a 4x4. The road to Kisoro is better (although longer if you’re coming from the east). 

Call or WhatsApp Gordon, the general manager, for any inquiries: +256 779 806583

name: Central market
description: Central market for fruit and vegetables. Also many other things to have a look at.

name: Kisenyi Lake Retreat campsite
description:
Community Campsite in between National Parks in a small village at the lake. Still under construction but very nice place, like you are in the bush with wildlife around. Hippoos, monkeys, lots of birds, waterbucks...
When you drive the public road you don't have to pay for the NP but you can see a lot of game.

name: Continental hotel restaurant
description: Good chicken stew for 6 000, chips chicken 12 000, chips sausage 5 000. Beer 3 000, fresh passion fruit 3 000.

name: Ayapapa
description:
The best place to relax in Uganda! Beautiful open house directly at the crater lake, bilharzia free so you can swim. Jasiek, the owner, is open minded man, who build this place with good vibes. He's polish, living in Africa since almost 20 years. You have access to open kitchen with spaces, gas stove, dishes etc. fireplace, hammock, everything you need. You can use also cottage with beautiful view on the lake. There is also a place for car with roof tent.
We planed to stay there only 1 night, but finished with 5 :)
Jasio asked to contact in advance because he has quite a lot of guests from airbnb. But still if he doesn't have place for you he will surely help you to accomodate close to his place. We saw few and they're also very nice.
30$ banda/cottage 
camping, you have to ask but it should be reasonable
watsapp no. 002560775369689

name: Chicken Inn
description: Great food! Delicious chicken curry, chicken strogonow, mushroom soup, extremely cold beer. The best food I've eaten in Uganda! Fair prices and very nice service. Super highly recommended.

name: Mweya Campsite
description: Basic campsite on a beautiful peninsula inside the park. 20,000 pppn. Restaurant, Park Visitor Centre and Petrol station nearby. We ate at the restaurant, nice food. Camping has basic but clean toilets. View is amazing. Very friendly staff. If you didn’t have to pay for park fees per day, we’d stay an extra night.

name: Equator Line
description: Circular stone photo point marking equator line.

name: Kiseka auto market
description: Main area for spare parts. Entire malls dedicated to car and truck parts as well as innumerable stalls along the road. We found oil filters in no time.

name: Forest near pylones
description: Lots of opportunities to wild camp in the forest near the power pylones. Probably visible from the road but many different spots and areas available on the road from this point on going north. Easily accessible through the pylones construction roads.

name: Chahafi Resort
description:
Expensive resort with non-expensive camping. Just half an hour drive to the border to Rwanda makes this an excellent place to stay when doing the border crossing.

A double room is 115 USD (but is overpriced for what you get). However, camping is 15 USD per unit (car/tent) and includes a good breakfast for 1 person. Additional breakfasts are 7 USD per person. Good selection of fruits, toast, pancake, egg, bacon and more. 

The camping ground is really big and could easily fit some 30 vehicles. It’s nice and flat grass.

There’s a small ablutions block, but the manager opened a cabin for us and let us use the toilet and shower in there.

Just next to the lake, which supposedly is Bilharzia free. However, there’s no real beach which makes getting into the water a bit hard (but doable). 

Food is quite expensive at 10 USD for a lunch.

Follow the signs from the main road.

name: Heras Country Resort
description:
Best value hotel we've found in Uganda so far: huge double room with breakfast for $21.
Big and secured parking place, just outside of town (800m) and very quiet because not many guest.
Staff extremely friendly.

name: Lutembe beach
description: Amazing place.  Feet in the water... the hotel is under construction but the swimming pool is already beautiful. Friendly staff

name: Bandag Tire Shop
description:
Best tire shop in Kigali. Have BFGoodrich, Michelin, West Lake and Hankook. 

The phone number on Google is wrong. These work:
0788426469 Michelle
0788670619 Theogene

name: Lake Mwamba community camp
description:
(not exact coordinates, look for a sign on the road or ask) Very nice place directly at the lakeshore, managed by local friendly family. 
Place is grassy with beautiful trees around. They have also a Katanda waterfall on their property. Beautiful quiet place to stay for few days, perfect for overlanders. 
Camping is 20 000 per car
If you stay for 3-5 days you will get a village walk for free to see how community lives.
Thay can also arange boad ride for bird watching 20 000 pp
Mahoma waterfalls around.
You can have food on order (breakfast, lunch, dinner), cold beer. 
Chef of place is a hiller and he can help you using natural herbs. He helped my husband with migrene. Very recommended!

name: Petrol, Selia cafe, car wash, car mechanic
description: we changed our engine oil and filters here, service is ok, you pay only for oil, changing oil is included in the price

name: airtel service center
description: you can register here and buy a sim card for 2000 ush

name: KCB Bank
description: ATM of KCB Bank that doesn't charge for taking out money.

name: Miami Tours & Travel Hotel Restaurant
description: The rooms are very basic but a fair deal. We paid 20‘000 UGS for the room. Staff is very friendly and they have courtyard where we parked our bicycles. It would probably be possible to park a car behind the gates. The food is very good and also fairly cheap.

name: Acacia Guest House
description:
Good value for money! 55.500 for a single room but is enough for 2 people including breakfast for two! Fruits and omelet with bread! Clean and hot water for shower! We had room number 809, for us the nicest one! They have a restaurant, but we had no dinner there! To get the cheap prices you have to book via booking.com! We booked directly at the reception! Our room would have been $25, but with the discount on booking it was $15 dollars! They cannot give discount at the reception!

Happened for us often in Africa 😀

Secured parking

name: Meza - Shawarma and More
description: Nice restaurant with Arabic food like hummus, shawarma, falafel and also burgers! Opposite of Acacia Mall!!!

name: Hoima Kolping Hotel
description:
On the way to Murchison Falls we fell into HKH Hoima Kolping Hotel. Spotles rooms with big bathroom a very comfortable bed. A good rated restaurant and very nice people here.
Double bed Room 85.000USh Buffet 18.000.
Safe parking Free WIFI.

name: Hôtel Natal
description:
Simple hôtel but really good Indian staf. 
First they ask me 30 000 for double room. I asked for camp and they told me we give you room for cheaper price. 20 000. After I asked if they have cheapest room like 15 000. The owner say no problem you pay 15 000. Every room are the same. In his restaurant he told me the price is cheaper too for me. 
Different mentality than other hotel. 
Room are simple the real value it s maybe 20 000 maximum. 
They have small parking, and small green area too.

name: Ngamoru Wilderness Camp
description:
A wide camp with several sett up tents. very clean tents US 165 per night
8.000 beer 3.000 water.
electric light in the tents from Solar charged batteries.
A lot of Tsetse flies around during daytime.
They offered us the shower of a tent while camping nearby US$ 10ppn.

There might be lions around by night
 So use a torch using the toilet.

Same owners as Fugley*s in Kitgum

name: Hotel Leslona
description:
Large area with lot of rooms, well maintained
, bar and restaurant (New restaurant not yet opened).
Clean rooms hot showers with only a little water pressure.
Very nice and friendly staff
Safe Parking
65.000USh for double room
Camping allowed on a stony ground in the inner court 10.000USh ppn.
Free WIFI

name: Ultimate Base Camp Jinja
description:
New hostel, great vibe and staff. Biker friendly. They have mountain bikes for rent. Massages available. Great hot shower. Very clean. Restaurant nice garden with option to camp. Safe storage of bikes and safe parking. 24/7 guards. 
15$ a bed. 5$ for camping.

name: uwa kisoro
description: here you can get gorilla permit for both parks! interesting for those not passing kampala or coming from rwanda

name: Thomas Coffee Plantation Tours
description:
The most friendly coffee tour you can find in Uganda. Thomas speaks English very well and he knows how to produce and prepare a wonderful coffee.
10US$ pp He will give you a good discount when you buy some coffee.

name: Sunrise Inn
description:
Large rooms and bathrooms. Warm Shower but low pressure. Nice Veranda.
Restaurant and Bar.
Very friendly service.
Free Wifi
Small fridge in the rooms.
We were the only guests.
Doublebed room USh 100.000

name: Ride 4 a Woman
description:
This is a hostel for local women who have been subjected to domestic violence. It runs programs for the women including a sewing program. They have a wonderful shop where you can purchase the hand made crafts which are of great quality. 

Rooms at a rate of; double $110  includes full board or 75 a single.

name: Mbabulya Foundation Community Project
description:
Very basic hostel in a hiking pathway.
If you are interested in more local / community oriented hiking, the local Mbabulya community foundation organises tours up the mountain right in front of the village. 
The mountain is not as high as the highest peaks but the views are stunning and the people very nice. They organise multiple day hikes and the cost is around 25,000 ugs for the guiding services plus some extras for food and accommodation. 
They have their own hostel, which is a basic local near the pathway. 15,000 ugs per night.
They can also organise food and they boil the water for tourists.

name: Betty’s Ethiopian Restaurant
description: Amazing Ethiopian dishes - and at a very good price. We went 3 times whilst in Entebbe! A humble place, nothing flashy, but the food is great, and well worth the visit if you love (or haven’t yet tried) Ethiopian food. We paid about $5 for a big mixed vegetarian dish that fee both of us).

name: Lake Lyantonde lodge & campsite
description:
Amazing place, on lake Lyantonde!
nice family that run's orphans house and school. 
this place is new and thay have 2 nice rooms (2 more on the way :) ) and big place for camp ground. thay can offer alot of activities around here, village walk, hiking to m't rewnzeri and crater lake's, chimpanzee and gorilla safari, every thing with fare prices!
25000 UGSH per nighr per room.
10000 UGSH  per tent (no RTT or campervan)
Ronald - (+256)0705001536
Wilson - (+256) 0705755010

name: Immigration - Mbale office
description: Little office at the far right side of the big yellow building on the ground floor

name: Namono Cottges
description: Very nice cottages with great food, very friendly staff and quiet! $34 usd Highly recommended!

name: Lodge
description: Reasonably cheap hotel, the only one in town. Its the colourful building with a bar out front. Reasonably clean, bucket shower available. I paid 15,000 shillings after haggling but later found out that locals pay 10,000. Loud music is played at the bar until at least 10pm when I fell asleep, not ideal if that will keep you awake.

name: Lodge
description: Simple Lodge next to a bar. Paid 17,000 for a large room with ensuite (cold shower and western toilet, it was Room 2), fairly clean, no complaints. I was also offered a small room without facilities for 7000.

name: Mweya Campsite N° 1
description: Most basic but absolutely beautiful campsite in QENP. Nothing there except for pit toilets and an amazing view. Book the site at Mwenja (campsite 2), or stay there at public campsite 3. Plenty of wildlife around at night, so ask for some firewood (no extra costs).

name: Total petrol station
description: Total petrol station, pretty good price. Only cash.

name: Guesthouse Sawa sawa
description: Lovely place! Run by some sweet ladies, they have a number of rooms (shared bathroom/self contained) for 15/35 dollars, but they allowed us to put up our tent for 5 dollar on the small inner courtyard. Food is very reasonably priced 8-15000 for a main course.

name: Ssesanga Motor (Land Rover Garage)
description:
I had great work done on my Defender here.

Contact :Ssesanga Hamza
+256706536628

name: Kalagala Falls Overland Camp
description:
Campsite owned by the same company who run Adrift Nile rafting.

It will be fully open at the end of July 2019, swimming pool and landscaping still to be finished.

It is an amazing setup with bays for overland vehicles next to shelter c/w sink.

Restaurant and bar with good food at a reasonable price. View of Nile from bar but not camping area.

Camping $10pp dorms and safari tents also available.
 
Staff are amazing!

name: New Highway Hotel
description:
Good place for stay over a Night.
Clean and friendly
Single-room 30'000.-
Breakfast 5000.-

name: Guesthouse Oasis
description:
in Luanda a small oasis if you have to be here to organize visas!
Clean rooms and spacious, bathroom with hot water shower, single room for 1200 incl. Breakfast. Twin for 1600. Dinner for 3500 and absolutely good food. The motorcycle can be parked in the courtyard. The cars are in front of the guesthouse with guarded parking.
In the Map.my it is still under the old name Rouxinol Hotel in it new Oasis Guesthouse! For me the place to be for one to two days !!

name: Eco lodge Lake Kifuruka
description: 2 grassy terrasses overlooking the lake and facing Mount rwenzori. 10000Ush pp.

name: Rand Hotel
description:
Well signposted hotel in Busia on Uganda side of border. Fairly basic, but clean and friendly. Large secure carpark; I was offered space in the hall to park my motorbike.

Small rooms with double bed: $25 with hot shower and TV; $20 no TV; $15 cold shower. Check the shower actually works before taking the room. Rooms at the back are very quiet and recommended.

Food was reasonable. Breakfast (Sh 20,000) was a disappointment; the full breakfast described on the menu didn’t appear – no cereal, no bacon, no sausages – and they wanted to charge me the full amount.

Good resting spot before or after the border. Shell station closer to the border accepts Visa

name: Lucia Villas in Mbale
description: Well managed clean Hotel in Mbale. Price 20 USD for a doublebed room. Breakfast included. Bathroom in the room, very clean und functional, much better than normal African standards. Good WiFi. Friendly staff. Bed and breakfast, no restaurant, but you can bring your own food. They can also prepare a meal for you (we paid 7000 UGX pp) Cold beers available.

name: Palm Garden
description: Hotel, banga, campsite, bed and breakfast . Very nice compound Just outside Gulu. Good food, relaxed athmosphere

name: Sisiyi Falls Campsite
description: Located 5 km from main tarred road facing beautiful Sisiyi falls. Large flat grassy area for rooftop tents or big rigs and spots closer to the falls under in the forest for ground tents. Toilets and cold showers. Good mobile internet with MTN. 30,000 UGX pppn. (5,000 more to include breakfast). Also has a cottage that is under maintenance as for July 2019.

name: Boomu Womens Group
description: Its a place of a women’s project, situated beside the southern maingate to Murchison NP. If you come from South you better stay here instead of the Red Chili Camp inside the Park, because it’s more quiet and nicer here. You find some round huts, clean showers and toilets. We didn’t use the huts but our rooftop tents. We had a very well cooked dinner and nice breakfast. Manager and staff were very  friendly and told us about the history of this site. Pricing was ok, around 15 USD pp for stay, beers, dinner and breakfast.

name: Kazinga Wilderness Safari Camp
description:
This quite new location is not to find in maps.me, but it is nearby the leopard loop. It’s not behind the gate, so you don’t have to pay the parks entrance fee. We found a very well managed lodge with nice and very clean  bandas, with shower and toilet. Ourselfes we used our rooftops. They cook very good meals, and make nice breakfast. Toilets, showers, everything is very clean and even the architectural and interior design of the housing is beautiful. Animals, sometimes cross the site, and you can see them without paying for the park. Nearby you can start a boat trip to Kazinga Channel. It’s worth to do this. Very friendly staff and Robert the mangaer is a friendly and helpful person.
Pricing Banda: 60USD ppn, full board. Camping 10USD ppn for staying overnight.
Phone: +256 772873106  WhatsApp +256 791017446

name: The Five Horsemen
description: Very nice hostel, good vibes, super friendly staff. Has a beautiful rooftop terrace with a view over the city, food and drinks, some locals also come there in the evening. Altogether a good and cosy atmosphere. Mixed dorm costs about 12$, single room 20$, breakfast available.

name: Bismilah Hotel and Lodge
description: Clean basic rooms, quiet at night. friendly staff. room is 20.000 ugx (5 dollar).

name: Lake Albert Guest House
description: This guesthouse is made up of small rondavels and single rooms in a main building, obviously once busy (during oil exploration times) but now almost closed. Views over the lake from outside the compound are fantastic. You can drive or walk right up to the edge of the cliff. We camped within the compound and had sundowners and cooked dinner right on the edge of the cliff and watched the fisherman’s lights come on as it got dark.  A magical sight. It would be great for big rigs and roof tents. It’s much cheaper and has a better view of the lake than the fancy expensive lodge up the road. Didas who is the caretaker looked after us well and can arrange for you to camp on the cliff edge. We really enjoyed being here and it is absolutely worth the trip just to see the fishermen at night.  We paid $15 for both of us including a tip for the lady who washed our dishes. Bonus! There is also wildlife around, gazelles, colobus monkeys and donkeys as well as goats.

name: plot 99
description: real Belgian style french fries in Uganda! ( twice fried) , great pizza ( woodoven), salads and wraps. great view over masaka from their garden. movienights and campfires occasionally - check their facebook.

name: Golf Course Supermarket
description: The best of the 3 grocery shops we visited. It has its own bakery. Good selection of dry goods. We could buy tonic in bulk here. A little bit more expensive than the Apple and Day to Day that we visited before this one.

name: Stanbic Bank ATM
description: First ATM after crossing from Rwanda. There a few other banks/ATMs in town also.

name: Orient bank ATM US Dollars
description: Here you can draw US dollars at an ATM at Entebbe Airport. They are busy with construction so the location may change.

name: Kyamp's Hotel at the Kyamp's filling station
description: Diesel / petrol and air for tyres. Ended up eating at the restaurant and was pleasantly surprised. Clean and neat and even got a hot hand towel before our meal. Good prices. We had a 2 x rolex, 1 x chips and 1 x African coffee for 19 000 Ush. They also have a nice grass area at the back with table's if you prefer eating outside. We then learned it is also a Hotel. Unfortunately I do not know the rates.

name: Ndego Gate of Bwindi Impenetrable NP
description: You sign in at this gate then you can drive through the park for free. Good dirt road but can be slippery in the rain. Gorgeous drive through beautiful native forest.

name: Diocese of Muhabura Bakery
description: Great bakery selling proper homemade bread loaves, jam donuts, cakes and good coffee. What a treat after so long in Africa.

name: Silent Guesthouse
description: In case you need a safe place to stay in Amudat the Silent Guesthouse is the right place. Martha is nice and helpful. Ask for what you need. There is a clean basic toilet, food on request.

name: Muhabura View Guesthouse
description:
This place is run by the diocese however they allowed us to camp on their lawn. Beautiful views of Mt Muhabura and lovely staff. Charge us $16USD for the two of us and the car ($10US for use of the room with hot shower and $6 parking).
No booze or smoking on site. We are not religious but didn’t feel at all uncomfortable and everyone was very welcoming

name: Kyamps Petrol Station
description: Fuel station with diesel and petrol. Cash only

name: Rwenzori Mountains National Park
description: Beautiful NP in the mountains. Many trekking options (guide & armed ranger mandatory). We did a 26km roundtrip day-hike to Muhama Lake. It poured for half the trek but we still enjoyed it and the view of the mountain peaks at the lake was beautiful. Our guide Ambrose (organized via Turaco Community Camp) and our park ranger were knowledgeable about the flora& fauna of the park and very friendly. We paid $100pp ($35 park entry + $65 for guided hike). Its an expensive day-hike but nice to visit such a beautiful area.

name: Andrews & Brothers Supermarket
description: A fairly large supermarket in Fort Portal selling a decent variety of staples and some fruit and veg.

name: Kisenyi landing site - Lake Edward
description: A boat landing site on the lake past the tiny village of Kisenyi. We arrived when a dozen or so fishermen were onshore cleaning their small wooden boats and nets and got a warm welcome to watch and talk with them. Saw hippos in the lake and sleeping on the shore nearby.

name: Gracious Palace Hotel
description: Hotel in a quiet side street. Double en-suite room 130,000 Ush including breakfast. Clean room and bathroom, mosquito net, extra large bed. Good water pressure. Parking guarded and gated. Restaurant just ok. Wifi ok. Staff polite.

name: Kalitusi Backpackers
description:
This place is a camping site and backpackers but the restaurant is AMAZING and is worth visiting in its own right. Anna makes the best Rolex in africa (at least that we’ve eaten in 3.5 months) and the other food it awesome too. Check it out but don’t be in too much of a hurry.
Restaurant set in beautiful garden.

name: Vine Gardens Hotel
description: Small hotel set back from the main road in a quiet location. Clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff. We paid 50,000 Ush for an en-suite double including breakfast. There’s a swimming pool, bar and restaurant. Safe gated parking. No wifi.

name: Nile Nest
description: Nestled on the western banks the river Nile. The Nile  Nest offers breathtaking scenery from the expansive vantage cottages perched the slopes.

name: Kisoro Airstrip
description: Road is closed that crossed this airstrip, you need to detour towards Rwanda border crossing if going west

name: Surgery Kampala
description: The Surgery Kampala medical centre. Here you can see doctors, get blood tested. Ultrasound. Xrays. Service was fast and Effective. I paid 220000 Ugx for consultation, blood test and ultrasound.

name: Spring motors
description: Good mechanic for Toyota. Reasonable prices, much cheaper than Toyota dealership. But they are not fast - add half a day to time they give you.

name: Endiro Coffee
description: Amazing coffee, great pastries, and awesome service. Best we’ve had in ages!

name: Kampala artisan market
description: Awesome place to come and buy some different and locally made products, jewellery, ceramics, clothes etc.

name: Polish cementery Masindi
description: If you have time and if you want to drive through nice landscape the cementery is an option. It is quiet with some nice children around, no guide, no entrence fee. If you continue the road torwards Budongo forest, you come to a gate you have to pay for the Royal Mail. It is a 2 km way through the forest and back. In our oppinion not worth USD 15 pp to enter. You better give the money to the school half way right to the gate.

name: Panamera Bar and Lounge
description: great food, great drinks. cool vibe. more high end, relatively speaking.

name: Oils -Castrol importer
description: Synthetic, mineral, gear oil, hydraulic... anything you need is sold here in a small alley behind a building. cash only. good prices.

name: Pop A Lock - Locksmith
description:
Mark is a great guy. Has a GS motorcycle and willing to help travelers. 

He's an expert with replacing keys, FOBs, replacing ignitions. 

he's located in the parking lot where this pin is in a sprinter van.

mark - +256752600258

name: National Insurance
description: You can renew your Comesa insurance here. In October 2019 6 month renewal was $154usd. Original 6 month Comesa was purchased in Zambia for $43usd.

name: Corrupt police barrier
description: Stopped by the police because of exceeding speed limit. However we did drive below the maximum speed of 50km/hr. The police officer wanted to become ‘friends’ and solve this problem together: he said we had to pay Ush200.000 to be able to continue driving. We weren’t drive too fast.

name: Village camping Latoro
description: Camp site outside the parc with local people. This side of the parc is where the elephants and the hippos are, they are not in the parc. You do not pay the parc fee. The camp site is on the outside of the local village, you can park and place your tent on the site. Friendly family that respects your privacy but is there to help if needed. Water is available only from the well. Toilet can be in the nature or at the family toilet that is a bit basic. 5dollar or 20000 Ush. Small village centre close by with some shops.

name: Jambo cafe
description: We stopped at this cafe on our way from QENP to Kibale NP. If you see the interior (it is assumed to be someone’s house), you wouldn’t maybe expect that freshly made, very good food is served here. We were quite hungry upon arrival, since we didn’t have breakfast yet in the early afternoon.
