Therefore, we ordered Rolex, chapati with guacamole, two fresh fruit-yoghurt smoothies and a piece of freshly baked lemoncake. It all was very tasteful and very cheap (total bill Ush19.000). The owner is super kind and welcoming. The food is freshly made, so it took half an hour before getting it, but it is definitely worth waiting for. Would definitely recommend this place for a food-stop!

name: The Gardens Restaurant
description:
This restaurant is conveniently located, with secured parking and close to all other places in the small town of Fort Portal. It seems to be a place for travelers from abroad and locals that can afford the higher prices. We ordered two burritos (one veggie and one beef burrito). Although it was delicious, in our opinion it’s not value for money (Ush35.000). Coffee is also very expensive at this place. However, the atmosphere is very relaxed, you can nicely sit outside, the service is good and the ablutions are very clean. So, if you want (e.g. after a few days in the bush) some ‘luxury’ and western food on a nice terrace, this is the place to be. No option to pay by card.

For the same price, you could eat delicious pizza at the Dutchess, very close by. In our opinion more recommendable.

name: Kaddo Guesthouse
description: Nice and clean double rooms with bathroom and (warm) shower outside. 20.000 shilling/ 5 Euro (for 2 people). Good value for money!

name: Rama Motor Garage & Spare Parts
description: Good and friendly technicians but they overcharged us way too much. Wanted 530.000 /= for bolting our cooling fan to engine: 4 working hours.

name: Kirigime Guest House
description: Okay Hotel. Most of the staff is friendly. 30.000 /= for single room, 50.000 /= for double room (single bed). Breakfast is 10.000 /= more. Not all rooms have western toilets and sockets. Hotel is very noisy until early in the morning. Beds were not that comfortable.

name: Palm Heights Hotel
description: Nice hotel. Staff is welcoming. We paid 19 dollars double room with bath and hot water and tv. Breakfast included. The room is big, the bed confortable, with mosquito net. There is a huge and nice garden where you can camp. The lawn is good. Breakfast is omelette sausages cofe thee. We also had dinner rice and chicken which was cheap. There is a nice terasse and bar at the restaurant. The village is less than 5 minutes by walk to buy some local food and boda boda to town is 2000ush.

name: Ferry across the White Nile
description: a bit sketchy for big rig but really big trucks we're using it. no cost. but you do have to register with police passengers and vehicle at site.

name: Lake Victoria Country Home
description: Nice and quiet place. We paid 19 dollars for twin room with bathroom, traditionnal breakfast included. We booked online. The room was spacious with mosquito net and fridge. There is a nice and well equiped kitchen we can use, a comfy living area with dstv. The house is welcoming. The garden is big and well decorated with grass, chairs, table, bar. They have got some tents in the garden so I guess people can camp. There is also outside bathroom next to the camping area. The lake is not far and there are some shops and supermarkets at the corner of the street. I really recommend this place.

name: Victoria Gardens
description: Still a bit under construction but a nice little hotel operation. Got a room for 35,000. Difficult to find so ask locals.

name: Murchison Backpackers & Campsite
description:
Very nice, clean and very friendly backpacker hostel.
The Owner May is such a kind person, she and Hassan helps with everything! 
They do have different types of rooms, dorms, family rooms, rooms with shared ablutions and also privat rooms. The rooms are all in a colonial styled house with a very nice and well maintained garden. 
You can pitch up your tent in the nice garden.
The rates including full english breakfast. 
There is also a small menu for lunch and dinner - yummy! 
The best place to stay in Masindi!!!

name: MTN and Airtel Sim card shop
description:
Place to buy sim cards from MTN or Airtel.
Handy to know if you arrived from Rwanda and need a new sim card for Uganda.

name: The Elephant Home
description: This place has good rooms and also nice campsite. Overlooking at Queen Elizabeth NP. Very nice and cheap food. Rooms are a bit expensive and not necessarily up to European standards but they are still comfortable. Everything is sparking clean and staff will make everything for you to feel good. Above all, this is run by and for the community. Indeed, farmers around struggle with elephants and Buffalos of the park which are coming to eat in their fields. Also sometimes you hear the drums in the evening, farmers trying to scare elephants. Elephants can also cross the site.

name: Wildtracks Overland Camp
description: Very nice and quiet place for camping (7usd pppn), clean ablutions with outdoor-shower. They use solar panels to heat the water. Staff was friendly and helpful. They offer meals in the restaurant and have dorms as well as private rooms. No shade next to car for camping.

name: Bannz Nile Grill
description: Brand new rest stop operation. Good place to take a break from the horrible traffic. Food, coffee, pizza, ice cream.

name: The Deli
description: Upmarket Cafe/Deli - they have burgers, salads, great coffee, milkshakes etc. prices expensive as far as Uganda goes. But a nice break from chapati and beans. Also has fast free WiFi. And the meat from the butcher is fantastic. Kg of Fillet is 30,000 ugx recommended

name: The Seventeen Apartment Hotel
description: The Seventeen is an apartment hotel located on the top of Kololo Hill with views of the entire city. We have two and three bedroom apartments, fully furnished and fully serviced with a kitchen, dining room, balcony, a minimum of two bathrooms in each apartment plus a swimming pool, gym and a small restaurant.

name: Uganda Wildlife Authority (UWA)
description:
UWA-Uganda wildlife Authority-Kampala. This is the place to get Gorilla trekking permits. 

Opening times:
Monday-Friday 8am-5pm
Saturday-9am-1pm 
$600pp price is going up to $700 in July 2020 check the UWA website for more info. 

We came on a Saturday morning and staff only arrived at 9:45 —TIA

name: Masindi central market
description: Fantastic fruit, veggies, kitchen ware, clothing etc.

name: Top of Murchison falls UWA Camp site
description: The Camp site is very sloping with a few flat areas. We are here after the rains so the grass is high and trees lush so not much of a view of the Nile, but a 1 minute walk and you on the banks. There is a Bander to eat/rest under. Ablutions are pit toilets. 20,000Ugs pp- we tried to pay at the Paraa ferry as we did for the UWA campsite on the northern shore but the staff member told us we must pay at the camp site. We have been here a few hours and no sign of any staff members. Road to get here is fantastic. Took us   35mins from the ferry to the camp.

name: Anna‘s B&B
description:
Very clean, friendly place to stay.
Anna is a super Host, great Food, great Breakfast and Dinner. Very privat atmosphere.
Definitely a place to stay! Thumbs up!!!

name: UWA Nkuringo Office
description:
This is the office where you begin the Nkuringo Gorilla Tracking- come here to register and get your briefing before beginning the tracking. When we did ours, the briefing began at 8AM. 

Note: Permits must be obtained in advance. We got ours in Kampala.

name: Heritage Resort Hotel and campground
description:
Amazing view of a mountain and a loveldy garden here.
They rent out rooms an chalets but also let you camp here and open a room for shower and toilet.
As it was raining they let us use a conference room for cooking.
we paid 30000 for both of us.

name: Mgahinga NP main gate
description: Gorilla, Sabinyo hike all start from here. Gorilla treks we found out can be booked and paid for here. But going on a trek on the same day is not guaranteed. We booked and did the Sabinyo hike on the same day. $80pp 6-8hr hike. Card machine without extra changes is available when there is electricity.

name: Coffee Pot
description: Good food and coffee. Reasonable prices.

name: Nyambi591
description: Great place to stay in Kampala. Very good location walking distance to Acacia Mall (Shoprite), UWA office (Gorilla permits). There is also a good Fuel station that does wheel alignment down the road. The property has enough space to fit 2-3 vehicles in the driveway., which is locked behind big blue gates and has 24/7 security guards. We stayed in the dorms but it might be possible to stay in a RTT. Fully operational kitchen, good WiFi, hot showers. Private rooms are available but you should call ahead to check availability. We paid $10pppn for a mixed Dorm room. Nice big beds with own power point and light. Linen was very clean. Contact the owner Alykhan on +256 792 172017 GPS - 00°20′24.14″N 32°34′56.67″E

name: moonlight hotel
description:
a bit noisy until 11pm
typical African hotel. very simple but clean.
gated parking, mosquito nets.
20,000 for a 1.5 person bed

name: MTN Shop
description: MTN shop to get sim card in Jinja. Plus service center.

name: Crater lake view
description: Great place next to roadside overlooking crater lake kesenda.

name: Bakers Campsite
description:
Luxourios Campsite directly
325 $ singel 425$ double full board.

name: Yebo Campsite
description:
Simple Campsite with kind of african huts bandas.
Camping 10$\37000Ush.
Hut two people 50$.
Cold shower.
Wifi.
friendly staff set up campfire for us.
You can order food but chicken rice 10$..we preferred to cook ourselves.
Solar power.

name: Basaliza Pub
description: Specialised on pork meat . Nice roadside restaurant tasty..cold beers

name: Total gasstation
description: We got diesel here for our truck, water for our tank and also air for our tires. And when we were finished, Alfred, the manager, told us, that we can stay here over night. We parked in the back abd we could use toilet and shower. Very friendly staff. It's not a "nice" place, but safe and if it's already late afternoon, a good possibility to stop.

name: Buffalo Resort
description:
Roadside Restaurant at roundabout.
Big garden space with tables under thatched umbrellaroofs.
Eigther porkjoints or buffet 15000, upper quality. Nice recomandable place.

name: Rwonyo Guest House Uwa Camping
description:
Brand new rooms..camping possible in parking lot 29.000
Room 130.000 double
Warm running water, elektricity , breakfast included.( only rooms )

name: GAZ Cafe
description:
Roadside stopover restaurant and fuel station
Buffet for 20.000 incl fruit salad and softdrink.
Good food

name: Bukaya landing site
description: We met Joseph there and he kindly accepted to take us for a boat trip of one hour around the Nile source. This for 40,000 Ush for two people. His phone number: 0754213631.

name: Sunset rock with giant slide (free)
description: Kalikruk (the name the locals gave the rock) is a beautiful viewpoint to watch the sunset or sunrise. Bonus point is that there is a ~ 20 meter slide into the rock. Use one of the plastic bottle sledges left behind to get down faster. All free to enjoy!

name: Hotel Discovery
description: Small hotel in gated compound with restaurant at the front. Single and double rooms available. Basic but clean. Mosquito nets. We paid 28,000 shillingies per night for the double en-suite. Unfortunately no running water in room but jerrycans provided from tap in courtyard. Friendly staff. Safe parking. Delicious fresh mundhazis in the morning!

name: Joshua Mechanic
description:
IMPORTANT NOTICE: THIS IS NOT THE EXACT LOCATION OF JOSHUA KANYERE. YOU NEED TO CALL OR TO WHATTSAPP HIM. HE WILL COME TO YOU.
YOU MAY WANT TO CALL HIM AT +256782151161 OR VIA WHATTSAPP AT +256785326924.
We had a worrying noise when engaging the 4x4. We were staying at Home Of Friends Guesthouse and the management recommended to call in Joshua. He did a wonderful job. He checked the the complete 4x4 drive train and found the cause being a worn out coupling. He got himself the spare parts needed and repaired it. Next day we could continue our travels. He is a very honest and modest guy and charged us a price which was way too low in our opinion even according to African standards considering the work and the result. We offered him a higher and more fair price.
Since he came to us we do not know the exact location of his workshop.

name: Kingfisher Safari Resort
description:
Well maintained big Campsite outside Jinja, overlooking Lake Victoria from the beachbar. Very crowded on weekends due to big Swimmingpool and sports facilities. Price for camping $20/P, can be negociated, (UGX75000/1 night 2P). wifi, hot showers, restaurant awailable
MaWe, Swiss

name: Bomah Hotel
description: Large gated compound. Hotel with bar, well maintained swimming pool and restaurant. Price for double room en-suite was 85,000 UgS with a little negotiation (initially wanted 97,000). Warm shower. Didn’t try the restaurant food but the free breakfast was nice. Beers 4,000. Free to use pool if you are a guest! Perfect stop after Kidepo :)

name: New Daniel Hotel
description: Gated compound set in a pretty garden. Safe parking. 82,000 UgS for double en-suite. Hot shower. Mosquito net. Breakfast included. Friendly staff. Small bar with cold beers for 4,000. 25 mins walking to Jinja market (worth a visit!). Nice alternative to camping out of town by the Nile.

name: Mabira Forest Eco-tourism Centre
description: This campsite is located at the Mabira Forest Eco-Tourism Centre in a beautiful forest clearing. The amenities are rudimentary but the location beautiful. It is situated quite close to the main Kampala-Jinja highway and can be noisy at night especially on weekends but worth it for the forest activities. We did a self guided walk through the forest although a guide is available. 20 000ush for entrance once off and 10 000ush for camping. Private campsite is 20 000ush. The private campsite is further in the forest in another clearing but no added facilities and quite far from the amenities. The road to get to it is narrow and we couldn't drive to it. No running water but we were given a jerry can of water and firewood can be bought. Cheaper option than some of the other camps in/around this forest. Unfortunately there was a lot of rubbish in the bushes surrounding the clearing (maybe NYE party or conference)

name: Hornbill Cave Kibale Camp
description: Hornbill Cave Kibale Camp is a little hidden gem that we were very happy to discover. Coming from Kibale NP, go through Bigodi town and turn right when you see the sign for Kibale Forest Camp then follow the road until you see the signs for Hornbill Cave Kibale Camp. Camping is 10$ pppn but 15$ for two people in a tent sharing. The manager Amsa is very friendly and doing a great job. The campsite has its own forest and swamp which guests can walk around free of charge. A guide can be arranged too. It has 7 primate species that can be seen here in the forest and some frequent the camp. It is a cold shower but a hot shower can be arranged on request and ablutions were very clean. We also enjoyed a campfire at no extra cost. There is a bar but they are still working on implementing a restaurant. Local meals can be arranged through them from Bigodi village. The little details made the place for us such as the candles lit around the campsite at night and the stunning view. Currently, a self contained banda and treehouse in the forest are being built. The camp is developing in stages. There is a tap for running water. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will go as far as to say it was definitely one of the better campsites we have come across for a month in Uganda.

name: Clouds View Hotel
description:
20,000 UGX for a room with double bed, mosquitto net, side table, plastic chair, bath with cold shower, toilet, and sink.

There is secure parking for multiple motorcycles inside the hotel, but anything larger might not fit. Most of the hotels on the main road don't have private parking, but this one does (for motorcycles).

7,000 UGX for bbq beef with plantain and cabbage. There's a bar selling large beers for 3,000 UGX.

name: Bumaga Campsite
description:
This is the Bumaga campsite in Semuliki National Park about 2kms after the Sempaya Tourism Centre going towards Ntandi. The campsite is managed by the Uganda Wildlife Authority and set in a small forest clearing with a mound for the fireplace. Booking for hot spring, nature or bird walks in the park can be booked at the Sempaya Tourism Centre if paying with Visa or cash. You can also book at Bumaga but only cash. One can camp at the campsite for 20 000ush pp (at time of visit) and only pay park entrance fees and activity fees for the day the activity is done. We paid 35$ pp for park entrance and 30$pp for birding (UWA 2020 price list). 

Many C African bird species are found only here for E Africa as the park borders DRC. 

The staff were friendly and helpful. Our birding guide was great and the hot springs were very impressive. 

Cold shower. 
Running water. 
The toilets and showers are not right at the campsite but a short walk to the staff compound. Western toilet with flushing water and all clean. 
A fire was also included in the camping. 
Small bar with sodas and beer.
Local food can be arrange with prior notice. 
Cooking equipment can be hired according to the UWA write up of the campsite. We had our own equipment. 

Also black and white Colobus, red Colobus, red-tails, grey cheeked mangabey and de Brazza's monkey.

name: Kisoro Supermarket
description: Well stocked shop where you can find everything you need, including nuts raisins, meat, cheese yoghurt, toiletries etc. Friendly and helpful owner!

name: Volcano et al viewpoint
description: A really nice viewpoint of the region's 3 volcanoes and a great view of the local farming activities below! Lots of stopping space and quiet with no people around.

name: Ndengo-Bwindi View Point
description: Coffee, crafts, cold drinks with indoor seating and exquisite view at 2150 masl.

name: Kingha Coffee Company Tours
description: Experience life in coffee country! This company supports local community through their agricultural education programs, providing free tools and training to local coffee farmers. Enjoy a coffee safari which can be tailored to ones schedule! A portion of the proceeds from the coffee tour goes directly to the agricultural education programs, helping farmers help themselves. Contact: Kingsley at +256 780 249 250 ; kgriffin@kinghacoffee.com ; www.kinghacoffee.com

name: Victoria Lake
description:
we slept one night there.
it's called a beach by the locals but it isn't really. 
a few people when we arrived in the afternoon, very friendly  mostly fishermen.
the only problem : there is a kind of church, so loud music and prayers from 6 to 8 pm. very quiet after, and we stayed until noon the next day.

name: Kihiihi Modern Supermarket
description: Nice variety, has most things one needs. Reasonable prices.

name: Kansiime Backpackers
description: Lovely chill place to paddle your own canoe to! Beers 5,000. Restaurant a little pricey. Free sun loungers and swimming from jetty. They have huts and dorm beds but unfortunately parking is at the top of the hill!

name: Farmers Co-operative Society Grocery
description: Fresh fruit and veg and more direct from the farms such as honey, eggs, organic dried mushrooms etc. Really friendly service!

name: Road condition
description: From here to Buhomo/Bwindi its an approx 100 km dirt road south in bad condition, but passable. From here to the turnoff near Katunguru north-east its 27 km with stretches of tar, dirt, and mincemeat looking mud and plenty of potholes of all sizes.

name: Red Earth Cafe
description: Upmarket local cafe offering 100% Robusta filter coffee for alertness on the road! Also some pasties, sit in or outside, craft shop, toilets, salon, bridal shop et al.

name: Bushpig Backpackers
description: Decent hostel with cheap parking and friendly staff!

name: KCB bank and ATM
description: No fee withdraw bank in Uganda. A few branches in the city.

name: UAP Old Mutual Insurance
description: Got base and COMESA insurance at UAP. Paid $196 for 12 months, all countries included. Took 1,5 hours, good service! Contact Geoffrey ahead of time to reduce time spent obtaining the insurance at gmpyangu@uap-group.com

name: Anmol Indian restaurant
description:
very good indian food, reasonable prices.
tali starts at 10 000
chicken chips 12 000
chicken byriani  18 000
beer 4 000

name: botanic garden
description:
we arrived late evening wanting to ask for permission to park on the entrance parking for the night.
surprisingly we were allowed to enter and camp anywhere on the grass for free, only the botanical garden fees to pay :
10 000 per foreign adult 
2 000 per child above 5
2 000 per car
the entrance ticket is valid for the next day also, so we spent the whole morning there.
there is a restaurant close to the lake. you can park there but have to pay for the security guy (don't know how much) if you want to spend the night. 
we slept in the grass between the trees. obviously very quiet except for birds noises.
there are toilets inside the garden as well.

name: albert lake
description:
this would be the perfect place for camping, with a flat area and great view on the lake.
you need a 4x4 to reach there.
we drive a motorhome, so camped a bit before, close to the main track.

name: Muhanga modern primary school
description:
The school director ,Medad ,can welcome you in his house in a big room for two guests.Also a free sitting room is available . 
Friendly couple which make the best to feel you confortable .
The place is outside the town and quiet.
If you want you can share breakfast  lunch or dinner with them with local food and tea. The bathroom and toilets are outside the house. 
The price for each guest a night is 20,000 uganda shillings. , the meals are négotiable 
Contact with Whatsapp +256782005901

name: Ruhija NP reception
description: The office to start at 7.30 for the briefing and allocation of groups. From here you drive with your own car or catch a lift to the start of the tracking location. Maximum 8 people per group with 4 gorilla groups in the area. Low season has plenty of extra permits and can be bought with cash or visa at any of the receptions including this one of the park.

name: Agandi Uganda Lodge
description: Very nice and beautifully made upmarket lodge, nice open views, only 2 years old with cottages which are very expensive at 250US per night for full board. Camping with a car is in the parking lot but it has a view and you can use the lodge deck and lounge, 3 course dinners at 20US pp, tent camping can be on level grass platforms. Camping is 10USD pppn with hot water shower in a room and use of toilets at the bar area. Internet is always available if it works.

name: endiro coffee
description: Inside Sol View Musana. Local coffee company supporting Musana community development organisation. Nice spot to recharge on the road between the east of the country and Kampala. Safe, visible on street parking.

name: endiro coffee
description: Mbale's endiro coffee cafe. Local business supporting ending child vulnerability through coffee. Inside and outside seating, open spaces, wifi at a small fee, nice chill out area and meeting space. Able to purchase beans and other community impact goodies. Popular with expats!

name: Guest house
description:
Frendly girl who welcome you
Basics rooms
No water but give you jerry can
Cheap,  I paid 15000 shillings .

name: Roadside stalls and shops
description: Good stop for groceries, roasted meat, bananas and fruit and vegetables.

name: Twin lakes views
description: On top of the hill at the end of the track the most beautiful views all around over QE park and Rwenzori mountains in the distance on one side and twin crater lakes Mirambi and Katinda on the other. Lots of people came to look but all friendly and just interested and they leave after a while....I thought only to return at sunrise so it is busy with kids and villagers which becomes a bit challenging. Coming close to sunset would be good even if its just for the view. The walk around the right lake is great for a good 2.5 hours and the left one about 1.5 hours, and a swim ofcourse if you like.

name: African Village Restaurant
description: A sort of expensive and fancy place with African and western food. I had the best rice and beans of my life there for 5k ush though.

name: KCB bank/ATM
description: Uganda's no withdrawal fee ATM and bank in Mbale.

name: Local honey and souvenirs
description: Nice little stop with a view, locally harvested honey and souvenirs for reasonable prices.

name: Jibu Water
description: Refill 20 litres own container for UGX 7000. uganda@jibuco.com; 077 187 7933; 070 770 0772. Open Monday to Saturday 08:30 to 17:30. Closed Sunday.

name: Gilead Pharmacy
description: Over the counter and prescriptions. Recommend as having the widest variety in Mbale. Cash only. Open Monday to Sunday 07:00 to 22:00.

name: Kampala Adventure Vacation Safaris
description: Good storage in Kampala. The manager Director of adventure vacation safaris Farouk Busuulwa is a reliable and very helpful person cell+256 701 858 025. We stored our car here for the second time in Kampala. He can arrange also COMESA insurance. Website http://www.adventurevacationsafaris.com

name: Kapchorwa Super Stores Shopping Centre
description: Well stocked grocery store with most things one would need. Jumbo's is also another option in town further east on the same side if the road.

name: No fee ATM
description: Centenary Bank. No fee to withdraw cash. Foreign exchange available here too.

name: Sunset viewpoint at Rafiki Lodge
description: Fantastic views of 2 of 3 Sipi Waterfalls, valley and plains below. Bar and free wifi. Various accommodation options at high prices including camping at USD20 pp, but rather sleep elsewhere and just come here for the drinks, views and Wi-Fi.

name: Nada's Diner
description:
Home cooked meals, Mediterranean style as takeaways such as:

- Beef stroganoff
- Beef or chicken Shawarma
- Koushari
- Shepherd pie
- Pizza
- Hommos
- Falafel
- and more...

Call or whatsapp Nada a day or two ahead of time to see what's cooking at +256 793 345 580 and order. Very reasonable prices and incredibly tasty! Nice change from camp food.

name: Kira Farm Development Centre
description: Camping at UGX 55 000 per night per spot for two people, self catering accommodation UGX 80 000 pppn half board or UGX 120 000 pppn full board. Wifi is at a cost. Meals at UGX 30 000 pp. Peaceful and close enough yet far enough away from the busyness of Kampala. All proceeds go towards supporting the work this enterprise does. Booking ahead essential: Joshua at 039 3202361; +256 782 168 526; +256 772 618 347; kira.lodgesug@gmail.com; kira.amigosug@gmail.com.

name: Coffee: The Gold Pearl Coffee
description:
At the Africa Coffee Academy. Buy high quality specialty coffee grown, marketed and sold by local Ugandans. Convenient place to pick up some beans for the road. Arabica from the Sipi region. 


Contact Marble ahead of time to order any quantity: +256 782 041 151; +256 704 553 517; thepearlgoldcoffee@gmail.com

name: South African Consulate
description:
Consulate from South Africa.

Open from 08:00 to 17:00 weekdays. 
Phone: +256 417 702 100

name: Endiro Coffee
description: Endiro Coffee Muyenga Hill branch. Popular with expats this open plan cafe is trendy, stylish and a great chill out spot with a view and exceptional service. Wide menu selection with incredibly curated and tasty coffees making a difference at farm level. Certainly worth a stop if this side of Kampala!

name: Capital restaurant
description: Nice clean local restaurant and bar. Great milky tea and katogo with meat or veggies. Favorite spice with locals.

name: Art in the Jungle
description: Art in the Jungle is located on the edge of the jungle and Lake Nyamirima with beautiful views and a private forest. It is a private property and not focused on tourism so limited and basic facilities only. Good for overlanders who just want to be alone.

name: Mahoma Falls
description: Nice waterfall in dry season and it must be big in rainy season. Just walk down the track on the left and cross under the big water pipe down to the falls, kids will show you, climb up where there is a great spot to swim

name: Wildcamp
description: Just off the main road an abandoned farm with an old building and plenty of space to set up out of sight for a quiet night.

name: Regional immigration office
description: Extension of visa and other immigration matters. Call Joyce for more information +256 772 476 310

name: Alpine Medical Center
description: Quick service, consultation 20.000 and own laboratory to test blood (20.000 extra) and stool (also 20.000 extra) for parasites, typhoid, malaria and other common diseases in this area.

name: UWA Kisoro new location
description: The UWA have moved to a new building opposite the Police station. They are no longer next to the Coffee Pot Restaurant. When we discovered the new location the building had no UWA signage.

name: Rweteera Safari Park
description: A beautiful lodge with camping overlooking a serene crater lake with Kibale Forest in the distance. You can camp right next to the lake, listen to the birds, watch the local fishermen and look for the lakes small hippo. There are 3 different types of primate in the surrounding forest. There is a bar and restaurant here and plenty of activities including crater lakes walk, nature and community walks, canoeing, cycling, tea plantations visits and  chimp trekking. After all that you can relax by the camp fire sharing your adventures.

name: Nguse River Camp
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

The campground is located in between Murchison falls and Kibale forest National Parks. It's right on the road just after Nguse River. Lots of birds, squirrels were seen crossing the road moving from the adjacent hills to the swamp below the camp. The camp has flushing toilets and bush open shower. There's a restaurant on the site with solar power for lighting and charging phones. Solar fridge available too. It has green compound and no nearby neighbors so it's a perfect spot to have a break in your trip and enjoy cold beer in front of birds.

name: Semliki River Camp
description: Semliki River Camp is located in Ntoroko district Western Uganda just on the banks of Semliki River overlooking Congo. The camp has hot bucket showers but they're in process of building permanent showers. They have flushing toilets and campfire. You can pitch your right on the river banks and if you are lucky, you will see hippos. Best camping spot in the Semliki area.

name: Kibela Cultural Homestay
description: New community homestay establishment offering a nice bar with upstairs deck, basic campsite on grass with some shade and toilet/shower with bucket of water. Closed now for lockdown but otherwise a nice place to camp in a quiet environment and surrounding village life

name: Viewpoint
description: On this winding road this viewpoint is sign posted. A parking with shelter and place to stop for a bit to enjoy the view down into the valley.

name: Lodge Bella Vista
description: Although you have to camp in the car park which is ok, this is a wonderful spot to spend a few days. The scenery is fabulous with a crater lake one side and the magnificent Rwenzori Mountains the other side. With plenty of hikes around the lake and beyond, swimming and canoeing too, there's plenty to get your appetite going when you return to camp. There is an Italian restaurant and Pizzeria too and the food's not bad.

name: Kabundaire Market
description: Much larger than Mpanga market down the road this market has food and second hand clothing in abundance. Nice to stroll around and have a look.

name: Caramel Cafe and Lounge
description: Great fresh breads to take away, icecream and good choice of meals and coffee obviously, nice place for breakfast or lunch

name: Vitamin Cafe Turkish restaurant
description: A nice quiet garden with comfy couches to sit away from the smelly noisy city streets. Turkish food and mezze dishes

name: Bahai Temple
description: The only one of its kind in Africa, a temple dedicated to all religious organizations and directions. Free access, a place to reflect and be quiet away from the city bustle. On top of the hill so views of the city all around.

name: Entebbe Airport
description: COVID update; make sure the PCR test is all in printed text. I used City Ambulance in Kololo for the test, got the results but they misspelled my name, passport number and age and changed it by hand which is NOT allowed. Different level of incompetence. The 4 hours coming early is not necessary and they check and check and check again. Have   your ticket printed as a boarding pass on a phone was not allowed. Good luck traveling in this time of madness...

name: COVID test Lancet Lancet Laboratory
description: Lancet Laboratory at International Medical Centre (IMC) Jinja Uganda performing COVID tests. call or whats app +256 (0) 756221047 / +256(0)775106697 for an appointment, they will come to your hotel or camping site for a COVID test, you got the results the following evening via whats app or email. price 330,000 UGX

name: Muhavura Ranger Post
description: One of the three places where Gorilla trekking could start in the Mgahinga NP depending on the actual place of the animals. This gate is not very touristic. You can park there, when you have trekking the following morning. The street is very bad, lots of stones. 14 km from Kisoro. They offer also breakfast, lunch packages and dinner. Very nice people. There is a special offer from 1.12.-31.3.21 for 400$ pp (tourist).

name: Lichrimras Royal Hotel
description: They have small rooms for 50.000. We only asked to sleep in our big rig and use their showers. Paid 15.000 pppn. Showers hot.

name: In the corn field
description: Nice place at the edge of two fields. Plenty of space. Not visible from the street. Quiet.

name: Kisiizi Falls
description: Very nice fall, 33 meter , beautifull walking, 30 minutes or more if you want. also if you want to zipline at the fall its also available.Entrance and guide 5000  Uganda shillings  accommodation is available for a whole family and a single rooms is also available, they have a good restaurant too.

name: Church
description: Nice place for a night. In this area are not so many wild camping spots so we asked here. Pater Peter was very friendly and let us stay beside the church. Quiet. Not visible from the street.

name: Airtel Service Centre
description: We bought and registered our Airtel SIM here. Passport and passport required. Finger print and picture recorded. Takes about 30 minutes. 4G. Data was 3K UGX for 9GB.

name: Baker
description: Good Baker selling bread and pastries including French sticks.

name: Royal Supermarket
description: Indian run supermarket with some hard to find items.

name: Arcadia Cottages
description: Set on the hill above the lake it affords wonderful views. We hiked up from the lake and had lunch (very nice). There is no camping here. The cottages look very nice, and being on the steep hillside, each has a wonderful view. Quite a big place, nice gardens, looks well run.

name: Lay-By With Nice View
description: Not much opportunity along this track to camp. This spot is in a small quary immediately beside the road. Nice view to one side, but no privacy. However, only the occasion car and pedestrians pass.

name: QENP Southern Gate
description: New gate. Affords shortcut to Ishaha Camp. Can pay park fees here.

name: Lookout over QENP
description: One of many nice places to stop for sweeping views across QENP.  Large parking area.

name: Orchids Village Camp
description: You can camp direct at the lake. Lots of grass and nice trees. People are very friendly and helpfull.

name: Airiamet Coffee Shop
description: Calm, friendly coffee place with espresso, latte, AeroPress, French Press from local Ugandan coffee (depends: Mt. Elgon and/or western areas). Apart from local snacks and breakfast you also get pizza, fish, burgers (25,000 UGX), Indian curry, Mexican food and fresh juice.

name: Nile picnic and view
description: Open area for a picnic with water access to Victoria Nile and nice view overlooking the river in flowing direction. Beware of the many hippos directly at the shore and also the Tsetse flies (depending on season).

name: Murchison Falls Café
description: Clean canteen-style restaurant with tasty local food just next to Shell filling station. They also offer a la carte, fresh juice and coffee, cappuccino, latte and have pastries.

name: Smart Shoppers
description: Excellent equipped supermarket. You get frozen chicken & mince, milk, dogfood, and a lot of european stuff (including sanitary products). Prices are good (middle range).

name: Kabwoya Wildlife Reserve checkpoint
description:
Foreign visitor fee 10 $ pp + vehicle fee which is 40 $ for a standard foreign car. You have to pay that also in case you just want to spend a night down there at the campsite/lodge with lake view.
With some arguing I managed to drive down to the lakeside (Lake Albert Guest House) without paying anything. Locals, visitor busses, fishermen and everybody else pass this checkpoint without being stopped at all. Additionally, the whole area is going to be turned upside-down once they continue with their oil production. I see no point in paying the high foreigners' fees if not specifically coming for a game drive/safari.

name: Heritage Gardens
description:
Big rig friendly gardens with a small shop selling sodas. Must be self sufficient. Great place to camp before entering park road to Pakwach 108km distant - we assume wild camping is not allowed between here and Pakwach.
We paid 20K UGX all in.

name: Karuma Bridge
description: This bridge takes you over the spectacular Victoria Nile river rapids. The army/police are stationed both sides, and although there are no signs, photography is strictly prohibited. Beware.

name: Staff Canteen
description: Behind the Shell garage and before entering the lodge there is a staff canteen for the budget minded. Sells cold drinks and basic food. We had a chapati and meat plate for UGX 10k each, and that was Mazungu price.

name: Elephante Commons
description: This is a cafe, but more importantly, they sell wonderful frozen meat. See picture.

name: DHL Agent
description:
Shifted from around the corner to here. Closed Sundays.
Run by Steven 0782922156.

name: Covid 19 PCR Test Here
description: Covid 19 Test here. Three days for result. Lancet laboratory. 300,000.

name: Garden Eden
description:
From overlanders for overlanders.This place is the garden of an overlanding couple, who are taking a travel break in Uganda.
Since the owners are not always around, it is better to call up front. +256 783665311
The garden is nice and has a leveled grassy area with some trees. Toilets are basic African style and the outdoor shower is cold. But the stay is for free and the Chats nice.

name: Twinkle Laundry
description:
Laundry priced by the bag. Machine washed, dried and folded (not ironed).
A good sized bag is 20,000 UGX.
At the location is a house with green gate with an IAA sign. Ring the bell and Marget will attend to you. There is no sign. The location marked on Google Maps is about 200m wrong.

Phone +256 778 145137

name: MBN Lab for Covid Test
description: No appointment necessary, price is 165000 UGX. Results theoretically in 12 hours, but we showed up at 1400 and they told us we’d have results by 0900 the next day. Open 7 days a week, but only to 1300 on Sunday.

name: Truck Park
description:
Large truck park next to garage. Newly built with a sparkling clean toilet/shower   block that would make most campsites blush. Near border. Noisy with trucks coming and going. Armed security. 5,000 UGX pn.
(Garage under construction - shop / restaurant coming)

name: Owa Kitara
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Owa Kitara :- We are a vegan artistic homestay, 2km away from Fort Portal the Tourism City Of Uganda. We Offer :- Mountain Biking, Hikes, Runs, Residence Recording Studio and Camping.

name: Wild spot with shade
description: Nice quiet spot at an old windmill with a nice view on Mt. Kadam. You can go in deeper that track, there is plenty of space.

name: Ferry to Wanseko
description:
This is the location of the official vehicle ferry going to Wanseko. The ferry has not run since June 2020 as the landing is flooded, same situation as ferry in Murchison falls park.

02°14'05"N 31°18'51.94"

You can find the passenger wooden boats that can take motorcycles and bicycles but no cars. I paid 10000 for myself and 20000 for motorcycle. Long negotiations with "water boda" guys to load bike paid 10000 in the end to load.

name: Mobikey (MAN) / Workplace
description: Mobikey (MAN) is a great workplace with a competent team. The water pump in our MAN was defective. The exchange was carried out quickly and professionally. The prices are fair and the service friendly and impeccable. Highly recommended.

name: Good Home Supermarket
description: Chinese Supermarket with good selection and prices are ok.

name: One stop - Kenya/Uganda
description: Please do not apply for an e-visa for the Ugandan entry. We thought we were being clever by getting our visa online to avoid a long wait at the border. They can not process e-visas here and we had a delay of over 2 hours on top of the other things you have to do at a border crossing. It's a new process here and may improve with time.

name: Casa Delhi Turista
description: A small hotel with basic clean rooms on the ground floor but with a great bar restaurant on the roof terrace looking out to Wanale mountain range with waterfalls. Great staff, good reasonably priced food and fresh coffee. A nice quiet budget stop off before or after the border and within 2mins walk to the shops where you can organise your MtN sim. Tours can be organised from here. There is a small secure back yard for two land cruiser sized vehicles with power from one of the rooms if needed.

name: Petrol station and garage
description: Petrol station with tyre repair and mechanic

name: Lancet Covid testing
description:
Lancet laboratory with 24 hr result for Covid19 testing for 210,000 UGX. They do the test at the lab. No appointment needed. Also possible to ask them to come to you. Call 0707536413 to make an appointment. 
They make a copy of your passport. Expect for some stuff ups with spelling of names or passport numbers so make sure all is correct before you head to the border.

name: Malcolm X backpackers
description:
Malcolm X is a socially-oriented backpacker hostel in a super central and safe neighborhood called Kololo in Kampala. It is very close to some great restaurants and nightlife and the premises is beautiful and spacious and has a huge garden and a communal kitchen open for everyone to cook.
 
Malcolm X is operated by the Aria social program and was established in order to build and run a program for young adults from underprivileged communities in Kampala. The participants in the program are trained and employed in the hostel while getting leadership and life skills training, career and scholastic guidance, business management, entrepreneurship workshops and much more. 
 
The place has mixed 6-bed dorm and private rooms. They also allow camping in the garden at a lower price.

name: Parking at border
description: big yard for staying overnight at the border. quiet (we were the only vehicle) and nothing to pay. I think this area must be Covid related.

name: Tropical Gardens Hotel
description:
New hotel being built. Mostly complete with nice garden, including bench seating in the grassy area and large-sized rooms. Owner friendly and helpful. Room for 60,000 USh including breakfast. Hot water showers. 
Quiet and perfect for a stop.

name: Rolex restaurant
description: Local place, simple food, good English. 10,000 for eggs and potatoes with a coke.

name: Local food
description: Very local place with the meat hanging right there. 10,000 for a huge plate of meat and what tasted like mash potato, I’ve had worse in fancy restaurants

name: Jakaranda
description: Very good restaurant! (one of very few options ... The old Travelers corner is just a bar today). A bit pricey compared with local food, but totally worth it if you want western food. We had Cordon Bleu chicken (8 dollars) and barbecue chicken wings with fries (5 dollars), all very well served and very tasty. We also ordered the pizzas for delivery in the hostel and it was the best we had in the last months (they actually put cheese on them!). Chef Peter will not disappoint you!

name: Student Center
description: Pretty nice place! They usually receive students but they accept any traveler. The rooms are only 25000 pp (7 dollars), they have 2 bunk beds with nets, very clean and tidy. The washrooms are extremely clean and the cold shower is great after a long day of sweating. Bright takes care of the place and he is very kind.

name: Broadbill Forest Camp
description:
Absolutely fantastic place to stay in a tranquil location surrounded by forest. 
Campground under construction during our stay but renovation should be completed within the next two weeks. We were allowed to stay in the bandas for the same price while construction was taking place. 
Camping is 10USD pppn. Bandas available as well but I am not sure of the price of those. They do have an excellent view over the park from the deck and are quite nice inside. 
Campground to have new facilities with hot shower. Flat space for vehicles. Big rig should be fine.
Restaurant/bar on site. Three course meal (soup, main, dessert) for 10USD. Great place to lounge. Wifi available.

name: Semliki River Camp
description: Situated on the banks of the beautiful Semliki  River in Uganda, the camp is set on the banks of the river overlooking Congo. 30 minutes drive to the hotsprings, batwa pygmies and semliki game reserve for wildlife viewing. The camp has showers and flushing toilets, self catering kitchen. Rooms are being built.

name: Kasenyi Safari Camp
description: Normal price in May 2022 is $15/pppn. It is possible to negotiate. A lodge and established campground. Only 3 flat spots, because of the  hilly area. In front of a salt lake. Very nice view and many animals around, we saw buffalos, hippos, flamingos and we heard hyenas at night. In rainy season, this place is full of elephants, according to Philip the owner (Ugandan man with many good stories). Very clean and new ablutions, hot shower and very nice toilets. We paid 20000 pp per night. The restaurant is bit overpriced (75000 dinner) so we didn't eat there. Very nice option to stay outside the park and see many animals.

name: Mutukula Uganda border
description:
covid test from Tanzania not necessary. PCR test cost 125000 UGX at border, takes 1,5 h.
Tax for car 214000UGX

name: The Haven Eco River Lodge & Campsite
description: You can store your car for 1$ per day under a roof. Drop off and pickup service to and from Entebbe for ~70$

name: Gorilla conservation camp CTPH
description:
The Overviews the valley, rainforest on to sides. The guesthouse has 5 double bed rooms with big onsuite bathroom. The camp has it's origin in gorilla conservation through public health. That means not only the gorilla, but also the humans living around the Forrest. 
camping is possible. Access road is steep and narrow. They help also with bookings for the gorilla tracking. Everyone is very friendly und you get fire in the evening.

name: Banda lodge
description: they have huts and a villa with 4 rooms, kitchen and living room. due to Corona limited restaurant hours. place is highly recommended.

name: test and fly
description: Here you will get a PCR test within 12h. US$ 65 is the current rate

name: MTN Service Center
description: MTN service center you can buy sim and bundle.

name: Gorilla Conservation Cafe
description: Nice cafe. supports gorilla conservation. You can also have lunch here

name: Sipi Falls Lodge
description:
**camping is 50.000 with only toilet, no shower**

This lodge has a wonderful view on  waterfall  no. 1
You can park at thier lawn parking. You can pitch a tent on the grass with a view of the waterfall. 
The camp belongs to the community and a tour guide to the waterfalls can be arranged. We paid 20,000 ugs pppn. You can ask them to heat water for the shower.
You can connect to the restaurant with a cable, even though it is very weak

name: Enshama
description:
New Lodge in this beautiful area, with 3 chalets currently. More being built. They will offer camping, but it's just next to the restaurant and not that great. Nixon offered us a chalet at a special price because they were eager to get some reviews, and business

Qp

name: Hotel Africana Moroto
description: A new big hotel. We asked them to park if we could park in their parking lot. It was the first time someone had asked them for only parking, they agreed for 50,000 UGS. They let us connect to power by cable. They give us a room for using the toilet and shower. We were the only guest at 250 rooms.

name: Lokumoit Gate
description: This is the official entrance to the park. 40$ for 24h pppd, 50$ for the whole day in the park.

name: Kalokudu Gate
description: A good entrance/exit if it is rainy to avoid the muddy roads.

name: Kaabong Resort Hotel
description: They let us park in their parking lot. Gate height is at least 3.8 m. Connected to power by cable to the reception. 30,000 ugs for parking. We used our toilet and shower.

name: Northern Pearl
description:
Hotel owned by an Indian family.
You can park in the parking lot or next to the rooms, the location is quieter. The gave us a room for toilet and shower. Also to connect to power. Excellent restaurant in place. We paid 50,000 ugs. Sunil 0759984301

name: Lancet laboratories & IMC Entebbe
description: got here our covid test. Swap was taken 4 pm, results took till 2pm. Printing as official result took much longer(4:30pm) All test(5) were negative. Anyway they all work together.

name: Karuma Traveller's Hotel
description: Please note that in GoogleMaps the hotel has another incorrect location on the way to Pakwach. You can park at the parking lot. There is a big grass that you can set up a tent. They gave us a room for toilet and shower. Quite a lot of noise from the traffic in the road.

name: UWA Ranger outpost
description: Along the road to Pakwach there are Ranger Outposts that you can rest and even sleep

name: Vilakazi Murchison falls Safari Camp
description:
The place is pretty neglected but okay for camping. Had to cut some branches so that we could enter with our truck. A very welcoming staff. We went on a whole day safari for 150$. The guide's name was Okello Joseth Olum
+256772350699
A weekend can be noisy
Solar power, They give you a room for toilet and shower

name: Kibale Guest Cottages
description: A large compound with a wide-grass grass that can be parked on. The gate is high for big rigs. Solar power. They have a water tap and pipe that yoy can fill water. They let you use one of the cottages for toilet and shower. 10$ pppn

name: KAFRED
description: This is a community attraction for a Bigodi wetland tour. Monkeys, birds and  antelops. Guided tour for 25$ pp. Ask for Rodger + 256 783506705

name: Sura Mechanics
description: In Lutoto. A good Mechanic. Sura +256795753551

name: Odongo Bazil Mechanic
description:
+256782715903
Odongo Bazil
Good mechanic in Kasese.

name: Kasese Kruper supermarket
description: Very rich selection, also cold supply, cans and snacks.

name: Katwe Tourism Information Centre
description: Katwe Tourism Infromation Centre. The salt tour is a must, 10$ pp. For the birds tour be sure the lake is with water, we have not. Ask for Godwin +256 772 324980

name: Doreen Restaurant
description: local place with good food (fish/meat of the day with usual side dishes (ugali/others had different) and vegetables).

name: Julie's Restaurant
description: nice little place selling tasty food at good price (see image of menu). we had matooke with groundnuts and veggies plus two fruit juice, was served immediately and very tasty.

name: SSAZI  PINE VILLAGE
description:
We were looking for a parking around Mabamba Wetland. Ssazi Pine Village is ok for Big rigs, the gate was ok for our 3.6 meter truck height. Big resort with big grass but quite neglected. When we parked there were no water in the showers. You can connect to the power with a cable. We took from here a taxi to the Mabamba Wetland 100,000 for half day. 
The camp is on the  runway of Entebbe airport, noisy.

name: Spear Motors Ltd
description:
Authorized garage of Mercedes Benz in Kampala. 0702396112/
0392222696

name: Café Javas - Nakawa
description: CJ'S is a very good resturant with large selection of dishes and juices. A bit expensive compared to other places in Uganda.

name: Great Lakes International Hospital
description: Brilliant new hospital, COVID testing available at 80 000UGS

name: Imperial Gas
description:
Imperial Gas Supply Ugabda Limited. We have an adaptor to Europian cylinder. 100,000 for a 11 Kg 
074050839. It takes about an hour.

name: Kikagata (UG)/Murongo (TZ) Border post
description:
South African with motorcycle and carnet crossing from Uganda to Tanzania.

Easy leaving Uganda, just ensure your COVID PCR test has a QR code on it.

Rapid test done on Tanzanian side, very efficient! Go to immigration next and then to customs for stamping the carnet.

name: PAN ENGINEERING LTD
description:
They do any engineering job. They have an open mind and they are trying to find a solution to almost every technical problem. They built us a broken roof window and
 fixed us leaks in the roof and vibrations in the side mirror.
Pardeep Singh 0722593024

name: Parkside Safari Lodge
description: Lodge with large en suite bandas and restaurant. Don't officially offer camping but readily agreed when we asked. Grassy areas are slightly sloped but easy to level on. They let us use the nextdoor banda for the bathroom. Hot and cold water in the shower. Clean facilities. 10usd pppn. Breakfast 5usd. Nice location but probably wouldn't be possible if the place was full. Says they offer WiFi on the sign but we didn't try it. 0392945318

name: to Murchison Falls NP - FEES!!!
description:
New tarred road northeast of Masidi up to the new bridge in Murchison Falls NP. 
BUT Attention! If you drive a 4x4 with foreign number-plate and enter the National Park, even in transit, you have to pay for the vehicle 150$ per each entry and 40$/24h pp. The lodges and campsites close to the NP are outside the park. So if you stay there and and go back in the National Park for a game drive you have to pay again. Complete rip-off!

Hence we recommend the road west of Masindi along Lake Albert to the lodges - that is for free. Roads under construction in Aug21, but in a good condition.

name: Tyrexpress
description: You can repair your tyres and do wheel balancing / alignment. Quick service!

name: Sipi Guest House
description: Better to camp than Sipi Falls Lodge, more grass and great view of the valley from the parking lot. The staff let us use the kitchen for washing up but be aware of the chickens. Bathroom was in one of the rooms, very basic. Staff is very friendly and there is a nice little bar with view of the waterfall. 25,000 ugx pppn.

name: Fort portal
description: Good hotel. Nice rooms. Just outside centre. Good wifi. No camping possible.

name: The Lookout (bakery and lunch)
description:
Very nice place! This is a bakery and restaurant. They also have rooms.

They have a huge grass lawn to camp on. Only thing is they have dogs at night and one is grumpy. 

Very good food, very friendly people. 

They didn't had Overlanders yet, so they don't know the price yet. 
Highly recommend this place to stay!

name: White Nile Rafting
description: If you want to do rafting, please go with White Nile Rafting. It is owned and operated by locals, very well experienced (former professional kayak expert). The right equipment and very nice experience. Call Annet directly +256 787 508236 or go to whitenilerafting.com

name: Bwindi view lodge and campsite
description: A place 200 meter from information centre where tracking starts. Some helpful and friendly staff. But owner was very rude and couldn’t take any negative feedback. They help you also with negotiating the best group. Good food. Clean rooms.. We paid $120 per room for 2 persons including all meals and lunchbox for tracking. Update: Rooms are very outdated and damp, smelled of mold. Not worth the $120! Camping $10/pppn. Ablutions are run down.

name: Mwesigye clinic
description: Laboratory with possibility for Covid PCR test. They give a nice certificate. Results after 12 hours. UGX 270.000 per test. In the Referral Hospital they don’t do tests for travellers. They referred me to this place

name: Endiro Coffee
description: Very good coffee and menu! Amazing view and what a nice atmosphere

name: Stallion Hotel
description:
Nice hotel from very friendly owner. 
We could camp on his lawn or parking (flat) but he gave us a very reasonable price to stay in a family room. S100000 including breakfast. 

there is dstv for sports at the bar :)

To camp, be aware that the road can be noisy...

name: Village home stay Mukikambwe
description:
What a great stay we had with Charity and her family. They build this home as a family house. When you want to experience real village life, this is the place to be.  You can help cooking on fire, get water at the well and help with things around the house. 
It’s best to call Charity in advance because she lives in Kampala and is not always at the village. When she’s not there, her family is so staying is no problem but good to give some notice. 

Charity Naluwu: +256 750 660 703

We stayed in our rooftop tents in front of the house but there is a basic room with a 2 person matrass. There are no mosquito nets.

name: Rainbow house of hope - Maya
description:
Great place to spend one or more days. You can stay on the premises of the Rainbow foundation. Everyday kids from the neighborhood come here for all sorts of activities. The founder of Rainbow, Michael is very welcoming. They can provide food. There’s a toilet and cold shower available. They’re working on making a kitchen and more facilities. This place is very new to Overlanders so there’s no set price yet. We made a contribution towards the foundation. 
It’s best to contact Michael before coming: +256 784 875022

name: Mozes - tour guide (sipi falls and coffee tour)
description:
Mozes is a wonderful tour guide who took us to the sipi falls in the morning (4 hour hike through the community and to the three falls). We did the coffee tour with him in the afternoon, which was the best tour we did so far. We went to the coffee plantation, helped remove the pulp, pounded the coffee till we had green coffee beans, roasted them and then enjoyed a wonderful selfmade cup of coffee. We even got to take the remainder of the ground coffee with us, so we can enjoy it another time. 
He is very enthusiastic and speaks English very well!

We payed 25 usd for the hike in the morning (2 adults) and 20 usd for the coffee tour (also 2 adults). 

You can reach him via +256 752 457 783

name: Safari Gas Station
description: I was allowed to pitch my tent in a grassed area at the back. There is place to park a vehicle. It is noisy as its near the main road but quietens down later in the night. There is a restaurant on site and the meals are reasonably priced. No WiFi.

name: Bikeventures
description:
Bikeventures rents out bicycles, organises bike tours and has accommodation. It is run by cyclists and they support local charities. They have a number of different types if roles catering for individuals or groups.
There are decent bathrooms with hot water, running water, toilet paper and toilet seats. The kitchen looks well equipped. The beds and bunks are comfortable and have mosquito nets and electrical points. There are also fans in the rooms. The WiFi is not the best and was erratic when I was there. There is secure place to store bicycles or motorbikes. The parking area is big enough for RVs. A good place to stop over. May not be the easiest to get to bit it is quiet.

name: Palms Guest House
description:
Simple guest house with clean rooms and shower ranging from 20,000UGX to 50,000UGX per room. 20k room is fine for a couple for the night though the water wasn't working when we stayed so bucket water. Meals available on request.

Not suitable for vehicles. We asked to camp and they were happy for us to but there is just a concrete driveway area so not suitable.

name: The Hangout
description: Area with 7 or 8 food outlets including Mexican, Chinese, Pizza, Shawarma, Grill etc. Kids play area and fresh groceries available. Relatively expensive but very tasty food.

name: Bike Shop Uganda
description: Great bicycle mechanics with spares for sale including inner tubes, tyres, chain, derailleur, small tools etc. Also stock 700c sizes. Recommended.

name: EGH Guest House
description:
Very basic guest house. Rooms with western toilet and shower 10,000 or 15,000 UGX. Water had run out when we visited so bucket water wash. Cold beer available. Ok for a night if you're tired but not great. 

Big garage space for cars but nowhere to camp.

name: Lake Mulehe Safari Lodge
description:
Lodge on the edge of Lake Mulehe, with a wonderful view over the lake. They have a campsite next to the water, but as this wasn’t very flat and quite windy, we opted to stay in their parking lot up the hill, next to the restaurant. They are currently working on the ablution blocks down by the lake, but opened a room for us for shower and toilet. 
One of the most friendly staff we encountered in four months traveling. 
The lodge has a nice restaurant/ lounge area. Breakfast is included with camping. We paid 15 usd pppn.

name: Leonard’s Auto Garage
description:
Leonard runs a very good garage. He is an expert in Toyota, Nissan and Ford cars and works also on the cars of the Uganda Wildlife Authority and Dutch Embassy. 
After being to 6 garages, he was the only one who knew how to fix our AC. He has mechanics, panelbeaters, electricians and other experts on site. His panelbeater fixed the dent in our backbumper and applied new spraypaint for 100.000 USH. New bushes and rubbers on the shock absorbers for another 100.000 USH. 

As he is leasing the garage space, he might move in the future, so best to call him first: 0776 200 014

name: Rweteera Safari Park
description:
Nice campsite on the shore of Lake Nyabikere. The ablutions for the campsite are quite run down, but we were able to use the bathroom in one of the rooms. 
Price was 10 USD per person per night.

name: Bank with ATM
description: Bank with ATM next to street, very easy to find

name: Kumi Hotel
description:
Hotel with big garden where we were allowed to pitch our tent. For 20‘000 pppn they also allowed us to use a room to shower. They offered breakfast (5000 pp extra) which we didn‘t do. 
Rooms look nice but we didn‘t ask what they charge for it.

name: Deluxe Hotel
description: Nice and clean hotel. It is located in a very quiet area but still close to the main road. We took a single room for 30‘000 UGS which was more than big enough for two. I think they would allow camping but the ground is very uneven. So not very suitable for tents. Breakfast is 5000 pp.

name: Ariho Hotel
description: Nice Hotel with rooms for 30‘000 UGX. The bathrooms even have proper toilets and showers (cold). They serve food as well which was good. It‘s located right at the main road. We parked the Bicycles in front of the room in the courtyard. There is also a parking in front of the Hotel (not secured)

name: Mel`s Workshop
description:
That’s what I call a decent workshop. Showed up on a Friday around noon with damaged spacers in the front. They immediately saw the problem and started working on it. Took them six hours, I paid 75,- USD. They also have a very capable auto-electrician, very smart guy. 

Actually the service their own safari cars in the workshop and also they are building up these cars from scratch. Highly recommended if you don’t like to go to Kampala.

name: Santaviva motel
description:
Nice and local place in Kisoro town.
The owner, Ivan, is very welcoming and friendly.
The food is local and excellent (and also very cheap)
The double room including breakfast is 25$ but we negociated 50 000 shilling per night as we were staying several nights.

name: Toyota Kampala
description:
Big Toyota dealer and workshop.
They did our service there. Came in the afternoon and could arrange an appointment for the next morning. 
Everything looks really professional.
“MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.”

name: Karibuni restaurant
description: Nice restaurant to enjoy local food. Quick and good food, vert quind staff.

name: Luweero Hotel Apartments
description: new hotel, finishing work in progress, run by kind and caring Pakistanis. we camped in the parking lot, paid 120,000 shillings for 4 adults and 2 children for a very clean room with a hot shower. they will soon build a campsite. there is a nice swimming pool and a restaurant, not tried.

name: NBM LABORATORY
description: You can make a PCR TEST for COVID-19. 65000 Ugx pp

name: Kikonko Lodge
description:
This is the best stopover between Fort Portal and Murchison Falls. Kikonko just started their Camping business. The Lodge has been finished 2 years ago. It is an eco lodge and it provides excellent food. You can use the shower at the pool site. Wifi provided. Nice view over Lake Albert. The campsite has the best view over Lake Albert where you see thousands of fisher boats lighten up the lights at night. Breathtaking.

15 US$ p.P. per night. 
Breakfast 6$, 
Dinner 15$ three course menu

name: Starting point for chimpanzee trekking
description:
Deo is a UWA ranger, who will guide you to the Budongo forest (30 min drive).
You can take Deo in the car. He is watching this group of chimpanzees for 13 years, so he knows a lot. We left the car at the edge of the forest, where a local was watching it. It was only a 10 min easy walk. We saw at least 15 chimps. They were in the trees and on the ground. We spent 1,5 hour in the forest.
We paid Ugx 40.000 pp. Highly recommended.
Call Deo behorehand +256775285071

name: Kabatoro Guest House
description:
Nice guest house. Raphaël welcomed us for one night. It was the low and raining season so it was really cheap (15000shl for 2).
Bedroom and sheets are clean and we had a best shower in Uganda (cold water). You can park your motocycles and bicycles easily (not sure for van). Quite place, I definitely recommand to stay there instead of going in the city.

name: global Village resort pakwack
description: Still being developed into a resort but they allowed me to camp here. At the moment only a bar and restaurant and 2 bandas, plus toilets and 24/7 security. Nice open green space with trees, few picnic tables, river front on the nile River just a few minutes from pakwach village and northern murchison Falls entry gate. No other campsites around that are outside the park. Only toilets, no showers, but management really helpful. +256788073404  or +256774045126

name: KAZINGA TOWN
description: Stopped here in a field by the health centre and opposite the school. We asked permission to the local police, and Town chief. Lots of roaming animals walking down to the Channel. Elephants,hippo, buffalo, water buck, and a large pack of hyienas. Told there is also a resident leopard. Villagers very nice but nosy so lots of visitors. Try and stop when school is on and not a holiday or weekend as children are many. Further on the road past the village down to the channel lots of fishermen to buy fresh fish and again animals. Got quite windy the night we stopped.

name: Pangolin Rescue Camp
description: A pangolin rescue camp that offers basic camping. Pit hole toilet and bucket shower, still under construction. They also have a basic restaurant and bar(no fridge or electricity for cooling beer). They also offer a basic tree top single room, 2 person tent and 4 person tent. Moses and his staff run the place solely on donations from people and from the camp site. They reinvest all their earnings towards the community and the rescue of pangolins. In 5 years they have rescued and re instated to Bwindi Forest (rescued from poachers and even Congo) more then 106 pangolins. They have on site an oyster mushroom farm run by local community ladies. They also have a fish farm on site to support ex poachers. Contact Moses direct whatsapp +256782386972. 7 km from Bwindi NP entrance in the town of Rugando. Turn left at the pangolin rescue camp site through a narrow dirt road through banana trees. Not suitable for large rigs but medium sized truck 7.6 metres x 3.2 high got in. If they have a pangolin on site you can enjoy a pangolin experience by joining them on a walk in the neighbouring forest and tea plantation when they take the pangolins out to eat. Also offering an interesting village walk of Rugando. Definately an amazing worthwhile experience whilst donating to the rescue of almost extinct pangolins.

name: 1-Stop depot
description: Wholesale beer, soda and water. Sold is a case of Club w/ the plastic crate for 84,000 ugx

name: Wild camp with pretty view
description: It's a really nice spot with a fantastic view. Close to the road though, but you can't be seen. Traffic is OK. In the morning it was a little windy. Had a quiet night here.

name: HOTEL 100
description:
Very cheap, good value. Some hunts in the room but expect that it was clean. They have rooms between 20000 and 30000 shl with breakfast.
You can park your cars, we put our bikes in our room.
Breakfast is just tea, eggs and banana.

name: DTB ATM
description: The ATM from the Diamond Trust Bank does not charge for withdrawals. Maximum is UGX 800.000.

name: DTB ATM
description: ATM which does not charge a fee.

name: Picnic spot
description:
Picnic site on top of a small hill with a fantastic view onto the open plains.
There are picnic tables and clean toilets.
Nice place with a big tree and lots of birds.

name: Guest house / Bar
description:
Guest house, not too clean but enough for one night if you really need one (like us) with hot shower.
For 500 kes.
Its being a bar but "far" enough to don't disturb us.
There is place to park a van or motorcycles. We took our bikes with us in front of the room.

name: National Forestry Authority office (royal mile permits)
description: Here you can get The NFA permit needed to hike in the royal mile. A half day permit is 90,000 ugx, full day is 120,000. You also need a guide which is negotiated separately. The guide started at 100,000, we ended up agreeing on 50,000.

name: Nyakafunjo gate, to enter royal mile.
description: This is the gate to enter the royal mile.  A permit is required, which can be obtained at the NFA office 3km back down the road.  We arrived here first and we’re sent back.

name: Kogere Guest House
description:
We ate breakfast here. Banana and beans. They serve pretty fast. It was good and relatively cheap. Almost european standards. In east Africa it is difficult to find a place like that. Especially outside of the big city's or expensive hotels.
They only have tea, no coffee. It was a recommendation of a local. They also have rooms with shared bathroom for 15'000. As we only found out in the morning, we did not sleep here and haven't seen the rooms.

name: alma flavours and spices
description: Very good restaurant with local and western food. Reasonable waiting time. Best Burger so far in Uganda for 10000.

name: Florida Guesthouse
description: Paid 20000 for a room. A bit noisy until about 11pm. Very clean. Has no sink/basin. Good mosquito net. Cold water.

name: unique city motel
description: Nice little place with a small garden and secure parking. They have rooms for 30000 and 35000 nothing special but clean, running water and real shower(cold)

name: Ultimate Cycling - repairs
description: Paid 70000 for servicing and fixing my gears. Didn’t take long. Seemed to know what he was doing. There is a good coffee shop and bar there too.

name: Eletuka Guesthouse
description:
Small gasstation with four rooms. The rooms are spacious and clean. We could put both our bicycles inside. But there is no running water. They give you a bucket to shower. No toilet in the room. They are outside and very very basic. For one night its definitely okey.
20000for the room we did no nagotiating.

name: London Guest House
description:
Double room with private bathroom. Hot water, western toilet, mosquito net, free and fast wifi, secure parking  40,000 UGX for 2 people for 1 night. 
We arrived in Kampala late due corrupt border issues, had no cash and no sim cards so couldn't transfer money either. The owner was extremely pleasant and understanding and told us to get cash in the morning just get some sleep. He speaks well enough english  What a nice guy and a gentleman. I would 100% recommend this place to stay.

To get there: coming up the hill you pass the Ersam restaurant (big fancy walls), there is a small lane on the left with dirt road, then it's the first gate on the left with red walls.
or, search for the Milano Guest House, the laneway is directly across the way from that.
Knock on the gate if you cannot see anyone.

name: Liana Guesthouse
description:
After searching a bit we finally found a relatively affordable place in Jinja. We payed 40'000 for a nice room (negotiated the price - originally he wanted 70'000) with a hot shower, European toilet and even a TV.
There is secure parking. 
For those who search something cheaper, you can find quite a lot of simple guesthouses around the corner.

name: KK Guesthouse
description: Friendly quiet guesthouse (no bar!!) Mosque not far, though (we stayed here the first night of Ramadan!). Shower in the room but toilets outside. Clean sheets and towel. Nice and helpful staff. Guard at night. Courtyard to store the bicycles. 20000 Ugx for a double room.

name: Bakatai Guesthouse
description: Cheap/clean guesthouse with spacious double rooms for 30 000Ugx. In the biggest rooms (front and back of the building) bicycles can easily fit in. They allow your bikes in the room. Not far from local food (yummy roasted chicken!!) and supermarkets. Hot shower, for once!Friendly staff.No wifi.

name: Lancet Laboratories
description: If you still require a PCR test for the borders try here. USh 160,000 for a PCR test with results in 24 hours. it may have changed price so worth calling first. 0704 215428. fast and efficient with easy parking outside Cash only though.

name: Katabarwa House
description: Simple but clean and cheap guesthouse. 10000 Ugx for a double room with mosquito net.Not self contained. Toilet and bathing room (jerrican) outside.Bicycles fit in the room.

name: Sanyu restaurant
description:
Great place to eat. One of the best we tried in Uganda.Plates always serves with veggie.
Fish available, good beef meat. Delicious rice.Clean.Fair prices.Open early morning for breakfast.

name: Ferry crossing UNRA
description:
Ferry operates! This location is the new loading point and for now under construction. The old one is  500 m N/E
Ferry leaves in Wanseko twice a day the last one  at 16:30 pm. Crossing takes one hour and is free of charge. Trucks can also cross.

name: Water world guesthouse
description: Very clean guesthouse- 30000 ugx for a spacious double room and bathroom enclosed - Hot shower! - Also other rooms at 20000 or 45000ugx.

name: SP gas bottle refill
description:
We managed to get our South African CADAC bottles filled here. Pay by
Mobile money only, we had to ask the driver to do it for us because we didn’t have it set up in our phone.  Paid 8700 for 4kgs, not sure if this was for 4kgs or for the full capacity of 6, even though one was partially full. 

The gas’s filling is down a ramp behind the fuel station, on the right hand side.

name: Ishaka Chapati with Beans
description: fantastic chapati, plain, with omelett or with vegetables and beans

name: Home of Kigezi
description:
A center of conservation for local cultural and natural heritage. Houses a museum, camping spots, rooms, possibility of eating and above all else a phenomenal paradisiac garden. 

Got myself a camping spot with included dinner and breakfast for 7$. Shower and well working western toilet available.

name: Ssese Museum
description:
An informative museum with a small collection of items and a good amount of posters giving insight into the culture of the Ssese islands. One of the tour guides on sight gave me a shoddy 20 minutes tour of the items and a brief history of the island. His asking price was 30000UGX for non east Africans, 20000 for Kenyans and 10000 for Ugandans. The posters do a good job at describing most things of interest, so perhaps try to haggle the price down a bit if you would like to give a token of support to the museum.
The museum grounds seems to often be used as an outdoor club in the evenings. there's a bar as well as toilets around. I even heard about a shower but haven't searched for it yet.

name: URA Moroto
description: URA get your Carnet stamp out for going to Kenia. You stamp it in Lodwar on Kenia side.

name: Immigration Moroto
description: Get your Passport stamp out when going to Kenia. You can not get the Visa for Kenia here. We had an East Africa Visa so we where  allowed to cross the border. Easy going 15 min.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Last Checkpoint bevor leaving Uganda. They check your Passport if you stamp out in Moroto and if you got a valid Visa.

name: Lake Bunyoni Agaba Chef Restaurant
description: This is a delicious local restaurant with a beautiful view over lake bunyoni. Agaba is an amazing chef, he started recently his own restaurant and have been previously working for lodges. We definitely recommend it !

name: Baboon cliffs, crater view
description: Beautiful and peaceful view of a crater (no lake). No animals in sight but worth a detour for a coffee break.

name: Water refill station - JIBU
description: Get fresh water for your car tanks or water bottles. 20L is 5000 schilling.

name: Kansenene Home
description:
Theo & Gudrun have a beautiful spot for camping in their backyard close to Fort Portal. 
Road to their place requires 4x4.
2 pit toilets ready, showers will be available soon.
Call Theo before you arrive to make sure they are around 0772218182
Price negotiable.

name: The Deli - butcher and shop
description: Inside the cafe is also a shop where you can get cheese, wine, meat and other nice goodies! Not cheap, but if you want to treat yourself (also to ice cream and espresso’s) this is the place.

name: Robs Rolling Rock (abseiling and tours)
description:
