Rob ( +256 776 963078 also on WhatsApp) is known for his abseiling tours (AMAZING) but also does hikes, rock climbing and coffee tours (also great). His company started in 2005 and is also know via the Lonely planet. He’s super friendly and speaks proper English.
The abseiling (100 meters next to the sipi waterfalls) was super scary but truly amazing! Bucketlist experience. So don’t miss out. 50 dollars per person for the abseiling. 15 dollars for hikes / coffee tours.

name: Murchison falls bamboo village
description:
Very welcoming staff.. ablution blocks are under construction, but you can camp here for 15 dollars and use a room for showering for free. 
4 course meal is 25$. 1km from NP gate

name: Sipi valley resort
description:
They have a beautiful big lawn on which you can camp. It is accessible for overlanders with rooftop tents, but not big rigs. (Land cruiser fits perfectly).
View is stunning, although it’s sad that they used barb wire for the fence.
You can see sipi falls if you camp next to the fence.
Outside showers through donkeys and toilets near the restaurant (which is a little far).
45000 schilling per night per rooftoptent if you stay 2 nights.
30000 for ground tents.
Grace is the manager +256 781 674387 and is on WhatsApp.

name: Fresh fish and chips by the lake
description: You can drive down to the lakes edge and enjoy fresh fish and chips at some of the lakeside local restaurants. You have a lake view and local markets all around, you can organise boat trips too. Very relaxed and chilled

name: Police stop and escort
description: The police stopped us to tell us we needed an escort for the next 30 km because of bandits. Not sure if it’s true, he asked 2500 schilling to come with us…

name: Simcard - safari on
description: Safari com customer care center. Only at the care centers can you get simcards

name: Ramco gas
description: A place you can re charge your Cadac and other gas bottles. You have to leave it with them and collect it next day. I have re filled here twice with no problem. Place to park outside

name: Katosi lakeside retreat
description:
Camping at a beautiful lake retreat.
Camping is available at an Airbnb in Katosi, Beautiful lakeside cottage. Camping at a lakeside peninsula with great views of Lake victoria. Both beautiful sunrise and sunsets can be seen from the campsite over the lake and it has its own private beach. A good place for full moon weekend. Great place to just chill after Kampala or the journey from Jinja. You have to be self sufficient but can use the cottage ablutions with solar hot water. Fresh fish can be ordered on request or local meals can be organised. Great place to watch the birds or walk into the local villages. 
Please call Diana to arrange your stay
+256 772 587 187
±256 772 587 187

name: DFCU Bank ATM
description: Withdraw cash with our French Visa Card. 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings with 5,750 of fees.

name: Centenary Bank ATM
description: No fees for withdrawing at the ATM (French visa card)

name: Shell (Credit card accepted)
description: They accepted Visa card payment here. Not always the case in Uganda.

name: Blue Spring Dry Cleaners & Laundry Services
description: 2 large bags of laundry left in the morning, washed dried and ready in the evening = 40 000Ugx. price indicated per piece but agreed beforehand on bag price.

name: Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary (Rhino Tracking)
description: Entrance gate to the Reserve where you can track white rhinos. Prices as of June 2022 are: 20 USD pp once off entrance fee + 30 USD pp for rhino tracking + 20 USD pp night for camping.

name: Café Marlette
description: Located at Total filling station. Has pastries, samosas, etc for take away... also pizza and other dishes if you have the time to eat there. They also sell bread (better than the ones sold at small local shops). Good cinnamon raisins buns and veggie samosas.

name: Zion Camp
description: A Bed and Breakfast suggested by Ismail, the shoebill stork guide. Located only 4km from boat departure so it's handy if you just need a place to sleep the day before shoebill tracking. The place is owned by Catherine a very kind Ugandan woman. You can camp at the lawn in front of the rooms (not much privacy) or at the back of the property near maize fields. They open a room for toilets and cold showers (she can warm up water if needed for a bucket shower). They can cook meals if needed. Nice views of the lake when you're on your rooftop tent or from the upper garden. Great Mobile internet with MTN, just good enough with Airtel. We paid 15,000 UGX pp. Catherine's whatsapp is +256787422340

name: Rwenzori Snow Peaks Coffee House
description: Coffee house where you can get a very nice cup of coffee, from beans grown in the area. You can also buy ground/beans directly from the cooperative. Think you can also do a full tour in the field, but probably have to call in advance

name: SANYU Children’s home
description: This place will allow you to camp or stay in guest house. It’s an approved orphanage since 1929 and please donate for your stay. You can spend a day with the children to support the orphanage staff. Camp at a donation please! Stay as guest for 60000ush

name: Fig Tree - Kagi’s House
description: Kagi invited us on his land for one week. We stayed in his very nice and well maintained garden. The place is only 5-10min from the city center. You can shower with clean water in a bucket and there are dry toilets. He charged us only 10k/night to support Danny the handyman.

name: Wage Farm
description:
Great place to buy some local spices and wonderful turmeric tea. Isaac is the cofounder of wage farm, helping women to create their micro farm in permaculture to produce spices around the country. We stayed one week in their garden sharing amazing food and moments with him and his wife Shadia. We learned so much about spices and helped out in their garden. We highly recommend meeting this beautiful person and family and give them a hand if you can.

I would advise you to contact Isaac in advance by WhatsApp +256 778 483 331

name: Kiho Lodge
description: This is the best spot in Uganda. It’s a Luxury Hotel/lodge with restaurant (set 3 course at 15-18USD exquisite food), spa, wonderful rooms, fireplaces, outdoor showers connected to rooms, clean bathrooms. We stayed in our caravan in the car park and supported the Lodge by eating here. Charles the owner has put great detail into clean water, the gardens and in the wet season, animals like Elephants walk in the garden!! Make it a certain stop for some luxury in rough Africa. Possible Gorilla family close by if you are lucky, and free use of mountain bikes for guests. All other activities are available as usual through the lodge, Uganda Authorities take their fee. Forest walk 70USD, Pigmy Cultural tour 15USD, etc

name: Autotec Motors Ltd
description:
Very experienced African workshop. Shiraz, the owner, is the 3rd generation of owners. His 3 sons are all involved, either in the workshop or in the part shop next door.
All kind of mechanical, electrical work and panel beating can be done.
Shiraz has good contacts to Kampala through relatives also in the business.
They service the police, military and firefighting trucks.
Got my Toyota Landcruiser engine reworked and repaired very quickly and all the bodywork and spray painting done after an accident. They work throughout the whole week, even on Sundays.
Contact: Shiraz
+256 752 401 553

name: Fine Gas Distributor
description: +256 754 488590 ask for Mbarak. We filled South African tanks here with screw tops. 4.5kg cost 78000UGSH

name: Tour Guide Juma
description:
Juma workes as a guide in Sipi and around Mount Elgon. He offers different activities: 

Coffee Experience - 15$ 
Waterfall Hike - 10$ 
Sundown Walk - 5$ 
Abseiling Adventure - 50$ 
Community Walk - 10$

Elgon Trek also available (more Infos at his website www.elgontrek.com)

He lives in the village of Sipi "behind" the main road - we couchsurfed at his place for 2 nights and did the waterfall hike and the coffee tour with him. Here you can experience the Sipi village/community way of life.

His planes for the future are building a kitchen and get running water at his place to offer a homestay for future visitors 

We can definitely recommend him for both, a guide and a host

His contact details are the following:

Juma Chebet 
+256787767402 (WhatsApp)
chebetjuma1@gmail.com

name: shell petrol station
description:
possible to fill CADAC. 40000UGX for 3kg. Took less than 1hour. 
after trying Imperial where nobody attended, we went to Shell station. Steve (+256750474754) took us to a small filling station nearby, where they kept the bottle for less than 1hour, the time to find the adaptator for a CADAC bottle. Steve called when it was done to fetch the bottle at Shell station. No added tip asked.

name: Leisure Gardens
description:
Great place for a stopover, big green garden with several basic chalets for 20.000. 
Nice and cheap local food at the restaurant, they also have a small bar with cold drinks. staff was super friendly,  we ended up watching the Premier league together in the bar.

name: Savannah Lodge
description: Beautiful lodge on the Kidepo Valley National park. It has safari tents a nice restaurant and a bar. Place to park cars and bikes. Safari tents have toilets and showers. The view is magnificent.

name: BP Campsite-Buwenda
description: Located on the banks of River Nile the logest river in the world. BP Training & Campsite,Buwenda provides a perfect venue for all social activities such as picinics, teambuilding, weddings, camps, weekend outings etc. The campsite has accommodation facilities with a Guest house, Twin Bandas , and camping tents for campers. Other facilities available is a multipurpose Hall, Event tents. While at the campsite you can access the river bank, have scenic views of the River Nile at very close angles.

name: MTN Service Center Malaba
description: Here you can buy a MTN Simcard and get your registration.

name: Jalja Supermarket
description: Nice supermarket with indian owner. They have f.e. joghurt, Müsli, Peaceful Sleep Roomspray, beer, wine, Whiskey and other alcoholic drinks.

name: Sambiya River Lodge
description: Official Lodge with rooms and bandas. They let us camp in a very nice grassy and shady part of the lodge. They opend a room for toilet and shower. Wanted to charge 50 USD pppn. In the end we paid 30 USD pppn. Very nice staff. Bar and restaurant and a pool you can use. Also zip lining possible for 77.000 ugx. Very recommend this place. No MTN signal. Free but pretty slow WiFi at the main building.

name: New Palm Hotel
description:
We asked if we could park here overnight and were very nice welcomed. 
It’s a hotel with rooms for 80.000 Shilling but we negotiated 30.000 to stay with our rooftop tent. They even had a Sauna and a steam bath available for their guests. The staff is very friendly and the manager came to show us around the place. The chef is cooking very delicious meals. We can really recommend this place

name: Mama Rula's
description:
Camp just outside Chipata, best stop before heading to South Luangwa. Bar and restaurant. Individual toilets and showers (not always hot)
Note: At the Engen fuel station in Chipata you can pay with credit card.

name: Bridge Camp
description:
A bit run down but very nice bar area.

Nice stopover between Lusaka and Chipata. May 2022 : 260Kw pppn negotiable Kw180 pp for camping.

name: Eureka Camping Park
description: Large campsite with chalets around the edges. Overland trucks also use this site. Under the flightpath for Lusaka Airport. Bar with a bar menu. Thatched huts for some of the sites, and some braai stands. 150 kwacha pp

name: Mlibizi Zambezi Resort
description: Camp site and Chalets. WiFi, boat cruises, OK ablutions.

name: The Royal Sijango Village
description:
correction: We had our car fixed by mr. Nell who is a neighbour. He was a bit shocked we stayed here because lasr period there were armed rob berys in this place especialy when camping alone. he thought it had to do with untrusfull staff. We were lucky then........
Very nice campsite, spacious sites, good for 4 groups. Surrounded by  forest. Well run and one can use the swimming pool, bar and restaurant of the lodge. 10 USD pppn.

name: The Moorings Farm & Campsite
description:
PRICE 27 ARPIL 2022: 140 kwacha ppn.
A few campsites and chalets on a working farm which is 1 km away. The sites are on a nice meadow with big trees. Every site has its own little boma.Very tidy. No MTN network.

name: Chimemwe Lodge
description: Small campground behind Chalets, no WIFI, but  good 3G connection to Internet. 180 K pppn for camping

name: Nyamepi Camping
description: There are a couple of sites on the river where they charge $23,- pppn instead of $115,- per site. With two persons that will be a good option. Stayed at SB-1, which can only be booked on site. Views are lovely, ablutions were clean and hot water via donkey (if needed). Lots of wildlife at night in the campsite.

name: Pioneer Camp
description: 20kms north east of Lusaka. Lovely campsites, bar, pool. Close to International Airport. Clean borehole water. *2021 update: 12 USDpppn.

name: Nkanga River Conservation Area
description: Camping within conservation area at river. Place also used for student camps.

name: Wildlife Camp
description: Superb place directly at the Luanga with view of elephants, hippos, crocs, baboons and leopard (if you are lucky). A campsite inside the park wouldn't be any better. Popular with overlanders. USD 10/16 pppn. Three times as expensive as other places, for example bush walk USD 55 (+ park fee), spaghetti bolognaise USD 16, firewood USD 5.

name: Jollyboys Backpackers
description: Vehicles camp on driveway but grass spot in the back.  Ablutions good.  Bar and restaurant.  Can organise tours and outings.  Cost:ZKW43.5

name: Eagle's Rest
description: This campsite is in a fantastic location being right on the shore of Lake Kariba with beautiful views! ZMK100pppn and children under 16 are free. The campsite has green grass and the ablutions have been recently renovated and are luxury and full of character for camping standards. There are braai spots and a beach bar area and a restaurant with a swimming pool. There is a childrens play area. Lodge accommodation sleeps up to 4 persons at between ZMK750 and ZMK850 per night depending on the number of people. Sometimes there are mid week specials which are 50% off the lodge price.

name: Kiambi Lodge
description: Very beautiful campsite overlooking the Zambezi River; free tea and coffee in bar / restaurant area!  Good ablutions. Paid for wifi  Cost:14USD pppn for camping.

name: Kapishya Hot Springs
description: Pretty campsite near the hot springs.  Flushing toilets and hot showers (donkey boiler).  Bar and restaurant at main lodge.  Very expensive drinks and food: full english breakfast US$26 per person!  Beers and other drinks also overpriced. Paid internet.  Cost: US$20 pppn. Power at US$5 per night.

name: Thorn Tree Guest House
description: Very friendly hosts!  Gorgeous house with rooms overlooking large garden.  Can camp either in the garden or erect rooftop tent in carpark.  Bar and restaurant reasonably priced.  cold shower. Flushing toilets.  60Zk pp

name: Nkupi Lodge
description: Ideal place near the port (for doing carnet at customs).  Clean ablutions (warm showers and flushing toilets).  Small bar and will cook meals for a reasonable price.  Lots of space for camping and also a few chalets.  Cost:Kw100 pppn

name: Mutinondo Wilderness Camp
description: Lovely campsite 25km off the main road. Spaced out sites with braai and wood. Central ablution facilities with lovely showers and plenty of space. Open-air kitchen. Honesty bar and meals available. Lots of activities. *WF available at the restaurant, 20 USD PPPN

name: Maramba River Lodge
description:
Spacious campsite. Braai on most and table on some. Nice ablutions. Resident hippo that comes up from the river at night. Bar and restaurant. wifi in the bar.
15USD per person per night for camping. Not sure if price is justified. Might be best to try other locations first.
Edit: Price as of 17 August 2022 is $20 (KW 320) PPN, There is better elsewhere and at a reasonable rate.

name: Tracks & Trail river camp
description: Clean grassy campsite and there is a pool

name: Bushcamp
description: Nothing beats bush camping. Just pure nature and nice views over the river.

name: Lyangu
description: Shady campsite, plenty flies. Newly built ablutions. Water from the well.

name: Ngonye Falls Community Campsite
description: Fantastic beach nearby and the facilities were great

name: Kabula Tiger Lodge
description: A taste of South Africa. Lodge geared towards SA tiger fishing, prices quoted in RSA and conveyed to kwacha. A peaceful and beautiful spot overlooking the Zambezi. Was rainy season when we came so we had the place to ourselves. To get here follow a long sandy trail from the main road. K80 pppn plus K30 for firewood. Nice chalets for K420 pn.

name: The waterfront lodge
description: Fanciest city campsite by far!!!!   Caters mainly for the lodge, chalet, hotel set but also has permanent and own tent campsite.  Bar and restaurant available for guests and visitors.  Zambezi and Vic Falls experiences can be booked/arranged from here (very expensive).  Wifi for free. Every site has its own braai, water tap and electricity on site. Pool is extraordinary clean. Shower is hot. Rate is now 275 Kwacha p.P.

name: Chizano Lodge
description: Zambezi-side site with wooden decking and viewpoints over rock pools and rapids.  Reception & bar in sandy flat area (suitable for camping), half dozen individual chalets in adjacent fenced area (not visited or examined but looked decent).  Camping KW150 pppn - not good value as no power (batteries buggered) and toilet blocks very basic.  I.e. Separate male and female hut consisting of toilet (no seat), sink & shower. Female hut had no door.  Hot water by fire-heated tank to rear - decent temp.  A decent site and could be very nice, but basic.

name: Croc Valley Camp
description: Nice family run lodge with campsites overlooking the river! Overlander trucks are separated. Elephants and hippos are frequent guests. Good restaurant, ok ablutions, game drives & walking safaris can be organized.  >>12 USD p.P./Night plus 12% tax or 150 kwacha (including WIFI 100mb)

name: Chishimba Falls
description: Camp with braai area next to the water falls and information center, shady trees, basic ablutions, friendly and helpful stuff. 15 USD pppn includes entrance fee, 5 USD for car.

name: Lumangwe Falls
description: Camp with braai area (firewood provided) and shelter directly at rim of water fall. Spectacular view!  Shady trees, tidy place, very friendly and helpful stuff. 15 USD pppn - entrance  fee included, 5 USD for car. Take road from Kawambwa. Road from Mporokose is extremely rough/erosions for some 10 kms. Nice walk /drive to the gorgeous Kabweluma Falls (5 km from gate). One of our top 10 places after 1 year in Africa.

name: Mumbuluma Falls
description: Tidy place and toilet next to entrance, firewood provided, you can take a shower under the waterfall:-) 15 USD pppn including entrance fee, 5 USD for car

name: Forest inn
description:
Lodge with campground next to road (noisy), 4G mobile internet.
Neat campsite with many trees and good facilities, hot water, electricity, laundry, restaurant and wifi. Good stopover with friendly staff. For 30Zk (2,50€) you can get a wheel barrow load of fire wood. 70Zk (6€) pp

Camping prices (2020) $15 pppn.

name: Kasanka National Park
description: There are 3 different campsites available. Because they were all fully booked (high season for bats!) they let us camp at the Conservation Center (which is outside of the national park). Firewood provided, camping 10 USD pppn + entrance fee 63 ZMW pppn+ car. Don't miss to visit the BBC Hide for bat watching!

name: Fig Tree Cafe
description:
Wow, all freshly prepared, coffee, tea, cake, pastry, any snacks, home made jam and other specialties! Never mind the price, you'll know all is freshly done and very yummy! Nice green setting outside and welcoming inside as well. Curious shop offers unique stuff. Great staff and owners! Definitely worth a longer stopover! 
Closed on Sundays

name: Zambia Immigration Office
description:
Zambia Immigration Office. (CASH ONLY) Open 6am-8pm. $50usd for visa (accept USD only) 

NOTE: KAZA Visa not valid here. Only for entry in the Vic Falls area.

name: Kariba Dam Wall
description:
Possible to cross the dam on foot. Open from 06:00-18:00.
Amazing.
Stop at either Zimbabwe or Zambia border for more information.

name: Muyangana Restaurant
description: Building up conference facilities. 50kwacha pp. dstv sports bar on site.

name: South Luangwa National Park
description: open from 06.00-18.00 hours. entry fee is 35usd pp and 15usd per vehicle. entry fee is only valid for that specific calender date you enter. very muddy during rainy season. do not leave the gravel roads

name: Kashize Bush Lodge
description: About 5km outside of Choma. At time of visit there were 3 basic rooms, small, but clean. In between these chalets you can pitch up the tent wherever you want and the chalets bathroom can be used. it doesn't look like a typical campsite, but it was still under construction. there is also a bar, which can be noisy til late. camping: zkw 40 pp. chalet: zkw 100.

name: El Pantano
description: nice little restaurant with typical zambian food located next to the main road, opposite the petrol station in a green compound, where there are also other small shops and a Internet cafe.

name: Police Post
description: open 24 hours. in rufunsa village. they said a new police station will be build.

name: Kacholola Hotel
description: Hotel with some private rooms which we didn't see from the inside as they were all occupied. So it's not an official campsite, but the friendly owner allowed us to pitch our tent under a shelter in the garden. Ablutions could be better. Food can be ordered at Restaurant.

name: Fringilla Farm campsite
description:
Nice campsite with simple ablutions about 50km north of Lusaka along T2/Great North Road
Working farm with a simple campsite and chalets at the back. Very friendly staff, electricity and light at site as well as a large communal braai and fireplace area. You can hear the highway though. Excellent butchery (try the biltong) and other farm produce for sale (milk, vegetables, eggs, cookies etc). We had the dinner buffet for 110Zk pp (9,50€) which was great value and sourced almost entirely from the farm, service was outstanding. Lunch was also good especially the meat pies. Many marabou storks along short walking path out back. Wifi at restaurant/bar and reception which was comparatively fast. Very nice Scottish manager came by every day for a chat and to give us information about things to do and see. Great place for children with large playground and loads of different farm animals. 120Zk pp (8,50€)

name: Fresh Air Lodge
description: nice clean. 3km from border.  good stop over for night. 150kcha for double with hot shower and sat.tv. breakfast included. suspect camping would be ok.

name: Macfarlanes
description: Car and truck recovery and repair specialist; Landcruiser experts.

name: German Truck Tech
description:
Trucks & 4x4 Mechanic.  Mercedes specialist.  
call Carsten: +260 977 802984

name: Broken Hill Lodge
description:
We camped in the back yard of the Lodge in front of a room. We could use the shower and toilet of the room for 300 ZMW. 
The bathrooms are clean.

name: Nico Insurance
description: Good place to get Comesa Yellow Card cost was 1200.00 Kwaacha very helpful

name: Kasabushi Camp
description: Beautiful camp inside the Kafue National Park at the river. Very nicely built facilities. Fireplace for each campsite incl. firewood. 200 ZMW pp pn.

name: Hippo Bay Campsite
description: Wonderful place to stay right at the lake. Since we visited in June there was plenty of water in it. Andrea, the owner, is such a nice guy and the staff is super friendly! The lodge a bit further down the road is amazing as well with a lovely lapa. Please note that it takes a bit longer when coming from Livingston since the road towards the Dumdumwenzi Gate is bad, as well as the Cordon road within the park (at least in June 2018). They are building a new road so this should improve.

name: Zikomo Safari Camp
description: Lovely quiet camp near Lodge, next to Luangwa River in the quiet Nsefu Sector, quite expensive. good open air ablutions, owner by an American family, very friendly setup and staff. Campsite does not take large groups, and is quite tight and small, so best to ring first +260 216246202, it's about 26km off the Tarmac on a tight slow track. Camp closes in wet season as access is impossible, game drives $55 pp lots of animals in this quiet part of the park. Worth a trip if you don't want the noise of the other camps, they have direct access into the park for their game drives so no need to go in via the  gate

name: Tanganyika Science  Lodge
description:
Update May 2022: camping 120kwacha pppn.  

Gorgeous little hideaway Lodge. You can camp straight at the lake shore. Facilities are simple but clean and neat. Clean water for swimming.

It is a bit difficult to find, even if you use tracks4africa. When you think you are lost or completely wrong , then you are nearly there. Ask locals, they know  the place.

name: Agriculture Ministry Rest Camp (Traveller Lodge)
description:
Run down Motel. We could camp under the trees and use the facilities of one room for 50ZMW pp/night. 
It's good enough for a stop over but not more. 

There are better options as we found out: drive a bit north on the T2. On the left, after about 1km,  are promising Lodges. One had on there sign,  that they have a campsite.

name: Ngoma Farm
description:
lovely spot at a man made lake, for now the are no facilities, but toilets and showers as well as chalets are in the planing.
ask at the farm for permission and you will be shown to the spot!
perfect spot if you are self sufficient. for now still private! not jet officially opened.
very friendly farmers family, ask for Mr. Cornwell
alloutmedia.de

name: Ogaz
description:
Refills gas bottles. 
They have no European bottle adapters and therefore do not refilll those ones!

name: OXYZAM
description:
Refills gas bottles. 
They have no European bottle adapters and therefore do not refilll those ones!

name: FOLEY'S AFRICA
description:
Land Rover Defender specialist.
Several people recommend Nick as the place to go.
Service costs 179USD, including oils, filters and healthcheck. 

You may need an appointment as he is very busy. 
www.foleysafrica.com

name: Kubu Cafe
description:
Relaxed and tasty restaurant at the "mall" next to Shoprite. 
Try their burgers or wrap!

name: Sancta Maria Mission
description:
The mission allows the occasional visitor to camp in its grounds with the best view in town overlooking the Zambezi River. They have the best drinking water in the region and opened some rundown but functional room for us to use the shower and toilet. There is also a thatched shelter under which you can pitch your tent.
We gave a donation of 50Zk (4,50€)

name: Bush camp Zambezi Beach
description: Fantstic spot on white sand beach right at the Zambezi. Access is through a tight spot in the bushes just left of the pontoon. You also have a view on the impressive foot bridge spanning over the river which is used by pedestrians, bicyclists and even motorbikers. The locals are very friendly and respectful and we had some nice chats without feeling like the general entertainment. There are some shallow areas at the river where you can wash yourself and the water is clear enough to watch out for crocs.

name: Green View Guest House
description: Camping on lawn or parking, they opened a chalet for toilet and shower, ours had no shower head and only cold water, when we came back for another night we asked for another bathroom which had a shower head but almost no pressure and no toilet ring, rundown place but friendly staff and security at night, 100Zk (9€) for tent/car

name: Brenda's Best Baobab
description: Charming little place at Zambezi with green lawn, nice overgrown garden and large Baobab tree. Lovely Brenda is running the place together with her Dutch husband. If you have a ground tent you can pitch it on the lawn at the river where there are some braai areas, vehicle camping is in the small parking next to the reception hut. With a larger extension cord you could get electricity from near the Baobab, ablutions are clean, showers were cold but there is a boiler so maybe the staff just forgot to switch it on, dish washing area behind ablutions and there is also a small restaurant as well as 4 chalets. 50Zk (4,50€) pp

name: Ngonye River Camp
description: Fantastic place at the Zambezi and near Ngonye Falls run by Jack from Livingstone who has put a lot of effort into building it. You can pitch your tent on the green lawn or sleep in/on top of your vehicle in the parking. There are beautiful white beaches with sun chairs and umbrellas, a terrace as well as a braai area overlooking the river and hammocks. A sink and stove is provided for self-catering, there is wifi, solar powered electricity and there are also two en suite chalets. Boat and fishing trips possible. 10US$ pp for camping and 25US$ for a chalet for two people.

name: Bush camp Termite Forest
description: A tight squeeze into the forest in a little populated area.

name: Chimfunshi Wildlife Orphanage
description:
Very worthwhile detour to a chimp sanctuary which does amazing work. 85 year old Sheila founded the place and is full of interesting stories. You can buy wifi for 50Zk for 150 minutes and there is a well stocked curio shop. All proceeds go to the orphanage. 
They allow camping for a hefty 150Zk (13,50€) pp so rather see it as supporting a good cause as facilities are limited.

name: Riverbend Campsite
description:
Very nice little campsite at bend of the Kafue river. Facilities are well maintained and the caretaker Patrick looks after his guests admirably well. There are several braai areas, a large thatched shelter with tables and benches, a playground and dish washing area. Lights are powered by solar panels, ablutions and dish area have hot water through a donkey and a huge campfire was lit for us. In the rainy season you can go fishing and there are canoes for hire as well as beautiful walking paths over the cattle farm. 
80Zk (7€) for the tent/car/family and 30Zk (2,50€) pp

name: Nsobe Game Camp
description: Beautiful place with campsites at a peaceful dam with table, benches and braai area. Ablutions are clean but there was very little hot water coming out of the shower heads. You can freely explore the farm which has game, cattle, pigs and fisheries and we saw bush bucks, vervet monkeys, reed bucks and water bucks. Don't miss the reptile park with a variety of snakes and knowledgeable caretakers. On weekends a spa is opened with sauna, jacuzzi and massages and there is also a pool. We had lunch in the restaurant for a fair price and enjoyed it, beer is cheap at 10Zk (0,90€). Tap water is not potable but we could get some drinking water at reception. Can get crowded on weekends as it is one of the few getaways for expats in the area. 35Zk (3€) pp + gate fee of 25Zk (2€) pp which you only pay once per stay

name: Senanga Safaris Lodge
description: Typical local and rundown lodge but probably one of the better options in town. Situated right at the Zambezi and we enjoyed watching the mokoros over a cold beer. Green grounds and a pool. They allow camping for 100Zk (9€) pp but say that they had complaints because of the sloping ground. A chalet costs 250Zk (22€). We didn't stay but think it's good for a cheap cold drink in the afternoon.

name: Sandy Beach Safari Lodge
description: We came here on a recommendation for 2 nights, a stunning spot on the lake. There are rooms available and also camping for 75 Zk pppn. There is a restaurant and bar and they will bring you a braai and charcoal if you want it. The owners and staff are very helpful and friendly. The road here is 4 km of gravel and bits of sand with beautiful baobabs. Great spot to relax for a bit. There is wifi available- we have not tried it yet.

name: Mvuu Lodge & Campsite
description: a nice and shady campground each with its own bush shower and open air toilet, braai and fireplace. Firewood free. Nice restaurant/ bar at the Zambesi. Bushcamp US $ 24 ppn. Exclusive Camp US $ 28 ppn

name: Dean's Hill View Lodge
description: Great place for camping, we stayed also in Mama Roula but this place is cheaper and way better. 50kwacha (around 5usd) pppn. Grass, hammocks, tables and hill view.

name: Ikithe Luxury Resort
description:
Beautiful new lodge close to a small lake (white sandy beaches) with 6 chalets and 8 campsites. Hot/cold shower. Bar, Restaurant, Swimming pool. Price is 250 kwachas per tent for camping and 1500 for a room. We were told it can be busy and loud during weekends.

4/08/22 camping is 300kw pppn

name: Bush Camp Rocky Hills
description: Nice location to spend a night not visible from the dirt road. Some huts in the area and you can hear people in the distance but no visitors. Sandy but relatively solid so probably fine with 2wd.

name: Moto Moto Museum
description:
Outstanding museum covering Zambian history and stocking plenty of artifacts of human life in Africa and its development. Very worthwhile stop for a couple of hours. ZMK65 per person.

Open daily 9am to 4.45pm, except Christmas Day and New Years Day.

name: Lake Chila Lodge
description: Lodge with camping right on the lake shore. We could not stay or inspect the place in detail as there was a large local celebration on the campground at the time of our visit. 120Zk (10€) for a car

name: Kings Highway
description: Very nice campsite with cottages, good and clean toilet and shower block, no restaurant or bar, price equivalent of 10$ pppn in zkw

name: Dan Wyllie Mechanic
description: Great experienced and very trustworthy mechanic. Used to have a big workshop in town, but closed down and works with a smaller team now out of his own property which is a little out of town. Homely and interested but still professional. Him and his team can do: service, mig/tig welding, rebuilding, body work, auto electrics. Specialized in 4x4's. Ask for: Dan Wyllie. Phone: +260977843672

name: Ingombe Ilede Baobab
description: Campsite next to Ingombe Ilede 'sleeping cow' baobab. Historical trading post where some human skeletons haver been uncovered. Basic campsite with ablutions. Expensive for what it is USD15 pppn plus USD10 for 'car parking'.

name: Lake Wakawaka campsite
description:
Very basic abandoned campsite next to a lovely quiet lake. Takes some effort to get there, especially during the rainy season, but you'll get rewarded with a tranquil spot.
Beautiful surroundings, very helpfull staff. They provide log fires, a clean long drop toilet and fresh water from the lake.
Haven't seen any hippo's or crocs, but not to sure about actually swimming in the lake.
You need to be absolutely self-sufficient.

name: Ankufa Supplies Gas Refill
description: Gas bottle refill - South African bottle ok but cannot refill UK bottles.

name: Lake Bangweulu
description: Just in front of the Council Lodges you can camp right on the beach. There is little a place where a small vehicle can fit. Just before proceed, you must ask the autorisation at the council office. Place is nice, bar is not far with cold beer and you can buy fish straight from fishermen.

name: In The Bush
description: A nice spot in the bush not far from the road where you can stay few days. No easy to find a spot on this road where there is settlements  all along the road.

name: Kalunde Bar & Grill
description:
We camped here for free behind the bar. The owner (David) is super friendly! They made us an amazing dinner for a very good price.

There is a borehole close by for drinking water.
Can be noisy on weekends...

name: Bush Pond
description: Nice spot with lot of place to stop overnight or longer. Far from main road but still heard the traffic which decrease on night. We've seen absolutely no people there

name: Peaceful Forest
description: Quiet spot in small forest with plenty of place.

name: Border crossing Zam/Malawi
description:
Small border, quiet, quick and efficient.

From Malawi to Zambia prices are as follow;

**  $50 visa for 30 days (double entry is $80)
**  TIP, not payed for
** Road tax =150 Zambian Kwacha (we paid MKW 13000 as we didn't have local currency yet)
** Insurance 
issued at border for 30 days for 103 Zambian Kwacha
We paid $10 + MKW 1000

name: Dorphil
description:
Very delicious and cheap food! Western and Sambian dishes. The stuff is friendly, welcoming and warm-hearted! The woman there was a chef in the lodge in South Luangwa NP. So high quality prepared food in nice african ambience!
Definitely recommend this place!

name: Bayama's Lodge
description: Bayama's new camping rates for '22 season are K100pppn. Facilities for up to 6 campers and new entrance with no height restriction since September '22.

name: Honda motorcycles
description: Reasonably large Honda motorcycle shop in Lusaka

name: Buscamp 5km before Hot Springs
description: Buscamp between Shiwa Ngandu and Kapishya Hot Springs. Narrow road leaving the gravel road in a right turn on the left hand side. After driving under the powerline you will find a more or less open spot on the left. Visible from the street but only two persons passing and not disturbing. You will find space vetween small trees. Might be too tight for big rigs.

name: Chusa Falls
description: Here used to be Chusa Falls. Hydro powerplant since 2012. Not worth the visit since you have to ask permission and are accompanied by a guy with a AK-47.

name: Pontoon between Kasama and Isoka
description:
Pontoon across river. 10 tonne max weight, bridge soon to open and can be crossed if arrangements made with construction company. 
We asked workers at the bridge - might be ready in Jan. 2020. But did not look promising.

name: Armed Robbery
description: Warning: lots of bad incidents happen at this nice viewpoint (monument of floods 1958) according to police and locals. We stopped for a photo, one of us got out of the car, the others remained in. Suddenly, from two sides, two armed people opened the doors, robbed all our valuables and threatend us, within 5 seconds, and disappeared. Occurs quite often along this road.

name: Zinga Backpackers
description: $5 for Camping, $8 for a car with rooftop tent, dorm $10, double chalet $30, family room (four people) $60

name: Sikh Temple
description: Very quiet place to stay, they charge me for a room K50. There is a place to cook and clean toilets. The shower is just a tap with cold water, not good... No wifi.

name: Kalwa Guest Farm
description: Large active farm. Camping on over grown front lawn. Friendly people. Great price 50ZKW pp. No amenities. Access to toilet in farm house. No lights. No water. That's in the house.

name: Luangwa river bushcamp
description: Nice place to camp on the bank of the Luangwa river. Some activites around with fishermen village at 200 meters  but nobody disturbs us. Nice view over NP and some hippos in front.

name: Parking of Golf Club
description:
On the parking lot of the golf club in a good area of the city.
Very friedly staff, low priced restaurant.

We agreed a day membership for using the place: 10$

Good 3G Internet with MTN-SIM

name: Zambezi Breezers
description:
Nice lawn at the river with shade from trees, hippos.
Showers and toilets ok, restaurant expensive, charcoal is extra.
Starting point of canoe tours.
10$ p.p.p.n. or 100 Kwacha pppn
3G with mtn-SIM

name: Mayukuyuku Camp and lodge
description:
Srrangly enough this appears to be the only available scenic campsite in Kafue north during the green season (though there is Roy's Camp & campsite near the hook bridge but that looks aweful). And they know it! It's a total rip off. You pay $25 for camping here (that is WITH greenseason discount!), which in itself is ridiculous enough because the facilities are not worth that money. But in addition you have to pay the park fees, whether you like it or not. $20 pppn, $5 pppn for camping and $15 per vehicle. 
Ablutions are nice (hot water, open air sgower) and a campfire is provided, though in our case way too late, so we made it our selves. No wifi or even cell phone reception. Campsite bar is not operational. Even though you are in the middle of a wildlife park and you are right next to the river there is no guard. Staff is okay. Campsites are mediocre. No braais or kitchen facilities. Very few standpipes which provide horribly dirty water. There are shelters but no tables or chairs. Flat spots are available, but most don't offer river views and those that do are so close to the water that we saw crocodiles chasing each other right next to the shelter! No electricity or lamps whatsoever. Campsite is not well maintained, except for the ablutions.

name: Pinnon Lodge
description:
Stunningly beautiful place! Very small setup with so far only 2 chalets (soon to be 4). Established only 1.5 years ago by friendly but quite deceitful and amateuristic British owners who live here. Note: not reachable by road during wet season! We arrived just after, and one stretch of track was so muddy that we got stuck and had to be pulled out. The last 5 km was generally very bad track and their repairs after the end of wet season made things even worse. But the setting and views are absolutely amazing. They don't have a campsite but if a chalet is free than you might be permitted to use the bathroom and camp right next to the chalet. It may be wise to phone ahead. Ruth (0973376432). We paid $10 pppn but this may be higher in high season. Note that if a chalet is rented out during your stay, then you have to leave! They lied to us about this which came to light when we were forced to turn around because we got stuck again when trying to leave. 
Countless birds are to be spotted here and hippos and crocs roam in the water nearby. We had a hippo walking right next to the car one night. We almost felt we were bushcamping because of no boats, cars or people going by. Not even staff. Bathrooms in the chalets are very clean and offer beautiful views over the river. Showers are lukewarm at best. Dinner is $20 (3 course) and quite good but not worth the money. Bar/restaurant is a bit empty but has an amazing setting. Firewood is provided if you ask. No tsetse flies, though there are quite a few on the road to the lodge.
Since its not a campsite there is no kitchen, braai or electricity outlet, but you can start your campfire anywhere you like and one chalet has a small shelter nearby. No wifi but amazingly good mobile Internet reception.

name: Village Rest Camp
description: Nice grassy place with pool and possibility to use the gym. Ablutions ok in gym-area. Restaurant, bar and accomodation available, but we didn't use it. Friendly staff. For camping 100kw/pP or 10$.

name: TrenTyre
description: Managed to get 2 BF Goodrich MT tyres for landcruiser here, though not cheap.

name: Chinyunyu Hot Springs
description:
Hot spring and local place for bathing in the stream that comes from the spring.
Entrance is 8 kwacha for adults and 15 usd for tourists. I was allowed to pay the local price which it was worth.

name: Katima Mulilo / Sesheke Border
description:
At the Zambian Immigration we had to pay 

-200 Kwacha Carbon Tax (more for larger cars to a max of 275, less for smaller), 
-750 Kwacha Third Party Insurance, 30 Kwacha Council Levy and 
-20 US Dollar Road Tax.

There is also an official bank where dollars and other currencies can be exchanged. Do not use the money changers.

Visa free for South Africans.

name: Mbala / Isopa Border Post
description:
Zambia Exit: A small 2m by 2m building with two guys who sat under a tree. They processed our Carnet and stamped us out without any problems. They even called someone who had shillings for us the exchange.

Tanzania Entry
On the Tanzanian side there were a few more buildings. We went into the immigration office where a guy who looked 25 sat in civvies. Just as we sat down in his ‘office’ it started raining hard again and he excused himself to go and take his washing off the line. We filled in the immigration forms while he was gone and then on his return he stamped us in. For the Carnet we had to go to another building, but it was completely locked. The immigration guy came out and then went somewhere to try and find the guy. We waited at least half an hour for the guy to show up and then sat in his office for what felt like an hour for him to type all the vehicles details into the system with one finger. We had to pay $25, which they prefer by card, presumably in an attempt to curb corruption. The machine however didn’t work so we gave him shillings, but then he had to transfer the money from his M-Pesa account to get a receipt number to enter into the system. This also failed to work so in the end he just wrote a note. Immigration gave us two months, but the customs officer only gave the vehicle 1 month in Tanzania. We exiting 5 weeks later we had to pay another $20 to exit.

name: Zigzag Hotel
description: Described as a budget hotel, this place has a good vibe with a good lively restaurant and bar on site. Nice gardens to sit and relax in. Friendly and attentive staff. Short walk to supermarket, ATM etc. Basic rooms but nice showers with plenty of hot water and good wifi. Very quiet at night. Secure parking.

name: Chikolongo Camp
description: Beautiful bush camp at the Mwaleshi River in North Luanga NP. The friendly attendants prepare fire and a hot shower for you. There is a concrete communal table and braai area. And level spots underneath trees to pitch your tent.

name: Kafue NP Entrance
description: Need to buy park entrance permit if not transiting. Poorly organised payment of this as we were told that payment would be taken at our campsite and when we left there the park official was at church....had to stop again at this gate and wait 15minutes for the second time for somebody to take payment

name: Makwembo Internet
description:
Internet café with decent speed. Wifi, fixed computers, printing, scanning.
Very friendly owner.
Wifi was 20 ZMK for an hour

name: Isanga Bay Lodge & Campsite
description: Camping on the beach next to the lodge with access to lodge amenities. This campsite can be reached by boat or road. If by road you must have a high ground clearance 4x4. Not suitable for big rigs as low trees and village items. Fantastic location is worth it. Small shared ablutions for 6 sites, fire pits and braai on some. Ablutions clean and have hot water for showers (wood burning boiler). Plenty of natural shade, palms and direct access to lake Tanganyika. No bother on beach from sales people. Last 3 km of track winds through village with vague road route, cross small concrete bridge and then fork left down obvious track. Lots of children :-). A little noise from adjacent village but not intrusive. No wifi and only 2G MTN in some areas

name: Swan Insurrance
description:
Buy your comesa here, very helpfull. They even open on saturday morning.
In the border, just say you need a comesa and you will buy it in town, they will let you go.

name: Nyoka Chalets and campsite
description: Looks like a building site and no real camping facilities, but there is a lady in the back chalet who said no problem to camp on a Grassy space in front of the chalets. They will open a chalet for you to make use of the shower and toilet. Cost for camping K150. Cost for chalet K100 pppn. Very basic chalet, but hot water works!

name: Katoyana Campsite
description: 5 Large shady campsites, each with a shelter and a table. Central ablutions, flush toilet and cold shower, clean and rustic. The camp is unfenced, we had hyaena in the evenings. There is a very helpful camp attendant who can provide firewood. Truly a special place! USD15 pppn

name: Zambezi Source camp site
description: A single cleared space in the forest near the information center with no facilities. There is a long drop, but it's a way from the camp site. Natural water source, but no shower/toilet. Far from everything, but well worth a visit. USD 15 pppn and USD 20 entry fee.

name: Nchila Campsite
description: Should be pre-booked, but they let us in after a bit of a wait. USD 30 pn. The farm is owned by Dr Fisher, well known and involved in the community, a 5th generation Fisher on the farm. We think this is the best campsite in the world. Hot shower, kitchen, braai area and flush toilets and pristine forest and a forest stream. Simply stunning!!

name: Mutanda Nature Lodge
description: Beautiful spot on the mutanda falls, although the camp site is a bit further. 150K a night. With restaurant and warm showers.

name: wild camping
description: great wild camping spot on open plain, peaceful and quite

name: wild camping on the way to Angola
description: wild camping on the unused Tracks to the Angola border

name: CIP renewing
description: Old building at ground floor, left entrance next to UN entrance

name: Kelvin Exhausts
description: really good place for fixes to your exhaust

name: Parays Game Ranch
description:
Really nice Campsite with lot of activities. Plenty of shade, Braai, 3 swimming pools, toilets and showers next to a huge dam with Game coming to drink day and night. Fishing for free on Dam, just bring your fishing rod
Really lovely owner.

Campsite 100 kwacha pppn/ 50 for kids
Day visit 40 kwacha pp/ 20 for kids
Lion viewing 20 Kwacha pp/ 15 for kids
Game driving : 60 kwacha per vehicle 
Boat ride 10kwacha pp

Week-end could be busy with local people coming to enjoy the place

name: bushcamp
description: Quiet Bush few kilometers from main road. Only few cars driving on the gravel road but nobody stops.

name: Lowden Lodge
description: Lovely welcoming home with space for camping. Janet is building ablutions, but in the meantime you can use the gym ablutions. Cooked dinners are fantastic and nothing is too much trouble. It's also a good place to leave a vehicle if you need a short trip home. Just under US50 pppn incl dinner and breakfast for a room.

name: Roy's Camp
description: Lovely Campsite just outside the Kafue NP, directly on the river. Nice and clean ablution block, hot showers, toilets and a kitchen area. Marc takes good care after his guests and is very helpful. Good place to visit the NP for a day or just to stretch your legs. Hippos are in the river, an elephant is a regular visitor of the campsite.

name: Kamkonzo Community Campsite
description: Campsite at the Luangwa River with a shower and a toilet, nice and quiet place, 200kw ppn +30 service +20 car. 7 km from the northern entrance gate to Luambe NP, there is no Camping at the Luambe Lodge anymore.

name: Shearwater Explorers
description: Very spacious campsite, probably constructed for overlander trucks. Nice ablution with excellent hot shower Swimming pool and fancy bar. Wifi did not work. It is also possible to rent a tent. Camping 15$ pp.

name: Nsefu sector entrance
description: Just tell the guard you are transiting and you will be let through for free. No time check is done at the other gate so you can drive around anyway. Lots of hippos, elephants and impala. Very barren though and not as scenic as the South Luangwa park.

name: Wild camp next to river
description: Accessed by network of sand roads just north of the village. River is full of hippos and crocs. Elephants about and also heard dogs. Ground is too hard for tent pegs.

name: Luambe National Park entry
description: Tell them you are transiting, then it's free. No time checks done on exit so you can drive around or camp anyway.

name: Blocked Road
description: We were turned around at a village road block on this road. Not sure if it's legit but you can't go this way anyway, despite our maps showing it as the main road. You have to go down RD105 which then leads to the park by a road not shown on all maps.

name: Wild camp off RD105
description: Lots of clearings just off the road here. Road is very quiet. Lots of firewood.

name: Wild camping
description: There are lots of flat clearings for wild camping all the way along this road. Very quiet road.

name: North Luangwa national park
description: USD 25pp plus 15USD for a foreign registered car.

name: Annie's Inn
description: Very basic hotel with hot water and secure parking. K250 per night for the room with breakfast included. No credit card facilities despite what the security guard says, also no Internet. Restaurant was closed for dinner but maybe you can make arrangements if you arrive early.

name: MV Liemba
description:
Boat to Kigoma direct. This is a historic boat built in Germany in 1913 and moved to Tanzania in 5,000 wooden boxes and reassembled in 1915.

We were 3 people and 2 dogs on 2 bikes and a Hilux. We waited for 3 nights for the boat to arrive but couldn't get any information until it was alongside. We believe it comes once a week but could be once a fortnight. 

We read online that we could get tickets for US$40 but when we arrived we were told it was $100 per person, we tried to negotiate but they wouldn't budge. Motorbikes were $50 and a Hilux was $300 for transit alone, we then needed to add loading costs which were $30 for bikes and $200 for the Hilux. Local on the wharf told us that it should be less and that $40 for foreigners sounded right, even the crane manager said it should be much less at least for the cabin but no movement for the operators, we spoke to the captain but were just referred to the clerk for sales.

The boat itself wasn't great but expected from a 100 year old boat, toilets stunk and 1st class did not have private bathroom as posted everywhere online, just a private section for 1st class passengers. 

We decided it was too expensive and so did not do the journey opting instead to take the road  Shame

They were going to allow us to keep our dogs in the 1st class cabin.

name: Chirundu Gwabi Lodge
description: Beautiful grassy camp sites under big trees, with braai and clean ablutions on the Kafue river banks. Shower gets  10/10 for hotness and wetness, but only 4/10 for duration... Place is mainly used by South Africans for fishing, and we were the only campers. Bar is loud in the evening, but farg enough away from the camp sites that it's not a real problem. Friendly staff who were surprised that we didn't have a fishing rod and offered to rent us one.  K100 pppn. Good value. Excellent full English breakfast at K75.

name: Mapunga camp
description: Well run camp by John (manager) campsites for $20pppn right at the river. Staff ensures there is hot water and even lights your fire (fire wood provided by the camp). There are two male lions resident in the area, which we saw on a night drive ($30pp)

name: maxxis tyres
description:
They fixed a tyre very quickly and friendly. 
They sell new tyres too. It's a garage in “german style“, new machines and very clean.  We paid nothing for the fixing, it was free for germans :)

name: Whispering Sands
description: Didn´t stay there but new place SA owned and managed next to bend in Zambezi and close to Ngonye Falls. Externally somewhat utilitarian in appearance but inside the buildings there are local touches & colour and all neat and clean. Camping, chalets, fishing, pub, restaurant, wifi.

name: Nsobe Camp
description:
On the fringes of a huge plain (which goes towards Chikuni, hq of Bangweulu Wetlands), lies a hidden camp & campsite - probably seasonal because when it rains the surface is not driveable. Staff is super friendly and provide water & fire at the campsite and a hot shower upon request. A very nice spot when you want to see the Shoebill stork! 

KW100 pppn + KW100 conservation levy. 

The track from the great north  through Lavushi Manda (110km) will take you 4h in a solid 4x4.

name: Kafue River Lodge
description:
Very, very nice camping spot amongst lots of trees. BBQ stands & running water on each site and a plug point at a central shelter. Spacious ablution block with 4 toilets & 4 (donkeyboiler) hot showers, sinks & mirrors. View is on a beautiful stretch of the river with a pof of hippos & fishing Kingfishers. Morning coffees & fishing fantastic on / from the 'beach' below the central camping area. 

Easy to atrange a boat cruise, fishing trip or game drive from the lodge, highly advised. The manager has been a guide in this area for 25 years, including the Busanga Plains.

name: Bush Camp
description: Follow dirt track leading off M1 to a large open flat area, bush camp behind some excavation mounds. Nice flat spot and very quiet. A truck stopped close to the mound but didn't stay, we saw no-else the whole night.

name: Afrox
description: They filled our German gas bottles very quickly and friendly. But you need an adaptor, they haven't one. We paid 378 ZKW for 18 kg. we have an adapter from german connection to a south/east African connection.

name: Mayfair Insurance (COMESA)
description: Office of Mayfair Insurance. We bought a year of third party Zambian Insurance as well as a year of COMESA Yellow Card Insurance here. Price: 464 kwacha for Zambian insurance and 736 kwacha for the Yellow Card. Very professional staff. Parking lot out front.

name: Zambian Immigration and Customs
description: Good and friendly border. It’s a bit slow and you need a lot (see picture). For a 4.2l diesel cruiser the carbon tax 275kw (not payable in usd), 20 USD (only payable in usd) road toll tax and 40kw council levy. No atm yet, but they are building a new post as they’re rapidly growing. So for us only black market change unfortunately. Otherwise it’s an easy border.

name: Hensons Auto Centre
description: Went here for welding on our tire carrier. Professional. Quick. Good price. Was recommended by a safari company that services their trucks here. Ask for Peter. +260-096 6666938

name: Olga lodge
description:
Area next to the lodge and restaurant. Simple but good for one night. You can use the bar toilets. 
Camping is 100kw pp. The restaurant serves decent food for a good price.

name: Professional Insurance
description: We bought our Comesa insurance here. Very friendly and helpful staff. The diamond insurance a bit further in town was closed on Saturday morning. This one was open.

name: Buffalo Camp (North Luangwa National Park)
description: Mark Harvey, who owns Kapishya Hot Springs, runs Buffalo Camp in North Luangwa National Park as well. He's a very knowledgeable guide and leads excellent walking tours there. Usually people stay in rustic chalets at $100 pppn, but when the chalets are full, they may allow you to camp for $40 pppn. The entire camp, including the camping area, is on the Mwaleshi Riverbank, which has water year round. Campers have a hot shower, flush toilet, and sink. The team at Kapishya told us about this option when we were there, and we were very happy we went. The walks are $25 pp, which is excellent value, considering how much you see and learn. The walks last about 4 hours each. Evening walks are followed by sundowners (Beware very high prices for the drinks), and then a night drive back to camp. You can self cater. One must pay park fees on top of this: $20 per person plus $15 for a vehicle plus $30 pppn bed levy. That's $115 per night in the park for two adults. (We paid 1060 kwacha at their exchange rate). Open mid June to end October. Email: kapishya@shiwasafaris.com

name: Mayana market
description: We were told by our campsite that this is the best market in town. Good selection of meat, eggs, alcohol, dry goods.

name: Twin Cave Lodge
description: A Lodge with a big lawn for camping. They don't have power, ablutions, sink or bin but they give us a bathroom inside with shower and toilet. Friendly people. Good for one night. We pay 60Zwk pppn.

name: Mulberry Mongoose
description: Great souvenir shop where they make jewelry from snares. Local artists and material sourced locally as much as possible. Not cheap but quality stuff. (GPS coordinates are just before the shop but after the first sign.)

name: Tiko Community Centre
description: This place is a lodge and restaurant run by a community to generate and income, they have different projects and teach the locals to grow their own organic food. We stayed in a triple room for $20, you can also camp for $5 or use the dormitory for $6. There is compost toilets and bucket showers for camping, rooms have ensuite western toilets with a hot shower.  The restaurant has great vegetarian, african and continental options. It was amazing to wake up and see all the locals at work around the Community Centre, everyone was really nice!

name: Thula restaurant
description: Convenient location to have lunch on your way to Chipata; we left Lusaka early in the morning and took a break here. Chicken, spaghetti, sausages, chips, and cold drinks. No haute cuisine, but it will do.

name: Mumba Tuta Falls campsite
description: Designated campsite in Lavushi Manda national park. There are 3 sites, one of which have Banda's for shelter. One shelter burned down. Near the river with a lovely water fall, especially in or just after the rains. Usually quiet, so a lovely spot to get away from it all.

name: GCMF Mpongwe
description: Nice hotel run by a charity, rooms available from 150 Kwacha with shared bathroom, own bathroom 200 kwacha. Restaurant and bar available, prices for a drink 10 kwacha. Food prices 40 kw Pork chops, 35 kw Beef stew, 30 kw Chicken or 25 kw Dry fish with rice. Not a really crowded place so good for a good night rest. We where allowed to open our tent as well for 100 kwacha for 2 persons and 2 motorcycles, not sure if camping is always possible.

name: Wild camping spot
description: Spot not so far from road, it's a old road they probably used when they build the great east road. Nobody around and plenty of space here to stay a night.

name: Fawlty Hotel
description: Great place to stay for a while. Nice dormitory with 4 or 6 Beds. A lot of sense of design and quality. Really clean, and nice staff all around the house and at the reception. 120kwacha per night per person in the dorm. Good WiFi, pool is nice and clean. The kitchen is clean and there’s everything that you need to cook. They organize also tours and safaris. It’s quiet and there’s a big yard at the back close to the pool .

name: Madison General Insurance
description: We were able to purchase a COMESA yellow card here. Was roughly 550 Kwacha for all of the countries on our way to Sudan. Very professional office. They take Visa. We were able to top up out local Zambian insurance (which we brought when entering from Namibia) to cover Comensa countries. This seems MUCH cheaper than buying separate insurance in Malawi.... Top top up we were quoted: 146K - 1 month Malawi 360K - 3 months Malawi and Zimbabwe 101K - 1 month Zimbabwe (based on a 2.7litre mercedes sprinter 4x4 campervan on UK plates).

name: Malangano Camp
description:
Think that review is very old, look at the new once down: 
Very good alternative for the Pioneer Camp. This beautiful, quiet, green Zambian campsite with bar, café and bunk house is located 25km from central Lusaka on Great East Rd (T4) going towards Malawi or South Luangwa. The campsites are stretched over 1 hectare, you can pitch your tent or camper anywhere. Braai stands are available.
Bar closing at 21.00  
Very friendly staff. No electricity at the the sites but the people provided us power. 
When we stayed, a live concert was held 3 km away until 4 am.

name: Godfrey car repair Kasama
description:
kasama
quick solutions qualified car repair. good for landrover and other

name: Laundry Livingstone Dry cleaner
description: Good place laundry. 45 k per 1 kg. Friendly man. At the same day

name: rapid 14 campsite and lodge
description:
As this place is part of Overland Missions, opening and availability is seasonal. Call or WhatsApp ahead of time to determine availability. Incredible spot!

They don’t charge for the campground but they are happy for a donation.

name: Best of bikes
description: Really helpful motorbike shop with a British owner and a qualified yamaha mechanic. Can deal with all makes and was very helpful getting a spare for my Honda. Can source tyres but best to give some notice as big bikes are not that common in Lusaka. If you're stuck, get in touch with them.

name: the Landmark Hotel
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Users report "Landmark Hotel does not offer any camping facilities at all, they even said so! They even refused campers to enter or use their car park. "

Brand new hotel with independently standing self-contained and air-conditioned rooms that are large, clean and simple but well appointed with a very large Cabro tiled compound with very secure walled parking manned by security guards. has a restaurant on site. Paid 25 US Dollars/250 Zambian Kwacha for a double room including breakfast. It's cheaper than camping, with air-conditioning, hot water and towels provided plus flat-screen TV with DSTV!  wonderful base from where to rest and recuperate and explore the surrounding area. wonderful hotel!

name: Baobab by the Village
description: We took the most southern route from Livingston to Lake Kariba and there were no campsites or decent wild campsites around, so we drove to this baobab and asked the people of the village around if we could stay for a night. They were extremely happy to help us and sat down around the bonfire with us. Beautiful spot with zero touristic traces around. Real Africa right here.

name: Kundalila Falls
description: 65 meter Waterfall along the Kaombe river. It’s a national heritage site so the official entry is $15, but you can easily get a better price by talking to thr guard, we payed 400zkw for 5 people. Totally worth it, beautiful hike, views and we had an amazing swim at the bottom. You can also camp at the restcamp, but I‘m not sure about the price for that.

name: Livingstone
description:
I arrived late in Livingstone so I just parked here at the entry post national park. I asked the rangers 
 if I may sleep here for the night. That was no problem.

name: Kasambo Farm Guesthouse
description:
Rooms with shared bathroom at 150kw or private for 200kw. Take a room and stay in the carpark.
Out of town so hopefully quiet at the weekend.
The place is rundown.
It turned out that the manager wasn't entirely honest with us at which point we left before it was too late. As a result not recommended.

name: Road Tax Office (Road Transport and Safety Office)
description:
If you've come in through Kasesye this is where you need to pay road tax.
Make sure you bring USD, your passport and registration documents!
They open at 8am weekdays only 
They don't really seem to know what they are doing - it took about an hour in total, they charged me 20usd.

name: Mwela rock paintings
description:
30usd entrance for 2 is too much.
However the standard of guiding is excellent. Ask to see the lion, it's a bit further, down a narrow track, best to take your vehicle so long as it's not too big (we broke a lot of branches so it should be ok for a while!!). There is a picnic/campsite at the end of the track.

name: Kundalila Falls Official Campsite
description:
Reputed to be the most attractive waterfall in Zambia.
Access from the main road is via a 14km dirt road, mostly OK but a bit rocky in places.
A large open flat campsite with both sunny grass area and sandy shade. Footpath used by locals right next to it. No showers but a new toilet block with seated flushing loos. No overnight security present.
Initially we were asked for 150kw pppn camping plus 150kw pp to visit the falls plus 50kw for the vehicle.
As it's run by the same organisation as Chisimba Falls we explained that they include the visit in the camping fee and we were not willing to pay that extortionate amount. We left the office but remained in the carpark a while. The guy came out and told us that if we still had the Chisimba receipt then he would charge the same. So we paid 350kw for 2, camped and visited. Note that the guy goes home at 3:30pm...

name: DHL Lusaka Airport
description: This is where you can pickup your carnet, easier access than DHL downtown.

name: Old Farmhouse Deli
description:
A new deli selling good local fresh meat cheese and veggies.
Far better than ShopRite!!!

name: Southern Medical Centre
description: Dr Sanjay Shinde - a good guy and is very approachable.

name: KaingU Lodge
description:
Magical place right on the eastern bank of Kafue (hippos, crocs) inside the GMA. large grassy and well maintained sites with lots of shade, fireplace, sink, clean private ablutions with hot showers. No electricity but possible to charge phones at lodge. When we were there, there were no guests at the lodge so we were welcome to spend time in the main lodge area with WiFi. 
Staff (friendliest and most knowledgeable we have met) went out of their way to make sure we have a great stay and the owner couple is amazing!
Activities are not cheap but still good value: boat cruise, game drive in Kafue (they have cars parked on the other side of river), walking safari etc. we did the canoe excursion and loved it.
To get there, you turn south approx 60km east of the main Kafue bridge towards Itezhi-Tezhi. After 48kms you turn right towards the lodge (signposted, another 42kms). Lots of tsetse on the way but none at the lodge. 
Only 3 sites so best to email (lodge does not have a phone connection) ahead - info@kaingu-lodge.com
Price is 25$ pppn, includes firewood. Not the cheapest but so worth it. Ended up staying 3 nights and it was a highlight of our six month trip

name: Kayube estate
description: A great place to store your car or truck indoor. Friendly staff. They even wash your car when you hit the road. $50/month.

name: Lusaka-chipata
description: Just to spend the night. Nobody disturb me here. Little ending road.

name: Tehillah Lodge & Campsite
description:
Small Lodge 5 km north of Isoka directly on the Great North Road. +260 975396510 tehillahlodge@gmail.com
100 Kwacha for Camping
150 Kwacha for a room
Nothing special, camped in front of a room, shower not really warm, maybe there is some improvement later on as they are still building.
Had a breakdown in Isoka, so it was a good place for just over night.

Added (20 Feb 2019)  SHOCKING

name: Olga's Italian Corner
description: Italian restaurant with pizzas and pasta. Very good food. We had the best pizza in Africa

name: ATM at Zanaco 24 Bank
description: ATM with a normal 50kwatcha withdrawal rate at the nearby PUMA filling station. Accepting VISA

name: GM Trading Shopping Centre
description: As per Andreas from Bayama Lodge you find the biggest supermarket from Mpika here together with a Hardware Store and an ATM

name: Old mining quarry
description:
Kind of quarry and rocky riverbed next to the Great North Road. You can find plenty of places more or less hidden and not seen from the road. I stood near the entrance, did not so much worry about being seen as there are trees and the cars and lorries pass by with high speed. Loads of holes in the ground were they were digging for a kind of white stone/gravel/sand? 
When I was there for 1 night nobody came pass by.
MTN reception is good!

name: Decent Auto Electrical
description: Small Auto Electrician workshop in a compound with other african style workshops. The compound is known under the name Comet Compound. Ask for Comet if you don't find it.

name: Luangwa Safari Lodge
description: Small Lodge with private Bungalows in different sizes., swimming pool and free WiFi. Room prices starting from 50/60$ incl breakfast. Owned by a German father and son. Budget acco in a fixed rooftent for 25$. Camping possibilities very limited on parking ground.

name: Vic falls Zim/Zam border
description:
Going from Zimbabwe to Zambia 

$50/500 Kwacha visa for 30 day (UK and NZ)
$80/800 Kwache multi entry visa 
$50 for Kaza Visa which allows you multiple entry between Zambia and Zimbabwe for 30 days

Car TIP
$20/200 Kwacha Carbon Tax (was 275 kw on Sep 19)
$30 Toll fees (payable in USD only) 

They have an ATM and exchange bureau on the Zambian side 

NOTE: KAZA Visa valid only for entry in the Vic Falls area. Any other border post you need to pay again.

name: Walter's workshop / Master Exhaust
description:
Walter is a dutch engineer who runs a workshop for all sorts of Toyotas, Nissans etc off Leopard Hill Road. He is very reliable and honest and serves for every kind of breakdown. He also offers a recovery service and offers welding of all kind.
I've had my damaged waterpump for my Toyota Landcruiser HJ60, all my fanbelts and wornout pullies replacecd here. Also my radiator, my gearbox mountings and my faulty welded front spring holder repaired. All in all I had a throughout checkup of my brave old Toyota.
Contact: Walter Harthoorn +260 977 783232, email: finhart@hotmail. com
His place is not easy to find, I put a small sketch of his business card as a picture. It's on a dirtroad off Leopard Hill Road, turnoff at a red&white mobile tower. Turning into the road there is a long brown wall of a residential compound on the left, the right side of the road is fenced but open land. It's the second gate (red) of a walled plot. The gate is set a bit back flanked by big rounded wall structures.

name: Majoru Butchery
description: Butchery which sells German style meat, sausages and Biltong. Also sells German style bread Mondays and Fridays.

name: Borderpost Kasumbalesa Sambia - DRC
description:
Traveling with three motorbikes with cdp and visa from Sambia to Kongo.
Opening times: 6:00 - 18:00
Lunch on Zambian side seems to be from 13:00 to 14:00 and officials won’t help you. 

Steps:
Zambia:
- Entry (voucher for parking fee), only one by one allowed to enter
- Interpol office (behind the barrier to the right)
To the big grey building:
- Immigration Zambia
- Customs Zambia: CdP, gate pass
- Paying parking fee: 25 USD for each motorbike.
- Officer at the entry (barrier): signing big book
Leaving through barrier on the other side, to DRC compound.
The fixers were not happy with us so they let the guy at the second barrier ask for any fantasy recipe, after short discussion he gave up and let us pass.
DRC:
Stoping in front of the border, big building:
- Medical check: temperature and yellow fever vaccination
- Immigration: we got from the desk direct into the head's office. We got stamps in the passports and were asked to pay something. We payed 10 USD each "la motivation" (initially wanted 20 USD each).
- There seems to bei no official customs office, actually there are not many foreign cars crossing so we explained the lady at the barrier how to handle the cdp. There was no stamp available..."because of sunday".
- At the same entry we got a ticket for the parking fee. We payed inside at the caisser and got a recipe. Each motorbike 25 USD ( for a small vehicle, there are no prices for motorbikes, truck ist 200, abnormal load is 300)
- We had to pay another 25 USD per motorbike "Trafigo" they also call it "entry fee" it ist like a road tax and valid for one month.
- Back at the barrier there were two police officers in civil clothes and they wanted to do a security check. They had no ID card and in the beginning we refused (because of all the guys around the border telling you anything). After they convinced us that they are "real" the check took a little bit longer. But no complains, not asking for "la motivation".
- After that and with all the papers we could pass the first barrier and we left the compound.

The whole boarder procedure took us 3.5 hours and costed 85 USD per bike.
More or less just an African boarder crossing. Could have been faster if we had more information in advance.

name: Rehmar Guest House
description:
Littlebit shabby but everything you need.
Singlerooms for 250 or 300 ZK per night incl. BF.

name: Mazabuko Motel
description:
Littlebit rundown motel but huge space. Camping and Trucks also welcome.
Double rooms for 120,- ZK.
Restaurant with basic food but for very fair prices.

name: Livingstone Backpackers - LBP
description:
Very nice hotel / hostel with pool. Many young folks. At night a littlebit loud because of the bars on the other street side, but happy to found this place for some days "European style accomodation" to relax after many days of riding.
Prices see attached picture.

name: Mudpackers LA Sport
description: All kind of 4x4 Equipment, solar panels, winches, gas bottles, camping equipment

name: Mudpackers LA Sport
description: Cadac Centre, sale and refill of LPG gas bottles. Parts, equipments etc

name: Lyawa Lodge
description:
500Kwacha for a big room with ensuite.
50Kwacha pppn for camping.
Breakfast included (fried egg, toast, jam etc).

name: General Insurance Comesa
description: I was forced to buy Zambia insurance at the border, $27 U.S. for six months. They wouldn't let me drive to Livingston without this base insurance purchase. This base insurance you must get before you can buy Comesa. In this office the friendly guys helped my buy six months of Comesa valid in every Comesa country for $55 u.s. for six months. If you want six months of Comesa you must have six months of base. Overall seems pretty cheap to have valid insurance for every country between here and Egypt.

name: Nsalu Cave
description: Guide book says cost is $3 pp and $3 for vehicle but no one was there so we didn't have to pay. Only 10 minute walk up the rocky hill to the cave. Well worth the visit. Great spot to camp if no one is around but guide book says $10 pp for camping.

name: Side of wicked 4x4 track
description:
Camped here directly on side of track. Shockingly two cars came past in night, no worries. 
Use this awesome 4x4 track to get from Mpika area over to South Luangwa.
The 4km West of this point is serious 4x4, low range 1st gear coming Down (west to east) going up would be tricky, I think very very serious with rain.

name: Pontoon across Luagwa river
description:
Cross here for the 4x4 road to Mpika 
We paid 200K. It was put in the river in April. Small hand pulled pontoon good for my 3ton 4x4.
The road West is mostly good, 5 hours to the wild camp just before serious 4x4 rocky section. Lots of steep dry river beds, I would not try in rainy season.

name: Mulberry Mongoose - local jewelry
description:
Fantastic jewelry and crafts made on site from recycled and natural things.
Famous for using snare wire, and makes donations to anti-poaching efforts.
A++

name: Tinta's Restaurant
description: Best nishima with chicken or beef we have had in a month in Zambia. Also things like burgers, fries, curries, etc. Really clean and Tinta is super friendly.

name: Lusaka National Park
description:
30 kwacha per person.
Small NP with very few animals but they have a white rhino which you can view in a pen. Ask at the gate as he's sometimes out of the pen, best time is late afternoon as they bring him in for the night. They are introducing a female soon.

name: coffeeberry
description: nice place to have a cup of coffee or eat something. nice garden where you can rest. large cappuccino about 45kw. staff friendly and the place is neat.

name: Campsite Mpanshya
description:
