Campsite not fully established now but already in service. No sign on the road  Ablutions OK. 1 shower each men/women. Hot water only in one chalet available during our stay cause camp is not fully connected to electric power. Owner will boil you water. Nice clean rooms available.
Price Campsite: 10$/ppn.
Price Rooms: 40$

name: Rapids bush walk (Kaingu camp)
description: If you're staying at or near KaingU Lodge they have a short scramble/bush walk to see rapids, and a nice riverside bar.

name: Mpamba rock
description: Sunset from the top of rock, short easy walk.

name: New Kalala Lodge
description:
$10 pppn, beautiful lakeside campground. They have braais, picnic benches, small shelters and electricity (sometimes). 
The lodge is a short walk up the hill and has a restaurant/bar with amazing views and you can use the swimming pool. We didn't eat at the restaurant but they said dinner was 120Kwacha, lunch 100kwacha, and breakfast 80kwacha. 
The lodge offer boat trips ($ unknown) and trips to some hot springs, they charge $10pp or you can self drive and go for free. You cant swim in the hot springs.

name: Grocery store / supermarket
description: A small supermarket which has almost everything you need (groceries, toilet articles, ...)

name: Shoprite / PEP
description: Shoprite and PEP with everything you need. Take VISA.

name: T2 Direction Tanzania
description:
Bad road (T2) until border to Tanzania. paved but narrow anymd deep potholes. lot of trucks. 
Expect 4h to Kings Highway Camp (Kalungu) and another 2h to the border.
At least 10km of the road before the border should going to be renewed soon.

name: Bad road T2
description:
Bad road (T2) Direction Mpika. Paved but narrow and deep potholes. lot of trucks. 
Expect 2h to Kings Highway Camp (Kalungu) and another 4h to Junction T53 (to Kapishya Hot Springs)
At least 10km of the road after the border should going to be renewed soon

name: kalabo
description: Golden Lodge. in center Kalabo. Hot and cold water, shower, grid, no wifi, MTN, TV and airco, spaceous safe compound for parking. double room 100 Z. Kw. p.n. ($11)

name: Acamms Lodge
description: Not a formal campsite. But we camped in the parking area and used the toilet in one of the chalets

name: Musungwa Lodge
description: Great lodge overlooking the dam. Accommodation ranges from full board: (bed breakfast lunch dinner and use of all facilities) at K750 to camping at K100 pp

name: 4x4 track bush camp
description:
Good place to camp on 4x4 track, you can pull off the road and it's flat.  A few vehicles drove past but no issues. 
4x4 track is steep and rocky, we did it in Land Rover and Prado 95 during dry season going up (south Luangwa to Mpika) and it was fine.

name: Green Solutions
description: Workshop which does all kind of machinery work, big drilling, welding (I had my stainless steel exhaust welded here), hydraulic fittings and bending.

name: B&S Logistics
description: Martin is building up a workshop here, but does already all kinds of work including car and truck recovery. Recommend by all the expats and farmers here around. Contact: Martin Smart Chiyanika 0977723691

name: Mukuni Park Curio Market
description: Public curio market with lots of small stalls all under one roof

name: The Royal Livingstone Hotel
description: Very expensive 5 star hotel but the view from the deck over the Zambezi makes it worth the price of the drinks.

name: Entrance to Shiwa House (Africa house)
description:
Open 8.30-10:00am Monday to Saturday. 
Tours are $20pp, it's interesting but short and over priced.

name: Lake View Lodge
description:
Chalets and rooms at the lake shore, see prices on picture.
Camping 100KW pp next to a chalet or down at lake. Shower and Toilet from room.

name: Intale Campsite (old name)
description:
Old Intale Campsite
At the moment closed and not funktional, but will be reopened October 2018. Looks nice sitting at a peninsula of Lake Kariba.

name: Hitchin's Yard
description: A garage run by Dez who is a Toyota doctor. Recommended if you have Landcruiser issues. Not really any sign but lots of cruisers parked in front of a garage.

name: My Livingstone Your Livingstone
description: Room in house of very friendly Zambian lady. The place has internet and you can use the kitchen. Theres enough parking place for a bigger 4x4. We travelled with two motorcycles amd parked them on the property.

name: Endrone Fuel at Rufunsa
description: New petrol station not on Google Maps or maps.me

name: Zuus Guest House
description: Neat, clean guest house just off the main road. Comfortable beds, hot shower, electricity, breakfast included, hospitable staff. Safe compound for bikes/car. 230 ZK for single room with queen bed or 280 ZK for double room with two queen beds.

name: McBrides's Camp
description:
Nice rustical bushcamp at the McBride's Lodge. Clean flushing toilets, showers are always warm and every sink has cold and warm water. A central social area gives shade und there is a sink to clean the dishes. Lots of opportunities to see the wildlife, just ask, Chris and Charlotte McBride are charming and will be happy to help. Chris knows a lot about wildlife, especially about lions. They have even published a book about lions. 

We did a 2.5 hour boat cruise (15$ pp) on the Kafue and saw hippos, crocs, pukus and lots of birds. 

Rates per night, spent at the camp:
Camping: 20$ pp
Park fee: 20$ pp plus 15$ per car and 5$ camping fee pp

name: Lilayi Lodge and Restaurant
description: Very elegant Lodge and a excellent Restaurant. We had a nice breakfast twice, really beautiful Park with animals. And if you Go Back to the gate a 11 am, you may watch the baby Elefant getting their bottle of milk. 50 Kwacha for this.

name: Mudpackers LA Sport
description: Offroad accessories and camping supplies. Very well supplied 4x4 store. Trevor the owner is very friendly, offers good advice and has reasonable prices. Stocks frontrunner, tentco and can probably source anything vehicle or camping related you need that they don't have. Fills all type of gas cylinders too. Also repairs vehicle fridges. So really a one stop overlander shop and there's a coffee shop next door with great cappuccinos and salads if you need to wait.

name: Taitana Executive Lodge = Thula Lodge
description:
Easy place next to the Great East Road for a stop over between Lusaka and South Luangwa NP.
Better if you're in a self sufficient vehicle (ablution block only with cold water, not fancy but still functional).
You can park in the backyard between the chalets, and you can use one of the gazebo with table and chairs. 
Friendly staff (Ester is the name of the manager).
100 KW for 2 adults and a car.

name: Zambezi Palm Camp
description: Nice Setting at the River. Sites with tents and without tents. Still building up. At the time one ablution. 150ppn or 15 $. Bar.

name: Zambeef
description: alternative butchery to shoprite liquors next door

name: zambia state insurance
description:
got here the comesa that Livingston refused to issue .probably to much work. never ever give up. 206 zkw 
2 month 2 country's

name: Tough 4x4
description: From here in the direction of SL National Park: about 10km very tough rocky off road driving. I did it the other way around, broke a leaf spring and took me 2 hours for 10km. Between Chifungwe and Mfuwe gate: easy track with some sandy parts and some water crossings. Wet season impassable. Drive safely!

name: Handcraft wooden products
description: It's something very interesting, 300m far from the hot springs, and 50m far from the forest junction, under a small tree next to the road,  there are 5 brothers that produce very beautiful wooden handcraft products. It's worth to see them, their creations and...why not, buy their creations too, for sure much cheaper than in the shops where you can find them.

name: Da Canton
description: Very Italian ice cream and pizza, good place to have a rest. The owner, Stefano, is very a good guy. Ah, on Wednesday if you take a pizza, you have another extra Margherita for free! Anyway, ice cream is great!!

name: Chinyunyu Lodge
description: very basic and dirty ablutions but only campsite around. safe and quiet. 50kwh for 2 persons.

name: East road to Msoro
description:
Excellent overnight place just off the road to Msoro. Beautiful scenery and quiet. Not many cars passing by.
Nobody visited us, village nearby.
Up the hill next to the place there are some fires from people.

name: Relax Guest House
description: Decent place. Clean room, prices range from ZMK150 to ZMK260 including breakfast for 2 persons. Cam make meals on request and rooms have mosquito nets.

name: Garden Village Mall
description: Perfect mall with pick‘n pay, food lovers, money changers and also a schwama restaurant

name: Lusaka Backpacker
description: Great hostel with dorm (12$ US) and room (30$ US), bar, basic restaurant with good food and breakfast, swimming pool, close to the mall and safe parking

name: Local hotel at Chifunda
description: Local hidden hotel just ask when you arrive in town, they can cook local meal too, basic room with outside basic ablution, cold beer at the local store, park inside for bike and street for car and nice owner who speak little english

name: Take away restaurant
description: Local food restaurant next to the gas station, cheap and not too bad :-)

name: Take away restaurant
description: Next to the petrol station, local food and kebab, and real espresso coffee!!!

name: Last fuel station for 200km going south
description: From here for more than 200kms there are no petrol stations, so...consider it!

name: Manda Hills Mall
description: Shops from Pep, Woolworths, Game (good for a variety of items) and lots of restaurants fast food option and coffee shops. Camping gear at Game.

name: Last pretol station in 180 km
description: From here going south there are no petrol stations for 180kms...consider it!

name: Finger lickin restaurant
description: Exactly next to the Total, here you can eat the best nshima whit vegetables of Zambia. They sell also bread.

name: Wild Tracks
description: Nice spot on the river with friendly welcome and nice couple who run it but only the 2 riverside campsites are worth it. Self catering safari tents and houses (not sure of price) and if you want you can rent a small dome tent for kw75 with a mattress, table, chairs etc, plus kw150 pppn for camping so for us the best option without my trusted campervan which is getting fixed in Lusaka as everything was fully booked. Wood, ice and charcoal available and the pool can be used but campers can only use it from 10-12 and 15-17hrs. They mostly cater for the lodge guests but if you are self sufficient the river side campsites are nice!

name: Wild camp along a track
description: Follow one of the tracks of the main road and park in the bush, one guy came along but waved and walked on. Enough wood around but be careful with all the dry grass when making a fire.

name: Victoria Falls entrance and parking Zambia side
description: Park your car safely here for ZMK70 and see the waterfalls from the Zambia side! Entrance USD20 pp and this time of the year the falls are very small and only visible in the distance, Zimbabwe will offer better views.

name: Rapid nr 10 gorge hike
description: This is the end of half day rafting trips at rapid 10 but you can park your car and climb down the gorge on the wooden ladders to get down to the river and fish 300-400m upstream!

name: Bush wildcamp
description: Head off the highway and drive into the bush, lots of space, no villagers around this stretch and just the noise of trucks passing.

name: Kafue River Mall
description: Good Pick n Pay with fresh stuff, wines etc, cell phone shop to buy a sim card, pharmacy, Debonairs Pizza and Hungry Lion outlets as well as a PEP store.

name: Lotri Bay
description:
Let me share with you the discover of this amazing place along the Kariba lake!
Open since one year, but not yet officially, Lotri Bay is the perfect spot on Kariba shore: Mountain to claim, gorge to explore, Kayak to experiment, game viewing, hike, bivouac, swimming in a cage crocodile proof...
Visit this place.
You need a four wheel drive and to contact the manager, Bruce (+260 97 4775477) as the gate is locked for the animals not to leave.

name: South Point Clinic
description: One stop clinic with good modern facilities. I walked in, paid Kw80 for consultation and waited for 30 min before a doctor saw me.

name: Police Shake Down
description: This road has many police cameras where seemingly all foreigners get stopped to pay ridiculous amounts of Kw2000 which suddenly go down to 600, 500 and end with a Kw100 ‘fine’ to continue... the less fun part of Africa

name: Mr Given's garage Mungo
description: Does not look like much but he welded up my wheelchair. Can do welding of al kinds and metal work.

name: D104 Luangwa River
description: Nice flat spot near the D104 road under two large trees next to the Luangwa River. It is just passed the Luambe Nat Park sign so it is outside the park. We also asked a local fisherman if it was OK to camp here and he said it was. Someone had  a fire here before.

name: Mumbwa Toll Plaza
description: Official stop to check you have paid road tax. Will stamp your toll receipt you don’t have to pay anything

name: Mr Mpatamato
description: Great and friendly mechanic who helped us quick and professionally +260975602929 with a hole in the sump. He doesn’t have many tools or spares but if you have your own bits and pieces he can surely fix it!

name: Check point
description: A quick spray to disinfect the tyres and off you go!

name: Turn off Buffalo camp
description: As Buffalo Camp is closed you are allowed to drive the much more scenic route along the river we were told at the west gate but after 5 km a car with rangers (rhino poaching unit) came to stop us and say this is forbidden. So only the straight transit road is open to those that pass through. The park has little to offer or see for such high costs (65USD for 2 people) except transition.

name: Kaazmein Lodge
description:
Really nice hotel with a huge garden in which two Zebra's, a bunch of Emus, peacocks and ducks roam free. The rooms are all ensuite and with A/C. We paid through booking.com 32 USD per night for two people with breakfast included.

Friendly staff, secure parking, cheap restaurant and you can book all activities in Livingstone at the reception.

Highly recommended.

name: Eco Lodge and Campsite
description:
Camping under mango trees, lots of shade and space and a nice garden on the beach with hammocks and chill spots. Nice and quiet, we moved here after one night at Funky Chyclid and the noise of their generator, for Kw5000 pppn this is much, much better. Toilets and shower are dated, no electricity points nor bin and water is off when there is a power outage, no wifi and the staff loves screaming at each other at 6am around your camp but otherwise a pretty chilled place as long as you go and ask for the things needed. 

Their claims to be a responsible non profit (HEEED center next door) is however doubtful, the South African managers are not interested in HEEED, the non profit side and the Finnish owners (who only come part of the year) have their private house on the land and it is all quite unclear actually where the money goes, even staff doesn’t really know so they would be better off not claiming too much and being transparent first. Gerard at the HEEED center across the road is a nice guy though and it is fun to join their arts and crafts programs over the weekend days.

name: Police control west boundary Kafue NP
description:
Spot opposite the police control point, at the north side of the road. Ask to the agents.
The road from here to west until 10 km post Kaoma is in a very bad condition many pot holes

name: Zambezi River Camp
description: Beautiful place at the river, former Ferry Station. Few locals arrived to get water from the river but all very friendly and did not care staying us here for the night. There are Hippos and Crocs, so take care!

name: High Commission of Malawi (Embassy)
description: Here is the place where you apply for a Visa. Costs 100 US$ (!) and you can get it the next day if you ask nicely. You need a photo. Opening hours 09.00 - 12.00 Mo - Fr.

name: Pontoon campsite
description: Pontoon has 3 campsites. All with shower and toilet. Small campsites with a view on the river. $20 p/p and K167 per vehicle and K70 park entry fee per day. Very friendly staff and excellent wildlife sightings from campsite.

name: Camp Mutinondo
description:
Open clearing next to the Mutinondo River. Drive past the house and huts to the big tree on the river bank. This is as wild as wild camping come. Lots of Elephants and buck. Heard some Heyana.

Found 4 rangers armed with rifles and they confirmed that we could camp here for free. They even guarded us through the night. Had very interesting conversations and listened to their stories. Wonderful place with wonderful people.

name: Lyangu Camp site no 4 Liuwa NP
description: Nice basic campsite clean and neat. About 100m from toilet and shower. Cold shower. Toilet. Enoch the campsites keeper can supply firewood for 25 ZK. Cost of campsite was 20 US per person for SADEC members and 30 for international visitor.

name: On M15 just north of Chirubu
description: A wildcamp in a quary next too the road. Turn of on the little hill and drive down too get away from the noise of the road. There is a small village down in the valley. 4 people came past late afternoon. There was some traffic on the road and you could here the cars. Good for a over night stay.

name: Kasempa
description: There is a service station with diesel and gasoline

name: On the D301 betwen Kaoma and Kasempa
description: Older carrer on border D301. Place very silent and night quiet.

name: Wildcamp on the road D305
description: Old career on the left  in the direction of Kasempa . Nice place very quiet and at distance of the road so no noisy

name: Road Toll Point
description: Road toll point, can’t pass until you pay. Sign board says ZMK20 per car but they wanted to charge us over ZMK300 for being a foreign registered vehicle! Ended up paying K72 for “single access”. Don’t accept card, cash only (ZMK)

name: Gravel pit
description: Not many possibilities on this road, away from the road but not really hidden. Only a few friendly locals past, quiet night

name: Dead End Road
description:
From the main road about 500m away. To the end road where stones on the track. The entrance to the way is east after the small backroad to Mporokoso.
No one came over and we had a quiet night.

name: Fibwe Public Viewing Area
description: Fibwe public viewing area for the bat migration. A circular slashed grassy area with wooden benches. Free to use. Bat viewing at 4.30am and 5.30pm. Oct-Dec only.

name: Naweka Enterprise (world of belts)
description: On the first floor accessed from the stairs on the street, this place has fan belts for all trucks and cars. Got a replacement here for my truck for 330 kwatcha.

name: Fresh View Hotels
description:
One of the best hotel here in Siavonga.
Not for the low budget, it's 80$ the room. View is really nice!! Live music almost every night.
You can come for a couple of drinks.

name: Mukuyu Camp
description:
Really beautiful bush camp on the side of the Lower Zambezi River. 
You can camp for K200, or go to a chalet for K400.
A bit rustic, but perfect if you are looking for a real bush experience!
Kenny the owner is a local, he can bring you on a safari in the Park or the GMA with his scenic Land Cruiser.
Good for backpackers.

name: Old Quarry
description: A quiet place not far from the Street. We saw no person and on the Street is almost no traffic. OK for one night. Good internet reception

name: Country 24
description: Just recently opened. Hotel with 7 rooms. Clean, aircon, hot water. Kitchen can be used. Food and  drinks are being served. Rooms between 300 and 750 Kwatcha.

name: Stamp out Carnet
description: Here you have to stamp out the carnet if you go to Malawi, no Customs at Chitipa Border. You dont have to go to the main Building at the right side.

name: ATM ZANACO VISA MASTER
description: ATM and Bank 24 Hours Visa and Master Card

name: Camp Nkwazi
description: Expensive campsite next to Zambezi river, but not overlooking the river. Campsite, shaded at a meadow. Prices vary depending on the season between 15 and 25 US$ pppn.

name: Road T5
description: Fuel station at 50 km de Mutanda in direction  on Mwinilunga

name: Bayama's
description: Bayama's Lodge offers 10 self contained chalets, a nice restaurant and authentic bar in a safe and natural environment. Further you'll find camping facilities like ablution block, water and power points.

name: DHL
description: Good service, professional and friendly!

name: Chilambwe Falls camp site and water fall
description: Great waterfall well worth a visit. Basic camp site very basic. Long drop toilet. 1 site. Water falls are 5 minutes walk from camp site. Office price is 15USD camping and 5 USD for car. We negotiated and paid 50ZK pppn. It's worth the 40km drive from Chimshimba Falls.

name: Auto Mechanical Workshop
description: Sameer and his father Khalid run this great garage. Highly recommended.

name: Kawambwa
description: Diesel and petrol at the station near the centre of town

name: Ntumbachushi Falls
description:
Beautiful falls .The main  fall drop about 40 m into a pool,with a second  cataract alongside. 
Campsite very bad abandoned with no toilets and no shower and no water.
Price  excessive  150 kw pp and 50kw for the car

name: Kafue NP entrance gate
description: The men at the gate allowed us to camp with our rooftop tents in the back of their buildings. There are some old Defenders rotting there but no rubbish otherwise. We could even make a fire with plenty of wood everywhere. There is a public toilet available. There are guards 24/7 and some local restaurants nearby. On the parking there is space for big rigs but not so hidden as behind the buildings.

name: Mt Meru fuel station
description: Fuel station on the left side of the road going up from Lusaka.

name: Police checkpoint
description: They asked where we came from, where we’re going, what we’re carrying and then sent us on our way.

name: Puma fuel station
description: Last fuel station for 200km going north to Mpika

name: Isoka fuel station
description: Fuel station in town with diesel. Did not take cards, cash only.

name: Company Clinic
description:
we went for a malaria test, first a quick test en tested negative. but Doc wasn't sure because I told I was dizzy. so detail test follows and positive.
good work from this doc ( Indian female).

name: Immigration Office
description: For cyclists, you can get a Visa here, they don’t like Dollars so you can get local currency from the ATM across the street. Really nice guys, don’t forget to get the exit stamp In Malawi (Mzuzu), otherwise they will not give you any Visa. Mzuzu you can just tell them when you wanna have the exit stamp, easy and quick. In Chama there are some stores, can get basically anything. No Petrol station though, only blackmarket fuel

name: Old road works site..200m away from road
description: Just down a old car track, opens up into a flat area, which looked like it was used when they were building the road. Cannot be seen from the road, no people around all day long. Nice views of the near by mountains. Flat on areas for roof tent camping, but also very soft ground in some places. Good spot for the night between Lusaka and south Luangwa.

name: Immigration Office
description: You can extend your tourist visa here. Located 4km from turnover off to  Serenje town. You will find post office on your left and immigration office is on opposite side. Staff were very friendly

name: Immigration office at Mafinga
description: Exit out of Zambia and entry into Malawi is in two different towns/places.

name: Tribal textiles home decor and cafe
description: Beautiful and modern coffee place. You can have some smoothies following local (and healing) receipts. They have a small menu. Open from 7:30 till 16:30. They have a garden with picknick tables in the back and some lounge chairs in front. It’s also possible to do some souvenirs shopping. They offer nice and fairtrade products like jewelry, pillows and soap.

name: Great Lake lodge
description: Nice campground near lake and fish pounds., walking distance from town. Grassy pitches one ablution block with cold water and showers. One kitchen block.  Quite place. We paid 150 K/2p/night .  We were allowed to use the hot shower of a nearby chalet.

name: Sweet spot close to the road
description: Really peaceful place, just get off the road and ride along the fence and find a nice spot further down. No one around at all, really lovely place:)

name: Motel Mariana
description: Motel only. No camping. interesting town a lot of services for mines and farmers. Engineering,garages etc. No camping in town.

name: Nindo country lodges
description: Very nice new lodge. lot of rooms big yard but unfortunately no camping. Big and clean restaurant

name: Kabwe Mall
description: Upmarket Mall with nice Shoprite. Stock up here before going north.

name: Afrox
description: Refill LPG gas. 7 KG  ZMW 63.  ZMW21 PER kilogram. Very friendly staff. Across the road from Indozia bank.

name: Toll gate
description: Fees on board was 20zwk for local cars. 20 usd for foreign cars except the neighbouring countries (bots, nam, ang, cong, tan) If you paid at the border then you don't need to pay here.

name: Control point crossing Kafue river
description: Small control point crossing Kafue river.

name: Ishambingos Lodge
description: For kilometers no camping. Found this place. Huge camp grounds. nobody there. Definately rundown. Had to add there is no other place on this very bad road

name: Puma
description: very neat petrol station after hours on bad road.

name: Endrone
description: Neat fuel station. close to town.  Plenty parking

name: Kaoma Urban clinic
description: After picking up a fungus on my foot. i got treated by young very polite and sensitive doctor. He gave injections on 4 places. cleaned all. Applied anticeptic cream. A perscription for some medicine. Ask me to come back to make sure it was the right medicine. All treatment for free.

name: Next to the Mielies
description: Small off ramp onto 2 spoor road for maybe 600 meter. Road dead end. Away from main road next to Maize land. so somebody must be staying around. Looked but could not see any one. Ok for 1 night.

name: Mweeke Toll Station
description: lot of officers checking paperwork. we never got paperwoek we paid for

name: Refuel
description: Just before the turn off to the border (when coming from Livingstone), you can buy diesel and petrol from jerrycans.

name: Kent Guest House
description:
Very basic local accommodation. 60 Kwatcha for a bedroom. Squat toilets and bucket shower outside. In any case, much better option than the overpriced Bridge Camp. Be aware of the loud music coming from the bar across the street.
Food and souvenirs stalls few netter away in the village market.

name: Chisonkolo Falls
description: Nice picnic site next to a series of smaller waterfalls. Run by the community 5ZK pp and 15ZK for a car. Can swim if the water levels are lower. Nice stop over. Just of the great north road.

name: Thomas the Gardener Fruit & Veg Delivery (tel - 0963138009)
description: Beautiful fresh fruit and veg delivered by the lovely Thomas on his bike from the village! He can take your order & bring you anything, including bread etc! We had rocket, spring onions, bananas, beautiful fresh basil, limes & carrots. All grown by Thomas in his garden!

name: River crossing
description:
there are no bridge. Good to cross it in dry season.
No crocodile.
Small village. No other cars. 
On north side is big tree to winch. On south side a little bit far.

name: Cutted trees
description:
Place in the bush next to cut trees. There is some space for 2 or more cars.
Nobody disturb. Close to main road but traffic is not so big so there is quite nice and quiet.
You can go further into a bush to see better place if there is because small road is not finished.

name: AC refrigerating, electrical repairing
description:
You can fill up AC gas, fix your refrigerator, they can help with electrical repairing, filters and liquids. Fair prices, recommended!
Close to this point is a lot of guys who can welding.

name: mechanic and Nissan expert
description:
Expert in Nissan. He has a lot of spare parts and excellent knowledge in all used Nissans. He can also fix other cars. He has second garage in Lusaka. 
Contact Vitalis
097 151 1032
Lusaka - 097 776 8080

name: Road tax (toll) check
description: Locals have to pay 20 kwacha for the road to Lusaka, but foreigners don't have to pay if they have receipt from the border for the road tax (toll). If you don't have it you have to pay here at the office 20$.

name: Natwange Backpackers
description: Really lovely hostel in a gated property with pool, gardens, sun loungers, pool table and couches/sitting area. We splurged on a private double room with en-suite for $45 including breakfast (really great quality, stylish, clean, comfy bed) but they also have shared bathroom private’s & dorms for much less. Lovely owners. Breakfast is eggs cooked to order, toast, cornflakes, tea/coffee.

name: Marhaba
description: Supplier of gas for east Zambia, they can refill your gas bottle here. 30 Zoe per kg propane

name: Flat clearing behind trees
description: This is a large flat sandy area 30m from the road, sheltered by trees. Good for one night. You can hear (very few) cars passing on the road and there is a house over the other side of the bushes as we heard voices but were not disturbed. People come to work and pass through from 6am but were very polite and did not disturb us.

name: Speed checking
description:
In all southern Zambia from Malawi to here it was only speeding control we faced. Speed limit is 40 km/h. We were driving safely, 48 km/h but we had to pay the same fee as if we go 100 km/h... it's not fair rules!

Fines for overspeeding:
50-100 km/h you pay 300 kwacha
more than 100 km/h 480 kwacha
It looks like they are always here. If somebody will see it, confirm.

name: Bush camp
description: Bush camp near Choma city but quiet. Not a single person came or even pass us by. We hide in the bush. Good to stay for one night, not longer because it's nothing special.

name: Shivay Hardware
description: The most organized hardware store I have ever visited.

name: Flintstones Backpackers
description: Hotel and hostel in a nice neighborhood.  Close to Levy Mall with fast food options, close to the bus station from South Luangwa.  Male and female dorms for 80 Kwacha, private rooms starting from 240 Kwacha.  Cheapest hostel we could find.  Free WiFi that works!  Bar area with TV.  Reasonably priced menu.  Clean.

name: RSK Lodge
description: Cheapest hotel we could find in Livingstone.  Starts at 80 Kwacha, up to 180 Kwacha.  We got the room for 150 Kwacha.  Now, this isn't the sort of place you want to have your honeymoon at, it's a dive.  But it'll do the trick.  Double bed, mosquito net, shower, sheets seemed clean, working TV and fan in room.  Room was full of mosquitos though because the window was wide open and it was raining.  Lots of weird water stains on the ceiling.  Bathroom was not very nice.  So there are tradeoffs.  Lodge next door asked for 350 Kwacha for what looks to he identical rooms, it's an expensive town.

name: SIM card Mtn and Airtel
description: You can find every sim Card here and register

name: Jupiter Rite
description:
Fairly big supermarket in which you will be able to buy some provisions. Possibility to pay with a credit card (even though the machine did not work when we were there). Take-away Restaurant in the same building with traditional food, chips and even a delicious shawarma (kebab). 

30ZMW for a packed kebab roll.

name: Jacaba Lodge
description:
Nice, small Lodge. Single room for 150ZMW, double room for 200ZMW and they also have other rooms for 280 and 300ZMW. 
Friendly people and space for bicycles in the room. Good for a one night stop.

name: Escarpment Camping Site & Lodge
description: Nice camping site (still under construction) with a very friendly owner named captain James Kasamanda. A former Scotland Yard officer and senior investigator officer of the anti corruption commission of Zambia. you will be in good hands. We paid 100K to pitch our tent and 50K for food.

name: Chukwuma Guesthouse
description:
very nice and calm guesthouse. Large Rooms with aircondition, fan, hot shower. we had a suite with two bedrooms, living room and kitchen. very nice people. Overnight they washed our car which was completely covered with mud.
 Elizabeth is a very good cook. They serve the breakfast in the restaurant.
250ZMW per double bed room.
But the access to the guesthouse from south is a mess. Better you do not follow the first sign coming from south and go the second street right.

name: City Dental
description: Professional dentist. European standart.

name: Luangwa Bush Camp
description: This is a beautiful and quiet place at the Luangwa River in a forrest. The Road D104 is very bad. The track changes often between wide open and narrow. After rain there is a lot of mud. You have to cross several rivers. I did it with a 10.5 tons 4x4 truck, easy for motorbike. Locals ride with bike. If you are sensitive with the finish of your vehicle, than do not go there. In the rain season the water level in the river can be more than 1 m. There may be hippos and hyenas around.

name: Bush camp
description:
Nice quiet place in bush for tent only. 
Large area easy to find near the city and near the main road.
No people came.

name: Time Time Tyre Repairs
description: Good place to get tyre repairs done in Livingstone. Friendly guys who know what they're doing.

name: ATM
description: ATM from atlasmara to get Kwacha. One find also Moneygram. Next to the preschool. Not visible from the mainroad

name: Ngonye Waterfalls
description: Nice Waterfalls. One enters the park and drives up to the end. The last meters you walk across the rocks and through a river to reach the view point.

name: Shoprite - Shopping Centre
description:
Well stocked Shoprite, ATM and various other shops like Pepstore etc. 

Good place to stock up when going to Liuwa Plains

name: Liuwa Plains African Park Office
description:
Liuwa Plain National Park Office.

You can book Campsites at this office as they have space. 

No credit card facilities. only Cash - USD or kwatcha.

name: Kwale Community Camp
description:
Kwale camp is located in the southern part of the Liuwa Plain National Park. This community campsite offers five shaded campsites with warm water showers (solar) and flush toilets, managed by the local community in association with African Parks.

Water tap for cleaning dishes. 

Very friendly staff. They also provide fire wood (15-20 kwatcha)

No electricity. 

Weak signal with Airtel and MTN (MTN works a bit better)

name: Chikwinda Gate
description: Scout camp at the park entry gate. With water pump and a 24h guard it's a pretty good location for cyclists. Other overlander certainly welcome. There is a mobile phone antenna and the guard has the key. It's worth to ask and climb the 50m for the nice views. The Tafika camp nearby doesn't accept poor looking people with a tent...

name: "Shortcut" for cyclists only
description:
"Shortcut" through the Luambe NP to avoid dangerous river crossings when following the main road. End of April all the locals were telling me not to take the main road because of the crocodiles. This shortcut is a path sometimes sandy and with some dense grassy sections you have to "dive" into. It's only suitable for bicycles of light and small motorbikes. It's more or less starting after a safe river crossing at 
Lat. -12.45585 Lon. 32.25427
and ends at
Lat. -12.66984 Lon. 32.19249
ask the locals for the shortcut, they will know.

name: Engen Gas Station
description: Petrol Station where you can pay with credit card!

name: airport checkpoint
description: standard checkpoint for insurance and vehicle defects

name: Regular checkpoint
description: Standard checkpoint where they can check for insurance and vehicle fitness et al.

name: Sioma district toll charge
description: Sioma district check point which charges K65 to cross with a foreign number plate.

name: Toll gate / Speed control area
description:
Toll gate at this point. Show receipt obtained at border.

Drive 60km/hr or less as there are plenty of police speed controls and checkpoints along this stretch. 

When they stop you you have to get out of the car to meet them.

name: Chongwe gate
description:
30 $ ppn
15 $ per car up to 3 t 
possible to pay in Kwacha  (920 with exchange rate that time )
very basic and poor management, 
no map to take a photo of the area
ticket is valid for one calendar day

it seems that they are not well prepared for self drive vehicles 

If you like elephants, this is your park! You will see them rolling in the mud, sandbathing,rubbing the body on the threes, grabbing leaves from the highest trees....After several safari expirience we never saw that behaviour...very enjoyable :-)
we also saw lions. Park is not crowded.

name: Innovate Insurance (Yellow Card / COMESA)
description:
Bought Yellow Card insurance here very easy K567 for Land Rover for 6 months.

The third party Zambia insurance was purchased at Livingstone border from Innovate. COMESA is an extension to the existing policy. I could only purchase COMESA here for that reason.

Second floor Kwacha Pension House. Entrance on Tito Road.
+260 961 345 431

name: Lundazi Castle Hotel
description: Bizarre place. A small Norman style castle built in the late 1940s by an eccentric British administrator of the area. It hasn't been updated much since, but a double room with en suite was 150 kwacha per night and it has loads of character.

name: Builders Warehouse and EastPark Mall
description: Part of the big SA chain this warehouse has anything you need for tools, bolts and other bits and pieces including camping gear.

name: Station OASIS with diesel "low sulfur"
description:
There is a place apart with low sulfur diesel. 
The price is 14,30 Kw per liter (the normal diesel is 12,01 Kw per liter). 
It is diesel 500ppm.
In all others stations in Zambia, except sometimes in Lusaka, it is 2000ppm.

name: Near Tatayoyo gate (Kafue NP)
description: Very nice place, at 500m from the road. Lot of space, and quiet.

name: Skyview lodge
description:
Beautiful big grounds, big clean rooms with double bed and single bed, table, tv and small fridge, hot showers. Restaurant and bar on premises.
Lots of place for kids to run around with jungle gym and swimming pool. Great for one night stay or longer. K300 for double room.

name: Okavango Lodge
description: Best prices we could find in Livingston. Beautiful garden, clean rooms and bathrooms, hot shower. Double room with small double bed and single bed is K450. Good value for money. Restaurant and bar on premises but also very close to shops where you can stock up and get all you need.

name: Santorini Greek Restaurant
description: Excellent Greek restaurant. Non cheap but worth for the quality, especially the Humus and the grilled meat.

name: Lusaka Custom port office
description: pay your carbon tax emission extension here

name: #social
description: nice restaurant where a lot of locals eat. decent food for a decent price.

name: Gina's Lodge
description: Nice place to stop for a night. Large and clean rooms and excellent dinner. I had some fever and had to get a malaria blood test. The lady of the lodge organised the taxi and even came with me to make sure I get what I want. I negotiated a single room with half pension for 220K.

name: Samfya Marine
description:
Given the alternatives this isn’t bad at all. You can get power if you park close to the event palapa, water, ablutions.  Didn’t use the shower but others did. Quite a busy place with locals and the bar can be a bit noisy but both nights the sound of the lake drowned out other noise as it was windy. No wifi but 3G coverage if you have your own sim. Very friendly.

150kwa pppn.  Seems to be the norm in the north

name: Rob and Claire B&B at the farm + campsites
description:
This B&B is situated in the lovely garden of Rob and Claire's farmhouse. They also accepts campers for 5$ per person per night. Extra cost for use of shower/charcoal. 

They're also happy to sell some of they home made products like smoked meat, sausages and more.

Call them for inquires: +260954029223

name: Olga's The Italian Corner
description: Incredible wood fired pizza here. Honestly above everything I have tasted in 5 months in Eastern and Southern Africa.

name: Kanzenzi Wildlife Camp
description:
Camp for wildlife scouts, protecting the nearby nature reserve from poachers. Not too far from the road, with some running water (borehole- handpump), tents set up for the scouts and some buildings. Plenty of trees and cleared well for tents. 
roaming.kiwi: superb. lovely people, our kids are having their first "normal" interaction with local children - can't recommend highly enough. Dreadful road though - potholes as big as the Landrover

name: Cheap Safari and homebased restaurant
description: Friendly George can organize any game vehicles in a reasonable vehicle with great guide who was very passionate and knowledgeable. We paid Kw800 plus Kw200 petrol and Kw150 for the driver plus the park fees which you pay yourself. It was less than half the price for us 4 (2 kids under 12) compared to Croc Valley and more people brings the average price down ofcourse. He and his wife are also great hosts for a dinner at their home of local food (nshima and chicken) and its a different kind of experience for only kw25 pp! Call him on +260965052721 or +260974899484. He also does taxi service or village tours!

name: Café Zambezi / House of Africa
description:
From the outside it looks like a lovely bar / restaurant. 
As well it has a hotel enclosed. There are private rooms starting at 350 Kw/night and 6 bed dormitories for 100 Kw/night.
The place is fairly new and therefore really beautiful and clean. It is colourful, nicely decorated and with lots of loan in the yard to chill out or enjoy meals in a peaceful atmosphere. 
The staff is extremely friendly, always asking if everything is in order, checking if one needs something.
There is also a kitchen with all necessary equipment and a small swimming pool.

name: Wild camp
description: Quiet on a little used track with all the space you could wish for, no people passing by after arriving at 16hrs

name: Golph garage - Toyota Authorised service centre
description: Friendly owner and manager. They know their Toyotas. Official service centre, with original parts.

name: ATM
description: Two banks with ATM, haven't seen one since the border with Tanzania

name: Kamapanda Border Post
description: Border going into Angola. Very nice building and decent road to it. No staff upon arriving, had to wait a few minutes. Had to call the staff from a village nearby.

name: professional insurance
description:
you can buy comesa insurance here.
Also extension of it is possible

name: general insurance
description:
her you can buy an Zambia car insurance and also comesa extension.
we paid for BOTH  (we did not take it at the border) valid 1 year and more than 10 countries about 90 euro.
it is less if you only need it for some month or less countries.

name: Great Kalambo Falls Lodge
description: It is possible to camp at this lodge for 100 Kwacha pppn. Ablutions ok (relatively clean hot shower and western toilet). Restaurant serves good local food which is reasonably priced. Lodge is located about 1 km from the Kalambo Falls and is situated on the walking trail between the viewpoint of the Falls and the Falls themselves. Road from Mbala is good - also in rainy season. Last 1km or so is a bit steep. In total it is less than an hour from Mbala. The Falls and are very beatiful, so all in all a nice detour. Fee for the falls is 150 kwacha pp.

name: Caracas Lodge
description: Lodge for truckers about 2 km north of Kapiri Mposhi train station. I arrived into Kapiri very late on the train due to delays and rested here for the night. I pulled up on my bike at 1.30am and the guys were immediately helpful. The lodge is pricey at 250 but the comfort is amazing: king size comfy bed, en-suite with shower and flush toilet, tv, quiet at night outside, and breakfast of tea, bacon, sausage, egg, and bread. Had a great stay here after 3 days spent on the train from Dar es Salaam to Kapiri Mposhi!

name: Tony's Stop
description: A special place to stop en route from Kabwe to Kapiri Mposhi. Its a beautiful tea shop and garden run by a Madame who has lived there since 1965. Since her retirement she has maintained her shop and tea stand here with some helpers and gardeners. It really is a most beautiful place to stop for a tea and fresh doughnut or fruit. The madame speaks English fluently and she will happily give you a tour of her abundant garden. Not to be missed.

name: Awesome wildcamp on the edge of a plain
description: Wildcamp on the edge of a plain, nobody for miles. Loads of firewood, very overgrown track from the top of Liuwa Plains NP.

name: Old Mission Church
description: The ruins of this old church from 1895 makes for an interesting pitstop and some explanations from the caretaker.

name: Lake Tanganyika Resort
description: New place with 3 rooms incl breakfast kw570 per person per night, camping is allowed but not much shade, price negotiable.

name: Stone quarry
description: Elevated from the lake, no village or house around and a great open view over the lake. Ground is loose rocks or take the small path immediately to the right to be out of sight from bypassers.

name: Comfort Stay Lodge
description: We paid 200 kwatcha to camp in their (reasonably) secure grounds. Roof tent. 2 Adults 2 kids. Absolutely nothing else seems available in the area...

name: Kalambo Falls
description: The second highest free falling waterfall in Africa... quite impressive with 254m (as I was told) and perfect for a quick cautious dip to cool off

name: Luke’s Beach
description: The perfect spot for a night or two of palm beach feelings. I hiked the 6 km from Kalambo Falls down to the village where one of the staff was quickly found and he walked me to this amazing sandy beach with palm trees and total privacy or so I thought. I brought a tent and mat and I don’t see any beds in the 3 chalets but I am sure they can organize if you preplanned it. Camping kw100 on the beach or grass and I asked them to bring me a local meal for kw50 which was no problem, but bring what you can to be self sufficient. The boat from Mpulungu is only kw20 for a return the locals say. Just ask for the public boat to Michembe village and from there its 10 min walking along a small path. Village kids came to stare me down for a while but as they always do, they left...

name: Camp by bridge
description: Wildcamp by bridge. A bit close to villages, in hindsight... far too many curious people, if you stay here be prepared for it!

name: View point of falls
description: For the full picture just follow the balustrade away from the falls!

name: Ndole Bay Lodge
description: Lovely spot on Lake Tanganyika run by Craig and Elise who can give you lot of info as well about the area. You can do diving and boat trips on the lake and into the Nsumbu NP. Hot showers, clean toilets and BBQ stand. Camping $15 pppn. You can upgrade to lodge rooms which will start for $125 a night including 3 meals.

name: Chipoma Falls National Monument
description: Semi wild camp spot on the Chimanabwe River and Chipoma Falls.

name: West Lunga NP
description: This place is next to the ferry which brings you into the West Lunga NP. When we arrived, the ferry was on the other side of the river. We spoke to the ranger who told us that the operater is in the park with other visitors and is expected back the next day. We asked him, if we could stay for the night and that was ok for him. There are no facilities at all.

name: Muzombwe Scout Camp
description: This place is at the end of a quite overgrown track which is in parts also quite stony. The place itself does not have any facilities but a nice view over the lake and a lot of birds around. We could see and hear fisher but nobody came to us.

name: Chongwe Falls
description: No falls when we were here, but lovely spot for a picnic overlooking a pool. We spotted a very large crocodile and a hippo so don't even think about swimming!

name: Farmers Rendezvous Lodge
description:
Nice quiet Hotel. Clean rooms. Nice shower. 
Restaurant and bar

name: ATM Stanbic Bank
description: ATM does not charge commission. Free of charge with Visa or MasterCard.

name: Toyota Zambia
description: Big dealership with a huge service bay and large parts dept. I was able to get an appointment for the next morning.

name: zambezi cafe
description:
It's one of the best place to eat here in Livingstone. African and contemporary dishes (as well as crocodile!!)
live music and bar.
There is an Hostel at the back.
Could be crowded on weekends

name: The Waterfront Bar & Restaurant
description:
Dreamy local bar on the waterfront. Good price beer and amazing view. 

Didn’t try the food, but it’s low cost and was recommended. (Chicken - kw20, salad and chips kw15)

Very close walk to Nkupi lodge.

name: Hanlo Estate Guesthouse
description:
Hanlo Estate is a small absolute clean and beautiful privat Guesthouse located on a quite and full secured huge property with horses at the other end.
Hano and his wife Lilo are extremely friendly and welcoming. 
They speak africaans,  english and german
The meals are delicious and a must have.
 
I have attached a brochure of the guesthouse also.

Rates are:

USD 85.00 per ROOM for a single person
USD 95.00 per ROOM for two people sharing
The above includes breakfast, WIFI and DSTV.
You can also use the pool. 

Additional:

Supper USD10.00
Dinner USD 15.00
Airport pick up/drop off USD50.00

Please contact: +260 96 187 6215 or +260 97 777 0345 or email at hanlo.estate@gmail.com for further information or bookings.

You have to contact them bevor arriving because there is no bell at the front gate! 
facebook page is; https://web.facebook.com/hanloestate/

name: Nyabota Lodge
description: Nice rooms with private bathroom at 150 kwacha. There is a nice garden, a restaurant and a bar. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

name: Kanyemba Luangwa border crossing
description: You can't cross with a car, you have to hire a boat, they can carry a bicycle or motorbike from Zimbabwe to Zambia or the opposite. It's about 1 Usd pp and 3 Usd for the bike. Custom was very nice and efficient, just 5 minutes to get the Zambian visa.

name: Scc Luka
description: Ask if network is working, otherwise only cash payment

name: Wild camp on the road to Isanga bay lodge
description: Open area right next to the road. Road is very bad so no traffic. Only saw 2 friendly people coming past in the evening. Good for a 1 night stop no more.

name: Excellent lodge A
description: Decent value for money. Rooms for 300/350/500 K, all very clean. Included continental breakfast.

name: Sikale Campsite
description:
If you like to be alone in the middle of nowhere this is the place. 
A good shady place under a big tree. 
This place is open but not maintained because of not enough visitors. 
No ablutions at all. 
No water.

name: Mulungushi Boating club
description:
Nice campsite, right by the dam! Beautiful and quiet. Staff is nice and speak English. Hot shower accessible and there is a pool and bar. 
50KWZ pp

name: Immigration office
description: Immigration office where you can extend your visa.

name: Sioma Camp
description:
Located near Sioma/Ngonye Falls National Park. Sioma Camp has accommodations overlooking the Zambezi river with facilities such as outdoor swimming pool, beach, fully equipped kitchen, bar, laundry service and 24-hour front desk for your convenience.
Dinners are available on prior arrangement.
The campground has a terrace.
Fishing is very good as the area is a conservation zone.

name: Bush camp
description:
Close to the main but hidden behind big earthworks. Good overnight stop between South Luangwa NP and Chipata.
Access from the road (looks a bit like a road construction) ends after ca 200m in a spot for a few vehicles.
We spent a very quiet and peaceful night here after a wonderful game drive in the South Luangwa NP.

name: Aksons Metal Fabrication
description: welding shop in Churundu, fast work and good service.

name: Mamá Africa
description: Best place in town for brai and nshima. nice ladies and good price

name: Secondary school informal camp
description: Secondary school next to the road. I asked the headteacher and told me a safe and calm place to camp, next to an empty teacher's house (no wind). There is water (5 minutes walking next the hospital) and african toilet next the campsite. Nobody came to visit me. Shops are on the other side of the road.

name: Pel Take away & minimart
description: Restaurant of a petrol station. Big dishes and cheap prices. Zambian food and take away burgers, samosas and sandwiches. Calm and polite staff.

name: Govinda's Indian vegetarian restaurant
description: Vegetarian Indian food. 100 kwacha for daily menu. All you can eat (you can repeat all times you want). Good price and good food.

name: Local Zambian Buffet
description: Monday-Friday lunch is served for K60 per person. Choice of meat with local side dishes.

name: Village - Safety Stop
description: For any cyclists on the old Petauke road wanting to avoid wildlife and have somewhere safe to sleep between Mfewe and Petauke. This village is friendly and the locals seem used to cyclists asking for somewhere safe to sleep. We slept in the school room.  There is also water from a bore hole and a very small shop although probably best not to rely on it.

name: Perigrine campsite
description:
3 campsites next to Taita falcon Lodge on the Zambezi gorge. Very restful and quiet.
Wifi in the lodge (400m)

name: The Oasis Evergreen Lodge
description: The Oasis Evergreen Lodge is a great stopover for tourists traveling through Africa and Zambia. The scenery is great with self contained rooms, each room has cable satellite tv and tea/coffee making facilities, free WIFI, there is also a bar for guests, and outdoor barbecue area. With great sitting area to soak in the African atmosphere as the sun sets in the evening or rises in the morning. Located in a quiet area with secure parking in the premises.

name: General Alliance Insurance
description: We did our Comesa Insurance for our two motorbikes there. Easy, friendly and overall good experiemce. Only cash accepted. We payed 2215 kwecha for two bikes, all Comesa countries and 1 year. Cars and bikes are the same price.

name: Wency's Autoworks
description: Professional, friendly, fast and knowledgeable mechanic. 50 ZMK per hour. Did our bent steering rod within 30 minutes.

name: Mayfair Insurance
description: Correct location for Mayfair Insurance. 1194 Lunzua Road (no longer on Lubuto Road). Bought COMESA yellow card here. For 6 months - Zambia 3rd party insurance k278 ($22) + COMESA k567 ($44).

name: Mr Anton workshop
description:
one of the most welcoming / friendly / efficient mechanic we met since we started our journey 
he will probably not have your parts at the workshop but pretty sure he will find a solution for your mechanic's troubles. (even if you need to order parts in Lusaka To be delivered by bus to mpike )
I insist ! really nice and experimented guy ), you can rely on him !!!!!!!

name: Grakas Lodge
description: Double rooms with private bathroom, hot shower, fridge, TV, kettle, 350 Kwacha. They were cleaning the swimming pool so it was closed. Nice bar and very good and cheap restaurant.

name: roadside bush camp
description: This point is for the dirt road off the main road (if heading north, it's on the right). Once on the dirt road, take a left and follow the road (seems rarely used) to camp anywhere along the road. We passed the night in our RTT at about 200m up the road. We were next to the road but since on a small hill and behind some trees, not visible from the road in the dark. Traffic on the main road was heavy until about 9pm then again starting about 6am.

name: Mutinondo Wilderness
description: A beautiful, private wilderness area with many options to hike (unguided) up and around huge granite outcrops and visit several small, lovely waterfalls (flowing when we where there) and swim in the natural pools. Really an exceptional place. We paid k100pp for day visit.

name: Smart guest house
description: Double rooms from 100 Kwacha, electricity from 6 to 11 pm. Shower and bathroom outside. Staff super friendly. There is bar inside, we can order food from one of the restaurant in the village.

name: Dali Dali Guest House
description: Double room 150 Kwacha, hot shower, electricity, mosquito net. They are still building the guest house, no bar and restaurant yet but there is a nice bar & grill 100 metres away. Staff is very friendly.

name: Big Dreams Guest House
description: Very nice double rooms with private bathroom for 200 Kwacha. Electricity, hot shower, mosquito net and fan. Very close to a bar, it can be noisy on saturdays.

name: Zanaco Bank
description: Atm with 50K charge for each withdrawal. don't know the maximum allowed to withdraw (we took 4000) They also exchange kwacha to euro, pounds, & a few other foreign currencies.

name: Big bush camp area
description:
Nice area, long stretch of grassland where you can pick your spot. And of course leave it just how you found it.
In between Matambo and Chiluba, take a right angle turn south when above the waypoint, then after 4km, take a left hand turn at the bottom of the hill adjacent to the waypoint. Drive 400 metres and it opens out etc.

name: Kabompo River Lodge & Camp site
description:
Lodge and camp site on the bank of the Kabompo River adjacent to West Lunga National Park. Facilities include chalets and camping.  
They allow you to camp next to a chalet of your choice and use the shower and toilet in the chalet.
Lovely quiet camp with great views over the river and park.
Each stand has a sink with running water.
Firewood is provided. Offered activities include fishing, boating and game viewing in the park (there isn't much we were told) and river. There even is a playground for the kids!
US$20 pppn or K200 pppn for residents

name: Samwanji Guest Lodge
description:
Motel type rooms with private bathroom in secure grounds. K250 per room. You can park right in front of the units and sleep in the rooftop tent.
Good place for an overnight stopover.

name: afrox Choma
description: afrox refills also CADAC cylinders.  payment by kg.

name: Nsofu Ranch and Tackle Shop
description: Beautiful lodge and campsite located on Kafue riverfront and very close to Zambezi river. Cost for camping is US$15 pppn with own tent, US$30 pppn if you use their tent and bedding. Beautiful pool right by the river. River safari is US$30 pp. You can pay by card here. They also have a tackle shop to buy or hire fishing gear.

name: Swallows Rest
description: A fishing camp in progress. Currently only wild camping available, chalets and catering to be available soon.

name: Impala automotive spares/Engen
description: Good general automotive supplies shop in the Engen station. Friendly and helpful staff, referred to other places when they didn’t have things.

name: wild camp  next to the road
description: direct near the road is a flat spot with not many trees. we decided to over ight here before going down as it was getting late and looked for rain.

name: Nice open field camp
description:
A open area with less trees far away from the main road. The track you have to follow to get here is for a small village at the river. No car is there and you will be alone as this track is rarely used
Elefant and Kudus are here

name: wild camp at river crossing
description:
the pontoon was disasambled (because of Saison? ) but the river was still high to cross. It was minimum 1.2m deep and as we are alone we were not risk that. The riverbed is also muddy. So better to sleep and over think it. 
So we camped here as there are no tsetse around. Lots of hippos here and elefants in the night.
Be aware of crocs😏 
In the next morning there was a tractor, so we had an emergency backup and we decided to cross.
Pretty deep at 2 points of the nearly 200 m wide river.

name: Pro Tech Motorcycles & Bikes
description: Alternative to KTM (which recently shut down). Well equiped workshop; do all brands, though seem specialized on MX & Enduro. No spare parts or tires available.

name: Chifungwe Gate
description: They allow you to camp. 5usd per person. Long drop toilet and they provide hot bucket. Very friendly. Far view on river. Elephants crossing at night.

name: Puma gas station
description: Also has a little shop and some fast food. Not much, though

name: Harrys
description: Really nice food in a big resort. Grill in an open kitchen. Large portions. Main 150-200 ZMW.

name: Chimfunshi
description:
One of the largest chimpanzee sanctuary of the world. 

Entry 60 kwatcha p/p and 30 for kids from 3 years. Everything goes to the chimpanzees and the community.

They feed the Chimpanzees at 11:30 & 1. 
You can camp here too (look at the “informal campsite” button on the map)

Look for signs on the main tar road. There is an old very bad one (tracks4africa suggested the old one) and a new, witch has signs.

name: SOS Childrens Village
description:
Lovely place where you can visit the good project.

They have a guesthouses you can rent and you can also camp here. All the money goes directly to the children. 

We didn’t stay overnight, we were just visiting them and it was such a great experience!

You are more then welcome to pop in unannounced but you can also call the manager Kennedy +260 962 483163

Or Fredah +260 977195696

name: Police checking changing lanes!!!
description:
On this crosspoint near shopping mall Mandahill they check if you change lanes on the last moment or drive in the wrong direction from the wrong lane. If you do they fine you for 900k but the official fine is 300k!!!! The officer said because of changing lanes and bringing danger but that is also not correct and official. The fine is only for changing lanes. 
In addition: the police officer was not reasenable so we finally said we would report him for corruptie, so we kept on asking for his badge/ID number and finally he said we could go without paying. This guy really was way out of line so happy with this result

name: Mama Muwowos Lodge
description: 4 km north of Muyombe. You find a sign at the terrible main road. Nice place with bungalows and very very nice and helpful people. It was already dark and we were so happy to find this place. They also prepared delicious food for us. The bungalows for two people are between 150 and 200 ZMW.

name: Airtel
description:
Airtel office to get a Zambian SIM card.
Very helpful and efficient people at the desk. 
10 ZMW for the SIM card, 100 ZMW for 5Gb data and 100 ZMW for 450 minutes voice

name: Zambia immigration (Kanyala)
description: Only Zambian immigration here. No customs. Very quiet and fast.

name: Namwe Guesthouse in Chama
description:
Nice and clean Guesthouse with friendly owners. We stayed there, because we found no Camping on the way between Lundazi to the great north road. Chama is a small and tidy town with basic infrastructure.
The price was a reasonable 120 ZKW for two persons.

name: Mumu's Lodge
description: Nice stopover in Kaoma, warm welcome, big clean room in rondavel far from main road behind double enclosure, secured parking slot in front of room, hot shower, air con, restaurant. No alcohol. No bar so no loud music even on week-ends. 500 zkw full english breakfast and 2 small bottles of water included. We had a veggie dish for diner, 20 zkw each. If you don't want to wait at the restaurant you can order, go back to your room and they call you when food is ready.

name: PG Glass
description: A good place to get those chips in your windscreen repaired,  cheaper than a new one. They charged me K250 to repair a chip. They also sell windscreens. +260 966002211

name: Namwe Guesthouse in Chama
description: Nice Guesthouse with friendly owner. We stayed there because we found no place to camp between Lundazi and the great north road. Chama is a tidy little town with basic infrastructure.

name: Melissa Supermarket
description: Small supermarket with a good range of products.

name: Fuel
description:
Possible to buy petrol here. Can only purchase 5L containers at 90 ZMW. 

Don't know about diesel.

name: Veritas General Insurance
description: At the Post Office you get third party car insurance  for Zambia. Ford Ranger e.g. cost 163 ZMW for 3 month.

name: Nyamfinzi Hotel
description: Modern western style hotel, new and sparkling clean. Tv, ac, generator for power outages. Restaurant with western and great local Zambian dishes. Gated and guarded parking. 2km away from main road, quiet location. 750ZMW for double with breakfast.

name: Near Old Buildings
description: Stayed here with no hassle no more cars after 16.00 seems quite a good place to camp outside Kafue on the way in or out.

name: Power tyre
description: Very good tyre repair place. He is only using quality tiptop material from Germany. We got an Unimog tyre repaired with side damage. He can do the hot repair method. Reasonably priced with friendly staff. Contact Bennie Oosthuizen +260963805674

name: Zunga Camp & Campsite
description:
Nice place inside Kafue NP with some shade direct at the Kafue River. We were allowed to use toilets and shower from one of the chalets. Very friendly people. Paid 200 ZMW for 2 adulds and one vehicle. 
No mobile signal.

name: Austafrica Tyres
description: Great place for tyre maintenance and new tyres. We needed some new BFGoodriches, and although not on stock, they were able to deliver after two hours! And we had alteady phoned and visited many locations in Lusaka. The BFGoodrich tyres were not cheap, as they are imported from the Netherlands. All equipment is of a good standard, as well as the competence of the crew. They also have a mechanical workshop and are specialized in 4x4 vehicles.

name: Lukasa
description:
Lovely campsite & BnB, located in the south of Lusaka, on the boundary of a residential- and farming area. The owners, Harry and Geke, have opened up their garden and house for travelers and short stay visitors who are looking for a “home away from home”. Their unique and stylish decorated rooms offer a little luxury and the warmest welcomes.

The campsite is set in a beautifully maintained garden with swimming pool and patio facility for your enjoyment. The campsite bathrooms offer an unusual luxury. 

It is also possible to join the “table d’hôte” with the owners: a nice meal with an accompanying drink for only US$10,- p.p.

All-in all a great place for adventurers who need a break in a peaceful set up with Lusaka “just around the corner” for their shopping, visa applications, etc. 

And not to forget, Harry and Geke are a really nice Dutch couple, already living and traveling through Africa for more than 20 years, so they can also give you good advise on where to go and what to do in Zambia or other places in Africa. 

Please give Harry a call or send a Whatsapp before arriving to check availability: +26 0966860445.

S 15.51800° O 28.19076°, Turn here, access to Lukasa.

Mi Casa, su Casa, Lukasa

name: FXA Bureau De Change
description: Money change with a good rate from Pula into Zambian Kwatcha. Only change paper, not coins. Was advised not to change money with the informal guys on the street.

name: Road Triangle Signs
description: Uprising Real Sign. Bought our metal backed road triangles from this road side business. ZMK100 for a set of two. Friendly, chilled service and they do a range of signs etc. Owners name is Kevin.

name: The Livingstone Museum
description: A fantastic exhibition depicting the history, formation and culture of Zambia. Not to be missed is the David Livingstone exhibit, depicting one of the legendary overlanders of the past

name: Chongwe Council Guest House
description:
We arrived late in the night to this place, the night guard was sleeping.  he woke up and show us the rooms.it's a local place okay to stay for the night, nothing special. bucket shower, no water in the sink. they ask for 150 kwacha, we paid 100 kwacha for twin room (private toilet and bucket shower).
I think there are resturant and bar in the place but didn't check. (we came late) 

Carpark-camping possible in a Campervan.

name: Butterfly Apartments
description:
Self catering apartments with all necessities such as stove/oven, microwave, kettle, DSTV, fridge, big bath, swimming pool and 24 hour security amongst other things. A little luxury from the extended camping. Around ZMK450 for 2 adults and our 30 month old. Price includes daily room service/cleaning. Clothes washing at ZMK20 per load. Can book on AirBnb otherwise contact directly at reservations@thebutterflylodge.com
Really nice and spacious in a quiet neighbourhood. Ideal if you have your own vehicle, yet they can arrange trips to the falls etc. Recommend this spot.

name: Foot and mouth checkpoint
description: Foot and mouth checkpoint from north to south. Waved us through coming from the south. Immigration Checkpoint also

name: Fuel station
description: Puma fuel station. There are a number of Puma fuel stations in Choma, as well as a Total fuel station

name: C.S. Cycle Mart (1973)
description: Bicycle shop where you will find spart parts. I tried every other bicycle shop in the city (Mudpackers, Game Store at Mandahill Mall, Si Ruth, etc.) and none had 26' inner tube with presta valve except for them. The manager is a bit rude but if he has what you need it is worth the pain...

name: Choppies Supermarket
description: Well stocked shop, has everything one needs at reasonable prices.

name: One Baby Cry grocery store
description: Local spaza shop selling basic necessities including cold drinks. Enjoy some local banter too!

name: Lusangazi Council Levy
description: Town Council Levy : 100 zkw for tourists. Receipt in order, this is a legal levy.

name: Mongu Tyre Centre
description: Tyre and battery sale and repairs, very friendly and helpful people, accept CC, expertise in tyres,  moderate prices.

name: afrox gas
description: they do not have european adaptor.    they only use zambian bottles.

name: Siavonga District Hospital
description: Get tested for Malaria, German trained dentist, x-ray department and physio. Accept cash.

name: Sesheke Fuel Station
description: Fuel station on Zambia side. Diesel (no LS) and Petrol.

name: ATM
description: Zanaco bank ATM. ZMK50 withdrawal fee for international cards.

name: Kariba Pharmacy
description: Well stocked pharmacy including veterinary medicines. Accept card payments.

name: Lifesong lodge and guest house
description: A clean and good vibe place for stopover in Kitwe. Individual rooms of various configurations. Lovely fresh food at Roast restaurant on the premises with safe parking.

name: Forest
description: Wild camped on track off main road. west Lunga.

name: DRC border
description: Exit border from Zambia and onto DRC is here.

name: Nakila Lodge
description:
nice accommodation not far from the lake. clean rooms, including mosquito nets. very safe. running water day & night. you probably find here the best food in town (k35 per meal). price for room is k350 for double (possible to bargain down), or k150 a single bed in a two person shared room. also it has nice shared living room & dining area, you may also get the ladies to cook your food. they can also do your laundry for k2 per piece. much better accommodation & food than other options in town. prepare for very limited electricity like all places in this area (there is even a fridge in the room when power is on :-))
recommend 4x4 to get here.

name: Mansa immigration
description: mansa immigration on the second floor of the Provident House. You can extend your visa here. opening times daily 8am-13:00 and 14:00-17:00.

name: Tyre repair and auto shop
description: Tyre repair and auto shop with compressed air available. No compressed air available at the Puma next door.

name: Kasanka NP (bat viewing)
description: Main gate where you pay entrance fee park. 10 USD pppd and 15usd for car. Here you can ASK if there is camping place available. We had no booking but could stay at ponton. We were in rainy season and road to camping was ok. Need high ckearence. Road to fibwe hide was really bad. Need 4x4. It was so bad, we left early from the bads so we could drive back to camping in daylight.

name: Total fuel station
description: Total fuel station. Cash only. Good, efficient service

name: Nakapalayo Community Tourism Project
description: Community Tourism Project, sandy flat ground with a sala and chalets, bucket shower and toilet. It's possible to camp. They offer also guided Bushwalks, Village tour and visits to school. They provide on request food and an evening entertainment. Light from Solar.

name: Henry's courtyard
description:
Best value for money private accommodation in town. 
standard double for 250kw, executive double for 350kw. in a big group we managed to negotiate to 300 pppn including continental breakfast. 
guest house has genset and 24/7 power. clean rooms, hot running water. fridge and AC in the room. you may be able to access WiFi at reception.

name: Kigelia Campsite and Chalets
description:
On the main road just 3km's outside of Chipata.
Basic campsite and ablutions with hot water, 4 chalets with en suite bathrooms.
Lovely big lapa with comfy chairs and tables and chairs.

name: CASH ATM FDH BANK
description: ATM cash available all hours, FDH Bank towards Northern end of town

name: Peaberry Coffee Roasters and cafe
description: Zambian specialty coffee brand and shop. Nice sit down area as well as offering takeaways, sell coffee beans and a good selection of tasty treats and light meals to go with your coffee. Free Wi-Fi and friendly service.

name: Spectrum Clear H2Zero bottling plant
description: ZMK25 for 30 litres. Cash only. Bring your own bottles.

name: Total fuel station
description: Good, friendly service, accept card payments. Low sulphur diesel available

name: OK Restaurant and Take Away
description: And it is OK! In town and recommended by a local. Cheap and cheerful. Menu attached as photo. It was a long wait for the food to come.

name: Atha Executive Lodge
description: Very clean and reasonably priced overnight accommodation. Room prices range from ZMK250 to ZMK350 for a double room, 2 persons, including breakfast. Hot showers/bath depending on room type. Secure parking with night guard. DSTV in rooms with fan, no mosquito nets, but hook provided. Generator was running for lights during load shedding.

name: Livingstone Memorial site
description: The monument commemorating the place where David Livingstone died and heart was buried. Remote place which includes a small exhibition of how this legendary overlander was found on his death. Fee is 15$. Camping another 15$. Average of 20 kilometres travelling time per hour from the turn off after Kasanke National Park. Faster by Motorbike. Easy track.

name: Livingstone Memorial site turn off
description: Take this gravel road if wanting to view the Livingstone Memorial site. Follow the road and take the first black and white sign to the site turning left and then the second black and white sign turning right. After which navigate north east using iOverlander to the red hazard triangle checkpoint on iOverlander. Then drive north north-west to the site. About 1.5 hours to the site from this turn off.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police checkpoint. Asked us where we are from and where we are going and when. Then sent us on our way

name: Total fuel station
description: Fuel station, accepts card payments. No low sulphur diesel in Kasama.

name: Peaceful Wild Camp
description:
Adjacent to road, partly out of site of road. Flat. Few people. Peaceful night. Not much road noise.

We stayed two nights. Second night police came at midnight. Bit frightening to wake up to find vehicle surrounded by men with guns. But they showed identification and searched truck. Very friendly and professional. Said goodbye afterwards and left. Someone had reported seeing our truck stopped.

name: Bavika General Dealers
description: Has essential groceries and variety from stationary to hardware. Get vegetables at the fresh produce market in town (see other check in on map).

name: Fresh produce market
description: A variety of fresh vegetables and fruit from local farmers. Really low prices!

name: LBM Fuel Station
description: LBM Investment Limited fuel station. Great, friendly service. Accept card or cash. No low sulphur diesel.

name: Cavmont Bank
description: ATM outside and inside building as well as foreign exchange available for US Dollars for Mbala border crossing and use in Tanzania.

name: Auto World Mazabuka
description: We let repair a broken bolt of the shock absorber fixation. They did it well in cooperation with another mechanic who brought his arc welding device. But they forgot to tighten the battery terminal after work, that they had disconnected.

name: Sunken Lake Kashiba
description: Very nice hidden camp, with crystal clear water. you can also swim here. 10US$pp.

name: Roadside
description: about 1km off the main road. Big shade tree. Nice and quiet.

name: Roadside - Kafue
description: Spot to stay here is not perfect but you  will reach the Kafue. The road to get here is just beautiful and you can park your vehicle wherever you like along that path. A lot of waterpumps availible there. People very friendly.

name: Flower and Fern Cottage and Campsite
description: Self catering cottage and campsite situated on a farm in an exquisite countryside setting with horses, chickens, geese and friendly dogs and cats. Natural, quiet and peaceful, this establishment is stunning and also has safe, accessible and good walking trails around the farm. Not too far from Mbala and Lake Tanganyika, this lovely spot is ideal for visiting and exploring the surrounding areas without the busyness of the towns, and us also an ideal place for some downtime, time to recoup and 'to get away from it all'. Accessibility is via an approximately 3 km dirt track from the D1 road to the cottage and campsite, easily traversed with 2x4 vehicle even in rainy season. The price is US$ 50 for the cottage per night including hot shower and running  toilet with wood provided for the donkey boiler or US$ 10 pppn camping with an available hot shower and toilet. The cottage is serviced daily and includes cutlery, crockery, towels, mosquito net, microwave, gas oven and plates, fridge and its own bathroom with hot shower via donkey boiler and everything one needs for a comfortable stay.
