Drinking water is from a spring, boiling optional. No Wi-Fi, but there is local network available. Limited, but sufficient flat ground is available for rooftop vehicles. Hosts Jackie and Kevin are wonderfully hospitable who will make you feel welcome, at home and well looked after, as well as provide good knowledge of the area and what to see and visit if needing anything. Highly recommend this place and all it offers - a must stay if passing this side of the country from one night or more. It's hard to leave once here! WhatsApp or call Jackie on +260 966 917 545 or email jackiec005@gmail.com before arriving to ensure availability and/or make a reservation. Cash only and Zambian Kwacha rates available on request.

name: By life connected
description:
Perfect stop on your way to the Kafue NP. 

Informal campsite owned by the young and enthousiastic Dutch couple Lars and Kellie. They just started a NGO with the aim: Bringing local farmers and lodges together. 
They can tell you all about their adventures. 

To meet overlanders they opened their nice garden for overlanders. 
They have boreholewater, solar to charge youre phone, outside solar heated shower, pizzaoven, kitchen and sometimes WIFI. 

It is all rustic, but has a very good vibe and if you bring wood and ingredients for a pizza it will be a fantastic stop on your way to Kafue NP. Close Nalusanga village. 

PRICE: only $7,50 pppn and you support a NGO. 

Please contact in advance, because they are not always at their house.  
Whatsapp: +31621866624
Mobile: +260762090217

name: 3 Threes
description: Excellent coffee shop and place to get delicious food.

name: Professional Insurance
description:
You can extend your professional insurance policy here and add comesa. We added for our motorcycles here. 
Extend insurance 265K Comesa 322k

name: B'Hive Café and Car Wash
description:
Nice local bar, both open air and indoor, very friendly staff, nice music, also sports bar.
Good carwash as well, very busy so you can have a drink at the bar while you wait for your car to be washed.

name: Langila Lodge
description:
Good safe place to stay. 

Rooms for double bed available for K200.
Good clean rooms.

Camping with power and showers available at a negotiable rate.

Owner Ellie was very helpfull and happy to assist with any query.

name: Wild Camp
description: 1.4km off the the tar road. Nice view and we just saw 2 friendly people around here.

name: Along the Railway
description:
Along the railway, on the little road, in he direction of a farm. 
We spent a quiet night. We asked the farmer when he passed to go back home, and he said it was OK for us to stay here.

name: Mindolo Dam Camp
description:
A nice open campground adjacent to the lake. Busy with motocross bikes on the motocross circuit. Bar serving coffee, beers and ice creams. Three marked (sort of) walks: 4km, 5km and 17km (we did 5km and it was nice, saw buck). Swimming pool (a bit green). Ablution block behind bar (run down).
K50pppn + K40pvpn.

name: Kitwe Immigration Office
description:
Able to extend visa here (required each 30 days up to 90 days).
Very friendly staff. Took 10 minutes. New stamp in passport for another 31 days.

name: Dag Hammarskjold Memorial
description: Crash site of UN Secretary General 1961. Informative guide (Gilbert). $15, but we negotiated K100.

name: Chisamba police checkpoint
description: Police check thoroughly for any vehicle non compliance.

name: No name Lodge
description: The guy is starting with this lodge. When we arrived it was no working but he had rooms, with bathroom but no water yet. He gave us many buckets. No electricity yet but he took our phones to charge. He told us “pay as you want”. We gave K100 for 2 person. We arrived by bicycle. You can arrive by car but not park it very close. There is a steep path to get there.

name: Stef’s Sourdough Basket
description:
Steffanie is baking German Sourdough bread. This place is her home from where she bakes and supplies.
Please WhatsApp her if you want to order bread.
Sometime in the future she will have her own little shop.
See her offers of different breads on picture.
Also directions on picture, Lusaka off Great East Road, 18 Kabompo Road
+260 96 8220381

name: Bug dreams Lodge
description: It seems a nice lodge, just 200 meters in direction to Chiapata from here. I didnt sleep because I didnt know that this town existed. In these coordinates is the market of Chimsanya. Few restaurants and shops.

name: House of Excelence Lodge
description: Very nice lodge. Very clean, nice restaurant, big parking... double rooms K350, twin rooms K400. Wifi available.

name: Shoprite - Supermarket
description: Shoprite one of the biggest supermarket in Zambia

name: Golf House - Luke and Steph 's
description: Camping ground for tents or tented vehicles in his private garden in the middle of Kasama.

name: Oliverate Eco Lodge
description:
Quiet place in the mountains with five rooms, although room 3 seems to be the better one. 
They were asking 350 for the night but because of no water or light due to load shedding negotiated to 200 ZMK for two one night.  

You can also car camp for 100 ZMK. 

each room has air con and wifi.

name: Dup"s Truck Stop
description:
A truck stop. Used by the big trucks hauling copper. Plenty of space to park. Beer available and pool table, and clean toilets/showers. Cheap beer 20k for 760ml.

Night security. Good for one night if you are needing somewhere to break your journey. Airtel reception is good. Trucks leave early in morning (6am). Good value at K30 (total) for the night.

name: Lusaka
description: Pioneer Camp vehicle storage. They store overland vehicles next to their lodge / campsite. Usd 2,- per day. Outside parking (not under roof). Reliable staff.

name: Total
description:
Brand new Total petrol station. Swipe available.
Good service. Low sulphur fuel available.

name: Railway Muesum
description:
A bit tired, but worth a visit nonetheless. Ten or so locos and some information.
USD15 or K150 per person.

name: Park & Fly Livingstone
description: Very new place. Next to airport. An Mynhardt is rumning the place. New boxes to store vehicles and even high trucks. Arranges service and starts vehicles every month. Very good and save place to store your vehicle. Long term usd 50, per month. +260 977744855. Also whatssapp. Or. +260 963439104. Also Whatssapp. Also  2 rooms and 5 studios for rent. Arranges airport transfers.

name: Sportel Vehicle Storage \ Limo Hire Zambia
description: Dutch Guy offering long term parking for vehicles. Very secured and looked after. Power for trickle chargers available. Option for parking under roof (max. 3,5 meter) or in shipping container (max. 2,5 meter). Drop off at airport and collection from airport included. Place is very safe. Communication via WhatsApp for availability, updates and other communication. Hans Sportel +260966743145

name: Golden Pillow
description: Really great hotel, big rooms with an ensuite, comfortable double bed, aircon, fridge and table/chairs. Good fast Wifi (unlimited). Good resturant with local dishes. Security 24/7. 280 for a room. Really reccomend.

name: Baobab in the bush
description:
Chilled little spot, no people around. Follow cattle tracks to Baobab tree. Good for bicycles and motorcycles with good clearance. 

The tar road is rad with the odd pothole and sand, good alternative to highway.

name: Mt Meru fuel station
description: Fuel station accepts cards. New place. With clean washroom.

name: Lusu Mission
description:
it used  to be a little campsite next to the Zambesi River run by the Mission.
If you leave a little benefit they will let you stay overnight. Very friendly people!
Water can be used dir showering from the River. 500 m  to the camp a bit rough

name: Zambesi Riverside
description: nice quiet overnight spot direct at the River at the dirt road from the Sitoti ferry! Beautiful view just before you reach Senanga - nobody bothered us.

name: At Kafue River
description:
Meadow with nice view on the river - a lot of crocodiles around. To find the way you have to drive around the fenced property to reach the river. Ask the fisherman  to 
bring you fresh fish!

name: Scorpion place
description:
quiete place in a slight forest area a little bit off the road.
Be careful - after sundown we had 6 big black scorpions around our place!
We got visited from 2 local guys just curious and asking for money we did not give. They were happy with a Coke. The tobacco farmer (landlord) passed by this morning - very friendly!

name: Mozanaf Campside abandoned
description: this camp is not existing for quite a while any more but nice place to camp direct at the river with hippos we heard from the other side and a big ( 4 mtr.) river snake passing! Very quiet place - no traffic noise and no locals passing by.

name: atlasmara bank
description:
regular bank but can change money even without an account.  better rates than the people on the street.

they do buy/sell Malawi kwacha.

best to sell all of your Zambia kwacha before you exit.

name: Zest Restaurant
description: Great affordable local restaurant serving braai (including kudu and crocodile), pizza, stir-fry, fish, burgers, and local traditional food etc. It was so good we came back on our last day in Livingstone. It could take a while for your food to come out since they do get busy so order some appetizers (the halloumi mushroom skewer is great!)

name: Toll
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Attention for the latest check-ins

no need to pay, just show them the road tax receipt from the border (on green paper).

name: Mansa Hotel
description: Nice hotel in town. Prices for rooms range from 200-300KW but we asked and they allowed us to camp in our rooftop tent in their big gated lot in the back for 100KW. At first they said 200KW, but since we could get a room for that price, we negotiated down. There is a restaurant at the hotel and gas station and Shoprite close by. A sign said they accepted credit cards, but we paid in cash. Gated lot is dark and quiet and we had the place to ourselves with access to a toilet. There might be wifi available but it didn't seem to be working at the time of our visit.

name: Wannabes Lodge
description:
This is a very nice and cheep Place 5 Km from the Border to Tanzania.
You can camp in the Garden or get a cheap and clean Room for 250kw.
Cold shower, good Restaurant and cold .  Friendly Management,  very well in speaking English. Secure Parking.

name: KN Cottage and Camping
description:
Khaya Nyasica is a 50 acre, peaceful, small holding 15 Kms to the NE of Lusaka. It is one of the few remaining patches of indigenous bush close to the capital. It is easily accessible by good tar roads. 20 mins from the Great East/Airport roundabout, 15 mins from the Great North Road. It is 20 mins from town/shops and 
5 mins from Bonanza Golf club (restaurant). It is 15 mins from Lusaka Airport.

Accommodation is a choice of a thatched Rondavel with Kingsize bed and bathroom or camping with the use of the Rondavel bathroom. There is a lot of space to park a vehicle with a rooftop tent. The whole property is secured by an electric fence with electric gate. This is a great place to spend a peaceful night away from the noise of the city and among fabulous bird life and a small herd of Angoni cattle. Camping is $10 pppn and the cottage $40 pn. Whatsapp or call Caroline +260 977229380 or Angus +260 978077247 to reserve in advance.

name: Highlands Lodge
description: Small lodge in a wall fenced yard with lots of green. Can sleep up to 6 guests.

name: local guest house
description: This is a little guest house run by a local for locals. Not a Western Standard but still nice, with beds and Moskito net. no runnig water, no electricity. just some Solar light bulbs. very friendly. we paid 100 kwacha for one room with 2 beds. the house is a bit hidden in the second row from the main road. nice for an overnight stay.

name: WeTuna Garden Mansa
description: WeTuna Garden is beautifully situated on a fish pond surrounded by green. The staff is very nice, we are the first to ask about camping. We were offered safe parking, clean toilets in the restaurant and very tasty food to reasonable prices. We payed 100 Kw pp. For us the best place in Mansa.

name: Great spot in the mountains
description:
Great spot!! Open grass field with views of the lake through the trees. Motorcycle, bicycle and 4x4 friendly. 

From tar road there are two gravel roads about 200m apart that run up a small enbankment on bend in road. We took the grass covered track that went through 50m of overgrown bushes (if coming in 4x4 consider cutting bushes). Other track is steeper but looked less overgrown. 
Continue down track about 500m until open field on right. Go to end of field to see lake. 

Did not go to end of track as it looked a bit washes away, did not have any visitors.

name: La Villa Guesthouse
description: La Villa Guesthouse allows camping in a mobile home or roof top tent. The parking lot is fine, the staff is very friendly, toilet and shower are clean. A good place for a stopover. We payed 50 Kw pp.

name: Hiding in the bushes
description:
Very convenient for the Namibia/Zambia boarder. Just of a sandy track (about 1km off the main road). There is a large grassy area to the left of the track, with some trees and bushes towards the back. We reversed in-between some trees so were party hidden from even this track. 

No one disturbed us (we don't think anyone even passed). A big rig would probably fit but not hidden between the trees (we are in a campervan).

The track is sign posted (old sign!) to a lodge, we drove down the track (possibly taking the wrong way at the 2 forks) looking for this but instead of found ourselves behind a small village (which presumably has an alternative entrance).

Nice spot and free!

name: police checkpoint
description: police check point, maybe only for trucks

name: Dangerous section of the road.
description: A lot of trucks are passing by and many breakdowns occur in this hilly area. We saw three Trucks with breakdown, one laying on the side and many leftovers from past accidents, like vehicle parts or goods laying on the road.

name: D500 to Siavonga/Kariba
description:
Shortly after this point, you will turn left onto the D500 (if coming from the T1); it is nice tar all the way to the end. No traffic/police- beautiful scenery. 

Took us just under 3 hours to reach Eagles Rest Camp on Lake Kariba.

name: Autoworld
description:
Wide selection of parts for a variety of different vehicle types (car batteries, shocks etc). Helpful/knowledgeable staff. 

Payments by card or cash

name: Bovu island
description:
Fantastic place, off the radar from the crowds! 
Mama Allis makes great food, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The sunset cruise in a makolo on the Zambezi is really nice, saw also some elephants drinking.
Very special place, nice vibe, we really recommend it!

They have campspots available for tents, but it's on a island so not accessible with a car.
For us it was a break after some traveling so we stayed in a chalet with views over the Zambezi River. 
We left the car on the mainland, it is a safe area and a watchman is looking after it.

For information search for: junglejunction.info
We negotiate a price for staying in a chalet, all meals and activities, so it's possible to make a better deal if you contact them in advance😉

name: General Insurance
description: Bought 10 months 3rd party insurance and comesa here. Ask for Marvis.

name: Mthuzi hotel
description:
Double rooms ensuite start from 350k. Rooms look good and clean. Aircon - fridge in the room. Nice swimmingpool. WiFi but did not work when we were there. They have a restaurant but would suggest not to eat there, took very long and the food was cold.
Hotel is a perfect stop for a night before you cross the border with Zimbabwe.

name: Entering Lotri Bay - phone them first!
description: Before you drive the 4x4 route towards entrance gate of Lotri Bay you have to call the lodge. Otherwise you will arrive in front of the gate and it will be closed and no cellphone reception over there. After they received your call, they can open the gate. From this spot to the entrance gate is 6km.

name: Zuwaga Enterprise
description:
A big workshop for cars, motorbikes, trucks, ATVs
 and maybe motorhomes as well. The owner, Gary is a very good and experienced mechanic.

name: AJ Restaurant
description:
Nice place with simple card, Meat, Chips, Burgers. All prepared freshly, windowed kitchen. Next to the five star pharmacy where you can get malaria rapid test, etc. 
Staff speaks english very well.

name: Mpika Immigration
description: You can extend your visa here. Nothing else to say.

name: SDA Dentist
description: We had an emergency, a wisdom tooth need to be removed as quickly as possible. They helped us immediately, Wesley (American) runs the dentist and it is almost beyond European standards, very clean and new appliances. They have a X-ray camera as well.

name: Cut through to National Monument
description: Do not use the track signposted to National Monument. Use tarmac road instead to moment. Otherwise you may get stuck for a few days like we did.

name: Zambian border post
description: This is the actual location for Zambian border post.

name: Immigration Office
description: You can extend visa here. Nothing else to say.

name: Zambezi Cafe Carpark camping
description:
Cheapest carpark campspot we could find, 100K total (2 people in a Campervan, same deal at Jolly-Boys is $18 USD ).
 

The carpark is accessed from the dirt Street behind the cafe (black metal gate, looks like it is next door to the guest house to the left but it belongs to them).

Access to the main guest house via the garden gate. Guest house has nice pool/garden area, bar, kitchen you can use, restaurant, hot showers, loos - basically everything you might need!
The carpark itself has a big gate, closed at night with security apparently and feels safe enough but is just a carpark (don't expect a nice view!)

Staff super helpful.

name: Imigration Livingstone
description: Ask for Eva, she heads the Imigration. Get my visa extended for the first 90 Days free of charge. After that they wanted 1700 Kwatsha. With Eva's help and understanding of Corona, I was able to extend over 3 months without fees and problems.

name: Samala Camp
description:
New campsite just before the entrance of North Luangwa NP.
Beautiful spot on the Mwaleshi River.
The campsite and the self-catering tents have an outdoor shower.

Price for camping is $10 pppn and $25pppn for the self-catering tents (access to a fully equipped kitchen with fridge freezer, gas stove etc.)

The road to the camp is in good condition, it took us around 1,5 hour to get from the Great North Road to the camp.

Very friendly caretaker Shadrick
You can also contact Ernst: +260 95 0987579

name: Immigration
description: Mbale Immigration Office for extension of visas. 097 784 1729/096 188 2151. Mr Banda.

name: Greens & Grains
description: Organic food store selling a selection of fresh fruit and veg, organic whole grain wheat, meats, yoghurt, honey, preserves and more. Turn in just next to St Mary Magdalene Anglican church (blue), it's just behind it. Open Tuesday and Thursday 9-5pm and Saturday 9-2pm. Contact Annemieke +260 977847116

name: Kabelenga Family Hospital
description: Small family clinic offering all necessary services such as GP, orthodontics, gynecologist, x rays and scans. Booking essential: +260 950 709057. Open 24 hours.

name: Immigration
description: Lusaka regional immigration office for visa renewals. On the second floor of the Public Service Pensions House building.

name: FNB bank
description: FNB Mazabuka branch ATM and bank. No fee to withdraw.

name: Sesheke Pharmacy
description: Over the counter antibiotics and more. Good, efficient service!

name: Sesheke Council Lodge
description: Basic, clean double rooms for ZMK200 a night. No breakfast, but good overnight stop either side of border crossing. Rooms include mini fridge, hot or cold shower, TV and mosquito net. Can cook from ones vehicle. Bar on site and a night guard. Value for money!

name: Mukuni Medical Centre Hospital
description: Range of services including dentist, dental x-rays, medical emergencies etc. Reception: 0955 799 475; Dentist 0979 854 441. Good service, phone ahead for appointment.

name: Nyanjawisi Aqua Mineral Water
description: ZMK30 to fill own 25 litre container. Open 08:00 to 17:30 Monday to Friday, 08:00 to 13:00 Saturday. Closed Sunday. +260 95 0318495.

name: Zambia Revenue Authority
description: Livingstone office for CIP extensions. Done within 1 hour. These co-coordinates is the entrance gate.

name: Mosi-Oa-Tunya Auto Paints and Spares
description: This shop had what Autoworld did not in spare parts only. Good, fast reliable service! Popular with locals. Open Monday to Friday 07:30 to 18:00, Saturday 07:00 to 17:30, closed Sunday.

name: 436 Airport Cottages
description: Fully self contained modern apartments between ZMK300 and ZMK500 per night per cottage. Weekly rates available. Aircon, braai spots, TV, mosquito nets. Great, peaceful place to stay, hospitable and kind hosts. Limited WiFi. Small pets allowed but must be controlled. For vehicle storage see other check-in.

name: Kalimba Reptile Park
description: A wonderful park with snakes and crocodiles set in a very clean and beautiful surrounding just outside Lusaka.

name: Cenotaph to Celerbrate the Final Surrender of Germany in World War 1
description: On the 25th November 1918 the German forces in East Africa finally laid down their arms bringing WW1 to a final close.

name: Mukalabumbu camp
description: Nice new campsite with 5 places, some spots view a view on the plain. Good ablutions with a solar shower.

name: Nico Insurance
description: For third party insurance and Comesa. we just walked in and helped directly, good service.

name: Munali Cafe
description: Speciality coffees, bread and pastries, brewing Munali coffee grown in this Southern Province. Nice ambiance, reasonably priced. Open Monday to Saturday 06:30 to 20:30 and Sunday 06:30 to 20:00.

name: Heartland's Best Farm Shop
description: Wide variety of eggs, vegetables, fruit, meat and cheese. Open Monday to Thursday 07:00 to 18:00, Friday 07:00 to 17:00, Saturday 07:00 to 13:00, closed Sunday.

name: Tembusha forest camp
description:
New campsite in the forest 10km from the main road. Nice spacious campsites with private ablution, it has an outdoor shower and even a bathtub inside. You also have your own braai and dishwashing area and a fire place. On top of the hill behind the campsites there is even a small pool! We did a short hike up to a hilltop to watch the nice view, recommend! 

Contact number: +260 96 8205468

name: Shigu Farm
description: Campsite on a farm. Next to big dam used for irrigation. Good fishing. Running water at tap. Real basics but safe and very clean.  Firewood and braai available.  Toilet and hot shower. Contact Dehan at +260 96 6722043 before you arrive.

name: Christopher owner private place
description: He is the owner allow camping. Very nice no facilities. The best we can get in Samfya. Next to the water.

name: Kange lodge
description: Good place, we camped for one night.  Private lodge no facilities for camping Fresh borehole water available. Paid K100 for the night.  We negotiated the price.

name: Changwena Falls
description: Scenic falls with few rapids with holes to swim in. The falls are next to the road. We camped in the bush next to the path leading to the falls.  No ablutions.  The location is remote with no cellphone reception.

name: Kamfinsa Dairy Farm
description: Campsite on a farm next to the main road.  A safe and convenient place to overnight.

name: Mt Meru Filling Station
description: New fuel filling station. This is a new filling station in a place where there was no fuel previously.

name: Ntanda Cottage
description: Ntanda cottage is on the banks of the Kafue river on a privately owned farm. Lovely views on the river.  The host John is friendly and his help Fiona is helpful with anything you want.  You can camp on the premises and there is a outside hot shower.  You can sleep in the cottage too. The cottage is fully equipped with everything you need.

name: Nyambwezu Falls
description: National monument, waterfall.  Camping next to the river with the falls just 150 meters walk. Wild camping. Natural bush and peaceful.  Although they are supposed to charge for entry no one was around to collect the entrance fee.

name: Mujila Falls
description: Lovely wild camping!  Just you and nature.  Looking down onto the Mujila waterfalls and rapids. 30km from the Mwinilunga - Lumwana T 5 road.

name: Nyangombe Christian Training Center /Kakobaki Falls
description: Campsite on the edge of the river below the waterfalls. Safe spot. Ask permission from Gordon the missionary. Camping is for free.  Very interesting selfmade hydroelectric system and waterpump below the falls.

name: Cassia Engineering
description: Run by Peter Mostet this machine shop can make simple parts as required. Peter repaired a jack for us by machining a new piston. Almost next door to Parays campsite.

name: Chinyingi Suspension Bridge
description: Lovely camping under a tree on the edge of the River with a lovely view over the river. Sandy beach, ideal for swimming in the river.  Safe and quiet.  Short walk to the bridge.

name: Madinawala Engineering
description:
Machine shop. 
I pressed out the wheel bearings for my MAN truck here. 
200 Ton press.

name: CLA Commercial Vehicles / MAN Lusaka
description: This is the only MAN Servive dealership in Zambia. It provides basic services eg oil change.

name: Truck Parts Shops
description: Row of truck parts shops (MB, MAN, DAF) etc. I bought air dryer and oil filters here.

name: Road Transport and Safety Agency RTSA
description: We paid our foreign vehicle truck toll fee here.

name: Francesco's Pizzas (take away)
description:
Delicious, original Italian pizza and Greek souvlaki. WOW, don't miss this. Only on weekends and by take away.  We enjoyed every bite and came back two nights in a row :)
On Friday and Saturday from 16:00 to 21:00
contact Francesco +(260)964111111

name: Entrance to Flower and Fern Cottage and Campsite
description: Here is the entrance gate to Saise Farming Enterprises Ltd, on iOverlander as flower and fern cottage farm and campsite. Ask for Jacky or Kevin, they will pick you up at the gate.

name: Chigombwe mission
description: Wild camping next river with hydro for mission

name: Bad street
description: First great, then more and more potholes. Very bad.

name: Sand pit
description: Near the road but very quiet at night. One of the few places at this road you can park and have some space. Locals are coming around like everywhere. But they are very friendly.

name: Behind the church
description: A quiet and safe place for a night. We were just looking for a place to stay, and it was late, so we found this church and decided to park behind. Ofc not without asking the priest. But he was very kind.

name: Dylan's Place
description:
An informal campsite on Dylan's farm. 

We stayed here for almost a year (yes you read that correctly) in 2020 during Covid 19. 

There is room for two vehicles comfortably and is big rig friendly. We had our own MAN 4x4 and another MAN 6x6 in the garden at one point.

Water, electricity (extension cable needed) and washing machine available.

Please ring Dylan before coming on +260 97 6110585. We paid Kw100pn. But that was long term!!

We marked some things as 'not available', but Dylan is super friendly and may well make the kitchen etc available.

If you bring him a bottle of Jamesons whisky, you will win his heart forever.

Farm entrance: -15.342256, 28.191062 (Ice for Sale signpost)

name: Baobab wild camp
description:
Near to the road, but invisible. Very quiet. Very few people.
We tried three campgrounds, but we were dissappointed of them. It was late so we decided to look for an alternative. Of course it is not the best solution not being at the Malawi lake, but for us at this day at this time it was perfect. Africa and wild.

name: Liseli
description:
Lovely (self catering) Lodge just outside Mongu. Clean, friendly staff, nice bar and restaurant with lovely food.
Camping area is under development but you can already camp there and shower in one of their chalets (very reasonable prices). Mongu is the ideal stop over to the liuwa plains or to/from the south to Soma etc.

name: SES Unisure
description: Speciality Emergency Services (SES). www.ses-unisure.com 0962740300 We were needed a doctor check and went there after Harry (Lukasa)  recommendation. Professional and nice staff.

name: CIDRZ Klingalinga Central Laboratory
description: You can make here Covid -19 test 0973500606

name: GMA Area of Liuwa Plains
description: We crossed the Zambezi river with a pontoon at Lukulu town and followed the GPS tracks. Wild camping in the bush.  The camping spot is under huge trees next to the twospoor track.  Johnben a local resident nearby offered us a welcome and brought us firewood.

name: Private college
description: Lovely big tree to camp for the night in mid town. Our host the head of the college gave us permission to camp. Jenny has been very helpful and kind, give us electricity from the office for a small fee.  Contact +260 96 7213120

name: Saba Safari Campsite
description: New five star campsite on the banks of the Kafue river.  7 campsites each with its own thatched shelter equipped with a table.  Each site has a basin for dishes and electricity points.  The ablutions is outstanding with showers and flush toiltets. Ismail Patel is the friendly host that makes you welcome.  Firewood is supplied. $15 pppn

name: Nico Insurance
description: Bought one year third party insurance with yellow card comesa all countries. Very professional. Nice office.

name: Between Lukulu and Lusiwasi
description: Wild camp between 2 villages. Large space without shade for several vehicles. 400 m from the road, you can hear the truck but the traffic stops in the night. We had the visit of the children of the villages. We spoke with them. We gave them some fruits. Very quiet. Signal MTN H

name: Near Kasanka NP
description:
Wild camp on an old track before enter in Kasanka NP. Take a gravel road at the Waypoint S 12 33.291 E 030 23.480
At the waypoint S12 33.279. E 030 24.027 turn left on a overground track. Stop at the curve of the track because if you go on you will exit on the same gravel road you left.

name: Medprof Ltd
description:
They promise 3-6hrs turnaround (although they actually did for us in 1.5hr!). Walk ins accepted, 24/7.  Entrance is off Mushili Way. 1600 kwacha including certificate. Very professional service. We used the certificates at the border to Bots without any issue. 
Went here to get the covid-19 pcr-test done. Sample is taken here any time of the day (they are open on weekends too) and send to Lusaka, which happens only during the week-days at 5pm. Got our samples taken Monday at 4pm and received the negative covid-19 certificate including lab report and fully signed by the health authorities before 6pm the next day. Costs: 2300 ZK per person. Expensive but a reliable service.

7th Feb 2022, cost was ZMW1600

name: MTN Signal near Shandavu Camp
description: We have 4G with MTN at 2,5 km from Shandavu Camp where only Airtel works.

name: wild camping
description: it's a very nice place behind a small community. And it's 100km to/from Mongu, close to sidearm of zambezi. People broke stones around here. very friendly people. very silent at night.

name: wild camping
description: nice camping spot very close to the zambezi river nearby river rapids. the falls are 10 min driving from here, east side. amazing views.

name: Truck Stop Behind Shoprite
description: Truck stop. Concrete surface. Trucks come and go. KW50/night. Nothing special.

name: Stanbic ATM
description: In our one year in Lusska in 2020 neither of these two ATMs charged us a cash withdrawal fee on our UK Halifax Clarity Credit Card (we were charged upwards of Kw50 on all other ATMs, including Stanbic).

name: nachikufu cave
description:
just 2 km from the main road by a narrow track. no problem with our motorhome, no 4x4 needed.
we spent a very quiet night there, it feels very remote and the landscape is really nice. the cave is locked, we could visit in the morning with the gatekeeper. not much to see and absolutely not worth the official price. long drop toilets on site. Being a "national momument" there are official entrance fees : 10$/adult, 5$/kid, 5$/car, 15$ for camping.
we paid 100zk for the night and 100zk for the cave.
good Airtel and MTN signal.

name: FNB ATM
description: at the entrance of the kabwe mall, there is a FNB ATM, no charge on international cards. 2000kw max per withdrawal

name: Off Road
description:
from there a track leads to several bush camps completely hidden from the road. Can be muddy after rain. we were lazy and didn't go very far so don't know how deep you can go into the bush.
can hear the noise from the road, but we spent a quiet night there.

name: Bled
description: Abusive speed control marked at 60 km and well at 54 they take you, you pay 300 kwacha with receipt and ask for the photo

name: Villa Mbanandi Lodge
description: Accommodation for which the first prices are 290 kwacha, excellent reception and possibility of paying by credit card meals and accommodation in a single operation.  Note that the restaurant, although it does not have a very large menu, offers excellent food.  Security parking at the back of buildings or in front of the lodges for those who wish.

name: Njobvu Safari Campsite
description:
Very nice campsite and chalets just by the river with stunning view! Very friendly staff. Locally made and run. Good food and coffee (and best water drunk in Zambia)! Wifi available and good (not free). They organize game drives also.
Also tips for rainy season it’s a bit further from the river than other campsites so it usually does not get flooded.
USD 10 pppn for campsite (call first), 60 pppn for room.

name: Shandavu camp - Melindika
description:
Shandavu Camp - Melindika
Located 6 km from Kafue NP near Ithezi-Thezi, open from May to December. Created by a French vet, Victoire, this camp offers bungalows and some camping places. Drinking water from a borehole. Solar electricity in the commune.
Dry toilet. Outdoor shower, hot water on request.
The camp is a farm with pigs, goats, chickens, dogs and cats. An enchantment for the children. Shady pitches.
Victoire will propose you various activities to discover the surrounding communities. Possibility to accompany her during her veterinary visits. She can organise a visit to a fishing village with a local guide, a visit to the elephant orphanage in the Kafue Park, a boat cruise on the Kafue Lake at sunset...
We loved this place so much with Victoire's warm and caring welcome that we went back before we left Zambia. The communities have stayed away from tourism. They love to be photographed without any financial compensation. The children do not ask for anything. Do not offer them a pen, candy or money. We have contributed to the life of the village by making the seamstress work, by hiring a local guide...
The camp is closed during the rainy season
Contact Victoire Delesalle by WhatsApp: 00 260 977 33 61 42
assomelindika@gmail.com
http://melindika.org

name: Blue Lagoon old watch tower
description: Amazing place in the middle of the flood plains. Get here on a 4m wide +-3,5km raised area. Very thick bush on it with a few ant hills hiding in the grass but beautiful and remote once you get there. Old metal structure left which you can climb for sundowners

name: Dar Lalla
description: Moroccan Restaurant. Place is perfect for a nice relaxing lunch or dinner. The grounds are beautifully kept.. the food authentically Moroccan.

name: Project Luangwa Cafe and Craft Shop
description: Best baguettes, iced teas and coffees (and more) in town! We had salmon and avo baguette with iced lemon tea.... brilliant. Wish we had discovered it earlier.

name: Precision Workshop
description:
If you absolutely need you can go there because they have parts and further north Zambia it is difficult to find parts.
But, that was expensive and we were not happy with the work, they forgot to tight the part they changed... And they didn't fix the other problem we asked for..

name: wild camp east to Nyimba
description: It looks like non formal truck's parking behind the trees. No body see you from the road. Drive in 50m south side

name: Fast Wheels Center
description: A good place for big rigs puncture, also for other vehicles.

name: Timothy fresh Veggies & Fruits Delivery
description: Timothy delivers fresh veggies and fruits to the camps around South Luangwa. You can preorder by phone +2600974357554 what you would like. We were quite happy to get green salad and all kind of herbs from him.

name: Mita Hills Dam
description:
Beautiful spot to overnight with view over the big lake.
There were a couple of fishermen that showed us their catch of the day.

The spot is outside the boom gate for the power station but we went in to the main building and asked for permission. It is maybe not necessary but this way they are aware of your presence.

For the actual spot turn left in front of the gate and follow the track for 1.5km. There is a small track on the right hand side that leads you through to the lake.

We came from Mulungushi dam. The road was already dried up but was quite bumpy. It is worth it though since you see a lot of tiny authentic villages and can buy tomatoes from locals that still live like 100 years ago.

name: Next to river on the road. Beautiful rappits
description: Wild camping next road. Beautiful river stream with rapids

name: Nice and quiet place
description: Nice and large place. very calm. the road is 300 meters. Good to spent a night.

name: Foot of the Mafinga Mountain
description: Wild camping in the yard of a local resident. We got permission from the owner to make camp behind his house. Beautiful Mafinga Mountain views.  We paid a small fee to the owner as a thank you.

name: Chiwayu Guest Lodge
description: Small local lodge right beside the Great East Road, few km from Chipata center. Almost opposite to Kigelia campsite (which is run down). Room was 300k. Clean room, no damp smells, etc. Restaurant can make simple, local dishes (i.e. Fish 70k). Ok choice if you don’t want to camp for a night. Friendly staff. Can also do your laundry.

name: MTN service center
description: Modern, professional and official MTN service center.  The purchase of the SIM card including the data bundle took a maximum of 30 minutes.

name: AtlasMara
description: The first working ATM since the border and the only bank in town....

name: Dzalo Campsite and Lodge
description: This is a new campsite run by the owner Gabriel.  Very basic but a beautiful location on the Zambezi River.   We are using the bathroom of one of the chalets. The bathroom is basic but clean.  From the main road it is 13km to the camp. Very bad dirt road but so worth it when you arrive at the location.  Call Gabriel at 0957502625

name: Market for petrol
description: You can find guys selling 20lt jerrycans of petrol for 440kw, no petrol station here.

name: Roadside
description:
After a long day and village after village and no quiet place to camp for the night, I just pulled off into the bush. People saw me but nobody came. 
If you think of going up north this way....don’t if you don’t really really have to, the roads are non-existent to Chama and you follow sandy or muddy or rocky bicycle tracks in dense elephant grass. This was dry season.

name: North Luangwa River lodge
description:
North Luangwa River lodge is located on the river not to far from the pontoon. It consist of a elevated structure creating a nice atmosphere between the tree canopies. The chalets are constructed out of reeds giving it a rustic feeling. Covid had its effect on this lodge too as it was standing still for some time with no maintenance done. There are however a team attending to all repairs. Camping is also possible on an open area next to the chalets overlooking the river. There is a separate ablution for camping (still under construction). 
Don't expect glamour but rather Bush living when staying here.
We enjoyed our stay here with staff being very vriendly and helpfull. I believe this is currently the only lodge/campsite currently open within the park. 

Contact: +260 95 0562378, WhatsApp +263 (0) 7 79940800

name: Northen Rock Hotel
description:
Located next to the main road. It has a option of three units 1)500zkw for a double bed 2) 650zkw for queen bed and larger unit 3) 1400zkw for a family unit. The units are nice and clean with working bathrooms.
A decent place to rest on your way to North Luangwa Park.

name: Saba Safaris
description:
Saba safaris is a rustic bush camp located on the banks of the Kafue river in Zambia’s Kafue National Park. Surrounded by pristine wilderness and an abundance of wildlife, Saba safaris offers guests a unique and memorable African experience in the wild. 

We offer tent hire, boat and game drive activities for our guests. Our campsite is solar powered and all showers have hot water 24-hours a day. Our water is potable and safe for drinking and cooking.

name: Koso Lodge
description:
Bnb with bar and restaurant. Good safe parking and good spot to stop over on the way to Lusaka. 

Paid 480K for a double room but had 3 people in it (we put up a stretcher for our 3rd member) for no extra cost.

Includes breakfast served from 6am perfect for starting a big driving day. 

Bar and restaurant very well priced.

name: Chinsali General Hospital (new)
description:
New large hospital for Chinsali region. 

Has a full emergency and outpatient section with pharmacy and testing laboratory.

name: Clear night sky for star observation & photography
description: The "Flower & Fern" campsite is also an ideal place to watch and photograph the clear starry sky without a light pollution. Milky way pictures & time laps are made easy here.

name: Kasama Lodge
description: The "Kasama Lodge" belongs to the government.  BigRig's up to about 8m in length, which do not fit into the "Thorn Tree Lodge", can "camp" here in the parking lot.  (200 kwacha for 2 people and vehicle).  We stayed 3 nights. Toilets and showers can be used (we didn't need them).  the place is crooked.  Staff and reception very friendly.  During the day, certain vehicle traffic on the road and at the lodge.  Absolutely quiet at night.  Eating possible at the Thorn Tree Lodge across the street.

name: Snowy Hub Dental Clinic
description: Simple, old fashioned dental office.  But the dentist, Mr. Lukonde, is well trained, works professionally, sensitively and carefully.  Dental treatment with ceramic crown = Kwacha 1500. Before doing this, contact Mr. Lukonde by phone or WhatsApp: +260 97 302 0272.

name: The Orchard
description: Fancy new outdoor restaurant/coffee shop and health food shop, lots of nice goodies and excellent food!

name: Camp Livingston
description:
At the memorial, they have a very nice campsite with full ablutions. You can also camp on the paving if you like. Extremely friendly staff. There is a serenity about this place that is hard to explain.

Patson, the park manager is well knowledge-based and will give you a good idea what village life and traditions are all about.

The road leading to here is a bit rough but we'll worth it.

Cost $15

name: Giraffe Springs
description: To have your suspension fixed, spring blades retention, quick service while you wait. This area has everything from windscreens, tyres and car parts!

name: Lodge without a name
description: At the East Entrance of Mporokoso is a lodge in the construction stage. Here we were allowed to stand for one night. However, the staff had to clarify this with the supervisor. Hardly traffic noise. Night very quiet. For BigR7igs, there is a side entrance.

name: Kabweluma Falls
description: The "Kabweluma Falls" are not quite as high as the "Lumangwe Falls" but even more  spectacular. Narrow but currently good access to the Kabweluma Falls. From the parking lot a 300m long walkway with two wooden walkways and a staircase leads down to the platform below the Falls. You need a wide angle lens (16mm full frame equivalent) to catch the whole scenery. Access and parking are also for  "BigRig". Theoretically you could also camp here overnight but it is not very attractive.

name: Kutemwa Lodge
description: They do not let you camp here, but you can stay in your closed vehicle (MotorHome) if you rent a room (from 150 kwatcha). Also possible for truck campers.

name: Grand Palm Lodge Mwense
description: Coming from Mansa, the "Grand Palm Lodge" with 9 double rooms with toilet and shower as well as a bar and restaurant is on the left just before Mwense.  You can also camp on the spacious but somewhat sandy terrain.  "Drinking water" flows out of the tap from a borehole.  Electricity not in place.  A bit of traffic noise, but mostly quiet at night.  If necessary, you can use the toilet and shower (cold) in a room (no extra charge).  We paid 150 kwacha all inclusive for two persons and the car. The surroundings are rural, but nothing special.  BigRig Suitable and Roof Tents.  No tents.  Simple lodge, but everything is clean and tidy.

name: Dewclaw Eco-Tours And Safaris Ltd
description:
Dewclaw Eco-Tours And Safaris is tour operation company based in Mosi-oa-Tunya National Park in Livingstone , Zambia. The company offer eco-friendly tours and safaris in and outside Zambia. We specialise in day and multi-day activities in any National Park in Zambia, Botswana, Malawi and Namibia. For Every tour that we do , we plough back a certain percentage bak to the community. We offer the following activities:
1. Guided Tour Of The Falls
2. Rhino Game Drive And Walking Safari
3. Village And Cultural Tour
4. Multiday Safaris
5. Elephant Ride
6. Lion Walk
7. Cheetah Walk
8. Helicopter Flight
9. Microlight
10. Rafting
11. Canoeing

name: Wild camp
description: You can stop here for a break or for the night. When driving north, about 500 m after the right turn to the 05 road, there is a turn to the right to a Chinese quarry. You can see the white top of the mountain above. Close to the road but you can proceed until that you can not be seen

name: Livingstone Central Hospital- COVID testing
description: 1000kw for a COVID test with travel certificate done 7 days a week from 8h to 12h30. Just pay at 1st building on the roght and get the test done in another yellow building. Results to be picked the next day at the district health office.

name: PCR STEP 3: collect results at Health department regional office
description:
This is where you pick up the test results from the Hospital. Many truck drivers that pick up there tests and its chaotic and poorly organized so 3 hour wait for the results...come late in the morning when things quiet down

17/9/2021 See recent review: you can test here too.

name: Mabro Auto Parts
description: A shop where you can ask for any help with your car. They fixed our broken mirrors. Call Dayies Nsofu 0965887868 good mechanic

name: Kasanka Conservation Center
description:
The "Kasanka Conservation Center" is 2 km away from the national park gate at the main road and can be reached for BigRigs too on a narrow but good gravel road. It is still outside of the national park, therefore no entry fee. The conservation center lies in the forest and is very quiet day and night and is a different organisation. US $ 10 ppn for camping. Seat toilets with water spooling, cold showers, on demand even warm showers. Water from a tank. A kitchen can be used. There are chalets with two simple double rooms, sharing a toilet and shower, as well as dorms. A pretty dining room is also available. 
The whole thing is not up to dates standard but neat and clean. The employees are very committed and friendly. 
After all, one stays cheaper here than in the national park itself and it is also a nice stopover.
No Mobile connection (MTN)

name: Chisonkolo Falls
description: There is a nice patch of grass outside the gate of the falls where the staff allowed us to camp. At a slight gradient, one corner is more ir less level. Very peaceful night after visiting falls.

name: Trotters Butchery
description:
"Trotters" is a neat and clean butcher's shop.  The butcher's shop was recommended to us by white locals.  However, all products are packaged and frozen.  There is beef, lamb and pork here.  It is about 4 km north of the Fringilla Farm, which also has a meat shop.
The parking is BigRig friendly.

name: MTN
description: Really nice guy here. 10 Kwacha for the SIM. He exchanged some money for me too

name: Entrance north Luangwa
description: Have to pay here $25pp and $15 for foreign vehicle just to transit!

name: Quiet R105
description: Big flat area with plenty of space to turn around beside the road. Visible from the road, but only one motorbike and a bicycle went past in the late afternoon, no one came near the car. Very quiet area

name: Chisamba Curry House
description: They make great freshly prepared lamb and chicken curries with rice or chapatis (~ 100-120 kw) as well as fresh samosas, to take away or to sit and eat in their shady roadside garden. They also offer breakfast, masala chai and coffee, as well as home-made mango and vegetable pickles, spices and fresh vegetables. We came here walking from Fringilla's for lunch.

name: Pontoon (Kasama-Chinsali road)
description: We took this road from the Old Great North Road to Chinsali. The pontoon carries one 4x4 vehicle at a time. The official price for "foreign number plate" vehicles is 30 US $, but we paid 100 kw without receipt. Friendly people and nice road altogether!

name: Ilukama Villa Guest Rooms
description:
Simple chalets each with private toilet and bathroom (water from the bucket), at 80 kw per room. We were received by a very friendly lady, who conferred with her boss on the phone, then we were allowed to camp on the premises and use the bathroom in one of the chalets for 60 kw. Very nice and looked-after compound with sand and trees, which has also an area with tables and braai next to the entrance. There was electricity (power plug in the chalet, exterior lights at night), and a guard overnight, as well as some chicken visiting. Very nice place for staying over night, e.g. in a roof tent.

There is no water at this facility. Had a look at the place and very run down. Still 80ZMK for a bungalow.

name: Nkhwima Nganya Guest House
description: Guesthouse directly at the road to Muyombe (GPS position is approximate, we recorded S10°29.123 E33°26.110, the guesthouse is 11-12 km north of Muyombe). They have rooms at 50 kw. Pit toilet and bucket bathroom are in the back of the property. Local election campaign  representative stayed overnight as well. There is a tuck shop for snacks and softdrinks. We stayed overnight in the parking area and slept in the roof tent for 100 kw (negotiable, we felt the manager did not have a good idea of how much to charge). The place is nice and shady and very rural (farm animals around, friendly neighbours), quiet at night.

name: Lake Side Lodge
description: We arrived here following several signposts from Samfya town center towards the road to Twingi. This bungalow hotel is quite pricey, apparently the Chinese staff from the fisheries center construction site next door are checked in here. At reception, they said they have standard rooms for 830 kw and executive suites for 1800 kw. Rooms are either to the road (dead end road) or facing the waterfront. We asked about camping, and they offered their backyard at the end of the compound, however, we decided not to stay so we did not negotiate the price and conditions for camping, but it may be an option, though there may be some noise from the water pump and the construction site.

name: Wild camping Chifunda-Emusa road
description: One of the few spots where you can stop along this road, on top of a slope, there is less grass and some gravel, but level ground (probably from the road improvements). Enough place to get our Landrover with roof tent well away from the track. There was no traffic at all during the night, and only a couple of friendly cyclists and pedestrians passing in the morning. Nice bushy feeling at night, quiet with some birds and monkeys, good for stargazing.

name: Leopard's Hill Retreat and Conference Center
description:
4x4 vehicles and trucks can be stored here safely under a tin roof. Cost for a 4x4 vehicle (Landrover, Landcruiser) is currently 30 US $ per month. The compound is surrounded by electric fences, wall, gate, there are shepherd dogs around. 
The manager is Jonas Schmid, he speaks German and English.
Contact:
info@leopardhill.center
+260 971 860023
Apart from vehicle storage, rooms in the chalets are available (80 US $ per room per night, including breakfast), as well as airport transfer (20 US $). A self-catering kitchen may be used (5 US $ per day). 
This lodge is conveniently connected with Pioneer Camp through the road connecting the Great East Road and Leopard's Hill Road via the Pioneer Camp access road.

name: Mwandwizi Lodge
description:
New lodge with nice rooms.
Hot water, TV, tea, breakfast, big secure parking, but no Wifi.
250 for one.

name: Chela Lodge
description:
Basic and cheap lodge opposite the main shore of Mpulungu.
150 Kwacha/per night.
Cold shower, western toilet (w/o toilet seat).
Good for one night!

name: Wittanda Executive Lodge
description:
Relatively good lodge in Kaputa.
Rooms start at 250 Kw.
Only cold water.
Restaurant is very basic. I gave them my own supplies, and they cooked a nice breakfast for me :).
Big parking, also for big rigs!

name: Kundabwika Falls
description:
Waterfall with basic and unattractive campground, w/o any facilities (except long drop toilet). 
Flies are annoying. Small ones, who attack your ears and eyes, and even smaller ones, who just form a halo around your head.
Since it was not even possible to have a picnic there, I fled the site (after some pictures!)

name: Mwense Council Guesthouse
description:
Basic guesthouse in Mwense, with hot showers, and a restaurant.
200 Kw per night.
Big secure parking.

name: Dove Resorts
description:
Lodge between Mwense and Mansa. Looks nice from the outside, rooms are ok.
I didn’t stay, but just checked it out, since there are not that many options in that area.
Big double room for 350 Kw.
Big parking lot.

name: Kayube Estate
description: Situated right on the mighty Zambezi, only 25 km upstream from the Victoria falls. Kayube Estate offers a variety of unique self-catering accommodation options. They are right opposite the Zambezi national park. Boat trips are magnificiant, staff is very helpful and friendly, owner Karien is a lovely lady who makes you feel very welcome.

name: Great North Shopping Mall
description: "Great North Shopping Mall" A clean, tidy shopping mall with well-stocked "Shoprite" and "Pick'n Pay".  Good ATMs, currency exchange and many other shops.  The large guarded parking lot is very accessible and also suitable for big rigs.

name: Taitana Lodge
description: Here is the Taitana Lodge.  Camping is not possible, but you can stay overnight in the parking lot with a self-sufficient vehicle.  We paid ZKW 100 for this.  Without the use of toilets and showers.  The parking lot is not very quiet because it is on the through road.  Fine for one night, en route to or from South Luangwa NP.

name: Teja Executive Lodge
description:
One of the better lodges in town (after Wetuna Garden).
Nice big rooms with fridge, TV, hot showers.
Big secure parking.
You can negotiate the price.

name: Wasa Lodge
description:
Nice lodge at the lake.
Since I was the only guest, I negotiated the price for a nice bungalow down to 40 USD, full board! (plus park fees). normally 90 or 110 dollars.
They have two new (and still very well maintained) bungalows, with indoor and outdoor showers, and panoramic glass doors to the lake (and a warm down blanket!).
There are plenty of hippos in the lake. You can hear them all night, but they are well hidden.
Bad restaurant, but they will prepare a nice campfire at night.
You can also book guides and other activities here.

name: Alpha Enterprize
description: Total along main road did not have diesel so we came here. Price actually lower than Total.

name: Speed Trap
description:
Speed limit changes from 60km to 40km multiple times while crossing town. Police are often along this road with their speed cameras. Pay attention to the speed changes to avoid delay.
Fine is 300Kw if you get caught.

name: Hadi's Take Away
description:
Fast and cheap place to grab food items such as samosas, pastries, etc. But also sells things such as fish and chips. 
Adjacent to gas station. There are probably nicer places to eat in town but this was convenient and fast.

name: BBC Hide
description:
Viewing platform.
Very beautiful spot high above in a tree, with spectacular view across the forest canopy to the straw-coloured fruit bat colony, only during the migration season (Oct-Dec). Visitors outside this season are unlikely to see any mammals, and may find the hide is not maintained and ready for use. You are not supposed to visit without a guide. 
To reach the hide, you need to walk app. 1 km from the parking through reed and high grass. The path is under water from Jan-May, and may also be a bit muddy outside of that time.

name: Road to Lake Wakawaka and Bangweulu Wetlands
description:
BIG RIG WARNING - YOU WILL NOT FIT!!!!

This “road” is in extremely bad shape. Big washouts, sandy patches, rocky parts, sometimes very narrow (no big rigs!).
The road after Lake Wakawaka to Bangweulu Wetlands is also bad!
It took me 8 hours to cover 140 km from Kasanka NP to Bangweulu Wetlands!

name: Crumach Lodge
description:
Another lodge at the main road in Mpika. 210 Kw/ night. A bit run down, but still ok. Fridge, TV, hot showers, AC (also works in  heating  mode!).Big secure parking.
Unfortunately, a lot of cockroaches, which I only noticed after I moved in.

name: Bush Camp
description: Little road with a lot of spaces for Camping. We were allone with the sound of animals during the night. Maybe the road will be go to the river, but we did not tried it.

name: Corrupt police
description: Police stop hear trying to get you to pay a “fine” for any little thing they could find. I waited patiently and was friendly, eventually they let me go

name: Kalwelwa Camp
description:
Excellent campground run by Frank Willems of Birding Zambia. Camp is mainly geared towards birders as there are plenty of excellent birds in the nearby forests and dambos but also an excellent place to base out of if visiting source of Zambezi, etc. 
Right now camp is a set of very nice tent structures with plans to build something permanent within the next year or two in a nearby forest. Camp staff very helpful (offering to do dishes and laundry at no additional charge.) Fantastic remote area to spend a few days relaxing. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here. (Included photos of kitchen area although staff will cook for you as well at no additional charge.)
Composting toilets. Hot showers. 3G signal a short walk from camp. 
Can camp for 25USD or have bungalow for 50USD. (price is for 2 people.) 
Reservation required. To make reservation contact Frank at +260 97 5869870 (also on WhatsApp.) Would HIGHLY recommend.

name: Bad Road -- D286
description:
Deep ruts and sand. 
Doable in the dry season, but very slow going (average of 20km/hr.) Likely would be pretty gnarly during the rains.

name: Potholes Galore -- M9
description:
Bad road full of potholes. Completely deteriorated for 70km east of Kaoma. 
When you hit the district border, the road is in good condition.

name: Tongo
description:
Very local spot right on the water front.
After a good few hours in the nearby game park I stopped here for nice cold local Mozi beer, was Kw15 vs 20 at others nearby.
as its in the covid period not much on food to offer but I liked their menu, sadly no camping
They also do river cruises but advise to get prices from other's before just accepting who ever you decide to use

name: Sichuan Restaurant in Jubilee Hall
description:
Very tasty Chinese food which differs pleasantly from your every day Chinese.
The restaurant is located on the top storey of an otherwise empty hall in which you can park your car more securely than anywhere else. It's not obvious from the road but look for Jubilee hall.
The neighbourhood is busy but feels completely secure.

name: Melissa Supermarket
description: Very well stocked, clean supermarket with partly Italian products and Nespresso compatible coffee capsules from South Africa at a low price (brand "Cafféluxe").

name: Centro Shopping Center
description: At Pick n Pay some European products, smoked meat products.  At Knightsbridge Place there are Nespresso machines and Nespresso capsules (very expensive).  Well-endowed pharmacy at the gas station.

name: East Park Mall
description: Large Mall as in South Africa. Very nice and well-stocked SHOPRITE supermarket.  Partly European products.  The Woolworths grocery store also has salami and other specialties.  On the opposite side of the mall is a professional "Link Pharmacy".  ATM's etc. Access and parking space also for BigRig.

name: Hotel Treffpunkt
description:
The hotel "Treffpunkt" does not have any camping facilities.  But with a self-sufficient, closed vehicle, you can park overnight in the parking lot, or more quietly on the dead end road, and live in the vehicle.  It is relatively quiet here and you are undisturbed.  We paid ZKW 100 per person per night.  The owner is a Zambian who lived in Germany a long time ago. 
By the way: 
- The Kazungula Bridge is in operation
-  The road from Livingstone to Kazungula is perfect except for a few small potholes.

name: Njiwa Lodge & Campsite
description: The Njiwa Lodge & Campsite is a bit off the road.  The campsite is only suitable for smaller vehicles.  Larger vehicles must be parked in the parking lot with coarse gravel.  Then a Bangalow for toilet and shower will be made available.  The price is ZKW 200 per person per night.  That was too expensive for us, which is why we drove away and stayed at the hotel "Treffpunkt".

name: Chipembele Wildlife Center
description:
Very interesting place. Can visit, but please call them before.
Anna&Steve will show you, they teach Zambian children and communities the value of wildlife and their environment so they may be conserved for present and future generations.

Anna & Steve Tolan
E: info@chipembele.org
T: +260 216 246108

name: Osis Filling Station
description: Oasis Filling Station. They don’t have 50ppm Diesel, only 500ppm and unleaded .

name: LBM Filling Station
description: LBM Filling Station. Unleaded, Diesel AND Low Sulfur Diesel available,

name: D500
description: App. 100m from the road behind a little hill. Not visible from the road. There is only a footpath which we followed, but with a small car no problem.

name: entry to wildcamp D500
description: We left the road here to the bush camp. Follow the footpath.

name: Tiffany's Canyon Lodge
description:
A lodge set around a lake in a resort style. There is a day visitors area with activities like speed boating, canoeing and bouncy things in the water. There's a restaurant on site.
Different rooms available and also camping. A friend treated us to an executive room (so unfortunately don't know the prices) and the views were really nice, especially at sunset. Near the main road but once the door is closed you can't hear any noise from the road. 

If you don't want to stay in Lusaka, it's a nice stop between Livingstone and South Luangwa. A full English breakfast is included with the rooms.

name: liuwa Reception
description:
Here is the new reception to pay the permit and camping for the Liuwa Plain Nationalpark. The entry fee is per night and you have to leave the NP next day afternoon. We paid 100 KW for the pontoon and for the park as International:
40 USD ppn
15 USD vehicle
15 USD ppn camping

name: Puma
description: Fuel station that you can pay by card. No need for cash like almost every other fuel station in the country.

name: Wildcamping on a Lake
description: A small road going down to little lake. A very peaceful place around the lake. You will find some spots for overnight. Some people are fishing and very friendly. A little noisy from the main road.

name: Shambololo Lodge
description:
It's a very nice, peaceful, silent, small camping area on a dam. Complete with grass mostly with shade by high trees. Everything clean and well maintained. There is extra Picnic-place, campfire, firewood, braai place. Ablutions and shower clean. Dish clean place. Very friendly and helpful Stuff. Self-catering but cold drinks available. Boating, Canoeing, Fishing, cycling possible but bring your own equipment. 150KW pppn
The Area is fenced. Call/WhatsApp before you arrive. Mr. CLEVER +260979337931

name: Roadside
description: Nice flat area on the left if you're driving towards the escarpment. Great place for an overnight before you tackle the hike in the morning. No one drove past us.

name: Chinsali nambulumba police check point
description:
We waited at this checkpoint about 10mins as they first checked all oncoming traffic. 
They wanted our passports and toll receipt. Went on with no issues..

name: Mapalo lodge
description:
Very cheap accommodation. Paid 250 kwacha for a spacious private en suite double with a bar fridge, kettle, fan, coffee table and couch.
We had dinner at the restaurant- 60kwacha for a plate of chicken, chips and coleslaw. Could also get a cold Mosi.
Very friendly staff.
Bathroom is small and basic but has hot water, basin, flush toilet and shower.
Room has powerpoints.
Recommended for a over night stay, definitely great value for money

name: Check point between South and North Luangwa
description: Just a quick stop, fill in your details and carry on

name: North gate to Luambe park
description:
Gate entrance to Luambe, we only filled in details and passed for free
There is a loop which comes of the main road and stays close to the river that passes by the pontoon (pontoon is marked on overlander)
Nice river views with hippos, elephant, giraffe, crocs, stork and also wildlife to be seen from the opposite side

name: Druadan Farm
description: It's on a Farm they produce fresh organic vegetables and have eggs. It's a grassy camp place with shade. Very silent. They offer also one cottage with 3 bedrooms and bathrooms. They have a pool, cold drinks. You can walking, cycling around the farm. There is a canoe on a dam. They offer there products and also meals. Price is 50KW pppn camping. Please contact Alice before you arrive: +260978518188

name: NRFA Toll
description: Here you must pay a toll for using the national highway (20 Kwacha for our Toyota Fortuner 4x4) and they also check that you've paid the toll fees you're supposed to pay at the border you've entered Zambia. If you didn't pay it you can pay it here.

name: atlas mara bank
description: ATM where no fees have to be paid. 6000 zmk is max

name: Barn Motel formally SkyView
description: The place is now called Barn Motel. They have rooms for 350 and 450 KWS. The place is hudge with a big pool and large grass garden. For other details see the SkyView reviews.

name: ShopRite
description: Very big supermarket with great groceries variety and even a tiny section of camping gear. ATMs around. Stanbic ATM didn't charge any fees for withdraw.

name: Sinazeze
description: Petrol Station on the way to Lake Kariba. Only Kwacha, ATM didn’t take MasterCard. Convinced the owner to pay in USD. No change possible.

name: Mabula Game Farm Campsite
description:
Large fenced Campsite in the middle of a vast gamefarm with roaming free elands, waterbucks, impalas and other antelopes. Neat ablution with hot water and flush toilets. Hot water at the dishing area. Wood and coal included. 10USpppn
No sign on mainroad, but an old steam machine on the eastern side. Call the manager ahead to have someone open the gate. Chris : +260 96 6866517

Activities : walking, game viewing at the waterhole or dam, swimming pool (but yet to be rehabilitated after serving as bream pound during covid time).

We decided to camp at the dam. No facility, but the toilets of the Dam Chalet if no guests.

name: Chimbalanga Gardens
description: A hotel and conference centre just outside the town on a spacious property. Ample room to camp on a lawn close to the conference centre - even for big rigs. We camped in a campervan and did not require any other facilities, apart from a toilet which was made available in the main building. I am sure that the facilities of one of the free standing units would be made available, should there be a need. Although some 200m away from the North Road, road noise can be heard until late evening after which it becomes quiet. A good and convenient overnight stay that can even be extended.

name: Maggie`s Community Camp
description: Nice campsite between Chipata and South Luanga Gate. Camp is basic - no electricity, no hot water. Very friendly staff, supplied us with firewood, guard is around the whole night. There’s a little bar as well. Good place for a stopover. Camping is KWH 100,-, Chalet KWH 200,-. If you like to support the local community, stay for a night.

name: Main gate Ngonye Falls (Westside)
description:
Here is the main gate to the falls. 
Price went up.
Price pp (international): U$ 5
Price for vehicle: U$ 15
One the west side you will let by a guide (free). 

The ticket is also valid for the entry of the eastern side. It is approx 20 km to drive (back to the M10). The last 3 km from the M10 is rather a drive through wide bushland and fields.
Within the park area one must drive
 another1,5 km to the end. 
Bigger trucks might cut some 
branches. 
At the end there leads a trail directly above the falls. Great view!

name: Destroyed track
description: Coming from Senanga you can follow the sandy track only to that point. A flood has destroyed completely the way. No vehicules can pass that point southward anymore (locals push their bicycles only).

name: Bush camp on old track beside main gravel road
description: This place is approx 12 km west of Kalabo. From their there are still many settlements. Here now is only bush around. The place is on an old track which leads parallel to the main gravel road. Almost not to be seen by the passing (very few!) traffic. Very quiet.

name: The lakeview Lodge
description:
Lodge and campsite direct at the lake with nice view. there is a restaurant with good food and very good vibes! 
Nice place for 120kwa. ppn.
cell phone signal

name: BALDYS Mechanical Services
description: AVOID AT ALL COSTS - they take in cars that they don’t know and then spend days to sort out really simple tasks. Something that should have been a 10-min job turned out 5 excruciating days of waiting there. They also took our car on a test drive with a misplaced bonnet (hanging open) and 2 doors hanging open with all our stuff inside after dark - inexcusable. Workshop manager has serious anger management issues. Good things: Launch scanner and friendly service until things go south.

name: The Ranch
description: Beautiful, safe, super clean and affordable. One-bedroom cottages with high speed wifi, smart TV with Netflix, high-pressure shower, garden, patio & braai - currently only 20$ per night (incl laundry!). They are building a swimming pool and campsite, ready in August 2021 (kitchen, ablutions) and bigger apartments (3 br). Lovely owners, Abrahams & Marjolein. Contact Abrahams: +260 96 6837450. It’s the red gate 200 m from Kids Alive Zambia. The best price-quality ratio in Lusaka!

name: Villa Lodge/Guest House
description:
New lodge near the main road. Clean rooms for 200 Kwacha.
Hot water, fridge, fan, but no AC, no restaurant.
Big secure parking.

name: Flat flood plain
description:
Along the M8 up to Chavuma are not many possibilities. Everywhere thick bush or settlements of the farmers.
This flat wide open "flood plain" was perfect for us. Nobody around.
Probably not possible in the rain season or if wet.

name: Old quarrel beside M8
description: This is an old quarrel. The whole area is pretty populated - so we were happy to find this place. You are well hidden from the road. Had a quiet night.

name: Nkakula Bed and Breakfast
description:
If you need to come to Chinsali and need accommodation (around 300 Kwacha for a room with big bed), this is not a bad place to stay. 
It has air conditioning and hot shower. Rough around the edges and a little bit dirty but pretty OK.

name: The Escape Lodge
description:
Nice Lodge near Cosmopolitan Mall and Shoprite.
400 Kwacha, incl. continental breakfast.
Big pool and bar.
Big and secure parking, but no shade.

name: Best Workshop in town
description: Workshop for all kinds is f car, doing woodwork as well. Eugene is supposed to be the best welder in town. Welded my exhaust within minutes and replaced the rubbers and bracket. Turn right after Kasama Milling, then it’s on the left side

name: Bwinjimfumu Royal Lodge
description: A nice, brand new campsite right next to the Great East Road at Chongwe Bridge. Big rigs can park in the parking area with access to the beautiful garden. Ample space for ground tents and RTT’s closer to the river. Loose standing ablutions with option of using the facilities of a room. Room prices are ZKW 250 and camping ZKW100ppn neg. Road noise inevitable. Did not stay as it was too early and we wanted to get to Lusaka.

name: Come Together
description: The past mechanic, the Tanzanian presidential mechanic (according to him) made a mess, these guys repair a lot of it. For small problems is a good place. And Senzo, the rasta mechanic, is pretty helpful. You can call him at 0977855758

name: Visa extention
description: Here you can extend your visa for another month. Service quick and friendly. Within 15 min done and for free.

name: River side
description:
Further the "Bush camp" noted in iOverlander, you reach a hunter camp.
Turn left and you will find several places along the river to set your camp.

Be careful of elephant and hippo tracks.

We heard Lions and other animals during the night

Zamtel phone reception and 2G

name: In front of "The island"
description:
on a loop crossing twice a luangwa river arm.

We stopped in an open area close to a dry riverbed.
you can also drive on the island and find spots in front the the Luangwa river.

nice game viewing 

Zamtel poor reception

name: Towards Liuwa Park Gate
description: This is just where we stopped for the night but you could stop anywhere. To the Liuwa park gate from the ferry at Kalabo is about 10km of thick sand. This spot is about half way to the entrance gate. Peaceful place. Saw some herd boys come past but they did not visit us.

name: Covid Test: Step 2 - The Test
description:
After having paid in the main building nearby the gate (step 1) you have to walked to this building for the real test.
It is on the backside of the building. Hard to find and not very obvious. You have to turn left into the sandy road (passing the Mothers Shelter House). Then right.
Every day. 08:00 to 12:30

name: Small rapids on rocks
description: 5 minutes walk down the track (in dry season) and if you bear the tse-tse flies, a very nice place to cool down.

name: The reward after climbing the road up
description:
ADMIN NOTE; next visitor here please clarify whether the spot is accessible with vehicle/bike, or only on foot for hike-camping

A flat area 5m to a pristine water river with small pools

Few hundred meters from the main track, you have to meander through the trees to get to riverside.

Few shade in dry season (but wouldn't come in rainy one)

We spotted some animals too : warthogs, klipspringers, and black tree monkeys (Colombus?)

you can hike down to a long waterfall, or up along the river.

we spotted there after driving up for SLNP... and finally spent 2 nights!

no Airtel, no Zamtel reception

Bonus

name: Woodlands Lodge And Tours
description:
Cheapest hotel option in Livingstone.
I booked via booking.com, $21, incl. full english breakfast.
Typical Zambian hotel, no foreigners!
People are nice.
Half of the furniture is broken, but the AC works!

name: ORYX Filling Station
description: ORYX Filling station in Livingstone . Here they have ‘low sulphur’ Diesel.

name: Elyada Farm
description:
Elyada Farm welcomes travelers to stay here for a night. We offer a place for you to pitch your tent, park your vehicle and get your water supplies up again. 

Internet connection is good (4G), if you like (and the farm manager is around) we can make you nshima, drinking water (from the borehole) is available, the place is fenced and there is always a guard.

We do not have a fixed price. You can just give a donation. Elyada Farms mission is to provide trauma counseling to the people of Kabwe, your donation will be used to achieve our goals.

Phone Farm: +260 973 326 684

name: SAFARI GUIDE - South Luangwa (Standwell)
description:
Private guide with safari vehicle can take you on daily drives to South Luangwa including a night drive. We chose to do two drives, one departing from the park gate at 06h00-10h00/11h00 and another departing at 16h00 until 20h00. 

The guides name is Standwell, his number is +260963876511. He is quiet but knowledgable and looks to please his guests. 

Please remember that the park is not a zoo, you aren’t guaranteed sightings. That being said, it’s an excellent park and with the network of guides around, you’re sure to see something amazing. 

If you decide to night-drive you will need to pay $20USD for the vehicle (this is not part of what you pay to Standwell). Park fees are also over and above his fee ($20USD pp SADC). 

This works out cheaper than drives with some of the surrounding camps/lodges and you’re supporting the local community. 

Have a great safari.

name: Forest wild camp
description:
A quiet opportunity to overnight not too far from the main road.
it's just a convenient and clean place.

Access track is visible on Openstreetmap: turn West from the T3, pass below the 4 big power lines, drive 1 km and then choose a place far enough to not hear the road noise.

Bushbabies spotted at night. Many cars, light trucks and donkey cars passed in the evening and morning, waving at us. Access may be muddy in rainy season. cell phone reception

name: Kafue picnic spot
description: A great newly built dam with lots of shade trees just off the main road, and outside of the NP. We stopped for lunch and saw African ground horn bills, storks and several other birds. Quiet and dust free

name: Hotel Suddex
description: A new hotel in town with a secure car park, clean rooms, bathrooms and a great restaurant. We camped in the car park and used a room for showers and bathroom. 1,000 shillings for the use of the room per night. Telephone: 0703570793.

name: ABSA ATM
description: ABSA ATM in Petauke, opposite Choppies and cell tower.
