name: Felix house
description:
Félix is a very nice, trustworthy man. He's also an engineer who worked on big trucks in the copperbelt. If you're having problems with your car, he can definitely help you.

He'll let you stay infront of his house or inside for a small fee. It's a good place also if you want to cross North Luangwa early in the morning

Felix telephone is +260 97 7415805

name: Félix
description: Félix is the first informal mechanic who really saw the problems my car had. If the problem is big and parts have to be sent from Mpika or Lusaka, he can find a way to bring them

name: Lukasa
description: Secure parking just out of town. Accommodation and airport transfers available.

name: CIMS bakery
description:
very nice bakery to get brown bread and sweets. They also have warm rolls and samosas for lunch or take away. Recommend to go here!

It seems the bread is available around 10am and in the late afternoon.

name: Zam Beef
description: buchery for good meat. also oil and some other things

name: impossible crossing
description: Got here while driving O5. 2 mtrs down washed away. Tried to make a ramp for 2 hours but too risky so had to turn around. can't believe no one put a warning here. So for now we think the O5 is impossible to drive

name: Scam money changers
description: At the Spar parking lot there are money changers active. They scam you and short change when given the possibility. They are not violent, but just a warming to always count your money before leaving the place. We confronted them when we found out they scammed us, and they reluctantly repaid the money.

name: Garage workshop
description: Small mechanic workshop for fixing al sorts of cars. Doesnt have a lot of parts, but know where to get them in town. 4 mechanics and an electrician work here. It is the grey building on the corner with all the cars in front

name: Monze
description: RUBIS filling station in Monze. Possible to pay by card.

name: Mtendere Mission Hospital
description: PCR test done here. 1000kwacha. First pay, take receipt to district building (opposite of the Daylight school), get the form there. Go to the swab tent on your left when entering the hospital area. Take you sample to the laboratory, all the way down last door. Result within 3 hours. Can be used for traveling!

name: Ceg Lodge
description:
Very basic campsite but ok for one night. Grassy sites and gravel for rooftoptents/trucks. There is not much shade.

For camping there are two very simple ablution blocks. One with two toilets (no flush). One with flush toilet and shower. There are some braais. No electricity or WiFi.

Rooms have different rates. Doubles for 250 or 350 kwatcha.
We paid for our rooftoptents 100 kwatcha.

name: Meru gasstation
description: This gas station does not accept cards. It is a little bit cheaper then the Puma gas-station a few hundred meters away.

name: Overflow Guesthouse
description:
Beautiful Guesthouse.
Very friendly and helpful owners.
Clean and neat. Towels available.
Hot water and flushing toilets in the room. 
They prepare food on order for you.
Big livingroom for sharing with other guests. 
Around 400 Kwacha with breakfast.

name: quick lane
description: they sell all Motul products. I got a 7100 4T 10W-60 MA2 engine oil for my motorbike. they also service 4 wheel vehicles.

name: Good morning take away
description: Very nice food! Best chips i had in africa and a lovely egg sandwich! Very lovely guy working here! It‘s open in the morning and evening

name: Olga's Italian Cuisine
description: At the nice restaurant you can also sleep. We paid 1000 for 2 rooms. Very friendly staff

name: Chilusi Bicycle repair & spareparts
description: Chilusi is located in the alley behind the gate, just ask at the side of the road before the gate entrance. He is one of the better bicycle mechanics in town, and has a lot of spare parts. Chilusi fixed my almost broken alu rear wheel. Was recommended to me by CS Cycle Smart in town.

name: Nels Motors
description:
Really good workshop and mechanic for Toyotas and Land Rovers.
Bryne the owner has a huge collection of antique cars himself (land rovers and land cruisers) and one of the cleanest workshops I have ever been too.
Helped us out straight away with our land cruiser 80 and friends of ours with their land Rover defender.
Did very good work, quick and clean.
It's hard to find but worth it, just follow the coordinates.
Otherwise call Bryne at 0977619734

name: Lusenga Plain NP Bushcamp
description:
Visited during rainy season.
Very good access road. Eastern side of ring road hardly used due to a fallen tree halfway. Very overgrown at this time.
Western side in better condition but don’t expect any great views as the road stays in the forest.
This position was the only place we managed to squeeze through the trees into the open plain with a great view. No wildlife except for birds. Very peaceful atmosphere. Good place to relax undisturbed.
Bush camping officially allowed.
Pay your fees at the DNPW office in Kawambwa near the filling station (might take some time, visitors are rare…)

name: Kaputa Immigration
description:
You can extend visa here. Should be around 2-3 days before expiry.
There’s also a tap with drinking water.

name: NAT Safe ATM
description:
Bank with ATM 
Not more to say. Good luck

name: Bicycle mechanic
description:
Bicycle parts shop and mechanics for low level maintenance.

Tyres, tubes, cassettes, wiring, wheels etc available.

name: Georgies Pub and Grill
description:
This pub/ grill offers very affordable accommodation for the tired traveller who needs a night away from camping. Our room cost 650kw which included breakfast. A few drinks and a delicious dinner in the pub next to some small rapids on the Mutanda river. We were even able to pull our vehicle up next to our room and plug in our fridge. A great overnight stay on our way to Mwinilunga. 
We heard that this place can get very rowdy and unpleasant at weekends as it turns into a big party place for locals so if you prefer peace and quiet it should be avoided Friday to Monday.

name: Michelo bicycle mechanic
description: Bicycle workshop on the market. Ask for Michelo, an experienced bicycle mechanic used to dealing with higher end road and touring bikes. Serviced a Shimano freehub and rebuilt wheel.

name: HC Superstore
description: Decent supermarket. Only place I know of for quite some distance (especially if coming from northeast) where you can buy reasonable dairy products (cheese, butter, yoghurt).

name: Robbery
description:
WARNING: Our car was almost broken into.

We stayed on the parking lot of Smart Guesthouse when at 03.30 somebody tried to open our car doors. After that the guy was looking for a stone to smash the window. The fool did not know we slept in our rooftop tents so we chased him away.

This town is not safe. Many people on the streets and activity all night. Many drunk people. The town is one big truck stop.

name: PCR test
description:
You can do a PCR test at the Chipata District Hospital. K800 per person. They don't accept cards so take cash with you. Results within a few hours.

Official certificate should be retrieved at an office close to the Chipata Central Hospital. There is only one guy who can make the certificate and he is always in a meeting.

We crossed the border with the test but without the certificate.

Some guy Peter can also do the test after hours (at this hospital) and under the table for K500.

They also provide Covid (booster) vaccinations here, in Chipata Central Hospital and Kapata Clinic.

name: Vehicle Storage Pappu
description:
Storage and Vehicle repairs/servicing
Contact Pappu to arrange details of where the vehicle will be stored and if you like anything done on it. Airport transfer is possible.
I was super-happy with everything. Excellent place to get your suspension overhauled. Pappu is a former rally driver and knows everything about cars and has the contacts for high quality work.
Tel/WhatsApp +260 96 676 2972
zambianspring@gmail.com

name: Katito Farming (Butchery)
description:
Farm butchery owned by Simon Brown.
Most probably the best place to buy meat in the greater area (including Kasama). They've got everything except pork and game. 
Pre-order only, no shop. Our beef fillet and rump was packed in small portions and deep frozen. Cash only!
Contact details: 
admin@katitofarming.com
+260 971 093 612 
+260 963 474 481 (whatsapp)

name: Royal Kutachika Lodge
description: Great views overlooking the Zambezi River, pool, bar and restaurant. Food is good. Standard rooms K330,Executive rooms at K550 double or twin, Presidential Suite at K1000 excludes breakfast.

name: Lusaka Collective craft shop and coffee
description: Really nice craft and decorating shop just  behind the main road. They sell all sorts of decorating objets from local brands and productors. Place is beautiful. They also serve excellent coffee !

name: Protea Hotel
description: Modern chain hotel, which delivers as expected for a high price (Kw2,030 for a double). We stayed here because at the time it was the only place in town with reliable Wi-Fi which we needed in order to complete the new online Malawi visa application process. The staff were absolutely excellent and the pool is nice. Decent, reasonably priced restaurant.

name: Toll Gate
description: Toll gate here. New laws as of 18 October 2021, you have to show your green cert that you paid for on entering Zambia plus 20 kwacha for a car. This is now standard across all of Zambia. They stamp your green cert and give you a receipt of payment that they staple onto the cert.

name: Swan Insurance - Comesa
description: If you are given Swan Insurance at the border, then you must get your comesa through Swan insurance itself. We asked in  few different insurance brokers and this was the response. Bring your insurance cert you obtained at the border. We paid 456 Kwacha for 3 months comesa to cover Tanzania, Rwanda, Uganda and Malawi. Mozambique is not covered by comesa. Very easy process, staff were friendly and knowledgeable

name: Keg & Coppersmith
description: Lovely bar/restaurant. Great food and reasonable pricing. Definitely worth popping into. It's located at the shopping mall which also handy.

name: Mozambique embassy
description:
Mozambique embassy for visas. You need to wear trousers and covered toes. No shorts or flip flops.

30 day single entry visa is Mk 60,000. You need to fill out the form here( don’t use the one on the internet because they won’t accept it despite it being exactly the same), 2 passport photos ( must be pure white background) letter of invitation and 3 months bank statements.

You submit your visa application which takes about a week to be approved. Then come back to the embassy, hand them your passports and they will give you bank details which you take to Standard Bank nearby. Standard Bank give you a deposit slip, which you return to the embassy, then wait for 4 or 5 hours for your passports to be returned.

name: Rubis
description: Brand new fuel station, option before Lower Zambezi. Accept Credit card!

name: Woods Camp
description:
Trully amazing campsite by Zambezi river. Its right on the river so you are surrounded by animals all the time. Hippos and herds of elephants, even walking through the camp. At night we could hear hienas and leopard. Ablutions are simple but clean and very well mantained. There's solar power at camping spots (they turn the generator on until 21, but is not too loud) and great place to wash the dishes. There are many barbecue grills. You can storage some food at their fridge to be safe of some hungry elephant at night. The bar and restaurant area is really comfortable with few sofas to relax. There's a very small pool but if you go during the week theres a good chance that the main house is not booked so you can use the amazing pool. Only dowsizes: is 45 km from the NP gate, at least 1:30 hs. But the only closer camp is Mvuu (20 km) at 25 Dollars pp! Price now $10 pp. 

 Maybe give Ruth, the general manager, a call so she can clean and prepare the pool before you arrive. Phone/whats  +269 966940242

name: HEALTH PORT
description: You can do your pcr test here. Is officialy on ZIM side, but if you come from Zambia you just Park at Zambia's border, leave one ID at imigration and go walking through the bridge. Is around 2 km each way. You can even see the falls from the bridge and there is a nice Cafe on the bridge where you can have some drink and watch people jump on bungee jump. The Health Port is the first tent at your left when you reach ZIM. We did it in 4 people so they charged $50 pp, but regular price is $65. It took 3 hours the result that came into an official link in e-mail. It goes to Panabios website and you can get it printed through there. Or you can wait 1,5 hours for the printed results there. Accepted Credit card! Better book with Kiki first +263 774870041. On time: no vaccine card asked in ZIM border or quarantine demanded, only the 48 hour pcr.

name: Gambit guesthouse
description:
New guesthouse with 6 rooms has been open 8 months.
Clean room with dbl bed clean sheets and mosquito net.
Fans for room on there way.
Bar and restaurant not completed yet so nice and quite.
Can get food at market around 500 Mtrs away.
Clothes line to hang washing also.
Can park bicycle in room as it is big enough.
Wanted 250kw but as I am only one I got it for 200kw no breakfast.
Nice and friendly staff.
Boiled some eggs for me which was nice.

name: White Stone Lodge
description: Roadside Lodge with chalets and car park camping

name: BS bike service centre
description:
Bicycle mechanic that can work on all bicycles as he has worked for Sampada cycling team SA.
Can help with chasing spare parts and accessing parts that are hard to find.
Can email Bright at
Info@bsbikeservicecentre.com
Website 
www.bsbikeservicecentre.com

name: Hungry Lion Free Wifi
description: Just answer a quick satisfaction survey and you have 40 minutes free wifi. (No need to actually buy anything there).

name: ShopRite Supermarket
description: Excellent variety for groceries and much cheaper than in Zimbabwe. Safe parking lot.

name: Oryx Gas Small Shop
description: Quick and efficiently they refilled our 3kg South African CADAC gas bottle for 37 kwacha per kg.

name: Chibila
description:
Flat grass area overlooking the dam. Two vehicles can park there easily. Brad was such a helpful host. They made us a fire for our braai. We got served fresh capenta and currie wraps as the sun went down over the horizon. Hot water and flush toilet for campers . Hot water for coffee in the morning. Bar available . Got lots of information from Brad on where to travel and where to buy groceries. They even washed our car !
Brad: +260 977 240 113

name: Riverside Guest House
description: Paid 100 for night. 1 person. No breakfast. Shared Bucket shower. Room is clean but very basic. Good mosquito net. Bike in room. Town is noisy. Communal toilet but clean.

name: Farm stall
description: Specialty goods, cookies, coffee, veggies, eggs, frozen meat. Also a small cafe. Nice, not cheap.

name: Thorn Tree Chalets and Tents
description: Thorn Tree House Chalets and Tents is half way between Livingstone and Victoria Falls. It is a beautifully maintained camp ground with some Chalets and Tented accommodation. Most sized rigs will be able to access the site. It has clean ablutions with hot water. There is a bar and lounge area and a swimming pool where one can relax. The kitchen is spotless and well equipped. No wifi but there is good mobile signal. The staff are very attentive and polite. As it is in a wildlife corridor, sometimes wild animals visit; there are no predators.

name: Gwembe Council Guest House
description: Nice Guest House with rooms from 100 to 180 Kwacha. Self contained and non self contained. Rooms are nice and clean, equiped with AC and mosquito net. They also have a restaurant serving good local food.

name: Mambilima Falls
description: It's just a flat, rocky place next to the beautiful falls, without any facilities. You see a sign on the street, there is a gate. We paid 150kpp. Samuel the caretaker is a nice, helpful guy. The sundowner over the river is great. Be prepared, that 100 children follow you and stay, till the sun goes down. The locals are really happy to have guests on their place. You can also buy fresh Tigerfish in the morning.

name: Zambezi river viewpoint
description: Beautiful viewpoint of the Zambezi river with a big baobab tree

name: Dar Lalla
description:
Moderator Note: Location might be incorrect. Next overlander, please check if location is correct and delet this note If so. 

Moroccan restaurant. Amazing food, lovely setting in spacious garden, family-friendly.

name: York farm
description: Farm shop for local vegetables. Good value for money.

name: Large flat area hidden from the road
description: Large wild camping space and flat. We have spent one night here, no one passed by. It is at the end of a gravel road. You can hear the main road so if you are in a roof tent, probably not the best spot.

name: Nawela Lodge
description: Nice lodge at the lake side. Very kindly staff en nice diners. Basic breakfast of bread with egg. Very clean rooms and area. There is a garden where you can sit and relax.

name: Next to the railway
description:
we came from north and took a dirt track to our left. we followed until we reached the railway. there we turned right away from the track - we crossed a earth wall and parked between the trees. As we arrived early (1pm) a few locals passed by in a distance - no problem. We had a quiet night and morning. 
Very good airtel signal.

name: Police check point
description: Permanent police check post just outside Mazabuka.

name: Old quarry
description:
A flat area near the junction of M1 and D1 road. When driving south from. Mbala there is a small track on 4he left a few undred meter before the junctions.
Some noise of the road in the evening but we had a very calm night.
Decent signal with mtn, we could make an audio call over WhatsApp.

name: Quarry hidden from the road
description: When driving in direction of Mbala there is a short and steep path going down on the left side of the road. You arrive in a first quarry wich is a little bit dirty, if you hold your left you should be able to find a track wich is half grown over by the grass. Follow it for less than 100 meters and you will arrive in a second quarry wich is well hidden from the road by a little hill. We had a very quite night there.

name: SES clinic
description: Very professional private emergency clinic. The doctors originally come from South Africa but work here for more than 15 years. One of us got Malaria and we came here for the treatment - we felt in very very good hands! We can definitely recommend thus place, if you need to see a doctor!!

name: Afrox
description: Managed to fill our South African CADAC bottle here. 5kg for K195. Friendly people and quick service

name: La Fattoria
description:
Italian restaurant with a campground. Camping in own tent or vehicle is 10$ pppn. The ablution block for campers is currently under construction but should be finished soon.
The tented lodges are 35$ per night and can accommodate 2 persons. Toilets and showers for each tented lodge, hot water from a donkey boiler. 
The restaurant is only open from Friday to Sunday but you can eat delicious Italian food (pizzas between 100 and 150 kwacha) and you can also buy cheese from the farm there.
It is a quiet place not far from the main road about 50 km north of Lusaka. The managers, Claire and Cath, are very friendly and helpful, it felt like home during our three nights stay.

name: Streetside
description: On the way to the Ngyona Falls we were stopping here for one night. First you turn to the small street and then into the bush. We had a quiet night here, we even did a fire in the evening. Some cars were passing by in the evening but no one came to disturb us.

name: Bongololo/Mozhi
description:
7 lovely campsites with separate ablutions next to the Lefupu river and the nearest campsites to the Busanga flood planes.
Near the Mozhi lodge which has WiFi .Camping U$ 25 per person

name: Bush camp off the D301
description: A short drive down the road and camped behind a huge ant heap, and not bothered by any locals

name: SOS Children's Village
description: School and orphanage next to the center of Livingstone (50 minutes on foot, on the main road). They will let you pitch your tent and give you access to the toilets. If you are lucky and meet the person knowing the wifi password, you may even enjoy a very good connection.

name: ZRA Zambia customs to renew TIP
description: ZRA Zambia customs to renew TIP in Chipata

name: Kabwe
description:
Very pleasant campsite in Kasanka National Park. Overlooks the Kasanka river plain. The camp attendant supplies hot bucket showers and lights the campfire. Flush toilet. 
Puku and Sitatunga are often visible from the campsite.
Prices as per Pontoon.

name: Breezes River Lodge
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

Camping grounds with rolling green lawns on the bank of the Zambezi River @$10.00 pppn. Hire of tents of different sizes are available @$5 pppn. There is electricity at each of the campsites as well as an outdoor cooking area. There are also employees that will assist with cleaning of dishes and setting up the campsite.
Clean ablutions, hot showers, Swimming pool, Central dining area, Strong wifi are available.
Restaurant is subject to availability (Canoeing Tours), the canoeing tours start at Breezes river lodge.
On-suite, air conditioned chalets overlooking the Zambezi River are available.

name: ITUBA Camp
description:
The former Chifunda Community campsite is now under a new name and freshly renovated. Still a community campsite and the people running the place are very friendly. Nice spacious spots at the riverside. They are still finishing up the renovation but you can camp here already for $10 ppn. New ablutions block looks great and has good hot showers. We drove from Mfuwe and the campsite was already marked at Luambe NP so easy to find.

Lot's of hippo and elephants around. So they made a big fire for us. 

For questions you can call +26095564668

name: Quiet spot next to road
description: This location is next to the road and behind a bush. Partially visible from the road but we spent a quiet night here. 3 cars passed during the night but no one stopped at all... Please be cautious of night crawlers in this area. Had a few scorpions and spiders visit us during the night.

name: Leginger sunset lodge
description: A nice restaurant with continental and local meals , very good staff members. The restaurant has a beautiful terrace with the lake Kariba views , beautiful sunset space

name: Pontoon to North Luanga
description: Pontoon to North Luanga. Here is where you can cross the river and pay the park fee (we crossed with a Hilux with two rooftop tent, just to give you an idea)

name: Duck Inn
description:
Chill and relaxt gastropub which serves well for a few drinks, a game of pool and some nice food. Don't expect fancy setting or food, but more general pub food (80 - 150 ZKW) which is prepared in a good way. We had the veggie dumplings, chicken popcorn and fresh fish, which were all tasty. And very friendly staff!

Good place to hang out for an evening.

name: Grandaddy's
description: Really nice braai place to enjoy your Saturday evening or Sunday afternoon. Many Zambians will come here for drinks and braai. nice atmosphere, friendly service, good stop to get an idea of Lusaka's hip and trendy scene.

name: Guesthouse Pleasure Resort
description:
Simple but nice guesthouse/hotel

Their prices range from 80kwacha per night (for 1 room) to 200/250 kwacha or higher. 
Me and my partner are in an 80 kwacha room and it's very small + shared bathroom and toilets. For us this is fine, but if you'd rather have your own bathroom and toilet, they have that option as well from 150kwacha onwards.

name: RD491
description: Road is in bad condition, need a 4x4. Road and time estimation on Google maps is not correct. It will probably take you around three-four hours from Lusaka to Lower Zambezi. The T2 road is recommended.

name: Chaminuka Lodge
description: Private game park with activities. Day trip with controlled animal interactions are fun. then with a great lunch. Horse/ walking or game drive safari. Hotel stay with large car park. Good phone signal.

name: Senga Hill Council Checkpoint
description:
They asked for 100 kwacha for foreign plates. Two guys work together. One shows a council receipt book with receipts mostly for 5-10kw, except foreign plates at 100kw. This guy walks away and the other takes your money giving you an already written out receipt which turns out to be a generic receipt. According to local residents it is a scam, and you should not pay.
Turn headlights and hazard lights on and drive around the barrier. DO NOT PAY!

name: Toyota Kasama
description:
Received excellent service from this Toyota service branch. We called in to get a filter kit and they offered to service our Land Cruiser. We were pushed for time and they finished the job in 90 minutes: oil service, inspection, cleaned the air filter and found a suspension bush to be worn, which they replaced. On top of that they cleaned the car, including the engine. All whilst we could wait in a comfortable lounge.
In my view,  excellent service and I highly recommend this team.

name: Treglo refrigeration and airconditioning
description: We fixed the airconditioning of our car here, great service! Trevor is very knowledgeable and a overall great guy. went for beers afterwards because he also owns a bar which is next to the workshop

name: Massive pot holes
description: About 200m of enormous and deep pot holes come out of nowhere. Slow right down before you get to this point or you are in danger of crashing

name: Fresh Air lodge
description:
Much better than Bayama lodge (or something like that)
Cheapest rooms for 200kwacha, most expensive for 300kwacha. All come with free breakfast (egg,bread, tomato and some onion + free hot beverage).
Also, the lobby has WiFi which you can kind of receive in the restaurant or the rooms next to the lobby.

Rooms are nice and clean, proper bedding, hot shower, fridge, desk and TV. And on top of that super nice staff.

name: Wild Camp
description:
We tried to get to “Big bush Camp Area” wild camp but just ran out of daylight. We just turned off the main road - There was no actual road turning off) until we found a level-ish area with short grass. We found a road when leaving, it runs next to the turquoise buildings

As we were setting up, a local came to ask if we were “bringing a job”. He said he was hungry so we gave him some canned food and he went on his way. Other than that, a peaceful night.

WILD CAMPING ETIQUETTE
1. GOING TO THE TOILET - Find a place where people are unlikely to walk. Dig a hole, do your business, burn the toilet paper (without causing a fire), cover the hole again. 
2. FIRES / BRAAI’s - If you have to make your fire on the ground: Dispose of the ash (without causing a fire) & cover with sand. Leave it looking as natural as you found it. 
3. Do not leave any rubbish behind. 

Wild camping should not disturb the environment, animals or the people that live nearby.

name: Mwamfushi Safari Lodge
description: Great campsite, run by a local, outside the park. If in the park, it is possible to sleep here if you have your own tent or by renting a camping tent there. You let your car in the park and they come to pick you up by boat to cross the river. The price is 200k pp if you have your tent and 400k pp if you use their tent. They had real and confortable mattresses and sheets that they offered us. We also got a nice fire at night. The staff is amazing, with a nice and caring service. Plus, the shower is nice and warm.

name: Kafue market
description: Great market on Monday and Friday with vegetables, clothes, chitenge (tissus). People are very nice and helpful, giving you real prices.

name: Wild Camp
description:
Turn left off the M10 (heading east) follow the tracks, theres plenty of open space surrounded by trees. Great spot to overnight after a tiring drive on this terrible road. Quite a bit of firewood around too. Big rigs can fit but may be a bit narrow with trees on either side.
No Signal here

WILD CAMPING ETIQUETTE
1. GOING TO THE TOILET - Find a place where people are unlikely to walk. Dig a hole, do your business, burn the toilet paper (without causing a fire), cover the hole again. 
2. FIRES / BRAAI’s - If you have to make your fire on the ground: Dispose of the ash (without causing a fire) & cover with sand. Leave it looking as natural as you found it. 
3. Do not leave any rubbish behind. 

Wild camping should not disturb the environment, animals or the people that live nearby.

name: Key Service
description:
Professional key maker, if you need extra keys for your car/trailer/motorcycle. 
Make sure you test it before you leave. It took him a few tries before he got it right.

name: Unusually nice little restaurant
description: Newly opened restaurant just after the border. Really clean and nice with laminated menus and fixed prices. Ladies running the show. I haven't seen anything this clean in Zambia. 40 Kwatcha for chicken, fries and coleslaw.

name: Choppies
description: Nice new supermarket. Opened at the day we visited, so lots of stock: meat, fresh bread, alcohol, vegetables, etc. Also open on Sunday!

name: zanco ATM
description: ATM available for cash            ......

name: Dreamland
description: Very simple hotel, big double bedroom with private bathroom 350 kwatcha.

name: Quarry
description: abandoned roadside sand Quarry.  If you pick the back left you are not visible from the road. No villages nearby. Saw no one, only 2 vehicles passed early in the evening. Very quiet.

name: Serenje Soch Inn
description: Lovely place a bit further out of the noise of the town. single room for 150 (small bed but works for 2 people), and double room for 200. both have ensuite bathroom and hot water, they sometimes have WiFi and you can get food here as well 👍

name: Tsika Island
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place has not been visited by an overlander

Tsika Island- you book an entire island to escape to. The self-catering camp sleeps 8 people comfortably.

There are 3 rooms available - 1 family room(1 King size bed and 2 single beds)  and 2 double rooms(2 single beds), all rooms have ensuite bathrooms. Guests have access to a beautiful communal area, splash pool, braai/out door lounge area and kitchen. 

The kitchen is fully functional with a gas cooker/oven, fridges, and freezers. They have all pots, pans, utensils and cutlery. There is also a braai that could be moved to the outdoor area and there is an outdoor pizza oven close to the swimming pool.

name: White rose lodge
description:
Very nice and calm hotel a bit out of the city. If you like a calm athmosphere where you can park safely this is the place to be.

Its also on booking.com single room is 18 dollar with mosquito net and shower

name: Rightway Auto Spares
description:
We got a clutch master cylinder replacement part for Land Rover Defender here.

Phone numbers on the receipt are:
+260 977 674551
+260 966 674551
email:
mwalewilliam10@yahoo.com

name: AGL Car Wash
description: Nice and cheap car wash. They cleanen the outside of my Toyota Hilux with a big  campershell for just 40 Kwacha. 1 hour of work for two.

name: Cadac Gas Refilling
description:
Gas refill of Cadac gas cylinders. I paid 266 Kwacha for about 7 kg in two cylinders. Friendly and quick.
Closed on sunday and on public holidays.

name: Airtel SIM card
description:
Official Airtel office, where you can buy your Airtel SIM card and get registered within 20 minutes. Opposite to Shoprite. Open on sundays as well (8 am - 3 pm).
2 GB for 1 week for only 20 Kwacha.

name: Craft shop in Museum
description: Very nice craft shop in the Choma Museum, located in a park. Reasonable "local" prices, f.e. only 30 Kwacha for a wodden Hippo or Rhino.

name: Guesthouse / Lodge Hodi
description: Sign visible from the road coming in to Kapiri Mposhi. Basic, cheap rooms, 70k without bathroom, 100k with. Not the cleanest but a good budget option. Bicycles allowed in room

name: Model Lodge
description:
Sweet quiet place on the way out of the city.
200 kwacha for a good room, ensuite, tv, clean and wifi. Very kind people + there's breakfast included.

name: M10 serious potholes
description: worst road we have driven in 6mths in Africa

name: Supermarket
description: sweet little suprrmarket with a snackbar attached to it which seeks very nice egg rolls with cheese!

name: Proquip Hydraulics
description:
Very friendly, helpful and quick service for replacing leaking pipes: They cropped the connectors of our broken servo pump-to-servo steering box pipe to a new pipe in no time.
The man in charge is Humphrey.

Adress: Plot 10580 Chandwe Musonda Rd, Lusaka 10101

name: Warthog Campsite
description: Campsite has just been relocated to this position.  Elephants walk through the camp.  Camping (own vehicle) $5 pppn.  Basic but friendly. Hippos and elephants visit fairly regularly. There is one potable water tap and other taps pump untreated lake water - speak to owners

name: Shoestrings Backpacker
description: Camping in a backpacker place on sand or grass. A kitchen area to cook your own food. Toilet and shower block is ok. Restaurant and bar, and WIFI in the bar if you pay for it. Swimming pool and a nice garden to relax in. Fences around the whole place and it is a secure place to leave your car while you explore Victoria Falls on foot, everything is within walking distance.  10 usd

name: Mountain Pass
description: Wild camp on the side of the road.  Great views over Lake Kariba

name: Mucheni Gorge View
description: Great site with amazing views - Caution it is on the edge of a cliff with no barrier or safety fence, probably not safe with children!  We spent the afternoon watching elephants in the gorge below.

name: Kandaha Fishing Camp
description: No facilities left working but a beautiful location on the side of the river.

name: Chundu Campsite
description: Site right in the banks of the Zambezi River under a big jackalberry (?) tree. No facilities, just a fire pit and an abandoned long drop. Beautiful view. Hippos nearby. We saw plenty of wildlife on our drive in. Only downside is there was music coming from the Zambia side - perhaps from a lodge across the way. (The buildings in Zambia aren't close, but you can see their rooftops). Cost for two people to camp for one night is $60: $25 pppn for park fee and camping fee plus $10 for the vehicle. When we asked the ranger at the gate about buying firewood, she told us to collect it in the park! If you drive a bit further into the park (toward Chundu 1) there's another beautiful more shady site under a few trees (but with lots of toilet paper around)

name: Robins Camp
description: Spacious campsite with new abolutions. All renovated and building is still ongoing. 15$ per person with RSA ID. Bar Restaurant and gameviewing tower on top of the museum. No Econet signal, therefore no Ecocash payment.

name: Sinamantella Campsite
description: Amazing views! Great location on top of the hill looking over the National Park.  Facilities run down.

name: Main Camp
description: Rundown but good location to start a game drive.

name: Tuskers Camp (Ivory Lodge)
description: Near Hwange NP. Ivory Lodge and Tuskers campsite. Great lodge with an amazing waterhole that is often visited by large groups of elephants. From the hide you can view them from very close. Ablution is good and fire wood is included. WiFi availbable in the bar (10 USD per 100MB). Price for camping is 15 USD per person per night.

name: Antelope Park
description: Nice camping grounds, Zebra grazing around the camp.

name: Clevers Lakeview Resort
description:
Very proper place! Good & clean ablutions, greatly kept garden and plants. US$ 13 cash required for all as of 12 years. WiFi would be an extra US$ 2 cash. Poor mobilephone Econet signal, just E, only very rarely 3G. Restaurant is open to the public, 4 course dinner US$ cash 22, main corse alone US$ cash 13. It was not a high class meal. Only local credit cards possible or US$ cash or Rand
Well maintained campsite with modern ablution. There is wi-fi on the campsite (USD 2 for 24 hours). Campsite is near to the Great Zimbabwe Ruins. Place has good water to fill up you drinking water tanks. Costs 13 USD per person per night. (CAUTION! THEY DON'T ACCEPT BONDS)

name: Bulawayo - Bulawayo Municipal Caravan Park
description: Good secure campsite in the middle of Bulawayo.

name: Campsite #7
description: Nice spot on the edge of the lake.

name: Worlds View Campsite (Farmhouse Campsite)
description:
PRICE APRIL 2022: 15 USD PPN.
.
Excellent place, fantastic views, ablution block is newly renovated. Everything is new, clean and functional. Can highly recommend this place.

name: It's a Small World
description: Small lodge with camping near the centre of town. Backpackers place in a safe neighbourhood. Although very small there is a secure parking area where you can camp. Ablution is fine and place has good Wi-Fi.

name: Mutare Caravan Park
description: Municipal camping ground.  Ablutions are a big grim so used our own!  Firewood and electric available.  Quite a lot of road noise.

name: Nyanga National Park - Mare Caravan Site
description: Great site, clean ablutions, hot showers with great water pressure, electricity, light and Bar-b-q at each site!  Good phone signal with 4G!!!

name: Chimanimani Hotel Campsite
description: A garden area set aside for camping. $20 per tent.  Very quiet.  Nice town.

name: Chimanimani National Park
description: Nice little campsite, very friendly staff.  Firewood provided if required.

name: Bridal Veil Falls Campsite
description: National Park campsite.  Beautiful location near the water falls. Firewood provided.

name: Forestry Commission Campsite, Chelinda
description: campground in the rainforest, plenty of space, firewood provided, 10 usd for camping plus 5usd pp "entry fee".

name: Penhalonga - La Rochelle
description: Botanical garden with hotel and campsite, bad infrastructure at campsite but nobody showed up to collect camping fee anyway.

name: Victoria Falls Rest Camp
description: Huge, relaxed Area in the Middle of the Town. Bungalows and Camping Spots under Trees and on green Grass. 15 Minutes Walking Distance to the Falls (you can hear them at Night). Free Electricity at Sites, good Ablutions and nice Pool. Free Wifi, but slow. Laundry is 5 USD per (small) bag. Don't miss the excellent "In Da Belly Restaurant" at the Pool. They serve excellent Meals at reasonable Prices (try the crumbed Warthog Schnitzel with Garlic Sauce, Chips and Salad at 12 USD for example). The only Downside is the constant Helicopter Noise above Town (although this applies to the whole Area). They wanted 10 USD pppn plus 7 USD for the Car per Night but we negotiated and then they skipped the Car Fee (so it was only 10 USD pppn). No charge for motorcycle.

name: Kariba Kushinga Lodge
description: Lonely, run down lodge but lovely views across the lake.  ($10 per night)

name: Lion & Elephant Motel
description: We were pleasantly surprised by this overnight stop off having crossed into Zim at Beitbridge. Campsite not yet reopened post covid but they gave us a simple and nice rondavel for $20 (same as camping rate). There is a terrace overlooking a river and a thatched restaurant which serves good food. Overall a great stop off for post-border weary travellers.

name: Maleme Dam
description:
Large grassy terrain with high trees next to lake and under beautiful rocks.
 Matobo NP, Maleme Campsite. Campsite In the center of the NP. Empty when we were there but a filthy place to stay. Ablution is non existent. The time you enter the NP is not registered. So if you get in early on day one, spend the night and leave in the afternoon on day 2. You have two days and only pay for one. Price for camping 30 USD per person per night. Do not stay here

name: Great Zimbabwe Campsite
description:
Large grassy terrain with trees next to Great Zimbabwe excavation and view on rocks.
camping $7 pp, nice shade, bbq area and picnic table. some sites have electric. Restaurant close - COVID

name: Bush camp
description: Bushcamp next to lake and water treatment plant.

name: Bush camp
description: Bushcamp near little village and dry river. USD 5 paid to villlage chief.

name: Chinhoyi N.P. Campsite
description: Site next to Chinhoyi caves, but also next to noisy main road. Big grassy terrain. Electricity only from ablutions. Electricity and water only part time available.

name: Twin River Inn
description: Grassy yard of hotel. Key of room for shower and toilet. Quiet although next A1.

name: Mbilizi Campsite
description: Great, grassy campsite with swimming pool bordering Lake Kariba. It is run by an ageing white Zimbabwean manager (Gordon) who seems to be living out his life there? The campsite and lodge/ boat storage at Mbilizi is lovely, but like everything else in Zimbabwe, showing signs of crumbling away and has seen “better days”.

name: Victoria Falls Backpackers Lodge
description: Four small but well equipped 4x4 bays with electricity. impressive gardens, swimming pool, pond, sky deck, resident animals, very fast internet and clean facilities. Dorms and private rooms also available, small restaurant on site.

name: Bvuma Mountains - Botanic Garden Campsite & Caravan Park
description: Reasonably well maintained grassy site with great view. We didn't stay here, but checked it out while walking in the park. Park access fee must be paid in addition to campground fee.

name: Mutarazi Falls - Mutarazi Campsite
description:
Small grassy terrain on short walking distance from waterfall. The site is managed by Far & Wide Lodge, a few km before the falls. When we stayed at the site nobody was at Far & Wide and the ablution block was locked. National Park access fee must be paid to enter the campground.
We didn't stay but guard said camping available $10pp night. park entrance $5 pp and vehicle $3 peaceful place - very quiet outside holiday season. 4x4 access only. hot water on request.

name: Denise's Kitchen/Parugare Safaris & Lodges
description:
Well maintained lodge and restaurant that offers camping facilities. Campers stay at the lawn behind the lodge. Public toilets, shower in one of the rooms. Many peacocks around.
USD $8 ( adult, camper).

name: Guvalava Platform
description: If you book you can camp on the hide platform.  We slept in our truck next to it.  This is right by a waterhole, no fences.  It was amazing.  As it got dark we had over 300 elephants come down and then were serenaded by a pride of 12 lion from 2am until day break. $23 per adult plus park fees.  There are no facilities! (They’re all broken)

name: Mucheni Gorge
description: Lovely campsite perched right on the edge of the gorge in the National Park.  Only facilities are pit toilet and braii with firewood.  It's a tough drive up on a big rig but we made it although there were some low trees at the end.  Camping $17 a person plus $4 per person park entry and $10 for the vehicle.

name: Hwange N.P. - Kennedy Camp
description: Small sandy site in the Hwange N.P. Doubles as camping site during the day.

name: Bata Shoe Factory
description: Gweru, Bata shoe factory outlet store

name: Kazungula Border Post (Botswana-Zimbabwe)
description:
Easy and friendly Border.

Exiting Botswana:
Passports got stamped out. TIP was not looked at. No Vehicle Inspection. No costs. Done in 5 Minutes.

Entering Zimbabwe:
Filled out Visa Form and paid 30 USD per Person for a 30 Day Single Entry Visa (EU Citizens). 50 for Univisa (multiple entries into Zambia & Zimbabwe). Customs gave us a free Temporary Import Paper (EU Number Plate), no Carnet needed. Then we had to pay 50 USD for our Car (Carbon Tax, Road Permit and Insurance - all valid for 30 Days). We already had a valid Insurance from Namibia covering Zimbabwe but they wouldn't recognize it. If you already got a COMESA Yellow Card they will accept it and cut off 30 USD for the Insurance (hence it would only be 20 USD instead of 50 USD for your Car). All in all it took us 30 Minutes, friendly people.

Kaza visa available with $50usd, no atm
NOTE: KAZA Visa valid only for entry in the Vic Falls area. Any other border post you need to pay again.

name: The Farmhouse
description:
Wonderful place. Old home that was ours to use for the time we stayed here. We camped on the grass in front of the house, used the old kitchen for cooking and relaxed at the fire place during the chilly evenings. Place has stunning views of the surrounding mountains. 
Cute and lovely little farm on which you can camp or book a night. Lots of animals (fresh eggs!) and a beautiful garden. Would recommend to stay 3 nights, so you can do two days of hiking, swimming and horse back riding. The Chimanimani mountains are truly beautiful! And Tempe is very kind and gives great advice!

name: Nyamepi Campsite 1
description: Mana Pools NP. Nyamepi Site 1. Public campsite in the NP. The nicest of the cheapest. There is not much difference between the expensive ones. Campsite is not fenced and located at the Zambezi River. Basic ablution nearby. As there is nothing in the NP you must bring everything yourself. Firewood available at the NP office nearby. Be carefull when walking around as the area is not fenced. You will be camping in the wild here and dangerous animals can visit the campsite at any time. Price for camping is 23 USD per person per night (excl. entry fee for the NP)

name: Orange Grove Motel
description: Camping on the grass behind the motel. Place is not an official campsite but they allowed us to stay for only a few Dollars. Secure, quiet and friendly staff. Ablution is bad.

name: Great Zimbabwe Ruins
description: Great Zimbabwe Ruins. Ticket $15 USD pP, with a Guide; $3 USD pP (or $6 USD if you're alone)

name: Avondale Shopping Center
description: Avondale Shopping center with a good supermarket.  Near the Harare Botanical Gardens.

name: Kensington Shopping Center
description: Kensington Shopping Center - Hair dresser here.

name: Mana Pools NP Gate 1
description: Mana Pools NP. First gate to the park. Bad roads from here. You must be here before 3 pm to enter parks. Can leave any time apparently.

name: Mana Pools NP Gate 2 - Nyakasika Checkpoint
description: Mana Pools NP. Second gate to the park. No time limit at this gate and from here the road will get a bit better (when not in the wet season).

name: Matobo NP Main Entrance
description:
Matobo NP, main entrance.    

As a day visitor from outside of Zimbabwe you pay $15 pp plus $10 for a foreign registered vehicle.

For camping at one of their three campsites you pay $27 per site and $8 pp plus $10 for a foreign registered vehicle.

They don’t provide maps or anything else. 
If you want to visit any sites (monuments and rock paintings it’s an other $10 pp).

USD only for foreign visitors (no bonds).
                                        .

name: Spar Supermarket
description: Spar and good specialty shops for meat, cheese and wine.

name: Pick and Pay Supermarket
description: Large Pick and Pay supermarket near Bulawayo

name: Wild Dog Conservation Center
description: Wild Dog Conservation Center near the Hwange National Park. Modern and interesting Museum covering the Life of Painted Dogs. They also have a modern Wild Dog Hospital where they treat sick or insured Wild Dogs from the Park. You are guaranteed to see at least the permanent Resident. It's a good chance to meet these beautiful and endangered Animals. Furthermore; there is another huge fenced Area that helps the treated Dogs get used to the Wild again (empty at the Moment). Visiting is free but they ask you to donate a small Amount of Money or to buy something from their Craft Shop (Wire Dogs made from destroyed Poaching Traps for Example). Very friendly and helpful Staff. As it's close to the Main Road between Bulawayo/Vic Falls it's worth having a short break here.

name: Zimparks Office
description: Reservations for Hwange and other National parks here.

name: Mana Pools Permit
description: On the way to Mana Pools. Obtain here your permit before going to the first gate. If you do not have it they send you back here. Permit can only be obtained if you have a reservation from Zimparks.

name: Lookout Cafe
description:
Cafe on the cliffs high over the Zambesi, impressive views over river and bridge.
Beautifully built brand new restaurant, service is impeccable!

name: Tod's Guesthouse
description: Reasonable campground behind lodge, individual shelters, but ablutions and lodge a  little bit run down, good for 1 night before/ after border crossing, 7 USD pppn, 4 USD per car

name: Vic Falls Direction Hwange
description: Quiet spot in the forest. No electricity or wifi.

name: Pungwe Viewpoint Wildcamp Spot
description: A great alternative to the more expensive far and wide campsite, this is a nice spot. It's situated at the hardly used viewpoint. The last meters to get to the point were a bit overgrown but perfect for us.

name: Old Access Road Nyanga NP
description: Easy place with nice view, just a few hunders meters from the tar road. This is the old acces road to the park but a bit futher it's blokked with a old chassis. First we tried world view ppint for camping but that's now a commercial site $2,-- for the vieuw.

name: Bushcamp
description: 75 meters from the main gravel road, nice view.

name: Deteema Camp
description: You have this campground all for your self if you book it. We just visited for a cup of coffee. Price is $25,- pp park fee is $10,- pp and for the car $10,- but thats valid for tje time you stay in the park. Rest is per day. Here's a waterhole with lots of birds maybe early in the morning or at evening animals start coming here for drinking.

name: Lomagundi Lakeside Association
description: Ok location by lake.  we rented a self catering chalet with air con. nice shade for all camping spots (essential in this climate) - there is a swimming pool! wild zebra,bush buck and hippo can bee seen on grounds - baboons are actively kept at bay.

name: The Ripe Fig
description:
Lovely quiet residential location - perfect for a lunch stop.
Coffee $1 USD
Iced tea $2 USD
Full English breakfast 22 bonds (~$5 USD)

name: Phomolo Safari Lodge
description: Newly opened lodge and campsite, nice location near small dam, small grassed area or separate boma enclosed area, braii area, new clean but basic ablutions, cold water only at moment but hot water soon. Very friendly owner and staff. Currently two lovely rooms available more planned. Easy access to NP. Good value at $5 pp

name: Chilila Lodge And Campsite
description: Very run down camp in a nice spot overlooking the lake, gardens nice, camping on grass, ablutions very basic but hot water in one shower via electric water heater, cost was $12 pppn inc firewood, down a long sandy track and entrance through a small boat yard. It was quite tight for our Daf truck but do able. Staff very friendly and helpful

name: Seldom Seen
description: Beautiful, peaceful location. You have an amazing view. It’s a birders paradise. $10pp camping.  $36 pp for cottage. You can do bird walks.

name: Masumu River Lodge and Campsite
description:
Nice swiming pool and bar. Good facilities. Very clean. Friendly place.

Price for camping: 35 USD pppn. !!
We looked for another place.

name: Wild Camping
description: wild Camping at socker field. Very nice and friendly people. Ask the chief of school. it's free!

name: Kamba Caravan Park
description: 5$ pP/night. Washing 2$ Firewood 2$  green grass very well kept resort

name: Makuti Lodge
description: Nice view from 17 small chalet rooms to lake Kariba and the National Park. Restaurant and Bar. 50$ simple two bedroom, 11$ breakfast for two, warm water no shower, no camping. Dinner $9 to 12 pP.

name: Dean's
description: Lovely spot surrounded by art shops and galleries. mid range price.  best milkshake in Africa by far! (inside Elephant Walk Mall)

name: Mozambique Embasy
description:
Got a 30 Day Single Entry Visa here for 50 USD (German Passports).

1) Went there in the Morning and got Account Details for their Bank Account at nearby ABC Bank.
2) Went to Bank and paid the 50 USD each. Got the Slip at the Main Counter. They stamped a Copy of the Slip.
3) Went to Embassy, showed the Payment Confirmation and filled out an Application Form. Gave 1 Passport Picture each and the Passports.
4) Went there on the next Day at 3 pm to collect the Visa/Passports.

Friendly People. As stated below you have to hand in your Application including Bank Confirmation before 12 am in order to pick it up on 3 pm the next Day. Transit Visa would also have been 50 USD. They told us that Visa on Arrival at the Border is slightly more expensive but we didn't check it when we arrived at the Border. Visa is valid for two Month.

name: Banc ABC (Bank)
description: The place to pay for your Mozambique visa.

name: Resource Center Accommodation
description: Stayed for 10usd in a room with two single beds. They normally go for 20usd per room per night. The place has secured parking and a watchman. Good cheap place and you have the option to camp. The town has shops and a data network connection. It's kind of a community education place. Friendly.

name: Burke's Paradise
description:
Very nice and quiet place up on the hill, a little bit outside of Bulawayo but it's worth it. 
Camp 10$ per person, Dorm 17 $. Rooms are also available. Very nice garden with swimming pool. Old but clean ablutions

name: Mtsheleli Dam/Lake campsite
description: Ok camping spots; beautifully set around the lake with excellent views. No facilities. There's one ablution block but without water... Nice, quiet, peaceful surroundings, with lots of birds. Fantastic place to spend an afternoon and night.

name: A3 80km before Harare, 5km before Marondera (driving towards Harare)
description: Look to your left when driving the slight hill, a little dirt track leaves the main road. There you will find many tracks going off the first track, we chose the first to the right beneath some big rocks. Some road noise, no visitors.

name: 3 Bulls Butchery
description: Excellent butchery! When you arrive in Banket its the first building to the right (coming from Harare). You will see a big white sign saying "Biltong". Try their dried bacon!

name: N1 Hotel
description: Fabulous camp site with stunning ablutions and great wifi. Swimming pool. Location perfectly in the middle of town.

name: The Victoria Falls Hotel
description: No trip to Vic Falls would be complete without a visit to this magical old colonial hotel and its famous Stanley Terrace for cocktails or lunch! Built in 1904, this place was once the only building here. You can almost hear the old colonials partying away with champagne on the terrace! It has a stunning view of the falls and is, by Zim standards, very affordable! Lunch averages $15 including a drink. Stunning place to spend a few hours.

name: Mobola Campsite, Chizarira National Park
description: Basic run down site. No water or working facilities.

name: Kaswiswi campsite 2, Chizarira national park
description: BEAUTIFUL spot for the adventurous only (lots of lion and difficult off-road track). Worth it for the amazing setting.

name: Sinompasi Camp
description: A remote part of Chizarira National Park near a river. Good for wild camping with planned formal site in pipeline

name: Gwango Heritage Resort
description:
Spacious campsite.
Central fire area, central braai area.
Restaurant, bar and lounge area. 
Only a couple of showers but very clean and water hot.
Free wifi.
10$ pppn
They also have rooms (chalets?) for 85$ for the room.
Dinner for $8 per plate.
Breakfast around $6 depending on options. 
Please note they do not allow children under 8 years old at this campsite as unfenced and too dangerous.

Large sandy flat area. Large stone braai area and wonderful fire pit with stools. Groundsman lit a fire nightly in the fire pit for us. Wood complimentary. Nice ablution block with flushing toilets, hot showers and good water pressure. Cleaned daily and toilet paper provided. Dish/laundry sink provided at side of ablution, also with hot water. No other water points in camp. Very quiet and staff very friendly. Free, fast WiFi at reception and bar area. Delicious meals available (lunch & dinner are $8)

name: Chirundu Border Crossing
description:
Leaving Zambia all procedures done on Zimbabwe side. Stamped out in 30 seconds. To enter needed to pay 55 USD for single entry visa as UK citizen. Fast and effortless. Whole border under 30 minutes. 

NOTE: KAZA Visa not valid here. Only for entry in the Vic Falls area.

name: Kariba lake bank
description: Quiet place on the bank of the lake. In the middle of the nature and wildlife! Around 15 km from kariba village.

name: Riverside bush camp in NP
description: I crossed from Botswana but took the dirt road through the National Park, decided to bush camp here for the night overlooking the river and views across to Zambia. Very scenic, very peaceful, saw nobody, lots of hippos and elephants around.

name: Peter Wards garage
description: Peter used to service Diesel engines, now has a backyard mechanical shop. Give him a call if you need help or a look. He also can help you find the parts etc.

name: Orange Grove Motel
description:
ADMIN NOTE: camping is no longer allowed here, so now listed as hotel.

Site secure. There is a little road noise and odd noises from nearby town. Bar and restaurant in hotel - not tried, but seemed busy. Fast wifi.

name: Hot springs lodge
description: Lodge at natural hot springs. Camping between the chalets 5pppn, chalet 30pn for 2 people. Very friendly staff.

name: Nicoz Diamonds (Yellow Card)
description: You can buy the Yellow Card here but they charge per Country per Day. That's how they do it all over Zimbabwe apparently. Thereby Costs quickly ad up (if you want to include some Countries and Weeks expect to pay from 150 USD upwards!). They also need to know your exact Entry Dates for each Country. We didn't buy it here, we will get a 'real' Yellow Card in Tanzania.

name: Muchuzi Lodge
description:
Beaufitful lodge with garden and swimming pool. Rooms are well decorated with good beds. Lito Chen is available for self-catering, but their cook can also provide delicious meals ($7pp). We paid $60 per night for a double room. Good place to relax just in the suburbs of Harare with plenty of supermarkets and petrol stations close by.

We did not ask for camping. Could only pay cash (no swiping available at the moment)

name: Power pipes
description: Exhaust specialist, however also a trustworthy mechanic. He renewed my worn clutch and organized a place for us to stay the night. Unfortunately no swipe / credit card machine available, but paid him via bank transfer.

name: Lion's den butchery
description: Best biltong in the area, also sells freshly made sandwiches.

name: wild camp at the canyon
description:
Right at the edge to a canyon with a river in. very nice view and perfect sundowner lookout.
lots of big stones so the place is nothing for a tent.
lots of monkey played around in the morning😉

name: fishing and angling club
description:
An amazing view to the Sambesi  river. There are some camp sides direct at the riverside.
They have a bar and basic restaurant.  beer 1 usd meal 3 to 6 usd.
Swimmingpool ( not usable at our time) waterfall and lot of flowers. its very green here.
Hippos and monkeys around.
ablutions are basic, shower hot
we staid here for a while as it is so beautiful here.
5 Usd pp/pn

name: wild camp at the lake
description:
place with grass direct at the lake. from the small Ruine here you can watch the hippos in the evening.
just a bus driver was around to wash his bus. He left in the evening.

name: wild camp near riverbed
description: just a place near the road at a dry riverbed. Some big rocks here where you can stand on. So not too much grass.

name: Gas bottle refill in Kariba
description: Next to the MT supermarket. $2 per kg only cash

name: Tashinga
description:
Public campground with beautiful lake view. No one there. They made hot water and provider firewood. Hard to spot wild life in the park but the scenery and view from the camp are
beautiful. Terrible access road, spend at least 2 nights. $8pppn park fee + $17pppn for the camp.

name: Unofficial Bed&Breakfast
description: 5 prestwood lane. Beautiful little apartments on their premise with self catering facilities. Normally $50pn (for a double room) incl breakfast, we paid $40 as they did not have breakfast.

name: Crisp n Clean - laundery service
description: Same day service, charges $4/kg. Acceptatie MasterCard, call at +263773854360

name: Mr Cruiser
description: Land cruiser specialist: parts, refurbishment and repairs. Mike Smith is a very friendly owner that helped us out in so many ways. He organized accommodation and gave one of his company cars to use while our Hilux was in for repairs.

name: Tengerenge stoneartist village
description:
Amazing nice stone art you can see here. Watch how they are made them and enjoy the flair in that small  village.
All the artist are so friendly and you can make a workshop also. My girlfriend came back with a realy nice stone so I thought she bought it 😂
You also can sleep here and eat local food.
As we see everytime new arts when we walked trough the places we stayed 3 days there. At least 
We did not manage to leave without buying something😅
contact of the village chief
Robert Murengwa
rmurengwa@gmail.com
+263774747138

name: wild camp close to the road
description:
close to the road near a small track. no people around.
I think to Nerow for a big truck. Our Van fits perfect 😉

name: panorama road wild camp
description:
Just a place to sleep.  I added it because in this area it is not easy to find something not too close to a village.
Btw the landscape here on this road is very nice

name: wild at a field
description:
Many places to sleep nicely in this area. So I set the waypoint on the road. Just look 100 meters befor or after to find what you are looking for. 
Amazing landscape on the way to come and go here!

name: Diana vow waypoint
description: Here is the junktion where you have to leave the road. Also a small sign is here

name: Bushcamp
description: Good for one night, entrance 100m before the big baobab

name: Chitove
description:
One of many fantastic tent sites in this park, without any facilities and no fence.
Not so many animals, but a beautiful landscape.

name: Chivirira Falls
description: Nice picnic place,  near national park entrance

name: Iron Cross Enterprises
description: Great little machine shop that are willing to take on most any mechanical repair.  They cleaned the threads on a suspension part for us, apologizing for charging their minimum charge of $5 for such a quick job. Great work and willing to help in any way when they couldn't find the 1/2 in. die for the job.  Luckily they found it and got us on our way.

name: CT Bolts
description: Bolt, nut, and fastener supply house. Reasonable prices, and they have metric and imperial Bolts and nuts!

name: Food Lovers Market
description: Grocery store with great produce selection.

name: Cuckoo Campground at Musangano Lodge
description:
The campground at Musangano Lodge has two campsites, each with their own BBQ pit, power point, and standpipe. Dish sink is shared. Ablutions use solar for hot water.  The campground is about 1m above the lodge. Free WiFi is offered at reception, as is a restaurant and bar. We paid US$10 pppn.

+263 (0) 732 320 327 or +263 (0) 712 320 327

name: Diana vow
description:
Here they are located. Extremly mystic place. We loved it and stayed here longer than expected😉
After a while someone came and asked for entrance fee (offical)
4usd pp guided tour.

name: Church of good samariter
description:
We ask the old lady living here and she was so friendly and let us camp.
nice grass area in that peaceful compound.  Water available

name: world's view point
description:
Nice view to the cliff and valley from here. Perfect for a sundowner😉
2 usd pp entrance. 
There are some walking pads and viewpoints here and a well made green area with benches. 
We where alowed to sleep here (2 usd pp) in this gated area. The ceaper is very friendly and show you everything. Maybe you also can buy some fresh meat from him for a good price. 
The Toilets are amazing clean and nice made. No shower here.

name: Nyamoro Dairy Farm
description:
You can stay here at this huge peasefull Farm. 2 big friendly dogs around, lots of cows, sheep's,  chicken and goose.
In the Tea room they have homemade jam,honey,chutneys and cheese to sell.
Also offer cake and lot of other stuff😉
Best I eat since a long time! Best gratings to the always happy waitress  Angie! 
The extremly friendly owner Debbie is open for overlander and so she alows to stay at the farm area. Have a walk to the lake and enjoy this beautiful pice of land.
We did stay some days and came back after a while as we feel like home here. 😂😡

name: Heaven Mountain Lodge
description:
Nice Campsite in walking distance to Chimanimani.
Showers are clean. Wifi available. 8 USD ppn.

name: Lake Mutirikwi
description: Quiet and nice place right at the lake. No facilities, 3G Econet reception.

name: Abandoned Road at old Bridge
description: Abandoned Road leading to an old collapsed bridge. Normal vehicles not visible from the road, high vehicles may be visible. Light traffic, so not much noise. Accessible with big rigs possible.

name: Wild camp after border gate
description: Small parking place right after the border gate on the Zimbabwean side. You should ask the people at the border of you can camp there. Best spot if you get to the border late or your rig is too big for the forest camp further down the road. Quiet and no traffic after the border gate closes at 18:00. Border procedures take between 1.5 and 2.5 hours for MOZ and ZIM side.

name: Picnic site next to road
description: Large even picnic site next to the scenic road. Nice view. Beware of baboons ... We did not overnight here but it should be no problem to do so.

name: Victoria Falls Entrance Gate
description:
Entrance Gate for Victoria Falls (National Park). Foreign Visitors pay 30 USD pp. SADC citizens 20 UnalSD pp.
It's also possible to cross the Border Bridge with Zambia (Bungee Bridge). You have to leave the Vic Falls Park again and walk along the Road to the Border Post. They issue a free Bridge Pass there (Passport or Driving License required) so you can walk to the Zambian Side and return to Zimbabwe without using your Visa.

name: Gosho Park Bush Camp
description:
Situated next to a girls private school (perhaps owned by) this small game reserve with giraffe zebra wildebeests and kudu offers camping at their "hikers" hut. 10$ pppn and 5$ for the vehicle. They will light the boiler and the campfire for you. They even asked if we wanted to stay in the hut, but I reckon most overlanders have better beds in their tents than the ones provided by the park.

If you arrive in the after hours, just talk to the guards at de gate of the school; they can help you out. 

You can hike freely throughout the park. 

Recommended for a stopover if en route to Harare

name: immigration office
description:
In the second floor you can extent your visa for free
(30 days more since the day you exzent)

name: DHL office
description: DHL world wide shipping, not cheap but efficient. here is the office

name: ZIMRA Carbon Tax/ insurance
description: Here you can extend your carbon tax. Unfortunately you must also extend the car insurance . 10USD for 30 days +30 USD for insurance if you do not already have insurance.

name: Tourist Information
description:
Very helpfull madame who was able to answer all the questions we had for visa and car paper extentions.
very helpfull!

name: suspension bridge
description: adventures small suspension bridge used by locals

name: camp at the river
description: Lots of grassy area here and bushes you can hide behind direct at the river. Very nice here. on weekend also locals are around fishing, washing car or clothes. Everyone is very friendly

name: river bed camp
description:
This place is right near the river on a grassy area. It was not easy to find a place in this area coming from south.
Here it works perfect for us. Not to many people around.

name: Ziwa National Monument and museum/camping
description:
Ziwa Ruine are here. Hard to find these ruins. not many signs showing the way. Correct coordinates are on Googlemaps and Tracks4Africa.
Museum costs 10 usd pp. Also camping is possible for 5 usd pp. Toilets are here.

name: Pungwe view point
description:
Nice view from here down to the pungwe water falls (best time between 11am and 1 pm). Also around the montains.
Place is run down and the way to here a bit overgrown. But so it is shure you be alone here😉
We camped here at the rest area wild and of course for free. Some run down dishes and a braai is here. Nobody around here. Nice camp with a great view and shade. We loved it.

name: wild camp at the top
description: Just added it as an other option to camp wild here at the view point. You also camp wild at the est area at the view point. Some dishes and a braai there but run down. See my description

name: honde view point
description: You can stay at the edge drops down to the valley. on clear days fantastic view. nothing to camp wild here we think.

name: KPG enterprises tools and parts
description:
a well equipped shop for tools and parts. I had to buy a 140mm bolt M18 and they had it for a fantastic price😉 
helpful stuff

name: mount beacon walk
description:
You can walk from here to the top of the montain. (20 min) beautiful lookout from there. 
At this place you can park your car. It is very save as here is a police training center😇 They charged 1 Usd pp for the walk (for maintanance of the way/steps)
They alowed  us to camp here for free! you can use there basic toilet and shower as well. 
Very friendly people!

name: scenic road wild camp
description:
Just near the road a place you can camp. 
nothing special but one of the nicest places here in that area. The road here is bad so you need your time.....
lovely landscape so it is worth to go!

name: Tessa's pool
description:
You can visit the waterfall here and have a nice swim at the pool.
It is free and one of the " you have to go" places in Simbabwe.

name: Hot Spring Resort
description:
Place Is a bit run down but they have a pool with hot water😉
we payed 5 usd pp and could use the shower and toilet from a bungalow. Also the power.

name: Chipinda Pools
description:
A nice spot here direct at the river.
entrace fees
car 10 Usd (valid for 5 days)
entrance 8 usd pp pn
camping 17 usd pp pn 
there are also exclusive camps available in the park . They cost 27 usd pp pn

name: Nyamapanda Border Post
description:
Leaving Zimbabwe:
Passports got stamped. Temporary Import Paper (TIP) was stamped at the same Building and they kept it. Then registered the Car at the Tent in front of the Building, collected the last of the three Stamps on the Running Pass and drove out. No money or Hassle, friendly People. Took us 10 Minutes.

Entering Mozambique:
Filled out a little Arrival Form, Passports got stamped. We already bought our Visa at the Embassy in Harare so didn't ask for Visa on Arrival. Then filled out the TIP ourselves and got it stamped (TIP was free! No Carnet de Passage needed). They asked if we already have an Insurance and we said "Yes" (which was not true. But we didn't want to buy it because we only transited though Tete to Malawi in 12 Hours). No Money or Hassle. Took us 15 Minutes.

name: Chihwenga Leisure Resort
description:
UPDATE: now a private resort
This place turned into a private resort of the district chief, beautifully maintained lawns with trees, and they’re building some chalets here.  foreman  told me I can camp here for free. Probably not always possible..
Seems to be a picnic place for locals. you can sleep peaceful here as it is far away from a village. 
Also you can walk along the river. beautiful scenery here because it is in a small gauge.
No sign for this place on the main road and you have to pass a fence.

name: wild camp near railway
description: Just a spot to sleep. Nothing special. The train came once in the late afternoon.

name: Indaba Book café
description: Very nice restaurant to have breakfast or lunch; they serve omelettes, sandwiches, cheesecakes etc and make good coffees. Very friendly staff!

name: Cyrene mission chapel
description: Beautiful old Chapel with interesting paintings

name: Tony's Coffee Shop
description: Beautiful Tea and Coffeeshop, perfectly described by the Bradt guide. Loads of different teas and coffees and delicious cakes in a beautiful house transformed in a coffee shop. Closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Not cheap, but definitely worth it!

name: Viewpoint 'Prince of Wales'
description: Beautiful viewpoint overlooking Mutare and the mountains. Sculptures are sold here by local artists; very nice souvenirs and fair prices.

name: tamarind lodge
description:
very nice place to stay. 2 pools (the cleanest seen in southern Africa), very very friendly and helpful staff (driving our kid to hospital suspecting malaria).
rooms avalaible or you can pitch the tent. grassy and shadow.
possible for campers trucks. wifi free and very fast, ablutions perfect and clean.
no view of the lake.
fenced campground.
sliding cames for kids (in and out from the pool).
did not try restaurant.
10usd pppn. under 5, free

name: Malcolm lodge
description: Family owned b&b lovely helpful people! Not a cheap place at $140 per room but great breakfast, good pool and gardens. Laundry service available and Malcolm and Paulette know everything and everyone in Harare! Call them to make a reservation: +263 7 72245953 or info@malcolmlodge.com

name: Ivory Lodge mechanic
description: Lodge workshop. We used their compressor to pump our tyres, but they had a pit that you might be able to use if you ask nicely.

name: MOTH campsite
description: the campsite itself is nice, however that's where the nice ends, you are directed to a very grim shower and toilet that is best described for staff use, it's disgusting, there washup areas are filthy and have not been cleaned for a very long time, avoid as this place has seen better days

name: wildcamp
description: Nice grassy place next to road to wildcamp. No facilities.

name: Chilojo Cliffs Exclusive Campsite 1 and 2
description: Campsite on the banks of the Runde river with beautiful view of the Chilojo cliffs. Great for overlanders and big rigs. Shaded site under big trees. Lots of animals walking through site. No water or showers. Pit toilet. There are 2 campsites and 4 picnic sites.

name: Nenyuka Viewpoint
description:
Just a little bit beneath the roadside picknick spot there is a sheltered, flat space to place a car overnight. Two minutes walk from a beautiful Viewpoint overlooking the red cliffs and green flats of Nenyuke.
Some people passed in the evening but nobody disturbed.
A beautiful place to spend one night.

name: Kuimba Shiri Bird Park Campsite
description:
Very nice and spacious campsite next to the lake. Zebras and horses walking around. Restaurant with playground and shallow Swimmingpool. All, except the campsite ablutions look well maintained. Very friendly staff.
Prices for camping 10$ pp plus 5$ entrance fee.  Children from 6 years pay 5$ for camping and 3$ for the park.
Entrance to the birds park is included.

name: Alternative road to backside of worlds view
description: Here’s the turn to a little dirt road that leads to the back of the Worlds View. Drive to the clearing and then hike towards the small structure or the hill to the right instead.

name: Kapula Private Camp
description: Two camps- North Camp and South Camp each with four en-suite tents overlooking a vlei. Communal kitchen and braai facilities. Raised viewing deck at each camp. Camp staff to clean tents, kitchen area and make fire.

name: Frog & Fern Cottages
description: A very charming and quiet place with a single Campsite with its own private lounge and Bathroom. Run by a very friendly woman, named Jane who really knows the area well. $10 pppn, not the best road to get there.

name: Froggy Farm Kiosk & Coffee Shop
description:
Charming little farm stand with vegetables, fruits, spices, unusual preserves (honey, jam,..) Owned by a kindly elderly gentleman named Noah. Everything is homemade and you can check out his garden and fields.
We bought some fresh strawberries and tomatoes, yum!

name: Ferry Kariba Mlbizi
description:
Sails between March and December
See website Kariba Ferries http://www.karibaferries.com/

name: Tengenenge Artist Community
description:
Charming and peaceful art village, started in the 60th by a former tobacco farmer. Has achieved international renown for the quality and artistry of the stone sculptures produced here. Currently there are approximately 80 artists in residence and their art is displayed in vast and very charming sculpture gardens.

They offer informal camping and very basic guest chalets in the style of traditional Shona mud huts. They offer traditional African food, Shona dancing, stone sculpture tutorials and village tours. 
Camping is $20per site per night but is probably negotiable (although there are no formal sites, it’s more a perk where you want thing)  and for the chalets they charge $30 per night per chalet. There are 3 chalets, 2 with 2 beds and 1 with 3 beds. They are very basic. The community as a whole is very inviting and friendly!

name: Starting point for Mt Dombo hike
description: Approx. 1 hour hike to Mt Dombo from where you have a spectacular view towards Nyanga but also Harare and Muthare. Went with two friendly locals who guided us and helped us carrying our children down in the heavy, upcoming rain. Asked for camping on their land which was not a problem at all. Paid them totally 30 dollars.

name: Snakeroad Wildcamp
description: Beautiful flat place next to a road bend. Fireplace, lots of firewood. Beautiful sunsets. Only one car passed, no people around. Rough road. No Econet reception.

name: Chimanimani Mountain hut
description:
Beautiful located in the mountains overlooking some green flats. Reachable only by foot in an 2.5 to 3 hours walk from the Chimanimani park base camp. The hut itself is very nice but not much more then a shelter. Mattresses are available. For blankets and pillows ask for a key at the reception (Base camp).
The hut itself is free but the park fee is 12$ pp plus 10$ for the car overnight.
Water can be found some 200m in westerly direction from the hut.
We spent a beautiful new years night on the veranda.

name: National Parks Office
description: You pay the park fees here and bring the receipt to the park entrance

name: The Blue Bird Café
description: Nice little restaurant. Good food. For something Western like this prices are very reasonable and staff is committed and friendly.

name: Platform campground
