description: Remains of a campground in the middle of the park. No facilities

name: Total Kariba, Fuel, tyres, Toyota parts
description: They have Toyota field service and accept Visa credit cards

name: Silozwane Cave
description: Very remote but worth the trip. The most beautiful of all the caves around here. More paintings than the others. Big and not so touristy. Beware of Black Mamba’s and Puff Adders. Follow the track behind the Heritage sign. First split to the right (green arrow still there?). On the rock go slightly to the right and follow the green arrows painted on the rock. Take enough water!

name: Toyota Bulawayo
description: Official Toyota Service Center. There are a lot of other carparts shops in this neighbourhood.

name: Big Cave Camp
description: Expensive (USD 15 pppn) but great place close to entrance Matobo NP. Part of Big Cave Lodge (800 mtr across rocks). We had the place to ourselves. Lodge has swimming pool, restaurant. Campsite has bar, kitchen area and ablution block.

name: Toll gate
description: We did not pay toll fee at border, so we paid USD 5 here

name: Norma Jean’s Lake View Resort
description:
The restaurant at the resort has really good food and is open for non resident guests as well.
The furniture is vintage into each minute detail. Great ambiance!

name: Zeracon Motors
description: Ask for Mark Valentine (workshop manager); he managed to get our truck running again by the side of the road!  Very friendly and knowlegable. Has a big workshop in town, but for assistance on the road; telephone: +263 712 722 230

name: Beitbridge
description:
Going out Zimbabwe
Zim side is very straightforward (under 20 minutes);
1. Pay bridge toll fee R350 /USD 23
2. Stamp pasport at immigration
3. Gate pass stamped outside at police check point
4. Drive to customs check point to have carnet filled out

SA side took over an hour....

name: Behind balancing rocks
description: Very close to the road but completely hidden from a big balancing rock. Close by there is a fence and a gate but no tracks of cars or people around.

name: "Mother and child" balancing rocks.
description: When we were here, the roads of this site of the NP where not really prepared for big rigs (farther on from this point we got some scratches).

name: earth cafe
description: nice little cafe for breakfast/ lunch set in a green garden, small children playground area.diverse menu. closed on Tuesday and closes at 3pm

name: Near Hwange NP gate
description: Open space surrounded by threes. Overnight spot one km from the gate. Good  if you come out late from the NP or if you want to go in early. Quiet.

name: Dead end gravel road
description: Out of the A5 and parallel to a tarred road. Just an overnight spot on a dead end track.

name: In the Bvumba
description: We arrived very late and it was getting dark. We stopped at this pic-nic area. Even if it's close to the road and visible, it's quite. No one come along and only few vehicles used the road. No econet signal.

name: bush camp
description: isolated bush wild camp not far from the border and the main road. access by dirt road then turn left at a fence and continue off road (easy). very quiet.

name: natural history museum
description:
Interesting museum with geologic, animal, civilisation wards. Spend easilly 2h to go around
Exhebition of various living african snakes.
Open daily, 9 AM to 5 PM
Foreigner fee: 10 U$D/ adult  5 U$D/ kid over 4 years
large shaddy parking

name: OK foods
description: Supermarket in Hwange town, although poor selection of fruit and veg.

name: LPG refill
description: Gas bottle refill station. In a yard set back off the main road, we were served by a lovely chap called Quentin. US$3 per kg.

name: Hwange N.P. - Masuma Dam
description:
During the day a picnic spot, but it is also possible to book overnight. Braai stand and firewood available. One shower with donkey for hot water, and a male and a female toilet. All facilities basic but clean and generally well maintained. A hide provides a lovely view over a beautiful waterhole with lots of hippos and crocs. We also had an elephant come to drink in the evening. Supposed to have a resident warden, but he was away when we stayed.
US$29 per person, plus park fees ($10 pppn ($20 pppn for foreigners) + $10 per vehicle for up to five continuous days). Expensive, but that goes for anywhere you stay in this park!
children from 6 to 12 pay halfprice (both entrance fees and camping fees)

name: Near road
description: Just off road, a little close. Can just be seen. Ok for one night especially if you arrive near dark. Farmers walked past at sunrise, no worries.

name: Khami ruins
description:
antique city of the Torwa (pre-Shona) civilisation from 1640
small interesting museum at the reception
open everyday from 9am to 5pm
foreigner fee: 10$/adult  5$/child from 5 to 12
picnic area on site
not much visitors, we were alone.

name: Grassland camp close to the cave
description:
Nice and quiet grassy flat area next to the tracks.
Friendly neighbour.
Small river, but was dry when we camped.
Dirt road not too good (4x4 required), and could be chalenging for big rigs (low branches)

name: Gulabaghwe cave
description:
Bushmen painted cave, next to the dirt road. Small parking and sign.
You can see painted giraffes and many other humanoid shapes on the back of a huge crocodile.
Free access.

name: road toll
description:
2u$d for car below 3t5
5 u$d for trucks
You can pay with U$D, bonds, Rands or Pula

All road tolls in Zimbabwe must now be paid in US dollars if the vehicle has foreign registration. There is no option to pay in any of Zimbabwe's currencies.(Bond, RTGS or Ecocash.) The fee is US$2 for cars, including all vehicles below heavy goods. South African rand are also accepted, but the rate fluctuates. Note that small denominations of US currency ($1 to $50) are hard to find. Toll gates and even supermarkets will usually tell you they have no change. If you get change in local currency, the rate will be terrible, so bring plenty of small denominations currency. Dollars are easier to trade than rand.

name: toll gate
description:
2usd car under 3t5
5usd truck
can pay in usd, rand, pula

name: Naletale Ruins
description:
Remote ruins from the old Monomatapa civilisation.
Entrance fee for foreigners: 10 $ / adult, 5$ / child
Sadly we couldn't visit the site as the guardian refuse our pulas. No payement with foreign currency accepted (nor Rands or Pulas). Of course no C.Card facility. No museum.
Approx 20 km of bad dirt road to access the site, 4x4  required.

name: Toll Gate
description:
2 U$D for light vehicle
5 U$D for trucks
You can pay with U$D, Pulas, Rands or Bonds

name: Hillside Sports Club
description:
Large flat grassed area for camping (was a bowling green) on a golf course. Access to electricity and water, close proximity to clubhouse, locker rooms, hot showers, toilets, restaurant and bar. Quiet and peaceful with access to lovely walks on the golfcourse with its wonderful trees and birdlife. Good security. 
 Great place right next to golf course. Big open grassy area with enough shade. Friendly staff, bar and restaurant, and Kevin helps you with anything you need. In case you like golf, they let you borrow some clubs and plays some holes

name: Hillside Dams Concervancy Parc
description:
Very interesting parc with many different trails around the dams.
Good shaddy pic-Nic areas with Braai pits.
Entrance fee: 2$ / adult, 1$ / child.

name: Jecha Point Fishing Lodge
description:
Be careful. This place has hidden costs 
$10pp. Very nice spot near the border. Camping on a large grassy flat area, grass is mowed and there are some trees for shade. You can park right next to the Zambezi to watch the hippos. Brai pit, very nice ablutions with hot shower, washing up area, lovely fire area with log seats. Firewood and charcoal provided.

name: Mana Pools Reception
description:
The main reception for the park. This is where you need to pay for your permit, and for camping or check in for any of the lodges if not private.

Non-Zimbabwean International residents pay $20pppn + $10 per vehicle for up to five consecutive days. 

You can also book activities such as guided walks ($10 per hour), and if they are available you can book one of four camping pitches at Nyamepi Camp at $23pppn. These four are the only ones available to book here if you do not have a reservation from ZimParks.

name: Wild camp
description:
Not too far off the main road but pleasant enough camp spot for a night or two. 

If heading south, take the dirt track on the left before the bridge, cross the smaller bridge and turn left on the track along the river. By the looks of things this track is unused. Enough space for a few cars, you can either park right on the river or a little further up the track to be even more hidden from view (or otherwise there is a lodge across the river and you can see the bridge). You can hear the road but otherwise it’s a pleasant spot, nobody passed by us.

name: Royal Investment
description:
Great African Restaurant at the local Comesa Market. Shop Nr 5. (you enter the Market, then keep left) 
Prosper and his Family run that Place. They cook very tasty local food, meat, vegetarian, vegan for a small budget. We paid 3usd for 2 plates and drinks.
Also the Market around is much cheaper as other shops at Vic Falls.

name: bupi lupane dam
description: Still a really great spot to wild camp. A few locals and kids greeted us as they walked by. Quite a bit of rubbish on the ground but still lovely and lots of bird life. We camped at the beginning of the rains and no issue with our big truck. Econet 4G.

name: Nyamandhlovu Pan Platform
description:
Very beautiful pan, equipped with a big platform and toilets.
Great view of the savannah.
We saw crocodiles, elephants, zebras and antelopes when we stopped by (3pm)
Day Use Only, Signs posted and enforced

name: Shape Pan
description:
Very beautifull pan with natural spring in typical savanah landscape.
No facilities.

name: Kariba Border Post
description:
Careful with hired vehicles. Customs directs you to an external agent for a commercial vehicle guarantee which is apparently required for getting a TIP. The agent gets some documents from his car and asks 100 USD for it. Eventually we paid 50 which still felt way too much but it was already dark and he was the only agent. Customs not helpful to determine true price for CVG. Otherwise quiet and friendly. Card payment possible (except cvg)

NOTE: KAZA Visa not valid here. Only for entry in the Vic Falls area.

name: Immigration
description: Extend your visa for a month from the day you go in. Takes 5 mins, free. You can do this twice for 90 days total then after that it costs

name: Wild camp Near highway
description: Looks close to road on map but is elevated and very well hidden. Can hear road but can not be seen. Nice view, watch out for spikey bushes. Perfect for a night or two, use rocks to get level

name: Zimbabwe National Park Office
description: Book your national park stays here (Mana Pools etc.). Visa accepted.

name: Binga rest camp mineral pools
description: Ask to swim at the mineral hot spring pools which has a fantastic view over Kariba lake at sunset. Bar stays open until 10:30 pm and swimming is free even if you're not staying at their accommodation. Lovely staff. Accommodations look very nice but we didn't ask price. No space for camping.

name: Mount Nyangani (Zim highest peak)
description:
Included in Nyanga NP entry fee.  
Highest peak in Zimbabwe, takes approx 2-3hrs. Guide is compulsory at $5 per hour per group, you book the guide at the Park office.

name: Nyamuziwa Falls
description:
Included in Nyanga NP entry fee. 
Falls 100m from car park, smaller than the other falls in the area.

name: Nyanga NP gate
description:
Day fees (not 24hr) below:
$10pp
$10 p/car 

Includes:
Mount Nyangani (highest peak in Zim), approx 2-3hrs, guide is compulsory at $5 per hour per group.
Mutarazi Falls (highest in Zim).
Nyangombe Falls. 
Nyamuziwa Falls. 
Natural swimming pool.
Archaeological, historical, cultural sites.  
Pungwe Falls/Gorge (although you can access this for free).

name: Nyangombe Falls
description:
Included in Nyanga NP entry fee. 
Falls 10 min walk from car park. Beautiful and worth the visit if you're in the NP.

name: Kariba lake bank 2
description:
Found this spot whilst looking for Kariba Lake bank, not sure if it's the same place or if there is another road. Road turn off to here marked. 
Beautiful spot, lots of wildlife!  

Turn off to this place is at 16.536407, 28.936982

name: Gache Gache Lodge/campsite
description:
Manager is Jojo - 0773697330 
Best to pre-book if possible. 

Camping is $15 pppn.
Lodge prices vary so call and book ahead.  
Restaurant/ bar area and a kitchen to self cater.  
Also offer sunset cruises, game drives and fishing. 

We didn't stay, but we had some car problems and they had a mechanic who helped us out.

name: Woodland bush camp
description: There's an old car track leaving the main road, follow this and there's plenty of hidden places to camp, nobody around.

name: Between Juliasdale and Nyanga
description: Very nice wild camp. Flat area on grass with a beautiful view on the moutains all around. Very easy to access, around 500 m from the road and nobody !

name: nice view and big rocks
description: Wild camp 500m before a place where there are cottages, at about 250m from the road.  We stopped on a small old way, between beautiful big rocks and with a nice view on montains around. Beautiful sunset and sunshine. Very quiet.

name: A3 near a nice water point
description:
These nice place is about 700m from the A3, on your left when you are driving in the direction of Harare.
(it is 500m far from another wild camp discribed by another i-overlander. Thanks to him !)
We drove over a small dirt road, until we arrived near a nice water point full of nénuphars(Water Lily). Place very open, between the water point and big rocks. Lots of birds. Very quiet. No noise.

name: 40km south of Chinhoyi caves
description: At about 1km from the road, close to a small gravel road, on short dry grass. Easy to access. Very quiet.

name: Near worlds View
description: Directly at the ridge, beneath the dirt road that end a little bit later. Some bushes and trees behind the track. Maybe some other cars for sundowner.

name: on the way to Dianas Vow
description:
On the way to the rock paintings of Dianas Vow. At a bridge over firm sand to a nice place at the river. Not to be seen from the road, but from some houses on the other river side.
A friendly herde went by only waving. Firewood available, bushes and some trees.

name: Nauz Charara Site
description:
Huge shady ground with lodges at the Charara Riverfront and at the lake shore. Caravan sites with electricity in the middle of the ground, but also 3 sites at the Charara River side. Electricity included in the price. 
Campsite 5$ per site, 5$ per person and a once off entry of 5$.
Filling station and shop at grounds. Taps with lake water, has to be boiled before drinking.

name: Wild Camp behind the rocks
description:
Drive off the dirt road behind the rocks, a large open area with lots of rocks & trees to camp .
Good for an overnight stay when heading towards the Zim / Botswana border crossing at Matsiloje small border crossing.
Great to sit and watch the amazing sunset & stars.
Local villages are in the area but nobody bothered us, we were just left in peace. A few cattle & goats passing by the next  morning.

name: Shearwater Explorers Village
description: New Campsite. Ablution and Campsite very clean. Tourbusses. But also space for Camping. 5sites. Little houses available. Restaurant. Directly located in Town. Perfect to do some shopping and excursions to Vic falls. WiFi available.

name: Sports fields
description: Walk in to the grounds on a Saturday or Sunday and enjoy a 1 USD beer while watching a soccer match of the very competitive local league. Friendly people and good to chat to some locals without them trying to sell you something.

name: Comesa Market
description:
In the back there is a little restaurant with 1USD meals like sadza or rice with chicken, fish and beef. Cheap, tasty and filling! 

In front you can change foreign currency to bond notes so 10 USD gives you 12 ZIM bond notes so as long as you spend them in Zim you can make some money

name: Bushcamp near road
description: It's not easy to find a place with no people from Kariba to here, just an open space next to the road,  nothing special but very quiet

name: Elephant Hills
description: Fancy hotel on the hills with some great distant views of the ‘smoke’ from the waterfalls in the distance. Good for a drink at the pool and picture!

name: Zambezi House
description: Beautiful decor, pizzas etc. Zanzibar meets Africa feel, meals and drinks on the river! Really beautifully done!!

name: Shumba camp
description: Semi fenced campsite with toilet and shower under big trees close to the hide at the waterhole. No views from campsite over the dam

name: Pick & Pay
description: Supermarket (former TM market). We did some shopping before continuing to Mana Pools (we arrive from Binga)

name: Mucheni 2
description: Brillant (official Zimparks) camping spot on the banks of the Zambezi

name: Makwa Pan Platform
description: A small pan with a couple of crocs and a platform/hide and toilet. Perfect to have your own piece of nature for the night, the small extra charge of 5USD is worth it for those that like solitude. No ranger, no wood....but the whole place to yourself after nightfall. The sewage is leaking so I moved 30 meters away from the platform to avoid the smell. A tree full of baboons joined me for the night...

name: HIVU Camping Site
description:
Sally will give you a warm welcome and she is a helpful host with lots of information about Vumba Mountains, plants and hiking possibilities.
Camping is USD 8,-

name: MOTH shrine for fallen soldiers
description: A peaceful spot commemorating the Zimbabwean soldiers fallen in WW2

name: White Rhino San paintings
description: Bushmen or rather San paintings, quite clear to see with a fence around, short climb up

name: Pomongwe Cave
description: Pomongwe Caves with many bushman paintings, its an extra 10USD for this including Rhodes Grave. After a convincing chat by the rangers on duty I went and paid the 10 bucks and it was not worth it :( maybe Worlds View tomorrow is better

name: World View and Rhodes grave
description: Same entrance ticket for the caves is valid at this one, 10USD pp. The grave of Cecil Rhodes on top of the rocks and amazing views all around.

name: Change USD to bond notes
description: Market with money changers 100 USD is 140 Bond so while in Zim only pay with Bond notes

name: Beautiful drive around lake
description: Amazing drive around the lake, dotted with small villages and waving children. The last bit coming from Great Zim to the highway is ok gravel.

name: Wild camp
description: Turn off onto the sand track to find plenty of open quiet space to camp away from the road.

name: Transerv car part
description: all sort of parts batteries and oil you can get here

name: forest wild camp
description: near a way but it is not used much. it is in a beautiful rainforest

name: big tree & valley of giants
description:
From her the hike to the big tree and the valley of giants starts.
Amazing rainforest and pur Natur.  very nice area here. If your vehicle is higher than 3m you eventually  will have some work to come here.
you also can wildcamp here on this place.

name: Pharia State bar and restaurant
description: At a small shopping center in the first floor so the view of parked cars is not great but this is a good place to have a beer of their wide selection from 3USD and a meal from 8USD (ribs, pizzas, burgers etc) in a funky environment. Looks like a hip place to hang out for the younger crowd, food was really good and try the one in Vic Falls when you go there.

name: No working ATM - Zimbabwe
description: You won't get any money from the ATM.  Bring your dollars rands or euro. The guy's that sell airtime will change 1us $ in1,35 bonds that you can use for all shopping.

name: True Canvas
description: Repairs to any canvas for reasonable prices and done the same day 0772538605

name: Toyo Tech Auto repair shop
description: A mechanic for Toyota vehicles at the Total Marlborough with a full workshop. Owner Jefrey was very helpful initially but in the end not trustworthy and just wants more money and kept changing his pricing and asked a ridiculous amount as a deposit so I do not recommend this place.

name: Lee's Automotiv Repairs
description: Friendly and good workshop near Toyota Chiredzi. Contact Leon +263 7 74731366 or +263 7 72959379 (WhatsApp). Had my Toyota serviced there, some autoelectrical problems sorted out and seals on my frontaxle replaced. Reasonable priced.

name: Hippo Valley Country Club
description:
Large shady campsite with big old trees at the end of the golf course. Toilets ok and clean, Showers at campsite only cold, abolutions in general shabby and run down. But campers can use the hot shower at the gym. I got a key for 1 room as the ladies showers in the gym were also only cold. Pool access free. WiFi free and good, but at restaurant only. 
10$ per Person, electricity free from main building where the showers and the laundry are. Long extension cord needed.
Weekends can be noisy from functions with life music.

name: The Farmhouse
description: En suite lodges or camping sites available. Camping ground has a view out of this world. Food is fantastic. A chance to see zebra, wildebeest, giraffe, kudu, warthog. Lovely walking or cycling trails. Can book tours of Matopos National Park

name: Mabalauta Camp
description:
Public campsite in the Mabalauta area of Gonarezhou Nationalpark. 5 sites available. Site 1,2 and 3 have a bit of river view. 4 and 5 are a bit further away. 3 is the biggest site. Big trees with shade, fireplace, watertap and concrete picnictable with benches on every site.
Walking without booking should always be possible here, the exclusive camps along the river are often booked. Cheaper rate than the exclusive camps. Beware of monkeys!
There is Econet reception near the reception and therefore payment with Ecocash possible.

name: Nyavasikana Camp
description:
This is an exclusive camp in the Gonarezhou Mabalauta section. Must be booked via the main office in Mabalauta or via internet at reservations@gonarezhou.org  
Price is higher than the public campsite, conservhation fee and vehicle entry fee do also apply according to Nationality.
Big site overlooking a rocky section of the Mwenezi River. Some big trees for shade and pit toilet. The river would be reachable for water.

name: Rossi Pool Camp
description:
This is an exclusive camp in the Gonarezhou Mabalauta section. Must be booked via the main office in Mabalauta or via internet at reservations@gonarezhou.org  
Price is higher than the public campsite, conservhation fee and vehicle entry fee do also apply according to Natihonality but can be be paid per person not per site.
Small site perched on a cliff overlooking a rocky section of the Mwenezi River. A big Lapa for shade or to pitch a tent, fireplace, rollable brai drum and pit toilet. Otherwise no shade outside the Lapa, trees are small. 1 big rig would fit, as there is a small roundabout next to the main camp site.

name: Malinangani Camp & Picnicsite
description:
This is an exclusive camp in the Gonarezhou Mabalauta section. Must be booked via the main office in Mabalauta or via internet at reservations@gonarezhou.org  
Price is higher than the public campsite, conservhation fee and vehicle entry fee do also apply according to Nationality but can be be paid per person not per site.
Small site under big shady trees overlooking a sandy section of the Mwenezi River, albeit the view is obscured by smaller trees and bushes. A small Lapa for shade or to pitch a tent, fireplace and pit toilet. Next to the Lapa is only space for 1 vehicle, also a big rig would fit, and there is enough space in the back a bit away from the Lapa site.
The river would be reachable for water.
The camp is not signposted from the Malipati Main Road, you'll have to follow the signs for the Mwatombo Loop Road, it branches from there.
This loop is good for gameviewing also especially the area between the camp and the Swimuwini Restcamp.

name: In between the bushes
description: Nice spot out of the wind amongst some trees and rocks, plenty of firewood and quiet!

name: Reception National Park
description: Natural swimming pool with braai spots, toilets and a nice sand beach to take a dip!

name: Natural swimming pool
description: Nice swimming place in the river below some small waterfalls with a sandy beach and braai spots and toilets. Just follow the stream from the campsite to get here

name: Rhodes Museum and Hotel
description: Very interesting small museum on Cecil John Rhodes and Nyanga, very informative of the days of 1890-1920. Next door is the hotel which is a museum by itself and well worth a drink in the bar and the old veranda overlooking the forest.

name: Udu Lodge
description: Lodge with self catering chalets, 2 bedroom with 4 beds for 70 USD per unit. On the lake for bream fishing, looks ok and maintained.

name: Entrance to Bvumba NP
description: Park your car here and pay 10USD for a day permit or spend a night at the campsite for 13 USD/pppn

name: Gardens and carpark
description: After taking the scenic route through the small park passing the campsite and office this is the car park to visit the very beautiful botanical gardens, several trails to stroll around the jungle like forest and relax around the pond. I was the only one here for the day. Day entrance 8USD

name: Mountain climb
description: Park your car at the ladies selling fabric and honey and walk up in 25min to have views all around and into Mozambique.

name: Chop chop
description: Good restaurant for steak (from 12USD up) and pizzas, 2 restaurants in one with outside seating and nice funky interior. Beers from 3USD

name: Chinhoyi Caves
description:
Amazing caves to visit! Internationals 10USD and SADC 8USD, worth the stop over and it takes an hour max.
There is a lodge next door with a swimming pool, not sure about prices but looked well visited.

name: Trichelia Viewpoint
description: Perfect spot to sit on the river, fish and be alone with the hippos!

name: Mana River mouth
description: Long drop toilet for those in need! Good spot for breakfast or sundowners with grass lands full of hippos and elephants.

name: View point
description: View point on the river down a sandy track for breakfast! The ranger call it ‘car park’

name: Green Pool
description: This time of the year at the end of the dry season the roads leading here are hard dried up mud so quite bumpy, little wild life in the area

name: Long Pool view point
description: Right on the water a lovely place to park, make some coffee and sit, many hippos, crocs and diversity of birds.

name: Immigration and border
description:
Zimbabwe to Zambia.

Unfortunately they needed a Police Clearance certificate for my SA registered vehicle as their system is not computerized here, something I did not have. It took 30min and some nice conversation and they came out to check the car and chassis numbers etc and then stamped a copy of the car registration.
Immigration at Zambia was not there so another office in the back would bring help, the system went down so more waiting when they got the book to do things manually.

I am glad I paid someone to assist me for 10USD and made it slightly easier, have patience, smile and expect to be here a couple of hours. 

NOTE: KAZA Visa not valid here. Only for entry in the Vic Falls area.

name: Handyman Store
description: Builders store with a limited assortment of drills, hand tools, screw, glues, bolts and nuts but Game in the Manda Hills Shopping Center has much more variety actually.

name: Ann Bruce Backpackers
description: Very nice and friendly hostel in the green and calm area of the city. Runs by older lady Ann who is helpful and welcoming in cozy and perfectly organised for backpackers house. Bathrooms are clean, beds in dorms comfortable, kitchen well equipped. Price: 10 usd pppn + extra fee for using stove/oven 2 bonds + charge for WiFi (I’m not sure how much it cost). If you camp in a ground tent probably you can set it up on the grass in the garden but cars with rooftop tents are to high to pass the gate so we had to leave our car just in front of the property. We felt like at home after few weeks in the tent. Recommended!

name: Kyle National Park
description: Beautiful small game park with rhino. Entry fees: local $3,- international $10,- +$10 for vehicle.

name: Rwenya Rivercrossing
description: Bridge collapsed a few years ago, so everyone uses the rivercrossing. Its not too deep, but very sandy. 4x4 necessary. The river is about 100 m wide and the southern shore could be a problem for bigger vehicles as its steep and narrow. Lots of people around to help if you get stuck ;-)

name: Chapungu Falls
description: Nice waterfall with a stunning view over the valley, perfect picnic spot, maybe also a good wildcamp

name: Mountain Top
description: Take the small track to the right on the Cashel Scenic route (sign Campersdown) and follow it up to the mountain top. Lots of places with a stunning view over the mountains, lots of firewood around. Some friendly locals passing by, had a wonderfull quiet and chilly night. The road up is a bit bumpy

name: Border Zim/Bots
description:
Exiting Zim: Done in 5 Min. with CDP
Entering Bots: Desinfection of tyres and shoes, no control of the car just a look inside, Immigration and Customs easy. The road tax and insurance you can pay with Credit card.
Small easy borderpost

name: Tofo Tofo restaurant
description: Inviting place next to the thar road 5 min walk from the sea and town centre. Very nice staff, great jazz music and we even got the starter/tapas before the meal. Prices: 1/4 chicken for 400mt, calamari 500mt, fish curry 450mt, big beer 100mt. Food rather average and salty.

name: Hwange
description: in front of the church outside the town. Quiet.

name: Mlibizi (Kariba Lake)
description: near the lake in the abandoned campsite, we love it.

name: Troutbeck -World's View  2294 m
description: into the wild at view point. World View Trail at 1 km (2$ pp . we didn't do)

name: Mutare - The Homestead Guesthouse
description: parking in the guesthouse. employees are very friendly. 5 $ pppn

name: Mutare - Prince of Wales View
description: view point near the road to Bvumba. Sculptors Shona here very friendly (they leave before sunset).

name: Nic Nac's
description:
Restaurant, snack place at the end of Banket town going towards Harare.
Great service, home made cookies, pickles and more than just sadza to eat.

name: Victoria Falls Hotel
description: A tourist attraction in it's own right, worth visiting just to see the view of the bridge and mist from the falls. The grandeur of British colonialism in full display, grand public areas, gardens, bars , wall hangings, furniture. Quite a place!

name: Africa Sun Homestay
description:
Africa Sun is a hostel and homestay run by an awesome guy named Zuga.  Stay at his big Zimbabwe house in nice, clean, and comfortable rooms.  Free WiFi and hot showers.  House is in a nice suburb a few minutes from the city centre, you can take a share taxi for 1 Bond per person (~$0.28).  Zuga is a really nice and knowledgeable guy, aims to please, picked us up from the train station for free, took us to the supermarket, helped us sort out buses, etc.

He asked for $35 for two of us for two nights in a private room.  Much less than any other hostel or hotel we found and good value.

You can see photos and reviews on his Airbnb listing, but you can message him and book directly and he'll give you a better price.  Look for the listing called "Africa Sun".

Zuga
WhatsApp: +263 77 869 3247

name: Bus to Botswana
description: Get the bus to Plumtree border, Botswana here.  12 bonds (~$3.50).

name: The River Brewing Company
description:
Craft beer! Restaurant with their own brewery, making everything from IPAs to wheat beers. 

Have you been longing for something else than a watery lager when traveling through Africa? Look no further! Unfortunately it’s all on tap so you can’t take bottles for the road.

name: GunPa Guesthouse
description:
An oasis on the route Beitbridge - Bulawayo!

You can overnight in cottages or caravans. They also offer camping. The place is safe, the washrooms are very clean, and the shower very hot, if you want. We used the beautiful pool to relax a little bit.

name: Nswatugi Cave
description: Nice cave with lots of paintings. Worth it. There is no office so you must not pay the 10 USD.

name: National Parks and Wildlife
description:
Here is the location for the Zim Parks office where you need to get a permit before going to mana pools. You do not need a booking to get a permit, they will call ahead for you. 

Located just before the old bridge to Zambia. coming from the border, turn LEFT immediately out of the gate and continue towards the bridge. Park up and ask the guards where the office is. We were the only people there when we went Saturday morning.

name: Impala Motor Parts
description: Good place to pick up spares, fluids, and general bits and bobs.

name: Siansimba River Lodge and Camp
description: Wonderful located bush camp directly at the Zambezi river. Bring everything with you. For us one of the most beautiful camp in southern part of Africa.

name: City Choice Backpackers
description: Hostel with dorm and rooms. I stayed in the dorm, it wasn’t very clean and a bit too expensive (15 usd), I m not sure the bedsheets are changed after every guest but  I arrived at 2 am and it was the cheapest option in the city center.

name: Coimbra Restaurant
description:
Semi fancy Portuguese restaurant where all the rich mzungu/mulungu seem to go. Food is good but prices expensive. Bring bonds to pay, accept cards but at 1:1.

Everyone seems to order the chicken and chips, there is little to offer for vegetarians.

name: Victoria Falls Backpackers Lodge
description:
Really nice and quiet place with a good vibe. 4 bays to park your car, ground tent possible but on sandy bottom. 
Shower (hot water) and toilet simple but clean. Pool, TV Lounge,  very nice and clean common kitchen area!
Spa service for reasonable prices, we did not try.
You can also order food. Barbecue min 4 people.
Free coffee in the morning.
Pool, Kicker  (2 games 1 dollar), darts for free, Internet 3 dollar per day ppn, but you may bargain about that.
We stayed our second night in Victoria Falls here because it was too busy and overpriced and not nice camping in town.

name: Free parking Vic Falls
description: Free Parking for Vic Falls on Zimbabwe site

name: Gate
description:
Gate before Robins Camp. You have to sign in a book 

10$ ppn when you stay overnight in the park 
20$ ppn when staying outside 
10$ for the car for 5 days without leaving the park

Note when you arrive in the morning the ticket is valid until 6pm the next day if staying in the park.

name: Railway Museum
description:
Great museum where the knowledgeable curator Gordon can show you around. They have lots of steam engines and carriages from the industrial revolution, all if which you can climb in/on. 

Home to Cecil Rhodes personal train used for his funeral. Gordon will offer to unlock it so you can see how he traveled (while alive). Should be interesting for overlanders to see how a 20th century billionaire did it. 

Very interesting and 2 bonds pp (<0.5 usd). Well worth a couple of hours. Parking right outside with space for big rig.

name: Exit Gate
description: Just exit gate, No payment possible.you have to go to main gate

name: Gate Game Park
description: Gate is very low but there is an extra road for bigger cars

name: Mezilume Dam
description: Campsite close to the game park and rock paintings

name: Maabwe Bay Campsite
description: Maabwe Bay is an excellent quiet place. Margot and Richard have a great hospitality. Here at the Lake Kariba you find a small paradise.

name: Breeze Lodge
description: Double room at 130 bonds, very clean, common leaving room with TV, big garden, very quiet and close to the centre. Staff is very nice. They can prepare meals on request. Good WiFi and hot shower.

name: Massa Cafe
description: Local bar, very nice atmosphere. There is a restaurant in the garden, 8 bonds for 2 sadza

name: Kyle view chalet and caravan resort
description:
In former times this was a huge, beautiful campsite and lodge.
Now everything is run down, but clean.
The campground is closed, but we stayed on the grassy ground close to a chalet, which facilities (toilet, shower, kitchen, plug point) we could use.
Free WiFi is sometimes available at the reception (it's Africa!). 
We paid 5 USD pP pN. 
It's a good alternative to the much more expensive Norma Jean's camp (13 USD pP pN) in the neighborhood.
Very friendly stuff (it was quite cold, they made a fire at the open fire place in the restaurant, although we were the only guests).
Close to the lake and the ruins of Zimbabwe.

name: Rutenga Truck Stop
description: Large area used as Truck stop next to the road. You can search a spot a bit away from the highway.

name: Nyamazi Lodge
description: Clean rooms, very peaceful and nice garden. 5 Usd pppn. There is a restaurant but they cook only on request. Shared bathroom, the gyser was off so they'll heat some hot water for the bucket shower. There is a fridge you can use and probably they'll let you use the kitchen as well.

name: Nyamakwere Lodge
description: 151 bonds for a nice room with bathroom. There is a bar and restaurant. They also have a camping. Hot shower and WiFi.

name: Mavhuradonha wilderness eco-lodge
description: Very nice place few hundred metres from the main road, you can camp or they have wooden tents (for 20 USD) or cottages (30 Usd). The road to this place is very scenic. There is no restaurant or bar on site.

name: Toll station.
description: Toll Station a few 100 m before. We always paid 5$ for our 18 t mobile home.

name: Footballfield
description: On a big rough footballfield with view to east and north and Mozambique. Very quiet at night. Nice place to stay for a night.

name: Fuel station
description: There are 2 fuel stations in Hwange. Fuel shortage affects this area and they don't accept card.

name: Total fuel station
description:
There is currently a big fuel shortage in Zimbabwe. There was no petrol available in town, the Total was the only place with diesel. They sell by international card payment only, price was $1.47.

The network for the card machine was down for 2 days when we were there, so make sure to get your gas when it's available! They told us this happens about twice a week.

name: Total fuel station
description: When we passed there was no electricity, so pumps didn't work. I'm not sure though if they even had fuel.

name: Classic cars gas station
description:
This place accepts US$ cash only, no cues and apparently is usually supplied with fuel.
Price was $1.15 for diesel and petrol

name: 2B BACKPACKERS LODGE
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Our Backpackers is a highly social with our friendly staff, experience in all types of travelers, all within budget so you can get the chance of exploring the capital. The lodge believes in bringing people together with the communal areas to encourage new friendships discoveries. We are not party backpackers but we are aiming at relaxed home away from home feel.

We offer A few private rooms, male and female dorm rooms and a medium sized campsite overland friendly, solo campers and we offer tents for rent. 

looking forward to Checking You In...

name: Solid Link Guest Lodge
description: Simple lodge, we camp in the parking lot having access to bathroom and water and paid 30 bond (5usd ecocash - Ecocash is the mobile currency of Econet, which is the most common mobile network used in Zimbabwe). Very nice people and strong WiFi. good place between Harare and nyanga.

name: Bliss Lodge
description:
Lodge on top of hill near Karoi, currently expanding its rooms. Camped in parking lot, very basic but access to water and opened room for hot shower. Nice people. offered $5 USD in cash.
, could likely have offered less...

name: Bush camp
description: We passed a quiet night in our RTT. Turn off the main road onto a dirt road headed toward the river. This spot is just below the small rise. Out of view of the road. Can see the river and city lights in the distance.

name: Glow Petroleum
description: Petrol and diesel available. Accepted USD. No credit card.

name: Holiday Inn Mutare
description: We didn't stay here but looks nice and secure parking. We stopped here to use the free WiFi and get info about where to buy petrol, get USD (via Moneygram or Western Union), and exchange USD for RTGS (aka bonds). Reception staff were very helpful and so nice.

name: Stanbic Bank (currency exchange)
description: Can exchange USD to RTGS (aka bonds). Rate was 8.64, best we found. Not necessary to have an account as at other banks.

name: Flo Petroleum
description: Gas station selling petrol & diesel for USD for$1.25/liter. No lines. They're closed for lunch 13:00-14:00.

name: Chimanimani National Park
description: Park with many day hikes in the beautiful, rocky mountains and grassy valleys including to the hut, Mt Binga, Skeleton Pass, and to waterfalls and caves. Water flowing in the river when we were there. Road to park campground where you park for the trailhead is bumpy but ok. Can get hiking info at parks office in Chimanimani and pay entry fees there or at campground USD$10pp +$10 car fee. Cash only, bring exact change if possible. Now plus $5pppd required guide fee.

name: Gas station
description: Gas station with petrol and diesel. When we were there, only accepting USD $1.30/liter. Cash only. No line.

name: Belmont Motors Bulawayo
description: Gas station with petrol and diesel. Pay with USD. Petrol $1.10/liter.

name: Choice guesthouse and backpackers
description: Welcome to choice guesthouse and backpackers situated in the beautiful Heyman road in the suburbs of Bulawayo.Choice Guesthouse and backpackers office tranquil accommodation and camping spots with ample space and lovely garden for travelers looking to relax and explore Bulawayo. For those travelers that needs to be close to the city bars we also offer backpacker accommodation in George Silundika street and 15th avenue. Both our places feature free wifi , fully equipped communal kitchen for self catering purposes. Free coffee and tea is available. Accommodation is clean and comfortable and you can choose between dorms and private rooms where bed, linen and towels are provided

name: Tudley Butchery
description: A high quality butcher in Arondel shopping mall in Harare

name: ATM
description: Nedbank ATM next to a shopping center. There is also a fuel station, but it's not open yet

name: Dimba Lodge
description:
Dimba Lodge is situated 40min away from Vic Falls, perfect spot to be close to the falls, but far from the crowds and noisy helicopters! Calm and green place.

It offers private chalets (50usd two people), shared 4bed dorms w/ private bathroom (15usd pbed) and campsites (10usd pp). Accommodation is simple, but very clean and cosy. And a big breakfast is included!  

Definitely the best of this place is that its situated right in the bush. And as its neighboring the Zambezi National Park, wildlife roams freely around the place (you might not see them, but you ll see its tracks!).

The staff here is super friendly and they have very knowledgeable guides. They offer activities (as Bush Walk) much cheaper than what we found in Vic Falls (25usd). We strongly recommend doing the “Sleep with the herders” activity (we spent a night with the herders at their nomad camp, keeping lions away from the cows, pretty exciting!!)

We came here for a couple of days and ended up staying for a month doing some volunteer work. We were caught up by the amazing work they do in regenerating the land. 

They haven’t had much tourists lately, but now theres a new manager working hard on making the place shine again!  


Ps: signs on the road arent very clear. Coming from Vic Falls 4km after passing the airport entrance you ll see a sign “Dimbangombe Safaris” turn right. Go 7.5km following the signs for “Africa Centre for Hollistic Management (ACHM) or “Reception”.

name: TollGate
description: 2 Bond toll increasing in September 2019.   You can pay with card

name: Deja'vu
description: This is the best place for good coffee, cakes and muffins, and meals.  The service is fabulous, the food consistent, all around excellent.  Sit inside or in the gardens.  Even better, you get to support owner Claire's donkey sanctuary which is a short distance away as the restaurant is formed to do this.  All furnishings and art are locally made too.

name: Old quarrel beside gravel road
description:
We hid in the left corner of a kind of old quarrel beside of a gravel road. 
There you can not be seen from the few bypassing bikes and cars (but you can hear them). 
To find this you have to leave the A13 (Mount Darwin - Shamwa) and drive approx 1,5 km on this small gravel road (if you continue it will lead you through scenic but well populated former farmland and finally after 26 km to the A11).
Nobody disturbed us here in the bush and it was very quiet in the night

name: Bush camp on cutline for power line
description:
Not many possibilities in this region for bushcamping. Most of the land belonged to white farmers before and now there are many local farmer around. 
Here is a small piece of "original" bush left between Raffingora and Mhangura.

Here was cut a "track" through the bush for a small powerline (there is a big agriculture complex further ahead). We followed this broad and unused track for about 500 m (easy driving) and parked in a open space in the bush. Nice and very quiet place. The "track" seams to be completely unused.

name: Mike bicycles shop
description:
Mike runs this bicycle mechanic shop. He has imported spare parts and second hand parts. Affordable prices.
Mike +26375195174.

name: MARES Donkey Sanctuary
description:
If you love horses and donkeys and want to support their work there are a couple of spots to park on a grassy side and nice grassy space under trees to pitch a tent.  It has outside shower with hot water, toilet and tap. There are peacocks and dogs but it is a wonderful location in the golf course, lots of small birds, great night sky.  
Camping US$5 pppn
there is a rustic cabin with twin beds, sink, toilet and basin, outside shower with hot water, usually used for volunteers but if it is free US$10pppn.
Big rigs may need to park at the gate.  Animals welcome provided they don't harass the animals.

name: Total Fuel Station
description: An alternative fuel station to the 2 on the main road. Very accommodating, friendly staff who helped us out tremendously. They agreed to combine USD and RAND for us to buy fuel and they gave a much better rate than the other 2. David is a legend!

name: Total (always petrol)
description: Total gas station which apparently has always petrol for "diplomats", but also sold to me. Only USD cash.

name: MAN Bus&Truck, Harare (not recommended)
description:
The people are friendly, but the prices are outrageous.
 For an oil change, 45 minutes of work, I was charged 3 hours. Plus $ 30 for "something".

name: Skyline and Skyview
description:
Nice Zipline and wooden bridge over the falls. Looks really good fun

Skyline/Zipline: $55 (includes one shot on Zipline and small bridge)
Skywalk/Bridge: $35 (includes small and long bridge, one shot on each)
Combo: both

Park fees are payable separately

name: Double T Services
description:
Look for 13 Bristol Road, leave the road at -17.848501,31.018545 and ride straight to the back of the property where you'll find the garage on the right at -17.847989,31.018914.

Trevor Thixton runs the garage and is very helpful. If you have a problem, he's worth chatting to as he can help make a plan.

Has very limited stock of dirt tyres, chains, bulbs etc; however, he knows how to get parts.

Can do most work on motorcycles except rear shocks.

trig@zim.co.zw
+263 77 226 8971 (uses whatsapp)

name: Zimbabwe Revenue Authority (ZIMRA)
description:
To extend TIP, bring your own vehicle, current TIP with proof of payment, and passport with stamp for extended visa. Go to teller 0 or 1. They need to see your vehicle and will verify the number plate, so park close to the office. 

They accept international visa and mastercard cards, and ecocash. Same USD price as paid upon arrival at the border.

A bit slow to process and pay for everything, and it seems common for others to push in.

If on the last day of your TIP, your vehicle is being repaired and you'd like to stay for longer until repaired then the vehicle is placed an embargo. ZIMRA require a letter from the garage on headed paper explaining what work is being carried out. During the embargo, ZIMRA will visit the garage to see your vehicle; however this depends on how bust ZIMRA are (they said that). Once the vehicle is repaired, you must return to this ZIMRA office, purchase a new TIP, and then the vehicle can be collected from the garage and ridden on the road again.

name: Mapari Rest Resorts
description:
Everything as usual a little bit run down. 
Water only when it has power, otherwise the pump will not run.
Is more a cheaper and safer "parking". OK for one night. Price 2 pers. and auto USD 6.00.

name: Pindi's Place
description: Mechanic, electrician, air con & fridge repair. Pindi von Urff-Kaufeld +263 78 461 9558

name: Faith Fuels
description: This gas station is allowed to sell fuel for US-Dollar.

name: Wild camp at border post
description: Flat spot right before the ZIM / BOTS Border Post. Very quiet at night, only a few houses but no one bothers you. All very friendly. No shade.

name: Ornamental Restaurant
description: Local restaurant in front of the buses that arrive from Harare, Zadza and rice options with meat or fish...nice and cheap food arond 0,50$

name: Local restaurant
description:
one of the best local food I have tried in Zimbabwe, zadza, beans, vegetables and meet for 10 bonds.
we even stay in one of the rooms, very basic and no in the best conditions but for 30bonds was good enough

name: Hala hotel
description:
Affordable and nice hotel, they have single rooms for 130bons, double 200, room with toilet outsite 150...they finally offered us one double room with toilet for 100, comfy beds and clean.
they have wifi and a big Parking area with shade.
in the reception they gave drinking water.

name: Garage Toyota
description: Toyota Garage. Friendly and helpful welcome

name: Go Veggies
description: They deliver only, lots of organic produce. Also dairy and meat. Call or WhatsApp +263 77 859 9061. No collection.

name: Neil's Auto Electrics
description: Auto electrician in Glen Lorne +263 7 72256128.

name: Hidden Rocks
description: Fantastic campsite, off the road with unique views & nice camping spots under trees and inbetween the massive rocks. Cosy comunal gazebo & good abolutions. Emma, who runs the place, is really helpful & friendly. Highly recommend a stop-over here!

name: Motorcycle Mechanic
description: Great workshop for all brands with a specialization in MX/Enduro. Stock some tyres, spare parts & gear (Surprisingly well stocked). Sure these lads will find a solution for many potential issues. Well hidden & no sign, so just ring at the gate of Nr. 18.

name: Motorcycle Workshop AutoCycle
description: Motorcycle workshop stocking some tyres & gear. Les the owner is a really friendly guy & is sure to help you find a solution.

name: Sunbird Guest House Harare
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner.    

Sunbird Guesthouse is an established B&B in Harare which caters specifically to the needs of Self-Drivers. Sunbird Guesthouse is also the Harare base of  Manapools.com who help with Campsite Booking, Fuel access & Vehicle Repairs . They can also cache provisions in the guesthouse freezers to take the hassle out of self-drive in Zimbabwe.

Secure parking within a road enclosure with 24  guards. Full Solar Power with generator backup and uncapped Free Fibre Wifi, Borehole water with Solar Geysers and reverse-osmosis drinking water.

name: Flo Petroleum
description: Diesel available, can pay in USD or Rand. Could not pay by card.

name: Ngweshla
description: Ngweshla is a beautiful campground! Great facilities, hot showers, kitchen and an amazing host! Casper the friendly host is amazing! It’s deep inside the Hwange National Park. If you can make it out here, do! Have spare tyres! 4x4 ideally! Otherwise most pickup/SUV’s should handle!

name: Pokwe
description:
Beautiful Campsite with great view at Runde river. No water, no electricity, no braai, but a bush-toilet. Toilet was not clean.
Park fee 15 US pppn, camping 30 US pppn, car 2 US pn. Thats the price for what they call "Exclusive Campsite" if you come without reservation. I think, it is 50 US pppn for camping if you book in advance !

name: Mandavu Dam
description: You camp directly at the lake with a great view from the hide. There are lots of Kirks and Hippos, but they can't come in. Toilet and hot shower are clean in the African way but need maintenance. Entrance fee 20US pppn, car 10US   for hole stay, camping 29US pppn as a "walk-in". Probably it costs almost double if you book in advance. Firewood is included, a caretaker heats the shower.

name: Weavers Nest
description:
Very friendly owners who run a lodge at their house, where you feel at home. They got a couple of rooms and there is a possibility to camp. There is also a swimingpool in the garden. 

Address: Cary Street 67
Call / WhatsApp: +263774034545

name: Whovi Game Park Office
description: Gate to the park payment point to the park, 15$ pp/d 10$ for the car. If you camp in the park, entrance 8$ pp/d, camp 10$ pp/d and car 10$

name: Water hole  with many animals
description: Water hole with many animals not appear on the small map that you get in the reception

name: Croc & Hippo Pools
description: It is not a camp site but since Deteema was occupied and we have all facilities with us, and we didn't make fire the nice ranger let us stay here for overnight for 23$ . In the rainy season the road might be very muddy

name: Zambezi NP gate
description:
There might be a problem with over landers rigs . They don't let Over lander to be in the park but we showed them that we have visited Hwange  before so they let us stay. If you have a problem ask for Cathy she was so helpful. The roads are good even after very rainy days.
Prices:
If you stay at the campsite 17$ for camping, 8$ entering, 10$ for the car 
The price for a day visit,  15$ entering 10$ for the car

name: Zambezi NP Chamabondo gate
description: Timot's pan hide you can camp here, there is a very nice fenced platform with table and seat you can build a tent inside. Econet signal on and off. You have to pay entrance at the main office at Victoria Falls or at the main gate to Zambezi NP.

name: Lenn's Place
description:
Situated on the outskirts of Nyanga with nice views over the Msasa valley and with beautiful sunsets over the mountains, this newly renovated self catering cottage offers a budget stay in the Eastern Highlands.
Very quit and safe area.
It is ideally placed for families, backpackers and overlanders  and with only 900 metres from the main Rusape tar road it's easy accessible. No requirement for a 4 x 4 vehicle.

Lenn's Place offers two simple rustic bedrooms, each sleeps four. One Queen Sized bed and a bunk bed. Total eight people. There is a nice shared bathroom with bathtub and plenty of hot water.

There is a seperate kitchen and dining area in a thatched rondavel with a braai area outside with nice views over the Msasa valley and beautiful sunseths.
There is no TV and no Wi-Fi.

Some distances: Rusape 50 k, Juliasdale 35 k, Troubeck 65 k, Nyanga Village 50 k, Mutare 100 k.

Contacts via WhatsApp +46702451449, 
Mail: Lennwac@gmail.com
Facebook: Lenn's Place.

name: An entrance point to the Kafue NP
description: A entrance point to the park be aware that from here to the park it is full with the tche tche flies

name: Parking lot
description: Informal truck parking lot next  to the bridge, on the road but only few cars passing, good MTN signal

name: Bibi  Workshop
description: A good place if you need any welding +26095536844

name: roadside garage
description: Vicious Bruno is the owner of this garage please call +260979413972 very helpful they fixed our shocks

name: Nervson
description: Nervson is the owner of a big farm here, he i very friendly and offer a very nice camping spot at his farm. Easy accessible from main tar road. Very simple and rustic but nice views over the bush and all the way up to Kariba and very quiet. A good stop over if you don't make it to Mana Pools before the gate closes. Nervson has number +263 776001515, same on WhatsApp

name: Lisodo Camp Site
description: Exclusive camp site in Gonarezhou National Park. Site has a fire place and a pit toilet. Beautiful setting on the banks overlooking the Runde River. Plenty of birdlife and animal sightings around camp. Camp costs USD40.00 per night plus USD10.00 for park and vehicle fees.

name: Chivilila Wilderness Campsite
description: Exclusive site in Gonarezhou National Park. Overlooking Chivilila Gorge on Rundi River. Site on a rock slab with thatched gazebo, fire place and pit toilet. No other facilities - bring your own! Cost USD40.00 for the site per night.

name: Runde Gorge Exclusive Campsite
description: Exclusive camp in Gonarezhou National Park. Shady tree on sloping ground at site, but we chose to park on the level sandy spot just in front of the site. Very picturesque in a gorge of the Runde River. Good animal sittings across the river where critters come down to drink. Camp costs USD40.00 per day for the site. Park entrance and vehicle fees another USD10.00. The site has a fire place and pit toilet. One could bucket water from the river if needed.

name: Chinguli Camp Site #2
description: Serviced camp site in Gonarezhou National Park. There are five sites in total, we stayed at site #2. Each site has a small thatched gazebo with built in table, and a water tap - water supplied from the river untreated. The ablutions include hot showers (solar geysers) and flush toilets - very nice having just been renovated during Covid shut down. Site costs USD30.00 per night - park and vehicle fees another USD10.00. Firewood can be purchased at USD5.00 per bundle.

name: Gayiseni Exclusive Camp Site
description: Exclusive camp site in Gonarezhou National Park at the confluence of the Save and Runde Rivers. We couldn’t find the actual camp site so parked up in the river bed at the junction and spent the night there. Lots of game around with herds of elephant crossing the river through the night. The pool next to the camp is “alive” with crocodiles. Camp costs USD40.00 per night with park and vehicle fees an extra USD10.00.

name: Southern Cross Motors
description: A Mercedes Benz garage also for commercial ones. We made a service treatment.

name: Chessa Camp - Mana Pools National Park
description: Informal camp on the banks of the Zambezi. Just upstream from Mana Mouth. Not sure if this camp can still be booked through Zim Parks.

name: Mucheni 1
description: Exclusive campsite in Mana Pools National Park. Right on the banks of the Zambezi. Game all around, especially on the flood plain behind the camp. This site used to be under African Bush Camps but may be available now due to Covid. Not sure on pricing - best to negotiate with the Parks people at the office.

name: Chitake Spring Baobab Forest
description: Wild camping in Mana Pools. No facilities at all - bring everything you need including water. Flat ground in the middle of twelve big baobab trees on a plateau with a 360 degree view of surrounding bush veld. The only thing that may disturb your stay here are lions!

name: Kabila River Lodge
description: Wild vew on the lake, swimming pool, hot shower in the rooms, very quiet, 3 rooms, don't know the price. 15 us $ for camping in the garden. 2 adultes and 2 childs< 8 years

name: Siamungu Bush Camp
description:
Nice area overlooking the Zambezi. Elephants come to drink and possibly lion too. Long drop toilet.
Oddly, in spite of this camp being totally off the beaten track, at 4am we were woken by loud music - Tracy Chapman and Punk Floyd coming from God knows where! In the morning we still couldn't work it out!

name: wild camp close to Matobo entrance
description:
wide open area where we spent one quiet night before entering Matobo national park.
few people passed by and waved at us
the ground is not very level but we found a flat place after trying for a few minutes

name: crocodile meat
description:
here you can buy croc meat (tail) directly from the farm.
very cheap, we paid 4usd for a 4kg piece !
the meat comes frozen.
we just have to find a nice way to cook it now ;)

name: place with semi lake view
description:
we tried hard to find a place to sleep where we could have a view on the lake. this is the best we found. the view is partially obstructed by trees, but if you walk 50m you can enjoy a nice view.
there are stone benches and tables as well as a brai.
it's just close to an official building for water supply and we thought we couldn't stay, but the guard told us there were no problem.
my son had a nice time trying to fish down the lake with local fishermen. just beware of the crocs!
with our 2,30m wide and 3m high campervan we fit in the narrow space, but it will not be suitable for bigger rigs.

name: Crispy Fresh Supermarket
description: very small supermarket with an interesting range of imported products. you can find bacon, mayo, chocolate, yoghurt, cheese, couscous, frozen berries, various frozen meat, and fresh veggies, jam, marmite, coffee...

name: Susurumba hike
description:
Here is the turn from the main road to hike up the susurumba mountain.
we parked at the Pine Tree Inn and started the trail from here.
took us 1h15 to hike the 2km up to the top, 30mn to go down.
Take some good shoes as there are some rocky/steep/rock climbing parts.
very nice 360° view

name: Flo Petroleum
description: Here you can pay for petrol or diesel with an international credit card. Can be useful if you're running out of cash.

name: Nush Bakery, Café & Pizzeria
description:
Excellent standard of bakery & coffee, a real treat for Europeans wanting a wonderful cappuccino or croissant.
Prices are almost European, cappuccino (large) US$3, plain croissant US$2

name: Cimas Lab
description:
Here you can get your PCR test for covid 19. they don't do it in public hospital.
60$, results within 2 hours.
next door there's a Lancet laboratory where they also deliver tests for tourists. same price.

name: Rock Paintings
description: Many boulders, beautiful views of the lake and several rock paintings.  good parking a few meters from the paintings. Free

name: Humani campsite and workshop
description:
This is the Humani workshop. From here they show you the way to the campsite. 

The Humani farm offers wonderful campsites on the Turgwi River. It has a flushing tollte, a donkey shower and a fire place. There is game around as the place is situated in the Save Valley Conservency area. We liked the place very much and we recommend it. There is no park fees, Camping is USD 15 pp.

name: NRE Powerstation / Pungwe B camp
description:
This is a very nice new campground with different levels, directly at the Pungwe River. Very clean toilet and shower. Electricity is provided and a nice attendant is helping you. You have to book the camp in the NRE Office in Hauna and pay there (we paid $5 US per person per night). They told us that we can’t go there before checking in at the office.
The only disadvantage is: The Hydro Powerstation is located on the same grounds. The campgrounds are within 30-200 meters from the station. We stayed at the last place within trees and next to the river. BBQ station is just a few meters away.
A very nice and well looked after place (if you can handle the power-lines)

name: NRE camp at Hydro Station
description:
NRE offering 3 Campsite at their Power station (Reception is in Hauna) Pungwe B directly on the river. Very nice place with shower and toilets. Each site have power, a brai and there is one building which you can use to sit in. No mobile signal.
You have to pay ($5 ppn) at the NRE office in Hauna (see the second point in IOverlander) to a lady by the name of Paida before you drive to here.

name: NRE Office
description:
Here you have to pay the camping fee 5$ ppn. By the woman with the name Paida. To the camp site you have to travel East for about 1km and turn left at the Red Dragon sign, drive on the dust road to the end round about 15 km.
Follow the Pungwe B Hydro and Pungwr B campsite signs on the end.

name: Nervson Farm
description: This is the farm house from Nervson Mabonga. He offer a beautyful spot for camping App. 2 km from here with a view over the landscape. There is a shelter, but nothing else at the moment. A toilet will be build. Nervson is realy frindly and happy to meet you. We can fully recommend this place. Contact number for phone and whats up is +263 776001515

name: on the road
description: Nice place on a little track beside the road. Not visible from the road and very quiet. The road from Kariba is in very good condition at the moment.

name: TM supermarket
description: Good supermarket with everything. Affiliated with Pick n Pay.

name: Pariah State
description: Full breakfast and two cappuccinos $9 American. Excellent burgers, bar and vibe.

name: Emqameni Lodge
description: Has rooms, some multiple occupancy, but not clean. $40 for a single person per night, no restaurant, no wi-fi, no camping. Big rigs will struggle with the entrance gate. Has showers, small kitchen with ancient electric stove. Will not be back here. The gate guy is also the receptionist, caretaker.

name: Jawanes Tyres
description: Also sells wheels rims, batteries and does wheel repairs. Next to Pariah State restaurant in Pomona (other side of the road from Borrowdale.)

name: Livingstone Lodge
description:
One of the better and "cheaper" places in Vic Falls.
Negotiated down to $40/night, incl. english breakfast.
Small swimming pool, small bar and restaurant, food on request.
But a bit far from the falls, so better to have a car to move around.

name: KW Enterprises
description: These guys made a propshaft from scratch in less than one day for our 6x6 truck. They keep a large stock too but if you need an unusual one like we did they just make it. All the right machinery for balancing etc. Ours cost $470 (it's a big one). Call Dean Walder on +263 77 319 4020

name: The Packshed
description:
Lovely rustic restaurant, open Friday, Saturday and Sunday 10-3 for late breakfast, chicken and chips lunch, good coffee, homebrewed cider and a small shop to buy preserves, honey, braii packs and frozen chicken. 

We camped here by arrangement with the owner Rhett, but it's not a regular campsite (yet). Great view over the valley.

name: Gonarezhou National Park Reception
description: A warning for bigger vehicles. We were not allowed entrance or to drive around the park or exit any other gate. We are a medium size truck. This was not mentioned by anyone else with a truck so thought we would add it here.

name: Behind the hill
description:
We found this mice plateau with views going out if the main road.

there are plenty flat areas where you can park and sleep.

Not visible from the road, but you sometime hear the vehicles on the road.

you have to meander between small trees to find the place.

we've been here in dry season: 
no high grasses
many small flies and bees.

cell phone reception

name: Rock top wild camp
description:
Coming from Rusape, there is an access road before the electrical lines on your left.
Then there is a track which lead on the top of the hill.
No 4x4 needed, high clearance recommended 

from there you have more than 180° views,
and on the other side, you can shelter from the wind between the trees.

not visible from the road, but you can hear the vehicles there

Cell phone reception

name: Old forestry road
description:
just at the pass, turn north on an old road. We parked on the road, on one of the only flat area. Nice view, nice hikes.

No noise, even if you can hear the vehicles on the road as there is virtually no vehicles passing! You may have cows visit!

No network.

name: On the way to Gonarezhou
description:
simple camp spot between hills
quiet
not visible from the road

name: Chamuluvali exclusive campsite
description:
Exclusive campsite on the banks of Runde river.
Toilets and braai as only equipment.  

Very nice view over the riverbed, with hippo, crocs, waterbucks, elephants and also many birds.

For SADC residents, seems it's 63 USD pppn if you book in advance, and 21 if you walk in.

name: Tokwe Dam
description:
Nice place for a night. Good for the view on the dam and good for a small walk in the area.

Follow the road until the end and choose a flat place. There are trees to prptect of the wind if you need.
There are some house around the dam, so check before to ask if it's ok just in case.
Nobody around, just the maintenance guy saw us in the morning and ask why we stay here.
He was friendly and let us.

Network coverage.

name: CIMAS COVID testing station
description: At Borrowdale Office Park (race course). $50 dollars American. Results working within $24 hours.

name: Zimbabwe Revenue Authority
description: Kurima House, Zimbabwe Revenue Service office to renew TIP. BUT... they'll send you to a CBZ bank branch to pay your $40 US first. Then you may have to wait some hours for the payment to reflect on the Zimra system. Parking tends to be easy and costs a dollar and if you don't pay you may be clamped. Try to avoid CBZ branches in the city centre where scammers and thieves often target foreign registered vehicles. I had to remove a gentleman who crawled underneath mine in an effort to puncture a tire.

name: Inanke Cave
description: Spectacular example of cave paintings including some mysterious 'alien' like figures -  a really nice 6km hike/scramble to get here following yellow painted arrows. Worth the effort. Leave from Campsite 1 at Toghwana Dam. It took us a couple of hours one way at a slow pace. There is a nice ledge inside the cave to sit for a picnic. Highly recommended.

name: Patsimi Trust Restaurant
description:
Fabulous local food and very nice staff. Also very cheap!
Its also a theater and on the restaurant there is a sign which says „Little Theater.“ 

They serve food from 1pm onwards.

name: Three palms wildcamp
description: A great overnight spot on the Hunter's Road with a view from a low ridge over the plains. Great sunrise and sunset spot and lots of plains game around. Heading south it's after a very long stretch of black cotton, heading north it's before, so if it is wet it's either a good spot to recover or to plan depending on your direction of travel. (If it is very wet the parallel road on the Zim side is raised and less sticky).

name: Weaver Cottages
description: Nice little B&B in the center of Harare. Run by a friendly English couple who know what international travellers are looking for in a B&B. Very nicely set up cottages with hot outdoor showers and a secluded nice garden. Great place to get away from the hectic Harare life. No cooked breakfast, but great fresh bread, granola, fruits and yoghurt in the morning.

name: Abc bank - Standard Chartered
description: Get USD here straight out of ATM. Rate today 1:110. No hassle getting dollars abroad just insert you mastercard or visa and get dollars.

name: Covid Test
description: Here, in the first floor next the OK supermarket you have a place for do the PCR test. It costs 60 USD per person, and results in 1hour and a half. You can park the car in OK supermarket

name: White horse inn
description:
Old colonial style hotel. Ok stop if you’re doing the Bvumba trail! Amazing garden, Good WiFi and a nice meal. Not cheap! But for the trail there aren’t a lot of options.
There’s a pool, a bar and a restaurant.
Book your Bvumba trail via Seldom Seen!

name: MARS
description: Do PCR test including travel certificate. 30 USD, test in morning, in the afternoon you can collect the result.

name: Banff Lodge
description: Banff Lodge Hillside Bulawayo, beautiful gardens with a lovely pool and deck bar and restaurant area. Beautiful Gardens with comfortable and clean rooms. Delicious food and super friendly staff. Secure onsite parking.

name: Rhino safari camp
description: Rustic lodge on the edge of the lake. Not always open. Lovely spot, lovely owners. But call ahead!

name: Greame’s wildcamping
description:
Ask the guys, where you can get your permit, if you can go wild camping. Stunning places, be mindful of the lions and the rains though! 
Matusadona is super beautiful!
This spot is almost on the road on a sort of gorge overlooking the river (high up!).

name: Self Drive Support And Overland Safaris
description:
Overland Adventure Consultants
With Greame Sharp

He will introduce you to the most beautiful and adventurous places in Zimbabwe. And through discovering Zimbabwe's iconic destinations, as well as some of the most remote and pristine areas, you will be supporting conservation projects across the country. 

From pre - departure vehicle familiarisation, gear use, off-road driving techniques to 'on route’ assistance with any mechanical breakdowns, medical evacuations, resupply needs, route changes and navigation support. We are readily available 24 hours a day to ensure you have a rewarding, life changing self-drive adventure through Zimbabwe.

He’s an amazing guide and will help you with anything!

WhatsApp: +263 7 83423041

name: Wildcamp at Mguza dam
description: Open spot right next to the dam and view over the lake thats overgrown with lillys. Not a lot of flat ground, but managed to find a spot. Might need 4x4 to get here in rainy season. Many mosquitos!

name: MacTech Brothers mechanics
description: Terrence and his brother run this immaculous and excellent workshop here. Very clean and well organized, and very fast. They changed my timing belt and a leaking camshaft seal for 200$ in 3 hours. (Was recommended to me by Peter Ward, thats on ioverlander too, who didnt have time).

name: Three ways safaris
description: Six roomed lodge on the south bank of the Bubye River. Overnight camping permitted for roof tops, but no formal campground. Very pretty setting among large jackal berry and rain trees. Rooms USD40-60 per night depending on size. Dinner USD20 and breakfast USD15. Owners DEE and Quinn  07 72258919

name: Benji Weir
description: Exclusive campsite on the Bhenji River just above the weir of the same name. Facilities include an observation deck overlooking the river, a fire place/braai and a pit toilet. In the dry season this is the only water source for some distance around and a lot of animals visit. The site costs USD45.00 per night for a maximum of six people in two vehicles. Chances are you will be the only people within a 10km radius.

name: Centre Pan - Gonarezhou National Park
description: Exclusive campsite next to a natural pan in the central part of Gonarezhou. No facilities here - only nature! Site charged at USD45 per night for six people and two vehicles.

name: Gweru Boating Club
description: The old boat club is a bit run down, but there are some nice cottages at the end. The camp site has not much to offer but a place to park your vehicle. Very peaceful though, and the “champagne” frogs will serenade you.

name: Nyamuni River - Matusadona National Park
description:
Sandy strip next to the river under a lead wood tree. Permission to camp granted by operations manager of park. Normal camping fees for Zim Parks. Locals pay :
1. USD10 per night per person camping
2. USD3 per night per person conservation fee
3. USD10 per vehicle entry - once off
4. USD5 per person entry fee - once off

name: Miombo Safari Lodge
description: Lodging, tented camping and camping available. Although Campsite is being redone they let you stay by the tented camps and use the ablutions. Hot water, wifi(though not working at time of visit). $20pp but very happy to do a deal ($10pp). Pool available too. Really nice staff, even made us a fire! Wood included. Good stop off in Dete

name: Franco Foods
description:
Best and cheapest place in town, but rather basic.
Grilled chicken, pork or T-Bone with huge portions of rice or chima for 3.5 USD.
Soft drinks 50 cents!
Popular with locals!
Opposite Ann Bruce's Backpackers, in the car wash!

name: Mazvikadei Marina Campsite
description:
$10pppn. Inside the private Marina (no other entry costs if camping). Grassy shaded area with braii, nice view of the lake. Ablutions are clean with hot water, perhaps a little old. Very secure - you may need to ring or email ahead so the security can expect you and let you in. Some spots may be tricky with a big rig due to the trees. Only electrical points was at the office which you can use to charge phones etc. Very friendly staff, great place to stop off especially as not much else around. Attached a leaflet of theirs with a map.
Golddusttownship@gmail.com
Bev +263773302457
Bill   +263773828331

name: Dema Villa
description: Has self catering rooms to rent, but can put up a small tent, has outdoor shower and toilet. Beautiful manicured lawn with swimming pool and a large eating area and games room and bar. Deon and Martha made us feel real welcome and could not do enough for us and they prepare dinner and breakfast if desired. The rooms are clean and bathroom ensuite with a small kitchen and a large living room and an outside patio with table and chairs.

name: Travellers Lodge
description: Basic en-suite rooms w. breakfast for 20 or 25 US.

name: Flint Auto
description: The owner Hilton is knowledgeable, and pleasant to deal with!

name: Romelda Retreat
description:
Beautiful campsite on the shores of Lake Kyle, offering manicured shaded lawns with a view of the Lake. Individual braai areas fitted with electricity points and lighting. 

Ablutions with hot water (solar geyser), toilet, shower and washing area.

name: Ziwa Ruins Official Campsite
description: Located right by the museum and surrounded by Ziwa ruins. Bucket showers, pit toilets, water, a couple of sheltered picnic tables. Beautiful surroundings. Slow unstable internet connection with Econet. 5 USD ppn. This region is very pretty and the ruins are nice to visit if you're into Zimbabwe history.

name: Hippo Pools
description:
Very nice and relaxing place, with good service!
Big established lodge and campground at a small river in Umfurudzi NP. 
Swimming Pool, restaurant, WiFi, electricity.
Activities: mountain bikes, canoes, hiking trails.
Also tents and chalets available.
